Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Our first time here. The service was hospitable and genuine, no pretense despite being a Michelin-starred restaurant. Alex and Kim were friendly and was impeccable in their service. Food was amazing with unique combinations of fresh ingredients. Chef also came over to each table to interact which we felt was an awesome touch. Strongly recommended!

Well deserved Michelin Restaurants.
The bread is so crispy on the outside and so so so soft on the inside. Pairing with the bordier butter, it is really exceptional.
Every dish of the food is amazing.

The service is so good. When the table is full of crumbs, the waiter will clean it up to sweep away the crumbs. The waiter are also friendly and knowledgeable about the dishes.
When we found a bone in the fish and the chef came out to apologize. Felt the service was so good.

The atmosphere in the round room felt great too.

One of the best fine dining places I’ve ever been to! I can’t keep track of what was being served because there was just so many different courses, but each course was really tasty 🥰 I don’t think I’m a small eater but I was so full by the last few courses, I don’t think I ate any at all. Remember to pace yourself. I’m most impressed by their bakes; their toasty black sesame bread was literally the best bread I’ve ever had in my life.

White Grass is a hidden gem, providing a distinctive dining venture with its fusion of Japanese and European flavors.

Each dish is delectable, especially the bread, pastries, and desserts rank the finest that I ever tasted.

The real flower centerpiece adds a pleasant fragrance, and the stylish decor contributes to the overall charm, making it an excellent option for couples and hosting friends.

On my second visit, I can confidently say they consistently exceed my expectations.

Very good ambience and attentive service. The bread is crispy outside and moist inside. Sesame bread is delicious too. Abalone is well done combined with the sauce and texture. The lobster meat is too soft for our liking. Everything is fine but no distinctive wow factor.

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Les Amis restaurant is a gastronomic wonderland that transported me to a world of culinary bliss! The ambiance felt like a page out of a Parisian romance novel, with soft lights and a melody of enchanting tunes. The menu, a poetic composition of flavors, offered a dance of taste that left me in awe. The waitstaff, dressed in elegant attire, choreographed a dining experience that was nothing short of a culinary ballet. Each dish, a masterpiece plated with precision, tasted like a symphony of harmonious ingredients. If you're yearning for a dining escapade that feels like a rendezvous with gourmet dreams, Les Amis is the destination to indulge your palate in a poetic feast!

Ordered the dark chocolate cake and it was so delicious! The cake is placed on top of a tart shell which is very special. Almonds are super fragrant too.
Hope that delivery service can be included in the future and handwriting on the chocolate could be better 😅

Had a very pleasant dining experience at Les Amis. Patrick, our server, was very friendly, attentive, and entertaining. He suggested a perfect wine to have with the steak. He also patiently explained every dish to us. The amuse bouche tartalette with bacon and mushrooms was a good introduction to the meal. Notable food from our dinner are the French egg, crab soufflé, simmered celery root, salted brioche, herb sorbet, and poached pears. The caviar that was thoughtfully used in some of the dishes is an interesting addition of a complex salt flavor; it did not overwhelm the taste of the other ingredients. The wagyu was tender but I expected a bit more flavor and it lacked a bit of surprise. The herb sorbet is most interestingly a refreshing palate cleanser. Overall, it was a memorable and pleasant gastronomic experience.

Truly Michelin 3 stars! Excellent food with great creativity,  best service, excellent wine pairing, and the deserts are the best.  Not cheap but it is worth it!

Everything was impeccable, the food was great and the portions were generous, great wine pairings and amazing service.
Toni and the team were very kind and took genuine care of us.
The Blu Lobster appetizer, their sour dough, the riz de veu and the cheese course were divine.
Highly recommended.
Best restaurants in Singapore.name: Les Amis

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Our experience at Braci was probably one of our most memorable meals and the food served was truly deserving of its Michelin star. Would highly recommend getting the seven course menu as there were so many more elements in our dinner incorporated that made it all the more special. Flavours were all very well balanced and overall we left feeling very satisfied.

Visited in Sep 2023

Braci was on my list of restaurants to visit for over 4 years and I must say that it was worth the wait. It is no surprise that Braci has retained its Michelin 1 star for 6 consecutive years. The menu was a progressive one which is definitely inspired by Chef Mattie’s Italian roots. There are 2 choices for people (5 course and 7 course). I would suggest people to go for the 7 course as the additional dishes in the 7 course meal are worth it. One of my favourite parts of the experience was trying out the 100 yr old balsamic vinegar.

If you’re not taking the wine pairing, I would strongly recommend folks to try out a few of their cocktails, esp. their Negroni (one of the most unique ones I’ve had)

Service was good. The restaurant is able to cater to some food allergies (like my shellfish allergy).

A definite recommendation for fine dining lovers.

Location was not to my liking.
Great staff very welcoming and accomodating to our strict dietary restrictions.
They had to make a menu from scratch for us which gives them bonus points.
Food quality was amazing and the ingredients exquisite.
However, the taste of the food was confusing and frankly bland at times.
But i cannot judge the restaurant fairly as i did not try the actual menu items.

Amazing time at Braci for a birthday celebration for my husband. The Italian food was superb with beautiful floral aesthetic to each dishes. Staff is polite and friendly too! Special thanks to Chef Matteo who is very engaging and make the day extra special! Love the black truffle "hide and seek" dish which is one of the highlights of all dishes! It so savoury and unforgettable….

nice food nice atmosphere. i tot the service could be more positive. but i still enjoy the experience especially on a chill night in the rooftop. overall quite an expensive experience but they were very nice to add an additional anniversary dessert for us:)
Best restaurants in Singapore.name: Braci

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Absolutely loved the food here. The sea urchin is terrific - we had the 1/2 portion with the pudding and it's more than enough as it's quite rich. The quail is a must order, so tender & juicy. Service is top notch. Although I will say that the cheesecake was just so so. Will definitely return soon. Easy to make reservations online

all the chef standing there when preparing food are very friendly willing to talk to customers probably is close to all the chef at the counter seat , feeling very close and cozy, when enjoying food there.  floor staff are also friendly, since self pampering with friends there every tue , is like a canteen for us.  Expensive for a quick lunch, we always go back there for uni pudding & salad, is a place that food won’t goes wrong have a stable quality.  All chef there not much break 3-5pm still need to prep for dinner.  Maybe not the food attract us but are the chef n waiter waitress we enjoy chitchat with them during our lunch very warm.

This restaurant is hands down one of the best, if not the best restaurant we have eaten at. The food was exquisite, the quality of the food was just incredible. The staff were lovely, chef Jo even come out to check on how the food was. Cannot recommend this place enough. My 9 year old even had her own 3 course menu just for her. Will definitely return when we are back in Singapore! Thank you to the team at Lolla 🙏😍

Food - good but for the price I’d expect better quality. It’s way too salty. That being said, nobody comes here for a healthy meal, perhaps
Service - five stars, attentive but not overdoing
Atmosphere - need improvement on music choice, too loud and cannot hear conversation well

The course was very good. I particularly love the prawns and the potato bread. The mushroom with the broth was executed perfectly!  The chairs at the basement was uncomfortable and the room was a bit warm. Service was better when another senior staff took over the table.
Best restaurants in Singapore.name: Lolla

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Had a great 6 course lunch at Beni! Service was great - the hostess was warm and friendly, and explained dishes clearly. Food was good - subtle flavours that meshed really well together, and beautiful presentation. The lamb in particular was executed perfectly. I also loved the mignardises and that the kitchen was open but calm and not chaotic.

Here for birthday lunch, cosy setting but nothing much to shout about for the interior. Had the lunch menu, food is good but nothing really outstanding that I can remember. Hmm maybe Cherry Gazpacho is quite special. Perhaps its a normal lunch menu, maybe should come back again for special collaborations when they have one.

Some changes to the menu itself. Menu is very refreshing, akin like the Spring season. As always, hostess & chef hospitality are the best. To us, their food, restaurant atmosphere, relationships between staffs & us are what made us being their regulars.

A very nice ambiance intimate dining room that caters to about 6 pax capacity and some counter seats for perhaps, Omakase? Set menus are definitely French and heavy on seafood.

The service was nicely paced, dishes was explained, and professional. Their wine recommendation was good as well.

The presentation of each dish is where the star is. The taste is ok, balanced.

Recommended for date night, probably not the best suit for big  groups or business dinner unless you reserve private room.

We booked the restaurant to celebrate our 25th year wedding anniversary.
We took the $268 set dinner and added on foie gras ($20) for one of our dinner set, and changed one of the dessert to cheese truffle.
All the dishes are wonderfully made, and even the bread basket (uniquely in a cloth pouch) is warm and hot, with specially made bread spread.
The service is amazing and special mentioned to Louis who has made our experience really enjoyable.
We also had Yamanaka-san who personally served us for one of the dishes.
The downside for the place is that it is a small restaurant and seatings are quite closed to one another. It's no issue for us and we mingled with other patrons.
Highly recommended.
Best restaurants in Singapore.name: béni Singapore

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
It is a high-class environment, evoking an upscale atmosphere. While the setting exuded elegance, there's room for improvement in the service department. We did find ourselves waiting a considerable amount of time to place our order.

The restaurant offers a unique amenity: photo-taking services with free prints. However, we encountered a slight hiccup when our photo wasn't promptly printed. A bit of a delay ensued before we finally received our printed photo.

Opting for the anniversary 4-course meal set, which comprised a starter, appetizer, main, dessert, and beverage, we were treated to a mix of flavors. The standout was undoubtedly the signature prime rib, a delectable dish that is an absolute must-try. On the other hand, the braised beef rib fell slightly short of expectations, with the sauce impressing more than the somewhat dry meat.

We indulged in the chocolate cake and strawberry trifle for dessert. While the chocolate cake delighted our taste buds, the strawberry flavor of the trifle didn't quite resonate with our preferences.

Adding to the thoughtful experience, complimentary drinking water was a nice touch, as was the complimentary cake for those celebrating birthdays.

Great ambience, great service.

Only issue is the tenderloin which is too dry. Love their prime steak which is carved for us directly, and love the lobster tail. Salad that comes with each beef dish is magnificently tossed! The pudding is great too

Used the Amex love card and got 35% off for 3
Pax, if not the price can be rather hefty.

I would say the experience in Lawry’s is the best-ever service I have in Singapore. No matter before, during or after the wedding private function, they are keeping their standard very thoughtful, helpful, friendly and even more than I expected. The staff are very considerate and the signature dishes quality are excellent. It is value-for-money to book their restaurant as private function and enjoying the high ceiling with the natural daylight came into the room, which made the event photos came out nicely. Thank you the team who help us out with the background music and the room decoration. We are more than happy to come back again.

Lawry's is the epitome of old school.  From the colossal table-side serving carts to the waitress' uniforms, there is nothing at all modern about the experience.  Luckily for Lawry's , they pull it off where others don't.  How?  The decor, while dated, is clean and presentable.  The waitresses look like they belong in a 1950s TV show, but the service is friendly and impeccable.  So this is a case where old school is retro and kind of fun.  The food is decent, not as spectacular as the prices suggest they should be, but decent.  The spinning salad is a trademark and is excellent.  The Yorkshire puddings were just barely average... they definitely needed seasoning. If you are looking for a slab of beef in a throwback setting, and money is not a problem, this is the place for you.

Celebrated my birthday here and I can say, the foods we ordered were nice! Of course we tried their prime rib which is the star of the night! Will recommend!

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
I have been in shinji two times but my previous visit was excellent! we had long omakase. the sequence were balance, materials are fresh and excellent quality of freshness. two kind of uni were also still firm (not watery). I think that would be better if some “aburi” are added, that would give some equisite medley on the whole omakase. special sake for shinji was well presented with balance, elegant body and fruity. well served by the chef that can speak little indonesian that made us even relax, the waiter is very attentive. thank you for an excellent gourmet and services.

Had the 15 course sushi and enjoyed it very much. Highlights for me were the Chutoro, Aji, Shiro ebi and Uni. The Chef and staff were very hospitable and I look forward to my next visit!

Amazing omakase experience with fresh ingredients. It's one of the best i have in singapore so far (and I've had a lot!). The uni is to die for.

That's the Japan standard you should be talking about in Singapore. The price tag matches with the quality they delivered. I have never tasted such refined Japanese foods in Singapore before. Shinji may be able to go up against some of the best sushi restaurants in Japan. Chefs are well trained and able to converse in English fluently.

They even surprised me with the desserts in the Omakase menu which usually people don't pay attention to. I would definitely visit again soon.

Inadequate service staff. Turned amazing gourmet experience into a very bad experience! I suggest everyone who goes there CHECK YOUR BILL!

I went for lunch Omakase chef special. The waitress only mentioned to me, it will be $350 and plus. I said it is ok. But she never mentioned where this plus comes from. Automatically everyone in SG would understand it as service charge.

In the end I received a bill of $400++, which got me very confused. And first waitress explained to me the price is decided by chef. Second one came to me, said, I told you, it is going to be more than $350.

Well I only said ok to $350 but not $400. On the menu it says “please specify a cap if you wish.” Instead apologies for her miss communication, she started pointing finger at me arguing it was my mistake not mentioning the cap. She told me “I SAID, it will be more than $350, everywhere in singapore it is PLUS PLUS so “A PLUS” means chef decides how much you pay.”

Whoever would go to a $350 and more lunch would never care about $50 more, however her attitude of justifying her mistake and miscommunication, push the responsibility to customer is definitely revolting.

The argument waitress had with me was ugly, not only an embarrassment to me but also an embarrassment to the chef, and to other customers who were still eating!

I left the counter to the reception with my dignity not to continue the embarrassment.

In the end the accountant charge me $350, which wasn’t the best solution. She should have removed the service charge of the waitress.

No one who goes to this kind of restaurant care about paying more, $350 or $400 aren’t much different. But it has to be properly explained, not by how much restaurant wishing to charge!

Food was great, in the end I left without chef’s gratitude. It wasn’t a complete meal, and service doesn’t qualify as Omakase.

Suggestion to the restaurant:
1. Notify customer how much more it will be, be clear in advance!
2. When the miscommunication happens, it’s definitely the waiting staff’s responsibility! Don’t blame the customer! Especially not at Sushi counter!
Best restaurants in Singapore.name: Shinji by Kanesaka

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Visited in Sep 2023

A fantastic dining experience. The dry-aged duck main course was absolutely fantastic and so was the fish/turbot main course dish. The beef carpaccio course was also brilliant. The restaurant doesn’t have a non-alcoholic pairing and that’s probably a small area where they can improve their ‘value proposition’.

Service was top notch.

A definite recommendation for a classy dinner experience

Wonderful culinary experience from the start till the end. The location and ambiance is welcoming and cosy, the staff is friendly and took great care of us, the food is delicious, high attention to details and wonderful ingredients from all over the globe. The chef is very talented and creative. The sommelier chose some amazing wines and champagne to pair the dishes with. Amazing experience.

A sensational lunch which well exceeds its price point of $178++ per pax. The only criticism would be that the bread course was uninspiring, but who cares? It’s free anyway. Canapés started with their signature playful tomato soup. Using trompe l’oeil to make it look like tomatoes it’s actually a soft shell with tomato gazpacho encased within. The scallop tartare with avocado and tomato jelly was wonderfully light with all the elements working in harmony. The cod mousse taco was nice but overshadowed by its two counterparts. The first course started with a bang, yellowtail finished table side with a horseradish snow. Light, refreshing and full of flavour with an added air of theatricality for good measure. The second course was Mozambique langoustine which was the highlight of the menu. Sitting on top of a creamy anchovy sauce. The sweetness of the langoustine was a perfect complement to the (not-too) salty sauce. While the gem lettuce added some crunch to contrast with the soft and plump shellfish. This course was pure delight from start to finish! The pasta course was an elevated carbonara which utilised cured egg yolk. It was not too heavy which was a pleasant surprise. The main was veal with white asparagus coated in sabayon in a moscato sauce. The veal was cooked to perfection and the kitchen, once again, demonstrate their attention to detail by ensuring that each dish consists of an equal balance of flavours and textures. The palate cleanser was finished table side with a prickly pear granita, highly refreshing after two somewhat heavier courses. The dessert was the chef’s take on semifreddo using Marsala grapes, dessert wine sauce and clotted cream. Wonderful and I loved the bitterness of the grapes and wine sauce. Overall a spectacular meal, one of the best michelin-starred lunches one can grab in Singapore that showcases high quality ingredients, inventiveness while also not ripping a gigantic hole in one’s pocket. The setting of the restaurant is intimate and perfect for a date or a more private business meeting. Staff are warm, attentive and knowledgeable (and also take good photos). Definitely worth a visit.

Modern Italian restaurant serving interestingly innovative dishes especially the amuse bouches. Wine pairing was generous and well thought out - always a nice way to find new wines if a restaurant gets it right! Service was good. Small but well spaced and clean relaxed ambience.

1st time at their restaurant for dinner. Nice colonial place. Restaurant itself felt inviting. Staffs were all smiling when greeted & warmed when serving food.

Food were great. Wine pairing was generous.

Recommended.
Best restaurants in Singapore.name: Buona Terra

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The staff is AMAZING! Our waiter took special care to ensure that we had really nice pictures for the "birthday cake shot".

The food was nice, but nothing too special.

I would go back for the service and ambience alone.

Went there for lunch for the first time. We had orchid lunch set. Especially love the soup, the smoked duck and the lobster rice/fish noodles. We didn't get to take any photo so just find some photos online to show some of the best dishes we had.
Yes it's pricey, but it's worth the money.

Great food and good service. There were just 2 of us and the restaurant was able to adjust the dim sum portion to 2 pieces each so that we could try more variety. Love that flexibility!

Good ambiance with impressive crockery that have beautiful black brush ink paintings of flowers. Each diner was served your individual bowl of fried cashew nuts as appetisers instead of communal serving in most Chinese restaurants. Nice touch!

We had steamed live prawns that were served with very fine strips of ginger, scallions and chilli in a light sauce for dipping. A silver finger bowl with a lemon slice was provided. Nice touch!

Ingredients used in Sze Chuan Styled Stewed Sea Cucumber Fish Maw and Braised Bean Curd Bamboo Pith were fresh and good quality. However the flavours of both were not memorable and the gravy for the beancurd had too much cornstarch.

Fried Rice Crab Meat with Dried Scallops was full of "wok hei". The only dish that left a good impression.

Good hospitality for there is no charge for warm water.

I was here on a weekday afternoon (prior reservation is recommended). The place quickly got crowded at around 1pm, mostly with business folks who presumably were there for lunch meetings.

Excellent place for dim sum. The food isn't cheap here, but what you get in return is high-quality food, in fact the best dim sums in town, and excellent service.
Best restaurants in Singapore.name: Summer Pavilion

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
This restaurant had a fantastic atmosphere,  you could sit in the open area or choose air conditioning if you needed. The menu had a great selection, especially if you are with a group of mixed Food preferences! Our food was just perfect, tasty and good portions. The staff that served us tonight were so friendly and helpful.  Is a more peaceful part of the River to dine - Was one of our best meals on our Singapore trip.

Love the nice, modern Mediterranean vibe & the cozy atmosphere. Food was delicious and the portions were great for sharing. We ordered the Father’s Day Promotion which was a king version of the Beast Burger which came with fries & a glass of half-pint Tiger beef for only $35! That was a delicious but really messy affair. 😂 The Kurobuta Pork Belly Claypot Rice was surprisingly good, Baby Back Ribs were tender, juicy & succulent & Crispy Pork Knuckle had a crispy, crackling skin but tender meat! 😋 Everyone enjoyed the food immensely.

Effort was put into the desserts but they were a bit of a let down. Service from Armando & Rose were excellent…they were friendly, professional & took care of us well from start to end.

Overall, very happy we decided to try Beast & Butterflies for our Father’s Day Celebration! What made it even better was that signing up for the Ala Carte rewards membership entitled us to 10% off our total bill, $10 voucher which we could redeem plus a complimentary bottle of M wine worth $68 to bring home!

Brought my hubby out for his birthday late lunch. The food was only ok tasting but very pricey for such a ok tasting food. A bit disappointed with their plating. The salad beside the main dish (Rocket leaves) were so plain. Not a mixed salad.... So boring with presentation.

At Beast & Butterflies — the culinary experience is nothing short of exceptional. The crispy pork knuckles, scrumptious burgers, and tender pork ribs are just a few highlights from their extensive menu. The chefs' attention to detail and commitment to quality shine through in every dish.

Was delighted to dine here. All of my friends kept praising their food especially the crispy pork knuckle! Definitely must try when you dine there. Great modern Mediterranean setting and cozy ambiance. Food came faster than expected even they are having a full house during our time of visit. Shall come back again to try other food.

Best restaurants in Singapore.name: Beast & Butterflies

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Came here for the first time for a business dinner. Will come back again with the family. I like that it’s a quaint small place. Service is very personal. Food was excellent. Was graciously given a few bottles of free corkage on requests, but the wine list looks interesting. Would like to try next time.

The setting is a rustic cottage. So it’s a nice, quaint and quiet place to catch up with friends. But that’s about it. We had the Noodle Lunch Set for S$38++ around mid September 2023. We paid more than S$50 per pax but what we got was a single oyster and an insipid bowl of Korean inspired beef noodles with dry and tough beef. Did they say it was 4 days slow roasted? Ermm…. The single oyster tasted OK. So, in short, it’s not value for money, either based on food quantity or taste. The Dempsey area is not short of atmospheric restaurants with better food and pricing.

What a nice hidden gem in Dempsey. It’s quite easy to miss – just look out for a lil shack with barn doors, and you know you’re in the right place.

Went here for dinner, and had such a great time. The staff were very friendly and courteous. That alone will make me want to come back.

The food was wonderful too. Oysters and trout tartare were great starters. They had to substitute ingredients for our pidan dumplings, but it was flavourful just the same. Really loved the sauce on that one. Only thing that didn’t hit the spot 100% was the sakura chicken thigh mac and cheese, but we’ll chuck it to taste preferences and not to the quality of the dish. Would have preferred the mac to be a little more saucy, but the chicken was perfection.

Noodle of the week was some assam laksa rice noodle, and it hit all the right spots for us. Loved how tender the baby squid was, and the best part about that dish was the homemade prawn ball. Lamb dish paired perfectly with the garlic mash too.

All in all, a great experience and will be back again.

What you see in the pictures was what I had for dessert at Morsels in Dempsey Road. I’m not a foodie.  I definitely don’t have a sweet tooth.  Yet, The dessert started with the Tiramisu cake - what you see on the right.  After about 15 minutes, the Tiramisu cake had disappeared completely, leaving behind only the dust of Milo powder. What does this tell you about the Tiramisu?  It’s disappearance advertised for itself.  The way it melted in my mouth, and then slipped down my esophagus to my stomach.  Thank you, John, for this unexpected treat.

It's really a hidden gem. Need to walk past another restaurant to find the location. The food is unique fusion with really nice presentation and palatable. Even the kids age 6 and 8 say Yummy. It's a great opportunity to taste many dishes on the menu. You won't waste your calories on carbs as the menu is designed as such. Very nice service from the staff! Thank you Morsel for leaving us such a wonderful and memorable dining experience.
Best restaurants in Singapore.name: Morsels Restaurant

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Visited in Jul 2023

The last time I had visited Rhubarb was 4-5 years ago. So a revisit was a long time coming. Good food and great service as always. There are 3 options/dining experiences you can choose from. I went for the most comprehensive one - 3 starters, 1 main with chef’s premium ingredient and 1 dessert.

While I can see how Rhubarb has been able to maintain its 1 star for so many years, I struggled a bit to find some key differentiating factor versus other French contemporary Michelin places. Good food nonetheless.

Service was really good. The dishes kept coming fast and I was done with my entire dinner in an hour.

All in all a very good dining place. If you haven’t been there, it is definitely worth going.

The 4-course lunch Omakase was very very satisfying, with interesting notes and flavours that I’m pleasantly surprised by. I also really enjoyed my chat with Joseph as a solo diner, so that my lunch was a little livelier. I had an absolutely lovely time and would return again.

Decided to go last min as I suddenly met a long time friend. She said she didn’t want to eat something too heavy. The starters were mainly seafood and fruits, which opened up her appetite after a full day of hard stress work. The main was a tender slowed cooked beef. Dessert was a coconut sorbet I think (?). Accompanied the meal with a Riesling. We quite enjoyed the night.
Funny note, one of the appetisers is a mix of fruits and seafood, I confused the apple with an olive. The taste was good though. Please don’t change the dish because of my comment.

Food are all tastefully plated and delicious. They were kind to ask me if I have dietary restrictions and I told them I would like to have all cooked food. So they made changes for me to replace the lightly torched scallops to cooked crab stick for appetiser. Really appreciate it:) every dishes were all well explained and executed.

Outstanding food, worth its Michelin star. Service is friendly. The atmosphere is a little bit let down by the lighting and impersonal musical background. Overall a very nice place to have an amazing meal. Prices very reasonable.

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
I went with my partner for a date night and was quite excited to try due to the location and design of the restaurant ..but unfortunately very basic food which was presented like fine dining. The steak was served dry and raw which when we complained was taken back, warmed and served back. 18$ truffle fries were soggy and salty. We paid like 250$ for 3 dishes and dessert.

A romantic place for lovers. Surrounded by nature and good food. There's nothing to not like here.
Amidst lush greenery and pristine forest air, it's truly "Love's in the air".
You can't help falling in love after this.
Finish the meal with a kiss 💋 to seal in the memories. ❤️.
By the way, menu is also halal.. 😊

The place is great. Not noisy on a weekday. Staff were excellent. Food options was good. Pricing felts a little on the high side. Restaurant has kids menu option - one of the pasta choice didnt taste great. Serving portion is good.

It was a work dinner where we pre ordered the items of the set menus. I had the Wagyu rump steak which was really good, no gamey taste and very juicy. Dessert was Valrhona chocolate tart which was so sinfully good, very chocolatey. The Halia also served complimentary matcha and banana chocolate macaroons.

The place was very nice, covered with greenery.
Service was great, staffs were attentive and food was served timely spaced out.
Not a place that’s very accessible unless you drive or take a hired ride. If you don’t drive, it’s a little hard to get a ride out.

The food here is fantastic. They are masters with flavour and use of herbs. It’s so in line with the whole experience of dining in the Botanical Gardens. For starters, the Octopus and duck are a must try. For Mains, get the scallops (they come with Barramundi). Both are great and served with beautiful balsamic vinegar (not the supermarket kind).
Best restaurants in Singapore.address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
Best restaurants in Singapore.name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Nice environment and friendly staff.
And the food is great!

It’s my honour to have an opportunity to try the New Menu. I like the most is my main, the Glacier 51 Toothfish with special mixed with 4 different oils! It’s amazing and taste really good 👍🏻

It’s a wonderful night and dinner with my beloved. 🥂

Recommend 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

My partner brought me here for my birthday lunch and we had a lovely time here. We ordered the 2 course lunch with an add on of extra serving of potato bread & steak.

We enjoyed the potato bread that we ordered a extra serving. The steak was also yummy and cooked to medium rare. The steak came with oyster mushroom was also cooked to perfection. Special shout-out to to the beef tartare(lovely presentation!)& pork steak(burst of flavour!!)!

The duck breast was slightly too rare for our liking.

The service was lovely and friendly and they also surprised me with a apple tart for my birthday.

A lovely place where we spent our anniversary lunch. Food was YUM. A mix of different cuisines rolled into something I'd call contemporary European. Presentation of dishes was spectacular with the beef tartar showcased in a delightfully unusual way!

This is a five-star experience all the way - Alma has a Michelin star in the guide that just came out for Singapore, and deservedly so. They were happy to accommodate vegetarian food for the prix fixe menu, which is great value. The signature tofu with black truffle was sublime, as were the Japanese tomatoes with tomato sorbet. The amuse bouche of tomato with a sour plum film was another delight.

It's a nice space too, with a beautifully designed interior and a superb selection of wines and in particular rare whiskies.

This one's going on our repeat visit list for sure!

A lovely fine dining restaurant with great service and friendly people. Food was very unique and tasteful. Looks like they have many years of being a 1-star Michelin restaurant. Well deserved!

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
An absolutely delightful dining experience! The food, the service and the atmosphere was all incredible. We were treated to the most wonderful waiter in Arvin whose wine knowledge and food explanations were the highlight of the day. He answered all our questions and was forthcoming and generous in sharing his food knowledge. All the dishes were fantastic and very flavoursome. I can’t wait to come back again! We had the amekase menu.

Having dined at this Peranakan restaurant upon a family member's recommendation, we were eager to experience its Michelin-acclaimed cuisine. Opting for the tasting menu, we were treated to an exceptional culinary journey. As someone with Southeast Asian roots, I might be a bit biased, but I must say this restaurant truly stood out. It exceeded my expectations and proved deserving of its Michelin accolade.

Had this slightly less than a year back. Food was delicious, staff were attentive to all our requests. Restaurant was nicely located at Dempsey with free parking. Knowing that we were celebrating a birthday, they gave us a small dessert (kinda) which I felt was very thoughtful of them. The staff were also patient in taking countless number of picture for us. Definitely deserving of the one Michelin star. Will definitely be back again in future!

I believe this brings the best of Peranakan fine dinner to the guest. Dishes are true to the original flavors yet giving a refreshing new twist. Great place to bring visitors to try our local delights but elevated.

Fantastic experience. The food was both friendly and approachable, given these were ingredients I've never tried before. Think elevated family meals cooked perfectly. Patrick and the rest of the staff were professional and genuinely proud of the food. Dessert stole the show.
Best restaurants in Singapore.name: Candlenut

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Lovely experience.  Good service and attentive staff. Well deserved Michelin star with the food. Has fantastic courses paired with champagne. Air- conditioning is way too cold and freezes everyone. Any warm dish turns cold too quickly. Dessert was also a star and did not let down the entire course of dinner. Felt the staff could have been more confident in introducing each course.

Came here to celebrate our anniversary, a surprise dinner planned by my husband for us. The restaurant is intimate with only a few tables available, so you get undivided attention from the staff. It is also an open kitchen concept which I love so you can see the chefs hard at working preparing their masterpieces for us. I enjoyed pretty much every single dish, the abalone wellington was definitely unique and one of a kind. Overall had a really good experience here.

One - starred Michelin restaurant located within Voco Hotel (previously known as Hilton Orchard), serving Modern-Contemporary cuisine,established by Restaurateur-Sommelier Ignatius Chan in 2004. There is heavy influence of japanese ingredients used in the menu and served in the European way. Opt for the menu with two main courses for a wholesome dining experience. Food presentation is beautiful and tastefully presented, and what's good to look at is also good to eat.

Had our belated anniversary lunch at Iggy’s as we were having a staycation at Hilton. A lovely resturant with friendly and helpful crew. Love the fact that we are able to view how the chef and his team prepared our meals to the kitchen.

As the husband and I do not take raw fish, the chef was able to customize to our taste by searing the fish, love how the raw yolk enhances the overall taste of the dish. They did an interesting take on the sponge gourd which brought the vegetable to another level. The linguine was average. The roast beef has charred edges which was a nice touch. Overall we enjoyed the 5 course meal at $150++ per pax.

Came here for lunch with 2 overseas guests who would like to taste a Michelin restaurant.  Decided to bring them to Iggy's as the restaurant has been one that has been keeping their reputation for years. Food was great as you can see in pictures.. perhaps ..some touch up to the interior may make the place feel warm and friendly.
Damage : $200 (lunch)/pax

Best restaurants in Singapore.address: 581 Orchard Rd, Level 3 voco Orchard Singapore, an IHG Hotel, Singapore 238883
Best restaurants in Singapore.name: Iggy's

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
My favourite Greek restaurant in Singapore of all time.  I have been here 10 TIMES. The food is always so consistently good. They serve the best salad, octopus, sea bream, lamb chop and even chicken. Their dips and pita bread are also to die for. Service isn't as good as it used to be anymore but oh well.

Celebrated a friend birthday here and the staff was quite helpful. We were introduced to a good spread. Wasn’t expecting the food to be good in this type of cafe but was pleasantly surprised of the meat quality and portion. Slightly on the salty side but acceptable. Overall, would come back again.

Loved having dinner here. Food, service, atmosphere all fantastic. Wayne was a great server who recommended some signature dishes - codfish roe was my fav. Octopus was well cooked and kebab was also unique but perfectly cooked.

Came here multiple times including the one at the old location. Also recommended and brought my friends, colleagues here many times! Loved the food, ambience and service! Just so good! This time my friends and I came here to celebrate birthday and the bar manager treated us to complimentary alcohol and gave a small bottle of olive oil (we also purchased a big one!). Their olive oil tastes so gooooooood! The dessert was complimentary as well. I love the fish, octopus and vegetables the best!

Food is fantastic. Price is reasonable as well, total damage is about $50/pax. (We ordered like 7-8 dishes).
Service is pretty prompt. The ambience is good & cozy for gathering & chit-chatting.

Best restaurants in Singapore.name: BAKALAKI Greek Taverna

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Good restaurant, French cuisine, more like traditional or family style restaurant .
Recommendation
1. French onion soup
2. escargots
3.duck

This is our 2nd visit. We love the food and the fact that it's a non pretentious place. We've felt really comfortable on both our visits. For starters we had the escargot and bone marrow. It was really good. We ordered 2 rib-eye with bearnaise sauce and a ravioli for mains.

The only thing we were not really comfortable with was how close the table next to us was. Overall we had a lovely time.

Stepping inside Brasserie Gavroche, it had a nice old rustic charm to it, with the vintage looking wooden furnitures and 50s style hanging lights. Not a typical fine dinning setting but more of a simple sit down dinning for a close group of friends to meet up and chat over a hearty meal.

The restaurant serves some of the more classical French dishes such as foil gras and escargot, with choices of either cold or warm appetisers dishes. It seems the white asparagus is in season now and we ordered 1/2 dozen of escargots and the foie gras (served with toasted country bread) to go with it for our starters.

The escargot was baked with parsley and garlic butter. Classical proven dish that couldn’t really go wrong, but nothing outstanding either. Felt that the escargots was a tad over baked for me as the meat was slightly tough. Overall the taste was rich and flavourful, and the leftover butter oil makes great dip for the bread. 3/5

The white asparagus was served with Parma ham, Benedict eggs and hollandaise sauce. The asparagus was crunchy and juicy, and would have paired perfectly with the savoury ham, if not for the lingering bitter vegetal aftertaste coming from the asparagus. Not sure what the Benedict egg and hollandaise sauce bring to the dish, didn’t think the sauce went well with the dish. 3/5

The foie gras serving was generous! Some of the inferior foie gras I tasted had a powdery and crumbly texture with a strong metallic iron aftertaste lingering. But the foie gras served here was of a much higher quality. Smooth and buttery with a right proportion of fat; lighter in taste but yet flavourful (from the meat) and rich without being too overpowering. It left you wanting to try more as it didn’t have the saturating greasy feeling. The yellow portion of the foie gras in the picture was actually solidified fat and simply pure decadent! I would strongly encourage everyone to at least try a small bit of it to savour the slow melting of pure animal fat essence in your mouth! The reddish condiment at the side was some sort of dried fruit puree and the slight sweet-sourness went very well with the savoury foie gras. The only disappointment I had with the dish was the hard country bread, but otherwise excellent dish. 4.5/5

We ordered 3 mains for sharing:  lamb tongue (not in regular menu), beef tartare and ribeye steak

Personally I prefer my lamb to be grilled for that rich “muttony” favour. This lamb tongue was stewed and served on top of potato mash. I chose this main as lamb tongue was an interesting cut I had not tried before despite the cooking style. The meat was tender with a bit of chewiness to it. Taste was delicately light and I hardly get any ‘muttony’ favour in it. This was a very nice dish albeit it didn’t suit my personal taste preference. 3.5/5, only because of personal taste preference, otherwise the dish deserved a 4.

The beef tartare was disappointing. I loved the Angus beef for its ‘sashimi freshness quality’ with a slight chewy texture. But the condiment was a tad overpowering from the pungent shedded onion and the overly tangy dressing. I felt that the taste was off balanced in the mouth, skewing more towards the condiment. Texture was good, chewiness of the meat went well with the onion crunchiness. The bread was disappointing hard. 3/5

Saving the best for the last, the ribeye was the highlight of the meal for us. Perfectly grilled to medium rare with a pinkish tender center (an expected standard for any high end restaurant) and a slight crusty charred exterior. Decent fat content and the juice of the meat was well sealed during the cooking. Every mouthful was a fine balance of favour and texture. Tenderness of the meat interspersed with crispy charred parts, full bodied and juicy meat favour elevated by the light seasoning. It also went very well with the Béarnaise sauce as it presented a different taste profile. Just to show you don’t need super expensive beef cut or A5 wagyu to enjoy a premium quality steak. 5/5

Went for dinner
Ordered the onion soup, lamb rack and mussels
Had an amazing time wining and dining
The soup was delicious and fragrant
Lamb was very flavorful
Mussels was very fresh and tasty

A Belgian in a French Brasserie… what could possibly go wrong.

Nothing actually. Superb business lunch. Relaxing atmosphere, warm traditional interior, capable and attentive staff, and the food - oh man - the food!!

Tried the morel mushroom soup and the evergreen Angus Beef tartare. Sublime! Just the way I’d expect it in the best restaurant in Paris, or Brussels. And even the fries are “Belgian Approved”.

Thanks guys

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Well-deserving of all their accolades! The service was attentive and considerate. We had their lunch set meal that was so good value for money. It seems that every dish others ordered also looked so good. They even surprised us with a complimentary dessert for our anniversary. Will definitely be back for more!

Th staff are attentive and know thier menu well...the ambience is nothing to talk about...quite simple and mediocre .food is excellent  but a bit overly priced  steaks at 150 and over ..I could go to a 5 star hotel buffet with wider variety. But they must be doing something  right as many guests on a weekday we visited.

My family of four has attended the Wagyu Omakase, and the recently promoted Hida Wagyu Omakase as well. We have also ordered a la carte dishes like their popular wagyu donburi and sandwich, and enjoyed their steaks. Yes, a meal at Fat Cow certainly doesn’t come cheap. However, we feel that we are paying for quality food and service, and we had repeated visits because we genuinely love the food and appreciate the service accorded to us.
A special shout out to Chef Leon, who was heading the Hida wagyu Omakase while Chef Shingo was out of town. He held his own pretty well and we appreciated his kind gesture in preparing a Hida specialty for my daughter. Just as my family values good food, we regard customer service and the overall dining experience highly when we decide where to dine out for our special family occasions. On that note, I need to compliment server Vijaya for her dedicated, observant and  professional, yet personable service. We have shared with the chefs that we shall continue to patronise Fat Cow, but we look forward to an adventurous and interesting take on their next change to the Wagyu Omakase menu.
I would highly recommend a visit to Fat Cow if you love Wagyu beef and hold an interest in trying different cooking styles and marrying tastes.

It was such a lovely experience dining here! Very nice Japanese steak house with such a contemporary twist - very delicious tempura and amazing wagyu. Each bite just felt like it melted in your mouth, and I haven’t had beef that was THAT good in a while! They also gave us complimentary dessert, which was a nice way to top off the meal. Last but not least, service was impeccable and staff here took really good care of us. While it’s without a doubt on the pricey side, rest assured you are getting your money’s worth for the experience. Overall we had a fantastic time and would highly recommend this place for anyone that loves steak and/or is looking for a different yet unique dining experience in SG.

I was looking for a nice fine steak in Singapore and after reviewing most of the reviews, decided to give it a try
And, it was a really good one indeed!

It is a fine Japanese steak house with a scrumptious and super amazing wagyu I’ve ever tasted. Each bite just felt like it melted in your mouth, and for me it was really a good quality wagyu.

All items were delish. I enjoyed every bite of my order. Including my drinks.

I also got a complimentary dessert, as it was my birthday.

The service was impeccable. The staffs are friendly and did their best to take a really good care of us.

It’s indeed pricey, but for me it is worthy.

I had a fantastic time at Fat Cow and when in Singapore will absolutely come again to try their Matsusaka wagyu.

And as a snob eater, I definitely recommend this place.
Best restaurants in Singapore.address: 1 Orchard Blvd, #01-01/02 Camden Medical Centre, Singapore 248649
Best restaurants in Singapore.name: Fat Cow

Best restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
A good restaurant at the Asian Civilization Museum. One of the key feature of the restaurant is the terrific view of Singapore River side. Had the set lunch and it was a sumptuous dim sum and Cantonese style dishes. Great layback ambience. Very good attentive service

Quite disappointed with the flavour or the food. Quality is good, like the prawns were juicy and fresh, but the flavour was meh. Salmon skin was incredibly crunchy though. Sure we were there for an event but expected a lot more flavour wise. Surprisingly enjoyed the black sesame ice cream.

Took the sharing 70$ tasting menu and the food was delicious , so as the view from the inside and outdoors.
Loved the deep friend salmon skin and shrimp soup. Maybe the only disappointing dish was the Empress rice but the rest was great. Good for dates and celebrations

📸 Empress, one of our favourite wedding venues to capture cherished moments! 💍✨ Not only does it boast Michelin Guide recommended cuisine (a hit with wedding guests!), but its enchanting ambiance along the scenic Singapore River is simply irresistible! 🌃✨ When night falls, the venue comes alive with stunning lighting, creating a magical atmosphere. 🌟 Also, the unique sliding doors on the exterior offer an unforgettable march-in experience for couples. 👰🤵 We highly recommend Empress to all wedding couples searching for an unforgettable venue! 🎉

Underwhelming set lunch. Portion of second course main dish was really small, the fried rice was served in a very small bowl. I'm not a big eater but I did not feel full after the three courses, not to mention my male colleagues. Not value for money. Waited quite long in between courses.
Best restaurants in Singapore.address: 1 Empress Pl, #01-03 Asian Civilisations Museum, Singapore 179555
Best restaurants in Singapore.name: Empress

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
Was hosted by a generous friend as we had colleagues from overseas visiting us. What an exceptional feast! Our guests were very impressed by the size and freshness of the crabs. They also enjoyed the prawns.

I personally loved the herbal soup that the prawns came in. I also ladled the yummy gravy from the chilli crab dish into my fried rice and polished off 2 bowls in that fashion.

There was also a particularly yummy toufu & vegetable dish that I enjoyed. I would certainly order that again.

Whilst we were there I ran into other friends who were also hosting their overseas visitors so I guess this is the place to be in these situations. A really big draw is the wonderful view right outside the restaurant and opportunity to walk along One Fullerton after the heavy meal!

To  Ms  May
The taste was good, but the male staff was the worst. Don't talk about JCB behind your back among floor staff. They will serve you beer without permission, and if you ask for extra towels, it will cost you $1.60, but is that okay? Please feel free to make fun of me.

Actually it was my third or fourth time visit . Perfect location, fresh seafood and great service . We visited for company dinner we took one of our colleagues from Japan during their short business trip. They were all happy and we enjoyed a lot . Since the place is big, I noticed some service (like beverage service) were little slow however they tried and gave us great services from bottom of their heart . Especially one of the service staff Ms. WanYi helped us a lot. She tried her best whenever  we needed their assistance and I liked her sincere warm service . Thank you all team and Ms.WanYi for your great service and I’ll see you again.

This was my first experience with Chilli crab and black pepper crab. Overall food was good, service, atmosphere, and location are outstanding.  Very busy and popular area, great photo opportunities.  Crab was good, we had 2 very large crabs, and side dishes were all good.

Very good dishes and good services.  Pretty good Chili Crab and Black pepper crab.  Fried rice noodles are pretty good also.  View of the Sands Hotel and casino across the bay is beautiful.
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Palm Beach Seafood

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
Crab fried rice is soooo good! For cajun flavoured crab combo, never expect the spicy version to be so spicy. I personally feel less spicy will be good enough. Brought my own cake, thanks for the decoration, very cute.

The mild Cajun sauce is tasty. Super delicious!!!! Staff friendly and excellent service! We loved it and would come again！

This was highly recommended by a local as they offer a good variety of shellfish dishes. We ordered black pepper crab, crab cakes, chili crab with rice cakes, fried mushroom, and my personal favourite the rice with lobster bisque. It was a lovely take on Chinese congee but westernized. We ordered way too much food in advance and it will be better for the restaurant to advice if the food is too much for 7 pax proactively vs us over ordering. Overall the team had fun indulging the food.

Dine for 3 pax for dinner. Ordered the mixed w crab, prawns, oyster, etc. in cajun sauce, too spicy.  We also add the crispy octopus (not crispy at all). Bill close to $150 w UOB card we got $20 discount. Overall, it's a good place if your craving for crab & seafood.

We went here after getting the 50% off from Chope. The prices here are expensive so worth trying if got discount 'coz they serve really nice bag of seafood. The bag is good for 2-3 pax and have a lot of ingredients. The sauce or seasoning was right on spicy and very flavorful. Really enjoyed eating with the hand to licking the sauce off you fingers. It was so good.

The staff are also very friendly and attentive. They give you utensils if you need them while eating.
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Dancing Crab (Orchard Central)

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
The chargrilled fish dishes are quite nice.
The calamari was great as well. Good sauces.
The individual fish plates looked like it was more worth it than the whole fish when we ordered which came in this long wooden serving board.

We went on a weekend and it was very busy.
If you're looking for a romantic cozy intimate vibe, this is not it. We saw a few families with kids, people celebrating birthdays, etc.
Vibe is casual and crowded.
Staff were friendly.

Set in a lovely ambience in a relaxed housing estate, the place underwent some renovations since the last visit years ago.
Still retains a charm from the old establishment.
They offer to combine the orders into beautiful large format fish platters if you pick 3 mains.
Decided to keep it simple with a clam chowder, John dory fish and chips and grilled turbot.
Fish and chips were alright, personally expected better though it was served in tiny chunks which felt like eating battered fish fingers.
Grilled turbot was seasoned nicely and had an interesting hint of cumin in the rub.
Oysters were the highlight, there were plenty to pick from. The ones we had were large and fresh with just the right salinity but pretty pricey at 9 bucks a pop pre taxes.
It's more of a spot with a nice cosy vibe that serves platters worthy of feasting for the eyes.

This could be my new favourite place to eat seafood. Highly recommend the chargrilled salmon done medium rare. But don't skip on the Mediterranean squid too. Fish and chips was good but nothing too special. But surprisingly the Angus burger was quite enjoyable too. Overall this place is really good but service can be a little slow. But when the food is so good I don't really care about that. When I was eating I was already thinking about the next time Ill be back.

Fresh seafood with friendly and knowledgeable service staff. It’s our first time here and we were unsure what to order, but Robin was very helpful and informed us of a few items for us to consider. We ordered the Madai fillet with a pepper sauce and Beef. Fish had a delicious, flaky tender flesh and came in a good portion size. Beef had an uneven cook throughout but still rather enjoyable, retaining the juicy and succulent meat.

We were given a cozy booth table and spend a lovely evening chatting. The service staff was very courteous. The place does feel a little smoky and could do with some better ventilation but still would recommend.

Really long queue so expect a waiting time, loved that you can pick almost any fish available and style to cook it in, lots of choices for the fish and oyster. I went for fish and chips, calamari and fresh oyster, all ingredients was crazy fresh, however wished the fish and chip was a little more crispy. My favourite dish was the calamari
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.opening_hours:

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Greenwood Fish Market @Bukit Timah

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
This is my second experience with The Boiler (the first was with another outlet) and it was just as pleasant as the first one. I really liked the house made sauces which went great with the fresh seafood. The crab with the butter garlic is a must try. And the Boston lobster tastes fresh and sweet just steamed. Our waitress (I forgot her name) was very friendly and attentive and took care to provide us with recommendations, which was very useful for people like us who always got puzzled with the menus.

Decided to come here based on the location to the hotel so we were pleasantly surprised. The Boiler is definitely worth its salt and deserving of its accolades. Served by the friendly Gabrielle, she offered great advice on the menu without being pushy. She was thoughtful, opportunistically entertaining our little one whilst we devoured our meal. We went for the duo combo with the raging hot sauce and good old fish and chips for the little one. The aroma in the restaurant is the first tell tale that the food is going to be good and it definitely delivered! Was cooked perfectly and delicious! Will definitely be back before the holiday is over👌

Amazing service by Lee for my husband’s birthday, we even got a free Boston lobster which is a great addition! Love the bottomless ice lemon tea too which Lee very nicely refilled promptly for us. Lee made our dinner so much more enjoyable, he also offered to help us take photos when he saw us struggling to take one. Thanks for the amazing time!

There is a reason this place is so highly rated. The seafood was so fresh and flavourful, I just wish I could have tried more. Loved the clams especially but I should have gone for the spicy sauce!

Simply a must try but I would add that they should add potatoes to the boil too!

We just had our family birthday dinner at The Boiler Esplanade Restaurant, and I can't say enough good things about it. Their crab seafood is mouthwatering - fresh, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. What's more, during your birthday month, they offer a complimentary lobster, which was an unexpected and delightful surprise.

The icing on the cake was the friendly service. The staff made us feel right at home, and their recommendations were spot on.

Overall, The Boiler Restaurant is a gem. If you're a seafood lover and want a fantastic dining experience with a bonus lobster during your birthday month, this place is a must-visit. I'll definitely be back!
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: The Boiler @ Esplanade Mall

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
The dishes of crab with egg yolk and chilly crab both served with 1.3 kg weight of crab with great taste.  Service is quite good, so does atmosphere.  The $838 set dinner is great enough for ten people to eat and enjoy.

Reasonable tze char prices at comfortable setting. Also have appropriate posters on wall, very suitable for birthday dinners with family. More options for crabs if you are in bigger group. Crab meat is fresh and sweet, liked all the dishes that we ordered, even forgotten to take 2 more photos for another 2 dishes cos busy eating 🤭Thanks the patient staff for help clearing tables and making space for birthday 🎂

Will definitely come back again. Worth the price! 2 crabs for $38. Huge portion, just nice for 2 people. We also ordered the fried squid, $14 for small size. Be careful not to enter the wrong one, there's a seafood restaurant with the same advertising as this place!

The crabs were quite value for money but the meat could have been better. The salted egg gravy was too sweet. Chilli sauce was too spicy. Guinness pork ribs were too small in portion, too sweet and fatty. Salad ice plant was rather pricey. Service was good though.

Really really well-priced crabs and yummy tze char dishes!

The chilli crab wasn't too sweet which I liked and the vermicelli version soaked up the crab juices well though it may come off slightly bland to some, but nothing a little chilli can't rectify

Special mention for the guinness pork which I had zero expectations for as I usually don't like proteins tossed in sauce but their pork has a 1:1 ratio of meat and fat which was right up my alley

Recommend making a reservation before heading down as the space is small!
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Crab at Bay Seafood Restaurant

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
We ordered the Alaskan king crab for 4 persons cooked in their famous black pepper style. The food overall was good and it came out fast with the exception of the last main dish- Irish roast duck- After waiting a long time we asked about it and it was discovered our duck was served to another table. It was reordered again for us.
The black pepper flavour was too much black pepper and spicy for my taste. It was like too much black pepper on your food. Perhaps it would be more balanced if the crab was served with the fried rice instead of after.
Portions are fairly small.
It should be noted that at the restaurant, you are charged for the peanuts (tidbits on the bill) given to you upon seating and also for cold tap water.
It seems to be a common occurrence to be charged for tap after at restaurants in Singapore

have been coming here since i was a kid. the service is great. recommend the white
pepper crab and the dong bo pork ribs. (you must specifically ask for the ribs as it’s not on the menu).
it can smell quite fishy sitting near the live seafood but it’s all part of the experience, seeing alaskan crabs try to climb their way out 🤣
the garlic broccoli dish was $30 for one floret, please have your fill of veg before coming..

not great for wheelchair users. so many steps and sharp corners. service to serve food is quick. ordered pepper and curry crab. they are okay. no depth in the sauce. the rest are nice.

Expatriates hotspot. Atmospheric location. Food is very tasty but also only for people with deep pockets. Multiple options for crab types and flavours. The chili crabs that I ordered come with huge arms. Their mango dessert is great too. Reservations strongly recommended, touristy restaurant too. Parking is free but limited during peak hours.

We had the pepper crab and the spicy chili shrimp, some green vegetables and fried rice and a bottle of sake.

THE PERFECT MEAL！

Loved the room, with a whole wall of aquariums full of fresh crabs and lobsters.

I’ll go back for sure!
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Long Beach DEMPSEY

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
We found ourselves in Chinatown and had to try the famous Singapore Chilli Crab 🦀 We ordered 2 portions which was enough for 6 people (crabs were huge 🤩) along with some veggies, prawns and fried rice.
The crab wasn’t very chilli in my opinion, but it was pretty tasty. The meat was really fresh and the food was served very quickly.
Everything is expensive in Singapore, so I’m not even going to comment on that 😂 but definitely worth the experience!

Well, you can do 2 things here, be a tourist and enjoy the food, or be a local and enjoy the food. I'm doing the local / expat thing, and if you look through the higher pricing and the fact that it's a touristy palce, you will enjoy the vibe and the good food. Some of the staff could be a bit more friendly and less pushy, but we like coming here. Again we like the food and it's just a matter of attitude. We are regulars and keep coming back.

Very good and nice restaurant in the heart of China town a lot tourist are making a stop in this place , and three different are available to eat local food speciality

If you love sea food then this is the best place to eat and enjoy drinks. So wonderful crowd, food tastes awesome and very good service.

Pretty atrocious food. In the heart of Chinatown, the yellow seat restaurant might make it because of its unique location and decor. But the food is definitely sub-par. Ordered dumplings and Singapore vermicelli (bee hoon) and both were tasteless and without enough spice or protein. Don’t expect authentic Singaporean food here / there are better options in Chinatown.
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.opening_hours:

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Chinatown Seafood Restaurant

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
I wasn’t very pleased with the food today. But I am glad the service and service recovery were pretty commendable.

We booked a private room today for a small event.
Ordered 4 crabs with 3 ways of cooking styles.
The chili crab was great as usual.
Salted egg crabs were less tasty and underwhelming
The steamed crab was not fresh and smelled bit stale. Told the service staff and he brought it back to the chef and was told it’s the wine used. I eaten this before and I am sure the stale smell is definitely not because of the wine. It’s just not fresh. I don’t pay $100+ for a crab with a funny taste and risk food poisoning my guests. Was given a refund for that item immediately which is a great way out of the unhappy experience.

Nonetheless, the coffee pork ribs were very delicious.
Steamed razor clams were awesome too.
The lamb ribs were tender and taste good.

Asparagus with scallops and the signature spinach tofu were pretty blend and so so.

I think the chefs today are not in their usual standards.

Excellent service and food. Must order chilli and black pepper crabs. This outlet never fail to impress, the quality has been consistently top tier. Wang Li Xin has been really attentive - my mum requested for quieter corner table instead of at the entrance, and she immediately change it for us.

The seafood here is really fresh and juicy. Had their famous crabs. This time we had the salted egg ones. Ordered the set for 2. Value for money. Service is good also.

Dim sum is also good.

Good to make a reservation as it gets really crowded on weekends.

Amazing dinner here. Always consistent quality of the crab. They took extra time to ensure that the fish was presented fully. Innovative yam scallop rings. Overall nice dinner with birthday celebration. Walked in.

It was worth to visit this restaurant. It was so easy for the branch in Ion. The crab was very delicious and not expensive when compared to the quality. The stirred fry vegetable was so good. I recommended to order seafood fried rice. It was good to eat with the crab. Please reserve the table in advance.
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM
Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM

Sunday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: JUMBO Seafood - ION Orchard

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
One of the few pet friendly seafood restaurant around. There’s a good amount of parking available and a lovely place to dine at. Staff are friendly and the dining atmosphere is very cozy. Even on a crowded weekend food comes out at a decent pace. Best make a reservation before going down. A couple of the dishes we ordered could be better but generally food is all over average.

Decided to try Toto last night for early dinner. We ate around 6pm. The food was surprisingly good! And the place is so nice and pet friendly. I love their chilli especially when eaten with the beef horfun. My furkid truly enjoyed going out with us

I always see this restaurant, but it gave me an impression the price will be high so we didnt try out till now.

Infact, the price of the dishes was really not the economical price range.

However, I appreciate the boss to offer to did a small dishes. FYI, the price on the menu are meant for medium size.

The San Lao Bee Hoon is good, it taste like the Char Kuey tiao but bee hoon version but it wasnt really that crispy. It still has the wok hey for this dish.

The kailan veg as shown in the picture wasnt badly presented.

The recommended chicken wasnt did not taste great. It did not give the crispy with sauce coated.

The soup taste great. One of the best dishes.

Toufu - as we dine with kid so the boss offer to change the sauce to no spicy to custom for little kid.

Butter prawn - good! One of the best dishes among what we ordered.

Ngor Hiang - OK only.

Overall ok but not worth the price we paid. Service was ok, nothing Ex ordinary.

Enjoyed myself totally with my furbaby. Good food and super pet friendly place. Rare to see a tze char place that is pet friendly. I reckon all the waiting staff are dog lovers too. Free parking but spaces are limited. I will be back again in no time! Always like to include a receipt for clarity.

First time having dinner at TOTO Seafood after my niece search for a pet friendly restaurant to celebrate Father's Day and My Birthday.
At this moment I will give the food 4 Star, the missing star goes to the bowl of rice. The bowl is small and we find it difficult to eat from the bowl. Using plate with fork and spoon is better, however if your culture is serving rice in bowl, I would suggest using a bigger bowl, it will be more comfortable and I hope the rice can be improved also.
Next, the service and staffs are excellent, friendly, smiles and responsive. Lastly I like the ambient and definitely will come again and bring back the 5th star.
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.opening_hours:
