Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.address: 46 Lor 23 Geylang, Ground Floor Fansida Building, Singapore 388375
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: TOTO Seafood

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
Here to celebrate my friend’s birthday, we all first time here and the experience was great! Especially a staff name Moises, he recommends us some seafood set and even ask us if we want to take a group photo. The food is nice as well, we will definitely revisit here!

The food is great! Love the Duo seafood combo , the garlic butter with crab and every other meat is delish! I like the desert as well - ice cream with molten lava cake(warning : very sweet).
Thank you Moises and team for the experience!

I love this place and their food. The seafood is very fresh and the house sauce is simply superb. Thank you Moises and team for creating pleasant memories for us all the time.

Thank you for the surprise cake. It was such a sweet gesture and we are very grateful.

Good variety of seafood - Dungeoness crabs, squid, prawns, Boston Lobster, clams etc - all prepared and comes in a bag for communal sharing. You have gloves and aprons to dig in and get your hands dirty to enjoy your food. Birthdays get a large sharing set and get a free Lobster.

Drinks are decently priced for beers and whiskey highball.

Having dined in before was a good experience. So decide to do take away. Do note the take away option when you add 1 corn, is 1 part of a corn as show in pic. 1 x sausage you get a whole sausage.
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: The BOILER @ Howard Road

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
They just moved over from Turf City. Seems like nothing much have changed in terms of the services etc. maybe just the environment.

The food taste good and never too salty. Some would say it’s blend but healthier. Prices here are reasonable and you can check on their weekly specials on their fresh seafood.

I was surprised that the place was so packed on a Saturday. It looked to be almost full house even in the private rooms. The food were good but the chilli crab sauce was kinda disappointing. The fish was really good. We had dinner set and add on. The servers were quick on their feet and super hardworking with a lot of teamwork.

Definitely an historic place. Super old and so is the vibe. Last time dining the area before it will close down and move to peach garden area. Heard a lot of good memories created over here, generation by generation.

Will miss this place

Was there for dinner. The servers are busy but attentive enough. I like the Peking duck is served with a egg based wrap instead of the usual dough wrap. We requested to be duck meat served as it is, and it’s still tasty and soft. The sweet and sour pork is tasty, tender and not tough like others. We will be go back again.

Almost exactly the same as turf city, many staff the same, food taste the same, price similar.

Only difference is need to pay carpark (slightly expensive) and main dining hall is enclosed with no natural lighting.
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Ah Yat Seafood Restaurant

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
Not the first time having their Signature Lobster Porridge which was so flavourful and the Southern Australia Lobster was really fresh! My family enjoyed their other popular dish, Steven Chicken and Soon Hock was cooked really well and tender. Had their Green Dragon Vegetables with Scallops, the portion was pretty generous and yummy. Overall, the dishes were all served quite promptly and staff were very attentive too. A great place for gatherings and celebrations!

Love Australia lobster porridge was nice & fresh. Steven chicken taste good too. Personal recommend this 2 dishes. Price is at the high side, environment is quite noisy. Service is not bad, friendly staff. But staff serving food & cleaner wear same glove to serve food, exchange tableware, clean up table. It was kind of unhygienic to do so.

The restaurant was bright and clean. Very spacious. Seafood was fresh! Food was delicious. Nice lobster porridge and Alaskan king crab :)

Being a Singaporean, live seafood is a classic! And I am glad somewhere like Orchid Live is still around!

The portion is fairly large and the taste of their dishes were great! I really like the pricing and promos they have from time to time! Their Alaskan king crab, Australia lobster, and lobster porridge is a must! A definitive order is their signature Steven Chicken, this dish is my favourite!

Overall this place is a great alternative to some of the other well-known brands in SG. If you live in the north area then this is surely the place to go!

Will definitely go back to visit whenever I have to chance to go up north in Sg.

Great place!
We ordered the $199 package, it is definitely value for money!
The lobster is fresh, the porridge is infused with sweetness from the lobster. The portion is large as there are 4 of us and we are very full after eating the porridge and barely touched the chicken and streamed fish.
If you are nearby and craving for some great lobster porridge, this is the place to be.
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Orchid Live Seafood

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
Old school kind of restaurant. Supposedly creator of chili crab. Tried both kind of chili crab with and without eggs, it was different and nice not so ketchup taste n less starchy. We had the fried fish with Thai mango sauce, good! Crispy US duck was good, tender n skin was crispy.

Superb dinner and seafood experience with the work team. Everything was done excellently. Deep fried baby squid, duck, Cereal prawns, fish and crabs. Amazing. Will want to come back again with family.

16 Jul 2023: back here to celebrate mum BD. Nice food, firm meaty crabs and excellent service. Tried the curry fish head as it was birthday girl's favourite.

I love the old school vibes here! Traditional Chinese restaurant set in the 80s! This place has been around since 1956, and the food is great! Service is also good! Love the chilli crab here and they are apparently the creators of this iconic dish! We had Buddha jump over the wall soup, baby kailan, chilli crab with mantou, and a fried mee sua. What a memorable and amazing experience! Will definitely be back again soon! We also got to say hi and bye to the friendly founder and owner on our way out!

Nice food n great service. The boss is always friendly n welcoming. My gal loves the Chili Crab n it’s always a must have dish on the table for her when she goes to Roland Restaurant.

One of the old school Chinese restaurants that the entire extended family goes to over the years during special occasions. Has nice Tim sum and Chinese cuisine. 5 stars for sentimental value and nostalgia. Good to know that the restaurant is still around after all these years.

Family had a 10 course meal to celebrate a few birthdays.

Cold dish was so so. Would prefer sliced lobster with mayonnaise to lobster balls among other things.
Lotus paste bun was ok, but it is always fun to have it styled as longevity peaches which are linked to Chinese mythical stories.
Buddha jumps over the wall was nice, but every individual soup pot ingredients are non-uniform. You never know what your going to get till you open the lid. 😂
Suckling pig was awesome! Crispy! 😋
Razor/Bamboo clams were delicious.
Asparagus was decent.
Drunken prawns were ok.
Chilli crab is the signature dish with fried Mantou buns which are a childhood favourite. 🤩
Steamed pomfret was good.
US duck was yummy.
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Roland Restaurant

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
Lovely staff that’s attentive and very helpful with recommendations. Parking is also very easy with lots available right outside the restaurant. All the food have some Asian flavors in them. It’s quite interesting and different from most seafood restaurants. Try the sambal sauces too. It goes really well with almost everything.

So happy with my meal here. I waited too long to try this place and I was missing out! Great food and excellent service. The place is cosy and quiet enough for good conversations as well.

We ordered a few things that were off the menu so I can't remember the dish names, but I was very satisfied with the lobster, uni on toast, and monkfish liver claypot rice thingy.

We over-ordered for 2 pax but everything was delish! Scallop tart, octopus, samegarei fish and donabe. Also had 2 desserts: chendol and bingka ubi. All in all really solid feed. Seafood is crazy tasty and fresh, asian flavours. Not the cheapest but a great spot for catch ups with friends. Going again for dinner this week so will see if the standards hold up. Can’t wait!

First time visiting, and i must say the dishes were all outstanding and the perfect example of less is more in terms of cooking methods and seasoning. They were definitely delectable overall. Shout out to Catherine and the team for their warm hospitality and great recommendations. Particularly enjoyed the wild-caught Steenstrup's bay squid and the samegarei! highly recommended.

A refreshing new seafood-only experience. While the dishes were a bit pricey, they were definitely delectable. The staff were also patient to explain about the dishes and gave some great recommendations. Particularly enjoyed the wild-caught Steenstrup's bay squid.
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.opening_hours:

Tuesday: 12:00 – 3:00 PM, 6:00 – 10:30 PM

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Naked Finn

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
Food was tasty definitely cooked without MSG.. wasn’t thirsty after the meal ! Although it was hot weathered sitting outside it was fine at evening. Fish was delicious flavored with sauce! Forgot to take photo of it! 😂. Would come again another time

The food is good but on a pricey side. I can't complain about the location and ambience. Service could be improved though, many servers looking around but only attend to our table to serve tea and clean the mini bin only after being called. I would expect better for a place like this.

If you can order 4 food and drinks for 155SGD, it seems like a reasonable price. The chili crab is really good, and I'll definitely go back when I visit Singapore again. One disadvantage is the lack of English language skills of the employees.

We were being ushered to the VIP room and was served by Cindy, love the meticulous and wonderful service provided by her.

The food was great, we had the Alaska crab, mud crab and many other dishes.

The VIP room has got great sound proofing.

Highly recommend the crabs and bamboo clams

As a visitor to Singapore, the chili crab (mud crab) was one of the best aspects of the trip. I was worried about coming alone, but my waitress made great recommendations and the food was amazing. Cindy went out of the way to teach me how to pick my 800g crab correctly (lol said just eat like you would eat at home, it’s the best) and made sure that I got the deep fried man tou to dip with the soup (amazing).
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: JUMBO Seafood - Dempsey Hill

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
Ever since started to eat their chilli crab at east coast park. Been following them to robertson quay. And then now at clarke quay. The last visit was their lunch buffet. It was so good & alot of variety. We missed out the bird nest tarts

Good seafood with good service and Reasonable price.
Appropriate place for family, group lunch or dinner.
Avg. 60-80S$ per pax without alcohol.
There is promotion for Korean tourist for set menu and a lot of Korean tourist in Sunday lunch.

Went in a Saturday afternoon to have the lunch buffet. It was good. High quality dim sum and dishes. Do remember there is a 90 mins time limit during weekend as told by the captain. The service was good, all staff were very attentive to us. It was an enjoyable meal. Will come back next time.

There are a lot of prawn dishes. All were good but just a bit tired of eating prawns haha. The traditional dim sum like custard bun, siu Mai , Har kao were good and authentic. There were some selection of the menu was only one time order. But it’s good enough to taste almost all the items from the menu.

The crabs were big, superb and succulent. The place opens after 530pm. Be prepared for very steep prices (up to 88 bucks per kilogram). You are given all the necessary tools to get every single morsel out. Plus make sure to order fried buns. They go so well with the sauce!

Good balance of a fancy and traditional. They Do buffet and ala carte and free flow :)
Food and service was good and ambience here was good. Not all traditional dishes but most play a few house specials. For two, we didn't do the buffet for lunch cause we usually don't eat that much but prices range . Check one of the pictures for pricing during weekday lunch - enjoy
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Red House Seafood Nanyang (Clarke Quay)

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
The restaurant is situated in a deserted level but when seated, it gives off an old, spacious traditional restaurant ambience. You will be need to select from the variety of live seafood options by Unique Seafood, before instructing your preferred cooking style.

I highly recommend the HK steamed soon hock, black pepper crab and bamboo clams. The bamboo clams were generous with both fried and steamed garlic, it was delicious. The black pepper crab was extremely flavourful while the chilli one is really spicy.

The other dishes seen on the images were fine and they were in the small portion. Overall, value for money with the live seafood selection experience and food taste. Service wise was alright, feels quite understaffed as I have difficulty getting attention at times.

Good selection of fresh & live seafood, been here a few times in the past & decided to leave review.
Reasonable priced seafood with some great discount & deals going on.

Best service and price. Everything was cooked perfectly and tasted delicious. Would definitely come back when in Singapore.

All bad except being overpriced ..  Can give ZERO star to upload this ... we'll do so.

The place is cold after requests to rectify, over priced vegetable  & seafood overcooked. Crispy skin piglet (1/2) is cold  & served under 15 mins despite staff said it's freshly done (too fast to be true)

A live seafood restaurant- the seafood here is always super fresh. Service can be a little slow sometimes as they seemed to be understaffed, but still always polite and you can tell they really try.

Would recommend the bamboo clams, drunken prawn, steamed fish and black pepper crab! 👌🏻

Good for a special occasion super seafood indulgence!
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.opening_hours:

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Owen Seafood Restaurant

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
Restaurant had a promo on the king crab.. no regrets ordering it. Chef did a good job preparing it 2 ways - baked and chilli crab style. The former version was the better choice as it brought out the best taste of the crab; the latter  could had been served better (they did eventually give us a plate to hold the sauce). The lobster porridge was tasty as well.

Easily 10/10 experience dinning here.
The quality & freshness of the ingredients is top notch.
Would definitely recommend my friends back here again! 🤩

Revisiting Orchid Live Seafood after a long time, when they were still at Sembawang. The concept and menu has changed, now mainly selling the set with lobster porridge and seafood bag. Lesser number of dishes available on the menu.

The lobster porridge is still excellent. The staff promoted to upgrade the 800g lobster in the 4 pax set to 1kg Australian lobster. Liked the succulent and thick lobster meat.

Overall prices are now on the high side, but it's quite uncommon now to see your seafood literally scooped out of the tanks.

The best chilli crab in Singapore.
Fresh lobster and crab from the tank with every bite you with the taste of freshness. Thick chunky meat is guaranteed.

Start with the lobster porridge - omg the soup will knock you off the table. It's sweetness from the lobster and fragrance of the fried onions.

2 best sauce types :- chilli crab and salty egg crab

1st came the chilli crab heehee our normal ask for more spicy it came out so tasty and does not taste tomotoey at all. Chef"s spiciness not from chilli padi as you see none and the taste was infused by the sweetness from all the seafood in the bag. We could not stop at 36 manitou which came out piping hot. Added another plate of their signature fried rice 🍚 it's so satisfying and brings you to heaven when you add a spoon of the chilli crab sauce to it.

Salted egg crab was even better than the chilli crab it's not fake and the taste is so good we can just say OMG - gosh so shiok.
Even the potatoes they use are so good it soaks up all the sauces.

Overall the whole experience was heightened by the great service of the staff they are so accommodating when we ask for more sauce and always serve us with great patience and smile
We will definitely be back for the fresh seafood, tasty sauces and great service.

Food is fresh, and portion is huge! One crusty bag is more than enough gor my family of four. The Steven chicken is tasty too.
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Chicks N Lobs

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
Family dinner for 4. crispy tofu, century egg vege. fried ho fun with deer meat. stout pork rib. food was tasty.

Casual dining at the Techview food court. The black pepper crab is delicious! 😋 Not overly peppery like most other places - savoury. Loved it! Their pumpkin prawn balls are also good! Food quality is great, friendly and fast service.

Wonderful place to dine at. The food was fabulous and tasty, portion was generous! Ordered the crab bee hoon and the broth was superb. The white pepper crab was great as well. Overall a pleasant experience.

Went there to celebrate my dad’s birthday. We ordered the 4 pax set meal.

No complains for the most of it except the prawns - they were not fresh.

I did find that the portions can be more generous as well, but overall we still had a good meal here. Will patronise again.

This restaurant is famous with crab dish, but we didn’t order, instead we ordered others like beer pork ribs and wine prawns which were very good and tasty? Ingredients are fresh and portions were large!
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Uncle Leong Seafood @ 1 Kaki Bukit View

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.reviews:
This is really a touristy place and it is always busy. However, we do tend to take our friends visiting from overseas here for the location and the water view.

It’s not the cheapest place to get chilly crab but the taste is quite easy for most people, even for foreigners.

The service level could be below the bar as they often don’t have enough staff or have staff who don’t speak good English.

Reservations are recommended for this location.

I have given up on jumbo after 2 failed experiences at East Coast branch and once Dempsey but because a friend came in from Shanghai so brought him here to try again as its like the icon of Singapore. This time, the crab was so fresh and nice. Ordered chilli and black pepper crab (1.2kg & 1.3kg). Feels like the Jumbo standard is back this time.  Nice

Food is good! Seafood fresh and succulent. Tasty and delicious. Ordered mocha pork ribs, Alaskan crabs cooked chilli style and Chinese wine steamed, bamboo clams, lamb ribs etc. There is also a 50% discount for Alaskan crabs.

Service is fast and prompt

Ambience wise - a bit noisy

Will return

You may make a reservation, we walk-in to get the number and waited for about 45 minutes to be seated. Menu has variety of dishes from seafood to meats and vegetables with different kind of cooking method. Price was above average but worth a try.

Fried scallop - the scallop was wrapped with yam and fried it. It was crusty but the yam not quite match with it.
Crab meat tofu - the tofu have a thin layer of veggie paste on the top, poured the crab meat gravy on it, it’s delicious.
Sweet and sour pork - the sour taste was quite artificial and not what I expected but not bad though.
Garlic stir fried asparagus - fresh asparagus and the garlic brought out its flavor.

Mango dessert - Sweet, sour and refreshing
Yam dessert - so special that it was the first time I tried, the paste was so thick and have yam paste inside with ginkgo and pumpkin. Recommended if you wanted to try something special.

Food was great, got the chilli mud crab, cereal prawns, mi goreng noodles and scallops wrapped in yam. Service was quick and staff attentive. Best to reserve a table ahead of time and also decide on what to order as there is a 1.5hr time limit on tables and it took about 40 minutes for the crab to come out when we were there.
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM
Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM
Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM

Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo.name: Jumbo Seafood - Riverside Point

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Nice vegan and vegetarian option. But the vegan food was lacking in flavor. The atmosphere is really beautiful though.  I think the first dish, the desert, and the risotto were very good! And the drinks were very special too! The people next to me had the vegetarian options and they said it was really good. I love the experience though and if you want to impress you vegan friends I would still bring them here just for the view and service.

Joie is an absolute gem for vegetarian dining in Singapore! The elegant ambiance, coupled with impeccable service, sets the stage for an unforgettable culinary journey. Each dish is a masterpiece, beautifully crafted with fresh, flavorful ingredients that redefine vegetarian cuisine. The creative menu offers a delightful fusion of tastes and textures, leaving me astonished with every bite. The attention to detail in presentation is exquisite, elevating the dining experience. Joie isn't just a restaurant; it's a celebration of vegetarian gastronomy, and I can't wait to return for more culinary delights!

I had a fantastic experience at Joie Vegetarian Restaurant! The Monkey Head Mushroom Steak was a true culinary delight. The flavors were exquisite, and it's clear that the chefs put a lot of thought and care into their dishes. What impressed me the most was the affordability of the 5-course meal. It's not often you find such a high-quality dining experience at such a reasonable price. The service was impeccable, and the ambiance was lovely. I can't wait to return for another delicious meal!

We dined at Joie today, July 16, 2023, and it was an outstanding experience. The service was excellent, and the food surpassed our expectations.
The attention to detail in dish presentation was evident. The staff's timing and coordination were impeccable, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable dining experience. The relaxed ambiance with soft lighting and comfortable seating added to the inviting atmosphere.
In conclusion, Joie offers an exceptional dining experience with attentive service and delicious food. I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a memorable culinary adventure. I can't wait to visit again.

My first time trying vegetarian fine dining, the foods were surprisingly good! The waitress , Kelly, was very professional, she explained the dishes to us and also show us the right way to enjoy the dishes. The main dishes , mushroom steak and risotto were very impressed too. I will definitely come back again.
Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.name: Joie | Vegetarian Casual Fine Dining

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
We are not vegetarian but what is not to like? This place makes eating too enjoyable. The food is very very delicious and the service staff are very very attentive. Super recommendation coming from a pure meat and seafood lover.

Petai - great sambal chili fried with a whole plate of goodness

Olive fried rice - we had two plates, one after the other, enough to justify the deliciousness of the dish

Curry 'mutton' - good curry but something seems to be lacking in the flavour

Salted egg yolk - we had two plates of this too

Glutinous yam (suan pan zi) - delicious? We had four plates of this.

It is in my personal humble opinion that you are missing out on very good food if you have not tried this as a vegetarian.

Food is OK. The grilled mala fish is good! Impressive imitation of the texture very close to the real fish version.
Satay is also nice.
The rest are so so. Kids says favourite truffle fried rice that is usually fragrant at other places has no truffle taste. Frankly, I prefer the high tea at their other outlet.

Very delicious meal here! Portion is big price is reasonable. The fish is a must have! Very tasty 😋 I’m a meat lover and I thoroughly enjoyed myself at this vegetarian restaurant. Good job to the chef! Staff was attentive.

Celebrated our friend's birthday dinner at Lotus. It was indeed a great choice we've made and no regrets too. Food was well prepared and delicious. Atmosphere was chill and clean. Will come back again.

We came just to try the Grilled "Fish" and we were not disappointed albeit the flavour we chose does not resemble much of the original 烤鱼. It was still tasty and we would want to return to try the other flavours. The other dishes were also pretty good. The tofu box was really interesting with some diced mushrooms that provide an unusual taste and texture. The spinach in superior broth was done really nicely it tasted so premium. Tau Kwa Goreng was perfectly fried but a little spicy for me.

We were seated near a cabinet and discard trolley where staff kept walking to & fro, sometimes talking over our heads as they reach for stuff. Pretty unpleasant and lack of service etiquette.
Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.name: Lotus Vegetarian Restaurant

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Food is good, Service is good too. A little improvement can be done in the seating area and hygienic. They could have much better crowd comming in with that.

Visited Anand Bhavan, opposite to Mustaffa after a long time few years later. I always recommend to visit and try their menu. This is Indian Vegetarian Resturant, better to try their tiffins items rather than rice items. Service will be quick, though there was a huge rush, served within 10 mins. Tired their Masala Rava Dosa, Mini Sambar Idly, Sambar Vada, Onion Uttappam and Poori set, and all
Of them tasted good. Sambar have lot of Brinjals only instead they can add lot of other vegetables also.

Wrong decision to visit this place and worst was to ask for take away. Just wanted to get idly set take away and thought that it would be fast. But unfortunately, waited for about 30 minutes after payment was made. The place has kitchen next to the washroom entrance and it was smelly and very unpleasant to stand there to wait for my order to be delivered to me. Overall, not very clean place to visit. Observed many foreigners there who might be looking for only vegetarian food and had limited choice rather to be there. I am sure it could be managed better in terms of cleanliness, service, order management for simple stuff. However, I was there after many years and may take me another few years to step in again.

Price: $3.60 (Plain Thosai)

Plain Thosai: 5/5
Thosai was savoury, crispy, soft and had a good sour flavour.

Sambar: 4.5/5
Sambar was savoury, flavourful, a little sweet from the vegetables and familiar tasting.

Chutney: 5/5
The orange chutney was flavourful, tomatoey and a little spicy. The white chutney was quite gingery and sweet from the coconut. The brown chutney tasted peanuty, savoury and was rather spicy.

Total score: 14.5/15

Add-ons: Masala Tea ($2.60) was fragrant, warm and comforting but could use more spices.

Service was fast and I received my thosai within 5 minutes. It will be quicker to get your drinks directly from Counter 1 at the restaurant as they seem slightly short-handed in the drinks area. The lady managing counter 1 is really nice and makes your drinks after seeing your receipt. I saw this as a good thing since I could decide when I wanted to have my masala tea instead of having it served while I was having my thosai.

The place was air conditioned and the place can get crowded and is a really bustling place near lunch time.

All in all, I enjoyed my brunch of thosai and masala tea at Ananda Bhavan Restaurant (Vegetarian). :)

One of the popular South Indian breakfast places of Singapore. The food preparation is Tamil style and quantity is apt.

Overall the taste, quality and hygiene was good and rates were genuine.

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.name: Ananda Bhavan Restaurant (Vegetarian)

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Perfect if you visit with friends/family as you can order various things from the menu and share them together. Our favorites are the biryani and butter naan. Read many reviews saying that the carrot cake is a must try but it didn’t really suit our palettes. The samosas are tasty but not very special. The lychee drink is refreshing, really helps after a long walk exploring the city. Would definitely visit again on our next trip to SG.

Price: $6.54 (Plain Thosai)

Plain Thosai: 5/5
Thosai was very crispy, savoury and slightly sour.

Sambar: 5/5
Sambar was flavourful, savoury, hearty and had a good lentil taste.

Chutney: 5/5
Orange chutney was tangy, sweet and spicy. White chutney was coconuty and spicy.

Total score: 15/15

Add-ons: Masala Tea ($4.16) was fragrant from the spices used and warm and comforting to drink.

There was a little waiting time but it was definitely worth the wait as the plain thosai was very delicious. From the thosai to the sambar and the two different chutney. Service team were really responsive to requests and new orders.

The place was brightly lit and a cozy place to have your Indian vegetarian classic as well as your familiar Singaporean dishes with a vegetarian twist.

The first time I went there, I had the vegetable briyani, Gobi 65, Aloo Gobi and mango lassi. The food was good and the lassi was awesome, don’t fade the lassi.

The second time that I went there, I had the fried carrot cake, murtabak and Gobi Manchurian and I’ll say to skip the Gobi Manchurian as the cauliflower was almost non-existent and I was just eating a lot of batter. The fried carrot cake is decent for an vegan take as it is not commonly available and the murtabak is alright but can be skipped.

Food was really nice. Enjoyed the dishes! The service can be improved, we were more or less asked to leave the moment we finished our food. We understand that they have limited seating and a queue but just felt rushed.

Good variety on the menu but I do find it moderately highly priced. Service was typical yet they really do have interesting things on the menu with Chinese and muslim influence. It has its own character but I do very much prefer pure Indian cuisine. It’s nice for the occasional change. Location was good, walking distance to the Little India train station and restaurant is clean and cool with air conditioning.

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.name: Gokul - Raas Vegetarian Restaurant

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The presentation of the set meal is particularly exquisite and delicious. It shows the chef's care and seriousness, and the restaurant environment is also very comfortable. The waiters are also very polite. So we enjoyed it during our meal.👍🏻

First time here for the alacarte lunch buffet and was really impressed. Staff were friendly and very attentive (especially Lily, 阿宝, and a third guy who served us - didn’t catch his name), and food was of excellent quality, better than most other vegetarian places we have visited. Dimsum offerings are also unique. Will definitely come back again!

This is my first time to having the vegetarian. I didn’t expect that vegetarian food would be so delicious and special. The baked vegetarian fish and fire cracker monkey head mushrooms are amazing! Every dish is very delicious, the waiters are also very kind and the service is attentive. I will definitely come again next time👍

We were here tonight.
Food was good. Portion was just right.
We are specially delighted to serve by Karen and her other colleagues.
Because of Karen humour, we all had a very enjoyable evening.
Thank you so much Karen n others!
Keep it up the good work. It definitely adding a plus to the restaurant.

My favorite vegetarian restaurant. We went there for lunch. The staffs are friendly. All the dishes were beautiful presented. Recommend braised wild bamboo pith in collagen soup and homemade edamame bean curd topped with fresh mushroom. Very delicious.
Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.name: LingZhi Vegetarian @ Liat Towers

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The food was super good! I'm glad I made the ride here! The customer service was no so good but that has been my experience in Singapore hahaha 🤣 you must try the vegan dumplings they are the best! I also had the Nasi Lemak and it was delicious 😋🤤.

It's in B1 so take the elevator then go through the door on your left lol.

In case your looking for the restaurant it's downstairs in B1, we went for dinner and it was very quiet. Ordered the clay pot rice which was the highlight! Dumplings were so so with to much wrap for my taste. Laksa was ok also. Overall it was quick service and Decent food. You have to order also at the counter and pay upfront.

This place looks... ordinary... in fact a little plain and obscure. But, the food is phenomenally good. Seriously they should be awarded a Michelin Star.
Came highly recommended by my partner, and despite a long work day, we chose to go for dinner. We ordered what you see in the pictures--and we were blown away. Really, very good, no it's outstanding.
Everything is good, and I particularly like the dumplings, the Nonya laksa, Lasagne, especially the Korean noodle Jajangmyeon, I must go back there and eat again! And the cheese cake is to die for! They have a reputation for THE BEST VEGETARIAN LASAGNE in Singapore, voiced by Food Critics, and I can tell you, you would have wasted your trip if you did not try it!
The service is personal, plain, direct and friendly (no airs). The people here are just down to earth, and the food service is fast. It's best to go in the evening, because it's in the CBD area, and therefore day time it would be crowded.
This is a vegan place, so for those of you are allergic to milk or preservatives, you can eat with a peace of mind.
I would highly recommend this place, give a 4.5 Star. The 1/2 star missing is for them to include more local favourite like the Char Kway Teow and perhaps Hor Fun. Really all they serve there is very very good. Go and thank me later. Just go!

One of the trusted place for vegetarian food. Always enjoy the simple but nice offering there... Assam fish has the sour kick. Nasi Lemak was great with the chilli.

Small menu yet you can definitely find something you’ll like! Has a range of local food and western food - Nonya laksa, chicken rice, dumplings to lasagne and salads!

I have tried the laksa, very rich not too spicy soup. The chicken rice made from beancurd is very meaty and the chilli sauce has a kick!

My favourite drink to order is their homemade almond milk - very thick (might not be for everyone), rich and filling.

It is at basement of havelock II, it has limited seats due to the small storefront, and can be a good place to catch up with friends as the area is not too noisy

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.name: Genesis Vegan Restaurant

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
First food experience in Singapore… and I am so impressed!
The food was excellent - portion sizes are generous. Two plates and small noodles was more than enough for two to share and almost finish. Drinks were quenching, and the service was outstanding. Thank you!

I got invited for lunch by work friends to this wonderful vegetarian restaurant. Being a vegetarian, I was delighted to see the vast options in the menu. Each dish we ordered was unique and with distinct aroma and taste. I particularly recommend signature olive rice, Garden Medley, Tempeh Long Beans with Olive to name a few. A very satisfying experience and look forward to next visit.

My very first visit to a vegetarian restaurant.  Service was great. They let me in a few minutes earlier than the opening time when they saw me waiting outside.

Staff were professional, proactive, and helpful.

I appreciated it when the staff told me that the number of dishes I ordered was already a lot, and previously informed me that the dishes I ordered were all mushroom-based and recommended different dishes for variety.

Food was tasty, especially the Thai green curry and the rendang. One of our companions was amazed when he was told the "chicken" in the dish he ate was not meat.

Portions were sizable and work well for group diners.

Whole Earth should be considered as the best restaurant serving plant-based food in Singapore. The location is in the Tanjong Pagar neighbourhood, just a short walk from the MRT station. They serve incredible vegetarian food. I’d say it’s quite unusual in a meat country such as Singapore.

Vegetarian food is hard to find as many eateries only offer a very small number vegetarian food on their menus. (usually pizza, sandwiches or soup).
The place is nicely renovated. The interior with its decor is simple & uncluttered. The establishment seems more keen on focusing on the food rather than a flashy interior. I’d suggest to book a table in advance.

The service is fast. The menu consists of classic dishes that’s a mix of  Peranakan & Thai. The restaurant is Singapore’s first & only plant-based restaurant to be awarded the Michelin Bib Gourmand for 6 years from 2016 - 2022. That, if anything, should make you curious & eager to visit.

For you who’s not vegan | vegetarian, don’t let the fact that this is a plant-based restaurant dissuade you from eating here or order food for take away. The quality, the taste, textures & the variety of flavours is second to none.

Generous portions
Quick and good service
U may want to make prior reservations since it is very busy during evenings and not much  place to accommodate walk-ins.
Neat and chique ambience. Easily accessible from tangong pagar MRT.

Pretty elaborate menu to cater to all taste buds. Amazing smokey aroma from the rice. Eat food while still hot. Once it cools off, taste no good

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.name: Whole Earth

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
A nice and interesting vegetarian restaurant. They have a good variety of different dishes to choose from, either as individual portion or meant to share. The dishes that we ordered tasted good. Also they have some selection of interesting beverages. There are also a variety of tea to choose from. Overall, a good place for a meal if you are vegetarian or want to eat vegetarian food.

Friendly services provided by the staff.The staff were accomodating to our seat and food request. They also offered to help us take a group photo. There are a wide range of food available on the menu. When we were undecidable on the pizza flavours, the staff recommended two of their most popular flavours - BBQ pizza and pesto pizza. We thoroughly enjoyed both pizzas. Overall, the food was delicious even for some of us who are non-vegetarians. Highly recommend iVegan!

I had few different mains here from asian to western.

I would recommend their black bean burger. The house made patty goes very well with the rest of the ingredients. See picture. The sauce pairs well too. The sweet potato fries are seasoned  just right, not too heavy. Salad refreshes the palette. I also tried their bbq mushroom sandwich with the same sides and different sauce (mayo). It was decent.

For the guacamole sushi, it is unique and worth a try.

For the Asian mains, I have tried rice and noodles for the set lunch. I feel they are on the bland side. However, you can request to add more salt and pepper on your order. The peach gum dessert is also very less sweet and taste very healthy.

The staff is very friendly. Sometimes, complimentary appetizer would be served. Expect to spend close to 20 dollars for a meal here.

Great flavours, great aesthetics and vibes, great service! Staff kindly gave us a heads up that their food is towards the lighter side but all the dishes we ordered turned out so flavourful and satisfying hmm so didn’t face the issue of food being bland at all. Service was great too!

We tried the salad, mushroom soup, sushi and grilled broccoli/mushrooms. All were served promptly and were delicious. Wasn’t too difficult getting a table on weekend dinner.

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Very ambient place to eat saatvik veg food. Everything here is without onion n garlic. Unlimited buffet options also available here. Loved the food 😋.

The food is great overall, though sometimes they try to cut corners. For instance, pre-made rotis become hard and stretchy. I opted for the buffet and it was amazing, except for the roti on a particular day.

Amazing food and great portion, all food without garlic onion. We ordered this for 3 people and had enough to take away for another meal! Also probably the best puri I've had!
- Malai Kofta
- Paneer Butter Masala
- Jeera Aloo

Great food for folks looking for Jain / no onion-garlic meals, this is one of the best restaurant in little India, Singapore. Basic food with great taste, good variety and pocket friendly. Just improve service a notch and it will be perfect..

Divine Veg Saatvik food for cleansing your body and soul ! A service to humanity , Enjoy the buffet at a trivial cost listening to therapeutic Hare Krishna chants ! 🙏 The service staff are amazing , try engaging with them to know about the culture !

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.name: Swaad - The art of food Pure Vegetarian Restaurant

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Comforting and delightful korean cuisine that is vegan and vegetarian friendly. Love most of the dishes I tried in my multiple visits here. Highly recommended. There were alot of insects in the restaurant on the day of my visit but it could be because of the rain.

Ordered via grab food. The kimchi jiggae healed my flu. The bulgogi fries were addictive.  The tteokbokki had the perfect chew.  Can't wait to actually eat at the restaurant to have a full experience.

I enjoyed my dish Army Stew which as you can see from the photo was bubbling away for minutes. My wife was rather underwhelmed by her dish though unfortunately.
The Kimchi Jeon (pancakes) were nice enough though not better than Indian flavoured breads/uttapam in that the flavour was not as storied/flavourful as we expected.
Staff were very nice and I'm sure if we had visited it when busier then we would have probably enjoyed it more. Their sister branch we happened to pass one evening and had a completely different feel, more intimate and cosy so we may try that another time. Very nice man on the reception.

The rare place that my daughter who is a vegan to enjoy Korean food. Surprisingly it's quite good even for a non-vegetarian like me.

Exceptional Korean food at a decent price.

Food is excellent & service is prompt. Tofu soup is delicious and flavourful, with the ingredients generously portioned. Omelette & Kimbap are also great.

This is also one of the few Korean places I've encountered where the Kimchi pancake can be shared between 2 people, which is great if you aren't dining in a large group.

Definitely give this place a try if you get the chance! Be warned you may have to queue during lunchtime.
Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.opening_hours:

Sunday: 11:45 AM – 9:00 PM
Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.name: The Boneless Kitchen

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
What a hidden gem! Very homely and cosy environment with great food!
We enjoyed every dish and the innovation behind each of them. Unique dishes not seen elsewhere and the set meal allowed us to have a taste of all the great dishes. Most dishes were made from scratch, even the ikan bilis! All made with minimal or no seasoning and all natural ingredients. Yum! 😍
Very worth it and I'll definitely be back again!

Great for celebrations. Remember to make a reservation. We were a group of 11 people and service was great. They made special provisions for parking because we had a family member with mobility issues. We also had a birthday cake and celebration.

Foodwise, in my opinion 佛有缘 serves the most unique vegetarian cusine in Singapore. The best is still Miao Yi (for personal reasons) but it closed down 😢 Forget about the 自在 "empire", Shu and coffee shop zizar, it's always the same old thing.

We had the cold dish with "ice vegetable" salad, which is really good. The yuzu monkey head mushroom is always a hit. The sugarcane flower is unique. And last and not the least, the humble bee hoon - is always a family favourite.

A Delightful Vegetarian Culinary Journey at Fo You Yuan Vegetarian Restaurant

Apart from the outstanding food, the service at Relocate Vegetarian Restaurant was impeccable. The staff members were friendly, attentive, and eager to cater to our needs, making us feel welcomed and valued throughout our dining experience.

Overall, Relocate Vegetarian Restaurant has truly impressed us with their diverse and mouthwatering selection of dishes. Whether you’re a vegetarian or simply looking to explore plant-based alternatives, this restaurant is an absolute gem. We highly recommend it to anyone seeking a memorable dining experience with top-notch vegetarian cuisine.

The delicate strands of noodles were expertly stir-fried with an assortment of fresh vegetables, creating a harmonious medley of taste and aroma.

The Rendang was a true masterpiece. The rich and aromatic coconut-based curry was impeccably spiced, resulting in a tantalizing symphony of flavors.

One of the highlights of our meal was the Vegetarian Shark’s Fin Soup. It was a delightful surprise to find a cruelty-free alternative that retained the essence and texture of the traditional dish.

The Sweet & Sour dish was a perfect balance of tanginess and sweetness, complemented by succulent mushroom and an assortment of colorful bell peppers and pineapples.

To end our meal on a sweet note, we indulged in the Yam Paste with Gingko Nuts. The smooth and velvety yam paste was flawlessly cooked and paired beautifully with the tender gingko nuts

Old school vegetarian restaurants good not too salty good service. Friendly staff. Must try for old school vegetarian restaurants. They have moved a few times already hopefully they can stay here. Finally found them again. I have been eating at this restaurant over 15 years now...still as good as the first time I tried....

I'm super glad that we have a Chinese vegetarian in Desker Road, stone throwaway from Mustafa. Food was authentic and feeling good old days. Fantastic and thank you for opening an outlet in Little India.
Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.opening_hours:
Monday: Closed

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.name: Fo You Yuan 佛有缘素食馆

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Great food, since many years ago. Vegetarian but meat eaters will enjoy this place too.

Mezze platter was quite big even for 2 pax.

Really enjoyed the moussaka and the Spanakopita.

If you pay by cash there is some free ice cream.

First time visiting due to friend’s recommendation. Did not disappoint. Lots of options that don’t make you feel you’re eating vegetarian. Drink menu is extensive but on pricey side. Service was good.

Ambience - The restaurant has this very European, relaxed vibe. Good for families but I don‘t see why you can’t go for a date either 😁

Food - my friend and I ordered the halloumi salad and lasagna. We really enjoyed the meal, the ingredients were good quality and food was prepared with care. However, did feel the halloumi was a bit too salty. They have a variety of Mediterranean and Italian options and can make it vegan too. Didn’t really enjoy the rose though.

Service - prompt service and the staff were polite and friendly

Would definitely return again.

You won't believe how rare it is to have a Mediterranean vegetarian place that has so many allium free options, including the Pizzas. Glad to see original sin survive the pandemic when many didn't.

The Moussaka and Mediterranean pizza were good, though a little too salty but that's probably just me. Nice ambience for a date with friends or the significant other, especially over a good conversation. You pay for the quality. Enjoy!

Wonderful and classy vegetarian restaurant. Had dinner here with the wife on a weekday evening. Food was wholesome, good service and atmosphere. Recommended!
Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.address: 01-62 Jln Merah Saga, Chip Bee Gardens, Blk 43, Singapore 278115
Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.name: Original Sin Restaurant

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Vegetarian is a good place for vegetarians for an experience. The variety of food is very good, portion is decent and price is awesome. The sucklings pig is crispy and soft on the inside. The pineapple fried rice is fluffy and flavourful. There is 3 level in the building and plenty of food available. The toilet is clean. The staff is professional and good. The restaurant is also well decorative

A great selection of delicious vegan foods 😋. Everything is plant based, with the exception of entries clearly marked as containing dairy and / or honey, most of which can be made vegan per request. Massive menu of delightful dishes.
Easy to find - right next to the Budda Tooth Relic Temple.
Reservations are recommended

This is a pure vegetarian Chinese restaurant close to Buddha temple in Chinatown. For Indians, this is 'Jain vegetarian' - no onion, no garlic. The food was very tasty. Ben (présume he is the owner) was very friendly. The warmth of the service added to the great experience. Though the menu doesn't look like a vegetarian one, these are all mock-meat..made from tofu. A nice place for vegetarians to get an authentic taste of Chinese food.

A great survivor of the pandemic unlike it's contemporary Miao Yi at nearby People's Park Centre 😢. We are grateful that we still have a place for restaurant standard Chinese vegetarian cuisine. The Ee Fu noodles has a good balance of noodles and vegetables.

Surprisingly, some dishes aren't that expensive, with the mock meat and tofu dishes going for $12 for the small version. You might find some neighborhood vegetarian stalls at coffeeshop to be slightly more expensive! 😱 My only complaint is that a bowl of plain rice is $1.20 🫨 Also note that the resto is on the 2nd floor and might be challenging for elderly or mobility impaired to climb.

A nice place for a quiet, even slightly above budget meal. And the place to bring your friends and family for a good old vegetarian splurge. Either way, bon appetit!

One of the best places we eat in Singapore. It is vegetarian and also have dishes using artificial vegetarian meat. They have been been featured in many awards and also people are kind. Food rates good. It is next to Buddha temple on the corner and in first floor.

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The place has cafe like atmosphere. Food only has 6 course and 8 course meal only. The course meal can not be shared. The food portion is not so big, my friend and I ordered 6 course each and it feels very filling.

Ok so here is the deal, this was my last restaurant during my stay in Singapore and I almost didn't come because I thought it was only vegetarian but they have 2-4 options for every course and it was BY FAR THE BEST vegan meal I've had on my trip. I even had the potato salad and as a black man, I'm very picky about this, but it was unique and really good! The pasta, the bread stick, the drinks, the miso soup with surprises at the bottom. I mean if I wasn't leaving tonight, I would come back tomorrow! Please come here if you are VEGAN!!!! and I told the owners to please advertise that they have vegan options because they are so delicious 🤤🤤🤤

Only two set meal options are available (6 courses or 8 courses ) No À la carte option. No sharing of meals is allowed, meaning all dinners must ordered one set meal.

The starter are not bad and the salad is good.

Ordered the following dishes for the mains:

Olive fried rice
雷茶 Spaghetti
Star pizza
Baked Cauliflower
Baked Rice

Overall, the food was just ok, not really fantastic and worth the price.

Compared to another similar restaurant "Element", which I think it is much better and slightly cheaper 😀.

There are new dishes. 😍
Staff friendly and the food is delicious
Today Main Course ~~Cheesy Lemon Zest Liguine with Balsamic Vinegar (they can help removed onion garlic) and Lion's Mane Mushroom Steak with Crispy Mix Veggie. Love it. ❤️

I visited for lunch and was initially informed that only the lunch set was available, and individual dishes couldn't be ordered. This left me disappointed as I wanted to sample various items from the menu. However, I later learned that the set menu allowed me to select dishes from the à la carte menu.

During my visit, I tried the following:
1. Wholefood trio appetizer - a delightful starter that truly whetted my appetite.
2. Rosemary breadstick with mustard dip.
3. Mulberry cider - quite enjoyable.
4. Baked butter mushroom with garlic butter - a tasty dish.
5. Double-boiled cordyceps white fungus soup with black garlic.
6. Peppery golden quinoa risotto - although good, it lacked the desired level of peppery flavour, so I requested additional pepper to enhance it.
Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.name: Sufood

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Kwan Inn Vegetarian, a Singaporean gem since the 1990s, stands out for its commitment to quality and innovation in vegetarian cuisine. Their 8 Treasures Fried Rice and Thai Style Fried Rice are culinary brimming with flavors. Try the Fried Prawn, served with a delightful Pineapple Mayonnaise dip. It's a tantalizing blend of crispy goodness and sweet tanginess, complementing their diverse menu perfectly. The menu also boasts ethical choices like Vegetarian Sharkfin Soup, comforting and guilt-free. Don't forget to end your meal on a sweet note with the Cold Lemon with Aloe Vera Dessert, a refreshing delight.

having vegan food during 九王爷诞。food is quite decent, got many type of dessert as well. Price is abit expensive 20-30% compare to nearby shop maybe due to service and nice deco inside. Can come here for vegan food after praying at the guam yim temple.

One of my family’s favourite restaurant especially my son’s. The food is great over all these years, eaten almost 30 years. The price is reasonable except lunar new year. The boss is very friendly and the Chinese male staff gives great service. Our fav will be the cold dish, shark’s fin soup and the fried bee-Hoon. The Mala is the one that is a bit expensive but really nice.

Visited on 27/08/2022. Reached there around 2pm+ but still crowded majority 70% tables fully occupied. First time visited as wanted to try it's vegetarian food. Not much choices for ala carte  menu. So try its Fried Beehoon, $6. Taste-wise yummy. Order a pot of chrysanthemum tea $2,full of chrysanthemum flower in pot. If want to add some snack have to walk to entrance there's different types of snacks display in cabinets. Have to choose n used a tong to take and queue to pay only cash payment. Tried vegetarian chicken and vegetarian sping roll,it's yummy. For mode of payment there's Paywave but if you paid by cash will not charge of GST. Overall,like the yummy food, will definitely revisit again, to try others food.

Food is not bad . But the service of some staff is horrendous . Its like cant wait for you to walk out of the store . ( so that they can be lazy again ? Then whats the point of employing so many ? )

The tall lady service staff quite ok
( theres is only 1 tall lady service staff there so should be able to know who )

The others staffs manning the snacks station is also ok .

The elderly Auntie Cashier is VERY RUDE . Wanted to pay by card . ( Understood theres additional 8% ) and already made clear its ok . She still saying dont have cash etc with an annoyed look . Very very impolite .

* looking among the comments . Service seems to be a perpetual problem here . Boss should take a look why this is so .
( unless boss dont care bout the biz )

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
A delight to every South Indian dish that’s being presented! The restaurant holds the legacy with not just the location, the interior but also to the taste with food. We tried a few variations including the famous meal and biriyani. A must try will be the meal combo, served hot. We had to wait for around 30 mins to get seated but it’s worth the wait.. ground floor and first floor has seating capacity. The prices are very reasonable for the quantity being served. Will definitely recommend this place for all South Indian vegetarian fans!

Food here is good, not that very bad. Service got to improve. Environment can be cramped and noisy. Pricey but still okay, you pay what you asked for. I was served food first, even finished up eating the foods but drinks were served after 5-10 after finishing up my meals. Masala tea arrived 30-40 minutes late upon ordering. This is not acceptable at all. And never even apologized for serving the drinks late. I ordered one ice tea and one masala tea. Also, I personally feel the standard of the food have dropped a lot. Used to patronize here often but I think it's about time that the service and food taste is falling apart.
Overall food is 7.5/10.
Service is 3/10.
Environment is 4.5/10.
This review is based on my honest opinion.

I saw this on a food travel show and immediately wanted to try it out.

There was a short queue but seated after 5min or so wait. Service was friendly and no fuss. Dining area is simple but as expected.

Definitely lived up to expectations with amazing, fresh, authentic and tasty food. I had the dosai meal which had 3 curries, some chutneys, Daal, sambar, and even a sweet sago coconut pudding. Amazing flavours, colours and spices. A generous meal which was thoroughly enjoyable.

For a sweet finish I tried the almond hawa and milk kova which were both new to me. Very sweet but had their own unique taste and texture which hit the spot.

One improvement would be to use less plastic for serving food - lots of little plastic containers on my meal set and for sweets.

Overall a great experience and will definitely be recommending and be back.

The food and service is always good in Komala Vilas. We stay nearby so we can walk to this restaurant during our jaunt in Singapore.
I wish they include an elevator to go upstairs for lunch. On request they let my parents share the meals but mentioned there will be no refills.
Taste is always exceptional.

Nestled in the heart of Little India, Singapore, Komala Vilas Indian Restaurant is a culinary gem that proudly showcases a rich history of authentic Indian cuisine. With a legacy spanning over several decades, this restaurant has been a beacon of tradition and a must-visit for anyone seeking genuine Indian flavors.

Authenticity Unveiled: Komala Vilas has stayed true to its roots, preserving the authenticity of Indian culinary traditions. From its traditional South Indian dishes to the flavors of the North, every plate served here is a journey through the diverse and vibrant cuisine of India. The recipes have been carefully passed down through generations, ensuring that each bite tells a story of India’s culinary heritage.

Efficiency Meets Warmth: One of the standout features of Komala Vilas is its impeccable service. The staff is known for their swift and friendly demeanor, ensuring that you not only receive your food promptly but also feel welcomed. Their commitment to creating a warm and inviting atmosphere enhances the dining experience.

Culinary Excellence: The true star of Komala Vilas is the remarkable quality and taste of the food. Each dish is a work of art, with fresh ingredients and a perfect blend of spices. Whether you crave the crispy dosas, aromatic biryanis, or rich curries, every bite is a burst of flavors that will transport your taste buds to India. Vegetarian or non-vegetarian, the menu caters to every palate with equal finesse.

In summary, Komala Vilas Indian Restaurant is not just a place to eat; it’s an exploration of India’s culinary diversity. The history, authenticity, fast and welcoming service, and, above all, the mouthwatering food, make it a true treasure in Little India, Singapore. When you dine here, you embark on a journey to India without leaving the vibrant streets of Singapore.

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Visiting Afterglow was a vibrant journey into the heart of plant-based cuisine. The experience started with their signature Afterglow Maki Rolls, a perfectly balanced spicy and tangy treat that set my taste buds alight, though they were a bit dry; however, upon request, the waiter kindly offered me some complementary almond spread as a dip.

Next came the Cauliflower ‘Steak’. It was nothing short of a culinary marvel, turning a humble vegetable into a dish bursting with flavor and texture, both hearty and delightful.

Finally came the Acai Bowl, a dessert that defied all my expectations. It wasn’t just a simple bowl of fruit and granola; it was an artful blend of fresh, juicy fruits, the crunch of granola, and the velvety smoothness of acai sorbet. Each spoonful was a celebration of taste, striking a rare balance between indulgence and health. This dish wasn’t just the end of a meal; it was the highlight, leaving a lasting impression of how incredibly satisfying and diverse vegan food can be.

Afterglow isn’t just a restaurant; it’s a testament to the beauty and richness of vegan cuisine. It’s a place where every dish is crafted with care, not just for the flavors but for the story it tells about plant-based eating. For anyone who cherishes vegan food or is curious about it, Afterglow is a must-visit. I loved it and will definitely be back!

Had a very attentive server explaining the ingredients behind the dishes. The menu is well marked for common allergens such as nuts, gluten, alliums, etc.

We absolutely loved the vegan meatballs. Each dish was flavorful and even our non-vegans friends had an enjoyable experience at this restaurant. The salads are also nicely seasoned. Would like to come back for their desserts next time.

The place is quite cozy and intimate but perhaps not suitable for larger groups (6+ people) as it is hard to navigate between tables.

First time visited with a friend for a lunch. The ambience and atmosphere is relaxing. The food portions are quite big and very satisfying. Really grateful for the kind lady who explained us and asked us if we had any allergies etc and notified us of the dishes that have nuts at the same time gave some good recommendations. Very attentive, detailed and the food was delicious. Such a heartwarming experience.

Some of the dishes are very nice, but overall too pricey. I like the vegetable purée, tomyum zoodles and cold lasagne very much. The beetroot hummus is good too. Kimchi roll is decent as well.

The atmosphere was cozy and inviting, perfect for a relaxing meal. The staff members were incredibly friendly and welcoming.  They took the time to give us detailed explanations of the dishes and provided us with their recommendations.

Every dish we've tried was bursting with flavors even though its vegan.
One dish that really stood out to me was the mushroom balls.
Its packed with savory umami flavors and the texture is on point.
The cauliflower steaks were also perfectly seasoned and had a delightful char that added a smoky depth to the dish.

The friendly and attentive service combined with the incredible food made for a truly memorable dining experience.

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
This is a Indian vegetarian Resturant and good for their varieties to thali offers. They have Punjabi, Gujarati thali, special Jalebi and Froops fruit based ice creams. Food taste will be average and service will be good, staff is very friendly and timely serves the customers.

Food: The food was delicious, well flavoured and not the extremely spicy. We tried the puri bhaji and the bhaji was a little bland but we added a bit of salt and it was good to go. I got their dal batti churma as a takeaway and the dal was delicious, however the bati was a little different and more doughy than I’m used to but it was still delicious. The churma however had more sugar than wheat so that could do with improvement. The star was definitely the gatta Sabzi which was extremely delicious. The dahi puri was also delicious. Overall, we were satisfied and would definitely eat there again. They have a wide variety from Mexican, Italian to the normal North Indian and Indo Chinese and being a vegetarian restaurant, it provides great variety to vegetarians.

Service: This wasn’t great as the staff who attended us was a bit rude. He kept on insisting that we should order more puris (we got 4 to share between 2 ladies) but we know how we can eat. The dahi puri was the last thing to come and i had forgotten that we’d ordered it so I said this is not ours and he said “this one ordered” referring to my friend. My friend was very shocked and I feel more training should be given to staff so they know how to refer to people. I don’t think that’s a very nice way to refer to your customers.

Ambience - It’s not a fancy place and as it was the weekend, it was quite packed and a bit stuffy. However, we didn’t mind as the food made up for it.

Great place for Gujarathi thali in Singapore . Good ala Carte options reminds of mumbai food . We had both Punjabi and Gujarati thali

Excellent vegetarian place.

There are numerous fusion loads to choose from, including Indian and Mexican menus. The food was flavorful and delectable. Portion size was reasonable for the price.
Friendly staff and excellent service.

Overall, it was a pleasant experience. I will definitely return.

I recently ate there and it was delicious! I can't wait to go back and try more dishes. Everything was so flavorful and fresh, and the prices were reasonable too.

Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Lovely spacious place with plenty of seating. Wholesome vegetarian meal at decent pricing. Staff were helpful but clearly busy.

They also have a bread bar and small grocery corner selling fresh vegetables and interesting and healthy foodstuff. The coconut bun was tiny but so delicious. Ask for it to be heated up for you.

A tip: it can get really packed so you might end up with a sofa seat rather than a dining table. Try booking a table!

Compared to typical Chinese vegetarian restaurants, which serve mainly fried foods , this restaurant serves many greens options, and the salad really tastes good.

Ordered three different types of pizza, and the odd one is the "Tom Yum." Pizza tastes really a bit weird.  The taste of Yum ingredients does not blend well with the pizza 😅.

We also ordered two burgers, and they are very nice.

Overall, this is a very nice restaurant for both vegetarian or non vegetarian persons who like to have a healthy meal 😋

Very pleasant ambience and super polite staff! I was so pleased to see that there were so many vegetarian options on the menu! :’)
The turmeric risotto was quite interesting, it tasted and looked a lot like an Indian dish, ahaha! The pesto noodles were also quite good.

A healthy vegetarian restaurant that serves great food along Orchard road. The ambience is very cosy and quite with separate sections.
The food is very fresh and delicious. Dumpling was served hot with a lot of ingredients inside. The salad is huge and I love the sauce so much.
This restaurant also provides nutrition count in their menu which is very convenient for anyone who is on diet or care about fitness.
Definitely will come back to try more if I'm around this area and want something fresh in a hot day.
*water is charged.

I find the restaurant a bit dim. The food was fabulous. Everything was nice, except for two. Tom yum pizza and the broccoli pizza. The taste was exotic and overwhelming for my wife and I. Rojak is a must try, and I love the varieties of Tea  in the Menu. I heard the dumping was good, it was sold out during my visit, will try next time.
