Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
I want to preface this review by mentioning that I'm not a professional food critic, and my thoughts are based on how I felt during my family dinner experience for my grandfather's birthday.

Our dining experience was unfortunately not up to our expectations. Firstly, the food left much to be desired as everything tasted very bland. We had to request salt and pepper, and even after adding a generous amount, it didn't do much to enhance the flavours.

To make matters worse, the servers missed out on serving the APPLE CIDER, which was supposed to be part of our 8-course meal. Instead, they brought it to us at the end of the entire meal while we were already packing up to leave soon. This left us feeling quite disappointed.

On a positive note, I must say that the atmosphere was pleasant and contributed to the overall experience. However, the lackluster food and the timing of the cider service were significant drawbacks to what should have been a special family celebration.

Celebrated my birthday here with my friend :) We were served by Mr Peter who did a great job in service and even gave me a surprise birthday treat towards the end.

The service here is impeccable and food is absolutely delicious! The set meal offered is very affordable, about $80 for 2 pax (8 course meal) 😊

10/10 will visit again. Thank you Mr Peter!

Well done vegetarian restaurant with lovely set meals.

Came here for lunch, and loved the decor and set up. Ordered the 5 course set meal and was delighted at the selections available.

I was however abit let down by the portion of the mains. The food was done very well, I loved the appetizers, but the mains was abit of a let down, portion wise. Taste was good and I really hoped the portion could be bigger as it was such a minimal serving that I was not even full after the 5 course meal. Service was ok but the servers did appear quite busy.

It would be worth coming over to try the dishes and experience vegetarian done in a very classy way.

The waiters had an average attitude and felt like they wanted to finish their work quickly, you could tell they were busy. Despite having booked a table a couple of weeks ago, we were placed close to the kitchen and the entrance to the restaurant, we did ask for a change of location but were refused. The food was average, nothing particularly good, the value for money is okay.

We have been patronising this Elemen outlet at the Millenia Walk since 2017, and never once have we been let down by their service or quality of food.
They serve a wide variety of fusion vegetarian cuisine at an affordable price. The food are flavourful to the palate and their presentation are pleasing to the eyes.
This outlet is helmed by Manager Peter and Asst Manager Cheng Yee who are friendly, accommodative and customer oriented.
However, due to manpower shortage and during peak hours, slowness in service may occur.
Vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.name: elemen 元素

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
Professional service was provided by the thoughtful and attentive staff. An entire birthday cake, not merely a slice, was given to us. Most dishes were great. The highlight of the meal was the seafood stew. All the breads were also exceptionally delicious. However, the sea bass tasted very ordinary and the sky high price tag went to the showy ‘performance’ by the chef. Restaurant was too dim and had a funky smell.

The staff are very friendly and the food is also tasty. The portion is surprisingly big and we ate till our hearts content.

Staff very helpful and polite. Atmosphere is chill with soft music. Food serve just in the right timing.  Of cause the price is not cheap. But it worth the price overall.

Lastly thanks for the birthday cake. Love it but we were too full to finish it.

Booked Sunday afternoon to have their set lunch, only to find out they only serve buffet that day at $78++ per person. Opted in anyway and didn't regret it, given the fresh ingredients, great taste of Italian and friendly staffs! Personally I love the dessert section especially Panna Cotta! If I had to pick on something, it'd be the dim lighting. No discount on the bill even with Shangri-la Circle membership, but you do get extra points.

Remember, when you get into the lobby, you are on 3F. You need to take an elevator to get down to 1F where the restaurant is.

The restaurant has decent ambience for a semi chic and comfortable dinning experience. The salt crusted fish is delicious and if you want to see some fire show. The winner for me is the crab pasta. Yum!

We celebrated our anniversary dinner here and it was a great decision! They generously presented us a complimentary cake, thank you for perfecting the night.
Among the dishes, we absolutely love the Porchetta. It was tender, yet crispy and flavourful, Highly recommended! While on the other side, we didn’t like the potato purée in the braised lamb leg dishes. It may have ruined the experience with that main dish. Despite that, this would not stop us from giving 5 stars because the other aspects (service/ambience) make up to it. A great dining place for celebrations.
Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.address: 22 Orange Grove Rd, Level One, Garden Wing, Singapore 258350
Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.query: Restaurants with outdoor seating in in Singapore

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
I went with my partner for a date night and was quite excited to try due to the location and design of the restaurant ..but unfortunately very basic food which was presented like fine dining. The steak was served dry and raw which when we complained was taken back, warmed and served back. 18$ truffle fries were soggy and salty. We paid like 250$ for 3 dishes and dessert.

A romantic place for lovers. Surrounded by nature and good food. There's nothing to not like here.
Amidst lush greenery and pristine forest air, it's truly "Love's in the air".
You can't help falling in love after this.
Finish the meal with a kiss 💋 to seal in the memories. ❤️.
By the way, menu is also halal.. 😊

The place is great. Not noisy on a weekday. Staff were excellent. Food options was good. Pricing felts a little on the high side. Restaurant has kids menu option - one of the pasta choice didnt taste great. Serving portion is good.

It was a work dinner where we pre ordered the items of the set menus. I had the Wagyu rump steak which was really good, no gamey taste and very juicy. Dessert was Valrhona chocolate tart which was so sinfully good, very chocolatey. The Halia also served complimentary matcha and banana chocolate macaroons.

The place was very nice, covered with greenery.
Service was great, staffs were attentive and food was served timely spaced out.
Not a place that’s very accessible unless you drive or take a hired ride. If you don’t drive, it’s a little hard to get a ride out.

The food here is fantastic. They are masters with flavour and use of herbs. It’s so in line with the whole experience of dining in the Botanical Gardens. For starters, the Octopus and duck are a must try. For Mains, get the scallops (they come with Barramundi). Both are great and served with beautiful balsamic vinegar (not the supermarket kind).
Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.query: Restaurants with outdoor seating in in Singapore

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
Dusk Restaurant & Bar is a hidden gem offering an exceptional Modern European dining experience. The food surpassed our expectations, with each dish reflecting a perfect blend of flavors and culinary expertise. The menu showcases a diverse selection, catering to various palates.

The ambience, especially during sunset, adds an enchanting touch to the dining experience. The view is breathtaking, creating a serene backdrop for a memorable meal. The well-thought-out decor and layout contribute to a sophisticated yet inviting atmosphere.

Moreover, the service at Dusk is impeccable. The staff is attentive, knowledgeable, and goes above and beyond to ensure a delightful dining experience. Their recommendations were spot-on, enhancing our overall enjoyment.

While the prices are reflective of the quality offered, the outstanding food, captivating ambience, and top-notch service make Dusk Restaurant & Bar a must-visit for those seeking a memorable and refined Modern European culinary adventure.

Great ambience & food. Celebrated my mum’s birthday here. We all loved the food. The beef cheek was really tender and mash was really creamy. The lobster was cooked really nicely. Even the birthday cake served on the house was good 😋 it was a really decadent and rich chocolate cake.

You could even purchase add-on cable car rides at the restaurant for just $5 per head.

We really enjoyed having our meal here as the view was fantastic. We went at 6.30pm and managed to enjoy the sunset. Food is reasonably priced considering the service and atmosphere. We were also given a complimentary slice of cake as it was my partner’s birthday.

REALLY NICE MEAL OUT

Popped into Dusk for dinner with a reservation. The highlight was the service we received, cordial and attentive! The food was simple but well done, but the cocktail mixes 🍹 and beer options 🍺 weren’t very impressive. Being said that, Dusk offered us such brilliant views, beautifully appointed and had an astonishing view of the city. Normally views like that carry a serious price tag, but to our surprise it’s surprisingly affordable here, and both food and drinks were well priced. Thumbs up!

Visited this place with 4 other friends last evening, and we managed to catch the sunset there! The view was amazing and beautiful!

The restaurant atmosphere was quite zen and chill when the sun is still up, and becomes romantic when the sun goes down. Haha! Quite a good environment for dates and/or hanging out with friends.

Most of the food is deliciously yummy, especially their meat items. We ordered the following:
- 3 sharing platters (1 beef, 1 lamb, 1 pork)
- 2 mains (prawn pasta and fish&chips)
- 1 sides (tomato meatballs)

I feel that everything's tasted good but some of my friends felt that the pasta wasn't up to their standards. Oh well~ to each of its own... I highly recommend the beef and lamb sharing platters and the meatballs!

As for the drinks, most of them are quite common like anywhere else but at affordable prices! There are a few unique drinks but weren't available last evening. 😔

Love the atmosphere and vibe. Will definitely visit this place again when there's occassions to celebrate. 😄

FYI, the restaurant is an outdoor one and there's only fans around.

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
Other than the pizza tasting decent, everything else left much to be desired. There was no reception upon entering the hotel, and the manager was not particularly friendly nor understanding: I had made a reservation prior for the rooftop bar, but I was not informed that there was a minimum spending required of $75 per person. It would have been courteous at least to have been informed prior. As such, my expectation of a pleasant dinner experience turned out to be an unpleasant and short-lived meal, what more right in the middle of the dim-lit hotel lounge as guests continued to stream in (yet with no other diners at 7pm), and while the manager worked at the table right next to us. That being said, if you can afford to spend for a luxurious atmosphere at the expense of a service, professionalism and good food, go ahead.

Cosy upscale Italian restaurant located on the ground floor of a boutique 5 star hotel.

Surprisingly empty on a Saturday evening, so we had the entire wait staff looking after us.

We started off with a refreshing French 77 drink paired with Tartufo Fries and Burrata Pomodoro & Pesto. Pretty good truffle fries, but not the best I had.

Cape Santa alla Griglia (scallops) was almost mind-blowing, with a crispy bread that is really delicious if you dip it in the amazing broth before taking a bite, and well-cooked scallops. Repeat note: Amazing broth.

Truffle porcini was a pretty big portion and really creamy. They ran out of the fresh truffle slices, whicj would have made this dish perfect.

We finished off with a classic Aperol Spritz. Done nicely, though not the best I had.

Overall, this is an excellent Italian dining option.

Foods are awesome especially the pizza mama mia(sorry cant pronounce the name)! We always come back because of the best customer service by Marcello. Not only that he gives the best food in the menu but he put personal touch in his service.

Loved all the dishes and the service was great too. Went up to the rooftop bar after dinner which had great views. A nice place to chill when you're done with dinner.

Chanced upon this place after seeing a review of places with rooftop bar. The food is not pretentious, instead they are what you would expect of delicious Italian food. The environment and hospitality is a plus - with the opportunity to head for a drink at the rooftop bar before settling for dinner at the restaurant. Great place wind down to have a Italian fare in a chic but relatively inexpensive place.

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
Surprisingly a very good lunch! Didn’t have expectations and was pleasantly surprised.

We had booked a table outside but the Singapore heat was too much to handle and decided to sit inside, which the staff were very kind in accommodating. Salmon was good and cooked well. The penne vodka sauce pasta was tasty and the caesar salad good as well.

Having lunch here is a great way to get views from the top of Marina Bay Sands without paying the admission fee for the deck.

We had a beautiful birthday dinner here, made better thanks to professional and friendly service, delicious Italian food, and a chill, cozy ambience.

The music can be quite upbeat that is similar to a club but softer, adding to the relaxed yet personal dining experience. Thank you to the team for a wonderful experience in the sky.

Wonderful view
So great for sunset
We were also able to catch the Super Tree Grove light show at 7:45 and then run to other side to watch the Spectra Water & Light show at 8:00

We only ate the truffle gnocchi & giant 1 pound meatball, be forewarned it is a meal all by itself.
The meat ball was great quality meat, my hubby said it was dry for his taste and the sauce saved it but I felt it was pretty juicy, so to each their own
The truffle gnocchi was absolute PERFECTION. The gnocchi was a good size and not to soft or mushy like it can get sometimes. The truffle flavor was very pronounced just the way I like itS and I particularly love that they shredded the truffle like a garnish on top rather than just one huge chunk of truffle. That way I could get a bite truffle and every single mouthful.

And at the end they surprised us with a happy anniversary cake and I have to say that cake was surprisingly good. I really enjoyed it.

The view and the staff are definitely the highlight of this place. The awesome skyline of Singapore can be appreciated from this restaurant, especially if you sit in the outdoor patio. In terms of food, it can be better. The price tag for some of the dishes are high considering it’s quality.

Overall very good service by our waiter. We really got the pasta as we asked for. Great. Our table wasn't ready as it just started raining and everyone needed to be moved inside.
View inside not really great but of course outside. Wine was quite pricey and not really good. But if you want to be once up.. best option!

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
Loved the food! Especially the Padaiappa rice, which was so authentic Tamil.. had a wonderful chat with the owner and he even changed the music to meet our request. Great service and thanks for making our Friday a truly enchanting experience.. will bring friends here next time!

Nice Indian bistro with good live Indian music. Even better food. Their padayapa rice is damn shiok. Their fried chicken wings too.

Visiting Singapore for a holiday and staying with my sister's family who lives there. We came here on a Saturday evening to celebrate her birthday. Her family is a regular at this place.

We certainly had a great time celebrating her birthday. The live band belting out the tamil songs were in their element and they were so gracious to take in all of the song requests coming from the patrons.

This was like an experience never before for me coming in from Chennai to have a tamil songs playing at a resto bar. We had Guinness on tap which was fine. The food orders took quite some time though and all of them were tasting good. I would definitely come back here in my next visit to Singapore as well.

The band and music was good. Service was ok as the wait staff were always walking around.

Problem was the wait for food was terrible. 2hrs for a Padaiyappa rice and the other dishes had to be reminded and main white rice had to be called again after the dishes arrived. Couldnt enjoy the meal and food.

The ambience and music band with TV for football was good. But food service was appalling.

Suggest to minimise your menu to finger food as Fri/Sat are your peak and cant seem to handle food orders once 8 or more pax at a table comes. I spent about $400 but didnt get the dinner feel from eating. Focus on e music and drinks and some light finger food.

Western and Indian and local menu maybe too much to handle for the business. Background music toned down a bit would also be good to hear us talking at the table.

The reviews all seem to say the same thing. Try work on it. We'll come again. But just music and drinks this time.

Our go-to place for drinks after basketball games in the evening. Prices for beers are good, and more importantly for me, they have a tap for Guinness. Fries and nuggets are our staple bar foods with the drinks. And added points for the always obliging staff to spare us packs of ice for our ceremonial icing down of old joints after games.

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
This is a very vibrant Italian restaurant with solid sound coming from Bose speakers. Food is great. Slow cooked Lamb Ragu pasta and eggplant parmigiana are amazing. Their firewood pizza is not to be missed too. A perfect environment to stay and chill with a glass or wine or beer after a nice dinner.

I visited this place for a dinner date. We had already made a reservation in advance, as we knew very well that this place would be packed on the weekends.

The staff were very nice to greet us as we made our way into the restaurant and even walked us over to our tables. The waiter at the time was very observant, and would constantly check up on how we were  doing.

More on the food:

(Appetizer)
Burrata Bruschetta - 8/10 🌟
- The Burrata was really lovely!
- The sweet and juicy tomatoes compliments the creamy and milky cheese

However, the bread was a little tougher than expected that our knives struggle to cut through. Nevertheless, it was pretty delicious 🤤😋

(Appetizer)
Eggplant Parmigiana -  10/10 🌟🤌
- Absolutely bussin!
- It tastes better than a regular lasagne, the eggplant is barely noticeable. Which is good in a way as my partner is not too much of a fan of veggies.
- The sauce topped with the cheese just makes this dish one of the best in my opinion

(Main)
Diavola pizza - 9/10 🌟
- Spicy, greasy and meaty pizza
- The spicy and salty sorpressata balances the thick and absorbent pizza dough
- Low-key better than pepperoni pizzas 🤭

*Unfortunately I forgot to take a picture*

(Dessert)
Flambéed Chocolate Ecstasy - 6/10🌟
- Presentation was really good 👍
- Interesting concept of both Hot and Cold dessert

However, our brownies were a little too frozen 😕. We knew it was a hot and cold dessert as there was ice cream served with the hot-plated brownies. But when we tried to scoop booth goodies, the brownie was frozen hahaha. Interesting concept but would recommend other stuff like the tiramisu maybe.

Overall, excellent experience. Prompt service, a little pricey but worth the occasional visits. Came in hungry, left full  😵

My first time dining here and the staffs here are really sweet and customer oriented. They made the dining here with my girlfriend beyond pleasant. They made small talks with you and check on you regarding the quality of the food. The food was amazing but my friend and I couldn’t finished it because we are 2 girls that over ordered. If you are going for a date, this place is extremely ideal. Will definitely be back.

Was here for a birthday celebration. Staff was very nice and provided complimentary tiramisu cake (slightly alcoholic), which tasted phenomenal. Pizza is very well balanced and does not get gelat from a few bites, while the pastas and risottos pack a good flavourful punch. In total, it was slightly pricey but overall nice place to wine and dine.

Regarding indoors seating, music is kinda loud to have a clear conversation. Place is pet friendly and there are many dogs around

Service was underwhelming for the price paid.  Not the worst. But one would expect better.

Food. so long is pizza or pasta or Italian is nice. The pork chop was soso only.  Pizza came before the starters.

Dessert is a must have!! The tiramsu and flaming chocolate extasy. Don't touch the hot pan!!!

Wine selection is good and recommendation by the wine guy was great!!!

Good for celebrations... or hangout.
But bring a big wallet.

Free parking (4hrs) too if u need to know  1 ticket per bill.

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
It was my first visit with my wife to Merci Marcel, we were delighted by the overall vibes of the restaurant. We ordered the eggs Ben and French Toast Brioche, latte and flat white. The food and coffee were excellent, the portion of eggs Ben was a bit small though. A great place to chill!!

My first visit to Merci Marcel and my friends and I had a good time bonding over the food and the servers were great, especially Marilyn who was patient in giving us and overview of food selects and sharing the specials of the day. Soft yellow lighting gave it a nice cosy family/friends evening gathering atmosphere vibes. Thumbs up!

Good services. Food is presented artistically.
Latte is nice with a cute pattern, although this pattern is not very stable.
The French toast is okay. A bit pricy but understandable because this is Orchard.
Good environment with sunshine.

Very good! Although we didn't have a reservation, they managed to fit us in. The staff were all friendly and provided a fast and efficient service. The food and coffee were amazing, not to mention the cafes' atmosphere was very relaxing. It was a lovely breakfast and experience.

Amazing place, nice atmosphere. Food was excellent but the portions are small (unless you ordered pizza). Also on the higher price range, so do take note. Great for special occasions though!

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
One of the best places so far. Price is a little steep but still one of the best. Alfresco was cooling and chill vibes.
Truffle mushroom pizza is one of the best I have ever eaten. Not too creamy, just nice. Truffle has a complex taste, nothing monotonous like the cheap gas smell.

Seafood pasta was also great, strong umami taste with a touch of spicy

Amazing food, one of the best dinners I've eaten, ever.

Both crabmeat pasta and truffle pizza were delicious and exceeded our expectations. Thin crust pizza paired with mushrooms and truffle oil, mmmm.

Our lava cake took a while as the first had an incident. That was fine. However, the second one came and it wasn't lava'ish. No chocolate flow and it was just warm which is disappointing.

Another issue is no free tap water which I had an issue with. It's $2 for water which is non-refillable.

Staff service and the other two food were impeccable. Will definitely return to try other dishes, probably skip the lava cake.

Food is above average. Atmosphere is great and not overpowering. Dog friendly. Staff are generally attentive, younger staff tends to be more casual and overlooking details. Indoor is ac, outdoor is open and dog friendly.

A quiet dining place within the bishan park. Easy to park your car and short walk to the restaurant. Food were nice and a variety of wine and beer with happy hours will 8pm. A good place to chill, happy and drink.

Relatively standard menu. Limited vegetation options. I ordered the Margerita pizza.
The service of food was prompt and the staff was quite polite.
The taste wasn't bad but not exceptional and gave me the feeling that the menu is a bit overpriced.
The indoor seating can get a bit noisy due to the canopy styled roof and echo. There is an outdoor seating option that also allows you to bring pets I think.
One thing I wasn't too happy with, was the cleanliness of the toilet.
Its a nice option to go with if you are in the vicinity but keep expectations moderate.

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
Used to be better. The unique onion blossom is not a blossom anymore. The "meaty" harlequin sandwich was meant to have lots of meat, Tabasco sauce and proper cheese, however I was served a greasy and soggy sandwich today had dripping egg yolk, two measly skinny strips of streaky bacon and missing the Tabasco... The service is good, interesting themed environment if you're going there for a drink (or two) by the river. Was surprisingly expensive for what we got, must be.....the location?

I think it’s a nice place to hang out to have a drink by the river. However the food was really bad. The French onion soup was really salty. The mushroom soup was served cold. When we told them, could see that they just took it back and threw it in the microwave as it came back with a thick skin on top of the soup. The onion blossom wasn’t fried well and I could taste the flour.  The onion was also slightly raw. I ordered the masala ratatouille for my main and I do not know what came (some mush of vegetables blended together). The only edible thing was the little bit of rice on top.  I would probably not come here again for food.

Undercooked salmon which we got the waiter to send back. It came back still undercooked to our dismay so we sent it back once again. After 20 minutes, we went to check on the progress of the cooking and realised they haven’t started it. We were slightly annoyed. Thankfully they apologised and agreed to waive the order. Nothing too special abt the food. The calamari was oily and the batter didn’t stick to the protein. Same as the cod fish bites. The western dishes were nice. King prawn pasta was good. I liked the view of the water and the distant city lights. The place had an abundance of alcoholic options so great for drinking. It was dog friendly which is a plus but the outdoor area could be better maintained.

Nice and quiet place to come chill or work like we did today, with a beautiful on the downtown skyline. A perfect hideout without the hustle and bustle.

I think Kontiki has somewhat lost its shine. Food can definitely be better - tried their local food fusion dishes but was left disappointed. Noodles were quite undercooked and just totally underwhelming. Prawns were big and looked nice but idk I guess your chef was having a bad morning or something. Probably just stick to western food.

The store could use more upkeep especially in the outdoor areas.

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
Super fun, super yummy, super people, burnt ends is such a lovely place to dine at and worthy of their Michelin star! This is a place that focuses on flavour bombs and not looking pretentious at all. Love the touch of fire and smoke in all their dishes that add a beautiful layer of complexity of flavour. Special thank you to the team for looking after my friend who doesn’t eat beef by replacing it with something equally delicious, small touches like this show that this is a restaurant that really cares for its diners. Don’t miss out on burnt ends!

We went for the chef selection.
The portions was small so can try many things.

Taste wise are beyond average, but not to the extend of giving a lot of excitement
The dessert was great. Wines was great.

Definitely nice environment for sure
Very good service.

Tried the chef’s menu where the head chef Vincent prepared for us highlights of Burnt ends plus some new items.

Really enjoyed the dinner. Firstly, the service was exceptional. One person on my table doesn’t eat raw food or beef and Vincent prepared a menu that catered to that for her.

The food was also mind blowing. The food really made use of amazing fresh ingredients that are cooked to perfection. The beef steak at the end had a nice char to the crust. The uni on the crab toast was mouth wateringly good. The marmalade beef on toast was also so soft and delicious.

Overall, a superb dinner. The cocktails and wine selection were also amazing, and I highly recommend ordering.

great experience as some dishes do not taste as you expected how it would be. love the surprising element. overall food was superb. sourdough was super good.

Has to be my favorite restaurant in Singapore! Every single dish represented Singapore’s melting pot of culinary landscape really well! Food tasted great, and cooked with pride!

I love the service as well! Jasmine was pinpoint with her recommendations. I thoroughly enjoyed her enthusiasm and sense of humor as well ❤️. Finally, thank your Markuro for entertaining us with your cocktail preparation skills. 🍹

See you again..soon…when I can get a booking….. 😆

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
My friend and I have been wanting to return since our first visit a few years ago. We came with more friends this time and it was as good as we remembered. The menu is different from then but the quality of the food is consistent! We loved almost everything. Not to mention, the attentiveness and warmth of the staff - really made the whole dining experience more enjoyable

Overlooking Singapore CBD, Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer, and the sea, the view from the restaurant was simply breathtaking. The food presentation was impeccable, and I particularly enjoyed the beef tartare as well as the burrata with ham and figs. However, I found both main dishes, the chicken breast, and iberico pork a bit on the dry side, but overall, they were still satisfactory. The service was outstanding, and I was touched by their attentiveness to my reservation note about celebrating my boyfriend's birthday. They remembered and brought out a delicious sticky date cake with a candle and birthday wishes, creating a wonderful surprise. The overall experience was truly fantastic.

Staff service was top notch ! Food was amazing and special. We were treated with a full moon night view too ! Even my 8 year old commented “Good Service” ! Definitely will be back for more :)

I would give more than 5 stars if it was possible. An unforgettable and delicious last diner in Singapore after 1 week. And the sauvignon blanc was perfect!

Food is not good as we expected. Ambience is nice and cozy though. I understand from colleagues that the finger food at cocktail section is appetizing, they recommended the french fries.

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
Good Italian restaurant to have afternoon lunch. Cozy while not crowded, compared to evening. Liked its fried calamari, crispy outside and tender inside. Salad was quite sumptuous, only that we had to ask for additional dressings and some salt to add flavour. Beef cheek was fantastic and recommended, while the pumpkin mac & cheese was ok although I were not crazy about. Night time was a great place to be. Price was above average.

We were here to celebrate a colleague’s birthday. The ambience was great and food was delicious. Homemade Gnocchi with Porcini Mushrooms was certainly my favorite. Service staff were friendly and attentive. Overall it was a pleasant and enjoyable dining experience.

Delicious Italian food in a nice, mostly outdoor setting. Very nice patio, much of it covered if needed, and some indoor seating. Food was great, loved the gnocchi in truffle cream sauce. The namesake mozzarella dishes were also very good. The service was friendly, but sometimes hard to find. Would definitely go back again.

I came here for dinner with a friend. The restaurant is in a great location and the outdoor space is particularly lovely at night. Their speciality is of course the variety of Italian cheeses they offer, but this also leads me to why I don’t come here more often: the menu isn’t really the best for couples. It would be great if they offered portions or even a mix of cheese dishes that were sized and priced appropriately for two people to share. As it is, they’re a little large and, frankly, rather expensive. Likewise, the rest of the menu offers some nice dishes, but it’s not a huge range and we struggled a bit to find things we could share. For larger groups, I think this would be less of a concern, and there is a set menu available, as well. I just wish they had a more couples-friendly menu. The dishes we tried were of course all very tasty. Likewise, service was nice and friendly.

We ordered the smoked burratina which was really good and I mean the mozarellas are a must order since its in the name. Pastas were good but the mains stood out for me. Service was great as well, staff were attentive and friendly. I really loved the ambience as well, the outdoor seating just felt so cozy and intimate.
Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.name: Latteria Mozzarella Bar
Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.query: Restaurants with outdoor seating in in Singapore

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
Had 1 set lunch with the Mushroom soup, serving for soup was a bit disappointing for set lunch. Not sure if the serving ala carte order would be the same or not. As for the taste, not much of surprise in any way.

The Arrabiata pasta (not fresh pasta) didn't gave the woah effect in any way as well. Saving grace was the fresh prawns.

My wife tried the Gnocchi with gorgonzola. Pasta (fresh) texture wasn't good, sauce not really to our likely.

Another disappointment is the dessert from the set lunch, which we had ordered the flourless Chocolate cake. Look at the picture and you will understand. Taste, so-so, maybe due to the presentation.

Lastly is the Tiramisu, saving grace to not get below 3 stars.

Overall, not a place which we would be considering to go again.

This is my 5th visit to Poco Loco. Each visit I am always bowled over by the great food . This is a hidden gem at Upper Thomson. I have eaten at many Italian restaurants, I have to say the pasta here are extremely good, full of flavour and really satisfying . Not sure where did the chef previously came from but I dare say it is even as good as some of higher class restaurants like Etna. Highly recommend.

Value for money! We tried PocoLoco for the first time and we really enjoyed our meal. We ordered 1 dinner set ($45), which consisted of an appetiser, 1 pasta dish, 1 main course and 1 dessert, there’s an option to order a glass of wine for $8. We ordered an extra pasta dish with lamb as well. Portion was good (not too small/big) and our favourite was the pork collar main course (part of the dinner set). Price was nett and drinks were reasonably priced as well ($2 for jasmine green tea and other soft drinks). Overall it was enjoyable and value for money.

Generally the food is fresh and not too bad. We had mushroom soup, calamari, spaghetti carbonara, spaghetti arrabbiata, spaghetti vongole, Panna Cotta and chocolate flourless cake.The first 2 items and the last are worth trying. Could give the calamari a miss though. The restaurant is within 5mins walking distance from tel station exit 4.

Jun 2023. I always loved pocoloco Italian food. We got mushroom soups, seafood pasta and lasagne.
Nothing to complain about.
Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.name: PocoLoco
Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.query: Restaurants with outdoor seating in in Singapore

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
We had their set menu here for my birthday. All the food was very good. Taste was on point. Serving portion slightly on the smaller side but usual. Food freshness and quality good. A lot of design has gone into their food presentation. Ambience of the place is great and the view of the bay is unparalleled. Only downside - price could have been cheaper. 😉

This place has a wow factor. The 19th floor view of Marina Bay Sands and its surroundings are astounding. Service was impeccable.

The angel hair pasta was one of the best I ever tasted. The halibut was perfectly done. I don't like fish that is overcooked. The duck breast did not have any gamely taste. The "melt in the mouth" beef cheek was tender and tasty. Definitely worth a second visit.

View of Vue is breath taking. Perfect for a romantic date. Celebrate the hub bday here. We order a A5 Black wagyu that melt in your mouth but was serve a little too cold for my liking, we top with a foie gras which taste great on the sweet side. Cheese platter was great. Tuna tartar was ok. We also ordered a the Darjeeling Poached Pear dessert. Unlimited servings of Fat Beef bread with the dip was very tasty. The restaurant also surprise us with complimentary birthday dessert as well. The bill came up to be $600++. Outstanding Customer service by one of the male staff with spect, he is not only attentive, also very observant. Did I mention he is a superb photographer as well 😍. The Caucasian lady waitress gives off a tired of working vibe. Unfriendly, when we express need for help, she answered in a way as if we have no money to dine there. When we were leaving I say thank u smiling to her she even return a half eye forced smile, not really bothered by it but really 🙄. I would recommend Vue for the atmosphere, not too intimidating.

It was a wonderful fine dining experience with awesome service!

The wine was smooth and nice too!

Perfect place for any celebrations or just a fantastic meal with awesome view of Singapore skyline!

My second visit. My last visit was during the pandemic.

Today’s lunch was very satisfactory. Food was improved than last time. It is not amazing but good. They allowed us to choose 2 appetisers for 3 course meal, which was satisfying.

Service was flawless.
Atmosphere is great- it is quiet so you can actually hear what your friends are saying (in many restaurants in Singapore, it can get quite rowdy and you cannot hear what those sitting next to you say)…here they provide ample space and long distance between tables. Ceiling is high and the whole space is quite magnificent.

All of my friends felt it was not bad value for money. We usually dine in hotels and fine restaurants. So my standards might be a little bit different from tourists.

We love the view. I have been to many places with the MBS view (Jaan, Smoke & Mirrors, Art, Dolce Vita, Level 33, One Fullerton area, Monti, Fullerton Bay hotel, Fullerton Hotel and so on)… but I think this place has the best view.

The only downside is they open new bottles of water without informing us. We thought we had two bottles but we ended up paying for three bottles of sparkling water. Not a deal breaker but it would be nice to ask each time they open a new bottle.

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
They serve some of the most delectable Italian dishes we've ever had, each dish was prepared with exquisite flavours. We highly recommend trying the White Truffle Tagliolini while it is still in season. The ambiance of the restaurant is brilliant, perfect place for a romantic dinner, or just a night out with friends/family. We wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone who appreciates fine Italian cuisine and exceptional service.

Our server, Cheryl/Cherry, went above and beyond to make our dining experience truly exceptional, we want to express our sincere gratitude for making our dining experience memorable. Your professionalism, friendliness, and knowledge about the menu were outstanding!

From the food itself to the service offered all we could say is it’s stunningly perfect. Mr Ronnie helped us much, even with the picture taking , he’s even so vibrant to all the guests he served.  We’re also glad that the team keep on checking with us on what we needed and they are of such great help , Mr Mark was there to help and even gave us a complimentary dessert. Special thanks to Mr Suren who did a great job and elaborate to us the foods and wine which was served .

The wine which was served to us is just so👌.
Salute to the mentioned names for going above and beyond on serving us.

Came here for the first time to celebrate an anniversary and it couldn’t have been a better choice.

Sourdough bread was unassuming but soooo fresh and fluffy, the best we’ve had! We enjoyed our starters which were the lobster and the carpaccio more than we did the mains! But overall food was delicately plated and delicious.

The service here was nothing short of amazing as well, the waiters were very attentive and explained each dish to us, checked on how we’d like the food every now and then which we appreciate.

Especially enjoyed the part where we got the option to have our desserts alfresco with the amazing view of the city lights and MBS area.

Pricey but overall would recommend for a special occasion!

This is the first time I have visited an Italian place, not had a pizza and pasta primarily, and still walked away full and satisfied. We took a set 3/4 course menu, and the chef was kind enough to bake in dietary preferences (eg. Vegetarian for me). All the items were amazing. But (weirdly) a special callout for the warmest and loveliest bread that I have eaten in a long time. And yes, if you do manage to get a seat outside, the view of Marina bay is just spectacular.

Staff were absolutely friendly and attentive. I brought my mom who rarely enjoys fine dining but she thoroughly enjoyed her experience and were overjoyed with the dessert recommended by the manager. The ambience is cosy. Decor and interior looks ok but not too exciting. Desserts were truly the highlight. We had the espresso mascarpone and amalfi lemon desserts and it was perfect for both our taste buds.
Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.name: Altro Zafferano
Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.query: Restaurants with outdoor seating in in Singapore

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
Had a very good dinner here. We ordered a few starters. The bread basket and brioche bread goes well with the duck foie gras to terrine and the French butter as well. The mussels, grilled octopus, fried mushroom balls were very delicious. The pasta had a very heavy blue cheese taste and might not be a dish for everyone. You need red wine to wash it down.
The 1kg Angus prime ribs went well with the generous peppers.

Certainly a wonderful experience at Atout! We savored a delectable meal consisting of peppercrusted roasted Angus beef, refreshing chilled cucumber gazpacho soup, and truffle brie. I'd like to give a special thank to Francis, whose exceptional service and accommodating demeanor truly stood out.

Visited Atout to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Elegant ambience, staffs were friendly, We had lobster bisque, escargot, fried frog leg, duck confit, and all every dishes taste good.

Love that the outdoor area is pet-friendly. Finally a place where we can get great food, great service, and yet bring our dogs along.

Francis (our server) made great recommendations, and delivered the best service I’ve seen in some time. He was almost like a trusty friend who genuinely cared that we had a good experience. What a rare gem!

The steamed artichoke was great, as with the rest of the food. Nothing we didn’t like at all.

1. The highest food quality
2. Fresh made and delicious everything
3. The serve very fast
4. Great service
5. Chef is phenomenal
6. Very reasonable prices
7. Desserts mind blowing

Highly highly recommended!

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
Was here decades ago when it had the first German pork knuckle and beer.  Decided to give it a try again after many others.

The place was surprisingly quiet for a Friday night.  Not only for Baden, but the rest of Holland Village too. Got a good spacious place seated inside as there were lots of cigarette smoke outside.

Ordered the pork knuckle and had 2 pints of beer.

Have to say that the pork knuckle was very well done.  Very crispy on the outside, and soft and succulent on the inside.  I have to say though that the meat was not as juicy as it should be.  But nevertheless, it was still good and much much better than the other popular German outlets.

Was served by a quiet and strange non-responsive Sikh wait staff.  Not that alert, and certainly unsure of what our order was.  He also spoke very softly and quite intelligibly.  However, I have to say that he was polite and obviously wanted to be good at his work.

Finally, the place was quiet and great for a dinner.

Will definitely be back for the pork knuckle and beer if I longed for any of these.

Service staffs are very friendly and helpful. Food and beer is pretty good, love their beef stew, it's so full of favour 🤤 The curry sausage is a bit strange, the curry is sweet! German style curry I assume 😂

James manager is very friendly and caring.
Food is nice and happy hour beer so worth.
The place is clean and music is nice. Highly recommended

Worth to come in for happy hour
Service is fast, food is fresh.
Server is friendly. Best to chose the outside seat as it is relaxing to drink beer seeing passer-by. Late night music after 9pm song very nice 👍

Visited on a weekday(mon) to have a drink. The wine is good and affordable. The onion rings , however, is only 8 pieces and costs a whooping $10.90+. 1 piece of onion ring is $1.50. This is the most expensive onion rings I've ever had. Pls be careful when ordering food. Better ask how many pieces before u order.

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
Food and service were good! Looks like they have revamped the bistro and looking better. Went there for lunch with wifey as we wanted to grab some fresh meat at butchery. Ordered 2 soup to go along with our main. She ordered potato soup and onion soup for me. Before the soup arrived, we were served with their in house baguette and butter. It was so so good especially the butter. Main were served hot from kitchen, portions were good for the price and we left the bistro with our happy stomach. Wish they can offer ribeye in time to come. They were having Oktoberfest menu too. Do drop by! Will definitely return. Thank you

Had an outdoor seating which was sooo hot. They gave a time limit of 1 hour but was happy to let us hang around if there wasn’t too busy. Food wise was ok but nothing spectacular. Has a children’s playground at the side so lots of family groups were there. would recommend the onion soup and creme brûlée but sirloin was underwhelming. Great that it had lots of vegetables at the side.

Had fresh onion soup that warmed us up . Thereafter we shared the mains of short rib and pork cordon blue .

The short rib served tender w mixed flavour between savoury meat and sweet caramelised onion, and tinge of horseradish . And pork cordon blue toughen up texture in breaded form and broaden the palate w some greens .

Enjoy the meals as much as the shopping later .

This place have very good beer and western foods. I highly recommend as service are good and foods are excellent. Only downside are the outdoor seating only got small wall fans and the downlight are too strong and sharp make me felt warmer on a sunny day dinner. Last to mention that the portion are quite big.

Nice food!
Revisited, food n service are great 👍👍
Plants in the garden were healthy, nice to have plant labels.
Also playground for kids while waiting for seats.
Supermarket offers wide selection of meat, snacks, fresh vegetables etc!

Restaurants with outdoor seating in in S.reviews:
Nice & healthy food, good portion, serene ambience, cozy place to hang out, there are two swings which super therapeutic.  💞🥰 definitely will come again!

Note: love their Crysanthemum salad sauce! So special. And they even heated up our cookies 🍪 😍

Food portion now is so horrible, it was much better last time.

Quality still good

Very little portion of steak for $15.80. Waited quite long but the food was left at the counter and turned cold.

It took 35mins for a take away salad and rice on a Sunday lunch time where only 2-3 tables had guests so that was a negative. Staff gave an extra cookie so that shows they care for customer service .

Nice outdoor space to sit and some good healthy options. Taste is good and food is fresh. We had mangoes green salad and cluck Norris and both were delicious

Healthy bowls with set options as well as customisations available, as well as a make-your-own-bowl option. You need to fill in the paper menu by selecting your choice and hand it to the counter. Collect your order when your assigned beeper goes off. Convenient lunch option for office-goers around Biopolis, can get fairly crowded at peak lunch hours, typically between 12 and 1. Indoor as well as outdoor seating available, the outdoor tables have a pleasant atmosphere, surrounded by the greenery. Very vegetarian friendly as well, they've added a lot of new bowls to the menu. My favorite is the spears and shield. The olive rice is wonderfully flavoured and the vegetables are grilled to perfection.

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
Tried out some of the suggested specialties, including their shrimp fried rice, Sichuan chili oil wanton, and sweet potato salted egg ball. Each dish delivered a unique and delightful burst of flavors.
The prawn and banana fritter boasted a crisp exterior, giving way to a delightful blend of sweet and savory flavors within.
The pastries ordered were generously filled, resulting in a burst of rich and flavorful goodness with every bite.
The Shrimp fried rice deserves a special mention as it stands out as one of the finest I've ever tasted, boasting fresh shrimp and perfectly textured rice, with each bite delivering a delightful array of flavors

What a surprise! I LOVED this restaurant. The most delicious dim sum ever!! We sat in the open area and it was really nice. We didn’t have data in our phones so we couldn’t order with the QR code but the staff gave us a sheet of paper and a pencil to order. Everything was absolutely DELICIOUS.  For fellow tourists: make sure you have cash since they don’t accept card payments (there is an ATM nearby)

The best authentic Dim Sum and Chinese food! Amazing quality, great service… yes you sit on a plastic chair and the place is not fancy… but guaranteed yummy! A must do once in Singapore 😋

Swee Choon's dimsum is alright if you don't set too high an expectation. Service and dining environment is comfortable.
Lots of variety from noodles to stir fry items. Can cater for all diners.
Price is reasonable.
7/10.

Still one of my favorite dim sum joints, offering food served very quickly.
Swee Choon seems to have figured out their winning formula. Offering simple fares at reasonable pricing served very quickly. This dim sum eatery has blossomed from one small shop space to taking over the neighboring spaces for their never ending queue of customers.
We ordered quite a few dishes. Cucumber with black fungus was a surprise crowd winner, even winning over someone who does not usually enjoy cold dishes with its simple and light garlicky taste. The porridge was so so, a rather small bowl though but I wasn’t watery so you do get it chock full of ingredients. The chilli wanton was abit of a let down, as the spice level was abit meh. I loved the Kang kong stir fried with garlic. With the simple way of cooking, it brought out the freshness of the vegetables. I like the fried pork too, it was marinated just right and very tender and not over fried. The tentacles was abit over fried and was kind of like chewing on rubber.
I would definitely hands down visit Swee Choon anytime.
*good to note: I ordered a takeaway of egg tarts, char Siew puff at the outside takeaway kiosk. Waiting time was very short too, and staff ensured items were tied up properly for ease transportation back home. Egg tarts still tasted amazing when they were cold.

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
Tried the lunch set. It’s definitely good for value.
The chicken burger is single burger bun at the bottom. The bun is lightly toasted and crispy. The chicken chop is tender and the skin is removed.
The cheese on top is good. Added more flavours to the chicken chop.
The Mexican cheese pasta as side dish is decent, the boiled vegetables don’t have much taste but it’s okay.

Value for money. I like the Mexican grilled chicken that comes with cheese sauce and sliced white onions. It’s hard to find this in typical western stalls but I like this style the best.

Was here on 4th Aug 2023, around 1am after midnight.

Had the smoked duck carbonara and chargrilled chicken chop with ice lemon tea!

Ice lemon tea was sweet but more on the slightly sour side so not my thing but it may be for others.

Carbonara was creamy as well as savoury with a lot of smoked duck bits mixed in aside from the smoke duck slices seen in the picture. Chicken chop was tender and the fried rice had flavour. Both dishes had generous portions and although the food tastes generally like your average western food, giving it higher rating for the price point in par with the quality and quantity of food.

Atmosphere was chill and the customer service was warm and attentive.

Generous portion of collar pork was nicely grilled. Mashed potato tasted similar to KFC 😅. Onion served under the pork could be more cooked. Overall, it's good for the price. 👍 🆗️

You all will love this place if you enjoy chilling in a comfortable environment. It's the only place that remains open until 2/3 am.

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
Bernard is really nice! Should definitely come here at least once! Love the cocktails pairing too! They did not scrimp on the alcohol 😂 Also had an appetiser and ordered an extra cocktail before dinner (refer to photos). No phones allowed during dinner and it’s pitch black anyways so can’t help you there. Will come back again soon :)

Fantastic once in a lifetime experience! We had an amazing host - Bernard who shared his life story. He had an amazing voice, sounded like a radio DJ. Randy was really friendly too in guiding us to our seats. The customer service at the lounge was really warm and friendly too!

Very very unique experience and 10/10 will recommend to come to this place. The picture was taken before the dinner and the dinner was served incomplete darkness. The service is very heartwarming and very friendly.  Dining in pitch dark really gives us the perspective on how a vision disabled person experience their day to day life (just the eating part alone). I think I should not reveal too much details but rather let you experience yourself. This unique experience start from the time u step in the restaurant. Really must try!!!

Absolutely great experience. Booking with credit card is necessary. When arrived we waited at this fancy bar area where an appetiser is served. We can order bar drinks too. Lockers were provided to keep your bags, phones, watches that illuminate. Then we were taken to a second floor where the room was in complete darkness. When you can see, the sense of touch smell and taste elevates and became more sensitive. Food and wine were great just have to be careful when consuming since we can’t see. Servers are all very passionate, friendly and professional. They told us they can’t see and we are impressed by how swift and accurate they serve. They were also very engaged in conversations with us. Menu changes every two months we were told. Highly recommended!

Had a unique dining experience at this restaurant with a concept of complete darkness. This added a thrilling dimension to the entire experience. The reception area was lit up and the staff were very friendly.

Once ushered into the pitch-dark dining room, the staff orientated us with our table setting.

A total of 3 courses with 4 dishes each were skillfully served, and although the adjustment to eating in complete darkness took a moment, it became a novel part of the experience.

I want to extend special appreciation to Bernard, whose friendly and jovial service elevated the evening. His assistance in helping us find our seats and orientating us with the table made a significant difference. Bernard's delightful humor, peppered with funny jokes, truly made the experience enjoyable.

While the portions were not large, the food itself was decent. However, the overall adventure, coupled with Bernard's excellent service, makes this restaurant a standout choice for those seeking a distinctive and memorable dining experience. Highly recommended!

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
The environment during lunch was quiet, not many tables were occupied, which surprises me because the food was great in taste and portion, and the set meal was price reasonably.

$17.90 for a set that comes with a main or pasta, and a drink and soup of the day.

The soup was superb with slices of fresh mushrooms and onions. The drink were canned. I ordered cheesy chicken chop, the chicken thigh was just right in size and cooked well. The fries and salad that came along were huge in portion.

I highly recommend everyone to come during lunch!!!

Had the weekday lunch promotion. Main course plus soup and drink for $17.90+gst.

Mushroom soup quite tasty.
Fish and Chips portion quite huge.
Tom yum comes with1 mussel, 3 prawns and some clams. Very tasty.

Seafood Tom yum  pasta with salted egg chicken is good too.

Overall, Value for money.

The set lunch quite decent, with soup and drinks. Soup is garlicky and pasta is also not bed. More creamy milk for the sauce. Can always try different dish  on menu

Price is reasonable for the portion that they give.
Service is the BEST I have gotten.
Have order food for friends but come late and the food was cold so they cook a new and fresh plate for us.
No Service charge.
RECOMMEND PEOPLE TO COME WITH FRIENDS.

We had a wonderful set lunch at 49 seats.

We ordered Fish and chips with Tom yum sauce and also Tom yum seafood pasta which are also their popular dishes here. The sauce are creamy but not to spicy. And it came with soup and drink.

But importantly, their portion is huge. Greta value for money .

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
It was a small and very sweet place to hang around with wonderful staff always smiling...... Specially the senior staff..... with whom used to chit chat quite a lot at late night at 2 am to 3am..... had a wonderful food there......

What a surprise find!! The food here is amazing!!

1. Truffle fries is perfectly fried and truffle oil is evenly distributed, with generous amount of cheese
2. Chicken mid wing with belachan - wonderful pairing
3. Pork knuckle steak - new on the menu - good portion and well cooked. Even the salad on the side is so fresh!
4. Lamb chops are great too, super tender and well cooked.

Overall definitely returning to try other dishes in their extensive menu, highly recommended!

we stumbled upon this place and decided to try out their all-day breakfast! we ordered it with scrambled eggs, english muffin and bratwurst chicken sausage. the scrambled eggs were cooked to perfection, and english muffin (which was just toast?) was toasted to a crispy exterior and a soft interior, and the sausage had a nice snap. the pasta was also cooked nicely and had a nice mushroom flavour. the whole place was very clean and the atmosphere was great. the staff were very friendly as well! make sure to check out this place if you're in the area!

Nice cosy place to have a evening drink with few friends or family. Super service. Waitress was extremely helpful in selecting menu items suitable for our pallet.

A nice place for small gathering on weekdays. Food was so so … escargot chewy , lamb rack 2 pcs for $24 dun worth and slightly over cook. Lamb shank was a better choice tender and nicely braised. Salmon ordinary abit dry. Finger food acceptable . Oyster at that price was not really promotional. Good for beer drinker . Wine selection limited and stock also limited.

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
It’s been a while since I came here and the increase in price is really steep; I no longer find it value for money. We got Plain Prata x1, Egg Prata x1, Butter Chicken x1, Garlic Naan x1, Dum Briyani x1 and Iced Teh Tarik x2 which added up to $38.80 for 2.

Prata is average but their fish curry is really diluted. Butter chicken is not bad. Garlic naan is what you would expect it to taste. The only thing worth the price is probably the Dum Briyani. Although it looked like a small portion, there was a lot of mutton buried in the rice and was really filling. The mutton was also tender with really nice gravy. Personally will not be back again.

Good place to have your Indian breakfast. Service is good during the morning.

Last I had supper here at night on weekend, they clean your table as soon as you finish your food to make way for the next diner which is understandable. So, decide if you want a place for good food or a place to hang out.

I've been using this restaurant as a JC peeps meeting base for years. Glad to see that it, together with its competition down the road, has survived the building of the MRT line. When I last went, they didn't have date milkshake. Not sure if its temporary or for good. Date milkshake is good 👍

Incredibly extensive menu with plenty of seating. Service is really quick and you order through a QR code so it’s convenient. There’s parallel parking along the road and parking at the malls opposite. The food was good, there’s choice between dum briyani and just briyani and this was the plain briyani, rice was flavourful and the chicken was good. Can even choose what piece of chicken you want. Overall quite nice, i would return and would want to try the other stuff on the menu.

This is one of those few eateries I often wonder how they managed to attract the crowds. The place isn't cozy, the food are generally pricey, there are mostly misses than hits in their extensive menu, even the tasty ones are achieve by being too greasy & over saucy like the Maggi Goreng Pattaya I had today.

Also their QR code ordering system is a pain to use, there's no embedded payment system to any of the many existing digital payment we have here, you simply have to enter ur credit card manually. If you choose to pay at the counter, your cart orders would be gone and you have to re-order everything at the counter.

Saturday: 7:00 AM – 3:00 AM
Sunday: 7:00 AM – 3:00 AM
Late-night dining options in Singapore.name: Al-Azhar Restaurant

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
Food was great had the char kuay tiao goreng mutton which was good and the magi goreng was pretty decent both with a nice runny egg to compliment and ordered the prata kosong, egg and cheese and the star of the show was the mutton curry which was really good! Drinks were alright. Overall really nice supper place near the Serangoon area.

Prata's crispy and good. Service is ok though it can be slow. But the prawn masala's a real letdown with the small size, you can see the photos of the size of the prawn, which is really the size of a shrimp. Also ordered the butter chicken, which is ok.

Came here for Lunch with my family and Kids. Not only their Prata are crispy, their other dishes are delicious. Recommend their Spinach which my kids also love. Services are good but dont expect restaurant type at this coffee house. Kids love to have their prata with condensed milk which they didnt charge me. Recommended Prata place for family.

Came back to edit my review in the past to downgrade the ratings. They are becoming too complacent and now everything is served not freshly made. Parata or fried rice, both were served cold even though requested to serve the freshly made hot one. Requested and got a reheated parata. Done with the place and will never return to eat cold fried rice or cold parata again. This place is super popular for their Roti Prata Plain and Egg Prata. ( things go down when business becomes too complacent and forgot to serve the product what it meant to be). Good staff with great attitude to serve the customer. This WAS the best place rated by me for variety of prata. Should you need to have a sizzling hot prata to be served, then just let the staff know and they will serve you accordingly. But now they do not do it anymore. You must try this place at your own risk, look around a newly opened parata place around your home which might be better in taste and served freshly made hot ones.
Feel bad to downgrade their ratings but in this business one have to keep it with the pace. Hope they will improve soon but for me I am done.

Meant to catchup with friends over Prata but this place was extremely noisy (and packed), and the staff kept chasing us away even when we were not done with our meals. They kept coming to ask if they could clear our plates when most of them were only half eaten.

We were a big group and had ordered a lot. So it would definitely take more time for us to finish our food. But the experience was extremely poor because of the service attitude.

Late-night dining options in Singapore.name: R.K. Eating House

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
Was just there for dinner last night with my partner and the overall experience for my first visit there was great!

The taste of the dishes was surprising delicious and the freshness of the seafood was sublime! The attention to detail on each plate and the flavour profile was something that got my wanting seconds.

The cocktail was pretty sweet but overall well-balanced in a very presentable manner.

This first visit was short but definitely looking forward to the other visit that will come in the future. Perhaps a good cocktail session as well!

Kudos to the Lumo team for delivering such a well dinner experience!

Had a really pleasant experience at Lumo! Was really happy with the service by Joshua, he went the extra mile to sing us a birthday song and requested to take a photo for us. Food was great too, highly recommended!

[Sep 2023] Intimate restaurant that serves modern European cuisine. The grilled octopus and prawns were pretty good, enjoyed the smokiness that came with the fresh seafood. Service was prompt and warm. Place is fully booked on a friday night, reservation a must.

visited over the weekend and had an amazing experience! The ambiance was inviting yet intimate, creating the perfect atmosphere for a great night out with friends. The cocktails were well crafted and came with a variety of choices from classics to innovative ones. The food was good for sharing and we throughly enjoyed every dish. The staff was attentive and friendly. recommended

Food was phenomenal. Usually I would have really great appetizers and mains but desserts are a letdown. Lumo exceed expectation in every way down to the desserts. The cheesecake with lime yoghurt is a great pairing and I simply had to takeaway a slice for my husband. The sirloin was done perfectly well in medium rare and my favorite is likely the scallops with pumpkin puree. Service was impeccable and overall I had a great night celebrating my friend’s birthday. Thank you to the Lumo’s service crew and chefs!

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
Finally tried here after passing by many times! I like the chicken rice, it has kind of a home cook taste and the chicken meat is also soft and flavourful. The gray is just nice too, not salty nor blend. The rice has also the chicken rice pandan fragrance. Laksa portion is huge and top with a generous spoonful portion of chilli paste.
Lunch time is very crowded, suggest to go in evening or night for supper as it wont be that hot too.

Such a cozy space for dinner with an extensive menu :)
* Maggie goreng 4/5
* Pineapple fried rice 2.5/5 (avoid this one, there are many other menu to try)
* Teh peng 4/5
* Iced Lemon Tea 4/5 (a bit too sweet for my liking)

Had a mee goreng with chicken added on. $6+. Chicken was too salty. Decided not to finish the chicken.

The wife had stir-fried plain broccoli. $14. Was a bit expensive as the portion wasn't big for $14.

The boy had the chicken wrap with fries. The best review came from him. He thought the wrap was better that the one at Spize as the sauce was nicer and the wrap wasn't overflowing with purple cabbage 😅

Food is Trash, why even bother when the price also makes no sense for the quality the provide. A regrettable experience. Hokkien mee was diluted and teh ice was sugar loaded.

Halal restaurant at Paya Lebar area which remains open 24x7. The price is cheap, yet the food was really delicious. It gets quite busy from 10am till midnight. I tried the Hainanese Chicken Rice, Sambal Stingray, Otak-otak, Super Cooler Drink (based on coconut juice), and I highly recommend it.

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
Every dish is on point. We curated our own menu and we emailed them in advance. We used the klook vouchers so that saved us $60. We love the ambience that the rotating restaurant has to offer. I must say the view of Marina Bay Sands is stunning. A great place for celebrations. We went there for birthday celebration and they gave us a free birthday cake. The staff were so attentive and took so many nice candid pictures for us. We really enjoyed ourselves dining at Tong Le Private Dining. Thank you!!!!

Food was really good for its price. We had the Colorful Cloud Dinner Set Menu. I will say it started out amazing and plateaued off around the main course. But for its price I am won't be too picky. Service was good, staffs were friendly and professional. The revolving platform gave a 360 view of the city which was a huge plus for me. Atmosphere was quiet when we came early on, but started to get a bit rowdy due to a huge party to our sides despite the closed-off rooms. But overall a pretty decent visit. Will recommend!

I had the pleasure of indulging in an exquisite dining experience at Tóng Lè Private Dining, and I can confidently say it was an absolute delight for all the senses. The first thing that captivated me upon entering here was the stunning view. The restaurant's unique concept of a rotating dining room allowed me to indulge in a 360-degree panorama of the cityscape, adding a sense of wonder and spectacle to the already exquisite dining affair. The menu was a testament to the chef's creativity and culinary expertise. Each dish was a harmonious blend of flavours, beautifully presented and bursting with vibrant colours and textures. I must also mention the impeccable timing of the service. Each course was served with precision, allowing us to savor every bite without feeling rushed. The staff's attention to detail and their commitment to providing exceptional service truly enhanced the entire dining affair. Overall, my dining experience at here was an unforgettable journey of culinary delight and I cannot wait to return to experience their wonders once again :)

Most rotating restaurants live off the gimmick of being exactly that - a rotating restaurant offering a 360 degree view of a location. Many times, the food in such restaurants isn’t a priority, but the experience is. This restaurant, however, serves excellent food and offers a great view of Marina Bay Sands and the fountain and light show in front of the mall, as well as a nice view of parts of the Singapore skyline. The rotation is very slow and it take about two hours to do a full 360 revolution. If you are unlucky, you will be at the opposite side of the fountain show both times it occurs. For a period of the 360 tour you are very close to an office building - so close that you can see the monitors of the people working in the building.

The seating arrangement is varied, from two/four person tables, to separate dining rooms for larger groups. The restaurant has a very good bar which has a great selection of cocktails and spirits. The restaurant is quiet which makes it easy to have a business conversation, if that‘s why you are there.

The restaurant offers a seven-course menu which is perfectly timed for a two-hour dining experience. The wine menu is very extensive and there is a sommelier that can provide advice if you require so. The menu was extremely well thought-through and the various dishes were perfectly combined to provide a first-class dining experience.

The staff is very attentive and friendly, and made us feel welcome from the minute we set foot in the restaurant.

We would come to this restaurant again, and in particular for the dining experience. We were positively surprised by every course.

Location: 5/5 (in the financial district opposite Marina Bay Mall)
Ambience: 4/5
Menu: 5/5 (albeit a fixed menu)
Food: 5/5
Drinks/wine selection: 5/5
Staff: 5/5
Price/quality: 4/5 (pricey but very high quality)

Quality of food matches the price. The family all agreed it was a perfect place for a family celebration. The service was immaculate and staff very attentive to details. We didn't mention it was a BD celebration but when we clinked our wine glasses, they must have overheard us saying Happy BD, and they surprised us with longevity buns. They also understand Chinese etiquette well as our son discreetly wanted to foot the bill, but the attending staff came quietly to check with my husband who was the host if they should accept my son's card. That's so thoughtful as in Chinese custom the host foots the bill and they respected that.

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
Super solid burger, juicy and not dry at all! All the ingredients and sauces fits one another so well. I had their No.1 and No.2 burger before, never fails to impress me ✨ The burger is pretty big, and they have insane promotions everyday! Lunch time sets and dinner sets and even happy hour. Super worth the price for the food and the drinks were really good too. Had some sides of truffle fries and nacho tater tots (for the happy hour 1 for 1)- super worth, not soggy or too oily. I had their curly fries before as well and it’s great too. Would recommend and i will always come back here when i crave a good burger! Tho their service is a little slow- cause i believe they are low on manpower, other than that it’s great

So glad my wife and I finally got to have a meal here; the last time was on a weekend at peak-hour so we weren’t prepared to wait then on a walk-in. This time there were plenty of seats available. We were really impressed by all the food (and milkshake) here! I think it says a lot when wife, usually not a burger fan, really enjoyed her 25 Degrees burger! 🍔 She had the No. 2 while I had the No. 1, both so juicy, tasty, and fresh. Absolutely value for money especially with the high quality ingredients! The crispy broccoli was pleasantly delicious too 😋 Service all-round was friendly, prompt, and excellent 🙏🏻 Thank you so much! We hope to be back again soon.

Great value for money. Juicy patties in burgers, though the medium well is still quite pink and rare. Had the Number One which is quite a classic burger  and Number Three- jalapeno provided a good kick. Kids burger is a fantastic size. Sides come in huge portions. Happy hour has 1 for 1 offers for certain items.

Probably dined here for over 5 times and their consistency never fails.
Love their signature Number 1 burgers
The combination of cheeses with the caramalized onions and bacon goes so well together.
Would recommend their Number 3 if you're looking for something with a kick of spice from the Chipotle sauce and Jalapenos.
Atmosphere can be quite humid in the afternoon as it is facing the outdoors.

My wife misses 25 Degrees at Lake Tekapo New Zealand.

I neither have the time or money to bring her there now so I provided her one of their branch at an alternative location.

The place is nicely decorated.

Food was fresh and delicious. The beef was juicy, and the chicken was tender and succulent.

Service was fantastic despite only one guy was on the floor service. He managed to get everyone served until some of the staff came in at a later time.
