Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
This is most probably the best Chinese restaurant among the private clubs in Singapore; love the dim sums and Char Siew. Staff always very attentive and it is a great venue to entertain and impress. Cuisine is contemporary Chinese and decor is modern

Not your cheapest place but some of the items are superb. Ox Tongue yummy, Grilled Black Throat the best I had since I started looking out for this fish 6 years ago. Did not try their wagyu cos they are from Kagoshima, not my first choice of Wagyu. The truffle rice is awesome, almost nothing rice at $12/little bowl as a $48 hotpot of it only serves 4 small bowls, yet some how you find it irresistible, the the wagyu oil on rice at Fat Cow. Give it a try if you feel like feeding your soul. Squid can skip. Warm Ankimo also can skip, still like cold with ponzu better.

Great place for dinning. Steak, crab cakes and salad. Excellent.

a bit of a let-down. I expected fine dining. Yes the place is nice as per fine dining, service is good, menu looks even too broad, prices are quite top.
So from the prices I thought that it was really going to be fine dining experience. I was puzzled by the abundance of items on the menu... how does a fine dining restaurant keep up with all those items, ingredients, preparation, etc..? It should have been a red flag from the outset.
The food is substandard for the place. My beloved domestic helper can prepare this food, minus the presentation.
Presentation of the dishes is average. All meats lack of the right flavors. Sure I know that a tenderloin or a filet will have less flavor than say a sirloin. And that's where the chef should do something about it. Few thin cut potatoes don't do the trick for me. Pasta another disappointment.
The burger, isn't it the same that they serve downstairs???
So I left quite disappointed, and wondering if The Second Floor is actually serving some of the same food that you get from The Eagle's Nest, plus some dish decoration, at double the price.

There for wine dinner, the dishes were interesting and impressively done.
Late-night dining options in Singapore.name: The 2nd Floor (Members Only)

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
There is only a word to describe our experience: “exceptional.” Excellent food, excellent service! All food worth the bite. The presentation of food is enchanting. A must try is their dessert. Chef Andy even approached us to check our experience on the food. John the manager also took time to converse with us. Teamwork was evidently shown with how the staff interact with each other. Every minute of stay counts. Will definitely go back.

I was so happy when I found out about this 24hrs restaurant! It's usually really late when I end work, so I'm happy that there's somewhere I can go to eat! The receiving staff John was super friendly and welcoming, and throughout my meal he was able to make lots of passersby smile with his cheerful personality which is super nice 😭💕！

Lingesh was the staff who helped serve my food and he was super nice too! He had an excellent smile and was super polite and friendly through our conversation! The staff all seemed wonderful and the food was really tasty, but a little pricey. Really liked the strawberry latte. Would definitely like to come back again, for both excellent service and wonderful food! 🥰🥰

Thanks for the excellent service from Lingesh and the lady who helps to take order (didn’t manage to get your name). We enjoy the dining experience here.

The grilled salmon and royal chocolate hazelnut are delicious. Portobello mushroom burger could be better as feel the mushroom was a bit over cooked. We don’t really like the pizza margherita as the cheese is not the taste that we usually had.

Thanks for providing candle and decoration on the cake. We will go back again to try other food  next time. Hope the service will be as good as now in future.

First time checking this place and landed there cause it stays open 24 hours. Great place to hang out for supper and chit chat late into the night.

Started with the Quesadillas which was quite light, some places pack it with loads of cheese and heavy in taste. I liked this cause it worked for supper. I would say the avocado could have been a little more seasoned with salt and perhaps garlic for added oomph.

Next up was Pasta Pomodoro, which was as expected. The sauce could have a bit more flavour, unfortunately the cherry tomatoes on the side were sour. Linguini was al-dente. Simple dish that sufficed.

Chicken Roulade was a tad dry on inside after it set for a while. Maybe we should have dug into it the instance it hit the table. But none the less, it was tasty, well seasoned, crusty and nicely browned on outside for good flavour. Perhaps making the roulade a little thicker would better hold in the moisture. The star highlight of this dish was the mash potatoes!!! It's been a long time since I had a side dish that actually made me do a double -take. Not the creamy smooth cheesy type, smooth enough with little chunks of potatoes. Fragrant, lightly salted, hint of butter creamy flavour. Lovely Chef Andy graced my cravings and served an additional bowl of mashed potatoes.

Chef Andy is a pleasant dude, and clearly passionate about his food. Friendly and very engaging with guests.

Ok, this review isn't about him. Let's round it off with dessert. OMG!!! The portion of the Caramelized Banana Waffle was GENEROUS. Definitely a sharing portion. The waffle isn't super crispy on outside, but it was warm on inside and Kenna gave you the feeling of a warm hug. Nice amounts of walnuts and banana. In this day in age where food prices are insane for even the tiniest of portions, this dessert was a lovely surprise.

Food was very well seasoned and tasty for both the carbonara and steak. Steak was nicely cooked and pink in the middle. The tea was the Muse specialty, very nice and berry-tasting tea. The restaurant on level 2 also has a nice overlooking view of the Orchard intersection with Wheelock, Ion and Tangs so would be even nicer during Christmas time when the Orchard is lit up. We had 2 desserts, the pecan pie was fantastic and the red velvet cake was moist and nicely layered. Fast and friendly service too. Overall a great place for good food and a nice view!

Late-night dining options in Singapore.name: Cafe de Muse - The Restaurant

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
Our first time here. The service was hospitable and genuine, no pretense despite being a Michelin-starred restaurant. Alex and Kim were friendly and was impeccable in their service. Food was amazing with unique combinations of fresh ingredients. Chef also came over to each table to interact which we felt was an awesome touch. Strongly recommended!

Well deserved Michelin Restaurants.
The bread is so crispy on the outside and so so so soft on the inside. Pairing with the bordier butter, it is really exceptional.
Every dish of the food is amazing.

The service is so good. When the table is full of crumbs, the waiter will clean it up to sweep away the crumbs. The waiter are also friendly and knowledgeable about the dishes.
When we found a bone in the fish and the chef came out to apologize. Felt the service was so good.

The atmosphere in the round room felt great too.

One of the best fine dining places I’ve ever been to! I can’t keep track of what was being served because there was just so many different courses, but each course was really tasty 🥰 I don’t think I’m a small eater but I was so full by the last few courses, I don’t think I ate any at all. Remember to pace yourself. I’m most impressed by their bakes; their toasty black sesame bread was literally the best bread I’ve ever had in my life.

White Grass is a hidden gem, providing a distinctive dining venture with its fusion of Japanese and European flavors.

Each dish is delectable, especially the bread, pastries, and desserts rank the finest that I ever tasted.

The real flower centerpiece adds a pleasant fragrance, and the stylish decor contributes to the overall charm, making it an excellent option for couples and hosting friends.

On my second visit, I can confidently say they consistently exceed my expectations.

Very good ambience and attentive service. The bread is crispy outside and moist inside. Sesame bread is delicious too. Abalone is well done combined with the sauce and texture. The lobster meat is too soft for our liking. Everything is fine but no distinctive wow factor.

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
They serve some of the most delectable Italian dishes we've ever had, each dish was prepared with exquisite flavours. We highly recommend trying the White Truffle Tagliolini while it is still in season. The ambiance of the restaurant is brilliant, perfect place for a romantic dinner, or just a night out with friends/family. We wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone who appreciates fine Italian cuisine and exceptional service.

Our server, Cheryl/Cherry, went above and beyond to make our dining experience truly exceptional, we want to express our sincere gratitude for making our dining experience memorable. Your professionalism, friendliness, and knowledge about the menu were outstanding!

From the food itself to the service offered all we could say is it’s stunningly perfect. Mr Ronnie helped us much, even with the picture taking , he’s even so vibrant to all the guests he served.  We’re also glad that the team keep on checking with us on what we needed and they are of such great help , Mr Mark was there to help and even gave us a complimentary dessert. Special thanks to Mr Suren who did a great job and elaborate to us the foods and wine which was served .

The wine which was served to us is just so👌.
Salute to the mentioned names for going above and beyond on serving us.

Came here for the first time to celebrate an anniversary and it couldn’t have been a better choice.

Sourdough bread was unassuming but soooo fresh and fluffy, the best we’ve had! We enjoyed our starters which were the lobster and the carpaccio more than we did the mains! But overall food was delicately plated and delicious.

The service here was nothing short of amazing as well, the waiters were very attentive and explained each dish to us, checked on how we’d like the food every now and then which we appreciate.

Especially enjoyed the part where we got the option to have our desserts alfresco with the amazing view of the city lights and MBS area.

Pricey but overall would recommend for a special occasion!

This is the first time I have visited an Italian place, not had a pizza and pasta primarily, and still walked away full and satisfied. We took a set 3/4 course menu, and the chef was kind enough to bake in dietary preferences (eg. Vegetarian for me). All the items were amazing. But (weirdly) a special callout for the warmest and loveliest bread that I have eaten in a long time. And yes, if you do manage to get a seat outside, the view of Marina bay is just spectacular.

Staff were absolutely friendly and attentive. I brought my mom who rarely enjoys fine dining but she thoroughly enjoyed her experience and were overjoyed with the dessert recommended by the manager. The ambience is cosy. Decor and interior looks ok but not too exciting. Desserts were truly the highlight. We had the espresso mascarpone and amalfi lemon desserts and it was perfect for both our taste buds.
Late-night dining options in Singapore.name: Altro Zafferano

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
Other than the pizza tasting decent, everything else left much to be desired. There was no reception upon entering the hotel, and the manager was not particularly friendly nor understanding: I had made a reservation prior for the rooftop bar, but I was not informed that there was a minimum spending required of $75 per person. It would have been courteous at least to have been informed prior. As such, my expectation of a pleasant dinner experience turned out to be an unpleasant and short-lived meal, what more right in the middle of the dim-lit hotel lounge as guests continued to stream in (yet with no other diners at 7pm), and while the manager worked at the table right next to us. That being said, if you can afford to spend for a luxurious atmosphere at the expense of a service, professionalism and good food, go ahead.

Cosy upscale Italian restaurant located on the ground floor of a boutique 5 star hotel.

Surprisingly empty on a Saturday evening, so we had the entire wait staff looking after us.

We started off with a refreshing French 77 drink paired with Tartufo Fries and Burrata Pomodoro & Pesto. Pretty good truffle fries, but not the best I had.

Cape Santa alla Griglia (scallops) was almost mind-blowing, with a crispy bread that is really delicious if you dip it in the amazing broth before taking a bite, and well-cooked scallops. Repeat note: Amazing broth.

Truffle porcini was a pretty big portion and really creamy. They ran out of the fresh truffle slices, whicj would have made this dish perfect.

We finished off with a classic Aperol Spritz. Done nicely, though not the best I had.

Overall, this is an excellent Italian dining option.

Foods are awesome especially the pizza mama mia(sorry cant pronounce the name)! We always come back because of the best customer service by Marcello. Not only that he gives the best food in the menu but he put personal touch in his service.

Loved all the dishes and the service was great too. Went up to the rooftop bar after dinner which had great views. A nice place to chill when you're done with dinner.

Chanced upon this place after seeing a review of places with rooftop bar. The food is not pretentious, instead they are what you would expect of delicious Italian food. The environment and hospitality is a plus - with the opportunity to head for a drink at the rooftop bar before settling for dinner at the restaurant. Great place wind down to have a Italian fare in a chic but relatively inexpensive place.

Late-night dining options in Singapore.name: Florian Singapore (Italian Restaurant Singapore | Rooftop Bar Singapore)

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
Our experience at Braci was probably one of our most memorable meals and the food served was truly deserving of its Michelin star. Would highly recommend getting the seven course menu as there were so many more elements in our dinner incorporated that made it all the more special. Flavours were all very well balanced and overall we left feeling very satisfied.

Visited in Sep 2023

Braci was on my list of restaurants to visit for over 4 years and I must say that it was worth the wait. It is no surprise that Braci has retained its Michelin 1 star for 6 consecutive years. The menu was a progressive one which is definitely inspired by Chef Mattie’s Italian roots. There are 2 choices for people (5 course and 7 course). I would suggest people to go for the 7 course as the additional dishes in the 7 course meal are worth it. One of my favourite parts of the experience was trying out the 100 yr old balsamic vinegar.

If you’re not taking the wine pairing, I would strongly recommend folks to try out a few of their cocktails, esp. their Negroni (one of the most unique ones I’ve had)

Service was good. The restaurant is able to cater to some food allergies (like my shellfish allergy).

A definite recommendation for fine dining lovers.

Location was not to my liking.
Great staff very welcoming and accomodating to our strict dietary restrictions.
They had to make a menu from scratch for us which gives them bonus points.
Food quality was amazing and the ingredients exquisite.
However, the taste of the food was confusing and frankly bland at times.
But i cannot judge the restaurant fairly as i did not try the actual menu items.

Amazing time at Braci for a birthday celebration for my husband. The Italian food was superb with beautiful floral aesthetic to each dishes. Staff is polite and friendly too! Special thanks to Chef Matteo who is very engaging and make the day extra special! Love the black truffle "hide and seek" dish which is one of the highlights of all dishes! It so savoury and unforgettable….

nice food nice atmosphere. i tot the service could be more positive. but i still enjoy the experience especially on a chill night in the rooftop. overall quite an expensive experience but they were very nice to add an additional anniversary dessert for us:)
Late-night dining options in Singapore.name: Braci

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
Just an awesome place for a beautiful fusion meal. Plus, the kitchen was happy to change up the menu to suit a couple of pescatarians.

Firstly, the starters are all amazing. Favourites were the sour dough bread with butter and sesame oil and the tofu skin with sardine.

Secondly the mains were excellent, particularly the turbot, which was meaty and flavoursome.

The desserts were all the real winners of the night, particularly the oolong tea baba, which was particularly spectacular.

The wine matching was also great, especially the two Australian wines in the mix (a pinot noir and botrytis viognier).

Finally the staff are awesome and make the mighty a winning experience.

[Late review]

Visited in June 2023

Ibid had been on my list for a long time and it was a great experience it was. Not many restaurants can command a 4.9/5 rating on Google after 700+ reviews and one can see why. The menu is well thought out and the e dish preparations are absolutely perfect. The Wagyu, Cod and Risotto dishes were brilliant and the desserts were great too.

Service is really good. Chef Leong was also kind to have a long conversation on the fine dining scene in SG and provided some great insights on certain places to visit outside of SG.

A definite recommendation for all residents of SG. This restaurant must be on your places to try.

We chose to try Restaurant Ibid for our birthday celebration this year. They blew my mind with the creativity of their food and their courage to venture into the unknown. Go big or go home they say. And Ibid certainly didn’t hold back on their desire to be bold and try what others have not. There are many good fine dining restaurants but the key is how you create the wow factor and create even the slightest temptation to revisit soon. The last two restaurants that gave me this feeling was Andre and then Mosu. Mark my words, this place can become very big.

It was hard to decide which dish was the best for the night. But if I can to choose, it would have been the Mangalica Pork. It looks just like steak, and tastes incredulously divine. The pair with a glass elio perrone mongovone hit the right notes. This dish can’t get any better than this.

Big shout out to Chef Woo and his team, particular Anita who has been wonderful through the evening. We will see you soon.

My boyfriend and I celebrated his birthday at Restaurant Ibid and I must say, it was an exceptional experience. From start to finish, the staff were warm and friendly, making us feel right at home. We were impressed with the attention to detail that went into every dish, as Chef Woo himself took the time to explain the menu to us and answer any questions we had. It was clear that each dish was carefully crafted with a deep understanding of ingredients and flavor combinations.

Overall, I highly recommend Restaurant Ibid to anyone looking for a truly memorable dining experience in Singapore. The level of care and attention put into every aspect of the meal, from the food to the service, is truly exceptional. We left feeling satisfied and impressed, and can't wait to come back for another visit.

We visited in April and had a wonderful time dining at Restaurant Ibid. The menu was well thought out and the dishes absolutely delicious. We really enjoyed interacting with the staff and Chef. Chef even took the time to made a list of restaurants we should check out in Singapore. Everyone there is really passionate about food. This is definitely a place for a food nerd. And as gen z would say, the food is bussin’.

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
Excellent services with quality food and fantastic atmosphere. The restaurant only has limited table, definitely need reservations to come here. The place focuses more on a wide range of quality vegetables across the world. Very unique presentation of the dishes! My partner was having the vegetarian option and it was as good as the non vegetarian options. The chef even packed us his hometown cake to bring home for tasting.
A little high on the cost, but worth the experience!

One of the most breathtaking food experience I had the chance to enjoy.

Amazing culinary journey. The contemporary symphony of aromas and textures through a vegetarian focus was fresh, exciting and new. Every dish is meticulously crafted to bring a delightful balance of flavors. The wine pairing was on point. Compliments job to the chef.

Excellent service. Attentiveness and professionalism exceeded our expectations.

The atmosphere was warm, friendly and cosy. We felt welcomed and in optimal conditions to savor our dinner.

We recommend this restaurant to anyone passionate about food.

Beautiful vegetarian cuisine, beautiful ambience, beautiful service and staff. Just take that leap for tastebud and exquisite ingredients discovery. Presentation of the food, attention to your dining experience made it such a pleasant experience. Do come by each season for different culinary exposure.

Chef Jeremy and the team did a fantastic job championing seasonal vegetables. The wine paring was beautifully done for each course to highlight the taste of the food with a great balance.

The ambience of the restaurant was intimate and lovely but the light was slightly dark. It was a birthday celebration and we had a great time throughout the night.

The menu was exceptional, a great variation of vegetables and herbs tastefully balanced and beautifully presented. The choice of courses was perfectly matched. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The chef introduced himself to all the guests and was very accommodating. We really enjoyed our dinner at JAG, a highlight in Singapore.

Late-night dining options in Singapore.name: Restaurant JAG

Late-night dining options in Singapore.reviews:
We ordered quite a variety. The food was nice except for the lamb. A bit disappointing cause I was looking forward to it. Previously it was soft and tender. The rest though was consistently good.

I've been coming here for the past 5 years with my wife. This is her go to Halal Ramen stall whatever the timing is. Be it for lunch or dinner, the food is still good. Thumbs up for the service and good food. Thank you for being a good go to Halal Ramen for my wife and I.

Just know by chance walking around and found this place. Quick order and great service. Serving until 11:00pm we think. Price is ok. Should try. They have Japanese foods and Singapore foods as well. Over all value money.

The entire dining experience here was just so smooth and impressive. Weill definitely come for more.

Fast service and supportive staff. Refined broth, not too oily. And they are very generous with the gyora filling. Overall a perfect meal to end a long day.

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The food and wine was excellent and exactly as we expected. Really enjoyed everything but especially the chef’s special seaweed pasta and the grilled bacon wraps. Unfortunately the restaurant was busy and because it’s quite open it’s very loud and has a cafeteria feeling to it. The service was quite disappointing, and we had to ask multiple times where the rest of our food was (even servers came a few times to ask if we were done with the table or waiting for more items). The whole thing felt very chaotic and like no one was really on top of things; which is as disappointing. Food was good enough that we  will try again in a less busy night and hope service is better.

Loved the service by the staff. They are friendly and accommodating. They would check about the food too.

Food was great; tasty and generous. It’s nice to now that the class of dish can be found in the area. Love it.

The space is pretty crowded, especially on weekend. Walking areas between the tables and payment area are tight. Worth to mention too, the ventilation can be improved. The air was towards the warmer side (probably because of the crowd during dinner time?) and made clothes smell.

Finally got to have a meal here, and real glad we did. Everything looked so good! I think the meatballs, which we had for starters, were simply amazing, quite possibly the best I've ever had - so tender and moist and tasty! 😋  The pasta and the lasagna were wonderful also, deliciously creamy and so rich in flavours (on hindsight I really shouldn't have tried to eat the entire lasagna on my own.. way too rich 😅). And the pistachio tiramisu was a surprisingly delightful treat, though personally I still prefer the traditional version. Definitely coming back for more and to savour the many more other items on their menu. 😊

The baked pork belly deserves special mention. The succulent and perfectly seasoned pork is roasted to a crispy, golden perfection, while the meat inside remains tender and flavorful. Every bite is a harmonious combination of savory, salty, and wild fennel flavors that dance on your palate.

Of course, I couldn't leave without indulging in their delectable pistachio tiramisu, which was the perfect sweet ending to my Italian gastronomic adventure.

Ordered some items from the regular a la carte menu and some weekly specials. It’s my first time there, celebrating my husband’s birthday. The dishes are delicious and flavourful, we cleared everything. Only thing I felt could be better was service.
Didn’t get any “how’s everything” when all the tables around me got it; need a bit of attention to get them to come over to take orders etc

Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: iO Italian Osteria

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
My all tiem favourite Italian spot in Singapore! Super chill place that feels great for a Sunday afternoon lunch. Food is excellent and service is impeccable. Always start with the buratta and end your meal with the itramisu, it's just lovely. Would come more often if I didn't stay so far away!

The restaurant is a 2 mins walk from my office but I have never tried it on a normal weekday. So on a Saturday, I brought the whole family to the restaurant and I was really impressed by it.

We ordered a few off-menu items like the burrata, guanciale pizza and the cod fish on summer vegetables. Added another mushroom risotto as well. Food is really very good and the service staff is also caring. It's one of the best Italian restaurant I visited in Singapore.

The traditional food of Tuscany! Wow! Experience for me. The food was exquisite and the service, impeccable.

Dine in dinner. Sat outdoors. Beautiful wind and cool air in the evening.

The crew at Pietrasanta are warm
And welcoming. Attentive and interactive with suggestions. Loved the experience.

The food is amazing. Double, Wow!

Made a last minute booking for a weekday lunch and only the outdoor seats were left. But the outdoor seats were lovely as well. And service was also very prompt!

Food was excellent. Both the pasta and pizzas we ordered were amazing. Was very full after all the appetizers and mains but we still inhaled the tiramisu very quickly after it was served.

Hidden gem in One North! Try it for yourself! ;)

Good & friendly service staff.
Reasonably good food. The calamari and cold cuts were good. So were the pasta, focaccia, pizza of the day, fettuccine of the day, linguine of the day. Nice deserts too.
However, the beef of the day was over cooked vs the medium rare that was asked for.
Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: Pietrasanta The Italian Restaurant

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Great Italian restaurant for a date. The food was authentically Italian and the vibe was so casual and cool. I am all about the wood fired pizza. We ordered pizza with mushroom and meat it was so hearty and delicious. The gnocchi was creamy and hit the spot. The surprise was the dessert. I never had the citrus cake before and it was a revelation. Absolutely loved it. Can’t recommend it enough. Overall the food and service makes this restaurant worthy of a visit again.

definitely enjoyed our dinner here, staff were attentive and friendly. The seafood platter was fresh, the steak was definitely a 10/10. The fresh crab meat pasta was good too. Will come back again.

The pasta was the best!! We had Mediterranean salad which was good, it’s like Italian mix with Greece. We ordered spaghetti vongole and spaghetti seafood with Bisque sauce, both are delicious and I almost lick the plate, I’m sad that I’m full already if not will order cheese cake for sure. It’s my new favourite Italian restaurant for now, love the service and vibe so much, it’s casual and classy, parking is complimentary valet is a plus! Will be back 100%

Great Italian dishes.  Especially the starter fish dish.  Superb and nicely executed

Deep fried calamari is so good!

Pork collar was nicely seared and presented

Pizza with anchovies are interesting

Risotto was also good
Seafood pasta was not as exciting though

Overall a good dining experience

However,  I hope the servers can be more attentive in filing the wine glasses of customers when it goes empty.

Pizza was quite a let down, if you are looking for a crispy crust pizza, you’ll be let down… the centre of the pizza was wet and floppy, we resorted to taking it home. Calamari was tough, carbonara was a special request and disappointed with the clumpy sauce. Unlikely that we’ll be back unfortunately.

Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: La Braceria Pizza & Grill

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Visited in Sep 2023

A fantastic dining experience. The dry-aged duck main course was absolutely fantastic and so was the fish/turbot main course dish. The beef carpaccio course was also brilliant. The restaurant doesn’t have a non-alcoholic pairing and that’s probably a small area where they can improve their ‘value proposition’.

Service was top notch.

A definite recommendation for a classy dinner experience

Wonderful culinary experience from the start till the end. The location and ambiance is welcoming and cosy, the staff is friendly and took great care of us, the food is delicious, high attention to details and wonderful ingredients from all over the globe. The chef is very talented and creative. The sommelier chose some amazing wines and champagne to pair the dishes with. Amazing experience.

A sensational lunch which well exceeds its price point of $178++ per pax. The only criticism would be that the bread course was uninspiring, but who cares? It’s free anyway. Canapés started with their signature playful tomato soup. Using trompe l’oeil to make it look like tomatoes it’s actually a soft shell with tomato gazpacho encased within. The scallop tartare with avocado and tomato jelly was wonderfully light with all the elements working in harmony. The cod mousse taco was nice but overshadowed by its two counterparts. The first course started with a bang, yellowtail finished table side with a horseradish snow. Light, refreshing and full of flavour with an added air of theatricality for good measure. The second course was Mozambique langoustine which was the highlight of the menu. Sitting on top of a creamy anchovy sauce. The sweetness of the langoustine was a perfect complement to the (not-too) salty sauce. While the gem lettuce added some crunch to contrast with the soft and plump shellfish. This course was pure delight from start to finish! The pasta course was an elevated carbonara which utilised cured egg yolk. It was not too heavy which was a pleasant surprise. The main was veal with white asparagus coated in sabayon in a moscato sauce. The veal was cooked to perfection and the kitchen, once again, demonstrate their attention to detail by ensuring that each dish consists of an equal balance of flavours and textures. The palate cleanser was finished table side with a prickly pear granita, highly refreshing after two somewhat heavier courses. The dessert was the chef’s take on semifreddo using Marsala grapes, dessert wine sauce and clotted cream. Wonderful and I loved the bitterness of the grapes and wine sauce. Overall a spectacular meal, one of the best michelin-starred lunches one can grab in Singapore that showcases high quality ingredients, inventiveness while also not ripping a gigantic hole in one’s pocket. The setting of the restaurant is intimate and perfect for a date or a more private business meeting. Staff are warm, attentive and knowledgeable (and also take good photos). Definitely worth a visit.

Modern Italian restaurant serving interestingly innovative dishes especially the amuse bouches. Wine pairing was generous and well thought out - always a nice way to find new wines if a restaurant gets it right! Service was good. Small but well spaced and clean relaxed ambience.

1st time at their restaurant for dinner. Nice colonial place. Restaurant itself felt inviting. Staffs were all smiling when greeted & warmed when serving food.

Food were great. Wine pairing was generous.

Recommended.
Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: Buona Terra

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
TOP notch Italian food, prices are also on the higher side (pasta $40-50, beef $70-100+). In return you get quality for what you pay for. Definitely not a daily dining Italian shop. I came with my friend for a celebration.

Shop opens up with a bar, and then leads you into a dining area where there were ample space and ambience was on point. Good vibes.

Warm bread was fluffy and tasted perfect when dipped with a their top grade olive oil and a touch of balsamic vinegar. Starter was ok. Mushroom soup done right, service was prompt, pastas were all round tasty (one of the best), beef steak was done exactly the way I wanted it, not over cooked and not under cooked, tiramisu was a good old recipe that is worth it.

I must also comment that the restaurant made an effort to portion the food for 2 for every ordered item, when they noted we were sharing everything, this I’m very appreciative of.

The only thing I thought could be better were the bread sticks offered on the table, they were lacklustre as a tidbit or small bite. Maybe it’s just me but I saw most tables did not bother to eat or touch.

Overall, this restaurant definitely deserves a 5 stars.

I refuse to believe that this is a Michelin star restaurant. Food was AWFUL. How could you ruin steak? I literally had one bite of the meat and it was rancid just like the lobster we had for starter - I left it untouched. The truffle pasta was the only thing we were able to eat but won’t give it more than 2/5. Service was also below average. Truly disappointed 👎

Always a super experience at Garibaldi’s. What a treat with the amazing starter bread that comes out steamy hot, the salad delectable and the mains delicate and delicious.

Fun to order different dishes so you can have a taste of all the starters, mains and desserts.

We were here for SG restaurant week and had the set lunch menu.
Nice ambience, crowded even on a weekday afternoon. Staff was nice and friendly, took care of our table and topped up the water.
Choice of appetizer: salmon trout or wild mushroom soup
Mains: Mediterranean royal sea bream or Braised beef cheek with fettuccine
Dessert: cheese platter or blueberry yoghurt cake.

Verdict: I loved the seafood dishes as it was quite fresh. Good choice of salmon and sea bream. As for the beef fettuccine, it wasn’t as nice as expected. Perhaps the braised beef did not have much taste. Lastly, the dessert was alright, it was a mix of fresh blueberry, yoghurt and also blueberry jam. They could keep it simple by having a classic tiramisu instead.

Went for SG Restaurant Week. Weakest point for me has to be the service. Feels like eating at a neighbourhood cafe with the lack of attention and care from staff.

Food is very hit or miss. We love the scallops starter, but my burrata dish was very bland. The lobster pasta main was amazing, while the beef was disappointingly dry. We both had the blueberry yogurt dessert and it was alright.

Overall wouldn’t come again.
Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: Garibaldi

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Professional service was provided by the thoughtful and attentive staff. An entire birthday cake, not merely a slice, was given to us. Most dishes were great. The highlight of the meal was the seafood stew. All the breads were also exceptionally delicious. However, the sea bass tasted very ordinary and the sky high price tag went to the showy ‘performance’ by the chef. Restaurant was too dim and had a funky smell.

The staff are very friendly and the food is also tasty. The portion is surprisingly big and we ate till our hearts content.

Staff very helpful and polite. Atmosphere is chill with soft music. Food serve just in the right timing.  Of cause the price is not cheap. But it worth the price overall.

Lastly thanks for the birthday cake. Love it but we were too full to finish it.

Booked Sunday afternoon to have their set lunch, only to find out they only serve buffet that day at $78++ per person. Opted in anyway and didn't regret it, given the fresh ingredients, great taste of Italian and friendly staffs! Personally I love the dessert section especially Panna Cotta! If I had to pick on something, it'd be the dim lighting. No discount on the bill even with Shangri-la Circle membership, but you do get extra points.

Remember, when you get into the lobby, you are on 3F. You need to take an elevator to get down to 1F where the restaurant is.

The restaurant has decent ambience for a semi chic and comfortable dinning experience. The salt crusted fish is delicious and if you want to see some fire show. The winner for me is the crab pasta. Yum!

We celebrated our anniversary dinner here and it was a great decision! They generously presented us a complimentary cake, thank you for perfecting the night.
Among the dishes, we absolutely love the Porchetta. It was tender, yet crispy and flavourful, Highly recommended! While on the other side, we didn’t like the potato purée in the braised lamb leg dishes. It may have ruined the experience with that main dish. Despite that, this would not stop us from giving 5 stars because the other aspects (service/ambience) make up to it. A great dining place for celebrations.
Italian restaurants in Singapore.address: 22 Orange Grove Rd, Level One, Garden Wing, Singapore 258350
Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Have not been here for quite awhile, so went for their Thursday steak buffet. Still as good with all the appetizers and pizzas. The steak is soft and juicy but pity the tomahawk is a bit dry. Roast lamb is great as well. Didn’t really ate too much of the pasta though its very good cos need to save space for cheese and desserts!

All the food was excellent, the service was courteous and friendly, and we had a great time. (Honestly, the quality of the Asian food wasn't that great.) The chefs came around during the meal to give us tastings, and it felt like we were at a friend's party. It was a great time. Thank you:)

Delicious brunch with an extensive selection of Italian cheese. The Lasagna was also extremely delicious! The service was perfect as well. Money well spent and a very fun afternoon thanks to wine/prosecco free flow as well.

Went for Sunday brunch. Cheese room is lovely with a wide selection of cheeses. Loved the unique chocolate cheeses and burratas. Mains selection is ok, could be larger. Lamb stew was nice. Desserts are good as well.

The restaurant offers an array of 🧀 cheese.
If you are a cheese lover, this will be the restaurant for you!
We had buffet but the selection is limited unlike the conventional buffet.  However, food is delicious.
The service is good. Mr Muru / Mr Nuru (Manager) is very helpful & friendly.
Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: Basilico

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
This is a very vibrant Italian restaurant with solid sound coming from Bose speakers. Food is great. Slow cooked Lamb Ragu pasta and eggplant parmigiana are amazing. Their firewood pizza is not to be missed too. A perfect environment to stay and chill with a glass or wine or beer after a nice dinner.

I visited this place for a dinner date. We had already made a reservation in advance, as we knew very well that this place would be packed on the weekends.

The staff were very nice to greet us as we made our way into the restaurant and even walked us over to our tables. The waiter at the time was very observant, and would constantly check up on how we were  doing.

More on the food:

(Appetizer)
Burrata Bruschetta - 8/10 🌟
- The Burrata was really lovely!
- The sweet and juicy tomatoes compliments the creamy and milky cheese

However, the bread was a little tougher than expected that our knives struggle to cut through. Nevertheless, it was pretty delicious 🤤😋

(Appetizer)
Eggplant Parmigiana -  10/10 🌟🤌
- Absolutely bussin!
- It tastes better than a regular lasagne, the eggplant is barely noticeable. Which is good in a way as my partner is not too much of a fan of veggies.
- The sauce topped with the cheese just makes this dish one of the best in my opinion

(Main)
Diavola pizza - 9/10 🌟
- Spicy, greasy and meaty pizza
- The spicy and salty sorpressata balances the thick and absorbent pizza dough
- Low-key better than pepperoni pizzas 🤭

*Unfortunately I forgot to take a picture*

(Dessert)
Flambéed Chocolate Ecstasy - 6/10🌟
- Presentation was really good 👍
- Interesting concept of both Hot and Cold dessert

However, our brownies were a little too frozen 😕. We knew it was a hot and cold dessert as there was ice cream served with the hot-plated brownies. But when we tried to scoop booth goodies, the brownie was frozen hahaha. Interesting concept but would recommend other stuff like the tiramisu maybe.

Overall, excellent experience. Prompt service, a little pricey but worth the occasional visits. Came in hungry, left full  😵

My first time dining here and the staffs here are really sweet and customer oriented. They made the dining here with my girlfriend beyond pleasant. They made small talks with you and check on you regarding the quality of the food. The food was amazing but my friend and I couldn’t finished it because we are 2 girls that over ordered. If you are going for a date, this place is extremely ideal. Will definitely be back.

Was here for a birthday celebration. Staff was very nice and provided complimentary tiramisu cake (slightly alcoholic), which tasted phenomenal. Pizza is very well balanced and does not get gelat from a few bites, while the pastas and risottos pack a good flavourful punch. In total, it was slightly pricey but overall nice place to wine and dine.

Regarding indoors seating, music is kinda loud to have a clear conversation. Place is pet friendly and there are many dogs around

Service was underwhelming for the price paid.  Not the worst. But one would expect better.

Food. so long is pizza or pasta or Italian is nice. The pork chop was soso only.  Pizza came before the starters.

Dessert is a must have!! The tiramsu and flaming chocolate extasy. Don't touch the hot pan!!!

Wine selection is good and recommendation by the wine guy was great!!!

Good for celebrations... or hangout.
But bring a big wallet.

Free parking (4hrs) too if u need to know  1 ticket per bill.

Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: Publico Ristorante

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Very good service staff food nice very rich Italian food creamy and rich. The pizza thin crust but it's very filling need to order more salad instead. Huge portions good food qualify for good quality. Like service staffing professional

Always lovely to have dinner in this place. I am Italian and I appreciate good food made with good ingredients, in a genuine and simple way. Vespetta is one of our favourite. Great service, great location. We always have good time and we will keep coming back 👏👏👏

We had a company lunch. The set menu $41 (before service charge and gst) comes with starter, main course and dessert. However certain dishes need add-on price so the price is not absolute final.

The food quality is acceptable but no surprise. The breaded roasted sea bass fillet maybe a bit dry considering it is roasted. The roasted boneless chicken leg is quite well prepared and juicy. Calzone Alla Nutella is good for 2 or more people to share. Taste is good thanks to Nutella. Tiramisu is so-so.

Atmosphere is nice if you're sitting outside along the river, but may be hot and exposed to sunlight if it is sunny.

It maybe a good place for business lunch or drinking only.

Came here for lunch after my banking stuff.  Pretty much little aircon but it’s alright not warm as there are many wall fans around.  Food quality is okay but wish the tomatoes is grilled and potato not burnt.  Salads is good as I love the cheese, beef is okay.  Tiramisu serving is big, plus point is not too sweet just right.  My colleague ordered sea bass and looks really good.  Overall a decent and happy meal.

If you like authentic and very tasty italian food, it‘s a must to go her. We had a very good time - thank you so much! 🇮🇹
Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: Vespetta Italian Restaurant

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
We started the meal with the calamari, squid was fresh but the seasoning was a little bit too sour for my liking. The pasta was decently yummy but nothing too out of the world. Everything was done well hence the 4 stars review but perhaps it lacked the little OOMPH factor that would make it a five star. Service was exceptional, waiter was very attentive and nice, provided tons of recommendations and was very warm!

Went there during restaurant week and was amazed by the food quality and impeccable service. Everyone was friendly. Special shout-out to one of the staff, not sure if is the manager with a cross chain, interacting well with my 3 years old boy! Will definitely return again :)

We decided to celebrate the little boy's birthday at an Italian restaurant renowned for their delicious sourdough pizza, which has been ranked among the top 10 best pizzas in Singapore.

For starters, we opted for the Burrata cheese and sourdough bread, which was nothing out of the ordinary. However, the roasted potatoes with rosemary were a standout dish that shouldn't be overlooked.

Unfortunately, we were somewhat disappointed with the expensive petite Wagyu Striploin, possibly because it wasn't cooked to our desired level of doneness. We also sampled the Linguine Clams pasta, which was decent in taste but didn't quite wow us

Their menu is extensive, but their pizza steals the show. So many toppings to choose from! We ordered quite a feast, but I highly recommend the Calamari, Lobster Pasta, and any of their pizzas. The best part? They serve up your food lightning-fast, perfect for the hungry souls out there.

And don't forget to save room for dessert - their Pistachio Gelato is out of this world. Creamy, nutty, and just heavenly! 🍕🍝🍦

All of the food is delicious. The waiter was so attentive, polite, and friendly. They can explain their own food. The place was easy to find. The price was reasonable.
Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: Amò

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
They serve some of the most delectable Italian dishes we've ever had, each dish was prepared with exquisite flavours. We highly recommend trying the White Truffle Tagliolini while it is still in season. The ambiance of the restaurant is brilliant, perfect place for a romantic dinner, or just a night out with friends/family. We wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone who appreciates fine Italian cuisine and exceptional service.

Our server, Cheryl/Cherry, went above and beyond to make our dining experience truly exceptional, we want to express our sincere gratitude for making our dining experience memorable. Your professionalism, friendliness, and knowledge about the menu were outstanding!

From the food itself to the service offered all we could say is it’s stunningly perfect. Mr Ronnie helped us much, even with the picture taking , he’s even so vibrant to all the guests he served.  We’re also glad that the team keep on checking with us on what we needed and they are of such great help , Mr Mark was there to help and even gave us a complimentary dessert. Special thanks to Mr Suren who did a great job and elaborate to us the foods and wine which was served .

The wine which was served to us is just so👌.
Salute to the mentioned names for going above and beyond on serving us.

Came here for the first time to celebrate an anniversary and it couldn’t have been a better choice.

Sourdough bread was unassuming but soooo fresh and fluffy, the best we’ve had! We enjoyed our starters which were the lobster and the carpaccio more than we did the mains! But overall food was delicately plated and delicious.

The service here was nothing short of amazing as well, the waiters were very attentive and explained each dish to us, checked on how we’d like the food every now and then which we appreciate.

Especially enjoyed the part where we got the option to have our desserts alfresco with the amazing view of the city lights and MBS area.

Pricey but overall would recommend for a special occasion!

This is the first time I have visited an Italian place, not had a pizza and pasta primarily, and still walked away full and satisfied. We took a set 3/4 course menu, and the chef was kind enough to bake in dietary preferences (eg. Vegetarian for me). All the items were amazing. But (weirdly) a special callout for the warmest and loveliest bread that I have eaten in a long time. And yes, if you do manage to get a seat outside, the view of Marina bay is just spectacular.

Staff were absolutely friendly and attentive. I brought my mom who rarely enjoys fine dining but she thoroughly enjoyed her experience and were overjoyed with the dessert recommended by the manager. The ambience is cosy. Decor and interior looks ok but not too exciting. Desserts were truly the highlight. We had the espresso mascarpone and amalfi lemon desserts and it was perfect for both our taste buds.
Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: Altro Zafferano

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Food is alright, flavours are all good but nothing too spectacular.

The seafood in the calamari platter was fresh, no weird tastes. Pizza is on the average side. Crab pasta tasted like the non-spicy version of chilli crab which is quite unique. Would say the fish was the best. The fish itself is roasted very well and also love the layered potatoes.

Overall, felt that it was Italian cuisine tailored to the Singaporean palate. Also, the restaurant is understaffed, there was only two service-crew serving everyone. Atmosphere-wise, it’s on the top  level of the hotel but there’s no views of anything. It was basically a poolside restaurant with the occasional crying / screaming of kids and babies in the pool.

Would only recommend if you are hotel guest or looking for a casual restaurant in the area.

When you're looking for a less crowded Italian restaurant on Orchard Road, this is a good place to hide. Nice small restaurant, located on the Rooftop of Voco Hotel. The food is good, but it could be better. Service staff were wonderful and knowledgeable of the menu.

I’ve visited with my mom during singapore trip. They served great dishes. I especially recommend Truffle Burrata Cheese Pizza. The staff who is Korean guy is very kind and professional. We had a good moment because of him. I want to thank you to he and rest of all staffs.

Love the ambience of this roof top bar as well as the service received!

Thank you Cai Ying, Jeremy and Owen for the exceptional services during my dinner at il Cielo, thank you for making it easy and enjoyable for me and my 5 year old son.

Special mention to Cai Ying, who was especially attentive to all my needs and food recommendations were superb (look at the photos!)

Of course, thank you to Chef Marco and Chef Beh Li for making my foodie son crave for the food even more after we left the restaurant.

Would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who is looking to have a quiet evening with pool and view of Orchard!

Do try the Burrata Purgilese and the Tiramisu! These 2 are my favourites!

I had a really lovely lunch with my family. It was a special occasion to celebrate and the food and service was excellent (the pool view is great as well). The staff Owen made our day and we genuinely enjoyed our time there. Thanks team!!

Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: il Cielo

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Our experience at Braci was probably one of our most memorable meals and the food served was truly deserving of its Michelin star. Would highly recommend getting the seven course menu as there were so many more elements in our dinner incorporated that made it all the more special. Flavours were all very well balanced and overall we left feeling very satisfied.

Visited in Sep 2023

Braci was on my list of restaurants to visit for over 4 years and I must say that it was worth the wait. It is no surprise that Braci has retained its Michelin 1 star for 6 consecutive years. The menu was a progressive one which is definitely inspired by Chef Mattie’s Italian roots. There are 2 choices for people (5 course and 7 course). I would suggest people to go for the 7 course as the additional dishes in the 7 course meal are worth it. One of my favourite parts of the experience was trying out the 100 yr old balsamic vinegar.

If you’re not taking the wine pairing, I would strongly recommend folks to try out a few of their cocktails, esp. their Negroni (one of the most unique ones I’ve had)

Service was good. The restaurant is able to cater to some food allergies (like my shellfish allergy).

A definite recommendation for fine dining lovers.

Location was not to my liking.
Great staff very welcoming and accomodating to our strict dietary restrictions.
They had to make a menu from scratch for us which gives them bonus points.
Food quality was amazing and the ingredients exquisite.
However, the taste of the food was confusing and frankly bland at times.
But i cannot judge the restaurant fairly as i did not try the actual menu items.

Amazing time at Braci for a birthday celebration for my husband. The Italian food was superb with beautiful floral aesthetic to each dishes. Staff is polite and friendly too! Special thanks to Chef Matteo who is very engaging and make the day extra special! Love the black truffle "hide and seek" dish which is one of the highlights of all dishes! It so savoury and unforgettable….

nice food nice atmosphere. i tot the service could be more positive. but i still enjoy the experience especially on a chill night in the rooftop. overall quite an expensive experience but they were very nice to add an additional anniversary dessert for us:)
Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: Braci

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
I recently had the pleasure to dine in Da Luca, and I must say, it was a culinary masterpiece. The service from Albert was impeccable, with the staff showing a passion for Italian fusion cuisine.

Every dish was a work of art. I started with house-bread that was given as complimentary food, and it was delicious. Then, I ordered the Chef's recommendation of Cold Pasta Scallop Uni with extra Black Truffle, 3 Bruschetta and Grilled Lamb. The combination flavours of them were vibrant, and the presentation was stunning.

The water selection was also extensive. You'll know by heart that when the waiter asked, "Do you want a regular or sparkling water?" It is truly a 5-star restaurant. It's the perfect place for a special occasion or a romantic evening. Bravo!

Superb everything.

From the moment we stepped in, we were well taken care of by Albert.

We ordered the following and were stuffed by the end of the dinner service. Portions were relatively huge for us both.

What we ordered:
1 X Angel hair scallop uni pasta
2 X Oysters
1 X Eggplant parmigiana
1 X Lamb rack
1 X Tiramisu

House bread was really really really good!

Overall, very value for money!
No words can describe, only numbers can. 10/10!!!!!

Cosy restaurant.  Went with my family. Very delicious food. Every dish i had was decently well presented and tasty. My family really enjoyed sharing the different variety of food from salad, scampi pasta, calamari, lasagne, stead, cod fish, crispy spanish pork.

Prices are on the high side. Be very careful when ordering items not listed in menu.   We had a shock at how expensive the truffle pizza was. They should have highlighted the cost during recommending since they are really off norms by a lot ( really many times the usual price;  though i know truffle is supposed to be more expensive).

Generally, it is still a pleasant dining experience.  We will go back again but will be really careful during ordering. 😅

Lovely Italian lunch celebrating a friend's birthday. We used to work near to this restaurant more than 10 years ago. The food must be good since it survived Covid?! Decided to try it and boy it was good. Abit on the pricey side.

Was recommended to dine here, I must say I was rather impressed by the quality and portion.  All our orders are well divided before being brought to us, portion was really generous and filling.

Really love the truffle uni capellini, and the service standards of service staff. Tiramisu (baileys) gals alittle short of my expectation and I feel can be better, but otherwise the rest of the food were great!

Will recommend to call in for a reservation.

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
I recently had the pleasure of indulging in Rubato's lunch buffet, and it was truly a memorable experience. The restaurant provided impeccable service, and the buffet itself offered a delightful selection of Italian dishes.

From the moment I walked in, the staff at Rubato made me feel welcome and ensured that I had everything I needed throughout the meal. Their attention to detail and dedication to guest satisfaction were evident.

The lunch buffet at Rubato featured a wide variety of Italian classics, from fresh salads and antipasti to hearty pasta dishes and delectable desserts. The flavors were outstanding, and the buffet's diverse offerings catered to a range of tastes. It's a fantastic option for those looking to explore a variety of Italian flavors in one sitting.

The only area where Rubato could improve was in the presentation of the main courses on the buffet. The plating of the meats and sauces at the start could be refined to make it easier for diners to identify and enjoy each dish.

In summary, Rubato's lunch buffet offers an exceptional culinary journey through Italian cuisine, with outstanding service to match. It's a fantastic option for those seeking a wide array of flavors in a warm and welcoming atmosphere. With a little attention to plating, Rubato's lunch buffet could become an undisputed five-star gem in the world of Italian dining.

We had a blast celebrating at Rubato with their fancy Vegetarian Italian Omakase! We told them we don't eat meat or seafood, and they whipped up a 6-course masterpiece just for us. All we had to do was sit back, relax, and enjoy the delicious Italian dishes they served up!

Scallop, Uni angel hair pasta was 10/10, worth the price. Octopus was 10/10 too, charred taste and sauce goes well together. Crab leg pasta was alright 7/10. Big and juicy oyster 8/10.

We just had the best dinner date at @rubatosg ❤️!

They are one of the oldest & most prestigious Italian restaurants in Singapore founded in 2009. Do you know they are available till 2am daily for deliveries via @grabfoodsg & for dine-in during weekends, eve of PH & PH?

Among the dishes that we've tried in our 6 course Japanese-Italian Omakase, here's our top 3 picks! See till the end to salivate over what we enjoyed 😝.

🌟 "A Gift from the Angels"
You literally 🤯 when you take a mouth, it consist of Chilled Angel Hair Pasta, Hokkaido Scallops Sashimi, Exotic Japanese Seaweed, Premium White Truffle Oil And Freshly-caught Hokkaido Bafun Uni, the combination matches so well and they are really fresh!

🌟 Lobster Cappuccino & Mushroom Soup with Truffle
The soups are so flavourful & rich but not cloying, we just slurp down the soup till the last drop, it's definitely one of the best we've ever tried.

🌟 Cod Fish
The cod fish literally melts in the mouth, there wasn't much seasoning or sauce but you can taste the freshness of the fish in every bite!

You can enjoy a Japanese-Italian Omakase between 6 - 9 courses starting from $128++. The chef will decide on the menu, you can inform them of your dietary preferences & they will customize the menu accordingly for you! They also have regular menu if you prefer to choose your own dishes.

This restaurant is a perfect place for dates, gathering or celebrations. Recommended to make a reservation and enjoy the amazing dining experiences!

Celebrated my birthday with my girls at Greenwood! Mr Daniel was attentive and provided a great experience for us! The Tomahawk Steak & Seafood Platter is a MUST TRY! Ended the lovely night with amazing desserts, one of every kind! Thank you Daniel for the arrangement! Will be back!

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The food was very good. Especially the crab pasta (10/10). The bread is very tasty (8/10). The pizza looked nice. Dough & crust good, overall 7.5/10. Service is very good (9.5/10), all service staff were friendly, attentive & helpful. Ambience good (7.5/10), acoustically a bit noisy.  The table setting very nice (9/10), the table cloth has a pleasant look & comfortable feel. The tiramisu cake lacks the alcohol but still scores a solid 8.5/10.  Good price value. We will be back for more delicious pasta 😋

Came here on a Monday evening for dinner with friends. Enjoyed all the food! All taste good and reasonable pricing. However, the restaurant is rather small.

My family found our favorite Italian restaurant now. We loved every dish that we ordered. The pastas were memorable. Every bite was al dente. And the chocolate sauce that came with their cannoli was amazingly rich. It brought me back to Paris where I had the best hot chocolate that tasted like liquid chocolate.

Dined-in at Etna last weekend for a birthday celebration. Booking was made online and requires a confirmation on WhatsApp on the day of booking which I had missed on my end. Nevertheless, we were fortunate to be able to take the only outdoor table left which was by the pavement which was equally comfortable with nice vibe.

The service staff were all friendly and nice. Food is not the best but I do recommend the crab pasta that we had. The crab taste was not overwhelming and the bisque blends in well with the pasta. We did not particularly enjoyed the ciriole alla norcina pasta as the pasta was a little thick for our liking. We also ordered a traditional focaccia and a calzone napoletano pizza as well which were amazing too. Portions were huge and we barely were able to finish the food for a group of 4.

Overall, Etna serves great Italian food and is worth the visit. Food were reasonably priced too.

Overall not bad, I’d say 7/10. We had the veal was a ‘today special’.

Didn’t know veal could be breaded. The batter was tasty. Pasta was mediocre for me. All on was a good meal!
Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: Etna Italian Restaurant (Duxton)

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
An absolute gem tucked deep in Namly estate. Amano's does great pizzas which are generously sized with a nice crunchy crust and fluffy dough.
The rocket and prosciutto pizza is reliably good. Prawn and bacon was also excellent.
Look out for their weekday promos which are an exceptional deal for the taste and quality of the food.
Staff were polite and kept our water glasses topped up.
Good place for a nice and laid-back weeknight dinner.
Parking can be tricky since it's in a residential area, but normally don't have to walk too far to get one one weekdays.
I find the tiramisu a tad cloying on the sweetness, would give other options a go next visit.

As this place is quite hidden amongst the private estate enclave, there is little crowd and no need for reservations (even on Friday evening).
Decent Italian food with oven baked pizza! The best dish was the seafood risotto! Yummy!

Amano is probably one of the best kept secrets for those looking for budget (relative to the usually more upscale options) Italian food. One of the main reasons for this is its location - it is located deep inside a private estate at a standalone row of shophouses. Unless you drive, you'll probably have to do a fair bit of walking to reach it. If you drive though, you can park for free along the road just outside. The food itself is really nice, especially the pastas and pizzas. Despite being a relatively small joint, they do have one of those huge traditional pizza ovens and I understand that their dough is made in-house. Can't comment on the other types of dishes on the menu but the pastas and pizzas are generally a safe bet. Do not that the pizzas are huge so you can definitely share one among two, or even three persons! The place itself is usually empty so you can just pop by and eat without too much fuss. Strongly recommend if you're willing to travel abit!

A hidden gem in the middle of a neighborhood. Only way to get there is to drive.

Food in general is a good variety and decent quality. Prices are much friendlier than the other Italian restaurants in the Bukit Timah area. And service has been excellent.

Dinner for 3: Had 2 starters (burrata/ prosciutto platter and bread basket), 3 mains (1 pizza, 1 seafood pasta and 1 lamb gnocci), 2 glasses of wine.

Enjoyed the food, though I thought the gnocci was a bit too salty - probably won't get 2 tomato based ones next time. Whilst generous with the cheese on the Pizza, I reckon the restaurant can do better with a better selection of parmesean topping for pastas.

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Went for dinner for 2 adults and 1 child. Ordered Calamari Fritti, Fettuccini Aglio Olio Porcini E Gamberi, Pizza Romana, Tiramisu Classico and Oreo Cheesecake. The serving portion are decent and we ordered a tad too much. Food are great. The fettuccini was al dente and flavourful. Personally would prefer if the prawns are deveined. Pizza was nicely baked with crispy edge and generous amount of toppings. The Tiramisu’s lady fingers were fully soaked in kahlua, making it a nice touch to finish up a good meal. All the servers are great, courteous and attentive to the customer’s needs.

Wife said i will love their Tiramisu... n she was right! Tiramisu al pistachio.. fantastic dessert. Amazed with their Bolognese too. Seeing my son 9 could nearly finish it by himself i had to ask him to stop save room for dessert. ^_^. It's been a while since i had dined in ltaliano restaurant. I like the food here n the ambience in there,it was well lit up.

The service was very good. Enough staff, smiled n well trained. It was rare to see when a waiter cleaning the table, spray the cleaning agent closely onto the cloth first, then wipe the table. *Waiter-John 2 thumb up*
Usually the one i saw just spray the chemical agent straight onto the table...=_="

I say this place will do better if there are more parking lots. Haiz... SG cramp up
Hope to come back again with just my wife, kids just mess up the mood lol.

Love the food here! Pizza and the truffle focaccia were super good and fresh. Super tasty (and personally I think eating with chilli flakes makes them even better!). The fried calamari dish was light and is great for starters. We also ordered the appetizer (melon wrapped in parma ham), and I think that was really good too (I have not tried it before and was a little skeptical, but after the first bite it totally changed my mind). Desserts (tiramisu and molten chocolate lave cake) were okay.

We had the Calamari Fritti, Pizza Ai Frutti Di Mare Al Nero Di Seppia, and Risotto Di Mare Zafferano – all via food delivery. All of them tasted so good, I can imagine it would be fantastic to dine at the restaurant. Looking forward to that next!

Hard to find parking but like the attentive homely service. Food is good. Pasta is the type with lots of sauce. We will try the pizza next time with the return voucher.
Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: Pietro Ristorante Italiano

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Best service (waiters/front of staff are so friendly) and promptness when delivering food and drinks! The fried calamari with the squid ink mayo, especially this mayo is amazing! Never had it but it's the most delicious mayo I've tasted...and I'm not a big fan of mayo! The 8 cheese pizza is excellent and so is the veal ravioli! Drinks are great too. We also love the decor -will definitely return to this restaurant.

Loved the experience. Great service at the door and through the lunch.
They accommodated all my requests, food was served in record time and great, from the lobster spaghetti, to the grilled prawns and grilled veggies. Good portion and quality was there. Very nice the espresso too.

Highly Recommended.

Great place for desserts. Good pastries and ice cream. Would be great if the kitchen can be opened until 12am. 😬

Was looking forward to the vegetable bowl BUT it's not available on the weekends so we shared a pizza, calamari and vongole pasta. Service was quick and efficient. Pizza was baked in an oven behind us. And even if we came in without a reservation on a Saturday we got a table easily.

It was a great experience. The food, the ambiance and the staff, all put together made the 1st experience dining here really great. Whether you are with family, or friends, or on a date night, this restaurant fits for all.

Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: Da Paolo Dempsey Restaurant & Bar

Italian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Very delicious food prepared by passionate chefs. Risotto, angel hair pasta, spicy pork ham pizza and wagyu beef steak were all cooked to perfection. The whole experience was brought to another level by extremely warm service by genuinely friendly staff. We would be back again.

Came to celebrate Father’s Day lunch on a lazy Sunday.  Place is not crowded and quite a nice homely atmosphere.  Ordered pizza, lamb chop, burrata cheese plater and bruschetta bread. All tasted delicious and pizza is really good.  Finished with nice coffee and tiramisu dessert.  Service is fast and prompt.  Overall a pleasant experience and the bill came up to $126 which is reasonable for the quality of food served.  Will certainly be back.

A nice cosy Italian restaurant nestled inside a private apartment. You will be spoilt for choices as they have a great authentic Italian menu and everything is tasty. Interior decor is also nicely done with a homey touch. Very friendly staff and chef as well.

I used to order often from them 4-5 years back as I was living next door and I returned for a dinner (last visit was probably 2019). The atmosphere is still great (old school italian place), the food is still amazing. Had the burrata, the 4 cheese pizza (I always order this wherever I go and Al Borgo is top 3 in Singapore for me) and pasta (angel hair with prawns). Nice Super Tuscan red wine at 90$ a bottle. Had deserts too (tiramisu and affogato with whisky instead of coffee). Total damage approx 230$. I left happy in spirit and tummy

It's definitely a great restaurant for who wanna taste real Italian food!! Thanks so much for giving us a lovely and unforgettable evening :)
Italian restaurants in Singapore.name: Al Borgo Italian Restaurant

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
TOP notch Italian food, prices are also on the higher side (pasta $40-50, beef $70-100+). In return you get quality for what you pay for. Definitely not a daily dining Italian shop. I came with my friend for a celebration.

Shop opens up with a bar, and then leads you into a dining area where there were ample space and ambience was on point. Good vibes.

Warm bread was fluffy and tasted perfect when dipped with a their top grade olive oil and a touch of balsamic vinegar. Starter was ok. Mushroom soup done right, service was prompt, pastas were all round tasty (one of the best), beef steak was done exactly the way I wanted it, not over cooked and not under cooked, tiramisu was a good old recipe that is worth it.

I must also comment that the restaurant made an effort to portion the food for 2 for every ordered item, when they noted we were sharing everything, this I’m very appreciative of.

The only thing I thought could be better were the bread sticks offered on the table, they were lacklustre as a tidbit or small bite. Maybe it’s just me but I saw most tables did not bother to eat or touch.

Overall, this restaurant definitely deserves a 5 stars.

I refuse to believe that this is a Michelin star restaurant. Food was AWFUL. How could you ruin steak? I literally had one bite of the meat and it was rancid just like the lobster we had for starter - I left it untouched. The truffle pasta was the only thing we were able to eat but won’t give it more than 2/5. Service was also below average. Truly disappointed 👎

Always a super experience at Garibaldi’s. What a treat with the amazing starter bread that comes out steamy hot, the salad delectable and the mains delicate and delicious.

Fun to order different dishes so you can have a taste of all the starters, mains and desserts.

We were here for SG restaurant week and had the set lunch menu.
Nice ambience, crowded even on a weekday afternoon. Staff was nice and friendly, took care of our table and topped up the water.
Choice of appetizer: salmon trout or wild mushroom soup
Mains: Mediterranean royal sea bream or Braised beef cheek with fettuccine
Dessert: cheese platter or blueberry yoghurt cake.

Verdict: I loved the seafood dishes as it was quite fresh. Good choice of salmon and sea bream. As for the beef fettuccine, it wasn’t as nice as expected. Perhaps the braised beef did not have much taste. Lastly, the dessert was alright, it was a mix of fresh blueberry, yoghurt and also blueberry jam. They could keep it simple by having a classic tiramisu instead.

Went for SG Restaurant Week. Weakest point for me has to be the service. Feels like eating at a neighbourhood cafe with the lack of attention and care from staff.

Food is very hit or miss. We love the scallops starter, but my burrata dish was very bland. The lobster pasta main was amazing, while the beef was disappointingly dry. We both had the blueberry yogurt dessert and it was alright.

Overall wouldn’t come again.
Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: Garibaldi

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
My all tiem favourite Italian spot in Singapore! Super chill place that feels great for a Sunday afternoon lunch. Food is excellent and service is impeccable. Always start with the buratta and end your meal with the itramisu, it's just lovely. Would come more often if I didn't stay so far away!

The restaurant is a 2 mins walk from my office but I have never tried it on a normal weekday. So on a Saturday, I brought the whole family to the restaurant and I was really impressed by it.

We ordered a few off-menu items like the burrata, guanciale pizza and the cod fish on summer vegetables. Added another mushroom risotto as well. Food is really very good and the service staff is also caring. It's one of the best Italian restaurant I visited in Singapore.

The traditional food of Tuscany! Wow! Experience for me. The food was exquisite and the service, impeccable.

Dine in dinner. Sat outdoors. Beautiful wind and cool air in the evening.

The crew at Pietrasanta are warm
And welcoming. Attentive and interactive with suggestions. Loved the experience.

The food is amazing. Double, Wow!

Made a last minute booking for a weekday lunch and only the outdoor seats were left. But the outdoor seats were lovely as well. And service was also very prompt!

Food was excellent. Both the pasta and pizzas we ordered were amazing. Was very full after all the appetizers and mains but we still inhaled the tiramisu very quickly after it was served.

Hidden gem in One North! Try it for yourself! ;)

Good & friendly service staff.
Reasonably good food. The calamari and cold cuts were good. So were the pasta, focaccia, pizza of the day, fettuccine of the day, linguine of the day. Nice deserts too.
However, the beef of the day was over cooked vs the medium rare that was asked for.
Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: Pietrasanta The Italian Restaurant

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Had a great time with some friends for dinner, it was lovely ambience with all the Christmas decor up! Amazing service staff and even the Chef was so friendly! Every dish tasted so good! We had a ball of an evening at the restaurant, heard they are closing their doors end of the year, it’s quite sad to learn about it because I would really hope to be able to have such amazing Italian food in Singapore. Thank You Chef Valentino

What more can I say except that I wished I had dined here earlier! It is one of the pricer restaurants I’ve been to AND it was worth every dollar 💵 spent! Every food and drink ordered hit the spot for us - deliziosa!  Prompt and warm service crew and the chef-owner, Valentino, and his family were present, and personally supervising the service crew and attending to guests. What lovely hospitality! You should be there to soak it all up… food, drinks, great service and lovely ambience (check out the photos!) I will surely miss them when they move out. You can still catch them before their last day on 24 Dec 2023. Dining reservations strongly recommended.

A family favourite restaurant that’s been around for a long time and unfortunately they are going to cease operations soon! Food is great as usual, their garlic bread is good, and it’s white truffle season now, best time to enjoy their truffle tagliolini. Their aglio Olio is unique as it comes with whole cloves of garlic, the seafood or lobster versions taste best. Portions are on the small side making it less value for money but taste is always on point.

I love this italian restaurant & it has been my top favourite. Food is heavenly, ambience is nice & hosts are really so warm & friendly.  Never fail!

Had my birthday celebration here and loved it. The portion were huge, staff were super attentive by clearing and changing plates frequently. I was pleasantly caught by surprise when the staff sang happy birthday. Highly recommended the lamb shank, pizza, salad, tiramisu and lava cake.
Italian cuisine in Singapore.opening_hours:
Monday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM
Tuesday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM
Wednesday: Closed
Thursday: 12:00 – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:30 PM
Friday: 12:00 – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:30 PM
