Sunday: 12:00 – 3:00 PM, 6:00 – 10:30 PM
Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: Ristorante Da Valentino

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Visited in Sep 2023

A fantastic dining experience. The dry-aged duck main course was absolutely fantastic and so was the fish/turbot main course dish. The beef carpaccio course was also brilliant. The restaurant doesn’t have a non-alcoholic pairing and that’s probably a small area where they can improve their ‘value proposition’.

Service was top notch.

A definite recommendation for a classy dinner experience

Wonderful culinary experience from the start till the end. The location and ambiance is welcoming and cosy, the staff is friendly and took great care of us, the food is delicious, high attention to details and wonderful ingredients from all over the globe. The chef is very talented and creative. The sommelier chose some amazing wines and champagne to pair the dishes with. Amazing experience.

A sensational lunch which well exceeds its price point of $178++ per pax. The only criticism would be that the bread course was uninspiring, but who cares? It’s free anyway. Canapés started with their signature playful tomato soup. Using trompe l’oeil to make it look like tomatoes it’s actually a soft shell with tomato gazpacho encased within. The scallop tartare with avocado and tomato jelly was wonderfully light with all the elements working in harmony. The cod mousse taco was nice but overshadowed by its two counterparts. The first course started with a bang, yellowtail finished table side with a horseradish snow. Light, refreshing and full of flavour with an added air of theatricality for good measure. The second course was Mozambique langoustine which was the highlight of the menu. Sitting on top of a creamy anchovy sauce. The sweetness of the langoustine was a perfect complement to the (not-too) salty sauce. While the gem lettuce added some crunch to contrast with the soft and plump shellfish. This course was pure delight from start to finish! The pasta course was an elevated carbonara which utilised cured egg yolk. It was not too heavy which was a pleasant surprise. The main was veal with white asparagus coated in sabayon in a moscato sauce. The veal was cooked to perfection and the kitchen, once again, demonstrate their attention to detail by ensuring that each dish consists of an equal balance of flavours and textures. The palate cleanser was finished table side with a prickly pear granita, highly refreshing after two somewhat heavier courses. The dessert was the chef’s take on semifreddo using Marsala grapes, dessert wine sauce and clotted cream. Wonderful and I loved the bitterness of the grapes and wine sauce. Overall a spectacular meal, one of the best michelin-starred lunches one can grab in Singapore that showcases high quality ingredients, inventiveness while also not ripping a gigantic hole in one’s pocket. The setting of the restaurant is intimate and perfect for a date or a more private business meeting. Staff are warm, attentive and knowledgeable (and also take good photos). Definitely worth a visit.

Modern Italian restaurant serving interestingly innovative dishes especially the amuse bouches. Wine pairing was generous and well thought out - always a nice way to find new wines if a restaurant gets it right! Service was good. Small but well spaced and clean relaxed ambience.

1st time at their restaurant for dinner. Nice colonial place. Restaurant itself felt inviting. Staffs were all smiling when greeted & warmed when serving food.

Food were great. Wine pairing was generous.

Recommended.
Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: Buona Terra

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Great Italian restaurant for a date. The food was authentically Italian and the vibe was so casual and cool. I am all about the wood fired pizza. We ordered pizza with mushroom and meat it was so hearty and delicious. The gnocchi was creamy and hit the spot. The surprise was the dessert. I never had the citrus cake before and it was a revelation. Absolutely loved it. Can’t recommend it enough. Overall the food and service makes this restaurant worthy of a visit again.

definitely enjoyed our dinner here, staff were attentive and friendly. The seafood platter was fresh, the steak was definitely a 10/10. The fresh crab meat pasta was good too. Will come back again.

The pasta was the best!! We had Mediterranean salad which was good, it’s like Italian mix with Greece. We ordered spaghetti vongole and spaghetti seafood with Bisque sauce, both are delicious and I almost lick the plate, I’m sad that I’m full already if not will order cheese cake for sure. It’s my new favourite Italian restaurant for now, love the service and vibe so much, it’s casual and classy, parking is complimentary valet is a plus! Will be back 100%

Great Italian dishes.  Especially the starter fish dish.  Superb and nicely executed

Deep fried calamari is so good!

Pork collar was nicely seared and presented

Pizza with anchovies are interesting

Risotto was also good
Seafood pasta was not as exciting though

Overall a good dining experience

However,  I hope the servers can be more attentive in filing the wine glasses of customers when it goes empty.

Pizza was quite a let down, if you are looking for a crispy crust pizza, you’ll be let down… the centre of the pizza was wet and floppy, we resorted to taking it home. Calamari was tough, carbonara was a special request and disappointed with the clumpy sauce. Unlikely that we’ll be back unfortunately.
Italian cuisine in Singapore.opening_hours:

Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: La Braceria Pizza & Grill

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Have not been here for quite awhile, so went for their Thursday steak buffet. Still as good with all the appetizers and pizzas. The steak is soft and juicy but pity the tomahawk is a bit dry. Roast lamb is great as well. Didn’t really ate too much of the pasta though its very good cos need to save space for cheese and desserts!

All the food was excellent, the service was courteous and friendly, and we had a great time. (Honestly, the quality of the Asian food wasn't that great.) The chefs came around during the meal to give us tastings, and it felt like we were at a friend's party. It was a great time. Thank you:)

Delicious brunch with an extensive selection of Italian cheese. The Lasagna was also extremely delicious! The service was perfect as well. Money well spent and a very fun afternoon thanks to wine/prosecco free flow as well.

Went for Sunday brunch. Cheese room is lovely with a wide selection of cheeses. Loved the unique chocolate cheeses and burratas. Mains selection is ok, could be larger. Lamb stew was nice. Desserts are good as well.

The restaurant offers an array of 🧀 cheese.
If you are a cheese lover, this will be the restaurant for you!
We had buffet but the selection is limited unlike the conventional buffet.  However, food is delicious.
The service is good. Mr Muru / Mr Nuru (Manager) is very helpful & friendly.
Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: Basilico

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
This is a very vibrant Italian restaurant with solid sound coming from Bose speakers. Food is great. Slow cooked Lamb Ragu pasta and eggplant parmigiana are amazing. Their firewood pizza is not to be missed too. A perfect environment to stay and chill with a glass or wine or beer after a nice dinner.

I visited this place for a dinner date. We had already made a reservation in advance, as we knew very well that this place would be packed on the weekends.

The staff were very nice to greet us as we made our way into the restaurant and even walked us over to our tables. The waiter at the time was very observant, and would constantly check up on how we were  doing.

More on the food:

(Appetizer)
Burrata Bruschetta - 8/10 🌟
- The Burrata was really lovely!
- The sweet and juicy tomatoes compliments the creamy and milky cheese

However, the bread was a little tougher than expected that our knives struggle to cut through. Nevertheless, it was pretty delicious 🤤😋

(Appetizer)
Eggplant Parmigiana -  10/10 🌟🤌
- Absolutely bussin!
- It tastes better than a regular lasagne, the eggplant is barely noticeable. Which is good in a way as my partner is not too much of a fan of veggies.
- The sauce topped with the cheese just makes this dish one of the best in my opinion

(Main)
Diavola pizza - 9/10 🌟
- Spicy, greasy and meaty pizza
- The spicy and salty sorpressata balances the thick and absorbent pizza dough
- Low-key better than pepperoni pizzas 🤭

*Unfortunately I forgot to take a picture*

(Dessert)
Flambéed Chocolate Ecstasy - 6/10🌟
- Presentation was really good 👍
- Interesting concept of both Hot and Cold dessert

However, our brownies were a little too frozen 😕. We knew it was a hot and cold dessert as there was ice cream served with the hot-plated brownies. But when we tried to scoop booth goodies, the brownie was frozen hahaha. Interesting concept but would recommend other stuff like the tiramisu maybe.

Overall, excellent experience. Prompt service, a little pricey but worth the occasional visits. Came in hungry, left full  😵

My first time dining here and the staffs here are really sweet and customer oriented. They made the dining here with my girlfriend beyond pleasant. They made small talks with you and check on you regarding the quality of the food. The food was amazing but my friend and I couldn’t finished it because we are 2 girls that over ordered. If you are going for a date, this place is extremely ideal. Will definitely be back.

Was here for a birthday celebration. Staff was very nice and provided complimentary tiramisu cake (slightly alcoholic), which tasted phenomenal. Pizza is very well balanced and does not get gelat from a few bites, while the pastas and risottos pack a good flavourful punch. In total, it was slightly pricey but overall nice place to wine and dine.

Regarding indoors seating, music is kinda loud to have a clear conversation. Place is pet friendly and there are many dogs around

Service was underwhelming for the price paid.  Not the worst. But one would expect better.

Food. so long is pizza or pasta or Italian is nice. The pork chop was soso only.  Pizza came before the starters.

Dessert is a must have!! The tiramsu and flaming chocolate extasy. Don't touch the hot pan!!!

Wine selection is good and recommendation by the wine guy was great!!!

Good for celebrations... or hangout.
But bring a big wallet.

Free parking (4hrs) too if u need to know  1 ticket per bill.

Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: Publico Ristorante

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
The food and wine was excellent and exactly as we expected. Really enjoyed everything but especially the chef’s special seaweed pasta and the grilled bacon wraps. Unfortunately the restaurant was busy and because it’s quite open it’s very loud and has a cafeteria feeling to it. The service was quite disappointing, and we had to ask multiple times where the rest of our food was (even servers came a few times to ask if we were done with the table or waiting for more items). The whole thing felt very chaotic and like no one was really on top of things; which is as disappointing. Food was good enough that we  will try again in a less busy night and hope service is better.

Loved the service by the staff. They are friendly and accommodating. They would check about the food too.

Food was great; tasty and generous. It’s nice to now that the class of dish can be found in the area. Love it.

The space is pretty crowded, especially on weekend. Walking areas between the tables and payment area are tight. Worth to mention too, the ventilation can be improved. The air was towards the warmer side (probably because of the crowd during dinner time?) and made clothes smell.

Finally got to have a meal here, and real glad we did. Everything looked so good! I think the meatballs, which we had for starters, were simply amazing, quite possibly the best I've ever had - so tender and moist and tasty! 😋  The pasta and the lasagna were wonderful also, deliciously creamy and so rich in flavours (on hindsight I really shouldn't have tried to eat the entire lasagna on my own.. way too rich 😅). And the pistachio tiramisu was a surprisingly delightful treat, though personally I still prefer the traditional version. Definitely coming back for more and to savour the many more other items on their menu. 😊

The baked pork belly deserves special mention. The succulent and perfectly seasoned pork is roasted to a crispy, golden perfection, while the meat inside remains tender and flavorful. Every bite is a harmonious combination of savory, salty, and wild fennel flavors that dance on your palate.

Of course, I couldn't leave without indulging in their delectable pistachio tiramisu, which was the perfect sweet ending to my Italian gastronomic adventure.

Ordered some items from the regular a la carte menu and some weekly specials. It’s my first time there, celebrating my husband’s birthday. The dishes are delicious and flavourful, we cleared everything. Only thing I felt could be better was service.
Didn’t get any “how’s everything” when all the tables around me got it; need a bit of attention to get them to come over to take orders etc

Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: iO Italian Osteria

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Our experience at Braci was probably one of our most memorable meals and the food served was truly deserving of its Michelin star. Would highly recommend getting the seven course menu as there were so many more elements in our dinner incorporated that made it all the more special. Flavours were all very well balanced and overall we left feeling very satisfied.

Visited in Sep 2023

Braci was on my list of restaurants to visit for over 4 years and I must say that it was worth the wait. It is no surprise that Braci has retained its Michelin 1 star for 6 consecutive years. The menu was a progressive one which is definitely inspired by Chef Mattie’s Italian roots. There are 2 choices for people (5 course and 7 course). I would suggest people to go for the 7 course as the additional dishes in the 7 course meal are worth it. One of my favourite parts of the experience was trying out the 100 yr old balsamic vinegar.

If you’re not taking the wine pairing, I would strongly recommend folks to try out a few of their cocktails, esp. their Negroni (one of the most unique ones I’ve had)

Service was good. The restaurant is able to cater to some food allergies (like my shellfish allergy).

A definite recommendation for fine dining lovers.

Location was not to my liking.
Great staff very welcoming and accomodating to our strict dietary restrictions.
They had to make a menu from scratch for us which gives them bonus points.
Food quality was amazing and the ingredients exquisite.
However, the taste of the food was confusing and frankly bland at times.
But i cannot judge the restaurant fairly as i did not try the actual menu items.

Amazing time at Braci for a birthday celebration for my husband. The Italian food was superb with beautiful floral aesthetic to each dishes. Staff is polite and friendly too! Special thanks to Chef Matteo who is very engaging and make the day extra special! Love the black truffle "hide and seek" dish which is one of the highlights of all dishes! It so savoury and unforgettable….

nice food nice atmosphere. i tot the service could be more positive. but i still enjoy the experience especially on a chill night in the rooftop. overall quite an expensive experience but they were very nice to add an additional anniversary dessert for us:)
Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: Braci

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Very good service staff food nice very rich Italian food creamy and rich. The pizza thin crust but it's very filling need to order more salad instead. Huge portions good food qualify for good quality. Like service staffing professional

Always lovely to have dinner in this place. I am Italian and I appreciate good food made with good ingredients, in a genuine and simple way. Vespetta is one of our favourite. Great service, great location. We always have good time and we will keep coming back 👏👏👏

We had a company lunch. The set menu $41 (before service charge and gst) comes with starter, main course and dessert. However certain dishes need add-on price so the price is not absolute final.

The food quality is acceptable but no surprise. The breaded roasted sea bass fillet maybe a bit dry considering it is roasted. The roasted boneless chicken leg is quite well prepared and juicy. Calzone Alla Nutella is good for 2 or more people to share. Taste is good thanks to Nutella. Tiramisu is so-so.

Atmosphere is nice if you're sitting outside along the river, but may be hot and exposed to sunlight if it is sunny.

It maybe a good place for business lunch or drinking only.

Came here for lunch after my banking stuff.  Pretty much little aircon but it’s alright not warm as there are many wall fans around.  Food quality is okay but wish the tomatoes is grilled and potato not burnt.  Salads is good as I love the cheese, beef is okay.  Tiramisu serving is big, plus point is not too sweet just right.  My colleague ordered sea bass and looks really good.  Overall a decent and happy meal.

If you like authentic and very tasty italian food, it‘s a must to go her. We had a very good time - thank you so much! 🇮🇹
Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: Vespetta Italian Restaurant

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Professional service was provided by the thoughtful and attentive staff. An entire birthday cake, not merely a slice, was given to us. Most dishes were great. The highlight of the meal was the seafood stew. All the breads were also exceptionally delicious. However, the sea bass tasted very ordinary and the sky high price tag went to the showy ‘performance’ by the chef. Restaurant was too dim and had a funky smell.

The staff are very friendly and the food is also tasty. The portion is surprisingly big and we ate till our hearts content.

Staff very helpful and polite. Atmosphere is chill with soft music. Food serve just in the right timing.  Of cause the price is not cheap. But it worth the price overall.

Lastly thanks for the birthday cake. Love it but we were too full to finish it.

Booked Sunday afternoon to have their set lunch, only to find out they only serve buffet that day at $78++ per person. Opted in anyway and didn't regret it, given the fresh ingredients, great taste of Italian and friendly staffs! Personally I love the dessert section especially Panna Cotta! If I had to pick on something, it'd be the dim lighting. No discount on the bill even with Shangri-la Circle membership, but you do get extra points.

Remember, when you get into the lobby, you are on 3F. You need to take an elevator to get down to 1F where the restaurant is.

The restaurant has decent ambience for a semi chic and comfortable dinning experience. The salt crusted fish is delicious and if you want to see some fire show. The winner for me is the crab pasta. Yum!

We celebrated our anniversary dinner here and it was a great decision! They generously presented us a complimentary cake, thank you for perfecting the night.
Among the dishes, we absolutely love the Porchetta. It was tender, yet crispy and flavourful, Highly recommended! While on the other side, we didn’t like the potato purée in the braised lamb leg dishes. It may have ruined the experience with that main dish. Despite that, this would not stop us from giving 5 stars because the other aspects (service/ambience) make up to it. A great dining place for celebrations.
Italian cuisine in Singapore.address: 22 Orange Grove Rd, Level One, Garden Wing, Singapore 258350
Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
The food was very good. Especially the crab pasta (10/10). The bread is very tasty (8/10). The pizza looked nice. Dough & crust good, overall 7.5/10. Service is very good (9.5/10), all service staff were friendly, attentive & helpful. Ambience good (7.5/10), acoustically a bit noisy.  The table setting very nice (9/10), the table cloth has a pleasant look & comfortable feel. The tiramisu cake lacks the alcohol but still scores a solid 8.5/10.  Good price value. We will be back for more delicious pasta 😋

Came here on a Monday evening for dinner with friends. Enjoyed all the food! All taste good and reasonable pricing. However, the restaurant is rather small.

My family found our favorite Italian restaurant now. We loved every dish that we ordered. The pastas were memorable. Every bite was al dente. And the chocolate sauce that came with their cannoli was amazingly rich. It brought me back to Paris where I had the best hot chocolate that tasted like liquid chocolate.

Dined-in at Etna last weekend for a birthday celebration. Booking was made online and requires a confirmation on WhatsApp on the day of booking which I had missed on my end. Nevertheless, we were fortunate to be able to take the only outdoor table left which was by the pavement which was equally comfortable with nice vibe.

The service staff were all friendly and nice. Food is not the best but I do recommend the crab pasta that we had. The crab taste was not overwhelming and the bisque blends in well with the pasta. We did not particularly enjoyed the ciriole alla norcina pasta as the pasta was a little thick for our liking. We also ordered a traditional focaccia and a calzone napoletano pizza as well which were amazing too. Portions were huge and we barely were able to finish the food for a group of 4.

Overall, Etna serves great Italian food and is worth the visit. Food were reasonably priced too.

Overall not bad, I’d say 7/10. We had the veal was a ‘today special’.

Didn’t know veal could be breaded. The batter was tasty. Pasta was mediocre for me. All on was a good meal!
Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: Etna Italian Restaurant (Duxton)

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Went for dinner for 2 adults and 1 child. Ordered Calamari Fritti, Fettuccini Aglio Olio Porcini E Gamberi, Pizza Romana, Tiramisu Classico and Oreo Cheesecake. The serving portion are decent and we ordered a tad too much. Food are great. The fettuccini was al dente and flavourful. Personally would prefer if the prawns are deveined. Pizza was nicely baked with crispy edge and generous amount of toppings. The Tiramisu’s lady fingers were fully soaked in kahlua, making it a nice touch to finish up a good meal. All the servers are great, courteous and attentive to the customer’s needs.

Wife said i will love their Tiramisu... n she was right! Tiramisu al pistachio.. fantastic dessert. Amazed with their Bolognese too. Seeing my son 9 could nearly finish it by himself i had to ask him to stop save room for dessert. ^_^. It's been a while since i had dined in ltaliano restaurant. I like the food here n the ambience in there,it was well lit up.

The service was very good. Enough staff, smiled n well trained. It was rare to see when a waiter cleaning the table, spray the cleaning agent closely onto the cloth first, then wipe the table. *Waiter-John 2 thumb up*
Usually the one i saw just spray the chemical agent straight onto the table...=_="

I say this place will do better if there are more parking lots. Haiz... SG cramp up
Hope to come back again with just my wife, kids just mess up the mood lol.

Love the food here! Pizza and the truffle focaccia were super good and fresh. Super tasty (and personally I think eating with chilli flakes makes them even better!). The fried calamari dish was light and is great for starters. We also ordered the appetizer (melon wrapped in parma ham), and I think that was really good too (I have not tried it before and was a little skeptical, but after the first bite it totally changed my mind). Desserts (tiramisu and molten chocolate lave cake) were okay.

We had the Calamari Fritti, Pizza Ai Frutti Di Mare Al Nero Di Seppia, and Risotto Di Mare Zafferano – all via food delivery. All of them tasted so good, I can imagine it would be fantastic to dine at the restaurant. Looking forward to that next!

Hard to find parking but like the attentive homely service. Food is good. Pasta is the type with lots of sauce. We will try the pizza next time with the return voucher.
Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: Pietro Ristorante Italiano

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
I recently had the pleasure to dine in Da Luca, and I must say, it was a culinary masterpiece. The service from Albert was impeccable, with the staff showing a passion for Italian fusion cuisine.

Every dish was a work of art. I started with house-bread that was given as complimentary food, and it was delicious. Then, I ordered the Chef's recommendation of Cold Pasta Scallop Uni with extra Black Truffle, 3 Bruschetta and Grilled Lamb. The combination flavours of them were vibrant, and the presentation was stunning.

The water selection was also extensive. You'll know by heart that when the waiter asked, "Do you want a regular or sparkling water?" It is truly a 5-star restaurant. It's the perfect place for a special occasion or a romantic evening. Bravo!

Superb everything.

From the moment we stepped in, we were well taken care of by Albert.

We ordered the following and were stuffed by the end of the dinner service. Portions were relatively huge for us both.

What we ordered:
1 X Angel hair scallop uni pasta
2 X Oysters
1 X Eggplant parmigiana
1 X Lamb rack
1 X Tiramisu

House bread was really really really good!

Overall, very value for money!
No words can describe, only numbers can. 10/10!!!!!

Cosy restaurant.  Went with my family. Very delicious food. Every dish i had was decently well presented and tasty. My family really enjoyed sharing the different variety of food from salad, scampi pasta, calamari, lasagne, stead, cod fish, crispy spanish pork.

Prices are on the high side. Be very careful when ordering items not listed in menu.   We had a shock at how expensive the truffle pizza was. They should have highlighted the cost during recommending since they are really off norms by a lot ( really many times the usual price;  though i know truffle is supposed to be more expensive).

Generally, it is still a pleasant dining experience.  We will go back again but will be really careful during ordering. 😅

Lovely Italian lunch celebrating a friend's birthday. We used to work near to this restaurant more than 10 years ago. The food must be good since it survived Covid?! Decided to try it and boy it was good. Abit on the pricey side.

Was recommended to dine here, I must say I was rather impressed by the quality and portion.  All our orders are well divided before being brought to us, portion was really generous and filling.

Really love the truffle uni capellini, and the service standards of service staff. Tiramisu (baileys) gals alittle short of my expectation and I feel can be better, but otherwise the rest of the food were great!

Will recommend to call in for a reservation.

Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: Da Luca Italian Restaurant

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
We started the meal with the calamari, squid was fresh but the seasoning was a little bit too sour for my liking. The pasta was decently yummy but nothing too out of the world. Everything was done well hence the 4 stars review but perhaps it lacked the little OOMPH factor that would make it a five star. Service was exceptional, waiter was very attentive and nice, provided tons of recommendations and was very warm!

Went there during restaurant week and was amazed by the food quality and impeccable service. Everyone was friendly. Special shout-out to one of the staff, not sure if is the manager with a cross chain, interacting well with my 3 years old boy! Will definitely return again :)

We decided to celebrate the little boy's birthday at an Italian restaurant renowned for their delicious sourdough pizza, which has been ranked among the top 10 best pizzas in Singapore.

For starters, we opted for the Burrata cheese and sourdough bread, which was nothing out of the ordinary. However, the roasted potatoes with rosemary were a standout dish that shouldn't be overlooked.

Unfortunately, we were somewhat disappointed with the expensive petite Wagyu Striploin, possibly because it wasn't cooked to our desired level of doneness. We also sampled the Linguine Clams pasta, which was decent in taste but didn't quite wow us

Their menu is extensive, but their pizza steals the show. So many toppings to choose from! We ordered quite a feast, but I highly recommend the Calamari, Lobster Pasta, and any of their pizzas. The best part? They serve up your food lightning-fast, perfect for the hungry souls out there.

And don't forget to save room for dessert - their Pistachio Gelato is out of this world. Creamy, nutty, and just heavenly! 🍕🍝🍦

All of the food is delicious. The waiter was so attentive, polite, and friendly. They can explain their own food. The place was easy to find. The price was reasonable.
Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: Amò

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Had a very good experience here! The pizza portion is big, good for sharing! The pizza dough has a nice crisp on the outside and very soft inside! The gnocchi and lasagna are well seasoned! Staffs are friendly and helpful as well!

I think this Italian restaurant is 5 stars for its food, service and atmosphere. We basically ordered 3 dishes (a seasonal grilled fish, a Limoncello pizza and the Angus Tenderloin) for 2 pax and it is more than enough. The taste of the seasonal fish (sorry can't remember what fish it is) is exquisite. Both the looks and the taste profile can completely fool anyone that it is not a fish dish. The Angus Tenderloin is grilled nicely with the medium rare pink in the centre looking so succulent. Limoncello pizza (duh!) is also recommended if you are spoilt for choice. Lastly, go for the dessert! It is so good! I also appreciate the attentiveness of the staff. Seldom you find mid-range restaurant servers pouring wine when you are near empty. This restaurant staff ensured my glass is never empty, which is also not exactly good if you really want to take things slower. Robertson Quay is a very nice spot to immerse yourself into the weekend evening crowd. Be sure to ask for an outdoor table so you can enjoy the people watching.

Wanted to dine at Publico but it’s fully booked so we went here which slowly started filling up seats by night.

𝙁𝙚𝙩𝙩𝙪𝙘𝙘𝙞𝙣𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙣 𝙨𝙩𝙧𝙖𝙘𝙘𝙚𝙩𝙩𝙞 𝙙𝙞 𝙢𝙖𝙣𝙯𝙤 𝙚 𝙛𝙪𝙣𝙜𝙝𝙞 𝙘𝙝𝙖𝙢𝙥𝙞𝙜𝙣𝙤𝙣 ($28)
- Al dente homemade fettuccine with a slight chewy bite soaked the luscious sauce well, although a little too wheat-tasting for me.
- Champignon mushrooms provided an earthy note.
- Beef tenderloin strips were a bit gamey and could be more tender though.

𝙇𝙞𝙢𝙤𝙣𝙘𝙚𝙡𝙡𝙤 𝙥𝙞𝙯𝙯𝙖 ($29)
- White base with mozzarella, parmesan, porcini mushrooms, very flavourful beef sausage and button mushrooms!
- I liked the thin pizza dough that’s Neapolitan-style with a crispy crust and a slight chew 🍕

𝘽𝙪𝙧𝙧𝙖𝙩𝙖, 𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙨𝙘𝙞𝙪𝙩𝙩𝙤 𝙙𝙞 𝙥𝙖𝙧𝙢𝙖 30 𝙢𝙚𝙨𝙞 𝙚 𝙥𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙙𝙤𝙧𝙤 ($24)
- Burrata cheese was very fresh and creamy!!
- Balanced with prosciutto ham that’s moist and not overly salty.

𝘾𝙖𝙡𝙖𝙢𝙖𝙧𝙚𝙩𝙩𝙞 𝙙𝙞 𝙥𝙖𝙧𝙖𝙣𝙯𝙖 ($32)
- Baby squid fried in crispy coating was firmly chewy with a salty flavour profile!
- Prawns were sweet, wouldn’t mind a bigger portion given the price of the starter 🦐

Complimentary bread was served warm and soft, we enjoyed it so much that we got another basket 🥖 Their seafood tasted fresh so a better choice of pasta could be the crab linguine or mix seafood spaghetti!

Follow @iloafbready Instagram for more food reviews 🥰

Love the night vibe: warm and cozy lights, big plants and water body. The pizza is really delicious, will definitely come back for this thin and crispy wood fire pizza. Love the ham with burrata, simple yet yummy! Although for dessert, don’t recommend limoncello cake, it’s pretty average or rather below average.

Limoncello is one those Italian restaurants that you can be assured that the quality of the food is always there. I have eaten at this place many times but never get to write a review. So this is long overdue. The restaurant is situated in a Condominium ground floor facing the river. You can order a coffee and a cake and watch the world goes by. The customer service is excellent. The food is even better. We had the crab pasta and linguine with winter truffles. Sadly the grilled amberjack was sold out. This is one of the reasons why I made a repeat visit. Instead we ordered a pan fried bream. The pastas are a joy and delight to savor. They used real crab meat. There is also a generous portions of truffles. The menu is wide and the desserts are awesome! This place deserves to succeed. I pray that they will be here to a long time to come.
Italian cuisine in Singapore.name: Limoncello

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Been here multiple times and food has been consistently amazing! Great place for special occasions, family gatherings if you’re looking for good food, with decent pricing. Stars of the show has to be the calamari and the seafood cartoccio. Other favourites include the Pizza Bella Roma, Pollo, Crabmeat risotto and tiramisu! Definitely looking forward to my next visit, will be back for more :)

Foods are delicious and well done. Especially the beef. Lava not as good as expected, the liquid flows not that smooth. Love them not too sweet. It was regret they have no hot water for coffee. It should be resolved easily.

I like the fact that this is a neighborhood trattoria, where locals are regulars. You can see that the proprietor and staff know their customers.

We were a group of 6, and managed to try quite a number of their dishes. Overall quality was good, we enjoyed the food. The highlights were seafood soup, squid ink pasta, scaloppini, capriciossa pizza.

I brought along a bottle of Barbaresco to enjoy (a reasonable corkage of $20).

A nice place that I would return to. Recommended.

Title: A Memorable Italian Delight at Cacio e Pepe at 3 Chu Lin Road, Singapore 669890

My family and I recently had the pleasure of dining at Cacio e Pepe, an Italian gem tucked away in a quiet suburban location. From the moment we stepped in, it was evident that this restaurant was something special.

**Ambience:** The ambience at Cacio e Pepe was warm and inviting. The rustic Italian decor, soft lighting, and cozy seating made for a perfect setting for our family dinner. It struck a balance between sophistication and comfort, which we truly appreciated.

**Food:** Now, let's talk about the star of the show – the food. Cacio e Pepe takes Italian cuisine to a whole new level. We started with their bruschetta, which was bursting with flavor and a perfect way to kick off our meal. The pasta dishes were a highlight, and it's no surprise considering the restaurant's name translates to "cheese and pepper." Their Cacio e Pepe pasta lived up to its reputation, with al dente pasta coated in a creamy pecorino and black pepper sauce. Each bite was a burst of cheesy, peppery goodness.

**Wine Selection:** The addition of an extensive wine menu was a delightful surprise. We paired our meal with a recommended red wine, which complemented the flavors of our dishes perfectly. It's evident that the restaurant takes pride in curating a diverse and complementary wine list.

**Overall:** Our visit to Cacio e Pepe was nothing short of fantastic. The combination of delectable Italian cuisine, a cozy ambiance, and a well-curated wine selection made for a memorable evening. It's safe to say that we'll be returning to savor more of their culinary delights.

If you're in the Hillview area, (nearest Mrt is DT3 Hillview Mrt), and craving authentic Italian flavors in a charming setting, Cacio e Pepe is a must-visit. It's an experience that will leave your taste buds dancing and your heart content.

Absolutely delicious pastas here! Highly recommend the gnocchi and tagliatelle al tartufo. The tomato sauce of the gnocchi was refreshing while the truffle paste sauce was creamy but light, and very flavorful. I will love to come back and try the other dishes.

A very busy restaurant on a Saturday night. As I had no reservation, I was given the last available table at the back outside. There was the drain smell that made it not the most pleasant environment to be in for long. Definitely good to make a booking in advance.

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Best service (waiters/front of staff are so friendly) and promptness when delivering food and drinks! The fried calamari with the squid ink mayo, especially this mayo is amazing! Never had it but it's the most delicious mayo I've tasted...and I'm not a big fan of mayo! The 8 cheese pizza is excellent and so is the veal ravioli! Drinks are great too. We also love the decor -will definitely return to this restaurant.

Loved the experience. Great service at the door and through the lunch.
They accommodated all my requests, food was served in record time and great, from the lobster spaghetti, to the grilled prawns and grilled veggies. Good portion and quality was there. Very nice the espresso too.

Highly Recommended.

Great place for desserts. Good pastries and ice cream. Would be great if the kitchen can be opened until 12am. 😬

Was looking forward to the vegetable bowl BUT it's not available on the weekends so we shared a pizza, calamari and vongole pasta. Service was quick and efficient. Pizza was baked in an oven behind us. And even if we came in without a reservation on a Saturday we got a table easily.

It was a great experience. The food, the ambiance and the staff, all put together made the 1st experience dining here really great. Whether you are with family, or friends, or on a date night, this restaurant fits for all.

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
An absolute gem tucked deep in Namly estate. Amano's does great pizzas which are generously sized with a nice crunchy crust and fluffy dough.
The rocket and prosciutto pizza is reliably good. Prawn and bacon was also excellent.
Look out for their weekday promos which are an exceptional deal for the taste and quality of the food.
Staff were polite and kept our water glasses topped up.
Good place for a nice and laid-back weeknight dinner.
Parking can be tricky since it's in a residential area, but normally don't have to walk too far to get one one weekdays.
I find the tiramisu a tad cloying on the sweetness, would give other options a go next visit.

As this place is quite hidden amongst the private estate enclave, there is little crowd and no need for reservations (even on Friday evening).
Decent Italian food with oven baked pizza! The best dish was the seafood risotto! Yummy!

Amano is probably one of the best kept secrets for those looking for budget (relative to the usually more upscale options) Italian food. One of the main reasons for this is its location - it is located deep inside a private estate at a standalone row of shophouses. Unless you drive, you'll probably have to do a fair bit of walking to reach it. If you drive though, you can park for free along the road just outside. The food itself is really nice, especially the pastas and pizzas. Despite being a relatively small joint, they do have one of those huge traditional pizza ovens and I understand that their dough is made in-house. Can't comment on the other types of dishes on the menu but the pastas and pizzas are generally a safe bet. Do not that the pizzas are huge so you can definitely share one among two, or even three persons! The place itself is usually empty so you can just pop by and eat without too much fuss. Strongly recommend if you're willing to travel abit!

A hidden gem in the middle of a neighborhood. Only way to get there is to drive.

Food in general is a good variety and decent quality. Prices are much friendlier than the other Italian restaurants in the Bukit Timah area. And service has been excellent.

Dinner for 3: Had 2 starters (burrata/ prosciutto platter and bread basket), 3 mains (1 pizza, 1 seafood pasta and 1 lamb gnocci), 2 glasses of wine.

Enjoyed the food, though I thought the gnocci was a bit too salty - probably won't get 2 tomato based ones next time. Whilst generous with the cheese on the Pizza, I reckon the restaurant can do better with a better selection of parmesean topping for pastas.

Italian cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Food is alright, flavours are all good but nothing too spectacular.

The seafood in the calamari platter was fresh, no weird tastes. Pizza is on the average side. Crab pasta tasted like the non-spicy version of chilli crab which is quite unique. Would say the fish was the best. The fish itself is roasted very well and also love the layered potatoes.

Overall, felt that it was Italian cuisine tailored to the Singaporean palate. Also, the restaurant is understaffed, there was only two service-crew serving everyone. Atmosphere-wise, it’s on the top  level of the hotel but there’s no views of anything. It was basically a poolside restaurant with the occasional crying / screaming of kids and babies in the pool.

Would only recommend if you are hotel guest or looking for a casual restaurant in the area.

When you're looking for a less crowded Italian restaurant on Orchard Road, this is a good place to hide. Nice small restaurant, located on the Rooftop of Voco Hotel. The food is good, but it could be better. Service staff were wonderful and knowledgeable of the menu.

I’ve visited with my mom during singapore trip. They served great dishes. I especially recommend Truffle Burrata Cheese Pizza. The staff who is Korean guy is very kind and professional. We had a good moment because of him. I want to thank you to he and rest of all staffs.

Love the ambience of this roof top bar as well as the service received!

Thank you Cai Ying, Jeremy and Owen for the exceptional services during my dinner at il Cielo, thank you for making it easy and enjoyable for me and my 5 year old son.

Special mention to Cai Ying, who was especially attentive to all my needs and food recommendations were superb (look at the photos!)

Of course, thank you to Chef Marco and Chef Beh Li for making my foodie son crave for the food even more after we left the restaurant.

Would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who is looking to have a quiet evening with pool and view of Orchard!

Do try the Burrata Purgilese and the Tiramisu! These 2 are my favourites!

I had a really lovely lunch with my family. It was a special occasion to celebrate and the food and service was excellent (the pool view is great as well). The staff Owen made our day and we genuinely enjoyed our time there. Thanks team!!

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
This place opens up at 11.30am, earlier than other lunch spots in the area. We decided on a mexican fiesta and as such, popped in for a quick fix and to our delightful surprise, we were not at all disappointed.

My dish was about $19 before GST. It was fried chicken with loads of tomato sauce on it, with cilantro rice and nachos on the side. My friends had nachos and enchiladas. The flavours were good and the cilantro rice was so yummy. They didn’t skimp on the cilantro and the rice was cooked to perfection, every rice with that intense cilantro flavour. My chicken was fried to perfection, and it was juicy and moist. The serving size is generous for what you’re paying.

The restaurant service was attentive, and I loved that they provided free iced water to patrons. Such should be the standard of more restaurants in Singapore.

The decor was quaint and cute.

Absolutely love the Mexican food here especially the Soup with the fresh seafood in it had the nachos with pulled pork which was amazing the enchiladas filled with beef and the set with taco and enchilada with beans on the side I added guacamole as well which was great! Definitely would recommend this! Though service is sometimes quite slow it’s still quite worth while

I don't eat much mexican, but I really enjoyed my dinner here. Was difficult to choose from the menu but thankfully the staff were very helpful with their recommendations.

The spring roll thingy was amazing, way better than it looks.
I didn't know nachos can be served like that, the pulled pork one was good but wish there was more meat.
Beef quesadilla was really good too, altho it looked really flat and sad, but it was actually very flavourful and filling.
Fish tacos tasted quite interesting, I actually couldn't taste the fish at all which is a good thing.

Oh and I love the guacamole and tomatoes and salsa ~

The downside is all the quesadilla/taco/XXX all looked and tasted very similar.

But yea would come visit again! It tastes quite wholesome!

I am a frequent customer and have been ordering from them for a couple of years. No longer in the future as there was a cockroach wrapped in my burrito. I have reported them to the food agency.

It’s been many years since I’ve last been here. It’s a long standing establishment and the food did not fail me.
Ordered the piñatas, chimichanga and calamari. Food was served fast and the server was very friendly.
All the food ordered were tasty, filling and authentic. I’ll be back to explore the menu more.

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The staff , Anthony was so accommodating and very informative. He suggested the best food for me and my boss. The weather outside was super hot but despite of that…we had a great time and enjoyed our lunch. Cheers to the staff and management of El Mero Mero👍👍👍👍👍

great experience here! service was amazing, friendly staff and celebrated my friend’s birthday here. great atmosphere with great food! will definitely want to be back. highly recommend!!

Great food and value for money! Did a lovely birthday surprise for us as well, would definitely recommend

Ambience is beautiful. We are from Mexico and food is authentic and well served portions.

Nice outdoor dining, food was yummy! We did however, come on a very hot afternoon for lunch, while I was sweating buckets, and there was a natural breeze + fans, it's obviously warm but that's expected as it's an outdoor dining restaurant.

Would be lovely in the evening and on weekends. I plan to return with my kids.
Mexican restaurants in Singapore.name: El Mero Mero | Mexican Taqueria

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Food was tasty but the portion is a bit small.  Guacamole was served with thin crispy nachos, it was prepared at your table which was a nice surprise.  Quesadillas were delicious but the dips were too small. Beer selection is limited though.  The fried chicken wings were crunchy and went well with beers.
Good crowd even on weekdays.  Both indoor and outdoor dining areas are available.

Quite a famous place in Arab street with a long stretch outlet. Food is pretty good, drinks are good, price is pretty alright. Probably recommended for family during noon and early evening. Place has the vibes for friends and couple during dinner time and late evening. Their tacos is really good. Plenty of tables to sit and they have indoor and outdoor seats. Worth the try in a famous place as such.

Great ambient, the decorations and music.
We were 7 of us there on national day for dinner, ordered quite a lot of different kind of tapas and main course.

The portions were all quite large, the mozzarella cheese stick was so tasty, the pepper was too spicy somehow. The tacos with hard shell was crispy and I love the full loaded vegetables and meat perfectly with the sauces. Grilled chicken chop was well prepared, juicy and tender.

Flan is different then what we have in kopitiam, this texture of flan was not smooth or silk.  Not recommend to order ice cream as it taste so cheap..

Fantastic hard shell tacos, freshly smashed guacamole right at your table. Burger is juicy and my kid says, flavourful.

They even helped light a candle on the dessert for my kid's birthday.

One of my all time fav Mexican bar. The great vibe hasn't change. Colorful, lively, vibrant.

Great service too from the team especially Sunil. Thoroughly friendly and super helpful.

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Celebrated Anniversary. A very nice place with tables that have enough room between them and all families n friends can have their lovely time without disturbing any other tables!

Absolutely fantastic...Margaritas at Dempsey Hill in Singapore is a Fabulous culinary destination.
The ambience and setting is beautiful with the wonderful Dempsey hill mini fountains at the exterior and the classy interior finish
The service was attentive and highly efficient
The food was just wonderful. Mexican Cuisine never tasted this good with each item presented beautifully and tasting just right.
A must visit place in Singapore

Cocktails a must in Margarita’s! All good ordered was yums! The beef for fajitas was done just right. Definitely a must come back.

Margarita's seems to have been at Dempsey Hill forever.

This is a restaurant that survived covid and has continued to thrive. Obviously, there are reasons for this.

1. The food has never let me down each time I have come here either with family or friends. The food is freshly made and always tastes great. The sauces are also made freshly. All this effort is clearly reflected in the taste. Portions are large and generous as well.

2. The service is attentive. There are always enough staff around so you can get their attention when you want it.

3. There is a comforting ambience about this place. The restaurant is large, so there is a good feeling of being in a nice, large, well-decorated and well-maintained restaurant.

Although they charge $1 for packing the leftovers to go, they do a meticulous job with it. All the sauces are put into separate containers, different components like the meat is packed separately from the tortilla wraps.

This restaurant meets you at the right level at every point where you need them. Definitely one to revisit again and again.

Food was nice and a decent quantity. Don’t expect to be transported to Mexico but it’s good enough. If you can, go for the Carne Asada over the Fajitas. You do get Ribeye and more meat for the higher price. Worth it!
Maybe skip the desserts though 😅

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
First time to this restaurant.
Love the location.
Love the amosphere.
Love how our furkid enjoy sitting with us.

Food was good but perhaps it will be nice if staff can do better recommendations.

I have to give thumbs up to the staff, being very attentive even on a full seating.

Will return again.

Celebrated my wife’s birthday here. The food was amazing and the service here is superb!

I had the most incredible experience at Super Loco, and it's all thanks to the exceptional service provided by Jenny. From the moment we walked in, Jenny's warm and welcoming demeanor set the tone for a fantastic evening. She not only made sure our table was perfect, but she also went above and beyond to recommend the most delicious dishes on the menu. Kudos to her 👍🏻👍🏻

They also gave us free churros and mexican lover shot as part of our birthday celebration here.

Surprisingly, even though the food looks so nice, NONE of them (ordered 3 types of food) were tasty. 👎🏻

The staff was NOT friendly/polite at all. Even though there was miscommunication, i didn’t get apologies which made me feel uncomfortable.

The atmosphere is good as they allow lovely dogs outdoor.

Overall, not recommend. :) Thanks!!

Nice and open air spot to hangout, visited after a downpour with the weather nice and cool.
We had chips and guacamole to start.
Buffalo wings and quesadillas were great with the right amount of spices.
Crabmeat tacos were a tad unwieldy, turned soggy when left out awhile.
The food can be a little salty so drinks and frozen margaritas were a nice respite.
It was nice to have 3 different salsas available by the table, the mango habanero does pack quite the punch.
Will revisit for the laidback atmosphere and great food.
Staff were attentive and offered water.

Delicious, modern Mexican cuisine. Great menu with lots of meat and veg options as well as a decent kids menu. Favourite was the cauliflower dish as well as pumpkin tostadas. Service was a little non attentive but otherwise a great experience in a comfortable environment by the river.

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Came here with colleagues on a Thursday night and it was quite crowded, luckily we made reservations beforehand. The table we were shown to had these weird pipes at the sides, so because we were a party of 5 people, the 5th person (me) had to either sit awkwardly at the end with the pipes blocking my legs, or squeeze together with 2 other people on one side. I chose the latter.

We ordered a few variety of tacos, wings, and drinks to go along with them. All were decent and they came out relatively quickly too. It was however, really noisy as there were large groups of friends and office workers (10+ people in a group) so it could be hard to speak above the noise. The staff was attentive and professional so that was good. All in all, this is a decent place to head to after work, but if you are looking for a nice quiet place to chill, this might not be the most ideal spot.

Good ambience, with attentive & polite staffs. We had a reservation at a Friday night, yet it’s isn’t too crowded. They offered complimentary nachos which tasted great.

The kimchi fries tasted good too as it’s filled with generous toppings. However, the tacos were bland and doesn’t tasted too cohesive together, which is such a shame. Frozen lime margarita is enough for 2, which is a huge plus point!

Overall it’s food it’s mediocre for its price-point.

The flavor of the Mexican Korean fusion dishes are delicious, although the service and ambiance leave much to be desired.
The seating is uncomfortable, and the small table struggled to hold all the food we ordered. Unfortunately, when we voiced our concerns to the owner, it seemed like they didn't really care. This might be my first and last visit there.

Really chill place to hangout and have a meal. Waitress came by my table at least 6 times to ask if we needed anything else. That’s rare by Spore standard.

Food was amazing! The chips are fried fresh and the serving sizing is huge! Go for the Taco, Burrito and Quesadillas! A+++++ Well done and deserve my 5 stars rating, we will be back!

Visited this place several times before and always enjoyed myself very much! Absolutely love the friendly staff and chill vibes this place offers :) This time, managed to reach in time for their happy hour (Tues - Fri; 5pm - 7pm) and ordered their medium classic margarita. The drinks were amazing and doesnt taste diluted at all~ the tacos and quesadillas were both rly flavourful and greatly satisfied my mexican food cravings :) The food and drinks were served really fast as well. Highly recommend!

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.name: Vatos Urban Tacos

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
My go-to for comfort Mexican food. Big heavy burritos! The breakfast burrito is great if you love sweet and savoury flavour combos as it comes with a syrup dip to have with it! Ambience is nice and casual, staff are always cheerful.

Haven’t tried many Mexican cafe/restaurants around but this was pretty good!

Heard that they have  just rolled out new additions to its All-Day Menu as well as a brand-new Brunch Menu.

Here’s what we tried for their All-Day Menu:
🍤 Fried Shrimp Tacos
A crispy, zesty delight!
🍜 Birria Ramen
The ramen was rich with a savory, spicy, sweet, sour, smokey and unique Mexican flavor. Imagine tasty cooked beef shreds and the birria consommé which is a rich stew with flavors of chillies, adobo, herbs and spices dressing up cooked noodles. As simple as this sounds, it’s also just luscious! You can’t miss it!
🥤 Milkshakes
Available in Vanilla, Chocolate, Strawberry
🍩 Churros
With White Choc or Strawberry Choc sauce

We tried some brunch menu items as well:
🍳 Huevos Rancheros
This is a big hearty breakfast that’s packs with loads of nutritious goodness! I myst say, it can get a tad messy to eat, but hey, that's the charm of a true Mexican meal – messy, delicious, and satisfying!
🥩 Country Fried Steak with Mashed Potatoes & Gravy
Comfort food at its finest.
🥞 Buttermilk Pancakes with Maple Syrup
Fluffy stacks of pure joy.

Probably one of the best casual Mexican food joints in Singapore. Really up there on top of my list. The place is small and could be crowded during peak hours, but the location is not near public transpo - so it’s not that packed quite often.

The food is top notch; I especially recommend their burritos and buffalo wings. One thing to take note of is that they offer a unique selection of beverages which are quite good, so if you’re not adventurous and the type that sticks with the usual soda maybe you should bring yours.

We tend to always overindulge at this place, but on an average it’ll cost you around $15-20 per person at Muchachos.

Great Mexican flavours in Downtown Singapore.  Tried tortilla chips and tacos. Got the soft one, not sure if hard tacos is available. The vegetarian option has only two possibilities: pepper, onions and tofu. Prefer to have more options. But the food was really good

Very big portions. Good flavours, meat well cooked, fries crispy. Lacks something fresh light or crunchy. Every dish very heavy.

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Wife googled and found this Mexican place with great reviews..The food was great and reasonably priced! We loved the Angus cheeseburger and quesidilla especially..Nice place to chill and hang out.. =)

Above average food. We tried the beef taco, fish taco and the chicken quesadilla. Of the three, fish taco is perhaps the best choice. Drinks were generally better than the food, had both the margarita and the frozen one. Will I be back? Probably, not that many fantastic Mexican places in Singapore

This place didn’t disappoint! The fish tacos were bomb!!! Super crispy and fresh. Each taco set me back by $10, but I guess I’m gradually resigning myself to the fact that tacos are exorbitant in Singapore…) looking forward to trying the carne asada bowl and tacos next time, plus more servings of fish tacos for sure, and maybe some cocktails to spice up a future evening 🙏🏼

Discovered this gem whilst searching for dinner spots in Little India. Their warmth and hospitality were amazing from the moment we were seated. Khal, our server, did us good by recommending the fish tacos and chicken quesadillas…these were bomb and so were the cocktails mixed by Razi. We are so happy we found this place and will be coming back again for the great food and friendly service! 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

The food tastes really good. Cravings satisfied.
Food ordered:
Chimichanga, nachos, burritos, soft tacos, mojito and churros.
The service was excellent. In our one year stay in SG, all the restaurants we have visited. This is by far the best service we have had. The servers are very attentive and proactive.
The place matches the vibe and the food.
Mexican restaurants in Singapore.name: Chimichanga Little India

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Get your taste buds to throw a party!

Solid margaritas - try the spicy mango if you’re feel adventurous!🥭🌶️

Tasty tacos and generous the avocado dip - server gave us a second serving!  It's a fiesta for your taste buds, with a smooth and enjoyable dining experience.🌮🍹✨

Had the frozen margarita for $10++ during happy hour (until 7pm) and it was great! We ordered the platter - pork and fish were both great! Shrimp was not bad too. Chicken was our least favourite. Limited seatings so best to reserve a table first.

loved the time at Papi’s! we got the platter and the fav was the shrimp one 🍤🌮 do come before 7pm for happy hour! we didn’t make it in time but still enjoyed our frozen margaritas 😛 it was also crowded so we got bar seats but the staff were sooo generous and friendly. 10/10 would recommend! 💯

Their service is top-notch! I love the food, drinks and all the friendly staff. The best tacos I have ever tasted in Singapore. For sure, I will be back again here!!!!

Okurrrrr y’all know how some tacos get drenched in gravies and sauces and then start breaking so your hands get messy and it’s a 2/10 experience?? Ya NONE OF THAT HERE. PAPI’s TACO SHELLS ARE LIKE 👍🏻! THEYRE SOLID. THEYRE RELIABLE. THEYRE FIRM. THEY EXUDE ASSERTIVE ENERGY📢📢📢👹👹

Thin sheets WHO? They’ve never heard of her. I loved the tacos! they were really substantial. Would say the shrimp tacos are a must have here—the rest are all good, but the shrimp had me on my knees 🧎🏻‍♀️🧎🏻‍♀️🧎🏻‍♀️🧎🏻‍♀️🧎🏻‍♀️ ok everything else was like okok. The chicken pork guacamole salsa everything okok but I think overall it’s all fairly priced and it’s nice. :-) 👍🏻🫣

Prices are good—get the platter to share if it’s a party of 3 or more. The corn was also pretty tasty. Cocktails were nice too (not pictured my friends got an orange one and a spicy one) the orange cocktail was nice and refreshing. For the spicy one……. Let’s just say it’s an ✨acquired taste✨

Strong recommend. 👌🏼🫣😭 but this outlet is a little small—try their tpagar one! It’s more spacious.
Mexican restaurants in Singapore.name: Papi’s Tacos - Seah Street

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Varieties of veg food is available.
Pre booking is highly recommended.
Have been here 2 times and will definitely go again since the quality of food, service and the ambience is amazing.
MBS view dining is great.

Visit Date - 13 August 2023

It was a very pleasant experience at Super Loco @Customs House. On a Sunday it was quiet and we had booked a table outside overlooking the Marina.
It is recommended to visit during sunset, there is a refreshing breeze and slowly the marina lights up all happy and colourful - a perfect way to gear up for the new week.
We were served by Danial. He gave some unbiased suggestions highlighting what he likes and why and some other items why his colleagues like

Based on that we ordered
A Bottle of Pineapple and Calamani Margarita - It was light & refreshing
Trotilla chips with salsa roja

For the main course we had
Wagyu Steak - juicy bite sized on a taco
Beef Quesadilla - quite tasty

This should have been enough for dinner but for us it was not complete without a dessert so we indulged in
Chocolate Lava - as mentioned by Danial, the Mint ice cream and choco-lava cake made a super combo.
Panna Cotta - personally I liked this the best. The tang of lemon sorbet balanced the sweet Oaxaca cheese topped with the crunch of pistachio crumble. This is an item to return for.
Thanks Super Loco

Don’t be surprised by my 5 STAR ratings🤣 I’m pretty sure it’s not because of my birthday🌝

So I celebrated my birthday at this restaurant and it was on a Saturday😊 I love went to other restaurant before but not this location. The VIEW is superb even at 6pm(before sunset)

I ordered Chefs Recommendation $48/6 dishes.. I would say the portion is not too much and just nice for my appetite… So, as I put in the reservation remark column, they gave me a hat that night with a complimentary citrusy shots🤣 Ok, it’s a bonus drink, what do you expect? A glass of beer or wine? 🤣

So.. If you like to enjoy beautiful view with nice Mexican food, you should consider here and make your reservation early at least a week before your selected date😉

Absolutely delicious and satisfying Mexican fare in a chill, laid-back setting by the Bay. No complaints and would definitely return! The chips and dips are a must-order!!

Dropped in just before last call for orders at 9pm on a weekend, but the staff were friendly and helpful even though we were latecomers. We ordered a selection of tacos, tostados, the nacho chips and a salad - everything was served very quickly, tasted fresh, balanced, overall just really delicious.

The nacho chips with the range of dips was probably the star of the night. It’s usually a starter that I take for granted but the sauces here pack a punch - so so good and deceivingly simple-looking. I may not be a regular diner at Mexican restaurants but I’d imagine that it would be hard to top this off. Can’t wait to go back!

We got an outdoor seat beside the Bay Area with the backdrop Marina Bay Sands.
The view was awesome, there were a lot of people gathering around the area just to take photos in the evening.

Everything we ordered tasted fantastic, and the plating was colourful. The service was warm, friendly and attentive. It rained halfway and Solihin quickly relocated us indoor, and offered to leave the door open so we can enjoy the view, until the rain got heavier.

Overall, it was a unique and warm five star experience!

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Someone described this place to me as a hole in a wall taco joint and he was absolutely right. Quite non-descript in the back alley of a mall, this place surprises with its delicious and reasonably priced tacos and other Mexican dishes. Friendly staff who try to manage with dine-in as well as take away orders.

I’ve been here so many times and their foods have never disappointed me once. Highly recommend Carnitas Tacos and Fish Tacos. Hot Wings are also delicious but we always tell them to put the sauce on the side so technically it’s not hot wings but original wings 😂

Prefer the fish over the non-spicy chicken. The chicken taco was quite wet. Fish taco has a nice texture and crunch. Hibiscus drink was pretty good, could do a little less sweet.

tried the carnitas, tinga, and beef cheek tacos. meats were tender and given rather generously. of which, beef cheek and pork shoulder were well marinated and was complimented by their sauces very well. however chicken's a hit or miss as the onion may be too strong for some.

all in all, it was still enjoyable, however we do think that having a toasted hard-shell would make everything better

Love the pulled pork nachos & pork belly/chicken tacos 🌮

Would be great if the ventilation is better. Felt quite stuffy ...

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
My team mates organise this dinner session and it was my first time having Mexican food.

We had fish taco, potatoes and beef taco (not sure what is the dishes names). I also thought taco is crispy type but it is pretty similar to peking duck wrap that I am familiar with.

It was a new experience and I enjoyed it.

I understand the restaurant is pretty popular so reservation is needed. The restaurant ambient is nice too.

Very good Mexican restaurant (and it is my favorite food in the world). The cocktails are well balanced and they are able to go off menu. The food is great, and the wood grill is bringing good flavor. Negative points: Cocktails are a bit pricey

Every single dish that we ordered tasted sooooo good. Tlayuda de la Casa was something super unique which I have been eyeing on ever since I found out about this restaurant and wasn’t sure which one it was in the menu but the wait staff was super helpful and recommended that we add the lobster meat. It was sweet and savory in all the right balance.

We managed to make it early for the happy hour which has tacos and drinks. However, we ended up in the first dinner seating and couldn’t keep the table past 8pm and we had to pack most of our food to go…

Food was impeccable, as much as the service was great, we believe that it could be better since there was a hefty price tag to this restaurant.

Nixta. Coming from the word "nixtamalization", a process by which maize/corn is processed by an alkaline solution. #TIL.

What can I say? The food here is pretty good but make sure you wallets are thick. Best dish is the Tlayuda de la Casa, a crunchy tortilla with corn all other ingredients. We opted for the additional lobster but the super sweet corn is all I can remember of this dish. The whole dish is just perfect.

Next best is the giant churros. Amazing soft and hot churros topped with cinnamon sugar. The sauces were only a distraction.

The fingerlings cooked in duck fat were pretty good with the cheese and sour cream too. Duck and pork belly tacos were decent but the portions were kinda small. My other friends seemed to like the chicken. While I admit that it was pretty juicy and tender, I find it a bit too salty. Like salt baked chicken.

Service staff were very competent and friendly. One of them even offered to help us take photos.

We did end up going elsewhere for more food.

This place has quite the star attraction – their grilled chicken. The catch? You're best off pre-ordering it, unless you fancy an hour of patient anticipation. We opted for half a savory grilled chicken and also ventured into Tlayuda de la casa, a crispy tortilla dough creation reminiscent of a pizza, generously topped with corn. To kick up the spice, we had to try their Seafood Cocktail Veracruz, a fiery, flavorful seafood soup. And for a sweet finale, we couldn't resist the Churros.

But here's the secret sauce: The Seafood Cocktail Veracruz is the real showstopper. It's so good that you'll find yourself dunking nearly everything in that soul-warming broth. As for Churros, they're an absolute must-order, arriving hot and crispy, a pure delight. The other menu items? Well, they don't quite hit the same high note, so you can safely skip those.

For anyone fortunate enough to find themselves in this neck of the woods, remember this golden rule: Always order the soup – it's the heart and soul of the experience! 😄
Mexican restaurants in Singapore.name: Nixta Mexican Grill & Bar

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Good quality Mexican food here with generous and delicious fillings. I got the Fajitas bowl and it was a big portion for one person, very worth it. It was full of meat, vegetables, sauce, and some chips on the side. I ordered takeaway and it was still in great condition to eat. I love coming to eat here as its menu is varied and all tasty, would recommend for sure.

yummy food, really love their hard taco. service can be slow depending on the crowd, understandably so. They’ve finally built a stand alone salsa station. i rate it Amazing out of good.

This is not the first time I requested a non given. My house doesn’t have any now due to renovation etc please do not impose your idea on others about recycling etc we all have own timing. Not everyone is good with eating with hands!! Respect each other our own way of eating be it with fork knife or spoon n with hands. !! So am I suppose to eat like this 4 legged friend?????? So now I have to use the container cover to scoop my rice. How pathetic now?? My unit in mess due to renovation. U just making me more miserable!!!

Wide selection of food that's much to my liking, staff is friendly and helpful to assist in ordering. Very spacious, free and easy with cool music. Thanks!

Friendly, energetic staff. Food is great. Easy go to choice when you can't decide. Super glad the self-serve condiments bar is back!

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Atmosphere is good to chill relax with the sunlight and open air. Service is polite, food is slow but acceptable as we can understand there seems to be a shortage of manpower. Tacos need to improve as it’s small and not crispy enough.

Nice spot for hang out with friends over cocktails and drinks while deludge over Mexican food.

The Food:
Quite close to authentic Mexican cuisine, especially their tacos. It's a must try.
The beverages are amazing. Get those!!!

Services:
The waiter who served me was subpar in services. Lack of patience and giving a feeling like we are wasting his time. But foods and beverages are served quick. So it deserves a star.

Atmosphere:
Nice, cozy, chill and outdoor spot. Not noisy and great place to chat with friends. I only wish it open till late midnight haha

The ambience is fantastic, it’s open air and you get a nice view of CHIJMES. The food is great, but slightly different to what we had before. The quesadillas now have bell peppers/capsicums in them which is a change. Salsa, chips and the guacamole were very tasty and actually worth buying as a whole side. Also the fly on the plate is just a picture.

It was a Tuesday afternoon and so grateful for the incredible staff to take our big request booking for lunch of 40 people in such a short time. Shout out to the lovely staff who served us and we had the best time! Great food too! We recommend and will be back!

Authentic Mexican food in Chijmes in a beautiful setting. There's a few vegetarian options (impossible taco, salad, vegetarian enchilada or quesadilla), but some favorite options are missing (no huitlacoche, taco de champignones, flor de calabaza, tamales). I assume the ingredients are hard to get.
Outdoor seating in Chijmes is nice, with lots of space for kids to run around.
Mexican restaurants in Singapore.name: Señor Taco Chijmes

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Very friendly staff, greeted us with a huge smile and bright personality.

In total, food took about 20min before it was served fully, rather slow given that we were the only table and had ordered first. Still, food tasted alright, but not something we'll deliberately come back for.

This is not air conditioned, hence you may want to consider other dinning options if you are planning to have a business meeting here.

The nachos is really good.
Huge portioning and very generous with the amount of chicken and the toppings.
The topping is a mix with the meshed avocado and minced parsley leaves.
With chopped to cube size tomato, it’s juiciness and sourness help to reduce the heaviness from the cheese.
The signature Chimichanga is very unique, especially the cheese is baked to able to stretch very long.
Super value for money

Nice outdoor area to R&R as the area not very big thus once got customers queuing, the staff will start to eye on those who hv been sitting too long.

Staff didn't advise customers on paying bills as they take it for granted all on QR CODE. is my 1st time there so kind of not comfy with it, they wanted to clear the plates like chasing u off when I mentioned to diff staff to leave it here 1st as we r not done.

Beer-battered fish tacos rocks!! The little mango cubes were very sweet and the texture was great! Highly recommend! You can skip the spicy mushroom tacos… only good part was the juicy mushrooms, nothing special.
I have to say they were very generous with the avocado in the guac chips :> will come back again for their fish tacos!

Chimichanga is a fantastic restaurant that serves authentic Mexican cuisine and a variety of drinks. Living up to their name, the Chimichanga at this place is truly fantastic. The crispy, fried skin is perfection itself, and every bite is a burst of savory goodness.

The Ribeye steak was cooked to absolute perfection, and what's even better is that it's a great value for the price. Elotes (Grilled Corn) were fantastic the addictive aioli cheese made me finish it in less than a minute.

The fresh guacamole served here is a refreshing delight and pairs well with the other dishes. And to top it off, they offer a variety of interesting drinks, and I had the pleasure of trying a few during their happy hour (before 7 pm).

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Came here on a Tuesday dinner time, and crowd levels were low. Indoor dining was really hot, so we opted for the outdoor seating. Water is complimentary upon request. Service staff are smiley and are very efficient.

The pricing of each item is relatively high, but the portion size is pretty good and quite filling. A small basket of salsa and nachos are given as a complimentary entree as well.

🥙 Chicken Enchiladas ($29)
I really enjoyed the refried beans. Its thick, flavourful, and grainy. 2 Fried tortillas are stuffed with chicken and cheese, and slathered with the green tangy sauce, topped with a small scoop of guacamole and sour cream. A side of rice is also given. Halfway through I was already quite stuffed, but was so good I finished it. Slightly towards the heavy carb side. Would like it if more vegetables and chicken were given for this price.
I rate: 4/5 🌟

🥙 Shrimp Chimichanga ($30)
Never had deep fried burrito before but this was a really interesting mouthfeel of soft, mushy warm fillings and crunchy shrimps. There is also a side of rice for this. Slightly towards the heavy carb side. Would like it if more vegetables and shrimp were given for this price.
I rate: 4/5 🌟

Back here for the 2nd time with the same clique. Tacos can’t go wrong here; I especially loved the fried fish tacos. The quesadillas and burritos and the usual Mexican fare made us return for more.

We had a chocolate sauce chicken something, ordered by one of the more adventurous girls. It didn’t gel with any of us. I never liked a sweet and savory mix, and this dish confused my palate. But hey, food is subjective so maybe it’ll work for you!

Not many people come here on a weekday lunch, I suppose they should have an affordable lunch set to make it more enticing.
There’s plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. There’s also a plate of complimentary nachos with salsa given to us when we settled down.
We tried the enchiladas and burrito. Both were tasty, including the olive rice served on the side. The filling was generous and for the enchiladas, it was a fried version of the burrito so it’s crispy and yummy. We did not get to try the drinks this time so hope to go back again soon.

Great little Mexican restaurant with both inside and covered outdoor seating.

The food we ordered was delivered fast and efficiently.

We had the Chicken Fajitas, which had  a large portion of nicely seasoned chicken as well as grilled onions and peppers.  All served in a sizzling hot cast iron griddle. You can simply stir or leave the cooked onions and peppers if you desire a more cooked item.

We also ordered the Habenaro spiced chicken wings, which you can pick how hot you want them made.  I ordered them at a 5 out of 10 by recommendation of the server.  It was great advice, just hot enough to pit a nice burn to your lips.

Had a pint of Guiness as well.

Great personable service.
Highly recommend this location.

Prices are a little higher than others, but the food was worth it.

Nice outdoor seating and good service. Hearty portion of Mexican food too. Tacos were yummy and chimichanga was stuffed with lots of tender and tasty lamb, recommended!
