Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Good food and friendly service. 3 stars for atmosphere as it’s just a takeout place. I really liked the burrito with slow cooked beef. Beef was soft and tasty. Even had a few morsels of soft tendon. Comes with choice of tomato or brown rice, and 5 more toppings, like lettuce, cucumbers, jalapeños etc. Nicely wrapped and convenient to eat on the go.

First time trying. I’ve frequent many salad places, as I usually have salad for lunch. Daily cut, Haakon, Stuff’d, Super Simple, Salad Stop to name a few. In terms of price point, I would say they are fair…. But they really need to expand their selections for toppings. It’s actually quite pathetic. They have such a small selection, and for items like shredded cheese and guacamole, customers still need to top up $1.50 and $2.50 respectively. I probably won’t buy from this place again unless they really come out with more topping varieties.

I have tried SaladStop! and The Daily Cut salad bowls. Superitto is by far the best in terms of quality of food and taste! Unfortunately, they only have 1 outlet in Paragon basement 1. I wish they have more outlets. They offer Salad bowl and Burrito wrap with a wide variety of cooked dishes and high-quality salad options to choose from. I love their olive oil salmon which cooked at the right temperature. Soft and moist in taste. Their stewed beef is juicy and tender. My other favorite is their tendered seaweed wrapped chicken. I think kids will love it! There are many more dishes. Thanks to Chef Andrew for dishing up delicious and healthy food. Well done man!

I like the burrito place. Huge portions, very friendly staff who address all requests make the rating. Scrambled egg was given good portion while chicken which isn’t good has also made half the bowl. Good selection of veggies is a good value. I asked for an extra tortilla which is also accepted by the staff made me so happy. Chicken should be cooked more.

A more upmarket version of another more common burrito/ wraps shop. Quite a lot of choices. Meat was the chewy type. Not mince. Toppings portions were kinda small though. Taste wise - average.

Sunday: 10:30 AM – 8:30 PM
Mexican restaurants in Singapore.name: Superitto

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Came during peak lunch hours on a weekday. Ordered Nacho Fries and Soft Tacos.
Food-Nacho Fries with pulled pork, it came warm and it was good! Packed with flavours. But the Tacos were disappointing, ordered mix of chicken, steak and fish but personally I find it overall bland, could've more proteins in it.
Service- was ok, ordered online and it came pretty quick.
Atmosphere- place was pretty small and had to wait a bit for a seat when diners are done.
Price-not exactly cheap, won't be having this daily for sure.

There a constant whirring noise in the dining area, which is quite irritating.  The service crew is helpful & quick.  Ate the mini burrito bowl set: the fries are good and the burrito bowl with steak is great!

Perhaps one of the fastest in serving straight after I ordered. Ordered 2 burritos & in less than 5 mins, food was served! Food’s great too - no compromise on quality with their efficient service. Just that space is a little small & once it gets crowded, it gets a little stuffy.

Grilled chicken meat was tender and soft, added guacamole to my burrito bowl too, fresh and refreshing! Service was fast as well. Wish they had given more salsa though.

It’s our first time in Guzman Y Gomez and first thing that gave me great impression was in the counter with Dina. Her extra ordinary customer service made me wants to come back here and eat again! I like the ambience. I hope to enjoy the food as it’s still on they way.

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.name: Guzman y Gomez - Novena Square

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Small location but there aren't too many Mexican options around Singapore, so this gets extra points for that. Plus the staff were just super nice - laid back but still attentive and kind. The tacos were fantastic: they pack a punch (the waiter wasn't kidding when he checked "you're ok with spice, right?") but they were delicious. It's not exactly cheap - 2x tacos were $14 and 3x for $18 but it felt worth it.

Had the amazing Mexican dishes here.
The fried fish tacos is one of the best. Fish filet deep fried and covered with a thin layer of crispy skin, it was served still hot, so it’s amazing.
The sauce of top is a little spicy with the mango dices, it gets a little sweet. Such an amazing combination.
The nachos is freshly baked with cheese and  fresh avocado.
Fresh churros are good, soft and crispy. Great chocolate sauce.

Second time back here because we love the food. So far, everything that we’ve tried has been good. I especially recommend the loaded nachos. Good service from passionate owners.

The only downside was that we were placed at the bar seat which had very little leg room and counter space. The owner did ask if we were ok with it beforehand but in the future, I would opt for a table instead.

overall, the flavours at huevos are great but most of its philosophy seems to be just spam a bunch of flavours- which leaves me overwhelmed. I can’t actually taste the fish in the fish taco anymore, because of the intense flavours of every component.

- cauliflower bites (wished they used bigger chunks so I could actually feel the bite of the cauliflower)
- fish tacos
- short rib tacos
- mushroom & feta cheese tacos (not worth, but nice as a breakfast taco)

I ate the birria tacos. Loaded nachos. Tortilla chips with salsas. Everything was on point. Especially the birria tacos. This is coming from a Mexican, San Diego California resident. These tacos are ON POINT. Just don’t tell my mom I said that. 😂
The salsas are very fresh. The Yucatán bottle hot sauce is pretty good too. To drink I’ve got their cider which is very tasty not too strong. Their Horchata(rice milk) is very authentic as well. I still need to try their other tacos. I’m pretty sure they’re really good. Make sure to have a reservation. If not, be prepared to wait. Just know, it’ll be worth it!

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.name: Huevos

Mexican restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Glad we went through the reviews here before we decided to order the roast chicken & fish taco. The food is amazing!

Roast chicken: Mild spicy level, breast is slightly drier; would be better if they could make it more succulent & juicy.

Fish taco: personal favourite, love the tangy chilli mango salsa sauce.

Good vibes, good food. Good ambience to have a fun time. Food wise, not bad. Roasted whole chicken is great. Their margaritas are not bad too. It’s ice blended so pretty unique.  Would say though, price point pretty high for low income earners like me.

Disco lights to turn on after the sun has set. If you or your friends birthday, can ask them sing happy birthday. They will stop the music and get all their staffs to sing for you. Plus, you get an Mexican hat.

Dropped by because the Korean BBQ places we wanted to go to were fully booked on a Friday night.

Deep fried fish taco - 4.75 stars
Best of the lot.

Grilled barramundi taco - 3.5 stars

Cauliflower taco - 3.5 stars

Chicken - 4 stars
Gets spicier as you eat it.

The broccoli side for the chicken was raw. The other salad was average as well.

The rotisserie chicken was well marinated and the meat was tender and juicy.
The “Not your average nacho” was indeed special, the topping and dips went so well with the tortilla chips.
The dishes were a bit salty though.

Pretty packed on a Friday but we managed to get a seat without reservation.

Overall, the fish tacos as other reviews were good. The nacho and chicken was average.

The main disappointment is the level of service seems lacking, and one particular server didn't look like he wants to be there, and it shows. We saw a group of diners behind us leave their table without ordering after no one attended to him for a while.

For the price point, I do expect a better level of service and food.

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
Take a queue number, and you'll be notified once your number is about to be called. Be prepared to wait, especially on the weekend. Join their membership if you frequent them. Food quality is maintained and they've a large variety of freshly prepared food. On occasions, they've special dishes served.

ITS JUST AMAZING GOOD AND ALL GOOD!!
To me one of the best Japanese restaurant which is debatable but my own opinion.
Lunch time was a lot of people and its just crowded
But the food amend everything
For those who haven eat must eat
Definitely must come and try it once!!
Price : $$/$$$$$
price wise not too bad, quite reasonable for a family meal which is more worth it.

Sushi Tei at Thomson Plaza offers a delightful Japanese dining experience. The restaurant has a warm ambiance with traditional Japanese decoration. Their sushi is fresh and skillfully made, and they have a variety of other tasty Japanese dishes. The service is attentive, but it can get busy during peak hours. Overall, it's a must-visit place for those who enjoy Japanese cuisine in Thomson Plaza.

Servers very kind kept trying to fill my cup with green tea. 😂

The freshness and the taste was acceptable. Pricey a little 113 for two adults one child.

However what makes it nice is the speed of the food. Like machine gun service. 😂 the dishes were flying out fast.

The rest of the dishes were acceptable nothing to complain about. Quite standard Japanese flavour and fare here. If you’re looking at omasake level this is m barely half the fineness. 😂

The desserts were a little too normal for the price. The red bean wasn’t very tasty and the beans were a little hard. Soup was quite plain and sugared. The rest are standard quite similar to ichiban boshi.

A little disappointed for the price but can’t fault the speed and the overall quality which is palatable. See the pics. You’re paying for the decor as well. 😂

I find their consistency over so many outlets and so many years, quite impressive. They very seldom disappoint.
Only sad thing is the portions have shrunk and the prices have risen.

Place was clean and we got a good seating. Ordered the scallops ramen, salmon aburi and cold soba noodles with tempura.

The ramen.. seriously tasted like the Maggi instant noodles I cook. Add an egg. Exactly the same. I was so disappointed. That was my main course. The broth and the texture of the noodles = Maggi instant noodles chicken flavour.

Soba noodles texture was of lower quality and the dip was too dilute.
Salmon aburi was of standard but still I can’t bring myself to give 2 stars instead of 1. Think I’ll not visit Sushi Tei for awhile now.

Japanese food near my location.name: SUSHI TEI @ Thomson Plaza

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
Food is good - salad is very fresh with lovely salad dressing. Speed of serving food is good.

The servers are very attentive. Lead server made sure that my elderly aunt was seated at a table that is not too cold.

Back of restaurant, the seats are closer together. We got a nice table for 4 at the entrance.

Would come back again.

the last time i came, the slices were huge and also very fresh. they also gave free ice cream during birthday which was awesome. disclaimer: sometimes the sashimi slices are thinner and not that fresh. but the service staff are attentive and kept refilling the green tea

Nice cosy Japanese restaurant with friendly and prompt service. The food is nice and enjoyable. Ambience is cosy and relax. A break from the congested city restaurant as it is tuck in a shophouse in the middle of residential and industrial  area. Price wise a bit on high but justifiable with the ingredients, food quality and service. Overall a enjoyable dining experience. A nice treasure.

Nov 2022

Exceptional quality for the price. Fresh sashimi & tasty cooked dishes. Throw in good service making this a no-brainer for Japanese cuisine at reasonable price.

UPDATE - Feb 2023
Come again for dinner. The thick cut toro is ok but I have had better. The Saury fish (not in season, so frozen) is perfectly acceptable. Smoked duck with mushroom tastes really good. Tofu salad and cod fish hotpot are not bad either.

Our family always love Japanese Cuisine and Hubby brought us here as he heard the reviews are good.

We ordered Kurobuta Don, Chirashi Don, Chirashi Salmon Steak and Chicken Terikyaki Set. The sashimi is fresh and the kurobuta is delicious! We enjoyed the food here but I guess we are bigger eaters and the portion is not filling for us . :)

Need to make reservation as it is very crowded.
Japanese food near my location.name: Edo Ichi Japanese Cuisine

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
We were very pleased by the excellent food quality and the prompt, responsive service.

We enjoyed the Premium Pork Loin Katsu Set ($24.90+), which came with a crispy and deep-fried pork cutlet as well as unlimited rice, cabbage, and miso soup.

You can choose from a wide variety of options at the restaurant, including chicken karage and other katsu sets.The gyoza is delicious, juicy, and flavorful.
It's a nice place to get together with loved ones.

I was pleasantly surprised after having a meal here. I didn’t expect much since it is a lesser known tonkatsu place. But after eating here, I would gladly recommend it to anyone who loves pork tonkatsu and ramen. Food portions are sufficient. The tonkatsu had a crispy crust while the pork stayed juicy and succulent. I appreciate the free flow tea and water --  they're one of the few places that still offer free tea and water 🙂.

Came here for lunch today. Ordered the Tonkatsu Pork fillet set which comes with rice, soup, appetizer and fruits. This Tonkatsu set comes with free-flow rice and cabbage. I like that the Tonkatsu pork is deep-fried nicely and not too oily.

My boy ordered the Kyushu Ramen and the soup is rich and flavorful and there are like 5 pieces of Cha Shu which has a nice smoky charred flavour.

Green tea (hot or cold) is on the house. Overall we enjoyed the food here and will definitely be back again!

Had the Tonkatsu Ramen.

🔥 Tonkatsu was crispy and meat was tender (note: not the fatty loin cut, was lean)
😣 Bamboo shoots had overwhelming sulfuric/fart taste, ruined the soup and ramen...
🍜 Noodles were cooked well, decent texture.

Not sure what soup type it was supposed to be originally, but in the end just tasted quite salty and like the bamboo shoots.

Complimentary green tea provided! 🍵

I would rate this 6 stars lol.Honestly I thought the ramen will be smaller and less meat but this proved me wrong! There is 5 pieces of chashu and all of it was so tender and good. The chashu ramen broth was very light but packed a nice subtle flavour to complement. Waiters were also very friendly. I will definitely come back 👍
Japanese food near my location.address: 301 Upper Thomson Rd, #01-110 Thomson Plaza, Singapore 574408
Japanese food near my location.name: Hajime Tonkatsu & Ramen (Thomson Plaza)

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
Highly recommend its teishoku with several yummy side dishes: delicious and nostalgic. The Salmon Don also good: great quality of thick cut salmon and bit portion. Yakitori not at the correct point, lacking umami and salt. Overall, a good choice for Japanese family restaurant. And it is really affordable.
The gyoza also amazing

Returned here after around a decade. It is just as wonderful as I remember it. There are really few places in Singapore that produce food this homely, consistent and value-for-money.

What have I been doing for all this time?? Feel like I've rekindled a long-lost love. Will try to come back again soon.

Nice cosy restaurant tucked inside this stretch of road famous for prata. Price is reasonable and food is yummy! Service is not bad. Will patronise again when around here. Koebi we tried too not bad.

Simple no frills eating place.
Food is overall decent. The sashimi tasted thawed. Katsu-don is ok.

Overall no frills.

Finally came here one day after walking past it many times. This unassuming place serves up homely and good quality Japanese food!

Overall, the quality of food is very high. I had the beancurd soba and the broth was absolutely delicious and came piping hot. It’s a simple dish, but so tasty when done right. My friend got the tempura set and it was great as well. The prawns were fresh and tempura wasn’t and didn’t taste oily.

The side dishes we tried were good as well. Will recommend this place for quality, homely Japanese food if you’re in the area!
Japanese food near my location.name: Tamako Meal

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
We had dinner at this outlet at Thomson Plaza and ordered 3 type of rice bowl with accompanied sets of salad/drink;  Salmon Don, Pork Chasyu Don and Hokkaido Beef Don. The Salmon Don took sometime to be served, though fish meat was fresh. My wife thoroughly enjoyed the pork slices which were tender and well marinated. The beef was nice as well. The outlet has limited seatings, tables are small and there is only few tables for group > 3.

Good quality not bad, quantity more for Primary School kids, can't tell the size from menu picture. Cooking staff seems very unfriendly, there's a customer who spilled the soup over himself and when he requested for serviette, the table staff asked cooking staff to past customer and heard him saying "then no need cook liao arh". 😅

The lobster don  and salmon aburi don is delicious. Can choose add on of $3 - cones with drinks, choice of salad or miso soup  while the $6 add on cones with drinks and either chawan mushi, kareage or hokkaido cream croquette.

A far cry from the standard and quality of their sister restaurant. Granted it is the budget friendly version but for the nominal price difference, I don’t think it’s worth the while. A big step down in authenticity of taste.

$10.90 - Aburi Salmon Mentai Don
$11.90 - Ebi Fried White Curry Rice

This place is opened by sushi tei which is next door. Both our dishes were pretty tasty and the rice was actually really good, though you can tell the salmon wasn't really the high grade sort. However at these prices, you can't really complain.

I'd recommend this place for a quick tasty non traditional Japanese meal, like aburi/truffle/mentaiko stuff.

Japanese food near my location.name: Hokkaido-ya

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
Nice traditional rustic Japanese style. Would recommend ama ebi and udon (without orange slices on top, unless you want an orange herbal taste) the tempura is also delicious along with the tori karaage.

Used to dine in there and I love the Chirashi. Decided to do take away today. For $16 hotate sashimi and $19 maguro , you can do better in terms of serving and quality. Hotate was thinly sliced and maguro was really fishy. I don’t mind paying for the food but your price and quality must be at least in line with what you are charging.

Everything was amazing, from the chef's friendliness to the waiter's/waitresses' attending. Very satisfied with Ken's cooking and amazing vibes all around. Friendly atmosphere and very fresh ingredients/drinks. Highly recommended.

Cozy little space in a convenient mall. My 10 year old enjoyed her tonkatsu ramen whilst my 7 year old loved his salmon ikura don so much he ordered 2 portions but predictably ate only 1 spoonful from the second bowl before declaring he was too full so I ate that up for him. In addition, the kids had a plate of gyoza each as well, and I quite enjoyed the chawanmushi.

Good drinks, great people and excellent food. The Salmon Sashimi is really fresh. Chefs here are really creative too. Please come and try!

Shoutout to Arlene the waitress, Ken and Andy the chefs for making the place my go to.
Japanese food near my location.address: 301 Upper Thomson Rd, #01-43 Thomson Plaza, Singapore 574408
Japanese food near my location.name: IKURA Japanese - Thomson Plaza

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
Had the $58 omakase set which wasn’t worth the price at all. Able to fill up your stomach tho. Dessert was probably the best out of everything, one or two pieces of sushi can be considered decent too.
Staff told us place was packed and didn’t give us really good seats but place had plenty of empty seats. When explaining the dishes, the staff just mumbled through quickly to get it over and done with.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon to try the $58 omakase. Food was overall pretty decent - nothing mind blowing, but it was a pleasant meal. I only feel like the miso soup, dessert and lobster could be improved.

Lobster was clearly frozen and not the freshest because it was pretty dry and tough, and the miso soup was just very very normal like packet miso. Dessert tasted like an odd slightly watery mash of jelly and cheesecake. Sushi and sashimi were good.

Wasn't crowded and ambience was nice.

Decent and chill place to have omakase. You get the food but not the typical omakase experience.
Nonetheless a more than decent dinner 👌

*Note, the beef in the 58++ omakase menu can be changed to a salted egg chicken

Not really like Japen style, the food just normal but the service I feel good.
We order the $58 and $88 and the drink is sake. But for food I feel not really fresh….. especially seafood. So that’s why I feel so so. I think the price I can eat better at other restaurants. ╮(╯▽╰)╭

Nice ! Omakase excellent.. perfect timing served for each dish..Delicious.  Server's very pleasant & good service. Reasonable price.. will be back..best to book reservation.
Japanese food near my location.address: 583 Orchard Road, Forum The Shopping Mall, #01-17, 238884
Japanese food near my location.name: Hana Japanese Restaurant

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
Food is superb. Every item is good. Sashimi is fresh. I highly recommend the grilled tiger prawns and prawn miso omelette. The grilled prawns here are the best I've ever had at a buffet. Perfectly seasoned and grilled.

Service is good too. They promptly top up your iced green tea.

For a Japanese restaurant offering a buffet lunch at around $50 per person including GST and service charge, it sounds like a fair deal. The quality of fresh sashimi is commendable, although the slices is a bit small. The presence of a varied selection of sake adds to the experience, catering to aficionados of Japanese beverages.

The ambiance, while small, seems to create a pleasant dining atmosphere, enhancing the overall experience. The friendliness of the staff is always a plus, contributing to a welcoming environment.

However, it's worth noting that additional charges for ice cream and green tea might catch some diners off guard, potentially affecting the perceived value of the meal. Overall, it seems like a decent choice for those seeking a reasonably priced Japanese buffet with fresh offerings and a cozy setting, despite minor considerations about Sashimi slice sizes and extra charges for certain items.

Cosy little restaurant in the quiet neighbourhood of Greenwood. Took my friend here for her birthday celebration and we were delighted with the affordable a la carte buffet dishes, especially the beef cubes and prawn tempura. The sashimi was quite nice. Lovely staff members who were very sweet throughout our meal. Will definitely plan a revisit.

I know and visit this place since 15 Years. One of the best all you can eat sushi place in town. Amazing food, prices are very decent and Gary is just awesome. The sashimi, wafu steak and the yuzu ice cream are the highlights for me.

Dined in for dinner on a Wednesday night. Food was admittedly fresh and sashimi quality was good. However, the price performance ratio and the selection of food availabile were significantly inferior compared to Shin Yuu's competitors e.g., Mitsuba, Ikoi, Himawari or Irodori restaurants. $59.90++ for dinner amounted to about $72 per pax for the meal.

Definitely not worth it for the money spent. Will not return. Not recommended.
Japanese food near my location.name: Shin Yuu @ Greenwood Ave

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
The service is impeccable in Oka. From the head chef, teppanyaki chef  to the floor staff. Always approachable and friendly. Food portion is generous and cook to perfection.  Will definitely visit again.

Decor can be improved, can create a more Japanese cosy restaurant feel.

Chef Tommy is truly the best when it comes to food quality and service. Everything seems right. The ingredients are good and cooked to perfection. The personal service by Chef Tommy is par excellence! Definitely worth many repeat visits.

Great food. Prices went up slightly compared to before but quality is great. Staff was very friendly and it was a pleasant experience.

My family loves this place as it has Teppanyaki and also regular Japanese food.

We dined at the Teppanyaki counter so my kids can enjoy seeing the chef in action and it was a good decision.

Chef Tommy was very helpful and suggested to us what we can order for kids. His food is also very good! From the scallops, butter prawn, goma chicken and pork belly to the garlic fried rice, all the Teppanyaki items were delicious!

We also ordered Salmon Sashimi, Agedashi Tofu, Tori Karaage and Puffer fish appetiser from the kitchen and they were great too. Highly recommend this place.

I was very busy with the kids and forgot to take pics of the food, and only managed to take pictures at the end of the meal. It was for a birthday celebration.

Very fresh and tasty Japanese food. For SICC members and guests only.

Japanese food near my location.name: Oka

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
Standard dropped a lot over the year. I ordered the tempura with soba. The dish looked vastly different from the menu. Everything shrunk drastically in size. Not only that, the food does not taste good at all. I remember the restaurant in its prime time with queue waiting for a table. Now the whole situation reversed. Disappointed with it.

Service is still good.

Just had a weekend lunch at Watami Junction 8, nice that it is not too crowded and the service was good. Food wise I would say it is average because my tempura is oily, the beef hot pot with spicy miso was okay. The chocolate lava cake is a bit over done and the cut open the chocolate inside does not flow out which is a bit disappointing. Well the overall meal is a good value for money but do expect the quality to be a bit inferior to other Japanese restaurants.

First time trying this, and was surprised at the affordability and the quality of the food. Noticed this for some time but never stepped in as I thought it was going to be pricey, but we ended up spending less than $20/pax.

Ordered the seafood hotpot as well as the set items (chawanmushi, apple and udon/soba) and they were tasty! They have a pretty wide range of food items on the menu - including sushi, noodles, rice, sashimi etc.

Queue was pretty fast - the sign said waiting time was 15-55 minutes, but I got in within 5 minutes. Food also came pretty quickly - served within 15 minutes.

I will likely return again the next time I want Japanese food.

Ordered 3 pax set, a bit too much for 3, we left some foods. Love the salad with pumpkin slices especially. Forgot to take pictures of the rest, tempura, salad, beef rice with egg, fish. Membership discount 10%.

Came here for dinner. Food is good for 3 pax. Quality and taste is still relatively good. Fantastic  food experience.
Japanese food near my location.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:30 AM – 9:30 PM
Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 9:30 PM
Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 9:30 PM
Thursday: 11:30 AM – 9:30 PM
Friday: 11:30 AM – 9:30 PM
Saturday: 11:30 AM – 9:30 PM
Sunday: 11:30 AM – 9:30 PM
Japanese food near my location.name: Watami Japanese Dining - Junction 8

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
Made a reservation for 6pm on Saturday evening. Family of 5.We stayed nearby and finally get to come and try this beautiful restaurant. Was a bit worried when I saw the recent reviews. However, the whole experience was above expectations.We enjoyed our meal. Food was awesomely delicious especially the BBQ items... Tempura was done to perfection. Very fresh ingredients. Price slightly on the high side, but for the food, ambience and great service, I think it's worth.

We had to try our luck and walk into this garden themed Japanese restaurant on a Sunday evening after seeing how well-rated they were on google 👀 and were lucky enough to score an indoor seat with a dining time limit. We would recommend making a reservation beforehand seeing as they were booked out.

𝗞𝘂𝘀𝗵𝗶𝘆𝗮𝗸𝗶 𝟲 ($𝟮𝟰)
2 chicken 2 pork 2 veg
Think the skewers are “omakase” style and dependent on what ingredients the chef is cooking up. We got chicken (teriyaki, mentaiko), pork enoki, pork with quail egg, lady fingers and eggplant. You can really taste the char and smokiness in every bite you take. We must say that these are some of the better skewers we have had at japanese restaurants.

𝗦𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗦𝗮𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗺𝗶 (𝟱𝗽𝗰 $𝟭𝟳)
The salmon trout sashimi was fresh and decently thick. They use real wasabi here (you get the aroma of spice but it doesn’t actually hurt, even if you add a lot) which complemented the sweetness of the salmon well!

𝗧𝗼𝗻𝗸𝗮𝘁𝘀𝘂 ($𝟮𝟬)
The tonkatsu was kyushu white pork loin and was fried a little dark, but the tongkatsu sauce was very pleasant and we enjoyed the sour notes in it.

The ambience at Toriyard was nice, and suitable for dates and family gatherings before/after a stroll in bishan-amk park. Decorated with lights, the restaurant looked really pretty when the sun went down. Like what many others have shared, the price point of the food here is definitely on the higher side. However, the food tastes authentic and there’re other items on the menu we would like to try, so we would be back with our wallets ready the next time!!

P.S. the outdoor area of Toriyard is also pet friendly!! So you can def grab an oishi dinner after walking your furry friend at the park.

Follow us on IG @toofoodtomiss for more foodie content!

We hosted our son’s birthday here as it was in the theme of a Japanese anime. The service Kevin (restaurant director) and his crew provided meticulous attention to our needs and the setup of the place was brilliant. Kevin saw that we were trying to stick a banner on the glass and he immediately ask his staff to clean the glass panel for us so that there will be no dust marks during photo taking. He and his crew are extra attentive to our elderly guests which makes its welcoming. Experiences like that should not be taken for granted, they really put in effort to help us create an amazing memory. I will definitely come back for regular meals and perhaps the next event. Thank you Toriyard (especially Kevin)

The food was fine. Prices are on a high side, but since there was only a limited selection at the park, we decided to have dinner here. Nothing special and paid $150+/- for 4 pax.

Nice restaurant situated within a nice park. A rustic yet classy ambience will suit any occasion, be it for a business lunch, romantic outing or just to meet up with friends. Food was authentic Japanese and of good quality.
Japanese food near my location.address: Bishan-Ang Mo Kio Park, 1380 Ang Mo Kio Ave 1, 569930
Japanese food near my location.name: ToriYard

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
Collagen soup is recommended. The taste is rich and essence of chicken is well-infused into the broth. Vegetables are fresh and sweet. I feel that for $19, the collagen soup can do better with at least some ingredients in it. Condiments, the leek oil is flavourful. Nanbe chicken could do better with better frying of the batter. The dish tasted a little under fried and batter was soft.

Staff used to be and could be more attentive. The broth was boiling away and they only adjusted the induction cooker upon request, twice. No one came to skim the floating fats off the soup or offer a sampling of it, which they used to do so. Also, there wasn’t any personal touch to make you feel welcome whatsoever. It was a you say I do approach.

Yummy food! Recommend the tomato collagen soup, steamed chicken, vegetable platter, and spicy nanban chicken. Also love the condiments!

They provided us with complimentary jellies as well!

Visited at about 730pm on a Friday night and shop was almost full, do come earlier! Tried both Original and Spicy, recommend to just get the Original! Spicy not as good.

We thought we ordered quite alot for 2 pax but it was actually just nice portion size. Meat was really good quality though was slightly expensive but totally worth it. $15 for US Beef (4 large pieces) and $12 for Chestnut Pork (7 slices). Theres a weekly promotion going on for different cut of meats too and no restrictions to the plates ordered too, do checkout their insta. Must also order their Fish Cakes!!! Omg I thought its just fish cake but noooo the texture and taste really different and yummy!!!

Vegetable and mushroom sets was quite well varied and very fresh & clean. Thin Tsuru Tsuru Noodles was meh… The sauces was surprisingly very unique and delish too, really liked the green paste (yuzu flavour) and spring onion with sesame oil dip.

At the end of the meal theres also jelly/agaragar served. Fantastic service too! Will be back again for the meats & fish cake!

Service was great and collagen soup was so thick and belly warming for a cold rainy day. The price however, is almost on par with HDL. No insane queues like HDL though!

Love the collagen soup. At Tsukada Nojo, the vegetables are always farm fresh. The best part is the Australian beef. It has a strong beef flavour (which isn’t for everyone). Best when undercooked in the broth (which I wouldn’t recommend for everyone too). Just love the hotpot here.
Japanese food near my location.address: 301 Upper Thomson Rd, #03-50 Thomson Plaza, Singapore 574408
Japanese food near my location.name: Tsukada Nojo - Thomson Plaza

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
Our first time here. Service was fast and professional. Wait time was pretty short, thanks to the service effectiveness despite the super high traffic on a Saturday night of Black Friday period. The food was so so good. Will come back when we come to Orchard malls.

Staff - responsive, attentive and polite.
Food - good. All good. Nothing to complain.
Premise - maybe they are always busy for lunch but the twin seats are rather tight between each other.

Portion of the food was OK I guess 🙂

Overall, happy tummies post meal.

Food is generous and Tasty! My Favourite sushi place for sashimi. Although 3 slices but each slice are thick and fill my mouth. Great Service and ambience. Hidden at the corner in the mall at level 5. Highly recommended!

This restaurant serves a variety of decent Japanese dishes at a reasonable price.  From fresh sashimi to sushi, tempura to soba, you've got something for everyone.

They have good service and the quality of the food is above average.  It's a place we visit often when we are undecided for food choice in Taka.

If you don't mind a short queue at peak hours, this is a good place to try.

One of the better Japanese restaurants in town. Sashimi is always fresh and cut thickly, making the Kaisen Chirashi don an attractive and filling option. Squid is also grilled to perfection, leaving a slightly chewy yet palatable aftertaste when eaten with the teriyaki sauce. Salmon aburi soft shell crab roll is tasty, crunchy, and with a slight hint of savoury.

Japanese food near my location.address: 391A Orchard Rd, #05-34/35 Ngee Ann City, Singapore 238874
Japanese food near my location.name: The Sushi Bar

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
An extraordinary Japanese restaurant close to our hearts. The seafood is impeccably fresh, and you absolutely must indulge in their grilled hamachi and succulent oysters.

Delicious Japanese food. Ordered a set of sashimi, bento, and a beef yuzu sauteed.

Sashimi was fresh, and almost all cuts of meat tasted rich and creamy. The swordfish was the standout fish.

The Natsu bento set came with a variety of side dishes. Tha beef yakiniku was well seasoned and well cooked, and the garlic fried rice was fragrant and not too salty.

The beef yuzu sauteed is an interesting dish to try, being served with a yuzu sorbet at the side. The beef was nicely cooked, and eaten with the yuzu sorbet creates an interesting flavour and sensation, fusing sweet, sour, and savoury, and balancing warm and cold.

Definitely coming back again for the dishes.

We had the Omakase set for 108 sgd per person -indeed very interesting,we loved especially the scallops ;too pricey though

The food is delicious and well cooked. Ordered the set as it is valued for money.

Both of the sets that i ordered had chawanmushi and it is so smooth and soft that it melt in the mouth.

The sashimi are thick and fresh.

The clam congee is pretty good and first time trying it.

Service wise is good! The staff pay lots of attention to details like placement of plate in the tray, clearing of stuff promptly and serving of desserts (fruit) without me asking for it.

The restaurant provides a good range of options. it has omakase, bento sets, sushi set, Nara House special dinner, ala carte (sushi, Don,soup, porridge🍲 teppanyaki.

We tried the following over 2 visits and our rating for each.

1. Karage 👍👍👍👍($10)

2. Salmon Sashimi 👍👍👍($18)

3. Cold tempura soba👍👍(2 prawns with bukweed soba, comes with a raw quail egg🥚($18)

4. Yakitori 👍👍👍($6; 2 sticks)

5. Grilled beef steak with salt 😔😔(disappointed. definitely not grilled over charcoal and taste more like pan-fried.its not worth the $28)

6.Gyoza 👍👍(ok. but not enough meat fillings) ($12)

7.Grilled Mackerel with salt 👍👍👍($13)

8. Grilled fried beancurd ($8)😳👍👍

9. Asahi by bottle ($10) 👍👍cold enough🥶

Overall, Good!.
Japanese food near my location.name: Nara

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
We walked in so we didn’t have a proper table. Honestly the ‘reserved’ table were empty and would be great if we could moved over. However the service staffed said that it was fully booked..?

Food was not bad, we tried truffle beef Foie Gras don, sushi rolls, fried chicken and sashimi platter.

Sashimi platter was really fresh, all in good is a 8/10 but make sure you make a booking. We sat at the counter and it wasn’t the best spot.

The oyster is a must have here. They are v fresh. I’m not a oyster eater. But this place really make me ate 3 in one go.

Wagyu beef is on the tough side.
Pork bowl however is good. Nice and tender. The egg is cooked perfectly.

Went there for Birthday celebrations and they gifted me a pretty good wine. Happy to bring my friends again for celebration. Yes they do check the ic for verification which is good for people who take advantage of the promotion.

The food is really good, fresh oyster ($3 each), good  foie gras ($12) , good salmon ($7 happy hour for 5 pieces) , happy hour beers ($11) , really worth the try for happy hour. Spacious seating both indoor and outdoor. Food is 5. Atmosphere is 5. Service is 3 cause the staffs are pretty inattentive and they are unsure of the dish recommendations and not service crew inside not really friendly or welcoming but the front service are friendly attentive and they welcome us and showed us to the table, after that it was pretty much we had to request for assistance. Overall 5 for the food the pricing the atmosphere, good place for couple and friends.

Tanuki Raw is the first place we think of when we want a good beef bowl. My favorite is their Foie Gras Truffle Yakiniku. The beef are always tender and succulent. The rice are richly seasoned with truffle, sesame and a perfectly cooked onsen egg. Not forgetting a glorious piece of foie gras as the main highlight of the meal! A perfect beef bowl I would say.

Staff are always attentive and before you could reach out, they are there to help you with little things like an extra plate for your food, extra napkins or water.

Love the cozy space restaurant space with nice modern music. A great place for dining alone, with family or friends.

The oysters during happy hours were great! Fresh and a little briny but the adductor muscle wasn't cut so needed to scrape a bit with the oyster fork. Salmon don was not bad but I preferred the vinegar rice rather than the seasoned mixed rice. Overall price and service was alright. Would recommend during happy hours.
Japanese food near my location.opening_hours:

Japanese food near my location.name: Tanuki Raw @ Orchard Central

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
I enjoyed the Nikujaga&Chirashi Don set very much, which is the special menu for today. (@28++)
The Nikujaga is great: the beef is stewed perfectly, super tender and with great umami; the potato is also well softened and the whole dish is without any unpleasant odour. The chirashi don uses good quality sashimi and wasabi atop of the Japanese rice. The Aburi Salmon Oroshiponzu is with promo for autumn and the texture and freshness of the salmon is good. For the rest of the set such as miso soup and salad, they are well cooked. Overall, the taste is good and the Nikujaga hit my taste bud and elevates the whole level to great.
The service is good here thought waiting time a bit long. The facility a bit old but the atmosphere is great: many people enjoy their cosy chat with a cup of free of charge but free-flow tea in this
Japan style restaurant.

We queue here for about 15 mins. After ordering, didn't have to wait that long for the food. Service was prompt and efficient. Maguro sashimi was cut a bit thin. So the satisfaction was not really there. The chirashi don has generous fillings of sashimi. The tonkatsu tuna steak with cheese was quite salty and heavy. I would not want to order this dish ever again. Tempura was done well.

A few other outlets to this brand,and i feel that standards differ greatly,especially between this and their East Coast Outlet.

Have eaten here at their novena outlet twice and both times we have come away very satisfied with their food as well as their exceptional service from their very friendly and attentive  ground staff, to their Japanese head chef who goes around from table to table ensuring that everything is going well for the diners. They even made sure to reserve a Kanpachi Shio fishhead for me when i called to enquire its availability,just in case it ran out before we arrived.
Hallmarks of a great sushi joint.

Their Kanpachi Kabuto Shioyaki (Greater Amberjack Grilled Salted Fish head), was superbly executed. Flesh was firm and flaky,and very fresh to the bite and mouthfeel. Hit the spot totally.

The Grilled Salmon Belly was super as well,3 pieces of perfectly grilled belly oozing with juices in its tender meat. Skin was crispy and crackling to the bite,perfect contrast.

Of all the fish dishes ordered, the Shima Hokke (Grilled Atka Mackeral) looked good,but tasted pretty mediocre in the end. Think maybe its because its a pre-ordered and flash-frozen pre-marinated fish.

Deep fried soft shell crab was good,but a bit on the saltier side. The California Maki Roll that we ordered as an afterthought though,was remarkable,hitting all the right spots in every way. Rice was soft and warm,ingredients were fresh and well-paired,and it didnt break apart most importantly,when we dipped it in soya sauce.

All in,kudos to this team at Novena,you guys have got it down pat. Well done!👏👏

Food: 8.5/10
Ambience: 9/10 (tables well spaced out,comfortable dining)
Service: 9/10
Value For Money: 7.5/10
My Rating: 8.5/10

I used to visit them regularly when I was working near Millenia Walk. Have been to this outlet less than 10 times.

Good quality sushi at reasonable pricing. Standard of food has been consistent over the years.

We always enjoy their sets which offer amazing price-quality ratio for Singapore. Atmosphere is traditional Japanese but cosy. It can be very busy at times.
Japanese food near my location.name: Tomi Sushi

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
My husband and I went for early lunch on a Thursday. We did not make any reservation and were glad we had counter seats. We ordered the 12 sticks course and added a garlic rice. It was good. Watching the skewers being grilled over the charcoal reminded me of the yakitori restaurants in Japan!

I wanted to take pic of the menu but was told by a server that it was not allowed. Other area of service was good and hence the 4-stars for service.

Always ended up ordering quite a bit whenever we patronise Nanbantei 🙈
Food quality's consistent and ingredients used were fresh.
Skewers were yummy! I'm a fan of their Grilled Eggplant with Shiso 🤤

Prices have gone up a far bit though 😮‍💨

We went to this restaurant for late lunch, arrive around 2 pm, we were reminded that the last order is 2:30 pm.
We ordered kurobuta don sets. The charcoal grilled pork is super good. The is my second visit, ordering the same food.
However, I dun feel welcomed because they were rushing to close shop around 2:15 pm, before the last order.
I will be back for the good food, but I hope they can be more friendly and offer better services.

Feels like an intimate and authentic Japanese joint. There were a couple of tables of Japanese people. Staff were friendly and yakitori were juicy. Liked the asparagus bacon and tomato bacon yakitoris. The garlic fried rice was really fragrant too.

A wonderful yakitori place located within the Far East Plaza, where each menu comes with 2 sticks (most of them). My favorites have got to be the Asparagus Maki (asparagus wrapped with pork), and the pork meatballs. All of the meat served were super juicy and salted to perfection. Definitely come back for more.
Japanese food near my location.name: Nanbantei Japanese Restaurant (Far East Plaza)

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
As a few had mentioned, thick fresh cuts of sashimi. Enjoyed the salmon belly cut. The rainbow row sushi was also another highlight. Best washed down with their ice cold beer. Sirloin steak came with very nice sauces and crispy garlic chips. Yum!

Walked in for Saturday lunch. Glad that physical menu is provided as not all items featured in the online website had pictures.
Chawanmushi 5/5
Seafood tofu 5/5
Tamago sushi 3/5
Ebi fry roll 4/5
Enoki bacon 4/5
Tori momo teriyaki 4/5
California roll 4/5
0verall for a first time visit, food was surprisingly tasty. Quite expensive meal for two pax but definitely worth a try.

Excellent quality food. Staff are friendly. $5 happy hour deal. Portion for the happy hour sake is small but it is $5 so can’t complain. Sake was yummy so they don’t scrimp on quality.

Food 5/5
Service 5/5
Ambiance 4/5

Good portions and great sushi. Get the Pitan Tofu! Lighting in the place could be better, it’s a bit dim. Nice and quiet place. A great place to check out if you’re craving sushi in Orchard 🍣

The atmosphere of the place feels empty, not very decorated and doesn't felt like a Japanese restaurant. Service is normal as sometimes we still need to try to get their attention even though the restaurant only had two tables dining, probably they were closing soon and tired after a long day at work. Not every dish was nice for me though.

Their sashimi and sushi is really fresh and delicious. Their sashimi is thickly sliced into three pieces, however I would have preferred that they half the thick slice further more. Chawanmushi
and soft shell crabs was great! The grilled fish is really worth it for the promotion price they were giving as it was quite a big portion and well seasoned. Tako wasabi and grilled ray fin wasn't to my liking as I've tasted better. The mentaiko spaghetti was too watery and sauce was too overpowering, although I do know Japanese pasta is a little soupy, however it was just too much for this dish. The inaniwa udon was the greatest disappointment for me as I felt their soba sauce wasn't tasty or salty enough to pair with the udon.

Overall, the sashimi and sushi have good standards and would recommend.

Japanese food near my location.name: The Sushi Bar

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
Very delicious Japanese food with reasonable price and good service by staff. Excellent! Will go back when in Singapore.

Not the fanciest place around, but a nice place to get some affordable Japanese food and a beer with friends. Good environment with air conditioning

Ordered their 30pc sashimi promo on Grabfood and the pieces were cut very thin 😅. Please don’t offer the promo if you’re unable to provide it in normal thickness.

This shop is a restaurant, but the interior look like a bar and a bit like food court. The menu have lots of different foods, they also have some zhi char and BBQ dishes. Have to mention the hand roll it is good and reasonable price. All the foods taste good. Alcohol ranges are wide ranging from beer, wine, sake, soju etc.

Salmon sushi served warm, no go la, its not kopi! Wake up your idea before sfa knock on your door.
Lucky didnt cause me to have food poisoning. Don was alright but dont order the salmon sushi. Plus waitress very reluctant to take order despite the qr ordering system not being able to order the japanese food.

Wont visit again

Japanese food near my location.name: Kazoku Japanese Cuisine

Japanese food near my location.reviews:
A sensory delight from start to end. From the amazing interior and atmosphere, to the masterful and graceful slices by the chef, to the beautiful sight and taste of the ingredients.

Celebrated my anniversary with my wife here and it was absolutely pleasant. Staff were attentive, and the chef is engaging as well, explaining each course and occasionally cracking some jokes with the diners.

Each course was a masterpiece of their own, and makes one anticipate the next along the culinary journey.

At the end of meal, chef Kimura presented a surprise gift and a polaroid picture of my wife and I as a memory of this wonderful experience.

Awesome time dinning here. Chef Kimura is friendly and constantly engaging us throughout the whole meal. He share about the ingredients passionately and the service crew was equally up to the standards of this place. Every dish was delicious.

Comfortable space. Went for lunch and was presented with familiar but high quality ingredients. The Nigiri rice here is still perhaps on of the best you will get in SG, each and every Nigiri is served with the same warm temperature of rice which shows their attention to details. Staff are attentive and the chef himself was super friendly.

It's a superb 1 Michelin star restaurant. Enjoyable, especially for a celebration like a birthday or an anniversary.

Chef is friendly and nice, service crew is superb, the food is extremely fresh, and the sakes are uniquely curated. The story is resounding as well, with chef flying ingredients back from his own hometowns, representing them here in Singapore.

That said, I'm not sure if half a grand for the experience, is something I feel easily comfortable with parting, for the price point of the ingredients (vs some other omakase spots in Singapore).

Recommended by our fav omakase chef in Thailand. Got similar vibe and taste compare to Sushi Masato (also one michelin star). Food was great but service was not on point.

Japanese food near my location.name: Sushi Kimura

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
A hidden Thai outlet in industrial estate with strong support from the nearby workforce. Food is authentic n lunch value set can be considered. Delicious 😋

Very decent Thai food for its price. Used to be cheaper and came here a lot when studying at a school nearby. Prices went up since 2017 but the food is excellent. The Thai Beef green curry is a must get, so is the basil sauce fish fillet. It is closed from 3-6pm so take note. Recently they seem to start taking reservations, so if you have a big group might want to call earlier to get seats. The Thai milk tea and lemon grass drinks are very nice!

Comfort meal with decent Thai food.
We’ve dined at this outlet several times, good quality food is served here. If you enjoy milky curry, do give their green curry a try, tastier when soaked in the pineapple rice. Their appetizers are all good too, prawn cake is our favourite. Yummy Thai iced tea and green milk tea, sadly the mango sticky rice is always sold out. Take note that Jai Thai doesn’t serve Thai pork dishes.

Decent Thai food with reasonable price. I personally love their fried “Kang Kong” and clear tomyam soup. Will try out other Thai dishes, green beef curry, pandan chicken, etc in the future…

Been eating here for many years, maybe my own taste buds have changed as well but the food doesn't seem as good. A bit too sweet like every other generic thai food chain.

Other than that the prices have gone up and portions have gone down, but that can be said for most places since COVID so it's understandable
Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Jai Thai Restaurant

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
All the food was great and in good portions! Seafood pad Thai definitely worth it and not too salty or oily. Mango sticky rice was great as well - not overly sweet and just the right size for sharing at the end of the meal.

Would return to try more dishes!

Nice thai food of good quality.

1. Welcoming appetisers for the platter
2. Thai coconut seafood soup is the best dish from our order
3. The quality of the fish fillet needs some improvement

Service: Good!

Ordered too much and no space for dessert.

Overall can be spicier hence we requested for the kitchen to up the spice level.

Knew we fell into a tourist trap the minute we stepped inside.... Food looked really pleasing from the reviews here, but you're really paying for plating and not authentic thai food. The prices were unreasonably high for thai food in Singapore, too, so no wonder we're the only locals here.  🤣

1. Locals are lined up next door while we stupidly paid tourist/ western prices. Didn't do a good job separating white people's reviews from the noise.

2. The signature Otah at $3++ a scoop was not satisfying. I thought there'd be a special way of cooking with the clay covers, but these was deco. Fish was tough and Otah didn't have 1 ounce of coconut / banana leaf flavour. Basically fish balls with somewhat coconuty paste

3. Fried rice had no wok hei and was deconstructed for no good reason - your chilli padi and onions and whatever that yellow thing was, was raw. Maybe for people to adjust to their preferred spicy levels.

4. Tomyum was recommended by the waitress as their signature but was sour and fishy as heck. Like what is this....

5. Place looks dated and nothing like the pictures from 6 years ago

6. Ok but to be fair, one dish was good and  somewhat unique: Crab Meat Curry. This I will recommend if you want to eat here.

Everything seen here + 4 beers amounted to $160. Could have gone next door or any other thai restaurant for maybe 40-50% less. Note to self: sift carefully for local reviews next time. Take the "worthy of a Michelin star" review with a dollop of salt.

Interior is kept clean and very presentable. Definitely more towards a fine dining type of venue.

Portions were rather small for the price, for what can be considered common dishes.

The food was made to be on the milder side, which is less than authentic. The stir fry and texture of the noodles were pretty well done though.

Absolutely a welcoming place and a must try Thai restaurant in Singapore. They have a great choice of vegetarian options and its absolutely vegetarian! The flavour, taste, service was very good and would recommend this place!
Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Sawadee Thai Cuisine

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Enjoy my dinner with my family in this new outlet. Portions are generous and the flavour is fantastic. My favourite is the Thai iced chendol and please add $1 for the red ruby as it’s very delicious.
Definitely will come back again. 👍❤️

New location is bright n clean. We arrived minutes b4 11. Friendly wait staff ushered us in. However, food took long to b served. Assorted veg platter comes with 2 fishes. Don't think this is indicated in d menu. Won't b nice if vegetarians order this dish. d sambal dip for d steamed veg is good. Disappointed that only red chilli padi is served. Where's d green ones??

Will return again for d reasonably-priced food.

Pad Thai was good. Tom Yum Soup was good. Pineapple Fried Rice was bland and unimpressive. Pandan Leaf Chicken was big but over-fried and dry. Rosella drink was pleasant.

*Update: Very thirsty after the meal. Restaurant uses a high amount of MSG, most likely in the soup. I wouldn’t revisit.

Didn’t have to wait long for the table or food, service was pretty okay. Food was good but not the best Thai food I’ve had in Singapore. Pineapple fried rice is very good and has a nice wokhei! Their snack corner has pretty tasty snacks, try the fried chicken skin!

Food was horrendous, sarcastically a feast for your palette. Been to their Golden Mile outlet and food was decent. Re crowd, there was no one on a Saturday afternoon. Mall parking - was tough to find a lot, perhaps due to the F1 weekend.

• Tom yum soup - salty, numbing for all senses
• Basil beef - dry and tasteless
• Prawn omelette - minimal chopped up / small prawns in the middle which almost couldn’t be found, super oily
• Kailan roast pork - oily, bad consistency, pork was soggy and pieces were too huge, vege was black (which I ate most of anyway hence you can’t see in the images)

Total damage $57

Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Diandin Leluk Thai Restaurant Pte Ltd

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
This restaurant, nestled away on an upper floor of Tanglin Mall, is a great place to come when you want high-quality Thai food. It’s not inexpensive but the quality of the food and service are great, the atmosphere is relaxed and spacious, and they do have a range of set menu options, as well, if that’s what you want. We’ve never had a bad meal here. I think it’s also a good place to bring guests. If you want Thai street food or mass market, there are other places for that, but for more of a fine dining experience, this is a great choice.

Overall the menu looks Pricy. So ordering set meal . Overall taste are not authentic Thai.  Salad taste unique but made mostly from a fruit . The Tom Yum is very salty , the small prawns are not original prawn (懷疑泡過硼砂）.  The beef taste more like Indian style rather than Thai style .

The plus point is the service .

To conclude :  it’s a good place with good ambience and decorations. However if you are looking for authentic Thai food you need to look else where .

“Fine dining price without the fine dining experience!”

Look somewhere else if you’re looking for Thai fine dining. This place is cosy and impressive at first sight, until you have to interrupt your guests by leaving your seat to call the waitresses over. Yes, service is almost non-existent as I had to leave my seat on several occasions just to get a waiter. Not to say too, the food was not impressive. We looked at each other and agreed in unison that we had all experienced better ones in town.

A regretful visit. To sum it up in a sentence, “Fine dining price without the fine dining experience.”

Thai food flavours that come across as being refined, without being excessively salty or laden with MSG, as would be the case if one is used to typical Thai food budget options that are abound everywhere in local estates. We enjoyed some of the dishes, which stood out uniquely - the stir-fried crispy pork with homemade curry paste and long beans, and the fried prawns in filo pastry with avocado mousse. The Iced Thai Milk Tea is robust in its tea flavour, with the sugar syrup on the side. Ambience is a warm amber feel, while service is attentive. Price wise, well, it's not called "fine cuisine" for nothing, definitely not a price range one commonly associates with usual Thai joints. Our a la carte orders for a family of 5 came up to $315. The restaurant does run buffet options at $50 per person on certain days of the week, and they also have a range of set menu options.

came here for dinner during weekdays.  requested for window seats.

good decor, ambience and spacing.  surprisingly the service has wow-factor, i felt like i was in Thailand!👍

very comfortable and all the ordered food was good.  the fish and its dressing, however, were a bit bland for my liking.
Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Patara Fine Thai Cuisine (Rebranded to SARAI)

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Quite authentic Thai food, and decent service. Hard to get to unless you drive but parking is free! Their Thai milk tea is really sweet and flavourful, and did I mention it's really sweet?

The Baked Honey Pork Ribs is decent, though it does seem like they only season it last minute. They did cook it until the meat inside was soft but the flavour of the honey is only on the outside, and the inside of the meat doesn't have the same flavour.

Service is good though, and ambience is good. Quiet lunch with maybe 3 other tables with patrons.

Surprise! A dinner date with my husband who chanced upon this place and decided to bring me here.

The place was dim, though, with hanging light bulbs that made it cosy. However, the surrounding area gave me a sensing that this place is abandoned with lots of empty flower pots and other decoration pieces lying around. The sight just makes me feel creepy, especially at night. Of course I am not sure if it's the design/theme of the restaurant.

When I flipped through the menu, the condition of it gives customers a not so pleasant impression. The menu was old, pages were crumbled or wrinkled. The least can be done is to reprint the pages of the menu. Prices for the dishes were little on the high side but that is because I think of the fine cuisine that we are going to have. True enough, I was right!

For 2 pax, we ordered:
1. Thai Fried Rice with Prawns(4 pcs)
- was tad oily
- not much of fragrance
- portion was big that could feed 3 to 4(small eaters)
- accompanied sides were salad, 2 slices of cucumber and a slice of tomato

2. Tom Yum Clear Soup with Seafood
- came in a pot that has a burner underneath
- taste was sour and spicy
- could feed 3 pax

3. Honey Chicken
- Chicken seemed to be fried but not overly done. Still could taste the tenderness of the chicken.
- could feed 2-3 pax
- nothing fantastic, quite ordinary

4. Stir fried dou miaow with garlic
- vegetables maintained its crunch but could blanch it slightly more as it has that rawness of the vegetables taste
- could feed 3 pax

5. Mango drink
- refreshingly good

6. Mango sticky rice
- to go for no matter how full you are
- rice was done up nicely and mangoes were riped and had a good combination of 80% sweetness and 20% sourness
- mangoes blended well with the rice and not forgetting the coconut milk when drizzled onto the rice just enhances its taste. Yummy!!!

We visited this restaurant for lunch after a round of golf at the Champions. One of us is a Thai native and she commented that the food here is really authentic Thai. The only few places you can find real good Thai food, other than Golden Mile, is this place. We had Thai green curry, Thai basil pork, pineapple fried rice with prawns (even though this is not really Thai but it's really delicious), and stuffed chicken wings. The outdoor seating is really rustic and pleasant, albeit a few smokers around us. Service can be improved as there is only one lady serving the entire area.

Recommend by my friend. Went to the other side for cafe. Never know that there is another well-hidden for Thai food. It is so right inside the area, so conceal into the greenery.

Ordered more than 5 dishes including the desserts. The tom yum soup was so yummy. So was the fish cake.

Nice rustic place right next to a course course range. Food was good but what I love most was the environment - something you don't get alot from urbanised Singapore. Sadly I understand that they will be closing on 17 Dec 2023.

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
This Thai restaurant located in Holiday Inn Little India.
Great ambiance and service. Food didn’t taste so strong like the authentic one but it’s good for someone who is new to Thai cuisine or can’t bare the strong smell of the fish sauce.
Mango sticky rice was not really good, coconut milk was bland, mango was too ripped and the sticky rice was dry at the outside.

The Thai food here was amazing and exceeded my expectations. Some of the must order would be the stir fried beef and lemongrass sea bass. Both sauces were so appetizing and addictive and both the meats were very thick and tender.

The mango sticky rice is also recommended as you'll get a whole mango that's sweet and juicy, accompanied by three beautiful pieces of blue pea glutinous rice. Kudos to the servers as well as they were efficient in refilling the free water and making sure we're well taken care of.

Had an appetizing lunch at this outlet. Staff were warm and friendly and did a great job with the food recommendations. Finished off with a nice dessert and hot Thai tea. The lemongrass drink is not very aromatic and hope to see more items on the menu. IHG members can get 20% discount off the price. Bento sets take away are available to order online.

Friendly and welcoming, like the laid back atmosphere. Menu is rather limited for Thai dishes. Pad thai, tom yum soups, mango and papaya salads were well done. Rest of the dishes were average. Rather pricey, and for quite a number of dishes to add on meats will have an increase in price. Enter via hotel lobby lift to reach the 5th floor.

Ambience itself enough to get really relaxing time here with nice view of their roof top garden and pool.  variety of Thai Indian and western dishes available. Had western and Thai. Really good. Staffs are also friendly and quality of service really appreciated.

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
We had a lunch treat at A-Roy Thai Restaurant at Novena Square.
There were 9 of us, we may have over ordered as there were leftovers.
I must say that the Thai food here is really delicious and authentic.
Special mention of the fish (cooked in lime sauce) - very fresh and well cooked.
As it was a treat, I don’t know the actual bill amount paid.
Definitely will come back - suggest in a group of 6 or more so you can order a variety of dishes. Tip: share the rice so you can enjoy the dishes

Located at a convenient place at Level 3 at Novena Square. A very decorated big place. Staff are helpful and friendly. Vegetarian dishes are available. Fried chicken omelette, tom yam (spicy) soup are awesome. Enjoyed the lunch meal and portions with the four of us. The price may be slightly pricer but the food is really tasty. If you feel like eating good Thai food, this is recommended.

Quite a busy Thur evening dinner crowd! Definitely a favourite w regular customers who like authentic Thai food. Food was served fast and hot and tasty. Pad- Thai was fried perfect and the stuffed Chicken Wings always a favourite. Good portions and lots to choose from the menu. Including the mango sticky rice dessert. Enjoy!

Mum’s friend recommended this restaurant for dinner and we went back to this restaurant twice within the week. The food was amazing. Great and friendly staff! Highly recommended and great to go with family or group of friends. Authentic Thai food!

This place is very clean and the servers sterilise the tables and chairs thoroughly. Authenticity is legit from the quality of food and you can see many Thai diners as well. Tom yum soup has a kick and is not for non-spicy eaters. Hope to try the curries in future.
Thai cuisine in Singapore.address: 238 Thomson Road #03-61/64 Novena Square (Velocity 邮政编码: 307683
Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: A-Roy Thai Restaurant

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
The food there is scrumptious and the service is excellent 👍🤩☺️. The owner is also very nice and gregarious!😊 What a gem in queenstown area! Don’t miss it if you stop by QT!

I spent SGD$103.35 including Lalamove delivery charges for lunch from Joe's Kitchen. At 11.30AM, an old lady called to inform me that the item advertised on their web page on Oddle Eats was discontinued and they did not update their web page/store.  She then told me she would substitute with Thai fish cakes, giving me no choice. Delivery was scheduled to be 12 to12:30Noon. DELIVERY ONLY ARRIVED AT 1.30PM. I called the restaurant to check about my order which had failed to arrive on time. The staff told me I should call Oddle Eats. SHe said she does not know anything!  I later checked their Glass Door Reviews - not good working environment!

So I had to contact Oddle Eats searching for my order and was told Lalamove delivery was on the way. So from 11:30AM to 1:30PM, I was waiting for my order and super hungry. The food from Joe's Kitchen is BLAH. Brocolli was over-cooked, vermicelli with prawns came with NO PRAWNS (paid $23.40) and the Phad Thai was a clump. The deep fried crispy fish was not fresh and not crispy. The fish flesh was soft like porridge. The Thai fish cakes horribly salty.

Delivery  by Lalamove = SUPER LATE
Staff from Joe's Kitchen = HORRIBLE and CLUELESS; NOT CUSTOMER ORIENTATED
Quality of food from Joe's Kitchen =  Salty, overcooked, terrible and not fresh

DEFINITELY NOT RECOMMENDED. Will never order again from Joe's Kitchen.

I ordered a Thai red ruby to go. Found HUGE lumps of redness and one even had a hair in it. This is terrible. They use teeny pieces of chestnut filled with a whole ball of starch. Super unauthentic and unethical.

Food came out slow. Tomyum soup and basil pork and kailan were not up to standard but I would say the pandan chicken, prawn cake and fishmaw soup with crab meat was good. Fried rice was not oily, healthier.

We're back after 6 years to try the food here! We came in a group 4 adults for lunch on a rainy Sunday. Quite empty.

We tried:
1. Mango salad
2. Clear tomyum seafood soup
3. Beef green curry
4. Pad thai
5. Honey chicken
6. Garlic pork
7. Mango sticky rice
8. Red ruby

Out of all the dishes we ordered, the pad thai was most disappointing as they fried it with tomato sauce. 🥲

The rest of the dishes are 100%!! Loved them! 😍

Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Joe’s Thai Kitchen

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
This is a very reasonably priced Thai hidden gem. We ordered the drunken noodles as we saw that it was highly raved, and be warned that it is flavourful but very very spicy, even for someone like me who can usually take spicy food (so pls ask for less spicy if you can’t take spicy food). The pork basil rice was a steal at $6.90. Chicken wings were juicy, and the steamed tapioca was delicious! Overall the quality of the food is good for the price point. Worth a visit!

Thai Kha is by far the best Thai restaurant in Singapore! Consistent quality & taste of food and great service will convince you to return. Having ordered in the first time during the pandemic, this is my go to place when it comes to Thai cuisine. Order online or visit their restaurant, a beautiful and well maintained space. 😊🫶🏻

Went for dinner on a weekday, very quiet. Ordered through QR and food cooked fresh, but contrary to great reviews, our food was so so. Truly not bad. Drunken noodles was still a bit wet, but tasty enough but lacking oomph. Boat noodles not bad. Egg not crispy enough but tasty. Portion quite large. Spent 37.20 sgd for these 3. A viable option if around the area. Vegetarian options available for most dishes.

Casual place with good food. Tried the drunken noodle, prawns, fried rice and morning glory - liked the spicy kick but prawns were ok. Good food with reasonable price - would come back for casual lunch if nearby!

Visited Thai Kha at Havelock 2 (#01-01/48) for lunch recently!

Food:

- Had the Pork Krapow ($7.90 before tax, asked for less spicy) as my main dish. I personally thought that the pork was soft, tender and well-seasoned. Overall, the dish was well-balanced and tasty, although I wish that the egg was runny - it was cooked through.

- I also had some Chicken Wings ($8.90) to share. Felt that they were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. My only gripe with this was that they could have been bigger.

Service/Atmosphere:
- There were 6 of us who went for lunch together, and we all ordered Krapow with varying levels of spiciness and/or additional meat.

There was some miscommunication on the part of the service staff and they mixed up some of our orders. However, I don't deem this to be a serious shortcoming on the part of the staff - my only wish is that they would be better prepared for future orders!

- The restaurant wasn't crowded during lunchtime and is a good value for money option if you're willing to travel to Havelock 2 mall. Seems like a hidden gem to me, if I'm honest.

I will be back again. Very impressed with the quality of the food here.

Kudos to @cravings_satisfied_jay as well for suggesting this place!

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Food was super flavourful and probably one of the nicer Thai fish cakes I’ve had in Singapore! It’s well spiced and not too dense.

Only comment was that the place is not exactly really well ventilated - given that it’s located at the basement of far east. Otherwise, love the food!

Ordering is super simple as well as it’s all done through the app. Staff was also nice enough to explain through the process.

Went with my colleagues to this place and it was surprisingly good. But on a side note, slightly more ex for the portion of the minced pork. Would suggest ordering mince pork w rice if you are looking to get that. Their drunkard noodle dish is sooo delicious tho!

Authentic stall food! I will be back.

You need to write your order down on the paper on your table then proceed to counter to order. Cash and NETS only.

We also order the steam seabass and crackling pork. Both were not bad, the seabass was very big. I ordered the thai green milk tea which wa not very sweet.

The shop do get busy and kind of noisy when there is a huge crowd. The food is nice overall and I will come here for Thai food when I’m in town.

The Thai food here surprisingly nice and delicious. And the portions were big.
Love the pork meat, super soft and it melted when put into mouth.

It is one of our favourite places to eat. A highly recommended place for authentic Thai food. A place where we'll bring friends and they have many non spicy dishes suitable for children too. Service may be lacking during peak hours so go earlier during meal times or  be prepared to wait a bit.

Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Kra pow Thai Restaurant

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Had a wonderful dinner with my family yesterday. They serve yummy delicious Thai food with affordable pricing. Overall the dining experience is a good one.the fish is the highlight of the dinner. Savoury !

Food is delicious,  but quite small helpings. The outlet is convenient with parking available. Quite crowded but food served fast, just that they ran out of utensils. Tom yum is good, pineapple fried rice is delicious. Fried drumstick with garlic is dry.

I chanced upon it in Google and am sure glad I tried the food. It didn’t feel like being in Singapore when dining in. The food was good and affordable. For 4 of us with 7 items and 1 dessert, it was $74. No GST. Food was promptly served although service was not as prompt as staff were usually busy. The homemade prawn cake was delectable and tasted fresh. Red ruby was pleasant after meal and costs $3. Having patronised this place, the other Thai chain stores located in HDB neighbourhood now appear mediocre and overpriced. We love dining here and will surely be back again. While there is parking just next to it, you likely won’t find a lot during peak hours.

Lunch at our favourite Thai food place. They have crayfish (new item) on their menu now. Food is nice as always. They even have a mural painted beside their restaurant.

One of the better Thai food offerings around. If you want a slice of Little Bangkok where Golden Mile Complex once offered, Soi 47 is it.

Affordable, delicious and generous all together. Portions can be shared easily with 2-3. Get yourselves 4-5 dishes and enjoy. Interior is a bit plain/utilitarian but actually seems quite Thai. My favourite was the Pandan Chicken (packed a spiced punch for a delicate portion) and the Green Curry (denser, more aromatic; different from the watery coconuty style). Omelette was the fluffly type, and turned out too oily. Milk tea was average but glad it wasn't overly sweet.

If you're early or unattended to, it seems like you should walk in and serve yourself to an empty table. But later on at around 830pm, when a queue started forming, I believe the staff started managing the seats/tables.
Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Soi 47 Thai Food

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Came to this outlet a few times and the food has been consistent over the years. Flavourful Thai food and fast service. Spicy and good! Prices are also quite comparable. Price came to about $150 for 8 people with sharing dishes. Good  value!

Nestled at a corner of cheong chin nam road is a Halal certified (please recheck for validity before going) restaurant serving delicious authentic thai food.

Serving portions were big. Special mention on the mango salad, it was super tasty and authentic! So were the dishes we had. You will love it if you prefer slight saltiness in your food. We love what we ordered!

Service was good. Food ordering via QR code. Food served within a decent time and the prices are decent (with exception to the prawn vermiselli which is pricier given the number of prawn given). One probable issue for some patrons is the limited availability of airconditioned seating area.

Will definitely be back.

No frill Thai food. Anytime crave for decent Thai food with decent price this is the place. Try their glass noodle phat Thai, crab meat fried rice, basil chicken and mango salad. All rather authentic. Also you can select less spicy so good for people who cannot take spicy food.

Stumbled upon this gem after hiking at bukit timah. If you are craving for a spicy tom yum soup, this is THE place for you. Our orders came within 20mins. Not crowded even during weekend afternoon too! Near DTL and parking lots available. Price is wallet friendly!

Had been craving for a clear tom yum soup for quite some time now bcos Far East plaza’s cahaya restaurant weren’t selling them anymore. Fyi, Time for thai serves red and clear tom yum soup too!

Their soup was utterly rich in flavour and we ordered more spicy version. I can confirm my tongue was burning but not to worry, its not as numbing as Mala. You know how your throat feels powdery after slurping down some tom yum soup? This tom yum doesn’t do that! Fragrance weren’t overwhelming and the seafood portion were adequate. If you are starving, get the large portion. Rice is not included

Papaya salad was a refreshing appetiser. Tangy, slightly spicy and peppered with crushed peanuts, each bite doesn’t disappoint. Serving was big though, i would say definitely too much for 1pax.

Pandan chicken was alright. Only comes in 3pcs per serving i believe. I prefer Koh nangkram’s (along bugis st) pandan chicken tbh.

Home-made iced lemongrass and thai green tea was delicious. Iced lychee, again normal & safe bet if u didnt know what to order. Will come again for sure.

It’s literally Time for Thai, as we just walked-in after seeing the eatery from the overhead bridge!

There was a set meal for 2 but being small eaters, we ordered ala carte instead. My favourite would be the big & tasty Prawn cakes, the Fried glass noodles were not bad too (although it contains mainly vegetables, u can top up for meat/ seafood), & the Tom yum chicken red soup was spicy!

IG @pingguo301
