Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Time For Thai SG

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
While searching for vegan/vegetarian Thai food we landed here. The restaurant is located in Chinatown. There wasn't any waiting to get seated. We ordered vegan pineapple fried rice and vegan Pad Thai. Both were delicious in taste and quantity is decent for the price. The service was fast too. Overall satisfied with our meal.

*if u don’t like ants, please don’t go to this restaurant. I found many ants on table while I am eating”
簡單來說 : 沒味道，沒鑊氣，價格貴，桌子上有螞蟻，我不知道那些5星好評哪來的。
Sorry to saying that… but I don’t know why this Thai restaurant can get many good review…
Base on the price, this Thai restaurant doesn’t worth it. I suggest travellers can go for Thai food in hawker centre. Taste is not authentic AT ALL, maybe is Singapore style Thai food ONLY. Not real THAI FOOD
First, the pad Thai. Tasteless, no “Wok Hei” 無鑊氣
U know… Thai stir fry cuisine are supposed to use hard fire so to make everything with “Wok Hei” 鑊氣 it just like they boil the noodle and mix with sauce for me when I am eating their pad Thai
For the Thai lemon fish. The soup is like water… not sour at all. It doesn’t worth $34 (even more expansive than I eat in Australia). Believe me, don’t order it, go for this fish is hawker centre, much better than this!!!
And the papaya salad…. Tasteless too, can’t taste the fish sauce and the lime juice. I don’t think they make it in a Thai way as all the ingredients are not mixed well.

Very disappointed. $85 something for 2 people. I rather go to hawker centre than this.

For the restaurant reply : thank you for replying my review. But fresh ingredients doesn’t means that you cook it right & nice and authentic… u know… it about how u cook not about the ingredients. You can cook bad even u have good ingredients.

We ordered chargrilled pork skewers, which taste nice with the sauce. The pad Thai has the chicken option, which we think is yummy, as well as basil pork rice. Iced Thai green tea is too sweet even tho we have ordered half sugar, but the iced lemongrass tea is impressive. One of the best Thai food I have in Singapore.

If you love food as much as I do, you will enjoy the place. Great selection (even for me - allergic to rice!) And impeccable service. They are a little pricey though and the vegetables were a little too salty.

Still, I would definitely come back. Really favour the basil chicken. Robust flavour and not too salty.
Enjoyed the atmosphere and the tom yum soup too!

Lovely thai food in busy Chinatown. Really liked the vegetarian options and the flavors. Topped up the food with refreshing Thai coconut juice.

Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Sawasdee Thai Restaurant

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Atmosphere is good, cooling and nice pricing is consider affordable for a place like this but the only downside is understaff very very understaff and their staff attitudes I know you're busy so I make a quick question before making an order....

They should start self service ordering instead because what I see is they are really very understaff.

Anyway the food is really great end to end it's good.

Absolutely stellar Thai food experience! From the rich flavors of Pad Thai to the perfectly spiced Green Curry, every dish is a masterpiece. The authenticity shines through, and the service is impeccable. Cozy ambiance adds to the charm. A must-visit for anyone craving an authentic and delicious Thai culinary journey!

Delicious thai food. They must be doing well because they occupied 3 separate units. I like their restaurant because it comes with a little playground for children to play. The fried garlic sotong was very good. Generous spread of garlic was yummy. Food price is reasonable. I find the place a bit too small and tight.

Claypot Tang Hoon Prawn & Pineapple rice is super yummy, prawn cake a must to eat. Steam fish, kailan with roast pork, kangkong, tomyum soup, fried egg, chicken with garlic is what i will order when i there.

Food quality is good and the price is reasonable. Can taste the authentic aroma of Thai food.

However, the seats are quite limited. So prepare to que if you are going at peak hours.
Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Soi 47 Thai Food

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Best Pad Thai, sauce is savoury with a hint of sweet, and not the cheap ketchup like one used at other places. For the quality, the price is well worth it. Fish cake is not bad too - tastes fresh and not like the processed chilled kind from supermarkets. Air con half working , seats hard wood kind  so can't sit for long.

Our go-to for quick Thai food fix. The rice meal has generous dishes. You may need top-up rice if you’re very hungry. The green curry is very tasty. Pineapple rice set is my fave.

$12.80 per rice set meal, drink included

IG @sporkandbeanz

6 of us spent S$153 including GST and service charge. It worked out to be S$27 per pax which is affordable. Comfortable and clean. The service was inattentive. The food was served quickly. Only 7-8 mins walk to City Hall MRT Station or Bugis MRT Station.

The clear tom yum soup here is sad. For $9.00++ ($10.69 after taxes), the soup’s ingredients are a real let down. 2 frozen prawns, frozen dory fish pieces and 2 over cooked squid pieces (so tough that I could hardly chew them). A far cry from what the menu is advertising. Truly unenjoyable. Perhaps all that hit the spot was the sourness and spice, but even then it was not balanced.

There is a dedicated menu just for vegetarians, with super wide range of options and delicious authentic thai flavours. Really accessible from Suntec area. Highly recommend their Green Curry & Thai Mango Salad that was refreshing & tangy. Good for both group and individual meals. But restaurant interior lighting can be quite dim. Along the shophouses so its expected that there is not much seating space, but sufficient- since unable to reserve seats, seats availability depends on timing you visit.
Probably price of a zichar store
Thai cuisine in Singapore.address: 27 Purvis St, #01-01 Ann Chuan Building, Singapore 188604
Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Jai Thai Purvis Street

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at Ah Loy Thai, and it was a delightful experience from start to finish. The ambiance was inviting, creating the perfect setting for an enjoyable meal. The menu offered a fantastic variety of authentic Thai dishes, each bursting with flavor.

I must commend the attentive and friendly staff who made the dining experience even more enjoyable. Their recommendations were spot-on, and they were quick to ensure that every aspect of our meal was to our satisfaction.

The standout, of course, was the food itself. Each dish was expertly crafted, showcasing the rich and bold flavors that Thai cuisine is known for. The freshness of the ingredients was evident, and it's clear that the chefs at Ah Loy Thai take great pride in delivering a top-notch culinary experience.

Overall, Ah Loy Thai exceeded my expectations, and I can't wait to return for another round of delightful dining. Highly recommended for anyone in search of authentic Thai cuisine in a welcoming atmosphere.

Truly delicious authentic Thai food at this restaurant. The process of writing down your order on paper and then proceeding to the cashier to place your order and make payment is straightforward, and the waiting time for the food is acceptable.

However, there's a bit of an issue with the second place, which is still under renovation. The problem lies in the fact that the sound tends to bounce off the unfinished walls and ceiling, creating noise pollution and making it a bit challenging for patrons to enjoy a peaceful dining experience. Despite this, the food is definitely worth the visit.

One of the best Thai cuisine in Singapore. Located jn Bugis area, this Thai restaurant serves amazing Thai food. Fried egg, tomyum, lemongrass chicken, mango salad, is among the food that you must try, I kid you not. However, queueing system and rules can be improved.

You need to come here early or at odd hours or be prepared to queue, and it’s easy to see why - this restaurant has one of the tastiest Thai food I’ve ever eaten (and I’ve eaten a lot).

If there is one dish you must try, it has to be their omelette with minced pork; crispy and tasty.

Their tom yam soup and tom yam fried rice are also rich and delicious. Do also remember to order their Pandan chicken.

To a person like not really eating spicy food, I honestly think this Thai food hits exactly nice for me to eat. Taste great, good vibes, hopefully to visit next time! Thank you!
Thai cuisine in Singapore.address: 9 Tan Quee Lan St, #01-04 Bugis, Singapore 188098
Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Ah Loy Thai

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Authentic Thai food at reasonable price in orchard. Atmosphere is fair but for the food would still draw good crowds. Though overall orchard tower is relative run down overtime, this Thai restaurant still standing strong with its regulars & locals. Way to go!

Thai Tantric Authentic Thai food is located in Orchard Tower and at level 3. It is hidden at a corner but the corner is quite brightly lit. Orchard Towers is quite a rundown place too. This place has two shops side by side and both with seats and tables. We ordered clear tom yam fish soup (spicy and nice! Fish was fresh), omelette was so good, kangkong very tasty and lastly, the deep fried pork belly is just superb. Drinks aren’t that great though but the food made up for it.

If you want authentic Thai food at a very reasonable price, this is a must go to! No nonsense food.

Fantastic food at a reasonable priced. $48 for 2 pax here

Ordered the
- Pad Thai $8 each
- Meatball soup $14
- Egg plant $14
- Thai Milk Tea $2 each

Food was served fast, it was yummy and delicious 🤤

Food was great and fast. But prepared to go thru floors of dodgy massage parlours and many shops are closed in the Orchard tower building so not a very desirable place to visit.
Thai cuisine in Singapore.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM
Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM
Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM
Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM
Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM
Saturday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM

Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Thai Tantric Authentic Thai Cuisine

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Great intimate place for that romantic dinner  without breaking the wallet.
Somewhat good place for business dinner too. No kids under 14 are allowed.
Skip the high heels, if you don't normally wear them daily though.

78$ pp for free flow lunch. Brought a Thai friend as I heard many good reviews about this place. But sadly the food was very salty and chicken in the green curry was rather dry and tough. Beef was tough as well. Restaurant was quite warm. Total damage 185$ after GST. There’s free parking around the corner for about 10 cars.

You will forget that you are in Singapore while you are here. You can be expecting tip top level of service while you enjoy your meal in the beautiful restaurant on the hill. Really love the architecture and chandeliers hanging in the bar area. The food itself I think is quite average as I had better Thai food elsewhere. Personally, I think they are a bit too heavy handed on the MSG as I usually feel very parched after eating here. Overall, I think it’s a really good place to hang out and have drinks with friends in a more secluded area of Singapore.

Attending a wedding event. Nice environment. Good for chill out. The food is just ok for me. But the environment is good for meeting and chatting people with people.

The building itself was beautiful typical colonial building. Inside was quiet and while there was 5 of us and we made our own atmosphere it was very quiet. We went on a Thursday so maybe at weekends it’s busier?! The food was lovely.
Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Tamarind Hill

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Nice place to explore if you love Thai food. Some dishes to highlight include the tomyum soup (looks very clear but was really tasty -- sour and spicy, definitely love this the most), mango salad (spicy and definitely have the Thai kick, but I think the mango was a little too ripe for a salad as it's quite soft), stuffed chicken wings (well fried, the outermost crust was crispy and the stuffs ingredients were very juicy), and the coconut jelly (that was the dessert -- coconut taste was fragrant and was not too heavy for digestion). Ordered some beer and definitely pairs well with dinner.

I think all in all this place is a good try. But it's definitely pricey in my opinion.

This was a terrible experience and I would definitely not come back. Horrible service and the standard of the food does not match the high price point. I would urge those to check their menu first to find out if you want to pay for such an experience.

Let me explain my ratings as given above. I firmly believe that the service crew there should be retrained (if there was any training in the first place) because what they said and did were quite ridiculous.

When my companions and I entered the restaurant, it was very empty. The staff guided us to this room with three tables and we occupied one of them. After that, this group of around 12-14 people came in and started chattering very loudly. We requested to change tables since the noise was deafening but the staff did not allow us to. Their reasoning was that the other tables were reserved. I do not understand their reasoning because: 1. There were many other tables that were empty so why should we have been confined to that room? 2. From the time we entered to the time we left, the restaurant was at 50% capacity only. There was no reason as to why they couldn't have let us go to a table outside.

Another instance that left us totally stumped was when we ordered our food earlier than the other table in the room. However, the other table got their food first and although we waited for while longer, we still didn't get any food served to us. As such, one of my companions went to ask the staff why our food was taking so long and their response was quite hilarious. As the other table had ordered appetisers and we did not, we would be served later even though we had ordered our food earlier. I will refrain from saying any expletives but my companions and I were basically hungry and tired from their nonsense.

In total, we waited for 35mins for our food. That's too long of a waiting time when there weren't even that many tables occupied!

For the food, it was disappointing. It totally did not match up with the high prices we paid for it. For example, the tom yum was very diluted and there was little flavour. The bee hoon also had no taste.

Would not come back.

Been around for almost 30 years and they are one of the older Thai restaurants in Singapore. Decent food quality but on the slightly pricier side of things. Olive rice, pomelo salad and grilled squid are some of the nicer items on the menu. The spring roll had too strong a taste of the young bamboo shoots that most of us did not enjoy. Desserts are good and worth keeping a bit of space for!

Recently I had craving for Thai food. A friend recommended Yhingthai. The dishes there were really tasty. I love the prawn tom yum soup. Small portion just right for one person. Super spicy. We ordered several other dishes all were very good. Most of the dishes at Yhingthai are quite spicy. Be careful if you can’t really eat spicy food. The service staff there were polite. The average cost is around $50 per person. I would expect a more grand interior design and more Thai ambiance.

High end thai food. You pay for the quality of food and service. Everything was good. Try it if you want fine dining thai cuisine.
Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Yhingthai Palace Restaurant

Thai cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
It's a great experience.  Delicious traditional Thai food  The staff took very good care of me.  Awesome cocktails  I recommend this shop.

Came here for a lunch meeting and was told this is a popular spot for vegetarian Thai dishes as there is a whole dedicated section of the menu for vegetarian selections.

Vegetarian or not, this is overall a good choice for Thai food in a nicer setting, I particularly enjoyed the seafood Tom yum and the olive fried rice was not bad either. Green curry was mediocre but passable.

Decided to lunch at Sabai Fine Thai restaurant. At lunch time, ground floor was full, the server suggested second floor. Second floor not very large, about 8 to 9 tables. However more cozy and quiet than ground floor. I personally preferred second floor. We ordered mango salad, stuff fried chicken wing, fried thai noodle and pineapple rice. The wait was short and food were served almost together. The serving was generous and able to feed 2 big guys (my buddy and me). We had a hearty meal and an enjoyable lunch. Staff very attentive, our water glass always filled to the brim without asking. If you love Thai food in a cosy and quiet environment with attentive staff - Sabai Fine Thai is where you should be.

Delicious Thai food. The only disappointment was the Red Ruby dessert. See last photo.

Delicious food & a cozy ambience!!

We went to this place for dinner. We ordered rice crackers, soup, spring rolls, chicken & Mango sticky rice. Surprisingly,  all dishes came in less time than we expected and the quantity & quality of each dish was really good. Dishes are so delicious that it just takes you to Thailand. My daughter loved the adjustable light on the table too 😁 Must Visit place 💜

Thai cuisine in Singapore.name: Sabai Fine Thai on the Bay

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Welcome to delightful India right in the middle of Singapore. Located in Race Course road and in the vicinity of Little India this place screams authenticity. The quaint place had nice decor and a good vibe. We had the butter chicken, lady finger vegetable curry, fish tikka, garlic and cheese Naan as well as a starter which was a flatbread filled with a spinach style filling and a curry on the side to dip the bread.  For drinks we had a mango lassi and lime juice. Everything was delicious and the service was delightful and friendly. Recommended to make a reservation as it got quite busy on a Thursday evening.

Excellent dinner at Mustard on Race Course Rd. Restaurant is small and intimate and service is excellent and attentive.  They have a huge menu with tons of choices so we ordered way too much to try many things. Everything was wonderful but especially recommend the house special Chingri Maacher Malai, the Aloo Jhuri, Mutton Biryani and the kathi kababs.

Located in the Little India neighborhood. This restaurant has friendly staff, of which unfortunately not everyone speaks English.

Food menu is extensive and you don't have to wait very long on your food. Not everything was of my personal taste, but I am sure the food was nice. Also enough dessert choices and even typical Indian drinks.

Do note that the air conditioning is very cold here, somewhat too cold (heard the same thing from a co-worker who visited earlier).

Excellent food!

We arrived at opening at 11:30 specifically bent on enjoying authentic Bengali food—we left satisfied and glad we came early!

The waiters are able to make excellent recommendations. We opted to go straight for mains:

- Kosha Mangsho: tender chunks of mutton in a fantastic thicker gravy

- Chingri Maacher Malai Curry: delicate shrimp and coconut curry presented in a tender coconut

- Maacher Paturi: boneless fish fillet smothered in mustard, gently steamed in a banana leaf

Rice bread does not come with each main, and does require separate purchasing. We opted for:
- Luchi: aka puri, lightly fried and crisp
- Roomali Roti: one roti is rather large, and folded in on itself; delicate with a great chew
- Plain white rice

For dessert, we enjoyed Rossomalai (aka Rasmalai), a dessert in most areas of India, but theirs is fragrant and richly flavored with cardamom, almonds, and cream.

All in all, a fantastic visit for those who enjoy Indian food and are looking for something different than what most restaurants serve. They do include Punjabi items in their menu, which is typically what most people think of when they think “Indian,” but venturing off to possibly “unfamiliar” dishes won’t disappoint!

It’s a shame they are not awarded Michelin Star, all the dishes were on point. Highly recommend for anyone wish to taste good authentic Indian cuisine. Try all the signature dishes, all is a hit!
Indian restaurants in Singapore.name: Mustard Singapore - Flavours of Bengal & Punjab

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
One of best restaurants of Singapore to have authentic North Indian food. The interiors of the restaurant has a heritage kind of a feel and staff is very polite and courteous.

Though a bit expensive than usual, food quality and quantity was upto the mark and the food was delicious. Even the mouth freshener was really tasty. Would recommend visiting this place for authentic North Indian food.

Nice place and food tasted good. Especially the carrot halwa and chicken kebab. Fish gravy was little off... did not like it. Staffs were kind. The taxi dropped off me at fairmount hotel... but this restaurant is at raffles city shopping mall. But no worries, since both buildings were interconnected, I could just walk to the next. There is a corner to conduct some performance like singing. Reaaaaly traditional for Indians... haha.

Lovely service and food. Had my sons birthday there cos he wanted something different.  The lunch buffet on weekend is best value!! Lovely quality especially the appetisers.  And don't be mistaken the latter was rhe main course for us. Best you can order again and again!! The curries and nans as well as the dessert cum fruits were wonderful. My daughter who love the Indian food in Philadelphia was especially enjoying all the food including the sauces . And they were so kind to take a picture of the family and birthday and gave us a frame for that as well.. well done guys. Only down side, the deco has been there for many years.. a little dated but still acceptable lah..

This Indian restaurant in Singapore offers a unique dining experience. Unlike other Indian restaurants where I usually find the food heavy for dinner, here they have mastered the art of using a delightful blend of spices like turmeric, tamarind, cumin, fennel, and cardamom. The dishes, especially the curry-based ones like lamb, curry snapper fish, and chicken masala, are absolutely fantastic, and they pair wonderfully with the naan and roti. Don't miss out on the flavorful biryani rice too. To add to the exceptional experience, the wine selection, particularly the Shiraz, is a perfect complement to the meal. All of this, combined with the great service provided by Sunjav, makes it a truly memorable restaurant visit.

Amazing experience. The service was so good. Sitting buffet starters, many varieties and can be served multiple times as well as per our requirements. Main course items were less,
The quality of food is good. Their service is exceptional.
While booking the reservation, we mentioned we are coming for a birthday lunch, they arranged kulfi ice cream cake. They took photos and got them printed for us and given as a birthday card, which is unique.
Highly recommended
Indian restaurants in Singapore.name: Shahi Maharani North Indian Restaurant

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Delicious! I am craving for the food again. They are tasty and taste authentic. I would come again.

I like the service from staff, though they should check on us less. 😅 We had four people asking us about how everything was. The service was excellent because we were asked if we could take spicy food. When the food was served, it was individually to us; it felt like a special treat.

Location is also worth mentioning. I could think of another option where I could get delicious Indian food, but having Punjab Grill at MBS is perfect because there is so much to do around.

One of the best North Indian restaurants I have ever had a meal at. Under the stewardship of their new Chef Gorang Anand the menu and the cooking has been taken to a whole new level. Must try if you live in or visit Singapore.

Actually didn't spend a single cent, was a treat (Pre-opening Dinner Party). Went without knowing what to expect. The restaurant is in MBS. Heard from someone that this is one of the places serving best Indian food in Singapore. The food is relatively yummy. Chicken is tender. Naan is yummy. The uniforms of the waiters add to the uniqueness of the place. The waiters are relatively polite.

This is my favorite Indian restaurant in Singapore. I always spend a time to eat there when I am in town. The food is super delicious, service is great and they gave me some Deepavali seasonal dessert the last time I ate there.  Fantastic!!!

I had dinner at Punjab Grill today with family. Food was awesomely delicious. Restaurant's ambience is great. Staff is super friendly.
We order few dishes like pani puri & papdi chat, both were mouth watering.
Butter chicken and rogen josh were melt in mouth. For dessert we ordered rasmalai and pan flavoured ice cream. Overall we enjoyed our meal and definitely will visit again.
Indian restaurants in Singapore.name: Punjab Grill

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
As a Chinese Singaporean, I found the dinner to be extremely delectable. Parking can be done nearby in parallel to those shophouses. It was my first time having a South Indian cuisine, I really have no idea what to order so I kindly requested for recommendations and everything was pleasing to my taste bud. The person who took my order yesterday was really patient as well.

Giving my layman description, I’ve ordered meen pollichathu (Marinated spicy boneless fish wrapped in banana leaf), gobi manchurian (fried cauliflower sauteed with special sauce), kozhi porichathu (fried chicken marinated with various spices), porata (its like local roti prata but less oily), fish curry with mango, malabar mutton biriyani, mango lassi (yoghurt drink) and lemon soda. My favourite got to be the gobi manchurian as I have never tasted cauliflower done like this before. Biriyani portion was great for 2 pax sharing or for 1 hungry person, the mutton was yummy as well. Meen Pollichathu needs no explanation as it is one of their best seller and portion is reasonable for their price. The kozhi porchathu was probably my least fav as the chicken felt like its double fried since its a little hard, otherwise the taste is really good. Food were all served within 15mins upon ordering and the temperature was hot (everything is made fresh). Total bill came out to be around ~$87 for 2. I personally think its reasonable as I was extremely full by the end of the dinner and have no stomach for dessert haha.

Would definitely being my Kerala colleagues to try their dishes one day.

This place is special in its way of treating your taste buds with the kerala food in Singapore. The service is good, and the ambiance gives you the picture of the land Kerala.

Went for Onam Sadhya.. all the items served were cold and tasted like cooked in the morning and served for dinner. Taste was also bland and not worth Sadhya. Nothing special in the “Sadhya” served and definitely not worth $24!
Better have Andhra meal at any restaurant, its better taste and value for money.

Amazing food😀!!!. Excellent service. It’s an authentic place to get typical South Indian food.Especially Kerala cuisine. 😋Highly recommend !!!

I've only had lunch meals at this restaurant. The  quality of the meals is inconsistent. When it's good, it's really good.

They offer a lot of meat dishes and only a handful of vegetarian items. But there is enough here to get a good experience of the range and taste of Kerala-food.

Edit: In subsequent visits, the quality further dropped. The vegetarian meals were not served on the banana leaf, the rasam was the worst I've tasted, the puliseri looked pale and was just sweet, the ulli theeyal was too sugary, and everything else was average.
Indian restaurants in Singapore.name: Spice Junction

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The food was alright, not the best I would say in comparison to other places we went charging cheaper. We asked food to be non-spicy but it came spicy. Juice was fresh and came in big cups! Only thing which we felt was worth it. Service was also very friendly but we got a shocker when our bill came!

Firstly the person who served us mistook our order and got us 3 starter soups. We were excited to see 3 small bowls and felt he divided the soup bowl for us. We are used to being served 1 big bowl of soup and him giving 3 was thought of as being kind.
Those 3 bowls however popped up on our bill! When we questioned that when we had made individual orders, he just removed 1 bowl. Didn't cause much fuss and paid. And yes, that soup...not fresh but did not taste or smell aged. Regardless, was microwave heated. Could see the usual microwave stains of oil residue you can easily see inside the bowl and tell it was microwaved.

Why I am giving just a 1 star because what is most disappointing is we were also charged a 10% service charge on top of our meals! I just found out now when calculating our expenses. This the first time to experience that additional charge besides GST in Singapore. Even GST is already added, what you see is what you pay...but unfortunately, not here!
If you want to save costs, I'll recommend going elsewhere. A family member wanted to have a North Indian experience and quite some experience it was.
Due to open setting, there were also some men who were just staring at my mother and when us men looked, they immediately turned their heads away! What nuisance!

Will I plan to go here again? Nah, I'd even avoid crossing this place.

Generous serving!
Had buttered chicken, decent but I've had better ones. The vegetable biryani was good and had ample variation on the vegetables. The mango lassi is pretty good, have that.
A filling meal overall.

Visited this place couple of times last week. Staff is very courteous and food is super. Not spicy at all. Tried veg/chicken biryani, mee goreng, nasi goreng, mutter paneer, naan, etc and everything was super.

Good food and friendly staff , definitely will come back to try other dishes!

Good food and reasonable price. They open until late night. Call first if you going there after 12am.
Indian restaurants in Singapore.opening_hours:

Indian restaurants in Singapore.name: Royal Indian Restaurant

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Food is good quality is also just nice but felt little expensive
One plate is $4
Taste n quantity ok but for this price is too much
Service is good but has to Que up for every order or first buy n pay n then eat
Very fresh food n good hospitality not spicy.

Not too crowded even on a weekend which is always good in the heart of little India. Sometimes the crowd can be overwhelming.

The food is great. Especially the mutton dishes. The chicken tikka is also amazing. The chicken briyani want great and the chicken kerbab wasn’t great too. Naan was a little too oily.

I spent $38 on breads, paneer and sweets??? $10 for paneer makhani was expensive. It was not cooked properly. The best dish was "Paneer Tikka". I

I would say that their food tasted pretty typical “North Indian styled”. But not enough to blow us away. Their pricing was not too expensive, and neither cheap, pretty affordable.

Absolutely delicious Indian dishes.
The mutton dum briyani is nice but comparing to the other dishes, it doesn’t shine as bright.
Highly recommend their naan and side dishes, especially their butter chicken.

If you’re tall, please mind your head when you dine at the upper level.

Price point is also reasonable. Highly recommended.
Indian restaurants in Singapore.opening_hours:

Indian restaurants in Singapore.name: Jaggi’s Northern Indian Cuisine

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Interesting lunch and good vegetarian option. Enjoyed pani puri but maybe a bit too sweet for me. Equally the dal maklani was too salty and buttery albeit managed to finish quite a big helping. Pricing is bonkers tho with rice and dal dishes being close to 15 dollars. Service was excellent and I would come back and try a few other dishes. One issue is the lack of bathroom facilities or washbasin in the restaurant. You have to exit and do a couple of doors down and my nose never did recover from little India’s more underground smells !

I had a great experience at this Indian restaurant

The food was great and I enjoyed the service, the staff were friendly and helpful.

I like the atmosphere, and I appreciated how quickly the food was served.

While I haven't explored many Indian restaurants yet, I'm looking forward to returning to try more dishes in the future.

So far the best chaats I have had in Singapore. Nice and proper place to sit and enjoy the food. Prices are not exorbitant. One thing I dislike is that they don't have a proper hand wash inside the restaurant. Have to go out to wash and come back using the swing door, which defeats the purpose of washing hands. Indian food must be enjoyed by using hands, so hand wash point in the restaurant is a must.

Update on 18 Sep,
Since I liked the chaats, I thought of having at airport as I saw it was at T1 terminal @ L2. When I went there, they said it was moved to different location. Management must take out the signboard from T1 as it gives wrong information.

Very good option for Indian vegetarian food. Was seated very fast and the service was also good. During peak dinner time 8-9pm place will be crowded and generally there will be waiting.
Vast Manu covers most of the Indian variety food. Food is really tasty, especially all the chat items are very nice. If you are looking for   Indian vegetarian food definitely worth a try.

Great North Indian cuisine. Service was slower than expected, however food was good. Be careful when ordering more sides as they charge for everything

Indian restaurants in Singapore.address: 3 Belilios Rd, #01-03 Hilton Garden Inn, Singapore 219924
Indian restaurants in Singapore.name: Kailash Parbat Restaurant

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Very interesting setting. Good north Indian Punjabi style food. Overall 20+ of us liked it. Starters tandoori platter etc were great. Biriyani is not like the biriyani we expect in the south. But food was good.

This place tends to get lost amidst the array of restaurants in Cuppage Terrace and is a pleasant surprise serving good North Indian Cuisine!
The food was surprisingly good, great ambiance soaking in the vibrant cuppage energy and great service from the friendly staff !
The chaats and kebabs are nice !
The masala tea is also great!
Will return to try the other stuff !

Fantastic food with great service. The vibe is good, the drinks are potent. Have been a patron for more than a decade.. time to change the ambience?

Fabulous Food. Great Place. Great Ambience. Must try for some fabulous Indian Food. Taste, Quality, Quantity. Everything just Perfect.
Must say the owner is a great guy being a Ex Star Chef himself. He came out and spent so much time with us.

Not interested in trekking to little India then treat your taste buds to a night at the Curry Culture. Great vibe with a great outdoor seating area with great service. Meals may be a little more than other places but the quality of the food is well worth it!
Indian restaurants in Singapore.address: 31 Cuppage Road Cuppage Terrace, 31 Cuppage Rd, 229457
Indian restaurants in Singapore.name: The Curry Culture - Cuppage Terrace

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Positively delicious experience. Look no further for fine dining Indian cuisine.
We went for the set lunches vegetarian and non-vegetarian options, everything was amazing, smooth, and superbly well seasoned. Staff was friendly and attentive, and food was served quickly.
Can't recommend enough.

Gives you a fine dining experience. Nice place with tall ceilings and a posh setup. The furniture was good and comfortable. The menu was decent and the taste was unique. Do try the biryani and restaurant recommended dishes.  Expect to spend $80+ ( with svc chr n gst). Felt a little shorthanded on staff and felt rushed towards the end.

High end Indian restaurant in Pan Pacific . Went for lunch the set thali has a lot of variety and has unlimited refills . I would say some of taste could have been better . The service is great the staff friendly and very attentive.

We were there to celebrate our 21st wedding anniversary.  We ordered from the a la carte menu.  The service staff were very friendly and attentive to our needs and offered to help us in any way they could. What came as a surprise was a complimentary slice of cake from the restaurant to celebrate the occasion. Thank you for making the lunch a special one. Highly recommended!

Good Indian Fine Dine, you can certainly experience the quality ingredients, but we as a family personally felt that the masalas have been severely mellowed down to cater to the masses and hence the drift of authenticity from the dishes.

Indian food is all about spices, flavours and for sure calories. We weren’t disappointed at all, just that some dishes could have beer better :)
Indian restaurants in Singapore.address: 7 Raffles Blvd, Level 3 Pan Pacific, Singapore 039595
Indian restaurants in Singapore.name: Rang Mahal - Fine Dining Indian Restaurant

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Absolutely delicious Indian food in a fun open air location with a corner view of the street. Friendly service; we left, saying we'd probably be back and were greeted warmly when we did. Curries are delicious and the pakoras are tasty too. Chili pakoras are no joke though, super spicy!

Used to be my go to for Indian food but finds that recent visits are less pleasant. Staff not able to describe properly the dishes seems they can’t speak English well. The food are just ok not fantastic.

Love the bread basket, butter chicken and palak paneer! The chicken biryani is so so. The place is air conditioned with good hygiene. Quite a lot of tourists in the restaurant.

Butter chicken is good, but the tandoori chicken is okay but proportion is small, overall is pricey, and they have too many take away orders that took very long to serve our food, the outdoor tables are close to street where is not so good when raining

Absolutely brilliant food. Fantastic service. The staff are friendly and attentive. Set in the heart of little India. Amazing. Well done guys

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The chaat was below average.
The mutton and prawns were amazing!
Some guy kept grabbing our water glasses and filled it with still water while we were having sparkling, that was very irritating, it's a simple task but you guys can't get that right, very sad for 'fine dining'.
The lady who served us, Belle, she was good, she took time out to story tell. Loved her effort.
The ambiance was really loud! 😅
Low priority on my revisit list.

Love the history and amount of thought that went into each dish and modernizing it. The Goalondo steamer fowl curry in their special Bengali menu was the star, and so is the ema datshi. Staff members were also accommodating, and were able to explain the dishes.

We had the Experience menu which comprised about 12 items ( including a complimentary one that was not in the menu) - not cheap but reasonably priced relative to food quality/ quantity. Good array of food ranging from some more unique dishes  eg Alaskan crab, cod fish to familiar Indian items like naan ( best garlic naan ever tasted) and bryani. Attentive service with food items explained at each course. I am normally not that big a fan of Indian cuisine but this won me over . Will go again

Senthil & team attended to us wonderfully. The hospitality at Yantra is unparalleled and met by very few Indian restaurants in Singapore. Chef Pinaki even stepped out to speak to our family. Their Palak Anjeer Kofte, a palatable twist on Malai Kofte, are a must-try! Can’t wait to be back :)

Just one caveat - the portions are pretty small so keep that in mind when ordering.

By far one of the most memorable meals we had in Singapore during our trip!

We went back there for the first time in 8 years and found that the whole place was revamped and had become a very high-end fine dining! The lunch buffets were there no more (which was a bummer at first to be honest), but the quality of food was just the way we remembered it.

What amazed us was their amazing hospitality. All the staff were tremendously kind and friendly. When we told them that it was our first time back in 8 years and that this was our best meal this trip, they were so happy for us and let is explore some areas of the newly revamped restaurant (such as the new bar which was so beautiful I was in awe!)

Bit on the pricier end but if you’re looking to have some eccentric Indian cuisine, we highly recommend it!
Indian restaurants in Singapore.name: Yantra

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
A delight to every South Indian dish that’s being presented! The restaurant holds the legacy with not just the location, the interior but also to the taste with food. We tried a few variations including the famous meal and biriyani. A must try will be the meal combo, served hot. We had to wait for around 30 mins to get seated but it’s worth the wait.. ground floor and first floor has seating capacity. The prices are very reasonable for the quantity being served. Will definitely recommend this place for all South Indian vegetarian fans!

Food here is good, not that very bad. Service got to improve. Environment can be cramped and noisy. Pricey but still okay, you pay what you asked for. I was served food first, even finished up eating the foods but drinks were served after 5-10 after finishing up my meals. Masala tea arrived 30-40 minutes late upon ordering. This is not acceptable at all. And never even apologized for serving the drinks late. I ordered one ice tea and one masala tea. Also, I personally feel the standard of the food have dropped a lot. Used to patronize here often but I think it's about time that the service and food taste is falling apart.
Overall food is 7.5/10.
Service is 3/10.
Environment is 4.5/10.
This review is based on my honest opinion.

I saw this on a food travel show and immediately wanted to try it out.

There was a short queue but seated after 5min or so wait. Service was friendly and no fuss. Dining area is simple but as expected.

Definitely lived up to expectations with amazing, fresh, authentic and tasty food. I had the dosai meal which had 3 curries, some chutneys, Daal, sambar, and even a sweet sago coconut pudding. Amazing flavours, colours and spices. A generous meal which was thoroughly enjoyable.

For a sweet finish I tried the almond hawa and milk kova which were both new to me. Very sweet but had their own unique taste and texture which hit the spot.

One improvement would be to use less plastic for serving food - lots of little plastic containers on my meal set and for sweets.

Overall a great experience and will definitely be recommending and be back.

The food and service is always good in Komala Vilas. We stay nearby so we can walk to this restaurant during our jaunt in Singapore.
I wish they include an elevator to go upstairs for lunch. On request they let my parents share the meals but mentioned there will be no refills.
Taste is always exceptional.

Nestled in the heart of Little India, Singapore, Komala Vilas Indian Restaurant is a culinary gem that proudly showcases a rich history of authentic Indian cuisine. With a legacy spanning over several decades, this restaurant has been a beacon of tradition and a must-visit for anyone seeking genuine Indian flavors.

Authenticity Unveiled: Komala Vilas has stayed true to its roots, preserving the authenticity of Indian culinary traditions. From its traditional South Indian dishes to the flavors of the North, every plate served here is a journey through the diverse and vibrant cuisine of India. The recipes have been carefully passed down through generations, ensuring that each bite tells a story of India’s culinary heritage.

Efficiency Meets Warmth: One of the standout features of Komala Vilas is its impeccable service. The staff is known for their swift and friendly demeanor, ensuring that you not only receive your food promptly but also feel welcomed. Their commitment to creating a warm and inviting atmosphere enhances the dining experience.

Culinary Excellence: The true star of Komala Vilas is the remarkable quality and taste of the food. Each dish is a work of art, with fresh ingredients and a perfect blend of spices. Whether you crave the crispy dosas, aromatic biryanis, or rich curries, every bite is a burst of flavors that will transport your taste buds to India. Vegetarian or non-vegetarian, the menu caters to every palate with equal finesse.

In summary, Komala Vilas Indian Restaurant is not just a place to eat; it’s an exploration of India’s culinary diversity. The history, authenticity, fast and welcoming service, and, above all, the mouthwatering food, make it a true treasure in Little India, Singapore. When you dine here, you embark on a journey to India without leaving the vibrant streets of Singapore.

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Awash Restaurant offers an exquisite array of north Indian cuisines, showcasing rich flavors and authentic preparation. While the quality is undeniable, the prices may lean towards the higher side. If you're willing to splurge, the culinary experience is certainly worth it.

Located in CentrePoint. Ambience was good. Some of the signature items was there which we felt disappointed but it was surprise with other options which we tried and tasted good.

Ordered Sunehri Paneer Tikka which was very good from regular paneer tikka.

Tandoori Potato Nazakat was best and do give a try.

Kadhai Mushroom Korma and Lachcha Paratha was good combination too.

Sabz Briyani was ok felt little blant.

On the dessert Rose Phirni is a must try.

Mango lassi was subtle.

Staff was friendly and service was Good too.

Really good place. Staff is very friendly and nice to all, my kids also happy and his meal,
There are live music on Friday and Saturday night that is really good, and it make a good dine out for me

Awadh is possibly one of the best Indian fine dine restaurants in Singapore.
Location in Center Point, Orchard this place is on the level 1 and offers ample seatings arrangements.
The restaurant also boast of a small performance area guess for live music, unfortunately it wasn’t live during our visit.

We ordered Zaffrani Paneer Tikka which was simply delicious.
The other starter was Kalmi Kebab and by the satisfactorily expressions on my friends face it was nothing sort of another delicious starter.
We ended up with Murgh Lucknow Masala and Safed Moti Masala.

Since we were celebrating anniversary the place even surprised us with Shahi Tukda. It was so delicious that one shouldn’t mind paying for it.

You must visit the place if you crave for Indian delicacies.

We shared the meals and they actually serve the portions to each person which is very convenient. All of the recommendations that Priye gave us were amazing: lamb kabab, chicken seekh kabab, and chicken biryani. The food had the right texture—everything was cooked perfectly so that it was soft and not overdone. All the sauces were great with the food. The papad was great too—not overloaded with spices and a nice light texture.

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The restaurant located closed to Tanjong Pagar MRT at Icon Village. We ordered with Starters like Samosa, Samosa chaat, Papadi Chaat, Veg Pakora, Full Tandoori Chicken and main course was aloo paratha, kadai Paneer with Tandoor Roti and Garlic butter Naan. Everything was Yummy and Tasty. Even Kids like the Samosa which was apt for them. Should try this restaurant for North Indian Food.

Great Indian food! Resonable price and staffs are friendly and attentive. Was kind and patient to introduce the menu and recommend according to our preferred spiciness level. Particularly like the samosa chaat. Will definitely be back to try more!

Tasty lunch meal, with great service 👍👍
Authentic North Indian food. Not so spicy for me, which is good. I really enjoyed my experience here.
Highly recommended 👍👍👍🔥🔥

Food is ok. Ambiance is good. However the taste is not consistent. went thrice and everytime its different.

Tucked away in the 100am mall next to Amara hotel at Tanjong Pagar this restaurant has great tandoori chicken and tandoori Roti. Also the snacks such as samosa with masala tea is purrrfect !!! Thanks for the scrumptious meal and it was absolutely traditional Punjabi 😍😍😍😍😍👍👍👍👏👏👏👏

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
During my short visit to Singapore I was happy to see a good South Indian restaurant.
We tried a full non veg meals with prawn and chicken gravy. Meals were unlimited . Taste was good and happy to have food at this restaurant. Person at bill counter was happy to welcome us.

Nice place to have Indian food.

If you order rice, the side dishes and curries come for free.

Water is available for free.

Could have been 5 stars if not for the higher price of the meal. I paid $20+ for 2 meats and 1 soft drink.

An Indian restaurant for the novelty. Generally better biryani or meals than the stalls in hawkers/ foodcourt.

Masala chicken/ mutton was nice and portion is filling. Fried food like chicken 39 was cold when served. Fish/ or chicken curry is quite spicy. Dal curry is hot and nice during lunch time. Assam is peppery, siok.

I frequent this restaurant. Each time seems to be worst than another. Most 5 stars are probably tourist visit or first/ one-timer. Looking at all the lowest rating, the sentiments are aligned that the service is bad.

One of my favorite thing is that the Veggies and curries are free flow. I love Dal curry.  Perhaps it was just a miscommunication but when I requested to have more of one particular veggies of the day, they don't seem interest to serve (for 1 instance). For some reason my veggie and rice portion seem a bit smaller than usual too on the last time I visited (see photos). I came around 8.30pm, a time that it was not so busy, however the service staff around the dining area is not so attentive and not service-oriented at all. It feels like I owed to them by dining here/ it is a struggle to serve. Maybe the service staff are tired after the whole day.

A suggestion is to make the veggie and the curries to be self serve, it allows the individual to choose the type of veggie and control the portion so as to not waste food (not everyone wants to eat all types of veggies).

Really good food! Reasonable prices too! We had Prata and rice and lots of dishes! Especially enjoyed the chicken with onions which was an interesting dish! The other dishes were very good too - mutton, fish, curry. Surprised that the Prata was also really good!

Very authentic, menu is a bit confusing and the servers had a hard time explaining. We got the chicken set which comes with the white rice and a dish of chicken (these are pre-prepared and were not that warm) then someone comes around with tubs of curry sauce to spoon in your plate. Also ordered the chicken briyani, comes as whole chunks of chicken on the bone in the briyani. Was a very generous amount of food for the price.

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Fantastic Halal place. Very nice food! Staffs and the owner have been very kind and lovely. Very recommended! Hope to come back again soon, I was in Singapore this January

Aroma's is a great place to try out indian food! The owner is extremely warm and enthusiastic and he would recommend special items off the menu if you make specific requests. I have been coming with my family for a year now and have become great friends with the owner.

I would personally recommend to try their chaat (light snack) items as well as the indian-chinese fusion items such as gobi/chicken manchurian. Aroma's also does excellent biryanis which are so well flavoured/seasoned, you would not even need any gravy to accompany it.

I highly recommend all folks to come and give this restaurant a shot! :)

It's our first visit to such a specialty restaurant. We’re not sure if we’ll like it, judging from some of the low reviews. But wait!! We had such a great meal and experience with the owner here!When we first arrived, the signage was pretty small and not so eye-catching among the rows and rows of Indian food along the stretch of shophouses.

The menu was pretty big; we had no idea which to order until the owner approached us and we asked him for some recommendations. Firstly, he recommends some items to see if they suit our taste, and the more he asks, the more he knows about our food preferences.

Surprisingly, when the food came, the curries blew my mind! The different kinds of curry to match with different kinds of carbs are so suitable that they do not overpower each other. They are so flavorful! I specifically recommend the mixed vegetables; they're so flavorful with the briyani! The garlic nann is topped with REAL bits of chopped garlic and fragrant butter. It's so good with the curry the owner recommends! We wanted to order another nann, but we were so full because of the delicious briyani and curry. All the food was served hot and warm.

We were served papadam with a special mix of mint and many other spices and yoghurt green sauce. The sauce is so good that you want to keep dipping in it. He also recommends dipping the fried fish into this sauce. Yum!!

Do not hesitate to ask them for recommendations, as the owner did it very well! We will definitely go back for other dishes, especially butter chicken and prawns.

**This is more of a specialty restaurant than the other Indian food restaurant, which serves large portions of food. According to the owner now, they have only been open for 6 months. Some of the reviews from a year ago were definitely not from the same owner. Give it a try! You’ll not be disappointed.

Recently eating AROMA'S restaurant ,Race course road(near banana leaf appollo) Little India. Mutton Dum biriyani,chicken Dum Briyani ,Gobi manjurian,chicken 65,mushrooms cream soup,baby corn pepper fry,Masala tea taste fantastic and fabulous 👌 👌👌

Perfect respite after a warm morning walking tour of Little India.  Muthu welcomed us, very nice (cool) setting, very cold drinks and the food was great!  We'll be back!

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
No comment is needed on the food served in MTR. super fresh.

I ordered Rava Idly, Uddina Vada, Masala Dosa and Masala tea.

Rava Idly: coriander and nut and smth more in the Idly. soft and fluffy. perfect match with mint chutney.

Uddina Vada: wooooow. this is the heaven. 0.01mm of layer of crispy and very soft dough. Woooooow……..

Masala Dosa: was getting full after 2 dishes above… but still i enjoyed it… crispy layer and soft and chewy inner dough

Masala tea: thick. customised sugar level adding sugar prepared on the table.

will visit many more times…..

Must visit place of you love South Indian cuisine. Be prepared for some waiting in the queue since it is very popular. But the turnaround time is very fast. Just love their Thalis with so many flavours, podi dosa, khali dosa, idli.

This is my all time favorite Southern Indian restaurant in Singapore! As a vegetarian, I always come back here for their dosas and idlies. If you find yourself in Little India/Farrer Park, you have to try here at least once!

Well, I can’t really find words to discribe the taste. It was just delicious and heavenly feeling to have this comfort food after a long flight.

MTR has been best at what they do, I love their products 😘.

Super duper authentic South Indian food.

Price: $6.50 (Plain Thosai 1st Picture)
$7.56 (Pudi Masala Thosai 2nd Picture)

Plain Thosai: 5/5
The usual thickness of a thosai but was extremely crispy. Thosai was flavourful and slightly nutty.

Pudi Masala Thosai: 5/5
Crispy on one side and soft on the other. Cheesy taste from the thosai likely from ghee. The pudi spice blend is savoury and quite spicy. The potato filling was really flavourful, soft, slightly sweet from the onions, very tasty.

Sambar: 5/5
The sambar was flavourful, bright, spicy and slightly sweet.

Chutney: 5/5
Green chutney was flavourful, coconuty and slightly minty.

Total score: 15/15

Add-ons: Uddin Vada ($3.24) was extremely delicious. Insanely crispy thin outer shell and soft inside. Filter Coffee ($3.20) was fragrant, tasty and a wonderful way to end the meal.

I first ordered the Plain Thosai, finished it before I made my order for the remaining Pudi masala thosai, Uddin Vada and filter coffee. Not sure if it was coincidental or just amazing service but the Pudi masala thosai came next, and when I was just about finish, the Vada came. And shortly before I finished the filter coffee came. I was extremely impressed at the end of my meal.

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Good indian food, quick service and great hospitality by the staff. We had dal tadka, paneer kadhai, roti and rice, the food was tasty, good quality and portion size. Paneer unexpectedly was quite soft and creamy. A meal for 4 would cost anywhere between 65-80 SGD.

The 'Shish Mahal' Indian restaurant was just across the road from the Ibis hotel we were staying at, and we visited it three times, having some delicious curries there and cool beers.

Very inexpensive for Singapore, with excellent staff who made us feel really at home, and kept offering us additional titbits.  It's a great place to eat, and the area around it - 'Albert Court' is very interesting.

Came here for a late night snack and some beer. While they were kind enough to accommodate my order despite the kitchen being closed, the cheese balls were still cold at the core. Beers are fresh and cheap tho. Would come again for that.

Was given complimentary papadam which was really nice! The chicken briyani was fragrant and flavourful and was nice to have together with the palak paneer and garlic naan!

The staff was also very friendly and helpful!

Good place to  eat indian and nepali food.
Price is reasonable .Staff are receptive on your request. Atmosphere is amicable . You have choice for both indoor and outdoor. cheers

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Really nice food with an interesting dining concept. Loved sitting on the floor upstairs. The chef / owner was lovely. I think my favorite dish was the butter chicken, but honey everything we tried was lovely. The samosas and the tandoori chicken were also great. Yum!

WOW! Where do I even begin… easily one of the best, most delicious places to eat out I’ve ever been to! Great and authentic setting, delicious Indian cuisine and lovely staff to make you feel like home. The spicy challenge is so fun and the taste of the food there is simply out of this world! A must visit if you happen to be in Singapore!

Had an incredible time here! My group stumbled in not knowing at all what was in store for us.

We first of all were impressed that this place made the Michelin List so many years in a row, and then we saw the hilarious Spice Challenge and were intrigued with all of the fun events this place hosts like the Full Moon Nights & the cooking classes. The owner/chef was so awesome. He was so funny and sarcastic and also encouraged us to get out of our American-Indian comfort zone and wouldn’t let us all just order Tikka Masala as we originally planned, and because of that, it turns out I found authentic Indian food I loved even more! I really wish I lived here so I could take the cooking classes with him!

Many thanks for providing our group with such an entertaining experience and pushing us out of our comfort zones. It was truly a time!

An amazing and authentic environment with unique deliveries of classic dishes. They have a sauce heat sampler platter to see what heat level you like.  There's a challenge wall for those seeking immortality as well. But the naan and sauces are too notch. A must try. The proprietors are amazing and have a fun sense of humo(u?)r.

Changed my perception of Indian food in Singapore : well-curated, small portion size, so I didn't feel stuffy while digesting and a bit pricy. Masala tea was better than I had in Mumbai but it would have been perfect if the sugar was on the side.

Indian restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Most authentic and flavourful North Indian food experience so far in Singapore… no extra spices, oil or colour… only fresh juicy mild aroma and taste 👌🏻

Best part was that they served everything one by one, so that we could eat and enjoy at leisure and relish the sizzling hot dishes :)

First time here! Amazing food and service! Definitely coming back!

Lots of options, portion is just nice as well 👌

Personal favourite tonight was the Goan Fish!

A really homely establishment serving delectable Indian dishes at affordable prices relative to other places.

The paneer masala was rich and perfect with the Naan basket. The mutton biryani was rich and tender. Accompanied with the Malai chicken kebab, which was served on a sizzling hot plate that oozed rich flavours. Finally, the Gulab Jamun was rich and fragrant without exceedingly sweet. Topped with the Mango milkshake served with passion, the food was downed with great enjoyment.

Come on down if you are in the vicinity, you won’t regret it.

The food was excellent, the service exquisite. Thanks to the waiter we ordered incredibly good food. The Goan fish curry was probably the best I ever had. The mint chutney was very strong in taste, hence it was the first time I ever really appreciated it as an appetizer sauce.

Would definitely recommend, way better than expected.

Love their lamb rack briyani. The briyani was not too oily, flavourful and lamb rack was succulent. Lamb was not gamey at all. Their lassi and dal makhni were very rich in flavour. They have a variety of sauces to complement different dishes which pairs very well. It's affordable for such quality Indian food.
Service crew were very polite and attentive.
