Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
We originally came for peeking duck, but the waitress advised us that it would be too much food for the two of us, which I appreciated! We got one of the chefs menus instead. My favorite was the chili prawns and my least favorite was the fried rice, it just wasn't anything special compared to the other dishes.

Service was great and they even set up a kids place setting for our baby, which was sweet, even though he is much too young for solid foods.

The food was mediocre at best, but the service was good. We made a reservation for seven beforehand, yet the table we were assigned was extremely small, could not even fit the dishes we ordered.

Compared to other Chinese restaurants in this price bracket, such as those at the Ritz Carlton and Hilton, this dining experience left much to be desired.

BBQ Meat Combination 2/5
Steamed Star Groupa 2.5/5
Peking Duck 3/5
Sweet and Sour Pork 4/5
Stir fried Kai Lan 1/5

One of the best Peking ducks ever! Please note that all other dishes, despite the high price, are portions for one pax only.

Very expensive but worth the Michelin star!

Fantastic restaurant, small portion but really great. I would say, 烧腊 is the best!!!!!!! Highly recommended for family gathering or special occasions.

Peking Duck was the highlight here. Level up with a touch of caviar. The duck here is more lean and crisp but I do think a little of fat adds to the flavour. Still good nonetheless.

Had a soup (meh, especially for that price) and a Soft Shell Crab with Crab Meat (which was yums, creamy but not to the point of being jelak, guess it helped that we shared instead of having 1 each) and a refreshing petite fours of Osmanthus Jelly and Pineapple Tart.

The complimentary birthday cake was delish too, reminded much of Ritz's Royal Caraibe from 20 years back. Dark bittersweet choc mousse on a layer of caramelised crunch. Service was top notch, attentive yet but imposing, always there but invisibly.
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Jiang-Nan Chun

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
My husband located this restaurant on Google maps, it was about 10 minutes walking distance from our hotel. It is situated on the 5th floor of a shopping mall and closes at 10pm. Last order is at 9.30pm.

We shared a starter of crispy crab and prawn rolls. They came separately wrapped with red and green sauce.

I had a lamb rack (one lamb cutlet to be precise) on a bed of potato and vegetables. My husband had braised sliced duck for one person with steamed rice. The food was nice and the service was quick. The plates were not hot, so the food became cold very quickly.

The wine is expensive, but always is in Singapore. More cost effective to buy a bottle.

The chrysanthemum and jasmine tea was nice.

I had always wanted to try this restaurant. But it’s always skipped my mind when I’m at paragon due it’s located at level 5.

So this time round, I’m very focus to go to this restaurant with the purposeful trip down to paragon.

As much as I’m excited and anticipated for this restaurant, it starts to turn me off little by little as i walked in, when we’re seated to our table, we could smell a strong damp and moldy stench arising from their carpet floor… this is a killer for our dining experience in there.

Apart from that, the food definitely still maintain its Michelin standard (though the Michelin was no longer accredited in 2023), also we like the “old” staffs working there, the service from the traditional Chinese restaurant where you can experience, they know their stuffs, and they do know how to talk to customers. Had a great chat with the staff as well.

I guess the restaurant really need to upgrade n change their carpet.

Food was okay, nothing too grand or special. Of all the dishes we got, I would only highly recommend the sweet, sour and crispy fried mushrooms. The kangkong was good.

Servers were very attentive and helpful with the recommendations. Although as a tourist, we didn’t know that every refill of our tea would be charged and they kept refilling without us asking them to - ended up paying $20 for hot water refills.

Atmosphere was okay also, walkway going inside the restaurant gave it a good vibe.

Nice place to have dimsum with families ablnd friend inside Paragon mall. Many choices of dimsum. It is not a big restaurant but a very nice decoration. It was in the Michelin guide. The restaurant was not busy when we arrived. The service is good and workers are friendly.  It serves typical dimsum dishes like other dimsum restaurants. It also  serves regular chinese dishes.  We order multiple dimsum dishes, and foods are delicious. If you order lo mai kai, it will take about 20 minutes  to prepare. Other dimsum items were ready pretty quickly. I like the chicken feet. It is better than the one we have in the States.  It was soft and tastes so good. Other dimsums items are good too but not like wow.  Overall I like this restaurant and the service.

Extended family dinner to welcome back our nephew and niece who are studying in UK, back to Singapore on summer break. The food was great and service was good, prompt, attentive and friendly. We've been here several times and always had good experience.
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Crystal Jade Golden Palace

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
I have been wanting to try the food here and finally I did - after making advanced booking for a weekend slot about a month in advance. The dishes are good and unlike other restaurants serving Chinese Dim Sum, the place feels tranquil and quiet despite that the place is full on a Sunday lunch time. Great place for gathering and catch up over food.

Ordered a variety of dim sum, all were really good except the egg tarts (mini and not the best). The price of their dim sum is pretty on par with other places but yet the fillings so generous and you can taste the fresh quality in their ingredients used. My favourite was the steamed glutinous rice, we even ordered a second serving! Service staff were quite busy and not easy to reach hence the slight markdown on service. Otherwise it’s a good experience and we will be back.

Came here as we got 50% discount. Arrived here at 1.45pm. We didn’t order too many dim sum as we ordered the Irish duck n noodles for 2pax. It’s a mistake. Maybe we came late. The duck skin was a disappointment not crispy at all. Half a duck cost $65 before discount. Instead the dim sum were much nicer especially the steam ones. I would enjoy better if we ordered more dim sum. The ambience was nice and service was good.

Ordered dim sum.
Food
Overall okay for food. Duck was quiet hard to bite maybe they could cook medium well . For desert we got mango sago. Maybe they could add ice-cream to it.
Service
Waitress and waiter both recommended food that were amazing. The waiter even taught us how to use our Amex voucher.
Atmosphere wise
Waiter led us to a room.
It was quite hot inside as most pf the air conditioning were outside .
Would definitely come back here.

Lovely dim sum lunch today at Wan Hao for our family of 4 with 2 kids.  The Irish duck was tender and juicy. The servers didn't push for us to order more expensive dishes like we experience in some other restaurants who try very hard to cross sell. The service was attentive and polite. I loved that it was also quiet and elegant for our lunch.
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Wan Hao Chinese Restaurant

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
*A cosy popular place (well established and highly accessible in Orchard Rd area) to gather with family and friends to savour exquisite dim-sum as well as its signature Beijing roasted duck!
*Prices have gone up somewhat apparently; nonetheless, the memories of dining there would be priceless.
*Attentive staff provided meticulous service.

The Duck is just superb and to die for. Definitely must order this.
Another dish highly recommended would be the Beef Dices and Roast Pork. crispy and solid -👍
Others dishes are nice too and prices tends to be on the higher side.
So impressed with this ⭐Auntie Li Yong ⭐ whom was serving our table. (Hope i got her name correct)
She was so efficient and on the ball, service was just Top Notch, making sure my 2 kids are well taken care of also. And what surprised me was she is just on a Part Time Basis as she is busy on family matters. Wow.
Excellent service from all staff and top notch dinning experience.
👍👍👍👍👍

Great service and the peking duck is one of the best I've tasted. The chef managed to cut the duck into the same thickness and size as the cucumbers so that it is asthetically pleasing and a delight to eat. Only complain if I were to nitpick is that the wrapper for the peking duck breaks easily.

Every dish was good. Especially the fried soon hock. Though this fried fish dish turned out to be more expensive than the duck.

Family friendly place good for gatherings, the young and the old.

Made a reservation for Imperial Treasure Super Peking Duck because they were touted as serving the best Peking duck in Singapore. The duck required advance order and this can be done while making the reservation.

The duck skin was indeed very crispy but I found the meat rather bland, but who eats Peking duck for the meat anyway? The rest of the dishes I ordered were quite ordinary but that may be because they were ordinary dishes to begin with.

Not very likely for me to return..

Delectable Peking duck with crispy skin and tender juicy meat as expected from their speciality. Quite an experience to have a chef preparing the duck for us. The fried mince duck meat, fried rice and other dishes were great as well. Recommend this restaurant if you’d like to try Peking duck.
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Imperial Treasure Super Peking Duck

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
Since opening in The St. Regis Singapore hotel in December 2007, Yan Ting restaurant has been a stalwart of the Chinese Cantonese fine dining scene, the epitome of extravagance and luxury. These days, there are plenty of Chinese fine dining restaurants around, but Yan Ting has certainly stepped up their game, remaining a premium dining destination of choice, serving well-executed and refined gastronomic delights on each plate.
.
Ambience at Yan Ting is opulent. The grandeur of the interior exudes a classy elegance, without being too over the top. The tastefully arranged layout is suitable for business or private dining, and the decor enhances the overall ambience without being too loud. I also like the bright ambient lighting, which isn't too harsh or dim. The pearl marble floors and plush furnishings feel sophisticated and comfortable.
.
Service at Yan Ting restaurant is professional, discreet, and polite. Staff may not make much conversation, but they are attentive and observant. The accord each table good attention, answering queries, fulfilling requests, serving orders, and proactively clearing finished plates with finesse. Communication in English or Chinese Mandarin is decent. Felt very well treated here.
.
Food at Yan Ting follows the Chinese Cantonese philosophy of freshness of ingredients, little usage of herbs, and well balanced dishes that are naturally flavourful but not greasy. Yan Ting restaurant prepares classic Chinese Cantonese dishes according to time-honoured recipes, but presents them in beautiful contemporary style.
.
Portions are sized for individuals, but dishes are best shared. Prices are high. Prepare to splurge, budget about SGD $245 per person for a meal here.

Food was great and yummy! We ordered their signature set menu and enjoyed it. All the dishes were on point, not too salty and oily. Overall we enjoyed and will come back for their dim sum!

Visited Yan Ting to celebrate a birthday, but was left disappointed by the standard of service. Food was decent, but nothing to shout about.

We were seated at around 6.15pm, and ordered 4 set meals and half a Peking duck within 5 minutes. We waited for almost half an hour for the appetiser to be served, and similarly waited for approximately half an hour for the following courses. At 8.30pm, we had not yet been served our main courses, and decided to get the main courses to go and to get dessert served instead.

As for the Peking duck, we were served the Peking duck pancakes shortly after our appetiser. We opted for the second serving to be served as chopped duck, which I assume would have been sliced together with the first serving. However, we yet again had to wait another half an hour for the meat to be served, which meant that it was cold by then.

What disappointed us the most was the level of service provided by one particular staff, Steven. While serving the dishes, it felt that he was simply dropping or tossing our plates onto the table. What shocked us the most was when he presented the bill, he seemed to throw the bill onto the table, pointing at the line for the signature without saying anything! When we asked if there was any way to give feedback, he said that there was none other than leaving our feedback online.

To Yan Ting’s credit, the managers Bruce and Fiona did try their best to offer service recovery as we were leaving and apologised on behalf of their server.

For the price point that Yan Ting is charging, we would have expected better trained staff, as well as better serving processes. Overall, not an experience we would expect from a highly rated restaurant and not a restaurant we would likely visit again.

We were here on our vegetarian routine day. Even though they don’t have many selections of the vegetarian dishes. You can ask them for the off menu. They will customise for you. We ordered hot and sour soup, truffle tofu, Gongbao vegetarian chicken, fried mushrooms Mien, and stir fried vegetables. Every dishes were tasty. However you might need to wait for up to 30-45 mins to serve your food.

We were hosted to lunch here, and the place was packed at 12 noon, so much so that reservations are a must.  One negative is that the place was too loud, with so many people talking, that I ended up with a headache.  Having a normal-level conversation was quite difficult.

Service was quite warm and quick, and the waitstaff were always quick to top up our teas.

The food was generally of a high standard, though some meat dishes were rather tough.  The pork jowl done charsiu style was tasty, but some pieces were tough to bite through or chew.  Similarly, not all pieces of the stir fried beef, which was delish, were soft.

The xiqolong bao was nce, but the standout dish for me was the siew mai. We ordered desserts of sago with mango , and quilingao, both of which made for a sweet ending to the meal.
Chinese food in Singapore.address: 29 Tanglin Rd, Level 1U The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247912
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Yan Ting

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
I absolutely loved the food, especially the beef and scallops! The Chinese 8-course meal left me completely satisfied, and the service was excellent. The table setup provided a sense of privacy for our group, making the dining experience even more enjoyable

Came here for birthday dinner and had the Daffodil dinner set which should be popular since many other patrons ordered the same.

Would give 6/5 if we could. Food is fantastic. Service is attentive. Ambience is romantic. Price is value for money given the quality of the dishes. All worth it to put up credit card authorisation for the reservation ahead of time.

Looking forward to coming back again next time.

Eating area is dim, and stiff

Service and serving of food was shockingly slow in which a multiple dishes had to be checked multiple times & server could not give adequate response or update, shirking responsibility to kitchen. Dish orders were missing/forgotten.

It was overall very frustrating and really tested patience when both trying to consistently check and lunch time was unneceasarily extended.
It was also difficult to get attention of server

If you do not know how to speak Chinese, do avoid this place as likely to struggle communicating to server

Food only looks pretty but you can take it as a given that all the main cooked big dishes will have a lot of oil & salt.. best to make special request to exclude

Definitely not worth the $70++ per head when food, service, waiting time was ridiculous.

Do get better tasting dim sum or chinese food elsewhere & for cheaper

We went for the weekday dim sum lunch buffet because they are going to discontinue buffet soon! Love the quiet atmosphere and service was good.
Most dishes are delicious. Buddha jump over the wall is a must try soup - rich and tasty. I like the truffles charsiew bao and crispy wanton - unique. The porridge was disappointing and bland. Roast duck is so so. But we really enjoyed the desserts!

Heard so much about Hai Tien Lo restaurant. Went there for dinner. Fine dining Chinese restaurant to be exact. We ordered the set dinner and we were surprised by each dish. Beautifully displayed in an artistic manner. Each bite of the dish bursting with different tastes and senses to the tongue. Each dish was painstakingly prepared and you could taste the real flavour of the ingredients. No flavour enhancer, natural, genuine taste from the combined ingredients brought out from the chef’s skillful cooking. Check out the photos of the dishes I had.                                     The smoked fried chicken was excellent! You can smell the faint smell of smokiness. The skin so thoroughly fried and wafer thin, dipped into the special sauce, sour, sweet and a hint of spiciness, so freshing, a brilliant combination that brought out a whole new experience to my taste buds and senses. Other dishes were equally surprising and excites my taste and senses. Service was attentive and polite. I will make it a point to come again when the menu changes. I want to be surprised, I want my taste and sense to be excited!
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Hai Tien Lo

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
First time here and came without making a reservation on a Saturday evening about  8pm.  The restaurant was full but fortunately we waited for only around 10 minutes.   Was quote sceptical because I saw many foreigners and thought this could be tourist trap.  I was wrong,  the claypot pig liver is super delicious and the braise fish head is so flavourful.  This is indeed a very good Cantonese restaurant.

If you’re looking for Chinese restaurant with amazing food and friendly service, look no further than this hidden gem. I recently had the pleasure of dining at this spot and was blown away by the quality of their dishes.
The beef meat teow with wok hey was outstanding. Beef was so tender and portion size was generous, even for the smallest option on the menu.
Next up was the roasted duck, which was an absolute standout. The skin was perfectly crispy and meat was tender and flavorful.
Finally, I have to mention the cereal prawn ball, no hassle at all in removing the shell and  flavorful prawns.
Restaurant was the friendly and welcoming atmosphere.
If you’re in the mood for some truly Chinese cuisine, look no further than this spot.

Came here because of the online reviews and  partly we were nearby. The foods are hit and miss. Can order the fried beef kway teow, vegetable and home-made tofu. Will not recommend the Indonesia curry chicken and the roast duck, roast pork and char siew combo.

Food is served quick and they are delicious! Place can be loud sometimes due to the occasional loud talking and laughing by other customers but I would definitely recommend coming here for the food.

Whilst visiting Singapore, my friend took me to lunch at his favourite cantonese restaurant. I can understand why - friendly, warm service and absolutely delicious food served with a smile. The fried rice, sweet and sour pork and special tofu were particularly  notable - all of the plates went back to the kitchen absolutely clean
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Wing Seong Fatty's Restaurant

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
Definitely a traditional Chinese restaurant to visit.. food are good and most importantly their service make you feel at home. Will like to compliment Ms Sharine that taken care of our table, she is always with the warm smile when we came into the restaurant till the end. She will take care of what you need and look into all small details that you will feel very welcome in this restaurant. Thumb up and continue the good works!! 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Food was good. We were craving for good dim sum and my friend recommended me this one. We don’t speak Chinese (I speak a little), but the servers are very nice people and gave a lot of smiles even though they’re covered by their masks. Will keep coming back in future ❤️

Wife and I decided to finally visit this iconic restaurant today. Feels like stepping into a little time capsule the moment you entered the restaurant; greeted by those old ShangHai music and bustling noise from the dinners. We ordered this recommend dishes, steam cabbage with scallop, roast chicken with minced prawn, popiah and crispy yam seafood bowl…(lol, English names don't do justice to the dishes’ auspicious Chinese names). Food tasted great with loads of fresh ingredients, clean profile and right about of spices you expect when dining in a fine Cantonese restaurant. Service was on par with the food, speedy and responsive, our tea cup was nvr empty. (btw, their lychee Long Jing tea was really nice too!)

Price is on the higher end but was not unexpected. Frankly this place can be classified as a one michillen star restaurant.

Planning next trip already!

4.25 stars but a touch expensive even when you try do it on the cheap. Located opposite China point it's apparently one of the oldest restaurants in Singapore. When I first saw the menu it had some extremely expensive items on there. Like $1200 for abalone with something. This being well out of our price bracket we ordered the birds nest, popiah, broccoli, rice and a full duck. It was about S$250 to feed 5 of us. We drank tea. We didn't finish it all as it was more than anticipated. Food was great. Nice to see a lazy Susan on the table.

I have made the right decision to celebrate my mother’s birthday at this Chinese restaurant with a long standing history of serving delicious traditional Chinese foods! My parents loved the old school ambience and the 1960s music.

We would like to especially thanks and compliment the manager, Gao Bo, for the top-notched and impeccable service! He was extremely friendly, attentive, and going extra miles to ensure our dinner is comfortable. Really appreciate his thoughtful setup for the birthday cake after our dinner (see picture).

My family and I will definitely come back again!
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Spring Court Chinese Restaurant

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
The restaurant offered a charming ambiance with its tasteful decor and welcoming atmosphere.

The service was exceptional; the staff was attentive. Our orders arrived promptly, and each dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavors. I highly recommend trying the foie gras and crab roe soup- it was an absolute delight!

Would definitely recommend to anyone seeking a memorable dining experience.

Incredible place for lunch! Such a beautiful atmosphere accompanied by beautiful food.

Had the half duck with the first course in pancakes (not pictured) and the second course wrapped in lettuce which was a great way to freshen up our palettes. The stir fried prawns in chili sauce is an absolute must and no wonder it’s one of their signature dishes. The buns to accompany and soak up any leftover sauce were great, we would’ve gotten more but didn’t want to fill up!

The sautéed wagyu beef with cumin was so aromatic and the meat extremely tender, and the fried rice with pork and seafood was delicious and equally portioned out for the three of us.

We had a fantastic time, the service was impeccable and we hope to come back soon.

Shisen Hanten beautifully blends the bold flavors of Sichuan cuisine with Japanese inspiration, all while offering traditional Cantonese dishes.

Their Mapo Tofu is amazing I would return here just for this dish. The perfect blend of spicy and savoury, with tender tofu bathed in a flavorful sauce, makes it a must-try. Their vegetable dishes are equally impressive. Here, the true essence of the vegetables shines through, highlighting their natural flavors and freshness.

Service at Shisen Hanten is impeccable, with attentive staff adding to the overall dining experience. Their commitment to ensuring your satisfaction enhances the enjoyment of the meal.

Genuinely enjoyed the lunch here and the staff are very friendly, service was impeccable!! My mum has many food requests and the staff (Penny, Doris and Yvonne) were very accomodating to them. Penny was especially patient in suggesting different menu changes and making sure nothing was amiss during our meal. The lunch set menu was also pretty worth the price. Paid a bit more for the lobster but it was really fresh and tasted amazing with the sauce!

Fine dining time, and we love it. It's the most beautiful Chinese restaurant in Singapore. We have a great experience with the selection dishes that offer from Chef. It is kind of spicy but good to go.
Chinese food in Singapore.address: 333 Orchard Rd, Level 35 Hilton Singapore Orchard, Singapore 238867
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Shisen Hanten by Chen Kentaro

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
We had their weekend dim sum buffet. The service and food were incredible. Shirley, Maggie and Chin Chin were amazing hosts, recommending dishes and ensuring that we were well taken care of.

Great place for your family dinners. I will definitely come again soon! :)

Shirley, Maggie and ChinChin service were impressive. Very attentive in service and clearing plates. Chef also put on a goof fire show for the pork dish. Every item served was explained well. They also provided a cake from my mum’s birthday.
Many thanks to the team!

The menu at Man Fu Yuan is a celebration of exquisite Chinese cuisine, and it showcases the artistry and passion of the talented chefs. The array of dishes offered caters to various palates, ensuring there's something to delight everyone. Whether you're a fan of traditional favorites or seeking innovative culinary creations, this restaurant has it all.

The service at Man Fu Yuan deserves special mention. The staff members were attentive, knowledgeable, and passionate about their craft. They took the time to explain each dish, offering valuable insights into the flavors and ingredients. Their attention to detail and genuine enthusiasm contributed to the overall exceptional dining experience.

The ambiance of the restaurant is sophisticated and elegant, with tasteful decor and comfortable seating. The soothing background music added to the overall relaxing atmosphere, creating the perfect setting for a special evening with loved ones or an important business gathering.

Man Fu Yuan Restaurant is a gem that should not be missed. From the exquisite cuisine to the impeccable service and delightful ambiance, every aspect of this dining establishment exceeded my expectations. Whether you're a connoisseur of Chinese cuisine or simply seeking an exceptional dining experience, I highly recommend visiting Man Fu Yuan Restaurant. It is an indulgence for the senses and a culinary journey that will leave a lasting impression.

Service is good there, the 6 courses meal will get 5 stars if not because of the lobster with crispy rice noodle dish. While the lobster is fresh and the texture good, the noodle spoilt the dish with the fried noodle taste like rancid oil, disappointed. Other than this dish, all other dishes are up to standard. Recommended the Man fu yuan appetizer.

Celebrating my daughter birthday Food was awesome. Was serve by a very friendly and attentive staff named Maggie Yong. She was so attentive in her details and ensuring the celebration of my daughter birthday a success one
Chinese food in Singapore.address: 80 Middle Road Level 2 InterContinental Singapore, Singapore 188966
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Man Fu Yuan Restaurant

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
This is the quintessential Cantonese dim sum place with consistent quality and selection. We’ll come by whenever we crave solidly good dim sum. Mind you the pricing is not cheap - see latest dim sum menu in picture. The roast duck is tender, juicy and not too fatty. Top it off with fantastic service, no wonder this place remains popular.

We basically picked Carlton because of Wah Lok. We hated Carlton, but loved this restaurant and ended up eating here twice. Highly recommended. Egg tarts were very traditionally good and can easily have it by the dozens. No picture of egg tarts simply because they were gone before I had a chance.

Visited on a Saturday 1pm for dim sum. Overall it is okay, but not as fantastic like it used to be.

Food is decent but not fantastic, I'm talking from dim sum perspective and not main Chinese dishes.

Service is good, maybe primarily I avoided the lunch crowd and not too much ppl at that hour of 1pm+ for weekend.

Atmosphere is hotel restaurant style where you have padded floor and it's a nice environment, not too noisy as compared to other restaurants.

There are better dim sum restaurant out there and not likely I will visit this restaurant. But I'll recommend for dinner, it is a nice place to host friends, colleagues, family, but never the dim sum.

The staff were very attentive, they talk to clients with professional smile. However, I think the food I had was not impressive giving the high end price. We ordered half roasted duck, french beef cube$36, and fried squid… the portion was so small, especially the duck cost $44, only 8-9 thin pieces. For a glass of water they charged for $2 (staff did not mention it when we order), a small portion of peanut charged for $5 (did not mention too)…Not recommended, there is better duck place in town..

First of all, just want to say that Wah Lok is still my most loved Chinese restaurant in SG. The food is excellent and they stick to their tradition of making good food. However they did disappoint me in one aspect on my last dinner there. Ordered the abalone based on the menu and when it came, the slice abalone just looked pathetic in comparison. Upon checking with the manager, his explanation was that there was a word sliced in the order and picture was only for illustration (by the way, my order was the closest to the name on the picture). To me, this is downright misrepresentation and it really irks me that they could make such a big mistake and ruin their otherwise perfectly good track record. I hope the management quickly rectify such mistakes and live up to its fine history.
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Wah Lok Cantonese Restaurant

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
A special treat for my Queen 👸 I love the fish braised fish maw - pleasantly surprise to see how well done and chewy it was! The sea grouper fillet was good too. I love the homemade noodles - perfect for the occasion. The only blemish was the Spanish pork was a tad too salty. But the attentiveness of the service staff + atmosphere saved the day 😘 Definitely back for dim sum soon. Thank you.

We had family dinner here tonight. This is one of the famous names that's been around for decades. Amazing - only the best can survive the test of time, economic cycles, and crisis. And lei garden is one of these names!

The food, service, and overall experience reflect its Michelin awards consistently received over the years.

Delicious in every menu that I ordered  especially fried/grilled food.
Menu that I like are crispy pork, abalone, fried scallop, and zucchini with pork. Moreover, mango sago and sesame ball are so good!

All the dishes didn't fail us. We tried Peking duck and roast duck. Both are nice and we didn't regret ordering.  Love it and already recommended it to many friends. We were served by Fong and we were served greatly by her and others. Thank you

Its one restaurant to go for fine authentic Cantonese Cuisines and Dim Sum dishes from HK, since 1987 in SG.

For me, i like their array of dim sum dishes that include Deep-Fried Scallop, Siew Mai, Crystal Dumpling and Deep-Fried Shrimp Wonton that are good in terms of texture and flavours.

Others like Carrot Cake, Lotus Rice and Xiao Long Bao needs more attention from the chefs to not overcooked them and to serve them at correct temperature.

Overall, restaurant has an elegant setting with modern oriental influence, but semi-circle bench sofa not comfortable. Service staffs wasnt attentive and impatient, probably due the overwhelming crowd on Sunday afternoon.
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Lei Garden Restaurant (Chijmes)

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
I came here to have my birthday lunch with my Godma and my two kids on 16 Nov 2023.

With the prices charged at $39.95++ per adult and $23.80++ per child, I thought we would have better options but I was wrong. Even my two kids are not impressed or satisfied with the food here.

The dim sum items for unlimited orders are really not enough to choose from and I don’t see any dumplings with scallops or other fillings but mainly prawns or pork. Verdict for dumplings: 7/10 (nice but not impressed)

Soup is limited to one serving per pax so we ordered 3 Shark’s fin soup and 1 Sweet Corn & Carrot soup. Soup is delicious but sadly can only order once. Verdict for soup: 9/10

Mains is limited to order of 3 items once only so we ordered garlic roasted chicken, sliced fish with seasonal veg and wok-fried prawns with pine mushrooms. Food is delicious but portion for the chicken is slightly smaller than expected. Verdict for mains: 8/10

Lastly, we are told to order desserts for last order. I wanted to try out the Warm Red Bean Bisque but it is unavailable so kind of disappointed so I ordered the Chilled Osmanthus Jelly instead. My Godma ordered the Chilled Mango Cream with Sago and Pomelo. Verdict for desserts: 6/10 (not bad but not impressed)

Complains: No restroom inside this restaurant, have to use the public toilet in the building or at the MRT station which is a distance away.

I will definitely not return to this restaurant or recommend to anyone as it is too expensive and too much restriction in their ordering and there is no special item such as lobster or scallops or abalone or bamboo clams.

Lunch dim sum Buffet review- Food is decent. Service is excellent. Shark fin soup, dumplings and egg tarts are fantastic.

However I do have some complains:
- Xiao long bao is restricted to 1 serving per table. Meaning only 1 pc per person!
- no steamed pork ribs
- the e-fu noodles are dry and tasteless.
- some orders, mainly the fried ones are forgotten.

Went for weekend dim sum buffet. Ran into other customers who also went to the wrong restaurant. Would be great if they place a signage at the grand restaurant to redirect customers to the dimsum place. Sufficient variety but nothing that stands out. Good place for your first dim sum buffet if you have more people and you can order different items.

Celebrated my grandmother's birthday on a public holiday. There was 4 wait staff and 3-4 tables of customers, service was sufficiently quick. Food was very good, except the peking duck not crispy and ice sweet and sour pork not cold enough. There are many food items which look good on photo.

1st time trying. Just next to Farrer Park MRT station. Food is generally good, service  staff are friendly and the serving speed is within 15 mins. The deep fried kueh teow is special, but if you wanna eat it crispy, should not pour too much sauce on it, else, it will be soggy pretty fast.

Think there is Amex promotion going on , 50% discount for 2 paxs, 33% discount for 3 paxs, and 25% discount for 4 paxs, etc.
Chinese food in Singapore.address: 1 Farrer Park Station Rd, #01-14/15/16 One Farrer Hotel Connexion, Singapore 217562
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Jia He Chinese Restaurant

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
Peach Blossoms truly impressed me with its modern Asian cuisine. The dishes were not only delicious but also beautifully presented. The attentive service added to the overall positive experience. The clean and well-laid-out atmosphere, especially in the private room, created a delightful dining environment. A must-visit for those seeking a perfect blend of taste, presentation, and ambiance. I just wish there was a dedicated server in the room at all times to assist with topping up the tea and offering water automatically.

The dim sum and Chinese dishes are pretty good. Some of the dishes are unique (can’t get it elsewhere) so worth it to come here for the food. However, the restaurant felt very understaffed. Food came fast but when we needed to get help from the waiters, it took quite a while.

The presentation of the dishes was impeccable, and the flavors were simply delightful.

The smoky char siew, in particular, was a highlight of the meal. Its perfect balance of smokiness and tenderness made it an unforgettable dish that I would highly recommend to anyone visiting this establishment.

What truly elevated my visit was the exceptional service provided by Desmond. His attentiveness and professionalism went above and beyond to ensure our dining experience was exceptional. I highly recommend this restaurant for a fantastic culinary experience!

Great service and impressively plated and flavoured food! Got the set menu and loved the crispy fish skin - soup tasted like the crab accompaniment. Dessert (not pictured) was melon balls with Hokkaido milk, very refreshing after a filling sequence of dishes.

The most creative dish of the night goes to the signature cigar roll. Overall, interesting blend of flavors though some can taste 'heavy'. Food is good, service is prompt and professional
Chinese food in Singapore.address: 6 Raffles Blvd, Level 5 PARKROYAL COLLECTION Marina Bay, Singapore 039594
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Peach Blossoms

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
From the moment my guests and I stepped into Min Jiang, we were greeted with an ambiance that promised a dining experience to remember. The food was nothing short of exquisite, each dish a masterpiece of flavors, beautifully presented and crafted with the finest ingredients.

What stood out as much as the culinary delights was the top-notch service. The staff were not only welcoming and attentive but also meticulous in their service. Their commitment to ensuring our comfort was evident through the constant refilling of our tea, which was done discreetly and efficiently, ensuring that our conversation flowed uninterrupted just like the tea in our cups.

The staff’s professionalism contributed to the overall sophistication of the evening. The harmonious blend of delicious food and excellent service at Min Jiang truly sets the gold standard for fine dining. It’s a restaurant I would recommend without hesitation and one that I eagerly look forward to revisiting.

Came here to celebrate friend’s birthday. Service staff is really attentive and environment is pleasant. Enjoyed the soup made with the remainder of the duck. Overall it’s an enjoyable fine dining experience.

Went for lunch on a Monday after getting married! The atmosphere was fantastic as the moment you step in, you are greeted by the friendly service staff and shown to your seat. The decor and design of the restaurant was beautiful and had a very tranquil feel to it.

We had the privilege of being served by Ms Lin Leng Lyang, who was professional and warm throughout the whole lunch. She  gave great recommendations for our party size, and we were all full but not over stuffed by the end of the lunch.

The food itself was really delicious, and I had way more than what I uploaded in the photos, but we were more interested in eating the dishes as soon as they hit the table. Overall, you won't go wrong with anything you order here.

Pricing is, of course, slightly to the higher side, not your everyday lunch or dinner option, but you definitely pay for what you get!

10/10 would go back for special occasions!

A wonderful evening spent in one of the most beautiful and homey restaurant in Singapore. We loved the food and ambience every time we visit. The place is always bustling with life and the service is always nice. Thank you to manager Eileen for the amazing hospitality, we also would like to thank Ebenezer for taking care of us this evening. We will be back.

the roasted duck is no where comparing to what I had in Beijing. i know is not fair to say so. skin not crispy enough n didn't slice thin enough. at least too thick to dip w sugar. meat too dry. maybe sg ducks not fat enough?? no fruit/wood aroma neither...
The place is too cold. not only the air-con temperature. also the material of the furniture especially the table. im having difficulties to put my hands/elbows on the table while eating. and it makes the duck cold after Chef sliced it in front of us. totally defeat the purpose of serving it hot when it's fresh out of the oven.
anyway nice place for gathering.carrot cake n dim sum is nice. others dishes average only.
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Min Jiang at Dempsey

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
Food was overall not bad, but very disappointed that the minced crab meat ball didn’t taste of crab and had a lot of prawn in it. (It should at least taste more like crab than prawn when it cost $60 for only eight pieces.) The signature Teochew dumpling was good though, with its fragrantly fried pork, mushrooms and chives filling.

The freshness and quality of food is not as great as compared to other branch. The beef has a stagnant smell and it does not has a great texture as compared to raffles town club Chinese restaurant and imperial Peking at paragon. The dim sum is not flavourful and the texture is not great too. The quality is surprisingly not fantastic. The ambience is not that bad but food quality has way to go.

The waitress did not take some of my orders and we decided not to wait. In addition, she even told us the wrong information of the delicacies she is recommending after much clarification. She is so blur.

Upscale Teochew restaurant with large windows. Exorbitant prices but very small portions. Felt shortchanged. 蝦棗 prawn ball was too moist and way overpriced for the quality. 潮州蠔仔烙 was too oily. The only saving grace was the “satay” sauce stir fried beef in kailan. Beef was chunky and tender.

While the food is very good esp the marinated duck, the bamboo clams and the smoked tea chicken, I was very annoyed with the service.  Was drinking wine and wanted to take things slow but waitresses constantly trying to clear our dishes.  Please respect people who wish to drink wine and eat their meals slowly.  It’s not a hawker….

Great service. Despite being so busy staff were very attentive. Food was of high quality. Ion was a nice place to be in. Very kid friendly.
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Imperial Treasure Fine Teochew Cuisine

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
A Hidden gem around this area. First time visited Famous Treasure and the food was excellent and the service was on spots. The waiter knees that we were busy eating Chili crab so they served our veggies and Hokkien mee after we almost finish our crab. This is the first time ever I had this thoughtful service. Definitely will be back again to explore more dishes!

Didn’t know where to go for dinner at Capitol piazza, we saw this restaurant facing the escalator in front of us, we took the escalator up and went to give this restaurant a try.

From the outside, we thought it was not crowded, until we went in and realise that it was actually quite full of diners in there.

Ordered a fish head curry and roasted pork belly.

The fish head curry was hitting the spot, right on point! Tasty and the curry spice is superb!

However, the roasted pork belly, we find it falling short compared to some other Chinese restaurants out there. Hence only 4 stars were given.

Will return to try other dishes. The sambal and prawn paste chicken are exceptional. Dessert wise, I love the orh nee. It was not sweet and the flavour was perfect.
Generally, other dishes are delivered decently.
Service was warm and prompt.

We went to celebrate my dad birthday.  The food was ok but pricey. But service was not fantastic as we felt that we are being rush through the meal, the restaurant was not full, but they are constantly clearing our plates and asking if we still need it.

Went in with a large group, too bad the private room was not available when we book.

Food is ok but service is not bad. Their volcano chicken is ok a bit dry. Price is a bit higher but guess it is because of the location.
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Famous Treasure Chinese Restaurant

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
Our very regular dining place. All staff here were friendly and accommodative. They serve live seafood here and food were always tasty. The managers, Kenny, Dennis and Raymond were all very friendly. Remember to book your seat before you go.

Had dinner. Ordered 3 of the chef recommended dishes. Food average. Only the tofu is good - soft and has a tinge of egg taste. Quite special. Stew chicken with bitter gourd - despite seen a recommended dish has nothing special. The taro too is pretty tasteless and hard. The sweet and sour pork and fried rice pretty average.

Dim sum was generally good, deserving of 5 stars. BUT if I were to compare it to Empire Fine Chinese Cuisine (same level, just next door) some dishes of Empire’s dim sum are better flavoured and ingredients seems of better quality (like the roasted pork belly, duck and char siew. Empire wins hands down!!) Their char siew soh was good! Crispy yet soft, pastry and meat ratio was good! Do not order the fried white bait. It was bland and the batter tasted weird. Service was very efficient and staff were very attentive when you need something - even tho it was full house!

Came here for breakfast. My favourites are fried glutinous rice, char leong (fried fritters dough wrapped in steam rice noodle roll) and their roast pork and duck.
It's better to make reservation and all your party need to be present before they let you in because once you ordered, they serve fast and you are expected to leave once you finished and do not linger. There is always a queue even though u made reservation, you still have to wait.

Made a reservation and the staff on the line got the date wrong, but thankfully, a staff called to confirm the reservation closer to the date and that was fixed.

The food was definitely great overall! I personally really enjoyed the following:
✅ Teochew Style Crispy Noodle with Sugar & Vinegar
✅ Seafood with Vermicelli in Claypot
✅ Crispy Roasted Pork Belly
✅ Braised Tien Tsin Cabbage with Minced Ham
✅ Peking Duck

Steamed Bamboo Clam with Garlic & Chili was $18++ each and it was nice, but think it’s way too pricey. My family members also enjoyed their Chilled Pig Trotter Jelly!

Food was served promptly, piping hot and delicious! The service staff who attended to us were mostly attentive with speedy responses.

However, it was slightly frustrating as I had pre-ordered their mooncake and had made multiple requests for this to be brought to our table since we were dining in, but in the end I had to queue to collect my mooncake after the meal while my family waited for me.

Overall still a great experience and would definitely recommend!
Chinese food in Singapore.name: East Ocean Restaurant

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
A good restaurant at the Asian Civilization Museum. One of the key feature of the restaurant is the terrific view of Singapore River side. Had the set lunch and it was a sumptuous dim sum and Cantonese style dishes. Great layback ambience. Very good attentive service

Quite disappointed with the flavour or the food. Quality is good, like the prawns were juicy and fresh, but the flavour was meh. Salmon skin was incredibly crunchy though. Sure we were there for an event but expected a lot more flavour wise. Surprisingly enjoyed the black sesame ice cream.

Took the sharing 70$ tasting menu and the food was delicious , so as the view from the inside and outdoors.
Loved the deep friend salmon skin and shrimp soup. Maybe the only disappointing dish was the Empress rice but the rest was great. Good for dates and celebrations

📸 Empress, one of our favourite wedding venues to capture cherished moments! 💍✨ Not only does it boast Michelin Guide recommended cuisine (a hit with wedding guests!), but its enchanting ambiance along the scenic Singapore River is simply irresistible! 🌃✨ When night falls, the venue comes alive with stunning lighting, creating a magical atmosphere. 🌟 Also, the unique sliding doors on the exterior offer an unforgettable march-in experience for couples. 👰🤵 We highly recommend Empress to all wedding couples searching for an unforgettable venue! 🎉

Underwhelming set lunch. Portion of second course main dish was really small, the fried rice was served in a very small bowl. I'm not a big eater but I did not feel full after the three courses, not to mention my male colleagues. Not value for money. Waited quite long in between courses.
Chinese food in Singapore.address: 1 Empress Pl, #01-03 Asian Civilisations Museum, Singapore 179555
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Empress

Chinese food in Singapore.reviews:
The food quality is overall average. Lobster soup is rich in taste but the serving of the lobster is under expectation. In fact most of the dishes portion is relatively small for that price range.

Service experience is also under expectation. We sat at a place with a blind spot and the service staff are not attentive to our request. I have to walk to the counter for help. Suggest to provide some electronic buzzing system if the restaurant has under staff to serve the customer.

Came across this place via Google search.
Suppose to come here for DimSum. But only available in the afternoon.
But we still decided to stay for dinner.

Food is not bad, very well presented. Taste is pretty ok especially the chicken and the laksa prawn.

But when comes to the service by the restaurant staff, I gotta give them a lower rating. It certainly under expectations.

Firstly, they are not welcoming at all when we were at the counter waiting to be seated.

Secondly, the waiter is not attentive. They have no smile at all (which is important in service line).
When we request for tea or request him to add hot water, he just came and grab the teapot and go off with super monotonous attitude. When we say thank you, the staff don't even response at all (basically like a robot).

Therefore, I don't think we will come back again. The food is ok but definitely not the best compare to the same level restaurant elsewhere. Also the service staff and their attitude didn't impress us despite the restaurant is not busy at all (only 3 tables including our table).

Came for lunch, excellent staff service and quality food. Recommend to come 👍🏻

The food and atmosphere was good but one of the staff had a really bad attitude and kept showing us black face. One other staff was very friendly so I'll rate it as 4 stars. Maybe the first staff had a bad day 🤷🏻‍♀️

Cosy environment. Great for family gartherings. Dimsum. Lobster pumpkin soup having 1 for 1 offer. Nice. Recommended.
Chinese food in Singapore.address: 122 Middle Rd, Level 2 Mercure Singapore Bugis, Singapore 188973
Chinese food in Singapore.name: Song Garden Chinese Restaurant

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Food quality was rather disappointing. If bread can be served so hard, what else can customer expect from the rest of the dishes.
Pork loin was tough and had no veg. Mushroom soup tasted nothing like mushroom. Mussels were fresh but too salty and small. Escargots were too salty too. Duck confit was quite tender. Steak was tender but lacking in presentation. Staff were  attentive. During reservation, I indicated that it’s a friend birthday but there wasn’t any complimentary dessert or wishes on the dessert plate. On a whole, 3 of us were disappointed with the experience. Wont consider coming back.

Was lunch there on Wednesday. Expect to see less crowd since is the mid of the week , who knows they are full house throughout lunch period. Luckily we made reservation in advance.
We’ve opt for $45++ 3 course set lunch, each of us ordered different dish.
Except the poached grouper taste so so and they serve ONE piece cheese as The cheese of the day’s dessert that looks so minimalist , the whole lunch experience was great, cozy ambience, service staffs are attentive in just right way.
They serve good wine too.

Established in July 2009, Bistro Du Vin (BDV) is fully committed to delivering a truly authentic dining experience in a French Bistro. No effort or expense has been spared in creating an ambience typical of a similar establishment in France, from the furnishing right down to the convivial service style, music and memorabilia decorating its walls. Wash down the meal with a bottle of wine from Bistro Du Vin’s simple yet comprehensive wine list which features a variety of French wines.

Great food, intoxicating booze and friendly staff – what more can you ask for?

Staff were friendly and always prompt in our questions and required service. Awesome!!

Service and food was on point, love the braised beef cheek in red wine that was served in a Le Creuset pot. My friends had the duck confit and it was equally good. Ambience was nice with dimmed lighting but can get a little noisy with all the ongoing conversations from diners. Restaurant was full when we were there for dinner so best to make reservation in advance.

Delicious food. Nice environment and good service. The grilled pork rack was delicious! The meat was lean yet tender. The rib eye steak was good but a tad too salty.
French cuisine in Singapore.name: Bistro Du Vin

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
It’s my find for 2023! Hard to believe they have been around since 2011 and my circle of foodies have not tried this joint until I did.

And I fully recommend it!

Food is super! Authentic French and impressive collection of wine! Go for the lunch and dinner sets which offer fantastic value!

Would have given service and atmosphere full 5 stars but the joint is clearly understaffed although the crew can be seen doing their best! Place is a wee bit too noisy for me too.

But I definitely will return!

I had set dinner with baked Escargot in butter and parsley as entrée (🐌 it has texture like calamari, and its good), Steak au Poivre (medium rare, really good) and Chocolate mousse.

The wine list is lengthy, with prices ranging from $76 to $654. The wine list is not very useful for people who are unfamiliar with French wine, and the team does not include a sommelier.

It's a good place for family and friends gathering.

This little French restaurant at Purvis Street has been there for many years! It's still as crowded now.  So do make a reservation if you intend to dine there.

They have a 3-course set menu, which  my friends and I took. Very limited choices for starters and mains, but my favourite starter, escargot wss in it.

As the restaurant fills up, it does get a bit noisy.

Overall a good experience. The food was generally good with only some small touches to perfection. Though not super fancy, they have performed well on the basics. Service was ok. A good dining experience. Will come again. 👍

We came here to celebrate my husband's birthday. Ordered 4 dinner sets and some Ala-carte items. We all agreed that their oysters were really good, and other items were great as well. I had the duck confit several years ago but today's one did not seem to be as good as previously.
French cuisine in Singapore.name: Saveur Bistro

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
It was a nice Dinning experience, quiet and cozy, staffs are friendly, the service is fast, the food we ordered overall are good - I would like to recommend their chicken liver with bread and the main course lamb sharing! The Escargot is small and nothing special though. Next time will try their claypot duck confit, seems quite unique also.

Since it was the birthday celebration, the dessert come out with “happy birthday” which is a plus! When you make the reservation, just indicate the occasion will do.

Really a fantastic place to catch up with family and friends. They serve authentic French food in generous servings!  The staff are attentive and friendly! A must come if you are looking for amazing French food👍

nice dinning experience. Especially their snail and quail,excellent sauce. Very crispy fries. Soufflé is a must!

The star of the show at Le Bistrot Sommelier is undoubtedly the hanger steak. Cooked to perfection, the flavorful meat melts in your mouth with every bite. The chefs expertly season the steak, resulting in a dish that satisfies even the most discerning carnivores. This dish alone makes a visit to Le Bistrot Sommelier worthwhile.

Another standout item at Le Bistrot Sommelier is the Mont d'Or cheese. A true cheese lover's delight, this creamy and aromatic cheese is a culinary masterpiece. The rich, buttery texture and bold flavors make it the perfect accompaniment to a glass of fine wine. If you're a fan of cheese, the Mont d'Or at Le Bistrot Sommelier will undoubtedly be the best you have ever tasted.

The service at Le Bistrot Sommelier is nothing short of spectacular. The staff members are friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu. They go above and beyond to ensure that each guest feels welcomed and well-cared for. Whether it's recommending the perfect wine to pair with your meal or providing detailed descriptions of the dishes, the service at Le Bistrot Sommelier adds an extra layer of enjoyment to your dining experience.

Le Bistrot Sommelier offers a cozy and inviting ambiance, creating the perfect setting for a memorable dining experience. With warm lighting, rustic decor, and well-spaced tables, the restaurant provides a comfortable and intimate atmosphere. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or simply enjoying a night out, the ambience at Le Bistrot Sommelier enhances the overall dining experience.

Le Bistrot Sommelier takes its wine selection seriously, offering an extensive and carefully curated list of top-notch wines. From crisp whites to full-bodied reds, each bottle is expertly chosen to complement the flavors of the dishes. The knowledgeable sommelier is always on hand to guide you through the wine list and assist you in making the perfect selection.

Le Bistrot Sommelier offers a gastronomic experience that is a cut above the rest. With its mouthwatering hanger steak, heavenly Mont d'Or cheese, friendly and hospitable service, delightful ambience, and exceptional wine selection, this restaurant has truly carved a niche for itself. Whether you're a local or a visitor, a meal at Le Bistrot Sommelier is an absolute must for anyone looking to indulge in a memorable culinary experience.

Authentic French cuisine, duck rillette and pate was still as good. However the standard of beef bourguigon dropped slightly as compared to the past. Very impressed by their house-made Mont Blanc and overall experience was good. Highly recommended!
French cuisine in Singapore.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:30 AM – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:30 PM
Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:30 PM
Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:30 PM
Thursday: 11:30 AM – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:30 PM
Friday: 11:30 AM – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:30 PM
Saturday: 11:30 AM – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:30 PM
Sunday: Closed
French cuisine in Singapore.name: Le Bistrot du Sommelier

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Fantastic service, albeit slow pacing by the kitchen. Our simple set lunch lasted around 90 minutes. Cold angel hair pasta was excellent, everything else was rather unmemorable. The restaurant was packed for lunch and the atmosphere was very noisy; we could not have a tabletop conversation without leaning into each other to hear ourselves. For the price point, much better food was expected. Better food would also justify the mighty long waits between each course. Lastly, petit 4s were just a canele and a chocolate disc each (no more financier, at least for the set lunch)

Love the angel hair pasta with caviar! I literally licked the plate!!! So good. The Apple “tart” is really good, so crispy and top a little ice cream on each bite sent me to heaven. It’s worth the price, the whole experience is exquisite and I was there for lunch. I have to go for a dinner next chance I am back in Singapore.

Nice ambience, service is good. Food is good  but not surprising. Recommended the pork jowl, well cook, very soft, moist and tasty. Angel hair pasta texture is very good except the truffle oil fragrance overpower the pasta.
Roasted gambas also recommended. We are eating course meal, I am not super impressed overall, maybe the ala carte menu might be better.

I had high expectations of this place. Our meal started off very well, the bread was fantastic. Appetiser was great, the best being the cold truffle pasta. Mains was a letdown. Carbonara is mere 3 pieces of pasta sitting on a generous portion of pork slices. Pork however was tough. Apple tart with ice cream was great. Staffs were friendly, however we waited very long between each course.

Celebrated our wedding anniversary here.

The restaurant and service staff are attentive to our dietary request, and the food are lovely.

With the pricing and the generous portion of the truffles. It really made my husband's day.

My gluten free pasta was seriously good and I could easily have another one. Another highlight was the pork and love how tender is was, as good as beef.

Even though we told them last upon arrival that we came for our anniversary, they still got us a little celebratory cake that so yummy.

Overall, nothing were disappointing.
French cuisine in Singapore.name: Gunther's

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
I had the steak set lunch.
The steak was too dry for my liking.
The bread was quite nice but not warm.
A bottle of sparkling water was at S$10 which i felt was over priced.

Not likely to return.

Great experience, the medium steak was really awesome as well! Quite tender and juicy! Worth a visit, ambience are quite traditional yet has it character.

Kudos to the service staff as well :)

Highly recommended for those looking for somewhere atas and also great steaks!

This was our second time at Les Bouchons and every trip here was enjoyable!
Their steak was very tender and juicy! We loved the portion and quality. Free flow of fries as well:
Service was good and staff was very attentive.

Definitely one of the better place to have steak in Singapore.

First time here and never disappoint us. Food were great and service was greater !
We were served by Elvis.. he’s been attentive and helpful. We need more service staff like him. Kudos👍🏻

What a sad and expensive experience it was. Les Bouchons used to be a favorite place for steak. Today , it had a horrid bitterness from the char and was really flat and tiny. Seemed  smaller than 300g being dwarfed by the chips. The creamed spinach actually tasted slimy. French onion soup had an unnatural sweetness. And the chips were sad and hard . Not the moreish chips I remembered!
Service was professional but without any trace of warmth or sincerity. Like we were an imposition.
The tables around us were full of very loud and noisy people which totally spoilt the atmosphere of calm dinnertime.
After the hefty bill and disappointing food ,we decided that we will not return again.
French cuisine in Singapore.name: Les Bouchons @ Ann Siang

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Good restaurant, French cuisine, more like traditional or family style restaurant .
Recommendation
1. French onion soup
2. escargots
3.duck

This is our 2nd visit. We love the food and the fact that it's a non pretentious place. We've felt really comfortable on both our visits. For starters we had the escargot and bone marrow. It was really good. We ordered 2 rib-eye with bearnaise sauce and a ravioli for mains.

The only thing we were not really comfortable with was how close the table next to us was. Overall we had a lovely time.

Stepping inside Brasserie Gavroche, it had a nice old rustic charm to it, with the vintage looking wooden furnitures and 50s style hanging lights. Not a typical fine dinning setting but more of a simple sit down dinning for a close group of friends to meet up and chat over a hearty meal.

The restaurant serves some of the more classical French dishes such as foil gras and escargot, with choices of either cold or warm appetisers dishes. It seems the white asparagus is in season now and we ordered 1/2 dozen of escargots and the foie gras (served with toasted country bread) to go with it for our starters.

The escargot was baked with parsley and garlic butter. Classical proven dish that couldn’t really go wrong, but nothing outstanding either. Felt that the escargots was a tad over baked for me as the meat was slightly tough. Overall the taste was rich and flavourful, and the leftover butter oil makes great dip for the bread. 3/5

The white asparagus was served with Parma ham, Benedict eggs and hollandaise sauce. The asparagus was crunchy and juicy, and would have paired perfectly with the savoury ham, if not for the lingering bitter vegetal aftertaste coming from the asparagus. Not sure what the Benedict egg and hollandaise sauce bring to the dish, didn’t think the sauce went well with the dish. 3/5

The foie gras serving was generous! Some of the inferior foie gras I tasted had a powdery and crumbly texture with a strong metallic iron aftertaste lingering. But the foie gras served here was of a much higher quality. Smooth and buttery with a right proportion of fat; lighter in taste but yet flavourful (from the meat) and rich without being too overpowering. It left you wanting to try more as it didn’t have the saturating greasy feeling. The yellow portion of the foie gras in the picture was actually solidified fat and simply pure decadent! I would strongly encourage everyone to at least try a small bit of it to savour the slow melting of pure animal fat essence in your mouth! The reddish condiment at the side was some sort of dried fruit puree and the slight sweet-sourness went very well with the savoury foie gras. The only disappointment I had with the dish was the hard country bread, but otherwise excellent dish. 4.5/5

We ordered 3 mains for sharing:  lamb tongue (not in regular menu), beef tartare and ribeye steak

Personally I prefer my lamb to be grilled for that rich “muttony” favour. This lamb tongue was stewed and served on top of potato mash. I chose this main as lamb tongue was an interesting cut I had not tried before despite the cooking style. The meat was tender with a bit of chewiness to it. Taste was delicately light and I hardly get any ‘muttony’ favour in it. This was a very nice dish albeit it didn’t suit my personal taste preference. 3.5/5, only because of personal taste preference, otherwise the dish deserved a 4.

The beef tartare was disappointing. I loved the Angus beef for its ‘sashimi freshness quality’ with a slight chewy texture. But the condiment was a tad overpowering from the pungent shedded onion and the overly tangy dressing. I felt that the taste was off balanced in the mouth, skewing more towards the condiment. Texture was good, chewiness of the meat went well with the onion crunchiness. The bread was disappointing hard. 3/5

Saving the best for the last, the ribeye was the highlight of the meal for us. Perfectly grilled to medium rare with a pinkish tender center (an expected standard for any high end restaurant) and a slight crusty charred exterior. Decent fat content and the juice of the meat was well sealed during the cooking. Every mouthful was a fine balance of favour and texture. Tenderness of the meat interspersed with crispy charred parts, full bodied and juicy meat favour elevated by the light seasoning. It also went very well with the Béarnaise sauce as it presented a different taste profile. Just to show you don’t need super expensive beef cut or A5 wagyu to enjoy a premium quality steak. 5/5

Went for dinner
Ordered the onion soup, lamb rack and mussels
Had an amazing time wining and dining
The soup was delicious and fragrant
Lamb was very flavorful
Mussels was very fresh and tasty

A Belgian in a French Brasserie… what could possibly go wrong.

Nothing actually. Superb business lunch. Relaxing atmosphere, warm traditional interior, capable and attentive staff, and the food - oh man - the food!!

Tried the morel mushroom soup and the evergreen Angus Beef tartare. Sublime! Just the way I’d expect it in the best restaurant in Paris, or Brussels. And even the fries are “Belgian Approved”.

Thanks guys

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Tasty food with great service

As a tourist, I went there on June 26 for the first time with a local friend. The restaurant provided a casual vibe, making it a good choice for that night. The dishes we had were all amazing, and I liked the Boeuf Bourguignon the most. Jon (sorry if I didn’t spell it correctly) who served our table was super energetic and elevated our dining experience to another level. Will definitely visit again if I travel there.

If you are looking for a casual, chic French dining then So France would be it.

Manager has great PR skill, chat with most patrons effortlessly. Offered us complimentary appetizer and cold cut platter which was a lovely gesture.

Friendly staff yet they do not hover around the table to clear empty plates (unless you are all done), which leave much privacy for chats to take place.

Enjoyed the food. Set lunch was good deal. And their ala carte mains, though seem pricey but big portion is good enough for sharing (think 300gm steak or 3 decent size chicken).

Will return with friends again (this is my 2nd time) because of the lovely vibes and decor. They allow us to linger past lunch time without chasing us off (very kind of them).

Always a great experience at So France. Food is impeccable, great selection of alcohol. Will definitely be ordering the fruit-infused french rum next time.

Thank you Shiva and team!

I visited on 17 Jun at 1pm. Had the Duck Hash and Rum Baba.
It was my first time having French food in a casual setting. The only previous experience I had with French food were just those stuffy fine dining places, which honestly sucked for me. Too little food, too much pomp and airs.
SO France changed my perception of French food; French food can be tasty and enjoyable!
The Duck Hash was great. The potatoes really sucked up the flavour of the jus, and the freshness of the yolk in the poached egg complemented the entire dish perfectly.
The Rum Baba was a surprise. I was worried that the sweet rum poured onto the citrus-flavoured cake will make it soggy or fall apart easily, but it didn’t! The integrity of the cake held up well while soaking up the sweetness and flavour of the rum. They were generous with the rum too.

The service staff was excellent. Cozy, quiet place to date.

Ordered the truffle soup which has soft vegetables & beef inside covered by a pastry.

Beef Bourguignon was soft with a wine reduction that made it intense without the beefy taste.

I'll skip the Steak Frites and order the duck or coq au vin if I'm here next time.

Really want to thank the staff for taking care of me and an excellent dining experience.

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Les Amis restaurant is a gastronomic wonderland that transported me to a world of culinary bliss! The ambiance felt like a page out of a Parisian romance novel, with soft lights and a melody of enchanting tunes. The menu, a poetic composition of flavors, offered a dance of taste that left me in awe. The waitstaff, dressed in elegant attire, choreographed a dining experience that was nothing short of a culinary ballet. Each dish, a masterpiece plated with precision, tasted like a symphony of harmonious ingredients. If you're yearning for a dining escapade that feels like a rendezvous with gourmet dreams, Les Amis is the destination to indulge your palate in a poetic feast!

Ordered the dark chocolate cake and it was so delicious! The cake is placed on top of a tart shell which is very special. Almonds are super fragrant too.
Hope that delivery service can be included in the future and handwriting on the chocolate could be better 😅

Had a very pleasant dining experience at Les Amis. Patrick, our server, was very friendly, attentive, and entertaining. He suggested a perfect wine to have with the steak. He also patiently explained every dish to us. The amuse bouche tartalette with bacon and mushrooms was a good introduction to the meal. Notable food from our dinner are the French egg, crab soufflé, simmered celery root, salted brioche, herb sorbet, and poached pears. The caviar that was thoughtfully used in some of the dishes is an interesting addition of a complex salt flavor; it did not overwhelm the taste of the other ingredients. The wagyu was tender but I expected a bit more flavor and it lacked a bit of surprise. The herb sorbet is most interestingly a refreshing palate cleanser. Overall, it was a memorable and pleasant gastronomic experience.

Truly Michelin 3 stars! Excellent food with great creativity,  best service, excellent wine pairing, and the deserts are the best.  Not cheap but it is worth it!

Everything was impeccable, the food was great and the portions were generous, great wine pairings and amazing service.
Toni and the team were very kind and took genuine care of us.
The Blu Lobster appetizer, their sour dough, the riz de veu and the cheese course were divine.
Highly recommended.
French cuisine in Singapore.name: Les Amis

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
It was my first visit with my wife to Merci Marcel, we were delighted by the overall vibes of the restaurant. We ordered the eggs Ben and French Toast Brioche, latte and flat white. The food and coffee were excellent, the portion of eggs Ben was a bit small though. A great place to chill!!

My first visit to Merci Marcel and my friends and I had a good time bonding over the food and the servers were great, especially Marilyn who was patient in giving us and overview of food selects and sharing the specials of the day. Soft yellow lighting gave it a nice cosy family/friends evening gathering atmosphere vibes. Thumbs up!

Good services. Food is presented artistically.
Latte is nice with a cute pattern, although this pattern is not very stable.
The French toast is okay. A bit pricy but understandable because this is Orchard.
Good environment with sunshine.

Very good! Although we didn't have a reservation, they managed to fit us in. The staff were all friendly and provided a fast and efficient service. The food and coffee were amazing, not to mention the cafes' atmosphere was very relaxing. It was a lovely breakfast and experience.

Amazing place, nice atmosphere. Food was excellent but the portions are small (unless you ordered pizza). Also on the higher price range, so do take note. Great for special occasions though!

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Visited in Jul 2023

The last time I had visited Rhubarb was 4-5 years ago. So a revisit was a long time coming. Good food and great service as always. There are 3 options/dining experiences you can choose from. I went for the most comprehensive one - 3 starters, 1 main with chef’s premium ingredient and 1 dessert.

While I can see how Rhubarb has been able to maintain its 1 star for so many years, I struggled a bit to find some key differentiating factor versus other French contemporary Michelin places. Good food nonetheless.

Service was really good. The dishes kept coming fast and I was done with my entire dinner in an hour.

All in all a very good dining place. If you haven’t been there, it is definitely worth going.

The 4-course lunch Omakase was very very satisfying, with interesting notes and flavours that I’m pleasantly surprised by. I also really enjoyed my chat with Joseph as a solo diner, so that my lunch was a little livelier. I had an absolutely lovely time and would return again.

Decided to go last min as I suddenly met a long time friend. She said she didn’t want to eat something too heavy. The starters were mainly seafood and fruits, which opened up her appetite after a full day of hard stress work. The main was a tender slowed cooked beef. Dessert was a coconut sorbet I think (?). Accompanied the meal with a Riesling. We quite enjoyed the night.
Funny note, one of the appetisers is a mix of fruits and seafood, I confused the apple with an olive. The taste was good though. Please don’t change the dish because of my comment.

Food are all tastefully plated and delicious. They were kind to ask me if I have dietary restrictions and I told them I would like to have all cooked food. So they made changes for me to replace the lightly torched scallops to cooked crab stick for appetiser. Really appreciate it:) every dishes were all well explained and executed.

Outstanding food, worth its Michelin star. Service is friendly. The atmosphere is a little bit let down by the lighting and impersonal musical background. Overall a very nice place to have an amazing meal. Prices very reasonable.

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Great French food at affordable lunch set price. The foei gras add on is a highlight, great berry sauce that cuts down the liver richness. Almost forgot to take picture of my main dish, lamb feet chop. End it with creme brule that's deliciously crunchy and soft in the inside.

June 2023:-
Booked for 8pm dinner and we were the only table at that time. It was a birthday celebration but was so disappointed with the food this time, not consistent. Downgraded from 5 to 2 stars.

Oct 2022:-
Great dining experience. Love the foie gras and duck confit.  Satisfying meal. I would go again to try other dishes.

Taratata Brasserie is a great place for traditional French food in the heart of Singapore. We enjoyed the carefully sourced wholesome and fresh ingredients. This allowed the meats to be lightly seasoned for the natural flavors to come through. The various sauces and condiments were hand-crafted in the kitchen by the master chef. The curated French wines were excellent, unlike the new world wines that are rushed to the table by adding sulfur and sugar. Overall, the experience at Taratata Brasserie reminded us of the leisurely meals we had in Paris and Europe during our holidays.

Had a wonderful experience at Taratata. Service was fast and we finished everything on the plates. Would highly recommend the foie gras, duck confit, salad and escargot. The kurobuta pork was nice as well but it reminded me of chinese char Siew.

The pesto escargot sauce was great but the escargot itself was a bit chewy. the steak was a miss. No taste, very hard to chew on, we asked for medium but we received it quite too well done. Would suggest to try other surrounding restaurants instead
