French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
What a hidden gem!!!
Went out for lunch with my colleagues and we were so happy as we stepped in until we departed. Very well decorated ambient as high class French restaurant with great customer service literally by every crew in the restaurant. Every menu came out highly presentable and the taste to remember. Choices of wine are so great as well.  Highly recommended. I'll definitely go back every time I visit Singapore.

gorgeous restaurant, wonderful service and very delish food. went for the degustation menu and it didn’t disappoint :) also loving the quirky cat and dog statues! very stuffed after the whole course, didn’t managed to finish the sweets but it was a great experience overall! :)

We came on Saturday and ordered the tasting menu. The food is great with excellent service! The degustation set lunch is $98 per person and it’s quite affordable especially the number of dishes and quality. Highly recommended place

Great Atmosphere, good food and the chef is friendly. First class service. We ll go there again. 1 for 1 cockage which is great.

Came here to celebrate birthday, the chef helped us to take a nice photo, I was wondering how come he never wished me happy birthday, and none of the waiters wished me happy birthday. After the meal when I went home I then realized my reservation was for the next day lol!!!!

But the waiters was so polite that when I told him I made a reservation for two pax, they obviously couldn't find it but they still got me a nice table without embarrasing me by telling me no reservation was made. ^^
PLEASE share the story with the chef, he obviously didn't know what happened cos I just stood up and wanted to leave cos I felt a bit neglected, when he asked me how was the food I said very good and left in a hurry. :p

Food was obviously excellent and service was impeccable, thanks so much for for everything, we will be back~

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Had a great 6 course lunch at Beni! Service was great - the hostess was warm and friendly, and explained dishes clearly. Food was good - subtle flavours that meshed really well together, and beautiful presentation. The lamb in particular was executed perfectly. I also loved the mignardises and that the kitchen was open but calm and not chaotic.

Here for birthday lunch, cosy setting but nothing much to shout about for the interior. Had the lunch menu, food is good but nothing really outstanding that I can remember. Hmm maybe Cherry Gazpacho is quite special. Perhaps its a normal lunch menu, maybe should come back again for special collaborations when they have one.

Some changes to the menu itself. Menu is very refreshing, akin like the Spring season. As always, hostess & chef hospitality are the best. To us, their food, restaurant atmosphere, relationships between staffs & us are what made us being their regulars.

A very nice ambiance intimate dining room that caters to about 6 pax capacity and some counter seats for perhaps, Omakase? Set menus are definitely French and heavy on seafood.

The service was nicely paced, dishes was explained, and professional. Their wine recommendation was good as well.

The presentation of each dish is where the star is. The taste is ok, balanced.

Recommended for date night, probably not the best suit for big  groups or business dinner unless you reserve private room.

We booked the restaurant to celebrate our 25th year wedding anniversary.
We took the $268 set dinner and added on foie gras ($20) for one of our dinner set, and changed one of the dessert to cheese truffle.
All the dishes are wonderfully made, and even the bread basket (uniquely in a cloth pouch) is warm and hot, with specially made bread spread.
The service is amazing and special mentioned to Louis who has made our experience really enjoyable.
We also had Yamanaka-san who personally served us for one of the dishes.
The downside for the place is that it is a small restaurant and seatings are quite closed to one another. It's no issue for us and we mingled with other patrons.
Highly recommended.
French cuisine in Singapore.name: béni Singapore

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Their food standard is good! Escargot is tasty with garlic and basil. Steak was good but too thick and they couldn’t help us to slice it thinner. Their duck congee was great! Their mashed potato taste great!! However, the grilled fish was not good. Not much taste and dry.

My friend said their beer is no taste and just like water. I didn’t drink it but just feedback from friend.

Escargot and chicken are good. Soufflé looks normal but apparently not cooked. It’s empty inside. Been to So France many times and this evening seems very much under staffed. Waitress is very polite but getting too busy towards the end of the dinner.

Great food, better than great actually. Had the quinoa salad, sparkling water and an espresso. The service was impeccable, friendly and helpful staff, the automostre is excellent. Went for a business lunch and it was a good environment for talking. The only downside is all the beautiful, well dressed people to distract you but that’s a bonus isn’t it!

5++ stars

You can find decent French breakfast and great coffee here. The restaurant is big with lots of seats, staffs are friends and service is good, best time to visit is during weekend morning and you can enjoy your breakfast and coffee without being rushed to get out. They sell French cooking/ baking/ chocolate/ tea  just outside the restaurant, it’s a good place to get some French essentials if you needed some.

Cosy ambience and food was fantastic, we had the festive set (chose the smoked salmon salad + lemon sole+ chocolate soufflé), plus ala carte items: salad nicoise and the $140 meat platter, but what really impressed us on top of the food was the impeccable service and warm hospitality from the staff, Eika. Thanks Eika!

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
This restaurant is a testament to the perfection of French cuisine. Elegance meets flavour in every dish. A delightful journey for your taste buds awaits.

A nice French restaurant for date nights and special occasions. Unfortunately, the food quality was rather mediocre for the price point. The ingredients didn’t taste fresh and some tasted like they were frozen. The raw oysters were very good though. Service was very casual.

Visited the restaurant for the 3rd time. Food is consistently good and the service was great too. We made a mistake with the member rewards and the staff helped to resolve the issue promptly without much interruption to our meals. Recommend to try the tooth fish and truffle fries!!
French onion soup is good too.

Nice ambience. Food is expected of an authentic French Restaurant. Ordered dinner set menu and opted for:
Entrée: Foie Gras
Main: Lobster Risotto
Dessert: Tarte Varlhona
Foie Gras was good and so was the Lobster Risotto. The dessert was for me somewhat ordinary.
Overall food was good and ambience is great. However, from a price perspective with each of us spending over $100 per pax, I thought it could have been better.

Food is reasonably priced and tasty! Place is rather small and wasn’t as busy as compared to other restaurants on a weekend night. However, even when the restaurant was not packed, the staff was inattentive and lack proactiveness. Service could definitely be improved drastically. Some of their male staff especially, could certainly work on their tonality and facial expressions when serving food to customers.
French cuisine in Singapore.name: L'Angélus

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
This little eatery nested beneath the Pandan Valley condo brings out the uniqueness of French cuisine.

Helm by 2 persons only,  service can be rather slow.  1 cooks, the other serve.

The lady serving food had a serious look on her face although she was generally friendly.

What stood out for me was the ambience of the restaurant.  Cut out looking very French,  it brings out that bonjour feel.

3 of us ordered 3 different dishes to try.  The fish,  the pork and the beef cheek and a French Onion soup.

Taste wise, they were above average.  The fish stood out the most.  It had all the lovely condiments accompanying.

The beef n pork was tasty enough n flavours were intense.

The soup was slightly let down.

Price was surprisingly on the high side for a small residential setup like this.  Parking was not too difficult though.

Ohh... they also provided a cut-up baguette with butter.

Generally, a nice cozy place to visit if there is a good reason to celebrate.

Quaint and very homely atmosphere. Good food.

[19 Sep 2023]
bread - 9/10, very addictive.

escargot - 8/10, good
portabello - 8/10, very nice

beef cheeks in red wine ($36) - 9/10, fantastic red wine sauce. replaced with short rib today.
pork ($36) - 8/10, great mash and nice mushroom sauce.
steak ($58) - 8/10, NZ Black Angus ribeye

lemon tart ($12) - 6/10, not quite crunchy, the mousse wasn't fantastic
apple tart ($12) - 8/10, very nice

Surprisingly good french food in a small quaint neighborhood. French onion soup was nice and cheesy and duck confit also was cooked really well.

There's also a complimentary bread basket which has a just nice portion size. Other restaurants we've been too, it's either too much or too little 🤣

5 stars for food and atmosphere. Quite little place with great settings. The duck confit was absolutely delicious.

Run by a local husband and wife team, the French Ladle is a quaint little restaurant serving authentic French food.
Helping of the much lauded foie gras was both generous and yummy. The delicious escargot paired extremely well with the crispy bread to soak up the sauce.
Both the mains of barramundi and ribeye steak were decent but a mite too bland.
Desserts of apple pie and ice cream rounded up a hearty lunch
All prices are nett with no GST or service charge.
Best to book in advance as restaurant is small
French cuisine in Singapore.name: The French Ladle

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Superb French dining experience at a reasonable price. We went for the 3-course set lunch and were satisfied with the quality of ingredients used, great cooking, and exceptional service provided by Rimo, Charlene, and team. Recommended dishes: Escargots in garlic butter, Lamb chops, Pear Melba.

We celebrated a birthday here and were delighted with the extra mile taken with the presentation of the desserts. Thanks to this meal, we’ve found another authentic French steakhouse!

I recently dined at "Les Bouchons Rive Gauche," and it was an exquisite culinary experience. The highlight of the evening was their selection of red wine, which beautifully complemented the succulent steak.

To start, we savored the pan-seared duck liver, a dish that showcased exceptional freshness and a rich, melt-in-your-mouth texture. It was truly unforgettable.

We also indulged in a delightful off-menu item, the heated Camembert cheese, which emanated a delightful flavor due to its oven preparation. The combination of the gooey cheese and its subtle yet profound taste was a gastronomic delight.

The main course featured the Black Angus prime rib, which impressed with its perfectly balanced seasoning that enhanced the natural flavor of the beef. It was a prime example of culinary expertise.

To conclude this magnificent meal, we had the crème brûlée, a dessert that was both light and zesty, providing the perfect sweet note to end our dining experience.

The ambiance and service at "Les Bouchons Rive Gauche" further added to the overall charm of the restaurant. If you're looking for an exceptional dining experience with an emphasis on quality, this is the place to be. I highly recommend it for anyone seeking an unforgettable culinary journey.

we did encounter a situation at our table. However, it’s important to note that this issue was not related to how the restaurant was run; it was more of an outside factor. Despite this unexpected situation, the restaurant’s staff handled it promptly and professionally, ensuring that it did not affect the overall dining experience. Their commitment to customer satisfaction and their adeptness in addressing unforeseen challenges further demonstrated the restaurant’s dedication to providing a top-notch dining experience.

Best steak we had as a family! Super value for money. So tender and juicy. Super good appetisers. Fantastic service!

Good food, good service and good vibe. The lamb chop was nicely cooked and reminded us of what we had in France. Waitress was of good service. She made sure we were well taken care of.

I had my birthday lunch here and the food was tres délicieux! Special mention for the pan seared foie gras and the ribeye steak. Such depth of flavour at a great value, do check out their lunch set promo if you're coming by in the day.

Big thank you to Rimo, Charlene and Jan for the impeccable service and attention to detail :)
French cuisine in Singapore.name: Les Bouchons Rive Gauche

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Food was impeccable, Santos was very attentive to our needs, cosy ambiance. Best Paris Brest that we’ve had. Great place for a date or a chill place to hang with your friends. Definitely highly recommended.

we had a pleasant dinner , one of the best mussel & suckling pig we ever had

key highlights of the food is , mussel , lamb , suckling pig , mussel was awesomely good , lamb was perfectly done & well seasoned  , suckling was so amazing crispy on skin tender and juicy mesf

service was great , something memorable is having a really cheerful person serving us .

overall is a really decent meal , would really recommend the dishes stated above  .

We had our bff birthday celebration last night after reading so many good reviews of this place. My friends and I totally don’t agree with all the good feedback, it doesn’t justify with the taste of food and service that we have had a lot of not very pleasant experience in a fine dining restaurant. Is was our first encounter that Omakase main course and appetisers was served in sharing board just because we are party of 6? It was not served in a meticulous and refined way or any efforts in the presentation of the food. The indifferent of the whole team including the chef and servers was disappointing.
When one of us mentioned that she is not in favour of shellfish, but she doesn’t mind the lobster which all of us wouldn’t mind the additional cost on top of our Omakase. She was served a vegetarian ( tomatoes and cheese salad ) as one of the appetiser instead of the lobster that the rest of us were receiving. Lack of communication and creativity even if they had misunderstood the food dietary needs in each and everyone of us. They could have clarified with us again. What we don’t understand is, has the restaurant run out of ingredients that you have to serve a vegetarian salad? I even reconfirmed with the server if it’s a vegetarian salad. After we had told the chef that we don’t take foie gras, we were still served with a board of foie gras and pate together with ham and stuffs. To our disappointment, the whole portions of the first appetiser was reduced to half after they changed it. They made no efforts in creating something else to accord our food requirements. Overall quality of the food was not great and pleasing.  The pork was overcooked that it was so dry and chewy, the sea bass was too salty, had muddy taste and not fresh.
The servers were not well trained and not paying attention of the details in dressing the cutlery, they just simply put down the cutlery, my spoon and fork was crossed, not changing the cutlery in every courses and even put my spoon on my friend’s bread plate. I have been using the same fork for the entire meal until dessert then I received a new fork. We were not offered salt and pepper when it comes to our beef and lamb. There wasn’t any salt and pepper on our table which are ubiquitously paired on dining tables, this has resulted that we had to search and took the ground pepper ourselves, and we search everywhere there wasn’t any salt at all. Non of the servers observed our needs. The whole restaurant was deserted and nobody was there to farewell us. This was the worst fine dine experience we had ever been and we would definitely not want to have our 2nd visit again.

The omakase was amazing I had the ocean trout tartare seared snapper and traditional crème caramel food was incredible the service is some of the best service I have ever experienced as someone who works as a chef in hospitality places like this are gems would highly recommend to anyone seeking great food and high level professional service

Wonderfully Flavorful, gorgeous presentations, our appetizers were simply delicious. Mains were good, desert too. Tiny space, AC a bit too strong and drafty, but really worth a visit.
Prices are commensurate with food quality.

French cuisine in Singapore.name: Bar-A-Thym Restaurant by Francois Mermilliod

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Great service and ambience with good views. I especially like the high ceilings and quiet. Food was good enough for its price tag but I wouldn't say it's awesome. Escargots were good and the starter prawns rather savoury. The crews were very lovely and even went all out to celebrate my parents' wedding anniversary with a complimentary cake, photo and card. :)

I proposed to the love of my life in la brasserie last Sunday and it was a pleasant experience. The managers Alan, JJ and the team were accommodating, helpful, and hospitable during the planning process as well as on the day itself. They helped with many suggestions and allocated a suitably private and romantic table for us. Truly appreciated it. The food too was delicious, in particular loved the lobster roll and their starters. We got escargot and sauteed prawns which were cooked to perfection and seasoned well. My fiancee' friend and her friends's daughter was with us that night and the restaurant had a special children's menu which is definitely welcome since children may not appreciate fine dining as much. In addition, they brought out a coloring book for her. Definitely, family friendliness is something they have worked on.

Deserts were delicious, and they provided a very beautiful chocolate cake with my proposal message free on the house. We had something called a lava cheesecake that I must warn is a bit deceptively named, with no liquid flowing out, but it was good nonetheless. Finally the staff were helpful in the proposal moment and taking photos. They even surprised us by printing and giving us some commemorative shots with a card from the restaurant to remember the day by.

Would really recommend this place to others, and pro tip, this area tends to be less crowded on weekends, so if you have a urgent need for last minute booking for an event on a weekend, it's is definitely worth a shot checking them out

Had a lovely birthday dinner celebration here recently. Appreciated the nice, classy restaurant decor,  and the very quiet environment with a bit of the bay view for table near the window.  Food was immaculately prepared. The dozen of escargot felt generous. Every bite with the meat, the bread and the tantalising garlic oil just warm the mouth and taste bud. The sautéed prawns with chorizo was average. I was recommended to try their crispy duck confit and bordelaise beef cheeks, and had not regretted the decisions. They also have an extensive wine menu and some value for money bin wine that they wanted to clear stock of. Overall, I'd recommend this restaurant for a nice dinner date.

Excellent food. High ceiling, romantic atmosphere. Take a stroll along Clifford Pier for the best view of Marina Bay Sands!
Dined in with Fullerton stay dining credits. Worth a visit.

Have been dining at La Brasserie for the last 13 years .One thing consistently defines the place is the exceptionally high quality of food

The constant feedback from my non vegetarian guests has been stellar be it the sea food or steak or just other meat dishes

Being a vegetarian, I have enjoyed their salads, soups, risottos and local vegetarian dishes

NOT A BIG FAN of their impossible plant dishes . Do not appeal to me and would recommend all of them to be removed from the menu

We recently went for dinner. The food as usual was high quality BUT what impressed me the most was that the service inspite of the post pandemic staff challenges was simply outstanding.

All credit to Mr Haizul, who has been watching over his F&B team and enabling them for success

Fairuz, Joy and Dorothy did an amazing job . More like being mind readers. Their attention to detail, making sure our orders were served right and even small customisation touches were highly commendable. We simply loved their high quality of service

Overall a 5 + / 5 high quality dining experience.
French cuisine in Singapore.name: La Brasserie

French cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
I had dinner here in June 2022. I commend the restaurant’s efforts in the presentation of the food, but the flavors left much to be desired. The ingredients were high quality, yet somehow they didn’t complement each other well enough to satisfy the palate.

The overall flavor profile of the food was acidic, most likely attributed to the green sauce that was present in most dishes. I would’ve preferred a more rounded umami taste.

With the wine pairing, the bill came out to around 355 SGD ≈ 262 USD/pax. Not ridiculous for a 1-star Michelin restaurant, but the flavor combinations should be improved to live up to this price.

Went for restaurant week and this is my first time to have lunch at Michelin star restaurant.
In general, the food is exquisite and have rich tastes. But some of the courses might be too salty or too sweet for me (Would like to rate 4.5 actually)
We seated at the bar counter which is around the open kitchen. It’s a new experience for me when having fine dining.

We came here for an evening of modern French fusion and were not disappointed. The restaurant is an open kitchen concept where the diners all sit at counters that wrap around the central kitchen. It’s all right but feels a little industrial and I would have preferred something a little more comfortable at this price point. They have a decent wine list and there is value to be had. The bread was nice and the variety of butters clever (though I’d replace the butter knives with a less awkward design). It’s not the very best we’ve had (that’s probably Pollen) but it was nice. The starters were all delicious and we particularly enjoyed the oysters with Thai green curry. The salmon was also very nice. I’m not entirely sold on the combination of black truffle with the prawn. The scallops were decent, the fish a little forgettable, but the cabbage was surprisingly good. A big thumbs up there. After  that seafood, I would have preferred a proper meat dish, but everything was certainly tasty. Among the desserts, the canelé and the lemon tart were particularly nice.

[3.5 Stars] Went for a lunch.

-Environment
Nice place, elegant and very clean. Seats are comfortable, not noisy, air-con is not too cold.

-Menu
I felt the overall menu is just alright, it is interesting but not super delicious or whatsoever. The portion is typical French style, the ingredient of scallop and duck able to taste the freshness. The rest of the menu are okay, not much of catchy points...sauces are in similar taste, creamy salty type....Desserts are ordinary.

-Service
I felt every time when doing the serving, it was so fast that we could not catch what the staff is explaining about the dishes/ingredient/dressing...If large part of the operating expense goes to Staffing, I do not feel the passion coming from the staff whenever we are being served. I think it is important to explain in a way which make customers could appreciate the food more.

-Price
Spent about $240+, just for an experience and it was just an okay.

I didn't really enjoy the place. note to self, never go for open concept Michelin star restaurant.

Place - easy to locate, heart of CBD area and even have a happening bar as neighbor.

Restaurant ambience - more for couple setting. Anything more than that is hard to have a chat with your peers as is a counter setting. Open kitchen concept.  There are 20 over staff fussing over our food, they look cool in their black outfit.

Food presentation - very sophisticated, elegant and detailed. Really IG worthy but you must have good photography skills as the lighting down there is terrible at our counter setting

Food taste - salty, sour, overpowering of spices, taste. A pity there is not one food that is worthy of mentioning. The mains are nice but all the special sauces over power the food.  There was one main which is the lamb tongue but it tasted like cured meat version. the Let's not talk about dessert as french dessert are always medicore everywhere. They tried their best.

I am comparing with Odette. I would prefer Odette kind of French food.

The next day all of us have very easy bowel system 😅🤭. Good for one try.

Greek restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
My favourite Greek restaurant in Singapore of all time.  I have been here 10 TIMES. The food is always so consistently good. They serve the best salad, octopus, sea bream, lamb chop and even chicken. Their dips and pita bread are also to die for. Service isn't as good as it used to be anymore but oh well.

Celebrated a friend birthday here and the staff was quite helpful. We were introduced to a good spread. Wasn’t expecting the food to be good in this type of cafe but was pleasantly surprised of the meat quality and portion. Slightly on the salty side but acceptable. Overall, would come back again.

Loved having dinner here. Food, service, atmosphere all fantastic. Wayne was a great server who recommended some signature dishes - codfish roe was my fav. Octopus was well cooked and kebab was also unique but perfectly cooked.

Came here multiple times including the one at the old location. Also recommended and brought my friends, colleagues here many times! Loved the food, ambience and service! Just so good! This time my friends and I came here to celebrate birthday and the bar manager treated us to complimentary alcohol and gave a small bottle of olive oil (we also purchased a big one!). Their olive oil tastes so gooooooood! The dessert was complimentary as well. I love the fish, octopus and vegetables the best!

Food is fantastic. Price is reasonable as well, total damage is about $50/pax. (We ordered like 7-8 dishes).
Service is pretty prompt. The ambience is good & cozy for gathering & chit-chatting.

Greek restaurants in Singapore.name: BAKALAKI Greek Taverna

Greek restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
This was my third or fourth time here. My last visit was quite awhile back. The food, ambience, and service here are very good! Parking is free! Place tends to get crowded and there’s sometimes a queue, so it’s wise to make a reservation before heading down. Had the dips and bread, octopus, sea bass, spinach pastries, and finally, baklava for dessert! Everything was great! Octopus was nice and tasty + tender, sea bass was fresh, all the pastries were warm and the Greek coffee we had to end the meal was pretty good too! Will be back here again to try more food! Hopefully sooner than later! Highly recommended for authentic Greek Mediterranean food! Fantastic experience every visit!

A lovely place for those looking for non pork meals. They don’t qualify as a halal place  as they serve alcohol. But good for Muslim friends. It was my first time here and it’s been a while since I had Greek food. I love the dips option from spicy to mild tasting dips. The fried calamari was great too followed by the medium rare lamb which was tender. Ensure you make a reservation to avoid disappointment. Good place to bring friends.

Always crowded on weekends such that even booking a table on same day is sometimes not possible.
I really enjoyed the medium meat platter. grilling was on point  meat was juicy and not dry.
moussaka went down way too easily. Greek dip platter was on point flavour wise and the taramasalata was flavourful without tasting too fishy.
sadly the pita bread is pretty small portioned, I'm not sure how you're expected to finish the dip given with the portions served
Grilled octopus was also delicious.

Service was friendly and efficient.
Decor isn't very Greek but honestly ambience is great (albeit a bit noisy)

It's harder to get a table here than the at its closest competitor, and for  good reason.

Good food. Although the beef can be on the dry side, everything else was delicious.

Highly recommend the grilled octopus. It is not chewy at all. For those who don’t like squid or octopus, try to have a bite.

Restaurant is packed on a Friday night and the food arrives pretty quick. Staff are quite alright. Some could use a little refining in politeness.

There’s complimentary licorice candy. Absolutely love it.

Will visit this place again. But recommend to come here in a bigger group to order a larger variety of dishes.

First visit. Reservation was smooth via seven rooms. We chose an outdoor table as the weather was pleasant. The food was delicious. We had the whole oven chicken and chicken yiro wrap with fries. Pesto pasta was good as well. Desserts were amazing too. Overall highly satisfied.
Greek restaurants in Singapore.name: Blu Kouzina Dempsey

Greek restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
This is our third time here within about one month time. The food here is really nice and the price is very reasonable for its quality. The place is on the bank of Singapore river, so the view is nice and relaxing. The service here is really good, and we managed to have a chitchat with Nod, who is a very nice person. Highly recommended restaurant overall.

Ordered the grilled squid, which was very reasonable for the quality. One of the best I’ve had. It has a good char on it, tasted super fresh. The lamb kebab was seasoned very well too. Tasted great with the pita bread that came along with it. The one that left me with the least impression is the beef souvlaki. Should have better seasoning. Service was alright. In fact they kept wanting to clear our plates when we were still trying to finish our food. Other than that, this temporary location was quite cosy.

A bright, open and airy restaurant, I will start by agreeing with everyone else that Zorba does a great job of creating tasty Mediterranean food. In particular, the lamb chops and squid were excellent and I thoroughly enjoyed the Greek salad and the variety of flavours in the dips. The vegetarian platter which comes as part of the communal menu was a lovely array of chargrilled vegetables. Our toddler guest loved the tempura asparagus that came with the squid. We opted for the communal menu at $75 per head which is more than enough food. A bottle of Sauvignon Blanc will set you back $95 and a glass of wine is $16. Weirdly, after we orderedthe communal menu for 5 people, everything came at once. So the communal menu *looks like* starters, mains and a dessert but in actual fact the staff kept bringing the stuff out all at once, so we had to request two additional tables to put all the food on! It was weird and chaotic and ok / slightly amusing amongst friends, but if I was there for a business dinner or something it would not have been acceptable. In light of a restaurant bill in excess of $500 for 5 people it is also not acceptable. For that price point people do not expect to be shuffling around trying to find space for food and adding additional tables etc. It should have flowed out successively, as dips and bread starters, salad and squid, meat and vegetarian platters then dessert. As courses. The staff had no idea where to put the food themselves, they just kept bringing the plates out and getting stressed at the table as we shuffled things round. Then about 5 minutes after they’d brought out all the savoury stuff, they tried to bring the dessert (!) which was the final straw for one of our party who asked them to take it away until we finished the mountain of food in front of us. The dessert let the communal menu down. It was a sad looking custard pie that we had to hack into pieces ourselves, with no ice cream or anything. The egg custard was over cooked and was more scrambled egg than custard.
I am inclined to give any restaurant that allows me to bring my dog extra credit, and Zorba did allow us to bring our dog to sit ‘outside’ (still completely covered area) and near the open restaurant doors, so he could catch the breeze from the aircon. That’s Thoughtful with a capital T. Lovely. Really appreciated that thank you. They also started well by offering him a water bowl,  but they never actually brought it. Luckily we brought our own. In fact the service generally was a bit all over the place. The youngsters serving our table couldn’t tell us anything about the wine, brought the wrong number of forks, knives and plates and then went to clear tables after being asked to bring more forks and plates. They were pleasant enough, very polite but it was as if it was maybe their second or third day working and they were still learning.
There is also a fabulous children’s play area for the toddlers to amuse themselves, which is just a fantastic idea. And very much enjoyed by our toddler guest.
I don’t want to be so critical of a restaurant that got so many things right. But you have to view these things in lieu of the cost of the evening and Zorba is not cheap. Therefore I expect the service and experience to match the prices of the food and wine.
I would go again, but I would probably not look to spend the amount we did. Perhaps a simple brunch or dinner for two.

Good atmosphere, good food and good service! I really love the food it taste amazing. Nod and the team really serve us well. Recommend to come with family or friends, very family oriented restaurant.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Zorba The Greek Taverna in Singapore, and it was an absolutely delightful experience from start to finish. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere that transported us straight to the heart of Greece.

The food at Zorba's is nothing short of outstanding. The menu is a treasure trove of authentic Greek dishes, and every bite was bursting with flavour. We started with the mezze platter, acolourfull array of hummus, tzatziki, and dolmades that set the tone for an incredible meal. The moussaka and souvlaki that followed were cooked to perfection, and the portions were generous, making it a great value for the quality.

However, what truly elevated our dining experience was the exceptional service provided by our waitress, Chantel. She was not just a server; she was a gracious host who went above and beyond to ensure our meal was memorable. Chantel's knowledge of the menu and her recommendations were spot on. She made us feel like valued guests, and her warm, friendly demeanour made the evening even more enjoyable.

In conclusion, Zorba The Greek Taverna is a hidden gem in Singapore. The food is top-notch, the atmosphere is inviting, and the star of the show was undoubtedly our wonderful waitress, Chantel. I can't recommend this place enough, and I can't wait to return for another taste of Greece right here in Singapore!

Thank you, Chantel, and the entire team at Zorba's, for an unforgettable dining experience!

Greek restaurants in Singapore.name: Zorba The Greek Taverna

Greek restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The best Greek restaurants we’ve ever been in Singapore. The ingredients are so fresh and every dish is very delicious.
The desert is also the highlight.

Will come back to try more dishes.

Came here for a work lunch as the food was supposed to be good! Apparently my friend said that the standards have dropped and the food used to be better prior to their renovation…

Also, the restaurant has a strict 2 hours rule in place and we had to vacate the place by 2pm for their closing.. not a good experience for sure.

One of the best Greek food I’ve ever had! The dips are yummy, pitas are warm and tasty, the grilled octopus is one of the best I’ve ever had!!!! The tacos giros are yummy and the beef is of great quality! One more thing to mention is that they even serve Greek beer!!! The service is good, decoration/interior design is top! A must go place!!!!

The best Greek food in Singapore!

Slightly pricey but the food taste amazing, simple yet flavorful!

The highlight for me was the octopus and eggplant spread 💯

Beautiful interior decor but the place was a little cramped and noisy due to the proximity of the tables. Food was great, esp the grilled octopus, but prices are on the higher end. Worth a try :)
Greek restaurants in Singapore.name: Alati Divine Greek Cuisine

Greek restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
We went there for our eldest's birthday dinner. The food was amazing. From the grilled Octopus tentacle, to the seafood platter to the meat platter and the best of all, the pork skewers.. we almost didn't order the pork skewers but am glad we did because it was out of this world and not like anything we (or I) have tasted before.

Be prepared for a budget of 80 to 100 per pax without drinks or alcohol.

Easy parking at Craig Place (walking distance). May need to maneuver a bit if you have guests on wheelchairs.

Had an extremely enjoyable dining experience here with my work colleagues. Although I've not been a huge fan of Greek food all along, our lunch was actually quite yummy. Got ourselves a mixed platter combo to share, some moussaka, spanakopita (make sure you get this), and some pita bread with dips. Make sure to call and reserve ahead of time, as they do get quite crowded during meal times.

This place is just outstanding: exceptional raw material used to create fresh, delicious, authentic dishes. Great wines offered, relaxed atmosphere, cozy decoration. All pieces are put together nicely for a fantastic experience! The cooks and managers are really putting their heart into Fotia and it shows!

We will be back for sure!

Greek food in a nice setting. Been here a few times and the food always stands out, definitely one of the best Greek restaurants in town. Salads are delicious, uses good fresh ingredients and seasoning was good. Meat platter was big enough for 4 of us with a good selection of grilled meat, flavourful and had good taste.

Beautiful venue that really makes you feel like you’re in Greece. Wide variety of seafood, meat and vegetarian dishes - the platters are definitely plentiful and good for big groups. Service is friendly and prompt which is appreciated.

Greek restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
We had order chicken leg blackpepper with is served very fast and the chicken is very small,spoiled and smelly,the rest 2 item not good 2/10 service is good but totally is not good

Did a photo shoot for their new dishes then get a chance to try all.
I do recommend to come here and try the Fried pizza, Seafood Mala pasta  ,Battered prawn with fish roe and mentaiko sauce  and Chicken rendang pizza.

Unhygienic place. Sat inside the bar and there were 2 HUGE cockroaches that were running across the bar counter. My friend informed the staff and they were very casual about it and just killed it and informed us that it was dead without any signs of embarrassment or being apologetic. It ruined my experience there.

The beer came very fast, but they forgot to give us our fries despite us being the only customers at that point of time. Then when more customers came in, we saw food going out but our fries were not there. Only after we informed them then we reordered something else. And again, there were no signs of being apologetic.

Place is slightly humid but friendly staff.  Place for only beers. Not sure why but beers come very fast,  not food and non alcoholic beverages. Had to order pineapple juice twice and our spam fries 4 times.
It came after 1 hour.

Be careful when you pass by the offers provided by this bar/pub. Cheated by the staff who is offering happy hour when we walked in. One of the staff offered happy hour price when we asked about the pricing, and when billing they started to deny offering the happy hour price. They do not admit their mistakes/miscommunication at all, felt no remorse and even argued back that they did not offer the price. Very upset at the way they're handling the whole situation, and going back on their words. Drinks were overpriced compared to the other bars/pubs (who would even go to a bar that sells overpriced drinks compare to the surrounding bar/pub?). Definitely not coming back to this place due to their bad services and dishonesty with customers.

Greek restaurants in Singapore.name: Place to R.E.A.D

Greek restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Absolutely loved my dining experience at this Greek restaurant! The flavors were authentic, and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. The staff was incredibly friendly, making it a delightful meal from start to finish. Can't wait to go back and savor more of their delicious dishes!

The meat platters and lamb rack at this Greek gem are culinary masterpieces! Each bite is a flavor explosion, and the tenderness of the meats is truly impressive. The dips, a perfect accompaniment, add an extra layer of deliciousness to every dish. A must-try for anyone who appreciates top-notch Greek cuisine!

Visited for the first time after hearing good reviews from friends. Awesome ambience and child-friendly. Helpful staff who helped us with food orders and wine recommendation. Dips were great, octopus tender and flavourful. Desserts were also delightful. The standout dish was the lamb chops!

Had dinner some time last week and the food was pretty good but it was quite pricey. The waiter asked if we would like sparkling or still water and we thought still meant free tap water, but it turned out to be $10 bottled water. Don’t make the same mistake as we did if you don’t want to splurge on water!

Unfortunately, we found a piece of stainless steel dish sponge in our food which is quite unhygienic and dangerous. The staff were kind enough to take it off our bill but this was a very eventful first experience dining here.

We had an excellent dinner here at Blu Kouzina. The food was delicious, staff very friendly and helpful, and the restaurant designed beautifully.

We shared the meat platter, kebab platter, 4 dip platter (tzatziki, hummus, red pepper, harissa), and kanafe. Everything we ordered was cooked to perfection and tasted amazing. Stand outs include the lamb chop and the red pepper dip.

The restaurant even served us a few drinks on the house!

Overall a great dining experience and easy recommendation.

Went to celebrate birthday with a few friends. The food and service were good. Only disappointment is that when we were leaving the place, the wine was actually not finished.  The staff could do better to confirm if we still want it before throwing the bottle away.
Greek restaurants in Singapore.name: Blu Kouzina Siglap

Greek restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
I came to Singapore few weeks ago and was looking for Mediterranean restaurants. I stumbled upon this gorgeous place 5 minutes away from my hotel. I tried Kebabs on day one and man it was delicious. Atmosphere is great and all servers are friendly, specially three girls Urmi, Wendy and Fina are super nice, they make sure to get you a table quickly, take the order in timely manner and also make valuable suggestions on the menu. They always keep checking if everything is fine and customers are enjoying food. I loved the desert suggestion after eating my dinner. After first day I have been to this place 7-6 times and was always greeted with same service. I highly recommend this restaurant and will go again before I leave Singapore for USA.

We had the sultan's delight and mussels with garlic cream and cheese toast. The sultan's delight is really enjoyable. We could taste the smokiness from the eggplant puree and the lamb stew is really tender with tomato based sauce. It's tangy and smoky with some crunchiness from the pine nuts. Really enjoyable. But the mussel is pretty standard. It didn't taste really fresh but they're quite generous with the amount. The garlic cheese sauce is ok only.
Service was good and attentive.

Visited for my birthday meal with my family as I was craving some Mediterranean food and this place had great reviews. However, the whole experience ended up kinda disappointing - as I had high expectations too on my first visit.

Service:
- It’s a restaurant but I felt like there was not much service per say.
- It’s a pretty high price point but they don’t serve complimentary water (charged at $3 a pot of hot water, or $11 for Evian water only)
- Ordering isn’t as fuss free as they try to make it. Online ordering only from mobile app, with just one physical menu at the door. Asked for any extra copies for easier viewing but none available. You also have to pay upfront in mobile order.
- Feels like I visited a restaurant but received fast food style service.

Atmosphere:
- Overall atmosphere is okay. Like a typical restaurant

Food:
- Average, I’ve had much better at other places for a similar price point.
- Pita bread, spreads and kebab grills were okay.
- Saffron rice & Briyani rice were disappointing. They use basmati rice which gave a nice texture. However, flavour is so subtle that I could barely taste the difference between the 2.

Summary:
Would I return? Definitely not! For the price point, the food and service didn’t live up to expectations for a highly rated restaurant. Will continue on my hunt for yummy Mediterranean food!

Visited on a Thu night, it's superb crowded and busy in the restaurant. 3 dishes for 2 people, very filling. Overall the food is pretty decent and the price point is on the higher side.

Excellent experience with vibrant dining experience. Food has great range of taste to excite the palate. Service is welcoming and top notch, they also gave a complimentary cake.
Greek restaurants in Singapore.name: Pistachio Middle Eastern & Mediterranean Grill

Greek restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
One of the few times you go to a restaurant and feel that the amount you paid for the service charge is worth it. The floor staff attend to you immediately and ensure the food served are hot. Unfortunately, there were some mishaps with the food served. When informed, it was immediately rectified and a new dish was served. I am very impressed with the service and the quality of food. Kudos.

Yummy food but I think they need more staff for the weekends. Hard to get their attention especially for water refill. Can’t blame them as there’s only two of them managing everything. Might want to consider self-service for the water though.

UPDATE:
Went back again and now they don’t even serve tap water but charge for bottled water at $6? Not sure if I will revisit.

We were there on a weekend for a late lunch. The place was very empty. We were ushered in quite quickly, but when we wanted to place an order, we waited quite a while to be able to get someone's attention.
3 out 4 items we wanted to order were not available, but we were not informed when we sat down, hence very disappointed. They also have a pasta menu that is not available for weekends too..
Food came quite fast, but the plates have very disgusting dirty and wet cotton string wrapped handles. I cannot imagine anyone's hand touching that and then touching the fries or wrap. Mocktail was a glass of diabetes, 15% to 20% syrup, coloring and milk. The orange cake was a miss too. It tasted like tapioca kueh.

We had a comfortable good time on a rainy Sunday evening, eve of PH, at Ela (Bukit Batok)! Our favourite dish was actually 'Keto' with Pulled Beef - the cauliflower rice was very well done with a generous portion of pulled beef! #mustry
We would like to do a special shout out to the one and only floor staff that night, Yani! She was like a wonderwoman, running the floor service alone, serving at least 5-6 tables of guests professionally - from bringing guests to tables, to taking orders, clearing tables, making drinks, serving the dishes etc.! Mad respect! Thank you for being so attentive and patient with your warm services! Will be back at the new outlet to try other items soon too! 🥳

It was so cozy and absolutely loved the vibes. The food was exceptional and the service was great.

The smell of the pita was sooo good and the pita on my lamb was soaked with flavor. Tho you may want to note that lamb generally has a strong smell/taste. My suggestion is to maybe elevate their dessert as the cake tasted like any ordinary lemon pound cake with an ice cream scoop on top. Wish there were smtg more special.
honestly would come here again.

Greek restaurants in Singapore.name: Éla Bukit Batok

Greek restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Food was amazing and prepared fantastically - delicious and hearty Greek/Mediterranean fare. All the restaurant staff were exceptionally warm, friendly, and kind, and it felt like we were having a sit down dinner at a family home. For the birthday celebration, everyone sang happy birthday as well and we were so well taken care of. The ambience was amazing. Definitely must try and we will definitely come back.

We went to Mykonos by the bay on 1st July to celebrate my daughter’s birthday. I must say that the service staff was quite friendly but the  quantity of the food actually disappointed us. The food was nice but portions were extremely small so we have to order more food. Specially the platter, which was priced at $29 was totally not worth as the dips portions were too small.

Very nice view of the marina of docked boats, al fresco dining.
Well trained staff, skillful and knowledgeable.
Food is equally fantastic.

Food is excellent, especially the fish, perfect with the creamy garlic source. Not too crowded on a Monday night, it was windy and comfortable with the outdoor seats. Staffs are attentive. Overall very pleasant experience.

Great Greek Food

Had dinner with a bunch of friends. We ordered to share. The meat sharing platter was of high quality and cooked to perfection despite it being a dish with many different types of meat. The breads and dips were also great.

Service was excellent. We had them arrange tables and then changed tables. They accommodated us each step of the way without any fuss. Service came promptly with a smile.

The place certainly lived up to its Mykonos name - blue and white furniture graced the place. Outdoor sitting was comfortable with ceiling ELV fans constantly cooling the place next to the water.
Greek restaurants in Singapore.address: 31 Ocean Way, #01-10 Quayside Isle, Sentosa Cove, 098375
Greek restaurants in Singapore.name: Mykonos On The Bay

Greek restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
We had our dinner here on Good Friday night with the last minute reservation from google.
We ordered a starter, a pizza, a grilled meat platter and a Lebanon dessert. The food worth 2 stars. The meat was pretty hard, the starter was too sour. The dessert was really not able to match our taste. The house wines was tasteless, but the red wine taste better when it pair with the meat. I will strongly recommend you only order the red if you want to have their one for one house wine promo.
Our bill was $128, you can get a much more better grilled meat platter and better food at other restaurants. :)

Le Rida has a rustic ambience somewhat akin to an old time eating house in a small town. Quaint and homely
Freshly baked pita bread with lemon chick pea hummus was delicious and filling
Mains of Lebanese lamb kafta kebab had the right balance of flavour and crunchiness.
Wash it all down with 1 for 1 Heineken draft at $17.90

Manager Sanjiv was both friendly and helpful in his recommendations and unlike in some establishments, he did not push you to over order.
Definitely worth a return visit!

A quaint no frills dining place with excellent food and good service. The staff are simple people but are very hospitable, often checking in on the food quality and our experience. If you are looking for a good meal away from hustle and bustle, this is the place to go. Oh.. U can definitely have a conversation with your company and hear them loud and clear

Didn't think the food was thaaaat amazing. Nor was the service. But at least they let us drink outside drinks.
HOWEVER, i requested for no garnishing on my hummus. When the guy brought it over, there WAS parsley on it. And all he said was "just pluck it out". --.--
So if i was allergic to that, i should just pluck it out.... nice. The hummus wasn't good either. I've tasted better. Like a friend who went with me commented... it isn't creamy enough. Also, comments about the baklava was that it was too hard... and wasn't good.

Absolutely loved the food, I am heavily into Mediterranean food. I have tried most of the places around Bugis as well. The food here was so fresh, with perfect taste and presentation. It was completely worth it travelling from East.
The service was quick, the portion size was generous . We ordered mezze plateer and tabalu salad. They were scrumptious loved the customised heart shaped Pita bread. Hummus, was so creamy and so were all other dips.

Would strongly recommend.. It has become one of my favourite place..

Greek restaurants in Singapore.name: Le Rida (Mediterranean. French. North Indian)

Greek restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The food is almost excellent, except the meat platter had some flaws where the beef was overcooked against what we ordered. The fish and the three dips with pita were excellent - must-try options. The salad was refreshing; I liked the sauce. A star was taken away for poor service provided.

First time trying and went with no expectation but was blown away. Easily one of the best eating places for my 2023! Fried calamari and superfood salad were ok, not bad. But, must order the Greek handcut fries - so smooth, so flavorful, so crunchy so unforgettable.. love it even till the very last stick! Grilled Souvlaki Chicken was so damn good: the chicken - tender and juicy plus the charred aroma, woohoo! tzatziki - ooh so perfect, the sides - all were so yummy! As for the white based chicken pesto pizza - ooh lala but definitely not recommending for one, please share else will be too jelak!

The food was not bad. I don’t know about the authenticity as I’m not so familiar with Greek, Mediterranean food but the taste was pretty good.
The pita bread was a bit too chewy not fluffy enough. And the way they cut it, kinda flattened it and made it sticky. But the dips were nice enough.
The octopus was tender and yet flavorful with grill taste. Not much lemon taste from the sauce below but it came with some salad.

However the price for the portion is not so value for money. For 2 pax, only 2 menu items of appetizers and 1 drink costs nearly $100… The pita bread platter was $28++, one octopus tentacle only was $38++.
Most ridiculous this is they charge $1++ per pax for table water aka tap water. Geez, I think that’s overdoing it. Firstly the tap water doesn’t even taste good, it’s got a weird taste, we hardly drank it. Secondly, one small cup each of tap water doesn’t cost the operator $0.50 from PUB, why are they charging $1++ per pax? Yes, you argue rental costs, labor costs, operation costs etc but it’s still a rip off. Evian from supermarket downstairs you can get mineral water for this price. You’ll say, it’s a restaurant don’t compare with supermarket but seriously tap water vs mineral water… don’t think water used to flush toilet costs as much as mineral water…

I don’t get why they are charging so much for everything because there’s not much service either. You even have to walk to the counter, stand and line up to pay. Is that service? Not impressed.

The atmosphere everything is just like a casual cafe. Half industrial looking with concrete floors. Nothing much. Don’t think I’ll be back. Unnecessary. Pita and dips you can make easily at home it’s so convenient now. Probably difficult to make tender grilled octopus. But meh, I don’t need it.

Palatable food and fairly large servings! Burrata pizza + Pitta bread with sauces were amazing - Tirokafteri & hummus. Ambience and decorations were great too! Would appreciate more attention to details in terms of planning surprises e.g. birthdays:)

Food was surprisingly good. Got the beef kebab (came with a pita and some form of tzatziki dip). The kebab was presented off the skewer, and was very juicy and flavourful. Just a little bit on the salty side, though pita + dip helped to balance that out. Wish there was another pita.

Staff were reasonably nice. One seated me, took my food order and said she would return for my drinks order, but never came back. However managed to ask someone else for help.

Overall a good experience and I would be back if in the area / craving juicy kebabs. Not a bad place for a date too, it's a spacious restaurant with enough room between seats that you don't feel like other people can listen in. Damage was about $38 for 1 pax after service charge and GST (ordered a main and water).

Greek restaurants in Singapore.name: Pano Kato Grill, Pizza & Deli

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
I came to Singapore few weeks ago and was looking for Mediterranean restaurants. I stumbled upon this gorgeous place 5 minutes away from my hotel. I tried Kebabs on day one and man it was delicious. Atmosphere is great and all servers are friendly, specially three girls Urmi, Wendy and Fina are super nice, they make sure to get you a table quickly, take the order in timely manner and also make valuable suggestions on the menu. They always keep checking if everything is fine and customers are enjoying food. I loved the desert suggestion after eating my dinner. After first day I have been to this place 7-6 times and was always greeted with same service. I highly recommend this restaurant and will go again before I leave Singapore for USA.

We had the sultan's delight and mussels with garlic cream and cheese toast. The sultan's delight is really enjoyable. We could taste the smokiness from the eggplant puree and the lamb stew is really tender with tomato based sauce. It's tangy and smoky with some crunchiness from the pine nuts. Really enjoyable. But the mussel is pretty standard. It didn't taste really fresh but they're quite generous with the amount. The garlic cheese sauce is ok only.
Service was good and attentive.

Visited for my birthday meal with my family as I was craving some Mediterranean food and this place had great reviews. However, the whole experience ended up kinda disappointing - as I had high expectations too on my first visit.

Service:
- It’s a restaurant but I felt like there was not much service per say.
- It’s a pretty high price point but they don’t serve complimentary water (charged at $3 a pot of hot water, or $11 for Evian water only)
- Ordering isn’t as fuss free as they try to make it. Online ordering only from mobile app, with just one physical menu at the door. Asked for any extra copies for easier viewing but none available. You also have to pay upfront in mobile order.
- Feels like I visited a restaurant but received fast food style service.

Atmosphere:
- Overall atmosphere is okay. Like a typical restaurant

Food:
- Average, I’ve had much better at other places for a similar price point.
- Pita bread, spreads and kebab grills were okay.
- Saffron rice & Briyani rice were disappointing. They use basmati rice which gave a nice texture. However, flavour is so subtle that I could barely taste the difference between the 2.

Summary:
Would I return? Definitely not! For the price point, the food and service didn’t live up to expectations for a highly rated restaurant. Will continue on my hunt for yummy Mediterranean food!

Visited on a Thu night, it's superb crowded and busy in the restaurant. 3 dishes for 2 people, very filling. Overall the food is pretty decent and the price point is on the higher side.

Excellent experience with vibrant dining experience. Food has great range of taste to excite the palate. Service is welcoming and top notch, they also gave a complimentary cake.
Mediterranean food in Singapore.name: Pistachio Middle Eastern & Mediterranean Grill

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
I had the pleasure of trying Turkish cuisine for the first time, and it was truly a delightful experience! The standout dish for me was the lamb; it had absolutely no odor and tasted fantastic. The grilled items were a highlight as well, bursting with delicious flavors. The restaurant’s ambiance was beautifully decorated, and the staff was both charming and incredibly helpful, taking the time to explain the dishes to us. While it’s not the cheapest option, the prices are fair for the quality you receive.

One thing to note, though, is that the platter we ordered was described as “for two,” but for Asians, it’s considered a generous portion. So, if there are four of you and you’ve already ordered other dishes, I recommend going for the platter for two only; it’s quite substantial. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great dining experience!

First time having Turkish food and was really
pleasantly surprised. Their dips and bread was really exceptional. The bread was steaming when it came out it was both crispy and fluffy at the same time. The platter for 2 was also great all the grilled meats was tender and flavourful. Portion was also huge.

Everything from the service to food were impeccable. Staff were polite and always made sure we were well taken care of. I ordered before my friend came and they asked when the food should be prepared and how it should be served. Food was perfectly done too. It is the little things that make a difference and win them a return customer.

Very impressive food & service displayed by the dedicated front staffs and chefs. It’s nice walking in the street after a wine & dine session in the area. The staffs were very attentive, price is reasonable.

Went here for a birthday celebration and the attention to detail from their service staff is amazing, didn’t mention to the staff that it was for a birthday celebration, only had a note in the reservation. But they went above and beyond, having candles in the dessert and even giving us props to take pictures with and proceeded to then print out the photo of us to keep!

The food also matches the service, authentic Turkish cuisine done perfectly, the Hummus was so good we had to order a second portion! I’m not usually a fan of chicken but the chicken that came with the platter blew my mind, so juicy and tender. Then comes dessert, my first time having Kunefe and the only thing I have to say is that I wish I didn’t share it, wanted it all to myself 🤣

Definitely coming back here again!

Mediterranean food in Singapore.name: Alaturka Mediterranean & Turkish Restaurant

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
Third time back at this restaurant and certainly will be back for more. Authentic Turkish cuisine and we especially love the creamy hummus, chickpea stew and delightful kunefe. Great service as well. Will recommend to visit in a group to try a variety of sides and mains!

Everything is delicious here! Staffs are friendly, the Kunefe is one of the best, and the Karavan kebabs, both beef and lamb, are amazing! 😅 The hot pita bread is also great. In the last 4-5 months, we've visited this place many times, and our friends love it too. Whenever we want to enjoy a meal without worrying about quality and taste, we head straight to this restaurant. 😋 You won't regret giving it a try!

Hummus! Good! The lunch set is value for money - comes with a main + drink + soup + bread + dessert all for $20!
The pita bread is baked to perfection and the submarine bread looks so amazing! However the price for the submarine bread is a little high. Will probably not order this again the next time.
The soup of the day was lentil soup (vegetable soup) its really rich and herby. Very different from what i usually have.
The chicken dish is the highlight of the meal. The chicken meat is sooooo soft and tender. The seasoning is on point. Goes really well with the breads. The rice that comes with the dish is really fragrant as well.
Lots of vegetarian options.
Overall a positive experience and will recommend 👍🏻

Total bill is about $85++

Ordered quite abit for 2 person.  Love the cauliflower salad. Hummus, eggplant dips. As we were celebrating our birthday, the restaurant gave us complimentary tea and a kind of Turkish delight. The staff were attentive and friendly. Will definitely go back for the cauliflower salad and hummus.

This was my second visit today and my colleagues and I absolutely loved the food! I am usually not a fan of Turkish or Mediterranean food but this place is an exception. After trying the food a few months ago for the first time, I have been wanting to visit them again.

Every dish was delicious and tasted fresh and   wholesome. The Mezeplate is a good option if you are not sure what to order as it has a bit of everything and you can to try the different dips and appetisers. I enjoyed the hummus, cauliflower salad and eggplant dip very much. Their lentil soup was very good too - comforting and tasty.

For the mains, we tried two of their lunch set meals -  two rice dishes with the different chicken kebabs which were served with tea, soup and a rice pudding dessert. We also ordered their salmon which was so tender and flavourful. Several colleagues commented that it was the best salmon they had ever tasted!

The highlight of the meal was their dessert - Kunefe which was absolutely delicious! The taste and texture was so complex and had so much depth! The crispy stringy pastry with the creamy sauce, nuts and ice cream was indeed like what the menu described it to be - “a slice of heaven”!

This is seriously an underrated restaurant which serves amazing food and I would highly recommend it :)

Mediterranean food in Singapore.name: The Mediterranean Deli Turk

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
Honestly, wasn’t the most impressed with the service here at first, asked for order and the person simply said yes can continued doing his own stuff for 5minutes.

However, when the food came, i didn’t think too much about it afterwards. Starting from the hummus, absolutely generous and delicious portions. Perfect appetizer.

The butter rice with kebab was crazy delicious, we literally scraped the plate clean from the rice and the greek yogurt like substance in the centre.

Pizza was crispy and fragrant at the same time, the tomato sauce parts was absolutely amazing.

Strawberry drink was okay!!! Not super special but nice!

In the middle of Arab street you find this restaurant. We were welcomed by a real Turkish guy. Very friendly and he could advise us what was the best to order. We sat outside, along the street. Within 15 min the table was full with all kinds of grilled meat. Real Turkish flavors and a nice apple tea were enough to make my day complete. Eating here, and watching the people pass by is a big joy.

Parking in this area is very hard, as you can understand.

Had a great dinner here today. My friend saw this online with high rating stars so we just stopped by after work.  And yes, the food is delicious, the atmosphere is awesome, love the music too.
So if your family or friends are outgoing and friendly, this is the right place for you to gather together and laugh together and dance together !

Cuisine is new to me as a traveller. Trying the dish with my arab friends and the chef being a wonderful host in telling us about the different food added to the stellar experience of dining here. Service was awesome. Food was a good blend of flavors.

Just returning home from an amazing service and hospitality from Cappadocia.
Chef Ahmed Hagras went out of his way to arrange a very sweet surprise for my husband's birthday at my request.
The whole staff sang happy birthday for him with a special kunafe.

The food itself is finger licking good, no doubt. But the experience was way better.

Thank you everyone at Cappadocia for helping make this day special for him.

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
Stumbled across this place today and decided to eat here with my mum. Very no frills and simple place.

She had a falafel moussaka, and I had the mexican beef bowl. The moussaka was delicious but I feel like 5 pieces of nacho chips wasn’t enough and mind you this cost $13…..

The beef bowl was a little dry, could do with some kind of sauce but it was good and we finished both dishes. The churros came freshly fried and was good too, but would have preferred actual choc sauce vs the hershey choc syrup.

Only gripes; the overly sugary lemongrass drink that was served premade with no ice. Had to ask for ice twice but given few pieces…..  also very weird that we dined in but were served with plastic cutlery when we clearly saw metal cutlery, it was a little strange. It was practically only 2 tables and the lady served my food to the other table…. Could tell she wanted to take it back to serve me but they already started eating it.

I think its a quaint little place but some things need to be improved. At $30 for 2 expected just a little more.

Excellent service. The beef Mexican rice bowl was not bad. With the homemade drink, I spent less than $10. I was there alone at 5 ish and I had the entire place to myself. I don't remember music playing but it sure would be nice to listen to some tunes.

Small quaint shop located near Tai Seng Mrt, they had a $10 set meal that had a wrap, small hash brown and a lemongrass tea. There was a small side of nacho chips with salsa.

Nothing amazing but I guess it was better than nothing coz there wasn’t anything there open before 11am

Dropped-off my 10-months old laptop at LENOVO Service Centre at 3 Irving Rd, #01-17 Tai Seng Centre. BITC, Singapore 369522 on Tuesday 18 April 2023,

Thus decide to settle my late lunch within the area too.

One will be spoiled with choices as there are so many small eateries and cafes. I was drawn to  Olive Mediterranean & Middle East which was located across the street at 11 Irving Place #01-14/15, Tai Seng Point, Singapore 369551.

Ordered for myself a Mexican Rice (Celantro & Spinach With Beef) Bowl at S$7.50.

If you are a small eater, the serving portion is just right. However, definitely a "No. No." for someone who has a heavy duty digestive system, I would recommend that you order some nachos or Quesadillas too.

In my opinion, the rice is mildy aromatic (I was expecting a more pungent aroma of Celantro and spinach).

I will rate the minced beef topping as "healthy choice".  It is relatively quite nice BUT will not leave one any special impression.  It will definitely taste alot better if there is a little more fat (this will enhance the juiciness) and more spices are added.

However, if you working in this area, it is a great place to meet up with your colleagues and friends after work.  You can sufficient outdoor sittings surrounded with plants.

Stumbled on this place as i happened to be browsing around. Been awhile since i had my tacos and wraps, decided to try this as i noticed they had very high reviews.

Had the beef Quesadilla - loved it as it was simply nice
Chicken Saffron Stew - Soooo tender and nice but soup wasnt as thick as i wanted but thats purely due to my own taste
Hashbrowns - Thumbsup as we all loved it. Hearsay its even better than M's hashbrown but i leave it for u to judge.

Service wise was top, very homely feel given by the lady boss and staff. She took her time to guide me through the menu and shared with me what we should order.
I must say the food takes a pretty long time to come for a quiet Monday Afternoon but i guess Good Food - Time to prepare so no complaints from me on this.

Overall i recommend this place based on the food served + prices. Very nice and they deserves better businesses. should be pretty quiet when its after office hours.

Will be back again :)

Wash it all down with 1 for 1 Heineken draft at $17.90

Manager Sanjiv was both friendly and helpful in his recommendations and unlike in some establishments, he did not push you to over order.
Definitely worth a return visit!

If you are looking for a good meal away from hustle and bustle, this is the place to go. Oh.. U can definitely have a conversation with your company and hear them loud and clear

Didn't think the food was thaaaat amazing. Nor was the service. But at least they let us drink outside drinks.
HOWEVER, i requested for no garnishing on my hummus. When the guy brought it over, there WAS parsley on it. And all he said was "just pluck it out". --.--
So if i was allergic to that, i should just pluck it out.... nice. The hummus wasn't good either. I've tasted better. Like a friend who went with me commented... it isn't creamy enough. Also, comments about the baklava was that it was too hard... and wasn't good.

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
My favourite Greek restaurant in Singapore of all time.  I have been here 10 TIMES. The food is always so consistently good. They serve the best salad, octopus, sea bream, lamb chop and even chicken. Their dips and pita bread are also to die for. Service isn't as good as it used to be anymore but oh well.

Celebrated a friend birthday here and the staff was quite helpful. We were introduced to a good spread. Wasn’t expecting the food to be good in this type of cafe but was pleasantly surprised of the meat quality and portion. Slightly on the salty side but acceptable. Overall, would come back again.

Loved having dinner here. Food, service, atmosphere all fantastic. Wayne was a great server who recommended some signature dishes - codfish roe was my fav. Octopus was well cooked and kebab was also unique but perfectly cooked.

Came here multiple times including the one at the old location. Also recommended and brought my friends, colleagues here many times! Loved the food, ambience and service! Just so good! This time my friends and I came here to celebrate birthday and the bar manager treated us to complimentary alcohol and gave a small bottle of olive oil (we also purchased a big one!). Their olive oil tastes so gooooooood! The dessert was complimentary as well. I love the fish, octopus and vegetables the best!

Food is fantastic. Price is reasonable as well, total damage is about $50/pax. (We ordered like 7-8 dishes).
Service is pretty prompt. The ambience is good & cozy for gathering & chit-chatting.

Mediterranean food in Singapore.name: BAKALAKI Greek Taverna

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
The most delicious Mediterranean food in Singapore. Very friendly staff,- quick service and very nice Singapore Sling. Super clean environment, good ambiance and price worthy. 5/5 will come back for sure.

If you like Hummus, this restaurant/pub has the best Hummus in Singapore 🇸🇬 .
Just order the big portion! You won't regret it.

For a person who doesn't like lamb, I'd like to share that this restaurant is the only one where I would not hesitate to order their lamb shanks!

The atmosphere is good for catching up with friends over a beer and a good Turkish meal.  A change from the usual type of dining places we locals normally go to. The friends I brought there thoroughly enjoyed the evening.

The staff are friendly and humorous.  It can get crowded Friday nights.  So go early!

They are open 6 days a week, closed on Sunday.

Super juicy and delicious kebab and loved the hummus and babaganoush too. The lunch special is good value for the quality and portion. Service was quick and helpful. Will definitely be back to try more.

Kazbar's cold mezze platter is a delightful mix of flavors with hummus, baba ghanoush, tabbouleh, falafel, stuffed grape leaves, olives, and pickled veggies. The lychee mint crush mocktail is a must-try, and the lively atmosphere adds to the overall experience. 🌟

Unique experience eating middle eastern food. The food was great and there was quite a bit of variety. Also the staff were very friendly! It is a bit on the pricey side but it is still worth the experience.

Mediterranean food in Singapore.name: Kazbar - Middle Eastern & Lebanese Restaurant + Catering

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
The perfect place chosen for a birthday celebration!!

From great service, to amazing ambience, to tasty food... everything was simply perfect!

Awesome selection for both veg & non-veg menu!!

2 thumbs up!

Thank you Byblos for making our evening beautiful!

Quality food, ambience and excellent service from staff made the dinner special. Thanks to receptionist Mahiti for always giving a great smile to all guest. It definitely makes a difference.

We celebrated my brother's birthday here and had a great time. The restaurant is beautifully decorated with classic Turkish designs and really put us in the mood for their cuisine.

We ordered the mixed grilled platter to share and they portioned it for to the seven people in our party. The salads were fresh and the dessert was delicious. I highly recommend their kunfa as it's authentic, made fresh and absolutely scrumptious.

My only drawback was the warmth. There could have been better distribution of air-conditioning, other than that we had a swell time. I know there are many other restaurants in the area offering a similar experience but Byblos stands apart with class and authenticity.

LOVE the food!!! Hot, freshly baked lavash bread, delectable and well seasoned kebabs, even the salads appealed to my picky 11 year old. Ambience was lovely, only downside was the music is a wee bit loud (I was sitting indoors), but the staff brought down the volume. Our plates were all cleaned out, clearly we enjoyed dinner at Byblos. Highly recommended!

There are many Turkish food restaurants along Arab Street but this is the best one I've had here. In fact, I daresay it's the best Turkish food I've ever had. The Chef and waiters were all very welcoming!

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
The best Greek restaurants we’ve ever been in Singapore. The ingredients are so fresh and every dish is very delicious.
The desert is also the highlight.

Will come back to try more dishes.

Came here for a work lunch as the food was supposed to be good! Apparently my friend said that the standards have dropped and the food used to be better prior to their renovation…

Also, the restaurant has a strict 2 hours rule in place and we had to vacate the place by 2pm for their closing.. not a good experience for sure.

One of the best Greek food I’ve ever had! The dips are yummy, pitas are warm and tasty, the grilled octopus is one of the best I’ve ever had!!!! The tacos giros are yummy and the beef is of great quality! One more thing to mention is that they even serve Greek beer!!! The service is good, decoration/interior design is top! A must go place!!!!

Seating x1:          ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
