1 🔴🔴🔴🔴🔴🔴🟡🟡🟢🟢 10

The best Greek food in Singapore!

Slightly pricey but the food taste amazing, simple yet flavorful!

The highlight for me was the octopus and eggplant spread 💯

Beautiful interior decor but the place was a little cramped and noisy due to the proximity of the tables. Food was great, esp the grilled octopus, but prices are on the higher end. Worth a try :)
Mediterranean food in Singapore.name: Alati Divine Greek Cuisine

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
This was my third or fourth time here. My last visit was quite awhile back. The food, ambience, and service here are very good! Parking is free! Place tends to get crowded and there’s sometimes a queue, so it’s wise to make a reservation before heading down. Had the dips and bread, octopus, sea bass, spinach pastries, and finally, baklava for dessert! Everything was great! Octopus was nice and tasty + tender, sea bass was fresh, all the pastries were warm and the Greek coffee we had to end the meal was pretty good too! Will be back here again to try more food! Hopefully sooner than later! Highly recommended for authentic Greek Mediterranean food! Fantastic experience every visit!

A lovely place for those looking for non pork meals. They don’t qualify as a halal place  as they serve alcohol. But good for Muslim friends. It was my first time here and it’s been a while since I had Greek food. I love the dips option from spicy to mild tasting dips. The fried calamari was great too followed by the medium rare lamb which was tender. Ensure you make a reservation to avoid disappointment. Good place to bring friends.

Always crowded on weekends such that even booking a table on same day is sometimes not possible.
I really enjoyed the medium meat platter. grilling was on point  meat was juicy and not dry.
moussaka went down way too easily. Greek dip platter was on point flavour wise and the taramasalata was flavourful without tasting too fishy.
sadly the pita bread is pretty small portioned, I'm not sure how you're expected to finish the dip given with the portions served
Grilled octopus was also delicious.

Service was friendly and efficient.
Decor isn't very Greek but honestly ambience is great (albeit a bit noisy)

It's harder to get a table here than the at its closest competitor, and for  good reason.

Good food. Although the beef can be on the dry side, everything else was delicious.

Highly recommend the grilled octopus. It is not chewy at all. For those who don’t like squid or octopus, try to have a bite.

Restaurant is packed on a Friday night and the food arrives pretty quick. Staff are quite alright. Some could use a little refining in politeness.

There’s complimentary licorice candy. Absolutely love it.

Will visit this place again. But recommend to come here in a bigger group to order a larger variety of dishes.

First visit. Reservation was smooth via seven rooms. We chose an outdoor table as the weather was pleasant. The food was delicious. We had the whole oven chicken and chicken yiro wrap with fries. Pesto pasta was good as well. Desserts were amazing too. Overall highly satisfied.
Mediterranean food in Singapore.name: Blu Kouzina Dempsey

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
Visited here on a weekday for lunch with office colleagues. We had reservation and took the seats arranged for our big group. There was option of set menu as well as ala carte. We went ahead with the recommendations of the staff and had the following: fried cauliflower served with mint chutney, hummus with pita bread, assorted kebabs which included lamb, chicken, pork and falafel. We had some beverages too. The menu is elaborate with Mediterranean cuisine and taste is authentic though some may not like it.
It was crowded during our time of visit yet the service was good. Staff are friendly and knows well of the dishes.

Went for a weekday lunch and with the $29 set lunch it was filling and totally worth it. Love the artichoke and herb hummus served with pita bread. It was better than the cashew  hummus. Chopped kale was good. Pretty interesting with fried capers and lady finger but smoke aubergine seems to be less flavourful. I would like it with more yogurt. No complaints about the seabass, chicken, pork ribs and lamb leg kebabs. Chicken was soft, pork ribs had tons of asian flavours and lamb leg was juicy. Overall would recommend.

Came here with some friends for brunch and decided to go ALA carte instead of the brunch package. To be honest, 55SGD for the brunch package was quite reasonable. But everyone on the table had to take it. Which was quite disappointing.

However - not an issue since we managed to order what we wanted anyway. I like the cauliflower and the egg plant dish. It was quite tasty. I had the crab tacos which were alright. Generally not bad for a brunch spot. I would go for the set the next time I'm back.

Food: very delicious, good options for vegetarians. We went for the brunch & it came with a hummus dip and side which we could mix and match. We tried the artichoke and herb hummus and cashew hummus and loved both. The kale with mihalic cheese was outstanding and I’ve never enjoyed kale more. The cauliflower with green tahini had this lovely tangy taste and was roasted to perfection. For the main course, we tried the full breakfast plate but it was slightly underwhelming as none of the items were outstanding. Didn’t like the falafel at all. The halloumi was delicious but only a small piece. The French toast was fresh and scrumptious.

Service: excellent service with attentive and accommodating staff who moved us to another table as our adjoining table was very noisy and loud.

Ambience: My friend and I didn’t really enjoy the ambience as we weren’t seated at the best place with a huge noisy group next to us and a service trolley beside us. I feel it would be much nicer if we sat up front in the main area where the bar is.

Visited in Oct 2023

Really great cocktails. But found the food to be average other than a couple of dishes which stood out. Among the mezze dishes, I thought that the Roasted Cashew Hummus and the Duck Pastilla were good. Didn’t like the octopus mezze as all of us felt it was burnt/over-grilled. For mains, we tried the pork ribeye which was ~3.5/5. Ordered 1 dessert item (kunefe) which was pretty good.

All the cocktails we tried were quite decent with my favs being Ottoman’s Island, Aergul Paloma and the Baklava Milk Punch.

Service was really good.

Mediterranean food in Singapore.name: Fat Prince

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
Good food and ambience. Lamb items tasted better. Wish the Arabic rice was cooked more. It was dry.
Belly dancer with amazing dance skills was a surprising addition.
Had a great time.

A bit further down the road from the more crowded food areas, but well worth the extra distance. The chicken kebab lunch special was excellent, the apple tea was also wonderful, and the staff are very attentive.

This was an excellent find while going through that area!

Mezze platter - 3.75 stars
Dips were delicious. Pita was bland and could've been better.

Kebab platter - 3.75 stars
Sausage was great. Beef and chicken a bit dry. Lamb was salty.

The food is really delicious and there are many must try middle east delicacies. The  downside of the restaurant is the service though they charge 10% service charge.

Hi, the best place in Arab street for authentic food. I keep coming back here and the food is very affordable, choose this restaurant if you can’t decide! We even got a free dessert, from Amar, his service was great!!!
Mediterranean food in Singapore.name: Beirut Grill

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
The food was not too bad. First time having Lebanese food. The chicken was cooked nicely and the basmati rice was seasoned well. The lamb chops were on the drier side. Overall interesting meal. Recommended for group dinners.

First time trying Lebanese food and it was really nice with a very good vibe. the ambiance was all set and whole arab street experince was lit. Hummus with bread and apple teas is a myst try dish over here. The price is on the higher side and I would say going in a group pf 5-6 people will be good as we get to try lot of new dishes.

Sanobar Lebanese Restaurant in Singapore is a hidden culinary gem that whisks diners away to the flavors of Lebanon. The restaurant offers a delectable and authentic Lebanese dining experience, from succulent shawarmas to flavorful falafels and tantalizing baklava desserts.

The ambiance is warm and inviting, and the friendly staff ensures a delightful dining experience. The menu caters to various dietary preferences and offers a true taste of Middle Eastern cuisine. Staff is so welcoming and friendly! Whether you're a fan of Lebanese food or new to it, Sanobar is a must-visit, I enjoyed the place so much when I visited Singapore in January!

Visited 13 July 2023 humid summer evening. The following sharing are based on our unbiased personal opinion and experience.

Multiple visit to this restaurant serving Turkish delicacy. Located at Kampong glam, Bussorah street. We had a great and delicious dinner for the night.

The food was filling and delicious dessert 🎂 and Turkish coffee was fantastic. And the dining atmosphere vibes was good with outdoor sitting.

Food 4 ⭐
Services 4 ⭐
Atmosphere 4 ⭐
Return to try again definitely 😁

Drop by the next time when you visit Kampong Glam I'm pretty sure you will like it here. Cheers

Nice food. Requested for some cherry tomatoes on the side and was spot on. Chicken was cook perfectly and tender. Good service staff. Was given a mint tea after meal. 5 star for the chefs and service crew.

A must go to restaurant. ;)

Mediterranean food in Singapore.name: Sanobar

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
I had the pleasure of being served by Mr. Faizal at the counter, and I must say he was incredibly patient, addressing all my questions. What truly impressed me was the meticulous way he packed the condiments – neatness and attention to detail, it's the little things that count!

I highly recommend giving their kebabs a try. Personally, I'm a big fan of the Shawarma Mandi Rice, as you can see in the photo here. It's not just tasty; it's downright mouthwatering! 📸🍴

Best kebab ever - they use a creamy sauce.
that sets it apart from most kebabs in Singapore. lamb shank texture technically great.

That said, it’s not so much Mediterranean as it is a South Asian interpretation of Turkish food. In that sense it lacked the South Asian spice overload, but also needed more of the exuberant flavour of the Turkish seaside (olives, olive oil, etc)

Service was amazing - it’s not an Indian restaurant but I found myself accidentally ordering all sorts of off menu things like lime juice no sugar and mango lassi, and they delivered.

Ordered the mutton kabsa, fattoush, khubz and a giant container of toum for dine in, as well as chicken shawarma for takeaway.

I appreciate that the food closely resembles the kabsa and shawarma versions you find in Saudi Arabia or Lebanon.

The shawarma had no weird chili sauce inside it, and had pickles and french fries. The mutton was tender and flavorful and the kabsa rice was nicely aldente.

If you're not looking to try more authentic middle eastern food outside of Turkish cuisine, this is the place to go.

Food tasted amazing and friendly service staff. The meats were seasoned and spiced flavourfully and the accompanying sides complemented it greatly. There was a slightly order confusion but the management solved it professionally.

Good food when im dine,service staff very friendly they recommended me few nice dishes for me takeaway,price affordable compared in arab Street

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
A very welcoming atmosphere and service was top notch. The concept and food was unique and good but like what others have mentioned, the portion can be rather small for its price tag. The wagyu beef was the highlight.

Definitely a unique place to visit if you’d want to try Mediterranean food and the service is really good. It’d be a place to consider revisiting if the portion matches its price tag.

The kind of place we had absolutely nothing to complain about.

Great food quality, amazing service, awesome atmosphere and inanely good cocktails.

We’ll be back

Food is great but the portion is too little, this should be improved.  Drinks are great, they have their own signature cocktail  The restaurant has great music and vibes.  Great for pre-dinner drinks.  Interior is beautiful and cleverly designed.

Best cheese cake I’d ever tried!!

It’s a new & cozy restaurant with passionate staff, one of the best restaurant in my SG trip, especially their cheese cake and the bikini… miss them so much!

First time into this nice Mediterranean Restaurant, ambience is good. Food is superb with Chef Marcus recommendations. The grilled salmon n lamb kofta were good! Love their desserts grapefruit tart n ice cream sandwich. The service is great n staff are friendly..

Mediterranean food in Singapore.name: Noa

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
After 15 years, this restaurant sadly shows its age, lacking the charm and care it once might have had. Claiming to offer authentic Persian cuisine, the reality is a disappointing mix of flavors that lean more towards Indian than Persian. The kebabs, dry and tasteless, are a stark contrast to the rich flavors expected from Persian cooking. Equally disheartening is the rice – cold, undercooked, and lacking the basic essence of Persian culinary art. This establishment, once perhaps a bastion of authentic cuisine, now serves as a reminder of how far it has strayed from its original glory.

Flavourful middle-eastern cuisine, the dips were delicious.
Nice al fresco dinning areas.
Thank you, Ronny for the great host that makes our dinner wonderful. We appreciate your service.

Came back to this lovely Persian restaurant after 3-4 years to celebrate the Wife’s birthday. Last time here was for dinner, with the belly dancer floating around!

This time we were seated indoors due to the afternoon heat! Last few times were seated outside by the river which is lovely in the evening.

It was quite busy on a Sunday afternoon ! The food was as good as we remembered it to be.

Look forward to coming back here… sooner this time :-)

flavourful and appetising Persian food! had an enjoyable alfresco dinner by the river with a very accommodating food attendant. the dessert was delicious but the faludeh shirazi was a tad too sweet for us. maybe next time will just stick with the saffron ice cream on top of the faludeh, sooo good. will go back to try more food on the menu!

We enjoy a spread of 3-Course Middle-eastern set lunch for $48++ per person. 🍷And we add on 2 hours of Toi Toi Sara’s Rose free flow for $40++ per person. Here what we ordered:
❤️ Kash-E-Bademjan
❤️ Borani Esfanaj
❤️ Fish Kebab
-Well marinated with special saffron sauce, it is very fresh and flavourful
❤️ Chicken Masti
-Marinated with yogurt and herbs, the chicken is tender and slightly charred given it’s fragrance
❤️ Dessert
-We love the ice-cream with spice and the Pistachios
The wine is good, with tinge of sweetness and hinge of dryness.
We really enjoy our meal in a restaurant with such a serene environment right beside Singapore River.

Mediterranean food in Singapore.name: Shabestan, Finest Persian Restaurant

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
The menu offers a wonderful variety of authentic Turkish dishes, each bursting with flavors that transported me to the heart of Istanbul. The quality of the ingredients was evident in every bite, and the presentation was a feast for the eyes.

The staff at Derwish are not only knowledgeable about the menu but also passionate about ensuring a memorable dining experience. Their attentiveness and friendly demeanor added to the overall positive atmosphere.

Had a delightful dining experience at Derwish Turkish! The mixed kebab platter was outstanding; I was trying to control my carbs but I couldn't get enough of the fragrant rice. The hummus was good, although the bread was a bit tough for my liking. However, what truly stood out was the exceptional service. The staff was incredibly friendly and always had a smile on their faces, which added to the overall splendid experience. Looking forward to visiting again!

Everytime I have a loved one visiting Singapore, I always take them here. I always come back here for the food and service. The food is great - big serving and authentic and I love their Bunefe!! ♥️ The service is top notch, leaving us satisfied every single time. Will surely be back with other loved ones who are about to visit. 🥰

Great food and service. Food is definitely wayyy more expensive than the usual, but the taste makes it not such a bad deal. Apple tea is really nice before eating the food, very refreshing and fragrant but after eating any food it doesn't taste as nice.

Peter, the staff here, was exceptionally polite and gave us a warm welcome. When I needed to store my dessert in the fridge, he was incredibly helpful. Peter also recommended their signature dishes, and we decided to try them.

The Tajin lamb shank was a delightful surprise, with tender, succulent meat that practically fell off the bone. The flavors were rich and aromatic, making it a standout dish.

The Meze tabagi was a delightful assortment of Mediterranean appetizers, a true explosion of flavors and textures. It included a variety of dips, fresh vegetables, and savory bites, providing a wonderful contrast of tastes.

For a refreshing beverage, we ordered the Mango Ayran. It was a perfect balance of sweet and tangy, making it a great complement to our meal.

Unfortunately, as there were only two of us, we couldn't order the traditional dessert Peter recommended. Nevertheless, we thoroughly enjoyed the atmospheric environment, delicious food, and excellent service provided by the staff.
Mediterranean food in Singapore.opening_hours:

Mediterranean food in Singapore.name: Derwish Turkish Restaurant

Mediterranean food in Singapore.reviews:
My friend and I have been wanting to return since our first visit a few years ago. We came with more friends this time and it was as good as we remembered. The menu is different from then but the quality of the food is consistent! We loved almost everything. Not to mention, the attentiveness and warmth of the staff - really made the whole dining experience more enjoyable

Overlooking Singapore CBD, Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer, and the sea, the view from the restaurant was simply breathtaking. The food presentation was impeccable, and I particularly enjoyed the beef tartare as well as the burrata with ham and figs. However, I found both main dishes, the chicken breast, and iberico pork a bit on the dry side, but overall, they were still satisfactory. The service was outstanding, and I was touched by their attentiveness to my reservation note about celebrating my boyfriend's birthday. They remembered and brought out a delicious sticky date cake with a candle and birthday wishes, creating a wonderful surprise. The overall experience was truly fantastic.

Staff service was top notch ! Food was amazing and special. We were treated with a full moon night view too ! Even my 8 year old commented “Good Service” ! Definitely will be back for more :)

I would give more than 5 stars if it was possible. An unforgettable and delicious last diner in Singapore after 1 week. And the sauvignon blanc was perfect!

Food is not good as we expected. Ambience is nice and cozy though. I understand from colleagues that the finger food at cocktail section is appetizing, they recommended the french fries.

Mediterranean food in Singapore.name: Artemis Grill & Sky Bar
Ambrosia Mediterranean Lounge

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
Fantastic Korean food that is value for money. They charged you $10.50 for the spicy pork meal they will give you the value of $10.50 meal.

Spicy pork was well marinated, right amount of cabbage as well. The cabbage soup is also good got tofu inside too. Love the whole combination.

Plenty of seats available and the queue moves quickly. My plate of spicy pork came out sizzling 🥵 you can see the bits of sauce splatter on my tray hahah

Worth it 💯

It’s truly a Korean food stall that’s 100% worth the value.
The new items which is the spicy soba is really good. Soba is not soaked in water and it’s the dry mixed type.
The chilli sauce is not spicy and well portioned, so that the soba doesn’t get thick sauces on it.
The pancake is really authentic and first time liking a Korean style pancake.
Shrimp tempura 6 pieces for $5.5, it’s definitely the best deal every.

Taste nice! Portion wise very big.

Got really confused what to order as all the menu looks good.

Price is good for the portion

Think can share for two people.

Each set comes with one side dish. You can choose between kimchi anchovies or cucumber.

I came here 30 years ago, and they are still in operation! Kim’s used to be in a food court setting, but now they have their own setup.

Unique to Kim’s is their water based hot plate. A must try are the beef bulgogi, spicy chicken and kimchi soup.

Heard lots of good reviews on its authentic yet affordable korean food so I decided to head down for lunch on Saturday. We ordered a spicy beef soup which comes with a side of rice and one side dish, a chives pancake as well as beef bibimbap.

The soup was pretty delicious, nicely salted and the vegetables and meat portion was very generous. It wasnt very spicy, which is good for those with a low spice tolerance.

Beef bibimbap was hot (temperature wise) which makes the rice nicely scorched and slightly crispy at the bottom. The sauce is slightly different from others I've tried, with a twang of sweet soy and meaty taste. The bibimbap comes with a small dish of bibim sauce as well, so you can personalise how much sauce you can add.

I do love the chives pancake, its fluffy yet crisp. Theres a nice balance of veges in it, so the chives is not too overwhelming.

Overall, the food is worth the trip for me. Flavours were all on-point and the meals were all quite healthy and not too oily. Great for families to visit!

Aesthetically, the place gives off a canteen vibe (no music and wallpaper decor), but for the price range, it doesnt bother me. Service was great as well, the staff was very helpful and multilingual (-1 though as I wanted another soup and they gave me the wrong recommendation :( )
Korean dining in Singapore.opening_hours:

Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM

Korean dining in Singapore.address: 100 Orchard Rd, #01-03D Concorde Shopping Mall, Singapore 238840
Korean dining in Singapore.name: Kim Dae Mun Korean Food

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
Food felt very authentic and Korean. Service was pretty fast and helpful. There weren’t many people here when we came here for lunch on Saturday.

The rice portion is pretty generous. Must have it if you get soup. Also ordered a seafood pancake which was great. They were also very generous with the ban chan.

Ordered the 2 person set for $95. Consisting of Suyuk, Dalgakbi and Seafood pancake.

Food was very nice. They were very flexible in the dishes as we are allowed to change the seafood pancake into a seafood stew and two drinks, as long as it does not exceed the original price of that dish 👍🏻.

It was slightly expensive, and the set for 2 can easily allow 3 pax to dine.

Had a really enjoyable meal here. Kids loved the shoyu meat and pancake. Bibimbap was excellent as were all the sides which were plentiful, distinct and authentic. Some of the best kimchi I’ve ever tasted.

Reservations required! Bigmama is super popular and crowded. I walked in when they opened for dinner at 5.30pm and was told I only have 1 hour for dinner as they were fully booked from 6.30pm.

Luckily they prioritised our orders and served really quickly. The very nice restaurant owners took time to explain how to eat the various dishes, which were so so good. Highly recommend ordering the samgyetang, portion is good for 2-4 pax, the soup was hearty and delicious while the glutinous rice is super yummy and filling.

Their refillable banchan was super delicious especially the glass noodles, kimchi and lotus root salad - while they only have 6 dishes, everything was really good and we had a second serving. Suyuk was pretty interesting as well but pales in comparison to the samgyetang.

By the time I finished at 6.30pm the restaurant was already full of people. Can’t wait to come again to try the rest of their dishes. Highly recommended!

-edit- oh yeah they don’t serve barley tea or water which is weird. And their drinks are not cheap. Bring your own water I guess.

A short walk away from Tiong Bahru Plaza, is a family restaurant catered to neighbourhood.

- The side dishes are good, better than majority restaurants. Except the japchae which is abit tough for that day.
- Enjoyed the big bowl of Makgeolli in a heartland restaurant.
- Soybean soup, Dakgalbi, seafood pancake are all pretty good for a neighbourhood restaurant. Dakgalbi has minimum order of 2 pax, but I would say portion is enough for 3 pax.
- Service is lacking and note that your clothes/bag will smell of food as you walk out.

Good place to go if you are tired of the food in TB plaza.
Korean dining in Singapore.opening_hours:

Sunday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, 5:30 – 10:30 PM
Korean dining in Singapore.name: Bigmama Korean Restaurant

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
We celebrated my niece birthday and as we had quite a few people we were given a room which provides the privacy. Service was attentive and the bbq was done before they serve.  So we do not leave the place smelling like bbq. Plus a huge variety of banchan. Abit pricey and might not be for everyday. But for special occasions it is a good choice for korean bbq

Standard of food is good. My family enjoyed different soups, and meat were nicely grilled for us. Generous servings of side dishes. Awesome

Had lunch here on a weekend and was immediately seated. As it was just both of us, we could not order more to try. Tea was on the house.  There were 10 varieties of ban Chan, including cold marinated crabs which was a nice surprise. We ordered marinated pork ribs and pork belly plus a huge steaming pot of Kim chee stew. The meat was cooked away from our table, as per request. The marinated pork rib was very flavorful    The pork belly was not bad. And the Kimchi stew too sour to our liking.  Staff were all very friendly. Overall a good experience.

Love the meat, tender and juicy.

The side dishes were great, there's also the soy sauce marinated raw crab as a side dish.

Favourite gotta be bossam and the bean paste soup. Packed with flavours and has this umami taste.

A little pricey. Services were alright.

Excellent authentic Korean food. Visited during weekday lunch and it was half crowded.  The BBQ chicken was very well season and really tasty.  Galbi Tang was absolutely bursting with flavour.  Leng mian cold noodles were also lovely on a hot day.  A bit on the pricy side but it was worth it.
Korean dining in Singapore.name: Chang Korean Charcoal BBQ Restaurant

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
Been wanting to try for weeks not easy to get a reservation online, either it's full or the remaining timings were quite weird.
Finally booked a lunch on a public holiday and secured a table. Initially wondering why the place was so empty when I arrived but after a while it was totally packed.
A little confusing on the menu because the physical one outside the shop had dinner menu and lunch menu and the electronic one only had lunch. Not sure if could only order from the lunch menu tab but upon asking could order from anywhere from the menu. There were duplicate dishes on ala carte and lunch menu because portion size was smaller and it comes with a set of soup and rice.
Ordered quite a few items to try, the most important thing I wanted to try was the marinated raw crab and we also ordered the galbi along with some other dishes like seafood pancake and kimchi stew.
Everything here was good, from the sides to the mains. The galbi was cooked by the staff and it was cooked to perfection. Raw crab was also nice and flavourful and well marinated.
Bill came and it was slightly expensive but definitely worth for the quantity and the quality. Would definitely come back again!

The newly revamp joint has a real modern touch. Service is absolutely amazing. Food quality is top notch. Many tables was having the raw crab. Looks good however didn’t dare to try. Seafood pancake was delicious & they don’t skimp on the ingredients. Btw the steam egg is FOC. Every table has it. We wanted to order however the waitress explained they will provide every table with one.
Highly recommended.

First time trying Guiga and I’m so glad we did! Everything from service to food was perfect. I loved the beef tartare and marinated crabs❤️ We got the Black Pork set with a side of beef ribs and the samgyetang, which is by far the tastiest I’ve had in Singapore. We didn’t quite enjoy the steamed egg, maybe cos we let it sit there for too long because we were busy eating up the feast we ordered!  We will definitely be back!

the food here was great and the kimchi was a hit! the pasta salad side dish was also yummy. Ronnie’s service was veryyy sweet and the top-ups on the side dishes were very very generous!

Reservations are recommended. When we visited on a Saturday for lunch, the place was packed.

The pork was good. The staff isn't very interactive or smiley, but they are quite helpful when it comes to grilling the meat.
Korean dining in Singapore.opening_hours:

Korean dining in Singapore.name: Guiga Korean BBQ Restaurant

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
Service is good and prompt. Wide spread of side dishes, porridge and kimchi is the best, but some of them abit salty. My favourite dish here is their Tteokbokki, very soft and chewy, is a must order!

Had one of the beef/pork sets and octopus soup. Was a very satisfying and hearty meal, especially with the free flow side dishes (very yummy!). Service staff were also attentive and helpful! Gave us a free steamed egg dish as well; thank you!

they had a great variety of side dishes, take note some of the dishes cant be refilled e.g. KIMCHI….. which was kinda weird cause it’s a korean restaurant… but anw we ordered a $25 pork belly and two small slim pieces of meat was served.. quality wasnt that great
cold noodles were okay - abit sour but noodles were chewy and refreshing
soft tofu hotpot - soup was not the best I’ve tasted, they included alot of ingredients like octopus, some meat, black fungus, 3 big pieces of tofu, and more

overall it was a meh experience

Finally returned after a couple of years since the food standard dropped. Served 13 side dishes of which one of them is porridge which I think it's a good choice if comes with young children.  And it tastes nice. Ordered BBQ pork+beef set which the staff helped us grilled and cut into small bite sizes.

Prompt service. Water provided. Impressed by the number of complimentary side dishes offered, but would rather they focus on the quality instead of quantity here.
Food was nothing to shout at, felt that the quality of food used to be better. Ate recently at some of the Korean stores in Beauty World and felt this paled in comparison
Korean dining in Singapore.name: Kim's Family Food Korean Restaurant

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
We visited this place for 3-4times. And tried different dishes. The restaurant is ran by Korean. It is authentic Korean cuisine. The atmosphere is chill and cozy. Our favorite food is the spicy chicken feet pot and the beef rib soup.
The panchan판찬there are also nice and the waiter and waitress are responsive. Just that sometime they get really busy.
It would be really lovely to go there for a sip of the hot soup on a rainy and cold morning.
Really like this place a lot.

overall a popular place with good options of home cooking style Korean food, better to have more than 3people sharing , portion is big for 2 person, you may only get a chance to try 1 or 2 type of food. The pork and chicken dishes are big portion. Chicken feet comes with steam egg and rice balls, it’s a good combination and good to share.
Came at around 630pm on a Friday evening, it started to get very busy from 7pm.

Came here on a Wednesday night at 7 p.m., and no reservations were needed. I have walked past this restaurant a few times, but I was more familiar with their nostalgic cultural Korean decorations. They moved recently to a new area along the same stretch, and it's so minimalistic now... A lot more space is catered for diners, with rooms for big groups. Side dishes was pretty okay only. Toilet is huge too!

💧 Water is complimentary

We ordered:

🐔 Jjimdak ($55)
Braised chicken in dark sauce, this dish is one of my favourites in korea. And this standard is pretty okay! Huge portion that feeds at least 4 people. Chicken could have been braised longer to have more flavour. The japchae noodles at the bottom soak up a lot of sauce, so it's quite filling, along with potatoes and carrots.

I rate: 3.5/5 🌟

🍃 Minari Jun ($28)
1st time trying Minari, and we were surprised how fresh this vegetable pancake tasted. It didn't have a celery scent and tasted rather clean. Quite flat as well. Would like it if it's bigger.
I rate: 4.5/5 🌟

🍶 Pine Nut Draught Wine ($28)
The way it's served is pretty interesting! In a small vat with a wooden scoop into a shallow bowl. It was a little gassy and had a faint, nutty sweet aftertaste.

I rate: 4/5 🌟

This place serves very authentic Korean food. Although traditional bbq was available, no one was having that as the standout are the Korean cooked dishes. It's quite close to the Korean food I had in Korea last year. The standout is the braised short ribs. It's so tender and meat falls off the bone easily. Pair the rice with the braised sauce and it's heavenly. The radishes and carrots were so yummy too. 2nd best was the assorted pancakes. It was like no other I had tried before. There were fish, mushroom, prawns and it's so all very special. It really fills you up too. The place was not very closely packed where you're sitting shoulder to shoulder and tables well spaced apart, unlike some other Korean restaurants here. The restroom are also very clean.

Went for an early dinner and was given a spacious seat for our family of 4. Ordered the barbecued pork belly and beef. They will actually sliced the meat and barbecue the meat for you so that you don’t have to actually do it yourself. Ordered the beef bulgogi for the kids and the kids loved it. Not too many of non spicy options for kids though. Kimchi pancake tasted great while the cold noodles were quite soggy. Overall prices are on the higher side, especially the barbecued meats. Service can be improved, cos we waited quite long for the rice to be ready and there wasn’t anyone to inform us that we have to wait for the rice.
Korean dining in Singapore.name: Todamgol Restaurant

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
We ordered the 4 colors pork belly set - original, wine, miso and garlic. The quality of the pork were all so extraordinary that the smell, while grilling - woohoo - was beyond words! The staff was definitely an expert in cooking the meats - all were perfectly cooked! We were craving for more and ended up order additional strip. The curry flavor was a great surprise too. The overall experience surpassed our expectation and we will be back again! Maybe, 8 color set the next time! 😋🤤🥩

Ordered the beef sampler set, 400grams for $98++ and a rice wine $40++, total bill was $160++ for 2 adults, 1  child. Food is just ok but the service was good! Friendly, and they cooked it for you.

Nice korean resturant at orchard shaw. Enjoyed celebrating my birthday. I had some special request for the table and they gladly helped. Wonderful service

Great food. Definitely must come enjoy.

Love the yuzu makeolli drink

8 Korean BBQ Shaw Centre is an absolute gem for Korean BBQ enthusiasts! The quality of the meat is outstanding, and the interactive grilling experience is both fun and delicious. The variety of marinades and side dishes add a delightful twist to the meal, making it a must-visit spot for anyone craving authentic Korean flavors. The service is top-notch, and the ambiance is perfect for a memorable dining experience. Highly recommended!

Came here for a family dinner on a weekday night - the entire Shaw Center was pretty quiet and the restaurant itself was about 1/3 full. Service was quick and friendly, food is so-so, definitely had better. Their speciality is pork (we order the 8-flavor platter ) but it was the 1 beef dish that I personally liked best. The appetizers were fine. Not super impressed.
Korean dining in Singapore.name: 8 Korean BBQ Shaw Centre

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
One of the many Korean joints in the area. This one feels more of the homely variety. Focus of our meal was fried chicken and it was reasonably delicious although the cheese seemed to dominate the taste a fair bit. The kimchi pancake was nice.

Went for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and the place was full.

Ordered the fried chicken platter, jajangmyeon, and seafood pancake. The fried chicken was tender and juicy. Noodles were springy and flavourful. The pancake was a bit disappointing as it was overly doughy and lacked crispiness. The sauce for the pancake was too salty as well.

Lots of free sides were given together with the meal. Overall left with full bellies. Bill came up to $63 for two people.

Ordered the Pork BBQ set for lunch with Spicy Tofu soup and a Stir fry Squid. During lunch there's only 2 tables including ours, service was quite good they bbq for you and service were prompt. The pork were very ordinary not as good as others around the area. The Tofu soup, soup base was good, but I'm not a fan of frozen mixed seafood pack with tiny shrimps and clams, and the Spicy fried Squid were very disappointing too. I'm ok with frozen seafood, but not the kind of pre-cut seafood where it becomes rubbery after cooking, and that's exactly how the squid were like. Maybe I ordered all the wrong stuff from the menu, it looks like their specialty was fried chicken.

A cozy place to have Korean food. This is my second time here as it is quite far to travel from the eastern part of Singapore. The Korean  ambience here to me is a plus. While the food here is not the kind that will blow you away, they are  decent. It’s a place to eat and drink and chill.

Came on a Friday night and the place was packed! Service was quite fast and they have free-flow chilled water. Food was not super amazing but it’s a chill place with kpop videos playing in the bg!
Korean dining in Singapore.name: Woorinara Korean Restaurant

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
Love the Korean Ginseng Chicken soup so much! It's probably the nicest I've eaten. I took a video of the bubbling chicken soup but can't post videos here lol. It's so good and warms the stomach so well.

Super like the toufu soup. It’s salty and sweet but super delicious. Taste abit dif coz of sweetness

Kimchi is Aso not bad n again food more on salty side

Came on thur lunch and I was the only one. The decor look old n service abit grumpy but I will come back for the food.

Second visit ordered the toufu soup. Still as good.

Also tried the pork belly set but find the meat abit tough n not fresh tasting. Although portion is good n price is $20 ish

Spent around $20 per pax for very simple food. The place is functional. Don’t feel that the service charge is justified as the old couple looked impatient and unwilling to have to serve dishes and all. The furniture is so old that there are some ants crawling around.

I take personal issues with keyboard warriors that has zero empathy to the elderly owners

Ignore all the reviews that critique at the elderly couple service standards. Both are in retirement and working everyday in a F&B (widely known to be gruelingly laborious) and running the whole operations+kitchen entirely on their own. Cut them some slack. Once, the couple had forgotten my request to top-up the side dish, but you don’t see my throwing a hissy fit. Be an adult and try to help them so you can get what you need, rather than retreat into your own shell, not get what you want and whining about it later

Have more empathy. What do you stand to gain by destroying two elderly livelihood who are trying to make an honest living. Stop trying to ruin honest businesses with this toxic cancel culture nonsense.

On the main topic - food critiquing:
(+) Food is great, one of the best Korean food in the area. Authentic and reminds me of my days in Korea. Nothing in Singapore comes close to authencity of the Korean food I vividly remember

(-) Food selections are few, not a Korean BBQ place if you’re looking for one but sells Korean cooked food

Sign off,
Strong supporter and Regular diner at Parkers

🌟 3.5 / 5

Simple Korean affair – just come and have your meal and leave. Not the widest menu offerings but decent. Spacious and clean environment. I’d say old & neglected decor rather than nostalgic. Not crowded during weekend dinner.

Food taste is alright, flavorful. Not impressive but satisfy your Korean food cravings. Good amount of side dishes but could have been more generous with the portion. Pancake could have been crispier. Bibimbap is good - recommended.

No frill service, don’t think it is worth 10% extra service charges given that the overall lackluster dining experience.

Korean dining in Singapore.name: Parker Korean Restaurant

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
Friend randomly chose this Korean place as it was near our office and it was truly a gem. We ordered Set C - $125 and add on chef fried rice, ginseng half chicken soup and 2 servings of boneless chicken. Right amount of food for the 5 of us. The best part of this Korean bbq is we didn’t have to cook or grill the meat. Just sat there and waited to be served LOL! Most of the food were above standard. The photos / videos said it all. Even the side dishes were nice and we have asked for few rounds of refill. The staff were friendly and attentive. The ambience was good too, not too noisy. No greasy feeling when we left the restaurant. So, thumbs up!😋😋

Not pricey but the food quality was really poor. For example, the seafood tofu stew was extremely diluted, and contained very few tofu, and seafood that were not really fresh. The pancake also had so little seafood that I checked with the waitress whether it was a wrong order. Complimentary side dishes were mediocre and were not refilled.

Food quality was good. I brought my colleagues there during lunch. Wait staff gave us extra kimchi without extra charge (and this is on top of individual condiments servings). This made us feel welcomed unlike another outlet in One Raffles Place which made us share the condiments (during this endemic period??!!). The reason for 4* is because the portion for ingredients (I ordered Beef bean paste stew) can be increased slightly but overall a very pleasant experience still. Will definitely go back there for lunch and bring more friends & colleagues to try. Oh, the set lunch price is not cheap but is considered reasonable in today's climate so cannot ask for more. To me, everything was good for my 1st visit 👏

A value for money Korean restaurant worth a visit at Boat Quay area. May not be the most authentic but its definitely good enough to satisfy one's korean craving. The gimbap was fragrantly done with sesame oil coating and the kimchi pork stew was so comforting during a cold weather. Just a note that the banchan is not refillable.

Had the seafood tofu stew and it was a far cry from authentic Korean food. The soup was extremely diluted, I would have been better off eating food court Korean food that tastes much better. Tofu was a small piece inside. Soup is full of onions. The only small piece of prawn was unfresh and mushed in texture. Kimchi's taste is overly acidic and not well-balanced. The rice was also mushy yet dry in texture. Even the barley tea is also diluted. I was fooled by the 4.5-star rating as of today.

Korean dining in Singapore.name: Han Pan Korean Restaurant

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
came in for a quick lunch as i recalled that the food was quite good previously. Sad to say that I suspect that there has been a change of ownership maybe? I have never eaten at a Korean restaurant which the banchan that had no taste… the kimchi was flavourless and dry. Kimchi soup was up to standard but for $17++ you can see how much meat there is (photo taken before consuming). I also ordered the kimchi seafood pancake $20++, but (in my opinion), it was undercooked. Had to dabao and refry it for dinner lol. Might be a case of the kimchi being wet and thus the batter was more to the watery and soft side but it was not to my liking and I could taste the batter. Total spend with GST and svc charge at $44.

They served free ice cream after the meal but then I was asked to pick a flavour twice when I when I was obviously not done with my meal? I told them politely that I was not done and will ask for it later. You can see in the attached photo that it was done to other patrons as well. The waitress left the ice cream on the table when the customer was still eating (I remember she was about 5 mins into her meal when she was asked about which flavour she would like for the ice cream). The next table who just got served their ginseng chicken was asked shortly about their ice cream flavour as well. I’m not sure if it is a an intentional tactic to chase the customers out ASAP but it sure feels that way. I really hope to give the benefit of doubt but it was not a pleasant experience.

Seeing the other reviews here makes me think that the current owners are not looking to improve the standards hence hope that this would help people make an informed decision before visiting.

Ordered ginseng chicken soup and beef short rib soup. Food is ok, price seems steep. Restaurant is dated. Service is ok. Probably will not return to dine. Nothing special.

Visited the restaurant during dinner. There was a crowd but since the queue was reasonable, the waiting time to get a table was quite reasonable too.
The sides were served first, and it was amazing that the the sides were refillable. The kimchi stew was quite huge and the soup was refillable too! The seafood pancake was really delicious and it was packed with flavour.
Overall, a great dining experience with friendly staff!

It is so disappointing that the food quality dropped. The spicy rice cake was tasteless, the kimchi pancake was too thick without any crispy. The spicy beef soup was tasteless too but at least I could smell the taste of the beef. I used to be wooed by their kimchi fried rice. So disappointed, will be my last visit.

Banchan was nice and the kimchi is super spicy 🌶️!!!

Cold Noodles was way off, not cold enough and the beef was super tough!

Kimchi pancake was good and spicy 🔥!

Spicy tteokbokki ramen - tteokbokki was tough but the ramen texture was good!

Not gonna make a special trip but will give the rest a try if I'm in the area.
Korean dining in Singapore.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM
Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM
Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM
Thursday: 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM

Saturday: 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM
Sunday: 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM
Korean dining in Singapore.name: Hansik Korean Restaurant

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
Below average Korean food. We ordered a seafood pancake, there was almost non existent seafood inside (95% was vegetable). Also, it was quite packed. The price was not justifiable with the environment and the food quality. Also, it took quite some time for the food to come.

Average Korean food with decent price..food served is fast with normal taste. Service is friendly and quick. Can get crowded during peak hours especially during weekends and public holidays.

The bibimbap was fantastic and it came with plenty of side dishes.

I loved that the rice was served separately and I can just add in the amount I want.

I had some white rice left and I asked if I could take it away. A nice staff gave me a small box and plastic bag to pack it.

Good food, great service, I absolutely would return for more.

Had dinner at the Plaza Singapura B2 level branch.
My taste bud for Korean food may be spoiled by my Korean friend 😜 I find this restaurant quite average, in my opinion.
But, it's 1-pax Set meal is definitely generous enough for sharing 😀

Sunshine Fried Rice

Used to have this quite often before covid. Hours of workout on Saturdays - pole, barre, yoga or whatever.. And fill myself up with this hearty carbs...

Still love this dish. I had 2 rounds of egg soup and banchan - 2nd round was huge heaps of kimchi, beansprouts and ikan bilis.

My fave banchan was still the potatoes which wasn't in that day's combi. 🙃

One of the Korean restaurants that I have been visiting for yearssss.
Korean dining in Singapore.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Korean dining in Singapore.name: ManNa Korean Restaurant

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
Overall really great experience!! Couldn’t stop going for the beef during the dinner buffet, we were celebrating a birthday there and had a great time! I was very touched by one of the service stuff the tall and beautiful unnie in black top went the extra mile to include the cheese on my tteokbokki cause the original menu doesn’t have it i always prefer having cheese in them it’s a great combination you guys!! Anyways she went out the way to include a slice and then microwave it so it melted all over 😋🤤

Overall satisfied with the food and service. However, there is still room for improvement in terms of service. I could feel that the experienced waiter were rushed and tired, so I understand they only replenish the Korean side dishes and water upon request.
The owner and owner's wife were also helping to serve customers. They were attentive and polite.
We opted for the normal buffet which is currently on promotion, so I have nothing to complain about it at this price.

The meats were decently good, and so was the rest of the korean dishes, such as the cold noodles or pancakes.

It's slightly pricey but if you are a big meat eater, it's gonna be a steal. The restaurant doesn't seem to be set up for korean BBQ, no ventilation vent whatsoever. So be prepared to smell like BBQ after your meal.

It has a nice homely feel, almost like sitting in a Korean home or kitchen once you step into the restaurant from regent lift lobby walk way.

We ordered the normal buffet on promotion.

The serving for pork Jowl and short ribs was quite generous.

The short ribs was cut a bit too thick I feel as I'm so used to the thin sliced wagyu variant.

A bit sinewy to chew for me.

The kimchi soup was slightly on the saltier side though.

Korean Buffet. A very sumptuous Korean BBQ buffet that also comes with classic Korean dishes like sangyetang and cold buckwheat noodles. Their food are really good but its the focus on the money shouldd really be on their grilled meats so don't get distracted by the cooked dishes!
Korean dining in Singapore.name: Seoul Restaurant

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
Daebak Korean Restaurant not only satisfies your Korean food cravings but also does so at a budget-friendly price point.

The Soondubu is the perfect dish to warm both your body and soul, its comforting and spicy tofu stew is a taste of heaven, offering a burst of deliciousness that's hard to resist. The chives pancake is a true highlight of their menu, offering a crispy delight on the outside, giving way to a dense, flavourful interior. The texture and taste make it an excellent choice, and it's evident that the kitchen knows how to craft this Korean classic.

One of the better korean restaurants I have eaten at! The food was prepared aesthetically and they had a good taste to the food! Portions were also very generous. Ate the Japchae and Kimchi Fried Rice, it was amazing and delicious!

Must try!!

🌟 Very reasonably priced at about $10 per bowl
🌟 My favorite has to be the chives pancake, crispy sides and not too doughy center! The pancake sauce was also just right!
👍🏻 The jajangmyeon and sizzling bibimbap were not too bad, nothing too special about it.
👍🏻 Service was good, staff were friendly!

Not cheap and but taste is alright.
The Kim chi rice is fine but the service is rigid.
Wanted to pay at the counter but the waiter said can only scan and pay.
(Updated) I went to another staff and she said can pay at counter.

Not kids-friendly. They couldn't afford purchase high chair. Not suitable for families with toddler. The taste is similar to food count. Too pricey. Think won't go back again. Because I think we can cook these dishes by ourselves.

For family, please don't come if you bring your baby/toddler.

Korean dining in Singapore.name: Daebak Korean Restaurant

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
Tried the Gamja-tang and it was great, they also have fried rice service after you finished the soup and it was delicious. Have a lot of side dishes for free flow. Staffs are attentive and helpful as well.

Extremely delicious KBBQ with all the side dishes, stew, steamed egg and beer! Great service and friendly staff. Good value for money given the quality and quantity of food served.

Most delicious banchan (side dishes) I've ever tried across any other Korean restaurants! The portion of the lunch set is pretty huge (and most importantly so full of delicious goodness 😌), the waiters are friendly and welcoming. So happy to finally get to visit them today even though the queue was pretty insane ~ be prepared to wait at least about 20-30 minutes during lunch time.. Will come back again for sure!

The pork knuckle is soooo nice! Soft and tender! Well marinated too. And the beef bone soup is so thick, very refreshing~ definitely will come back again!

Best korean food and legit so far that i have in SG!
Authentic side dish, meats and jjigae!
Comfy atmosphere for dinner. Got space for bike parking also 😆 definitely will come back!
Korean dining in Singapore.name: Hyang Yeon Korean Restaurant (Telok Ayer Street - Formerly Amoy Street)

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
Restaurant setting was a bit too dark for my liking. The meats were not marinated well enough and I have tasted better ones elsewhere. The stew was lacking in flavour and tasted too bland. Kimchi pancake was crispy but slightly thinner and smaller in size. Only good thing was that the staff were efficient in helping to grill the meats. Overall, for this standard and price, I won't be back as it's not up to expectations.

Love the place! Decent portion with reasonable price. My husband and I ordered Keto set for 8, the staff helped us to cook the meat, we just sit and enjoy. The meat is juicy and tender, side dish is refillable, we barely could finish all food. Strong recommend!

Service at this Korean BBQ restaurant was exceptional, with attentive and friendly staff. The meat quality was average, and it didn't quite meet the desired freshness I was hoping for, which was a bit disappointing. On a brighter note, the standout item was the delicious seafood pancake, which I would recommend trying.

We came for an early dinner and were offered a table outside for more privacy, as there was a large gathering going on inside. The weather was cool so we agreed. Best decision ever! We had a table overlooking the quay which was unexpectedly romantic for KBBQ. Also since it's outdoors, we wouldn't have KBBQ infused in our clothes and hair :)

We ordered the 4 colours set: original, garlic, miso and red pepper for the pork belly, and beef kimchi for the stew. The meats are not too marinated or overly sweet which we really enjoyed. The type of meat served is definitely better marinated. My favourite was the miso. It was perfectly cooked by our attendant, SK (and more on him later) The beef stew was OK but not great. Maybe skip that and order their army stew, I've seen good reviews on it.

We were served by SK who was super friendly and super sharp. He offered refills before we asked and was always present yet never hovering. As the restaurant wasn't crowded at that time he took time to tell us about where they source their meat (Spain) and how they ensure they always have stock. We didn't order a lot but still got a lot of attention and service. I was hesitant to take away our leftovers but he offered to pack them and was super cool about it too. He made our visit very comfortable and memorable. Our meal cost $87 for 2 as we only had the set, rice and 1 non-alcoholic drink.

On our way out the restaurant had really filled up inside and while I enjoyed the view and privacy outside, I liked the bustle inside too. It's super cosy and exudes tavern vibes, I'll definitely be back with a bigger group to experience that, with their extensive makgeolli selection!

Pork belly focused KBBQ with a variety of flavours for you to choose from, including curry, garlic and wine. The meal comes with a stew and you can add on favourites such as the pancake and steamed egg. Food is okay but nothing crazy to rave about - good if you want a dependable porky bbq meal.
Korean dining in Singapore.address: 6 Eu Tong Sen St, #02-79/90 The Central, Singapore 059817
Korean dining in Singapore.name: 8 Korean BBQ

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
This is a great fine dining version of Korean BBQ but at a very affordable price. Me andd my gf had the beef set meal at just 99 and it comes with so much beef and free flowing side dishes. The ambiance of the place was amazing down to their gold plated looking utensils and plates. The service was also very good. Definitely worth visiting!

I've always passed by this restaurant, intrigued by its fancy interior and being a huge fan of Korean BBQ, I finally decided to give it a try for a birthday celebration. Unfortunately, I must admit that the experience left much to be desired in terms of both the food quality and overall value. We spent around $240 for a party of three, ordering the Beef Set, SotBap, and Kimchi Stew.

Our initial disappointment began when we were seated right by the door, subject to a constant noise level that detracted from the dining ambiance. To compound our dissatisfaction, the food arrived at our table at an excruciatingly slow pace. When we were presented with a choice of grilling the meat ourselves or having it done in the kitchen. Regrettably, we opted for the latter, which proved to be a mistake because the result was overcooked beef - dry and vapid.

In an ironic twist, the Kimchi Stew turned out to be the only item that stood out.

In addition, surprise cake we brought for our friend took an unusually long time to make its appearance. This extended wait led our friend to catch on to the surprise, spoiling the special moment we had planned.

It is evident that the service staff were trying their best at service and perhaps they were understaffed. Nonetheless, that can't justify the disappointing quality of the food. All in all, it was a very unsatisfying experience and I definitely wouldn't recommend this restaurant to any of my friends.

First time here , restaurant looks amazing and clean! Service is really good! But food quantity is not the surprise me…is good experience,but maybe can more focus on food quality, I have same food in other restaurants and in Korea too.

Korean Cuisine with fine dining but moderate price!

I think this is one of the hidden gem in Tanjung Pagar area and if you love Korean food, MUST TRY.

Service is on par and beyond expectation! They might surprise you with mini food presentation 😂

Food is well prepared.

Suggest call to check table and availability.

They close quite early so dinner do come earlier.

To me, this is definitely a Michelin star worthy restaurant. From the pumpkin soup in the beginning, to the impressive and delectable array of banchan, the attentive service including the grilling of the meat for the diners - all these way exceeded our expectation of Korean BBQ experience here in Singapore, and at a price that is comparable to other restaurants. The brass cutlery used here accentuate the fine dining experience and feeling of indulging in a grandeur feast.  This would definitely be my goto place for Korean fare henceforth.
Korean dining in Singapore.name: Sura

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
Nice place, nice environment, nice Korean dishes. Lunch menu prices are also quite reasonable for a place in town. Will be back again.

it’s not the first time i went there but gonna be my last visit.

i ordered army stew and when the food was served i quickly grab the ramyeon. It has a funny taste (definitely is near expiring or expired noodle) as i always ate instant noodle at home.

When i feedback to the staff, the staff get the manager to us. We were shocked when i told the manager about it what she did was take chopstick/bowl grab our noodles and tasted it? (without our consent).

The manager even waited at the cashier waited us to made payment and show me a pack of noodle that is not expire (oh please, you can always take the latest batch) plus is not even right when you take our noodles to taste without even asking us so disgusting. Lastly, she is extremely rude and sounds like is our problem?

Enjoyed my experience as a solo diner here~ ordered  sundubu which was really flavourful and i loved the side dishes especially the steamed eggplant that came w it 🎵🎵🎵🎵 and thank you to server who also adhered to my request of removing clams as im allergic~ the hearty meal warmed my heart on a bad day 🥰

Hit this restaurant in late afternoon after roaming around to hunt for foods. We decided to try Korean eventually. The staffs there were friendly. We were second last customer before they call it a day on Saturday.

Ordered few dishes as shown in the photos. The spiciness is my liking, my wife likes their tofu kimchi soup and we ordered the garlic soy chicken which surprisingly tasty.

We were seated next to the glass that look into the Raffles central which is very decent for us. At the mark of 3, many customers got rejected since they are closing but they don't rush us for that. Will visit again soon on coming weekend!

Authentic Korean food that you will love.
Very yummy banchan (side dish) especially the anchovy and fish cake.

Ginseng chicken soup, beef Bulgogi and steamed egg is a must!

Portion is big, worth your money!

Dinner time isn’t that crowded so is a good place to have dinner!
Korean dining in Singapore.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, 5:30 – 9:00 PM
Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, 5:30 – 9:00 PM

Sunday: Closed
Korean dining in Singapore.name: Joah Korean Restaurant

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
Was skeptical at first as the reviews are not so positive about the service quality. But me and my friend had such a good time here. Food was amazing and came out so fast, it was really well marinated and seasoned. Panchan was one of the best I ever had, even better than many Korean restaurants in Tanjong Pagar area. Everything was just right. Atmosphere-wise, I love the choice of songs here, all good Korean songs with no mainstream ones, what a refreshing place. Now down to the service, all restaurants can be crazy at peak hours but honestly we had really good service, no fuss, no one bothering us eating or doing unnecessary stuff, the waitress we had was polite and fast. Not sure why the 1-star reviews were so negative on this part.

Ordered a tofu stew (for 2-3 pax).

For the price of $42, I would expect much more seafood. The shrimps are super small (as you can see in the picture and not that many), squid in small shreds.

Take note that side dishes can only be refilled once.

Service is below average in terms of friendliness and a welcoming vibe.

The soup and side dishes are decent, I just wished the meat quantity for this dish was much more generous and the service was better, then I would gladly pay that price.

This is my favourite hunt for authentic Korean food. Cosy restaurant with great variety. Love all the little side dishes as well as the mains. Restaurant gets busy and packed from 1215pm. Best to arrive at 1130am to get seats for bigger group.

Friendly service by a family run business. Food is great, very nice side dishes and of course the main course. Gotten my Korean fix!

Located on Killiney Road close to Somerset MRT and a short walk from Orchard road offers pocket friendly and homely Korean Cuisine. Walked in on a Sunday evening and got a place easily though other times times have seen it quiet crowded .
Service was very good ! The Chicken Bulgogi , ginseng Chicken soup and Kimchi Chicken Fried rice were all tasty! Each serving enough for 1 pax . Nice K-pop hits keep playing in the background and the staff keep attending and checking to your needs ! A nice place if you fancy Korean food!
Korean dining in Singapore.opening_hours:
Monday: Closed
Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, 5:30 – 9:00 PM

Korean dining in Singapore.name: Korean House Singapore

Korean dining in Singapore.reviews:
Late night chicken & beer. We use to go to Chicken Up but as they are closed we tried a new place. Overall the chicken is quite fresh & crispy the biggest issue is that even the spicy sauce is sweet. Noodles were good too & had a nice balance of sweet & savoury. Overall ok, not our favourite chicken place but good for late night fix.

Nice ambience. Order Chicken with cheese. It has lots of spicy tteokbokki which tasted really good. Fried chicken tasted so so, the battered is too thick, seaweed rice ball has so much rice but too little ingredients to mix with. Side dishes and jar of green tea (diluted) were given free. Steamed egg is nice. Picked up free ice cream as you exit. The price here is on the high side. Menu has wide variety.

Was missing korea, but too busy to travel. Glad that I found this place online and paid a visit. Their dishes were relatively similar to the taste I recalled while I was in Korea. And got free ice cream at the end of my meal.
Food is good. Service is good. Atmosphere can be improved but in no way bad.

Known to be the OG of Korean Fried Chicken Restaurant in Singapore which first introduced Chi-Mek (Korean Fried Chicken and Beer), Kko Kko Na Ra has recently launched a series of Crab-tastic dishes featuring fresh premium Korean Crab caught from Yeonpyeong Island on the West Sea.

We savored the essence of the Korea West Sea with their new launch 𝙎𝙋𝙄𝘾𝙔 𝙆𝙆𝙊𝙏𝙂𝙀 𝙏𝘼𝙉𝙂 (𝙎𝙥𝙞𝙘𝙮 𝙆𝙤𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙣 𝘾𝙧𝙖𝙗 𝙎𝙩𝙚𝙬) $85 which is the perfect hearty dish that warms the soul. The spicy broth is packed with punch with assorted vegetables, tofu and mussels.

We also had their ever satisfying 𝙎𝙤𝙮 𝙂𝙖𝙧𝙡𝙞𝙘 𝙁𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙙 𝘾𝙝𝙞𝙘𝙠𝙚𝙣 $23 and 𝙆𝙞𝙢𝙘𝙝𝙞 𝙋𝙖𝙣𝙘𝙖𝙠𝙚 $25.

Rare find of viral 𝙏𝙖𝙣𝙜 𝙃𝙪𝙡𝙪 that has set Korea's social media ablaze right here . For those with sweet tooth, dont miss the chance to enjoy these here. Perfect ending to our meal with Shine Muscat Grapes $5, Orange $3.80 & Mixed Fruits $3.80. Completed our meal with Green Apple CHORONG CHORONG Soju $18!

Satisfied tummies & great service.

Would recommend the seafood pancake, soft and crispy. Their sides were well presented and I like the pickled radish but their kimchi was a little bland in my opinion. Ordered their fried chicken and it was nice, but the kitchen or staff seemed to have forgotten our order and we had to wait longer than expected to receive our food. Fried octopus was a little chewy so it was a little tough to eat. Tea and water was complimentary and you can get a free ice cream upon leaving too (common in many Korean restaurants).

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
As a regular customer at Lang Nướng Vietnam, I cannot express enough how fantastic this place is. It has, hands down, the best Vietnamese barbecue in Singapore. The staff are always so friendly and accommodating, and the owner never fails to make you feel at home by personally greeting each guest. And let’s talk about the food - absolutely delicious every single time! The raw prawn dish, in particular, is to die for. It’s obvious that a lot of care goes into every aspect of this restaurant, from the carefully crafted menu to the overall atmosphere. I always look forward to my visits to Lang Nướng Vietnam and highly recommend it to anyone looking for authentic flavors and top-notch service. It’s always a treat to dine here!

Food very nice. I like their cockles in tamraind sauxe as well as the prawns steamed in herbs. Service staff very approachable and friendly. Very attentive to your needs. Ambience very nice, feels like you are transported to a local eatery in Vietnam with the low tables and chairs. Vietnamese music in the play too .

Stumbled into this restaurant on a Sunday and it was empty compared to the rest of its neighbours.

We ordered the BBQ meat dishes as recommended and asked for them to help us with the BBQ in the kitchen.

Pork was the best of the lot.
The premium beef was out of stock and we opted for the VN beef. It tasted like protein just not beef. It was coated with alot of sweet sauce and we could quite make out what meat it was.

The coke we ordered was flat and there wasn’t and fizz left.

We packed some more food home.
The usual, Pho, spring rolls to continue out dinner as it was really stuffy and hot in the restaurant.

Staff was friendly except a little forgetful.
We waited half an hour only to be informed they ran out of the dish we ordered.

Self proclaimed first Vietnamese BBQ in Singapore that transports you to Vietnam with its low tables and chairs, making you believe you're eating on the streets of Saigon.
Meat never tasted this refreshing with their generous serving of herbs and tangy sauces.

29 May 2023:
the most authentic Vietnamese food I’ve tasted in Singapore so far. grilled pork & vermicelli was really good!!! fried spring rolls made us gasp a bit so definitely must try. the shaky beef was not good, too tough- lesson learnt, don’t order a dish just cause the name is funny. their coffee is nice but wished it was stronger (Vietnamese coffee has to knock you off your chair to be of standard right?)

3rd July 2023:
Decided to try their broken rice. It’s as good as the vermicelli! really loved the meatloaf too (it has tiny noodles inside) overall great, clean & fills you up.
Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.opening_hours:
Monday: Open 24 hours
Tuesday: Open 24 hours
Wednesday: Open 24 hours
Thursday: Open 24 hours
Friday: Open 24 hours
Saturday: Open 24 hours
Sunday: Open 24 hours
Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.name: Làng Nướng Việt Nam - Authentic Vietnamese Cuisine

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Though the quality of their food and service seem to have gone down compared to before covid, this place is still one of go-to spots for Vietnamese cuisine. They have plenty of choices for main, drinks as well as desserts. Grilled pork vermicelli, Bun bo Hue, che ba mau and iced tea are highly recommended. There are 2 separate indoor seating sections inside the mall, and one area outdoor that’s usually good at evening time.

A no frills place with decent food. You order from a QR code, and the food arrives petty quickly. The Banhmi was just okay. The fish tasted good. The beef with rice and banhmi bread was also decent. The spring roll was okay with the dip that they provide. Service is average.

A fantastic little place for a casual sunset dinner whilst in a riverside walk/bike ride. Food was delicious (great Smokey BBQ flavour on our meat, plenty of fresh veges and self serve condiments) at a reasonable price. Photos show the red bean smoothie, chicken bun and beef boon. Service was very fast, although minimal (self order via QR).

Nicely grill porkchop flavour on point
Dessert is normal.
Pork amount could have been a little more and it will be perfect.
Order via QR code.
Pay inside the shop after dining.
Alfresco dining feels gd with the right weather. But might get a hint of cigarettes smell once in awhile
service are friendly

Spring Roll was too oily. U can taste the oil. So was the Vietnamese pancake very oily. Grilled pork chop rice was tender n tasty. Pho was good quality stock. Someone place was crowded.

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The service staff lacks attentiveness and the food service is disappointingly slow. The portion sizes are unreasonably small and the overall quality of the food is low, with some ingredients missing. Based on my experience, I cannot recommend this place.

I guess the good review could be the free 5 dollar return voucher. 🤔

Tried the various dishes shown in picture, all were very good, fried spring roll were packed with meat, chicken was very tender, grilled pork is super delicious with the dry noodle. Everything that we tried taste good and the quantity is not bad too. Used eatigo discount and the whole meal was super worth it. Highly recommend this place and will surely be back!

Food is decent with an interesting interior decor.

However, as ironic as it is, despite being named after the dish, I'd always appreciated the diverse non-Pho menu options at the Rangoon Road branch. I'd believed that might have been the chain's strategy to Vietnamese food seeing as there isn't much more complexity to Vietnamese cuisine in Singapore aside from Pho and Banh Mi.

Thinking that was the standard across all Mrs Pho branches, I was a little disappointed to see that that menu at this branch was rather limited mostly to Pho and Banh Mi with limited other options.

Still, the food was decent.

First off, the food is mediocre or less. The pho soup was just salty and missing that deep brothy taste. The dry noodle were the same as you’d find in any Kopitiam or Hawker’s Centre. The drink cups were the size of kids drinks.. the cup is half the size of an iPhone. The only thing that tasted good was the fried spring rolls but they were very tiny as well.

Also, the place was empty (only us) even though we went during peak dinner hours.

I really liked the old decor years ago before it became a franchise. The tiny low tables and short seats which really reminded me of Vietnam. Now it’s modernised with even a food-serving robot patrolling the aisle. When ordering the pho, request for basil leaves, which is no longer arrives with the noodles. The leaves make the noodle soup so much more fragrant and reminiscent of the dish in Vietnam. And of course the coffee is great. Vietnamese drip coffee with condensed milk is unbeatable.

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Looking for a truly authentic Vietnamese experience on our sunny island? Long Phung offers a spread of delicious Vietnamese dishes at prices that won't break the bank.

Every dish is packed full of flavour. You'll be left craving for more. And as you're dining, let your cup of Vietnamese coffee slowly drip, and you can enjoy the robust beverage as a perfect finisher to your meal.

Seating space is adequate, but do arrive early if you're looking to dine as the spaces fill up quite fast, especially on weekends.

We were out in the east and decided to try this place because there were a lot of good reviews. Seems like a pretty traditional Vietnamese menu. Food was good and you can tell it wasn’t seasoned for foreigners…it had very sublet but well balanced flavors. We loved all the sauces and the balance of crunch & soft textures. Our favorite was the fried spring rolls the flaky crust was so good it was addictive. The smoothies left a lot to be desired, they seem to be very skimpy on the fruit. Otherwise I love it that the food is also very light so you don’t feel so stuffed at the end. We didn’t get any noodle soup, maybe next time, but most people seem to have some sort of soup. We would definitely go back. The downside is the location (if you aren’t close) but the price, value and quality are all top notch.

Most of their dishes come with sweet sauce which  I like. Beef was okie, not very tender but their spring roll was good. Their crepe was special, inside got prawn and pork belly. I think they add coconut to the crepe

Paid 23.22 for the meal. Food was decent, served very quickly.

All seems fresh. My spring rolls may have been sitting a while as all 4 pieces were stocked together. Tough texture for the skin. Ingredients were fine.

Overall more of a good vibe. Maybe skip the ones I have ordered and get a pho or fish. Didn't satisfy my cravings.

Authentic Vietnamese food. Speedy service. Love the jellyfish salad, grilled squid, and beef stew. Banh Mi bread is exactly the same as those found in Vietnam. Returned twice in less than a week. Highly recommended!

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The Vietnamese food in this restaurant comes at a relatively high price, which is a bit expensive. However, I found the food to be lacking in authenticity and taste. The spring roll skin was thick and dry, and the soup lacked the strong flavors I expected.

On the bright side, the service was commendable. One of the staff members noticed that the spring roll might be too big for my son to eat comfortably, so he kindly offered to cut it in half, showing good attentiveness to the customers.

I ordered a vegetarian banh mi for takeaway. The bread was still crispy after the 20-min trip. The lemongrass tofu, sauteed mushrooms and pickled vegetables tasted nice. Wish there was a bit more toppings though as I'm more used to having my banh mi overflowing with ingredients. The staff was super friendly and nice even though I was there for just 10 seconds to pick up my order.

Nondescript Viet joint at the quiet UE square. Food was quite good though I felt my dish (dry rice noodle salad with lemongrass beef) should have more meat, there were too little beef slices. However, we liked the fried spring rolls and my husband enjoyed his chicken pho. A bit pricey (nearly $70) for 2 mains, an appetiser and 2 coconuts.

Moc Quan is a nice Vietnamese restaurant. The slice beef pho noodle is very smooth and tasty. Sliced beef is thin and easy to eat. The sauce is also on the spicy side.

The creme brulee has coffee taste. It's soft, not too sweet, as the sauce is bitter, but with the crystal sugar, the sweetness is just right.

The peanut sauce for Goi Cuon Is spicy. We requested for the peanut sauce to be without the chilli, and the staff were very nice to make it for us.

One of the staff is very kind to offer to refill our water at the end of the meal.

It was a pleasant experience.

They had outdoor seats too, which is good for those who do not want to be under aircon.

Love the food here. Fresh, authentic and flavourful. Had the bún thịt nướng kiều bảo, and it was really good!
