Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Usually, I would go for the BBQ chicken with rice vermicelli, but the Seafood noodle soup just seems more tempting that day, & it was packed with flavour & lots of seafood & bean sprouts! Surprisingly, the iced tea was infused with a scent of pandan (which we thought was lotus at first). 😯

IG @pingguo301

I discovered a new Vietnamese place and I was very happy with it. The food was great and will definitely come back again.

Most recommended Vietnam cuisine halal food, delicious, big, but affordable for the price.. Totally worth it.. I will come back again one day..

Great flavours and affordable prices. Went to this hide-out located on the second floor of a shop house. The place is ran by Vietnamese it seems. Try out their set lunches,really good and worth it. It’s also halal, so suitable for everyone to try!

In contrary of what everyone has said about the service, I had a good service from the kind lady here.

Now about the food, I had a pho and spring roll. I can say both taste authentic. Pho broth is very savoury, beef is very tender maybe they cooked it overnight. Spring roll is very fresh, sauce is just nice.

The serving time is a bit slow indeed despite we were the only guest. So I would recommend coming here on the weekend or maybe to rethink whenever you see many guests.

Another important thing, it's Halal.

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
a really pleasant and inexpensive place in somerset. we ordered 2 phos, 2 bahn mi and 1 spring roll — all demolished by the end of the meal. the bahn mi is my favorite. we ordered both chicken and pork, and they are both extremely yummy. unlike conventional bahn mi that is hard, this bahn mi is soft and yet crunchy. would definitely revisit again.

the phos were very good too with a generous portion of meat. spring rolls are fresh and the dipping sauce matches nicely.

most importantly, the service is top notch. the staff is attentive and sincere, and do their best to serve you quickly. do be mindful that you are required to order and pay at the counter, and you can also take this chance to learn and practice some sign language :)

signs a taste of vietnam pho is a very interesting restaurant because it is run by a family of the deaf 🧏‍♀️ the staff here may not be able to respond to your verbal cues, yet they are very helpful and always serve you with a friendly smile :P

we ordered sliced beef + beef balls pho ($12) and lemongrass turmeric chicken ($9). pricing seems very reasonable given that they do not charge any ++!
the pho is not as good as i expected, because the soup tastes more salty than fragrant imo - it might suit those who are into less herby flavours. luckily the noodles texture is just nice and the beef balls are super juicy and bouncy, i would honestly recommend ordering beef balls alone without the slices which might be a bit hard in texture. overall this is an okay bowl of pho but not the best I have tried :P
what really gave me a surprise is the banh mi. unlike my preconceived perceptions of baguettes, this baguette has a pleasant soft texture and buttery taste. i love the refreshing taste of radish and lemongrass which can’t make itself more prominent. the combination of chunky cucumber and juicy grilled chicken is also as good as it can be, but my only complaint is the chicken skin - only if they peeled that off then this would be a perfect banh mi 🫠

Very tasty pho, meat portion was slightly less than I'd have wanted (just perhaps 1 more slice of beef) but I finished the whole bowl including the soup which was very good.

It's located very near Somerset MRT but in a slightly inconspicuous spot. But if you are nearby, definitely worth a try.

Space is surprisingly quite good for a casual dinner with space for single diners up to big groups.

Some of the staff are hearing impaired but i did not have any problems with ordering and payment. Kudos to the business owner for running an inclusive workplace.

Lovely small shop in the basement of Orchard gateway.
Lunch crowd creeped in, and service still very fast! Water is not complimentary.

Beef & Pork Pho are light and fragrant. Noodles are more towards kway teow than Pho rice noodles. Soup is zesty because of lime and sweet from the meat. Portion is just nice.
I rate: 3.5/5 🌟

Spicy Beef bowl is really good. Love how there is a shrimp flavour in it and made the broth very robust. There's not a lot of soup though. Noodles are thick beehoon. Great for hangovers. It's not very spicy. I rate: 4/5 🌟

Avocado Milk Shake was so good! Thick and creamy with avocado fragrance. Good for sharing as it's quite big and filling. M
I rate: 4/5 🌟

Updated:
Visited again in July 2023
Portions were much more generous than before. Service was fast and efficient. We didn’t have to wait long for food. The kind owner was seen personally serving customers and was very kind. I ordered the grilled lemongrass chicken with noodle salad and opted out from noodles. More salad greens was given. It was delicious and chicken portion was good.

The service was very friendly and sincere. Visited on a busy Saturday evening, and the staff took quite a while for payment and taking orders.
The food came rather quickly though. I ordered boiled pork salad without noodles and the owner even came out to specially check that my order was right and whether I needed anything else. Appreciate the gesture! Would have liked for more herbs though. Recommend to visit outside of peak hours :)

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Came here for lunch. Ate the chicken pho soup that comes in a set. The taste is nice & I enjoyed it. The portion is big, almost couldn’t finish the spring roll side dish I ordered 😊. Overall it’s value-for-money, and the surrounding environment is chill and very “campus-like”

I didnt had a good experience on their service today especially from the unfeminine waitress (very short hair) that ask me to give up my table because my friend hasn’t arrive.
They could tell me the regulation before I enter. As I reach 12.15pm, she chased me at 1225pm. So I offer to order some food for myself first and this is accepted 🙄.
Understand that The restaurant is packed, but her service is curt.

The food tasted rather decent and noodles is very texture and addictive.
It’s so disappointing to have my lunch ruined over such service. Hope to see improvement.

Very average tasting but quite good portion pho. Served kinda warm rather than hot. The spring rolls are ok too, as quite hard to get wrong for Vietnamese spring roll. Overall, an ok place to get a quick simple lunch.

Vietnamese fusion, tucked into a corner of NUH/ Science Park area. We ordered the shaking beef shabu and caramelised veg as mains. Decent taste, decent price (lunch set ~15pp)

Plus point, vegetarian friendly.

Pretty good vietnamese place near Kent Ridge MRT.
This place is a bit funny cos of the very small opening times. 4hrs a day during weekday lunches only.
The place is well organised with the tables fitted out with all the things you need as a diner.
The menu is quite unique with traditional viet fare along with fusion type dishes.
Ordered the wagyu pho and cheeseburger spring rolls.
Pho was pretty good but my only negative comment was it felt a bit small.
The cheeseburger spring rolls tasted like cheese burger but in spring roll form.
All in all, a great place to eat. Hope it thinks about opening to more extended hours.

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Beef pho is okay, the beef is the lean meat, and the soup is not bad. The soup without MSG is more sweet.
The shrimp and pork ribs noodle is like the Singapore style. Quite normal. Meat and shirt portioning are small.
Tried the egg coffee. It’s a great experience. The egg is made into milk form as the upper layer. It does have the raw egg taste without the coffee. The coffee is a little bitter.
Went at 450pm and the staff said they only start work at 5pm. However in Google map stated as operating.

We walked past this Vietnamese restaurant and decided to come here for our team lunch. Food was delicious, everything was on point however the were short handed and by the time we were done with lunch, our drinks unfortunately hadn't arrived. The team's very sweet and apologetic but we have to get back to meetings. Definitely will want to come back when service improves as food is fresh and flavourful - one of the better Vietnamese cuisine in Singapore  💯

Had lunch with colleagues here on Friday - staff here were friendly and had a good number of vegetarian options! I had the Vegetarian vermicelli, it was very flavourful but slightly salty for my person preference. The interior was nicely designed with spacious seats, would highly recommend!

Just the right place to relive our Vietnamese holiday!

It was a quiet Saturday to eat at this usually crowded restaurant. The service by staff Ice was fantastic. She even offered to show us her mini garden and gave us a tiny bitter gourd to grow it at home.

Nice ambience and would be good if we could access the other section that is more nostalgic. Food was fantastic and the pancake was delicious.

I love the bamboo rice dipped in chicken gravy. The chewiness and fragrance of the rice made this a simple yet satisfying dish. Reminds me of eating by the roadside in Vietnam. The beef pho is another must try together with the pancake.

Overall a cozy restaurant that brings back memories of our trip to Vietnam.  Will return for more.

Every dish I tried was an explosion of flavors. But wait, there's more! As if the incredible food and beautiful ambience weren't enough, they even surprised us with a complimentary dessert. It was the perfect sweet ending to an already fantastic meal. The generosity and thoughtfulness of the staff truly made my experience memorable.

I highly recommend Co Chung Vietnamese Restaurant for lunch. Whether you're looking for a place to impress a client, enjoy a meal with friends, or simply indulge in a satisfying lunch, this restaurant has it all. The combination of delicious local Vietnamese food, inviting ambience, attentive service, and even a free dessert make it a must-visit destination. Trust me, you won't be disappointed!

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Excellent 👍 💯  Ate here again today for the 6th time since they opened long before covid. Used eatigo this time round. Coffee was excellent! They now serve banh mi too! Recommended to come here and use eatigo discount to grab a banh mi and viet iced coffee(no discount for drinks)for a tea time snack. Banh mi of course cannot win the ones in Vietnam but for the portion and taste is at least 8/10. Please support such shops instead of those big chains and too commercialized ones with not so nice food. Kris+ allowed here took with 6mpd earn rate.

This is my first time to this outlet at Rangoon Road, and I was told by my friends that this was one of the earlier outlets.

I did not even know there was an outlet here at the end of Rangoon Road, where it was very quiet. It's not really accessible unless you drive.

We ordered the sliced beef pho and Hanoi sliced chicken pho as mains, and the fried spring rolls. Our friends ordered the fresh spring rolls as well, but they weren't really to our liking.

The fried spring rolls has minced meat and yam, packed fully, but the size of the spring rolls were tiny.

The sliced beer pho and the chicken pho were pretty decent, but that's also because I have actually never eaten really fantastic or bad pho. The good thing is the portion was quite big, so no lack of soup or ingredients.

Under staff for better services. Still give 4 stars for services. The team of 3 boys, make it work and still bring out great food.

One of the better Pho we ever had try from many other places.

A place I frequent if I need a quick-fix for pho. Menu here has been revamped. Their regular pho, like it or not, comes with Japanese Wagyu. Tender and pricey. They have a “light” portion for smaller eaters — but my guess is to cater for folks used to their older menu (and prices)? You pay a bit less than before, but also get less to eat. Thankfully, their broth is still good. Now, do I need Wagyu in my pho? Not me. I think it is best kept on a grill. I love their wing bean, and its size has shrunk too. Seems like a trend… enough surprises for today. Service is nearly nonexistent. I thought their robot was more cheerful. They “feed you like family” but sure don’t treat you like one. Unfortunately. Finally, I think their toothpicks should be managed with more hygiene in mind (see photo).

Came for lunch on Saturday afternoon. Not very crowded but notice a lot of delivery orders. The sturgeon in a hot plate was very nice and recommended. Also had the pork pancake which was crunchy but a little difficult to eat. In Vietnam it comes with a thin rice paper to roll up and easier to hold and eat. Also liked the salted lemonade and Vietnamese drip coffee.

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Authentic Southern Vietnam cuisine. The signature crepe (banh xeo) is a must-try here. I also recommend their fried tofu vermicelli in shrimp sauce (bun dau mam tom), too.

Just found a delicious Vietnamese food.
The food is good which makes me remember  Vietnam
The atmosphere is also great as it is located in the centre of Chinatown
Highly recommend to come here

ordered beef pho, chicken bahn mi and spring roll and they were delicious. service was good too. will visit again.

A great and authentic Vietnamese restaurant in Chinatown. Great menu with wide variety of food and they even have a great selection of vegetarian dishes too. Highly recommend the bbq & fried roll noodle, spicy beef noodle, pancake, and all of their vegetarian dishes 💯🌟

Love this place; it’s a hidden gem!
Flavourful Vietnamese food at a reasonable price. I always get their beef rice noodle. I’ve also tried their pho, crepe, and banh mi. All are delicious 🥰

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
To date, the best Vietnamese food I've ever tasted. Everything was on point.  We had Platter of rolls, Papaya salad, Chicken stew, Fried crab, Daylily flowers, Mini pancakes, Grilled squid. Particularly good were the crab and daylily. Finished off with a good cup of drip coffee. Service was top notch, if you can get their attention as there's not enough waiters.

Impressed by the vietnamese cuisine and it's pet friendly! My favourite is their pork sausage. It is so juicy and well marinated. Love their coffee donut too! The fried rice is a must try too!

Nice beautiful place at Dempsey. It used to house the former Dome and now this is a place for Vietnamese cuisine. We were early and have nice seats near front of the restaurant. I like the dishes we ordered though the soup was a tad too salty for me. The wraps were nice and the coconut was refreshing.. definitely would consider going back again as their service is excellent and attentive. Parking was great as it is just outside the restaurant..however that said, it could be extremely crowded on weekends and you might want to go early.

food here was quite tasty, with some dishes better than others. favourite dishes were the rolls, and the hot and sour soup! overall, a decent meal but does not stand out among the other restaurant offerings at dempsey

Been returning for the Vietnamese ice coffee. Another refreshing dish would be mango salad which I usually asked for 2 serving. Main course is the usual beef pho. Recommend this place if you are at Dempsey Hill.
Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.name: Red Sparrow

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
To be honest the food was good if on the pricey end for this kind of F&B outlet. The killer was the extreme disorganisation of the operation. Multiple tables including ours were waiting for dishes. Our own experience was of 4 food items. The first took 20 min the last more than an hour. The poor girl doing front of house was struggling with what seemed to be a lack of system. When a dish came out of the kitchen she had to scan the half doz chits on a board to see where it was to go. We saw hot noodles turn cold sitting for more than 10-15 min before they got delivered to a table. Once to ours for an item we did not order before some rapid fire discussion with the kitchen before it got to the right place. Easily distracted by the next dish popping out of the kitchen, the current dish gets forgotten and not delivered. Or a take out meal gets packed even though the Food Delivery guy is not around. Frankly we saw the staff trying but it was chaotic. The food was pretty good (less the Water Fern Cake), but often a little colder than it should be due to delays. And 4 food items strung apart over an hour getting to the table marred the enjoyment. It's a pity but we are never going back and we recommend anyone without an extra hour over what you planned for the meal or if you are hungry to give it a miss.

Been here since they first opened restaurant days, I think they are growing a good business, food also tasted better. The fish sauce for the com tam was nice. It could be crowded during peak hours and the restaurant is limit seatings so come avoid these time or planning to queue. Service could be improved.

Small and crowded place.
Service was alright.
Food were pricey tho.
Taste wise, some good some okay, some can be better.
Their traditional Banh Mi is good.
Egg Coffee is nice.
Grilled pork ribs flavour nice, but texture a bit firm.

Queue is always present. Revisited several times and longest wait was 45mins. The dining place is cozy with a Vietnamese-like feel. This time round recommended to my friends who are vegetarian and we ordered their vegetarian soup noodle and vegetarian spring rolls. They were surprisingly delicious and flavourful. Definitely will revisit whenever time permits.

Ordered the spicy beef + pork noodle. The soup is delicious,  thr noodle is smooth. Only problem was that the beef and pork rib was too hard ... not tender. Staff was not well conversed in English ... service was ok. Price was a bit on high size ...

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
I ordered "Rice noodles and duck with bamboo shoots" and it's quite nice, not too salty, the bamboo shoots is tender, serving together with special sweet and sour fish sauce.

The service is fast and the staff are very friendly. You need to go to the counter for ordering and making payment. You can pay by cash or Paynow. There's no Credit card option.

Quite variety of food. It's very hot at lunch hour but the shop provide standing fan, unfortunately it's not that much helpful also.

I think the price might be a little high given the facilities and food. But maybe because it's at a bit centre area?

- Beside the eatery, this place also sells some goods from Vietnam such as instant noodles, soft drink, sauces and coffee.
- The food here is acceptable.

Updated Note: Price has been increasing .. Considering the self-service, lack of aircon … it’s fallen off my “must-go” list….

A good friend of mine recommended OC Mai months ago. I forgot all about it until I was in the vicinity recently. Today's my second visit. I don't profess to be a Vietnamese food expert but I spotted many Vietnamese patrons.

AMBIENCE
It's hole in the wall. The wall of the The Bencoolen, to be exact. You sit at the sloping sidewalk. No air-con. You might be lucky and get the fan.  Pray that you don't encounter patrons who smoke :)

PARKING
Parking is ridiculously challenging in this area. The Bencoolen's parking fees are quite reasonable. After 5pm, a flat $1.20. No grace period.

SERVICE
Self-service with the buzzer to let you know when your food is ready.

PAYMENT
Cash, Paynow, Paylah. No credit cards.

PRICING
Above average. Given the central location, I suspect the rentals are also above average.

FOOD
The menu is absolutely staggering! You'd be spoilt for choices, and there's even a western menu. For the 1st visit, my husband was disappointed that they didn't have the Vietnamese grilled chicken chop with rice (his favourite). He settled for fried rice.  Verdict: Avoid. Expensive and too moist.
I took the Beef Pho and Bahn Xeo.  The beef pho stock was average and the beef ball was rather minuscule and disappointing.
What TOTALLY ROCKS.....is the BANH XEO. So good!!
And this, you cannot do takeaway. You MUST eat it on the spot when it is freshly prepared. Crispy and healthy. Super authentic. (Note: i took a Banh Xeo cooking class at Hoi An before, from a Vietnamese chef.).

CONCLUSION
Given the staggering range of dishes, it is possible to end up with hits and misses. The eatery should consider tagging what her signature dishes are. Will I visit OC Mai again? For the Banh Xeo, definitely yes. And to try other dishes highly recommended by reviewers. I heard the Vietnamese drip coffee is good too. Have not yet had the courage to try their Bahn Mi. Am super fussy how Bahn Mi is done.

Food taste so so only.
I had try Vietnamese food at other air con places which taste better, price are better and service are better.
This place is warm and hot without aircon. And is self service, price is not as good as those.

Tried their pho like finally as it’s always crowded.

I’m surprised by the price, it’s a little pricey considering their store is non air conditioned and it’s by the walk way.

Simple and straightforward kitchen set up that you can see how your food being prepared when you place your order at the counter. It’s self service. In store they also sell lots of vietnam local delights such as sauces, noodles and other dry stuff.

The pho came, nothing to wow about. The soup is ok, but not the beef. It’s gamey and it’s unlike the usual sliced beef I had. The beef balls has a spongey texture instead of the usual meaty beef balls I had.  Love their chilli it’s very spicy!

We also order chicken pho but it came with very boney chicken parts not shredded chicken.

Fresh spring roll is ok.

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Ambience is really nice and most dishes were good except the prawn appetiser (prawns were not so fresh as the texture was mushy). Hence the 4 stars

Otherwise, the soups were really good. We had the Crab Noodle and the Braised Beef Stew with the Original Pho. All 3 were unique and pretty fragrant and flavourful. Prices are around $15-20 per pax with an additional $4ish if you order a drink

Delicious Bahn Mi! Like the other reviews said, the bread is a banger. Got the beef, cheese and pineapple (one of their recommendations) and it was worth every dollar. Really enjoyed myself. Glad there were vegetarian options too! The interior was very nicely decorated and quite nice to take photos.

There was a cockroach spotted around the floor of the premises. I asked for chicken baguette the guy put beef in there as well. So off putting!
I can’t eat beef. The price - about 11 dollars for a banh mi- is so expensive for what it is. Will not return!! The guy preparing the baguette was not friendly and there are no prices stated on the menu. I regret patronising this place.

Update* Prices have gone up slightly. B1 is selling at $12 now. Portion remains quite big and filling.

Their B1 Co Hai Baguette and B5 Stir-fried Beef & Onion Baguette are truly amazing. Super delicious! I regularly have cravings for them and travel down to eat. Best in town! #BestBanhMi

Quite an unassuming place. Have just walked right past a couple of times as I wasn't aware that there were more seats on the upper floor. Food portions are pretty big that I couldn't finish it. Taste wise, it's good for the price. I especially enjoyed my fruit tea. When we entered there was only one staff, and it didn't seem like anyone was going to show us to a table, so we walked right in. Noticed the same when other customers walked in. When paying, couldn't find a staff to accept payment, so one of us had to go downstairs to find a staff to come up and settle payment for us. Tables where customers have left were left uncleared for a while. Wonder if they are understaffed? Overall still think it's a pretty good restaurant to check out!

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The beef in this pho is surprisingly half cooked! This may not be very friendly for customers with a less robust digestive system. In fact, if the beef is fresh, even if it's just blanched and not cooked for a long time, it shouldn't have a tough texture.

As a restaurant on Orchard Road, the prices here are relatively budget-friendly, making it suitable for solo travelers. However, it's not very friendly to customers who don't eat pork, as more than half of the side dishes contain pork.

The soup base has a mild flavor, and the portion of beef is not small. Overall, it's a restaurant with good value for money.

As other customers have mentioned, the tables and chairs in this restaurant are particularly uncomfortable, and there's a very loud and piercing noise every time someone sits down or leaves! For customers with sensitive hearing, this can be quite torturous. I wonder if the restaurant uses these especially uncomfortable chairs to encourage customers to eat quickly and leave sooner!

I love pho, it’s one of my favorite dishes. That’s why I was excited to try the beef and chicken pho at Mrs Pho. Unfortunately, I found that the taste wasn’t as rich as I had hoped. It was just an ordinary pho. However, the clam entree was delicious.

A bit disappointing as the pho noodle was overcooked. Other than that my Felix beef pho broth is tasty. Would’ve been nicer if they let you add your own herbs. Chicken pho on the other hand is quite tasteless. Not quite up to standard. Other than that the place is decorated like you’re dining infront of a Vietnamese shop with small store front. To make it truly authentic, they need to bring out the short stools and foldable table 😉

Had a lunch meeting with my friend/insurance agent at Mrs Pho 313. Some items were not available like the wagyu pho and the beef brisket pho which would’ve been nice to order so we settled for beef combination pho. The restaurant was offering a meal upgrade for additionl 4plus dollars for a piece of fresh spring rolls and small size drink. Overall still as good as before but notice that their prawn sugar cane has lesser meat than before maybe due to inflation. Overall nice place to meet as the staff did not chase us away and managed to settle some insurance discussion. Funny thing is we forgot to settle the bill and the service staff approached us with patience. Mrs Pho staff thank you and we sincerely apologize for forgeting to settle the bill 🙏🏻🙏🏻🙏🏻

was craving for bahn mi, finally got to try it. Added fried spring roll as well. Food was good and portion is just nice. didn’t require me to enter my details upon ordering.

However I do feel like the tables need to be cleaned and dry. The menu I had was wet.

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.name: Mrs Pho Kitchen - 313@somerset

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Their Phos are pretty decent. Can get their fried spring rolls, quite good and taste quite different from the usual Chinese spring rolls. The non fried ones taste too raw for my liking.

Their coffee is not the best, have tried way better Vietnam coffee

The place is also not well kept and there’s dust everywhere

the taste was authentic, very nice. portion a lot, esp the bahn mi, a lot of meat. it was perfect with the rainy weather.  the staffs were also friendly. would definitely visit again.

Small restaurant tucked beside Amoy Food Center, it serves up authentic Vietnamese pho and other dishes. We tried the beef pho soup ($12.50) and fried spring roll (5pieces).

Portion was huge, they gave a good portion of huge chunky beef slices. Soup was flavourful as well but i felt there was a lot of msg in it. We thought the size of the spring rolls would be like the Chinese kind, but it’s a super long roll cut into two so we ended up having 10 pieces!

Will recommend as a better lunch option if you work around the area!

A Vietnamese friend brought me here. We had the sliced beef noodle soup (pho), mixed platter springroll which had both fried and non fried, and the drip iced milk coffee. The bill Was $21 per pax which was reasonable.
Food wise, the spring rolls and coffee is nice. The soup does not contain much msg however the sliced beef could be more tender. Good experience

Beef pho was smooth and the broth was tasty. However, the beef was too overcooked for my liking and could be more tender. Portion was not bad. Spring roll was good. Hygiene was OK (staff wore their masks properly). Overall, just a good place to have a quick Vietnamese fix as ambience is lacking.

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.name: Vietnamese Delight Pho 99

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Great spot for Bun Cha and Banh Mi! Excellent sourcing of fresh ingredients and wonderful service, very friendly. We also tried their Banana Flower Salad which was exquisite. Please give Uncle Ho’s a try for an authentic Vietnamese experience🤗

The BEST Vietnamese food in SG! Been coming here for my viet food cravings since yrs back and they've always maintained the same high quality and standard. Must order: bun cha, banh mi, pho, banana flower salad and the viet drip coffee! -basically everything on the menu 😍 Everything has its unique flavor without overpowering the taste of the fresh ingredients.
My friend recently hosted his party there and their buffet spread was so worth it. All the guests were singing praises about the food!

One of the best Vietnamese food I had outside Vietnam. The owner mentioned that the chef is from Hanoi.

Chanced upon this little gem of a place as I was nearby in RWS. We came on a weekday for lunch and the place was pleasantly not crowded since it was after the lunch crowd. We ordered Cha Ca, Bun Cha, fresh & fried spring rolls, lemongrass drink & sour plum drink. All food & drinks were excellent!! The Cha Ca was very yummy and reminiscent of what we had in Hanoi. Bun Cha was a slight variation of what we had in Hanoi but the soup/dip & meat were tasty & flavourful. Really brought back memories. Highly recommended to try! Will be back for banh mi & pho.

Update - 12 Aug

Had the Banh Mi with caramel pork. It was delicious and the bread was crispy outside & fluffy inside & overall tasty. The bread is made in-house, maybe that's why. Capped everything with an iced Viet coffee for a very satisfying meal.

The best and must try dish is the banana flower salad. The other dishes including the bun cha are just average.

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.name: Uncle Ho's Tuckshop

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Pretty good pho. Thought the broth to be a touch too sweet though (maybe too much rock sugar for my taste). Herbs were generous and fragrant. Meat was tasty. Wish there were more noodles and a larger portion for the price but still worth coming to get.

Really enjoyed my bowl of Pho, I had the $9 one with Beef Slices and Beef Balls! 👍🏻 Broth was very fragrant and the meat was tender as well. Had some roasted chicken for side dish and they were tender too, even though it does look quite dry. Trust me! It’s not! 😃

Vietnamese coffee is a bit sweet for me but after adding hot water; it is ok. Food wise; not too bad but nothing out of the ordinary. Charges 50 cents for half a glass of warm water and waited quite long for it. Smiling face was greeted with frowning faces. Is this place so popular that customers are 2nd class?

I am a regular here. Convenient place in Zhao Chiat for a good value quick Vietnamese food fix. Recommend their pho, congee, fried squid

Small Vietnamese restaurant with authentic menu. First time here and happy with the food, generous portion w reasonable price. Will come back again ❤️

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.name: Lâp Vietnamese Restaurant

Vietnamese restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Worst viet restaurant, trust me.
Rigid service and super lousy food. I ordered for the fried spring roll and it came with the plain ones. They claimed I ordered the wrong ones . Request to change but they refuse and no explanation. It’s my words against theirs.
Service is cold and unfriendly.
Soup noodle is just salt and hot water, tasteless. Basil leaves just 3 leaves and few strands of taugay. Meatball is hard and not fresh. Can tell that they just heat it up in the microwave oven. The spring roll skin is hard and rubbery. Chicken meat in the chicken soup is tough and rubbery. Lemon grass drink tasted like sugar water and nothing else. No presentation too. Look at my pictures. Not exaggerating but nothing is good here. It’s really the worst restaurant I visited in Singapore.
I go to Vietnam often and this restaurant is a big disgrace to Viet food.

Love the pho. They only have beef pho now. (The beef balls are qq and 😋)Used to have chicken as well. The broth is light but flavorful. Love the smell of lemongrass. Make the food full of zest. The spring rolls and chicken balls (fried) are however only so so. The prawn cane is well seasoned as well. Recommended food joint.

The restaurant decorations is good, it got a clean environment with good vibes. The staff is very friendly too.

The food is quite good. I have tried the beef noodles, the beef is tender and it tastes good 👍🏻 I personally like the drip coffee too.

Bad service of the staff. We wanted to change table as another group of colleague joining, the front staff said we couldn’t move because order been made (number is not on a table though can be moved and extra tables are available + no queue outside).

Next after ordered online, and requested to pay at the counter, she handed the paper receipt and without nice gesture said “this order pay first”.

This is unacceptable for the restaurant. Previously ate here but treated better, this caused an eerie feeling to come back to this outlet! Better train your staffs basic service measurements. No complaints of food.

As a concept it's certainly a great idea if they could match it up with great food and service. Food was just about ok.

Ambience nothing much to rave about.

The Spicy Pho on the menu is very  lightly spicy.

Food was delivered quick despite running at capacity.

The Pho broth though was just mediocre and not flavorful.

Will have to look for a better place to enjoy Vietnamese cuisine.

Beef slices were thin and tender, beef balls were springy.

The Vietnamese drip coffee was good but still lacked the oomph factor.

The staff at the entrance came across as plain unfriendly though I must add he did assist us.

Menu is pretty decent and everyone should be able to find something here.

Will i return ? Possibly not.

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
The most delicious Mediterranean food in Singapore. Very friendly staff,- quick service and very nice Singapore Sling. Super clean environment, good ambiance and price worthy. 5/5 will come back for sure.

If you like Hummus, this restaurant/pub has the best Hummus in Singapore 🇸🇬 .
Just order the big portion! You won't regret it.

For a person who doesn't like lamb, I'd like to share that this restaurant is the only one where I would not hesitate to order their lamb shanks!

The atmosphere is good for catching up with friends over a beer and a good Turkish meal.  A change from the usual type of dining places we locals normally go to. The friends I brought there thoroughly enjoyed the evening.

The staff are friendly and humorous.  It can get crowded Friday nights.  So go early!

They are open 6 days a week, closed on Sunday.

Super juicy and delicious kebab and loved the hummus and babaganoush too. The lunch special is good value for the quality and portion. Service was quick and helpful. Will definitely be back to try more.

Kazbar's cold mezze platter is a delightful mix of flavors with hummus, baba ghanoush, tabbouleh, falafel, stuffed grape leaves, olives, and pickled veggies. The lychee mint crush mocktail is a must-try, and the lively atmosphere adds to the overall experience. 🌟

Unique experience eating middle eastern food. The food was great and there was quite a bit of variety. Also the staff were very friendly! It is a bit on the pricey side but it is still worth the experience.

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.name: Kazbar - Middle Eastern & Lebanese Restaurant + Catering

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
I came to Singapore few weeks ago and was looking for Mediterranean restaurants. I stumbled upon this gorgeous place 5 minutes away from my hotel. I tried Kebabs on day one and man it was delicious. Atmosphere is great and all servers are friendly, specially three girls Urmi, Wendy and Fina are super nice, they make sure to get you a table quickly, take the order in timely manner and also make valuable suggestions on the menu. They always keep checking if everything is fine and customers are enjoying food. I loved the desert suggestion after eating my dinner. After first day I have been to this place 7-6 times and was always greeted with same service. I highly recommend this restaurant and will go again before I leave Singapore for USA.

We had the sultan's delight and mussels with garlic cream and cheese toast. The sultan's delight is really enjoyable. We could taste the smokiness from the eggplant puree and the lamb stew is really tender with tomato based sauce. It's tangy and smoky with some crunchiness from the pine nuts. Really enjoyable. But the mussel is pretty standard. It didn't taste really fresh but they're quite generous with the amount. The garlic cheese sauce is ok only.
Service was good and attentive.

Visited for my birthday meal with my family as I was craving some Mediterranean food and this place had great reviews. However, the whole experience ended up kinda disappointing - as I had high expectations too on my first visit.

Service:
- It’s a restaurant but I felt like there was not much service per say.
- It’s a pretty high price point but they don’t serve complimentary water (charged at $3 a pot of hot water, or $11 for Evian water only)
- Ordering isn’t as fuss free as they try to make it. Online ordering only from mobile app, with just one physical menu at the door. Asked for any extra copies for easier viewing but none available. You also have to pay upfront in mobile order.
- Feels like I visited a restaurant but received fast food style service.

Atmosphere:
- Overall atmosphere is okay. Like a typical restaurant

Food:
- Average, I’ve had much better at other places for a similar price point.
- Pita bread, spreads and kebab grills were okay.
- Saffron rice & Briyani rice were disappointing. They use basmati rice which gave a nice texture. However, flavour is so subtle that I could barely taste the difference between the 2.

Summary:
Would I return? Definitely not! For the price point, the food and service didn’t live up to expectations for a highly rated restaurant. Will continue on my hunt for yummy Mediterranean food!

Visited on a Thu night, it's superb crowded and busy in the restaurant. 3 dishes for 2 people, very filling. Overall the food is pretty decent and the price point is on the higher side.

Excellent experience with vibrant dining experience. Food has great range of taste to excite the palate. Service is welcoming and top notch, they also gave a complimentary cake.
Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.name: Pistachio Middle Eastern & Mediterranean Grill

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Even though the restaurant is in quite a touristy location, the food is actually pretty good. One of the more popular restaurant along the pathway. Staff are friendly and helpful. Lovely place to be to watch people walk by while enjoying dinner. Parking is limited in the area though.

Food is really great. Had a very nice dinner with family. The street sets the mood for good food.  Food felt authentic and very tasty. We had chicken Mandi, mixed grill and "pizza".

Place also has some good baklava.

Parking lot picture below.

One of the nicest place to eat on a cool night is at Arab Street, dining alfresco. We didn't even need them to turn on the fan.

My favourite dish here is the tabouleh itself. Sometimes you may find lemon seeds in it but that speaks to how authentic the salad is.

While initially heading for a different restaurant, at which we were repelled by the pushy staff / promoters, we headed down Arab Street to look for an alternative. Most of the other restaurants also had promoters out which tried to lure us in. The guys at Tabbouleh just let us check the menu first and then we asked for a table. Service generally was ok, we waited a bit to actually order, food did not take a very long time though. The atmosphere actually was quite nice, views on the mosque, night time street impressions with a table outside. The food was delicious, I normally don't like Hummus a lot, but here I liked it. It was well presented as well. In the end I got the feeling that despite the 10% service charge it was expected that we give additional tip, which was a bit strange hence the 3/5 for the service. We did like the tea at the very end which rounded up an otherwise nice dinner experience. Thank you very much.

We choose the restaurant because of its good reviews and as the staff was not at all intrusive as most of the other places in the area.
We shared a mixed appetizers plate, which was alright. Overall good, but also no particular highlights.
The iced lemon tea was perfect after an exhausting day.
A plus was the free mint tea at the end, which we really appreciated.
The service could be more attentive, while the food was out quite fast. All in all a rather average experience.

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
The food was not too bad. First time having Lebanese food. The chicken was cooked nicely and the basmati rice was seasoned well. The lamb chops were on the drier side. Overall interesting meal. Recommended for group dinners.

First time trying Lebanese food and it was really nice with a very good vibe. the ambiance was all set and whole arab street experince was lit. Hummus with bread and apple teas is a myst try dish over here. The price is on the higher side and I would say going in a group pf 5-6 people will be good as we get to try lot of new dishes.

Sanobar Lebanese Restaurant in Singapore is a hidden culinary gem that whisks diners away to the flavors of Lebanon. The restaurant offers a delectable and authentic Lebanese dining experience, from succulent shawarmas to flavorful falafels and tantalizing baklava desserts.

The ambiance is warm and inviting, and the friendly staff ensures a delightful dining experience. The menu caters to various dietary preferences and offers a true taste of Middle Eastern cuisine. Staff is so welcoming and friendly! Whether you're a fan of Lebanese food or new to it, Sanobar is a must-visit, I enjoyed the place so much when I visited Singapore in January!

Visited 13 July 2023 humid summer evening. The following sharing are based on our unbiased personal opinion and experience.

Multiple visit to this restaurant serving Turkish delicacy. Located at Kampong glam, Bussorah street. We had a great and delicious dinner for the night.

The food was filling and delicious dessert 🎂 and Turkish coffee was fantastic. And the dining atmosphere vibes was good with outdoor sitting.

Food 4 ⭐
Services 4 ⭐
Atmosphere 4 ⭐
Return to try again definitely 😁

Drop by the next time when you visit Kampong Glam I'm pretty sure you will like it here. Cheers

Nice food. Requested for some cherry tomatoes on the side and was spot on. Chicken was cook perfectly and tender. Good service staff. Was given a mint tea after meal. 5 star for the chefs and service crew.

A must go to restaurant. ;)

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Good food and ambience. Lamb items tasted better. Wish the Arabic rice was cooked more. It was dry.
Belly dancer with amazing dance skills was a surprising addition.
Had a great time.

A bit further down the road from the more crowded food areas, but well worth the extra distance. The chicken kebab lunch special was excellent, the apple tea was also wonderful, and the staff are very attentive.

This was an excellent find while going through that area!

Mezze platter - 3.75 stars
Dips were delicious. Pita was bland and could've been better.

Kebab platter - 3.75 stars
Sausage was great. Beef and chicken a bit dry. Lamb was salty.

The food is really delicious and there are many must try middle east delicacies. The  downside of the restaurant is the service though they charge 10% service charge.

Hi, the best place in Arab street for authentic food. I keep coming back here and the food is very affordable, choose this restaurant if you can’t decide! We even got a free dessert, from Amar, his service was great!!!
Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.name: Beirut Grill

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
I had the pleasure of trying Turkish cuisine for the first time, and it was truly a delightful experience! The standout dish for me was the lamb; it had absolutely no odor and tasted fantastic. The grilled items were a highlight as well, bursting with delicious flavors. The restaurant’s ambiance was beautifully decorated, and the staff was both charming and incredibly helpful, taking the time to explain the dishes to us. While it’s not the cheapest option, the prices are fair for the quality you receive.

One thing to note, though, is that the platter we ordered was described as “for two,” but for Asians, it’s considered a generous portion. So, if there are four of you and you’ve already ordered other dishes, I recommend going for the platter for two only; it’s quite substantial. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great dining experience!

First time having Turkish food and was really
pleasantly surprised. Their dips and bread was really exceptional. The bread was steaming when it came out it was both crispy and fluffy at the same time. The platter for 2 was also great all the grilled meats was tender and flavourful. Portion was also huge.

Everything from the service to food were impeccable. Staff were polite and always made sure we were well taken care of. I ordered before my friend came and they asked when the food should be prepared and how it should be served. Food was perfectly done too. It is the little things that make a difference and win them a return customer.

Very impressive food & service displayed by the dedicated front staffs and chefs. It’s nice walking in the street after a wine & dine session in the area. The staffs were very attentive, price is reasonable.

Went here for a birthday celebration and the attention to detail from their service staff is amazing, didn’t mention to the staff that it was for a birthday celebration, only had a note in the reservation. But they went above and beyond, having candles in the dessert and even giving us props to take pictures with and proceeded to then print out the photo of us to keep!

The food also matches the service, authentic Turkish cuisine done perfectly, the Hummus was so good we had to order a second portion! I’m not usually a fan of chicken but the chicken that came with the platter blew my mind, so juicy and tender. Then comes dessert, my first time having Kunefe and the only thing I have to say is that I wish I didn’t share it, wanted it all to myself 🤣

Definitely coming back here again!

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
The perfect place chosen for a birthday celebration!!

From great service, to amazing ambience, to tasty food... everything was simply perfect!

Awesome selection for both veg & non-veg menu!!

2 thumbs up!

Thank you Byblos for making our evening beautiful!

Quality food, ambience and excellent service from staff made the dinner special. Thanks to receptionist Mahiti for always giving a great smile to all guest. It definitely makes a difference.

We celebrated my brother's birthday here and had a great time. The restaurant is beautifully decorated with classic Turkish designs and really put us in the mood for their cuisine.

We ordered the mixed grilled platter to share and they portioned it for to the seven people in our party. The salads were fresh and the dessert was delicious. I highly recommend their kunfa as it's authentic, made fresh and absolutely scrumptious.

My only drawback was the warmth. There could have been better distribution of air-conditioning, other than that we had a swell time. I know there are many other restaurants in the area offering a similar experience but Byblos stands apart with class and authenticity.

LOVE the food!!! Hot, freshly baked lavash bread, delectable and well seasoned kebabs, even the salads appealed to my picky 11 year old. Ambience was lovely, only downside was the music is a wee bit loud (I was sitting indoors), but the staff brought down the volume. Our plates were all cleaned out, clearly we enjoyed dinner at Byblos. Highly recommended!

There are many Turkish food restaurants along Arab Street but this is the best one I've had here. In fact, I daresay it's the best Turkish food I've ever had. The Chef and waiters were all very welcoming!

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Honestly, wasn’t the most impressed with the service here at first, asked for order and the person simply said yes can continued doing his own stuff for 5minutes.

However, when the food came, i didn’t think too much about it afterwards. Starting from the hummus, absolutely generous and delicious portions. Perfect appetizer.

The butter rice with kebab was crazy delicious, we literally scraped the plate clean from the rice and the greek yogurt like substance in the centre.

Pizza was crispy and fragrant at the same time, the tomato sauce parts was absolutely amazing.

Strawberry drink was okay!!! Not super special but nice!

In the middle of Arab street you find this restaurant. We were welcomed by a real Turkish guy. Very friendly and he could advise us what was the best to order. We sat outside, along the street. Within 15 min the table was full with all kinds of grilled meat. Real Turkish flavors and a nice apple tea were enough to make my day complete. Eating here, and watching the people pass by is a big joy.

Parking in this area is very hard, as you can understand.

Had a great dinner here today. My friend saw this online with high rating stars so we just stopped by after work.  And yes, the food is delicious, the atmosphere is awesome, love the music too.
So if your family or friends are outgoing and friendly, this is the right place for you to gather together and laugh together and dance together !

Cuisine is new to me as a traveller. Trying the dish with my arab friends and the chef being a wonderful host in telling us about the different food added to the stellar experience of dining here. Service was awesome. Food was a good blend of flavors.

Just returning home from an amazing service and hospitality from Cappadocia.
Chef Ahmed Hagras went out of his way to arrange a very sweet surprise for my husband's birthday at my request.
The whole staff sang happy birthday for him with a special kunafe.

The food itself is finger licking good, no doubt. But the experience was way better.

Thank you everyone at Cappadocia for helping make this day special for him.

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Friendly staff
Foods were delicious and well cooked
Free complementary
Price was okay and worth to eat.

If you are coming Singapore don’t hesitate to visit this restaurant.

Food was really really good, it improved my mood to be even better. Condiments were a bonus. Staffs are friendly and approachable too. Definitely will come back again 😉

My second time to come here and service never disappoints. The food is tasty and the ambiance is great😊 highly recommended😊

Nice location and good tea, cool weather with Islamic vibes that place is too good to spend quality time with f&f nice to explore and good Turkish cuisine👍🏻

Delicious authentic Turkish cuisine, great atmosphere and excellent service ❤️

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
After 15 years, this restaurant sadly shows its age, lacking the charm and care it once might have had. Claiming to offer authentic Persian cuisine, the reality is a disappointing mix of flavors that lean more towards Indian than Persian. The kebabs, dry and tasteless, are a stark contrast to the rich flavors expected from Persian cooking. Equally disheartening is the rice – cold, undercooked, and lacking the basic essence of Persian culinary art. This establishment, once perhaps a bastion of authentic cuisine, now serves as a reminder of how far it has strayed from its original glory.

Flavourful middle-eastern cuisine, the dips were delicious.
Nice al fresco dinning areas.
Thank you, Ronny for the great host that makes our dinner wonderful. We appreciate your service.

Came back to this lovely Persian restaurant after 3-4 years to celebrate the Wife’s birthday. Last time here was for dinner, with the belly dancer floating around!

This time we were seated indoors due to the afternoon heat! Last few times were seated outside by the river which is lovely in the evening.

It was quite busy on a Sunday afternoon ! The food was as good as we remembered it to be.

Look forward to coming back here… sooner this time :-)

flavourful and appetising Persian food! had an enjoyable alfresco dinner by the river with a very accommodating food attendant. the dessert was delicious but the faludeh shirazi was a tad too sweet for us. maybe next time will just stick with the saffron ice cream on top of the faludeh, sooo good. will go back to try more food on the menu!

We enjoy a spread of 3-Course Middle-eastern set lunch for $48++ per person. 🍷And we add on 2 hours of Toi Toi Sara’s Rose free flow for $40++ per person. Here what we ordered:
❤️ Kash-E-Bademjan
❤️ Borani Esfanaj
❤️ Fish Kebab
-Well marinated with special saffron sauce, it is very fresh and flavourful
❤️ Chicken Masti
-Marinated with yogurt and herbs, the chicken is tender and slightly charred given it’s fragrance
❤️ Dessert
-We love the ice-cream with spice and the Pistachios
The wine is good, with tinge of sweetness and hinge of dryness.
We really enjoy our meal in a restaurant with such a serene environment right beside Singapore River.

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
I had:
1. Mezza platter
2. Saksuka
3. Mixed grills of chicken and lamb

Very decent food, but pricing wise not so.

I understand that being in boat quay would command some premium pricing. However,
I felt that the pricing is about ~30% higher than my comfort zone.

I had the Lamb mandi and testi kebab chicken. They were cooked tender, the chilli sauce on the lamb was off, it has that bitterness that is probably from lime skin mixed with the chilli.

Kunafa is decent as you get to mix on your own whether you prefer more sugar or cream.

Very nice view dining by the river. Food can be better though.

Delicious! We have been there for lunch and we ordered lamb mandi, chicken kofta wrap and hummus. Lamb is delicious and we highly recommend it. The waiter was kind and helped us with recommendations. The location is cool, at night it gets more crowded and it is a good spot to get some beers

No trip to Singapore is complete without a visit to Boat Quay, so keeping up with the tradition we decided on a late night dinner. After having our meal at another place when we were heading home - while walking past this new restaurant called Sultan Palace we were stopped by this extremely courteous Indian gentleman to come and check it out. When we said we had already eaten he offered us to try out the desserts. The warmth of Indian hospitality in his voice made us stop.

He suggested we should try out the #Kunafa, as we sat down. While we soaked in a bit longer in the vibe of Boat Quay food street - and waited. When the dish was served it was #sinful and #delicious. Check out the video in the post below.

As we devoured the large portion which was good enough for the four of us - and chatted with - the co-owner of the place.

The evening closed with some amazing Turkish (Turkiya) tea served in these gorgeous looking cups and tea pot.

Defiantly a must visit place again.

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
I had the pleasure of being served by Mr. Faizal at the counter, and I must say he was incredibly patient, addressing all my questions. What truly impressed me was the meticulous way he packed the condiments – neatness and attention to detail, it's the little things that count!

I highly recommend giving their kebabs a try. Personally, I'm a big fan of the Shawarma Mandi Rice, as you can see in the photo here. It's not just tasty; it's downright mouthwatering! 📸🍴

Best kebab ever - they use a creamy sauce.
that sets it apart from most kebabs in Singapore. lamb shank texture technically great.

That said, it’s not so much Mediterranean as it is a South Asian interpretation of Turkish food. In that sense it lacked the South Asian spice overload, but also needed more of the exuberant flavour of the Turkish seaside (olives, olive oil, etc)

Service was amazing - it’s not an Indian restaurant but I found myself accidentally ordering all sorts of off menu things like lime juice no sugar and mango lassi, and they delivered.

Ordered the mutton kabsa, fattoush, khubz and a giant container of toum for dine in, as well as chicken shawarma for takeaway.

I appreciate that the food closely resembles the kabsa and shawarma versions you find in Saudi Arabia or Lebanon.

The shawarma had no weird chili sauce inside it, and had pickles and french fries. The mutton was tender and flavorful and the kabsa rice was nicely aldente.

If you're not looking to try more authentic middle eastern food outside of Turkish cuisine, this is the place to go.

Food tasted amazing and friendly service staff. The meats were seasoned and spiced flavourfully and the accompanying sides complemented it greatly. There was a slightly order confusion but the management solved it professionally.

Good food when im dine,service staff very friendly they recommended me few nice dishes for me takeaway,price affordable compared in arab Street

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
The food was really nice especially the chicken Lebanese style pizza and the lamb mandi! The service was also amazing as the staff were friendly and checked if we enjoyed our food. Overall a great experience and recommend 5/5.

This was my second visit to the restaurant- the experience was worse than first time. Our food ordered did not come, ordered a fresh apple juice $8.90, after waiting till end of meal, a canned apple juice finally was served after 5x reminding the waitress. Overall meat was dry.. so different from what we had a month ago. And the aircond is not working and ventilation was horrendous! Only one good comment - the bread served for dip were warm and fluffy

The tabbouleh was horrible. Very sour. The other dishes were average to good. Staff wasted a lot of my time trying to figure out food panda.

Really enjoyed the food here, delicious tabouli (the best in Singapore (in my humble opinion) & hummus, very delicious kebab, the lamb Mandi fell off the bones & a yummy knefe! A good find, we’re definitely coming back! Very good service as well, lovely waitress with a good sense of humor.

Amazing service. Top notch. Food is great too. Will visit again!

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Super wanted to like this place … but the service was very slow, I often had to chase down the waiter. There were 2 cockroaches that ran across my feet and then headed to the kitchen, and when I notified the waiter, they were just as squeamish as we were. Food was ok, but probably wouldn’t go back.

Located at the junction of Baghdad Street and Bussorah Street, good Lebanese food of large size portions, the tables at the pavement is nice in the evening.  The staff were friendly and welcoming we overall it was good experience

Great food and atmosphere. Owner is super lovely legit food lover. Go here!

Amazing food, ate there twice

Sultan Mosque Nakamise Street has a lot of restaurants with a nice atmosphere, so I was a little confused, but a local friend brought me to this restaurant. The appetizer platter is full of Mediterranean cuisine (Lebanese?). For mains, we each ordered lamb chops and skewered beef (I don't know the name). I was so absorbed in chatting that I couldn't eat all the appetizers, but they all tasted authentic. The main meat dishes are simply prepared but delicious. I appreciated the thoughtfulness of pointing two large fans at us. None of the restaurants in Nakamise serve alcohol (for religious reasons), so if you need one, you should either drink before coming to this area, or go to a pub a little further out of this area as there are many pubs. Let's go for a drink.

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Stumbled across this place today and decided to eat here with my mum. Very no frills and simple place.

She had a falafel moussaka, and I had the mexican beef bowl. The moussaka was delicious but I feel like 5 pieces of nacho chips wasn’t enough and mind you this cost $13…..

The beef bowl was a little dry, could do with some kind of sauce but it was good and we finished both dishes. The churros came freshly fried and was good too, but would have preferred actual choc sauce vs the hershey choc syrup.

Only gripes; the overly sugary lemongrass drink that was served premade with no ice. Had to ask for ice twice but given few pieces…..  also very weird that we dined in but were served with plastic cutlery when we clearly saw metal cutlery, it was a little strange. It was practically only 2 tables and the lady served my food to the other table…. Could tell she wanted to take it back to serve me but they already started eating it.

I think its a quaint little place but some things need to be improved. At $30 for 2 expected just a little more.

Excellent service. The beef Mexican rice bowl was not bad. With the homemade drink, I spent less than $10. I was there alone at 5 ish and I had the entire place to myself. I don't remember music playing but it sure would be nice to listen to some tunes.

Small quaint shop located near Tai Seng Mrt, they had a $10 set meal that had a wrap, small hash brown and a lemongrass tea. There was a small side of nacho chips with salsa.

Nothing amazing but I guess it was better than nothing coz there wasn’t anything there open before 11am

Dropped-off my 10-months old laptop at LENOVO Service Centre at 3 Irving Rd, #01-17 Tai Seng Centre. BITC, Singapore 369522 on Tuesday 18 April 2023,

Thus decide to settle my late lunch within the area too.

One will be spoiled with choices as there are so many small eateries and cafes. I was drawn to  Olive Mediterranean & Middle East which was located across the street at 11 Irving Place #01-14/15, Tai Seng Point, Singapore 369551.

Ordered for myself a Mexican Rice (Celantro & Spinach With Beef) Bowl at S$7.50.

If you are a small eater, the serving portion is just right. However, definitely a "No. No." for someone who has a heavy duty digestive system, I would recommend that you order some nachos or Quesadillas too.

In my opinion, the rice is mildy aromatic (I was expecting a more pungent aroma of Celantro and spinach).

I will rate the minced beef topping as "healthy choice".  It is relatively quite nice BUT will not leave one any special impression.  It will definitely taste alot better if there is a little more fat (this will enhance the juiciness) and more spices are added.

However, if you working in this area, it is a great place to meet up with your colleagues and friends after work.  You can sufficient outdoor sittings surrounded with plants.

Stumbled on this place as i happened to be browsing around. Been awhile since i had my tacos and wraps, decided to try this as i noticed they had very high reviews.

Had the beef Quesadilla - loved it as it was simply nice
Chicken Saffron Stew - Soooo tender and nice but soup wasnt as thick as i wanted but thats purely due to my own taste
Hashbrowns - Thumbsup as we all loved it. Hearsay its even better than M's hashbrown but i leave it for u to judge.

Service wise was top, very homely feel given by the lady boss and staff. She took her time to guide me through the menu and shared with me what we should order.
I must say the food takes a pretty long time to come for a quiet Monday Afternoon but i guess Good Food - Time to prepare so no complaints from me on this.

Overall i recommend this place based on the food served + prices. Very nice and they deserves better businesses. should be pretty quiet when its after office hours.

Will be back again :)

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
Visited here on a weekday for lunch with office colleagues. We had reservation and took the seats arranged for our big group. There was option of set menu as well as ala carte. We went ahead with the recommendations of the staff and had the following: fried cauliflower served with mint chutney, hummus with pita bread, assorted kebabs which included lamb, chicken, pork and falafel. We had some beverages too. The menu is elaborate with Mediterranean cuisine and taste is authentic though some may not like it.
It was crowded during our time of visit yet the service was good. Staff are friendly and knows well of the dishes.

Went for a weekday lunch and with the $29 set lunch it was filling and totally worth it. Love the artichoke and herb hummus served with pita bread. It was better than the cashew  hummus. Chopped kale was good. Pretty interesting with fried capers and lady finger but smoke aubergine seems to be less flavourful. I would like it with more yogurt. No complaints about the seabass, chicken, pork ribs and lamb leg kebabs. Chicken was soft, pork ribs had tons of asian flavours and lamb leg was juicy. Overall would recommend.

Came here with some friends for brunch and decided to go ALA carte instead of the brunch package. To be honest, 55SGD for the brunch package was quite reasonable. But everyone on the table had to take it. Which was quite disappointing.

However - not an issue since we managed to order what we wanted anyway. I like the cauliflower and the egg plant dish. It was quite tasty. I had the crab tacos which were alright. Generally not bad for a brunch spot. I would go for the set the next time I'm back.

Food: very delicious, good options for vegetarians. We went for the brunch & it came with a hummus dip and side which we could mix and match. We tried the artichoke and herb hummus and cashew hummus and loved both. The kale with mihalic cheese was outstanding and I’ve never enjoyed kale more. The cauliflower with green tahini had this lovely tangy taste and was roasted to perfection. For the main course, we tried the full breakfast plate but it was slightly underwhelming as none of the items were outstanding. Didn’t like the falafel at all. The halloumi was delicious but only a small piece. The French toast was fresh and scrumptious.

Service: excellent service with attentive and accommodating staff who moved us to another table as our adjoining table was very noisy and loud.

Ambience: My friend and I didn’t really enjoy the ambience as we weren’t seated at the best place with a huge noisy group next to us and a service trolley beside us. I feel it would be much nicer if we sat up front in the main area where the bar is.

Visited in Oct 2023

Really great cocktails. But found the food to be average other than a couple of dishes which stood out. Among the mezze dishes, I thought that the Roasted Cashew Hummus and the Duck Pastilla were good. Didn’t like the octopus mezze as all of us felt it was burnt/over-grilled. For mains, we tried the pork ribeye which was ~3.5/5. Ordered 1 dessert item (kunefe) which was pretty good.

All the cocktails we tried were quite decent with my favs being Ottoman’s Island, Aergul Paloma and the Baklava Milk Punch.

Service was really good.

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
The food nice and very tasty, but the service zero very delayed to service the customer the staff looking supersized if ask them for things really disappointed from service ( but food amazing)

I recently tried out  this restaurant and it was absolutely amazing!

The food was incredibly flavorful, with a wide variety of delicious dishes to choose from.
The ambience was cozy and inviting, making it the perfect place to enjoy a meal with friends or family. I highly recommend giving it a try! 🍽️✨

Great food, welcoming ambiance.. you could say one of the best restaurants in Singapore to have dinner.

We’ve ordered Grand Konak for our team’s Party and the whole team have enjoyed the food! Grand Konak team is even so nice to accommodate our request as it’s their staff party too. They made sure that the food we are gonna have will be warm by the start of our party. I highly recommend Grand Konak for parties and gatherings, everything is just so delicious plus the service is really fantastic! We will for sure have them again for our next event ❤️

Nice Ambiance and Authentic Turkish and Mediterranean Cuisine.
We had mezza platter, Lavash and kunafee all were amazing

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
We had our dinner here on Good Friday night with the last minute reservation from google.
We ordered a starter, a pizza, a grilled meat platter and a Lebanon dessert. The food worth 2 stars. The meat was pretty hard, the starter was too sour. The dessert was really not able to match our taste. The house wines was tasteless, but the red wine taste better when it pair with the meat. I will strongly recommend you only order the red if you want to have their one for one house wine promo.
Our bill was $128, you can get a much more better grilled meat platter and better food at other restaurants. :)

Le Rida has a rustic ambience somewhat akin to an old time eating house in a small town. Quaint and homely
Freshly baked pita bread with lemon chick pea hummus was delicious and filling
Mains of Lebanese lamb kafta kebab had the right balance of flavour and crunchiness.
Wash it all down with 1 for 1 Heineken draft at $17.90

Manager Sanjiv was both friendly and helpful in his recommendations and unlike in some establishments, he did not push you to over order.
Definitely worth a return visit!

A quaint no frills dining place with excellent food and good service. The staff are simple people but are very hospitable, often checking in on the food quality and our experience. If you are looking for a good meal away from hustle and bustle, this is the place to go. Oh.. U can definitely have a conversation with your company and hear them loud and clear

Didn't think the food was thaaaat amazing. Nor was the service. But at least they let us drink outside drinks.
HOWEVER, i requested for no garnishing on my hummus. When the guy brought it over, there WAS parsley on it. And all he said was "just pluck it out". --.--
So if i was allergic to that, i should just pluck it out.... nice. The hummus wasn't good either. I've tasted better. Like a friend who went with me commented... it isn't creamy enough. Also, comments about the baklava was that it was too hard... and wasn't good.

Absolutely loved the food, I am heavily into Mediterranean food. I have tried most of the places around Bugis as well. The food here was so fresh, with perfect taste and presentation. It was completely worth it travelling from East.
The service was quick, the portion size was generous . We ordered mezze plateer and tabalu salad. They were scrumptious loved the customised heart shaped Pita bread. Hummus, was so creamy and so were all other dips.

Would strongly recommend.. It has become one of my favourite place..

Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
We enjoyed our meal here. The environment is very clean and they sanitize the tables after each group of guests leave. We especially loved the warm pita bread and lamb kofta. Service was also very quick and polite. It is a little on the pricier end but you can get a discount if you book via eatigo. We spent $64 for 2 after 30% discount and felt it was a reasonable price for the quality of food.

Staff were friendly and welcoming. I’ve tasted better hummus although given the name, I expected this to be more special. Their mint tea was good but could have been more minty. Overall the staff was the best part of this restaurant.

First time dining at the restaurant and my family enjoyed the food thoroughly. Every dish we ordered was so yummy. The staff, Anwar, was friendly, attentive and provided good service.

The waiter say if feel the food not nice or you like it, don’t have to pay. It’s a very heavy sentence to put on customer. Trust me the food was indeed tasty and delicious. We ordered meat platter for 2.. it’s more than enough for 2 person. And their fresh orange juice, it’s purely orange. No water added in.l like other places. It’s a killer pricey but it’s worth your every penny. 😊

We love going to Arab street and trying out the different restaurants here. First time at Hummus & Tandoor for a family lunch!

The food was delicious… all the dishes we tried were very good. The Aareyes Kofta was very interesting!

The place was quite empty on a Saturday afternoon. We had made a booking through eatigo with a 30% discount. The prices were a bit on the higher side, but more reasonable after the eatigo discount.

Would definitely recommend this place … and would plan to visit again soon.

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
Celebrated my birthday there with my friend and the fold here is super awesome! The meat are cooked to perfection and the servers were so attentive to details and prompt to react. If you are a meat lover, dont miss the experience here!

Some of the items that I really like, (no pictures cause busy eating 😅)
- Garlic Beef
- Picanha
- Duck Breast
- Chicken and Chicken Heart
- Sirloin
- Beef Ribs

And and and! The cheese bread and fried banana were awesome toooooo!

Do try them out!

We brought a toddler with us and it was child friendly. Overall the food were great and fresh. The marination taste really good and was grilled to perfection; the beef was medium rare, good job to the chef! I'm not a fish person but it got me eating second piece, it was delicious and fresh. Our daughter just loves the chips and tomato. Service was attentive and well explained. Good job to Chris and team! Looking forward to visit again!

It was my anniversary celebration. We had
lunch, and it was a carnivore's dream come true. The buffet-style service, with servers continuously offering a variety of meats until you signal them to stop, was a delightful experience.

The meat selection was impressive, and I must say the Picanha, Prime Part of Top beef stole my heart.
Despite that Picanha that stole my heart, there were some others that I think otherwise. Maybe this is personal preference.

Overall, I found their concept of unlimited, high-quality meat servings are truly enjoyable.

Notes: the bottle provided on the table are chargeable. One is sparkling water, the other is mineral water.

No complaints whatsoever. It's worth the steap price, from the sides (pictured) to the array of various meats, all cooked to perfection, to the attentive and courteous wait staff.

My only reccomendarion is to come hungry.

The only positive thing I can say about this place is the decent interior. The food is otherwise pretty terrible. Their picanha is tough, dry and sinewy while their supposed wagyu sirloin is almost certainly not wagyu given that it lacks the signature tenderness you expect from high quality beef and also carried a weird, almost gamey taste. Service was also lacklustre, with the waitress having an attitude that suggested she would rather be anywhere else than at the restaurant.
Brazilian food near my location.name: Casa Brazilia

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
The experience at Carnivore was fantastic; plenty of meat with wide variety was served continuously throughout the night. Every bite was tender and we enjoyed the service very much. At one point, we even requested the chef for a particular cut, which he very graciously prepared just for our table. The salad bar is very fresh and well prepared. We recommend the ham, pineapples and beef brisket. If you dare to try, get the chicken heart too!

Carnivore started 2 decades ago at Vivo City, relocated to CHIJMES, and just relocated to Robertson Quay.

The meat or skewers were not what we accustomed to. All the variants of beef on skewers had a very strong gaming beefy taste and either dry or hard. Definitely not tender just hard. The short beef ribs not so hard or tough but strong beefy taste. The chicken heart was okay at 7/10. The home made sausage was dried out, was not tasty at all, a dismal 2/10. The bacon wrapped chicken at 5/10. The chicken thigh better at best a 7/10.

The best from carver is the skewered barbecued pineapple at 9/10 and butterfish at 8/10.

Strangely the buffet sides were better overall compared to the skewered meats. Minestrone soup 7/10, black beans with sliced sausages 7/10, potato salad 8/10, asparagus salad 7/10, beef stew 6.5/10.

The assorted chocolate desert was 8/10. The fruit was decent at 7.5/10.

Dunno what to say. We are so used to the higher meat qualities when they were at Vivos City. Just wish they were as good as before. They just started operating less than a month since relocating from CHIJMES so maybe they just getting into the groove.

Service was good, friendly & attentive. Hardly anyone there during Monday lunch as it was a public holiday, in lieu of Deepavali.

This is a meat lovers paradise! Every meat they serve is awesome! My faves are the rump cap, chicken thigh and the butterfish! But on the whole food is awesome, and service is great! I especially loved the service from an elderly gentleman. He was attentive to my needs and made sure I got what I wanted. He deserves 100 stars and he makes my day!

Meats were a bit dried but taste still not that bad, salad bar and dessert okay, overall okay

Felt like meat variety for rotation was alot lesser than what was shown on their website. Pineapples only came twice, of which once did not even made it to our table.

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
Absolutely magnificent place, advised by my Brazilian friend. the key thing is that salad bar, which in itself is decent enough is accompanied by personnel cutting meat for you, as much as you can eat. bringing new kinds of meat, I tried to grasp all of what was available and I must say that picanha is an absolute favorite.

My first time to this restaurant and it was a great experience. Definitely a must-go place for meat lovers. The salad and food bar had a great variety to choose from and the meat get served direct to the table every few minutes (^^"). And remember to ask for the pineapple!!!

All the meat is quite salty, makes you keep drinking water and fill up your stomach fast. Most of the beef like tenderloin and lamb were overcooked and were lacking in flavour.

Booked our reservation for 7pm but had no issues despite us coming earlier at 6.30. Our waiter, even though he was a trainee (some chinese/asian person) was super on the ball when it came to refilling our water and changing our plates.

When I accidentally dropped some meat on my white shirt, he immediately dropped whatever he was doing and got me a wet and dry tissue for me to clean off the stain. Highly impressed with the service and food. Had a lovely evening together with my wife.

Food is great. Service is excellent. The salad bar was also really good. It's a meat lovers paradise
Brazilian food near my location.opening_hours:
