Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
The premise looks very clean, which is absolutely assuring. Acai bowl never fails, not too sweet and filled with fresh ingredients. I especially love their nut butters but wished that they could give slightly more as it’s always not enough to go around with the acai. 😅

Always had the Acai Flower bowl at other outlets, decided to try Coconut Yoghurt Acai bowl instead. Fresh fruits used, mixed with cruchy toasted coconut flakes, granola, and goji berries. The coconut yoghurt taste not very prominent and serving kind of little, hope to get a bigger scoped.

A promotion is ongoing in Woodleigh mall with 2 bowls for $16. Ordered a Original Flower Bowl and a Nuts for Açaí bowl with 2 butters namely peanut and cookie. The staff were very helpful to help me change my order. Overall experience was good 👍

The staff were so unfriendly with an unpleasant face that make you feel guilty for ordering, my appetite for eating açaí was gone instantly. I said hi with a smile no reply, thank you no reply, looking upset and kind of scary. The açaí is good though but never coming back here again for the service.

Came to support them for their new opening at the Woodleigh Mall! Got the promotion which was 1 for 1 acai bowls and the staff were super nice and acai was super yummy!

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
Came here second time. Ordered the watcha chicken Crepe. It taste really good with the chicken nicely grille.

I have ordered the sweet crepe of banana and Nutella. love it when it is gluten free. it is hard for the crepe but after the first bite it kinda of melt in your mouth. it is not too sweet. the spinach drink is very refreshing and is well blended. the portion of the. crepe is alright for me as it is quite filling. but maybe little for people with bigger appetite. packaging is well protected delivered by grab. looking forward to try their other crepe.

Before visiting, I read the reviews and was wondering how good can acai be. After trying it I must say it's really very appetizing with the chocolate sauce and peanut butter. One thing that can be improved would be the packaging for the acai, the bottom of it was already wet within 10mins.

The grilled tapioca wrap was also good with generous amount of fillings. Although the skin looked crispy it was quite chewy but in a good way.

Love their acai bowl! Portion was generous and they purely used acai - no fillers like chia seeds taking up half the bowl unlike at certain other places. My favourite is their keto goddess bowl - it has everything that I like: blueberries, strawberries, cacao nibs and coconut flakes! The owner is really friendly too. And price was very good at $12.90 for a large bowl which was enough for two of us to share.

Favourite acai place by far.

Beiju Express have the best açai bowl in town and I‘ve tried many. Fresh, delicious range of ingrediants, served at the perfect temperature and amazingly arranged.
And must try the Brazilian Tapioca Crepes. I had the Watcha Chicken. It was delicious!

Tried the Keto Goddess, and it was really nice. Portion size is very generous as well. The staff is also very friendly and helpful.

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
The açai is nice!! The waiter and waitress are nice too! There provide some seats inside where you can do your work or have a small chat with your friend while having açai!
There provide some power socket too! If you need to charge your laptop also can!
Overall it was a good experience!

You can choose your cup in different sizes, ordering Lean & Green. I will say the staff isn’t friendly and welcoming, but my order is being done perfectly. Big space for you to dine in.

Relaxing ambience to supercharge bonding time with this healthy Superfood! Overall I enjoyed the environment and both the berry & mango taste superb. Looking forward to try out the other range.

I’m a frequent patron, and would usually order the medium Triple A.

This time my order was served lesser than
usual. When I had went to get it checked, I was given the rudest reply by their staff Xin Hui, whom insisted it’s their SOP and was reluctant to change.

When I stood my ground about the serving standard being lesser, I was shouted at by her, my order was also snatched from my hands.

I’ve written in to their management about this encounter, it’s been about 6 months and I’ve not heard a single word back.

Came here twice, and both times, tables weren't clean. Their acai were great though pricey.

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
It's a nice little place for a fruit smoothie bowl or fresh juices, we are vegan so couldn't find a local breakfast place that provided vegan options, so we went into the mall opposite the hotel and came across this place to try out. Enjoyed the protector bowl although it is super cold and was roughly 14 dollars. The overnight oats were also quite nice. Service was quick too although it's small inside so limited seats.

Delicious green pancakes and açai smoothies! It’s a hidden gem in Tekka Place and is the perfect healthy food spot with a great variety of juices, smoothies and bowls. I can’t wait to try the salads next. The green pancakes are absolutely delicious- soft inside, crunchy outside and tasted phenomenal! A must try!

Enjoy the Ahh Acai bowl. One of the most basic ones. Unlike other acai, this is less sweet and very generous in portions for a $7.90 bowl. There are a few tables and chairs for dine in but I did a takeaway this time. A good place to hide from the sun and refresh yourself after walking the streets of Little India :)

Cozy little cafe in the mall which offers great bowls. The service has been quick and very friendly, and the açaí bowl itself had a great flavor. Indeed, the portion (20oz) has been quite a bit of açaí which is a great value for the money ($14.90). Really great place with a lot of fruity options. 🍌🫐🍓

I had their Vita Acai bowl, and it was delicious. Very generous toppings! I wanted more protein and they had “pea protein” and “whey protein” that I could add to my bowl.  Seats are limited, but thankfully I was the only one. I’m glad I dropped by, it was everything I wanted in an Acai bowl.  Loved the calorie count they gauge for their bowls too. The salad looked pretty amazing on their menu, hope I can try that next time too!

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
Marvelous restaurants with very high quality food.

Fondue de Camembert is highly recommended with unlimited bread supply, the steak is very tender and juicy with a surprise amount Fries.

Lava cake is excellent.

A must try restaurant.

Saw the review of this restaurant on social media so decided to give it a try. The place is very small with just a handful of tables. Could get a little noisy with full crowd. Make reservation before going to avoid disappointment. Home made fries tasted fresh. Even though its free flow but the initial serving was so generous that we did not ask for refills. We decided to try the 4 pax platter for 3 of us. A good selection with the platter. The ribeye was too charcoal-y for our liking. We actually prefer the beef skewers. Duck breast and sausages were delicious. Pork chop was so-so. It's a shame the food became cold too fast otherwise we would enjoyed it more. Staff service was excellent and attentive.

food was amazing, really enjoyed their camembert roti (bread was amazing btw, fresh crispy and fluffy in the middle) and the mains were cooked just right. not forgetting the free flow fries, slightly greasy but still great. definitely will come back again, very pleased!

Very well cooked juicy steak with free flow fries and salad.

Was too hungry to take more photos but really loved how the steak was done.

The set meals here makes it a more value for money option. We picked the burrata cheese with chocolate brownie which is amazing.

Awesome place for some steaks and fries. Reasonable pricing for restaurant dining. Staffs are courteous.
Calamari is the frozen type from supplier so that didn’t sit well with me.
The rest of the food was acceptable.
Brazilian food near my location.name: Braseiro Restaurant

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
"We three went to the restaurant today at noon to celebrate a friend's birthday. The location of the restaurant was easy to find. We ordered steak, pasta, and creamed spinach, and every dish was delicious. The service was attentive; they realized it was our first time there and offered recommendations. After finishing our meal, we received a complimentary dessert as a birthday surprise for our friend. The customers at the neighboring table even joined in singing for our friend's celebration. We really liked this place—both the food and the atmosphere were perfect. We'll definitely go back again."

Celebrated my husband birthday at picanhas , we enjoyed our dinner there. Food is absolutely fantastic to our liking, definitely lived up to the high rating expectations. Loves the hospitality and ambience as well, a different dining experience . 👍

The best customer service I got in Singapore. I highly recommend it. The steak was on point, drinks were very good and the spinach was delicious. Also, they gave us popcorn for starters.

First visit, impressed with the hospitality and friendly staff. Nice unique food, good for sharing to have a taste of each dishes. @live2njoy

The staff is very attentive, friendly and welcoming! The food and service are excellent. Very delicious and the dessert (chocolate dream) was very dreamy!
The birthday person enjoyed the pasta and the whole restaurant sang to him birthday song!
Big shout outs to the “snow-hat” dude who entertained my son and made such a kind impression on him. 🤪
Brazilian food near my location.name: Picanhas'

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
Right outside Braddell mrt, i rarely see acai stores around the neighbourhood and super glad to see one around the area! The acai is pretty reasonably priced, i got the regular size at $9.60 quite a big portion! The classic acai comes together w fruits nuts and granola. Drizzle was generous as well. Love it!

A small shop serving healthy superfoods that is acai bowls, which has also become my regular "rewards" for sticking to my healthy diet.

I chose their regular bowl with honey drizzle. The ingredients tasted fresh, the layering was compact and filling. Alternating between the crunchy and the sweet, you'll savor each healthy bite without the associated guilt.

Will add to my healthy bites list.

Acai with honey drizzle is da bomb. Really nice cocktail of yummy fruits and acai. The fruits are also fresh and portion is generous. For less than $10 is definitely worth every penny.

Despite staying nearby, this is my first visit and it’s definitely not going to be my last! Lady boss was very friendly and gave me some recommendations. I selected the regular Classic Açaí Bowl since it contains everything! Lady boss took time to cut up the fruits on the spot and presented the bowl (cup) beautifully.  She was very generous with the ingredients and I especially liked the almond butter drizzle (included in price). The açaí tasted wonderful with all the fresh fruit, nuts, and granola. Enjoyed every bit of my cup! Nana’s a real gem in the area. Please come support so I can continue having it forever!

The best açai! Generous with açai serving and toppings, wide variety of toppings available and tastes great. They use more premium toppings like macadamia nuts and goji berries. Love it so much

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
Had an amazing dinner with my friend on a Friday night. Reservations required. Service was great. Food was fantastic. Especially love the tenderloin, it’s so tender and yummy. Also love the bread we had, it’s well worth the price of $16.

Fantastic steak & food & service! You’d probably also be able to get a decent steak here for 

It was our first time visiting Bochinche. The restaurant has a lovely ambiance and the staff are polite and helpful. The manager kindly explained to us the differences between each cut of meat.

For starters, we had the SD bread basket and ox tongue carpaccio. The bread slices were delish with butter. The ox tongue carpaccio was an interesting blend of flavours that worked well together.

For the main, we ordered the Heavenly Meat Board with 4 different kinds of steaks. They were perfectly cooked medium rare, served with a bit of smoked salt, garlic confit and padron peppers, which elevated the flavour immensely. Sides were chips, broccolini and wild mushrooms. Kiddo had the cheeseburger and finished the entire thing off!

To finish off, we shared the nectarine tart and espresso creme brulee while kiddo had a scoop of vanilla ice-cream. The creme brulee was delicious. Creamy with the wonderful fragrance of espresso. We enjoyed that immensely. Were not too crazy about the tart though. The nectarine slices were not ripe and still hard after cooking. The sharp tang wasn't to our liking.

All in all a wonderful dining experience. We'll be back for more!

Great place with great food.

The staff were amazing as I celebrated my wife’s birthday. The steak was beautifully done and all the food recommendations were good.

Kudos to the people for making this place awesome.

Edit -

Forgot to mention that we also ordered the hand cut beef empanadas. Sad to say my nenek can make better epok epok.

Ordered the “Robbins Island” Wagyu Bone In Striploin (MS7) along with the creamy Mac-cheese pangrattato, broccolini pomegranate (without bacon bits) and Chips Provencal.

The wagyu striploin was cooked well but lacked the juiciness that wagyu steaks typically have. The steak was also under seasoned but was accompanied by smoked Maldon sea salt and roasted peppers.

Chips was fried well and had a nice crisp bite to it and was salted just right.

Broccolini was grilled perfectly and had a nice charred smoky taste to it but was overly salted. Portion was a tad too stingy in my opinion for the price. Served on a medium sized plate it looked like a few broccolini might’ve escaped during plating.

Surprisingly the creamy M&C was the best of the lot! Very creamy with gooey cheese and a nice layer of bread crumbs on top to give it a welcoming different mouth feel and texture.

Over all I think Bochinche is worth a visit due to its lovely homey interior but do be prepared to spend a few dollars here. 3.6/5.
Brazilian food near my location.name: Bochinche

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
The overnight oats can be kept for up to 3 days and still tasted yummy. I tried the chocolate flavoured ones. Very generous with the toppings. The seller was very friendly too. Must try!

Really delicious acai bowl! Great way to cool down from the heat. Great service really enjoyed.

Always get either acai bliss or mango lovers when we’re around sultan mosque. Generous portion and consistent taste.

Great acai, very generous toppings. Good service, highly recommended if you’re in the area!

A quaint store conveniently located along Arab Street that serves healthy fruit bowls. Thrilled to finally have one in the area!! The store offers a selection, and you get to pick your preferred fruit toppings. I got myself the regular sized Acai Bliss. It's not sweet and provides a decent portion of chia pudding and Acai. The homemade granola is balanced well- not too nutty. It also gets topped off with cacao nibs at no additional price.

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
This is my 1st time trying thanks to the Samsung rewards points redeem voucher.

Is really very healthy, full of nuts combinations, fruits mix and good amount of yogurt even when we exchanged the smallest cup. Is alot!!!!

We got the originals. Is super worth it. For a person who does not like nuts and all the healthy ingredient like the wolf berries.

Is surprising good ! I'll rate it 10/10(:

I have been coming here for over 3 years now and probs one of their biggest customers!! I used to have one acai every day!! Their acai is made fresh and a wide range of items to choose from, the staff are always kind and friendly and the acai is always yummy although I prefer their old gronola compared to their new cashew cacao one!! Can't wait to come back for my next acai treat!

They're located on the lowest floor of Ngee Ann City basement, closer towards Wisma walkway, away from the main food hall. It's not exactly the easiest to find their shop front, but if you are aware of where Mos Burger is, then you should be able to find them.

Overall a good bowl of acai bowl, with a lot of tender loving care placed on each bowl being served. I definitely did see the love as the servers were trying to ensure the look and feel of the fruits were really well positioned, cutting away excess and making sure every bowl was as close to the standard as possible.

Usually love coming here, great acai and quick service. But the staff on duty on Sunday afternoon is terrible, so unfriendly almost hostile. Really ruins the normal great vibes.

This is my first time trying project Acai and I must say it's really better than other brands that I have tried. More than 10 fresh ingredients on top of my acai and I really appreciate that. As there has no table provided, you can prepare a tissue or handkerchief to hold because the bowl is very cold.

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
Abit hidden place but love the acai bowl. Nit really bowl but they put in cup. Easier to eat while walking.
They have multiple sizes and can customize.

Staff are friendly too

First time having unlimited toppings at an acai place. It is really value for money if you like to try the different fruits and crunches. The acai was also not overly sweet and is quite refreshing as a snack or a small meal. Would recommend checking this place out if you are in the area!

The acai is not too sweet and of great consistency too, not too hard and not too watery. They have great variety of toppings which you can choose as much as you want but the more toppings you have, the lesser the acai is. So far my fav acai in town! The large serving is substantial enough for a meal. The staff are attentive.
We used burrple 1for1 and it was really worth it!

It was the second time I tried their acai, and it was worth to have it again! They have lots of toppings available, and from the medium size, u can put any toppings u want. Every topping and acai itself tasted very fresh. Perfect for a snack when walking around Theaters on the bay.

Delicious Acai served here. The staff are always friendly, and the portion is big! From medium cup onwards, you can have unlimited toppings. Love the customizing options available that we can choose our own toppings and not have only  premade bowls.

Beautiful location. Ate it by the river. What a view and especially beautiful with the sunset. 💖 Highly recommend. The prices are worth it! ( Medium cup onwards maybe😅)

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
A quirky little restaurant in an out of the way location, this place is worth looking up. 100% gluten free plus a whole page on allergens to help those with dietaries. The food was sensational, service flawless and they even helped us get back to the hotel using their own Uber app when we couldn’t get a taxi. This is a must visit in Singapore. I would recommend booking ahead. Thank you!

It was a lovely place to hang out. Just perhaps a little too warm with the outdoor seatings.

Food was great, the lamb was good. Love the sago cheese thingy. I didn’t get to see the menu cos the ordering was done by my friends.

Service was remarkably nice. They are all pretty friendly and very service oriented.

The kombucha was a great addition to our lunch.

10/10 ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Gluten free menu but it doesn't feel like you're missing anything. The food is delicious. We ordered the dadinhos, pão de quiejo (so good, we ordered another to go!), the ceviche, the root salad, the wagyu steak and the vegan moqueca stew. Their wine selection is extensive and they also have a great inhouse kombucha brew. If you've never had Brazilian food, this is a great introduction to it.

The fusion Brazilian food was amazing, every dish have taste on its own. Lovely night are made with lovely people, food, drinks, service and ambience. Even the crowd cooperates to create the memories. Love it here!

We ordered the Chargrilled Octopus (5stars) its very soft, beautifully grilled and deliciously paired accompaniments. Corn with cob (5STARS) is nicely grilled, the spices used is a nice pair to it. We also ordered the house made kombucha(5 stars). Came in a jar so it can be shared by 2. The wagyu steak and cassava fries are okay (3-4stars) probably cos they arent our taste.
Brazilian food near my location.name: The Butcher's Wife

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
Visitsd on 25/11/23 around 340PM.
My family member collected my order on my behalf and was GIVEN the wrong order. Since my family wasn't the one who ordered and I asked for no receipt, my family wasn't aware of the exact order.

5 solid minutes later, a female Malay staff in Hijab came over to the table, snatched the existing order away, and confronted my family member why we TOOK the wrong order that wasn't meant for us. On hearing my family's reply that we've already consumed the item, the Malay girl said "I CAN THROW IT AWAY", and proceeded to throw (literally throw) the order away by flinging it in the bin, and slammed the door shut. The same staff subsequently slammed the right order down on the table.

I wanted to ask for her name after I found out the events but was stopped by my family. Very bad attitude. If you cannot cope with increased volume of orders, don't work.  I decided to leave this review as customers next table also witnessed this event and told us we should give feedback, otherwise the staff and team will not learn. Horrendous attitude.

Inconsistent in quality. I buy acai on a regular basis at least 2-3 times a week and before it used to be more acai with some granola and toppings, but now it is more granola with some acai. It doesn't make any sense to pay that much for granola. I went back and complained to the staff showing them the thin acai layers and thick granola layers, but they said they cannot do anything and they only apologised. Too bad but the acai from this outlet is already off my list.

ordered takeaway. buzzer did not ring and i waited 10 mins before being informed that the order on the counter is mine and it had been there all along. the cup was uncapped and my acai was exposed to fruit flies. told the counter girl i ordered takeaway and she just put a cap over it. did not request for the acai to remade as i did not want to make things ugly, but this is very poor customer service.

I always love acai but i kinda realised the (young) staffs at punngol and upper thomson are not so service oriented.. No smile no initiative.. Don't expect more from them.. More like a pick up point.... Just take and go (off please)....... =x

My mutiple times visiting acai affair ..always wanted to give them a chance but always disappoint me bcos their acai is always melted ! I can understand melted acai is easy for your staff to handle but we as customers do not like melted acai and will not patronise again at this store . Very disappointed

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
First time trying out their $9.80 salad bowl.

It taste good, however, the portion was small.

The ice cream and waffles looks very appetising. Looking forward to try it the next time 👍

Nice ice cream with crispy and yummy waffle. Fresh salad bowl. And most important, friendly staff :)

Are you an Ice Cream ,Waffle and Salad lover?

Do visit @Overscoop West Coast Plaza. I did it. It was a lovely experience.

Their waffles is a must-try!!

Crispy outer texture and soft fluffy interior, so nicely done!!

I paired it with raspberry icecream and a cutie little scoop of mango.

Their ice cream is so good!!

Flavorful, well balanced and not too sweet.

Nice ambience and cheerful interior, friendly staffs too.

I love salads and I  like the concept that it comes with a salad bar.

Price wise, it's really affordable.

Will definitely be back to try more salad bowls.

Shout out to Joey for hosting and accommodating to all of us!!!

She is very friendly! Thank you @Overscoop!  I love healthy food, I will be back here for sure ✨

It’s our first time here. The waffle was basically air. Ice cream was good though. Service was not so great as we didn’t feel welcomed at all. The person who was serving us didn’t seem like she wanted to help us at all. A little smile would be great :). Anyways, paying $17.8 for a waffle and 1 drink is not so worth it cause you can get it at a cheaper price somewhere else

Waffles is a must-try! Crispy outer texture and soft interior, so nicely done! I pair it with Belgium chocolate and a cutie little scoop of salted caramel. Regret not getting a double scoop, their ice cream is so good!  Flavorful, well balanced and not too sweet.  Nice ambience and cheerful interior, friendly staffs too. I like the new concept it comes with a salad bar. Price wise, it's really affordable. Will definitely be back to try a salad bowl.

Brazilian food near my location.reviews:
I tried this shop becoz there is a Promotion $15 for 2 medium Acai bowl.

I love that their Acai is not sweet at all, because they don’t put extra sugar into it.

Very tasty Acai bowl and I will visit again.

love it!! always come here every thursday for their 1 for 1 offer!! acai is not too sweet as compared to other stalls, which is a plus point!!👍🏻👍🏻staffs r rlly friendly and nice too🫶🏻

got it at a promo (2 for $15) so seems reasonably priced. presentation is good!

would be good if there’s a place to sit.

tastes fantastic! will purchase again. healthy too!

The store was a having a good deal of two medium acai bowls, 2 for $15 and it was worth it. The bowl wasn’t small or too big. Love the service too!!

Been a Randy’s gal (over project açai, anyday!) and love the açai but the prices keep increasing :-(

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
We came here for our wedding anniversary and were absolutely impressed! Husband is Spanish so there were high expectations. Absolutely liked every dish, however the squid ink paella and croquetas were a hit for us. Service went above and beyond, would absolutely come back again :)

We were greeted by friendly staff when entering.
Ordered some paella 🥘 . Delicious.
Food was amazing not pricey for restaurant. Spanish delights well served.
Desert was cheesecake with whiskey ice cream.
The staff recommended food which were incredible.
Overall experience 100/10

I like the Beetroot with smoked olive oil sorbet. Stunning dishes. Paella is super nice as well. Good experiences. Very happening places. Price meet the service and dishes.

I think this should be the best place to have Spanish food in Singapore - very delectable and original dishes. Loved the beetroot and strawberry salad in olive oil ice cream. Paella was also very flavourful. No regrets for a Tuesday weeknight dinner.

Lively atmosphere.   It’s a bit noisy so if one will need to speak louder to your companions.  Been here for a few times and experienced seated on a table and counter.   I personally prefer the counter just because I can see what’s happening at the kitchen and it was fun to watch.   Food were all yummy and their Sangria was one of the best we have tasted in Singapore.

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
An establishment that has weathered the test of time, consistent and runs like a well oiled machine. A compact but well covered menu with daily specials. High quality food and tasty. Have to put a credit card deposit when booking online though. Wine options are quite pricey, even the entry level ones.

Had dinner with the lads yesterday and it was a great time. We ordered each of the mains to be shared amongst us, tapas style. We also sampled some of the appetizers. All I can say is that we were blown away by each dish that came out. Whilst small, each dish was bursting with flavour!

We also took each of all the desserts and it was the perfect way to wrap up the evening.

birthday + thanksgiving meal at Esquina. Honestly one of our best meals this year with each dish bringing out the beauty of the fresh ingredients.

Special mention to the clams with cream sauce and uni foam 🥰🥰🥰

Maître d Sugan was exceptional and really elevated the experience for us! Will be back

My second time at Esquina, the last time was prob 2 years back. They are one of the few restaurants that still maintained the quality and consistency of the food. Still as good as I remembered and definitely one of the best Spanish restaurants in Singapore! All the dishes were amazing, couldn’t find a fault.
Price is always steep at these restaurants ($167 for 2 pax), but definitely left the restaurant with my belly very full!

Visited in Oct 2023

Finally visited Esquina during the Singapore Restaurant week for the 8-course menu for $98++. Really well crafted menu which covered a wide variety of items across starters and mains. The octopus and pork main dishes were fantastic.

Service was decent.

A definite recommendation and I myself hope to be back again soon.

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
4 of us, we ordered 5 items to share, including a full rack of ribs, and the price came up to be $222 (excluding drinks). The food are generally good, and I particularly like the prawns paella and prawns. However, we find the ribs is quite salty, although it is tasty.

Encourage you to make reservation as they are very crowded even on weekdays!

Great food and a nice place to chill. The pizza shop opposite is under the same management and they allowed my kid to have a single slice instead of the whole pizza. The pizza was very authentic (dough was crispy outside and soft inside). The pork ribs was so tender and juicy. The paella and Spanish omelette were very good as well.

A good spot for Spanish food in Singapore. Price ~ 70-80$/pax. Almost all dishes we've tried taste great. Good portion as well. Nice ambiance & the staffs r attentive, just that stimes it's too crowded you might have to wait

Went on a rainy afternoon and it was rather cold inside the restaurant.

Food was great and of large portions. Honestly not sure what was ordered because a friend ordered but everything was really yummy!!

I love the omelette, have to eat it fast while it is hot. Grilled potatoes are also great for sharing.

The crust of the pizza is different from those that you can usually find at the normal fast food chain.

The sea salt ice cream is amazing too 😋

Chose this place for Spanish food as requested by the birthday star. Resturant was fully packed on a weekday night.

Every dish was nice though some items were slightly salty. Crowd’s favourite was the pork belly that we ordered a second serving. Their seafood like cod fish and squid were really fresh too! Perfect pairing with the white wine recommended by the server.

Total bill came up to $500++ for 6 pax.

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Food was so good, full of flavour and depth. Meat was tender. Portion of 5 Tapas and 1 Paella was more than enough for a table of 4.  We had the red Sangria and boy, it had quite a bit of alcohol. We could taste it on the first sip but who’s complaining? 😆

Service was alright since it was full house and they were short of staff. So that’s understandable.

Atmosphere was quite noisy as it was a Friday night but I can imagine it to be the same during weekends. It’s a nice place to be with great company. However do be prepared to pay more than a casual dinner place. We spent approx. $90 pp.

Would visit again soon!

Food is super good! 5 tapas is enough for two. Ordering another paella was an overkill, luckily the staff said we should just order half a portion. My favourite Spanish in SG!

This is my second visit back at Binomio, this restaurant served good Spanish food. We enjoyed the appetisers and paella today. However, the suckling pig today didn’t not taste good, while the skin was crispy but the meat tasted stinky. ☹️

We were greeted by friendly staffs on arrival. The staff patiently explained each type of tapas he recommended to try. We let him decides and all turn out great and we really enjoy them. We loved the pulpo afeira, the ink paella, costilla de ternera and the nido de huevos rotos. First time tried the nido de huevos dish, the chorizos was generous. The dinner went well without fuss. Will return to tried other tapas, like lengua.

Incredible experience and food, not a single miss. From the tapas to the paellas, to the desserts, to the sangria. Everything five stars. Service is on point, fast, and attentive. Great vibes as well both in private dining room and in main dining areas.
Can't recommend enough.
Spanish restaurants in Singapore.name: Binomio

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Was here for my friend's birthday. Nice Latin music and friendly staff. The food was a thumbs-up, especially the Squid Ink Paella is my fav. The cocktail is a must-to-order. I highly recommend this restaurant for any occasion.

First time to try.  Nice ambience. One weekday lunch time, and it wasn't crowded. Minimal people dining in, but the service was still slow due to maybe short of manpower. Service lacks assertion.

Moderate selection of tapas. We ordered the set lunch and 1 classic tapas. Set lunch was priced as 19 ++ because you wouldn't get any set that would cost 19$. The minimum is 21 coz, as you can see on the menu, one main is 2$ additional cost the least.

Food wise. All tasted nice. More of the salty side. Paella squid ink was good, salty. But the portion was so little.  Ham croquettes was good also. Iberico pork was good, salty also. The mashed potato was good. Everything we ordered was good for one person. A little pricey.

Free water. And pickled olives.

Overall, it's good to try.

Dinner having Mexican food and drinks and we tried the Tapas Club at Orchard central....it was good and just right. We ordered tapas green peppers, potato brava, squid fritters, pulled pork tacos and of course paella. The tapas are good and tasty. Paella are crisp but I would say I would ask them to make our paella more crispier at the bottom, chicken and other seafood are quite few, lucky the way they cook the rice is good so I forgot to count the meats and seafood. Dessert are the ones we really love and would come back for more, banana fritters and churros with chocolate dip.these you should try when you pass by and dine at Tapas Club. Drinks are OK,lots of wine varieties you could choose from.

I want to share one good experience I have with a staff name Jenny at Orchard Central Outlet. Super accommodating and made us feel comfortable. Her service deserve to be recognised and praise. I think overall the staff did a great job to made us feel welcome. I would definitely come back again in the future :D.

Awesome ambience, food and service. We were greeted by warm smile and excellent service throughout our dinning. Excellent recommendation by Chef Steven and the dishes he prepared was simply drooling! All the MUST order food bites for chillax are as posted.

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Spanish tapas at its best! They have a really good variety of tapas that you can enjoy in a small group setting. Each tapas were unique with its own set of flavour and texture, teasing the palate, readying it for the main course. Squid ink paella has that sweetness from the squid ink and further enhanced by the fresh lemon. The octopus was cooked perfectly with balsamic vinaigrette and was not chewy at all. For dessert, the churros with chocolate sauce was a good way of ending the meal. Highly recommended place to visit.

We had the lunch sets here and we enjoyed all the dishes that we picked. The Spanish Appetizers and Smoked Salmon Salad are good, the Braised Beef Cheeks are so tender and juicy, the Grilled Halibut is delicious, and the desserts are refreshing. Service is good, except that there should have been a queuing system at the door before it opens for service. Everyone rushed to the host when the door was open at 12. It’s rather messy.

We came on a Sunday around 1.30pm and had the set lunch. Portions were generous especially for the starters - we had the smoked salmon salad and scrambled eggs, which were tasty and well-balanced, the highlight of the meal. The grilled halibut and lamb rump mains were good. The lamb rump was well grilled if slightly gamey and accompanied with a delicious Provençal vegetable side. Desserts were a nice note to end on but tiny in comparison to the previous courses. Service staff were quite busy throughout and could be hard to get their attention, but courses were served quickly after ordering. Very worth it with our 1-for-1 deal but on the pricey side otherwise.

Wine and Co Holland village used to be our go to tapas place but since their brilliant chef left we haven’t been able to find a good tapas. Then we found this place and it will be our go to. Like most tapas places in Sg it’s expensive but the quality of the food is excellent and our favourite dishes  were cooked to perfection and tasted just as they should be.

The staff were very polite and service was quick. It’s a little dark away from the windows and a little noisy near the windows but if you’re going for a quick lunch that doesn’t matter. It’s a little difficult to find.

We came here for dinner and the ambience was lovely. Overall the food was delicious and it exceeded my expectations, especially the dishes we ordered from the warm tapas section. However, service wasn't that great. I had ordered a mocktail but was charged and delivered a cocktail. We also wasn't informed that the wagyu steak was minimum 300g, which left a bitter taste that night. Although it was stated in the menu, it was still misleading to include $28/100g. If it was stated better ($84, additional $28 for 100g onwards) We would have just ordered a dish more value for money such as a lobster. Aside from that, everything was well executed and we would definitely come again another time.
Spanish restaurants in Singapore.name: La Tapería

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
We enjoyed the seafood paella, chili crab croquettes and salmon avocado. The grilled calamari was slightly uncooked and the roasted eggplants was quite bitter. I am most impressed with their service. They provided a bag hook when they see me struggling with my bag on my lap, topped up my warm water promptly and even waived off the eggplants when they got our feedback.

Very good lunch set offers

Good is good and atmosphere is casual. Fast service and a good spot for business lunch. I was there for lunch but would also expect a great atmosphere during dinner time, considering how lively the area is

Love the paella!!

Probably one of the best Spanish restaurants- price and quality were definitely a match for me.

Octopus Galican style was a definite favourite at the table- sliced just the right sized and cooked to the right texture. The potato purée was beautifully done as well.

Squid ink fiduea- please do yourself a favour and order this. I usually get either undercooked or overcooked fiduea in SG and this was done with the right amount of crisp.

Pedron peppers- I know it’s a simple dish but to be honest, one of the best I’ve tried.

The cheesecake and roasted pineapple with coconut dessert was a great cap. Coffee was good with it too.

Will definitely come back again:)

It was our first time trying Spanish food. We ordered the Roasted Cauliflower, Pork Belly and Octopus for starters. And the Pork Ribs and Seafood Paella for mains. Love every dish! The Casa Sangria was a refreshing compliment, too. Will definitely patronise again 👍👍

Excellent set lunch and ambience! Compliments to the Chefs! My personal favourite is the prawn, the iberico pork, pork & sausage paella! Their signature cheesecake is to die for! Staffs are friendly! Place is clean and well decorated. They should have a cctv in private room so we can wave to get attention though. Coffee could have more punch too! But overall great meal! Will be back!
Spanish restaurants in Singapore.name: Kulto

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Pleasantly welcomed by managers Jerriek and Rey and chef Edward with their warm smiles and sincere service, we felt comfortable and had a lovely dinner.

The food was delicious - the prawn tapas (gambas) was our top pick, along with the grilled octopus leg. Actually the joy of having tapas is that we can all try different dishes and share with friends and family- a very fun experience.

The decor and environment was cosy, with real bricks and European art collections like plates and mirrors from various sources, tastefully displayed to transport guests to another place..

Would come again for a romantic dinner or family gathering, or just a chill evening with friends over yummy Spanish food

A few years ago, I ate the paella with dishes made by Chef Edward. I visited today and ordered the paella that my son wanted to eat, but as shown in the photo, the bottom of the paella was too black and the texture of the rice was the result of cooking by a beginner, and the seafood all had a very fishy taste. There was no saffron scent, it was very salty and how much MSG was used... Even though I couldn't eat it all and left it behind, my tongue felt numb and it tasted like I was going to have a headache. There were only three tables including us, but the customers who arrived later than us were not served first, and when I asked to confirm our order, the waiter cut me off and replied that he would be back soon, which was also unpleasant. I visited again with delicious memories, but today I had such a terrible experience that I will never return. I hope you find your original intention and pay attention to the freshness of the ingredients. (For reference, the mussels I ate at My Little Spanish Place in Boat Quay, which I visited a month ago, were very fresh and delicious.)

June 2023

First visit & the food quality was quite mundane really.The only bit that I enjoyed in the Paella were the prawns which were fresh and of decent size. Other dishes were middle of the road kind , not bad but certainly won’t make you crave for more.
Comfortable ambience & helpful staff. A bit overpriced to be honest.

Nice food with a good ambiance. We love their seafood dishes. Even a vegetable-based has a special sauce to eat with it. We return here a few times for different occasions.

Super nice staff, but at this price point I'd expect more from the food. We ordered plenty and so could sample different things and there were some winners (the pan con tomate was fantastic), but there were too many that were disappointing. The gambas al ajillo, while sizable, had no heat in either sense of the word. The garlic bread was far too oily and some other dishes were over salted.
Finally, and without wanting to sound like a lush, the glass of house red was ok but the volume provided was equivalent to what a sommelier would pour to let someone taste the wine.

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Went on a weekday night to celebrate anniversary as wife wanted tapas. We ordered crispy fried squid, mushroom croquettes, potatoes with bravas sauce & aioli, Argentian beef steak, garlic prawns, grilled chorizo & potato puree, Spanish omelette, and prosecco. Food was mostly so-so and the potatoes with bravas sauce was the least nice. Maybe the steak and grilled chorizo in potato puree were the best we ordered. The frozen sangria looks good but we didn't order. Staff was attentive and response fast. Outdoor has a nice view of Sentosa.

Sublime tapas with swift service. The Padras peppers, chorizo with potato purée, garlic prawns with toast, fish tacos, and churros with chocolate sauce transported me back to an enjoyable holiday in Barcelona. These were fine Spanish grub and I look forward to trying more dishes such as the paella.

With a good selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages, there’s also a nice grocery shop positioned near the entrance for you to take a taste of Spain home.

Overall the food taste good but the quantity in both our Paella is little (compare to the previous time I ate at Orchard outlet). Mushroom croquet are so good we ordered second serving. The cold cuts, salads and tapas (prawns, chicken wings, squid, potatoes with bravas sauce, eggplant) are good. Seabass can skip, not very tasty.

Well… walking out of the restaurant feeling regretful on my choice vs the money spent…

Potato with bravas sauce was terrible. That’s the saddest choice I have made. Always a potato lover and for any potato to taste bad for me, it’s really not a good thing. 1/10

Fried squid was just ok n nothing better than ok.
My son said “yuck” which was very shocking to me cos he loves his calamari. 5/10

Spanish omelette was quite good and the portion was huge. 7/10

Seafood and chicken Paella was the best out of all the choice and it was delicious.
Definitely a 8/10

Churros was equally disappointing. Very tough and hard and the oil used must be stale or used for many times. The churros smell very seafood-ish if u know what I mean.

Paying the amount for the quality. I am definitely not very happy walking out.

Great food! Came here for a company dinner and ordered many small plates. My favourites were the ibérico pork as well as the jalapeños, which was a very interesting dish! The mushroom croquettes was also really nice, and kind of tasted like solidified mushroom soup. All in all, I enjoyed every single dish. I do prefer the squid ink paella over the Valencia paella though, as it was richer in taste.

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
This cozy restaurant has left the best impressions! Lynn is very friendly & she recommended us delicious dishes. The presentation of food is beautiful & there’s a wonderful selection of desserts to end with! I would wlike to come back here again and again.

Came here for a birthday celebration and we were served by the pleasant and friendly Kai, who gave us excellent recommendations and advised us on the portions. Service was great and our food came super fast to the point that we got full a bit early. Kai noticed this and helped slow down the subsequent dishes. We had the octopus and truffle egg mash for starters. The dishes were all superb and up to standard but the portions were pretty big too so be warned not to overorder. The highlight for us was the seafood paella and the iberico pork, each spoonful of the paella was bursting with flavour and fresh seafood, we felt like we were one with the ocean itself. Our table for two was also very spacious. They served a light Basque baked cheesecake on the house for our birthday celebration. Will definitely be back again!

This restaurant really has it all! The service, the food and atmosphere. We were also served by an amazing waiter, Kai. One of the best genuine services! His recommendations for food and drinks were top notch =) He even insisted to take away the leftovers. And he was right, still so good the next day! Don’t miss taking photos outside the mansion. It’s too pretty to miss!

We celebrated my wife birthday at Una on a Friday. Only set lunch option available unless we pre ordered tapas. Service crew is very friendly here, keep checking our water is filled. The food is delicious! The server also surprised my wife with a slice of cake for her birthday! What a great place to celebrate birthdays.

Overall it was a great dining experience. The staffs are friendly.
The foods are delicious. The Ibérico pork was great however it could’ve been better if it was cooked medium rare. As in the picture the right side was alright while the left side was kinda dry, about medium well to well done.

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
A little understaffed at lunch but the sole lady service staff was still friendly and attentive!
Appetisers were excellent! Wish the paella was a little less wet, but the prawns were good.
Casual place for a nice catch up with friends!

Bit overpriced. Their serving sizes are teeny for the price of what they charge. Even their 4x Tapas for $78 is not worth it as some Tapas sizes are so small they are smaller than a typical entrée. And the Paella which supposedly feeds 2-4pax is more like 2 pax because it is a super stingy  thin layer of rice.

The cheese terrine is only two small slices of cheese for $20 and some bits of bread. The prawns had 5x prawns with barely any hummus under it for $30  (so misleading compared to their Instagram pics).

Four people dining, ordered 4x Tapas and one small paella, 2x desserts this cost $55 each excluding drinks. Maybe it's just inflation but I think they could have been more generous on the cheaper carb items like rice and bread.

That said the food was overall delicious, while non of them was a stellar standout, most were very well executed in terms of flavour. Service could have been much more attentive though, had to keep waving the waiter over for water even though the place wasn't even full.

The Spanish food here was pretty good! Despite being relatively new, they were quite busy when we visited.

Barrio 'Bikini' Sandwich (S$20) - this uses beef instead of ham. There was tons of delicious roasted beef slices in this, the bread was flattened and also very crisp as it was toasted for quite long. However, we found the sandwich to be slightly dry - the bread could have done with more butter. This was a bit less cheesy, and the truffle flavour was not too evident in this.

Jamón Ibérico Croquettes (S$14) - this was crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside, with chunks of ham inside and mayo on the top and base of the croquette. Quite yummy!

Grilled Green Asparagus (S$18) - the asparagus was done just nice (and came with lots of pepper), the sabayon sauce was creamy and delicious, the Ibérico chorizo added some good savouriness and the hazelnuts complemented the sauce and chorizo well. We enjoyed this!

Half Roasted Chicken (800g, S$45) - the chicken meat was tender and not too dry, and the marinade sauce went well with the chicken as well. Came with Panadera potatoes (pretty delicious as well) and salad.

Barrio's Special 'Ceviche' (S$20) - this was okay, the seabass was fresh and marinated with an interesting thin sauce. Came with tortillas to enjoy with the ceviche.

Pork Sausage & Mushroom Paella (S$42) - this was missing the crisp base/wok hei flavour - they made the paella softer as some customers didn’t like the burnt base. Other than that, the paella was flavourful with the broth and it was filling. They were generous with the chorizo and mushrooms as well, although the chorizo was a bit salty.

Churros (S$14, 4 pieces) - a very typical Spanish dessert, quite crispy outside and coated with cinnamon sugar. Came with chocolate sauce which went well with the churros.

Red Wine Sangria (S$15) - this was fruity, slightly sweet and light enough.

For more food reviews, check out my IG @foodlesstravelled!

Food was good! Ingredients were fresh and full of natural flavour.

Tomato appetizer was great and tomatoes were nice and sweet.

Aspragus was grilled really well and had nice juiciness and sweetness. Loved the sauce.

Fish was really fresh and you could taste the olive oil that was used.

Chicken was a tad dry to my taste but flavour was great and loved the potatoes.

A hidden gem for Spanish tapas and paella. The ambience was fantastic and the service was impeccable here. Shoutout to Kumar, our head waitstaff, who demonstrated what world-class hospitality feels like - from the moment we stepped through the door, he and his team made us feel right at home. They were extremely attentive to our needs and always responsive to our requests!

And where do I even start with the food - every dish served exceeded our expectations! The dishes that we tried that really stood out were the Whole Seabass and Pork Sausage & Mushroom Paella. Everything else we ordered was still amazing.

Would rate a 6/5 if I could. Thank you to the amazing staff at Barrio - will definitely be back soon!

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
If you want to dine along Haji Lane, this is a great place. It's outdoor seating and right at the very end. I'm personally not a fan of being in a busy place so took a star off for atmosphere but I acknowledge some people like that vibe. The service was great and everything we ordered was delicious. Prices are all very reasonable as well! They gladly gave us a birthday candle when we asked too.

Was at Comer Friday night of the F1 weekend. Good food and great vibe. There was a block party that evening with fantastic music and dancing. Everyone was in a festive mood. Would come again for sure. I hope they have block parties every weekend!

Chill outdoor vibe. Suitable for those who prefer outdoor seating. All the tables are high tables. The food is decent. Love the gambas and grilled octopus. There is happy hour before 8pm, sangria at 10$.

It’s hard to find delicious yet reasonably priced Spanish food in Singapore. Most of the menu options are below $20. Drinks was also good with happy hour till 8pm daily. We will definitely return! Just a note that this is a casual eatery with no AC, but it’s nice to sit outdoors in cool weather and enjoy the Arab Street vibe.

Attentive and friendly service, good food, reasonably priced - couldn’t ask for more! Highly recommend the seafood paella and mussels.

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Decent Spanish place at Boat Quay. More or less always packed. Made reservations and was given the outdoor seating close to the waters. Crab croquette was heavenly albeit a bit small portioned. Patatas bravas was great too with a super addictive sauce! Would have given 5 stars if the paella did not fall short. Have tried better elsewhere, the flavours were simply not the best.

Good spot for sipping wine and chilling.
The ham platter was my favourite, each type has a different fat and saltiness level which is very enjoyable with bread. The other tapas were just ok. The steak (not in photo) is a bit underwhelming as well. What pulled the rating back up is the wine and the service - the sommelier really knows his thing.

Update: Bumping up my rating because of a better experience the second time around. The iberico pork had such a good flavour profile. Meanwhile, the bone marrow is so sinful, yet almost worth all that cholesterol. I'd skip the churros, a little too oily, a little too crispy, and not enough chew on the inside.

Fantastic food, so much choice! We got 3 tapas each and struggled to finish them all. Seated by the waterfront with stunning night time views, just fab! Service was great, food came out very fast and the servers were very helpful and friendly - highly recommend!

Good location and quite easy to get to.
As the name of the place suggest this is a Spanish restaurant so is all the food and majority of the wine selection.

The food was good and the wine selection is nice. Paella was huge.

Service was okay and the place does get busy.

If you looking for Spanish cuisine this could be a good choice

We went to Boat Q outlet and it is not spacious place and very packed with customers.
The food we ordered we enjoyed except the squid rice not up to our expectation. And the price for what we ordered for 3 of us at 288++ would say very expensive and unexpected. Could use this money for even better deal food. But it is an experience!

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
A Mixed Experience at Tapas Club: Delectable Cuisine with Premium Pricing.

My visit to Tapas Club offered a culinary journey through their menu of Spanish delicacies. The Seafood and Chicken Paella impressed with its moist rice, each grain infused with the rich essence of the ocean. Equally noteworthy were the Pulled Pork Tacos, featuring meat so tender it melted in the mouth, and the Mediterranean Salad, which was a beacon of freshness.

However, despite the high-quality food, the prices at Tapas Club are on the higher end. The cost is a significant factor to consider, especially when comparable Spanish cuisine might be found elsewhere at a more affordable rate.

Given the sparse customer turnout during a weekday lunch, it does raise the question of whether Tapas Club might review their pricing strategy to enhance their appeal, especially if they wish to draw a larger crowd during typically slower business hours.

We had an impromptu dinner at Jewel on this weekday after landing from BKK. The ambience and decoration is beautiful. The drinks are reasonable priced and the food is delicious. The salad is fresh and the pork is really soft and tender. The friendly staff made us feel really comfortable and we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. Thank you for hosting us Tapas Club, we will be back soon.

This Spanish restaurant is worth the advance booking, as it tends to be busy, especially during dinner hours. With a week's reservation, you secure a spot for your party of eight. The highlight here is the must-try paella, bursting with authentic flavors. The menu offers a range of delectable Spanish dishes. The ambience and service add to the overall dining experience. For a delightful Spanish culinary journey, make sure to reserve ahead and savor the unforgettable paella at this bustling restaurant.

Was seated immediately at 630pm on a Saturday. Had the seafood&chicken paella, steak and spanish omelette. Surprisingly their paella tasted good for us! The best dish out of the 3 we had. Omelette was not as flavourful as I rmbr it to be.. Steak was the worst - ordered medium but texture was well done.

I would suggest to stick to their tapas and paella.

Most of the food wasn’t really good. The arepa was terrible, extremely dense and lacked ingredients in between. I wanted churros for dessert but they said that they ran out of them. They offered me a lemon tart instead, and even the vanilla ice cream that came with it was out of stock. So they offered raspberry ice cream instead which is not to my liking but accepted it.

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Had dinner at Gaig on Friday night. When we entered the restaurant,  I initially felt it had a little stiff atmosphere but those worries wore off as the evening went on.
The service staff had excellent knowledge on the menu and recommended good dishes for us to try.
They were very friendly and even shared occasional banter with us whilst changing our plates or serving our food.  Special shout out to the male wait staff who wore specs, sorry we didn't get your name but you really changed the vibe of the night for us. 😊😊👍👍

Chef Marti, the Head Chef went around the tables checking in on the guests. We enjoyed chatting with him as well.

We had the anchovy on toast, jamon iberico, padròn peppers, mushroom croquettes, bomba de la Barceloneta, the Gaig's cannelloni, Galican octopus and pork belly (not pictured because I forgot! Haha!), the suckling pig dish and the Catalan creme bruleè.
Everything was lovely and I enjoyed the food very much!
Personally I prefer the more casual Spanish tapas styled food. But this experience was very enjoyable aswell for a special occasion.

Definitely will come back again to try the other items on the menu! 👍👍

First time here draw in by Google review and michilin guide.
Surprise disapointment on how bad the food is.
1. Jamón Ibérico - very good taste and portion for the price.
2. Pa amb Tomàquet - a little dry for my liking
2. Crispy Suckling pig - tiny portion, taste average.
3. Boston Lobster Fideuà - the noodle is cold with boil lobster
4. Cod fish - too salty tasted like salted fish
5. Our Catalan crème Brûlée - Good
6. Chocolate & Mushroom - the combo doesn't work for me
7. Complimentery Birthday cake - Thanks

No, will not return.

Highly recommended. Tasted better than many restaurants in Spain. Dishes come in small portion hence can try more. The 2 service folks who attended to us were pleasant. I would love to be back.

2023-07-12
A little understaffed and it took short waits to get water refills. Lovely playlist with oldies hits.

Bread $5.4 per pax - Excellent, the highlight of each visit. Freshly toasted and with homemade butter. The butter was too salty this time though.
Jamon croquettes $6 ea - Excellent
Bomba de la Barceloneta $16 - Mediocre
Red prawn ajillo style $24 - Mediocre. Flavors were nice but the prawns were tiny
Squid ink seafood rice $50 - Excellent. Two huge juicy prawns and a scallop. Lovely heterogeneous texture in the rice, fragrant with infused seafood flavors.

2022-04-21 lunch
Staff were very professional and available. Great ambience.
Bread $3.5 per pax - Excellent. Delicious butter. The butter was highly salted and had some inclusions, though I couldn't identify what they were. Olive oil was nice but nothing special. Free flow and served freshly reheated; the outside is crisp and the inside is warm.
Duck foie gras terrine $26.5- Mediocre. The green apple sauce didn't seem to pair well. However, the provided shortbread sticks were great.
Tortilla camarones $5.5 each - A small prawn cracker. Great flavor and visuals.
Canneloni $17.5 - OK, tasted like tuna filling.
Fideua with 3x carabinero prawn $61 - OK. The carabinero head was nice, but the tail flesh was average. Noodles were unique but I didn't enjoy it much.
Baba on fire dessert $17 - Alcohol flavors were too strong, overpowering the subtle flavors of the ice cream and bread, and distracting from the texture. Nevertheless, it's a unique visual and sensory experience

It was my first time at Restaurant Gaig, and I would say the food here is simply amazing!

Restaurant Gaig’s menu showcases Catalan dishes with traditional recipes dating back to the 19th century through Chef Marti’s innovative interpretations. They also have a really good selection of wines that you can consider going with the meal.

Highlight from the new Chef’s Menu ($180++ per diner) focus on the no wastage nose-to-tail Gastronomy – Lamb

Location: Restaurant Gaig,  16 Stanley Street Singapore 068735

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Such a nice and relaxing place where can gather with my friends in CBD area after work. Food taste good and creative which really surprised us and food plating also nice. Service staff was friendly and helpful, we will be here again!

Had a nice evening here. Spanish food is fantastic and delicious. I like Ham and seafood rice especially. Churros is also great. Staff is very friendly. The in-house draft beer is awesome too. It's a great place to relax and enjoy.

Super love the atmosphere here & their Burnt Cheesecake, coffee and drinks is not bad too 🫶 Cochinillo & paella 🥘 can be better.

Delicious Spanish food, warm service, and a garden-like environment in the CBD where you can enjoy delicious food quietly.

Wonderful Spanish foods and basque cheese cake.Service staff also very nice with good looking place.

Ochi Spanish Restaurant & Tapas Bar

Spanish restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Food quality was top notch and every dish was amazingly yummy and delicious! Definitely one of the top Spanish restaurants in Singapore!

Only 3 areas of improvement:
- to have more cocktail options, they had way too many wine options.
- it was relatively noisy at the courtyard, might be the infrastructure or design of the restaurant where the noise keeps bouncing back.
- should have cleared the plates on the table before serving the new dish, and not get customers to help hold the plates while they are serving.

It's a 4.5 stars for me personally.

My 7 y/o daughter and I enjoyed our dinner with TINTO. The service was impeccable - our server was attentive and patient with us, explaining the dishes as they were served.

The Gambas (prawn) starter was excellent and our favorite! The Grilled Asparagus was great, and we appreciated that it wasn't too salty. The Grilled Squid and Chorizo Paella didn't disappoint, albeit the serving was smaller than I expected.

All in all, a lovely experience and a small notch above Tapas Club.

Really liked this place: Elegant, but still relaxed atmosphere, attentive service. The person who seems to be the restaurant manager is indeed checking that everything is taken care of. I also appreciate that, at the beginning, they ask what type of water you like, including warm and ice water. This is a lovely attention to detail.
They have a full vegetarian menu with creative and interesting dishes - I want to come back to try more of these. Also very good Spanish wine options.
This would be a definite 5 stars if not for the below:
1) At our table, we had one starter and two mains. One of the mains was paella, which takes time to prepare (it's called out in the menu). They brought the other main so early, that one person at the table was pretty much done with the food when the paella arrived.
2) the vegetarian dish of the grilled gem lettuce was really nice, especially the chimichurri. Great use of herbs and flavours. Unfortunately, it was quite oily, which made it very heavy. A less oily preparation would have been great.

PS: The restaurant was full when we were there. For privacy reasons, I edited the other diners - but it certainly wasn't empty.

Party of 4...we came here for a birthday celebration. First impressions upon entering the restaurant exuded positive vibes - ambience, decor, welcoming crew. We were led to the inner section which was very cosy and inviting... I knew a great night was in store. Great menu and price points. We were attended to by the inimitable Ara who made the evening very enjoyable. The recommendations were on point. Food was fabulous. Overall a lovely lovely place for authentic Spanish fare. Highly recommended. Well done guys!!

Tapas were very unique and tasty. I believe we had the grilled octopus and some anchovy + burrata cracker. Paella was nothing exceptional. Desserts (rice pudding and orange cake) were alright. If I were to go again, I would order just the tapas.
Spanish restaurants in Singapore.name: TINTO Spanish Restaurant Sg

African cuisine in Singapore.reviews:
This was an amazing find.  We meant to go to the restaurant next door but they were closed. We came in here on a whim. The food is amazing. My friend had the goat curry. I had the fish curry. Both were spicy but flavorful. The plantain chips are hot and crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. The coffee was amazing, presentation and taste.

We had a wonderful dining experience at this restaurant. The standout feature was their incredibly welcoming, friendly, and attentive service. The staff patiently recommended dishes and even showed photos of them when we needed assistance.

We ordered the peanut chicken stew and goat curry, both of which were absolutely delightful. The flavors were well-balanced with just the right amount of spice and heat, and there was no gamy taste from the goat meat.

The cocktails were also a hit, and the evening was rounded off with delicious desserts. The overall ambiance was cozy and inviting, making it a perfect setting for a memorable evening.

We'll definitely be returning, and I can wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to friends. It's a gem worth visiting again and again.

Went there for dinner and I had cauliflower and buttermilk fried chicken for starters and the portion is pretty generous. Absolutely love both of it. Got the fish curry too and it was amazing tho pretty spicy. However we didn't enjoy the Malindi Halwa dessert so much with it's jelly-like texture. Service is really top notch as they were always attentive.

It’s my first time trying Africa’s cuisine, and I’m pleasantly impressed with the food.

We ordered a variety of curry based dishes, with different level of spiciness - and we enjoyed all of them.

Highly recommended the Goat Curry, where in our opinion is the best one there.

Great ambience and fantastic customer service from the staff. Our waiter spent time to recommend us the dishes. The food is definitely on the pricier side and it felt that it might have been adjusted so much to suit the local palate that the food does not feel uniquely african. When the food tastes very similar to local dishes, it does not really justify the high price.
