Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
Simply put: delicious food, attentive service, nice ambience. Reasonable prices for the quality and yummy flavours.

This will always be our go-to for golden, crisp and tasty Peking duck.

We ordered some fish with veggies and assorted dimsum as well.

We enjoyed everything, and service was excellent! They even seated us with just 15 mins to spare before the lunch time last order cut-off.

🚇 City hall
🧾 $200+ including the Peking duck

IG @sporkandbeanz

Had a farewell dinner in their PDR - it’s a $1200++ minimum spend but with free corkage for wines and spirits which made it an absolutely phenomenal evening. Service is helpful albeit sometimes difficult to grab attention of, and the food is no doubt tasty. Wish they let us control the music in our own room or at least play more atmospheric music (it was basically lullaby music for the most part). Overall worth coming to if you want a good time with friends.

Great atmosphere.
Food are some very good and some are just fine for the price.
Drunken prawn preparation and live boiling were excellent visually and tasted good.
Peking duck skin were very good but the egg flavored wrapper dilute the taste. And additional cost to serve the duck meat with noodles were quite high.
Shark fin was nice despite no big piece of fin and its all small mixed pieces.
The soup in coconut shell were very nice
The big bamboo clam were nice.

Can't gush more about their service. Little things like offering to cut the cake we brought for a birthday celebration, asking if we wanted to pack the leftovers before we even had to ask, random staff actually looking over to smile and say goodbye while we were walking out after dinner, and that old school culture of staff treating customers like family is something we don't encounter much anymore these days...

Food is perfectly done classic Cantonese food. Peking duck generously yielded enough for a table of 10 to eat at least two rounds for everyone. Really keen to go back and try their dim sum.

Missed this place. Glad that they reopened at raffles city’s Fairmont. It’s right beside koji on the 3rd floor.
Comfy seating and great Cantonese cuisine and other fair. Peking duck was just as good as before. I liked their garoupa fish cooked 2 styles. Black pepper beef was tender and the fried bee hoon was perfect. Soup was perfect too. Finished the boiled pork ribs actually.
You’ll definitely come back. It’s such an iconic name.
Asian cuisine near Singapore.address: 252 North Bridge Rd, #03-22B Fairmont Singapore (South Tower, Singapore 179103
Asian cuisine near Singapore.name: Asia Grand Restaurant

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
Peach Blossoms truly impressed me with its modern Asian cuisine. The dishes were not only delicious but also beautifully presented. The attentive service added to the overall positive experience. The clean and well-laid-out atmosphere, especially in the private room, created a delightful dining environment. A must-visit for those seeking a perfect blend of taste, presentation, and ambiance. I just wish there was a dedicated server in the room at all times to assist with topping up the tea and offering water automatically.

The dim sum and Chinese dishes are pretty good. Some of the dishes are unique (can’t get it elsewhere) so worth it to come here for the food. However, the restaurant felt very understaffed. Food came fast but when we needed to get help from the waiters, it took quite a while.

The presentation of the dishes was impeccable, and the flavors were simply delightful.

The smoky char siew, in particular, was a highlight of the meal. Its perfect balance of smokiness and tenderness made it an unforgettable dish that I would highly recommend to anyone visiting this establishment.

What truly elevated my visit was the exceptional service provided by Desmond. His attentiveness and professionalism went above and beyond to ensure our dining experience was exceptional. I highly recommend this restaurant for a fantastic culinary experience!

Great service and impressively plated and flavoured food! Got the set menu and loved the crispy fish skin - soup tasted like the crab accompaniment. Dessert (not pictured) was melon balls with Hokkaido milk, very refreshing after a filling sequence of dishes.

The most creative dish of the night goes to the signature cigar roll. Overall, interesting blend of flavors though some can taste 'heavy'. Food is good, service is prompt and professional
Asian cuisine near Singapore.address: 6 Raffles Blvd, Level 5 PARKROYAL COLLECTION Marina Bay, Singapore 039594
Asian cuisine near Singapore.name: Peach Blossoms

Asian cuisine near Singapore.address: 28 Race Course Rd, Singapore 218550
Asian cuisine near Singapore.name: Asia Cuisine Pte Ltd

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
We originally came for peeking duck, but the waitress advised us that it would be too much food for the two of us, which I appreciated! We got one of the chefs menus instead. My favorite was the chili prawns and my least favorite was the fried rice, it just wasn't anything special compared to the other dishes.

Service was great and they even set up a kids place setting for our baby, which was sweet, even though he is much too young for solid foods.

The food was mediocre at best, but the service was good. We made a reservation for seven beforehand, yet the table we were assigned was extremely small, could not even fit the dishes we ordered.

Compared to other Chinese restaurants in this price bracket, such as those at the Ritz Carlton and Hilton, this dining experience left much to be desired.

BBQ Meat Combination 2/5
Steamed Star Groupa 2.5/5
Peking Duck 3/5
Sweet and Sour Pork 4/5
Stir fried Kai Lan 1/5

One of the best Peking ducks ever! Please note that all other dishes, despite the high price, are portions for one pax only.

Very expensive but worth the Michelin star!

Fantastic restaurant, small portion but really great. I would say, 烧腊 is the best!!!!!!! Highly recommended for family gathering or special occasions.

Peking Duck was the highlight here. Level up with a touch of caviar. The duck here is more lean and crisp but I do think a little of fat adds to the flavour. Still good nonetheless.

Had a soup (meh, especially for that price) and a Soft Shell Crab with Crab Meat (which was yums, creamy but not to the point of being jelak, guess it helped that we shared instead of having 1 each) and a refreshing petite fours of Osmanthus Jelly and Pineapple Tart.

The complimentary birthday cake was delish too, reminded much of Ritz's Royal Caraibe from 20 years back. Dark bittersweet choc mousse on a layer of caramelised crunch. Service was top notch, attentive yet but imposing, always there but invisibly.
Asian cuisine near Singapore.address: 190 Orchard Blvd, Singapore 248646
Asian cuisine near Singapore.name: Jiang-Nan Chun

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
The staff is AMAZING! Our waiter took special care to ensure that we had really nice pictures for the "birthday cake shot".

The food was nice, but nothing too special.

I would go back for the service and ambience alone.

Went there for lunch for the first time. We had orchid lunch set. Especially love the soup, the smoked duck and the lobster rice/fish noodles. We didn't get to take any photo so just find some photos online to show some of the best dishes we had.
Yes it's pricey, but it's worth the money.

Great food and good service. There were just 2 of us and the restaurant was able to adjust the dim sum portion to 2 pieces each so that we could try more variety. Love that flexibility!

Good ambiance with impressive crockery that have beautiful black brush ink paintings of flowers. Each diner was served your individual bowl of fried cashew nuts as appetisers instead of communal serving in most Chinese restaurants. Nice touch!

We had steamed live prawns that were served with very fine strips of ginger, scallions and chilli in a light sauce for dipping. A silver finger bowl with a lemon slice was provided. Nice touch!

Ingredients used in Sze Chuan Styled Stewed Sea Cucumber Fish Maw and Braised Bean Curd Bamboo Pith were fresh and good quality. However the flavours of both were not memorable and the gravy for the beancurd had too much cornstarch.

Fried Rice Crab Meat with Dried Scallops was full of "wok hei". The only dish that left a good impression.

Good hospitality for there is no charge for warm water.

I was here on a weekday afternoon (prior reservation is recommended). The place quickly got crowded at around 1pm, mostly with business folks who presumably were there for lunch meetings.

Excellent place for dim sum. The food isn't cheap here, but what you get in return is high-quality food, in fact the best dim sums in town, and excellent service.
Asian cuisine near Singapore.address: 7 Raffles Ave., Singapore 039799
Asian cuisine near Singapore.name: Summer Pavilion

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
The restaurant offered a charming ambiance with its tasteful decor and welcoming atmosphere.

The service was exceptional; the staff was attentive. Our orders arrived promptly, and each dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavors. I highly recommend trying the foie gras and crab roe soup- it was an absolute delight!

Would definitely recommend to anyone seeking a memorable dining experience.

Incredible place for lunch! Such a beautiful atmosphere accompanied by beautiful food.

Had the half duck with the first course in pancakes (not pictured) and the second course wrapped in lettuce which was a great way to freshen up our palettes. The stir fried prawns in chili sauce is an absolute must and no wonder it’s one of their signature dishes. The buns to accompany and soak up any leftover sauce were great, we would’ve gotten more but didn’t want to fill up!

The sautéed wagyu beef with cumin was so aromatic and the meat extremely tender, and the fried rice with pork and seafood was delicious and equally portioned out for the three of us.

We had a fantastic time, the service was impeccable and we hope to come back soon.

Shisen Hanten beautifully blends the bold flavors of Sichuan cuisine with Japanese inspiration, all while offering traditional Cantonese dishes.

Their Mapo Tofu is amazing I would return here just for this dish. The perfect blend of spicy and savoury, with tender tofu bathed in a flavorful sauce, makes it a must-try. Their vegetable dishes are equally impressive. Here, the true essence of the vegetables shines through, highlighting their natural flavors and freshness.

Service at Shisen Hanten is impeccable, with attentive staff adding to the overall dining experience. Their commitment to ensuring your satisfaction enhances the enjoyment of the meal.

Genuinely enjoyed the lunch here and the staff are very friendly, service was impeccable!! My mum has many food requests and the staff (Penny, Doris and Yvonne) were very accomodating to them. Penny was especially patient in suggesting different menu changes and making sure nothing was amiss during our meal. The lunch set menu was also pretty worth the price. Paid a bit more for the lobster but it was really fresh and tasted amazing with the sauce!

Fine dining time, and we love it. It's the most beautiful Chinese restaurant in Singapore. We have a great experience with the selection dishes that offer from Chef. It is kind of spicy but good to go.
Asian cuisine near Singapore.address: 333 Orchard Rd, Level 35 Hilton Singapore Orchard, Singapore 238867
Asian cuisine near Singapore.name: Shisen Hanten by Chen Kentaro

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
The food quality is overall average. Lobster soup is rich in taste but the serving of the lobster is under expectation. In fact most of the dishes portion is relatively small for that price range.

Service experience is also under expectation. We sat at a place with a blind spot and the service staff are not attentive to our request. I have to walk to the counter for help. Suggest to provide some electronic buzzing system if the restaurant has under staff to serve the customer.

Came across this place via Google search.
Suppose to come here for DimSum. But only available in the afternoon.
But we still decided to stay for dinner.

Food is not bad, very well presented. Taste is pretty ok especially the chicken and the laksa prawn.

But when comes to the service by the restaurant staff, I gotta give them a lower rating. It certainly under expectations.

Firstly, they are not welcoming at all when we were at the counter waiting to be seated.

Secondly, the waiter is not attentive. They have no smile at all (which is important in service line).
When we request for tea or request him to add hot water, he just came and grab the teapot and go off with super monotonous attitude. When we say thank you, the staff don't even response at all (basically like a robot).

Therefore, I don't think we will come back again. The food is ok but definitely not the best compare to the same level restaurant elsewhere. Also the service staff and their attitude didn't impress us despite the restaurant is not busy at all (only 3 tables including our table).

Came for lunch, excellent staff service and quality food. Recommend to come 👍🏻

The food and atmosphere was good but one of the staff had a really bad attitude and kept showing us black face. One other staff was very friendly so I'll rate it as 4 stars. Maybe the first staff had a bad day 🤷🏻‍♀️

Cosy environment. Great for family gartherings. Dimsum. Lobster pumpkin soup having 1 for 1 offer. Nice. Recommended.
Asian cuisine near Singapore.address: 122 Middle Rd, Level 2 Mercure Singapore Bugis, Singapore 188973
Asian cuisine near Singapore.name: Song Garden Chinese Restaurant

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
Visited on 23 Dec 2022 to order mutton briyani for takeaways. The rice is fluffy and well cooked.. almost like fried rice with individual grains.. and the mutton curry is succulent and soft to the bite, with very deep indian smell and taste to the curry sauce. Worth all the $5.50 paid for it

Cheap and nice crab promotion. $38.80 for 3 crab with any flavour really worth the price. But Asam fish taste not that fresh and some vege got bitter and sour taste like not that fresh. However, it is still worth going if promotion still valid.

Now there is promotion on for new zichar restaurant. (1) One whole fish for only S$18. (2) Indian curry chicken $4.50, if add egg and vegetable, it becomes a set at S$5.

Online but no response for whole day, after saying can order we placed order and pickup time. We already on the way to pickup since there was no response, after spam call for few times 6pm+ pickup call say crabs smelly not selling say order cancelled.

Order since 11am confirmed already, no responses no reply. Best part, WhatsApp was ONLINE ALL THE TIME. Absolutely disgusting service, no apologies aftermath and not remorseful through phone convo. NOT RECOMMENDED!!!

I went to the place on a Saturday at 615pm. There was only one other table of diners then. The place got really crowded after 7pm. There was only one waiter serving everyone so service is kinda slow. Food is on the saltier side but still very delicious. Strongly recommend their black pepper crab. Affordable and tasty.

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
As someone who's on a no grain diet, it's been hard going to restaurants but I absolutely loved the menu and appreciated the variety of gluten free options that I could choose from and the food was delicious. I highly recommend the mussels as I single handedly polished the entire bowl. Great buzzing atmosphere too for a Friday night!

Extremely friendly staff and good service. Grilled Cod Fish is a must try, suoer tasty, juicy and fresh!
Mango mustard salad taste weird to me (maybe just I don't like it) but overall its a good experience!

Have been to Coriander Leaf a few times and most recently again with my husband. Food was great, in fact even better than we remembered! We ordered the duck curry, the garlic naan (best naan we ever had), miso cod and spicy eggplant, and ended with the spiced lava cake. We had a delightful meal, and highly recommend the combination of the red curry and the garlic naan, it's a flavour explosion! We will be back :)

Overall, it was a good experience. Some food like the lamb was very good, but the stingray was not fresh. Naan was very good,served hot, and freshly made. Each serving per dish was small, good for 2 pax. Wide varieties of asian food to select from.

Food was very unique with the set lunch choices of South Asian, Chinese, Thai & Persian. I chose the South Asian and the naan was beautifully prepared, fluffy on the inside and crispy at the sides. Staff were very helpful & friendly and the ambiance was perfect!
Asian cuisine near Singapore.address: 30 Victoria St, # 02-01 Singapore Chijmes, Singapore 187996
Asian cuisine near Singapore.name: Coriander Leaf Chijmes - Modern Asian

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
The food was actually not bad although it's kind of pricy. Personally I would recommend getting their Kung Pao prawn as the sauce was very well executed. The fried udon was also quite good although I wished that the portion would be slightly bigger.

Food quality, taste and value, this place is on par with the best in their class. A good team of staff provides decent service. Noodles, fried rice are nicely done. Only thing is tables are so small that plates are falling off if one is not careful.

the suan la lamian is the only dish i eat here. it’s one of the better ones, imo even better than DTF. can’t really say much about the other dishes as i haven’t tried but all in all a solid bowl.

Went for a quick lunch. Food was served in less that 5 minutes. Quality is decent for the price. The chicken is the highlight of all the dishes we ordered as the meat was juicy and tasty. Overall, it's a good place to bring visiting friends/colleagues for some Asian style food. Service crew are polite and attentive even on a busy lunch (which is a plus).

Foodibear gives Chopsticks by the Asian Kitchen a decent 4/5.

Avoid lunchtime crowd. The queue can take 45mins. Tofu is very soft and fine. The skin of the wo-dia (rd pic) was thick and rubbery. I personally dont like it.  The fried chicken dish was all meat. Would prefer some bony parts.

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
Went on a rainy Thursday night 7pm. There were empty seats & mostly are foreigners. Made a reservation for 5 persons. We sat behind & it’s really dark there. We had to keep turning on our Hp flash light. Service & Atmosphere is very good. Staffs are friendly & restaurant decorations are retro vibes & pretty. Even the utensil they used are pretty. Food portions are small so it’s actually quite expensive. Taste is unique & not bad but I don’t really think it’s fantastic till it’s worth the pricing. We paid over $300+. We had a Yakult cocktail @ $48 for 3 pax, coconut lime mocktail & ice dirty chai latte (couldn’t taste the chai taste) at $10 each.

Lobster kueh pie tee taste good. Ugly broccolini is deep fried till very crispy, not to my liking.. Crab fried rice is tasty as it’s fried with XO sauce. Crispy Squid is not bad but the wilted kale is deep fried also so it’s crispy too. It doesn’t taste like veggies. Crispy crab omelette with the Singapore chilli dip had a tinge of Assam taste. Truffle roast duck is good, skin is crispy. But truffle smell & taste is not obvious enough. Crispy tofu is small portioned, it goes well with the Salty black pepper sauce.

Lastly is the xinjiang style Lamb ribs. We were suggested to order 2 portions since we had 5 person..  For 1 of the plate, whole ribs is totally fats & no meat. Every bite I took i thought I will at least ate the meat part but too bad it’s totally fats. End up i felt so nauseous & my stomach rumbles so badly that i threw up when I reaches home. It’s is the smell of the Lamb ribs 😢…

Kind of anticipated the meal here so was a little disappointed.. Also understand why it’s mostly foreigners since it might felt like fushion Tze char. But I really appreciate their good service.

Great place to catch with friends over delicious food and drinks.

The menu never fails to impress with the Asian twists. Huge variety of drinks as well.

Great team to provide a great experience here, and always a fabulous visit.

For 6 pax, we had the crispy crab omelette, truffle roast duck, spicy brussel sprouts, wok-fried wagyu hor fun, XYT hokkien mee, kurobuta char siew. The food was surprisingly good! My personal favourites were the truffle duck and brussel sprouts.

Overall a cosy and interesting bar to dine and chill with friends!

Hands down one of my top 3 places in Singapore.
The style of the place is so laid back and the staff is very nice.

Drinks and food are out of this world and of outstanding quality.

Come here, have a good time and drink a Soju Bomb!

Cosy little restaurant with a nostalgic atmosphere with good food. The kurobuta char siew was fatty and yummy. The fried chicken wings were not bad and the duck was good too but not much truffle taste.

They also have a good selection of cocktails and we had fun with the menu and drink selection.

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
Since opening in The St. Regis Singapore hotel in December 2007, Yan Ting restaurant has been a stalwart of the Chinese Cantonese fine dining scene, the epitome of extravagance and luxury. These days, there are plenty of Chinese fine dining restaurants around, but Yan Ting has certainly stepped up their game, remaining a premium dining destination of choice, serving well-executed and refined gastronomic delights on each plate.
.
Ambience at Yan Ting is opulent. The grandeur of the interior exudes a classy elegance, without being too over the top. The tastefully arranged layout is suitable for business or private dining, and the decor enhances the overall ambience without being too loud. I also like the bright ambient lighting, which isn't too harsh or dim. The pearl marble floors and plush furnishings feel sophisticated and comfortable.
.
Service at Yan Ting restaurant is professional, discreet, and polite. Staff may not make much conversation, but they are attentive and observant. The accord each table good attention, answering queries, fulfilling requests, serving orders, and proactively clearing finished plates with finesse. Communication in English or Chinese Mandarin is decent. Felt very well treated here.
.
Food at Yan Ting follows the Chinese Cantonese philosophy of freshness of ingredients, little usage of herbs, and well balanced dishes that are naturally flavourful but not greasy. Yan Ting restaurant prepares classic Chinese Cantonese dishes according to time-honoured recipes, but presents them in beautiful contemporary style.
.
Portions are sized for individuals, but dishes are best shared. Prices are high. Prepare to splurge, budget about SGD $245 per person for a meal here.

Food was great and yummy! We ordered their signature set menu and enjoyed it. All the dishes were on point, not too salty and oily. Overall we enjoyed and will come back for their dim sum!

Visited Yan Ting to celebrate a birthday, but was left disappointed by the standard of service. Food was decent, but nothing to shout about.

We were seated at around 6.15pm, and ordered 4 set meals and half a Peking duck within 5 minutes. We waited for almost half an hour for the appetiser to be served, and similarly waited for approximately half an hour for the following courses. At 8.30pm, we had not yet been served our main courses, and decided to get the main courses to go and to get dessert served instead.

As for the Peking duck, we were served the Peking duck pancakes shortly after our appetiser. We opted for the second serving to be served as chopped duck, which I assume would have been sliced together with the first serving. However, we yet again had to wait another half an hour for the meat to be served, which meant that it was cold by then.

What disappointed us the most was the level of service provided by one particular staff, Steven. While serving the dishes, it felt that he was simply dropping or tossing our plates onto the table. What shocked us the most was when he presented the bill, he seemed to throw the bill onto the table, pointing at the line for the signature without saying anything! When we asked if there was any way to give feedback, he said that there was none other than leaving our feedback online.

To Yan Ting’s credit, the managers Bruce and Fiona did try their best to offer service recovery as we were leaving and apologised on behalf of their server.

For the price point that Yan Ting is charging, we would have expected better trained staff, as well as better serving processes. Overall, not an experience we would expect from a highly rated restaurant and not a restaurant we would likely visit again.

We were here on our vegetarian routine day. Even though they don’t have many selections of the vegetarian dishes. You can ask them for the off menu. They will customise for you. We ordered hot and sour soup, truffle tofu, Gongbao vegetarian chicken, fried mushrooms Mien, and stir fried vegetables. Every dishes were tasty. However you might need to wait for up to 30-45 mins to serve your food.

We were hosted to lunch here, and the place was packed at 12 noon, so much so that reservations are a must.  One negative is that the place was too loud, with so many people talking, that I ended up with a headache.  Having a normal-level conversation was quite difficult.

Service was quite warm and quick, and the waitstaff were always quick to top up our teas.

The food was generally of a high standard, though some meat dishes were rather tough.  The pork jowl done charsiu style was tasty, but some pieces were tough to bite through or chew.  Similarly, not all pieces of the stir fried beef, which was delish, were soft.

The xiqolong bao was nce, but the standout dish for me was the siew mai. We ordered desserts of sago with mango , and quilingao, both of which made for a sweet ending to the meal.
Asian cuisine near Singapore.address: 29 Tanglin Rd, Level 1U The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247912
Asian cuisine near Singapore.name: Yan Ting

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
We had their weekend dim sum buffet. The service and food were incredible. Shirley, Maggie and Chin Chin were amazing hosts, recommending dishes and ensuring that we were well taken care of.

Great place for your family dinners. I will definitely come again soon! :)

Shirley, Maggie and ChinChin service were impressive. Very attentive in service and clearing plates. Chef also put on a goof fire show for the pork dish. Every item served was explained well. They also provided a cake from my mum’s birthday.
Many thanks to the team!

The menu at Man Fu Yuan is a celebration of exquisite Chinese cuisine, and it showcases the artistry and passion of the talented chefs. The array of dishes offered caters to various palates, ensuring there's something to delight everyone. Whether you're a fan of traditional favorites or seeking innovative culinary creations, this restaurant has it all.

The service at Man Fu Yuan deserves special mention. The staff members were attentive, knowledgeable, and passionate about their craft. They took the time to explain each dish, offering valuable insights into the flavors and ingredients. Their attention to detail and genuine enthusiasm contributed to the overall exceptional dining experience.

The ambiance of the restaurant is sophisticated and elegant, with tasteful decor and comfortable seating. The soothing background music added to the overall relaxing atmosphere, creating the perfect setting for a special evening with loved ones or an important business gathering.

Man Fu Yuan Restaurant is a gem that should not be missed. From the exquisite cuisine to the impeccable service and delightful ambiance, every aspect of this dining establishment exceeded my expectations. Whether you're a connoisseur of Chinese cuisine or simply seeking an exceptional dining experience, I highly recommend visiting Man Fu Yuan Restaurant. It is an indulgence for the senses and a culinary journey that will leave a lasting impression.

Service is good there, the 6 courses meal will get 5 stars if not because of the lobster with crispy rice noodle dish. While the lobster is fresh and the texture good, the noodle spoilt the dish with the fried noodle taste like rancid oil, disappointed. Other than this dish, all other dishes are up to standard. Recommended the Man fu yuan appetizer.

Celebrating my daughter birthday Food was awesome. Was serve by a very friendly and attentive staff named Maggie Yong. She was so attentive in her details and ensuring the celebration of my daughter birthday a success one
Asian cuisine near Singapore.address: 80 Middle Road Level 2 InterContinental Singapore, Singapore 188966
Asian cuisine near Singapore.name: Man Fu Yuan Restaurant

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
Heard about this establishment from friends who lived near Mandarin Gardens, decided to order out on a Saturday afternoon. It was pretty quiet on a Saturday post-lunch afternoon, and I was attended to promptly.

The staff who took my order was conscientious and meticulous. She made sure to present the signature dishes as well as repeated my orders to confirm them. She was also helpful in making sure that I could come back after the food is prepared as I had to run a short errand around the area.

I ordered the small portions of the following: Jing Du pork, tofu with chicken floss, butter squid. The olive rice was available in a standard size.

The family was not impressed with the food, the pork had a sweet vinegary flavour and was quite tough, the tofu with chicken floss was decent, but nothing to rave about. The butter squid was quite mushy, perhaps it was better to have it on-site? The olive rice had wok hei but barely any other flavours.

Was quite disappointed, perhaps due to the hype from the previous reviews. Probably won't be heading back for the food, despite the excellent service. Will also be sharing my disappointment with my friends at Mandarin Gardens.

Good service from the restaurant staff. I liked the foods here especially the olive fried rice, 京都排骨 and butter squid. The food quality is great and consistent. I dined in during lunch time and really enjoyed the quiet atmosphere here with great food.

We dropped by on a Wednesday and got the Butter Squid at 50% off. Also tried the Jing Du Pork and Fried Hong Kong Noodles, all of which were yummy. Ambience was quiet and peaceful, service staff was attentive.

Will be back here again!

I had a great experience at Thaipan on 24 Mar 2023. I went there for my ROM lunch and it was superb! The food was really yummy and the service was good. The staff were very polite and both my families were very pleased with the food presentation and taste! Their yam ring and fried salted egg prawn ball along with their fish were all cooked excellently! When I reserved the place and informed that it was for my ROM lunch, they specifically bought fresh flowers for the table. I would recommend this place as the price point is good too! (Attached photos of yam ring and cereal chicken)

Didn't come back to this restaurant for 8 years. Decided to try their new location at turf city. Food standard dropped a bit compared to last time. But the service is impeccable and also a good deal for the happy hour. Will try the other dishes next time.
Asian cuisine near Singapore.address: 175 Albert St, #01-02 Inside iBis Styles Singapore Albert Hotel, Singapore 189970
Asian cuisine near Singapore.name: ThaiPan Restaurant

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
The food was nice and yummy. All dishes were cooked really well. Price point on the higher side. Would I come back? Probably. Is it worth the price? Hmm can’t say for sure.
The food was undeniable good though

Fresh ingredients, taste of the original ingredients, simply steam the fresh crab with soya sauce, this require very fresh crab, and the soya sauce enhanced the taste.

Another dish I like was their yong tou fu, they make their own Toufu.
It was tender and the minced meat were well blend in their toufu.

The food here is excellent, very high quality and flavor is authentic and tasty. The peking duck is really good and the pancakes they used are really unique and delicious. Service is also very good even when busy. The restaurant ambience is very nice and is a great place for many occasions whether entertaining guests or celebrating family events

Over the years, the food standard has dropped IMO as they were really good in their initial few years back in 2011 when the Island new clubhouse was completed. Nevertheless, we still patronize them as the savings on the 10% service charge as member helps to defray the costs of the meal. In addition, the roast duck is nicely done - crispy skin and juicy meat on the inside. As a member's club, the service level from the wait staff is acceptable.

Great place for a sit down family dinner. The service is good and food is yummy! Request for the table with the view - the sunset over the golf course was simply breathtaking!

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
I absolutely loved the food, especially the beef and scallops! The Chinese 8-course meal left me completely satisfied, and the service was excellent. The table setup provided a sense of privacy for our group, making the dining experience even more enjoyable

Came here for birthday dinner and had the Daffodil dinner set which should be popular since many other patrons ordered the same.

Would give 6/5 if we could. Food is fantastic. Service is attentive. Ambience is romantic. Price is value for money given the quality of the dishes. All worth it to put up credit card authorisation for the reservation ahead of time.

Looking forward to coming back again next time.

Eating area is dim, and stiff

Service and serving of food was shockingly slow in which a multiple dishes had to be checked multiple times & server could not give adequate response or update, shirking responsibility to kitchen. Dish orders were missing/forgotten.

It was overall very frustrating and really tested patience when both trying to consistently check and lunch time was unneceasarily extended.
It was also difficult to get attention of server

If you do not know how to speak Chinese, do avoid this place as likely to struggle communicating to server

Food only looks pretty but you can take it as a given that all the main cooked big dishes will have a lot of oil & salt.. best to make special request to exclude

Definitely not worth the $70++ per head when food, service, waiting time was ridiculous.

Do get better tasting dim sum or chinese food elsewhere & for cheaper

We went for the weekday dim sum lunch buffet because they are going to discontinue buffet soon! Love the quiet atmosphere and service was good.
Most dishes are delicious. Buddha jump over the wall is a must try soup - rich and tasty. I like the truffles charsiew bao and crispy wanton - unique. The porridge was disappointing and bland. Roast duck is so so. But we really enjoyed the desserts!

Heard so much about Hai Tien Lo restaurant. Went there for dinner. Fine dining Chinese restaurant to be exact. We ordered the set dinner and we were surprised by each dish. Beautifully displayed in an artistic manner. Each bite of the dish bursting with different tastes and senses to the tongue. Each dish was painstakingly prepared and you could taste the real flavour of the ingredients. No flavour enhancer, natural, genuine taste from the combined ingredients brought out from the chef’s skillful cooking. Check out the photos of the dishes I had.                                     The smoked fried chicken was excellent! You can smell the faint smell of smokiness. The skin so thoroughly fried and wafer thin, dipped into the special sauce, sour, sweet and a hint of spiciness, so freshing, a brilliant combination that brought out a whole new experience to my taste buds and senses. Other dishes were equally surprising and excites my taste and senses. Service was attentive and polite. I will make it a point to come again when the menu changes. I want to be surprised, I want my taste and sense to be excited!
Asian cuisine near Singapore.address: 7 Raffles Blvd, Singapore 039595
Asian cuisine near Singapore.name: Hai Tien Lo

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
Been here a few times already. We ordered the tofu stew, fried pork and fried chicken wings for 2 pax. The meal was delicious and flavourful. There is not much of service to expect from and they don't have service charge anyway.

A cosy place to get your korean quick fix within the Bugis area.

Speedy allocation of seats. Efficient ordering system and wide variety of payment options available. Food ordered came reasonably quickly. 👏

The quality and pricing of food is good, reasonable and affordable. 👍

Overall, a pleasant experience. I will visit again to try the other dishes. 🤩

The Korean food is very authentic. We tried the Pork Deopbab, Tofu Soup Chicken & Kimchi Soup Pork. They exceeded our expectations and were full of ingredients. Prices are decent for Korean food. We tried a grapes bongbong drink even though it was good but it was too pricey (3 SGD), which could be easily bought cheaper elsewhere. A man (manager?) was really hospitable, gave us a table inside another area as we didn’t want to seat down outside and also recommended us some must try dishes.

Friendly Ajumma kindly presented the menu to my friend and I. Also, even offer to give us an extra chair to put our bags! Kamsahamnida 🙆🏻💖

Went to order tofu stew with beef (SGD$11.70) and spicy cheese beef (SGD$16.50)

Honestly speaking, their tofu stew is not so spicy and soup wasn't that thick 👍🏻 Beef is flavourful and soft to chew on it. Very easy to finish the whole soup by pouring the leftover rice into it which makes it very palatable as a soup porridge 🤣

Definitely good for days that you have no mood to eat or not feeling well 😊

*Prices indicated include side dishes and a bowl of rice (P.S: The egg roll is a bit cold when served hopefully they can improve on it 🙏🏻)

Will update if I tried any new dishes from the small eatery!

Been coming here since 2019 pre covid, decently priced korean food, with the ajjuma cooking the food. The go to food for me js the the grilled pork, kimchi pancake and kimchi jigge. Will def order this few when I am here.

Use at 9:00 in the morning, unfriendly, taste so so. There will be no second time.

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
Best dim sum we've ever had! The staff was very helpful with portion sizing! Everything we tried was delicious. The taro dumplings and the beef meat balls stood out, but seriously, everything was delicious!

Had a good experience dining here recently with my partner. The rich and cozy ambience, coupled with the food and service made our night. The jasmine tea pork ribs, four treasure soup and lobster noodles really stand out and I'd highly recommend them. Apart from that the service was on point, 10/10. Overall we had a great time dining, and the effort in each dish we had stood out. Nicely done!

My first time here, an amazing experience! From the ambience and decor being quite eye opening (read: unconventional for a Chinese restaurant), to the quality and taste of the food, it was excellent (albeit pricey - but you get what you pay for). Special mention to service staff Wilson, who was very attentive and friendly! Made the experience even better. Thank you, and I'd be happy to be back.

Good vibe and tasty Cantonese food. The ala carte buffet menu has a good spread, from dim sum to staple and fusion dishes. Dished high recommended- striploin, Mayo wasabi prawn, salted egg fish, black steamed fish, lobster vermicelli and chilli crab bun.

The service was great, and it was a nice personal touch for staff to give a cake on house and sing a birthday song together. Thank you Adela for the wonderful service.

Not impressed by the dishes. With the chef changed. Something didn’t seem right with their dishes.
Spicy Soft shelled crab was the worst i had in my life. The crab was over-fried. Very bitter burnt after taste from the crab. It tasted like oily bug taste. And yes I’ve tasted bugs such as grasshoppers, silkworm.
Claypot chicken was not cooked long enough. As such, the chicken was rather bland. Bbq pork puff was too sweet to my liking.
Anyway, overall dishes were ok but not worth making the trip for it.
Asian cuisine near Singapore.address: 32 Beach Rd, The NCO Club, Singapore 189764
Asian cuisine near Singapore.name: Madame Fan

Asian cuisine near Singapore.reviews:
Came here because I was amazed by their glutinous chicken rice which was brought back by my wife cold from lunchtime . It was still nice when I ate it cold at night.
Celebrated my elder relative’s birthday and the service and food is appreciated by all of us. As for the food, see my captions for must order Dim Sum. Will definitely come again to try other Dim sum we missed this trip. Currently there is free Peking duck (half) for orders above $98. Worth it.

We had a wonderful experience as I brought my wifey for her birthday dinner with close friends. The food was to us wonderful and to our liking. They gave a nice surprise for the birthday gal.. it will be out go to restaurant for Cantonese food. Next will try the dim sum…

14 May 2023: Awesome food with great taste and at reasonable prices. They also served nice dim sum and if you need privacy; 4 private rooms are available for booking. Staff were friendly and Imperial Grand Cantonese Cuisine is a hidden gem in Sam Leong road...will return for more delicious choices

Came here on a weekday for birthday celebration. The manager promptly made a surprise birthday free dessert.
Food is good cantonese cuisine with wok hei especially the xo fried carrots and crab meat bee hoon.
Will come back again for other dishes and dim sum.
They have private rooms too.

Nice rectro place with good dim sum! I was recommended by a friend and went to try today! Here's what we ordered:
1) HongKong congee (5*) - smooth texture!!
2) Egg tart (5*) - not cakey and pretty soft!!
3) Fried carrot cake(4*)
4) fried prawn fritters (3.5*) - a tad oily!
5) Hong Kong milk tea (4*)
6) Yuan yang (5*)
7) Siew Mai (5*) - moist and juicy!!
8) Appetiser (5*) - garlic and vinegar with fungus

Imho, the service is impeccable and the lady boss and server came and check with us a few times. It was obvious they have pride in their work and food! The lady boss asked if the tea was sufficient for HK milk tea and she will give me another brew if it isn't. You don't get such good service in FnB nowadays esp in malls. They also have some singing on Mondays and Tues nights and the male server even suggested the seats we can have for best experience! Haha mayb he is the real 老闆 :)

It is a delight to find such good service in a rectro place! Do drop by if you are in the hood. Dessert was on the house too!! Wow. We did not drive there but took MRT. Nearest would be either Jalan Besar station(downtown line) or Farrer Station(NEL). Anyway we walked from Rochor station and it was still v do-able.
Asian cuisine near Singapore.address: 11 Sam Leong Rd, #03-01 TRIO BUILDING, Singapore 207903
Asian cuisine near Singapore.name: Imperial Grand Cantonese Cuisine

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Our first time here. The service was hospitable and genuine, no pretense despite being a Michelin-starred restaurant. Alex and Kim were friendly and was impeccable in their service. Food was amazing with unique combinations of fresh ingredients. Chef also came over to each table to interact which we felt was an awesome touch. Strongly recommended!

Well deserved Michelin Restaurants.
The bread is so crispy on the outside and so so so soft on the inside. Pairing with the bordier butter, it is really exceptional.
Every dish of the food is amazing.

The service is so good. When the table is full of crumbs, the waiter will clean it up to sweep away the crumbs. The waiter are also friendly and knowledgeable about the dishes.
When we found a bone in the fish and the chef came out to apologize. Felt the service was so good.

The atmosphere in the round room felt great too.

One of the best fine dining places I’ve ever been to! I can’t keep track of what was being served because there was just so many different courses, but each course was really tasty 🥰 I don’t think I’m a small eater but I was so full by the last few courses, I don’t think I ate any at all. Remember to pace yourself. I’m most impressed by their bakes; their toasty black sesame bread was literally the best bread I’ve ever had in my life.

White Grass is a hidden gem, providing a distinctive dining venture with its fusion of Japanese and European flavors.

Each dish is delectable, especially the bread, pastries, and desserts rank the finest that I ever tasted.

The real flower centerpiece adds a pleasant fragrance, and the stylish decor contributes to the overall charm, making it an excellent option for couples and hosting friends.

On my second visit, I can confidently say they consistently exceed my expectations.

Very good ambience and attentive service. The bread is crispy outside and moist inside. Sesame bread is delicious too. Abalone is well done combined with the sauce and texture. The lobster meat is too soft for our liking. Everything is fine but no distinctive wow factor.
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.opening_hours:

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Whitegrass Restaurant

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Nice environment and friendly staff.
And the food is great!

It’s my honour to have an opportunity to try the New Menu. I like the most is my main, the Glacier 51 Toothfish with special mixed with 4 different oils! It’s amazing and taste really good 👍🏻

It’s a wonderful night and dinner with my beloved. 🥂

Recommend 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

My partner brought me here for my birthday lunch and we had a lovely time here. We ordered the 2 course lunch with an add on of extra serving of potato bread & steak.

We enjoyed the potato bread that we ordered a extra serving. The steak was also yummy and cooked to medium rare. The steak came with oyster mushroom was also cooked to perfection. Special shout-out to to the beef tartare(lovely presentation!)& pork steak(burst of flavour!!)!

The duck breast was slightly too rare for our liking.

The service was lovely and friendly and they also surprised me with a apple tart for my birthday.

A lovely place where we spent our anniversary lunch. Food was YUM. A mix of different cuisines rolled into something I'd call contemporary European. Presentation of dishes was spectacular with the beef tartar showcased in a delightfully unusual way!

This is a five-star experience all the way - Alma has a Michelin star in the guide that just came out for Singapore, and deservedly so. They were happy to accommodate vegetarian food for the prix fixe menu, which is great value. The signature tofu with black truffle was sublime, as were the Japanese tomatoes with tomato sorbet. The amuse bouche of tomato with a sour plum film was another delight.

It's a nice space too, with a beautifully designed interior and a superb selection of wines and in particular rare whiskies.

This one's going on our repeat visit list for sure!

A lovely fine dining restaurant with great service and friendly people. Food was very unique and tasteful. Looks like they have many years of being a 1-star Michelin restaurant. Well deserved!

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Alma by Juan Amador

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Lovely experience.  Good service and attentive staff. Well deserved Michelin star with the food. Has fantastic courses paired with champagne. Air- conditioning is way too cold and freezes everyone. Any warm dish turns cold too quickly. Dessert was also a star and did not let down the entire course of dinner. Felt the staff could have been more confident in introducing each course.

Came here to celebrate our anniversary, a surprise dinner planned by my husband for us. The restaurant is intimate with only a few tables available, so you get undivided attention from the staff. It is also an open kitchen concept which I love so you can see the chefs hard at working preparing their masterpieces for us. I enjoyed pretty much every single dish, the abalone wellington was definitely unique and one of a kind. Overall had a really good experience here.

One - starred Michelin restaurant located within Voco Hotel (previously known as Hilton Orchard), serving Modern-Contemporary cuisine,established by Restaurateur-Sommelier Ignatius Chan in 2004. There is heavy influence of japanese ingredients used in the menu and served in the European way. Opt for the menu with two main courses for a wholesome dining experience. Food presentation is beautiful and tastefully presented, and what's good to look at is also good to eat.

Had our belated anniversary lunch at Iggy’s as we were having a staycation at Hilton. A lovely resturant with friendly and helpful crew. Love the fact that we are able to view how the chef and his team prepared our meals to the kitchen.

As the husband and I do not take raw fish, the chef was able to customize to our taste by searing the fish, love how the raw yolk enhances the overall taste of the dish. They did an interesting take on the sponge gourd which brought the vegetable to another level. The linguine was average. The roast beef has charred edges which was a nice touch. Overall we enjoyed the 5 course meal at $150++ per pax.

Came here for lunch with 2 overseas guests who would like to taste a Michelin restaurant.  Decided to bring them to Iggy's as the restaurant has been one that has been keeping their reputation for years. Food was great as you can see in pictures.. perhaps ..some touch up to the interior may make the place feel warm and friendly.
Damage : $200 (lunch)/pax

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Iggy's

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Every dish is on point. We curated our own menu and we emailed them in advance. We used the klook vouchers so that saved us $60. We love the ambience that the rotating restaurant has to offer. I must say the view of Marina Bay Sands is stunning. A great place for celebrations. We went there for birthday celebration and they gave us a free birthday cake. The staff were so attentive and took so many nice candid pictures for us. We really enjoyed ourselves dining at Tong Le Private Dining. Thank you!!!!

Food was really good for its price. We had the Colorful Cloud Dinner Set Menu. I will say it started out amazing and plateaued off around the main course. But for its price I am won't be too picky. Service was good, staffs were friendly and professional. The revolving platform gave a 360 view of the city which was a huge plus for me. Atmosphere was quiet when we came early on, but started to get a bit rowdy due to a huge party to our sides despite the closed-off rooms. But overall a pretty decent visit. Will recommend!

I had the pleasure of indulging in an exquisite dining experience at Tóng Lè Private Dining, and I can confidently say it was an absolute delight for all the senses. The first thing that captivated me upon entering here was the stunning view. The restaurant's unique concept of a rotating dining room allowed me to indulge in a 360-degree panorama of the cityscape, adding a sense of wonder and spectacle to the already exquisite dining affair. The menu was a testament to the chef's creativity and culinary expertise. Each dish was a harmonious blend of flavours, beautifully presented and bursting with vibrant colours and textures. I must also mention the impeccable timing of the service. Each course was served with precision, allowing us to savor every bite without feeling rushed. The staff's attention to detail and their commitment to providing exceptional service truly enhanced the entire dining affair. Overall, my dining experience at here was an unforgettable journey of culinary delight and I cannot wait to return to experience their wonders once again :)

Most rotating restaurants live off the gimmick of being exactly that - a rotating restaurant offering a 360 degree view of a location. Many times, the food in such restaurants isn’t a priority, but the experience is. This restaurant, however, serves excellent food and offers a great view of Marina Bay Sands and the fountain and light show in front of the mall, as well as a nice view of parts of the Singapore skyline. The rotation is very slow and it take about two hours to do a full 360 revolution. If you are unlucky, you will be at the opposite side of the fountain show both times it occurs. For a period of the 360 tour you are very close to an office building - so close that you can see the monitors of the people working in the building.

The seating arrangement is varied, from two/four person tables, to separate dining rooms for larger groups. The restaurant has a very good bar which has a great selection of cocktails and spirits. The restaurant is quiet which makes it easy to have a business conversation, if that‘s why you are there.

The restaurant offers a seven-course menu which is perfectly timed for a two-hour dining experience. The wine menu is very extensive and there is a sommelier that can provide advice if you require so. The menu was extremely well thought-through and the various dishes were perfectly combined to provide a first-class dining experience.

The staff is very attentive and friendly, and made us feel welcome from the minute we set foot in the restaurant.

We would come to this restaurant again, and in particular for the dining experience. We were positively surprised by every course.

Location: 5/5 (in the financial district opposite Marina Bay Mall)
Ambience: 4/5
Menu: 5/5 (albeit a fixed menu)
Food: 5/5
Drinks/wine selection: 5/5
Staff: 5/5
Price/quality: 4/5 (pricey but very high quality)

Quality of food matches the price. The family all agreed it was a perfect place for a family celebration. The service was immaculate and staff very attentive to details. We didn't mention it was a BD celebration but when we clinked our wine glasses, they must have overheard us saying Happy BD, and they surprised us with longevity buns. They also understand Chinese etiquette well as our son discreetly wanted to foot the bill, but the attending staff came quietly to check with my husband who was the host if they should accept my son's card. That's so thoughtful as in Chinese custom the host foots the bill and they respected that.

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Tóng Lè Private Dining

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Les Amis restaurant is a gastronomic wonderland that transported me to a world of culinary bliss! The ambiance felt like a page out of a Parisian romance novel, with soft lights and a melody of enchanting tunes. The menu, a poetic composition of flavors, offered a dance of taste that left me in awe. The waitstaff, dressed in elegant attire, choreographed a dining experience that was nothing short of a culinary ballet. Each dish, a masterpiece plated with precision, tasted like a symphony of harmonious ingredients. If you're yearning for a dining escapade that feels like a rendezvous with gourmet dreams, Les Amis is the destination to indulge your palate in a poetic feast!

Ordered the dark chocolate cake and it was so delicious! The cake is placed on top of a tart shell which is very special. Almonds are super fragrant too.
Hope that delivery service can be included in the future and handwriting on the chocolate could be better 😅

Had a very pleasant dining experience at Les Amis. Patrick, our server, was very friendly, attentive, and entertaining. He suggested a perfect wine to have with the steak. He also patiently explained every dish to us. The amuse bouche tartalette with bacon and mushrooms was a good introduction to the meal. Notable food from our dinner are the French egg, crab soufflé, simmered celery root, salted brioche, herb sorbet, and poached pears. The caviar that was thoughtfully used in some of the dishes is an interesting addition of a complex salt flavor; it did not overwhelm the taste of the other ingredients. The wagyu was tender but I expected a bit more flavor and it lacked a bit of surprise. The herb sorbet is most interestingly a refreshing palate cleanser. Overall, it was a memorable and pleasant gastronomic experience.

Truly Michelin 3 stars! Excellent food with great creativity,  best service, excellent wine pairing, and the deserts are the best.  Not cheap but it is worth it!

Everything was impeccable, the food was great and the portions were generous, great wine pairings and amazing service.
Toni and the team were very kind and took genuine care of us.
The Blu Lobster appetizer, their sour dough, the riz de veu and the cheese course were divine.
Highly recommended.
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Les Amis

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Our experience at Braci was probably one of our most memorable meals and the food served was truly deserving of its Michelin star. Would highly recommend getting the seven course menu as there were so many more elements in our dinner incorporated that made it all the more special. Flavours were all very well balanced and overall we left feeling very satisfied.

Visited in Sep 2023

Braci was on my list of restaurants to visit for over 4 years and I must say that it was worth the wait. It is no surprise that Braci has retained its Michelin 1 star for 6 consecutive years. The menu was a progressive one which is definitely inspired by Chef Mattie’s Italian roots. There are 2 choices for people (5 course and 7 course). I would suggest people to go for the 7 course as the additional dishes in the 7 course meal are worth it. One of my favourite parts of the experience was trying out the 100 yr old balsamic vinegar.

If you’re not taking the wine pairing, I would strongly recommend folks to try out a few of their cocktails, esp. their Negroni (one of the most unique ones I’ve had)

Service was good. The restaurant is able to cater to some food allergies (like my shellfish allergy).

A definite recommendation for fine dining lovers.

Location was not to my liking.
Great staff very welcoming and accomodating to our strict dietary restrictions.
They had to make a menu from scratch for us which gives them bonus points.
Food quality was amazing and the ingredients exquisite.
However, the taste of the food was confusing and frankly bland at times.
But i cannot judge the restaurant fairly as i did not try the actual menu items.

Amazing time at Braci for a birthday celebration for my husband. The Italian food was superb with beautiful floral aesthetic to each dishes. Staff is polite and friendly too! Special thanks to Chef Matteo who is very engaging and make the day extra special! Love the black truffle "hide and seek" dish which is one of the highlights of all dishes! It so savoury and unforgettable….

nice food nice atmosphere. i tot the service could be more positive. but i still enjoy the experience especially on a chill night in the rooftop. overall quite an expensive experience but they were very nice to add an additional anniversary dessert for us:)
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Braci

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Had a great 6 course lunch at Beni! Service was great - the hostess was warm and friendly, and explained dishes clearly. Food was good - subtle flavours that meshed really well together, and beautiful presentation. The lamb in particular was executed perfectly. I also loved the mignardises and that the kitchen was open but calm and not chaotic.

Here for birthday lunch, cosy setting but nothing much to shout about for the interior. Had the lunch menu, food is good but nothing really outstanding that I can remember. Hmm maybe Cherry Gazpacho is quite special. Perhaps its a normal lunch menu, maybe should come back again for special collaborations when they have one.

Some changes to the menu itself. Menu is very refreshing, akin like the Spring season. As always, hostess & chef hospitality are the best. To us, their food, restaurant atmosphere, relationships between staffs & us are what made us being their regulars.

A very nice ambiance intimate dining room that caters to about 6 pax capacity and some counter seats for perhaps, Omakase? Set menus are definitely French and heavy on seafood.

The service was nicely paced, dishes was explained, and professional. Their wine recommendation was good as well.

The presentation of each dish is where the star is. The taste is ok, balanced.

Recommended for date night, probably not the best suit for big  groups or business dinner unless you reserve private room.

We booked the restaurant to celebrate our 25th year wedding anniversary.
We took the $268 set dinner and added on foie gras ($20) for one of our dinner set, and changed one of the dessert to cheese truffle.
All the dishes are wonderfully made, and even the bread basket (uniquely in a cloth pouch) is warm and hot, with specially made bread spread.
The service is amazing and special mentioned to Louis who has made our experience really enjoyable.
We also had Yamanaka-san who personally served us for one of the dishes.
The downside for the place is that it is a small restaurant and seatings are quite closed to one another. It's no issue for us and we mingled with other patrons.
Highly recommended.
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: béni Singapore

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
It is a high-class environment, evoking an upscale atmosphere. While the setting exuded elegance, there's room for improvement in the service department. We did find ourselves waiting a considerable amount of time to place our order.

The restaurant offers a unique amenity: photo-taking services with free prints. However, we encountered a slight hiccup when our photo wasn't promptly printed. A bit of a delay ensued before we finally received our printed photo.

Opting for the anniversary 4-course meal set, which comprised a starter, appetizer, main, dessert, and beverage, we were treated to a mix of flavors. The standout was undoubtedly the signature prime rib, a delectable dish that is an absolute must-try. On the other hand, the braised beef rib fell slightly short of expectations, with the sauce impressing more than the somewhat dry meat.

We indulged in the chocolate cake and strawberry trifle for dessert. While the chocolate cake delighted our taste buds, the strawberry flavor of the trifle didn't quite resonate with our preferences.

Adding to the thoughtful experience, complimentary drinking water was a nice touch, as was the complimentary cake for those celebrating birthdays.

Great ambience, great service.

Only issue is the tenderloin which is too dry. Love their prime steak which is carved for us directly, and love the lobster tail. Salad that comes with each beef dish is magnificently tossed! The pudding is great too

Used the Amex love card and got 35% off for 3
Pax, if not the price can be rather hefty.

I would say the experience in Lawry’s is the best-ever service I have in Singapore. No matter before, during or after the wedding private function, they are keeping their standard very thoughtful, helpful, friendly and even more than I expected. The staff are very considerate and the signature dishes quality are excellent. It is value-for-money to book their restaurant as private function and enjoying the high ceiling with the natural daylight came into the room, which made the event photos came out nicely. Thank you the team who help us out with the background music and the room decoration. We are more than happy to come back again.

Lawry's is the epitome of old school.  From the colossal table-side serving carts to the waitress' uniforms, there is nothing at all modern about the experience.  Luckily for Lawry's , they pull it off where others don't.  How?  The decor, while dated, is clean and presentable.  The waitresses look like they belong in a 1950s TV show, but the service is friendly and impeccable.  So this is a case where old school is retro and kind of fun.  The food is decent, not as spectacular as the prices suggest they should be, but decent.  The spinning salad is a trademark and is excellent.  The Yorkshire puddings were just barely average... they definitely needed seasoning. If you are looking for a slab of beef in a throwback setting, and money is not a problem, this is the place for you.

Celebrated my birthday here and I can say, the foods we ordered were nice! Of course we tried their prime rib which is the star of the night! Will recommend!

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Visited in Sep 2023

A fantastic dining experience. The dry-aged duck main course was absolutely fantastic and so was the fish/turbot main course dish. The beef carpaccio course was also brilliant. The restaurant doesn’t have a non-alcoholic pairing and that’s probably a small area where they can improve their ‘value proposition’.

Service was top notch.

A definite recommendation for a classy dinner experience

Wonderful culinary experience from the start till the end. The location and ambiance is welcoming and cosy, the staff is friendly and took great care of us, the food is delicious, high attention to details and wonderful ingredients from all over the globe. The chef is very talented and creative. The sommelier chose some amazing wines and champagne to pair the dishes with. Amazing experience.

A sensational lunch which well exceeds its price point of $178++ per pax. The only criticism would be that the bread course was uninspiring, but who cares? It’s free anyway. Canapés started with their signature playful tomato soup. Using trompe l’oeil to make it look like tomatoes it’s actually a soft shell with tomato gazpacho encased within. The scallop tartare with avocado and tomato jelly was wonderfully light with all the elements working in harmony. The cod mousse taco was nice but overshadowed by its two counterparts. The first course started with a bang, yellowtail finished table side with a horseradish snow. Light, refreshing and full of flavour with an added air of theatricality for good measure. The second course was Mozambique langoustine which was the highlight of the menu. Sitting on top of a creamy anchovy sauce. The sweetness of the langoustine was a perfect complement to the (not-too) salty sauce. While the gem lettuce added some crunch to contrast with the soft and plump shellfish. This course was pure delight from start to finish! The pasta course was an elevated carbonara which utilised cured egg yolk. It was not too heavy which was a pleasant surprise. The main was veal with white asparagus coated in sabayon in a moscato sauce. The veal was cooked to perfection and the kitchen, once again, demonstrate their attention to detail by ensuring that each dish consists of an equal balance of flavours and textures. The palate cleanser was finished table side with a prickly pear granita, highly refreshing after two somewhat heavier courses. The dessert was the chef’s take on semifreddo using Marsala grapes, dessert wine sauce and clotted cream. Wonderful and I loved the bitterness of the grapes and wine sauce. Overall a spectacular meal, one of the best michelin-starred lunches one can grab in Singapore that showcases high quality ingredients, inventiveness while also not ripping a gigantic hole in one’s pocket. The setting of the restaurant is intimate and perfect for a date or a more private business meeting. Staff are warm, attentive and knowledgeable (and also take good photos). Definitely worth a visit.

Modern Italian restaurant serving interestingly innovative dishes especially the amuse bouches. Wine pairing was generous and well thought out - always a nice way to find new wines if a restaurant gets it right! Service was good. Small but well spaced and clean relaxed ambience.

1st time at their restaurant for dinner. Nice colonial place. Restaurant itself felt inviting. Staffs were all smiling when greeted & warmed when serving food.

Food were great. Wine pairing was generous.

Recommended.
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Buona Terra

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Positively delicious experience. Look no further for fine dining Indian cuisine.
We went for the set lunches vegetarian and non-vegetarian options, everything was amazing, smooth, and superbly well seasoned. Staff was friendly and attentive, and food was served quickly.
Can't recommend enough.

Gives you a fine dining experience. Nice place with tall ceilings and a posh setup. The furniture was good and comfortable. The menu was decent and the taste was unique. Do try the biryani and restaurant recommended dishes.  Expect to spend $80+ ( with svc chr n gst). Felt a little shorthanded on staff and felt rushed towards the end.

High end Indian restaurant in Pan Pacific . Went for lunch the set thali has a lot of variety and has unlimited refills . I would say some of taste could have been better . The service is great the staff friendly and very attentive.

We were there to celebrate our 21st wedding anniversary.  We ordered from the a la carte menu.  The service staff were very friendly and attentive to our needs and offered to help us in any way they could. What came as a surprise was a complimentary slice of cake from the restaurant to celebrate the occasion. Thank you for making the lunch a special one. Highly recommended!

Good Indian Fine Dine, you can certainly experience the quality ingredients, but we as a family personally felt that the masalas have been severely mellowed down to cater to the masses and hence the drift of authenticity from the dishes.

Indian food is all about spices, flavours and for sure calories. We weren’t disappointed at all, just that some dishes could have beer better :)
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.address: 7 Raffles Blvd, Level 3 Pan Pacific, Singapore 039595
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Rang Mahal - Fine Dining Indian Restaurant

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
It could have been a mix of circumstances but a birthday dinner on a week night was a perfect way to enjoy ART. The entire set up of the restaurant ensures privacy and the spacing of tables creates a sense of luxury. We enjoyed the service and interactions with the staff who were helpful, Attentive and knowledgeable. The food was playful and creative with a distinct artistic language that embodied a circular motif seen in most if not all dishes. A feast for the eyes as well as the pallet an evening at ART is recommended for those looking for a slow evening in a fast city. The views of MBS are a plus too.

Been here a few times and the food has been consistently good. It’s my go to place for a fancy lunch with friends / solo lunch. Every dish is absolutely created with so much care and is quite literally, perfect. The pastas here have been on point as well.

The dishes are very “clean” and a delight on the palate with the natural sweetness of the fresh ingredients shining through.
Highly recommend.

One of the best restaurants we've ever had the pleasure of dining in. The location on the rooftop of the art gallery is ideal and offers a superb view of the bay. The dining room is refined and the atmosphere warm in a luxurious setting. As for the cuisine, it's magnificent, with a rich and varied tasting menu, same goes for the wine pairing, and a vegetarian version is available. Finally, the staff memers are at least as good as the food. We look forward to returning on our next visit to Singapore.

The view is fantastic especially by the window. The ambience is relaxing and welcoming. The food is delicious and the 7 course culinary experience brings you to taste many ingredients from all over the world all cooked with the highest level of care and attention to details. The chef Daniele is very talented. The staff is very friendly and took great care of us.

Over 700S$ for such an underwhelming set of food. Although everything was executed and cooked well, it was a very standard and uninspiring menu.

The service was fantastic , extremely knowledgeable and fast but this doesn’t make up for the value for money. When you go to a one starred Michelin restaurant and pay this amount, you naturally expect to have your mind blown with innovation and creativity. The taste was extremely familiar and standard, I do not recommend this place. There are other one starred and two starred Michelin restaurants serving better quality food for a lower price point. My suggestion would be to change the menu and offer different options, it seems like they’ve stuck with the same menu for quite a long time, nothing exciting or new.
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Art di Daniele Sperindio

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
My first 3 star Michelin experience. I found the service a little stiff, as the evening progressed the staff loosened up a bit which was nice, everything was so extra, the presentation of the food was so interesting and exciting. The food was good but I can probably tick off this experience. Make sure you like seafood! A once and a lifetime experience!
It was pretty cool we got to meet the chefs after.

I certainly had very high expectations of Odette, it having 3 Michelin stars and being #14 in The World's 50 Best Restaurants list at the time of the visit (november 2023).

Well, fame is definitely not everything! From start to finish, what lacked was soul and personality, and the whole experience made me think reputation by terms of media and rankings might be increasingly decadent.

To start off, we were offered a small and uncomfortable-looking table right by the entrance door, even though I had reserved a table in the Private Dining Room over a month prior. We had to insist on being placed in the intended room.

The whole time, it felt like we were doing the restaurant a favor being there and I could sense so much pretentiousness in service, food and ambiance. The flavor and even the high quality ingredients were shadowed by this and the gimmicky presentations of the food.

At a USD 500/SGD 700 price point per person (without wine pairing), I most definitely cannot recommend Odette to anyone.

What a lovely and delicious evening out in Singapore. Service was what you would expect from a 3* establishments. All the dishes, from the butter to the pigeon, were out of this world. The staff was well orchestrated and did a great job of providing information on each dish and engaging us in conversation throughout the evening. Having been fortunate enough to dine at other 2 & 3* restaurants around the globe I would put this in my top 3 in a very close race with Mudec in Milan for number 1 and edging out French Laundry in terms of the menu. I will definitely try to secure another reservation next time I'm in Singapore.

Odette has always been on my to-try list and this year I was treated to a birthday dinner here!

An amazing French experience savoring the 7-course meal. We were totally impressed by the presentation as well as the flavour of each dish. Not to mention the excellent and attentive service by the crew! It was also nice of them to gift a bottle of strawberry jam for every guest.

An unforgettable meal, or rather gourmet journey at this 3-starred michelin.

Tried the 7 course meal for a celebratory lunch.

The food was great - loved the Maryuko Uni, smoked organic egg and the desserts. ‘Blanc’ the dessert was phenomenal.

However, service was quite average. The waiters rushed through explanations of their dishes. And while they tried to entertain our questions about the dishes, the way that they did it was quite cursory and generally seemed quite reluctant to hold a conversation.
