Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
I went with my wife during my birthday and we had the set lunch "Two good to Share"

The Tuna Salad, in my opinion too pepper on the Tuna that covers the sweetness of the tuna. The ingredients for the starters are fresh but the sauce is a bit overly sour. The main are good with the beef cheek really soft and juicy. The salmon skin is crispy and not too dry.

The Fried rice was a bit oily and too filling for 2 of us to finish. As for dessert, the ice-cream tasted really nice but I can't identify the flavour

The Service staffs are attentive and bother to explain a bit about the food. As my table was between another 2 tables, I can't help hearing other people's conversations. Perhaps choosing exclusive tables inside the restaurant will be better.

Overall, a happy dining experience with good quality food.

Really enjoyed our meal here. We got the Too Good to Share set meal and the service and the quality of the meal. The attendants were quick to rotate our plates after every course. The food itself was amazing, it was all well seasoned and fresh. We left quite full and had to even take some of the food home. We've had set meals before in other restaurants and this one felt very well worth the price. The space is cooled to a very refreshing temperature especially if you've been walking outside in Singapore it can  start feeling cold after a while so it might be beneficial to bring a light sweater for those sensitive to highly air conditioned space (I enjoyed it personally haha) Looking forward to coming back in the future and trying more of their a la carte items!

A perfect Sunday noon lunch sums up our first visit to Akira Back. Known for its unique menu, this place is a delight for Japanese food lovers. There is a separate veg menu which makes it appealing. Each dish was presented beautifully and tasted equally good. Akira is a great choice to dine with friends and family.

The moment we sat down, we were asked whether we want green tea or sparkling water. We did not ask for detailed and thought the green tea is complimentary (for sure I know we have to pay for sparkling water) and to my surprise the green tea cost $7 each (the most expensive green tea I ever had). Should have read the review at least I won’t get a shock when I see the bill.

Food wise we ordered the Two good to share, the starters were nice, but the salmon was average. Huge portion of Wagu fried rice to fill up your stomach.

Dessert is nicely decorated but it is kind of small for 2 to share.

Japanese fusion food in a modern, swanky setting. Visited 3 times — pre, during and post covid, and I’m glad to say that the food has remained consistent, from the quality down to the plating! The portions are generally medium-sized, and good for sharing between 2-4 pax.

Pls refer to the photo captions for more info.
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Akira Back

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
The staff is AMAZING! Our waiter took special care to ensure that we had really nice pictures for the "birthday cake shot".

The food was nice, but nothing too special.

I would go back for the service and ambience alone.

Went there for lunch for the first time. We had orchid lunch set. Especially love the soup, the smoked duck and the lobster rice/fish noodles. We didn't get to take any photo so just find some photos online to show some of the best dishes we had.
Yes it's pricey, but it's worth the money.

Great food and good service. There were just 2 of us and the restaurant was able to adjust the dim sum portion to 2 pieces each so that we could try more variety. Love that flexibility!

Good ambiance with impressive crockery that have beautiful black brush ink paintings of flowers. Each diner was served your individual bowl of fried cashew nuts as appetisers instead of communal serving in most Chinese restaurants. Nice touch!

We had steamed live prawns that were served with very fine strips of ginger, scallions and chilli in a light sauce for dipping. A silver finger bowl with a lemon slice was provided. Nice touch!

Ingredients used in Sze Chuan Styled Stewed Sea Cucumber Fish Maw and Braised Bean Curd Bamboo Pith were fresh and good quality. However the flavours of both were not memorable and the gravy for the beancurd had too much cornstarch.

Fried Rice Crab Meat with Dried Scallops was full of "wok hei". The only dish that left a good impression.

Good hospitality for there is no charge for warm water.

I was here on a weekday afternoon (prior reservation is recommended). The place quickly got crowded at around 1pm, mostly with business folks who presumably were there for lunch meetings.

Excellent place for dim sum. The food isn't cheap here, but what you get in return is high-quality food, in fact the best dim sums in town, and excellent service.
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Summer Pavilion

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
5 course lunch menu ($98 plus $38 for grouper)
1. Black Angus beef tartare, truffle - Good.
2. Scallop, white asparagus, karasumi - Fine.
3. Gnocchi, duck confit, penny bun (porcini mushroom), foie gras - Good, rich flavours.
4. Himono grouper, mussels, greens, lobster foam, Giavieri osietra caviar - Just ok.
5. Mascarpone tart, buckwheat gelato - Fine.
Bonne bouche - Enjoyed the raspberry pate de fruits. The orange and passionfruit canele, the madeleine, and the yuzu berry were fine.

A visual delight and a treat for the taste buds. The 9 dishes were all more succulent than the others.
Thanks to Chef Roberto and his teams for this unique experience

A wonderful find in Singapore. Italian-Asian food done exceptionally well. The fish was some of the best we have had, and Chef Roberto really knows how to mix seemingly simple ingredients to create flavors that really create an impact. Amazing service as well from the staff, and the Chef was really kind in accommodating our dietary restrictions in the last minute. We will definitely be back. Thank you for a wonderful evening!

The one Michelin Star unfortunately went away, along with the previous head-chef when he departed in January.

With the new captain at the helm, the food has fallen extremely short of expectation, bringing the experience further down as the subsequent dishes arrive one by one.

The Hamachi starter was too salty. Period.

The next starter, black angus beef tartare with quail egg and truffle was introduced with a supposedly “magic powder” that is the dehydrated truffle. But no taste of truffle found. The caper-tartare ratio was skewed too much to the caper, which added an unnecessarily overly salty flavour to the dish (again).

Risotto is extremely normal without any outstanding point but fortunately bland to counter the first two dishes’ saltiness.

The himono grouper main dish was again, bombarded by too much salt again, and was sent back to the kitchen. The refired dish was more edible this time round, but at this point, we were already exhausted by the unpleasant experience.

The next main dish, wagyu beef cheek was the only pleasant dish that arrived. The meat was cooked to perfection and “soft as butter” is the perfect phrase to describe it. However, the truffle jus, similar to the earlier dish, had no hint of truffle at all.

Lastly the dessert and bonne bouche, which was meant to be a sweet ending, did not fulfill its purpose.

This is a restaurant where complacency after getting a Michelin Star, would eventually be its downfall.

I visited this restaurant to enjoy lunch set menus.
All dishes are taste nice and looks beautiful. Most impressed dish is HIMONO grouper. HIMONO is one of the processes of dry-aging.
The grouper meat is chewy and it’s surface is crispy. Those combination made me enjoying and satisfied.
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Restaurant Reve - Singapore

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Great intimate place for that romantic dinner  without breaking the wallet.
Somewhat good place for business dinner too. No kids under 14 are allowed.
Skip the high heels, if you don't normally wear them daily though.

78$ pp for free flow lunch. Brought a Thai friend as I heard many good reviews about this place. But sadly the food was very salty and chicken in the green curry was rather dry and tough. Beef was tough as well. Restaurant was quite warm. Total damage 185$ after GST. There’s free parking around the corner for about 10 cars.

You will forget that you are in Singapore while you are here. You can be expecting tip top level of service while you enjoy your meal in the beautiful restaurant on the hill. Really love the architecture and chandeliers hanging in the bar area. The food itself I think is quite average as I had better Thai food elsewhere. Personally, I think they are a bit too heavy handed on the MSG as I usually feel very parched after eating here. Overall, I think it’s a really good place to hang out and have drinks with friends in a more secluded area of Singapore.

Attending a wedding event. Nice environment. Good for chill out. The food is just ok for me. But the environment is good for meeting and chatting people with people.

The building itself was beautiful typical colonial building. Inside was quiet and while there was 5 of us and we made our own atmosphere it was very quiet. We went on a Thursday so maybe at weekends it’s busier?! The food was lovely.
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Tamarind Hill

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Food is alright, flavours are all good but nothing too spectacular.

The seafood in the calamari platter was fresh, no weird tastes. Pizza is on the average side. Crab pasta tasted like the non-spicy version of chilli crab which is quite unique. Would say the fish was the best. The fish itself is roasted very well and also love the layered potatoes.

Overall, felt that it was Italian cuisine tailored to the Singaporean palate. Also, the restaurant is understaffed, there was only two service-crew serving everyone. Atmosphere-wise, it’s on the top  level of the hotel but there’s no views of anything. It was basically a poolside restaurant with the occasional crying / screaming of kids and babies in the pool.

Would only recommend if you are hotel guest or looking for a casual restaurant in the area.

When you're looking for a less crowded Italian restaurant on Orchard Road, this is a good place to hide. Nice small restaurant, located on the Rooftop of Voco Hotel. The food is good, but it could be better. Service staff were wonderful and knowledgeable of the menu.

I’ve visited with my mom during singapore trip. They served great dishes. I especially recommend Truffle Burrata Cheese Pizza. The staff who is Korean guy is very kind and professional. We had a good moment because of him. I want to thank you to he and rest of all staffs.

Love the ambience of this roof top bar as well as the service received!

Thank you Cai Ying, Jeremy and Owen for the exceptional services during my dinner at il Cielo, thank you for making it easy and enjoyable for me and my 5 year old son.

Special mention to Cai Ying, who was especially attentive to all my needs and food recommendations were superb (look at the photos!)

Of course, thank you to Chef Marco and Chef Beh Li for making my foodie son crave for the food even more after we left the restaurant.

Would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who is looking to have a quiet evening with pool and view of Orchard!

Do try the Burrata Purgilese and the Tiramisu! These 2 are my favourites!

I had a really lovely lunch with my family. It was a special occasion to celebrate and the food and service was excellent (the pool view is great as well). The staff Owen made our day and we genuinely enjoyed our time there. Thanks team!!

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Incredible service!  The staff were attentive along with being very knowledgeable of the menu.  A major thank you to Joanne and her colleague who made our visit special.

Myself and my wife went for the set menu.  It was exceptional, especially the black cod with the seaweed caviar.

Along with this the atmosphere was great and the views as you'd expect were fantastic.

I would highly recommend guests to visit this restaurant, during their stay.

We had an amazing, professional and kind host. Chef prepared delectable meals. Spago provided a delightful and memorable experience for all the senses. We thank you for the very kind offerings for our birthday and graduation celebration. The dessert and cards were a meaningful touch. You have gone above and beyond and I would highly recommend your esteemed establishment. A wonderful evening all round with a sensational view. You have managed to keep in step with Wolfgang Puck’s reputation and have done him proud.

The lunch set is really worth the money, even if you choose to do a top up for the more premium options. Mocktails were good too, but nothing spectacular. The service was great, despite the minor mix up with my salmon which didn't come fully cooked (we made a special note for no raw food since I'm heavily pregnant). That was quickly rectified and while waiting, my husband and I were happy to enjoy another round of their breads. Their breads are amazing, please don't skip them. Overall, I'd definitely return with my husband for special occasions. Do note that children below the age of 8 won't be able to dine here, so parents with young children may have to consider elsewhere.

Definitely an experience of its own. Came here for lunch and the staff are so friendly and professional.

The 3 course dishes was recommended by the staff and the food was cook to perfection with great presentation!

Atmosphere was great with views of the sea and the other side of the city! Definitely will come again!

Breakfast with a view: I enjoyed breakfast at Spago and loved how it’s a semi-buffet concept. There’s a small but adequate menu from which you can select items like pancakes, eggs florentine, dim sum, noodle soup and various juices, which are brought to your table. As I was pretty tired, I stuck to this service. However if you prefer, you may also roam the buffet stations for other items like yoghurt, which my energetic son did. I would recommend going earlier to avoid the crowd. This breakfast space opens as early as 7am.
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.address: 10 Bayfront Avenue L57, Sands SkyPark, Hotel, Tower 2, 018956
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Spago Dining Room

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
We had a great dinner to celebrated our 24th wedding anniversary there.Service was really good , we served by Ariana . She is very friendly Taiwanese lady . she recommended some food for us & was really good. I am so pleased for their service . We really enjoyed our beautiful dinner , although that day was a heavy raining day . We also so impressive to get a complimentary Champagne & small cake for our anniversary . Thumb up 👍 for their service

We had the best time here on 27 Dec. Did a last min reservation for a family member's birthday. Service was good and the food was really tasty without it being overpowering. Ambience is nice indoors rather than outdoors imo and also since it was drizzling that day. After dinner, you could consider sitting at the alfresco area for drinks and admire the view of Marina Bay.

The food was really amazing! The starters are awesome with cheese and cold cuts. The source with sweetness and saltiness match perfectly. The ravioli was really good! I am a huge ravioli lover and not everywhere can be able to produce good ravioli pasta! One of the best I have ever had.
As for the desserts, tiramisu is my all time fav! And this place brought the A game for the dessert!
Best thing is the view. You’ll have indoors and outdoors sitting. If you’re one looking for great view and great food please try this place. It is really amazing!

As I took in the panoramic view of Marina Bay Sands from my table at Dolce Vita Singapore, I was struck not only by the beauty of the iconic landmark, but also by the tranquil ambience that pervaded the restaurant. Despite its bustling location in the heart of the city, the peaceful atmosphere of the restaurant allowed me to fully immerse myself in the flavors and textures of the food.

couldn't help but feel grateful for the rare combination of stunning views and quiet ambience that Dolce Vita provided and delicious food - Overall, the pesto pasta dish at this Italian restaurant is a sublime culinary experience that is not to be missed. The balance of flavors and textures is a testament to the chef's skill and dedication to their craft. If you're looking for an authentic taste of Italy, this dish is a must-try.

My wife and I had a great experience dining at Dolce Vita. The food was well presented and tasted great, and the atmosphere complimented a romantic night out. A highlight of the night was the authenticity and personality of the staff. A special mention to Alex and Suzanne who were both welcoming, personable, and resonated the true spirit of Italian hospitality.
Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.name: Dolce Vita

Fine dining restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Awesome food, atmosphere, settings and service. The whole restaurant is really pretty. While enjoying our food, we were also very busy taking photos. If you feel like pampering yourself with a good meal. You can really consider this restaurant. We had a wonderful and memorable time there.

Celebrating my husband’s birthday 🎂 great food, we opt for 4 course meal lunch and every dish has its surprise never to expect how delicious it was.  We sat at the table where were able to look at the chef prepare the dishes. We enjoy very much.  The price was reasonable too!  Will definitely drop by again. Thumbs up! 👍🏻

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Caviar, and I cannot say enough about the remarkable service provided by two of their staff members, Rahul and Harry. From the moment I walked through the door, it was evident that I was in for a memorable dining experience. Rahul and Harry welcomed me with warm smiles and a genuine enthusiasm that set the tone for the entire dinning experience. Their professionalism and attentiveness were truly remarkable. They made me feel like a valued guest from start to finish. What impressed me the most was their impeccable timing. My courses were served with precision, and they ensured that my water glass was never empty. Their ability to anticipate my needs and preferences was truly exceptional, making me feel pampered and well taken care of throughout. Rahul and Harry's unwavering commitment to delivering top-tier service elevated my dining experience to new heights. They went above and beyond to ensure that my experience was not just memorable, but truly exceptional. I am genuinely grateful for their exceptional service.

We opted for the Lunch Tasting Menu which offered  a 4-course menu (Baerii) priced at $88++ and a 5-course menu (Kaluga) for $139++. The menu included delightful selections like Amuse Bouche, Amaebi Tartare, Le Caviar Soup (exclusive to the 5-course option), Uni Pasta (my personal favourite), a choice of mains featuring Jerusalem Artichoke Risotto, Horse Mackerel, Wagyu Beef Short Ribs, and concluded with the delightful Orange Madeline. Every dish, including the Brioche served with kombu seaweed butter, was absolute masterpiece. While the first 3/4 courses left us utterly impressed, the mains, particularly the Horse Mackerel, leaned slightly towards an acidic note, which was not to our liking. We also had the Wagyu Beef Short Rib was braised and rather decent.

If you're looking for a dining experience that combines delectable cuisine with unparalleled service, be sure to visit Caviar and ask for Rahul and Harry. They are the true stars of this establishment, and they will make your visit one to remember. Bravo!

𝘾𝙖𝙫𝙞𝙖𝙧 had an exciting new lunch menu. When we visited, the vibes there were cosy and chill - a contrast to the luscious metal tubs of fresh caviar which sat in front of us. We started off their 4 𝙘𝙤𝙪𝙧𝙨𝙚 𝙡𝙪𝙣𝙘𝙝 𝙩𝙖𝙨𝙩𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙢𝙚𝙣𝙪 with the 𝙖𝙢𝙪𝙨𝙚 𝙗𝙤𝙪𝙘𝙝𝙚: a small pastry filled with beef, truffle mushroom, and creme fraise, right from the chef’s selection!

Following this, we were served their 𝙝𝙤𝙪𝙨𝙚 𝙗𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙙 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝙨𝙚𝙨𝙖𝙢𝙚. As always, house bread tastes the best, especially so when paired with their creamy homemade butter with seaweed.

The 𝙖𝙢𝙖𝙚𝙗𝙞 was a dish that featured fresh tiny prawns in a concoction of buttermilk and chestnut chunks. The sourness and tanginess paired well with the sweet seafood. The deep fried prawn head added a crispy touch!

We did not expect how rich (and how jelat D:) the next dish was. The 𝙪𝙣𝙞 𝙥𝙖𝙨𝙩𝙖 was drenched in an umami sauce that was a bit too much for our tastebuds. The salted lemon rind did not bring enough acidity to help either, but we must say that the uni was fresh.

The 𝙬𝙖𝙜𝙮𝙪 𝙗𝙚𝙚𝙛 𝙘𝙝𝙚𝙚𝙠 was cooked to a perfect medium rare. The miso mash potato, broccolini, and brussel sprouts though plated clumsily were well-curated garnishes. On the contrary, the beautifully crafted 𝙠𝙖𝙣𝙥𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙞 - better known as the yellowtail fish - was on the drier side. The fennel, fish broth, and trout roe were nice but not outstanding complements to the fish.

To top it all off, we enjoyed their 𝙨𝙖𝙠𝙚𝙡𝙚𝙚𝙨 homemade ice cream. This was a pleasant dessert that was creamy, delightful, and not too sweet!

Overall, the lunch tasting menu by Caviar was decent, but had nothing to shout about. With its fair share of hits and misses, we felt that one flaw was actually the lack of caviar. Perhaps a small little scoop would have sufficed - just for a taste! Nevertheless, we appreciated the effort that Caviar made in creating new flavours and bringing new items to the menu.

Follow us on IG @toofoodtomiss for more foodie content!

Caviar was featured in the soup and dessert for the lunch course set that we had. Main courses were decent and generally the dishes were cream based.

Good for an experience.

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
Has a warm welcome into the restaurant. However service staff were kind of slow when taking orders and preparing food orders. We had a long wait for our food to be served. Food portion was huge and was tasty. Price is also on the higher side. But ambience was good. Especially if you wanna chill with friends and family over food.

The food taste average. The only nice thing is the hot chocolate which serves with the Turkish tin. Not so satisfied with the service. We finished the food and decided to stay for a while longer. Without asking for the bills, the waiter passed us the bill. Would appreciate if they don’t do this to customers 😅 it made us feel like we are supposed to leave right after eating without the peace to stay a bit longer and we were there from 4.10pm to 4.50pm and it wasn’t even crowded. Very disappointing for such quality and service at such a venue.

Very nice brunch option. Great atmosphere. You should be mindful you should book a reservation to avoid eating at the bar and that there is a time restriction after which the next batch comes in.
The menu is pretty good but it was surprising to see some classics missing like veg scrambled eggs or eggs benedict.
Dishes are pretty big and high quality. We will definitely come back.

First time having wild honey.
Nice food.
We had quite a “surprise” on the first time ever at wild honey. It ended well.
I hope to see improvements over the check in the supply of bagels.

I had a wonderful birthday dinner here 🥰. The space is cozy and spacious, the food is delicious and healthy (not too sweet, or too salty). Staff are enthusiastic and friendly. The restaurant also gave me a surprise when giving me a slice of birthday cake beautifully decorated with candle. 🫶🏻 Thanks

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
Personally likes the vibes and environment here. But if you prefer a quiet place to discuss or chit chat, it might be not suitable.
The food is superb. I am willing to come back for their grilled octopus. I seldom eat octopus, but yea, their grilled octopus surprisingly delicious. 👍🏻🤓

Happened to park just right outside the shop and decided to have lunch here.

I remembered I used to frequent this place many years ago. However, it's quite difficult to get the roadside parking.

The coffee here is still as enjoyable. the price for the main course is kinda steep.

We ordered 2 drinks and 1 chicken burger and 1 salmon.

The total bill is about 90ish.

Might not come back so soon.

Service and ambience are good.

Have visited Symmetry quite a few times. Really like the menu here with the Shakshouka being my favourite. Vegetarian options available too.

Good, fast, efficient service. Reservation is recommended as the place can get quite crowded, esp. on weekends.

A really good place to have brunch/lunch and a boozy one too.

came here twice, the food overall are pretty good, especially their Benedict. (Still a little greasy in the end)
however, there was an aged waiter, don’t know if it’s their manager ( if it is, their training is awful 😅), keep pushing us. Bill and take away our cutlery…

quaint and pretty café.

we ordered their big breakfast and waffles. personally felt that their big breakfast tasted average, but their waffles on the other hand were so good!! the sourness of the fresh berry compote helped to balance out the sweetness from the maple syrup, and the blueberry icecream was perfect (wasn’t too sweet). they served a pretty mean coffee too, really aromatic blend.

chill vibes all around, can’t wait to be back!

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
The food quality and taste are constantly nice. Staff are friendly and attentive. It’s one of our staple dining options at Dempsey hill. They also update their menu time to time. The indoor dining area is nicely cooled with spacious seating. However, it is quite noisy during weekend peak hours.
Overall, we like this place and often bring home chocolates and cheese after the meal.

Just the right ambience and choice of songs for a chill and relaxing night for a good gathering with friends… and the crew were very nice to always check in with us to see what we needed… and it was very sweet of the crew to offer us the free desserts … 🥰 will be back

Love the atmosphere.
Food wise slightly above average and there's room for improvement. To highlight, the fish finger is too fishy.  Service team maybe need to be more attentive. Overall still a good place to hang out

My first visit to Dempsey project and it won’t be my last for sure. Food is great not just taste but presentation and creativity! The ambience is perfect especially for pet lovers. Staff are extremely friendly, prompt in servicing and very helpful. Eg. gave us decent advice where to sit to avoid morn sun. Staff was eager to please. Very impressed with the crew professionalism and attitude.

Once in a while when I want to have a carefree breakfast/brunch - I am reminded of these place. The environment in Dempsey certainly helps - and the food selection for breakfast menu has improved tremendously since a couple of years ago.

I do enjoy the breakfast… tasty… but the coffee is a bit of a letdown. For the price offering - I would expect a full bodied aroma coffee without the need of extra shot.

Price wise? Definitely on the pricier end - what is to say with the morning at Dempsey and a relaxing breakfast in an old colonial building.

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
Let me tell you, I enjoyed this brunch so much to the point that I think I can brunch there every week for the rest of my life and not get bored.

It has a very trendy interior, and the waiters are very helpful and friendly. We got the truffle scrambled eggs and the prawn and scallop special scrambled eggs. The eggs was creamy, perfectly cooked and the combination of truffle on one dish and mixed seafood on the other was like an explosion of flavor in my mouth, simply amazing.

For dessert, we got the pandan cakes and ice blended salted caramel latte and ice blended mocha, which is the restaurant's signature and it was the best ice blended drink I ever tried. It was creamy, rich in flavors and just satisfies your taste buds

The prices are reasonable, especially for the service and the quality of the ingredients used, maybe I will be back one day

They have improved their food and drinks. Had a great time here. The wait of 30 minutes was worth it. Must try their rosti. Crispy and delicious. The staff are friendly and responsive. It will be one of my frequented cafes. Highly recommended. Their ice blended drinks is thick and flavourful unlike some of the franchise cafes.

Super crowded, with Queue. Had to wait a good hour before we could enter.

Food is good. Notably the rosti, laksa pasta and pork cheeks.

Visited Tolido’s on a Thursday morning for brunch and it was packed with tourists!
My favourite was the Truffle Scrambled Eggs and Salted Caramel Ice Blended Mocha! Portion for the mains were big and damnn… it tasted amazing!! Best of all, pricing of their food and drinks were super reasonable as compared to other cafes.. 2 pax (2 mains  + 2 drinks) for only $56! They have lunch sets and promotions going on as well. This cafe is now my no.1 go-to cafe! Highly recommend!

My go-to cafe for reliably delicious and reasonably priced food. Coffee is a bit of a hit-and-miss (Douglas the boss makes it the best) so if the consistency improves, there is literally nothing else to complain about other than the long queues that are a testament to Tolido's popularity. Highly highly recommend their prawn laksa pasta. I've tried many others and they've all paled in comparison.

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
Excellent place to grab a leisurely brunch if you are in the east. Was there with friends and we had a good catch-up over brunch.
The portions of food were very big, enough for a full lunch actually, but this is reflected in the pricing.
They have a delightful policy of letting kids eat free on weekdays though, so you may want to consider some bonding with your child during the upcoming school holidays!

Very tasty food with a lot of healthy choices available in the menu.

The interior is lush with greens and design is clean and minimal. The soft music in the background brings good vibes to the atmosphere.

We ordered the pancakes, baked Atlantic salmon and smoked salmon avocado sourdough toast. All 3 of them are great! Very reasonably price and the price in the menu is the nett price you pay (no GST and service charge).

Highly recommend to try out this place and I will definitely come back again. The downside is, very hard to find parking if you’re driving down.

Lazy Sunday perk up with Grab order.
We ordered a variety of brunch meals and it came up to be near 100 bucks on the bill.

The food kept its flavour despite taking out.

Nutty Banana Croissant
Peanut butter with a generous spread of granola and banana held together by a lightly toasted croissant. Now for a good balance, they’ve thrown in some berries! Lovely and filling.

Grilled Chicken Burger
The fries was soggy. Now this is a global problem that requires attention. How the hell can you retain the integrity of delivery fries?
The buns was nice and the chicken patty was well grilled and juicy.

Mr Frank
This looks big and intimidating.
Not sure if we got around to finish it but for 17 bucks it’s something you can share!

Good Day Breakfast
This was a mash up of everything you would expect in an English breakfast. There’s salad, sausages, avocado and sourdough. I need a good cup of tea.

We’ve been to the cafe before.
Bright and airy. Lots of plants - but I think they need TLC.

It’s a safe bet guys. Go order and share the plates.

Stopped by for a simple drink and snack on a Sunday afternoon. The place had very nice vibes and the drinks were good.

My only wish was that we had space in our stomachs to try more of their food selection. Will definitely be back for another try the next time I’m in the area.

Excellent place for brunch . Neat and clean  setting . Food is great . Portions are big . Staff is friendly . What else can you ask for ? Keep it up team . Thanks 👍

Brunch places in Singapore.name: 6 Letter Brunch

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
There is truly something special about this brunch place. Not sure if it's the decadent food, the superb service or the fantastic atmosphere and decor.

I first ordered their homemade cold mocha brew, and it was very rich in flavor and literally the best way to start your day. For the mains, we ordered fried chicken topped on a crispy spring onion pancake and a giant croissant filled with creamy scrambled eggs and sizzling bacon. I loved both of them, not sure which one more. The pancakes with chicken was very hearty and the egg and bacon croissant is a classic. We ordered their walnut cheesecake for dessert to split and it was moist, but firm at the same time with a tasty frosting. The food prices may seem expensive, but for the great quality ingredients and inspired plates you are getting, it's totally worth it.

The restaurant is a bit small and can be very busy, so make sure to reserve before hand. The cooks are very talented, apparently they won quite a few competitions in the past.

The fried chicken on scallion pancake was excellent, the 3pc chicken thighs are stacked together and 2 time fried how your karaage comes out in izakaya. I couldn’t taste much of the pancake but overall the spicy mayo drizsled on top was a good balance. Juicy tender dark meat, my absolute favorite of a chicken part🤗

Lamb shakshuka was quite mushy! But it was very tasty. Bread soaked the mushiness and stain, great balance of the wet and dry.

Maple butter tater tots were quite an invention. It is sweet, I might prefer the good ol original tater tots. These are good to lunch on, the sweet taste spreads and overcome the potato and on some pieces you can taste the butteryness like a nicely soaked butter popcorn.

Houjicha latte was one of the best lattes I’ve had! I got iced. I think they used soy milk? Not sure but very tastey and not too sweet, just how I like it!!

I can’t wait to come back to try their lobster tail seafood linguine. It was too much fried stuff for my brunch today :(

Amazing food overall. Ambiance very basic. Nice busy spot for a weekend catch up with absolutely delicious food!!!

Reserve ahead for the weekend, 75 min dine-in time as it’s super busy. Came for the buckwheat pancakes and loved it. Blueberry compote with fresh fruits and crispy cornflakes crumble complement the  grainy and soft yet moist and fluffy pancake (sounds crazy). Very filling. Scrambled Eggs and harissa fried eggs with lamb are good too.

Went for brunch on 5/8 and had a good experience there overall.

Food: Had seafood pasta (which had an savoury and interesting taste that I like and hence devoured), truffle fries (your usual fries) and waffle ice cream! Okay not too bad but not like super fantastic.

Service: Very prompt, the servers noted our requests throughout meals and food arrived quickly too. Kudos to them for the good service!

Food was meh.
The all day breakfast was too oily.
The beef was a bit too overcooked and was too tough.
The truffle fries didn’t have much truffle taste.
The seafood pasta sauce tasted weird and didn’t have much seafood taste.

The cold brew mocha was good. Hot mocha was too milky for our liking. The matcha was decent.

Probably will not order their mains again.

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
Spacious dining area good atmosphere. Feels great with high ceiling. Enough staff running around.

My wife love the pizza very thin crust. I personally like the cream sauce with the Macaroni. Very rich in taste. The nachos beef  was great, crispy thin tortilla. Food portion were great with lots of filling on the pizza.

Keep it up! Thumbs up

Nice spot for a relaxing day! Outdoor or glass window seats are preferable as we can enjoy the greenery scene outside while having a meal. The staff is helpful. The food is not outstanding but not bad at all. Will definitely go back!

Had their seafood pan. I must say the bread they served was amazing. It’s crispy on the outside, soft and moist on the inside, more importantly, the bread was warm when served. A perfect combination to dip into the seafood pan.

Visited before and tried the Lamb and Prawn Rose this time around. The Lamb was super soft but a little bland, while the Prawn Rose was nice.

There is a playpen for kids at the outdoor tables, hence we weren't able to enjoy much of the nature ambience. However, those with kids would enjoy it.

Food will always be subjective but for us, it's good! Especially the shrimp aglio olio, calamari and the mini burger. Their breakfast is not bad as well, love the sandwich. Their milk shakes are tasty, must try the baileys espresso shake.

Brunch places in Singapore.name: Whisk & Paddle

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
Food was really yummy, one of the nicer cafe/western foods around! We got the spicy calamari, pork ribs, fish and chips, mushroom soup. Highly recommend each of them! Chill ambience with nice music. Want to give a special shout-out to our server, Chloe, who was super kind and attentive throughout our dinner, which made all the difference :) thank you Chloe! For making our birthday dinner a very pleasant one with your thoughtfulness and friendliness :)

Food standard is great here 👍
We ordered ceaser salad , crab spaghetti and aquapazza. Spaghetti and aquapazza are delicious.

We visited here for brunch around 11am for 2 pax walk-in.
There were few people inside. I requested bigger table as I got a lot of stuffs on my hand and not much customer inside, but a lady staff looks obviously not happy that I requested that.
We left restaurant around 1pm, but restaurant has not packed during our brunch. I am not sure why the lady was so unwillingly give us a bigger seat.

Overall, although the price is not reasonable, it’s still good restaurant in terms the quality of the foods and the atmosphere.

The cafe is part of hotel with separate entrance from mall. Very nice brunch spot. Ordered fish taco and baked egg. Baked egg is petty good because I love chorizo. But fish taco is slightly disappointing. Too much batter and lack of citric flavor
Their dessert menu is also limited. Thrifts, tried their tasting coffee set. MAD milk is naturally sweet from date, interesting idea.

This is an outlet I visited before with the missus and today I decided to invade Oriole with the 3 monkeys !!! The girls loved the overall decoration, they claimed it’s cozy and homely haha. Anyway, all the dishes were ordered by them and they sang super high praises for “whatever-they-ordered” (laughs). They loved the silky and smooth mushroom soup; THEY LOVED THE CHICKEN WINGS !!! They basically loved everything hahaha. We will be back for more Oriole, many thanks for hosting us well, till then !!!

We walked in on a Sunday afternoon and Jazzy assisted us. My aunt had a bad back and requested for sofa seat. Because most of the sofa seats were taken due to reservations, Jazzy mentioned she would try her best. After awhile, she came over and mentioned that the seat was available as they managed to get a sofa seat for us. Jazzy was very helpful throughout and her willingness shined through

We ordered the Sweet Soy Pork Ribs which was rather tender and the Smoked Salmon Waffles which was good. Overall a great experience and special shout out to Jazzy who was helpful, patient and an asset to the service industry :)

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
We loved this spot while visiting Singapore!! We loved it so much, we went back two mornings in a row for breakfast, lol! We loved their banana porridge, avocado toast and early grey pancakes. All so well thought out  and so flavourful. The service was excellent as well. It’s a perfect breakfast/brunch spot!

Ordered Earl Grey Pancakes, Poached Eggs with Avocado, Grilled Cheese Sandwich and Reuben Sandwich.
Pancakes seems simple 3-piece with chocolate sauce, a half of pear and crushed nuts.  Nothing really wow… Find it super overpriced.
Grilled cheese sandwich is pretty good and again, very simple toast bread with cheese, plus a simple light favoured tomato soup. Overpriced.
Poach eggs with avocado (guacamole).  Simple taste.
Reuben sandwich is quite okay. Not anything above average.
Overall, for the price tags, it’s not up to the standard or delivering the worth it value.
The outdoor setting is nice though, but due to its a public holiday, dine in time is limit to 1hr.
Well, it’s not going to bring me there for a second time.

Went for lunch. Laksa burger - Not much laksa taste. Aglio Olio - tiger prawn was quite small. Taste was ok. Coffee was good in general. We tried long black, latte and cappuccino. Tiramisu is not too soft and wet. Pricing is above average. Probably more suitable for breakfast, coffee and dessert. Reservation - 24hr in advance. Walk in ok

Second visit - made reservations. Service was still good. This time i tried the sandwich. It was good n filling. Better to share ☺️

The food was okay. Overpriced considering the portion size. Limited indoor and outdoor seating available. We came close to opening time so we had no wait. Service was friendly.

We had a decent meal but not good enough to repeat.

Food was okay. I ordered french toast but i found it was quite dry and not a lot of sauce. I ordered their Avocado toast dish and this ine was better.

Place was quite lively and staff was very friendly. I can tell they are really happy when customers come and they welcome you readily. Aunty serving was also very attentive.

I do hope they become more successful in the future!

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
Amazing as always. The food is of a high standard. I do love Wild Honey at Mandarin Gallery as the customer service and the Manager named Ms Jocelyn Abrahan is amazing. However, the Manager at Scotts is a business focused that she forgot the human-touched. But overall is good as per Wild Honey standards but they can do better in customer service.

Wonderful get together lunch. Food was perfect and service was impeccable with good ambience. My only complaint is the expensive parking in the building. Coffee ice cubes with milk is unusual drink. Ice chocolate was perfect without being too sweet. They were also able to help split the bill so we didn’t hv to do a separate split among ourselves.

We were here over the weekend 12Nov  to celebrate a special milestone birthday for a loved one. The service was excellent right from the word go! Everything was done with much care and thoughtfulness by the reservations team (special thanks to Diana for attending to my queries ever so patiently) as well as the whole team at the
restaurant - manager and staff, on the day of our celebration. We took the suggestion to pre-order from the set menu for our big group and that worked out well because the staff were ready with our 'personalised' orders when we arrived. Food was really good, especially loooove the Coconut Cake which I ordered in advance. The birthday boy had a memorable day. THANK YOU!! We will definitely come back again.

Love this restaurant! A lot of variety and food is always good. This location is really great! Love the ambiance. It tends to get busy any time so make that reservation!

This Wild Honey branch is located at Scotts Square, Level 3. The path upwards was scenic with many shops below this cafe.  We ordered the Norwegian fish and it was yummy! For the drinks, we ordered Chai latte and Pink Flamingo (green) hot tea by TWG. The tea was ok. The ambience was nice and cosy. It was a quieter lunch as it was the school holidays. Reserved seats but saw that there were extra table/seat spaces if were to walk in. Unfortunately, both my friend and myself had mild food poisoning from eating the same dish. Hope the kitchen will look into this.

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
It was my first visit with my wife to Merci Marcel, we were delighted by the overall vibes of the restaurant. We ordered the eggs Ben and French Toast Brioche, latte and flat white. The food and coffee were excellent, the portion of eggs Ben was a bit small though. A great place to chill!!

My first visit to Merci Marcel and my friends and I had a good time bonding over the food and the servers were great, especially Marilyn who was patient in giving us and overview of food selects and sharing the specials of the day. Soft yellow lighting gave it a nice cosy family/friends evening gathering atmosphere vibes. Thumbs up!

Good services. Food is presented artistically.
Latte is nice with a cute pattern, although this pattern is not very stable.
The French toast is okay. A bit pricy but understandable because this is Orchard.
Good environment with sunshine.

Very good! Although we didn't have a reservation, they managed to fit us in. The staff were all friendly and provided a fast and efficient service. The food and coffee were amazing, not to mention the cafes' atmosphere was very relaxing. It was a lovely breakfast and experience.

Amazing place, nice atmosphere. Food was excellent but the portions are small (unless you ordered pizza). Also on the higher price range, so do take note. Great for special occasions though!
Brunch places in Singapore.opening_hours:

Brunch places in Singapore.address: 390 Orchard Road, 01-03 Palais Renaissance, 390 Orchard Rd, #01 - 03 / 04, Singapore 238871
Brunch places in Singapore.name: MERCI MARCEL ORCHARD

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
Not much sitting space. Had to sit outside for a while and thankfully someone left so managed to go inside. Music is not too loud and quite cozy. As expected coffee house food is what you expect, price around 20 and above. It’s a reasonable portion though the steak hash is really more worth it than their everyday breakfast. Thank goodness water is free and most services are digitalized so no need to take order. Food arrived quite timely too so no need wait too long. Maybe will come back again when I feel more willing to spend but generally not my style of dining. Service was quite mediocre cos it’s a young crowd servicing.

banana bread was a 10/10! super moist, came slightly warm, and very strong and satisfying banana flavour. the cream on top (tasted like coffee), together with the tartness of the berries and crunchiness of the nuts gave a good variance of taste and texture.

the wurst rosti was also satisfying. the potatoes were crispy and the sausage was bursting with cheesy goodness. though, the default egg option is sunny side-up, and we paid $1.50 to have it changed to scrambled. the eggs were texturally perfect, though a bit bland. but when paired with the saltiness of the sausage, it was okay.

i’ve seen a lot of rave reviews about the carbonara but unfortunately i found it average at best. it was creamy and the mushrooms were good, but overall the flavour just felt flat. could use a bit of salt to make it more… moreish.

we also ordered a mocha and a filter coffee. the mocha had a strong chocolate flavour and a thick, luxurious mouthfeel. the filter coffee was interesting. it’s also great that they have so many filter options! (8)

overall a bit pricey ($86.84), but it was a pleasant dining experience with good food. we sat outside on a cloudy day and it wasn’t hot at all.

Pretty decent food and coffee, a little pricy. Scrambled eggs are nicely seasoned and cooked to perfection. Rosti could be crispier and flatter, a little too thick for my liking. The waffles was great, fragrantly toasted and soft in the inside and crisp on the outside. Avocado can add a little more seasoning. Truffle fries, average. Ice latte was nice, pretty decent coffee, freshly roasted and aromatic.

I ordered the Gentlemen's Relish which is a popular item here. Liked the compound butter and honey cream that comes along with the bread.

My wife opted for the Avocado Toast with Mushrooms and Eggs, and she couldn't have been happier. The scrambled eggs were cooked to perfection, and the combination of avocado, mushrooms, and eggs created a harmonious and satisfying dish.

Their iced coffee, and it was a refreshing and flavorful companion to my meal.

What truly sets Atlas Coffeehouse apart is their commitment to quality and consistency. The staff was friendly and attentive, adding to the overall pleasant experience. Whether you're a coffee enthusiast or a food lover, Atlas Coffeehouse is a must-visit. I'll definitely be returning to explore more of their menu.

Had the Rosti and gentleman’s breakfast. The Rosti was good and crispy, texture is just right and sauce that accompanied was delicious. O would order it again.
The gentleman’s breakfast was abit on the sweet side but overall still good.

Highly recommend to try the hazelnut coffee as it has a berry aroma to it.

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
I had the most incredible dining experience at this restaurant! From the moment I walked in, I was welcomed by a warm and friendly staff. The ambiance was enchanting, with soft lighting and tasteful decor that set the perfect mood for the evening.

The menu was a culinary masterpiece, offering a wide range of mouthwatering dishes that catered to various tastes. I started with the recommendation and it was an explosion of flavors that left me craving more. their signature dish was nothing short of perfection. Every bite was a delightful journey for my taste buds.

The service was impeccable; our server was knowledgeable about the menu, attentive, and made excellent recommendations.

Food, Service, Ambience, everything was simply AMAZING. Bong was a super friendly host ( he posed with us too). I highly recommend this place to folks looking out for a wholesome and healthy meal. Lookout for the portion sizes, they are pretty huge.

We were amazed from the entrance. The place has the soul, every detail of the decoration matches. Waiters were really helpful as we weren’t sure what we want to eat. Food arrived in few min, we took veg options- very fresh and tasteful. Burger was a monster and it’s my favorite if I have to choose!

Would give the service here 6/5 if we could because it was excellent. We came here for lunch with the kids and they enjoyed themselves tremendously. Special shout out to the service staff here. It is not easy to find a place that is hip, trendy yet so welcoming to kids and we felt right at home. Food was also yummy, healthy and clean but tasty. Highly recommend!

Love the bake duck confit, pineapple cake, love the friendly staff, love the environment, love the recycling school table and oil tank (outdoor, as a standing table) love the old tcm medicine cabinet as a deco,

Wanna celebrate your birthday? It's not an issue. Ask for sparkler on the cake，(do note it is chargeable ya)

Highly recommend.

Sunday: 10:30 AM – 6:00 PM
Brunch places in Singapore.name: My Awesome Cafe

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
We held our magical wedding dinner at Nassim Hill Bakery and Bistro Bar in late 2021 and it was an absolute dream in spite of the Covid restrictions.

Audrey, our point of contact, gave us personalized attention and we could feel her genuine excitement to commemorate our special day. She made the entire process of planning seamless and we are really grateful for her thoughtfulness and going the extra mile.

From the initial menu discussions, where her recommendations were tailored to our needs, to the meticulous preparation of a range of wedding favors for our guests, the experience was exceptional.

Each dish was meticulously crafted with evident care and it left a lasting impression on our guests, who were also consulted for their feedback by their thoughtful chef.

The cozy and serene ambiance added to the charm, making it a perfect setting for our celebration. What's more, the great value for money was evident in every aspect of our experience.

The team's impeccable service, support for preparing our wedding favours and flexibility in accommodating our setup time for our event truly exemplified their dedication. Our guests thoroughly enjoyed themselves, making it an unforgettable evening.

We highly recommend Nassim Hill Bakery and Bistro Bar for any special occasion or simply a delightful dining experience.

Always received friendly service and good food here. A four star is given because the portions of the food seemed to have shrunk for the same (high) price charged.

Still one of my go to places when I crave for a quality and wholesome salad - The Nutty bird. The salad is made up of specially curated individual ingredient dishes (such as marinated beetroot, dressed salad leaves, smoked chicken, homemade granola mix etc. The homemade (I believe) pesto sauce was a divine pairing with this salad!

Was recommended a steak & eggs dish and it did not disappoint. Quality ingredients used at Nassim Hill Bakery!

Would have visited more often if it’s a little more affordable.

Nassim Hill Bakery: A Cozy Haven for Bread Lovers

Brussels Sprouts - 8/10
Excellently prepared sprouts that strike a rare balance, avoiding the common pitfall of over-salting.

Truffle Fries - 4/10
A letdown, with the fries not living up to expectations and the truffle essence failing to enhance the dish significantly.

Steak & Eggs - 8/10
A pleasant surprise with the steak expertly cooked and complemented by a well-matched sauce.

Bread Collection - 10/10
A bread lover's paradise, with an array of loaves that promise a return visit to sample their baked offerings.

Overall - 7.5/10
This charming bakery and cafe exude a rustic allure and welcome four-legged friends. Ideal for a relaxed visit post-stroll around Botanic Gardens or in town. Make sure to sample their delightful breads and pastries!

#Ong2TheNextBite

Location a little hidden behind the Singpost on Nassim Hill, quite a spacious bistro for coffee and bites.

We chose this location as it is about 7min walk from TEL stations Napier or Orchard Boulevard.

Portions are quite big, hits and misses in quality and taste.

Hits :
Warm salmon Niçoise salad as recommended. Salmon is crisp and moist, everything is on point.

Alio olio is also nicely done, al dente pasta, fresh prawns & delicious.

Misses:
Waffles & pizza looked really good in photos.
disappointed with biscuit like crust and waffles are a little dry, nothing stands out for this dish.

Coffee drinks are ok, not particularly outstanding.

There is generally 2 prices for mains on menu e.g. $20/28 and wait staff said child or adult? Naturally we went for adult and most mains are $24-$28.

We paid $168 for 4 dishes and 4 coke drinks after a 10% UOB discount.

Nassim Hill Bistro is a fantastic brunch spot serving delicious comfort food in a modern atmosphere.

Let’s start with my favorite thing about this place:  There is a floor-to-ceiling sized stained-glass Phoenix on one wall. I love this thing. I regularly threaten my partner that I’m going to purchase it and place it in our home. For whatever reason, it is one of my favorite conversation pieces and bits of restaurant decor that I have seen in awhile.

Gushing about the Phoenix aside, Nassim Hill produces solid food. I have been here a number of times, and tried a number of dishes, from the cheddar bacon waffles to the chili crab pasta. They do a great job with whatever they make. I would say that none of the dishes are particularly different or inventive from the many other brunch places in Singapore; however, this place is very consistent with the food quality and I do appreciate that.

Service has always been prompt and friendly as expected.

Overall, this is a great place to grab brunch with a date, or your friends or family, really any occasion. You likely will not be disappointed.

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
Easy to find as it is located just in front of the Raffles place station. The staffs were very friendly and attentive. We really enjoyed their coffees too, I think they are better than those that you can get from regular cafes on the street. We had the chicken salad and club sandwich, and they were actually really good! Wanna come back and try other menus too.

Vibes, service, and food were amazing as usual. The best thing about Providore is their unwavering consistency in the quality of food across all outlets. Both of our beverages were well worth the money. As for the food, we ordered the English breakfast and baked rotolo. The English breakfast was a solid 10/10. However, the baked rotolo was extremely cheesy, and beyond a certain point, it was tough to eat. (Hence the 4-star review for Food)

Food was superb. Fries was so good which huge bits of salt - it was freshly fried and goes really well with the chipotle mayo which I finished every single drop of it.

I asked for a burger patty to be medium rare and it was not only juicy, it was also very well seasoned - just the way I liked it.

Nothing about this place is disappointing

I’ve ordered from this outlet several times, both in person and for delivery. The food is very high quality and fresh and is always delicious.

The restaurant has nice vibes, very modern feeling. The staff are friendly and attentive.

I recommend the sweet potato wedges and the grilled chicken salad.

I will definitely be ordering from here again!

A unique standalone space at Raffles Place, easy to spot. Love the crab linguine there however was informed that item has been unavailable for a month or two. Enjoyed my wine there, ordered Pinot Noir that's light and easy to drink. Overall very polite service by the team, as we stayed till closing, team member YY packed and offered tarts, one each for me and my friend, sharing that pastries are freshly baked daily, and rather than disposing any leftovers, they prefer to spread the love. Very awesome move and team (Ali waited patiently for us as well before we made a move and exited the restaurant). Keep it up :)

Brunch places in Singapore.name: The Providore (Raffles Place)

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
Not your usual location!! Away from the hustle and bustle of daily life. Held our wedding there (approx 80 Pax) and it was one of the best decision with ample space and kids-friendly facilities for the kids to run around. Place was basically a blank canvas which allows us to be as creative as we wanted it to be. Coordination with Melinda (Event Manager) and Alex (Outlet Manager) was a brisk task as they provided suggestion based on their experience which greatly assisted us. Staff were excellent, professional and accommodating which greatly exceeded my expectation by meeting some of our weirder requests. We choose the buffet option which had a nice spread and all my guest greatly enjoyed it.

My second visit here. My friend threw a party here last time and we really enjoyed the food and dessert, so decided to come back with the kid again. The staffs were busy but warm. Although short staffed if you managed to get their attention they would attend to your requests. Chicken parmigiana was delicious. Kids menu looks average but my daughter finished the whole thing! Had a good time here keeping the kid busy with the outdoor area. Other than the bouncy castle there are also balls and Lego which seem to be new.

Love the play area outside that is for kids. Food is good too. However bouncy castle was dripping with water and had many black patches, looks dirty such that my daughter didn't want to go up.

Top spot for kids.
The new chap who’s managing it is doing a magnificent job to be attentive to all customers. They seem a little short staffed on most days but that’s just F&B in sg.
If you’ve got a few hours on the weekend to kill and don’t mind 6/10 food, this really is a top spot for kids.

Cafe Melba at the Goodman Arts Center off Mountbatten Road is an F&B oasis for neighborhood residents and their young children. The local government repurposed the campus from its former use as a public school. The cafe is spacious and is right next to a small grass field that doubles as a play area for young children.

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
Nice ambience! Delicious and yummy food. Love the Ultimate Fudgy Brownie - it is definitely something to eat on your cheat day! The mix of textures that the brownie has just gel together so well — the coolness of the ice cream, the dense, sweet brownie and the soft marshmallows.

Food was generally good. There is room for improvement in terms of service, would be nice to see smiles on their faces.

Food is always amazing here and the atmosphere is great. I was a little disappointed by the lady serving us who was not the most cheerful but except for that it was great!

We ordered a bottle of Prosecco which was great and then for mains we had the Thai Basil Chicken Bowl, the Chicken Schnitzel special, and the Club Sandwich. All 3 were great, very big portions though!

I came here on a Saturday for a birthday dinner. We managed to book alfresco dining with a view, so be sure to call the concierge to arrange it! There were several light shows in the MBS area during our dinner. The food was alright. However, one particular thing that really stood out was the service staff named Remy. He was incredibly friendly and even helped me surprise my mom for her birthday with the cake I had specifically called in to book before dining. He also recommended food and drinks when we were having a hard time choosing from the extensive menu. He truly enhanced the overall dining experience. This is a great location with a wonderful atmosphere for date nights and family gatherings!

The view is really amazing, though my dish was quite average, the Seabass risotto.
It was a good crowd on a Friday afternoon.

Would come back again for the view, probably try something else on the menu.

PS Cafe at One Fullerton serves an exceptional Sticky Toffee Pudding that left me delighted and satisfied. Here are the highlights of my experience:

Irresistible Taste: The Sticky Toffee Pudding is an absolute delight for dessert lovers. The cake is moist, rich, and perfectly balanced with a luscious toffee sauce. Every bite was a heavenly treat.

Cozy Atmosphere: PS Cafe at One Fullerton offers a warm and inviting ambiance that enhances the dining experience. The comfortable seating and charming decor create a pleasant and relaxed environment.

Attentive Service: The staff at PS Cafe were attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. They provided excellent recommendations and ensured that my dining experience was enjoyable from start to finish.

Beautiful Location: PS Cafe at One Fullerton is situated in a picturesque location with stunning waterfront views. It's the perfect spot to enjoy a delicious dessert while taking in the breathtaking scenery.

Overall, PS Cafe's Sticky Toffee Pudding at One Fullerton is a must-try dessert. The combination of flavors, cozy atmosphere, and attentive service make it a wonderful dining destination. I highly recommend indulging in this delectable treat.
Brunch places in Singapore.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM

Brunch places in Singapore.name: PS.Cafe at One Fullerton

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
We celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary here coz we just love the food by Chef Ratha. And we were not disappointed. Onion soup was flavourful! Beef cheeks melting in my mouth as I remembered it. Sea Bass crispy on outside and fluffy melt in your mouth on the inside. Baked Brie had a nice texture and matched well with the tangy pomelo. We ended off with something new for us in the menu - Pandan Soufflé. Heavenly light texture and fluffy. Tinge of gulamelak and Pandan flavour with vanilla was a perfect match. 💕💕💕 will be back ! Thank you Chef Ratha! 🙏😊

We have been dining at Black Sheep from their days at Jalan Kelulut, happy to find out that Chef Ratha has re-opened at Norris Road.
We had the 3-course set lunch, every bite was exquisite.
Salad had delectable flavours mixed with pineapple, mango to give an exciting twist to each bite.
Not much more to be said about the main course except that it was as good as we remembered.
Don't leave without trying the flourless lava cake.

Had tried foie gras toast, escargot, French onion soup , Brie for bites. Oh and the bread roll is served warm with nice soft (but not melted) butter.. it’s always the details that counts.

and main I had the duck confit which is fry to perfection, well marinated. Soufflé is definitely the way to end it with a good note.

Bought a bottle of Chardonnay and brought along red wine to pair with the food.

Amazing food with great company. Thanks chef!

Ms.Cloud is an amazing hostess, very attentive made great suggestions and above all very welcoming and warm.
Chef Ratha fixes a scrumptious menu and the food is amazing.
Highly recommend

we paid about a hundred plus each as we had a bottle of wine. (2pax dine in)
Without it, costs per pax would have been lower. Overall pleasant meal and reasonably priced.
Must get the baked brie starter

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
First time to this restaurant.
Love the location.
Love the amosphere.
Love how our furkid enjoy sitting with us.

Food was good but perhaps it will be nice if staff can do better recommendations.

I have to give thumbs up to the staff, being very attentive even on a full seating.

Will return again.

Celebrated my wife’s birthday here. The food was amazing and the service here is superb!

I had the most incredible experience at Super Loco, and it's all thanks to the exceptional service provided by Jenny. From the moment we walked in, Jenny's warm and welcoming demeanor set the tone for a fantastic evening. She not only made sure our table was perfect, but she also went above and beyond to recommend the most delicious dishes on the menu. Kudos to her 👍🏻👍🏻

They also gave us free churros and mexican lover shot as part of our birthday celebration here.

Surprisingly, even though the food looks so nice, NONE of them (ordered 3 types of food) were tasty. 👎🏻

The staff was NOT friendly/polite at all. Even though there was miscommunication, i didn’t get apologies which made me feel uncomfortable.

The atmosphere is good as they allow lovely dogs outdoor.

Overall, not recommend. :) Thanks!!

Nice and open air spot to hangout, visited after a downpour with the weather nice and cool.
We had chips and guacamole to start.
Buffalo wings and quesadillas were great with the right amount of spices.
Crabmeat tacos were a tad unwieldy, turned soggy when left out awhile.
The food can be a little salty so drinks and frozen margaritas were a nice respite.
It was nice to have 3 different salsas available by the table, the mango habanero does pack quite the punch.
Will revisit for the laidback atmosphere and great food.
Staff were attentive and offered water.

Delicious, modern Mexican cuisine. Great menu with lots of meat and veg options as well as a decent kids menu. Favourite was the cauliflower dish as well as pumpkin tostadas. Service was a little non attentive but otherwise a great experience in a comfortable environment by the river.

Brunch places in Singapore.reviews:
Brunches is a very unique little restaurant.
The furniture is novel and clearly had a lot of thought put into choosing it.

The car table added a nice touch to the theme of the restaurant.

The food is expensive, rich and has to be accompanied by a drink or you won't be able to finish it.

The display stand with all the finger food paired quite well with the theme.

We celebrated a birthday party there consisting or 50 people minus the staff.

The waiters handled the people fairly well getting the food to tables on time and refilling their glasses.

Whilst we put up the decorations one of my daughters burst a balloon and one of the waitress's dropped a glass and blamed my daughter and the balloon that burst. The waitress  said my daughter popped a balloon so she got scared and dropped a glass.

The owner's service level is exceptional, he was going around pouring wine for every table and was honest to return the extra bottles after the party ended.

There is only one bathroom which isn't very clean but it's not too bad.  The bathroom didn't have toilet paper though.

The place was kept surprisingly cool regardless of the number of people there.

The drinks are also expensive but quite interesting and creative.

Wow. Legit authentic cafe vibes here.

We happened to stumble into this cafe after running an errand. Loved the atmosphere with the unique antiques and deco.

There's a table for two in a car!

The staff are really friendly, and the atmosphere is so calm and comforting.

Generious food portion and quality is comparable to high end restaurants.

Definitely coming back here with friends!
Highly recommend trying this place out. It's worth it!

Great place for a brunch experience. The coffee is up to standard and did not disappoint. Ambience is rustic with a touch of nostalgia. I would definitely come back again!

I like the western foods and the deco. Good place for photography. The dessert and  coffee also good.  This is my second time visiting. Already try the tuna during my 1st visit, today I try the Salmon taste good too. The service are good. My personal view the pricing are slightly on the high side.

Was around the vicinity, visited the cafe together with wife for get our brunch fixed. Interesting decorations they have spending effort. We didn’t have any reservations and luckily enough there were seats. Noticed they have a extensive menu for a cafe. Staffs were friendly and attentive, food taste good too. Pricing is reasonable. Will definitely be back. Thank you

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Had 1 set lunch with the Mushroom soup, serving for soup was a bit disappointing for set lunch. Not sure if the serving ala carte order would be the same or not. As for the taste, not much of surprise in any way.

The Arrabiata pasta (not fresh pasta) didn't gave the woah effect in any way as well. Saving grace was the fresh prawns.

My wife tried the Gnocchi with gorgonzola. Pasta (fresh) texture wasn't good, sauce not really to our likely.

Another disappointment is the dessert from the set lunch, which we had ordered the flourless Chocolate cake. Look at the picture and you will understand. Taste, so-so, maybe due to the presentation.

Lastly is the Tiramisu, saving grace to not get below 3 stars.

Overall, not a place which we would be considering to go again.

This is my 5th visit to Poco Loco. Each visit I am always bowled over by the great food . This is a hidden gem at Upper Thomson. I have eaten at many Italian restaurants, I have to say the pasta here are extremely good, full of flavour and really satisfying . Not sure where did the chef previously came from but I dare say it is even as good as some of higher class restaurants like Etna. Highly recommend.

Value for money! We tried PocoLoco for the first time and we really enjoyed our meal. We ordered 1 dinner set ($45), which consisted of an appetiser, 1 pasta dish, 1 main course and 1 dessert, there’s an option to order a glass of wine for $8. We ordered an extra pasta dish with lamb as well. Portion was good (not too small/big) and our favourite was the pork collar main course (part of the dinner set). Price was nett and drinks were reasonably priced as well ($2 for jasmine green tea and other soft drinks). Overall it was enjoyable and value for money.

Generally the food is fresh and not too bad. We had mushroom soup, calamari, spaghetti carbonara, spaghetti arrabbiata, spaghetti vongole, Panna Cotta and chocolate flourless cake.The first 2 items and the last are worth trying. Could give the calamari a miss though. The restaurant is within 5mins walking distance from tel station exit 4.

Jun 2023. I always loved pocoloco Italian food. We got mushroom soups, seafood pasta and lasagne.
Nothing to complain about.
Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.name: PocoLoco
Fun Toast

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Ambience is cosy and a good ratio of service crew to patrons.

Our order:
Crabby in Pesto Sauce
Mussels in a Pot (without chilli for the kids)
Signature Pork Chop
White Wine Pasta with Clams
Truffle Mushroom Risotto
Messy Cheesy Burger
Fish & Chips
Har Cheong Chicken Burger

Verdict - their Pork Chop is a MUST TRY and we will definitely order it again the next round. The meat is really tender and well flavoured. Went well with the garlic and mashed potatoes. They do their mussels and clams really well. Mussels were juicy and cooked to perfection. Our bellies were pretty pleased with our options and we didn't expect the portions to be so generous! Service standards vary according to the service crew set on duty. We were impressed on our 1st visit but nay on our 2nd. We will be back nonetheless.

A family-friendly restaurant, the staff are attentive and would provide toys to young children to keep them entertained.

Food is fantastic, with generous portions. Even the kids meal look to be more like an adult’s portion. Highlight of the meal include the ribeye steak which was flavourful and tender, and the pesto crab fettuccine, which was simply delicious and made me crave for more.

Parking would be an issue for those who drive as there’s limited lots, but those taking public transport, would be extremely convenient since it’s located just 1min outside Sixth Avenue MRT, and sheltered all the way.

Great service, a very cosy place for families especially with kids. Food was really good too including the free meals for kids below 11 on weekends and PH. My kids loved their beef sliders and carbonara! Desserts were on the pricier side though..

Family friendly restaurant.
Food was good and generous portion.

We enjoyed our experience and will return to try out the rest of the menu.

Googled places to eat at 6th Ave as was exploring the Downtown line.

Saw Little Lazy Lizard's menu and thought why not to give it a try. Tried it with my girlfriend for lunch.

When entered, we were welcomed warmly by one of the servers and he ushered us to our table.

Menu had a fair selection of food choices for us to choose. We each ordered a main and light bite to share.

Food ordered:
1. Pork Bulgogi pizza
- lovely and tasty
- thin and crispy regular base

2. French Toast
- portion was good 2 to share actually
- bread was fluffy (think Brioche was used)

3. Lazy Lizard wings (chef's recommendation)
- honestly when it came was little disappointed to see it was like regular fried wings. Maybe was expecting to be more special with its marinade or if its sauce that is outstanding
- deep fried timing was good, light and crispy and wasn't overly salty yet flavourful

I don't mind visiting this place again to try out their mains.
