Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Professional service was provided by the thoughtful and attentive staff. An entire birthday cake, not merely a slice, was given to us. Most dishes were great. The highlight of the meal was the seafood stew. All the breads were also exceptionally delicious. However, the sea bass tasted very ordinary and the sky high price tag went to the showy ‘performance’ by the chef. Restaurant was too dim and had a funky smell.

The staff are very friendly and the food is also tasty. The portion is surprisingly big and we ate till our hearts content.

Staff very helpful and polite. Atmosphere is chill with soft music. Food serve just in the right timing.  Of cause the price is not cheap. But it worth the price overall.

Lastly thanks for the birthday cake. Love it but we were too full to finish it.

Booked Sunday afternoon to have their set lunch, only to find out they only serve buffet that day at $78++ per person. Opted in anyway and didn't regret it, given the fresh ingredients, great taste of Italian and friendly staffs! Personally I love the dessert section especially Panna Cotta! If I had to pick on something, it'd be the dim lighting. No discount on the bill even with Shangri-la Circle membership, but you do get extra points.

Remember, when you get into the lobby, you are on 3F. You need to take an elevator to get down to 1F where the restaurant is.

The restaurant has decent ambience for a semi chic and comfortable dinning experience. The salt crusted fish is delicious and if you want to see some fire show. The winner for me is the crab pasta. Yum!

We celebrated our anniversary dinner here and it was a great decision! They generously presented us a complimentary cake, thank you for perfecting the night.
Among the dishes, we absolutely love the Porchetta. It was tender, yet crispy and flavourful, Highly recommended! While on the other side, we didn’t like the potato purée in the braised lamb leg dishes. It may have ruined the experience with that main dish. Despite that, this would not stop us from giving 5 stars because the other aspects (service/ambience) make up to it. A great dining place for celebrations.
Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.address: 22 Orange Grove Rd, Level One, Garden Wing, Singapore 258350
Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
First time visit, we were 2 adults and 2 kids. When we arrived, we were served with a smile from the front staff. Told to wait 5 minutes till they get the table ready.
Joseph (manager) was really nice to manage us to get a standard table instead of a high table (where we placed earlier)

Good menu for kids and adults. Ordered fish and chips for kids. They loved the fish, very light battered and crispy.
We ordered the hanger steak, and steak can only be  served as medium cook. Which is quite annoying when someone may prefer medium rare or other options. The steak portion is literally three pieces, not worth $42. Extensive drinks menu, ordered a lemongrass cocktail, which was very refreshing.

Overall service, ambience is nice. Bit disappointed with the steak portion and pricing.

This place is always booked out, so advanced reservations are highly recommended. It's a great weekend family brunch place with a sizable playground and sand pit for kids to have some outdoor fun. The compound is big with lots of areas for kids to explore. It's a nice space with high ceilings and lots of natural light. The service is on point with a very attentive and warm team of wait staff. However, the food is not as good as I'd hoped, especially for the prices they charge. Overall, lovely space, good service, very kid friendly, OK food, high prices.

Me and wife went for birthday and anniversary, staff was super amazing seeing we have baby they help us move seats inside. The ambiance was cozy specious and service was top notch. Food was a different style which we never had before and desert was just purely amazing too. We will come back again :)

Made a reservation for 12:45pm lunch. Was slightly late but they called to double check and kept our reservation. Was for a birthday celebration and it’s my second visit here. Their menu changes time to time and I have not tried their current menu before. Ordered 3 mains and all 3 mains are VERY good. Come and try for yourself. Staffs there are friendly and welcoming, one even joined for a birthday song for my friend. Overall, another good experience with Open Farm.

Was here for a wedding a couple years back and been wanting to return— finally did! The atmosphere was great for a quiet and intimate dinner catch-up with friend. Dishes were great but rather small in portions; ordered 4 dishes + 2 desserts for sharing to have just filled the two of us up. Nonetheless, absolutely beautiful dishes! Hoping to be back soon for more!
Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.name: Open Farm Community

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Been here a few times thanks to Champions golf course and driving range. It's a good hangout for golfers after their practice and games. They served different alcoholic drinks, including their craft brew.

Diners can view part of the golf course in this unenclosed establishment. The food wasn't spectacular but wasn't shabby too. One could get the typical western dishes here, besides the finger foods. No particular dish stood out to me or I haven't tried enough of them.

The atmosphere was good in the evening with the warm lighting but there were the occasional annoying insects.

Service was fine but it could be hard to get the staff's attention sometimes. It seems popular for families too. The location is inaccessible unless one drives. But there weren't enough reasons for me to drive all the way here just to dine.

Ever been to an eatery where you have relaxing ambience close to Mother Nature, coupled with great tasting food, throw in some nicely house brewed beers and background music? Yes this is the place - all rolled into one!

Their pizzas are very thinned crust with great cheeses and sliced salami. Another dish is their hummus and pita - came with four soft yet crusty pitas. Love their pasta and burgers too. Did I say the flambé waffles lit with flaming vodka and contrue liquor? Nicely done.

Will come back again during the day to soak
in the nature atmosphere.

Microbrewery restaurant at a public golf course is a good establishment. The IPA tasted  nice, but not all its brews were available, so I couldn't compare if others were as good. Humus was okay for bar bites, but $5 charge for additional pita would make the price a bit steep. Having the pita warmed was a nice touch!

My family all time favourite restaurant! We love their pizzas, steak and fries (which finally made its way on the menu again) and their deserts. The best part for us was the walk after our meals to the Rider's Cafe just around the corner where we call our cab from. It's a dark walk at night but we enjoy the chat along the short walk as we occasionally see some horses in the stable. It's all gone sadly and I hope the same fate doesn't befall upon this and the Thai restaurant across from them.

Came here for coffee and dessert (apple crumble) which was nice.

Environment: Nice spot to have a meal or drink as its surrounded by nature, that happens to be the downside as well. The place is literally crawling with insects and mosquitos are aplenty. Do bring some sort of repellent, i got bitten a fair bit.

Food: The coffee ive ordered was strong and the apple crumble came adorned with fresh fruits and was quite nice.

Accessibility: The parking is free and onsite. You probably wont consider this place unless you drive.

Price: Not fantastic but you have saved on parking anyway

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Overall okay for what you get. The service is zero self service food Court style western and Asian food. Aircon strong very fast food style. The menu price does not match the computer screen. Its hard to use not friendly user. But food came out ok lah. Nothing spectacular but it's what I expected for tourists trap places like this.

I rate this place as the “worst eatery” in Singapore. in Salad for 15 sgd with salmon there is 10 grams of salmon itself! The cutlets in the burgers look like they were cooked yesterday, all the salt in the world was put in the fries, the freshly squeezed juices have no taste.

Average food quality with decent amount of serving. I would say it's like a cozy coffee shop with different varieties of food to choose from.
It's like HANS concept with affordable food and ample space for even big groups to dine in.

Good food nice cozy place to sit! We ordered quite many things only thing is I didn’t like the chicken nuggets! It was really weird textured on the other hand every other thing we ordered was good. There is a play area too so kids stay busy and let you eat in peace! One more thing there was just 1 host in day time so things were processing very slow.

The food menu needs alot of work. It's really a big mess now and ordering through the POS is very limiting.

Food was ok, mostly packaged food taste. Basi lemak was but dry chicken. Lucky the Chili was good and rice ok.

Coffees are in tiny cups and feel expensive. Tea was not bad.

Really wish we could do add-ons. Kaya toast set comes with drinks but no soft boil eggs. At least that's what it says on the POS. So we didn't order.

Mac and cheese all box type. Although next table has the little pizza which looked decent for kids. Mushroom soup was surprisingly good.

Beautiful space, air con, indoor and outdoor play area for kids. just really hope they get their menu together. They have the staff for it just need to get organised.

3 adults and a kid we spent $50+ for a 'light breakfast'. Many other items not shown in photos.

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
A nice neighborhood family alfresco restaurant serving local tze char delights at affordable prices.

The lady boss and staff were friendly and attentive and the restaurant was clean.

The food was affordable and delicious in a home cooked manner. Portions are sufficient for the lone diner. For a group, order more dishes or double portions. If I were to be very picky, the gravy for the dishes can be a tad too starchy.

The food is good and super affordable. There's a wide-range of dishes too! The downside is the place is small and can be crowded during peak hours so you will need to wait to find a seat (or dabao).

Food quality isn’t that tasty, portion rather small. But the staff service was excellent!

My 1st time here as I was near the neighbourhood, yummy dishes, reasonably priced and we left happy!

Solid Tze char. Would recommend their mini fried fish soup 炸鱼炉

Friendly lady boss and nice comforting neighbourhood setting.

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Very crowded on weekends. Tables are very closely arranged. The good thing is their service is efficient and steady. Despite crowded, food serve was quick and doesn't have to wait long.
We ordered the seafood horfun and beehoon, bitter gourd black bean pork ribs, mince meat fried egg, hotplate tofu, cereal soft shell Crab and baby Kailan. All the dishes were delicious and flavourful. Not very salty and everything were fresh. Good food happy customers.

This place is quite popular with the locals. While the area is being upgraded, it is not very accessible. I do like the Prawn Minced Meat Rolls and Sweet Sour Sliced Fish are excellent options. Baby Kai Lan is too hard for older people. Coffee Pork Rib is a bit bland. Cereal Prawns are pretty lovely. Home-Made Tofu with Minced Meat is disappointing - while the meat is flavourful, the tofu doesn’t absorb the flavour, so you get a too salty feeling from the meat, but the tofu is tasteless. The salted fish fried rice is well received, so do try it.

Lovely place to it Hongkong food, such as Assam Fish Head, Cereal Chicken, Chicken Wings, Prawn Paste Chicken, Tofu with Minced Meat, etc. Located in Novena area, this is a lovely restaurant to visit for sure if you like Chinese/Hongkong casual food. Affordable price also.

great zhi char food.
assam fish head is very nice. the paste is homemade.
xo beehoon fish soup’s soup is refillable.
fried prawn roll is crispy and lots of fillings.

A reasonably priced restaurant with good tasting Chinese food. The oil soaked croaker fish was super crispy. We crunch crunch crunch almost every part of the fish. The sauce was not too salty and just nice to eat on its own without rice. The braised brinjal was really flavouful and umami, best to eat with rice. Will definitely go back again.
Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.name: Hong Kong Street Restaurant (Novena)

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Wonderful service by a group of young and well trained staff (all females waitresses!) the place is very kids friendly, kids can enjoy outdoor play freely while parents can watch over their meals. The patio is huge can host long tables and it's airy even on a hot day. Like the simple but tasty food choices.

Stopped for coffee after lunch, very cosy cafe placed in dempsey.

Open level cafe with indoor and outdoor settings. They have a small play area for kids to play, which is equipped with swing, hanging  rods, etc. Staff is attentive and service with a smile.

We ordered cappuccino and fresh juices for kids. Coffee was delicious, right temperature and good flavour.

Definitely recommended to check out if in the dempsey area.

It's a really nice spot for a family weekend brunch at Dempsey Hill. There is a playground with really rustic contraptions for kids to enjoy and for parents to snap some nice pictures. There is a second playground, but a paid membership is required to access the exclusive area. A prepayment of $20 per diner is required to secure a reservation. The food tasted fresh, and the portions are sizable. The service staff are very friendly and welcoming. Overall, it was a great weekend brunch experience for the family with good food and excellent service.

Late update but it should be recorded. Had a really nice Christmas lunch there in last Dec!!

Food, decor and service are all good! Just like went to a cozy restaurant in an European city! We like the appetizers much! Salad sauce is fresh with great balance on the portion. Pizza is crispy and yummy. Main courses are coming with different side dishes. All tasted great. Just the dessert a bit below our expectation.

They served gingerbread cookies to us which is unexpected. And the Santa and Elf family visit really surprised our kids! They can pick a small gift from the Santa’s bag!

There’s little playground and IG photo spots for the kids in outdoor area. It’s nice whatever you’re sitting in indoor or outdoor area.

I’m thinking to come again in Easter Holiday and see what program they will have.

AT feast Singapore, Dempsey venue and the Private Dining space were apt for our occasion. Staff were pleasant and supportive. It is a kids friendly venue. Food was amazing. Kids had a wonderful time and they loved it which is the ultimate barometer of satisfaction.

Overall a wonderful experience for us and the kids alike. Would highly recommend.

Special kudos to
Diana- Events Supervisor for all the communications, arrangements and coordination
Azrin- Operations Manager for all the support during the event
An- Service staff for ‘Going the Extra Mile’ support.

Thank you.

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Went for a Birthday celebration here. Definitely an instagrammable-worthy place to visit. With a wide variety of food selection. Ordered their all-day breakfast and it was really awesome! Great place for gathering. The interior decor are filled with vintage items. Super love this place, will definitely visit again. Not forgetting the staffs who are friendly and attentive!

It’s one of my family’s regular haunt. A rustic place that is tranquil, rejuvenate us from strained. Food is considered exorbitant though but hot beverages and deserts are reasonable. My buddy from Malaysia is amused with all the antiques/retro displays, nostalgic.

Celebrated our birthdays here just this evening and really enjoyed the entire experience. First of all, because this place is located in such a cosy and exclusive part of Changi, the surroundings were serene and peaceful. Ambience within the cafe was very good too - Lighting, furniture, and decorations were very unique! Service and food was of high quality! I appreciate that we had a table with a nice corner and view! The wagyu cubes, octopus salad, and mussels / clams pot were delicious! Lamb chops were tasty too, but the cut we had was slightly too fat. Been here before some years ago, but only tried the breakfast and brunch. Will be very happy and excited to come back to try more food! Also happy that there’s beer on tap! Parking is free as well!

This charming and peaceful location is perfect for enjoying a delightful brunch. Tucked away from the main road, it requires a leisurely 7-minute walk from the nearest bus stop. The restaurant offers both indoor and outdoor seating options, and we opted for the latter. While their brunch menu is limited, the dishes are of high quality, albeit a bit on the expensive side. Nonetheless, the food is delicious, and the romantic ambiance makes it an ideal spot for a date.

Slightly pricey but with good ambiance. Restaurant has a lot of rustic stuff for u to explore. Fried chicken not worth ordering. Kids meal taste relatively blend but healthy perhaps. Overall there can be better place out there in terms of price and food quality.

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Ordered satay rice bowl and it was nice! I like the peanut sauce. Also the vegetable on the side was delicious.
For the drink, I ordered tea(forget the name, but it's a no-sugar tea). It was refreshing!
It's worth coming if you'd like to have dining with a museum view :)

It's a really lovely space in the National Museum of Singapore to be having your meal. It feels like you are dining outdoors, but indoors. It's bright with natural light, and you get to enjoy the building's architecture from the inside. The service is good, but the food is mediocre at best. Food was not bad by any means, but it was just normal. I would definitely go back because the ambiance makes it quite the experience, and it is really kid-friendly. My daughter had a blast!

More than just a casual spot to nip into for coffee and light bites after your museum visit. Attended a private event here some months back and was pleasantly surprised by the finesse of the cooking. Both mains were memorable and very well executed.  Lovely and competent staff as well.

Didn't try the food but I must say it smells good from the other tables. However, the coffee is a disappointment. Sour after taste even on a latte. The black coffee make it unbearable to swallow. Nevertheless, price is reasonable. Overall a good place to chill & rest after a long walk at the museum.

Great environment! Feel like alfresco dining but in an aircon environment. Not enough service but the overall feel is still as long as one brings a great partner. Can't complain.

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.name: Food For Thought

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Today, I came early for the birthday celebration. I witness a horrible event, there was a boy saying about the cafe owner smoking in the compound where there is a kindergarten and he didn’t report it. The cafe owner slammed the door. In my view, although I enjoyed the celebration but this shouldn’t be the case. There should be rules and regulations in place. I was reading the comments. The uncle is really hot tempered person.

If I can give a zero star I would. After my swim, I went to the left most side of the multi purpose room next to the brick wall and switched on the lights at that corner. Chatting with my friend in not more than 10minutes, the cafe uncle came and rudely interrupted us. He said in a harsh and unfriendly tone “who ask you to on the lights? I’m paying rent you know?”. Excuse me, but there is no sign saying not to switch on the lights at this corner as far as I know the cafe’s corner is next to the glass wall. How I know? Because the first time I patronised this space, the same uncle scolded me for using his table next to the glass and told me to move to the side of the wall. Today, 17/10/2023, 9:13pm, he is again at his rude behaviour. I told him I didn’t know that this area is part of his tenancy, there wasn’t any sign stating anything of what he claimed, and as far as I know the clubhouse is open till 10pm. So I told the uncle why not you put a sign so that would prevent such things from happening in the future. But he, again rudely dismissed me saying if you don’t want to listen then don’t la, gesturing as he said that. My goodness I have not met such a rude old person before. You would think that age makes a person mellow. I would suggest people to be careful for this man and his attitude. Nothing against the food just the person working here.

I have been living in Braddel for the last 5 years and the clubhouse area used to be for residents to use as a place to eat or socialise. Other condo I have visited also have such facilities for people to gather, whether it is for people to sit and chat, read a book, study their subject, throw a potluck or have a Mooncake Festival - the whole point is that such a space is multi-purpose. I share some of the views of the reviewers about the lack of service standard/poor attitude from the uncle of the shop. His behaviour is harsh and rude. The incident happened a few months back, I didn’t want to bother writing it here but I bumped into him again and I’m just surprised that the cafe management is not helping him improve his behaviour. Thinking that the multipurpose hall was what is it, and there wasn’t any no outside food sign anywhere or is there is line demarcating the cafe space from the public space and what more the tables were all different. My friend and I sat at a corner studying then the uncle came and said this is not for us to study and use his electricity (in a rude tone). I told him as the operator he should put up signs to tell people at least, have that courtesy and not just blast people with his unruly tone. He then defended himself by saying the condo manager should be the one putting up the signs. Effectively pushing the responsibility to someone else. If the tables belongs to the operator, then the operator should at least put sign stating their policy. It is what most cafes or eateries do- “no outside food”, “no using of tables without making any purchase from Jio Makan”, etc. there are many ways to prevent misunderstandings, so why leave potential customers this sour experience? Also, there weren’t many people on that day too maybe just 4 tables mostly occupied by students, it is not like we are hogging the place and disrupting their business. This uncle and the cafe operator couldn’t see the long term gain, that while we are studying we might get hungry or thirsty and people may patronise them. Totally short-sighted. So be warned if you visit this place, the uncle is very sensitive.

Nice chill place in Bradell heights which I come to know that outsiders are permit to patronise. The snacks are nice and reasonable in price and the sour plum drinks are perfect to take away the greasy food.

Otah fries with dip was unique and yummy. Hot tea was fairly good to my liking. But for those who like it thick, you might need to tell them gao.

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
A great authentic family restaurant nestled within the Japanese Association. Maybe it’s the Japanese families dining around you, but it feels exactly like Japan in this place. Although the food isn’t the best, there is a warm homely flavour to the dishes. Had the seasonal special Hamburg rice with demi-glace sauce and was pleasantly surprised by the huge portion, with the beef being tender and not too gamey. Special shout-out for the salmon head which also comes in a generous portion for a very reasonable price!

Do take note that only members may gain entry or bring guests to dine at the restaurants within the Japanese Association.

We adjourned here for desserts and coffee after lunch at Akane.  The staff here are friendly and helpful.

If possible, request for the private room at the end if you are a large group.  There is a $10 surcharge but this can be waived.

There are special offers which include free flow beverages for $3 each if you order a mains or dessert.  It was well worth it, as we could try their cold brew coffee, cappuccino, mango juice and teas etc.

We enjoyed desserts like matcha ice cream, coffee with vanilla ice cream, mochi and cheesecake cup.

You need to be a member or signed in by one to enter Akane or Donguri.

Hokkaido milk soft serve is the best.
Restaurant closes at 8.30pm.
Member only venue.

The service and taste must be good because it’s the Japanese restaurant in the heart of Japanese Association... did look fine to me.

The dishes like set menu, donburi, and assorted sushi are around $20 should be good pricing. I actually felt like ordering Unagi Bento with a free drink bar for $27 or so...

The problem is, only the Japanese Association members or the escorted guests can dine there and I had to leave the place just before ordering like a guy in a wrong place.

Restaurant is located inside of Japanese Association building, and need to be accompanied with member. Variation of food is quite good, covering from Japanese, Chinese to Western option. Quality of food is also good. Location could be a challenge as no MRT nearby (accessible only by bus).

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Great hearty food at neighbourhood prices! Never tasted Nepali food and so that was a welcomed change. Service was great. Staff was attentive and helpful (despite the busy evening). Only let down was that the mains were not served together and the soup served was different from what was included in the set). Would have been great if this was relayed earlier.

Came to dine on a weekend, so had to wait for table as it’s crowded. The food is nice and value for money. The beef is done to the medium I wanted, chicken chop also tastes good. And they have Stella beer on tap at a very good price. Will definitely come back again.

Hidden in the heartlands, this restaurant serve excellent western food at affordable prices. The meat of the lamb shank was tender. Fish and chip was value for money as the fish slices were thick and not thinly sliced. Cheese oyster was excellent. An overall excellent experience.

A nice and cozy neighborhood western restaurant shop. More like German than Nepalese.Quite crowded during holiday, make reservation. Food is good. Steak ribeye taste better than A***n. Oxtail is best. Pork Knuckles is huge and need to wait for 1/2hour or pre-order.

I chanced upon this old restaurant and read good reviews on this restaurant.
The restaurant was almost full but the staff managed to get us a table for 6.
We ordered the western food set lunches and the food was generous and good.
All the lunch sets comes with soup of the day, drinks, mains and desserts.
Will come and try their Nepalese specialty the next time.

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.name: Tims Restaurant & Cafe

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
Food and service were good! Looks like they have revamped the bistro and looking better. Went there for lunch with wifey as we wanted to grab some fresh meat at butchery. Ordered 2 soup to go along with our main. She ordered potato soup and onion soup for me. Before the soup arrived, we were served with their in house baguette and butter. It was so so good especially the butter. Main were served hot from kitchen, portions were good for the price and we left the bistro with our happy stomach. Wish they can offer ribeye in time to come. They were having Oktoberfest menu too. Do drop by! Will definitely return. Thank you

Had an outdoor seating which was sooo hot. They gave a time limit of 1 hour but was happy to let us hang around if there wasn’t too busy. Food wise was ok but nothing spectacular. Has a children’s playground at the side so lots of family groups were there. would recommend the onion soup and creme brûlée but sirloin was underwhelming. Great that it had lots of vegetables at the side.

Had fresh onion soup that warmed us up . Thereafter we shared the mains of short rib and pork cordon blue .

The short rib served tender w mixed flavour between savoury meat and sweet caramelised onion, and tinge of horseradish . And pork cordon blue toughen up texture in breaded form and broaden the palate w some greens .

Enjoy the meals as much as the shopping later .

This place have very good beer and western foods. I highly recommend as service are good and foods are excellent. Only downside are the outdoor seating only got small wall fans and the downlight are too strong and sharp make me felt warmer on a sunny day dinner. Last to mention that the portion are quite big.

Nice food!
Revisited, food n service are great 👍👍
Plants in the garden were healthy, nice to have plant labels.
Also playground for kids while waiting for seats.
Supermarket offers wide selection of meat, snacks, fresh vegetables etc!

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.name: Huber's Bistro

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
I went with my partner for a date night and was quite excited to try due to the location and design of the restaurant ..but unfortunately very basic food which was presented like fine dining. The steak was served dry and raw which when we complained was taken back, warmed and served back. 18$ truffle fries were soggy and salty. We paid like 250$ for 3 dishes and dessert.

A romantic place for lovers. Surrounded by nature and good food. There's nothing to not like here.
Amidst lush greenery and pristine forest air, it's truly "Love's in the air".
You can't help falling in love after this.
Finish the meal with a kiss 💋 to seal in the memories. ❤️.
By the way, menu is also halal.. 😊

The place is great. Not noisy on a weekday. Staff were excellent. Food options was good. Pricing felts a little on the high side. Restaurant has kids menu option - one of the pasta choice didnt taste great. Serving portion is good.

It was a work dinner where we pre ordered the items of the set menus. I had the Wagyu rump steak which was really good, no gamey taste and very juicy. Dessert was Valrhona chocolate tart which was so sinfully good, very chocolatey. The Halia also served complimentary matcha and banana chocolate macaroons.

The place was very nice, covered with greenery.
Service was great, staffs were attentive and food was served timely spaced out.
Not a place that’s very accessible unless you drive or take a hired ride. If you don’t drive, it’s a little hard to get a ride out.

The food here is fantastic. They are masters with flavour and use of herbs. It’s so in line with the whole experience of dining in the Botanical Gardens. For starters, the Octopus and duck are a must try. For Mains, get the scallops (they come with Barramundi). Both are great and served with beautiful balsamic vinegar (not the supermarket kind).
Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
A hidden Thai outlet in industrial estate with strong support from the nearby workforce. Food is authentic n lunch value set can be considered. Delicious 😋

Very decent Thai food for its price. Used to be cheaper and came here a lot when studying at a school nearby. Prices went up since 2017 but the food is excellent. The Thai Beef green curry is a must get, so is the basil sauce fish fillet. It is closed from 3-6pm so take note. Recently they seem to start taking reservations, so if you have a big group might want to call earlier to get seats. The Thai milk tea and lemon grass drinks are very nice!

Comfort meal with decent Thai food.
We’ve dined at this outlet several times, good quality food is served here. If you enjoy milky curry, do give their green curry a try, tastier when soaked in the pineapple rice. Their appetizers are all good too, prawn cake is our favourite. Yummy Thai iced tea and green milk tea, sadly the mango sticky rice is always sold out. Take note that Jai Thai doesn’t serve Thai pork dishes.

Decent Thai food with reasonable price. I personally love their fried “Kang Kong” and clear tomyam soup. Will try out other Thai dishes, green beef curry, pandan chicken, etc in the future…

Been eating here for many years, maybe my own taste buds have changed as well but the food doesn't seem as good. A bit too sweet like every other generic thai food chain.

Other than that the prices have gone up and portions have gone down, but that can be said for most places since COVID so it's understandable
Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.name: Jai Thai Restaurant

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.name: Happy Family Restaurant

Family-friendly restaurants in Singapore.reviews:
One of the best places so far. Price is a little steep but still one of the best. Alfresco was cooling and chill vibes.
Truffle mushroom pizza is one of the best I have ever eaten. Not too creamy, just nice. Truffle has a complex taste, nothing monotonous like the cheap gas smell.

Seafood pasta was also great, strong umami taste with a touch of spicy

Amazing food, one of the best dinners I've eaten, ever.

Both crabmeat pasta and truffle pizza were delicious and exceeded our expectations. Thin crust pizza paired with mushrooms and truffle oil, mmmm.

Our lava cake took a while as the first had an incident. That was fine. However, the second one came and it wasn't lava'ish. No chocolate flow and it was just warm which is disappointing.

Another issue is no free tap water which I had an issue with. It's $2 for water which is non-refillable.

Staff service and the other two food were impeccable. Will definitely return to try other dishes, probably skip the lava cake.

Food is above average. Atmosphere is great and not overpowering. Dog friendly. Staff are generally attentive, younger staff tends to be more casual and overlooking details. Indoor is ac, outdoor is open and dog friendly.

A quiet dining place within the bishan park. Easy to park your car and short walk to the restaurant. Food were nice and a variety of wine and beer with happy hours will 8pm. A good place to chill, happy and drink.

Relatively standard menu. Limited vegetation options. I ordered the Margerita pizza.
The service of food was prompt and the staff was quite polite.
The taste wasn't bad but not exceptional and gave me the feeling that the menu is a bit overpriced.
The indoor seating can get a bit noisy due to the canopy styled roof and echo. There is an outdoor seating option that also allows you to bring pets I think.
One thing I wasn't too happy with, was the cleanliness of the toilet.
Its a nice option to go with if you are in the vicinity but keep expectations moderate.

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
When I first come across “Feast with JJ” I had thought it would be similar with all other nutritional meal prep companies in the island or so-called healthy food providers on any of the food delivery platform.  However, after consulting with Feast with JJ on what I would like to achieve based on my training goals and training scheduled - they recommended a meal plan to accommodate my needs and most importantly within my budget.

When the meals were received, it was very different as the meals were very focused on a balanced diet vs “healthy” or “nutritional” diet which surprised me at first.  After trying it for a two weeks, I noticed the differences it made an impact on my body and how it helped with my training.

Not only do Feast with JJ focuses on providing balanced meal plans for individuals or for the general - they are also able to accommodate customised meals accordingly to individual needs within the shortest amount of notice (that’s customer centricity, flexible and agile).  They customised a meal plan for me immediately for a period of two weeks to achieve my goal for a scheduled event.

Feast with JJ has changed my perspective on the diet and nutritional requirements for any body type.  They have earned my trust and confidence in providing balanced meals for my needs (or anyone) and would highly recommend reaching out to them if you are ready to make a change to your diet and nutritional requirements.

Lastly, I have stopped choosing my meals and left it to Chef Jade to decide on my daily meal despite being picky with my food.  Lastly, for those who feels like having a cheat day - hands down to their Tiramisu and Banana bread.

Thanks to the team at Feast with JJ
IG: fs2992_fitness_journey

Really awesome experience! Needed a specific diet to recover from some medical issues, was initially very doubtful that healthy food would taste good, and even more doubtful about certain cuisines that I already know that I dislike.. but gave it a shot and totally love the food! Jade is very knowledgeable and is able to cater the diet to specific needs even for a very picky eater. The best part is not needing to choose what to eat because that will result in ordering the same old stuff repeatedly. There is a good rotation of meals, meats, cuisines and cooking styles so it doesn't get boring. Been on it for 3 weeks and just signed up for another month. Also recommended to my friends! :) Thank you for healing me with food, Jade!

Repeated so many times,bundle menu, all the menu are superb! Its taste so good and very pleasant.
Thank you to Jade for the very friendly response and always helps to served the best for me and my friends. The party menu also super duper delicious.. nyummmphhhh...!!

I'm a Fitness professional with pretty strict diet requirements. I had tried several other meal prep options before but none I could stick with for more than 2 weeks. Either the food would be too old or utterly tasteless or the measurements suspect. However once I've started doing my meal preps with #FeastwithJJ it's just been absolutely great and bang on with the taste. Needless to say,  I'm quite picky and demanding when it comes to food and Jade has always been able to meet my demands and surpass them. Keep up the awesome work and God bless Jade, the awesome chef 😊

Repeated orders with FeastwithJJ for my family and got them to deliver to friends as gifts too.  Delicious wholesome food, good portion, healthy and Halal. Love their selection of pasta and bowls. My personal favourites are the Bolognese Ragu Bianca and the Mexican Beef bowl. You must try their decadent Tiramisu,  a family recipe prepared by the Italian Chef Jade. FeastwithJJ is highly recommended.

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
An unassuming prata shop but one of the best prata I've had! Coin prata is a must order, love how crispy it is. Plain prata is flaky and egg prata is soft and pillowy. The fish curry here is so good. So flavourful and can get free refills. There's usually a queue, it's quite an okay queue, about 15 mins. Definitely coming again!

Overall, I feel that the prata is not particularly outstanding. However, their gravy is definitely above average. Very flavourful but also very spicy. In fact a little too spicy for me. Mutton is quite tender.

The coin prata is very crispy and I believe they are famous for it.

Total damage is $16 which I thought is quite pricey although they gave a generous amount of mutton.

Easily one of the BEST Prata! Crispy on the outside, chewy on every bite. You have that balance of crispiness and the doughs chewiness. Everything is well cooked and left the pan at the right timing.

The magic complimenting the prata is the savoury sauce, curry... Yum yum!

Must EAT!

Hidden gem in a coffeeshop!

Sin Ming Roti Prata serves up very well done pratas in a coffeeshop that has a decent selection of foods. Their menu is extensive boasting 19 different sorts of prata (whether they are available all day, I'm not sure)!

Ordered 1 egg and 1 kosong today and paid $3.30 for that. A look at their cooking process shows 4 people around the prata grill, 2 'shapers' and the main prata-flipper whom I assume is the boss, leading his other subordinate over the grill. They also seem to cook it slower, and with less oil used compared to other establishments.

The kosong was served fluffed up, whilst having a decent enough amount of crispy parts. The egg prata felt like i was biting into a soft pillow of dough and egg. Very enjoyable indeed! Their dough has a tinge of sweetness to it too - I would know since I have my pratas without sugar or curry. Honestly, they are one of the better prata shops around, and their daily morning crowd is proof of that.

@goodfoodwrite - instagram & YouTube

One of the best if not the best roti prata I have tried in Singapore. The coin prata was crispy and fragrant, and the plain prata was equally crispy with slight chewiness. The curry has a hint of tangy taste. Overall a nice combination.

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
Had 1 set lunch with the Mushroom soup, serving for soup was a bit disappointing for set lunch. Not sure if the serving ala carte order would be the same or not. As for the taste, not much of surprise in any way.

The Arrabiata pasta (not fresh pasta) didn't gave the woah effect in any way as well. Saving grace was the fresh prawns.

My wife tried the Gnocchi with gorgonzola. Pasta (fresh) texture wasn't good, sauce not really to our likely.

Another disappointment is the dessert from the set lunch, which we had ordered the flourless Chocolate cake. Look at the picture and you will understand. Taste, so-so, maybe due to the presentation.

Lastly is the Tiramisu, saving grace to not get below 3 stars.

Overall, not a place which we would be considering to go again.

This is my 5th visit to Poco Loco. Each visit I am always bowled over by the great food . This is a hidden gem at Upper Thomson. I have eaten at many Italian restaurants, I have to say the pasta here are extremely good, full of flavour and really satisfying . Not sure where did the chef previously came from but I dare say it is even as good as some of higher class restaurants like Etna. Highly recommend.

Value for money! We tried PocoLoco for the first time and we really enjoyed our meal. We ordered 1 dinner set ($45), which consisted of an appetiser, 1 pasta dish, 1 main course and 1 dessert, there’s an option to order a glass of wine for $8. We ordered an extra pasta dish with lamb as well. Portion was good (not too small/big) and our favourite was the pork collar main course (part of the dinner set). Price was nett and drinks were reasonably priced as well ($2 for jasmine green tea and other soft drinks). Overall it was enjoyable and value for money.

Generally the food is fresh and not too bad. We had mushroom soup, calamari, spaghetti carbonara, spaghetti arrabbiata, spaghetti vongole, Panna Cotta and chocolate flourless cake.The first 2 items and the last are worth trying. Could give the calamari a miss though. The restaurant is within 5mins walking distance from tel station exit 4.

Jun 2023. I always loved pocoloco Italian food. We got mushroom soups, seafood pasta and lasagne.
Nothing to complain about.
Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.name: PocoLoco

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
A hidden Thai outlet in industrial estate with strong support from the nearby workforce. Food is authentic n lunch value set can be considered. Delicious 😋

Very decent Thai food for its price. Used to be cheaper and came here a lot when studying at a school nearby. Prices went up since 2017 but the food is excellent. The Thai Beef green curry is a must get, so is the basil sauce fish fillet. It is closed from 3-6pm so take note. Recently they seem to start taking reservations, so if you have a big group might want to call earlier to get seats. The Thai milk tea and lemon grass drinks are very nice!

Comfort meal with decent Thai food.
We’ve dined at this outlet several times, good quality food is served here. If you enjoy milky curry, do give their green curry a try, tastier when soaked in the pineapple rice. Their appetizers are all good too, prawn cake is our favourite. Yummy Thai iced tea and green milk tea, sadly the mango sticky rice is always sold out. Take note that Jai Thai doesn’t serve Thai pork dishes.

Decent Thai food with reasonable price. I personally love their fried “Kang Kong” and clear tomyam soup. Will try out other Thai dishes, green beef curry, pandan chicken, etc in the future…

Been eating here for many years, maybe my own taste buds have changed as well but the food doesn't seem as good. A bit too sweet like every other generic thai food chain.

Other than that the prices have gone up and portions have gone down, but that can be said for most places since COVID so it's understandable
Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.name: Jai Thai Restaurant

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
An absolute gem tucked deep in Namly estate. Amano's does great pizzas which are generously sized with a nice crunchy crust and fluffy dough.
The rocket and prosciutto pizza is reliably good. Prawn and bacon was also excellent.
Look out for their weekday promos which are an exceptional deal for the taste and quality of the food.
Staff were polite and kept our water glasses topped up.
Good place for a nice and laid-back weeknight dinner.
Parking can be tricky since it's in a residential area, but normally don't have to walk too far to get one one weekdays.
I find the tiramisu a tad cloying on the sweetness, would give other options a go next visit.

As this place is quite hidden amongst the private estate enclave, there is little crowd and no need for reservations (even on Friday evening).
Decent Italian food with oven baked pizza! The best dish was the seafood risotto! Yummy!

Amano is probably one of the best kept secrets for those looking for budget (relative to the usually more upscale options) Italian food. One of the main reasons for this is its location - it is located deep inside a private estate at a standalone row of shophouses. Unless you drive, you'll probably have to do a fair bit of walking to reach it. If you drive though, you can park for free along the road just outside. The food itself is really nice, especially the pastas and pizzas. Despite being a relatively small joint, they do have one of those huge traditional pizza ovens and I understand that their dough is made in-house. Can't comment on the other types of dishes on the menu but the pastas and pizzas are generally a safe bet. Do not that the pizzas are huge so you can definitely share one among two, or even three persons! The place itself is usually empty so you can just pop by and eat without too much fuss. Strongly recommend if you're willing to travel abit!

A hidden gem in the middle of a neighborhood. Only way to get there is to drive.

Food in general is a good variety and decent quality. Prices are much friendlier than the other Italian restaurants in the Bukit Timah area. And service has been excellent.

Dinner for 3: Had 2 starters (burrata/ prosciutto platter and bread basket), 3 mains (1 pizza, 1 seafood pasta and 1 lamb gnocci), 2 glasses of wine.

Enjoyed the food, though I thought the gnocci was a bit too salty - probably won't get 2 tomato based ones next time. Whilst generous with the cheese on the Pizza, I reckon the restaurant can do better with a better selection of parmesean topping for pastas.

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
Takeaway the roast pork dry noodle ($4.50) with braised egg ($0.70) on 12 June 2023.

Initially wanted to eat the dumpling 🥟 noodle but was informed no dumplings. So ordered roast pork (which I had tried before and it’s way better than their char siew) noodle instead and requested for no chili; later I added in some sliced pickled green chili.

Finished this in 7 minutes. Only gripe is that the portion is too little that I had to eat my tea time snack (which is DJ Bakery’s powdered sugar donut) immediately after as I was still hungry.

Initially wanted to eat the dumpling 🥟 noodle but was informed no dumplings ☹️. So ordered roast pork noodle instead and requested for no chili; later I added in some sliced pickled green chili.
.

Finished this in 7 minutes 😋😋😋😋😋. Though price is cheap, the only gripe is that the portion is too little that I was still hungry.

Value for money chicken rice see my photo to get what I meant. Coffee shop not glamorous and is non air-conditioned. The mixed vegetable rice is also very worth my money!!!

Roasted Pork Rice is delicious and price is reasonable. Good to try if it is nearby.

My go to place for a quick brunch nearby. There are a few varieties including Cai Fan, noodles, chicken rice and roasted pork dishes. Generally ok with reasonable price. Can be quite crowded during lunch hour though.

Never fail to have the bak chor mee whenever im here, also like their coffee, with nice fragrance and most importantly, the taste of the black coffee is thick enough.

We would love to collaborate with you. Thank you!
Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.name: Teongchewkeng

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
Professional service was provided by the thoughtful and attentive staff. An entire birthday cake, not merely a slice, was given to us. Most dishes were great. The highlight of the meal was the seafood stew. All the breads were also exceptionally delicious. However, the sea bass tasted very ordinary and the sky high price tag went to the showy ‘performance’ by the chef. Restaurant was too dim and had a funky smell.

The staff are very friendly and the food is also tasty. The portion is surprisingly big and we ate till our hearts content.

Staff very helpful and polite. Atmosphere is chill with soft music. Food serve just in the right timing.  Of cause the price is not cheap. But it worth the price overall.

Lastly thanks for the birthday cake. Love it but we were too full to finish it.

Booked Sunday afternoon to have their set lunch, only to find out they only serve buffet that day at $78++ per person. Opted in anyway and didn't regret it, given the fresh ingredients, great taste of Italian and friendly staffs! Personally I love the dessert section especially Panna Cotta! If I had to pick on something, it'd be the dim lighting. No discount on the bill even with Shangri-la Circle membership, but you do get extra points.

Remember, when you get into the lobby, you are on 3F. You need to take an elevator to get down to 1F where the restaurant is.

The restaurant has decent ambience for a semi chic and comfortable dinning experience. The salt crusted fish is delicious and if you want to see some fire show. The winner for me is the crab pasta. Yum!

We celebrated our anniversary dinner here and it was a great decision! They generously presented us a complimentary cake, thank you for perfecting the night.
Among the dishes, we absolutely love the Porchetta. It was tender, yet crispy and flavourful, Highly recommended! While on the other side, we didn’t like the potato purée in the braised lamb leg dishes. It may have ruined the experience with that main dish. Despite that, this would not stop us from giving 5 stars because the other aspects (service/ambience) make up to it. A great dining place for celebrations.
Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.address: 22 Orange Grove Rd, Level One, Garden Wing, Singapore 258350
Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
Without any doubt, it is the best Italian restaurant in Singapore. You can enjoy southern Italiano taste here. There's reason why this restaurant survived during the pandemic. Leonardo, the boss of Caruso, always treat his guests with his best.

The perfect Italian restaurant at Western Central. With every pride and passion possible, each dish is carefully prepared with excellent taste. The service is exceptionally pleasant with an original Italian taking you through their signature dishes.

2 recommendations here. Reserve your table way in advance. Parking is ample at Guthrie House behind.

The Italian food here is very authentic. They use fresh ingredients. The ingredients look simple but the aroma and taste of the dishes are very flavourful.
It was super busy and packed during mother's day, but the Italian owner was very approachable and friendly, and tried his best to get us our reserved table as soon as possible as the previous seating was late.
Love their pistachio gelato with bailey shot. It's really 👍.
Will definitely visit again!

Very pleasant Italian cuisine! The food is the attraction here, wouldn't rate the ambience and the service as 5 because it's just not there. However the food served was really scrumptious. Highly recommend the lamb steak. Would come back for the food again.

It was a pleasant visit, although I expected more as this is an authentic Italian restaurant. It was for a girlfriend’s birthday treat and we were served 2 slices of plain bread after ordering. It came with olive oil and balsamic vinegar but no side nor small plates were provided. So we ended up pouring the dips onto our main dining plate. No butter was served either.
The $58 mixed grilled meat platter was delectable. The lamb and pork belly were enjoyable. The salad was served was limp and there was no crunch nor freshness

We asked for mint sauce and the server wasn’t sure and said would check if available. Few minutes later, she served us brown sauce instead. We didn’t want to trouble the crew and decided to stick with the brown sauce. The meat was already tasty and we wanted the mint sauce to balance the taste. Nonetheless, I wonder if mint sauce was available as this is an Italian restaurant. I totally respect the original taste of the meats and used the brown sauce only sparingly. Service was friendly. Paid $123 for 2 mains (a pasta and mixed grill) and a bottle of sparkling water.
Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.name: Caruso

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
The food was nice and yummy. All dishes were cooked really well. Price point on the higher side. Would I come back? Probably. Is it worth the price? Hmm can’t say for sure.
The food was undeniable good though

Fresh ingredients, taste of the original ingredients, simply steam the fresh crab with soya sauce, this require very fresh crab, and the soya sauce enhanced the taste.

Another dish I like was their yong tou fu, they make their own Toufu.
It was tender and the minced meat were well blend in their toufu.

The food here is excellent, very high quality and flavor is authentic and tasty. The peking duck is really good and the pancakes they used are really unique and delicious. Service is also very good even when busy. The restaurant ambience is very nice and is a great place for many occasions whether entertaining guests or celebrating family events

Over the years, the food standard has dropped IMO as they were really good in their initial few years back in 2011 when the Island new clubhouse was completed. Nevertheless, we still patronize them as the savings on the 10% service charge as member helps to defray the costs of the meal. In addition, the roast duck is nicely done - crispy skin and juicy meat on the inside. As a member's club, the service level from the wait staff is acceptable.

Great place for a sit down family dinner. The service is good and food is yummy! Request for the table with the view - the sunset over the golf course was simply breathtaking!

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
The experience at Birds of a Feather is simply outstanding! The food, service and atmosphere are nothing short of excellent.

For those who like spicy, find the chicken in the chill is a must order! The barramundi dish left a very good impression in my dining experience.

Overall, highly recommend for you to come down and try! I will definitely come back again to try the other dishes.

You have to give this restaurant a try. This is my 3rd visit. I have always enjoyed their food. Presentation is top notch, like a piece of art. Though it's fusion food, the flavours of East and West are cohesive. In my opinion, the people who created the dishes have a profound knowledge of flavours and texture. Who would have thought of grilled octopus and feta cheese? Amazing flavours!

Some of the best modern twist to Chinese food. I absolutely loved every dish I tried when I was there. Here are two of my favourite dishes.
I spent my 18th anniversary there with my wife and we were absolutely impressed! I will definitely dine with you guys again! Unforgettable

A very carefully designed location for a well-balanced preparation of such a lavish selection of appetisers, entrees, and desserts. Not to mention the coffee and cocktails they offer.

Service was also top-notch, from greeting us to showing us to our table, taking our orders, taking our pictures, and repeatedly checking to make sure everything was okay on our end.

You get the impression that everyone is catching up and having a good time, which somehow makes a romantic dinner seem more informal. Friends catching up and couples enjoying a good supper together make up 80/20 of the crowd.

Everything about the experience was wonderful, including the ambiance, the cuisine, the service, and even how clean the restrooms were.

Well done Birds of A Feather team and management. KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK! SINGAPORE needs more places like yours. Congratulations for a job well done!

Food - super good. Must try pork belly

Service - unsatisfactory. The staff appeared rushed and lacked patience. Despite our attempts to get their attention on four separate occasions, our efforts were disregarded, leaving us feeling overlooked and undervalued.

Atmosphere - persistent noise and the intrusion of smoke odors
Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.name: Birds of a Feather

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
No comment is needed on the food served in MTR. super fresh.

I ordered Rava Idly, Uddina Vada, Masala Dosa and Masala tea.

Rava Idly: coriander and nut and smth more in the Idly. soft and fluffy. perfect match with mint chutney.

Uddina Vada: wooooow. this is the heaven. 0.01mm of layer of crispy and very soft dough. Woooooow……..

Masala Dosa: was getting full after 2 dishes above… but still i enjoyed it… crispy layer and soft and chewy inner dough

Masala tea: thick. customised sugar level adding sugar prepared on the table.

will visit many more times…..

Must visit place of you love South Indian cuisine. Be prepared for some waiting in the queue since it is very popular. But the turnaround time is very fast. Just love their Thalis with so many flavours, podi dosa, khali dosa, idli.

This is my all time favorite Southern Indian restaurant in Singapore! As a vegetarian, I always come back here for their dosas and idlies. If you find yourself in Little India/Farrer Park, you have to try here at least once!

Well, I can’t really find words to discribe the taste. It was just delicious and heavenly feeling to have this comfort food after a long flight.

MTR has been best at what they do, I love their products 😘.

Super duper authentic South Indian food.

Price: $6.50 (Plain Thosai 1st Picture)
$7.56 (Pudi Masala Thosai 2nd Picture)

Plain Thosai: 5/5
The usual thickness of a thosai but was extremely crispy. Thosai was flavourful and slightly nutty.

Pudi Masala Thosai: 5/5
Crispy on one side and soft on the other. Cheesy taste from the thosai likely from ghee. The pudi spice blend is savoury and quite spicy. The potato filling was really flavourful, soft, slightly sweet from the onions, very tasty.

Sambar: 5/5
The sambar was flavourful, bright, spicy and slightly sweet.

Chutney: 5/5
Green chutney was flavourful, coconuty and slightly minty.

Total score: 15/15

Add-ons: Uddin Vada ($3.24) was extremely delicious. Insanely crispy thin outer shell and soft inside. Filter Coffee ($3.20) was fragrant, tasty and a wonderful way to end the meal.

I first ordered the Plain Thosai, finished it before I made my order for the remaining Pudi masala thosai, Uddin Vada and filter coffee. Not sure if it was coincidental or just amazing service but the Pudi masala thosai came next, and when I was just about finish, the Vada came. And shortly before I finished the filter coffee came. I was extremely impressed at the end of my meal.

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
A great authentic family restaurant nestled within the Japanese Association. Maybe it’s the Japanese families dining around you, but it feels exactly like Japan in this place. Although the food isn’t the best, there is a warm homely flavour to the dishes. Had the seasonal special Hamburg rice with demi-glace sauce and was pleasantly surprised by the huge portion, with the beef being tender and not too gamey. Special shout-out for the salmon head which also comes in a generous portion for a very reasonable price!

Do take note that only members may gain entry or bring guests to dine at the restaurants within the Japanese Association.

We adjourned here for desserts and coffee after lunch at Akane.  The staff here are friendly and helpful.

If possible, request for the private room at the end if you are a large group.  There is a $10 surcharge but this can be waived.

There are special offers which include free flow beverages for $3 each if you order a mains or dessert.  It was well worth it, as we could try their cold brew coffee, cappuccino, mango juice and teas etc.

We enjoyed desserts like matcha ice cream, coffee with vanilla ice cream, mochi and cheesecake cup.

You need to be a member or signed in by one to enter Akane or Donguri.

Hokkaido milk soft serve is the best.
Restaurant closes at 8.30pm.
Member only venue.

The service and taste must be good because it’s the Japanese restaurant in the heart of Japanese Association... did look fine to me.

The dishes like set menu, donburi, and assorted sushi are around $20 should be good pricing. I actually felt like ordering Unagi Bento with a free drink bar for $27 or so...

The problem is, only the Japanese Association members or the escorted guests can dine there and I had to leave the place just before ordering like a guy in a wrong place.

Restaurant is located inside of Japanese Association building, and need to be accompanied with member. Variation of food is quite good, covering from Japanese, Chinese to Western option. Quality of food is also good. Location could be a challenge as no MRT nearby (accessible only by bus).

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.name: Donguri Family Restaurant

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
Came for dinner & celebrate my husband's birthday. Every dishes I ordered are quite well-balanced in terms of taste. The staffs are really nice and friendly too. Really appreciate the effort to leave a birthday message on the dessert upon my last min request.

What a phenomenal experience! It’s my 3rd time here and I’m pleasantly impressed. Spectacular French techniques (the sauces are always on point) blended with an Asian/local twist.

MUST ORDER:
1. Lemon sole Meunière
2. Purple cabbage
3. Roasted Bone marrow w/ escargot

Thanks Dylan and Sky! Service always spot on and the ambiance is perfect for a casual date or post-work catchup over a few bottles of 🍷 vino (they have an EXCELLENT wine list with natural wines in case you are averse to sulfites).

They have an assortment of sharing / holiday menus.
GO TRY NOW. Thank me later :)

A gem which serves quality fusion dish!

Pasta is well seasoned! Especially the C&C&C&C pasta which pack with lots of umami flavours.

In my opinion, there are no hit and miss dishes. Every dishes they serve are cooked to perfection!

Atmosphere is pleasant. Definitely a place for date or even family gathering.

Price is steep but justifiable with the quality food they serve!

All in all, this is a place to visit if u looking for something unique and at same time quality food!

Staffs are friendly and helpful too!

To restaurant staff:
One suggestion is to change the hand soap in the  toilet as it smells “overdue” 😅

Enjoyed the food. Delicious and well balanced. Enjoyed the pork Tomahawk, Duck Confit with Wok Hey Rice Noodles, as well as the risotto.

Did not enjoy the Desserts as much.

Place was rather small, with the tables placed really closed to one another.

Great experience overall. Will like to go back to try more.

Had an amazing dining experience at The Masses today.

Lilian has been a wonderful host with her generous smile. She has been very welcoming and patience in her order taking, and ensuring timely delivery of meal courses.

The food was an absolut delight (compliments to the chefs). Throughly enjoyed every course. Special mention to the chicken liver pate and duck confit with noodles, truly amazing.

The atmosphere has been really cosy and comfortable.
Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.name: The Masses Singapore

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
one of the best prata which i patronise over 10 years.  not those crispy oily type but chewy and freshly made to order.  try the prata with their fish curry!

hardly can find this type of prata as nowadays many prefers the crispy type which lack the authentic taste.

the place is clean and bright after reno.

give it a try!

Price: $2.00 (Plain Thosai)

Plain Thosai: 4.5/5
Crispy, savoury and good sour taste.

Sambar: 4/5
Flavourful and slightly spicy.

Chutney: 4.5/5
Orange chutney was sweet, spicy and slightly minty. White chutney was savoury and coconuty.

Total score: 13/15

Opens early for breakfast :)
I ate the egg masala thosai. I personally prefer the potato to have more texture (not so mashed like mash potato) so this masala thosai potato has parts that are too mashed up 🥲 like puree. However! I love the yogurt dips on the side. The portion of thosai is also big! I will still come back for it ☺️ Teh Halia is also good but missing the tarik feel (not frothy). The prata is more doughy, less crispy so those who like doughy kind, will prefer this. Regular curry can be improved, quite watery. Price is higher probably because it is a standalone shop. Sadly the indoor seats are very very warm. Ventilation is no good. I hope they get smaller tables for outdoor seats so that more people can sit outside 😊

First time there, Food is good. Not bad.. Impressed with the atmosphere / vibe. Restaurant is clean. Toilet is clean too..not like those other common coffee shops.

Other than the long serving time, the food is wonderful here. I had chicken murtabak and my friend had an egg prata, they taste great, very savoury.

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.name: 5G Restaurant

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
We had our dinner here on Good Friday night with the last minute reservation from google.
We ordered a starter, a pizza, a grilled meat platter and a Lebanon dessert. The food worth 2 stars. The meat was pretty hard, the starter was too sour. The dessert was really not able to match our taste. The house wines was tasteless, but the red wine taste better when it pair with the meat. I will strongly recommend you only order the red if you want to have their one for one house wine promo.
Our bill was $128, you can get a much more better grilled meat platter and better food at other restaurants. :)

Le Rida has a rustic ambience somewhat akin to an old time eating house in a small town. Quaint and homely
Freshly baked pita bread with lemon chick pea hummus was delicious and filling
Mains of Lebanese lamb kafta kebab had the right balance of flavour and crunchiness.
Wash it all down with 1 for 1 Heineken draft at $17.90

Manager Sanjiv was both friendly and helpful in his recommendations and unlike in some establishments, he did not push you to over order.
Definitely worth a return visit!

A quaint no frills dining place with excellent food and good service. The staff are simple people but are very hospitable, often checking in on the food quality and our experience. If you are looking for a good meal away from hustle and bustle, this is the place to go. Oh.. U can definitely have a conversation with your company and hear them loud and clear

Didn't think the food was thaaaat amazing. Nor was the service. But at least they let us drink outside drinks.
HOWEVER, i requested for no garnishing on my hummus. When the guy brought it over, there WAS parsley on it. And all he said was "just pluck it out". --.--
So if i was allergic to that, i should just pluck it out.... nice. The hummus wasn't good either. I've tasted better. Like a friend who went with me commented... it isn't creamy enough. Also, comments about the baklava was that it was too hard... and wasn't good.

Absolutely loved the food, I am heavily into Mediterranean food. I have tried most of the places around Bugis as well. The food here was so fresh, with perfect taste and presentation. It was completely worth it travelling from East.
The service was quick, the portion size was generous . We ordered mezze plateer and tabalu salad. They were scrumptious loved the customised heart shaped Pita bread. Hummus, was so creamy and so were all other dips.

Would strongly recommend.. It has become one of my favourite place..

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.name: Le Rida (Mediterranean. French. North Indian)

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
This is a nice restaurant tucked away in the SIM building. The restaurant was quite full for dinner as it appears there may have been a corporate function at the location which is not surprising. Nevertheless, the service was excellent and the staff were quite attentive despite the number of dinners. They have a good mix of Asian and Western food. The Nasi Kuning platter was good with lots of variety. Will come again to try the different dishes.

Had a lovely and delectable time on a quiet Saturday night. Standouts were definitely the burrata tomato salad, buah keluak beef cheek with truffle risotto and the kaya banana crumble with gula Melaka ice cream. The burrata was fresh and creamy and paired well with the sweet and juicy tomatoes. Beef cheeks were cooked to perfection - soft, tender and melt in your mouth - and the buah keluak sauce doused over it was subtly nutty and moreish. The kaya banana crumble was the perfect ending to the meal; kaya custard layered with caramelised bananas, all encased within a crisp and delicately thin shell, topped with coconut crumble with gula melaka ice cream on the side. We’ll be back for more!

I had the privilege to enjoy a wine paring meal with Glug Glug Wines and Table at 7. The meal was well thought of and the wine pairings elevated the dishes. I am hard pressed to choose my favourite course but if I had to, it would be the scallop and uni dish.

Besides the amazing meal, I was greeted with amazing and warm service from the team. Lastly, my glass and plate were never empty; a testament to the amazing and attentive service.

What a joy, I am looking forward to my next meal at Table at 7!

A friend organized lunch here and, overall, it was a good experience.  I liked the beef soup starter, even when the wagyu oxtail was changed, and I thought it was the best dish of my lunch.  A close second was the gado gado, with its fresh ingredients.  We also liked the sambal belachan which came with the empeng and keropok.

The mains were nasi lemak, mee goreng Java and ikan woku.  The nasi lemak was nice, but the chicken was too dry and difficult to cut, even with a knife.  The otah was okay, if a tad bland.  The noodle dish was pretty tasty, as was the fish rice.

Dessert was profiteroles, Indonesian bubur chacha and iced chendol.  The missus liked the chocolate profiteroles, while I found the chendol to be bland.  It had diced up jackfruit pieces and the attap chee was sliced into thin slices, but it could have used more gula Malacca and stronger coconut.  The banana in the bubur chacha was sour and past its used by date, so they were kind enough to replace it with a chendol, which was much better this time with more brown sugar.

Our server, Joe, was friendly and even took the time to help groups with photo taking, even when he was the only waitstaff.

Parking is free, and the eatery is in rather a quiet spot.  Do note that some parking areas are reserved for faculty members.

First time at this restaurant and it was an interesting experience. We had the Martell pairing dinner, which worked out to over $700 for 3 pax. The restaurant is located within the SIM campus along Namly Road, and it's quite an intimate setting, as the restaurant is pretty quiet. I imagine it to be a great place for a date. The food was tasty, but I had to have a snack after dinner. Service was really good. Attentive and friendly.

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.name: Table at 7

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
Great hearty food at neighbourhood prices! Never tasted Nepali food and so that was a welcomed change. Service was great. Staff was attentive and helpful (despite the busy evening). Only let down was that the mains were not served together and the soup served was different from what was included in the set). Would have been great if this was relayed earlier.

Came to dine on a weekend, so had to wait for table as it’s crowded. The food is nice and value for money. The beef is done to the medium I wanted, chicken chop also tastes good. And they have Stella beer on tap at a very good price. Will definitely come back again.

Hidden in the heartlands, this restaurant serve excellent western food at affordable prices. The meat of the lamb shank was tender. Fish and chip was value for money as the fish slices were thick and not thinly sliced. Cheese oyster was excellent. An overall excellent experience.

A nice and cozy neighborhood western restaurant shop. More like German than Nepalese.Quite crowded during holiday, make reservation. Food is good. Steak ribeye taste better than A***n. Oxtail is best. Pork Knuckles is huge and need to wait for 1/2hour or pre-order.

I chanced upon this old restaurant and read good reviews on this restaurant.
The restaurant was almost full but the staff managed to get us a table for 6.
We ordered the western food set lunches and the food was generous and good.
All the lunch sets comes with soup of the day, drinks, mains and desserts.
Will come and try their Nepalese specialty the next time.

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
A decent place with only seating outside, so dinners & drinks will be better if it’s not raining. Price of bucket beer varies time to time, food will be above average and staff are friendly. Today Garlic Naan was not cooked properly and Butter Chicken was good.

Tried the biryani.. it was more like fried rice with some gravy and veges. Maybe the curry-naan is better. Haven't tried.

It was told food taste is really good , so came here and Waitress told to make an order from app for discounts and I did. Waited for 45 minutes food didn’t arrive. Very lousy service. I don’t recommend this place.

Great non Indian ambience with fantastic Indian food and crafted beers. Recommended.

Been there multiple times and loved the food almost every time. They have awesome lunch sets which are very reasonable as well.

The right match of quality and quantity. Would definitely recommend for lunch and snack fare.

For dinner, I would not recommend as I have found the food losses it's freshness when it was prepared during the lunch time.

Nevertheless, a do try.

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.name: Food On Fire

Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.reviews:
Lovely venue to get a quick pizza fix.

Pizza arrived piping hot and with generous toppings to ensure each bite is filled with yummy bits

The wings was better than expected, what they lack in presentation was made up by the taste. My kids LOVED them.

And the garlic bread has a surprising twist to it. Not your everyday garlic bread.

Seating is limited so reserve if coming in a group >4.

This is my 2nd time here and both times Rao was super friendly and helpful. He provided us with recommendations and also offered to change up the ingredients for my dinner companion who had some food sensitivities. There's also good music and a good menu. Love the garlic bread with mozzarella cheese here!

We'll probably be back again!

I thought this place is already closed as most of the GrandStands shops are closed.
It’s a quiet lunch with only one table filled.
Food was good, but it give me a feeling that these are prepared in the factory.

I wanted to go to Da Valentino, but did not want to brave the heavy rain as the entrance was unsheltered.

Instead, I decided to try this place due to the good reviews but my heart sank when the pizza was delivered. The thin crust was the best part, but honestly the $24 pizza tasted as cheap as the chicken sausage topping. It was decent. The Paulanar lager tasted better. If you are happy with Domino’s, you will be happy here. Except Domino comes with 2 pizzas for almost the same price.

The staff was friendly. The place is quiet as most shops are empty due to the impending demolishing of the Grandstand.
Food: 3 | Service: 5 |

It was full house over the weekends, waited a while for the food to be served. There’s a peculiar sour taste on the Caesar salad but it taste good!

Ordered a pizza & the granchio pasta which is done to perfection (to me). Staff were super busy, yet they managed to put on a friendly smile.
