Restaurants offering takeout in Singapor.name: Napolizz Pizza (GrandStand)

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
Nice vegan and vegetarian option. But the vegan food was lacking in flavor. The atmosphere is really beautiful though.  I think the first dish, the desert, and the risotto were very good! And the drinks were very special too! The people next to me had the vegetarian options and they said it was really good. I love the experience though and if you want to impress you vegan friends I would still bring them here just for the view and service.

Joie is an absolute gem for vegetarian dining in Singapore! The elegant ambiance, coupled with impeccable service, sets the stage for an unforgettable culinary journey. Each dish is a masterpiece, beautifully crafted with fresh, flavorful ingredients that redefine vegetarian cuisine. The creative menu offers a delightful fusion of tastes and textures, leaving me astonished with every bite. The attention to detail in presentation is exquisite, elevating the dining experience. Joie isn't just a restaurant; it's a celebration of vegetarian gastronomy, and I can't wait to return for more culinary delights!

I had a fantastic experience at Joie Vegetarian Restaurant! The Monkey Head Mushroom Steak was a true culinary delight. The flavors were exquisite, and it's clear that the chefs put a lot of thought and care into their dishes. What impressed me the most was the affordability of the 5-course meal. It's not often you find such a high-quality dining experience at such a reasonable price. The service was impeccable, and the ambiance was lovely. I can't wait to return for another delicious meal!

We dined at Joie today, July 16, 2023, and it was an outstanding experience. The service was excellent, and the food surpassed our expectations.
The attention to detail in dish presentation was evident. The staff's timing and coordination were impeccable, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable dining experience. The relaxed ambiance with soft lighting and comfortable seating added to the inviting atmosphere.
In conclusion, Joie offers an exceptional dining experience with attentive service and delicious food. I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a memorable culinary adventure. I can't wait to visit again.

My first time trying vegetarian fine dining, the foods were surprisingly good! The waitress , Kelly, was very professional, she explained the dishes to us and also show us the right way to enjoy the dishes. The main dishes , mushroom steak and risotto were very impressed too. I will definitely come back again.
Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.name: Joie | Vegetarian Casual Fine Dining
Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.query: Restaurants with vegan options in Singapore

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
Great food, since many years ago. Vegetarian but meat eaters will enjoy this place too.

Mezze platter was quite big even for 2 pax.

Really enjoyed the moussaka and the Spanakopita.

If you pay by cash there is some free ice cream.

First time visiting due to friend’s recommendation. Did not disappoint. Lots of options that don’t make you feel you’re eating vegetarian. Drink menu is extensive but on pricey side. Service was good.

Ambience - The restaurant has this very European, relaxed vibe. Good for families but I don‘t see why you can’t go for a date either 😁

Food - my friend and I ordered the halloumi salad and lasagna. We really enjoyed the meal, the ingredients were good quality and food was prepared with care. However, did feel the halloumi was a bit too salty. They have a variety of Mediterranean and Italian options and can make it vegan too. Didn’t really enjoy the rose though.

Service - prompt service and the staff were polite and friendly

Would definitely return again.

You won't believe how rare it is to have a Mediterranean vegetarian place that has so many allium free options, including the Pizzas. Glad to see original sin survive the pandemic when many didn't.

The Moussaka and Mediterranean pizza were good, though a little too salty but that's probably just me. Nice ambience for a date with friends or the significant other, especially over a good conversation. You pay for the quality. Enjoy!

Wonderful and classy vegetarian restaurant. Had dinner here with the wife on a weekday evening. Food was wholesome, good service and atmosphere. Recommended!
Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.address: 01-62 Jln Merah Saga, Chip Bee Gardens, Blk 43, Singapore 278115
Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.name: Original Sin Restaurant
Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.query: Restaurants with vegan options in Singapore

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
The food was super good! I'm glad I made the ride here! The customer service was no so good but that has been my experience in Singapore hahaha 🤣 you must try the vegan dumplings they are the best! I also had the Nasi Lemak and it was delicious 😋🤤.

It's in B1 so take the elevator then go through the door on your left lol.

In case your looking for the restaurant it's downstairs in B1, we went for dinner and it was very quiet. Ordered the clay pot rice which was the highlight! Dumplings were so so with to much wrap for my taste. Laksa was ok also. Overall it was quick service and Decent food. You have to order also at the counter and pay upfront.

This place looks... ordinary... in fact a little plain and obscure. But, the food is phenomenally good. Seriously they should be awarded a Michelin Star.
Came highly recommended by my partner, and despite a long work day, we chose to go for dinner. We ordered what you see in the pictures--and we were blown away. Really, very good, no it's outstanding.
Everything is good, and I particularly like the dumplings, the Nonya laksa, Lasagne, especially the Korean noodle Jajangmyeon, I must go back there and eat again! And the cheese cake is to die for! They have a reputation for THE BEST VEGETARIAN LASAGNE in Singapore, voiced by Food Critics, and I can tell you, you would have wasted your trip if you did not try it!
The service is personal, plain, direct and friendly (no airs). The people here are just down to earth, and the food service is fast. It's best to go in the evening, because it's in the CBD area, and therefore day time it would be crowded.
This is a vegan place, so for those of you are allergic to milk or preservatives, you can eat with a peace of mind.
I would highly recommend this place, give a 4.5 Star. The 1/2 star missing is for them to include more local favourite like the Char Kway Teow and perhaps Hor Fun. Really all they serve there is very very good. Go and thank me later. Just go!

One of the trusted place for vegetarian food. Always enjoy the simple but nice offering there... Assam fish has the sour kick. Nasi Lemak was great with the chilli.

Small menu yet you can definitely find something you’ll like! Has a range of local food and western food - Nonya laksa, chicken rice, dumplings to lasagne and salads!

I have tried the laksa, very rich not too spicy soup. The chicken rice made from beancurd is very meaty and the chilli sauce has a kick!

My favourite drink to order is their homemade almond milk - very thick (might not be for everyone), rich and filling.

It is at basement of havelock II, it has limited seats due to the small storefront, and can be a good place to catch up with friends as the area is not too noisy

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
We are not vegetarian but what is not to like? This place makes eating too enjoyable. The food is very very delicious and the service staff are very very attentive. Super recommendation coming from a pure meat and seafood lover.

Petai - great sambal chili fried with a whole plate of goodness

Olive fried rice - we had two plates, one after the other, enough to justify the deliciousness of the dish

Curry 'mutton' - good curry but something seems to be lacking in the flavour

Salted egg yolk - we had two plates of this too

Glutinous yam (suan pan zi) - delicious? We had four plates of this.

It is in my personal humble opinion that you are missing out on very good food if you have not tried this as a vegetarian.

Food is OK. The grilled mala fish is good! Impressive imitation of the texture very close to the real fish version.
Satay is also nice.
The rest are so so. Kids says favourite truffle fried rice that is usually fragrant at other places has no truffle taste. Frankly, I prefer the high tea at their other outlet.

Very delicious meal here! Portion is big price is reasonable. The fish is a must have! Very tasty 😋 I’m a meat lover and I thoroughly enjoyed myself at this vegetarian restaurant. Good job to the chef! Staff was attentive.

Celebrated our friend's birthday dinner at Lotus. It was indeed a great choice we've made and no regrets too. Food was well prepared and delicious. Atmosphere was chill and clean. Will come back again.

We came just to try the Grilled "Fish" and we were not disappointed albeit the flavour we chose does not resemble much of the original 烤鱼. It was still tasty and we would want to return to try the other flavours. The other dishes were also pretty good. The tofu box was really interesting with some diced mushrooms that provide an unusual taste and texture. The spinach in superior broth was done really nicely it tasted so premium. Tau Kwa Goreng was perfectly fried but a little spicy for me.

We were seated near a cabinet and discard trolley where staff kept walking to & fro, sometimes talking over our heads as they reach for stuff. Pretty unpleasant and lack of service etiquette.
Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.name: Lotus Vegetarian Restaurant
Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.query: Restaurants with vegan options in Singapore

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
The place has cafe like atmosphere. Food only has 6 course and 8 course meal only. The course meal can not be shared. The food portion is not so big, my friend and I ordered 6 course each and it feels very filling.

Ok so here is the deal, this was my last restaurant during my stay in Singapore and I almost didn't come because I thought it was only vegetarian but they have 2-4 options for every course and it was BY FAR THE BEST vegan meal I've had on my trip. I even had the potato salad and as a black man, I'm very picky about this, but it was unique and really good! The pasta, the bread stick, the drinks, the miso soup with surprises at the bottom. I mean if I wasn't leaving tonight, I would come back tomorrow! Please come here if you are VEGAN!!!! and I told the owners to please advertise that they have vegan options because they are so delicious 🤤🤤🤤

Only two set meal options are available (6 courses or 8 courses ) No À la carte option. No sharing of meals is allowed, meaning all dinners must ordered one set meal.

The starter are not bad and the salad is good.

Ordered the following dishes for the mains:

Olive fried rice
雷茶 Spaghetti
Star pizza
Baked Cauliflower
Baked Rice

Overall, the food was just ok, not really fantastic and worth the price.

Compared to another similar restaurant "Element", which I think it is much better and slightly cheaper 😀.

There are new dishes. 😍
Staff friendly and the food is delicious
Today Main Course ~~Cheesy Lemon Zest Liguine with Balsamic Vinegar (they can help removed onion garlic) and Lion's Mane Mushroom Steak with Crispy Mix Veggie. Love it. ❤️

I visited for lunch and was initially informed that only the lunch set was available, and individual dishes couldn't be ordered. This left me disappointed as I wanted to sample various items from the menu. However, I later learned that the set menu allowed me to select dishes from the à la carte menu.

During my visit, I tried the following:
1. Wholefood trio appetizer - a delightful starter that truly whetted my appetite.
2. Rosemary breadstick with mustard dip.
3. Mulberry cider - quite enjoyable.
4. Baked butter mushroom with garlic butter - a tasty dish.
5. Double-boiled cordyceps white fungus soup with black garlic.
6. Peppery golden quinoa risotto - although good, it lacked the desired level of peppery flavour, so I requested additional pepper to enhance it.
Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.name: Sufood
Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.query: Restaurants with vegan options in Singapore

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
Visiting Afterglow was a vibrant journey into the heart of plant-based cuisine. The experience started with their signature Afterglow Maki Rolls, a perfectly balanced spicy and tangy treat that set my taste buds alight, though they were a bit dry; however, upon request, the waiter kindly offered me some complementary almond spread as a dip.

Next came the Cauliflower ‘Steak’. It was nothing short of a culinary marvel, turning a humble vegetable into a dish bursting with flavor and texture, both hearty and delightful.

Finally came the Acai Bowl, a dessert that defied all my expectations. It wasn’t just a simple bowl of fruit and granola; it was an artful blend of fresh, juicy fruits, the crunch of granola, and the velvety smoothness of acai sorbet. Each spoonful was a celebration of taste, striking a rare balance between indulgence and health. This dish wasn’t just the end of a meal; it was the highlight, leaving a lasting impression of how incredibly satisfying and diverse vegan food can be.

Afterglow isn’t just a restaurant; it’s a testament to the beauty and richness of vegan cuisine. It’s a place where every dish is crafted with care, not just for the flavors but for the story it tells about plant-based eating. For anyone who cherishes vegan food or is curious about it, Afterglow is a must-visit. I loved it and will definitely be back!

Had a very attentive server explaining the ingredients behind the dishes. The menu is well marked for common allergens such as nuts, gluten, alliums, etc.

We absolutely loved the vegan meatballs. Each dish was flavorful and even our non-vegans friends had an enjoyable experience at this restaurant. The salads are also nicely seasoned. Would like to come back for their desserts next time.

The place is quite cozy and intimate but perhaps not suitable for larger groups (6+ people) as it is hard to navigate between tables.

First time visited with a friend for a lunch. The ambience and atmosphere is relaxing. The food portions are quite big and very satisfying. Really grateful for the kind lady who explained us and asked us if we had any allergies etc and notified us of the dishes that have nuts at the same time gave some good recommendations. Very attentive, detailed and the food was delicious. Such a heartwarming experience.

Some of the dishes are very nice, but overall too pricey. I like the vegetable purée, tomyum zoodles and cold lasagne very much. The beetroot hummus is good too. Kimchi roll is decent as well.

The atmosphere was cozy and inviting, perfect for a relaxing meal. The staff members were incredibly friendly and welcoming.  They took the time to give us detailed explanations of the dishes and provided us with their recommendations.

Every dish we've tried was bursting with flavors even though its vegan.
One dish that really stood out to me was the mushroom balls.
Its packed with savory umami flavors and the texture is on point.
The cauliflower steaks were also perfectly seasoned and had a delightful char that added a smoky depth to the dish.

The friendly and attentive service combined with the incredible food made for a truly memorable dining experience.

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
Comforting and delightful korean cuisine that is vegan and vegetarian friendly. Love most of the dishes I tried in my multiple visits here. Highly recommended. There were alot of insects in the restaurant on the day of my visit but it could be because of the rain.

Ordered via grab food. The kimchi jiggae healed my flu. The bulgogi fries were addictive.  The tteokbokki had the perfect chew.  Can't wait to actually eat at the restaurant to have a full experience.

I enjoyed my dish Army Stew which as you can see from the photo was bubbling away for minutes. My wife was rather underwhelmed by her dish though unfortunately.
The Kimchi Jeon (pancakes) were nice enough though not better than Indian flavoured breads/uttapam in that the flavour was not as storied/flavourful as we expected.
Staff were very nice and I'm sure if we had visited it when busier then we would have probably enjoyed it more. Their sister branch we happened to pass one evening and had a completely different feel, more intimate and cosy so we may try that another time. Very nice man on the reception.

The rare place that my daughter who is a vegan to enjoy Korean food. Surprisingly it's quite good even for a non-vegetarian like me.

Exceptional Korean food at a decent price.

Food is excellent & service is prompt. Tofu soup is delicious and flavourful, with the ingredients generously portioned. Omelette & Kimbap are also great.

This is also one of the few Korean places I've encountered where the Kimchi pancake can be shared between 2 people, which is great if you aren't dining in a large group.

Definitely give this place a try if you get the chance! Be warned you may have to queue during lunchtime.

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
First food experience in Singapore… and I am so impressed!
The food was excellent - portion sizes are generous. Two plates and small noodles was more than enough for two to share and almost finish. Drinks were quenching, and the service was outstanding. Thank you!

I got invited for lunch by work friends to this wonderful vegetarian restaurant. Being a vegetarian, I was delighted to see the vast options in the menu. Each dish we ordered was unique and with distinct aroma and taste. I particularly recommend signature olive rice, Garden Medley, Tempeh Long Beans with Olive to name a few. A very satisfying experience and look forward to next visit.

My very first visit to a vegetarian restaurant.  Service was great. They let me in a few minutes earlier than the opening time when they saw me waiting outside.

Staff were professional, proactive, and helpful.

I appreciated it when the staff told me that the number of dishes I ordered was already a lot, and previously informed me that the dishes I ordered were all mushroom-based and recommended different dishes for variety.

Food was tasty, especially the Thai green curry and the rendang. One of our companions was amazed when he was told the "chicken" in the dish he ate was not meat.

Portions were sizable and work well for group diners.

Whole Earth should be considered as the best restaurant serving plant-based food in Singapore. The location is in the Tanjong Pagar neighbourhood, just a short walk from the MRT station. They serve incredible vegetarian food. I’d say it’s quite unusual in a meat country such as Singapore.

Vegetarian food is hard to find as many eateries only offer a very small number vegetarian food on their menus. (usually pizza, sandwiches or soup).
The place is nicely renovated. The interior with its decor is simple & uncluttered. The establishment seems more keen on focusing on the food rather than a flashy interior. I’d suggest to book a table in advance.

The service is fast. The menu consists of classic dishes that’s a mix of  Peranakan & Thai. The restaurant is Singapore’s first & only plant-based restaurant to be awarded the Michelin Bib Gourmand for 6 years from 2016 - 2022. That, if anything, should make you curious & eager to visit.

For you who’s not vegan | vegetarian, don’t let the fact that this is a plant-based restaurant dissuade you from eating here or order food for take away. The quality, the taste, textures & the variety of flavours is second to none.

Generous portions
Quick and good service
U may want to make prior reservations since it is very busy during evenings and not much  place to accommodate walk-ins.
Neat and chique ambience. Easily accessible from tangong pagar MRT.

Pretty elaborate menu to cater to all taste buds. Amazing smokey aroma from the rice. Eat food while still hot. Once it cools off, taste no good

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
Perfect if you visit with friends/family as you can order various things from the menu and share them together. Our favorites are the biryani and butter naan. Read many reviews saying that the carrot cake is a must try but it didn’t really suit our palettes. The samosas are tasty but not very special. The lychee drink is refreshing, really helps after a long walk exploring the city. Would definitely visit again on our next trip to SG.

Price: $6.54 (Plain Thosai)

Plain Thosai: 5/5
Thosai was very crispy, savoury and slightly sour.

Sambar: 5/5
Sambar was flavourful, savoury, hearty and had a good lentil taste.

Chutney: 5/5
Orange chutney was tangy, sweet and spicy. White chutney was coconuty and spicy.

Total score: 15/15

Add-ons: Masala Tea ($4.16) was fragrant from the spices used and warm and comforting to drink.

There was a little waiting time but it was definitely worth the wait as the plain thosai was very delicious. From the thosai to the sambar and the two different chutney. Service team were really responsive to requests and new orders.

The place was brightly lit and a cozy place to have your Indian vegetarian classic as well as your familiar Singaporean dishes with a vegetarian twist.

The first time I went there, I had the vegetable briyani, Gobi 65, Aloo Gobi and mango lassi. The food was good and the lassi was awesome, don’t fade the lassi.

The second time that I went there, I had the fried carrot cake, murtabak and Gobi Manchurian and I’ll say to skip the Gobi Manchurian as the cauliflower was almost non-existent and I was just eating a lot of batter. The fried carrot cake is decent for an vegan take as it is not commonly available and the murtabak is alright but can be skipped.

Food was really nice. Enjoyed the dishes! The service can be improved, we were more or less asked to leave the moment we finished our food. We understand that they have limited seating and a queue but just felt rushed.

Good variety on the menu but I do find it moderately highly priced. Service was typical yet they really do have interesting things on the menu with Chinese and muslim influence. It has its own character but I do very much prefer pure Indian cuisine. It’s nice for the occasional change. Location was good, walking distance to the Little India train station and restaurant is clean and cool with air conditioning.

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
Food is good, Service is good too. A little improvement can be done in the seating area and hygienic. They could have much better crowd comming in with that.

Visited Anand Bhavan, opposite to Mustaffa after a long time few years later. I always recommend to visit and try their menu. This is Indian Vegetarian Resturant, better to try their tiffins items rather than rice items. Service will be quick, though there was a huge rush, served within 10 mins. Tired their Masala Rava Dosa, Mini Sambar Idly, Sambar Vada, Onion Uttappam and Poori set, and all
Of them tasted good. Sambar have lot of Brinjals only instead they can add lot of other vegetables also.

Wrong decision to visit this place and worst was to ask for take away. Just wanted to get idly set take away and thought that it would be fast. But unfortunately, waited for about 30 minutes after payment was made. The place has kitchen next to the washroom entrance and it was smelly and very unpleasant to stand there to wait for my order to be delivered to me. Overall, not very clean place to visit. Observed many foreigners there who might be looking for only vegetarian food and had limited choice rather to be there. I am sure it could be managed better in terms of cleanliness, service, order management for simple stuff. However, I was there after many years and may take me another few years to step in again.

Price: $3.60 (Plain Thosai)

Plain Thosai: 5/5
Thosai was savoury, crispy, soft and had a good sour flavour.

Sambar: 4.5/5
Sambar was savoury, flavourful, a little sweet from the vegetables and familiar tasting.

Chutney: 5/5
The orange chutney was flavourful, tomatoey and a little spicy. The white chutney was quite gingery and sweet from the coconut. The brown chutney tasted peanuty, savoury and was rather spicy.

Total score: 14.5/15

Add-ons: Masala Tea ($2.60) was fragrant, warm and comforting but could use more spices.

Service was fast and I received my thosai within 5 minutes. It will be quicker to get your drinks directly from Counter 1 at the restaurant as they seem slightly short-handed in the drinks area. The lady managing counter 1 is really nice and makes your drinks after seeing your receipt. I saw this as a good thing since I could decide when I wanted to have my masala tea instead of having it served while I was having my thosai.

The place was air conditioned and the place can get crowded and is a really bustling place near lunch time.

All in all, I enjoyed my brunch of thosai and masala tea at Ananda Bhavan Restaurant (Vegetarian). :)

One of the popular South Indian breakfast places of Singapore. The food preparation is Tamil style and quantity is apt.

Overall the taste, quality and hygiene was good and rates were genuine.

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
What a hidden gem! Very homely and cosy environment with great food!
We enjoyed every dish and the innovation behind each of them. Unique dishes not seen elsewhere and the set meal allowed us to have a taste of all the great dishes. Most dishes were made from scratch, even the ikan bilis! All made with minimal or no seasoning and all natural ingredients. Yum! 😍
Very worth it and I'll definitely be back again!

Great for celebrations. Remember to make a reservation. We were a group of 11 people and service was great. They made special provisions for parking because we had a family member with mobility issues. We also had a birthday cake and celebration.

Foodwise, in my opinion 佛有缘 serves the most unique vegetarian cusine in Singapore. The best is still Miao Yi (for personal reasons) but it closed down 😢 Forget about the 自在 "empire", Shu and coffee shop zizar, it's always the same old thing.

We had the cold dish with "ice vegetable" salad, which is really good. The yuzu monkey head mushroom is always a hit. The sugarcane flower is unique. And last and not the least, the humble bee hoon - is always a family favourite.

A Delightful Vegetarian Culinary Journey at Fo You Yuan Vegetarian Restaurant

Apart from the outstanding food, the service at Relocate Vegetarian Restaurant was impeccable. The staff members were friendly, attentive, and eager to cater to our needs, making us feel welcomed and valued throughout our dining experience.

Overall, Relocate Vegetarian Restaurant has truly impressed us with their diverse and mouthwatering selection of dishes. Whether you’re a vegetarian or simply looking to explore plant-based alternatives, this restaurant is an absolute gem. We highly recommend it to anyone seeking a memorable dining experience with top-notch vegetarian cuisine.

The delicate strands of noodles were expertly stir-fried with an assortment of fresh vegetables, creating a harmonious medley of taste and aroma.

The Rendang was a true masterpiece. The rich and aromatic coconut-based curry was impeccably spiced, resulting in a tantalizing symphony of flavors.

One of the highlights of our meal was the Vegetarian Shark’s Fin Soup. It was a delightful surprise to find a cruelty-free alternative that retained the essence and texture of the traditional dish.

The Sweet & Sour dish was a perfect balance of tanginess and sweetness, complemented by succulent mushroom and an assortment of colorful bell peppers and pineapples.

To end our meal on a sweet note, we indulged in the Yam Paste with Gingko Nuts. The smooth and velvety yam paste was flawlessly cooked and paired beautifully with the tender gingko nuts

Old school vegetarian restaurants good not too salty good service. Friendly staff. Must try for old school vegetarian restaurants. They have moved a few times already hopefully they can stay here. Finally found them again. I have been eating at this restaurant over 15 years now...still as good as the first time I tried....

I'm super glad that we have a Chinese vegetarian in Desker Road, stone throwaway from Mustafa. Food was authentic and feeling good old days. Fantastic and thank you for opening an outlet in Little India.

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
Lovely spacious place with plenty of seating. Wholesome vegetarian meal at decent pricing. Staff were helpful but clearly busy.

They also have a bread bar and small grocery corner selling fresh vegetables and interesting and healthy foodstuff. The coconut bun was tiny but so delicious. Ask for it to be heated up for you.

A tip: it can get really packed so you might end up with a sofa seat rather than a dining table. Try booking a table!

Compared to typical Chinese vegetarian restaurants, which serve mainly fried foods , this restaurant serves many greens options, and the salad really tastes good.

Ordered three different types of pizza, and the odd one is the "Tom Yum." Pizza tastes really a bit weird.  The taste of Yum ingredients does not blend well with the pizza 😅.

We also ordered two burgers, and they are very nice.

Overall, this is a very nice restaurant for both vegetarian or non vegetarian persons who like to have a healthy meal 😋

Very pleasant ambience and super polite staff! I was so pleased to see that there were so many vegetarian options on the menu! :’)
The turmeric risotto was quite interesting, it tasted and looked a lot like an Indian dish, ahaha! The pesto noodles were also quite good.

A healthy vegetarian restaurant that serves great food along Orchard road. The ambience is very cosy and quite with separate sections.
The food is very fresh and delicious. Dumpling was served hot with a lot of ingredients inside. The salad is huge and I love the sauce so much.
This restaurant also provides nutrition count in their menu which is very convenient for anyone who is on diet or care about fitness.
Definitely will come back to try more if I'm around this area and want something fresh in a hot day.
*water is charged.

I find the restaurant a bit dim. The food was fabulous. Everything was nice, except for two. Tom yum pizza and the broccoli pizza. The taste was exotic and overwhelming for my wife and I. Rojak is a must try, and I love the varieties of Tea  in the Menu. I heard the dumping was good, it was sold out during my visit, will try next time.

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
The presentation of the set meal is particularly exquisite and delicious. It shows the chef's care and seriousness, and the restaurant environment is also very comfortable. The waiters are also very polite. So we enjoyed it during our meal.👍🏻

First time here for the alacarte lunch buffet and was really impressed. Staff were friendly and very attentive (especially Lily, 阿宝, and a third guy who served us - didn’t catch his name), and food was of excellent quality, better than most other vegetarian places we have visited. Dimsum offerings are also unique. Will definitely come back again!

This is my first time to having the vegetarian. I didn’t expect that vegetarian food would be so delicious and special. The baked vegetarian fish and fire cracker monkey head mushrooms are amazing! Every dish is very delicious, the waiters are also very kind and the service is attentive. I will definitely come again next time👍

We were here tonight.
Food was good. Portion was just right.
We are specially delighted to serve by Karen and her other colleagues.
Because of Karen humour, we all had a very enjoyable evening.
Thank you so much Karen n others!
Keep it up the good work. It definitely adding a plus to the restaurant.

My favorite vegetarian restaurant. We went there for lunch. The staffs are friendly. All the dishes were beautiful presented. Recommend braised wild bamboo pith in collagen soup and homemade edamame bean curd topped with fresh mushroom. Very delicious.
Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.name: LingZhi Vegetarian @ Liat Towers
Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.query: Restaurants with vegan options in Singapore

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
A nice and interesting vegetarian restaurant. They have a good variety of different dishes to choose from, either as individual portion or meant to share. The dishes that we ordered tasted good. Also they have some selection of interesting beverages. There are also a variety of tea to choose from. Overall, a good place for a meal if you are vegetarian or want to eat vegetarian food.

Friendly services provided by the staff.The staff were accomodating to our seat and food request. They also offered to help us take a group photo. There are a wide range of food available on the menu. When we were undecidable on the pizza flavours, the staff recommended two of their most popular flavours - BBQ pizza and pesto pizza. We thoroughly enjoyed both pizzas. Overall, the food was delicious even for some of us who are non-vegetarians. Highly recommend iVegan!

I had few different mains here from asian to western.

I would recommend their black bean burger. The house made patty goes very well with the rest of the ingredients. See picture. The sauce pairs well too. The sweet potato fries are seasoned  just right, not too heavy. Salad refreshes the palette. I also tried their bbq mushroom sandwich with the same sides and different sauce (mayo). It was decent.

For the guacamole sushi, it is unique and worth a try.

For the Asian mains, I have tried rice and noodles for the set lunch. I feel they are on the bland side. However, you can request to add more salt and pepper on your order. The peach gum dessert is also very less sweet and taste very healthy.

The staff is very friendly. Sometimes, complimentary appetizer would be served. Expect to spend close to 20 dollars for a meal here.

Great flavours, great aesthetics and vibes, great service! Staff kindly gave us a heads up that their food is towards the lighter side but all the dishes we ordered turned out so flavourful and satisfying hmm so didn’t face the issue of food being bland at all. Service was great too!

We tried the salad, mushroom soup, sushi and grilled broccoli/mushrooms. All were served promptly and were delicious. Wasn’t too difficult getting a table on weekend dinner.

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
Visited Funan outlet several times and came up with the following conclusions.

1. Service is normal only, do not expect too much especially during peak period. Waiting time can get up to 30mins or longer after ordering. AVOID peak period.

2. Staff generally have no smiles on their faces all the time. I believe they are rushing and too busy.

3. Food ordered may not be prepared by the kitchen table by table, hence do not wait for all the food to reach first before starting your meal.

4. Although there are special request options on some of their food items, if your special request is not listed as one of the options, please stand up and approach the staff and make sure you get your message across clearly.

5. Food portion is considered big and decent. Becareful not to over order.

Lastly, I do recommend to try the orh luak if you are visiting.

Pretty generous portion for their food! And taste prettily good. Tried their curry baked rice and will say the curry tastes awesome! I can’t take spicy so it’s a little too much for me.

Orh Luak is super hard to find now and theirs tastes awesome!! Super love!

They are kids friendly too, have 2 different kids meal in a car shape plate set.

Enjoyed a meal with the Burpple 1 for 1 deal (the redemption process is easy but do take note of the restrictions on menu items that qualify for this deal)

The laksa pasta is as flavourful as many people describe it to be! Very rich and creamy sauce.

The basil pesto was savoury and creamy, but a tad too oily (see photo). Would recommend all to get the less salt, less oil option

We had our lunch here for a colleague farewell lunch. This is a small restaurant at Funan Centre B1. No reservation is allowed, it’s quite crowded during lunch time but we managed to secure a table. Office crowd starts to come in during lunch time. There is a wide variety to choose from the menu, the laksa pasta is flavorful, which came as a surprise. Food is served within 10min after ordering. Nothing worth mentioning about the ambience or service. It’s typical of a resultant in a shopping mall. Importantly the food is tasty and I would definitely return again. Highly recommended.

Extensive selection of green goodness. The black kut teh was surprisingly tasty and satisfying. Exceeded my expectations. The cheesy lion mane was addicting with generous globs of oozing cheese sandwiched within a crunchy shell. Just wished there was a bit more mushroom. Carrot cake was a really huge serving. It was fine though felt like it missed a bit more meaty bite. Would be keen to try the other items on the menu.

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
My favorite place to get thunder tea rice. It's hands down the best I've ever had, no exaggeration. While it may be slightly pricier than other options, the quality of their ingredients is top-notch. And just take a look at how luxuriously thicccc and velvety that soup is. It's unlike anywhere else.

Overall okay place to have a quick meal.

Thunder tea rice was good, but the tofu nugget is a miss as it was quite dry. Mostly just 'instant food' that didn't require much cooking as the chef just had to put the ingredients together.

Dining area is just your usual quick eating place, sitting on stools instead of chairs. Pretty small space with the use of a mirror to make the place seem bigger. Dining area is clean.

Would say that service is good as there was food recommendation when I was placing my order, and service staff were friendly.

Tried this vegetarian restaurant few times, there is quite a number of choices as well, so far all that I tried was nice. Love it!
Will definitely visit again and try the others food. 😁

Good quality food
Nice place for Vegan food
Service might be slow but it takes time for good food.
Laksa is nice.

Have been craving for Thundertea rice, so my nice colleagues took me here.

These are 100 % vegetarian. Thus, the lack of the Ikan bilis is evident. Still decent but really at $10 a bowl, I find it too pricey.

Generally, a decent bowl overall. The biggest lack down was the sambal; sweet with no kick.

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
SO glad my husband and I stumbled upon this place! Our only regret is finding it on the last day of our trip here in Singapore. The menu had so many different options making it so hard to choose. We both got a burger suggested by our server that was phenomenal. The vegan egg tasted SO real according to my non-vegan husband. My iced Thai Tea absolutely hit the spot. We also tried the crispy spring rolls and they were so flavorful! We had to end the meal with some ice cream. I got the chickpea coffee flavor and my husband got the purple sweet potato. Both were to die for! Highly recommend!!

My wife and myself are vegetarian and we celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary here. Food was good. The vegan egg was a new experience and surprise, tasted rather good. Made reservation citing Anniversary and requested for a table with a good view but apparently no one noticed the message, that's why gave only 4 stars for service.

Went on a Monday evening - it was surprisingly quiet yet pleasantly peaceful. The waiter was friendly and helpful - told me it’s usually quiet on Mondays evening but very busy during the week especially on weekends. The burger menu set was generous and delicious, so was the lemon-passion tea. I also got a slice of the banana bread and a chocolate muffin to take away. It was so good that I came back the next day to try out another amazing burger. 100% recommend - definitely a must tryout!

Delicious vegan food with lots of options to pick from. We got the truffle pasta and truffle fries. Passion fruit tea is amazing and I got a double omni toona burger.  Such a nice restaurant with an amazing atmosphere.  Would definitely come again.

The service was great and the waiter was very attentive and helpful.

But the food was below average. The spring rolls and mushroom fritters were ok. The burger and pasta was disappointing,  pesto linguine  was quite soggy over cooked. The star dish was the purple sweet potato smoothie. Very pricey maybe cos its vegan food. If you are vegan and have strict dietary restrictions you will come but i will not be back again though.

Thanks to the waiter who assisted us on our table last Sunday, 25 June!

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
I want to preface this review by mentioning that I'm not a professional food critic, and my thoughts are based on how I felt during my family dinner experience for my grandfather's birthday.

Our dining experience was unfortunately not up to our expectations. Firstly, the food left much to be desired as everything tasted very bland. We had to request salt and pepper, and even after adding a generous amount, it didn't do much to enhance the flavours.

To make matters worse, the servers missed out on serving the APPLE CIDER, which was supposed to be part of our 8-course meal. Instead, they brought it to us at the end of the entire meal while we were already packing up to leave soon. This left us feeling quite disappointed.

On a positive note, I must say that the atmosphere was pleasant and contributed to the overall experience. However, the lackluster food and the timing of the cider service were significant drawbacks to what should have been a special family celebration.

Celebrated my birthday here with my friend :) We were served by Mr Peter who did a great job in service and even gave me a surprise birthday treat towards the end.

The service here is impeccable and food is absolutely delicious! The set meal offered is very affordable, about $80 for 2 pax (8 course meal) 😊

10/10 will visit again. Thank you Mr Peter!

Well done vegetarian restaurant with lovely set meals.

Came here for lunch, and loved the decor and set up. Ordered the 5 course set meal and was delighted at the selections available.

I was however abit let down by the portion of the mains. The food was done very well, I loved the appetizers, but the mains was abit of a let down, portion wise. Taste was good and I really hoped the portion could be bigger as it was such a minimal serving that I was not even full after the 5 course meal. Service was ok but the servers did appear quite busy.

It would be worth coming over to try the dishes and experience vegetarian done in a very classy way.

The waiters had an average attitude and felt like they wanted to finish their work quickly, you could tell they were busy. Despite having booked a table a couple of weeks ago, we were placed close to the kitchen and the entrance to the restaurant, we did ask for a change of location but were refused. The food was average, nothing particularly good, the value for money is okay.

We have been patronising this Elemen outlet at the Millenia Walk since 2017, and never once have we been let down by their service or quality of food.
They serve a wide variety of fusion vegetarian cuisine at an affordable price. The food are flavourful to the palate and their presentation are pleasing to the eyes.
This outlet is helmed by Manager Peter and Asst Manager Cheng Yee who are friendly, accommodative and customer oriented.
However, due to manpower shortage and during peak hours, slowness in service may occur.

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
Sunny ☀️ Choice at Bt Batok. Their Assam “Fish” Rice set one of the best I tried, not too spicy soupy texture not thicken sauce. I ❤️ the raw fresh radish beetroot salad. Been here many times. #vegetarian #brownrice #assamsoup

Eight treasures rice (八宝饭) - 5 stars
Loved this!

+++

Leppet - 3 stars
Haven't tried the actual dish. The toppings seemed like they could've come prepackaged.

Yam abacus - 4 stars
On the soft side. Tasty.

Assam fish noodles - 4.5 stars
Even better than the Assam fish rice because you get a whole noodle bowl full of the sauce!

Very tasty, delicious and makes me feels like home. The ingredients are 真材实料！Very nice lady boss as well. Highly recommend and I will be back!

The food here is delicious and value for money; this was my first visit, and impressed with the variety of food offered here. You can also purchase packed vegetarian/vegan snacks. In any place where no harm is caused to animals or humans, you can expect good vibes from such places. So do visit this place. I highly recommend it.

Delicious Lei Cha. Rich hot soup served in a thick walled bowl to retain heat.

Barley Gingko is thick and nice too.

Lion mane curry is rich and spicy!

Repeat visit.
Ba Bao Rice is surprising good

Restaurants with vegan options in Singap.reviews:
I had a fantastic dining experience at Nalan! The service was impeccable, and the quality of their Indian vegetarian dishes was truly outstanding. From the moment I entered, the staff (Syed) made me feel welcome and attended to all my needs with a smile. The menu offered a wide variety of flavorful options, and each dish was expertly prepared, showcasing authentic Indian flavors that delighted my taste buds. I was particularly impressed with the attention to detail in presentation and the use of fresh, high-quality ingredients. I can't wait to visit again and savor more of their delectable offerings. Highly recommend for anyone seeking top-notch service and delicious Indian vegetarian cuisine!

This review is for the outlet at City Hall. By faaaar the best Indian restaurant we went to. Bit expensive, but literally every single thing we ordered was damn tasty and authentic in taste. Liked it so much that we went back for next day breakfast as well. Highly recommend

It’s a good place to visit for vegetarian people. They have good options and combos for both South Indian and North Indian food items. I visited this place with my family, we enjoyed the taste as well food preparation and presentation. Kids loved the Pav bhaji and we liked the South Indian platter. We had a good dinner time during weekend.

The waiters were friendly; the setting suited well for family dining; and the food was authentic, flavour rich, and remarkably presented. The Cheese Naan was lovely and paired nicely with the two types of gravies we ordered - Gobi Manchurian and Paneer Butter Masala. The bombastic-looking Channa Battura was above our expectation. The Dahi Puri was a hit or miss kind of food; some of our taste buds couldn't tolerate the sourness of it. Though most of the food were a success, their Podi Masala Thosai failed to shine; it tasted like chinese medicine to us, who were foreign to the cuisine. Lastly, they should either upgrade their offline menu book or subscribe to a better web domain as it was very laggy to open the online menu. Please put more pictures :)

Staffs: Poobalan and team. Keep up the warm service!

Absolutely wonderful food. Came here by myself on a Sunday night. Staff was wonderful in accommodating for vegans, and clarified to add no butter or ghee in my meal. I got the Aloo Gobi (Cauliflower and Potatoes in a Tomato Masala sauce) with Basmati rice. The Aloo Gobi was simply incredible, the flavor was so strong but not overwhelming, just perfect really. It’s clear they care a lot about the food here.

The atmosphere was wonderful, very classy despite most guests being in shorts. The staff were dressed very nicely and were very attentive and quick. My server was Kathiravan, and he was quick to check up on me when I needed anything. It was not super cheap for a meal, but the price was well worth it to me, especially considering how expensive Singapore is. Highly recommend if you love flavorful Indian food!

Cheap and good! Quality of the chicken is fantastic with very juicy juice that flows out each bites and the taste for both original and spicy chicken are speechless! First time eating and I have to praise their effort to make it so delicious for us to enjoy a simple delicacy.

Jollibee Novena Management and services is very poor. Ordered serve were incomplete. Sizes or chicken are really not same or cur is very small.
I ordered 2 pc chicken joy with 2 side meal with rice but no rice given to us.

The cut of chicken is very small. Not worth the price

Dissapointed with their quality of food. My chicken was underweight and cold when served. The meat was dry, full of bones and not crispy, and the standard was a far cry from when they first opened in Singapore. Though there was only one staff attending to the walk-in counter orders and collection, the staff was also looking at her phone, not paying attention when I walked up and stood in front of her to request for chilli. I'm certainly not going back to this outlet again.

Tried the fried chicken for the 1st time. Its pretty decent

Quite nice but seems smaller portion than other fast food chain's. also the parts are not as meaty.
got two tubs of unknown sauce or gravy along with the chicken n fries. the coke zero tasted dilute than from bottle. wonder if they put ice cube in container to chill the drink. Overall good for a change.

Came just before dinner. Service is almost non-existent, need to do everything yourself from ordering at the kiosk to collecting.
The rest are standard fare like most fast food restaurants. The place is reasonably clean as it is off peak hour when we visited.

Was a tad disappointed that their staple and popular corn soup and fried chicken was sold out on a weekday lunch timing☹️
Do take note that the wait is usually quite long at this outlet during lunch and dinner timing.

Standard dropped so much. Dirty table and chair. Nobody clean. Maybe expect customer to self clean. The rice burger got no sauce . Hamburger is cold. The Japanese brand owner need to come in otherwise brand spoil by francheee

Wow this has got to be the best mosburger I’ve had so far. The beef patty is grilled so nicely that I can taste the crisp of the charred meat! So nice, I love it. The sauce complements it too.

The bbq sauce came on the side which was a nice idea as you can adjust how much you want to put it in your burger.

Other than that, the staffs are all near the kitchen and nobody were at the counter. While we can order at the self-counter it’s weird that human interaction is decreasing.

The outlet was rather empty too, oh wells, it’s centre point.

Food quality has dropped tremendously. An order of 2 cheeseburgers took 30mins. Portion was small and price increased! So disappointed.

Service and hygiene at this outlet is bad. Counter staff used gloves to take orders, touched money, grabbed the mop and touched the dustbin and finally, packed my cheeseburgers and tissue into a takeaway bag at the kitchen. I followed her there to see if she would throw away the dirty gloves but she used the same ones to pack my food. Absolutely disgusting. Outlet was clearly understaffed.

Local fast food chains in Singapore.reviews:
the place is not very accessible and may need some walking to get there, but it worths every steps.

Ordered a guacamole burger and then I put some salsa, and it was the best thing I have ever had. So fresh so juicy. I like veggie in my burger so this combination hits every spot.

The free flow drink and free flow salsa were the cherries on top. But the salsa condiment station may need some more attention, it ran out quite fast.

The price is on the high end of a chain but not too much and is quite reasonable for the value.

Will come back!

Came on a Sunday late morning. Not too crowded. The promo on angus burgers for two was worth it. Nice meat cut, soft and juicy. Quite filling for us. The curry fries are interesting to try. A little on the salty side. Overall good food and atmosphere.

Friendly staffs.  Food quality was average. They provide self-help drinks kiosk for us to replenish our beverages. The restaurant was clean and tidy for this fast food chain.

Crowded n service was slow, despite not understaffed. Cashier was "mechanical" with his standard qns. Guess he cld have overworked.

Many drinks were oos. No iced tea. No pink lemonade. No plain water. No sugar syrup. Drinks area was wet, dirty n messy. I was actually quite shocked but d diners ard me just made do with whatever drinks that were available.

It took ~10 min for my burger n fries to b served. Burger was made well n fresh. Patties were hot n crispy, so were d fries. Once d crowd at d counter cleared, staff stepped out to clean tables, clear trays n push in d chairs. Sugar syrup was replenished. Impressed.

Staff service was extremely disappointing and very unprofessional and with no work attitude. When food was served as well.
But other then the exceptionally poor service food standards have been kept somewhat the same which is good though today the fries were a little  undercooked.
Had the portobello burger as I’ve had it for years still great nothing wrong with that and the onion rings which tasted good and  the breaded chicken burger was good and flavourful always liked the self service salsa though there were no jalapeños now which is rather sad and the drinks area.
Overall still good food and the burgers were not wrapped properly also sadly but the SERVICE needs to be improved. As one staff was on the laptop infront of the counter as well.

Edit: this is a few hours later I possibly have food poisoning and a very bad diarrhoea might be from one of the ingredients of the burger or salsa I’m not too sure.
As of 02/08/23

Ah. How far KFC has fallen. Chicken are not quite warm, they are pretty small and dry.

They are not even comparable to the other chicken chains. Even the hawker center western food can do a better job.

Even the super market frozen fried chicken is better with the air fryer.

They encouraged us to use the website to order but it hung and was super buggy.

Staff here is decent I think. Minimal contact. 1 extra star for them.

Avoid KFC. So many years but you decided to cut cost and lose.

KFC tasted the same as usual.
Food served hot.

Uncle Kuan at the cashier was really friendly and helpful.

Many people waiting for their food. The staff worked quickly . But i really disapointed because when arrived home, i couldnt find my potato fries even there was printed in the slip. It was $4.5. Lesson : You must check by opening the box there before you go home.

Hello! After my morning appointment, I strolled around the mall deciding what to have for lunch. The staff members, who were all seniors, welcomed me with their smiles and made me feel truly valued as a customer. It's heartening to see that despite the rise of automation, KFC Novena maintained the human touch over the counters.

I am writing this review to encourage both KFC Novena and the senior staffs member! Thank you KFC Novena

Plus:
- The app deal is truly value for money. Kudos to the Marketing team.

Minus:
- Poor service crew, lacking in common sense.

Situation:
Takeaway orders require customers to fill their own drink with the cup provided. With my hands full, I requested for the staff to help fill my drink in their kitchen instead. Staff rejected, and insisted I had to fill it myself despite explaining.

Long story short, I stood firm. She caved in, got an elderly colleague to follow up. Sign of her unwillingness to do it herself.

Improvement opportunity:
It would make more sense (e.g. for efficiency) and bring an enjoyable experience to customers if takeway customers can have their drinks filled by the staff instead. It will not make sense to have an outlet looked pack but in reality having dine-in and takeaway customers queuing to fill their own drinks, thus turning away potential customers.

Food for thought:
I dont see delivery riders having to fill drinks for their customers. If the crew can do it for delivery orders, why not takeaways too? Both are essentially takeaways, arent they?

I missed eating Jollibee in the middle east. I am glad I found one in Singapore. They are now certified halal. So, even better. I got the set with a crispy chicken burger, fried chicken, fries and a drink. The crispy chicken burger was not spicey at all but the size was good. The fried chicken was juicy, but not spicy as claimed. Fries was very small. Drink was not refillable. Service was a bit slow and could be improved. The restaurant was maybe half full at the time. So, easy to find seating. Overall, pretty good but a bit underwhelming compared to my experiences at Jollibee in the middle east. Portions are a bit bigger there and the drinks are always refillable.

Fried chicken is excellent!
Dining place is not well lit enough.  40 minutes of waiting period on non peak hour.

Firsr time here in 10 years
Self service kiosk menu was useless, spagherti was not available however at the counter it was, store does not accept visa or mastercard and thats a massive disappointment.
Food took a while to be served, everthing was just warm
The uncle incharge of bussing tables were chucking all the left overs on a separate open trash bag instead for using the bins itself and that's unhygenic

Dissapointed!

The line was insane….. probably 30 mins in line and then 40 mins waiting for our order to be cooked because there was so many people BUT they did not lie about the chicken because how was it so juicy even with breast meat my mind is blown?? Skin was so crispy it was delicious. The burger was also really good, typical spicy chicken burger there was nothing not to like about it. Spaghetti was yummy too, yes it was sweet but not overwhelming, peach and mango pie was great!!!

Chicken joy and palabok is very delicious.. good for family and friends. Very spacious..

Finally got to try MOS Burger's onigiri as it is only available in express outlets and not regular outlets. As an onigiri lover who tried various ones in Japan and Taiwan, i had to say that it was a disappointment. Primarily the rice was too soft and mushy that it could hardly hold its shape together. The tuna filling was fine. Not gonna buy again. The express outlet did provide a convenient quick stop for a bite and service was ok.

BBQ Cheese Wagyu Burger doesnt taste like bbq... taste like tomato sauce... parfait the mochi is frozen... horrible..

I don't know why they are rated so low, but as someone who treats Mos like their macs and eats it super frequently, this place produced the best fish burger I had from MOS overall. I didn't get the name but the slim man with specs had such a sweet and polite service. What a lovely spot for a quick meal!

What I like. This is a good place to stop, get what you want, and go. There are limited seats. The milk/lemon tea comes with syrup separately which is good since you can adjust. There is also an auto machine. There is customized salad in a cup.

What I dun like. They dun have the normal cheese burger in the menu. Everything is a tab more high class and expensive. But subjected to change. The small shop has few people manning so expect longer waiting time.

That’s the actual corn soup after ordering. Totally different from the pic and little amount and the taste is even worse.
The beef burger sucks, beef is hard.
Don’t walk into this place in the morning and it’ll only ruin your day!

Thrilled to be a long-time fan of Arnold's Chicken! The consistency in taste over the years is truly commendable. What sets them apart is the thoughtful touch – providing gloves for customers and a convenient sink for post-meal handwashing. This attention to detail enhances the overall dining experience. Kudos to Arnold's for keeping both taste and customer comfort at the forefront!

I'm trying Arnold's dining in for the first time instead of ordering in. The experience is more enjoyable with enhanced flavours. They offer disposable gloves for convenient eating and provide basic soap for handwashing - a considerate touch.

Finally tried the well-known Arnold’s Fried Chicken that has been raves about by many and they certainly didn’t disappoint. I went with my wife on a Saturday afternoon for lunch and surprisingly, there was no queue. Waited a bit to make my order at the counter and ordered a 4-pieces meal for 2 before making payment. FYI, only Nets or cash is accepted. Service was relatively fast and everything was ready on a big serving tray. The chicken meat is juicy and tender. I like the seasonings and marination on the meat which are way better than other chain fried chicken outlets. The fried buns are an interesting and delicious side which complement the mashed potatoes and coleslaw. All in all, a very satisfying meal and I would definitely return whenever I crave fried chicken

As an Eastie for over 50 years, I must have been living under the rock. Today is our first time ever visit Arnold’s Fried Chicken. Singapore’s very own KFC.

What can I say? Move over, KFC !
AFC is way yummier. The chicken is moist (I suspect the chicken might have been marinated with milk or Yoghurt) and the “sand”-blasted chicken skin is crispy.
Even the coleslaw is fresher than KFC’s.

All I can say is that AFC has won a new fan !

Happily enjoying 39 year old chicken recipe with family. Great eatery concept. Simple food queue system way of ordering. It’s tender chicken set will get your fingers wanting for more. Brilliant coleslaw for all to share. Here we go for fried chicken goodness.

Today is Sunday
Shocking thing is only one lady is working. Alone! Not joking!
It’s crazy something wrong 😮
How can this restaurant make one person cover more than 20 people?

Waiting for 30mins + already
Cannot say anything because only one lady working is suffering!

Love this 5 stars location, and it has its special menus and burger. I tried their limited Dassai Sakura Seafood Rice Burger, its awesome! The staff were very friendly and helpful. You can see the Merlion status just right infront of the shop. There are outdoor seats too. Will surely come back again!

I am a Mos Burger fangirl. Love the milk tea, butterfly prawn, ebi rice burger and natsumi fish burger. I have to say the lettuce for the natsumi fish burger today was extra fresh. I like the Millenia Walk outlet as it is pretty quiet and I can enjoy my food.

The only fast food restaurant in this shopping centre.

The burger is like.. more dry than what I usually had at other MOS .

Quiet little place right at the very corner .

Local fast food chains in Singapore.reviews:
Great disappointment, once awhile, I patronize this branch but I usually buy Ebi Rice burger.

Today I decided to change my menu to double mushrooms wagyu burger , I shouldn't have order this.

I ordered as take away and after I received the orders I immediately went home .

I didn't even go shopping or so whatever, my bus came within 1 min and about 10 mins I reached home , my burger was cold and not even warm .

Their packing looks nice but the burger cold and talking about double mushroom what do they mean double mushrooms, there like 6 to 7 slices of mushroom that's all, hmmm you call it double so if not double means I will just have 3 slices mushroom???

My hubby Ebi Rice burger was as usual warm and nice to eat. Corn soup was still hot.

So , I' m sorry to say , do not order their buns burgers, only Ebi Rice burgers or beef rice burgers is ok.

As for their soup it cost me $3.50 , you better buy Campbell soup from the can now ntuc promotion selling 3 cans for $5.20 is way much better than Moss Burger corn soup.

Moss Burger in TBP , I wish your branch all the best and I pray your management read my review.

I won't be surprised, they might close one day if this type of standard goes on.

Aunties and uncles working there are very friendly.
They will help to order when the kiosk is having a long queue. Also help to clear the tray.
If any customisation of the item, they are willing to help.
Tried the new Wagyu brown rice burger, it’s just simply so nice.

Placed order at 6:27pm and waited for 35mm a for now. And I haven’t get my food yet. If the store can’t cope with the order please do not take delivery order! That is UNFAIR for those who place the order at the shop and ended up waiting for hours!

Very disappointed with this Mos burger branch. I waited an hour for my order and the fries and burger were not hot at all. I will never buy from this branch anymore and strongly encourage not to eat or order at this branch. The company should do a periodic checks on the quality of food and the long waiting time served. Atmosphere smell oily too.

Bought the beef mos cheese burger. The patty was really cold. I continued eating to realise it was raw in the middle and tasted bad. I threw the whole thing and told them it was raw to which Victor made me an entirely new one and checked on me after to see if it was okay. He’s absolutely excellent and gives great service the standard of high class restaurants.

Local fast food chains in Singapore.reviews:
Such a big retails, there is only one staff that was doing order picking at the front. Waited for more than half an hour just for a “FAST FOOD”. Unacceptable.

***PLEASE DO NOT BUY***
If possible I would give 0/5 star.

-Bad Customer service.
-Dishonest Staff.
-Chicken is not Crispy.
-Chicken is Dry like powder.

On 15th Aug 2021, Sunday at around 9.00pm. My Kids wanted KFC, I placed my order using the KFC app. Ordered the new 5pcs Cereal Crispy Chicken meal, with additional 3 set of cheese fries at Junction 8, KFC.
Upon my collection I requested for Thigh, drums and wings meat as my kids doesn’t like the Breast meat. I was served by a Malay Aunty wearing scarf. Her name tag was unclear and I won’t mention her name here. Moving on, She immediately told me that she’s has packed the meat which can’t be changed. I asked why? She told me it’s packed accordingly and she included all the different kind of meat cut. Which I assumed a mixture of “Thigh, Breast, wing and drums”. So I trust her and didn’t insist to change.
Shortly, a Malay uncle came to collect his order. He speak in Malay, requested for certain meat cut, she immediately unbox and rearrange accordingly for him. I felt very unfair by her action which is not ethical and unreasonable. I didn’t want to create a scene there as my kids want KFC badly.
Next, she packed my cheese fries in a mess, with disrespect, box wasn’t covered properly and fries were sticking outwards. This is too much and I told her for prepare a new set of cheese fries for me. She gave me unpleasant tone “have to wait ahhh” I was like fine. Please go ahead.
The preparation took around 8mins, she prepare for me in a well manner as I think she realised that she might get into trouble if I raise a feedback.
When I’m homed, I prepare the meal for my kids, the cheese fries were fine. But the Cereal chicken was horrible and it’s all breast meat accept 1 drum. My kids were very disappointed and I’m very disappointed by the service. This is the last time and I won’t recommend anyone to go there. Bad experience and some sort of racists service given.
*This is not a made up story, you can feel free to contact me personally and my Invoice number is  9174. I will not delete this post and review as my statement is true. Thank you!

Make sure you TRIPLE CHECK your order before leaving the store. Encountered a very bad experience today where 2 zinger burger sets are missing! Total of 30mins and $10 wasted, just to receive an incomplete order.

Why does this KFC consistently fail to stock new items? Is the Bishan outlet an afterthought for KFC headquarters? I simply want to try out the new Cheesy Mushroom Zinger Double Down. My lack of enthusiasm for KFC stems from experiences like this. The management leaves much to be desired.

Worst horrible KFC I've ever patronised! Waited damn long for a simple riser meal. Ended up those queuing after me got their order before me! I ever went there when there's no crowd but they're still super slow! The staffs were all slow and sluggish. And the worst part was their poker face acted like nothing happened! Might as well close down the outlet!

Local fast food chains in Singapore.reviews:
Wanted a light snack. The Natsumi Fish was delicious! Strong brewed coffee too.

Okonomiyaki rice burger - surprisingly nice. The sauce and the patty mixed does taste like having a Okonomiyaki thrown into a burger. Worth a try.

This is now a MOS Cafe that sells its burgers in sets that come with fries, onion rings and a salad for a full meal. Without drink but allows customer to select from the wide range of beverages on the menu. There’s also fried chicken and desserts. Certainly a popular joint given its value for money approach to Japanese fast food of good quality.

Just order VIA food panda
When I eat find out a small plastic inside the rice burger
Kitchen have to more be careful with this matter

More than half the cup was ice and their tea taste more like water. Food doesn't taste as good as before too. I suppose it's to save cost and compromise their food quality and taste. Unlikely to come back again, considering this branch is their more premium outlet, doesn't seemed to be the case.

Local fast food chains in Singapore.reviews:
Chicken was juicy and freshly cooked. Right next to sinks for you to wash your hands so you can eat without worrying. Cosy tucked away place.

First chance for us to try Popeyes, something my son has obsessed about since he discovered that the chain is in Canada where we will visit his grandparents soon (Popeyes is not in Germany). Compared to KFC the chicken is not as greasy, has a nice spicy heat to it, the cheese fries were good, and the chicken tenders were very good. The location is inside the entrance to a busy MRT line, so easy to get to. Seems to be popular with shoppers and local business workers

Horrible service . Waited 17 minutes for my order only to received wrong order. Ordered 2 pieces chicken with RICE but INSTEAD THE FILIPINO OLD LADY GAVE ME MASHED POTATO. Went home and just realised. Won’t patronise no more!

It's one of my favourite fast food fried chicken for a quick bite. The fried chicken is always served hot. Mashed potatoes sauce is good.

The Mac and cheese looked kind of ugly but the taste was great. The mashed potatoes and the biscuits were also delicious. My few criticisms of it was that the chicken in the chicken sandwich was kind of soggy and not that crispy. I was also not able to get a straw for my drink. This would’ve been 4 stars but a pigeon wandered in to the restaurant somehow.

Local fast food chains in Singapore.reviews:
Had their fried chicken set with 2 side dishes. Chicken is well seasoned and nicely fried. Coleslaw is a bit too sweet for my liking, but still tasty. TCO salad is generally ok. Service is good. Friendly staff.

An alternative to the epitome fried chicken offered by KFC. Efficient operation, plus point on the nice hot fried chicken that does not give you the feeling of death chicken. Ie. Chicken is being left on the shelf for so long that you feel that it's pretty stale when it's served. The side dish that comes with it is remarkable. Excellent place to have a cheap decent meal.

I tried this Tumeric Nasi Lemak at Chic-a-boo at City Square Mall. The rice came together with a large piece of fried chicken, 2 sticks of ebi fry, cucumber and hard boiled egg.

I thought that the rice was tasty and portion was adequate. Costs $9.80, together with a soft drink.

Shop unit is a little small and sometimes not easy to get seats. As it was during lunch time, the shop was a little noisy.

First time trying the Best fried chicken in Singapore. $9.80 nasi lemak has so much ingredients, prawns and whole egg. $6.90 korean fried chicken is much better than 4👆. Love the chicken decor

Both original & spicy chicken taste nice. Served hot. It comes with a set, u can choose your side dish. We came during weekday for lunch, there's plenty of seats.

Local fast food chains in Singapore.reviews:
I’ve always wanted to try its chicken since it’s opening here.
Not sure about other outlets, but this outlet’s chicken is ok.
Frankly speaking, the Size of the chicken is medium, and that didn’t surprise me.
I like the pineapple juice, is really refreshing.
Service was ok, the staffs are quite enthusiastic in serving.
Not so crowded here if compared to a few other outlets that I passed by b4.

Loyal supporter at Jollibee’s other branches. First time coming back to Paya Lebar outlet since Covid period and was totally disappointed with what I got. Ordered a two piece meal for takeaway. While one piece was quite good, the other piece looked dubious, as if it was some left over half eaten piece of chicken. What’s with the tiny piece of bony fried meat that left me wondering which part of the chicken it was. Don’t they even QC their chicken parts before serving to customers? Hope that they can at least have more pride in their work and respect for customers.

The sundae is just half cup and it'selting already . And I ask the crew if this is the standard and she said Yes .🥴poor service . .I worked in Jollibee also that's why I know what is the standard portion of Sundae 😄

The 2nd photo is Sundae from Jollibee BEDOK u can see the difference 🥴

Second time eating Jollibee after having a great first experience at another branch. Feel like the original chicken in this branch isn't as delicious. Also tried the Fiesta noodles for the first time and thought it tasted rather bland and soggy, but maybe its my own personal taste

Chicken is fresh n juicy. Pasta a bit sweet, overall $7.40 for one pc chicken n pasta, 3 out of 5*

Local fast food chains in Singapore.reviews:
Their chicken is always but most the time their service is terrible they need to improve
Slow moving service

Chicken Joy Is The Best!  Eating at Jollibee as a filipino comes with a feeling of home.  I grew up with eating this crispy and juicy fried chicken and am glad that the same quality was carried over here in Singapore.  The secret sauce aka gravy makes the already tasty fried chicken more delicious.  This branch at suntec is not too crowded and im glad they they have a self service kiosk.  Just wished they accept contactless credit card payment.  Fried chicken portion is just right for the price.  The restaurant is clean and is spacious enough.  The Uncle who let me in was very courteous in helping me find the washing station and exit (I rarely find helpful uncles in fastfood chains these days).  So overall, a great experience for me and of course chicken joy never fails to fill my tummy!  The jolly spaghetti is equally good!  Sweet cheesy and served hot.. just how I like it!

Seems to be a great place for lunch. But the experience is terrible. There is only 2 self service kiosk and the queue was super long. We wonder why?? When we reach our turn and after input our orders, then we only realise that they only accept NETS. And not visa or master. This is ridiculous. After ordering, again it took about 10 minutes before our food was served. The chicken is nice but not that nice that warrant us to go back again and join the ordering queue and using the kiosk that only accept NETS.

The first time I ate there and I thought it was delicious, minutes after eating I had a stomach ache... I thought it wasn't the food but my immune system, but 5 days ago I ordered delivery because I liked the chicken with the portions and now I'm 5 days with a serious intestinal infection.. I'm very disappointed and sad about it..

Friggin tiny chicken the size of a wing drumlet. Not even half the size of a KFC drumstick. Pathetic.

Boycott this brand at all costs.

Local fast food chains in Singapore.reviews:
Went to purchase for take away, around 1.40am just now at this outlet.

Service staff so nonchalant. Maybe because wanting to close outlet quick.

Order from self order kiosk for extra lettuce can no lettuce.

Worst is the McSpicy burger patty has a bone I suppose they couldn't care much and slap a McChicken spicy inside

not my first time patronising and having a bad experience. previous time food took way too long and tasted spoiled. today i ordered from mayflower grab via because it was the only macs available. milo was spilled all over which could be the drivers fault. caremel frappe was extremely melted with no signs of whipped cream at all. both meals (big mac and double cheese) were missing. found out from driver that the workers forgot to pack it in. i havent got my refund from grab yet. this needs to be improved.

Mcdonath has been always everybody favourites including myself. I love their nuggets. apple pies. corn and esp their French fries. You cannot find anywhere that give you the type of French fries that Mcdonath have. You must have it there to get the most of it. Once you pack back though still taste good but not as good as you have it there. I also love their chicken nuggets. Both my hubby and me love to have our Mcdonath meals in house. We never pack back to get the best of it. Service provided at most of its store are good and tip top. Keep it up Mcdonath.

Love the new breakfast bagel! Shld keep it permanent on the menu, pls! Perfect.

The team works very slowly, food is subpar. Service needs some work to say the least. Ordered food at a non peak period and it took pretty long to get my food ready. This is regardless of dine in or take out. And the outlet has been this way for awhile. I honestly have no idea how it has sustained business this long

Local fast food chains in Singapore.reviews:
Ordered 2 sets of Classic Ultimate Angus BBQ Value Meal with a Taro pie. Burgers were excellent!! Served hot! With a nice big leaf of vegetable, fresh tomatoes. We brought some ourselves also. A hot beef patty is first for us, at a fast food restaurant!! Well done BK TEAM at Kallang Leisure Park! All other items were also on point. Crispy fresh fries and onion rings. Nice comfortable environment, too. Going forward, this outlet will be our go to BK joint. Cheers!!

Love their fries. Tried the rendang beef burger, didn't like the raw onions inside, sauce is ok - but can still improve on it.

Efficient service. Crispy and warm fries. Good quality and delicious burger. Simply amazing. Simply the best fast food I've ever had.  It is unfortunate that the best I can give is a 5 star review. It deserves so much more.

This the best fast food ever! Never have I ever eaten food which have given this much enjoyment. Service is EXCELLENT, no wait for food and servers who attend to your every need. It's a shame that I can only rate 5 stars, it deserves so much more.

Recently went here w my friends. The customer service was great and the food was absolutely delicious. (I recommend the chicken burgers).
