Local fast food chains in Singapore.reviews:
The location of the place is very convenient, and they serve food quickly. Recently, I had the opportunity to taste their truffle mushroom chicken burger which was only available for a limited time. The burger was delicious, with a crispy chicken patty and cheese covered generously with truffle sauce.

Deserve a 0 rating! Dirty tables, extremely poor service, and surprisingly rude people, especially, Thava  who claims to be the manager. Such ineptitude is disgraceful for a manager. She handed us the tray, instead of the take out bag as we had ordered. Moreover, 25% of our order was missing. When asked her about the poor service, she remarked rudely that she was busy. No apology, zero finesse. Shame on you Burger King! Folks don't go here unless you're itching for a bad experience!

They managed to mess up even with the simplest order. Ordered tempura chicken nuggets with curry sauce, and somehow, they didn't give me the sauce. The chocolate Sunday with mint candies in the picture tasted so bad. The soft serve is too sweet but not milky. The candies are stale as if they were old. They gave very little chocolate syrup (compared to McDonald's), which made it even worse. It's definitely my last visit of BK, especially for this outlet.

Absolutely horrible crew service. I see my order prepared and it cons the the counter. Crew checks and calls pit a number. I inform them that this is my order and she insists it is not. It is a number she called a while back. I asked again as she continues to call out the same number. She then decides to check and finds out its my order and just simply says yours and walks away. No apology or any form. I guess this gives me another reason to avoid fast food like Burger King and to eat at home. Foe the cost, triple the amount of food. Thus happened at 11.05 am today at CLARK Quay Burger King.

Order thru Grab food for a Spicy Chicken Bundle. End up missing a spicy chicken burger. Call the branch but no one answer.

Local fast food chains in Singapore.reviews:
Decently good burgers, and portion sizes were large enough (though price is accordingly more expensive too). You order at the counter and they'll deliver it to you. Process was fast, though you'll fill your own drinks at the dispenser at the corner.

I loved the Angus beef mushroom burger, but the juice did get all over my hands. They do have napkin dispenser at the tables so that helps a bunch.

The higher seats were a bit uncomfy, but it's OK if you just want to eat and go. Decent parking in the area, and it's also right at Paya Lebar MRT, so about 4 mins walk in and up the escalators.

Ordered the cheeseburger set, paid $7.50.  Ordering process was so user friendly, find a seat, plong yourself to the seat, scan the QR code, start to order, pay and you will be served.

The sets make sense as you can opt for a refillable cup and help yourself to the drinks - unlimited! Salsa bar also UNLIMITED!

Ingredients and food tasted good, you can really taste the freshness in their veg.

Given the price point, this is a no brainer.  So, forget Macs or BK, this place should be your defacto burger fix!

Came here for lunch using the coupon we bought from Q0010. Got the california classic set meal at $6.99 instead of $13 full price. We paid another $8.99 for 5 pieces chicken tenders.

The beef burger was more premium compare to M brand. However, we still prefer M's fries. The chicken tenders were served with 3 sauce options: mustard, mayo or bbq. It tasted alright but not as tasty as K brand.

The restaurant was spacious and servettes are available on each dining tables.

stopped by the Carl’s Jr branch at Singpost for a quick snack, and I was thoroughly impressed by the exceptional service provided by one of their staff members. Their friendly demeanor and excellent service made my visit truly memorable.

It was my first time trying their pork burger, and I was pleasantly surprised by its incredible texture and mouthwatering sauce.

In addition to the main course, I also ordered the sweet potato bites as a side, and they turned out to be a delightful choice. Crispy on the outside and perfectly soft on the inside, these little bites were packed with sweet potato flavor.

I would like to extend my heartfelt gratitude to the staff member at Carl’s Jr, Singpost branch, for their exceptional service during my visit. Their friendly demeanor, attentiveness, and commitment to delivering a satisfying experience truly made a difference.

If you’re looking for a quick and delicious snack option, I highly recommend visiting Carl’s Jr at Singpost. The friendly staff and their dedication to providing excellent service will make your visit memorable. And of course, don’t forget to try their All Star Meal👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

One of the best burger chain that you can find. Drinks were free flow and service was prompt and good. The burger was nicely wrapped and easy to eat.

Local fast food chains in Singapore.reviews:
Probably the best bk fish burger I ever tasted here. Not too hard or overcooked it’s just right. Other bks their burger and meat is always too hard and taste bland. But this one is pretty flavourful. Fries is alright kind of on the soft soggy side. I love the burger and I hope it will stay this way!

Everything is not bad, and this is quite a quiet Burger King outlet. The generous cheese on the fries is commendable and worth applauding. Overall food tastes like your typical fast food restaurant, and is decent. The speed of service can definitely be improved. Prices so far with the deals are quite friendly. Burger King also cannot use ezlink card fyi

We had to drive back to collect the missing burger. It’s not the first time this has happened during our BK take-away. Happened at the ARC and Orchard Cineleisure and our orders were not event big. Imagine how frustrating it is to have to return to collect the missing items when you are hungry.

BK management, teach your staff to count! Or to be more attentive at work!

I went to counter to order my food as im paying using cash. No one was there at the cashier. The Indian guy with tattoo saw me and did not take my order. Another guy went pass the cashier. When i nod to my head showing i want to order then he took my order. Hopefully the indian guy with tattoo have a better customer service.

A few times the meat hasn't been cooked properly in the burger as can be seen in the photos

👎food can be hit and miss

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Had a great 6 course lunch at Beni! Service was great - the hostess was warm and friendly, and explained dishes clearly. Food was good - subtle flavours that meshed really well together, and beautiful presentation. The lamb in particular was executed perfectly. I also loved the mignardises and that the kitchen was open but calm and not chaotic.

Here for birthday lunch, cosy setting but nothing much to shout about for the interior. Had the lunch menu, food is good but nothing really outstanding that I can remember. Hmm maybe Cherry Gazpacho is quite special. Perhaps its a normal lunch menu, maybe should come back again for special collaborations when they have one.

Some changes to the menu itself. Menu is very refreshing, akin like the Spring season. As always, hostess & chef hospitality are the best. To us, their food, restaurant atmosphere, relationships between staffs & us are what made us being their regulars.

A very nice ambiance intimate dining room that caters to about 6 pax capacity and some counter seats for perhaps, Omakase? Set menus are definitely French and heavy on seafood.

The service was nicely paced, dishes was explained, and professional. Their wine recommendation was good as well.

The presentation of each dish is where the star is. The taste is ok, balanced.

Recommended for date night, probably not the best suit for big  groups or business dinner unless you reserve private room.

We booked the restaurant to celebrate our 25th year wedding anniversary.
We took the $268 set dinner and added on foie gras ($20) for one of our dinner set, and changed one of the dessert to cheese truffle.
All the dishes are wonderfully made, and even the bread basket (uniquely in a cloth pouch) is warm and hot, with specially made bread spread.
The service is amazing and special mentioned to Louis who has made our experience really enjoyable.
We also had Yamanaka-san who personally served us for one of the dishes.
The downside for the place is that it is a small restaurant and seatings are quite closed to one another. It's no issue for us and we mingled with other patrons.
Highly recommended.
Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.name: béni Singapore

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
For family lunch we ordered the suckling pig. Although that was the star dish, my favorite dishes were the spinach with eggs, and loofah soup. The kids devoured the sweet & sour pork and the shredded pork in sesame buns that looked like mini-burgers. There was also a spectacularly presented appetiser which was an intricately carved bitter plant (maybe a gourd?) that came in a swirling cloud of dry ice. If you need something sweet to balance out the bitterness there is a tiny pot of honey that comes with it.

It was absolutely delicious. No wonder it has so many awards year after year.

The bun in the pork bun is baked almost to perfection and the sweet and sour pork with lychee was great (a tiny bit to sweet for me).

My two favorites though are the garlic prawn and the crispy beef. I will definitely be going again.

The food at Putien Kitchener road is amazing and I enjoy my meals here every much especially when Ah Lian is here. Ah Lian has been an amazing host to my family and I all these years, and we’ll always come back to Putien for our birthday dinner.

Had a very good dining experience here, the staff Ah Lian very attentive and the manager Fenny also recommended the well option for two pax, which we felt so comfortable. The eggplant with floss is highly recommended. They constantly make sure the patron having their food without worrisome ;) would come and visit here again!

The service was fantastic, and waiters are very helpful. Putien cuisine is not my favorite honestly, but this restaurant makes it so tempting and I can tell dishes were made with fresh ingredients, quite great compared to other Chinese restaurants in Singapore.
Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.name: PUTIEN Kitchener Road

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
An absolutely delightful dining experience! The food, the service and the atmosphere was all incredible. We were treated to the most wonderful waiter in Arvin whose wine knowledge and food explanations were the highlight of the day. He answered all our questions and was forthcoming and generous in sharing his food knowledge. All the dishes were fantastic and very flavoursome. I can’t wait to come back again! We had the amekase menu.

Having dined at this Peranakan restaurant upon a family member's recommendation, we were eager to experience its Michelin-acclaimed cuisine. Opting for the tasting menu, we were treated to an exceptional culinary journey. As someone with Southeast Asian roots, I might be a bit biased, but I must say this restaurant truly stood out. It exceeded my expectations and proved deserving of its Michelin accolade.

Had this slightly less than a year back. Food was delicious, staff were attentive to all our requests. Restaurant was nicely located at Dempsey with free parking. Knowing that we were celebrating a birthday, they gave us a small dessert (kinda) which I felt was very thoughtful of them. The staff were also patient in taking countless number of picture for us. Definitely deserving of the one Michelin star. Will definitely be back again in future!

I believe this brings the best of Peranakan fine dinner to the guest. Dishes are true to the original flavors yet giving a refreshing new twist. Great place to bring visitors to try our local delights but elevated.

Fantastic experience. The food was both friendly and approachable, given these were ingredients I've never tried before. Think elevated family meals cooked perfectly. Patrick and the rest of the staff were professional and genuinely proud of the food. Dessert stole the show.
Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.name: Candlenut

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Nice environment and friendly staff.
And the food is great!

It’s my honour to have an opportunity to try the New Menu. I like the most is my main, the Glacier 51 Toothfish with special mixed with 4 different oils! It’s amazing and taste really good 👍🏻

It’s a wonderful night and dinner with my beloved. 🥂

Recommend 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

My partner brought me here for my birthday lunch and we had a lovely time here. We ordered the 2 course lunch with an add on of extra serving of potato bread & steak.

We enjoyed the potato bread that we ordered a extra serving. The steak was also yummy and cooked to medium rare. The steak came with oyster mushroom was also cooked to perfection. Special shout-out to to the beef tartare(lovely presentation!)& pork steak(burst of flavour!!)!

The duck breast was slightly too rare for our liking.

The service was lovely and friendly and they also surprised me with a apple tart for my birthday.

A lovely place where we spent our anniversary lunch. Food was YUM. A mix of different cuisines rolled into something I'd call contemporary European. Presentation of dishes was spectacular with the beef tartar showcased in a delightfully unusual way!

This is a five-star experience all the way - Alma has a Michelin star in the guide that just came out for Singapore, and deservedly so. They were happy to accommodate vegetarian food for the prix fixe menu, which is great value. The signature tofu with black truffle was sublime, as were the Japanese tomatoes with tomato sorbet. The amuse bouche of tomato with a sour plum film was another delight.

It's a nice space too, with a beautifully designed interior and a superb selection of wines and in particular rare whiskies.

This one's going on our repeat visit list for sure!

A lovely fine dining restaurant with great service and friendly people. Food was very unique and tasteful. Looks like they have many years of being a 1-star Michelin restaurant. Well deserved!

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Lovely experience.  Good service and attentive staff. Well deserved Michelin star with the food. Has fantastic courses paired with champagne. Air- conditioning is way too cold and freezes everyone. Any warm dish turns cold too quickly. Dessert was also a star and did not let down the entire course of dinner. Felt the staff could have been more confident in introducing each course.

Came here to celebrate our anniversary, a surprise dinner planned by my husband for us. The restaurant is intimate with only a few tables available, so you get undivided attention from the staff. It is also an open kitchen concept which I love so you can see the chefs hard at working preparing their masterpieces for us. I enjoyed pretty much every single dish, the abalone wellington was definitely unique and one of a kind. Overall had a really good experience here.

One - starred Michelin restaurant located within Voco Hotel (previously known as Hilton Orchard), serving Modern-Contemporary cuisine,established by Restaurateur-Sommelier Ignatius Chan in 2004. There is heavy influence of japanese ingredients used in the menu and served in the European way. Opt for the menu with two main courses for a wholesome dining experience. Food presentation is beautiful and tastefully presented, and what's good to look at is also good to eat.

Had our belated anniversary lunch at Iggy’s as we were having a staycation at Hilton. A lovely resturant with friendly and helpful crew. Love the fact that we are able to view how the chef and his team prepared our meals to the kitchen.

As the husband and I do not take raw fish, the chef was able to customize to our taste by searing the fish, love how the raw yolk enhances the overall taste of the dish. They did an interesting take on the sponge gourd which brought the vegetable to another level. The linguine was average. The roast beef has charred edges which was a nice touch. Overall we enjoyed the 5 course meal at $150++ per pax.

Came here for lunch with 2 overseas guests who would like to taste a Michelin restaurant.  Decided to bring them to Iggy's as the restaurant has been one that has been keeping their reputation for years. Food was great as you can see in pictures.. perhaps ..some touch up to the interior may make the place feel warm and friendly.
Damage : $200 (lunch)/pax

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.name: Iggy's

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Les Amis restaurant is a gastronomic wonderland that transported me to a world of culinary bliss! The ambiance felt like a page out of a Parisian romance novel, with soft lights and a melody of enchanting tunes. The menu, a poetic composition of flavors, offered a dance of taste that left me in awe. The waitstaff, dressed in elegant attire, choreographed a dining experience that was nothing short of a culinary ballet. Each dish, a masterpiece plated with precision, tasted like a symphony of harmonious ingredients. If you're yearning for a dining escapade that feels like a rendezvous with gourmet dreams, Les Amis is the destination to indulge your palate in a poetic feast!

Ordered the dark chocolate cake and it was so delicious! The cake is placed on top of a tart shell which is very special. Almonds are super fragrant too.
Hope that delivery service can be included in the future and handwriting on the chocolate could be better 😅

Had a very pleasant dining experience at Les Amis. Patrick, our server, was very friendly, attentive, and entertaining. He suggested a perfect wine to have with the steak. He also patiently explained every dish to us. The amuse bouche tartalette with bacon and mushrooms was a good introduction to the meal. Notable food from our dinner are the French egg, crab soufflé, simmered celery root, salted brioche, herb sorbet, and poached pears. The caviar that was thoughtfully used in some of the dishes is an interesting addition of a complex salt flavor; it did not overwhelm the taste of the other ingredients. The wagyu was tender but I expected a bit more flavor and it lacked a bit of surprise. The herb sorbet is most interestingly a refreshing palate cleanser. Overall, it was a memorable and pleasant gastronomic experience.

Truly Michelin 3 stars! Excellent food with great creativity,  best service, excellent wine pairing, and the deserts are the best.  Not cheap but it is worth it!

Everything was impeccable, the food was great and the portions were generous, great wine pairings and amazing service.
Toni and the team were very kind and took genuine care of us.
The Blu Lobster appetizer, their sour dough, the riz de veu and the cheese course were divine.
Highly recommended.
Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.name: Les Amis

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Every dish is wonderful and I can’t wait to come back again. No doubt this is a Michelin starred restaurant. Especially love the lobster dish and the crab glutinous rice. There’s a outdoor carpark just right opposite the restaurant and little India mrt station is less than 5mins walk away.

Chef Kang is a Micheline Star Chinese Restaurant.

His Superior Sharks Fin soup is fantastic.

Every dish carefully and passionately prepared.

This is our first time here, and noticing that many ministers have dined at this restaurant, I found that the food is too sweet for my taste

5 Stars for this restaurant.. Although they are a Michelin 1 Star restaurant for consecutive years.

Managed to get a table after booking for very long. They are so popular and is always full house. You can't walk in too.

The dishes are Cantonese style and the wok hei is fantastic!

The restaurant only has 3 private dining rooms.  That is why it is very difficult to book a table.

The staff are very prompt and friendly.

Chef kang is very friendly too and joined us for drinks and photos.

Price is on the high side but it's worth the quality of the dishes.

Nice place to have dinner with family. The chill crab 🦀 is very nice and the chicken wing is good.

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.name: Chef Kang's Private Kitchen

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
We had a lovely dinner for my brother's birthday. Food was good, and the portions were fairly generous for fine dining. What I found extra special was who each dish was beautifully presented with such intricate details.

Food was hands down beating expectations. I knew it would be amazing for a Michelin star restaurant but I actually thought it was better quality than just a 1 star. Also appreciated the large diversity in courses and in between tasters for the full menu. If anything there can be too much food you get full!. The smaller space feels more intimate and nice to look into the kitchen area. The option to choose your tasting size was also nice

Cons
- entrance door is difficult to find for building
- wine list is long…but not high diversity in selection. It seemed like the median price was $800-$1000 for any wine bottle. Not many options for simpler but quality,  less exclusive wines. Also although wine is “the” thing for most of these places, still wish there was more spirit friendly options

My favourite fining dining experience in Singapore. The food was exquisite, delicately well-balanced and carefully served. The ambience was intimate and soothing. The butter and bread was heavenly tasty, soft and aromatic.

It was a birthday celebration for us and we had a wonderful time. Definitely recommended for a special occasion.

Stunningly well presented and proportioned lunch taster menu. From the first perfectly warmed brioche and seasoned butter, through an exquisite selection of canapés, fish, duck and desserts the team provide culinary delights that will challenge your vocabulary to do justice to the experience of your tastebuds.

We had the lunch tasting menu (SGD 148) and it was absolutely amazing. Their Parker house roll with Shio Kombu butter was packed with intense umami, and I would have demolished the whole bun (6 servings) if I didn't have breakfast (haha).

The menu is French, with a pretty heavy Japanese influence. Appetizers came in small bites that piqued the palette. The small bites were:

Ankimo glazed in Ponze with Katsuoboshi cream and salted radish
Smoked Eel Riletter with apple and marigold
Spring pea tartlet with smoked cream crue and marinated Ikura
36 month aged comte cheese cornet

The main appetizer was a picturesque feature of aged Hamachi with fennel, shiso and N25 Kaluga Reserve. Superbly refreshing and slightly salty, it set up the tone for the next heavier main course - the Roasted Venison with green asparagus. I could say that this is one of the best roasted venison I've ever tasted - so tender and flavourful, with no gaminess to it. Beautifully executed!

I was also immensely impressed by their dessert - to be honest I feel a lot of fine dining restaurants are a letdown when it comes to desserts, like falling off a sharp cliff in the tasting experience, but I was super super happy that their desserts allowed us to end the meal on a high note. The warm and light pistachio souffle was a perfect complement to the cold and rich Abinao chocolate with espresso cremeux.

The only part I felt they could improve on was the petit fours, not bad but a tad bitter for the earl grey tart and the canelé was way too hard. But look how pretty the Choux is with white chocolate butterflies on top! There was definitely a lot of effort from the pastry chef.

Overall an amazing experience and I think well worth the price tag!

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Visited in Jul 2023

The last time I had visited Rhubarb was 4-5 years ago. So a revisit was a long time coming. Good food and great service as always. There are 3 options/dining experiences you can choose from. I went for the most comprehensive one - 3 starters, 1 main with chef’s premium ingredient and 1 dessert.

While I can see how Rhubarb has been able to maintain its 1 star for so many years, I struggled a bit to find some key differentiating factor versus other French contemporary Michelin places. Good food nonetheless.

Service was really good. The dishes kept coming fast and I was done with my entire dinner in an hour.

All in all a very good dining place. If you haven’t been there, it is definitely worth going.

The 4-course lunch Omakase was very very satisfying, with interesting notes and flavours that I’m pleasantly surprised by. I also really enjoyed my chat with Joseph as a solo diner, so that my lunch was a little livelier. I had an absolutely lovely time and would return again.

Decided to go last min as I suddenly met a long time friend. She said she didn’t want to eat something too heavy. The starters were mainly seafood and fruits, which opened up her appetite after a full day of hard stress work. The main was a tender slowed cooked beef. Dessert was a coconut sorbet I think (?). Accompanied the meal with a Riesling. We quite enjoyed the night.
Funny note, one of the appetisers is a mix of fruits and seafood, I confused the apple with an olive. The taste was good though. Please don’t change the dish because of my comment.

Food are all tastefully plated and delicious. They were kind to ask me if I have dietary restrictions and I told them I would like to have all cooked food. So they made changes for me to replace the lightly torched scallops to cooked crab stick for appetiser. Really appreciate it:) every dishes were all well explained and executed.

Outstanding food, worth its Michelin star. Service is friendly. The atmosphere is a little bit let down by the lighting and impersonal musical background. Overall a very nice place to have an amazing meal. Prices very reasonable.
Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.opening_hours:

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Our first time here. The service was hospitable and genuine, no pretense despite being a Michelin-starred restaurant. Alex and Kim were friendly and was impeccable in their service. Food was amazing with unique combinations of fresh ingredients. Chef also came over to each table to interact which we felt was an awesome touch. Strongly recommended!

Well deserved Michelin Restaurants.
The bread is so crispy on the outside and so so so soft on the inside. Pairing with the bordier butter, it is really exceptional.
Every dish of the food is amazing.

The service is so good. When the table is full of crumbs, the waiter will clean it up to sweep away the crumbs. The waiter are also friendly and knowledgeable about the dishes.
When we found a bone in the fish and the chef came out to apologize. Felt the service was so good.

The atmosphere in the round room felt great too.

One of the best fine dining places I’ve ever been to! I can’t keep track of what was being served because there was just so many different courses, but each course was really tasty 🥰 I don’t think I’m a small eater but I was so full by the last few courses, I don’t think I ate any at all. Remember to pace yourself. I’m most impressed by their bakes; their toasty black sesame bread was literally the best bread I’ve ever had in my life.

White Grass is a hidden gem, providing a distinctive dining venture with its fusion of Japanese and European flavors.

Each dish is delectable, especially the bread, pastries, and desserts rank the finest that I ever tasted.

The real flower centerpiece adds a pleasant fragrance, and the stylish decor contributes to the overall charm, making it an excellent option for couples and hosting friends.

On my second visit, I can confidently say they consistently exceed my expectations.

Very good ambience and attentive service. The bread is crispy outside and moist inside. Sesame bread is delicious too. Abalone is well done combined with the sauce and texture. The lobster meat is too soft for our liking. Everything is fine but no distinctive wow factor.

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Okay… the food is good enough to make the queue worth it. The queue moves super slow mostly due to some staff takes very long in dishing. But trust me, the food is worth the chaos in getting the food. Plenty of seating including upstairs.

Their specialty is the spicy squid in squid ink sauce. It’s quite spicy but flavourful. Other classic dishes like fried tofu with egg, chicken curry, beef rangdong and variety of fried dishes are all done well.

It’s Michelin bib, and we are fan of nasi Padang. The black squid samba was great.  The rendang chicken was a little over cooked but the flavourful gravy help.  The the handout anchovies potatoes chilli was ok. Asam fish was well done with perfect ladyfingers.  The samba chilli provided was very fresh and right amount of spiciness and flavour. Cuttlefish was forgettable. Tahgay long bean salad cannot go wrong. Yes I will be back again.  Here there is more consistency than many other NP restaurants around the area.

Stayed nearby and came to eat here almost every day! Food is authentically Indonesian and tastes absolutely delicious, they accept credit card payments as well which is quite a novelty in small shops in Singapore (dont know why). Everything we tried was good 👍

Like what many claimed, this was one of those long saved but not checked off places in my books too - finally found a day in which we are craving for some spicy food and decided to head down here!

At 1:30pm, the queue was still stretching out of the store, although it does move relatively quickly, it’s pretty hard to get a table even with second level seating - somewhat like a hawker centre if I may.

The selection was in abundance compared to the other Nasi Padang stalls (which really isn’t in the same league), from the normal begedil to the rare tahu goreng.

💰 the price point is okay - though the tahu goreng at $8 was pricier than the fish and chicken which were $5 a piece.

Food was really good in general! The tahu goreng, grilled chicken and fish are a must order when you visit 🍗 🐠

Definitely will revisit when I’m craving for a good Nasi Padang with a wider variety!

Decided to give them a try because of good reviews. There’s more seats available upstairs and it’s air conditioned.

There’s one shared toilet upstairs too.

Ordered some dishes to share for 2 paxs and it cost us $26.60.

Honestly speaking, beef rendang and fried chicken is tough and dry. Brinjal was bland.  Begedel is soggy. Asam ikan taste okay.
Also, food wasn’t served hot.

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
An exceptional experience, very fortunate to have visited this unique restaurant last night. These folks have real flair, making the visit enjoyable from the moment we arrived. I think that I can relate to the chefs “cross roads” concept, an amazing set menu with elements from across the globe. Great wine pairing, loved hearing the story lines.  Loved the casual, relaxed atmosphere. Everything presented with confidence and fun.  Well deserving of its Michelin status.  Each course was remarkable, but I was particularly taken with the chocolate fish ball!

I recently visited Nouri and I must say, the experience was outstanding. The food was absolutely delicious, with a unique blend of cross-cultural flavors that truly impressed my taste buds. From start to finish, every dish was beautifully presented and expertly prepared.

The renovated space is also fantastic, with a modern yet elegant atmosphere that adds to the overall dining experience. There is also a renewed chef table.

The service was top-notch and the staff was incredibly attentive. I highly recommend Nouri to anyone looking for an exceptional dining experience in Singapore.

Thank you, Nouri, for an unforgettable evening!

The owner did a wonderful service. We went in for lunch before our flight and the service was prompt and the food came out in a nice pace for lunch. The food was ok and this is my second time here. It has been consistent during the years. This is a nice spot to bring business guest for lunch as it is usually quiet during lunch in the area where most of the comparable restaurants may only open for dinner.  Yes, it is quite pricey.

Food was great, service was great, atmosphere was great. It was relaxed and we had a good time over good food. All the options were presented to us so well; tea, opening drinks, etc. I was just slightly shocked that the selection of tea to end the meal costed $30ish per pot. But other than that, I enjoyed dinner.

Unique flavors, warm, friendly service, beautiful plates, reasonably priced. Staff generously explained every dish and ingredients and an energetic open kitchen made for a memorable dining experience.

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Excellent services with quality food and fantastic atmosphere. The restaurant only has limited table, definitely need reservations to come here. The place focuses more on a wide range of quality vegetables across the world. Very unique presentation of the dishes! My partner was having the vegetarian option and it was as good as the non vegetarian options. The chef even packed us his hometown cake to bring home for tasting.
A little high on the cost, but worth the experience!

One of the most breathtaking food experience I had the chance to enjoy.

Amazing culinary journey. The contemporary symphony of aromas and textures through a vegetarian focus was fresh, exciting and new. Every dish is meticulously crafted to bring a delightful balance of flavors. The wine pairing was on point. Compliments job to the chef.

Excellent service. Attentiveness and professionalism exceeded our expectations.

The atmosphere was warm, friendly and cosy. We felt welcomed and in optimal conditions to savor our dinner.

We recommend this restaurant to anyone passionate about food.

Beautiful vegetarian cuisine, beautiful ambience, beautiful service and staff. Just take that leap for tastebud and exquisite ingredients discovery. Presentation of the food, attention to your dining experience made it such a pleasant experience. Do come by each season for different culinary exposure.

Chef Jeremy and the team did a fantastic job championing seasonal vegetables. The wine paring was beautifully done for each course to highlight the taste of the food with a great balance.

The ambience of the restaurant was intimate and lovely but the light was slightly dark. It was a birthday celebration and we had a great time throughout the night.

The menu was exceptional, a great variation of vegetables and herbs tastefully balanced and beautifully presented. The choice of courses was perfectly matched. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The chef introduced himself to all the guests and was very accommodating. We really enjoyed our dinner at JAG, a highlight in Singapore.

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Another perfect evening. Delicious dinner. Beautifully executed. Sophisticated cocktails. Quality time with family. Catching up with friends

Thank you Team 65 for your hospitality  🫶

Had the most fabulous opportunity to dine in table65 a couple months ago and was presented with exquisite 3 course lunch by Chef Dayal and team.

I must say the experience was way beyond.
Every plates served was a taste of wonder and every bites and sips worth the savouring

Will definitely come back for more of these splendid treats.

Shout out to Kevin for being such an awesome host with some mean mixology skills :)

A truly unforgettable first Michelin star experience. Dayal and his team curated a spectacular dinner with bold flavours and world-class ingredients. Was lovely chatting to the staff about table65's history and what led them to where they are now. Definitely worth a second visit, not to mention situated in extraordinary Sentosa.

The food was a surprise with the presentation and the food was very tasty especially the amuse-bouche, starter and the dessert. I picked the venison, the dressing for the sauce and roasted pumpkin were well combination too.

Booked this restaurant with great anticipation of the dinner.  There is no a la carte menu to order only set menu, and the price is steep at $288 per pax for a 6 course dinner.  However, we still went for it reading that they are a Michelin restaurant.   But the overall experience there was not very pleasant.

We were greeted and shown to our seat by a waiter? Bartender? Sommelier? He spoke loudly and in a fashion like those at the market place which was rather rare in a fine dining restaurant.   We were seated and I asked if we could change our seats to a more private adjacent small table for 2.  He rejected saying the restaurant is full and that the 2 seats would be in the way of their work traffic... and we took his words that the restaurant would be full on a Wednesday evening...
The restaurant is nicely renovated but had a cold feeling in spite of the fact that we were seated at a counter around the kitchen.  Maybe because there were only 4 crew in the kitchen. the place lacked some vibe.
We were given a small pad with the smallest lettering of the menu.  Having aging eyesight and the dimness of the place is commented that the wordings are really small.  And he laughingly said " can expand mah.." and turned to go.  We asked for the wine list, and he said inside here also and pointed to the grading wine list.  We clicked in, but being not savy with gadgets, we could not find the list and so asked for help.   And he instructed us how to go into the pages. The prices are really steep for the wines and so we decided to do the wine pairing at a price tag of $188 with wines from Portugal, Germany, French and Italian...
Food was good..  Ah, I must say the bread is really good.
Finally we are done with our dinner and ask if they have camomile tea.  Yes, of course, but we weren't told that there is a charge for it.   We were charged $18 per cup.  And we only had one cup and it was a Chinese tea cup....
The night finally come to a close for us and there were only 4 couples....🤔 I thought we were told the restaurant was fully booked and our request for a change of table was rejected because of that....🤔??
Well..

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Absolutely stunning dinner served up by 1-star Chef Sun Kim. Contemporary Korean food with his individuality expressed brilliantly. Loved every dish but the abalone and dessert! Will definitely come back again. 👍🏻

Everything was great from start till end, though I have to say my favourite was the main dish (rice, sliced beef, kimchi) - perhaps it was also influenced by the back story (shall not give spoilers!). Overall an enjoyable afternoon spent, will worth the leave from work we had to take just to make the lunch sitting.

I have tried many restaurants in Singapore and this is the best in my opinion. Usually in such restaurants I’ll always have 1-2 favourite dishes that blew my mind, but here I can’t choose. Perfect amount of flavour and texture in every dish. Service was exceptional too.

A little more contemporary than Korean though that’s perhaps (rightly or wrongly) influenced by my expectations of a Korean fine dining experience at Meta and hence left with a slight disappointment of what it could be.

This probably explains why the standout dish is the abalone from Jeju that sits on top on the flavorful porridge/ risotto. It’s superb - something you could have everyday. If there’s one most indulgent comfort food ever, it’s that. Not even the KBBQ with A5 wagyu could up seat that.

Overall, there wasn’t a dish that disappointed per se - execution was great, especially the Striped Jack - the accompanying squid and surf clams were perfectly cooked and the tuna with avocado was a nice surprise/ twist. But as I alluded to earlier and I am not sure if my expectations were misplaced, the disappointment was perhaps I was looking more for the Korean influence in the food that I didn’t quite get.

One of the best restaurants I’ve been to in Singapore. The scallop was my favourite dish. Overall, it was an amazing dining experience and I highly recommend this place.

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
My first 3 star Michelin experience. I found the service a little stiff, as the evening progressed the staff loosened up a bit which was nice, everything was so extra, the presentation of the food was so interesting and exciting. The food was good but I can probably tick off this experience. Make sure you like seafood! A once and a lifetime experience!
It was pretty cool we got to meet the chefs after.

I certainly had very high expectations of Odette, it having 3 Michelin stars and being #14 in The World's 50 Best Restaurants list at the time of the visit (november 2023).

Well, fame is definitely not everything! From start to finish, what lacked was soul and personality, and the whole experience made me think reputation by terms of media and rankings might be increasingly decadent.

To start off, we were offered a small and uncomfortable-looking table right by the entrance door, even though I had reserved a table in the Private Dining Room over a month prior. We had to insist on being placed in the intended room.

The whole time, it felt like we were doing the restaurant a favor being there and I could sense so much pretentiousness in service, food and ambiance. The flavor and even the high quality ingredients were shadowed by this and the gimmicky presentations of the food.

At a USD 500/SGD 700 price point per person (without wine pairing), I most definitely cannot recommend Odette to anyone.

What a lovely and delicious evening out in Singapore. Service was what you would expect from a 3* establishments. All the dishes, from the butter to the pigeon, were out of this world. The staff was well orchestrated and did a great job of providing information on each dish and engaging us in conversation throughout the evening. Having been fortunate enough to dine at other 2 & 3* restaurants around the globe I would put this in my top 3 in a very close race with Mudec in Milan for number 1 and edging out French Laundry in terms of the menu. I will definitely try to secure another reservation next time I'm in Singapore.

Odette has always been on my to-try list and this year I was treated to a birthday dinner here!

An amazing French experience savoring the 7-course meal. We were totally impressed by the presentation as well as the flavour of each dish. Not to mention the excellent and attentive service by the crew! It was also nice of them to gift a bottle of strawberry jam for every guest.

An unforgettable meal, or rather gourmet journey at this 3-starred michelin.

Tried the 7 course meal for a celebratory lunch.

The food was great - loved the Maryuko Uni, smoked organic egg and the desserts. ‘Blanc’ the dessert was phenomenal.

However, service was quite average. The waiters rushed through explanations of their dishes. And while they tried to entertain our questions about the dishes, the way that they did it was quite cursory and generally seemed quite reluctant to hold a conversation.

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Absolutely amazing food; had the Omakase at the chef’s table. The umami and creamy sea urchin balanced with the sweetness of the shrimp and slight saltiness of the caviar to produce a full flavour profile with each mouthful. Loved the perfectly (teppanyaki) seared abalone with risoni and the A5 Kobe wagyu dipped in the egg yolk (it was so silky, tender and flavourful from the marbling). Service was excellent as well; they were jovial and attentive and made the experience delightful.

This is a late review. I came here during valentines weekend. Both my friend and I had food poisoning and I was bed ridden for three days. Only decided to review now because my friend told me that her group of friends also got food poisoning from the same group of restaurants. So totally not worth it even tho the food was great. Spent 750 per pax to get food poisoning.. really ridiculous..

We had some Izakaya food and beer before going for show. Food must be good considering the price is not cheap for beer food, but its a tad a bit too salty for me. Service is great of course. My favorite will be the lobster spaghetti, a bit of fusion.

Worst Omakase I ever had. Decided to leave a review. Anyone who thought of coming, read this.

For the $700 dinner omakase menu, their special additional dish is only a plate of ‘otoro’. (Picture 2) Yet they didn’t even remove the sinew of the tuna properly, causing it to be extremely chewy and tough to eat. Have to chew for very long time and yet some areas we just puke out.

Other omakase restaurants I’ve been to, the otoro basically melt in your mouth.

Also, when they show you the ingredients (Picture 1), as you can see there’s a lobster. At the end of the course, there’s no lobster provided and was not in the menu as well (Picture 3)

If that’s the case. Why put the lobster on the ingredients plate, I don’t get it. The other dishes taste so-so only. Not memorable or outstanding.

Not just a dining experience; it’s a culinary journey through the intricacies of Japanese cuisine, but with a touch of modern flair. Made with the best quality. Pricing is on the higher side (tried both of the $550 and $700 omakase) but for a special occasion, it’s worth every penny.

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Very mixed thoughts in Labyrinth. The restaurant is exactly as advertised - chefs take on Singapore food - however I didn’t think it was necessary better than hawker stalls (especially if you consider the price). The other thing with the menu is it switched between hot and cold dishes too often (cold as in frozen). For example, the salad was cold, then the frog pie was hot, then the chili crab was partially cold, then switched to hot prawn mee, then the fish was even cold (I think the sauce not the fish itself)…. And so forth.

It’s so apt that this 1 Michelin starred restaurant is located within the Esplanade — Singapore’s National performing art centre.

Having dinner here is like being treated to the whole Singaporean experience… not only showcasing the cuisine, but our culture and way of life. Will not spoil the surprise for u, but they go all out with the props here!

If u are visiting Singapore, I highly recommend this dining experience, which is not only delicious but highly-entertaining! We left the restaurant with our bellies full and very happy.

Locals may balk at the high price we are paying for local favourites, but I think the creativity and presentation is worth a visit.

Creative spin to local dishes, knowledgeable staff. Definitely an experience not to be missed!

Although I’d have preferred lesser influence from Japan, got confusing for a bit when dishes tasted like it’s from Japan instead of Singapore.

Overall a great experience and highly recommend!

Crazy off the hook amazing experience at Labyrinth Restaurant. Singapore is blessed with so many incredible places to eat and Labyrinth is right at the top. The food is impeccable in terms of flavour and presentation, the service is on point and close to perfection, but it is the story and creativity that is infused through the entire dinning experience that transcends the gastronomic journey. I loved every minute and can’t wait to go back for more. I now know why Labyrinth is #11 on the best Asian restaurant list for 2023, was awarded the highest climber award in 2023, and have 1 Michelin star.

[Late review]

Visited in May 2023

A truly fantastic dining experience which beats some of the ‘higher star’ restaurants in Singapore (from a flavour and cuisine creativity perspective) quite comfortably in my view. Labyrinth’s rise in recent Asia Best 50 rankings is well justified.

The dishes are a tribute to some of the classic Singaporean flavours and the menu does justice to the various inspirations (hawker food, old SG restaurants). The starting course (Roti Jon, Otah, Satay) set the tone and it just kept getting better. Every main course item from Chili crab to Prawn Noodle Soup to the Sizzling Plate Steak was exquisite. Among the dessert dishes, the Orh Nee preparation was fantastic.

For drinks, I did not go with the wine pairing and just ordered a few cocktails. Average cocktails and nothing exemplary.

A 200% recommendation for all SG residents and visitors

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Our experience at Braci was probably one of our most memorable meals and the food served was truly deserving of its Michelin star. Would highly recommend getting the seven course menu as there were so many more elements in our dinner incorporated that made it all the more special. Flavours were all very well balanced and overall we left feeling very satisfied.

Visited in Sep 2023

Braci was on my list of restaurants to visit for over 4 years and I must say that it was worth the wait. It is no surprise that Braci has retained its Michelin 1 star for 6 consecutive years. The menu was a progressive one which is definitely inspired by Chef Mattie’s Italian roots. There are 2 choices for people (5 course and 7 course). I would suggest people to go for the 7 course as the additional dishes in the 7 course meal are worth it. One of my favourite parts of the experience was trying out the 100 yr old balsamic vinegar.

If you’re not taking the wine pairing, I would strongly recommend folks to try out a few of their cocktails, esp. their Negroni (one of the most unique ones I’ve had)

Service was good. The restaurant is able to cater to some food allergies (like my shellfish allergy).

A definite recommendation for fine dining lovers.

Location was not to my liking.
Great staff very welcoming and accomodating to our strict dietary restrictions.
They had to make a menu from scratch for us which gives them bonus points.
Food quality was amazing and the ingredients exquisite.
However, the taste of the food was confusing and frankly bland at times.
But i cannot judge the restaurant fairly as i did not try the actual menu items.

Amazing time at Braci for a birthday celebration for my husband. The Italian food was superb with beautiful floral aesthetic to each dishes. Staff is polite and friendly too! Special thanks to Chef Matteo who is very engaging and make the day extra special! Love the black truffle "hide and seek" dish which is one of the highlights of all dishes! It so savoury and unforgettable….

nice food nice atmosphere. i tot the service could be more positive. but i still enjoy the experience especially on a chill night in the rooftop. overall quite an expensive experience but they were very nice to add an additional anniversary dessert for us:)
Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.name: Braci

Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.reviews:
Still as good! Excellent rice consistency with the right pressure applied on every nigiri, firm but not dense. Fish was firm and nicely sliced in the right proportion to the rice. Will definitely continue to visit.

Waiting area can be enhanced for guests, instead of being placed in the dark area. Chefs are all superb, interactive, well trained in all aspects, considerate as per universal standards of the fine dine Japanese excellence. Cosy space for omakase, ingredients are fresh, right cut, delicate culinary expertise in food presentation. Will be ideal for each to have more space and comfortable seats.

Looking for authentic omakase sushi in singapore, with finesse? HIGHLY recommend Shinji @ Carlton. Chef Ishin is very skilful and precise in his sushi.

Abalone with liver sauce cooked for 6 hours and its very tender.

Glasswares ; Zaltos for wine lovers

One starred Michelin ⭐️

Definately will come back 😀

Sorry didnt take any photos of the sushis was enjoying my experiences, can keeping my hands clean for sushi😂

Service is always good and the quality of the food items always exceed our expectations. The chef is always thoughtful which is why we always come back to celebrate our special day here.

Absolutely top notch and  authentic japanese omakase in SG. Fresh and succulent highly graded fish on top of warm japanese vinegar rice with a unique savory playfulness on your tongue. Would highly recommend to try!
Michelin-starred restaurants in Singapor.name: Shinji by Kanesaka

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
Food is alright, flavours are all good but nothing too spectacular.

The seafood in the calamari platter was fresh, no weird tastes. Pizza is on the average side. Crab pasta tasted like the non-spicy version of chilli crab which is quite unique. Would say the fish was the best. The fish itself is roasted very well and also love the layered potatoes.

Overall, felt that it was Italian cuisine tailored to the Singaporean palate. Also, the restaurant is understaffed, there was only two service-crew serving everyone. Atmosphere-wise, it’s on the top  level of the hotel but there’s no views of anything. It was basically a poolside restaurant with the occasional crying / screaming of kids and babies in the pool.

Would only recommend if you are hotel guest or looking for a casual restaurant in the area.

When you're looking for a less crowded Italian restaurant on Orchard Road, this is a good place to hide. Nice small restaurant, located on the Rooftop of Voco Hotel. The food is good, but it could be better. Service staff were wonderful and knowledgeable of the menu.

I’ve visited with my mom during singapore trip. They served great dishes. I especially recommend Truffle Burrata Cheese Pizza. The staff who is Korean guy is very kind and professional. We had a good moment because of him. I want to thank you to he and rest of all staffs.

Love the ambience of this roof top bar as well as the service received!

Thank you Cai Ying, Jeremy and Owen for the exceptional services during my dinner at il Cielo, thank you for making it easy and enjoyable for me and my 5 year old son.

Special mention to Cai Ying, who was especially attentive to all my needs and food recommendations were superb (look at the photos!)

Of course, thank you to Chef Marco and Chef Beh Li for making my foodie son crave for the food even more after we left the restaurant.

Would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who is looking to have a quiet evening with pool and view of Orchard!

Do try the Burrata Purgilese and the Tiramisu! These 2 are my favourites!

I had a really lovely lunch with my family. It was a special occasion to celebrate and the food and service was excellent (the pool view is great as well). The staff Owen made our day and we genuinely enjoyed our time there. Thanks team!!

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
Chanced upon this restaurant while finding a dinning place. I did not make any reservations and at 6:40pm it seems like they are fully reserved up. Anyway the waiter was very nice to let us have a table for outside area.

The happy hour oyster attracted me and to my surprised, the $2.50 per oyster is large and creamy. They did not give some miserable quality for promotional price. Commendable for this!

Ordered the blueberries rosemary smash and they put real jumbo size blueberries and a fresh sprig of rosemary. A very refreshing drink served in large size in my opinion. It lasted me the whole entire 2 hours of conversation.

An ideal place to chitchat in a nice environment that is not too noisy. The service of the staff is very attentive too. The young crews are super friendly.

Oysters are great - super succulent and pair perfectly with hot sauce and lime. Pizza is quite average but the sweet potato fries are something else. Cocktails were average. The interior is beautiful and I heard there a live band plays occasionally.

This restaurant is packed on weekends and the attraction is probably the live band and mostly female crowd. The food is actually pretty decent but I’d say the pizza was better than the Vongole pasta (which was rather salty). Service can be slow due to the large number of tables the waitress needs to attend to.

Sides would be more suitable for big groups to share. The food were great. The cheese fries had mozeralla and nacho cheese which provides different layers of taste. The portions of the mains was very filling too. It might get a little crowded even on weekdays dinner so it would be better to make a reservation first.

Attentive service, great atmosphere and quality food. I’m always a bit skeptical of eating non-Asian cuisine in Singapore but I was pleasantly surprised by the food here at Supply and Demand. We dined as a large group and ordered several appetisers, pizzas and pastas. There were some Asian fusion flavours/dishes but also standard Italian flavours. Would recommend the vegetariana pizza, the calamari, and fig and prosciutto starter. The service was excellent and we enjoyed a nice bench seat off to the side of the restaurant. Would happily return.

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
Atmosphere is 10/10.There is a lot of space inside.

My queue time is around 10-15minutes depending on certain hours.Avoid peak hours like lunch break 1-2pm to skip the queue.

There are a lot variety of foods and it also provide free flow of plain water.

Service was good here at this branch and my food came rather quickly. Taste is just like how the other Saizeriya branches are around Singapore. Simple, a huge variety of pastas to choose from. All in all.. it's comfort Italian food for the masses.

Quick and basic Italian style food is what to expect here. No white linen table cloths although you can get a small decanter of white or red wine to create more of a moment. They offer a number of vegetarian options, I tried both the mushroom soup and the pumpkin soup. The mushroom is the better of the two with a nicer thick consistency and hearty flavor. If you are a soda drinker like me - recommend adding the free flow drinks to satisfy your cola craving.

Saizeriya is like the Italian food joint for those of us craving Italian food on a tight budget, serving Italian fare fit for discerning peasants.

The standout dishes at Saizeriya include their affordable Escargot and Garlic Focaccia. These offerings provide a garlicky explosion that will destroy your breath for the remaining day. The food quality can be somewhat inconsistent, the pasta sauces were a bit on the runny side in my latest visit.

Staff were fast and alert. They were friendly too. The food was delicious and cheap! Delivered really quickly to the table. There’s also a lot of vegetarian options! Love it there!

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
The cocktails were great and at 42++ for 3, it’s really a sweet deal.
The antipasti were amazing. We had the melon with ham as well as the octopus which were really cooked well and tasty.
The main dish today was a miss. The beef was really tough even cooked medium. Tendons were striped across the entire steak which should never be the case with a ribeye.

So far one of the two best pizza's I have had beed eating in Singapore. Great tomato passata, decent salami and cheese. All ingredients are fresh and good quality. I was really surprised with short waiting time, just a couple of minutes and all three pizza's have been served. Very friendly and helpful Staff.

The portions match the pricing, so rest assured that you'd be full! I got 2 mains (iberico pork and pesto pizza) for sharing and were beyond full. The food was flavourful and good but was a tad too rich/salty to finish. Come with more friends for a bigger bang for your buck.

Visited Lino 2 weeks ago for dinner, so yeah this is a long overdue write-in. I didn't manage to reserve a table online, so my friend and I just do walk-in. Unfortunately that day the restaurant had quite a few of big groups, hence we got the smallest table there - a little wonky and cramp.
However, I must say that the experience was delightful. The standout dishes that I tried were the Burrata Pizza, Truffle Fries, and Scallop Risotto.
The burrata pizza was a true masterpiece. The combination of the creamy burrata cheese with the freshness of tomato and pesto sauce plus the perfectly crust, not only visual appealing but also bursting with flavour. It's a must try for any pizza enthusiast. Truffle fries - excellent. The risotto was cooked beautifully with a creamy texture that complemented the succulent scallops.
This restaurant is definitely one of the top choices for those looking for Italian food in central Singapore.

First time trying this place on a weekend late dinner. Crowded but with available seats. Decent customer service. This place is nicely renovated with nice background music. Ordered 2 mains + 1 side. Price is decent for restaurant setup in orchard. Personally i feel the portion is slightly smaller. The pasta for the carbonara is abit hard for my liking. The duck confit taste good and meat is tender. Something i will recommend. Overall a good dining experience.
Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: LINO @ Forum

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
All the dishes were beautifully executed. I started with Tasmanian baby squid as antipasto, followed by two plates of pasta of the day, namely lamb pasta as well as pumpkin ravioli. Normally, I don't include dessert in my review, but the yuzu sorbet from the restaurant is truly commendable.

Well located in Orchard. Oysters fresh and sweet. Family liked the bolognese and thin crust pizza.

Pumpkin soup was standard, it reminded me of blended baby food.

My personal favourite is the uni pasta, the cream base sauce on the Uni pasta is just right, not overwhelming, savoury enough to also enjoy the  uni. I didn't  taste the yuzu in the sauce but I did enjoy the ginseng leaves as part of the flavor.

All the pasta are generously portioned,  so it's good to share.

One of the best restaurants in Singapore! We have been to many Michelin star restaurants but we think LaD'oro definitely deserves the recognition because it is better than many of them. The food is great in terms of taste, look, creativity, combination, presentation and portion. The chef finds every opportunity to surprise you and show you the difference between Italian and Japanese ingredients. The effort from the chef and experience as a guest is flawless! The menu we had is Autumn and we will be back for the next season. The Sendai Wagyu is the most impressive dish but unfortunately I forgot to take a photo.

Pretty nice and grand Interior, and initially I thought the price will be exorbitant but it's not. Def not cheap but I think it's acceptable to me. 3 of us spent around 50 each for 1 uni pasta (this costs the most but worth it as the sea urchins are quite large), 1 pizza and 1 side (yummy baby squids!), and we were very full. They taste good as well.

we booked dinner for 6.30 pm on a Sunday and there were only 2 other tables occupied. soft music and lighting made the atmosphere pretty romantic for dates! we ordered truffle fries (but they ran out of fries, only had wedges - we still prefer truffle w fries though), Pizza Bismarck and Tagliatelle Hokkaido Snow Beef A5 Bolognese. BOTH the pizza and the bolognese were SO GOOD. we loved it so much. they have really nice and pretty cakes too btw but we didn't get to try as we were very full but will def return to try those!
service by the staff was really good as they were very attentive to customers' needs - they even offered to split our pasta into 2 portions as they guessed we were sharing it!
Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: La D'Oro

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
We had a fantastic dining experience at Osteria Mozza. Not only were the sides and pasta absolutely delicious, with a wide range of options to choose from, but the service was impeccable. The staff was attentive, friendly, and made sure every aspect of our meal was enjoyable. I truly appreciated the excellent service that accompanied the delectable pasta dishes. The olive oil cake was excellent as well. A little cramped in terms of the seating but nevertheless I'll definitely be returning for more memorable meals!

Most memorable anniversary dinner that I've had. Food is generally good. What stands out most is their service. It's impeccable. Do take note that they have strict dress code requirements. I was rejected initially due to not wearing covered shoes and have to wait till the customer who is using their loan shoes is done with his meal. Having said that, I'm still very satisfied with the overall experience. This shows how good the service was. Special mention to Kishore for his great service and for providing a Polaroid photo of my wife and I to remember the night. Will definitely be back!

My second time here and the food and service is still as great! Special thanks to Margie who took care of us for tonight. She recommended us a few dishes based on our preference and everything was good! My favourite would be the  grilled octopus as it was not chewy or tough but of right firmness. Would definitely visit again! Thanks Margie!

We recently dined at this fantastic restaurant and had an amazing experience. Their pizza (only available for lunch), mussels and pasta were both outstanding, bursting with flavor. The service was top-notch, with Winson going above and beyond to ensure a delightful dining experience.  Who gave us food and desserts recommendations we really enjoyed

Sister and brother-in-law brought us here for a birthday celebration
The food was excellent! Even a Caesar salad was unforgettable. Mussels starter with delicious buttery bread. Beef tagliatelle was very moreish too

Service was top notch!! Super attentive, constant water filling and checking in on us if we needed anything. Was most impressed when they gave us a card with a handwritten note from every single staff on duty + a Polaroid for keepsake. This is service like no other.

Highly recommended please do come here for an awesome Unforgettable dining experience
Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: Osteria Mozza

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
One of the most value for money Italian cuisines in Singapore. All the dishes we ordered were outstanding except for the mushroom soup which was too watery.
We really love the Caesar Salad, Burrata pizza & seafood aglio olio.
Definitely will be back to try other items on the menu.

Great service! Very helpful attentive crew who recommended the Chianti wine which went down great with the pizzas. Good price too for the bottle at $60. Pizzas freshly made, indeed try the burata. Calamari also went down well and overall a very nice atmosphere and casual dining place to hang out/gatherings along Orchard Road. And they open on a Monday night too! Enjoy.

The pizza is OK, crusty chewy edges on a thin crust, 12 inch, good for 2 to share. The surprise fav here was the Caesar salad.

The rest we had were somewhat disappointing, especially the chicken wings that felt like they were double fried leftovers from last night. The fusion pasta of Salmon and Ikura was a failure too, there was a strong fishy smell in the dish. Can't find fault in the Tiramisu, but can't find praise either.

Service was prompt. Reservations recommended.

very cosy atmosphere, simple and quiet. staff was friendly and attentive too. be sure to make your reservation before coming down because the place is filled during meal times.

sweet potato fries are done very well and not overcooked. truffle mac & cheese had the right proportions of cheese to pasta and truffle goes very well with this dish too. aglio olio had full prawn so and sufficient ingredients to go along with, fresh and well made!

have yet to try their pizzas and it looked so good and portion seemed to be decent too. worth coming and trying!

Update: ended the night throwing up multiple times, will be reporting to the relevant authorities.
The horlicks tiramisu dessert is sour and taste extremely bad. We ate just one mouth and gave up. There was zero attempt of service recovery even after alerting the staff that the tiramisu is sour. Stick to their mains if you plan to dine here
Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: Picolino

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
Have not been here for quite awhile, so went for their Thursday steak buffet. Still as good with all the appetizers and pizzas. The steak is soft and juicy but pity the tomahawk is a bit dry. Roast lamb is great as well. Didn’t really ate too much of the pasta though its very good cos need to save space for cheese and desserts!

All the food was excellent, the service was courteous and friendly, and we had a great time. (Honestly, the quality of the Asian food wasn't that great.) The chefs came around during the meal to give us tastings, and it felt like we were at a friend's party. It was a great time. Thank you:)

Delicious brunch with an extensive selection of Italian cheese. The Lasagna was also extremely delicious! The service was perfect as well. Money well spent and a very fun afternoon thanks to wine/prosecco free flow as well.

Went for Sunday brunch. Cheese room is lovely with a wide selection of cheeses. Loved the unique chocolate cheeses and burratas. Mains selection is ok, could be larger. Lamb stew was nice. Desserts are good as well.

The restaurant offers an array of 🧀 cheese.
If you are a cheese lover, this will be the restaurant for you!
We had buffet but the selection is limited unlike the conventional buffet.  However, food is delicious.
The service is good. Mr Muru / Mr Nuru (Manager) is very helpful & friendly.
Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: Basilico

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
We ordered via Grab for a birthday celebration during Phase 2A and had absolutely no regrets! The portions were generous and came nicely warmed. The highlights for me were the robust flavours of the bolognese sauce, richly portioned with beef , reminiscent of what might have come freshly prepared from an Italian kitchen, as well as the four cheese pizza. The truffle-scented toppings sprinkled with a generous portion of caviar and the blend of cheeses made this a sheer delight and were a crowd pleaser. The kids were very happy with their meal too. Will definitely order again to try the other items on their menu.

We ordered the 4 cheese gourmet pizza, the premium burrata and the pasta bolognese for our sons' birthday. The food flavours were outstanding. We loved the rich truffle flavours for the pizza, the caviar provided the opulence for the burata. And we were so surprised by the strong beef flavours of the bolognese, with its rich tomato flavours. Absolutely delightful! :)

Ordered the burrata pistachio, 4 cheese gourmet pizza, black truffle pesto pizza and diavola pizza for a group lunch. Reviews all round were positive, especially in relation to the freshness, quality and generosity of the ingredients (e.g. heaps of caviar which complemented and did not overwhelm the flavours of the dishes). No compromises here. Will definitely order again :  )

If you like the idea of “Pita bread filled with Indian cheese cubes, sour tasting salami, lettuce with salad dressing and tomato” then please order Italian Focaccia Panini from them. Otherwise nothing Italian bout this!
Italian cuisine in Orchard.opening_hours:

Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: Vissimo Co

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
Upsetting, the food seemed like it would’ve been good tbh. Dripping in oil — taste gets one dimensional, feels like a chore to finish it after the first few bites. Commendable item would be their calamari. Overall, there are way better options in the area

perfectly adequate! was feeling like a simple chicken aglio olio, and this hit the spot. relieved to report that the pasta wasn't too oily per the other reviews - might be dependent on the chef.

definitely try their potato croquette - it's sort of like a portable rosti with a mash / cheese centre.

s/o to the staff too (for sunday lunch), who were friendly and helpful.

The aglio olio was well seasoned & like what many other reviews shared, had super generous helpings of prawns. However the carbonara was a little more like spaghetti in a really creamy soup, bacon bits on top generously sprinkled altho a little tough to chew. Probably won’t try the calamari again..

Affordable And Delicious Italian Fare To Go!  I tried their Beef Piadini and was surprised at how good it was!  The flat bread was crunchy with generous serving of beef and fresh zucchini!  At $7.90 definitely worth it.  Service is great!  Lots tables around to enjoy your food.  Can’t wait to try their pasta!

Been a regular since they opened and I have really been enjoying the food! My favourites would be the calamari, chili crab pasta and chicken piadini with grilled veggies - its so crispy yet juicy especially if you eat it on the spot! Prices are also very reasonable and service is fast even during peak hours. Strongly recommend!

Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: Headwerkz

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
Had an awesome dinner experience here. A homely Izakaya-styled Italian omakase place tucked within a cluster of Japanese restaurants. Rare find! Had the $88 omakase menu. Food was authentic and delicious. Chef Andrea was friendly and generous in his sharing - his passion of food and football (he is a Roma fan!) Will be back!

Food taste soooo good plus the service is great. Chef andrea is very nice and friendly. I will definitely come back here.

Had a great time at Bei Tempi, served personally by Chef Andrea, as we tried the various italian dishes that hail from Chef's roots in Rome. The wine here is reasonably priced as well so get a bottle as you enjoy the food. What struck me the most is on the usage of the different kind of cheeses in the dishes, so for cheese lovers, you will be delighted here.

Fantastic food with wine! Service is great and Chef Andrea is very knowledgeable and friendly. We will be back

Excellent on all fronts. Please try the artichoke when you visit, I’ve never had better.
Italian cuisine in Orchard.opening_hours:
Monday: Closed
Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM
Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM
Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM
Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM
Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM
Sunday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM
Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: Bei Tempi

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
Been here a couple of times and they never disappoint. This is the only pizza place where I go for the crust first over the toppings. There's something really special about that crispy and ultra flavourful crust that keeps me coming back again and again. The state fair fries is another notable mention. They're fries and more than you could ever want (maybe except for a larger portion). Service is always warm and fun, and I look forward to my next visit already.

Service is top notch, the type that you find in places that tip. Decor is posh American diner style. Don't be deceived by the blue exterior wall and lack of windows, it's actually quite homely once you sit down and start to enjoy yourselves.

Food is very good. Pizzas are thin and crispy and even the bread is flavorful without the toppings. There's definitely pizza preferences here, so choose carefully and explore after you've had your favorites.

Good for dates and friend groups.

I brought my partner here to celebrate his birthday. The food was amazing. Thought the service wasn’t the best 5 star but was an acceptable 3.5 - 4 stars. But the food made up for it. The ambience is amazing I love it so cozy and intimate.

What a classy American style pizza parlour. Love the leather seats and the music. Pizza was great while the Kale “Waldorf” Salad and Buffalo Chicken Wings were OK. The Blue Ale on tap was great but was in such a tiny glass, overpriced at $10 even during Happy Hours (till 7pm). Take note there is a promotion for ALL pizzas going at $20 each on Tuesdays.

Absolute fav pizza. Have dined in a number of times. Have ordered for delivery/pick up - countless times! Dough is so different from other pizzeria. It’s soft, chewy and tasty! Super love the White Label and Green Machine. Will definitely be having more of this in the coming future! Place is alright, feels pretty American.
Italian cuisine in Orchard.opening_hours:
Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM

Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: Blue Label Pizza & Wine

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
Hands down to one of the most authentic and fantastic dining place I visited!
Food: fusion of japanese and Italian cuisine, superb delicious
Capacity: around 20pax, choose bar seating to interact with chef directly while enjoying your food
Crews: well trained and polite! Refill your sake cup whenever it is empty🤣 and they will politely check with you whether you had done for the day when the waiting list is growing. No rude attitude at all
Price: average level I would say! given the quality of the served food it is really worth the money!
Reservation: better make reservation before came down to avoid disappointment! It is indeed a hotspot during dinner and supper hour😄
Definitely will return again for more dining experience😇

Fantastic izakaya. Hiromi-san is friendly and recommends the best food that’s in season that Chef Chun skilfully whips up single-handedly. Excellent food with a cosy and casual ambience, you actually feel like you’re in Japan as many Japanese frequent this izakaya. Love everything on the menu, especially their hot Uni pasta, crab croquette, oysters with spinach, and mentaiko pasta!

Casual place and friendly service. There is variety in the food menu and what we ordered is not what we expected. The presentation might look simple but the food is tasty. Food goes well with drinks.

The charming part of this place is the warmth that radiates from the staff - it is small and cosy and the walls are scribbled with messages from patrons - the staff are super friendly and the food is overall tasty - the hamburg steak with cheese gratin, uni pasta, wagyu steak, the fish carpaccio, oysters are all nice. Only the potato salad with mentaiko - the potato was undercooked and underseasoned. The sake is very well priced, and we had an enjoyable dinner here. I went back to ask for a lost receipt and the manager was super helpful and super nice - very memorable ❤️

The friendly staff help to make this small bar welcoming. The menu is limited but the items are all quite good.

If you come in a group, you can get to try more items.

It is a place for dinner and for after dinner drinks.

For people on a diet, get their picked vegetable side dishes and tofu.

For people after a workout, get their pasta.
Italian cuisine in Orchard.opening_hours:
Monday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM
Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM
Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM
