Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: AL Solito Japanese Italian izakaya

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
Probably the most expensive average salad in the world. $46 for a bowl. If this place keeps charging these prices (and not give much value in return) it’ll be out of business very quickly.

I was astonished when the price of my salad bowl (quinoa with kale, mushrooms, pumpkin and salmon) came up to $30.50! Is it due to inflation? I think other salad bars like Dailycut is only half this price for a large bowl but twice the variety, yet not compromising the taste.

I am so shocked by the price $38 for just salad ?! This is overpriced for just a cafe. This is not a high end restaurant and I don't know why I have to pay for this price especially just for a small piece of salmon?!
I wouldn't recommend anybody to patronise this shop!

The sweetest mocha I’ve ever had. So sweet I couldn’t finish it. There’s no coffee taste at all. A cup costs $8.69. You have to queue at the counter to order your food and yet there’s service charge.

Very noisy place, with metal chair legs scratching the floors, plates and pots sounds. Suitable only for short dine-in. Accept cashless payment only.

The work hours are highly convenient. However, there's room for improvement in the food quality. The chicken was tough, and the scrambled eggs were overcooked.
Italian cuisine in Orchard.opening_hours:
Monday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: Da Paolo Gastronomia - Orchard Paragon

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
Been years since I visited this branch. Love it that it’s relatively quiet and a good spot for catching up with friends.

Truffle fries is so good that 2 of us almost finished the entire plate while waiting for our friends, and had to get a 2nd serving. Pizza and pasta were good too! For about $28 per pax, we left feeling full and satisfied!

Been wanting to try this place but only now finally did. For starters we ordered the Antipasto and I love the bread. The pizza is the thin crust kind and really good. Had the Etna. And pasta as well (excuse the photo as nearly forgot to take a pic so it’s been eaten two mouthfuls lol) it was well cooked and the prawns are succulent. Had a latte as well but didn’t take a pic. It was really good latte. Will definitely come again.

We loved the casual vibe of the Pizza Express outlet at Scotts Square. The area was clean, spacious and comfortable with prompt service. The table was also nicely laid out when we arrived. Complimentary water is also served at no additional charge…

For the pizzas, we thoroughly enjoyed the Parma Ham & Arugula Romana Pizza which had the fresh rockets texture with a tinge of bitterness along with the flavourful Parma Ham. There was the signature “crackling sound” of the crust upon each bite that made Romana pizzas our option of choice at Pizza Express. Overall, it was fresh, crisp and delicious. Pizza Express does serve up authentic pizzas, the way it should be.

For more details, visit 2bearbear today!

I love this place. everthing is yummy, all service staff are very friendly.
they have selectable kids set menus and give kids menu book and coloring paper.
I recommend you should go there together with your family.
My kids love dough ball!

2023 May
Unfortunately, I have to decrease the star for this restaurant.
They were busy for delivery orders. Not only our orders but also other diners' orders seemed be ignored. Delivery was their prioity. I must have leave here while cancelling my orders after we waited for 40 mins. It's my worst experience.

We ordered takeout on Tuesday night, August 29th.  We ordered 4 pizzas a salad and an order of dough balls. The dough balls were for our young daughter. I took a dough ball from her order and as I was chewing, I immediately felt something hard in the dough so I took it out and inspected it and it was a metal nail head!!!

My husband contacted the restaurant to notify them of what we found and the gentleman who answered his call was dismissive and told my husband to contact Grab delivery service with any issues.  We are disappointed in the lack of concern over finding a piece of metal in the food! No responsibility was taken or even an apology or solution offered to address the issue.

I am just glad it was me who ended up with the nail in my food and not my daughter, who could have either really hurt her mouth or ingested it.

Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: PizzaExpress | Scotts Square
Eatalian Gourmet Garage

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
Amazing restaurant, the customer service lady that served us outside was outstanding along the with man with the positive attitude the whole night. We have been here twice already and will definitely be coming back again!

Thank you very much for your amazing service, definitely recommend for anyone who loves an amazing pizza base and pasta!

Food quality can definitely be improved. We took one set lunch and one extra pizza. For parmigiana, portion is a bit small but the taste is okay. The two pizza are okay but not the dough I prefer as they didn't let the dough rise enough. For tiramisu, it's okay but a bit tasteless. With the high price, food is not amazing but the service is. The staff is quite helpful and attentive.

Food ordered:
- Burratina con datterini
- Orecchiette della zia
- In piazza

All dishes ordered were fantastic, we were nodding our heads truly appreciating every bite. Will visit again for sure.

Nice place. Good setting/environment and service was good too. Went with the family and so got to try abit of the menu. The pizza was good a solid 8/10 I’d say and was definitely the dinner highlight. The pastas however while good were not great and I’d say a 6/10. All in all a pretty decent place if you’re looking for Italian food around the area.

Such authentic Italian food served here! Enjoyed all the food and dessert that we ordered. It has a nice ambience with helpful and friendly staff. Will certainly come back here again!

We did come back here again after 3 years. The previous review was done before the pandemic and we went there as a family. This time round, only the two of us. The food, service and ambience were just as impressive if not better. The first 3 dishes from the right were what we had on 29 July 2023. This restaurant provided us with free bread with olive oil in black vinegar and warm water too. If you are craving for Italian food, this is a good place for you to try. You will certainly enjoy it!

Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: In Piazza Italian Restaurant & Pizzeria

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
Disappointed. Ordered 1 Margherita & 1 Truffle pizza for delivery. Looked nothing like in the pictures (attached for reference).

There was not a single basil on the margherita and it was served with tomato slices instead of cherry tomatoes. The crust was doughy & dry. There was barely any sauce on the pizza too.

The truffle pizza was just as bad with some slices having plenty of cheese and others having hardly any. The mushrooms looked dry and shriveled and the crust was a little too bready for my liking. Your money would be better off elsewhere.

Claymore connect now has grab kitchen on its second floor. It has 20+ food options to choose from.

I chose volt pizzeria for my love for burrata cheese. I ordered for $18 with 25% discount on self collect. So essentially $13 for this salad.

Burrata was about 100gms. Salad was fresh and had tomatoes. All good for the price.

4 stars, because you do have to go in this heat to pick up.

I ordered the Hawaiian pizza for gathering, although the delivery came late, but I still received the pizza in good condition and it still hot and crispy!!

No regret in recommended to my friends!

Ordered from grabkitchen @hillview. Pizza itself was ok but the service was not ok.  Way off track in estimating the time needed to get the order ready for collection. I collected the order 45 mins after it was ‘ready for collection’

Awesome truffle pizza! Colleagues all loved it. Could smell it before I opened the box. Could even see the black truffle bits. Wish I can get it near my home, haha
Italian cuisine in Orchard.opening_hours:
Monday: 10:00 AM – 9:30 PM

Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: Volt Pizzeria

Italian cuisine in Orchard.reviews:
Professional service was provided by the thoughtful and attentive staff. An entire birthday cake, not merely a slice, was given to us. Most dishes were great. The highlight of the meal was the seafood stew. All the breads were also exceptionally delicious. However, the sea bass tasted very ordinary and the sky high price tag went to the showy ‘performance’ by the chef. Restaurant was too dim and had a funky smell.

The staff are very friendly and the food is also tasty. The portion is surprisingly big and we ate till our hearts content.

Staff very helpful and polite. Atmosphere is chill with soft music. Food serve just in the right timing.  Of cause the price is not cheap. But it worth the price overall.

Lastly thanks for the birthday cake. Love it but we were too full to finish it.

Booked Sunday afternoon to have their set lunch, only to find out they only serve buffet that day at $78++ per person. Opted in anyway and didn't regret it, given the fresh ingredients, great taste of Italian and friendly staffs! Personally I love the dessert section especially Panna Cotta! If I had to pick on something, it'd be the dim lighting. No discount on the bill even with Shangri-la Circle membership, but you do get extra points.

Remember, when you get into the lobby, you are on 3F. You need to take an elevator to get down to 1F where the restaurant is.

The restaurant has decent ambience for a semi chic and comfortable dinning experience. The salt crusted fish is delicious and if you want to see some fire show. The winner for me is the crab pasta. Yum!

We celebrated our anniversary dinner here and it was a great decision! They generously presented us a complimentary cake, thank you for perfecting the night.
Among the dishes, we absolutely love the Porchetta. It was tender, yet crispy and flavourful, Highly recommended! While on the other side, we didn’t like the potato purée in the braised lamb leg dishes. It may have ruined the experience with that main dish. Despite that, this would not stop us from giving 5 stars because the other aspects (service/ambience) make up to it. A great dining place for celebrations.
Italian cuisine in Orchard.address: 22 Orange Grove Rd, Level One, Garden Wing, Singapore 258350
Italian cuisine in Orchard.name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
Enjoyed my dinner here. I liked watching the chef closely while he cooked my skewers. Everything was fresh and flavourful. I found I had too much meat .. wish I got some grilled veggies as well.

I also ordered a bowl of rice as a side.

Love the grilled food. This is their speciality. Came with my daughter to sit counter-side best way to enjoy. Ordered the various chicken parts. I like that the staff are attentive. Top up the drinks without being asked.

The staff here is very friendly and helpful. The food is quite good. The skewers are grilled in front of you. I gotta say the plating, by the way,  is very simple

Nice little Japanese restaurant with lots of Yakitori meals. The set lunch, Obento B, was value-for-money and has a wide variety of dishes. Recommended.

Great place for after work drink and food. The yakitori is cooked upon ordering.  I saw a review that the garlic fried rice was a must try, it did not disappoint.
Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.address: 133 New Bridge Rd, #02-40 Chinatown Point, Singapore 059413
Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.name: Nanbantei Japanese Restaurant (Chinatown Point)

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
Had lunch yesterday at the Chinatown Point outlet. It has the toughest pork belly dish I have ever ever eaten in a Japanese eatery. Chewed a piece of it for a few minutes and still not broken up. Give up.... need to cut into very small pieces to swallow whole earlier. Good exercise for the jaws though.

Stay away from the iberico yuzu koshio yaki. The pork belly is just too tough. I had many meals there. Their butadon pork bowls are generally OK. Good value for the taste and price, but this was the worst meal i had so far.

Super yummy and service was great. We changed our order after submitting and the service staff helped us change it manually!!! Really grateful. There's also a promo for this signature loin set (in the picture) for GSS! Its my 2nd time here and won't be the last ;)

i love katsu curries and the ones here don’t disappoint. the freshly fried cutlets are tender and juicy, and the curry is a nice balance of spicy and sweet! recommended for a comfort meal

Came during weekday lunch. Not very crowded, managed to get seats for 5 with 0 waiting time. Ordered their cheeses pork cutlet which taste awesome! Pork skin is crispy and meat is very tender. Set comes with soup and mixed vege. Price is $17++ so after GST and Service charge is about $22

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.name: Gochi-So Shokudo Japanese Restaurant ごち惣食堂 @ Chinatown Point

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
Not the usual Japanese food as they are very strong and heavy in seasoning. Most of the dishes are tasty, but a bit on the salty side. Services are excellent and prices are slightly on the medium high end. Appreciate their complimentary birthday ice cream and also farewell sorbet for every guest.
Space is a bit tight and got a table of ladies that was virtually talking in a shouting volume that made our visit quite a displeasure one.

Best dish - charred Brussels sprout and sautéed mushroom

Had a great time here. Food was great and unique. We had the burnt butter prawns, lobster croquette and charcoal chicken. Would reorder the first and last for sure.

Service was fantastic - best service I’ve had in a long while. On my way out after the meal, I mentioned it was my birthday and Joan, the kind waitress, made me come back to the table to serve me really good ice cream with a candle and sake. Really sweet of them.

We had the set for 2 (Wagu Sirloin version) and added on pork jowl and sashimi platter $39. We paired our meal with Akai Umeshu and Earl Grey Sake. The eggplant and edame was ok, the foie gras chawamushi was rich and delightful and the wagyu and pork was perfect 10/10. The skewers were alright except for the chicken piece which was a tad too hard and mainly bones. The truffle caviar noodle was aromatic but we felt the caviar was abit too much and truffle abit overpowering for us. The complimentary birthday hojicha dessert and yuzu sorbet was on point. Service was warm and prompt when i feedback on preference for lower chair and the aircon. I spent almost $270+ for 2 pax for a very filling and overall satisfying meal. Highly recommend and would definitely return again.

Simply amazing food.. we had 9-10 dishes and there is not a single one that we concluded as "so-so" .. Every dish was so tasty and different! I can't even tell you what's the highlight because they were just so good..

Probably the most memorable was the prawn cos we were all wanting extra serving of bread to soak up the sauce . It was full of flavor~

Suggest to try their sets if u are unsure..

Lastly, don't drive there as its in those alley on Chinatown.. parking is good Ng to be difficult.. it's only a few mins walk from China town MRT.. very accessible

The bar was full on a Thursday night.

The service was warm & friendly, and they constantly checked in for orders, or ensure that our sake glasses were full.

The menu was extensive for a small restaurant. We mostly had skewers last night - loved the off menu Wagyu skewers, miso butabara, and my fave yuzu infused tsukune ball. The other recommended dishes like Brussels sprouts & lobster croquette were unique as well. Will be back to try the other dishes next time!

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
This was dinner in Chinatown Point.  We ordered the Teppanyaki beef set and a pork cutlet.

Taste wise,  it was okay. We hv had better ones, but this was alright.  The set came with the beans,  soup,  rice and some pickled veg.

The pork tonkatsu was rather mediocre.  The crust was over done.

However, the price is not too expensive.  Quite affordable and will surely fill you up.

Ambience is quite nice with great lighting.  Service was also alright.

Overall,  but too bad.

My favourite ramen place in Singapore - excellent choice of ramens at a very reasonable price and great flavours.

Came here on a weekday evening, and the place was half-full.

We ordered the following -

1) Premium Kiwami Tonkotsu Ramen - Nice robust broth of ramen that comes with toroniku cha-shu (tender roast pork cheek) and Okinawa ramen egg. Meat was so tender.

2) Hokkaido Oyster Fry - Tender oysters baked that are so cripsy. The sauce pairing is on-point.

3) Cheese Teppan Fondue Gyoza - Grilled Gyozas on a bed of fondue cheeze. This was a really good combination. Gyozas were packed with flavour.

4) Hokkaido Snow Crab Fried Rice on Tonkotsu Gravy - Silky smooth tonkotsu gravy that is served with snow crab fried rice. A little bland, but quite tasteful.

5) Kiwami Freezer

DIsappointed by this restaurant that is in my point of view over rated.

The food was good but not exceptional.

The service was not good and we food bad to be interrupted during the dinner and be asked to go to the cashier to pay.

Visited during off-peak for dinner. Wait staff were friendly n attentive.

Food is well-prepared. Beef is tender n juicy. Marinade n seasonings aren't too overpowering.. Tomato cheese gyoza is an interesting combi. Teppanyaki set meal is value for money. Will return for more!

Only complaint, d air-conditioning is a little on d warmer side.

Food was lovely and tasty but staff were just a little shorthanded at times and it was just a bit hard to get their attention.

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
Average price of $5-$6 for Japanese cuisine located in Chinatown, probably the most value for money meal you can find. I’ve been supporting their business for at least 5 years, the boss/chef is very friendly, always serve the customer with a big smile. The quality of the food is good, love their tempura dishes. The only thing I don’t really recommend is their red miso, but it’s subjective to personal preference, the sauce taste like Chee Chong fan’s sauce. Other than that, I really can’t find a reason not to dine here.

Amazing Curry Pork Katsu Rice Set (SGD6.5)

Freshly fried crispy pork katsu, sliced into thin enough slices for both the young and elderly.

Generous amounts of carrot and potato inside the curry with the typical delicious Japanese curry taste you are looking for 🍛

The kind owner even reminded me to not touch the hawker centre provided trays as they may be not the cleanest. Very quick wait today ☺️

It is the best japanese cuisine I have ever tried ! The couple serving you is super nice and will remember you if you come back. They want you to enjoy their meal and you feel it. I am absolutely fond of this restaurant and I strongly recommand this place for everyone who goes to the Chinatown Complex to try it !!
(My favourite plate is number 30, thé don set, but all the dishes are awesome)

I'm surprised that such good Japanese stall is there. My family and I ordered Katsu curry, Teriyaki chicken and Karaage sets. All of them are carefully cooked and very nice. Quality of rice and miso soup as well. Price is affordable too! I will definitely come back.

Really affordable Japanese food at Smith Street Hawker Centre.

Went during dinner time and it wasn’t crowded. The stall did server the dish to my table as well. Though it’s gets very crowded during lunch time.

Ordered the Katsu Teriyaki Set with comes with rice and soup. May not be restaurant standard but it’s really value for money.
Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.name: Kazan Japanese Cuisine

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
🍣 Food & Taste: The food all tasted good compared to the outlet at NEX. Adequate amount of sauce on everything. Felt satisfied after the meal.

📍 Place: The place does not seem crowded on a weekday afternoon. It is located in the basement of Chinatown Point mall. Very quiet.

🤵🏻 Service: Not bad. The staff acceded to our request to sit at the more spacious table.

💰 Price: Standard

🐣Waiting Time: Reasonable. Was not very long since time is still needed for food to be prepared.

However, the dessert took awhile.

The last time I was at a Genki we had to press a button to send the train back. Here the trains go back themselves. Food is not bad. The minimal service was also friendly - someone told us about the day’s special offer. Price wise it is the same as Sushiro but there’s more variety in terms of rice bowls and noodles.

My favourite branch. The staff are always friendly and patient even when it is crowded and busy. A female server patiently helped an elderly man who didn’t know how to order using QR code. During peak hours there is some wait time but it is understandable.

The salmon felt still frozen and not properly thawed but otherwise the food was decent and value for money.

As usual I will remind that the 5 star rating is given within the expectations of a fast casual sushi place. Expectations are not the same as  a 3 Michelin star restaurant. That said, the food, service, and atmosphere were all comfortable. There is a dining time limit of 60 or 90 mins (I can't remember), and they don't take reservations but beyond that there are no problems. The staff at the Chinatown point branch are lovely and very helpful.

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
I loved the vibes of the place - clean and calm. Came by during lunch and had the lunch set, the seafood is fresh. First time I truly enjoyed swordfish, tuna and scallops! It was definitely a good experience. I look forward coming again.

One of the disappointing omakase experience I’ve had. Food is not great, staff is not knowledgeable and reservation got bumped.

One of the omakase experience is having the staff explain to you every dish that you’re eating and what order to eat them. 50% of the meal, the staff didn’t even say a word and just told us to eat in any order you like.

Food didn’t feel expensive even though we went for the top range.

3 stars because it’s a small and quiet place. Nice ambience for a get together. Come but don’t come for the food and service.

The food was just ok for the price you pay. Tempura set is at $30. But they serve ice cream which gives a bit more score but overall, taste is just ok.

The service was bad though. The servant asked us to leave even if we were yet to finish our meal.

A wonderful little place in town that seats 16. Marukyu serves up with a rather good Japanese Omakase selection, making them stand out from the bevy of Korean BBQ shops spattered across the area. Great attentive service from their wait staff. Checking frequently to make sure our cups are filled and promptly clearing away emptied dishes. Will help speed things along if the staff were familiar with their own menu. Thankfully their super friendly head chef was moving around the front of house to make recommendation of the seasonal catches as well as his yummy specials. Food coming out from the kitchen was beautifully plated up, a feast for the eyes. Did not disappoint.

A traditional Japanese restaurant with lots of sashimi in their menu. Lunch set prices is very reasonable and most of the sets includes sashimi. Wanted to order noodles they have none when we were there. Ordered some set lunch to try also some sushi. The taste is at most “acceptable” but sashimi is fresh. Server is really going through the motion didn’t feel right to dine at such environment. The place is rather small but clean. If you are only looking for a place to fill your stomach you can consider coming.

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
The food is surprisingly good. The portion is overwhelming for its price, it can actually feed more than two people. The service is great, too. Sebastian, the manager, is very accommodating and approachable.

Very nice. Big serving. Reasonable price. Recommended when you are craving Japanese curry dishes. Good service too

Overall good, but poor service from a singular staff.

We had a mixed experience at this outlet. The food was decent, but the service was uneven. Our waitress, [didn't catch her name but she tied her hair up, wore specs, and wore a red uniform] was very polite and attentive. She displayed great service and was efficient.

However, another server, [Sebastian/Cebestian?] was relatively rude and unhelpful. He wore a black uniform and had a black face mask. When we asked about store policy & promotion items, he seemed annoyed by our questions. He also appeared to be not well service trained to answer such questions, as he could not give proper and polite answers to paying customers. He also spoke unclearly to customers. He displayed a poor attitude and was condescending to the patrons. Hope that management can consider training him more.

We were very disappointed with the service from him. His rudeness and lack of knowledge made our dining experience unpleasant. He also gave his staff member the wrong form for patrons to look at when they're signing up for the 8-minute challenge.

However, we would like to commend the lady waitress, for her excellent service. She was a pleasure to deal with and made our experience much better. The food was great as well.

Good service from the service staffs, polite and friendly. Foods were serve fast and hot. Taste is good. Comparing to Novena and Bugis Junction outlets, here in Chinatown Point is better in terms of services and food quality.

The chicken taste better than the pork i feel, cause the pork taste harder but the curry is so on point and the service here is amazing.
Must try the salmon bites, recommended!!

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
Very nice Omakase lunch in Mitsu. I can taste the freshness of ingredients and seasoning of dishes is spot on. Chef is very attentive and will adjust placement of sushi depending if you are right or left handed. Pace of the Omakase meal is just right and does not feel rush. Highly recommended place to have a decent Japanese meal.

In love with the zen vibes of the restaurant! They have a tatami room as well but didn’t manage to book as we just came for lunch. Prob need to have a min spending in order to book the tatami room! The whole restaurant ambience is really fantastic that makes me felt like in Kyoto haha! The lunch executive set is at a reasonable price from $20 onwards! Recommend to come lunch as the price is cheaper than dinner , same set but the price is slightly expensive for dinner. Overall, the food is delicious and the sashimi is fresh too !

Chanced upon this place and was pleasantly surprised. Food was very good. Sashimi and sushi was fresh. Enjoyed a peaceful environment as we were lucky that it was not too crowded. Staff was very patient and nice. Definitely coming back for more!

📍Mitsu Sushi Bar @ 21 Duxton Road

Flavor: 9/10: ❤️❤️❤️❤️🤍
Ambience: 10/10: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Service: 10/10: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

Mitsu Sushi Bar is a two-storey sushi bar located at 21 Duxton Road that specializes in a variety of Japanese food and beverages. Passionate about delivering high quality Japanese cuisine, Mitsu Sushi Bar ships in fresh seafood and produce in small batches five times a week from two of Japan’s most well-known markets, Kyushu and Hokkaido. This ensures optimum freshness and the best selection of fish for all of you Japanese cuisine lovers out there!

During my visit, I ordered the S$38.00 Wagyu Steak Set from their Dinner Set Menu, which consists of Wagyu Beef Steak, Sashimi, Steamed Egg Custard, Pickles, Miso Soup, Rice, and Salad. I also had the opportunity to try their S$26.00 Dragon Maki, which consists of a spicy soft shell crab cut roll with crispy crab stick.

In my most honest opinion, the Wagyu Steak Set at Mitsu Sushi Bar is an absolute killer. You simply must try it. The close to melt-in-your-mouth juiciness of the Wagyu Beef will turn most of you beef haters out there into a beef lover, while leaving any fan of Japanese Wagyu Beef feeling satisfied. For the price that you are paying, the portion size of the Wagyu Steak was unbelievably generous.

For a lack of a better description, the salad was the true black horse of this dining experience. When I took my first mouthful of the salad, I was truly caught off guard with how well-prepared and delicious it was. The tastiness didn’t overshadow the Wagyu Beef but serve this in any salad store and I guarantee you it will do tremendously well on its own as the star of the show. Just try it. You will know what I mean when you visit and taste one for yourself.

Unfortunately, the Dragon Maki felt quite lacklustre as compared to the Wagyu Beef Set. Perhaps this just simply shows how good the Wagyu Beef Set was, but the flavour profile of the maki was very flat even with the ikura, and I could hardly taste any spiciness on the rolls.

I personally love their business executive set lunch which has everything packed nicely in bite size. Easy to eat (and talk) and easy to try alot of stuff together. Their sushis are really good. A nice place to meet and gather if you can get the tatami room. Will come back and try again!
Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.name: Mitsu Sushi Bar

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
We tried the food for few times before our event and the food is delicious. The famous chef, Angus (also the staff) is friendly to help us. We hold an event here, our guests like the food and Japanese highballs. :) thanks

Love this new japanese bar right in the middle of chinatown. All the food are so delicious! The drinks are very affordable and the GIN drinks are the best ever.

A small shop with beautiful ambiance makes it an ideal place to dine with friends. Affordable and delicious Japanese cuisine, especially the Unagi don, it's just $16.
The food we order
1) Unagi Don ★★★★★
I am a Unagi lover, and unagi needs special preparation. They're grilled and basted with a sweet sauce, and served with eggs and preserved garlic. (OMG...is so yummy)
2) Chicken Don ★★★★☆
My boyfriend had this, and he like it.
3) Fried Oyster ★★★★★
My boyfriend had this too, he loves this, so we order another place of this. Its very fresh.
Basically, the food over here is above average. Its worth to try and definitely will come back again.

This staff there is so nice and polite and accommodating. Their oysters are super thick and juicy and worth the money. I would highly recommend this place.

Must try! Good place for food, drinks and chilling. Highly recommended

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
Crowded place most of the time.  Fast service friendly service.  Couple interesting dish I haven't seen on regular Japanese menu to try like smoked cheese.  Good selection of Sake.  Been here a couple times and enjoyed each time.

Skipped the alcohol and was still blown away by the quality of food here. Their prices are extremely reasonable and their dishes comprise of very fresh produce. Can’t got wrong with sashimi and their hot soups are comforting for rainy days. It’s a great place to unwind after work or for celebrations, or if you simply want to indulge in good izakaya fare.

Do not that they don’t really accommodate children under 12.

I've been to this restaurant a few times.
Food is always delicious!
There's a good variety of Sashimi, Sushi and other cooked food.
I personally love that the restaurant offers isakaya.
Chicken heart & gizzard are my favourite!
The restaurant offers a good selection of Sake.
The service staff are also friendly and helpful.
A good Japanese restaurant to hang out with friends. I will recommend this Japanese restaurant if you like to impress your guests/ friends from overseas.
Do make advance reservation for weekend.

Been a regular patron for a while, absolutely mind-blowing delicious food. Authentic Japanese atmosphere, ingredients are super fresh.

Can't recommend this place enough, I've already referred all my friends here and they all love it!

Picture is their chicken nanban don, my all time favorite!

Quality seafood and sashimi! Came back second time for the sashimi as i remembered that it was so fresh. Ehire and kani miso is a must-have here. Tried the pork skewers and was blown away at how tasty and juicy it was. didn’t expect that from them as they seem to be specialising in seafood sashimi. Legit almost everything they have on the menu is fantastic. Can add up to quite a hefty cost but it’s worth every cent.
Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.name: Niningashi

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
We heard there might be long queue but we were lucky enough to get a seat without any queue on a Friday night. The Unagi was so so fresh and nicely grilled. Perhaps the best Unagi don in Singapore. Will come back definitely!

Small little restaurant tucked away from the busy road, where you have to access is from a inner yard.
We arrived about 1 hour before they close, so we didn't have to wait. Good for late night dinner.
The food was great and delicious.
The staff were also very friendly and kind.
Having to grate fresh wasabi was a nice experience.

Overall experience was not bad. Went in for a quick lunch with wife. Not much queue probably due to the light drizzle. Separate sauce for u to add if you like it on a sweeter note. Go for the bigger portion if you are a big eater. The place is tucked away at a corner.

Have been visiting Man Man the past few years whenever I get a craving for Unagi ☺️ their queue has since died down over the past few years and it is a lot easier to get a seat / walk in. They are famous for their Hitsumabushi set which offers you 3 different ways to eat the grilled eel with rice and additional condiments. The grilled eel is always tender yet crispy! Yesterday’s portion might have been a tad bit over grilled as it was quite dry / more crispy. Nonetheless still a good meal.
They also serve Japanese beer at $5 a pint (Japanese pint size).
You might want to try their tamago egg as well - it’s really good!

Service was surprisingly fast, and the food came within minutes of ordering. It almost felt as if they had prepared them in advance.
The unagi were well-seasoned. There weren't overpowering sauces being poured over and had a slight charred taste that elevated the flavour experience.
The ikura was fresh and generously served.
Also, I tried the unagi liver, which was quite a unique dish. There weren't any strong iron tastes normally associated with eating liver. It was really well prepared and slightly charred, which made it easy on the tongue.
However, it was slightly on the pricier as they used fresh live unagi. It's worth a try nonetheless.

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
This place truly provides you an authentic experience being in an izakaya place open by a Japanese owner. I love the freshness of the sashimi, fried burdock salad which was amazing. The staffs ensure you have each dish at the right temperature. I had the unagi which tasted meh as the quality of the eel wasn’t too great. There was another dish that did not meet my expectation, the cold tomatoes which was priced at SGD8. I thought it will be those lovely sweet Japanese tomatoes but what I got was the normal slices tomatoes which was overpriced. Overall was an ok meal for me.

Had very great dinner here. The food are delicious. We have ordered chicken cutlet rice, cold soba, sashimi don, prawn tempura and karage and it is juicy. Sadly they don’t have steam egg.

We ordered pork katsu don, saba miso, potato salad and karaage.

Katsu don is taste good but the pork is very hard. Not nice.

Saba miso is good.

Karaage taste and texture like reheated the day before cooked one. Not nice, a bit disappointed.

Salad is fresh and I like their potato salad. Taste good.

Overall, I don’t really recommend to go. I think I’m not coming back unless I really can’t find other place to eat. It’s not my Japanese food standard.

All restaurants along this road was so crowded, found there was an outdoor table available so we decided to try our luck.
Food quality was good. Japanese common izakaya dining.
It would be hot if you get the outdoor seats and a bit difficult to get staff’s notice.

Came here for lunch and the place was packed! The atmosphere is pretty lively and loud and great if you want to have a nice get together lunch with colleagues.
The menu is pretty wide in variety though I do wish we had more options for soba and udons.

I ordered the ねぎとろ丼 Minced Tuna Don bento for $23 and I suppose it’s expensive but for this area, it’s quite standard. Comes with soup and a small pickle salad.

Would probably come back again to try the other stuff next time.

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
Base on colleague recommendation, definitely worth time and $. Might be our future hangout place 😅
Food wise, all of us agreed it’s good for such wallet friendly pricing 😜 But 1 item that we all luv very much…. baguette with cream cheese 😍 next time each of us will have individual serving 😅

Update 24th Aug:
Another day with splendid foods 😍
Take note, restaurant getting more popular…. Long Que during peak lunch hours, so go early.

Have been going to katanashi an for lunch once every few months since I started working in Telok Ayer in 2017. The food is great and the price is so reasonable. Over the years, many eateries in Telok Ayer have increased their prices, but Katanashi An has kept their prices the same. My favourite to order from there is the Hokkaido set, the salmon ikura don, or the fried chicken. There are a few ways to eat it, with dry or pour the dashi to make dashi chazuke. The place is small so have to go make reservations or go early before the lunch crowd. It opens at 1130am on weekdays.

Good place for sake lovers. ideal for meeting up with friends and colleagues for drinks or meal. Good food, good selection of sake and affordable price. Operating from Monday to Saturday : 1130am - 1430pm and 5pm - 1030pm

1st time trying this Japanese tapas place. We ordered about 10 items in totally. What I like is the chicken Karaage, fried chicken wings, and pork stew. The rest of the food  are just ok for me. Overall for food, I give it a 3.5 stars. Staff are friendly and helpful, and the food are served pretty fast.

Love the how cosy the place is. The food was really good and worth the money paid. Every single dish impressed me truly, I’ll definitely be back here again and recommend others to come.

Saturday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM
Sunday: Closed
Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.name: Katanashi AN

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
Kei Hachi is one of my favourite Japanese restaurants helmed by local chefs whom some think don’t have the skills of Japanese chefs. Here both sushi chef Andy and head chef Simon prove that they’re definitely on par. Their combined food preparations, presentation and taste are definitely a notch or two higher than most. Price wise it’s reasonable too. Our dinner order of the mid Omakase is both delicious and fresh. Worth every dollar we paid.

My friend celebrated my birthday here for dinner omakase. we had the middle options  for 3 of us and there was only us in the whole night, hence, we had quite alot of interactions with the senior chef. the food are superb and fresh, the combo mix of the sushi are surpringly good. Have a great night there.

Great place to chill and enjoy the omakase. Small place but was the only one there on a friday afternoon. Everything was delish, but obviously, some are better than the rest.

Came here for a birthday lunch celebration. The sushi were fresh and very tasty. Prices were reasonable for the quality of sushi. Service from the waiters were good however the chefs were only engaging their regular customers and not new customers. Overall pretty good omakase.

Had the lunch omakase which was very good! Great service as well! Will be back to try the dinner omakase.

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
Quite like the set that I ordered. Would be nice if can come with a glass of water, too.

Came in the late noon… very diners… pretty quiet.

Hm…. Waited for quite a while before someone noticed me because another customer wants to pay the bill.

No frills lunch with different protein Dons to choose from with various pork/beef grades.

Fulfilling lunch set that comes with a salad and miso soup.

Would be back and food is decent enough. Service is through qr ordering so it’s a 3 stars while atmosphere is normal.

the chicken don taste average. the mentaiko loin don is the sellling dish and the one to go for. highly recommend ! overall i would give it a five star but for that slight high price i will give it a four star . but it is worth trying occasionally

Came to the Chinatown point outlet for lunch. They showed us to our table quickly, however it seems like the AC wasn’t working that day. Staff was attentive and shifted us to another table quickly.

Was craving ramen and surprised at how well the ramen is done despite it being a buta don place.

Pretty reasonable size and pricing considering the location.

However we felt thirsty after, may have too much msg

Food was great and the ambience of the restaurant was nice too. Overall very pleasant dining experience.

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.name: Aburi-EN (Chinatown Point)

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
We finished the food. Or rather tried to because we didn't want to be wasteful.

Salmon moriwase - ikura was bit sour, we barely touched it. Doesn't have the typical briny, flavour explosion. Probably not fresh. Salmon belly and salmon were ok.

Steak cubes - worse than kopitiam western, skip.

Chawanmushi - bland

Ramen - milky and light, no real broth flavour. Tastes like it was made from a packet.

The only saving grace were the stingray fin and kawa ebi but as you can imagine these are snacks to accompany alcohol.

I know Izakayas are meant to have subpar food usually as the focus is on drinks and snacks. But for the same money you could eat at another Izakaya with better dishes. Take your money somewhere else.

P.S: They did give us 10% off for JUST the salmon moriwase. It was kinda strange I don't know any other establishment that pulls out just one item to discount on and kept emphasizing our savings lol 😂

Decided to drop in for a dinner on weekday. Outdoor seating are reserved and hence was ushered to upstairs. Very authentic Japanese place.
Service was bad... Lady staff cant even pronounce the food.. And worse of all another male staff can to collect our empty plates without asking...i am startled!!
Food and drinks are reasonable priced.

Great service from the staff, super friendly and warm. The set lunch is great value as well. Conveniently located in Chinatown, this place is a gem. They have offers every day as well, from discounted sushi rolls to discounted chirashi bowls. Do look out for the day's specials.

Compliments to chef Li! Had dinner on Friday night and we liked the cosy ambience. Good quality food, reasonably priced, with great service by Jane! Really enjoyed everything and will definitely be back again ☺️

Was walking around scouting for food on the day of check-in to the hotel and noticed this stall! My favourite Japanese food! So the very next day, dropped by for lunch! Quite disappointed that they served our food with such a great separation apart. Food is decent however, even though their teriyaki chicken is nowhere near appealing to the unagi-don.

Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:30 PM

Sunday: Closed
Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.name: IKURA Japanese - Fook Hai

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
Absolutely enjoyed the mizukagami menu. Friendly and attentive service made me feel very comfortable as a solo diner. Maybe one of the best sushi restaurants in Singapore.  Keep up the good work!  See you next time!!

Poor food quality and service, won't be returning and will avoid as well. Got the 200 omakase meal and totally not worth the price. Freshness of fish is not there, uni doesn't taste fresh as well, nothing taste exceptional throughout the entire meal (as what u would expect when u are getting the more premium omakase set). The waitress shared that they have changed their menu one year ago probably that's explain the poor recent reviews, and have been in business for 10yrs.

Staff is poor in explaining the dish as well, and is not receptive with feedback. Feel disappointed and cheated at the end of the meal.

Ryo sushi, miyu located nearby are way much better with fresh and quality food.

Went for dinner and they only have omakase menu. It was awesome. I picked the $130 umi omakase.

The service was amazing. Since I was alone, the only people to chat with are the chef and waitress so they took their time to explain the dishes to me, how to eat them and pair them with the sauce, and they even teach me about their ingredients, where it comes from, how they cooked it and how they maintain their quality. Jeffrey was the sushi chef serving me and he was very patient. The supporting staff aka waitress were also very quick to react, to refill my drinks and to clean my table and clear my plate.

As I was sitting at the counter, The chef even noted what I preferred and served me slowly as I wanted to enjoy my food with pauses in between.

Overall, I loved the food, the people there, the ambience, the service and will definitely be back.

The variety is substantial and the quality is awesome too.

Underwhelming.  We’ve been to Mitsuya since its early days and enjoyed their omakase.  This recent visit the quality and selection of fish was below par for the expectation at this price point.  While the presentation is still top notch, there are  better options (especially in this area) at this that are worth patronizing.

Pictures don’t lie guys! There to celebrate my daughter’s birthday, so aside the awesome fanfare, chef Harada San also made a “sushi cake”, which is greatly appreciated!

Protein is fresh and marinated where it matters. And every bite is like a heaven sent. Will be back soon. Be warned, you need about a month plus to make any reservations!

Gem indeed!
Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.name: Sushi Mitsuya

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
love the atmosphere, and the food! especially the uni, so fresh and yummy! good for first dates. beef was also very juicy and delicious.

Came for restaurant week! Everything was quite good, specially the starters. The scallop and tuna tataki tasted really good. Had a bara chirashi bowl and my friends had the Wagyu bowl. The chirashi I thought can have more raw fishes. They were cut into too tiny pieces it’s hard to tell what I’m even eating.

Had dinner here. Everything was good till there are large group of people sitting behind us and we had difficulty talking to each other. The tables are too close. If you are around the area can give it a try their food quite good but abit expensive. Happy hour 6-7pm!

Cosy place located on the 2nd floor and felt a bit like a speakeasy. Went on a Thursday evening and it was fairly empty.

The crispy kurobuta pork was really good and came with pickled apple.
The Kani miso kourayaki was really rich and I loved it.
But the Bara chirashi don was disappointing. It was covered in a lot of sauce except for the uni which was on top and I couldn't really taste the seafood.

Also, the sake was served with some sort of wine glass instead of the usual sake glass. But maybe it's because of the bottle what I ordered.

But I loved the ambience and staff were attentive. If I go back, I'll try the cooked menu items instead.

Food and service was good!
The chirashi bowl was amazing - will try the beef bowl next.
Also had the pork (main on its own) and I went to heaven on my first bite. The fat and meat ratio was perfect & it just melts in your mouth. Was tempted to order another plate but we were stuffed by then.
Had the donut dessert and was surprised by how good it was! Definitely a good way to end the meal.
Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.name: Kabuke

Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.reviews:
When the restaurant was at its peak, service was a bit slow. Rated it 4 stars was cos despite its a Friday evening, the restaurant allowed us to stay on for our gathering without pushing us to make more orders. This is a hard to come by experience these days where the restaurant either limits the dining time or “pressure” you to make more orders.

Food was great too! Mostly of what we ordered was delicious! Especially mentai rosti, crab gratin and the pork jowl. Missed to take some of the photos cos was too hungry!

Atmosphere is a 3 largely cos it tends to get a bit too noisy that we had to shout on top of the noise in order to be heard. Haha but well, we are also contributors of that atmosphere then. Otherwise, all good for an Izakaya.

The food was tasty and you know they use fresh oil to fry their fried item dishes. There was no “jelat” taste and the karaage and tempura tasted light and crispy. Another dish I liked was the fishcake stuffed with cheese (forgot the actual name), but I wished there was more cheese pumped within! However, ratings lowered for service as the beers/drinks took forever to be served. Overall the tasty food validates a return.

Had a delightful experience here. The atmosphere was casual with authentic Japanese decor. The standout for me was the mentaiko crab, which was creamy and flavorful.

Service was attentive and friendly, adding to the overall excellent dining experience. Highly recommended for anyone craving genuine Japanese cuisine.

A great option for tasty and authentic Japanese fare with hard-to-find dishes available on their menu! Particularly enjoyed the negitoro don here – it had a great mix of lean and fatty tuna, was seasoned well and had great texture. Loved the mentaiko salmon sushi and the mentaiko crab gratin as well! Service was very prompt as well, was shown to our tables and served food very quickly.

Great atmosphere and the staffs were prompt and efficient in serving us food. Food served was tasty as well. Ordered the chicken bites, guy don, river prawns, chicken meatballs and garlic fried rice. Didn’t expect the river prawns to be so small but they were deep fried and crunchy. Loved it more than I expected.

My favourite was the big and crispy chicken bites
Japanese restaurants in Chinatown.name: Shukuu Japanese Izakaya and Bar

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.reviews:
I have ordered sweet beef with vegetables and rice in total for a price of 16.50 SGD. The dish was honestly incredebly delicious due to very well cooked beef and rice as well as its tasty sweet sauce. The atmosphere was alright for a normal lunch/dinner, although I would say the main disadvantage of the place is that the indoor area have no closed doors and no air conditioning, hence, all sitting areas are fully outdoors which made my experience slightly uncomfortable, as I am someone who prefers to eat food in chilly environments with air conditioning. The service was decent and the food was cooked in a timely manner. Overall, I am quite satisfied with the place and would recommend anyone interested to try out Thai food in Singapore. I will definitely come back again.

I don't usually eat Thai food but I have to rate this one highly. One of the best Thai food places I've been to. As I don't usually take spice very well, I ordered less spice for everything. Everything we ordered came shortly even though the restaurant was packed. Lastly, the dessert was also amazing.

Great pricing, and yummy! No service charge just 8% tax. The papaya salad was fresh, and enjoyed the pad thai and minced pork basil 👍👍 Thai ice tea was refreshing too!

Cooking of the food is good but the ingredients are not fresh, frozen chicken prawn pork really spoilt the taste. Grilled pork neck not even well grilled and got the smelly aftertaste, disappointing

It's a little bit pricey but the food is good. Tom Yum fried rice is quite spicy but if you like Tom Yum, this one is a must-try. Stir-fry Kalan with roasted pork is one of my favourite Thai dishes. Overall the food here is authentic and they have many choices. Better come with a group so you can try more dishes.
Thai food in Tiong Bahru.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:30 PM
Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:30 PM

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.name: Little Elephant SG

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.reviews:
Drinks are overly sweet.
Lunch sets are from $8.9, which include a main and a drink.

Clear tomyam soup with noodles. Taste is 6.5/10
Green curry is also quite good here.

Would rate 2 star for their food as I don’t think they are maintaining their standard.

Love the seafood glass noodles and kangkong. Very appetizing and the spiciness was just nice.
The steak, a bit too hard to chew, but it’s still value for money. The lemon grass and ice milk tea drink was nice too. Mango sticky rice is a bit disappointing..

My intention was to eat Thai food, ended up eating western food instead. Ordered half spring chicken and jumbo fish and chips. Took around 25 minutes to arrive. I enjoyed the fish especially the tartar sauce, great with the fish and also the chips. The garden salad was not available and replaced with coleslaw which I preferred.

Not much crowded at my visit for dinner. Crowd quite building after but still have seats left.

very good food and even better service. definitely will be back ! everyone was very polite in greeting u when u enter or exit the place, in serving food or replying when u thank them, and very prompt to service when called. food served relatively fast! really enjoy the service here, sharing plates given without asking!! sticky rice cld b more flavourful i felt but the mango was nice and sweet. fish is definitely a must try, sauce really packed a punch n tasted like clear tomyum. spicy, very tangy and appetising. fried rice can be passed. spring rolls are nice and crispy, basic side dish. vermicelli is a must try. very flavourful and bouncy well cooked noodles. loved everything about the meal!

a bit pricey but the foods real good, however, honestly could work on their customer service because the staff do seem quite cold not to mention that they have service fees
Thai food in Tiong Bahru.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:30 AM – 9:30 PM
Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 9:30 PM

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.name: Sakon Thai

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.reviews:
Dinner Dine in opens at 5.30pm but there’s already a queue at 5.15pm.

Nice Thai food at affordable price.
Deducting one star cause the food is leaning on a saltier taste. Overall it’s flavour is good!

Fish maw soup with quail eggs: 5/5
Thai basil chicken rice w egg (no spicy) : 5/5
I love the fact that they added long beans and onions to give different layers of crunch and flavour to it! And they accommodate to my request for non-spicy a spicy rice.

Great place for families. For those dining I. Big groups I recommend you make reservations first if you want to sit indoor with air con.

Soo 47 is a casual Thai Street food style restaurant that offers robust Thai cooked food at reasonable prices. Don’t expect the original Thai food taste as fish sauce is missing or at much lower levels in several Thai classic dishes like Pad Thai, perhaps in response to a healthier lifestyle or just a preference of consumers these days. I do miss the heavy the “savory kick” from Nam Pla and Thai condiments. However the dishes are still delicious and I recommend the egg 🥚 dishes, prawn 🦐 cakes and Thai simmered fish 🐟 (add in fish sauce if you like). Service is good and prices are considered reasonable in pricey Singapore.

Operations seems to be a bit unstable. Staff were rushing and appear to be quite chaotic.

The food was decent, and the fish was on point. Will order again when I am back. If you love fluffy omelette, this is the right place. Beansprouts with salted fish was underwhelming, can't seem to bite into any salted fish.

Overall, still a good experience. Hopefully less chaotic.

The dishes are small and you can order a variety of it. Prices are reasonable. We like the steam fish in lime juice. Tom yum clear soup is good too.

Came on a Friday night, had to wait 5-10min for a table.
The steamed seabass was delicious. Highly recommended, the soup of the fish is very tasty as well. The salad was great as well, nice starter.
The staff were friendly and came with our orders relatively quick. The vibe is fine.
Thai food in Tiong Bahru.name: Soi 47 Thai Food

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.reviews:
Delicious Thai food along Havelock Road. Great tasty dishes which arrived so promptly upon ordering. Must try their Tom yum seafood which was spicy and tangy, cashew nut chicken and stir fried kailan with mushroom. Will definitely be back to try others 😁

Really authentic, delicious, quick and no fuss Thai restaurant. It was almost a full house on a Tuesday evening for dinner which is a good sign. Enjoyed majority of the dishes. Just found the onion omelette too oily so would not order next time but noodles, stir fries, papaya salad and veggies all excellent.

Nice decent Thai food, decent pricing as well. Fried egg with minced meat is nice. Service staffs are friendly and environment are kept clean and neat. Parking available at nearby multi storey carpark.

Food is ok, some dishes are nice while some are so so. The egg oyster omelette, coffee pork ribs are quite nice. However it’s an affordable and family dining place.

The food is superb, chef is Thailand so the food is the original Thailand taste, make me feel I am eating at Thailand. The red tomyum soup is the must order food when you are here. Others food is tasty too. The important thing is the price is standard price which is value for money
Thai food in Tiong Bahru.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.name: Kin Ba Ba Thai Food

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.reviews:
While I enjoyed the food for the most part, I found the ordering system a bit wasteful. The stall requires customers to write down their order number on a piece of paper and pass it to the staff, who will only take the order if it's presented on the paper. While I understand that this system can be helpful during peak periods, it seems unnecessary when there are only a few customers.

That being said, the food was quite good. I tried the tom yum soup, olive fried rice, and pad Thai. The tom yum soup was generous in its ingredients and tasted decent. The pad they had a good flavour and wasn't dry. The olive fried rice was okay. While the prices were a bit expensive for a hawker stall, I understand that in this economy, the prices are reasonable. Overall, it was a decent experience.

Solid Thai food store at the corner of Tiong Bahru market. Tom yum soup with so much seafood is only 6.5 (whaaat!) but a bit watery. Green curry is the best in my opinion

Had the garlic chicken and the serving was generous. The garlic has no bitterness so kids should find it acceptable but it lacks the strong garlicky flavour. $6.50 for the dish, add 50c for rice. The portion of chicken is like what you would expect in tze char for small or medium. I will come back and try the other dishes.

Yummy Thai fried kway teow and green curry. Lots of healthy vegetables

This is one hawker stall tucked right in one of the corner of Tiong Bahru Market. It's just located beside the famous Jian Bo Chwee Kueh stall. The decor of the stall is very interesting. After lunch hour, while most of the stalls are either closing or their food items are sold out, this is one of the stall that still served proper meal. I ordered their Phad Thai. I was really happy when they dished out the phad Thai serving on a piping hot ceramic plate which not many hawkers have ceramic cutleries now. Food is nice and the serving is generous, for the price of $5.50.
Thai food in Tiong Bahru.opening_hours:
Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM
Tuesday: 12:00 – 8:30 PM, 9:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Wednesday: 12:00 AM – 9:00 PM

Sunday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM
Thai food in Tiong Bahru.name: Muen Wang Thai Kitchen

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.reviews:
The gem is located in a residential area in the heartland. Thai food with a real authentic taste run by a Thai guy (one-man show). We ordered Basil Chicken, Tom Yum Clear Soup + Rice, and Pad Thai (Chicken & Seafood). Unfortunately, I forgot to submit photos as the food smelt so delicious and we were eager to eat. I thought all the items we ordered were excellent and tasted great.  Definitely thumbs up! It's definitely worth a try but don't expect a long menu.

great Thai food and fantastic value for money. omelette, steamed fish, kai lan and basil pork were all excellent.
Expect longer waits at peak meal times as the stall is helmed by one gentleman by himself - major respect

New Thai Food stall in this neighbourhood. Generally the food is good, most are quite authentic Thai style. Exception would be the Tomyum soup was not spicy or sour enough as it seem to be mellowed down in taste to more sweetness. Steam Seabass was excellent.

I stay nearby and always pass by this stall. Today I give it a try and never regret. I ordered basil chicken rice. It tastes delicious! The portion is big and price is cheap ($5.50).

Definitely will try other dishes next time!

saw queue and thai peep also ordering so order basil pork and fried kailan. Taste good, for very long time i didnt taste basil pork with fats in it, spicy too. The fried kailan superb - just nice of seasoning, good crunch and it is thin type. good variety of thai food available, option and reasonable price.
Thai food in Tiong Bahru.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM
Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM
Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM

Saturday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.name: Somboon Thai Cuisine

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.reviews:
Nice Thai food. I liked the pasta too. Reasonably priced. Great place to catch up with friends.

Wasn't crowded during a Saturday evening dinner. Order the Carnivore hotpot. Very delicious tom yum soup base. The pork and beef strips were very good. Portion was very generous for 2 person. We ordered an additional stir fried mixed vegetables. The Thai milk tea was slightly diluted, but still decent.

Would recommend the hotpot. We will definitely be back again when we have craving for Thai food!

Stepping into the place reminds me of the streets of bangkok and their bustling night life.

We had the Tom Yum Hotpot and Lava Omelette Rice with Crispy pork belly. The food is very well flavored, really good and servings are generous. Great place to gather with friends and family. We’ll be back again!

Nice Thai food place. Had their meaty Tom Yum MaMa hotpot. Good for sharing and it was super creamy (kao) with a good kick!!!
Thai ice tea n lemon grass was also soothing.
Also great to hear they can top up the hotpot soup but we did not have to.
Love the Thai music ballads in the back ground.
Kudos to the service crew who singlehandedly served us. Took a while to serve our orders but it was fine.
Lava omelette was good too.
On the pricy side but great for sharing.
Will be back.

We had Crispy Pork & Garlic Lava Omellete on Rice, Seafood Tomyam Hotpot, and Grilled Pork Skewers. The crispy pork really superb! Good combination with omellete.

The restaurant is very vibrant and funky. Good place for authentic Thai food
Thai food in Tiong Bahru.opening_hours:
Monday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM
Tuesday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM
Wednesday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM
Thursday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM
Friday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM
Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Thai food in Tiong Bahru.name: Tongue Thai’d

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.reviews:
The Thai style steamed fish is fabulous! The Sea bass is fresh, the soup is tangy coupled with spiciness blended well. The fried Tang hoon and Kang Kong were good too. Overall was very good.

Our whole group of people finished all the food ! Very authentic Thai food in singapore 👍🏻 must try out if you are Thai food lover . Cooked and prepared by Thai Chef ! No gst no service charge is a + point 👏

Nice atmosphere and great deco to dine in, authentic tasty Thai food and food prices are very reasonable with no GST and service charge. Most of the service staff and chef are very friendly and are Thais but understand simple English or even Mandarin. Highly recommend if you are in the area.

The glass noddle is sweet based and it’s good. Not so oily. The seafood are fresh. Compare with Phad Thai, will recommend glass noodle.
The steam fishes is a whole complete piece and it’s very fresh. The spices and lime goes very well with the fish. The soup is clear and taste. With initially the sweet layer, then a little sour layer, followed by the spiciness.
The mango sticky rice is amazing. The glutinous rice is not over cooked. It’s just nice that chewy yet not so soft. The mango is fresh and a little sour, one of the best ever tried.

Very tasty authentic Thai food.
A place to go to for Thai food buddies..
Easy parking behind or opp at multistorey car park..
Must try.
Hospitalible boss and staff.
The lunch menu is good for group lunch.
Dinner can come after 6 30pm.
Reserve yr table...
Thai food in Tiong Bahru.name: Thai Ha Kitchen

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.reviews:
This stall is located within the popular havelock road hawker center. Good location as there are ample parking space and most of the stalls are close with many tables available. Overall it’s still a decent mookata, not enough for the 4 star rating but good enough to give it a try. Chili, fresh meat are pretty average and the rest mostly consist of frozen food.

One of the best Thai mookata places. Love the lamb option alot. Their pork belly original and black pepper is very good too! Came here a couple of times alr and the lamb and pork belly are the regular dishes that I order! Definitely worth a try.

BBQ buffet is the main highlight of this new restaurant near by the lake. 59 dollar for 2 people for food. The only restriction is for items priced 4 dollar and above. Rest all items in the menu including ice cream is unlimited. The quantity and quality of the meat is great. The meat or what ever we use for the bbq provided are very fresh and so it’s very tasty as well. The bbq stove is a gas stove and so the time to prepare the bbq is very less. It’s more of a instant food rather than traditional bbq. The staffs here are so friendly and very attentive. Two things which are the base of this bbq is the quality and taste of the sauce they provide and the base liquid or soup provided to boil in the bbq pit. It can be a good place for any kind of people like couples or even family. A very well recommended place.

Came here for dinner because we were craving for Thai mookata for dinner. Food are reasonably priced at range of 2-5 dollars per plate depending on what you order. In total two of us spent around 38 dollars.

Downside: Meat quality is definitely those which are not high quality. Don’t expect much for the price point.

Mookata lovers... must come and try. So much variety for chilli. Meat so fresh n seasoning so good. Price is so affordable and reasonable. Even if you are first time eating mookata, this place is never a mistake. I'm a satisfied customer and will return again for more.

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.reviews:
Waited 20 mins for food to arrive was acceptable (peak dinner hour now)

Saw members of the staff singing birthday song for customer celebrating birthday.

Fish & Chips is good. Worth it for the price.

It’s a pity that they do not sell coffee. I bought in coffee from Paik opposite. Staff did not say anything about it. Lucky us.

I will keep the remainder 1 star till I have tried the Thai food. $22.90 for the steam fish sounds value for money

Ordered a Chicken Mushroom Baked Rice. End product came out to be egg fried rice with popcorn chicken and cheese. No cream sauce at all. Not baked either. This is the first time in my life eating a chicken baked rice in a restaurant with no white sauce. Asked the staff and yeah they said it is like that. At least the fries came out right. Paid $12 for all this. Western food got no standard.

Totally unacceptable! After ordering my food, i waited 15mins and then the staff said the food is not available. Rubbish service. Not worth paying for it.

Called so many times at the restaurant to make reservations from 11am till 2pm no one picking up the phone..this is very bad reputations for the restaurant outlet

Food is alright but customer service is really bad!!

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.name: Chargrill Western

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.reviews:
This is a very reasonably priced Thai hidden gem. We ordered the drunken noodles as we saw that it was highly raved, and be warned that it is flavourful but very very spicy, even for someone like me who can usually take spicy food (so pls ask for less spicy if you can’t take spicy food). The pork basil rice was a steal at $6.90. Chicken wings were juicy, and the steamed tapioca was delicious! Overall the quality of the food is good for the price point. Worth a visit!

Thai Kha is by far the best Thai restaurant in Singapore! Consistent quality & taste of food and great service will convince you to return. Having ordered in the first time during the pandemic, this is my go to place when it comes to Thai cuisine. Order online or visit their restaurant, a beautiful and well maintained space. 😊🫶🏻

Went for dinner on a weekday, very quiet. Ordered through QR and food cooked fresh, but contrary to great reviews, our food was so so. Truly not bad. Drunken noodles was still a bit wet, but tasty enough but lacking oomph. Boat noodles not bad. Egg not crispy enough but tasty. Portion quite large. Spent 37.20 sgd for these 3. A viable option if around the area. Vegetarian options available for most dishes.

Casual place with good food. Tried the drunken noodle, prawns, fried rice and morning glory - liked the spicy kick but prawns were ok. Good food with reasonable price - would come back for casual lunch if nearby!

Visited Thai Kha at Havelock 2 (#01-01/48) for lunch recently!

Food:

- Had the Pork Krapow ($7.90 before tax, asked for less spicy) as my main dish. I personally thought that the pork was soft, tender and well-seasoned. Overall, the dish was well-balanced and tasty, although I wish that the egg was runny - it was cooked through.

- I also had some Chicken Wings ($8.90) to share. Felt that they were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. My only gripe with this was that they could have been bigger.

Service/Atmosphere:
- There were 6 of us who went for lunch together, and we all ordered Krapow with varying levels of spiciness and/or additional meat.

There was some miscommunication on the part of the service staff and they mixed up some of our orders. However, I don't deem this to be a serious shortcoming on the part of the staff - my only wish is that they would be better prepared for future orders!

- The restaurant wasn't crowded during lunchtime and is a good value for money option if you're willing to travel to Havelock 2 mall. Seems like a hidden gem to me, if I'm honest.

I will be back again. Very impressed with the quality of the food here.

Kudos to @cravings_satisfied_jay as well for suggesting this place!

Thai food in Tiong Bahru.reviews:
Ordered catering for a gathering. Cashew nut chicken, crab meat fried rice, stir-fried kailan, minced pork eggplant, and mango salad. The trays had generous portions and the food was delicious. Perfectly done, with lots of flavour and authenticity. My friends were all very satisfied. Definitely the place to go if you want delicious catering for a home party without fuss and a unique, exotic experience!

Thai food craving today! Decided to do a takeaway cos of the unbearably hot weather lately. Friday, so decided to have pad thai seafood and tom yum soup. Pad thai is well-cooked with an authentic taste of Thai, not surprising since the staff are all Thai natives. Tom yum soup really gave me a good kick! Usually feel sleepy after lunch but with the soup, I was wide awake and feeling rather refreshed!

- value for money
- authentic Thai flavour
- really accommodating staff
- very professionally run as I can see the counter and kitchen being cleaned up all the time!

Terrible attitude from the staff. Asked for less spicy, I think they intentionally made it even spicier than usual.
Food is really bland, not worth it.

Awesome food!
Great price point and best of all, made by real Thai people:) They’re really friendly and recommended their yummy sauce for my noodles.
I had paad woon sen (fried glass noodle)
Would return to try their Mama noodles as I rarely see that at other Thai places.

Order thai hor fun for dinner.. it was served room temperature.. the "cook" blanched the ingredients and mixed in w the noodles and sauce.

Zero flavor, smelly chicken. Absolutely bad.
Thai food in Tiong Bahru.name: Thai Dynasty - Tiong Bahru

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
Dined in on PH eve. The place was rather packed at sunset.
+ The manager saw that the outdoor fan was blowing directly at my hair so he offered us another table nearer to the river.
+ The river view at sunset that day was awesome.
+ Food was served promptly. Everything tasted great.
- My only gripe was the serving size for some of the items. The churros in particular, were extremely little.
+/- Overall the service was friendly but as the place became more packed into the night, it was hard to get the servers' attention.

Ate early evening. Was leaning towards tacos but saw the Al Pastor Red Snapper and had to try it. Glad I did - it was sensational. Would have been 5 stars for atmosphere apart from the sticky table. Will definitely be back for more.

Food was pretty good. We were able to hang out for extended time as there was not a lot of people on a Friday night. Only downside is there’s no air conditioned area. It was very hot and humid. A bit uncomfortable.

A nice Mexican restaurant with different tiers of happy hour prices depending on the time of the day. Their frozen margaritas are delicious and a great accompaniment with their food. I recommend sitting outdoors by the Riverside if you don't mind not having air conditioning..

We chose the table outdoor because inside is a bit suffocating for me when there was crowded. Decoration with Mexican vibe is cool.
Quesadillas and nachos were so so.
Baja fish tacos was good but not really impressed.
Tried the mango margaritas and vodka soda. The drinks are lack of alcohol in my opinion, specially my friend’s vodka with 80% soda and 20% vodka I think 😂

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.name: Café Iguana Riverside Point

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
Chanced upon this restaurant while looking for some Mexican food.  We chose to sit indoors, which was relatively quiet and empty. Service was fast. The food was good too. Will revisit if we are looking for Mexican food again. Maybe will try outdoor seating next time.

Fast service especially for the food served. Food is OK with reasonable price. There are outside seats nearby the river and air-con ones inside the building.

Amazing restaurant! Found it by accident and it did not disappoint. They have the best oyster in sg!! Mexican food there was really nice and worth the money too. Definitely will go back again! Staff was friendly too😊

Very friendly staff...beautiful waterfront view.....Good mexican cuisine, but expensive.....Lively atmosphere with soft music....In each dish, Portion size was good for 2 people....Beer was with buy 2 get one free offer....

It’s not one of the most atmospheric options along the quay, since there was no music and very few customers. However the staff are very friendly and made us feel welcome without being too overbearing. Service was fast and the drinks prices reasonable. As a location for a meeting with colleagues it was ideal.
