Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
Finally a decent burrito bowl that is value for money, and the box is filled 3/4 full with loads of protein, rice, cheese, jalapenos, fresh tomatoes, onions and herbs! The works!

We ordered from the Paya Lebar outlet and we're pleasantly surprised as it's hard to find decent and hearty tex mex fast food in Singapore. While this is not Chipotle, it sure beats the measly burrito bowls at GYG (the worst!).

Ordered the Pulled Beef Burrito Bowl, pretty good quality stuff. Loved the jalapenos amd portion is decent.

This is sad. There's literally only 4 small chunks of chicken in each taco. And there isn't any other channel to feedback this to. I bought this as a set meal for close to $20 (inclusive of delivery).

I can't tell the difference between the burrito bowl and the nachos other than the bowl has rice and the the nachos are often stale. I like their wings but I've ordered delivery several times now and almost every time there's something missing (paid extra for cheese, or jalapenos but amount is exactly the same as an order without extras), mismatched order (chicken added instead of beef). Enough is enough, I won't order from here again.

Ordered herbal chicken quesadillas. Paid for extra cheese but the extra is not noticeable at all. With Guzman, without topping up for extra cheese, it has way more cheese. Part of the Herbal chicken doesn't seem fresh as it is abit mushy n we tot it was fish initially. Taste wise is below average.
Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.address: B1/B2/B3, 6 Eu Tong Sen St, Singapore 059817
Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.name: Antoheetos

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
First time to this restaurant.
Love the location.
Love the amosphere.
Love how our furkid enjoy sitting with us.

Food was good but perhaps it will be nice if staff can do better recommendations.

I have to give thumbs up to the staff, being very attentive even on a full seating.

Will return again.

Celebrated my wife’s birthday here. The food was amazing and the service here is superb!

I had the most incredible experience at Super Loco, and it's all thanks to the exceptional service provided by Jenny. From the moment we walked in, Jenny's warm and welcoming demeanor set the tone for a fantastic evening. She not only made sure our table was perfect, but she also went above and beyond to recommend the most delicious dishes on the menu. Kudos to her 👍🏻👍🏻

They also gave us free churros and mexican lover shot as part of our birthday celebration here.

Surprisingly, even though the food looks so nice, NONE of them (ordered 3 types of food) were tasty. 👎🏻

The staff was NOT friendly/polite at all. Even though there was miscommunication, i didn’t get apologies which made me feel uncomfortable.

The atmosphere is good as they allow lovely dogs outdoor.

Overall, not recommend. :) Thanks!!

Nice and open air spot to hangout, visited after a downpour with the weather nice and cool.
We had chips and guacamole to start.
Buffalo wings and quesadillas were great with the right amount of spices.
Crabmeat tacos were a tad unwieldy, turned soggy when left out awhile.
The food can be a little salty so drinks and frozen margaritas were a nice respite.
It was nice to have 3 different salsas available by the table, the mango habanero does pack quite the punch.
Will revisit for the laidback atmosphere and great food.
Staff were attentive and offered water.

Delicious, modern Mexican cuisine. Great menu with lots of meat and veg options as well as a decent kids menu. Favourite was the cauliflower dish as well as pumpkin tostadas. Service was a little non attentive but otherwise a great experience in a comfortable environment by the river.

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
Came down with family of 5. So lucky the owner who is also the chef prepared food that we ordered. Simply awesome. All the food was so yummy we ordered about 7 dishes. Mr Guru also recommended the special of the day! Lamb Shank with Mandi rice!!!! Checkout their specials whenever you order food. Mexican and Turkish Fusion! Food is priced at a very affordable rate and service from Ajay & Kelvin was amicable. Thanks Los Amigos we had a fruitful evening at your cosy restaurant. Will definitely be back for MORE!!!!!

On a picturesque evening, my friend and I sought a place to unwind, and serendipitously, we stumbled upon Los Amigos Mexican restaurant. The ambiance, adorned with vibrant decor and a backdrop of lively music, immediately caught our attention.

Our culinary journey commenced with an array of delectable choices, including the signature Prawn Ceviche, spicy pork belly, rib-eye steak, and a sweet finale of churros drizzled in rich chocolate sauce, all paired with my beloved margaritas.

The Prawn Ceviche emerged as the star of the show—a harmonious blend of succulent prawns and zesty lime, delivering a medley of sour, juicy, crispy, and tender sensations all in one bite. The spicy pork belly added an extra kick to our palates, which I relished, though my friend found it a tad too fiery.

Regrettably, the rib-eye steak didn't align with our taste preferences; its flavor and texture left us disappointed, slightly dampening our dining experience. However, we concluded our meal on a sweet note with the heavenly churros, perfectly complemented by warm, velvety chocolate—a delightful treat.

In essence, Los Amigos offered a mixed dining experience with highs and lows. While some dishes soared to culinary perfection, others fell short of our expectations. Nevertheless, the lively ambiance and attentive service ensured an enjoyable evening overall.

Hola!
Love the vibes of Los Amigos!

Staff are all extremely friendly and helpful!
A shoutout to Boss, AJ, Vinod and Black for making our experience extra awesome!

We had Tacos, Quesadillas, Ceviches… everything was just perfect. I asked for no onions (imagine that in a Mexican restaurant) but they delivered without a fuss.
Love the special Yakult Soju concoction by AJ!
(We will figure out the other 6 ingredients! 😎)
Will be back! Adios!🍻

Had to order 3 times. Half the food didn’t arrive. What did arrive was terrible! Want fluorescent sour cream that tastes like garlic and guacamole that tastes like sugar? Eat here. Want food that tastes good, is what your ordered and delivered timely? Go somewhere else!

It was a team dinner & drinks event.
We had a great time at Los Amigos  with lively music and ambience followed by tasty food and drinks.
With the long list of cocktail options, the Margarita stood out.
Thank you to the owners and the staff for making the evening memorable.

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.name: Los Amigos

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
Amazing food and place. Went here for my birthday.
I got the tacos,pizza and nachos. The paneer nachos were scrumptious. It had amazing cheese and melted in your mouth. It had sprinkles of olives and had a handful of nacho cheese.
The tacos were mediocre but it tasted fine. It had a mixture of vegetables dowsed in sauce.
The pizza was thinly crusted. It had a lot vegetable and the sauce was tangy and scrumptious .
They also gave me a complimentary cake which was scrumptious. It was soft and fluffy.
The customer service was really good. I recommend this place to everyone.

I ordered chicken manchurian and they served vegie manchurian after I complaint they served chicken one. But it is not the same as the menu picture😒 moreover plates are dirty you may see the fingerprint of the waiters in the last photo

Set menus rate 5 stars. They combine good food and value. Mexican and Indian sets both offer vegetarian and non-vegetarian choices for $11-16. I thought the Indian food and the Mexican food were both good. Yes, hawker stalls are cheaper and your mother’s food might taste better to you, but check out the view. If you don’t want crowds, don’t come at 6:00 on Friday or Saturday. We had a late lunch riverside and no waiting. Deep fried items freshly cooked. 👍

I LOVE THIS PLACE. THE LADY IS EXTREMELY NICE ITS A BEAUTIFUL RESTAURANT. OMG THE FOOD IS DELICIOUS, COME AFTER A GOOD NIGHT OF DRINKS AND FUN AND YOU WILL BE IN HEAVEN. I RECOMMEND THE REFRIED BEANS AND SHRIMP QUESADILLA AND BIRRIA TACOS.BEEN HERE 3x IN ONE WEEK. NO COMPLAINTS

The restaurant outlook, ambience, seating and food were good. We had some reservations before walking in to the restaurent as Kids demanded but believe me - It is worth spending time and money here. We ain’t any real Mexican to gauge the authentic Mexican taste but when it comes with Indian flavours and thats when you love the taste.

Ordered all kids choices from the menu but all of us adults got surprised too with the taste of all.

Kudos to the servers as they taken care of the order very well and our appreciations to the chef.

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
The staff , Anthony was so accommodating and very informative. He suggested the best food for me and my boss. The weather outside was super hot but despite of that…we had a great time and enjoyed our lunch. Cheers to the staff and management of El Mero Mero👍👍👍👍👍

great experience here! service was amazing, friendly staff and celebrated my friend’s birthday here. great atmosphere with great food! will definitely want to be back. highly recommend!!

Great food and value for money! Did a lovely birthday surprise for us as well, would definitely recommend

Ambience is beautiful. We are from Mexico and food is authentic and well served portions.

Nice outdoor dining, food was yummy! We did however, come on a very hot afternoon for lunch, while I was sweating buckets, and there was a natural breeze + fans, it's obviously warm but that's expected as it's an outdoor dining restaurant.

Would be lovely in the evening and on weekends. I plan to return with my kids.
Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.name: El Mero Mero | Mexican Taqueria

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
My team mates organise this dinner session and it was my first time having Mexican food.

We had fish taco, potatoes and beef taco (not sure what is the dishes names). I also thought taco is crispy type but it is pretty similar to peking duck wrap that I am familiar with.

It was a new experience and I enjoyed it.

I understand the restaurant is pretty popular so reservation is needed. The restaurant ambient is nice too.

Very good Mexican restaurant (and it is my favorite food in the world). The cocktails are well balanced and they are able to go off menu. The food is great, and the wood grill is bringing good flavor. Negative points: Cocktails are a bit pricey

Every single dish that we ordered tasted sooooo good. Tlayuda de la Casa was something super unique which I have been eyeing on ever since I found out about this restaurant and wasn’t sure which one it was in the menu but the wait staff was super helpful and recommended that we add the lobster meat. It was sweet and savory in all the right balance.

We managed to make it early for the happy hour which has tacos and drinks. However, we ended up in the first dinner seating and couldn’t keep the table past 8pm and we had to pack most of our food to go…

Food was impeccable, as much as the service was great, we believe that it could be better since there was a hefty price tag to this restaurant.

Nixta. Coming from the word "nixtamalization", a process by which maize/corn is processed by an alkaline solution. #TIL.

What can I say? The food here is pretty good but make sure you wallets are thick. Best dish is the Tlayuda de la Casa, a crunchy tortilla with corn all other ingredients. We opted for the additional lobster but the super sweet corn is all I can remember of this dish. The whole dish is just perfect.

Next best is the giant churros. Amazing soft and hot churros topped with cinnamon sugar. The sauces were only a distraction.

The fingerlings cooked in duck fat were pretty good with the cheese and sour cream too. Duck and pork belly tacos were decent but the portions were kinda small. My other friends seemed to like the chicken. While I admit that it was pretty juicy and tender, I find it a bit too salty. Like salt baked chicken.

Service staff were very competent and friendly. One of them even offered to help us take photos.

We did end up going elsewhere for more food.

This place has quite the star attraction – their grilled chicken. The catch? You're best off pre-ordering it, unless you fancy an hour of patient anticipation. We opted for half a savory grilled chicken and also ventured into Tlayuda de la casa, a crispy tortilla dough creation reminiscent of a pizza, generously topped with corn. To kick up the spice, we had to try their Seafood Cocktail Veracruz, a fiery, flavorful seafood soup. And for a sweet finale, we couldn't resist the Churros.

But here's the secret sauce: The Seafood Cocktail Veracruz is the real showstopper. It's so good that you'll find yourself dunking nearly everything in that soul-warming broth. As for Churros, they're an absolute must-order, arriving hot and crispy, a pure delight. The other menu items? Well, they don't quite hit the same high note, so you can safely skip those.

For anyone fortunate enough to find themselves in this neck of the woods, remember this golden rule: Always order the soup – it's the heart and soul of the experience! 😄
Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.name: Nixta Mexican Grill & Bar

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
Varieties of veg food is available.
Pre booking is highly recommended.
Have been here 2 times and will definitely go again since the quality of food, service and the ambience is amazing.
MBS view dining is great.

Visit Date - 13 August 2023

It was a very pleasant experience at Super Loco @Customs House. On a Sunday it was quiet and we had booked a table outside overlooking the Marina.
It is recommended to visit during sunset, there is a refreshing breeze and slowly the marina lights up all happy and colourful - a perfect way to gear up for the new week.
We were served by Danial. He gave some unbiased suggestions highlighting what he likes and why and some other items why his colleagues like

Based on that we ordered
A Bottle of Pineapple and Calamani Margarita - It was light & refreshing
Trotilla chips with salsa roja

For the main course we had
Wagyu Steak - juicy bite sized on a taco
Beef Quesadilla - quite tasty

This should have been enough for dinner but for us it was not complete without a dessert so we indulged in
Chocolate Lava - as mentioned by Danial, the Mint ice cream and choco-lava cake made a super combo.
Panna Cotta - personally I liked this the best. The tang of lemon sorbet balanced the sweet Oaxaca cheese topped with the crunch of pistachio crumble. This is an item to return for.
Thanks Super Loco

Don’t be surprised by my 5 STAR ratings🤣 I’m pretty sure it’s not because of my birthday🌝

So I celebrated my birthday at this restaurant and it was on a Saturday😊 I love went to other restaurant before but not this location. The VIEW is superb even at 6pm(before sunset)

I ordered Chefs Recommendation $48/6 dishes.. I would say the portion is not too much and just nice for my appetite… So, as I put in the reservation remark column, they gave me a hat that night with a complimentary citrusy shots🤣 Ok, it’s a bonus drink, what do you expect? A glass of beer or wine? 🤣

So.. If you like to enjoy beautiful view with nice Mexican food, you should consider here and make your reservation early at least a week before your selected date😉

Absolutely delicious and satisfying Mexican fare in a chill, laid-back setting by the Bay. No complaints and would definitely return! The chips and dips are a must-order!!

Dropped in just before last call for orders at 9pm on a weekend, but the staff were friendly and helpful even though we were latecomers. We ordered a selection of tacos, tostados, the nacho chips and a salad - everything was served very quickly, tasted fresh, balanced, overall just really delicious.

The nacho chips with the range of dips was probably the star of the night. It’s usually a starter that I take for granted but the sauces here pack a punch - so so good and deceivingly simple-looking. I may not be a regular diner at Mexican restaurants but I’d imagine that it would be hard to top this off. Can’t wait to go back!

We got an outdoor seat beside the Bay Area with the backdrop Marina Bay Sands.
The view was awesome, there were a lot of people gathering around the area just to take photos in the evening.

Everything we ordered tasted fantastic, and the plating was colourful. The service was warm, friendly and attentive. It rained halfway and Solihin quickly relocated us indoor, and offered to leave the door open so we can enjoy the view, until the rain got heavier.

Overall, it was a unique and warm five star experience!

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
Don't treat this as your traditional Mexican eatery, think of it a little more like a fusion of Asian with mexican flavours.

Honestly, the food here surprised us so much and we loved every single bite of it

1. Start off with some chili con carne nachos which is NOT-CHOS everyday chili and spice. The nachos were really crispy and tasty
2. Beef steak was amazing. The rub was delightful and tasty and just something really different. The salad on the side had mango dressing and elevated it to the next level
3. Baja fish tacos were big and sufficient to divide into 4 portions for a refreshing taste as well as crispy.

Overall, something to look forward to it you would like a blend of flavours

Sadly, another Mexican place where the food barely resembles Mexican food. The owners should plan a trip to Mexico to see what it is really like. The food is not at all spicy. (we were served the "spicy" version so I can't imagine the non spicy version). The margaritas were ok. I wouldn't go here again.

I thought the food was pretty good, even though it was overpriced. Drinks were very average and overpriced too. Their mango magherita came with sugar, and was far too sweet. Atmosphere was pretty chillax and nice. Service was quite bad. Although staff were responsive, they were quite unfriendly. There were no smiles at all. And when my Mexican friend told them one of the dishes was prepared wrongly, the staff just responded impatiently, self-righteously and with a look of displeasure. We spent around $70 per person so I feel service could be better.

The food was ok the portions are very small. It is in a great location but like most places we visited in Singapore overpriced and underwhelming

Great position on the River...
Great Mexican food.
Quick and gentle service.
Reccomended.

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
Always love to Guzman for a quick Mexican fix! Very fast food style Mexican food quick and easy as well had the burrito bowl with steak and extra cheese it’s always very tasty would recommend the tacos as well or the quesadillas! And there’s quite a few fillings to choose from also would recommend

Pretty decent food and pricing.
Good service in Sg is always a hard find.. how difficult is it to smile ?
Nevertheless.. that wont deter us from visiting again.. the food was good 😊
Seldom do we get fries which tastes good without the need of extra sauce/dip .. so 👍🏼 for that !

Fast food style Mexican food with tastes customised to sg/my type taste buds. Not bad at all although diff frm authentic Mexican. Tables are small and very near to each other (maybe it is this branch only). Servings of nachos is hearty.

Had a breakfast here. Try their burritos bowl tacos, and burrito. Had Jarritos as drink too, it was very refreshing. All was very nice and fulfilling, great Mexican Restaurant 🔝👌🏻

All the staffs were also very friendly and helpful. Will definitely come back for another visit when staying near Funan.

Service was very slow. Burrito bowls, tacos, and the enchiladas were fine and tasted as good as the other branches.
Hope that they can improve the kitchen process and not keep taking new orders when there are many waiting in the kitchen.

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
Atmosphere is good to chill relax with the sunlight and open air. Service is polite, food is slow but acceptable as we can understand there seems to be a shortage of manpower. Tacos need to improve as it’s small and not crispy enough.

Nice spot for hang out with friends over cocktails and drinks while deludge over Mexican food.

The Food:
Quite close to authentic Mexican cuisine, especially their tacos. It's a must try.
The beverages are amazing. Get those!!!

Services:
The waiter who served me was subpar in services. Lack of patience and giving a feeling like we are wasting his time. But foods and beverages are served quick. So it deserves a star.

Atmosphere:
Nice, cozy, chill and outdoor spot. Not noisy and great place to chat with friends. I only wish it open till late midnight haha

The ambience is fantastic, it’s open air and you get a nice view of CHIJMES. The food is great, but slightly different to what we had before. The quesadillas now have bell peppers/capsicums in them which is a change. Salsa, chips and the guacamole were very tasty and actually worth buying as a whole side. Also the fly on the plate is just a picture.

It was a Tuesday afternoon and so grateful for the incredible staff to take our big request booking for lunch of 40 people in such a short time. Shout out to the lovely staff who served us and we had the best time! Great food too! We recommend and will be back!

Authentic Mexican food in Chijmes in a beautiful setting. There's a few vegetarian options (impossible taco, salad, vegetarian enchilada or quesadilla), but some favorite options are missing (no huitlacoche, taco de champignones, flor de calabaza, tamales). I assume the ingredients are hard to get.
Outdoor seating in Chijmes is nice, with lots of space for kids to run around.
Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.name: Señor Taco Chijmes

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
I had a blast at Lucha Loco for the first time with my team. At first, they told us there were no tables available, but thanks to some smooth talking by my colleague and a stroke of luck with a no-show party, we snagged a great table for our group of six.

Hats off to George, one of the waitstaff, who was an absolute delight, super friendly, and full of great recommendations.

We indulged in some blueberry margaritas, chicken and beef enchiladas, lamb tacos, chips, and eggplant tempura, and let me tell you, they were scrumptious.

I’m already planning my next visit because there’s so much more on their menu I want to try. We left with satisfied tummies and big smiles. 😄🌮🍹

Food is really good! Very happy they have a good selection of vegetarian dishes. Definitely order the elotes and the tempura flower courgette. The courgette flower was a shell that was filled with tasty liquid cheese. The lion mane taco was tasty but I thought the mushrooms were a bit on the tough side. That said, the texture was so close to meat you could be fooled.

Highly recommend the tempura zucchini flower with black beans.

Was served by George. Professional, attentive and helpful. As it was my first time having mexican food. He was able to address my questions and willing to share more about Mexican food. Thanks for recommending the sauces!! Esp the green sauce. Super love the crab dish with amazing flavours. Highly recommend blue corn cake for dessert! Ambience was really nice and great for dating/ gatherings!

Food ordered: Fried Papas, Tostadas Crab, Quesadillas Chicken and blue corn cake

Food is not bad, don't be fooled by the portion. It looks small but it is definitely filing. Two of us had cauliflower, tacos and Zucchini flower. We were really full halfway. We had churros anyway, too sweet to decline.. George was servicing us and he was really looking after us, and recommended us the items or else we would have ordered too much. He even got us fee margarita shots. Thanks George! We enjoyed our time there.

Great tacos, especially the prawn tacos.
I think 2 tacos is enough for 1 person along with some small shared dishes.
The staff were all friendly, they came by for some small chats.
We sat outside the entrance and it was relatively warm especially with some alcoholic drinks.

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.name: Lucha Loco - Mexican Cocina Y Mezcaleria

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
The food isn't all that amazing and they only have al fresco high chair seating (sweat like mad while trying to balance). Maybe people go for the drinks but their food menu leaves much to be desired. Taco prices are per piece.

Amazing tacos! Absolutely loved their fish and pork tacos! Each one was done to perfection and loved how friendly the staff were as well. Great ambiance to hang out with friends and chill. Only downside was that tacos are pricey. Portions are small for the prices they charge and drinks are much more expensive than the bars around CQ.

Bad service and tacos. I ordered the Al Pastor chicken tacos. On the menu it shows that the order comes with 2 tacos "x2" for take out. The waitress says it's not true and only comes with 1 taco because they just changed the menu today. I don't mind spending $14 for 2 chicken tacos but these tacos were bad. The chicken and corn tortilla were very dry with no flavor. Not sure if they had flour tortillas but the waitress didn't ask. I waited patiently at the table for 20 minutes. I walked up to the counter and the waitress realized my order has been ready awhile ago and forgot to give it to me. Don't waste your money here. Vatos tacos is much better and only $6 a taco that is worth every dollar.

It is difficult to find authentic mexican food and this is as good as it gets! Really loved the tacos. The salsa was very refreshing with flavours bursting in your mouth in every bite. Love how the tacos are served warm. The best thing is that they are on the Entertainer app so many of the items are one for one if you subscribed.
There is a dance floor in the middle of the restaurant - I presume that there could be performances in the night? Not sure but it made the place look really spacious. There is both indoor and outdoor seating. Will recommend you to sit inside if you want faster service because the staff might have some blind spots due to the walls etc. if you sit outside.

Ordered tacos and chips for taco Tuesday. We are quite disappointed at the food.

The salsa (in the round container) comes with the chips is very very watery.  And it costs 7.8 together with the bag of chips. The salsa (in the rectangle container) bought from supermarket is way better.

The taco skin is a bit dry. Don’t want to o there and eat at all.
Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.address: 3A River Valley Road, #01-07 Clarke Quay, Block A, 179020
Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.name: Señor Taco Clarke Quay

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
My go-to for comfort Mexican food. Big heavy burritos! The breakfast burrito is great if you love sweet and savoury flavour combos as it comes with a syrup dip to have with it! Ambience is nice and casual, staff are always cheerful.

Haven’t tried many Mexican cafe/restaurants around but this was pretty good!

Heard that they have  just rolled out new additions to its All-Day Menu as well as a brand-new Brunch Menu.

Here’s what we tried for their All-Day Menu:
🍤 Fried Shrimp Tacos
A crispy, zesty delight!
🍜 Birria Ramen
The ramen was rich with a savory, spicy, sweet, sour, smokey and unique Mexican flavor. Imagine tasty cooked beef shreds and the birria consommé which is a rich stew with flavors of chillies, adobo, herbs and spices dressing up cooked noodles. As simple as this sounds, it’s also just luscious! You can’t miss it!
🥤 Milkshakes
Available in Vanilla, Chocolate, Strawberry
🍩 Churros
With White Choc or Strawberry Choc sauce

We tried some brunch menu items as well:
🍳 Huevos Rancheros
This is a big hearty breakfast that’s packs with loads of nutritious goodness! I myst say, it can get a tad messy to eat, but hey, that's the charm of a true Mexican meal – messy, delicious, and satisfying!
🥩 Country Fried Steak with Mashed Potatoes & Gravy
Comfort food at its finest.
🥞 Buttermilk Pancakes with Maple Syrup
Fluffy stacks of pure joy.

Probably one of the best casual Mexican food joints in Singapore. Really up there on top of my list. The place is small and could be crowded during peak hours, but the location is not near public transpo - so it’s not that packed quite often.

The food is top notch; I especially recommend their burritos and buffalo wings. One thing to take note of is that they offer a unique selection of beverages which are quite good, so if you’re not adventurous and the type that sticks with the usual soda maybe you should bring yours.

We tend to always overindulge at this place, but on an average it’ll cost you around $15-20 per person at Muchachos.

Great Mexican flavours in Downtown Singapore.  Tried tortilla chips and tacos. Got the soft one, not sure if hard tacos is available. The vegetarian option has only two possibilities: pepper, onions and tofu. Prefer to have more options. But the food was really good

Very big portions. Good flavours, meat well cooked, fries crispy. Lacks something fresh light or crunchy. Every dish very heavy.

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
Get your taste buds to throw a party!

Solid margaritas - try the spicy mango if you’re feel adventurous!🥭🌶️

Tasty tacos and generous the avocado dip - server gave us a second serving!  It's a fiesta for your taste buds, with a smooth and enjoyable dining experience.🌮🍹✨

Had the frozen margarita for $10++ during happy hour (until 7pm) and it was great! We ordered the platter - pork and fish were both great! Shrimp was not bad too. Chicken was our least favourite. Limited seatings so best to reserve a table first.

loved the time at Papi’s! we got the platter and the fav was the shrimp one 🍤🌮 do come before 7pm for happy hour! we didn’t make it in time but still enjoyed our frozen margaritas 😛 it was also crowded so we got bar seats but the staff were sooo generous and friendly. 10/10 would recommend! 💯

Their service is top-notch! I love the food, drinks and all the friendly staff. The best tacos I have ever tasted in Singapore. For sure, I will be back again here!!!!

Okurrrrr y’all know how some tacos get drenched in gravies and sauces and then start breaking so your hands get messy and it’s a 2/10 experience?? Ya NONE OF THAT HERE. PAPI’s TACO SHELLS ARE LIKE 👍🏻! THEYRE SOLID. THEYRE RELIABLE. THEYRE FIRM. THEY EXUDE ASSERTIVE ENERGY📢📢📢👹👹

Thin sheets WHO? They’ve never heard of her. I loved the tacos! they were really substantial. Would say the shrimp tacos are a must have here—the rest are all good, but the shrimp had me on my knees 🧎🏻‍♀️🧎🏻‍♀️🧎🏻‍♀️🧎🏻‍♀️🧎🏻‍♀️ ok everything else was like okok. The chicken pork guacamole salsa everything okok but I think overall it’s all fairly priced and it’s nice. :-) 👍🏻🫣

Prices are good—get the platter to share if it’s a party of 3 or more. The corn was also pretty tasty. Cocktails were nice too (not pictured my friends got an orange one and a spicy one) the orange cocktail was nice and refreshing. For the spicy one……. Let’s just say it’s an ✨acquired taste✨

Strong recommend. 👌🏼🫣😭 but this outlet is a little small—try their tpagar one! It’s more spacious.
Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.name: Papi’s Tacos - Seah Street

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
Glad we went through the reviews here before we decided to order the roast chicken & fish taco. The food is amazing!

Roast chicken: Mild spicy level, breast is slightly drier; would be better if they could make it more succulent & juicy.

Fish taco: personal favourite, love the tangy chilli mango salsa sauce.

Good vibes, good food. Good ambience to have a fun time. Food wise, not bad. Roasted whole chicken is great. Their margaritas are not bad too. It’s ice blended so pretty unique.  Would say though, price point pretty high for low income earners like me.

Disco lights to turn on after the sun has set. If you or your friends birthday, can ask them sing happy birthday. They will stop the music and get all their staffs to sing for you. Plus, you get an Mexican hat.

Dropped by because the Korean BBQ places we wanted to go to were fully booked on a Friday night.

Deep fried fish taco - 4.75 stars
Best of the lot.

Grilled barramundi taco - 3.5 stars

Cauliflower taco - 3.5 stars

Chicken - 4 stars
Gets spicier as you eat it.

The broccoli side for the chicken was raw. The other salad was average as well.

The rotisserie chicken was well marinated and the meat was tender and juicy.
The “Not your average nacho” was indeed special, the topping and dips went so well with the tortilla chips.
The dishes were a bit salty though.

Pretty packed on a Friday but we managed to get a seat without reservation.

Overall, the fish tacos as other reviews were good. The nacho and chicken was average.

The main disappointment is the level of service seems lacking, and one particular server didn't look like he wants to be there, and it shows. We saw a group of diners behind us leave their table without ordering after no one attended to him for a while.

For the price point, I do expect a better level of service and food.

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
had a great dining experience here,
they have wonderful vibrant ambience and
attentive service from welcoming staffs,
authetic and outstanding mexican dishes and great cocktails you shouldn't miss!!!!!!
freshest guacamole and picco de gallo, tacos with tender and succulent pork and beef coming with authentic soft corn totillas and supeeeeeeerb margaritas were all fantastic
would definitely recommend :)

Great vibe at this newly opened restaurant with the best customer service. A wide variety of food and drinks choices. The baja fish tacos were simply mouthwateringly amazing.

Checked out Vatos' new place at City House and tried their new dish, the Roasted Bone Marrow Platter. First time trying something like this, and I was pleasantly surprised—I loved it!

The portions were big (almost too much for me), the place had a cozy vibe, and the staff was super friendly and helpful. Excited to go back and try more dishes soon!

The honey chicken wings were cooked just right, perfect combination of sweet and tangy taste. The shoe string fries were crispy and the cheese quesadillas were appetizing. Finally, drinks OG margherita mix was good :)

I’m impressed! Vatos is a whole package of unforgettable dining experience. Totally love the ambiance of the restaurant, it’s brand new, spacious and the bar is sparkling with array of choice drinks aim to fulfil to one’s liking. It also artistically designed with beautiful painted mural on the wall which provides ideal spot for selfies and group photo to capture the memorable experience together. The food is fantastically fresh, delicious and creatively fusioned. In Vatos, I find this quote really summarise my dining experience “Anybody would enjoy the first bite of a dish, but only a real food would let you enjoy the last.”

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.name: Vatos City House

Mexican cuisine in Clarke Quay.reviews:
Food was tasty but the portion is a bit small.  Guacamole was served with thin crispy nachos, it was prepared at your table which was a nice surprise.  Quesadillas were delicious but the dips were too small. Beer selection is limited though.  The fried chicken wings were crunchy and went well with beers.
Good crowd even on weekdays.  Both indoor and outdoor dining areas are available.

Quite a famous place in Arab street with a long stretch outlet. Food is pretty good, drinks are good, price is pretty alright. Probably recommended for family during noon and early evening. Place has the vibes for friends and couple during dinner time and late evening. Their tacos is really good. Plenty of tables to sit and they have indoor and outdoor seats. Worth the try in a famous place as such.

Great ambient, the decorations and music.
We were 7 of us there on national day for dinner, ordered quite a lot of different kind of tapas and main course.

The portions were all quite large, the mozzarella cheese stick was so tasty, the pepper was too spicy somehow. The tacos with hard shell was crispy and I love the full loaded vegetables and meat perfectly with the sauces. Grilled chicken chop was well prepared, juicy and tender.

Flan is different then what we have in kopitiam, this texture of flan was not smooth or silk.  Not recommend to order ice cream as it taste so cheap..

Fantastic hard shell tacos, freshly smashed guacamole right at your table. Burger is juicy and my kid says, flavourful.

They even helped light a candle on the dessert for my kid's birthday.

One of my all time fav Mexican bar. The great vibe hasn't change. Colorful, lively, vibrant.

Great service too from the team especially Sunil. Thoroughly friendly and super helpful.

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Absolutely delicious Indian food in a fun open air location with a corner view of the street. Friendly service; we left, saying we'd probably be back and were greeted warmly when we did. Curries are delicious and the pakoras are tasty too. Chili pakoras are no joke though, super spicy!

Used to be my go to for Indian food but finds that recent visits are less pleasant. Staff not able to describe properly the dishes seems they can’t speak English well. The food are just ok not fantastic.

Love the bread basket, butter chicken and palak paneer! The chicken biryani is so so. The place is air conditioned with good hygiene. Quite a lot of tourists in the restaurant.

Butter chicken is good, but the tandoori chicken is okay but proportion is small, overall is pricey, and they have too many take away orders that took very long to serve our food, the outdoor tables are close to street where is not so good when raining

Absolutely brilliant food. Fantastic service. The staff are friendly and attentive. Set in the heart of little India. Amazing. Well done guys

Indian restaurants in Little India.name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant - Little India

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Interesting lunch and good vegetarian option. Enjoyed pani puri but maybe a bit too sweet for me. Equally the dal maklani was too salty and buttery albeit managed to finish quite a big helping. Pricing is bonkers tho with rice and dal dishes being close to 15 dollars. Service was excellent and I would come back and try a few other dishes. One issue is the lack of bathroom facilities or washbasin in the restaurant. You have to exit and do a couple of doors down and my nose never did recover from little India’s more underground smells !

I had a great experience at this Indian restaurant

The food was great and I enjoyed the service, the staff were friendly and helpful.

I like the atmosphere, and I appreciated how quickly the food was served.

While I haven't explored many Indian restaurants yet, I'm looking forward to returning to try more dishes in the future.

So far the best chaats I have had in Singapore. Nice and proper place to sit and enjoy the food. Prices are not exorbitant. One thing I dislike is that they don't have a proper hand wash inside the restaurant. Have to go out to wash and come back using the swing door, which defeats the purpose of washing hands. Indian food must be enjoyed by using hands, so hand wash point in the restaurant is a must.

Update on 18 Sep,
Since I liked the chaats, I thought of having at airport as I saw it was at T1 terminal @ L2. When I went there, they said it was moved to different location. Management must take out the signboard from T1 as it gives wrong information.

Very good option for Indian vegetarian food. Was seated very fast and the service was also good. During peak dinner time 8-9pm place will be crowded and generally there will be waiting.
Vast Manu covers most of the Indian variety food. Food is really tasty, especially all the chat items are very nice. If you are looking for   Indian vegetarian food definitely worth a try.

Great North Indian cuisine. Service was slower than expected, however food was good. Be careful when ordering more sides as they charge for everything

Indian restaurants in Little India.name: Kailash Parbat Restaurant

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Food is good quality is also just nice but felt little expensive
One plate is $4
Taste n quantity ok but for this price is too much
Service is good but has to Que up for every order or first buy n pay n then eat
Very fresh food n good hospitality not spicy.

Not too crowded even on a weekend which is always good in the heart of little India. Sometimes the crowd can be overwhelming.

The food is great. Especially the mutton dishes. The chicken tikka is also amazing. The chicken briyani want great and the chicken kerbab wasn’t great too. Naan was a little too oily.

I spent $38 on breads, paneer and sweets??? $10 for paneer makhani was expensive. It was not cooked properly. The best dish was "Paneer Tikka". I

I would say that their food tasted pretty typical “North Indian styled”. But not enough to blow us away. Their pricing was not too expensive, and neither cheap, pretty affordable.

Absolutely delicious Indian dishes.
The mutton dum briyani is nice but comparing to the other dishes, it doesn’t shine as bright.
Highly recommend their naan and side dishes, especially their butter chicken.

If you’re tall, please mind your head when you dine at the upper level.

Price point is also reasonable. Highly recommended.

Indian restaurants in Little India.name: Jaggi’s Northern Indian Cuisine

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Most authentic and flavourful North Indian food experience so far in Singapore… no extra spices, oil or colour… only fresh juicy mild aroma and taste 👌🏻

Best part was that they served everything one by one, so that we could eat and enjoy at leisure and relish the sizzling hot dishes :)

First time here! Amazing food and service! Definitely coming back!

Lots of options, portion is just nice as well 👌

Personal favourite tonight was the Goan Fish!

A really homely establishment serving delectable Indian dishes at affordable prices relative to other places.

The paneer masala was rich and perfect with the Naan basket. The mutton biryani was rich and tender. Accompanied with the Malai chicken kebab, which was served on a sizzling hot plate that oozed rich flavours. Finally, the Gulab Jamun was rich and fragrant without exceedingly sweet. Topped with the Mango milkshake served with passion, the food was downed with great enjoyment.

Come on down if you are in the vicinity, you won’t regret it.

The food was excellent, the service exquisite. Thanks to the waiter we ordered incredibly good food. The Goan fish curry was probably the best I ever had. The mint chutney was very strong in taste, hence it was the first time I ever really appreciated it as an appetizer sauce.

Would definitely recommend, way better than expected.

Love their lamb rack briyani. The briyani was not too oily, flavourful and lamb rack was succulent. Lamb was not gamey at all. Their lassi and dal makhni were very rich in flavour. They have a variety of sauces to complement different dishes which pairs very well. It's affordable for such quality Indian food.
Service crew were very polite and attentive.

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Really nice food with an interesting dining concept. Loved sitting on the floor upstairs. The chef / owner was lovely. I think my favorite dish was the butter chicken, but honey everything we tried was lovely. The samosas and the tandoori chicken were also great. Yum!

WOW! Where do I even begin… easily one of the best, most delicious places to eat out I’ve ever been to! Great and authentic setting, delicious Indian cuisine and lovely staff to make you feel like home. The spicy challenge is so fun and the taste of the food there is simply out of this world! A must visit if you happen to be in Singapore!

Had an incredible time here! My group stumbled in not knowing at all what was in store for us.

We first of all were impressed that this place made the Michelin List so many years in a row, and then we saw the hilarious Spice Challenge and were intrigued with all of the fun events this place hosts like the Full Moon Nights & the cooking classes. The owner/chef was so awesome. He was so funny and sarcastic and also encouraged us to get out of our American-Indian comfort zone and wouldn’t let us all just order Tikka Masala as we originally planned, and because of that, it turns out I found authentic Indian food I loved even more! I really wish I lived here so I could take the cooking classes with him!

Many thanks for providing our group with such an entertaining experience and pushing us out of our comfort zones. It was truly a time!

An amazing and authentic environment with unique deliveries of classic dishes. They have a sauce heat sampler platter to see what heat level you like.  There's a challenge wall for those seeking immortality as well. But the naan and sauces are too notch. A must try. The proprietors are amazing and have a fun sense of humo(u?)r.

Changed my perception of Indian food in Singapore : well-curated, small portion size, so I didn't feel stuffy while digesting and a bit pricy. Masala tea was better than I had in Mumbai but it would have been perfect if the sugar was on the side.

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
A delight to every South Indian dish that’s being presented! The restaurant holds the legacy with not just the location, the interior but also to the taste with food. We tried a few variations including the famous meal and biriyani. A must try will be the meal combo, served hot. We had to wait for around 30 mins to get seated but it’s worth the wait.. ground floor and first floor has seating capacity. The prices are very reasonable for the quantity being served. Will definitely recommend this place for all South Indian vegetarian fans!

Food here is good, not that very bad. Service got to improve. Environment can be cramped and noisy. Pricey but still okay, you pay what you asked for. I was served food first, even finished up eating the foods but drinks were served after 5-10 after finishing up my meals. Masala tea arrived 30-40 minutes late upon ordering. This is not acceptable at all. And never even apologized for serving the drinks late. I ordered one ice tea and one masala tea. Also, I personally feel the standard of the food have dropped a lot. Used to patronize here often but I think it's about time that the service and food taste is falling apart.
Overall food is 7.5/10.
Service is 3/10.
Environment is 4.5/10.
This review is based on my honest opinion.

I saw this on a food travel show and immediately wanted to try it out.

There was a short queue but seated after 5min or so wait. Service was friendly and no fuss. Dining area is simple but as expected.

Definitely lived up to expectations with amazing, fresh, authentic and tasty food. I had the dosai meal which had 3 curries, some chutneys, Daal, sambar, and even a sweet sago coconut pudding. Amazing flavours, colours and spices. A generous meal which was thoroughly enjoyable.

For a sweet finish I tried the almond hawa and milk kova which were both new to me. Very sweet but had their own unique taste and texture which hit the spot.

One improvement would be to use less plastic for serving food - lots of little plastic containers on my meal set and for sweets.

Overall a great experience and will definitely be recommending and be back.

The food and service is always good in Komala Vilas. We stay nearby so we can walk to this restaurant during our jaunt in Singapore.
I wish they include an elevator to go upstairs for lunch. On request they let my parents share the meals but mentioned there will be no refills.
Taste is always exceptional.

Nestled in the heart of Little India, Singapore, Komala Vilas Indian Restaurant is a culinary gem that proudly showcases a rich history of authentic Indian cuisine. With a legacy spanning over several decades, this restaurant has been a beacon of tradition and a must-visit for anyone seeking genuine Indian flavors.

Authenticity Unveiled: Komala Vilas has stayed true to its roots, preserving the authenticity of Indian culinary traditions. From its traditional South Indian dishes to the flavors of the North, every plate served here is a journey through the diverse and vibrant cuisine of India. The recipes have been carefully passed down through generations, ensuring that each bite tells a story of India’s culinary heritage.

Efficiency Meets Warmth: One of the standout features of Komala Vilas is its impeccable service. The staff is known for their swift and friendly demeanor, ensuring that you not only receive your food promptly but also feel welcomed. Their commitment to creating a warm and inviting atmosphere enhances the dining experience.

Culinary Excellence: The true star of Komala Vilas is the remarkable quality and taste of the food. Each dish is a work of art, with fresh ingredients and a perfect blend of spices. Whether you crave the crispy dosas, aromatic biryanis, or rich curries, every bite is a burst of flavors that will transport your taste buds to India. Vegetarian or non-vegetarian, the menu caters to every palate with equal finesse.

In summary, Komala Vilas Indian Restaurant is not just a place to eat; it’s an exploration of India’s culinary diversity. The history, authenticity, fast and welcoming service, and, above all, the mouthwatering food, make it a true treasure in Little India, Singapore. When you dine here, you embark on a journey to India without leaving the vibrant streets of Singapore.

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Welcome to delightful India right in the middle of Singapore. Located in Race Course road and in the vicinity of Little India this place screams authenticity. The quaint place had nice decor and a good vibe. We had the butter chicken, lady finger vegetable curry, fish tikka, garlic and cheese Naan as well as a starter which was a flatbread filled with a spinach style filling and a curry on the side to dip the bread.  For drinks we had a mango lassi and lime juice. Everything was delicious and the service was delightful and friendly. Recommended to make a reservation as it got quite busy on a Thursday evening.

Excellent dinner at Mustard on Race Course Rd. Restaurant is small and intimate and service is excellent and attentive.  They have a huge menu with tons of choices so we ordered way too much to try many things. Everything was wonderful but especially recommend the house special Chingri Maacher Malai, the Aloo Jhuri, Mutton Biryani and the kathi kababs.

Located in the Little India neighborhood. This restaurant has friendly staff, of which unfortunately not everyone speaks English.

Food menu is extensive and you don't have to wait very long on your food. Not everything was of my personal taste, but I am sure the food was nice. Also enough dessert choices and even typical Indian drinks.

Do note that the air conditioning is very cold here, somewhat too cold (heard the same thing from a co-worker who visited earlier).

Excellent food!

We arrived at opening at 11:30 specifically bent on enjoying authentic Bengali food—we left satisfied and glad we came early!

The waiters are able to make excellent recommendations. We opted to go straight for mains:

- Kosha Mangsho: tender chunks of mutton in a fantastic thicker gravy

- Chingri Maacher Malai Curry: delicate shrimp and coconut curry presented in a tender coconut

- Maacher Paturi: boneless fish fillet smothered in mustard, gently steamed in a banana leaf

Rice bread does not come with each main, and does require separate purchasing. We opted for:
- Luchi: aka puri, lightly fried and crisp
- Roomali Roti: one roti is rather large, and folded in on itself; delicate with a great chew
- Plain white rice

For dessert, we enjoyed Rossomalai (aka Rasmalai), a dessert in most areas of India, but theirs is fragrant and richly flavored with cardamom, almonds, and cream.

All in all, a fantastic visit for those who enjoy Indian food and are looking for something different than what most restaurants serve. They do include Punjabi items in their menu, which is typically what most people think of when they think “Indian,” but venturing off to possibly “unfamiliar” dishes won’t disappoint!

It’s a shame they are not awarded Michelin Star, all the dishes were on point. Highly recommend for anyone wish to taste good authentic Indian cuisine. Try all the signature dishes, all is a hit!
Indian restaurants in Little India.name: Mustard Singapore - Flavours of Bengal & Punjab

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
I love the vadai, it's the tastiest I've ever had and I'm surprised how nice and crisp it is outside, and soft and warm inside. Makes me feel like I've been eating nonsense for a long time. The VIP Thali is also absolutely delicious! Likewise the dosai. Service was o-k, the waiter actually got two out of 5 orders wrong, but was quick to serve us the correct item after that.

Didn't get to try the appam where they make it freshly on the spot. Can't wait to come back here again.

Time to enjoy a nice breakfast with an appam set and a madras tea (small).

Appam was soft on the centre and slightly crispy on the exterior. Served warm. It goes really well with the orange sugar and coconut milk. Madras tea was thick & creamy, and you can add sugar as you need.🫓☕

The place was packed in the morning, but no queue at my time (8.30am, Sunday). Staff seemed busy & stressed (this has been the energies of many people these days as we are undergoing purging collectively). Boss is kind and friendly, quietly came by to top up my orange sugar when I used it up the first round. 🙏🏻

We went for Breakfast on 18th Sept... no rush at all in the restaurant... very pleasant quick service... very friendly... foid taste wise average and can do better I feel specific to break fast... but the people working are there friendly... unfortunately, they are not accepting visa or master card.. maje sure carry a local card or carry cash..  but they accepted inr and so generous. ... we ordered plain idly, sambhar idly, dosa and coffee... dosa is average and can be better... as it is ganesha vinayagar chaturthi and took some idol photos from near shop.

Price: $3.70 (Plain Thosai)

Plain Thosai: 5/5
Thosai was crispy, savoury and had a good sour taste.

Sambar: 5/5
Sambar was flavourful, moreish, hearty and sweet.

Chutney: 4.5/5
Orange chutney was tangy, tomatoey and spicy. White chutney was coconuty and creamy.

Total score: 14.5/15

Add-ons: Madras Coffee ($2.90) was fragrant and milky. Very standard and good filter coffee.

Service was quick and the service staff were very polite and friendly.

The appam is to die for. Coffee was good. The vadai is crispy dosa not bad. Cost around $21. For the coffee and appam I will definitely come back.

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Could not believe this is a Michelin’s recommended place. It’s been a long time since I’ve been here and sadly to say, I’ll not come back again.

I ordered the curry fish head, chicken tikka and chicken biriyani. The expectation of the curry fish head was high but was the biggest disappointment. Not much taste, more towards blend with lots of unnecessary spices. Chicken tikka was not bad but the biriyani was also terrible. Rice was cold and stale.

Let’s come to the service. The server, an Indian guy who took my order was kind of rude and distracted. When taking my order, he was also at the same time talking loudly to other Indian servers. I had to repeat my order thrice. He didn’t seem to be happy working there. He was very uninterested when I asked him a question about the menu and gave the “would u hurry up” face. When he came back with the glasses and water, he slammed it on the table loudly. Only when i stared at him, he retracted back. I didn’t get his name though but I could recognize him. Ironically, the friendliest server was a Chinese lady server that day.

For the price you are paying, it’s definitely not worth it for the food and the service. Both are terrible. The management should do something about most of the servers there. Their attitude seems that they own the restaurant or they are not interested to receive any customers.

I urge anybody or tourist or what’s to visit this restaurant to try other authentic Singapore Indian food elsewhere. You will be getting better food and service elsewhere

Good Indian food here. Fish head curry is a must. Quite a big portion of fish head here. Butter chicken was also good.

It was getting mire crowded at dinner time. Reservation might be required at dinner time. Luckily we came slightly before dinner time.

Price was expensive though. 4 adults cost me SGD 200+

My first visit to this restaurant was a memorable one. The food was remarkably tasty, and the staff’s friendly and attentive nature added an extra touch of warmth. I will definitely be returning for more delightful meals and their top-notch service.

food was very authentic and service was quick. although the pricing will definitely be slightly higher than ur usual indian street spot. this restaurant is well air conditioned and has proper plating and service so price is definitely what you get. staff also abit too eager... clearing plates before we leave the table even. the place wasn't packed so i feel like such etiquette should be rectified to enhance customer experience

22/07/23
Have higher expectations for Michelin restaurants. Fish head curry is average. The curry has full flavour of curry spices but lack of savoury. Curry chicken has similar taste too. Overall food is only slightly above average.

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Apollo Banana Leaf Indian Food is a culinary delight! The Briyani Mutton is a flavor explosion - tender, fragrant, and perfectly spiced. The Tandoori Prawn is a succulent masterpiece, charred to perfection. The vibrant atmosphere and friendly staff enhance the experience. Whether you're a foodie or a spice enthusiast, Apollo is a must-visit for a mouthwatering journey through Indian cuisine. This place is a true gem that satisfies cravings and ignites a love for authentic Indian flavors. Don't miss out on this remarkable culinary adventure!

Went to Banana Leaf for dinner with my colleagues while on a business trip in Singapore, we really enjoyed the authentic Indian food. Our food was served on banana leaves which was a really cool experience plus the food was exceptional and tasty. The service was also good.

Ripoff ! The rice which was supposedly free flow is so expensive!

Give it a try when you are in little India. Our bill was about $100.

We ordered medium fish head curry, tandoori chicken and we got the portion of rice which comes with vegetables and gravy.

Masala tea was bad- skip. Overall a nice experience and you can bring your family and friends if they are from out of town!

However it’s not worthwhile to order the rice if u r not a big eater !

First time at banana leaf on a Friday evening. Atmosphere was great. Gotta say the fish head curry packed a punch with the rich, tangy flavour of the gravy. Perfect match with the biryani rice.

My parents and me were there for lunch, ordered the medium sized curry fish head with briyani rice and lime juice. The curry and side vegetables were flavourful, of acceptable spiciness . Medium size fish head portion was just nice for 3pax. The bill came up to $80+.. Feel that their food is over-priced. Go to them  if u don't mind paying a bit more

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Fantastic Halal place. Very nice food! Staffs and the owner have been very kind and lovely. Very recommended! Hope to come back again soon, I was in Singapore this January

Aroma's is a great place to try out indian food! The owner is extremely warm and enthusiastic and he would recommend special items off the menu if you make specific requests. I have been coming with my family for a year now and have become great friends with the owner.

I would personally recommend to try their chaat (light snack) items as well as the indian-chinese fusion items such as gobi/chicken manchurian. Aroma's also does excellent biryanis which are so well flavoured/seasoned, you would not even need any gravy to accompany it.

I highly recommend all folks to come and give this restaurant a shot! :)

It's our first visit to such a specialty restaurant. We’re not sure if we’ll like it, judging from some of the low reviews. But wait!! We had such a great meal and experience with the owner here!When we first arrived, the signage was pretty small and not so eye-catching among the rows and rows of Indian food along the stretch of shophouses.

The menu was pretty big; we had no idea which to order until the owner approached us and we asked him for some recommendations. Firstly, he recommends some items to see if they suit our taste, and the more he asks, the more he knows about our food preferences.

Surprisingly, when the food came, the curries blew my mind! The different kinds of curry to match with different kinds of carbs are so suitable that they do not overpower each other. They are so flavorful! I specifically recommend the mixed vegetables; they're so flavorful with the briyani! The garlic nann is topped with REAL bits of chopped garlic and fragrant butter. It's so good with the curry the owner recommends! We wanted to order another nann, but we were so full because of the delicious briyani and curry. All the food was served hot and warm.

We were served papadam with a special mix of mint and many other spices and yoghurt green sauce. The sauce is so good that you want to keep dipping in it. He also recommends dipping the fried fish into this sauce. Yum!!

Do not hesitate to ask them for recommendations, as the owner did it very well! We will definitely go back for other dishes, especially butter chicken and prawns.

**This is more of a specialty restaurant than the other Indian food restaurant, which serves large portions of food. According to the owner now, they have only been open for 6 months. Some of the reviews from a year ago were definitely not from the same owner. Give it a try! You’ll not be disappointed.

Recently eating AROMA'S restaurant ,Race course road(near banana leaf appollo) Little India. Mutton Dum biriyani,chicken Dum Briyani ,Gobi manjurian,chicken 65,mushrooms cream soup,baby corn pepper fry,Masala tea taste fantastic and fabulous 👌 👌👌

Perfect respite after a warm morning walking tour of Little India.  Muthu welcomed us, very nice (cool) setting, very cold drinks and the food was great!  We'll be back!

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
As a Chinese Singaporean, I found the dinner to be extremely delectable. Parking can be done nearby in parallel to those shophouses. It was my first time having a South Indian cuisine, I really have no idea what to order so I kindly requested for recommendations and everything was pleasing to my taste bud. The person who took my order yesterday was really patient as well.

Giving my layman description, I’ve ordered meen pollichathu (Marinated spicy boneless fish wrapped in banana leaf), gobi manchurian (fried cauliflower sauteed with special sauce), kozhi porichathu (fried chicken marinated with various spices), porata (its like local roti prata but less oily), fish curry with mango, malabar mutton biriyani, mango lassi (yoghurt drink) and lemon soda. My favourite got to be the gobi manchurian as I have never tasted cauliflower done like this before. Biriyani portion was great for 2 pax sharing or for 1 hungry person, the mutton was yummy as well. Meen Pollichathu needs no explanation as it is one of their best seller and portion is reasonable for their price. The kozhi porchathu was probably my least fav as the chicken felt like its double fried since its a little hard, otherwise the taste is really good. Food were all served within 15mins upon ordering and the temperature was hot (everything is made fresh). Total bill came out to be around ~$87 for 2. I personally think its reasonable as I was extremely full by the end of the dinner and have no stomach for dessert haha.

Would definitely being my Kerala colleagues to try their dishes one day.

This place is special in its way of treating your taste buds with the kerala food in Singapore. The service is good, and the ambiance gives you the picture of the land Kerala.

Went for Onam Sadhya.. all the items served were cold and tasted like cooked in the morning and served for dinner. Taste was also bland and not worth Sadhya. Nothing special in the “Sadhya” served and definitely not worth $24!
Better have Andhra meal at any restaurant, its better taste and value for money.

Amazing food😀!!!. Excellent service. It’s an authentic place to get typical South Indian food.Especially Kerala cuisine. 😋Highly recommend !!!

I've only had lunch meals at this restaurant. The  quality of the meals is inconsistent. When it's good, it's really good.

They offer a lot of meat dishes and only a handful of vegetarian items. But there is enough here to get a good experience of the range and taste of Kerala-food.

Edit: In subsequent visits, the quality further dropped. The vegetarian meals were not served on the banana leaf, the rasam was the worst I've tasted, the puliseri looked pale and was just sweet, the ulli theeyal was too sugary, and everything else was average.
Indian restaurants in Little India.name: Spice Junction

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Honest review: This is the best South Indian or Tamil food (to be specific) restaurant serving non-vegetarian food in Singapore. I don’t think I’ve found anything better.

Service - 9 | Ambience - 7 | Food - 10

The price point is reasonable for the taste and service. The food is super tasty, it is homely and not too oily. The service is quick, doesn’t take too long. The taste is super authentic which I really like! There are a lot of restaurants but the one’s serving food where meat is tender and tasty are few. I would highly recommend this.

Lovely place for some nice South Indian food. I couldn’t pick any single dish as they were all tasty. Loved the sweet and salty lime juice as well. Definitely worth a visit.

1st visit on 4th week of Oct 2023.
We were recommended by Indian friend to try the this restaurant.
Actually craving for nasi briyani but when served,  the taste totally different from North India briyani. It was spicy taste only, no fried onions and tumeric fragrance.. we cannot get use to it.
Sorry to say only alacart rice cost $7.50, with only spicy taste, is not worth to eat.
Other dishes, masala lady fingers and chicken tasted normal.
Fish with mango sauce tasted so so, served with a inner hidden shallow container with only few pcs of fish meat also not worth to eat..

I think the only best dishes go to the 6 pcs grill prawns but pricy..

The crab rasam was awesome. Delish vegetarian meals especially the spicy sour curry(Vatthe kolumbe). Must try. The pepper mutton, onion eggs and lollipops chicken was alright.

Had a craving for South Indian food so I came here. Hands down one of the best restaurants in the little India area. The ample use of curry leaves and coconut in the curries really show that Indian food is more than just being spicy. Of course, if you would like a spicy kick, order the karaikudi chicken masala. The parottas, although they look small are filling and flaky. Overall a really good experience, friendly servers, quick service and delicious food.

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Awesome dining experience. It’s outdoors and has a wonderful street side dining vibe. 100% recommended. Value for money. Great lamb curry and butter chicken and super crispy prata! They also do catering so might think of engaging them in future.

Overall food tasted average. Biryani was dry. Chicken Momo stuffing was dry and veg momo was salty. Rumali roti was good. Chilli prawn was better compared to all other items. Service was good and faster.

The food is great! Service was great, sadly the atmosphere wasn’t good, it was pretty hot even during dinner, PS. their chicken 65 is basically chicken tenders

I’m speechless. This restaurant is really amazing. The taste is even better than my imagination. And the staff is very kindly. A really must go restaurant. I highly recommend the chicken pepper dry 🌶️.

I've been frequenting this restaurant for more than 15 years and it has never disappointed me. Staff are always friendly and its a nice place to enjoy good beer!

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
My heartful recommendation for Biriyani lovers.
The most authentic taste I have ever tried in Singapore. The best 👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼👌🏼👌🏼👌🏼

Must try
Biriyani
Nenju elumbu
Mutton thokku

I almost finished food before taking a pic 🤣

An oldie and a goodie. Returned to Muthiah for the first time in a couple of years and had, as always, a fabulous lunch. Their ability to make every little item from the mOr to the filter coffee incredibly flavorful is uncanny. We have been frequenting this unassuming but outstanding restaurant since the 90s.

I order one vegi meals and one non vegi the taste is very poor too spicy and price is too high they need to improve their food quality and taste I very disappointed to eat

Best South indian home cooked food in singapore. 5 stars to the warm and amicable staff who keep checking in for next servings or if the food is OK.

And the best part? They are old school. No menus! So if u wanna treat ur taste buds to real humble authentic South Indian thali, head over here!

Came here for a quick bite. Ordered 2 vadais and a cup of tea.

The vadais are so worth every single dollar. Nice soft fluffy texture and crispy on the outside. Goes really well with the tomato chutney.

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Best and complete Indian cuisine. The usual go to restaurant, especially for family outings and having guests from abroad. Spacious, tasty foods and great service. But today, it's Take Away for a home party and the ever reliable Mr Ravi ensured our orders are all good and his staff are attentive to our requests. Halal certified and so many to choose from.

Had been a regular customer here. Overall food is good despite the food standard now and than has some issues. Price wise I think there's some increase. I think it's fine but the service has to improve too for it to reflect on the price increase. Hope the management will make sure the service gets better. Otherwise may not patronize anymore. Overall, price is competitive but like I said, service has to be competitive, otherwise risk of losing genuine customers. Food can be improved too, there is some drop in the food taste and standard as well.

Incredibly fresh fish head curry and amazing side dishes which pleased me and my friends.

Very grateful for Ravi’s very friendly and superb service which made the visit a joyfilled and pleasant one.

Sakunthala never fails me! The Briyani Mutton is a flavor explosion - tender, fragrant, and perfectly spiced. The Butter chicken is a succulent masterpiece, charred to perfection.

The vibrant atmosphere and friendly staff enhance the experience (But sometimes it gets really busy). Whether you're a foodie or a spice enthusiast, Sakunthala is a must-visit for a mouthwatering journey through Indian cuisine. This place is a true gem that satisfies cravings and ignites a love for authentic Indian flavors. Don't miss out!

My visit to Sakunthalas Restaurant was a culinary delight. I ordered the chicken biriyani, and it exceeded my expectations in every way. The portion was generous, and the flavors were simply amazing. The biriyani was perfectly cooked and had an enticing aroma that made every bite a treat for the senses.

To complement the meal, I tried their lime soda, and it's an absolute must-try. The refreshing citrusy flavor provided a perfect balance to the rich and savory biriyani.

The service at Sakunthalas Restaurant was not only quick but also remarkably friendly. The staff's warm hospitality added to the overall positive dining experience.

If you're in search of a place that serves delectable biriyani, offers refreshing beverages like lime soda, and provides top-notch service, Sakunthalas Restaurant should be on your list. I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Food tastes great. It's affordable and the location is prime. Level 1 has bar and casual eating whereas Level 2 consists of family dining space. Service could be improved though it was fast & quick. The atmosphere is average. Must try chaats here.

Dishes were fantastic and the staffs are super friendly, one of the best northern Indian cuisine I had in a while. Very comfortable atmosphere too.

See the photos for yourself; portion is generous and full of ingredients. Very wide selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages too! I guarantee you’ll will be satisfied.

10/10 will definitely come back again!

Amazing food!! Indians must try this place for sure. From main course to snacks, everything was just delicious 👌🏻

If you are someone who is looking to taste authentic North Indian cuisine than this place is right fit for you. We tried their special arbi kabab and it was really nice.

Wonderful ambience, great food and super courteous staff.  Value for money and fantastic bistro with a western feel and amazing north Indian tandoori food.  Very highly recommended

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Al-Bismi is right across where I now worked. I usually tried their plain crispy prata for breakfast on Sundays before serving in church. Today, decided to try again their chicken tikka briyani. They did not disappoint as the food taste as good as it looks!
The briyani bismatic rice is cooked lightly with spices without the heavy, oily fare that you get at the Tekka market stalls. The red fiery looking chicken tikka is nicely marinated and barbequed, yet remains tender. Kudos to the cooks, one of whom was seen observing me as I dug happily into the briyani! All these down with iced limau drink makes the meal complete

This restaurant in Dickson Rd opens 24 hrs. I tried Mutton Biryani, Thai Schezwan noodles and Aloo Paratha for the main course. The taste was really delicious and uplifted my mood. Then I had Milo Dinosaur drink which was extremely tasty and gave a final touch to this beautiful dinner. This place is vibing with people across the street and tourists. The waiter was a good guy and helped me try the best dishes. Must go here if you are living nearby. Highly recommend!

I had a training course nearby so I had my lunch here for 4 days. The food is great! I tried briyani on 2 days and the teh halia was good! Always had seats and the staff served quite fast!

Order 1 is enough for 3 persons. Taste is good, big portion too. Near our hostel.

Love my deep-fried crunchy poori ,and go so well with the savoury curry.
Beriyani rice is aromatic & flavoursome. The set comes with tender mutton,mild spicy curry,hard-boiled egg, and papadom.
Quite a generous portion for 1 person.

For drink, we get ourselves a cup of warm mild sweet tea limau! Super refreshing!

We spend less than $20 for 2 person ,quite a reasonable price 👍
Will definitely come again

Indian restaurants in Little India.name: Al-Bismi Restaurant

Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
Walked into this long standing restaurant on Racecourse Road for small bites. The chef and Helen did not disappoint.

The bhajias (deep fried fritters of plantain, potato and onion) and the chilli Bajji (green chillies deep fried in batter), Chickpeas masala and papadams were served hot off the stove and disappeared in seconds.

A big thank you to Helen and Mohit who took care of us.

Thank you for the great experience.

Great place to have authentic North Indian food in Singapore.
The place is managed by Raveena , a very courteous and welcoming person with his husband.
The taste of food was great.
Had my birthday dinner.
Large variety of drinks and food is available.

Must visit for Indian cuisine😀

My son went to a new Indian eatery recently with friends and told us about it when he got home. He was singing praises for the food he had, especially the butter chicken, so it was only fitting the family gave it a try. We went over for lunch here. Parking the car was horrendous, but the moment we sat down, ordered our food and ate, all the parking frustrations left us.
The staff were attentive and great at what they do. The food was the coup de grace for the meal. Everything they served was great, and trust me; we've had our fair share of Indian food! What I especially liked was the fact that we could taste the spice seasoning without being overwhelmed by it. The flavours were just right! It was a great meal for us!

Delicious North Indian food served consistently over the last 20 years.

I’ve dined in and catered from this restaurant for my birthday party. Every guest I bring to the restaurant or taste the food at my home is amazed by how delicious North Indian cuisine can be.

Prior to COVID 19, they used to be a popular food destination with the crew of a tier 1 European airline. The crew would pre-order a specific cashew based curry for their flight back home. Impressive.

Must tries if it is your first time there: Chicken Malai Tikka, Cheese Kulcha, garlic naan, any briyani, palaak saag (chicken with creamed spinach), baingan bharta (mashed roasted eggplant), baingan bajardi (pardon the spelling. Fried eggplant with spices) and the Kashmiri naan, a sweet dessert naan stuffed with dried fruits used in fruit cake. Even fruit cake haters became fans of it.

Sure, by all means, order the butter chicken which is also good. But do try the rogan josht or look for that dish with the cashew gravy (forgot the name).

Service is good and the seating is comfortable. Do expect that the waiting time for food will be longer during peak hours or when you notice that there are several other tables that have not gotten their food. One pro-tip is to place your order upfront to avoid delays from the kitchen.

Curries were greasy and not cooked like you would expect. Paneer tasted like mock meat. Navratna korma had chilies??
Actual order had less Naans than paid for so felt cheated. No one answers the phone.
