Indian restaurants in Little India.reviews:
No nonsense, delicious, and less than $6! I didn't know what I was doing, but I was seated at a table and I agreed to eat what the other guy at the table was eating: the vegetarian lunch. It was absolutely delicious and surprisingly filling. They serve extra rice and curry if you're really hungry. Some of the guys there were doing that. I did also see a woman eating there.

One of the few Pure Vegetarian South Indian Thali restaurant in Little India. Very hygienic and friendly atmosphere. Taste just like the home. Must visit place. Serving thali only in the afternoon and rest of the items entire day.

Go here for breakfast. Got here around 8am, ordered the paper dosa and my wife had the roast masala dosa, with chutneys. They also offered us what they described as a doughnut which was good but not sweet.

To order, go straight back to the counter, order, and wait for your food before sitting. It is self service once you’ve picked up your food.

My wife wanted a mango lassi but they said they wouldn’t have them until probably 10am.

South Indian meal of good quality and reasonable price. They server yellow dal which is I like (served in Maharashtra at few residences).
I had a meal twice there and quality is consistent.
You need to reach early to avoid the crowd on week ends.

Worth Trying.

I would definitely return for their food menu as it was packed at 11:30am Sunday. Cash. About 10 person deep line.

Mango Lassi was fresh, tangy and sweet. Very balanced mango vs yogurt flavour. $3.

Cash.

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
Been wanting to try for weeks not easy to get a reservation online, either it's full or the remaining timings were quite weird.
Finally booked a lunch on a public holiday and secured a table. Initially wondering why the place was so empty when I arrived but after a while it was totally packed.
A little confusing on the menu because the physical one outside the shop had dinner menu and lunch menu and the electronic one only had lunch. Not sure if could only order from the lunch menu tab but upon asking could order from anywhere from the menu. There were duplicate dishes on ala carte and lunch menu because portion size was smaller and it comes with a set of soup and rice.
Ordered quite a few items to try, the most important thing I wanted to try was the marinated raw crab and we also ordered the galbi along with some other dishes like seafood pancake and kimchi stew.
Everything here was good, from the sides to the mains. The galbi was cooked by the staff and it was cooked to perfection. Raw crab was also nice and flavourful and well marinated.
Bill came and it was slightly expensive but definitely worth for the quantity and the quality. Would definitely come back again!

The newly revamp joint has a real modern touch. Service is absolutely amazing. Food quality is top notch. Many tables was having the raw crab. Looks good however didn’t dare to try. Seafood pancake was delicious & they don’t skimp on the ingredients. Btw the steam egg is FOC. Every table has it. We wanted to order however the waitress explained they will provide every table with one.
Highly recommended.

First time trying Guiga and I’m so glad we did! Everything from service to food was perfect. I loved the beef tartare and marinated crabs❤️ We got the Black Pork set with a side of beef ribs and the samgyetang, which is by far the tastiest I’ve had in Singapore. We didn’t quite enjoy the steamed egg, maybe cos we let it sit there for too long because we were busy eating up the feast we ordered!  We will definitely be back!

the food here was great and the kimchi was a hit! the pasta salad side dish was also yummy. Ronnie’s service was veryyy sweet and the top-ups on the side dishes were very very generous!

Reservations are recommended. When we visited on a Saturday for lunch, the place was packed.

The pork was good. The staff isn't very interactive or smiley, but they are quite helpful when it comes to grilling the meat.

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
Great tasting Korean BBQ meat! We decided to try this restaurant among the many others along Tanjong Pagar area. Came around 6:30pm and it was fairly quiet and managed to get a seat. But the place was getting crowded shortly.

Attentive and very fast service. The banchans were replenished once we finished some of them.
The meats were of good quality!
Will definitely be back again!

TLDR: Will return

Type: Korean BBQ

Waiting Time: None at 7pm on a Thursday. Food took 10 minutes to arrive from the time we got a table and ordered.

Must Try (‼️): The meat in BBQ Set C - Beef Brisket, Marinated Beef Rib, Marinated Chicken - delicious and good value at $79.80 before tax and service charges // The shredded cabbage salad with black sesame dressing banchan.

Service: Good - the service staff was polite but the chicken was left on the grill for too long.

Note: The restaurant’s ventilation system isn’t great - the smoke will get absorbed into your clothes and hair.

The food is great, excellent customer service, banchan is delicious, so happy to try their Ganjang Gejang.We had a great dinner at Supulae Korean BBQ, thank you very much, definately will be back again.

Supposed to go to another outlet across the road for korean bbq but the queue was too long. Ended up in this restaurant.
Nice refreshing sides.
The meat are delicious and the sauces are what you will experience in korea.
Staff are prompt in getting the meat bbq for you.
Best of all, nice ventilation system as the restaurant is not smokey compared to other outlets.
Ordered their Supulae set

Ordered Set B which comprised chicken and pork. Selected kimchi stew as the side which was disappointing : diluted soup with cabbage and eggs with a hint of kimchi taste and red colouring. Steamed egg was plain steamed egg with no garnishes. Half half pancake was too mushy  with flour inside. Standard had dropped significantly since my last visit a few years ago. The sides tasted like they came out of a packet. Liked the finely shredded cabbage with black sesame sauce though. I think the restaurant has room for improvement if it wants to stand out from the heaps of similar options along this street.  Supulae has been around longer than the rest of the Korean bbq restaurants here and it should do better on their dishes. There is certainly fierce competition but Supulae needs to only not stinge on the quality then Ioyal customers like me will come back.

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
We visited this place for 3-4times. And tried different dishes. The restaurant is ran by Korean. It is authentic Korean cuisine. The atmosphere is chill and cozy. Our favorite food is the spicy chicken feet pot and the beef rib soup.
The panchan판찬there are also nice and the waiter and waitress are responsive. Just that sometime they get really busy.
It would be really lovely to go there for a sip of the hot soup on a rainy and cold morning.
Really like this place a lot.

overall a popular place with good options of home cooking style Korean food, better to have more than 3people sharing , portion is big for 2 person, you may only get a chance to try 1 or 2 type of food. The pork and chicken dishes are big portion. Chicken feet comes with steam egg and rice balls, it’s a good combination and good to share.
Came at around 630pm on a Friday evening, it started to get very busy from 7pm.

Came here on a Wednesday night at 7 p.m., and no reservations were needed. I have walked past this restaurant a few times, but I was more familiar with their nostalgic cultural Korean decorations. They moved recently to a new area along the same stretch, and it's so minimalistic now... A lot more space is catered for diners, with rooms for big groups. Side dishes was pretty okay only. Toilet is huge too!

💧 Water is complimentary

We ordered:

🐔 Jjimdak ($55)
Braised chicken in dark sauce, this dish is one of my favourites in korea. And this standard is pretty okay! Huge portion that feeds at least 4 people. Chicken could have been braised longer to have more flavour. The japchae noodles at the bottom soak up a lot of sauce, so it's quite filling, along with potatoes and carrots.

I rate: 3.5/5 🌟

🍃 Minari Jun ($28)
1st time trying Minari, and we were surprised how fresh this vegetable pancake tasted. It didn't have a celery scent and tasted rather clean. Quite flat as well. Would like it if it's bigger.
I rate: 4.5/5 🌟

🍶 Pine Nut Draught Wine ($28)
The way it's served is pretty interesting! In a small vat with a wooden scoop into a shallow bowl. It was a little gassy and had a faint, nutty sweet aftertaste.

I rate: 4/5 🌟

This place serves very authentic Korean food. Although traditional bbq was available, no one was having that as the standout are the Korean cooked dishes. It's quite close to the Korean food I had in Korea last year. The standout is the braised short ribs. It's so tender and meat falls off the bone easily. Pair the rice with the braised sauce and it's heavenly. The radishes and carrots were so yummy too. 2nd best was the assorted pancakes. It was like no other I had tried before. There were fish, mushroom, prawns and it's so all very special. It really fills you up too. The place was not very closely packed where you're sitting shoulder to shoulder and tables well spaced apart, unlike some other Korean restaurants here. The restroom are also very clean.

Went for an early dinner and was given a spacious seat for our family of 4. Ordered the barbecued pork belly and beef. They will actually sliced the meat and barbecue the meat for you so that you don’t have to actually do it yourself. Ordered the beef bulgogi for the kids and the kids loved it. Not too many of non spicy options for kids though. Kimchi pancake tasted great while the cold noodles were quite soggy. Overall prices are on the higher side, especially the barbecued meats. Service can be improved, cos we waited quite long for the rice to be ready and there wasn’t anyone to inform us that we have to wait for the rice.
Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.name: Todamgol Restaurant
Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.query: Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
After a few turns, I decided to try this place because of the reviews. Dun get me wrong, but my experience with the food is just, like I say just ......will I be back.... there's plenty other places to try. The set I ordered was JUST, the side dishes 😔 but the bean paste soup is really good. I have eaten Korean food before the craze. Maybe it's better to  get à la carte. The service is tops.

Restaurant That Are Actually Worth Waiting In Line For !!

Excellent service, staff were all very friendly and helpful and the service was fast too. More than anything, the food was super delicious.

A restaurant I really want to recommend to Local And Korean.

My preferred spot for satisfying my Korean food cravings!

Their kimchi soup is not only incredibly delicious but also delightfully thick. The steamed egg is a real treat too.

The best part? The attentive waiter who expertly handles the grilling of all the raw foods, from pork slices to chicken slices, allowing you to relish the meal without constant grill-checking.

The only challenge is their generous portions; the set meal is quite large for two people, even for a couple like us.

On busy weekends, expect a decent wait with a long queue, but it moves surprisingly fast. We arrived around 7 pm and waited approximately 30 minutes for dinner.

Despite that, I'll undoubtedly return whenever the Korean BBQ cravings strike!

The food is good, there are varieties of meat including marinated and non marinated. Server will help to cook the food for you. They provide lots of sides (7 when I counted). Had Set C which was a combination of pork and beef and complimentary steamed egg with roe and choice of soup. Only thing is the waiting time cos it could be 2 hrs and above and dining time was 90mins.

Had dinner at this restaurant and definitely the top 3 Korean BBQ restaurant in Singapore 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

This gem offers good quality meat which surely justify the money paid! Their pork was tender, fresh and no gamy smell at all. Their banchan were all very delicious except for the fish cake which was too tough and thick.

Steam egg is good, well seasoned and below was charred on point! 👍🏻 The naengmyeon was icy cold and the broth is flavourful but not too overpowering. And it goes so well with the meat.

They provide excellent service, staff were all very friendly and helpful and the service was fast too!one thing amazed me most is the staff will keep asking if your side dishes need to be refill which you don’t see it anywhere.

The atmosphere is pleasant and with Korean staff and their warm welcome, it will bring you to Korea instantly. 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
Fun place for fried chicken and beers. Loved the ice cream beer (aka frozen foam). Very neat concept. The chicken was great - you can get almost anything deboned which is awesome. I think we liked the cheese the best, but the garlic soy was lovely as well.

I went there on a quiet Monday night, and the place was pretty empty. A perfect spot for a relaxed catch-up.

We ordered two half chicken dishes - Yangnyeom & Soy Garlic flavour, along with a japchae. The chicken surprised us with its light, crispy batter and tasty sauces. The japchae, on the other hand, was okay and also had a rather small portion size.

Overall, I'd recommend this place for a casual weekday dinner with friends 👍

Tasty chicken and light cooling beer soju. Special ice cream beer. Good place for friends to hangout after work. Not so crowded during weekdays

We randomly chanced upon this when searching for good Korean food on Google so we decided to come here for dinner. Although we made reservations, it seems like the restaurant is relatively quiet during weekday nights (we came on a Tuesday night) - but nevertheless just make reservations in case things change!

We ordered a bowl of Jjamppong and got the original fried chicken to share (attached is the menu to see the different options). Portion is decent but the food was SUPER good! Honestly, the chicken batter was perfect and it was neither too oily or salty for our liking. The jjamppong wasn't too spicy or bland - just the right balance too. They even had a decent serving of seafood.

There was only one service staff member at that time and she was super professional and smiley when taking our orders and paying the bill. The overall vibes was really cool too, with Korean music playing in the background (not too loud so you can have proper conversations without shouting at the top of your voice). All in all, I would 10/10 recommend anyone looking for good authentic Korean food in Tanjong Pagar. It is a short walk from both Outram Park and Tanjong Pagar MRT stations.

Original boneless chicken with onion sauce ($24++ = $28) - 2.5 stars
Enough for one person though I'm probably not a bit eater. But this made me question whether KFC really is just overpriced Kentucky Fried Chicken. The chicken was kind of ordinary, although I imagine it had more meat than you'd find at Kentucky FC (and I haven't been there in years). But the issue was probably the onion sauce, which tasted like fairly artificial and processed mustard. I much preferred the fresh Pico de gallo-like onion sauce at Chir Chir. Would not pay $28 for this again.

======

Boneless chicken with sweet and spicy and rice cakes - 4.5 stars
The boneless chicken was juicer than the bone-in chicken surprisingly. My husband, who usually prefers the latter said he would just order the boneless chicken the next time. It was my second time having Korean fried chicken - given that the last time I had something similar was probably KFC popcorn chicken decades ago, I was pleasantly surprised that there was ample meat and not just a bunch of fried batter. I liked this sauce better than the soy garlic one but it was definitely sweet and towards the end I didn't quite enjoy the sweetness. We got the medium and it was larger than we expected.

Soy garlic 6 piece - 4.25 stars
Sweet sauce and could barely taste the garlic.

Good place for Korean fried chicken, but personally I think the sauces are too sweet for me.
Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.name: Twins Korean Restaurant
Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.query: Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
Simply overpriced for the food standard and their service.

We ordered JabChae, Seafood pancake, Soontofu soup, LA Galbi, and Bulgogi.

JabChae taste good but a bit too sweet.
Seafood pancake, they use too much flour and not cook enough. Too thick and still sticky inside.

Soontofu taste normal.
Bulgogi is also normal.
LA Galbi is taste good but too expensive for it.

Service also not good. Need so long to get staff’s attention to order. Even when we ask them to top up their side, eventually they didn’t do it.
Plus they should instruct soontofu comes with rice.

Overall, to be honest, I really don’t understand why Google review is over 4.
All dishes are overpriced for the quality.
There is a lot of good Korean food with reasonable price.

With three branches scattered across the island, this restaurant is renowned for its stellar tofu soup. You can take your pick from various proteins like beef, pork, or seafood. While there are alternative dishes like bibimbap or bulgogi for non-tofu enthusiasts, honestly, why would you venture here if not for the soothing allure of tofu soup? It's a must-try, deeply satisfying, and my friends who joined me even confessed that they occasionally sneak in for a solo, heartwarming meal.

Famous chain from Korea. I reviewed the Millenia Walk outlet which is for dinner which i love. I came to this outlet for Lunch. Super crazy weekday lunch crowd. I was disappointed with my order of beef offal soup. The whole soup is so thick and chunky. I barely finished it. The price point is too high for a weekday lunch. I rather do dinner. The restaurant has no lack of fans. Always long queue even for weekday lunch.

I have been too all 3 outlets and I personally find that this outlet staff are more friendly. First tip, try to make advance booking. I did via Chope. Very long queue during dinner time. Chope has got good deals too. Their portion is very big. I suggest if you have 2 pax, just order 1 combo and 1 side. The corn tea is very refreshing. After a hearty meal, they give free yakult. Yummy

Very expensive tofu.

But I’ll have to say that the Dumpling
Soontofu by SBCD Korean Tofu House is really good! Although the serving is very small for my tummy 😅, the soup is  packed with flavour, mildly spicy and most importantly, served piping hot. The soup goes very well with the short grain rice. I also like the Kimchi pancake  which is pan fried to slightly charred.

Overall, dinner at SBCD is a pleasant experience.

📍 SBCD Korean Tofu House 📍 7 Wallich St, B1 - 01 / 02 Guoco Tower, S078884

#tiramisooojiaks #jiakjiakjiak #sgfoodie #sbcd #soontofu #kimchipancake #dumplingkimchisoup #guocotower

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.name: SBCD Korean Tofu House
Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.query: Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
The Korean BBQ experience was truly authentic, featuring a variety of trays for grilling meat. The assortment of meat flavors and generous portions were impressive. While it might be a bit on the expensive side, the fact that the staff personally cooks for you makes it entirely worthwhile.

The staff members were not only friendly but also knowledgeable about which options would best suit your taste buds.

Will definitely be coming back again.

TLDR: May return for the beef only

Type: Korean BBQ

Waiting Time: 30min at 7pm on a Friday. Food took 10 minutes to arrive from the time we got a table and ordered.

Must Try (‼️): The meat in BBQ Set D - Ribeye, Boneless Beef Ribs, Beef Short Ribs - very flavourful

Good to Try (❗️): Bean Paste Stew - decent // Steamed Egg - decent

Don’t Try (❌): Cold Noodles - noodles needed another rinse as they were too starchy and the broth was bland // Kimchi Pancake - bland, thin, chewy and greasy

Service: Excellent - staff was polite and grilled the meat properly. They also gave us hangover tonic (see last picture), which was a nice touch.

Note: The restaurant can get smoky and the smoke will get absorbed into your clothes and hair.

Ordered BBQ set A with bean paste soup and a bowl of cold noodles. The service staff is very hospitable and polite despite them being super busy during dinner time. Deducting 1 star because the meat has a very smokey flavour after grilling on top of charcoal for a long time. The smokey flavour is not really my thing but idk you might like it. The ban chan selection is also not a lot. On the other hand, I really liked the bean paste soup though, it’s very umami and addictive. The cold noodles are very refreshing, I really liked it

Towards the end and round the corner of the Korean restaurant stretch at Tanjong Pagar, not that easy to find tbh but it was fairly quiet on a weekday evening and meats were of pretty good quality! Seafood pancake and cold noodles were AMAZING. Would come back for sure.

Ordered the pork belly and pork collar, both were tender but liked the texture of the pork collar more.

The kimchi cold noodle was surprisingly good, very refreshing. While for the seafood pancake, it tasted normal (can skip)

Also would like to thanks the service crew for their excellent service. They were attentive and helped to bbq the meat even during peak period.

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
First time here and was shocked with the enthusiastic greetings from the staff.

Table was prepared with dishes to compliment the food and more side dishes came along after ordering.

Ordering process was easy with just a QR code scanner. Food was awesome and we love how friendly and attentive our server Mr Shin Young Wook and another staff that grilled our meat for us.

I definitely feel so welcome here and will only come back here for Korean BBQ in the future !

Compliments to all the staff !

Endured more than an hour-long wait but was worth it. Though what I didn't understand about the queue is that we were asked to wait for 15 minutes and then it became more than 30 minutes. I am not sure if the one who manages the queue was tired or what. But so many groups are coming in and and I kept checking the status of my queue and it always says 1 group ahead of us. But every time someone comes in, we are never called so we ended up waiting longer. Minus one for service because of this. I do understand that we were late for around 5 minutes as we didn't here the call for the waitlist but he shouldn't have told us to wait for a certain amount and not be able to deliver it for us.

But overall, experiencing the wait firsthand, I finally get why there's a line for this spot. Meat was succulent and the rice balls are absolutely explosive in flavour. The must order from their menu. We didn't get to try jjajang coz it was a bit too much for 2 pax already.

The variety and generous portions of side dishes were plenty to satisfy me, so no need to go overboard with the ordering just like we did. Lesson learned. 😅 I am actually already very contented with just their side dishes.

The service was also very fast and genuine. You can really feel that the staff are accommodating you depsite the busy schedule. They are very attentive and cooks the food for you very well.

Out of all the Korean restaurants in Singapore I've been to, the staffs are most kindest!! The meat is so fresh and everything from the side dishes that I could refill at any time was perfect 😋 Other than the meat, the food is so delicious!! It's a restaurant that makes me want to go every day 🫶🏻

The food was delicious.. specially the bbq (Prime beef), it was really darn nice and juicy!!

The tofu stew was spicy with the right kick for taste bud..

The flying fish roe with rice was delicious and yummy!!!

Total satisfaction!!! Every item is good, Jajangmyeon, Cheese Seafood Pancake, and BBQ Pork Collar is a must.
Food is fresh and full of umami. Kudos to the staff for being friendly and helpful. They even grill our pork to perfection and always ask what we need next.
The atmosphere is cozy and surprisingly the temperature is cold and comfortable despite it being a Barbecue restaurant.
Last but not least, the food portion is generous too at the price we're paying, I would say it's affordable.

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
A good place to have casual Korean BBQ and dishes.

The Korean pancake is crispy.
Pork belly cut is nice.

Affordable buffet prices starting at $29.50 for weekday and plus $5 on weekends.

They don't charge GST which is a plus point.

Reservation is recommended as the place is fully booked.

The toilet is wet and has bad ventilation.
Hope the owner can spruce up the toilets so the overall dining experience can improve...

Amazing and value for money korean buffet at around $32 only! The beef short plate and pork belly was extremely nice. Second time back here. Service was really good too. Buffet comes with free flow of side dishes, free flow of steam eggs and also a top up for the cheese option for just $5! Hope prices and standard remains the same! Love this place

Had the buffet for dinner and it was super good! Meats are all thick cuts and super juicy. Marinaded well and not too salty. Staff was very attentive and fast, always helping to change the grill top. Great space and very good ventilation! We look forward to visiting again and trying other food!

Was looking for a Korean barbecue place in Tanjong Pagar and narrowed down on this option out of many others.

Arrived at around 8:30PM on a weekday, only 4-5 tables occupied.

Staff is friendly and warm. We decided to go a-la-Carte and ordered spicy chicken, soya chicken and pork belly for our barbecue. We also ordered a kimchi pancake.

Side dishes include radish, kimchi, garlic, coleslaw, chilli, tofu etc. Kimchi was pretty good.

All items are fresh. Staff helped us in barbecuing the items well. We really liked the spicy chicken, the sauce added a great taste. Meat was soft.

Good place for Korean barbecue cravings.

This is the place if you are a meat person. We went for the buffet which was value for money. Add $5 per pax for weekends and public holiday. Service was attentive and the lady bosses were friendly too. The buffet offers 7 types of meat. We don’t enjoy the Bulgogi. Go for the beef short plate, pork belly and soya chicken galbi instead. We had 3 rounds and were full. After payment, do help yourselves to complimentary Yakult alike probiotic drinks.

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
Highly recommended to try if you are looking for authentic korean food in Singapore.

They have renovated the restaurant. I love that we have sit at a semi private corner. There are many configurations for seating area. I saw a group of 15 pax gathering and yet we are able to enjoy our dinner without disturbing each other. Food is amazing and authentic.

Nice Korean restaurant around Outram area. It's one of the most authentic Korean restaurants in the central. Love the attitude of the owner and staffs. Excellent service and yummy food. We tried L.A Cut Marinated Beef, Pork Belly, Kimchi Pancake and Steam Egg. All is so yummy. Also, the complementary side dishes are refillable. Highly recommended 👍

Quite authentic Korean food! Portion is good too. Not many people on a weekday, so you can spend a good time with your friends without getting pressured to leave early. It’s pricier compared to other Korean stores nearby, but I will still go back just because there isn’t much people in the store.

Great authentic Korean spot! Loved their meat cuts and side dishes! A great spot to chill and relax as well. Slightly on the pricier side but the portion sizes were great! Definitely coming back here to try their stews as well.

Came here without any reservation on a sat night. The restaurant is not full. The staffs are very friendly. The lady helped to bbq for us and checked to make sure we bbq it right and didn’t over cooked. The pork jowl and wagyu beef are good. The susagues are yummy too. Everything else is perfect. The food is reasonably priced compare to other Korean bbq restaurant. We enjoyed our meal there. Just need to be prepared that your clothes will be full of smell after the meal. Haha
Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.name: Hongdae Korean Restaurant
Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.query: Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
First time visiting base on Google search recommendations.
Great food, great service by a young Chinese staff who guided how to enjoy the dishes. We order set B BBQ and seafood pancake. The portion is enough for me & 2 ladies friends. The staff keep coming to check out if we needed to refill side dishes. Very generous.
Will come back to try the cold noodles.

Went on a Friday late evening and thankfully it wasn't too crowded. Ordered the mixed meat set and Kimchi pancake that comes with fluffy steamed egg and seafood tofu stew. The meat was fresh and juicy but I think could do better with a bit more flavour. Love the "spacious" grill where the food could be cooked properly. Service and cooking skill of the staff was good! Variety of side dishes was great too

The food is good but the service quality is even better. Every time we visit, the restaurant is full and wait time for a big group is usually around 40-60 mins. However, once you get in, you are immediately served and the staff are very attentive. I love the cold noodle, steamed egg, and marinated premier beef here ...very tasty. Always come back whenever I crave for Korean BBQ

This is my second time visiting and it’s still as good! I absolutely love the food and service here. The generousity when it came to the portions and the food that is cooked by the staff. All of them seem very well trained and very prompt with their service. I’m very impressed and amazed to find such good service in a Korean bbq place. It definitely sets itself apart from the rest. I like the sides such as cheesy corn and the mash potato and bean sprouts. I will be back again!

Charim is always my go-to for Kbbq in Tanjong Pagar area. The service and food has always been consistent from all of my visits. I decided to do a takeout today and was pleasantly surprised when the staff handed me my stew, with this generous serving of side dishes.

Thank you for the great customer service!

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
One of the best Korean Contemporary dining I had. The food was amazing and great recommendations from the Head Chef! Ideal to bring your friends, colleagues and loved ones. Each bite of the food was just melting in my mouth. Highly recommended.

Was there with my friends to celebrate my birthday. We ordered a few dishes, and all was very good, especially the Black Bean Mascarpone, Bossam, Galbi Jjim, Dwaeji Ppyeo Deungsim, Abalone Gim Pasta and the Strawberry bingsu. These are the most try dishes.

Food was really good! If you’re a fan of beef tartare, you HAVE to try this. Enjoyed a burst of flavours for this one.

The octopus was really good too, could be charred a bit more but the meat was soo tender and yummy.

Seabass rice was yummy and had a pretty generous serving, though I thought the price was a little steep.

Service was great! The guy who served us was very attentive and had very good mannerisms.

Atmosphere was a little underwhelming, especially the choice of music but not a biggie. Maybe I was just expecting something a little more fancy but it turned out to be a pretty casual place with people wearing flip flops.

We went for a birthday celebration in a big group.  The food is good.  However, towards the end, we struggle to finish, thus affecting overall dining experience.

Like a lot of restaurants,  the staff lacks training in taking orders. Recommendations and estimation how much to order is actually an important skill for a good dining experience which many owners overlook.

The place is a gem. The food was amazing. I don't remember the name of the dishes but you can refer to the pictures. The kimchi with tufo and sourdough was my favourite starter. The balance between sweet salt and creamy is divine. This crispy seafood pancake also hits the spot. The crunch was perfect. The fried oysters were amazing as well. For the mains I had the seabass with burnt rice. It's great for ppl who likes caypot rice or bimbimbap. The flavour is obviously different that those dishes but the elements are similar. The many ingredients mix with crunchy rice. We also had the Abalone pasta which is refreshing if you like a cold main dish. Will visit again to try other stuff. The service staff was good as well.

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
Late night chicken & beer. We use to go to Chicken Up but as they are closed we tried a new place. Overall the chicken is quite fresh & crispy the biggest issue is that even the spicy sauce is sweet. Noodles were good too & had a nice balance of sweet & savoury. Overall ok, not our favourite chicken place but good for late night fix.

Nice ambience. Order Chicken with cheese. It has lots of spicy tteokbokki which tasted really good. Fried chicken tasted so so, the battered is too thick, seaweed rice ball has so much rice but too little ingredients to mix with. Side dishes and jar of green tea (diluted) were given free. Steamed egg is nice. Picked up free ice cream as you exit. The price here is on the high side. Menu has wide variety.

Was missing korea, but too busy to travel. Glad that I found this place online and paid a visit. Their dishes were relatively similar to the taste I recalled while I was in Korea. And got free ice cream at the end of my meal.
Food is good. Service is good. Atmosphere can be improved but in no way bad.

Known to be the OG of Korean Fried Chicken Restaurant in Singapore which first introduced Chi-Mek (Korean Fried Chicken and Beer), Kko Kko Na Ra has recently launched a series of Crab-tastic dishes featuring fresh premium Korean Crab caught from Yeonpyeong Island on the West Sea.

We savored the essence of the Korea West Sea with their new launch 𝙎𝙋𝙄𝘾𝙔 𝙆𝙆𝙊𝙏𝙂𝙀 𝙏𝘼𝙉𝙂 (𝙎𝙥𝙞𝙘𝙮 𝙆𝙤𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙣 𝘾𝙧𝙖𝙗 𝙎𝙩𝙚𝙬) $85 which is the perfect hearty dish that warms the soul. The spicy broth is packed with punch with assorted vegetables, tofu and mussels.

We also had their ever satisfying 𝙎𝙤𝙮 𝙂𝙖𝙧𝙡𝙞𝙘 𝙁𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙙 𝘾𝙝𝙞𝙘𝙠𝙚𝙣 $23 and 𝙆𝙞𝙢𝙘𝙝𝙞 𝙋𝙖𝙣𝙘𝙖𝙠𝙚 $25.

Rare find of viral 𝙏𝙖𝙣𝙜 𝙃𝙪𝙡𝙪 that has set Korea's social media ablaze right here . For those with sweet tooth, dont miss the chance to enjoy these here. Perfect ending to our meal with Shine Muscat Grapes $5, Orange $3.80 & Mixed Fruits $3.80. Completed our meal with Green Apple CHORONG CHORONG Soju $18!

Satisfied tummies & great service.

Would recommend the seafood pancake, soft and crispy. Their sides were well presented and I like the pickled radish but their kimchi was a little bland in my opinion. Ordered their fried chicken and it was nice, but the kitchen or staff seemed to have forgotten our order and we had to wait longer than expected to receive our food. Fried octopus was a little chewy so it was a little tough to eat. Tea and water was complimentary and you can get a free ice cream upon leaving too (common in many Korean restaurants).

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
The food quality was just alright. Price was on a high side. We spent about $500 for 3 pax lunch! Raw crab was nice but too salty.

Marinated crab was great. Not fishy tasting. It’s what they are known for.

BBQ is ok, some meat a bit tough even for a pork belly.

Tteokbokki was done well, doenjjang jigae (soybean paste soup) tasted great and flavourful.

Complementary sides were well done too, 5 dishes.

Took the 2-3pax beef set which came with bean paste stew and steam egg. The portion was just nice and it is reasonably priced. The stew was really good! Also loved the fresh kimchi and radish side dish. They also gave free melona on the way out which was a nice end to the meal.

- Marinated raw crabs: must order
- Yukhoe (raw beef with egg) : must order, big portion and delicious
- BBQ pork: skip this, you can get better cuts at other places.
- Watermelon soju (sweet) : can order, you can barely taste any soju but that's what we wanted
- Kimchi pancake: can order
- kimchi pork jiggae: can order, spicy and sour delicious soup that's good for sharing

Delicious and fresh crabs - got the crab set that comes with both spicy and soy sauce. I like the soy sauce but most of my friends like the spicy one. My Korean friend said that the soy sauce crabs are not that salty in Korea. Also love their side dishes.

Recommend to make reservation but I also walked in on a Friday around 6.20pm and manage to get a seat.

The meat here is very good, enjoyed the pork and beef intestines a lot. Kimchi pancake and rice balls were nice too. Tuna kimchi stew and cold noodles weren’t to our liking.

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
They do it better than Korea. I am a Korean and I have been to many Korean restaurants abroad. This place definitely is one of the best or should I say the best Korean restaurant i have tasted so far. Would definitely come back when i visit Singapore. Truly was an amazing experience. If you are in Singapore, dont forget to drop by this amazing place. You wont regret it.

Super Star K used to be taster with meat more seasoned. This time, it seemed that there was a change in management. The side dishes tasted different and seemed to have a change in preparation. The potato salad doesn’t taste the same anymore. The price is still quite pricey but there is a staff preparing/barbecuing the meat for us. Service is good nevertheless. It is a small restaurant.

Went there for a quick dinner with my colleagues. The waiter is welcoming and polite to serve us. Guess he assume we will be getting grilled meat and put the charcoal directly for us. Initially we were planning on cooked dishes but in the end we went for the grilled meal set that include the soup and pancake. The meat is well grilled with the marinated sauce. Soup is flavourful. Pancake was soft. I like steam egg but it is a bit burnt. Overall is alright but be prepared to smell like barbecue and grill if you plan to eat this.

Great Korean BBQ spot that offers a diverse selection of fresh, high-quality meats. We had the set menu which we found was good, the unlimited sides were a pleasant surprise with even the steamed egg being part of it. Staff helped to cook all the meats which were bursting with flavor. We enjoyed our visit and would be back.

Good service by the staff here. They will help you to cook your meat. Free flow sides. But it’s very very expensive for a little portion. Go for it if you are rich and a small eater. They use charcoal to cook the meat, feels like an authentic kbbq place.

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
Oreo croffle tasted amazing! One of the best croffle in Singapore. Freshly made and crispy (Might take awhile though). Definitely would recommend if you are looking for a Korean grade croffle, 👍👍👍 Ordered Green Grape Ade is really refreshing :)

Ordered a two pax Teokbokki meal ( spicy level 1)

The portion is quite small for two pax, and lacking as compared to other Korean eateries in the area..

The ingredients provided are mainly carbs (diff shapes of Teokbokki and Maggie mee). There’s only an egg, a few small slices of fish cake and 2 Mandus included in the meal..

Definitely not worth $30++ with this portion and ingredients..

authentic korean food! would recommend getting the tteokbokki set for 2, comfort food vibes 

Had lunch here during a Sunday afternoon. I rarely eat Korean cuisine so I am not sure whether it's authentic or not. Ordered beef brisket with level 2 spicy. Overall the taste is good for me. The portion can feed up to 3 pax, a bit too much for 2 persons. Quite full but a bit boring towards the end because all the ingredients are rice cake related and noodles. Great and friendly staff! Food served in a short period.

Had a pleasant experience dining at Red Holic! Chanced upon this eatery as we were walking down Tanjong Pagar Road, looking for options. Decided to give this place a try as the menu looked interesting, and we weren’t disappointed!

Food was tasty and strong in flavour, we ended up getting more than we initially ordered. Staff were rather friendly and helpful, would probably give this place another go if we’re in the area, considering how crowded it can get especially on the weekend! :)

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.name: Red Holic
Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.query: Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
Came for weekday lunch at 1130am and by 1230pm the place was packed. Note that restaurant has split shift; closes from 230-5pm.

My dining partner and I had a private room to ourselves.

We ordered the sashimi set (noted that requirement to order the same set within the same dining group). Came with various bancha (side dishes) which we loved the abalone porridge and grilled fish. The sashimi was fresh and generous. We also ordered the spicy fish roe cold noodles which was good. Additionally, we ordered a portion of marinated crab (the boss was nice enough to allow us to order ala carte as usually the marinated crab is only available part of the set). The marinated crab was tad salty for us even with rice - not sure if it’s how it supposed to taste like as it’s our first time trying.

The interior of the restaurant was nicely decorated with a fake Sakura tree. The staff who served us were friendly and helpful especially the lady wait staff who took photos for us and directed us to pose - added bonus for good service!

Will be back for sure!

A true Korean seafood experience. A very nice quiet place that have small private cubicles that serve the full sashimi set and ends with a nice army stew soup. It taste as good as those I ate in Jeju. I came with a Korean friend and he highly recommend to try the silkworm soup which is a Korean snack that is rich in protein. I was worried at 1st but but it tasted great. Will be back again.

Quite an interesting Korean sashimi restaurant, definitely a first time for me. We had the “Assorted Sashimi Set”(Small - S$160) which includes halibut and salmon. Sashimi is really fresh and no weird fishy smell at all. The side dishes in the set were tasty too. As to service, I think they are shorthanded, so I didn’t expect too much. We are here for the food mainly.

Authentic Korean sashimi, cuisine and experience.

I have never tried Korean sashimi before, and was delighted to find this place.

The seafood set for 2 pax is really worth it and so much food. Also you know its authentic when everyone around is Korean and speaking the language!

We also ordered the soy marinated crab which I had in Seoul before. Had a lovely marinate and texture, and was quite sweet.

Loved the seafood porridge starter and vegetable platter that complimented the sashimi.

The corn cheese mayo was very decadent :)

First time having marinated crab in Singapore and at with so many other dishes for a set meal for 2. Though cannot compare to Korea but the food quality is there and great value at 30+/pax. One indication of the quality is the serving of the side dish. Will be back for other menu.

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
Heard so many rave reviews on this restaurant. They don't serve Korean BBQ on the stove on each table. They have pot dishes where they put the portable stove to heat them. I personally don't like their food because they are too skewed towards being sweet. While i know korean dishes are tend to be sweet but i think they take it overboard as compared to other korean restuarants I tried. The signature marinated soy sauce raw crab is not fantastic. Tasted better ones around Duxton before. The beef tartare seasoning is too sweet again. What is really delicious is the marinated beef ribs. That particular one, i like. The ice cold beer is also very interesting with tiny shaved ice on top.

Only service staff X 1 is serving the entire restaurant due to lack of staff. She tried her best and have good memory to remember the orders. Just poor her need to man the whole floor. We ordered several dishes. The interval of the dishes coming is inconsistent. Almost towards end of the meal then the calamari came and we were almost full by then.

Really friendly staff and the ambience of the place is pleasant.

I think they may be a little understaffed and so waiting time was a little longer, but the staff are really friendly! We did find the tables pretty low, but once again, the place was still nice.

Ordered the soy marinated crab, wagyu tartare, oysters, truffle beef tataki, marinated beef rib, kimchi pancake and the seaweed rice balls.

Unfortunately, we ordered 3 soy marinated crabs and they were all extremely fishy, much more than should be expected, even when eating raw crab or any other type of raw seafood. Presentation was beautiful, though.

Other than the crab, the other dishes were generally pretty enjoyable. In particular, the oysters were very fresh, and the truffle beef tataki was done medium rare and did have truffles. The wagyu tartare was not quite what we expected - it was not like most traditional yukhoe where the seasoning is really clean and simple (mostly sesame oil, salt, at most mustard, etc.). This one has a really strong flavour and is pretty salty, if I recall, it tasted like gochujang or ssamjang I think. Fresh and worth a try.

Overall, we had a good time and enjoyed most of the food.

We visited because of the hype created on SM recently on the soy crab gejang gejang. We missed the all so famous pro soy crab in Korea and decided to visit to check if it was a hit or miss.

Gejang gejang - I would say it is both a hit and a miss. First and foremost, it it too salty on it's own, the saltiness level can make your throat feel sick. It mixes well with the rice ball at the side and also with the sauce given. However as a gejang dish, the saltiness could be further controlled.

Oysters - nice, tender and juicy

Scallops - too much truffle essence or oil, the scallop taste is lost and as an appetizer, it was warm and not cool enough

Raw prawns - not cool enough but fresh and succulent

Raw beef - 1 word, spicy, too spicy to enjoy anything else

Overall - not a place to rave about but for some one craving for some soy crab can visit to try it out on their own

Was searching for a Korean restaurant and came across this place.

For three pax, we shared the Spicy Seafood Crab Stew, BBQ Surume Ika and Marinated Pork set, Honey Garlic Fried Chicken Wings and Corn Cheese.

Would recommend the BBQ pork set and Corn Cheese! We tried the Peach Tea Soju Cocktail as well but we pretty much can’t taste the alcohol. Overall, the portion of the food were rather small except for the seafood stew.

The staff were rather helpful as they offered to change our plates every-time when the plates are full. A rather cosy resturant to chill with friends over korean food!

We had a fantastic experience dinning at So Seoul Korean Dining & Bar. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted by friendly and welcoming staffs. The food was outstanding, and I particularly enjoyed the soy marinated carb. The presentation was beautiful, and the flavours were spot on. The lady boss and servers were very friendly and attentive throughout the meal but I also want to give a shout out to the bartender, Wilson.  He was personable and made fantastic drinks, taking the time to chat with us about our preferences and making recommendations based on what we like. He also went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed. I highly recommend stopping by the Bar at So Seoul Korean Dinning & Bar and chatting with Mark for a while. Overall, it was a great experience, and I can’t wait to go back.

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
Really great experience here.

I would say be aware that the portions are big for the price and don’t over order 😂

The beef was amazing and a definite recommend. However the chicken was a bit bland and not worth it to be honest.

Would definitely come back here again.

Staff are also friendly and helps you to cook the meat.

A little understaffed here! But generally the atmosphere is comfortable and the food are of high quality! The buffet is great and have awesome variety! I like that japchae is also part of their banchan, making the whole experience very memorable!

Love the modern South Korean design and aesthetics. The meat was alright, wasn’t the best I’ve tasted but it was good. Our bill came to a total of SGD220, despite the buffet claiming to be SGD35/pax (there were 4 of us); we did order a stew and rice, but that shouldn’t account for the vast difference. Service was good.

Overall it was a good experience, will come again!

The quality of the food we had, particularly the pork, was absolutely exceptional. The succulent and flavorful taste of the grilled meat left us craving for more. It was evident that great care had been taken in sourcing high-quality ingredients and ensuring their preparation was done with expertise. The combination of flavors and the overall taste surpassed our expectations. Thank you!

I’ve ordered jokbal, spicy jokbal and samgyetang. Very good service, during order and after service as well.
The food delivery on time, food portion is huge, and they are really generous with the banchan as well.
Both jokbal and spicy jokbal are very delicious, manage to satisfy my cravings. My kids enjoy the samgyetang. Will definitely order again. Best of all, customer service is top notch, one of a kind. You have won yourself a loyal customer.

Korean dining options in Tanjong Pagar.reviews:
We really enjoyed the dinner here. We ordered the Set beef/pork set. It contains two pork and two set. Every type contained in the set was very satisfying. The waiter and waitress helped to bbq. The pan Chan were all very nice. And the soy bean paste soup was super super delicious.
And in addition my hubby like the environment it was very spacious.

Sep 2023
The first impression we walked in here was the place was very smoky & stuffy. The smoke filter hoods were too tiny. The meats were not marinated at all & tasted really bland.  Only the marinated short ribs was ok. The Korean fried chicken was completely tasteless. For the price tag, I will say it is not worth the value.

Nov 2023- We came back a second time because we had unused Chope vouchers . We ordered all marinated meat & they were better.  I’d say they salvaged themselves from getting 1 or 2 stars.

2nd visit to Daejim! First visit last month was to try the BBQ sets which were not bad - fresh meats but felt that the meats could be better marinated. Kimchi soup was great, very flavourful. The steamed egg was super good too! However the pancake was rather disappointing for a Korean food place :(

Today’s visit - tried the spicy stir fried squid+pork belly. Sauce was delicious! Bimbimbap was decent. Steamed egg today felt a little over cooked unfortunately. Spicy tofu soup came with generous servings of mussels and calms.

Service staff are nice (both visits, there are only 2 service staff but they were attentive). Remember to get your complimentary icecream after your meal too!

Sides dishes tasted good, will be more awesome if there are more choices 😆
Gejang size slightly small compared to the ones in Korea. However, is not as salty as other place in SG.
Honey makgeoli, they did not open the bottle infront of us and cant really taste the honey unless, you smashed the honey, but you get slight honey taste. Their original fried chicken is quite tasteless with the meat itself and the deep fried flour.. and the flour is quite flour (this can give it a pass).

Nice Korean bbq. Very friendly service. Value for money with Chope deal. The raw crab pak really well with seaweed rice, a must try when you visited this restaurant. Tried the BBQ beef set and Pork/Beef BBQ set, both are good as well. Oh and they also give us free ice cream 👍😊

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
The food quality is overall average. Lobster soup is rich in taste but the serving of the lobster is under expectation. In fact most of the dishes portion is relatively small for that price range.

Service experience is also under expectation. We sat at a place with a blind spot and the service staff are not attentive to our request. I have to walk to the counter for help. Suggest to provide some electronic buzzing system if the restaurant has under staff to serve the customer.

Came across this place via Google search.
Suppose to come here for DimSum. But only available in the afternoon.
But we still decided to stay for dinner.

Food is not bad, very well presented. Taste is pretty ok especially the chicken and the laksa prawn.

But when comes to the service by the restaurant staff, I gotta give them a lower rating. It certainly under expectations.

Firstly, they are not welcoming at all when we were at the counter waiting to be seated.

Secondly, the waiter is not attentive. They have no smile at all (which is important in service line).
When we request for tea or request him to add hot water, he just came and grab the teapot and go off with super monotonous attitude. When we say thank you, the staff don't even response at all (basically like a robot).

Therefore, I don't think we will come back again. The food is ok but definitely not the best compare to the same level restaurant elsewhere. Also the service staff and their attitude didn't impress us despite the restaurant is not busy at all (only 3 tables including our table).

Came for lunch, excellent staff service and quality food. Recommend to come 👍🏻

The food and atmosphere was good but one of the staff had a really bad attitude and kept showing us black face. One other staff was very friendly so I'll rate it as 4 stars. Maybe the first staff had a bad day 🤷🏻‍♀️

Cosy environment. Great for family gartherings. Dimsum. Lobster pumpkin soup having 1 for 1 offer. Nice. Recommended.
Chinese food in Bugis.address: 122 Middle Rd, Level 2 Mercure Singapore Bugis, Singapore 188973
Chinese food in Bugis.name: Song Garden Chinese Restaurant

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
This noodle restaurant, a longstanding presence in Bugis Junction, signifies its enduring commitment to quality. The "cross bridge mi xian" stands out, offering a delightful mix of ingredients. What sets it apart is the choice: you can either assemble the components in the hot soup yourself or have the kitchen take care of it. This interactive element enhances the overall dining experience, making it a notable option for those exploring the diverse culinary scene at Bugis Junction.

Came here for a sat lunch and the shop was less than half full. Ordered the signature hong guo which can either come  all in one bowl or with the ingredients individually plated. Honestly, it doesnt really make any difference cos u will need to dump everything in. But if u are here for the social media post, go ahead to order it seperately.

Taste wise, the soup was quite salty for me which is probably becos of the shrimp paste (?). I actually prefered the fried rice more which had the wok hey. The cutlet was ok too.

It will be a nice place for a casual lunch and i honestly may come back again.

"I have been dining here since 2008 and it has remained one of my favorite places to eat. The Vermicelli Noodles are consistently outstanding, boasting an amazingly soft texture. The ribs were also quite tasty. In the past, they used to accommodate extra noodle requests, but unfortunately, that service is no longer available. However, I'm delighted to see that they have expanded their menu with the addition of many other delectable dishes."

I have the 9 dish cross bridge vermicelli set . It’s a very big bowl of soup, the ingredients are in very small plates.
The soup is so much that can’t finished.
Overall a good experience and the staff are very friendly.

Love their cross bridge vermicelli. The price is very reasonable. And I usually just order their vermicelli but not other dishes. So I can’t say much about the taste. But if you like vermicelli, you should not miss Hongguo! I think the restaurant has been here for more than a decade! I remember I first visited it many many years ago…

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
First time trying. Definitely a good one. Not a spice-tolerant person but the fish and soup were really delicious before the rest of the spice mixed in. Then it was too spicy for me. But the food was really good. The drink portion was really big too for a single person. Atmosphere was good too, but my one complaint is that some of the staff members were behind our table talking loudly and laughing, I think while on their break. It felt a bit intruding for my family dinner but it's a small issue as it was only for a short while.

This place is a great option for enjoying fried fish in town. The initial taste is fantastic, but it can become a bit salty over time.

The prices are on the higher side too.

If you're planning to dine with a group of 8 people, be aware that this outlet doesn't have a dedicated large table. They usually merge two smaller tables, which might still feel quite cramped for a party of that size.

Love the location. The fish we ordered is limbo fish with soy sauce based. The sauce however is too thin for our liking. The cucumber cold fish is good.

Service wise, is good. Friendly staffs. Their drinks are unique.
Maybe will come back again to try out their signature flavoured fish. Nice renovation decor.

Food is nice n not too spicy. Service is great, responsive n patient, drinks were served immediate at request for me n my thirsty peers! Nice touch to have tissue pack given at each table too. A good place to chat and dine! We had a great time!

We dropped by Tanyu@Bugis Junction to celebrate a birthday: our very first visit (even though we are not totally  fish fans).
Seating and interior decor was comfy and functional. Some guests in the packed house were in highly celebratory mood, some rather loquacious and loud. Generally, the ambience was youthful and energetic.
In particular, the attending staff were exemplary in service and interfacing with us: offering helpful and tactful suggestions and ideas (patiently without being presumptuous or pushy) on menu items, side-dishes, satay-style grilled meats, fish options, types of sauces and flavours, accompanying ingredients, preferred spiciness levels etc
We ordered the Sauerkraut Grilled Limbo-fish (a specie of the catfish family), instead of the Seabass or Qingjiang fish (also a cat-fish); together with some side-dishes.
The grilled fish was thoroughly enjoyable: it was rather juicy, tender and delicious (and, of course, totally fresh), although some parts tasted "fishy" and had a few very fine fish bones as well. Caution recommended .
The Jumbo Lemon and Lime (Tower) was memorable for us, as it was truly a big jar, able to quench our thirst adequately!
If you like to eat fish, then obviously, you'd likely enjoy an outing to Tanyu!

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
We book an appointment for 4 adults and 1 child.  When we arrived, we have informed the staff about our reservation, the waitress didn't  brother to listen properly and showed us the way to the normal rectangular table for 4 adults, as the space is rather small, she told us to put the baby pram  outside the restaurant(we have no idea where to put because the entrance is rather small), at this point of time, we have only 3 adults + 1 child, and waiting for the last person to arrive.

Shortly after, when we are still deciding what to eat, the waitress came over to rush us to place order. One of the order, we selected 4x soups that served individually for 1pax, She comment that our 2year old child cannot finish the soup. I told her we have 4 adults, and like to order on behalf of him.

At the same time, we realised that she only gave us 3 sets of cutleries +1set for our kid. While waiting for our order, I was browsing the promotion offer from the acrylic stand on the table, the waitress wearing a blazer passed by told me that the promotion has expired, not sure why it was still displaying on the table though. The way she speak is as if we can't afford to pay for the food. Some of us are wearing work uniform, and the rest is t-shirt and shorts, I'm not sure if this part of discrimination against consumer or not. We've also requested for a baby chair, and she pointed that the chair is over there, we have to take ourselves.

At 7.40pm, she called my sister who is the one who make the booking earlier today, she pick up the call and found out that they reserved round table for us and we were at the wrong table.

Furious of the poor attitude, my sister scolded the person over the phone(which turns out to be the same woman wearing the blazer) and we even made sacarstic remarks such as asking them if they think we cannot afford to dine in there?

After all the commotion, we agreed to switch to the round table, and the baby chair was automatically placed at the round table. Eventhough they did apologize, my sister has repeatedly mentioned that we made a reservation, but not too sure why this kind of mistake are made. This is a well known and established restaurant, this kind of mistake shouldn't be happening.

After all food is served, my niece doesn't like the fried rice, so we order a warm soya bean milk for her. The waiting time is long, we also request for a straw, and we have to ask several times.

Almost every week, I have the habit of visiting restaurant for a treat to myself or gathering during my off day.

This is my first time encountering this kind of rude attitude and it is happening in morden day in Singapore.

To be honest, all these action were uncalled and it ruined the atmosphere of the gathering with my niece.  It is really a horrible experience, this is our first but definitely our last time at the bugis branch.

Came for the Xiao long bao buffet. The staff inside were ok, only the service manager was really really sweet. You have to finish the noodles before you can put in the order for the Xiao long bao. The best part of everything was the cucumber dish. I will go back just for that😍

Ever been to any Crystal Jade Branch in Singapore.
But this one is the one who has the poorest service.
Food is definitely good and delicious.
Even my 2 years old kids love their Lamian and Fried Rice 🥰

Crystal Jade is the place I love to go for their xiao long bao and noodles.

I tried their pancake. It's nice for the crispy texture but a little on the salty side.

The rice in the hotpot is very tasty. I like the texture of the rice, which is like Claypot rice. The peanut is crispy and nice.

The appetiser is a cold dish that is crunchy and quite tasty. Initially, I wanted to do without, but after the promotion by the lady saying it's what Emperor eats in the past, I decided to give it a try, and it's not bad.

I enjoyed their pomelo tea. It's sweet and just nice for me.

The seats are spacious and comfortable. It's also not very crowded in this outlet.

Staff responds pretty fast to my request.

Latest review:
I come back 3 times and had the pork soup dumplings and they were good. For some reason the 1st was maybe an outlier that day? Also good was the green beans, vegetable dumplings and hot & sour soup. I’ve changed my previous rating from a 3 to a 4 star. However, I would skip the crab dumpling which lacked flavor.

Older Review:
I was disappointed with this place. I've had many soup dumplings before and was looking forward to this Michelin Star reputation. So when I bit into these dumplings only to taste mildly flavored soup, I thought "what was the point"? By itself, it doesn't stand out. With the black vinegar and ginger sauce provided it loses out its flavors. The same could be said for the Fish Maw soup. It is so mild that you wonder why such a long title was used? You can't taste the ham, dried scallop, winter melon or really anything else in this soup. The only thing that wasn't disappointing was the chili dumplings. Overall, an average meal with above average prices.

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
Tasty noodles in a popular restaurant. A bit noisy and slightly unconformable furnishing, but that's pretty much part of the charm. Tried Signature Noodles and Barley Drink, both a good starting point

The store is located at Bugis Street facing Bugis Junction near Bugis+ side. Friendly staff greets warmly and suggests suitable seats. Order and pay seamlessly via the QR code on the table, with a quick waiting time until your food is served. The noodle is very nice flavors, especially their specialty noodles. Reasonably priced and highly recommended!

QQ Noodle House is a decent spot for a quick and affordable meal in the area. The standout feature of this place is their springy and tasty noodles, which come with a range of sauce and noodle options to choose from. However, the portion size is quite small, which might not be enough for some customers.

Unfortunately, the quality of the food has dropped compared to previous years. I tried the dry noodle recently, and it was disappointingly dry, with too little sauce to coat all the layers of noodles. The crispy wanton was still decent, though.

Aside from the noodles, they also have side dishes available. However, the dining experience is let down by the dirty and greasy tables, and the utensil tray that was not clean. The restaurant itself is a bit run down, with peeling table tops (as seen in the provided photo).

During my visit, I was also given a corner table that was placed too closely together with another table, making it hard to exit. Luckily, I was skinny enough to squeeze through the gaps, but others may find it uncomfortable.

Overall a good option for those looking for a quick and affordable comfort meal, but the drop in food quality and unclean dining environment can be a bit of a letdown.

Food was easy to order via the clear QR code on the table or via the menu. The package sets made it fuss free especially for people who are spoilt with choices. I ordered the Kolo mee, the portion was not a lot for a guy but the chosen side crabmeat soup made up for it.
Some of the service staff seem to have quite a strong accent that the mandarin might be difficult for some Singaporeans to understand.
Store set up was neat, tidy, and clean. Gave a simple and minimalist feel of dropping by for a non-extended meal, consume it, and leave.

wanton mee noodle texture is not as q as I've expected, glass noodle has wok smell and tasty but expensive($8), bkt has strong herb taste but the meat is very tough.

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
Plenty of meats and vegetables selections.
Beef meat is thin slices but a little over cooked. No other marination.
The dory fish slice is big but it has a little fishy taste.
Vegetables and mushrooms are good.
The best is all of them are fresh. However, their kitchen will not cut the items into smaller pieces. Some of them can be difficult to chew.
The soup booth is good, drinkable but gets thirsty afterwards.
The store is bright and air-conditioned.

The quality of ingredients is high. The beef broth mala soup is quite tasty and the medium spice is not overly spicy. Be sure to ask for extra soup. The dry mala is terrible and flavorless.

Located just infront of Bugis+. This is one of place for you who looking to eat spicy mala. Price by weight regardless meat or vegetable. Recommend not to take so many, as the price could be expensive. Option tomato soup available for those who dont eat spicy. Normal service by staff. Self service Sauce available at sauce corner. Paynow accepted. Disposable apron also available if you are required. Food was not bad. Sometimes could be long queue during peak hour.

Tried the bone mala broth. The food quality is good and the soup is very thick and full of flavor. It is not susprising that they are the biggest chain in the world. To me, it is on par with Zhang Liang, which is another famous chain.

Special mention: the meat balls are very good and juicy!

$15 for a 400g+ of food. Meat and veg are all the same price.

No service charge 👍🏻. Pick your own food, go to the counter and do your payment, collect your food at the counter.

Ordered a big mala and a medium mala, taste pretty much the same. Only that one has slightly more oil.

Tasty mala soup which I would rate a 7/10. Food however isn’t the best quality. Luncheon meat taste disgusting. Other process food is tasteless. Don’t mind coming back, if there’s no q.

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
First time here and came without making a reservation on a Saturday evening about  8pm.  The restaurant was full but fortunately we waited for only around 10 minutes.   Was quote sceptical because I saw many foreigners and thought this could be tourist trap.  I was wrong,  the claypot pig liver is super delicious and the braise fish head is so flavourful.  This is indeed a very good Cantonese restaurant.

If you’re looking for Chinese restaurant with amazing food and friendly service, look no further than this hidden gem. I recently had the pleasure of dining at this spot and was blown away by the quality of their dishes.
The beef meat teow with wok hey was outstanding. Beef was so tender and portion size was generous, even for the smallest option on the menu.
Next up was the roasted duck, which was an absolute standout. The skin was perfectly crispy and meat was tender and flavorful.
Finally, I have to mention the cereal prawn ball, no hassle at all in removing the shell and  flavorful prawns.
Restaurant was the friendly and welcoming atmosphere.
If you’re in the mood for some truly Chinese cuisine, look no further than this spot.

Came here because of the online reviews and  partly we were nearby. The foods are hit and miss. Can order the fried beef kway teow, vegetable and home-made tofu. Will not recommend the Indonesia curry chicken and the roast duck, roast pork and char siew combo.

Food is served quick and they are delicious! Place can be loud sometimes due to the occasional loud talking and laughing by other customers but I would definitely recommend coming here for the food.

Whilst visiting Singapore, my friend took me to lunch at his favourite cantonese restaurant. I can understand why - friendly, warm service and absolutely delicious food served with a smile. The fried rice, sweet and sour pork and special tofu were particularly  notable - all of the plates went back to the kitchen absolutely clean
Chinese food in Bugis.name: Wing Seong Fatty's Restaurant

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
We were ushered in the moment we walked past the shop. Love the decor of this cosy place! Ended up ordering their pork dishes that tasted quite good! Will definitely be back in the very near future to try their Chicken!

I’m not a fan of 猪肚汤, this is however a pleasant visit. Soup is nice. Those who like pig parts can visit here.

辣子鸡 so so only. Meat is tough and not spicy.

Best dish for me is the fried yam which is crispy and addictive.

Ya agree with Justin Chong, the chicken pot is j okay, we ordered the mala one, it tastes wuite like mala but tbh its a little too jelat after awhile

To be fair we did a takeaway so maybe its not so great? But if you are looking for like a decent mala pot then i think this is an okay one in the area

Had the claypot rice, which i supposed they are not that famous for, and it was slightly disappointing. Amount of chicken is generous enough i supposed but overall taste is fairly below average.
Perhaps try their hotpot instead :)

Staff is really friendly and helpful!
I enjoyed their 辣子鸡 and the “3 eggs veg”.
The 鸡公煲 is alright and I’ll probably skip it the next time I go back :)
Definitely a place to come back and try other options! :))

Chinese food in Bugis.name: Fat Bird Chicken Hotpot 胖胖鸡 （鸡公煲）

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
Enjoyed the food here tonight. It was very busy and while service was a tad slow, we recognise that the staff were doing their best. All the tasty food was definitely worth the wait! Will be back to try more food in future! Was very impressed with all the dishes especially the cabbage and the lamb! They are must-try dishes! I really loved the dessert too!

I had a great experience at this restaurant, the food was delicious l, and the seasoning was perfect. I especially appreciated that the dishes were not too spicy.

The restaurant is very popular, especially on the weekends, it can be difficult to get a table without a reservation, and the wait can up to 30 mins.

However, if you are willing to eat outside, you may be able to get a seat sooner.

Also, the restaurant is a lively place, with lots of noise.

My favorites🌟🌟🌟
Dry-fried pork intestines
Dried tofu slices with preserved pork

Super eating this place. Similar to the Mosque Street outlet, the service is great, and the food is consistently amazing. Would be back to try the other dishes. Many tables ordered soups and we will do that in our next visit :) *Must try the lamb* featured in the photos below. DELICIOUS.

3 of us went there during lunch time and we ordered 3 dishes to share. The fried tofu is crispy on the outside, soft on the inside = taste score 3.8/5. The eggplants are soft and the sauce is flavorful, makes an excellent dish to just eat with rice = taste score 4.2/5. The abalone mushroom chicken soup is not oily, there are 4 pcs of abalone that is thumb size big but it was very tough to chew, taste like a simple mushroom + chix soup = taste score 3.5/5. Overall experience 4/5.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at a remarkable Hunan cuisine restaurant (Xiang's Signature Hunan Cuisine), and the experience left me thoroughly impressed. From the moment I stepped in, I could tell it was going to be a memorable meal.

First and foremost, the food was exceptional. Hunan cuisine is known for its bold, spicy flavors, and this restaurant certainly delivered. Each dish was a burst of exquisite tastes and perfectly balanced spices. From the fiery Mapo Tofu to the succulent Orange Chicken, every bite was a delightful adventure for the taste buds.

The service was equally commendable. The staff was attentive, courteous, and well-versed in the menu, offering helpful recommendations and ensuring a smooth dining experience. They made us feel genuinely welcome.

The restaurant's ambiance added to the overall appeal. It had an elegant yet cozy atmosphere, making it ideal for both intimate dinners and larger gatherings. The tasteful decor and comfortable seating contributed to a pleasant dining environment.

While the prices were slightly on the higher side, the quality of the food and the overall dining experience justified the cost. In fact, I was so impressed that I visited this establishment twice during my stay, and I'm already looking forward to my next visit. If you appreciate exquisite Hunan cuisine, impeccable service, and a pleasant dining environment, this restaurant is an absolute must-try.

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
I hadn't enjoyed this fish soup in over three years, but my friend's craving led us to travel from the west to savor it again. Thankfully, it lived up to our expectations. We visited on a weekday around 2 pm, and the short queue quick service. The soup was excellent, featuring fresh sliced fish with quality close to perfection.

Been visiting for 15 years. Used to be one of my fav fish steamboat , however yest visit I felt that they have cut down portion quite a fair bit. Even taste have changed and soup was more diluted.  I can understand raising raw ingredients cost but if trying to scrimp on ingredients and affect the taste I think it is not worth it anymore.

There were 3 of us and we were seated at the end of the middle row. It was very cold and ac was blowing right above us. Requested for change of seat to one of the corner table after I saw 3 pax leaving but was rejected saying the tables are meant for 5-6 pax. Requested staff to change us to other empty table's were also faced with similar replies.

Ordering also took quite a while as shop seems to be shorthanded . One staff looking after the front door while another one in and out of kitchen and disappeared again. Tried to wave for staff to order but they saw us and ignored us. Quite disappointing.

After we finished our food, the two empty tables that were supposed to be waiting for the 5-6 people were still empty throughout our entire meals. Not sure why you prefer to wait for "unknown potential customer than ensure your current paying customer is comfortable in your store.

Considering the service and the drop in standard, unlikely to visit again.

This is a repeat visit for us, we have come before and enjoyed the food. But today we concluded that it won’t be a place we will deliberately want to come back. Food is not bad, fish slices are thick and plump. Soup is good but not great like before. Food is fairly priced, considering the shop, Aircon. We would give 4 stars except that the staff are all so gloomy. Not sure if this is the outcome of an old establishment left solely in the hands of employees without affiliation.

If you love to eat fish soup, this you must try. Always long Q, unless u go off peak hours like before 6pm or go Q at before they open.

Today i order their fishhead bee hoon soup, if u think like me that fish head mainly all bones then u are wrong. It got alot of meat & it taste yummy.

You can try their slice fish and fried fish been hoon soup if you prefer to have just meat, they have fish head/fish slice steamboat too

Very nice fried rice and tomato egg. Fish soup noodle was not bad for the price. Hearty meal overall
