Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
Service 5 stars. Quick to serve, fulfilled all our request for chilli, pepper, sambal etc.
Ambience 5 stars. Great music. Sufficient seating area. Came around 11pm.
But food varies greatly. We used to order the papaya soup. But today is just really bland. It is terrible. Nissan dry noodles taste great but the beef is really dry. Carrot cake is just soft. No crisp. Good flavors though. Nice milk tea ^^ Recommend the fried bean curd skin under dim sum. It is delicious. Give one more star due to service level. The food really came out fast.

Food was delivered on a reasonable waiting time.
the Filipino lady server was quick and efficient at her work, constantly doing follow up on drinks and food order.

they missed out our 2nd round order of spare ribs. we ended up just doing a refund for it coz we've been waiting for awhile.

First time order "Pork olive fried rice", the pork is tender and juicy,  hard to find other place with this standard.

Please avoid Wanton Char siew noodle,: the char siew and wanton is below standard.

Give the service full mark: the cafe short of man power and only the guy (maybe the manager) run the whole show, he still remain friendly and patience.

I recently tried the Xin Wang Hong Kong Cafe, and I have to say, it left much to be desired. There's virtually no service beyond them bringing your food because it's an IQ code order system. Unfortunately, the food doesn't come close to what you'd expect from a good Hong Kong cafe. It was so bland that I didn't even bother taking pictures for my review. I took one photo while we eating only. I wouldn't recommend it to fellow foodies or anyone who loves Hong Kong cafe.

The food was good, but not exceptional. The siu mei, sweet and sour pork, spare ribs, and baked chicken curry rice were tasty, similar to what I had when we lived in Hong Kong. Unfortunately, our experience was marred by the young lady who handled seating arrangements. She lacked courtesy and insisted on not giving tables even if they weren't reserved and there was no queue. It's a pity, as better service could have made the experience much more enjoyable.

Chinese food in Bugis.name: Xin Wang Hong Kong Café

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
Came here for a team lunch and ordered Grilled Fish Set B, with 2 jugs of roselle tea and honey lemon. Forgot what side we chose already, but it was nice (see first photo).

Enjoyed the Garlic Spicy and Mushroom Chicken flavours for the grilled fish.

Will come back again to try out the other flavours.

Walk in on a Saturday afternoon at around 3pm and there is no queue ahead of us so waiting time is less than one minute.

Ordered the grilled fish set at $68.80++ and it come with two other dishes.

The grilled fish and fried mushroom is very nice and tasty.

Ambience and customer service also very good.

Will definately return to dine in again.

Food and service was good. We ordered the yuan yang fish and the soup base is mala and tomato egg. The fish was fresh and grill to perfection. The mala spiciness level is acceptable to me.

Nice place. No free plain water. Food is relatively spicy for someone who only eat mala xiao la. Would recommend to my friends!

The fish soup is very delicious! 酸湯魚！
Got different discounts for different dates, we also order 干鍋 with 25%off, also good but quite a lot, better to have more people eat tgt :) reached around 7pm+ on weekdays, no queue is needed with 2nd floor available, but hope air conditioner can be stronger

Chinese food in Bugis.name: Kuan Kuan Spicy Hotpot and Nourishing Soup

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
Their beef noodle is a joke . My regretful lunch to give this a try and now feeling damn hungry. There are miserly scraps of thin beef pieces and it cost $6. 老板太抠门啦。牛肉碎片笑死人。 see pic below, this is untouched at all and that’s all the beef. 😑 Soup and noodle are average too. Do not order this on the menu ever. Walk 20 more steps to the coffee shop in front of mookata. 牛小二beef noodle is only $6.50 with generous portions of beef. Go there instead.

Was introduced to this place by a friend. We tried their mala (medium spicy level) and their skewers.

The mala was not too spicy for medium level and the skewers were lightly seasoned (not too salty).

Love the wallet - friendly price as total bill costs about $32 for 2 pax, which is considered cheap for the items we ordered including beer.

Got there at 6pm, just randomly look for a dinner place. 2 storeys, ground and basement, with lift.
The 烤串mostly $1 (lamb, pork, beef and chicken), quite affordable. Taste wise can be better, still edible.
Dishes wise abit limited compare the other main China restaurants. The chicken cold noodle not bad, more vinegar taste.
Beer have buy 3 free 1, $6 per bottles.
Food wise can see they mainly sell mala, by weight according to choices. I would try it next time as alot order for their mala.

Absolutely one of the best Mala places in Singapore! Definitely a must-try place!😍😋

It’s always so yummy! I totally recommend this place to all the Mala lovers. P.S. it’s available on foodpanda too! Extra convenient on busy days!😎😊

Good place with good food! Highly recommend the mala xiang guo - the spiciness is on point - one of the best tasted so far.

Chinese food in Bugis.name: Jin Jin Eating House 金金餐室

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
Can’t go wrong when you are in the mood for chunky bits and tendon bits of a Braised beef noodle. Sure, this is not an authentic Taiwanese beef noodle - but I loved it.

I alternate in between Lenu and a local food court beef noodle. Both has its own attraction and I would give high points to this. Ask the server for chilies - goes well with the soft tofu.

Surprisingly excellent for what (and where) it is. Very efficient service, ideal for quick solo diners and groups alike.

Liked:
- The beef combination bowl is excellent. Generous servings, snappy lamian, tender meat. Nothing to complain about.
- Tofu with century egg as a side.
- Chili crisp. They don’t provide this by default but they should. Not sure if it’s out of a bottle but it’s an essential condiment.

Last visited in Mar 2023

Been to place a couple of times for lunch. The food is quite good and the service is very fast. On both occasions, I did not have to wait for for a long time for the food to arrive. I’d recommend people to try out any of the pork noodle dishes. The scallop noodle dish is also good. You’ll have the option to choose a less or more spicy option for your serving. On average, you’ll spend around $15-16 per person if you don’t go for a combo meal.

All in all a very decent lunch or dinner option if you’re in Bugis Junction. Would definitely recommend this place to people.

fresh and tender beef slices with perfectly cooked ramen noodles, broth is light but very fragrant and flavourful. checks off all boxes of a proper bowl of noodles.

I’ve been to this noodle chain many times before in multiple locations, and I’ve always been satisfied with my meals!

I love that they have a range of prices, so even if you’re on a tighter budget, you can still have a great meal. My favourite is by far the vegetable pork wonton noodles, with the la mian. The noodles are chewy and the broth is rich and silky, topped off with juicy wontons. As a plus, there’s a tea time set inclusive of a drink and a side for only $13. I ordered a garlic fungus side, which was pretty mid since I don’t quite enjoy an overwhelming taste of raw garlic. The braised tofu was pretty good though. On another note,  I also love the dry noodles and century egg tofu side when available.

- a broke college kid

Chinese food in Bugis.name: LeNu at Bugis Junction

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
Exploring the mazy Bugis Junction in search of dinner options, discovered an authentic Chinese restaurant with a stupendous anniversary deal! We were attracted by the attractive promotional prices as we walked past.. who can resist $9.90 grilled fish 🐟 , $9.90 baby lobsters 🦞?!? 🤤 What swept us off our feet was that the food was actually generous in portion, and really delicious! The grilled fish was meaty, the meat was succulent and perfectly matched the savoury green chilli gravy. Top notch grilled fish that can easily rival Tanyu. The baby lobsters was immensely flavoured by the Mala gravy, and eating it while shucking the gravy was a delightful experience. The portion was decent, and absolutely no complain at this promo price. We also ordered tomato omelette which was fluffy and tasty. Of course, nothing completes grilled fish like ice cold beer 🍺. The food serves here are authentic and sumptuous, and made us crave for the other dishes on their menu. All in one, we would like to return frequently.. but honestly without the promotional discounts their usual prices are on the steep side. Highly recommend :)

I encountered this restaurant while passing by and decided to give it a try.

This place isn't friendly for diners who don't eat pork, so I tried a few dishes that don't contain pork.

The lamb rack were decent, but there was too much chili, which affected the natural flavor of the lamb. Of course, this heavy seasoning might be an attempt to mask the lack of freshness in the ingredients. The best fresh lamb rack are typically found in Mongolian-style cuisine, and some Sichuan restaurants also do a good job such as chuanyangji. Not all Sichuan restaurants struggle with lamb rack.

Eel is quite unique and not commonly seen in other Chinese restaurants. However, stir-frying the eel without chilli is a good way to bring out the eel's natural flavor.

This restaurant might be suitable for diners with less sensitive taste buds or those who prefer milder flavors. The service is good.

Tried this place for the first time, their grilled fish is very tasty and fresh. The host wasn't lying when she recommended to get the 鱼香肉丝 to go with rice, it was one of the best I've ever eaten. Strongly recommend to come and try.

Sauerkraut fish and frog are nice and not too oily like most Chinese eateries. But all food items are very steep thus not value for money. Avoid the beef pot with carrot and potato, I wasn’t able to eat a whole single piece of the beef brisket. Either tough tendon or coarse meat. (Refer to pic) Whole pot of beef was wasted. We only ate the carrot n some potato. Nice gesture they gave us 10% discount for whole meal.

Best Sichuan restaurant I've had in Singapore! EVERYTHING is delicious.

The grilled frog tasted super fresh. It was spicy but not overpowering. The cold noodles are springy and chewy. All their signature dishes are outstanding. The pickled veggies are superb as well.

I'm very impressed!

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
First time trying Chong Qing and it didn’t disappoint. Fish was grilled quite nicely, texture was smooth and easy to eat without much bones. 中辣 was quite spicy, so please be warned if you can’t take 🌶️. If you’re feeling famished, go for the buffet option as you get free flow of side dishes such as fried mantou, pork belly, chicken, chilli oil wantons and much more.

They actually grill the fish here, not those kind that fry the fish.

Choose the barramundi and it was a nice size and seemed fresh.

Ordered 中辣/medium spiciness and is tolerable.

Can select the other ingredients to accompany your fish.

Also ordered the 口水鸡/mouth watering chicken which was good.
Good valance of vinegar and spice.

Good service from staff and there's enough space between tables so it didn't feel cramped.

Felt like it was a bit pricey, but my Chinese friends tell me it's worth the price.

Definitely one of my favourite restaurant go for dinner/ supper with my friends, the staff there are amazing, friendly and flexible for any adhoc request from us. We always order the patin grilled fish as the portion and taste is super yummy 😋 !
Recommended to anyone who no idea where to go for supper, here is the place!

Very nice grilled fish but was super disappointed and disgusted by the lotus root that we paid 4.80 for. Enquired the waiter and he said it was oxidised. The look of it make our appetite die down. We also ordered their paradise iced fruit tea and it tasted very bland, 0% sweetness so we requested for sugar syrup. To our disappointment, they said they do not have sugar syrup. Also disappointed by the service, it was hard to ask for the waiter to refill the soup / serve us the food as there was only 2 staffs serving the upper floor.

Trying out the grilled fish that I heard so much and see publicity. Ordered a steamed fish,  mala chicken.  Not bad.  Find the fish base soup a bit salty.

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
Tried the Mala Soup. Soup taste good and not too spicy. Can add additional chilly to increase the spicy level at the condiments counter.

Go early as there will always be a queue!

Ordered tomato soup takeaway and was really impressed that they bagged the soup separately from the ingredients and double bagged it to go.

Apart from the minimum order of 300g (which is usually more than what i would order), i liked that they have 6 different soup base to choose from and rice as an option for carbs!!

Coming back here again next week!

This establishment offers a remarkable dining experience characterized by a wide selection of impeccably fresh vegetables and meats. The ambiance is pristine, complemented by refreshing air conditioning throughout the indoor seating area. Our party indulged in both Mala Tang (soup) and the dry mala dishes, and while both were enjoyable, the dry variant stood out as particularly delectable.

We had an awesome Mala (dry one), super delicious. We both enjoyed a lot. The only thing we didn’t like was the restaurant didn’t offer any tissue/napkins. You have to paid for it 😑

Mala tang here is better than gong yuan. Surprisingly the dry version is quite good as well. Tomato soup is good for those that can't take spicy.

Chinese food in Bugis.name: 新加坡张亮麻辣烫 Zhang Liang MaLa Tang @Bugis Junction

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
We had their weekend dim sum buffet. The service and food were incredible. Shirley, Maggie and Chin Chin were amazing hosts, recommending dishes and ensuring that we were well taken care of.

Great place for your family dinners. I will definitely come again soon! :)

Shirley, Maggie and ChinChin service were impressive. Very attentive in service and clearing plates. Chef also put on a goof fire show for the pork dish. Every item served was explained well. They also provided a cake from my mum’s birthday.
Many thanks to the team!

The menu at Man Fu Yuan is a celebration of exquisite Chinese cuisine, and it showcases the artistry and passion of the talented chefs. The array of dishes offered caters to various palates, ensuring there's something to delight everyone. Whether you're a fan of traditional favorites or seeking innovative culinary creations, this restaurant has it all.

The service at Man Fu Yuan deserves special mention. The staff members were attentive, knowledgeable, and passionate about their craft. They took the time to explain each dish, offering valuable insights into the flavors and ingredients. Their attention to detail and genuine enthusiasm contributed to the overall exceptional dining experience.

The ambiance of the restaurant is sophisticated and elegant, with tasteful decor and comfortable seating. The soothing background music added to the overall relaxing atmosphere, creating the perfect setting for a special evening with loved ones or an important business gathering.

Man Fu Yuan Restaurant is a gem that should not be missed. From the exquisite cuisine to the impeccable service and delightful ambiance, every aspect of this dining establishment exceeded my expectations. Whether you're a connoisseur of Chinese cuisine or simply seeking an exceptional dining experience, I highly recommend visiting Man Fu Yuan Restaurant. It is an indulgence for the senses and a culinary journey that will leave a lasting impression.

Service is good there, the 6 courses meal will get 5 stars if not because of the lobster with crispy rice noodle dish. While the lobster is fresh and the texture good, the noodle spoilt the dish with the fried noodle taste like rancid oil, disappointed. Other than this dish, all other dishes are up to standard. Recommended the Man fu yuan appetizer.

Celebrating my daughter birthday Food was awesome. Was serve by a very friendly and attentive staff named Maggie Yong. She was so attentive in her details and ensuring the celebration of my daughter birthday a success one
Chinese food in Bugis.address: 80 Middle Road Level 2 InterContinental Singapore, Singapore 188966
Chinese food in Bugis.name: Man Fu Yuan Restaurant

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
I went here with my friend. The food was very nice but not the best for me. The skewers were really nicely grilled, very meaty and the spice were also very tasty. The man tou was grilled quite well, crispy outside, but the inside was too dry. If inside is softer then would be better… And also the place was too noisy and crowded so can’t hear each other well. But overall the food was nice

First time there during lunch time, not that crowded. Like their food and they do have the BBQ plate on each table therefore the bbq skewers will place on top and food still be hot even if u eat later. Although varieties not as much but overall i will still go as it is a nice place to eat 烤串. I love their potatoes, toasted bread, 凉拌面, will go try more next time. Best to make reservation as dinner time and weekends normally fully book.

Previously was at the East Coast outlet, tried the Bugis outlet this time. Did not choose any premium options (the difference was the kind of topping on the meat) but food was still good! Each stick was $1.60 on average. The waiters don’t ‘introduce’ the meats so we had to deduce ourselves if we were eating beef/pork/mutton.

The mutton was very tender and we enjoyed it the most! Shishamo (fish) was also enjoyable, very nicely grilled. The bun was v generous and lightly salted, which I enjoyed. Nice vibes, got crowded after 7pm.

Went there for late dinner on Tuesday night was not crowded. Food service was fast. Food was rather good will be great if there are more selection other den bbq food.

I finally have a change to try China-style grilled skewers. They serve a smorgasbord of choices - 50 type of skewers (note: I order more than 20 types of them) that served with grill-box-on-the-table. They also include other dishes, e.g. Shredded cucumbers, cold noddles, cold bean curd, etc.; and wide variety of beers (note: I took green tea instead… too many oily foods 🙃). Well, my favourite food: grilled beef tendon, baked sweet corn, grilled enoki mustard, grilled potato chips,grilled premium lab ribs and many more…The place environment is decent. But, the service is good as the staff are friendly and they are able to converse mostly Mandarin and understandable English. The orders usually take about 10 minutes waiting time which deserved a 4-star from me.
Chinese food in Bugis.opening_hours:
Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM

Chinese food in Bugis.name: BBQ Box (Bugis) 串烧工坊 (武吉士)

Chinese food in Bugis.reviews:
Chanced upon this restaurant with my partner, we went in without any expectations or did any review before trying. We were both pleasantly surprised and impressed. The food was amazing and service was impeccable. I asked if I could order only one glass of barley because it came in a jug but they told me that they charge per jug, hence I didn’t order the drink at all. However, several minutes later, the server comes with a glass of iced barley FOC, I was super grateful!! ☺️ My partner and I might have found our new spot for china food, price is similar to that of Chinatown’s Oriental Chinese Restaurant 🫢 (also banana bread as toast??? Amazing!!)

Was abit skeptical b4 stepping in as not much customers and saw some negative reviews here.

However the 串串 meats turns out to be delicious! Personally felt its better than some other famous places. We ordered less salt versions and its just nice.

The 烤韭菜 and  烤饅頭 wasn't that nice though.

The 酸菜魚 is good as well.

Will revisit to try other dishes to see if it's good.

Food is good- especially worthy using Eatigo deals.

We ordered all dishes less salty and oily. The clams and frog leg was still somewhat salty. Crispy chicken was crunchy and skewers were tender and flavorful. The other signature dish (锅包肉）was a little tough to chew cos it uses lean meat. A lot of dishes to choose from.

The BBQ sticks were perfectly seasoned with a great balance of sweet and savouriness. The grilld mushroom was the star of the show today, damn sweet and fresh, while the grilled chicken and pork were tender and succulent. I did not have much expectations before coming here because of the great number of chinese BBQ restaurants in the vicinity, but it was a pleasant surprise to us 😋

the food here is nice. The price is a bit expansive. Will recommend the suan cai fish soup which currently only serve at 1 size. It's good for 3 pax. Ask for some discount when make payment.

Chinese food in Bugis.name: Chef China 华厨

French cuisine in Robertson Quay.reviews:
Superb French dining experience at a reasonable price. We went for the 3-course set lunch and were satisfied with the quality of ingredients used, great cooking, and exceptional service provided by Rimo, Charlene, and team. Recommended dishes: Escargots in garlic butter, Lamb chops, Pear Melba.

We celebrated a birthday here and were delighted with the extra mile taken with the presentation of the desserts. Thanks to this meal, we’ve found another authentic French steakhouse!

I recently dined at "Les Bouchons Rive Gauche," and it was an exquisite culinary experience. The highlight of the evening was their selection of red wine, which beautifully complemented the succulent steak.

To start, we savored the pan-seared duck liver, a dish that showcased exceptional freshness and a rich, melt-in-your-mouth texture. It was truly unforgettable.

We also indulged in a delightful off-menu item, the heated Camembert cheese, which emanated a delightful flavor due to its oven preparation. The combination of the gooey cheese and its subtle yet profound taste was a gastronomic delight.

The main course featured the Black Angus prime rib, which impressed with its perfectly balanced seasoning that enhanced the natural flavor of the beef. It was a prime example of culinary expertise.

To conclude this magnificent meal, we had the crème brûlée, a dessert that was both light and zesty, providing the perfect sweet note to end our dining experience.

The ambiance and service at "Les Bouchons Rive Gauche" further added to the overall charm of the restaurant. If you're looking for an exceptional dining experience with an emphasis on quality, this is the place to be. I highly recommend it for anyone seeking an unforgettable culinary journey.

we did encounter a situation at our table. However, it’s important to note that this issue was not related to how the restaurant was run; it was more of an outside factor. Despite this unexpected situation, the restaurant’s staff handled it promptly and professionally, ensuring that it did not affect the overall dining experience. Their commitment to customer satisfaction and their adeptness in addressing unforeseen challenges further demonstrated the restaurant’s dedication to providing a top-notch dining experience.

Best steak we had as a family! Super value for money. So tender and juicy. Super good appetisers. Fantastic service!

Good food, good service and good vibe. The lamb chop was nicely cooked and reminded us of what we had in France. Waitress was of good service. She made sure we were well taken care of.

I had my birthday lunch here and the food was tres délicieux! Special mention for the pan seared foie gras and the ribeye steak. Such depth of flavour at a great value, do check out their lunch set promo if you're coming by in the day.

Big thank you to Rimo, Charlene and Jan for the impeccable service and attention to detail :)
French cuisine in Robertson Quay.name: Les Bouchons Rive Gauche

French cuisine in Robertson Quay.reviews:
Excellent services with quality food and fantastic atmosphere. The restaurant only has limited table, definitely need reservations to come here. The place focuses more on a wide range of quality vegetables across the world. Very unique presentation of the dishes! My partner was having the vegetarian option and it was as good as the non vegetarian options. The chef even packed us his hometown cake to bring home for tasting.
A little high on the cost, but worth the experience!

One of the most breathtaking food experience I had the chance to enjoy.

Amazing culinary journey. The contemporary symphony of aromas and textures through a vegetarian focus was fresh, exciting and new. Every dish is meticulously crafted to bring a delightful balance of flavors. The wine pairing was on point. Compliments job to the chef.

Excellent service. Attentiveness and professionalism exceeded our expectations.

The atmosphere was warm, friendly and cosy. We felt welcomed and in optimal conditions to savor our dinner.

We recommend this restaurant to anyone passionate about food.

Beautiful vegetarian cuisine, beautiful ambience, beautiful service and staff. Just take that leap for tastebud and exquisite ingredients discovery. Presentation of the food, attention to your dining experience made it such a pleasant experience. Do come by each season for different culinary exposure.

Chef Jeremy and the team did a fantastic job championing seasonal vegetables. The wine paring was beautifully done for each course to highlight the taste of the food with a great balance.

The ambience of the restaurant was intimate and lovely but the light was slightly dark. It was a birthday celebration and we had a great time throughout the night.

The menu was exceptional, a great variation of vegetables and herbs tastefully balanced and beautifully presented. The choice of courses was perfectly matched. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The chef introduced himself to all the guests and was very accommodating. We really enjoyed our dinner at JAG, a highlight in Singapore.

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
I came to Singapore few weeks ago and was looking for Mediterranean restaurants. I stumbled upon this gorgeous place 5 minutes away from my hotel. I tried Kebabs on day one and man it was delicious. Atmosphere is great and all servers are friendly, specially three girls Urmi, Wendy and Fina are super nice, they make sure to get you a table quickly, take the order in timely manner and also make valuable suggestions on the menu. They always keep checking if everything is fine and customers are enjoying food. I loved the desert suggestion after eating my dinner. After first day I have been to this place 7-6 times and was always greeted with same service. I highly recommend this restaurant and will go again before I leave Singapore for USA.

We had the sultan's delight and mussels with garlic cream and cheese toast. The sultan's delight is really enjoyable. We could taste the smokiness from the eggplant puree and the lamb stew is really tender with tomato based sauce. It's tangy and smoky with some crunchiness from the pine nuts. Really enjoyable. But the mussel is pretty standard. It didn't taste really fresh but they're quite generous with the amount. The garlic cheese sauce is ok only.
Service was good and attentive.

Visited for my birthday meal with my family as I was craving some Mediterranean food and this place had great reviews. However, the whole experience ended up kinda disappointing - as I had high expectations too on my first visit.

Service:
- It’s a restaurant but I felt like there was not much service per say.
- It’s a pretty high price point but they don’t serve complimentary water (charged at $3 a pot of hot water, or $11 for Evian water only)
- Ordering isn’t as fuss free as they try to make it. Online ordering only from mobile app, with just one physical menu at the door. Asked for any extra copies for easier viewing but none available. You also have to pay upfront in mobile order.
- Feels like I visited a restaurant but received fast food style service.

Atmosphere:
- Overall atmosphere is okay. Like a typical restaurant

Food:
- Average, I’ve had much better at other places for a similar price point.
- Pita bread, spreads and kebab grills were okay.
- Saffron rice & Briyani rice were disappointing. They use basmati rice which gave a nice texture. However, flavour is so subtle that I could barely taste the difference between the 2.

Summary:
Would I return? Definitely not! For the price point, the food and service didn’t live up to expectations for a highly rated restaurant. Will continue on my hunt for yummy Mediterranean food!

Visited on a Thu night, it's superb crowded and busy in the restaurant. 3 dishes for 2 people, very filling. Overall the food is pretty decent and the price point is on the higher side.

Excellent experience with vibrant dining experience. Food has great range of taste to excite the palate. Service is welcoming and top notch, they also gave a complimentary cake.
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: Pistachio Middle Eastern & Mediterranean Grill

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
Absolutely loved my dining experience at this Greek restaurant! The flavors were authentic, and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. The staff was incredibly friendly, making it a delightful meal from start to finish. Can't wait to go back and savor more of their delicious dishes!

The meat platters and lamb rack at this Greek gem are culinary masterpieces! Each bite is a flavor explosion, and the tenderness of the meats is truly impressive. The dips, a perfect accompaniment, add an extra layer of deliciousness to every dish. A must-try for anyone who appreciates top-notch Greek cuisine!

Visited for the first time after hearing good reviews from friends. Awesome ambience and child-friendly. Helpful staff who helped us with food orders and wine recommendation. Dips were great, octopus tender and flavourful. Desserts were also delightful. The standout dish was the lamb chops!

Had dinner some time last week and the food was pretty good but it was quite pricey. The waiter asked if we would like sparkling or still water and we thought still meant free tap water, but it turned out to be $10 bottled water. Don’t make the same mistake as we did if you don’t want to splurge on water!

Unfortunately, we found a piece of stainless steel dish sponge in our food which is quite unhygienic and dangerous. The staff were kind enough to take it off our bill but this was a very eventful first experience dining here.

We had an excellent dinner here at Blu Kouzina. The food was delicious, staff very friendly and helpful, and the restaurant designed beautifully.

We shared the meat platter, kebab platter, 4 dip platter (tzatziki, hummus, red pepper, harissa), and kanafe. Everything we ordered was cooked to perfection and tasted amazing. Stand outs include the lamb chop and the red pepper dip.

The restaurant even served us a few drinks on the house!

Overall a great dining experience and easy recommendation.

Went to celebrate birthday with a few friends. The food and service were good. Only disappointment is that when we were leaving the place, the wine was actually not finished.  The staff could do better to confirm if we still want it before throwing the bottle away.
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: Blu Kouzina Siglap

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
Can't go wrong with Petes's for kebabs. Been coming here for years and the quality is always top notch.

Highly recommend the lamb kebabs - they are probably my favourite across Singapore.

Ordered Chicken with Hummus and find it nice 👍Serving was small so ordered another with fries. Chicken was well cooked and flavourful.
Pricing above average.

The food was great. Meat was fresh and tasty. The spicy sauce is fantastic :)

Great taste and good try for our 1st time on Mediterranean grills foods! This are today special dishes!

Seats are shared with a few other stalls within this eatery. You order from the shop you want to eat from.
Falafel were large, crispy, fluffy and delicious. The hummus texture was just right - not an amorphous baby food mush, not too chunky, and very tasty. Lamb kofta was on the salty side for me, but tasty nonetheless and of a good meaty texture. Thoroughly enjoyed both versions of chili blend - the green one and the red one. Warning for regular people: the red one is very spicy. Pita bread was on the flat side, a bit taco-like.
The owner is friendly and approachable.
Will definitely be back!

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: Pete’s Mediterranean Grill

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
The best Greek restaurants we’ve ever been in Singapore. The ingredients are so fresh and every dish is very delicious.
The desert is also the highlight.

Will come back to try more dishes.

Came here for a work lunch as the food was supposed to be good! Apparently my friend said that the standards have dropped and the food used to be better prior to their renovation…

Also, the restaurant has a strict 2 hours rule in place and we had to vacate the place by 2pm for their closing.. not a good experience for sure.

One of the best Greek food I’ve ever had! The dips are yummy, pitas are warm and tasty, the grilled octopus is one of the best I’ve ever had!!!! The tacos giros are yummy and the beef is of great quality! One more thing to mention is that they even serve Greek beer!!! The service is good, decoration/interior design is top! A must go place!!!!

The best Greek food in Singapore!

Slightly pricey but the food taste amazing, simple yet flavorful!

The highlight for me was the octopus and eggplant spread 💯

Beautiful interior decor but the place was a little cramped and noisy due to the proximity of the tables. Food was great, esp the grilled octopus, but prices are on the higher end. Worth a try :)
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: Alati Divine Greek Cuisine

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
Third time back at this restaurant and certainly will be back for more. Authentic Turkish cuisine and we especially love the creamy hummus, chickpea stew and delightful kunefe. Great service as well. Will recommend to visit in a group to try a variety of sides and mains!

Everything is delicious here! Staffs are friendly, the Kunefe is one of the best, and the Karavan kebabs, both beef and lamb, are amazing! 😅 The hot pita bread is also great. In the last 4-5 months, we've visited this place many times, and our friends love it too. Whenever we want to enjoy a meal without worrying about quality and taste, we head straight to this restaurant. 😋 You won't regret giving it a try!

Hummus! Good! The lunch set is value for money - comes with a main + drink + soup + bread + dessert all for $20!
The pita bread is baked to perfection and the submarine bread looks so amazing! However the price for the submarine bread is a little high. Will probably not order this again the next time.
The soup of the day was lentil soup (vegetable soup) its really rich and herby. Very different from what i usually have.
The chicken dish is the highlight of the meal. The chicken meat is sooooo soft and tender. The seasoning is on point. Goes really well with the breads. The rice that comes with the dish is really fragrant as well.
Lots of vegetarian options.
Overall a positive experience and will recommend 👍🏻

Total bill is about $85++

Ordered quite abit for 2 person.  Love the cauliflower salad. Hummus, eggplant dips. As we were celebrating our birthday, the restaurant gave us complimentary tea and a kind of Turkish delight. The staff were attentive and friendly. Will definitely go back for the cauliflower salad and hummus.

This was my second visit today and my colleagues and I absolutely loved the food! I am usually not a fan of Turkish or Mediterranean food but this place is an exception. After trying the food a few months ago for the first time, I have been wanting to visit them again.

Every dish was delicious and tasted fresh and   wholesome. The Mezeplate is a good option if you are not sure what to order as it has a bit of everything and you can to try the different dips and appetisers. I enjoyed the hummus, cauliflower salad and eggplant dip very much. Their lentil soup was very good too - comforting and tasty.

For the mains, we tried two of their lunch set meals -  two rice dishes with the different chicken kebabs which were served with tea, soup and a rice pudding dessert. We also ordered their salmon which was so tender and flavourful. Several colleagues commented that it was the best salmon they had ever tasted!

The highlight of the meal was their dessert - Kunefe which was absolutely delicious! The taste and texture was so complex and had so much depth! The crispy stringy pastry with the creamy sauce, nuts and ice cream was indeed like what the menu described it to be - “a slice of heaven”!

This is seriously an underrated restaurant which serves amazing food and I would highly recommend it :)

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: The Mediterranean Deli Turk

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
I had the pleasure of trying Turkish cuisine for the first time, and it was truly a delightful experience! The standout dish for me was the lamb; it had absolutely no odor and tasted fantastic. The grilled items were a highlight as well, bursting with delicious flavors. The restaurant’s ambiance was beautifully decorated, and the staff was both charming and incredibly helpful, taking the time to explain the dishes to us. While it’s not the cheapest option, the prices are fair for the quality you receive.

One thing to note, though, is that the platter we ordered was described as “for two,” but for Asians, it’s considered a generous portion. So, if there are four of you and you’ve already ordered other dishes, I recommend going for the platter for two only; it’s quite substantial. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great dining experience!

First time having Turkish food and was really
pleasantly surprised. Their dips and bread was really exceptional. The bread was steaming when it came out it was both crispy and fluffy at the same time. The platter for 2 was also great all the grilled meats was tender and flavourful. Portion was also huge.

Everything from the service to food were impeccable. Staff were polite and always made sure we were well taken care of. I ordered before my friend came and they asked when the food should be prepared and how it should be served. Food was perfectly done too. It is the little things that make a difference and win them a return customer.

Very impressive food & service displayed by the dedicated front staffs and chefs. It’s nice walking in the street after a wine & dine session in the area. The staffs were very attentive, price is reasonable.

Went here for a birthday celebration and the attention to detail from their service staff is amazing, didn’t mention to the staff that it was for a birthday celebration, only had a note in the reservation. But they went above and beyond, having candles in the dessert and even giving us props to take pictures with and proceeded to then print out the photo of us to keep!

The food also matches the service, authentic Turkish cuisine done perfectly, the Hummus was so good we had to order a second portion! I’m not usually a fan of chicken but the chicken that came with the platter blew my mind, so juicy and tender. Then comes dessert, my first time having Kunefe and the only thing I have to say is that I wish I didn’t share it, wanted it all to myself 🤣

Definitely coming back here again!

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: Alaturka Mediterranean & Turkish Restaurant

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
My favourite Greek restaurant in Singapore of all time.  I have been here 10 TIMES. The food is always so consistently good. They serve the best salad, octopus, sea bream, lamb chop and even chicken. Their dips and pita bread are also to die for. Service isn't as good as it used to be anymore but oh well.

Celebrated a friend birthday here and the staff was quite helpful. We were introduced to a good spread. Wasn’t expecting the food to be good in this type of cafe but was pleasantly surprised of the meat quality and portion. Slightly on the salty side but acceptable. Overall, would come back again.

Loved having dinner here. Food, service, atmosphere all fantastic. Wayne was a great server who recommended some signature dishes - codfish roe was my fav. Octopus was well cooked and kebab was also unique but perfectly cooked.

Came here multiple times including the one at the old location. Also recommended and brought my friends, colleagues here many times! Loved the food, ambience and service! Just so good! This time my friends and I came here to celebrate birthday and the bar manager treated us to complimentary alcohol and gave a small bottle of olive oil (we also purchased a big one!). Their olive oil tastes so gooooooood! The dessert was complimentary as well. I love the fish, octopus and vegetables the best!

Food is fantastic. Price is reasonable as well, total damage is about $50/pax. (We ordered like 7-8 dishes).
Service is pretty prompt. The ambience is good & cozy for gathering & chit-chatting.
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM

Sunday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: BAKALAKI Greek Taverna

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
We had our dinner here on Good Friday night with the last minute reservation from google.
We ordered a starter, a pizza, a grilled meat platter and a Lebanon dessert. The food worth 2 stars. The meat was pretty hard, the starter was too sour. The dessert was really not able to match our taste. The house wines was tasteless, but the red wine taste better when it pair with the meat. I will strongly recommend you only order the red if you want to have their one for one house wine promo.
Our bill was $128, you can get a much more better grilled meat platter and better food at other restaurants. :)

Le Rida has a rustic ambience somewhat akin to an old time eating house in a small town. Quaint and homely
Freshly baked pita bread with lemon chick pea hummus was delicious and filling
Mains of Lebanese lamb kafta kebab had the right balance of flavour and crunchiness.
Wash it all down with 1 for 1 Heineken draft at $17.90

Manager Sanjiv was both friendly and helpful in his recommendations and unlike in some establishments, he did not push you to over order.
Definitely worth a return visit!

A quaint no frills dining place with excellent food and good service. The staff are simple people but are very hospitable, often checking in on the food quality and our experience. If you are looking for a good meal away from hustle and bustle, this is the place to go. Oh.. U can definitely have a conversation with your company and hear them loud and clear

Didn't think the food was thaaaat amazing. Nor was the service. But at least they let us drink outside drinks.
HOWEVER, i requested for no garnishing on my hummus. When the guy brought it over, there WAS parsley on it. And all he said was "just pluck it out". --.--
So if i was allergic to that, i should just pluck it out.... nice. The hummus wasn't good either. I've tasted better. Like a friend who went with me commented... it isn't creamy enough. Also, comments about the baklava was that it was too hard... and wasn't good.

Absolutely loved the food, I am heavily into Mediterranean food. I have tried most of the places around Bugis as well. The food here was so fresh, with perfect taste and presentation. It was completely worth it travelling from East.
The service was quick, the portion size was generous . We ordered mezze plateer and tabalu salad. They were scrumptious loved the customised heart shaped Pita bread. Hummus, was so creamy and so were all other dips.

Would strongly recommend.. It has become one of my favourite place..

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: Le Rida (Mediterranean. French. North Indian)

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
I tried the Greek Kebab (Grilled Chicken with Avocado)-Very filling. Only comment is the sauce..only tasted most of it towards the end, not evenly distributed but the chicken had a generous chunky serving. Overall, it was delicious and fresh plus it was nicely sealed that there's no veggie peeping on the paper or any sign of a soggy end of the wrap once I got home. Well done and hope more will get to try it too :)

I love the crispy fluffy falafel and chicken shish wrap here. Selvam was awesome at customizing the wraps and making good chat. Super nice and quick dinner!

Good muslim food available. The person who serve Mr. Hanif

Food taste is secondary, the senior guy at shop is super frustrated and mean with possibly new colleague. Almost as if he will start throwing away things, shouting and all infront of customers.

And obv in this environment the new guy served us wrong order, and seems bit untrained and unaware of what he’s making.

Overall, never visiting again because of atmosphere and food both.

I recently enjoyed a hummus pita and falafel wrap at Pita Tree, and it was a taste sensation! The hummus was rich and velvety, spreading its creamy goodness over warm pita bread that was the perfect blend of soft and slightly crispy. The falafel in the wrap was a crispy, flavorful delight  a delightful contrast to the smooth hummus. The combination of these two in a single bite was heavenly. Pita Tree truly excels at crafting Mediterranean classics with fresh, quality ingredients. This dish left me craving for more, and I can't wait to return for another flavorful experience. A must-visit for hummus and falafel lovers! Somemore Thank you so much Mr Hanif for your suggestion…
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM

Sunday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: Pita Tree Kebabs - Katong

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
This was my third or fourth time here. My last visit was quite awhile back. The food, ambience, and service here are very good! Parking is free! Place tends to get crowded and there’s sometimes a queue, so it’s wise to make a reservation before heading down. Had the dips and bread, octopus, sea bass, spinach pastries, and finally, baklava for dessert! Everything was great! Octopus was nice and tasty + tender, sea bass was fresh, all the pastries were warm and the Greek coffee we had to end the meal was pretty good too! Will be back here again to try more food! Hopefully sooner than later! Highly recommended for authentic Greek Mediterranean food! Fantastic experience every visit!

A lovely place for those looking for non pork meals. They don’t qualify as a halal place  as they serve alcohol. But good for Muslim friends. It was my first time here and it’s been a while since I had Greek food. I love the dips option from spicy to mild tasting dips. The fried calamari was great too followed by the medium rare lamb which was tender. Ensure you make a reservation to avoid disappointment. Good place to bring friends.

Always crowded on weekends such that even booking a table on same day is sometimes not possible.
I really enjoyed the medium meat platter. grilling was on point  meat was juicy and not dry.
moussaka went down way too easily. Greek dip platter was on point flavour wise and the taramasalata was flavourful without tasting too fishy.
sadly the pita bread is pretty small portioned, I'm not sure how you're expected to finish the dip given with the portions served
Grilled octopus was also delicious.

Service was friendly and efficient.
Decor isn't very Greek but honestly ambience is great (albeit a bit noisy)

It's harder to get a table here than the at its closest competitor, and for  good reason.

Good food. Although the beef can be on the dry side, everything else was delicious.

Highly recommend the grilled octopus. It is not chewy at all. For those who don’t like squid or octopus, try to have a bite.

Restaurant is packed on a Friday night and the food arrives pretty quick. Staff are quite alright. Some could use a little refining in politeness.

There’s complimentary licorice candy. Absolutely love it.

Will visit this place again. But recommend to come here in a bigger group to order a larger variety of dishes.

First visit. Reservation was smooth via seven rooms. We chose an outdoor table as the weather was pleasant. The food was delicious. We had the whole oven chicken and chicken yiro wrap with fries. Pesto pasta was good as well. Desserts were amazing too. Overall highly satisfied.
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: Blu Kouzina Dempsey

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
The most delicious Mediterranean food in Singapore. Very friendly staff,- quick service and very nice Singapore Sling. Super clean environment, good ambiance and price worthy. 5/5 will come back for sure.

If you like Hummus, this restaurant/pub has the best Hummus in Singapore 🇸🇬 .
Just order the big portion! You won't regret it.

For a person who doesn't like lamb, I'd like to share that this restaurant is the only one where I would not hesitate to order their lamb shanks!

The atmosphere is good for catching up with friends over a beer and a good Turkish meal.  A change from the usual type of dining places we locals normally go to. The friends I brought there thoroughly enjoyed the evening.

The staff are friendly and humorous.  It can get crowded Friday nights.  So go early!

They are open 6 days a week, closed on Sunday.

Super juicy and delicious kebab and loved the hummus and babaganoush too. The lunch special is good value for the quality and portion. Service was quick and helpful. Will definitely be back to try more.

Kazbar's cold mezze platter is a delightful mix of flavors with hummus, baba ghanoush, tabbouleh, falafel, stuffed grape leaves, olives, and pickled veggies. The lychee mint crush mocktail is a must-try, and the lively atmosphere adds to the overall experience. 🌟

Unique experience eating middle eastern food. The food was great and there was quite a bit of variety. Also the staff were very friendly! It is a bit on the pricey side but it is still worth the experience.

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: Kazbar - Middle Eastern & Lebanese Restaurant + Catering

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
Food was amazing and prepared fantastically - delicious and hearty Greek/Mediterranean fare. All the restaurant staff were exceptionally warm, friendly, and kind, and it felt like we were having a sit down dinner at a family home. For the birthday celebration, everyone sang happy birthday as well and we were so well taken care of. The ambience was amazing. Definitely must try and we will definitely come back.

We went to Mykonos by the bay on 1st July to celebrate my daughter’s birthday. I must say that the service staff was quite friendly but the  quantity of the food actually disappointed us. The food was nice but portions were extremely small so we have to order more food. Specially the platter, which was priced at $29 was totally not worth as the dips portions were too small.

Very nice view of the marina of docked boats, al fresco dining.
Well trained staff, skillful and knowledgeable.
Food is equally fantastic.

Food is excellent, especially the fish, perfect with the creamy garlic source. Not too crowded on a Monday night, it was windy and comfortable with the outdoor seats. Staffs are attentive. Overall very pleasant experience.

Great Greek Food

Had dinner with a bunch of friends. We ordered to share. The meat sharing platter was of high quality and cooked to perfection despite it being a dish with many different types of meat. The breads and dips were also great.

Service was excellent. We had them arrange tables and then changed tables. They accommodated us each step of the way without any fuss. Service came promptly with a smile.

The place certainly lived up to its Mykonos name - blue and white furniture graced the place. Outdoor sitting was comfortable with ceiling ELV fans constantly cooling the place next to the water.
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.address: 31 Ocean Way, #01-10 Quayside Isle, Sentosa Cove, 098375
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: Mykonos On The Bay

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
Very underrated restaurant.
Food is great, service is good and ambience is clean, Price is very decent and restaurant is well designed. Why is this place so quiet? Please give them a chance, it’s a really quite amazing.

The lamb shank is highly recommended. Really just drop off the bone type. The butter rice is also amazing.

First visit to this Turkish food joint thru a friend's recommendation. The Mix Grill Platter offers a nice variety for sampling. Found the meat a bit tougher than my preference. The marination for lamb was good, not gamy. The Pistachio Baklava a bit too sweet - normal, most Turkish desserts are too sweet for me. Would return to try their other Turkish delights.

The place is very pretty so we were expecting a pretty decent food. However, as much as I wanted to love the place, the food was a big let down. We were the first to arrive for their dinner service but we waited for 20mins for our dips to be served. The dips are very poor, it’s like store-bought and tasted old, and the bread, i think they only gave one. Moussaka tasted like something I would make without knowing what moussaka tastes like (eggplant with watery tomato sauce). We also had a mixed grill, which at $70+, is quit disappointing.

Maybe it is worth having their lunch set of wrap, but our dinner experience was quite poor.

Love the food. Price is fair and service is fast! Although it's scanning QR code for the menu, apparently it's still ordering through a wait staff.

Very good Turkish food. Much better than the other Turkish or Mediterranean restaurants I had so far in Dempsey and other locations. Lamb shank is meat drop off bone and kunefe dessert was excellent and highly recommended.
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: Arkadas Cafe & Restaurant

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
Celebrated my birthday here with my hubby on 16 Nov 2023 and it was a pleasant dinner for us. We are satisfied with the ambience, food, drinks, service and the atmosphere.

The staff are polite and helpful. We ordered the Mixed Jumbo Kebab Platter for us to share and followed by Kunefe with ice cream for dessert. They even sang birthday song to me when they presented the dessert with a candle on it. It is very nice and I appreciate their thoughtfulness.

We are impressed with the jumbo platter as all the meat and veggies are well prepared, well marinated and well cooked. We finished everything off the plate. It is simply delicious. We also enjoyed the Turkish Tea and dessert.

We will definitely return to try out other food from here again.

If you follow my Google reviews, you'll know I'm very critical. Yet, this is a restaurant that I'm giving a full five-star rating. That is because it's really perfection!

This was my third visit, and this time was with a group of friends. I was not kidding when I shared that I liked the food here more than what I had when I was in Istanbul! Was it because they catered well to the local Singaporeans? I'm unsure, but I really liked the Turkish food here! Most importantly, the service quality here had been great thus far! Please maintain!

Such a gem! The food was so I’m very impressed!! Some meats are dry but overall the food is so good! I love the hummus dips! Our table was nxt to the glass so the view was amazing!!! The food does get cold fast because the place is cold!

I love love love the desserts they are super sweet as expected of Turkish desserts but with their tea or coffee it is perfection! Will come back for the desserts!!

My partner and I had a wonderful anniversary lunch at Sofra Turkish restaurant. We were impressed by the authentic and delicious Turkish food, the friendly and attentive service, and the cozy and relaxing ambience. We ordered the mix platter salad, the chicken Adana kebab, the baklava, and the Turkish coffee, and we enjoyed every bite and sip. The salad was fresh and flavorful, the kebab was tender and juicy, the baklava was sweet and crunchy, and the coffee was strong and aromatic. The portions were generous and satisfying. The staff were very kind and helpful, and they even gave us an extra dessert to celebrate our special occasion. We felt very welcomed and appreciated. The restaurant has a nice view of the CBD and esplanade, which added to the romantic atmosphere. We had a great time at Sofra Turkish restaurant, and we highly recommend it to anyone who loves Turkish cuisine. It is one of the best Turkish restaurants we have ever been to.

Amazing food. Would recommend! Good options but most of it are variation of similar items. Service is friendly and prompt. Prices are slightly above average but portions are good for sharing, so its good for groups. Great outdoor views (minus the heat). Would be good if there are those  mist-fans or coolers outdoor.
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.opening_hours:

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: Sofra Turkish Cafe & Restaurant

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
This is the most awesome place in all of Singapore! Huge veranda overlooking the park, delicious Turkish food! Super hospitable staff! Everything is always delicious, fresh, you can only enjoy food and views with such pleasure here! I would never have thought that there were such wonderful places in this city!

I ordered the baked cheese rice with chicken and it was pretty good, adequate cream sauce with the rice, the chicken was tasty & the melted cheese made it all better overall. Although I would say that the portion is slightly small, but perfect for one person. The other dish was kebab chicken rice - the shredded chicken was really good and the rice had a delicious buttery taste too. It came with some salad on the side, although without salad sauce, when paired with the chicken and rice it was a good meal :) The drinks prices were too high though, does not seem worth it.

Awesome food - awesome people - great location!
True Turkish hospitality!
Our favourites are
-the Turkish tea
- Adana kebab
- Lahmacun (bread with Lamb meat )
- Ekmek (Bread)
- Lavash (Turkish Bread)

Pricing is a bargain compared to other Turkish Restaurants in Arab Street.
For us it’s our everyday go to!

Food is a little towards dry but fragrant and taste is acceptable. Service is not so fantastic, 2 people sharing but no side plates and only given 2 thin pcs of serviette which we used to  hold the pizza. Venue is still considered good and outdoot sitting is pet friendly.

Overall, it's something can consider to try. Still grateful for making their outdoor sitting pet friendly.

Unassuming on the outside with minimal decor on the inside, I thought that there’s no way this place could be selling authentic middle eastern food!

But of course I was wrong. Meat dishes are decently priced and delicious, baked goods are fresh, and the Kunafe is deeelightful.
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.opening_hours:

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: Kebab Station

Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.reviews:
Had a take away as there were only a few small tables stuck between food counters so not particularly inviting. Ordered pitta and baba ganush. It tasted good but whether it was made fresh that morning I can’t be sure cause it looked like they were taking precooked pitta out that had been in the fridge although there were fresh dough balls on the counter.

The best Hummus and Falafel I have tasted thus far!
The Hummus is creamy and smooth with generous amount of Tahini and nice Olive oil while the Falafel is filled with Herbs at the right point.
Even though I had it take-away for supper, the food was still delicious.
I had Pita and Olive since 100AM days (more than 10years ago) and the Hummus never fails!
Although there was once when I did a take-away during lock-down, the Shawarma was a little over-cooked which the hit and miss is common with the manpower shortage seen at f&b.
But happy to have the nicely done Shawarma back again this time!
The price is reasonable with the quality provided compared to restaurant prices, not forgetting that the current rental must be way more exp than 100AM days although it is only a kiosk space.
A satisfied and happy customer😋

The Falafel with Hummus and Pita set was $16, although I agree with many users here suggesting that the portion is small, I do think that with the quality of the food, it might not be sustainable to up the portion without a significant price increase.

The falafel were nicely warmed, soft and flaky, great if you're having a scratchy throat and avoiding the deep fried variety. It was nicely seasoned and the warming spices hit just the right spot. I love the olive-tomato-salad thing and wish the portion was bigger but I guess with rising food costs, I find the portion reasonable.

The hummus was really smooth and lemon notes really help to cut through the spices from the falafel. Pita bread had a nice yeasty aroma and was soft and easy to stuff.

My only complaint was that it was really hard to cut and portion the pita bread with plastic cutleries and plates. It kept running about. The place is also quite squeezy and warm.

I'm a big fan of the Pita Pockets as the ingredients are always tasty and plentiful. I'll often take a tub of fresh Hommous home as well. If you are in the Great World area call in and try this great family business.

We were greeted by a Shalom!!!

The recommendations were awesome.
The beef was flavourful and delish. The bread was warm and safe and went well with the hummus.

I would definitely come again.

P.S forgot to take pictures at the beginning.
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.address: 1 Kim Seng Promenade, #B1, K109 Great World, 237994
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast.name: Pita & Olives

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.reviews:
Looking for a truly authentic Vietnamese experience on our sunny island? Long Phung offers a spread of delicious Vietnamese dishes at prices that won't break the bank.

Every dish is packed full of flavour. You'll be left craving for more. And as you're dining, let your cup of Vietnamese coffee slowly drip, and you can enjoy the robust beverage as a perfect finisher to your meal.

Seating space is adequate, but do arrive early if you're looking to dine as the spaces fill up quite fast, especially on weekends.

We were out in the east and decided to try this place because there were a lot of good reviews. Seems like a pretty traditional Vietnamese menu. Food was good and you can tell it wasn’t seasoned for foreigners…it had very sublet but well balanced flavors. We loved all the sauces and the balance of crunch & soft textures. Our favorite was the fried spring rolls the flaky crust was so good it was addictive. The smoothies left a lot to be desired, they seem to be very skimpy on the fruit. Otherwise I love it that the food is also very light so you don’t feel so stuffed at the end. We didn’t get any noodle soup, maybe next time, but most people seem to have some sort of soup. We would definitely go back. The downside is the location (if you aren’t close) but the price, value and quality are all top notch.

Most of their dishes come with sweet sauce which  I like. Beef was okie, not very tender but their spring roll was good. Their crepe was special, inside got prawn and pork belly. I think they add coconut to the crepe

Paid 23.22 for the meal. Food was decent, served very quickly.

All seems fresh. My spring rolls may have been sitting a while as all 4 pieces were stocked together. Tough texture for the skin. Ingredients were fine.

Overall more of a good vibe. Maybe skip the ones I have ordered and get a pho or fish. Didn't satisfy my cravings.

Authentic Vietnamese food. Speedy service. Love the jellyfish salad, grilled squid, and beef stew. Banh Mi bread is exactly the same as those found in Vietnam. Returned twice in less than a week. Highly recommended!
Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.opening_hours:

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.reviews:
This was the first time I tried authentic Vietnamese food as a vegetarian - thanks to the chefs for being so accommodative!
The food was quite nice, though not as flavourful as I was expecting it to be but tasty nonetheless. The tamarind drink was also super nice!

Decent Vietnamese restaurant that provides authentic food. We would recommend their chicken wings and grilled pork rice. Service is also quite pleasing.

A fellow foodie introduced me to this Vietnamese restaurant. We tried two type of beef noodle. The classic  beef noodle soup was good in that the broth was tasty. The other special beef noodle was more interesting in that the broth resembled that of Singapore prawn noodle.
Our favorite dish was the pancake where the meat and crepe is wrapped with lettuce and dipped in a sauce. Somehow the combination turned out to be nice.
We also ordered fried chicken wings, spring roll (fresh and fried skin) and chendol.
On the whole, the food is authentic and good. Service was also very good.

Another family favourite joint as we live nearby. Food is always consistently good 👍.

The banh mi is actually a "new" edition to the menu and the one to try is the Traditional. Plain baguette goes v well with chicken curry which is super yummy!

The Banh Cuon (Vietnamese version of chee chiong fun) although pricey (in SG) is worth ordering bcoz you won't be able to find it anywhere else. Freshly done, it is chockfulof crunchy bean sprouts, Thai basil and complemented with slices of Vietnamese ham.

The beef and chicken soup noodles are also to-die-for...try and you won't regret it. Same with the grilled pork chip rice!

Very nice little Vietnamese restaurant. Has a huge menu. We ordered 6 different dishes. All came relatively fast and super fresh. All the staff are Vietnamese and the place had a very authentic vibe.
Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.opening_hours:

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.reviews:
Pretty good pho. Thought the broth to be a touch too sweet though (maybe too much rock sugar for my taste). Herbs were generous and fragrant. Meat was tasty. Wish there were more noodles and a larger portion for the price but still worth coming to get.

Really enjoyed my bowl of Pho, I had the $9 one with Beef Slices and Beef Balls! 👍🏻 Broth was very fragrant and the meat was tender as well. Had some roasted chicken for side dish and they were tender too, even though it does look quite dry. Trust me! It’s not! 😃

Vietnamese coffee is a bit sweet for me but after adding hot water; it is ok. Food wise; not too bad but nothing out of the ordinary. Charges 50 cents for half a glass of warm water and waited quite long for it. Smiling face was greeted with frowning faces. Is this place so popular that customers are 2nd class?

I am a regular here. Convenient place in Zhao Chiat for a good value quick Vietnamese food fix. Recommend their pho, congee, fried squid

Small Vietnamese restaurant with authentic menu. First time here and happy with the food, generous portion w reasonable price. Will come back again ❤️

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.reviews:
They serve good Banh Mi, very authentic. The baguette was so crispy and soft not hard. I tried the Traditional and BBQ Beef, portion was very reasonable. As for the service, it was good 👍. Very friendly staff. Environment was also cozy. Will come back again.

Really really good banh mi! Our fav is the the chicken - though the others were good too! Affordable and quick to prepare. They have good coffee too!

Grilled pork banh mi was delicious, i enjoyed the pickled vegetables and kick from the chili padi too. Their bread is really light with a thin/crispy crust. Affordable and good place to get your banh mi fix! But i would prefer if the bread was more fragrant.

Great Banh Mi for a reasonable price! crispy bread. Best vietnam drip coffee I've ever had. they also have great service, the ladies were very nice. the uncle is also very kind.

The Best Banh Mi in Singapore, period. (I was born in Saigon) — go for Banh Mi, Siew Mai in a bowl, Goi Cuon (Summer Roll), Bun Thit Nuong.

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.name: 233 Banh Mi

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.reviews:
The food is savoury and tastes better than I had expected! Grilled pork and chicken meats were fragrant and tender...and very flavourful. Service staff are friendly and doing their best despite the manpower shortage. Expect mid-scale cafe price, but the excellent taste of the food is worth it. Portion size is decent too.

We ordered the beef banh mi , crab-pork brain soup and Vietnamese spring roll. We particularly liked the spring roll and the coffee. The soup was a little too thick for our liking but the brain had a clean taste. Overall a nice place a quick Vietnamese meal and coffee.

Cosy and clean. Very friendly service crew. Ordered spicy hue noodle soup, dried grilled pork noodle & beef wrapped in betel leaves. The food tasted pretty good ! Portions are generous as well.

Nice shop with good food. Tried fresh srimp rolls and beef combination pho.

Soup is sweet and herbs aplenty.
Shrimp roll is a little warm from the pork but really nice too!

We came on a Saturday afternoon. Love the atmosphere and ambience. A good place to chit chat. Ordered the beef sticks, chicken pho soup, dried pork vemicelli and prawn spring rolls. Can say their vietnamese food is good. Will come again.

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.reviews:
Decent Vietnamese place.

I had their egg coffee and special pho.

For the pho, the sliced meat was not the juiciest but the flavour was intense. Sliced meat ball were the highlight. Soup was on the sweet side but swirl it with the chilli and you will be happy.

First time having a egg coffee. If you like intense coffee with creamy egg, then give it a try.

Cool ambience & chill vibe beer hangout place in joo chiat neighbourhood. Good value beer $6.90

Legit Viet food at a good price. Coming back for sure!

Friendly and fast service! Good egg coffee, cha gio, grilled octopus skewers. Will come back to try hotpot and others!

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.reviews:
Great choices of Vietnamese food. Friendly service. I would eat there again.

Not a place for food, took 20mins for a simple Pho Bo during off peak

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.name: The Sisters

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.reviews:
Randomly dropped by to try due to reviews. Was surprised to find that they are fully vegetarian. Still didn't disappkint tho. Even my meat loving husband enjoyed his vegan meat burger here.

Ordered their standard chicken bahnmi which was great! The bread was nicely toasted, crunchy yet still soft and nicely balanced with the vegetables.

Their spring rolls are also really good!!

Definitely recommend this place.

atmosphere was rather quiet when we were there which is nice weekends tend to be slightly busier.

Food is really good though, both the beef and pork options are well marinated. we got the bun cha (well sorta bun cha) which came with spring rolls. the rolls appear to be yam based they were crispy and well done.

serving portions were of good size and would certainly come back again to try other options.

Been loving their food since before they changed to become a vegetarian restaurant, the quality has stayed the same since their switch. Bread is still so fresh and has a great crunch while being chewy, perfect banh mi bread.

Rating the food purely based on the mushroom and tofu vegetarian pho. It's really average and not the most bang for buck at $12 (+$2 for egg) but I went for it as I was craving something soupy. Nevertheless, I'd still be back to have my fill of vegetables and to try other stuff!

Ambience wise, this place is on its way to becoming thich nhat hanh's monastery food hall. The Buddhist mantra playing in the background creates an air of reverence; evoking a sense of decorum. I'd imagine that any noise made in this eatery feels disrespectful.

It'd be nice if the space was kept secular and casual so people can just have a hearty meal with friends. Cheers!

Sandwich Saigon converted to a pure vegetarian restaurant a week ago for religious reasons. We saw many customers coming in and leaving a bit confused. But we are not complaining 🤣 We love Vietnamese food and really happy there's vegetarian one at Katong now. The pho and bahn mi tastes great, the downside is that it's abit pricey.
Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.opening_hours:

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.reviews:
Below average vietnamese dishes in Singapore. The flavors of the pho wasnt so strong. The summer rolls was okay. But not great. Definitely opt for the vietnamese restaurant next door.

Every time I go to Singapore, I just love to say this 🥰

Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:30 PM
Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:30 PM
Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.name: Hong Win Cafe and Restaurant Pte Ltd

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.reviews:
I had a delightful experience at Joo Chiat Caphe! The atmosphere is warm and inviting, and the staff is incredibly friendly. The coffee was exceptional—rich and flavorful, just the way I like it. The menu offers a great variety, and I couldn't resist trying some of their delicious pastries. Each bite was a heavenly delight! I appreciate the attention to detail in both the food and the service. It's evident that the team at Joo Chiat Caphe is passionate about creating a memorable experience for their customers. I'll definitely be coming back for more.

Food and drinks exceptionally great.
Service staff well trained and friendly.
Different bread quality come try and u will know.

One of the places where u can find drip coffee in Singapore. Coffee smells great.
Quality food. Highly recommended.

Must try if you are in Joo Chiat area ☺️

The foods are good as well as their Vietnamese drip coffee. The amount of filling is fully loaded in their Banh Mi (as photo attached). I'll give a 5 star if the price of their coffee go slightly cheaper.

The shop is extremely stuffy and hot. Not much renovation done I guess. Seats are very cramped and limited. Coffee is diluted, not worth it I feel. However, banh mi is good. I order the earthquake and it is delicious. Wont recommend the coffee. Oh yes, the staff are extremely helpful and friendly.

Banh Mi tasted good and portion and filling was reasonable for the price. Viet coffee was good too, can go without sugar.
Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.name: Joo Chiat Caphe

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.reviews:
Though the quality of their food and service seem to have gone down compared to before covid, this place is still one of go-to spots for Vietnamese cuisine. They have plenty of choices for main, drinks as well as desserts. Grilled pork vermicelli, Bun bo Hue, che ba mau and iced tea are highly recommended. There are 2 separate indoor seating sections inside the mall, and one area outdoor that’s usually good at evening time.

A no frills place with decent food. You order from a QR code, and the food arrives petty quickly. The Banhmi was just okay. The fish tasted good. The beef with rice and banhmi bread was also decent. The spring roll was okay with the dip that they provide. Service is average.

A fantastic little place for a casual sunset dinner whilst in a riverside walk/bike ride. Food was delicious (great Smokey BBQ flavour on our meat, plenty of fresh veges and self serve condiments) at a reasonable price. Photos show the red bean smoothie, chicken bun and beef boon. Service was very fast, although minimal (self order via QR).

Nicely grill porkchop flavour on point
Dessert is normal.
Pork amount could have been a little more and it will be perfect.
Order via QR code.
Pay inside the shop after dining.
Alfresco dining feels gd with the right weather. But might get a hint of cigarettes smell once in awhile
service are friendly

Spring Roll was too oily. U can taste the oil. So was the Vietnamese pancake very oily. Grilled pork chop rice was tender n tasty. Pho was good quality stock. Someone place was crowded.
Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM
Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM
Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.name: Little Vietnam

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.reviews:
Post-dinner (>8pm) orders took 38min to arrive. Mix up of order too, although server offered to rectify.

Coffee was good, but pricey.

Ambience is good, decor is “modern” with bright highlights but overall dim dining atmosphere.

Understaffed when the menu is rather extensive. Staff able to converse in Vietnamese, basic Mandarin and basic English. Noted that main courses for tables after us were served their food first, some 10-15min before us.

The service is impeccable, great recommendations and we felt at home. Peter showed us how to eat the pancake and there was great showmanship! From the appetisers to the dessert, all was great.

Beautiful place, stellar service by Peter and authentic tasting food. One of the few places that have got me enjoy every dish!

1st time here.. Nice environment.. No need fly to Vietnam.. BUT Many dishes not available.. The highly recommended egg coffee is not available.... Staff is helpful BUT, poor command of English, can't give recommendation.. So if not well verse in Vietnamese cuisine, this may not be the place

Loved the food....came 3 days in a row.
Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.opening_hours:
Monday: 5:30 PM – 5:30 AM
Tuesday: 5:30 PM – 5:30 AM
Wednesday: 5:30 PM – 5:30 AM
