Sunday: 5:30 PM – 5:30 AM
Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.name: Vietsea II - Xom Nhau

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.reviews:
Repeated visits!!! Staffs are friendly and nice. Oyster fresh and sweet.
Love the Vietnamese pancake too as it’s crispy and fluffy. Lastly the roast pork baguette is crispy, and the pork is juicy.
Highly recommend!!!

I had a pleasure to dine in in this amazing restaurant. They serve incredibly delicious Vietnamese dishes with affordable prices. The ambience was quite good. I had a sense that I was back home at that moment. Definitely I’ll be come back with my friends next time

Visited for the first time today and tried their Bun Cha. It was good. Not as good as in Hanoi of course, but still delicious. We tried the fresh oysters at $1.90 a piece currently on promo and it was delicious and tasted fresh. The atmosphere is really like in the streets of Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh with the low tables and chairs. I recommend this place if you haven’t tried Vietnamese food.

Geylang is a food haven.

But if only you know where to find them

. If you like to time travel a bit to HCM.

This place can help you.

Try the viet beer to kick start

Then the salad, meat, follow by the rest is history.

Do remember my word of advise. Sit outside.

One of the best Vietnamese food in SG. The chilli dipping sauce is very appetising. The deep fried spring roll, bun cha, bbq etc are delicious. There is promotion on oysters as well, it’s fresh and plump. Price is affordable. Staff are attentive and friend. Nice ambience for friend gathering.
Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM

Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.name: Ăn Là Ghiền-Authentic Vietnamese Cuisine

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.reviews:
We had dinner there last Saturday, managed to get a table easily as there was no Q. We had the promo meal and added more veggie rolls and Imperial rolls (?) and more drinks.
I really liked the spicy beef Pho, very flavorful and the spiciness was just right. We enjoyed the food and the service was good too.
The only thing that can be improved here is the printing of QR codes given to tables as it's not friendly to the environment. A feedback that I shared with the cashier when paying.

The food was quite bland unfortunately, but the decor is nice and the service very friendly.

The chef recommended noodles in gravy in particular lacked all the flavour you'd expect from Vietnamese cuisine. The banh mi was better but the sauce was a bit odd, almost ketchup-y. Egg coffee was decent.

There are many better Vietnamese options around Katong, so I can't really recommend this one. It's nice, though, that they cater well to vegetarians.

Landed up at this Vietnamese place for a quick lunch with my daughter. Just the two of us

Been to other So Pho others but first time at Parkway Parade. Decent ambience, and was quiet around 2pm on a Sunday afternoon. Just 2-3 tables occupied.

The service was very good. Staff were helpful and efficient. All the food we ordered was delicious...

Definitely coming back again...for an un-pho-gettable experience 😜

Food was served very quickly. But it seems like they are short-staffed. The payment counter staff has to jump in for food service and ushering. Noodles this time now are slightly undercooked and have to be soaked in the broth slightly longer, but the plus side was that the broth was piping hot. Mixed platter appetiser would be slightly better if it came out earlier than the mains but cannot fault them as the spring rolls were freshly fried.

So Pho So Good.

First let’s start with the user experience of ordering.

The food is classified in a very unnatural way from so satisfying and so thirsty or something like that. Then you have to guess what’s in each category. It make choosing of food really hard with ref to the hard copy menu and the app for ordering.

Next, let’s dig into the food.
The beef was thin but chewy. We took only 10% of it.

The batter for the fried squid was thick and flat. There is hardly any crisp to it. The squid was stretch and fibrous.

The spicy soup felt like Chili flavour over water - there was no depth to the soup base though.

All in all, in think we came here because it wasn’t crowded. I guess we could have guessed why.

Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat.name: Cosy Relax BBQ

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
Honestly, wasn’t the most impressed with the service here at first, asked for order and the person simply said yes can continued doing his own stuff for 5minutes.

However, when the food came, i didn’t think too much about it afterwards. Starting from the hummus, absolutely generous and delicious portions. Perfect appetizer.

The butter rice with kebab was crazy delicious, we literally scraped the plate clean from the rice and the greek yogurt like substance in the centre.

Pizza was crispy and fragrant at the same time, the tomato sauce parts was absolutely amazing.

Strawberry drink was okay!!! Not super special but nice!

In the middle of Arab street you find this restaurant. We were welcomed by a real Turkish guy. Very friendly and he could advise us what was the best to order. We sat outside, along the street. Within 15 min the table was full with all kinds of grilled meat. Real Turkish flavors and a nice apple tea were enough to make my day complete. Eating here, and watching the people pass by is a big joy.

Parking in this area is very hard, as you can understand.

Had a great dinner here today. My friend saw this online with high rating stars so we just stopped by after work.  And yes, the food is delicious, the atmosphere is awesome, love the music too.
So if your family or friends are outgoing and friendly, this is the right place for you to gather together and laugh together and dance together !

Cuisine is new to me as a traveller. Trying the dish with my arab friends and the chef being a wonderful host in telling us about the different food added to the stellar experience of dining here. Service was awesome. Food was a good blend of flavors.

Just returning home from an amazing service and hospitality from Cappadocia.
Chef Ahmed Hagras went out of his way to arrange a very sweet surprise for my husband's birthday at my request.
The whole staff sang happy birthday for him with a special kunafe.

The food itself is finger licking good, no doubt. But the experience was way better.

Thank you everyone at Cappadocia for helping make this day special for him.
Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:30 PM
Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:30 PM

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.name: Cappadocia Turkish & Mediterranean Restaurant
Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.query: Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
Even though the restaurant is in quite a touristy location, the food is actually pretty good. One of the more popular restaurant along the pathway. Staff are friendly and helpful. Lovely place to be to watch people walk by while enjoying dinner. Parking is limited in the area though.

Food is really great. Had a very nice dinner with family. The street sets the mood for good food.  Food felt authentic and very tasty. We had chicken Mandi, mixed grill and "pizza".

Place also has some good baklava.

Parking lot picture below.

One of the nicest place to eat on a cool night is at Arab Street, dining alfresco. We didn't even need them to turn on the fan.

My favourite dish here is the tabouleh itself. Sometimes you may find lemon seeds in it but that speaks to how authentic the salad is.

While initially heading for a different restaurant, at which we were repelled by the pushy staff / promoters, we headed down Arab Street to look for an alternative. Most of the other restaurants also had promoters out which tried to lure us in. The guys at Tabbouleh just let us check the menu first and then we asked for a table. Service generally was ok, we waited a bit to actually order, food did not take a very long time though. The atmosphere actually was quite nice, views on the mosque, night time street impressions with a table outside. The food was delicious, I normally don't like Hummus a lot, but here I liked it. It was well presented as well. In the end I got the feeling that despite the 10% service charge it was expected that we give additional tip, which was a bit strange hence the 3/5 for the service. We did like the tea at the very end which rounded up an otherwise nice dinner experience. Thank you very much.

We choose the restaurant because of its good reviews and as the staff was not at all intrusive as most of the other places in the area.
We shared a mixed appetizers plate, which was alright. Overall good, but also no particular highlights.
The iced lemon tea was perfect after an exhausting day.
A plus was the free mint tea at the end, which we really appreciated.
The service could be more attentive, while the food was out quite fast. All in all a rather average experience.
Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.opening_hours:

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.name: Tabbouleh Lebanese Restaurant
Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.query: Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
I had the pleasure of trying Turkish cuisine for the first time, and it was truly a delightful experience! The standout dish for me was the lamb; it had absolutely no odor and tasted fantastic. The grilled items were a highlight as well, bursting with delicious flavors. The restaurant’s ambiance was beautifully decorated, and the staff was both charming and incredibly helpful, taking the time to explain the dishes to us. While it’s not the cheapest option, the prices are fair for the quality you receive.

One thing to note, though, is that the platter we ordered was described as “for two,” but for Asians, it’s considered a generous portion. So, if there are four of you and you’ve already ordered other dishes, I recommend going for the platter for two only; it’s quite substantial. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great dining experience!

First time having Turkish food and was really
pleasantly surprised. Their dips and bread was really exceptional. The bread was steaming when it came out it was both crispy and fluffy at the same time. The platter for 2 was also great all the grilled meats was tender and flavourful. Portion was also huge.

Everything from the service to food were impeccable. Staff were polite and always made sure we were well taken care of. I ordered before my friend came and they asked when the food should be prepared and how it should be served. Food was perfectly done too. It is the little things that make a difference and win them a return customer.

Very impressive food & service displayed by the dedicated front staffs and chefs. It’s nice walking in the street after a wine & dine session in the area. The staffs were very attentive, price is reasonable.

Went here for a birthday celebration and the attention to detail from their service staff is amazing, didn’t mention to the staff that it was for a birthday celebration, only had a note in the reservation. But they went above and beyond, having candles in the dessert and even giving us props to take pictures with and proceeded to then print out the photo of us to keep!

The food also matches the service, authentic Turkish cuisine done perfectly, the Hummus was so good we had to order a second portion! I’m not usually a fan of chicken but the chicken that came with the platter blew my mind, so juicy and tender. Then comes dessert, my first time having Kunefe and the only thing I have to say is that I wish I didn’t share it, wanted it all to myself 🤣

Definitely coming back here again!

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.query: Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
Good food and ambience. Lamb items tasted better. Wish the Arabic rice was cooked more. It was dry.
Belly dancer with amazing dance skills was a surprising addition.
Had a great time.

A bit further down the road from the more crowded food areas, but well worth the extra distance. The chicken kebab lunch special was excellent, the apple tea was also wonderful, and the staff are very attentive.

This was an excellent find while going through that area!

Mezze platter - 3.75 stars
Dips were delicious. Pita was bland and could've been better.

Kebab platter - 3.75 stars
Sausage was great. Beef and chicken a bit dry. Lamb was salty.

The food is really delicious and there are many must try middle east delicacies. The  downside of the restaurant is the service though they charge 10% service charge.

Hi, the best place in Arab street for authentic food. I keep coming back here and the food is very affordable, choose this restaurant if you can’t decide! We even got a free dessert, from Amar, his service was great!!!
Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.name: Beirut Grill
Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.query: Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
The food was not too bad. First time having Lebanese food. The chicken was cooked nicely and the basmati rice was seasoned well. The lamb chops were on the drier side. Overall interesting meal. Recommended for group dinners.

First time trying Lebanese food and it was really nice with a very good vibe. the ambiance was all set and whole arab street experince was lit. Hummus with bread and apple teas is a myst try dish over here. The price is on the higher side and I would say going in a group pf 5-6 people will be good as we get to try lot of new dishes.

Sanobar Lebanese Restaurant in Singapore is a hidden culinary gem that whisks diners away to the flavors of Lebanon. The restaurant offers a delectable and authentic Lebanese dining experience, from succulent shawarmas to flavorful falafels and tantalizing baklava desserts.

The ambiance is warm and inviting, and the friendly staff ensures a delightful dining experience. The menu caters to various dietary preferences and offers a true taste of Middle Eastern cuisine. Staff is so welcoming and friendly! Whether you're a fan of Lebanese food or new to it, Sanobar is a must-visit, I enjoyed the place so much when I visited Singapore in January!

Visited 13 July 2023 humid summer evening. The following sharing are based on our unbiased personal opinion and experience.

Multiple visit to this restaurant serving Turkish delicacy. Located at Kampong glam, Bussorah street. We had a great and delicious dinner for the night.

The food was filling and delicious dessert 🎂 and Turkish coffee was fantastic. And the dining atmosphere vibes was good with outdoor sitting.

Food 4 ⭐
Services 4 ⭐
Atmosphere 4 ⭐
Return to try again definitely 😁

Drop by the next time when you visit Kampong Glam I'm pretty sure you will like it here. Cheers

Nice food. Requested for some cherry tomatoes on the side and was spot on. Chicken was cook perfectly and tender. Good service staff. Was given a mint tea after meal. 5 star for the chefs and service crew.

A must go to restaurant. ;)

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
Tasteless shawarma with bland mayo and sweet and sour tasting sauce. It’s like the chef never even heard of the dish let alone know how to make it. I was hungry but even like this I chose to wait for takeaway and threw this away after two bites. For 12$ this was an all round bad experience.

Awful falafel wrap, honestly one of the worst I’ve ever eaten. Covered in horrible sauce, presumably to disguise the dry, packet falafels. Couldn’t finish it

Grilled beef skewers are quite tasty and tender
Highly recommended 👍

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
The food is really nice. I ordered chicken wrap. All vegetables and chicken inside were very juicy and tasty. But I think the price is quite expensive considering the portion. Mine was 10 SGD but was not very generous portion. If I consider the location, which is a tourism spot, then maybe the price is reasonable but, still, for locals, I think a bit expensive.

The food tasted very bad, the bread was incredibly stale, I'm pretty sure it was just microwaved. It looked very different from the photos we saw online so I'm not sure what happened. Wouldn't recommend at all, we spent a total of 60SGD and I wouldn't say any bit of that was worth it. Would not recommend at all.

Had their signature lamb chop but was served with Briyani rice. Food taste good here but food portion was a little disappointed. Wasn't very transparent about the cost as the receipt reflected different price from the menu. Wouldn't return to dine here again as it's tad expensive and they charge 10% service charge for a roadside store. 😅

Had a great lunch here. Cheaper than most places nearby and very delicious food.

We had a delicious lunch at  House of Kebab. The highlight was the hummus- lots of garlic & ideal texture.  The  mixed grill meat and chicken was a little dry but tasty and good flavour.

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
The menu offers a wonderful variety of authentic Turkish dishes, each bursting with flavors that transported me to the heart of Istanbul. The quality of the ingredients was evident in every bite, and the presentation was a feast for the eyes.

The staff at Derwish are not only knowledgeable about the menu but also passionate about ensuring a memorable dining experience. Their attentiveness and friendly demeanor added to the overall positive atmosphere.

Had a delightful dining experience at Derwish Turkish! The mixed kebab platter was outstanding; I was trying to control my carbs but I couldn't get enough of the fragrant rice. The hummus was good, although the bread was a bit tough for my liking. However, what truly stood out was the exceptional service. The staff was incredibly friendly and always had a smile on their faces, which added to the overall splendid experience. Looking forward to visiting again!

Everytime I have a loved one visiting Singapore, I always take them here. I always come back here for the food and service. The food is great - big serving and authentic and I love their Bunefe!! ♥️ The service is top notch, leaving us satisfied every single time. Will surely be back with other loved ones who are about to visit. 🥰

Great food and service. Food is definitely wayyy more expensive than the usual, but the taste makes it not such a bad deal. Apple tea is really nice before eating the food, very refreshing and fragrant but after eating any food it doesn't taste as nice.

Peter, the staff here, was exceptionally polite and gave us a warm welcome. When I needed to store my dessert in the fridge, he was incredibly helpful. Peter also recommended their signature dishes, and we decided to try them.

The Tajin lamb shank was a delightful surprise, with tender, succulent meat that practically fell off the bone. The flavors were rich and aromatic, making it a standout dish.

The Meze tabagi was a delightful assortment of Mediterranean appetizers, a true explosion of flavors and textures. It included a variety of dips, fresh vegetables, and savory bites, providing a wonderful contrast of tastes.

For a refreshing beverage, we ordered the Mango Ayran. It was a perfect balance of sweet and tangy, making it a great complement to our meal.

Unfortunately, as there were only two of us, we couldn't order the traditional dessert Peter recommended. Nevertheless, we thoroughly enjoyed the atmospheric environment, delicious food, and excellent service provided by the staff.

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
Super wanted to like this place … but the service was very slow, I often had to chase down the waiter. There were 2 cockroaches that ran across my feet and then headed to the kitchen, and when I notified the waiter, they were just as squeamish as we were. Food was ok, but probably wouldn’t go back.

Located at the junction of Baghdad Street and Bussorah Street, good Lebanese food of large size portions, the tables at the pavement is nice in the evening.  The staff were friendly and welcoming we overall it was good experience

Great food and atmosphere. Owner is super lovely legit food lover. Go here!

Amazing food, ate there twice

Sultan Mosque Nakamise Street has a lot of restaurants with a nice atmosphere, so I was a little confused, but a local friend brought me to this restaurant. The appetizer platter is full of Mediterranean cuisine (Lebanese?). For mains, we each ordered lamb chops and skewered beef (I don't know the name). I was so absorbed in chatting that I couldn't eat all the appetizers, but they all tasted authentic. The main meat dishes are simply prepared but delicious. I appreciated the thoughtfulness of pointing two large fans at us. None of the restaurants in Nakamise serve alcohol (for religious reasons), so if you need one, you should either drink before coming to this area, or go to a pub a little further out of this area as there are many pubs. Let's go for a drink.

Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.name: Makdoner Lebanese Restaurant
Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.query: Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
Food portions are huge and everything is really delicious 😋
The butter rice was fluffy and nice; had it with grilled meat. The lamb chops were tender and best eaten with tortilla and condiments.

Dessert was perfect! The baklava, cheese kunafe and rice pudding are on point. Really the perfect ending to a marvellous meal ❤️❤️❤️

This place is great! Delicious dishes plus the hospitality of the staffs, specifically sir Japeth & miss Cheska. The service was amazing and we’ll definitely come back. Worth recommending!

The service is superb!!!! Everyone is so accommodating, friendly, proactive and patient!! My brother had his birthday here and the staff was so enthusiastic and entertaining ❤️❤️❤️ love the atmosphere and food is incredible as well! The platter is always a classic ❤️🥰 the Turkish manners and culture is so lovely and warm.

Went twice, we stayed at a hotel nearby so frequently went around the area. There are many turkish restaurants somehow and we tried 2, we found Anatolia to be much better. Prices about the same as the one in Kg Glam but the food tasted much better at Anatolia, the proprietor was always there and he was friendly and accommodating. Being a corner lot made the restaurant much more comfortable to dine at.

We enjoyed good food and genuine service. It’s even heart warming to see a fellow Kababayan (working really hard here in SG).

💯💯💯
- Food presentation
- Food taste
- Atmosphere (love the cultural blend and representation)
- superb service

Great one!

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
Friendly staff
Foods were delicious and well cooked
Free complementary
Price was okay and worth to eat.

If you are coming Singapore don’t hesitate to visit this restaurant.

Food was really really good, it improved my mood to be even better. Condiments were a bonus. Staffs are friendly and approachable too. Definitely will come back again 😉

My second time to come here and service never disappoints. The food is tasty and the ambiance is great😊 highly recommended😊

Nice location and good tea, cool weather with Islamic vibes that place is too good to spend quality time with f&f nice to explore and good Turkish cuisine👍🏻

Delicious authentic Turkish cuisine, great atmosphere and excellent service ❤️

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
The perfect place chosen for a birthday celebration!!

From great service, to amazing ambience, to tasty food... everything was simply perfect!

Awesome selection for both veg & non-veg menu!!

2 thumbs up!

Thank you Byblos for making our evening beautiful!

Quality food, ambience and excellent service from staff made the dinner special. Thanks to receptionist Mahiti for always giving a great smile to all guest. It definitely makes a difference.

We celebrated my brother's birthday here and had a great time. The restaurant is beautifully decorated with classic Turkish designs and really put us in the mood for their cuisine.

We ordered the mixed grilled platter to share and they portioned it for to the seven people in our party. The salads were fresh and the dessert was delicious. I highly recommend their kunfa as it's authentic, made fresh and absolutely scrumptious.

My only drawback was the warmth. There could have been better distribution of air-conditioning, other than that we had a swell time. I know there are many other restaurants in the area offering a similar experience but Byblos stands apart with class and authenticity.

LOVE the food!!! Hot, freshly baked lavash bread, delectable and well seasoned kebabs, even the salads appealed to my picky 11 year old. Ambience was lovely, only downside was the music is a wee bit loud (I was sitting indoors), but the staff brought down the volume. Our plates were all cleaned out, clearly we enjoyed dinner at Byblos. Highly recommended!

There are many Turkish food restaurants along Arab Street but this is the best one I've had here. In fact, I daresay it's the best Turkish food I've ever had. The Chef and waiters were all very welcoming!

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
Good experience, wrap was decent, not worth to spent there, best dishes were Mixed Mezze and Mixed Grill, but if you are not a big eater choose only 1 of this dishes. The tea was good, lasted us the whole meal, decent amount. They also gave us a complimentary baklava. Nice touch. 200+ for 3 person.

We have visited this restaurant many times before. The staff are always very warm and friendly, and service is great. Food is consistently very tasty. Dishes are best for sharing. Our favourites were the pottery lamb kebab and the chicken musakka. A lovely, unique place for Turkish cuisine that we highly recommend.

Incredible Turkish food - despite being at a touristy location, the quality was excellent and of good value.

This was a popular spot on a Saturday night, given our last minute reservation, they only had slots 8pm and later.

Needless to say the slight wait was worthwhile - the various breads were so fresh and done in house. Meats were succulent and well seasoned, all around excellent, there wasn’t a dish we didn’t like.

Portions are generous, given the choice of would be nice to go with a group of 3+ but we won’t complain about leftovers!

had an amazing dinner here! brought my family to try turkish food for the first time and they enjoyed themselves :) the owner was extremely hospitable and gave us a complimentary kunefe as well as some tea. the food was amazing! solved my middle eastern cravings ~

My first authentic Turkish food experience highly recommended by my friend. And it totally blew my mind - how hearty and flavourful the food was and how warm the staffs were. The biggest take away was the hummus & bread and baklava!!

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
Clean tables, excellent service and most importantly delicious food! Portions are amazing and you really get what you pay for 👍🏼 If it is your birthday, let them know and prepare for a surprise 😉

Service and food were excellent. Was served by Sivan and his helpful crew! This was our 3rd visit and they never disappoint us 🥰🙏 Thank you! Highly recommended, Lahmacun, Beyti Kebab, Tavuk kanat ( Grilled chicken wings) Grilled meatball with cheese, Çoban salad and of course Kunefe with ice cream.

I read good reviews about this restaurant and decided to dine in last night with cousins from Malaysia and an aunt. Firstly, I'm disappointed with their service, food came not as we requested, instead of Pita bread, we were served rice. Secondly, had to ask from 3 servers before our drinks were served. Food are not as delicious as we expected it to be, compared to other neighbouring Turkish restaurants there. Not attentive service. Tables are dirty, chairs not cleaned before sitting customers. Will not come again.
2. After replying this review, I don't think the Owner is genuine with his reply. I'm not expecting for a refund neither a free meal but i am sharing my experience in the restaurant. I guess you should be sincere with your offer of apology or service recovery and not offer and giving an invalid number. Such a dishonesty!

Sivan was very approachable and friendly! Top tier service from the guys here and the manager as well. Food was good too! Highly recommend the meat platter and kunafe with goat’s milk ice cream!

Great Turkish fare, with the best kunefe. Order the mixed grill if you're here, and the kunefe with goat milk ice cream.

Just gets a little warm for outdoors seats.

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
Located at arab street near to beach road. Very tidy shop with many option of indonesia pastry. Lemper comes in 3pcs or 10pcs per box. The price depends on what flavour chicken/spice chicken/extra spicy chicken/beef. Easy order via whatsapp, cashless pay via paynow (scan to pay). Friendly and approchable staff. Highly recommended!

By chance ran into this little shop selling Indonesian snacks and kueh.  Very nice presentation and packaging.  They sell a variety of dry snacks as well as fresh made kueh including lemper, rice balls with coconut and gula melaka, tapioca and coconut, etc.  You have several choices of fillings for the lemper.  They also sell kueh lapis with a variety of flavors.

Expected to be good lemper but not impressed. Ayam lemper on soggy side. Kuih kuih was overly pandan rich and starchy to my liking. Had better ones elsewhere.
Won’t be patronising here again.

Came across this shop in Arab Street. Never tried a Lemper before decided to pop in to see.
Lemper was the main item they were selling, but there were also quite a few other kuehs displayed on the shelves. Took a while before deciding to try the ayam one. I took the non spicy one but the shop assistant told me she would recommend the spicy one if I could take chilli. Took her advice but I didn't get the very spicy one only took the mild one. Also got a box of ondeh and Salat. Was out around having meal then took out the items and realised the Lemper I got was rendang! I went back to the shop after the meal and asked for an exchange she agreed without hesitation and gave me a dollar refund. I didn't even know the chicken one was cheaper. They do have the problem of people walking into the shop picking the items up and putting it elsewhere.
Quite an interesting experience trying the Lemper. Was spicy but pretty acceptable for me. Loved the ondeh such a small piece but with loads of gula melaka inside. Salat was not bad but the green portion was a little too tough for my liking.
Nice interesting shop with some Indonesian delicacies to try.

It's so difficult to find Lemper Ayam in Singapore and finally I found a shop selling Lemper Ayam while walking around Arab Street. The taste is authentic and delicious. Love it! Must try the Pulut Kuning and the kueh kueh too. The staff was friendly, helpful and courteous. Highly recommended!

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
The food was really nice especially the chicken Lebanese style pizza and the lamb mandi! The service was also amazing as the staff were friendly and checked if we enjoyed our food. Overall a great experience and recommend 5/5.

This was my second visit to the restaurant- the experience was worse than first time. Our food ordered did not come, ordered a fresh apple juice $8.90, after waiting till end of meal, a canned apple juice finally was served after 5x reminding the waitress. Overall meat was dry.. so different from what we had a month ago. And the aircond is not working and ventilation was horrendous! Only one good comment - the bread served for dip were warm and fluffy

The tabbouleh was horrible. Very sour. The other dishes were average to good. Staff wasted a lot of my time trying to figure out food panda.

Really enjoyed the food here, delicious tabouli (the best in Singapore (in my humble opinion) & hummus, very delicious kebab, the lamb Mandi fell off the bones & a yummy knefe! A good find, we’re definitely coming back! Very good service as well, lovely waitress with a good sense of humor.

Amazing service. Top notch. Food is great too. Will visit again!

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
I had a great time eating delicious food at your restaurant. The staff were committed to great service and were very friendly. The atmosphere was awesome and I definitely liked that you have a very modern style. Most importantly, every food and drink on your menu tasted great

I've had lunch there. The waiters were friendly. They gave me a complementary Apple Tea 🍵 since it's lunch time. The food is pretty good. The Turkish taste is there. They have plenty options. Unfortunately most of the beef items were unavailable. Had to choose the lamb ones. It's really tasty nonetheless. They also have good chicken and vegetarian options.

We used the Eatigo discount and its definitely worth it.. the foods are great, taste just fantastic to our liking! The waiter is friendly to recommend us their signature foods too..

Service by the Chinese guy was good, but the food was really so so and would have been very expensive (avg $25/main) if not for the entertainer app we used. We tried their most popular mains and switched the rice to pita bread. But the bread was very stale and tough, the meat was so so and we ordered hummus which tasted rather diluted. The only good dish was the kunefe, although somehow it's really oily. I'm not sure if that's normal cos this is only the second time I'd eaten kunefe and the last time I had it elsewhere, it wasn't swimming in oil. We literally poured the oil out on a separate dish and it was a lott of oil...

Setting was pretty although it was mostly empty on a Sunday lunch time, not surprised 😅

Love the food from this place. It is slightly expensive but the food is always cooked to perfection. The meats is always so tender. The server was also very attentive and welcoming. Will definitely come back.

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
Nice tasty food. Lovely setting, with the Mosque down the road. Set among colourful lights.  No alcohol though because of close proximity to the Mosque.

Delicious, not particularly cheap, but worth it.

Warning!
Don't let the looks fool you, this place is awful.

Nothing that we ordered was portrayed right on the menu.

First off, there is no pita. It's literally a FLOUR TORTILLA.

The hummus tasted worse than supermarket hummus, I don't know how that's possible, but it was not good.

The lamb kofta didn't come with what was pictured either, but it was at least decent tasting. Babaganous (spelling?) didn't taste anything like I've ever had, but it was fine.

To top it off, all of the restaurant near this one gets their food from the same kitchen, and since we got food from here and from Derwish I will review their too.

To finish our meal, we waiting ages to get the tab, while the guys trying to get people in the door started yelling in each other's faces right in front of us.

Terrible meal. Terrible experience. I hope this keep people away.

Worst mezze platter ever. Hummus was wayyyyy too salty and didn't taste fresh. Using canned tomato sauce and hard and dry bread. Definitely not worth eating here

Food is fabulous very friendly staff

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
A nice place to chill. The set meal ($33.90) is value-for-money and comes with soup, pita and garlic bread, one main dish, a drink and dessert.

Food was very good. Staff consisted of a family who were welcoming. Service was fine, although not too professional as our order was mixed up and not taken down properly.
A lot of potential.

Amirah’s Grill review - FELT CHEATED! :( Please avoid!!
It was a nice Saturday evening we planned to visit Arab Street and unfortunately landed up in this so called Grill restaurant as we had decided to have a try with a different restaurant this time. The food was really sad and the presentation was bad. We ordered a egg plant dish called 'Moutabel dish' and was served with some other dish which didn't even have a slight ingredients of eggplant (yes, they served with a hummus instead). We notified the person at billing counter, but instead of accepting the mistake - they declined to remove the wrong dish from the bill. The pita bread served at Amirah's Grill is pathetic and doesn't even match 50% of what really a pita bread tastes as we had tried several other times in other Middle Eastern Restaurants in Singapore as well as UAE.

- Fools people with a different dish
- Doesn't accept the mistake and charges customer for the wrong dish
- No presentation skills
- Rude staff/Management (Didn't even care to correct the bill when a wrong dish was served)
- Costly. They charge S$9.9 for really small portion of hummus
- Servers with unordered dish (so, you have to eat what they want to server or left at their kitchen)

I rate this Amirah's grill: -1/10

Really stay away from Amirah’s Grill !!!

Mixed grill was smaller than expected, but very flavourful meats and potatoes. The yogurt drink had dubious bits in it and was not very tasty. Very chill atmosphere.

Nice and authentic turkish food. Maybe a touch overcooked, but taste was great. Very fast and friendly service.
Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.name: Amirah's Grill Restaurant & Cafe
Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.query: Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street

Middle Eastern cuisine in Arab Street.reviews:
Turkish kebab BBQ, hummus, and bread was a delicious and satisfying meal. The kebab was perfectly cooked, with a juicy and flavorful interior. The hummus was creamy and smooth, with a rich and nutty flavor. The bread was warm and soft, and the perfect accompaniment to the kebab and hummus. We loved the service very very hospitable. We were very comfortable stayed there for more than 1.5 hours had a really good time they didn’t rush us. Place is a little congested but overall I was very impressed with the Turkish kebab BBQ, hummus, and bread. It was a delicious and satisfying meal that I would definitely recommend to others.

Food was pretty good and authentic. Beyti Lamb Kebab was the star of the night. Usually lamb dishes have strong taste and restaurants tend to use very strong sauces to mask it, but the lamb didn't have such a strong taste and the sauce was mild. A perfect balance. Hummus was good as well, although the pita was on the harder to chew side.

However, service was a little off, hence 4 stars. Would, however, come back. Got 30% off dine in via foodpanda and ended up to about 30 per pax, so pretty good deal.

The food was served so fast. Everything was delicious and the priced were good too. Servings were more than adequate! JB still was sweet to serve us even though we came half an hour before they closed. Try the meat grill  platter! Love it!!!!!!!!

Food are fantastic. The butter rice is very tasty.
With the herbs on Lamb and chicken. It really tastes good. Price abit pricy but it will not deter people from going back.

Very good !!! We ordered the eggplant kebab, hummus and dolmads and it was so tasty!!!! Very good meal, perfect service. They were so nice to us and made us feel at home. Thank you! We will come back for sure ❤️

Brazilian restaurants in Holland Village.reviews:
Açai was quite sweet and quite diluted as compared to other açai bowl. That said, service and ambience was good and chill. Probably won't visit again as the açai bowl is disappointing.

Almost addicted to their Açai bowls. Not gonna lie. — Their interiors, ambience, environment, vibes are top notch and really good for self and group visits to chill, rest and relax. And reflect.

Açai is on the sweetest note of my tastebuds. Sweeter and happier side of life. 😋😍🫶🏼 Gotta love it here.

Acai Flower Bowl
Nuts
BYOB
Among all, i highly recommend BYOB for a bigger portion for a little ($1) more than the regular price for menu bowls. — Opt out of bananas as it’s just better and less jelak and gummy with the sticky texture. Nonetheless, still delicious.

8.1/10 🌟 Not the BEST açai place in Singapore town BUT one of the best one I have found. Can’t wait to try other items and places.

Great place to satisfying ur acai craving while in Holland V. Quality of ingredients is top-notch and acai is on the sweeter side as well. Ambience is quite cozy too.

the acai tasted more like sugar than acai berries, feels like the percentage of acai is much lower than to the other additives. nice space to chill, well decorated, dragonfruit is nice but i found the goji berries a bit hard

The menu are great. The taste are ok. Wish place is bigger

Brazilian restaurants in Holland Village.reviews:
Unfortunately my experience did not mirror that of the many positive reviews. The pizza base was soggy and the pizza disintegrated completely as we tried to lift up slices. The ravioli was drenched in this awful, overly salty and peppery sauce and I couldn't taste anything in the filling. The risotto was not particularly good either. Other Italian places I've been to have been much better.

You cannot imagine the service standards of this place.

Faizal, Jess and Gabriel - our servers for the night were exceptional. EXCEPTIONAL.

Surprised this place has NOT even obtained a Michelin ⭐.

Food 10/10
Service 10/10
Quality 11/10

I don't get it. How is this place charging mad affordable prices while serving food only perceivable at the Hyatt? 🤯

We were sitting outdoor enjoying our dinner!
First time visit the restaurant. Loved the texture of pasta, the sauce was creamy, portion was generous! Mozzarella with ham was delicious, too! The pizza was the down side that the seafood was tasteless and the pizza dough could be better. Tiramisu was good, too!

The pizza here is tasty. The crust is thin and baked nicely. We had the margherita with seafood add on. The squid was a little too chewy but otherwise it’s fine.

Service was prompt. Only downside was that the aircon was a really weak. We were in the restaurant and still felt really hot (on level 1). When we went to the bathroom at level 2, the air con there felt much better.

Delicious and filling pizzas and pastas. Couldn’t finish for 2 people! Worth it if dining with 1 for 1 / 50% offer! The store manager was very friendly and kind — offered to keep my many bags of groceries at the back while we dined and brought them back to me after we finished our meal. Thank you!
Brazilian restaurants in Holland Village.name: La Nonna

Brazilian restaurants in Holland Village.reviews:
This place opens up at 11.30am, earlier than other lunch spots in the area. We decided on a mexican fiesta and as such, popped in for a quick fix and to our delightful surprise, we were not at all disappointed.

My dish was about $19 before GST. It was fried chicken with loads of tomato sauce on it, with cilantro rice and nachos on the side. My friends had nachos and enchiladas. The flavours were good and the cilantro rice was so yummy. They didn’t skimp on the cilantro and the rice was cooked to perfection, every rice with that intense cilantro flavour. My chicken was fried to perfection, and it was juicy and moist. The serving size is generous for what you’re paying.

The restaurant service was attentive, and I loved that they provided free iced water to patrons. Such should be the standard of more restaurants in Singapore.

The decor was quaint and cute.

Absolutely love the Mexican food here especially the Soup with the fresh seafood in it had the nachos with pulled pork which was amazing the enchiladas filled with beef and the set with taco and enchilada with beans on the side I added guacamole as well which was great! Definitely would recommend this! Though service is sometimes quite slow it’s still quite worth while

I don't eat much mexican, but I really enjoyed my dinner here. Was difficult to choose from the menu but thankfully the staff were very helpful with their recommendations.

The spring roll thingy was amazing, way better than it looks.
I didn't know nachos can be served like that, the pulled pork one was good but wish there was more meat.
Beef quesadilla was really good too, altho it looked really flat and sad, but it was actually very flavourful and filling.
Fish tacos tasted quite interesting, I actually couldn't taste the fish at all which is a good thing.

Oh and I love the guacamole and tomatoes and salsa ~

The downside is all the quesadilla/taco/XXX all looked and tasted very similar.

But yea would come visit again! It tastes quite wholesome!

I am a frequent customer and have been ordering from them for a couple of years. No longer in the future as there was a cockroach wrapped in my burrito. I have reported them to the food agency.

It’s been many years since I’ve last been here. It’s a long standing establishment and the food did not fail me.
Ordered the piñatas, chimichanga and calamari. Food was served fast and the server was very friendly.
All the food ordered were tasty, filling and authentic. I’ll be back to explore the menu more.

Brazilian restaurants in Holland Village.reviews:
All day happy hour price for hoegaarden beer and rosee. This place do not serve beer tower.
The food is great, would love to come again with the big group.
We asked one staff to help us to take a photo and after he take 1 photo for us, he took out his phone to take another photo and told us that it is going to post on their Instagram. One of my friend felt not respected, firstly he didn’t ask for our permission, secondly, we don’t know who he is and don’t know what he is going to do with it, and express that he is not comfortable with it, especially he doesn’t like a random person having his photo in other people’s phone. Perhaps, asking for permission might be a good choice.
Btw, the food and drinks are so good!
By the way, I’ve gotten quite a few mosquitoes bite from there.

Nice location at the end of a busy street, this bar is open and airy with plenty of seating and a decent range of beers. The cocktails were also impressive and reasonably priced during happy hour. Food was only ok (fairly run-of-the-mill pub-grab and a little too many fried options) but that's ok. The staff were friendly and attentive. Solid choice for a street packed with options.

A great atmosphere and the food is really delicious. Staff super friendly and readily available for next drinks and orders.

A great selection of Western foods.

Nice ambience. The food is good and the staff attentive. The corner tables have some mosquitos issues but the staff will provide incense when asked. Highly recommend their lamb stew and lala soup.

Always one of my favourite places to go to in Holland Village (among the many watering holes there!). Prices are reasonable, food is quite tasty and the vibe all round is great. Generally not that crowded but if you're in a bigger group do remember to get reservations.

Brazilian restaurants in Holland Village.reviews:
Absolutely magnificent place, advised by my Brazilian friend. the key thing is that salad bar, which in itself is decent enough is accompanied by personnel cutting meat for you, as much as you can eat. bringing new kinds of meat, I tried to grasp all of what was available and I must say that picanha is an absolute favorite.

My first time to this restaurant and it was a great experience. Definitely a must-go place for meat lovers. The salad and food bar had a great variety to choose from and the meat get served direct to the table every few minutes (^^"). And remember to ask for the pineapple!!!

All the meat is quite salty, makes you keep drinking water and fill up your stomach fast. Most of the beef like tenderloin and lamb were overcooked and were lacking in flavour.

Booked our reservation for 7pm but had no issues despite us coming earlier at 6.30. Our waiter, even though he was a trainee (some chinese/asian person) was super on the ball when it came to refilling our water and changing our plates.

When I accidentally dropped some meat on my white shirt, he immediately dropped whatever he was doing and got me a wet and dry tissue for me to clean off the stain. Highly impressed with the service and food. Had a lovely evening together with my wife.

Food is great. Service is excellent. The salad bar was also really good. It's a meat lovers paradise

Brazilian restaurants in Holland Village.reviews:
The experience at Carnivore was fantastic; plenty of meat with wide variety was served continuously throughout the night. Every bite was tender and we enjoyed the service very much. At one point, we even requested the chef for a particular cut, which he very graciously prepared just for our table. The salad bar is very fresh and well prepared. We recommend the ham, pineapples and beef brisket. If you dare to try, get the chicken heart too!

Carnivore started 2 decades ago at Vivo City, relocated to CHIJMES, and just relocated to Robertson Quay.

The meat or skewers were not what we accustomed to. All the variants of beef on skewers had a very strong gaming beefy taste and either dry or hard. Definitely not tender just hard. The short beef ribs not so hard or tough but strong beefy taste. The chicken heart was okay at 7/10. The home made sausage was dried out, was not tasty at all, a dismal 2/10. The bacon wrapped chicken at 5/10. The chicken thigh better at best a 7/10.

The best from carver is the skewered barbecued pineapple at 9/10 and butterfish at 8/10.

Strangely the buffet sides were better overall compared to the skewered meats. Minestrone soup 7/10, black beans with sliced sausages 7/10, potato salad 8/10, asparagus salad 7/10, beef stew 6.5/10.

The assorted chocolate desert was 8/10. The fruit was decent at 7.5/10.

Dunno what to say. We are so used to the higher meat qualities when they were at Vivos City. Just wish they were as good as before. They just started operating less than a month since relocating from CHIJMES so maybe they just getting into the groove.

Service was good, friendly & attentive. Hardly anyone there during Monday lunch as it was a public holiday, in lieu of Deepavali.

This is a meat lovers paradise! Every meat they serve is awesome! My faves are the rump cap, chicken thigh and the butterfish! But on the whole food is awesome, and service is great! I especially loved the service from an elderly gentleman. He was attentive to my needs and made sure I got what I wanted. He deserves 100 stars and he makes my day!

Meats were a bit dried but taste still not that bad, salad bar and dessert okay, overall okay

Felt like meat variety for rotation was alot lesser than what was shown on their website. Pineapples only came twice, of which once did not even made it to our table.

Brazilian restaurants in Holland Village.reviews:
Celebrated my birthday there with my friend and the fold here is super awesome! The meat are cooked to perfection and the servers were so attentive to details and prompt to react. If you are a meat lover, dont miss the experience here!

Some of the items that I really like, (no pictures cause busy eating 😅)
- Garlic Beef
- Picanha
- Duck Breast
- Chicken and Chicken Heart
- Sirloin
- Beef Ribs

And and and! The cheese bread and fried banana were awesome toooooo!

Do try them out!

We brought a toddler with us and it was child friendly. Overall the food were great and fresh. The marination taste really good and was grilled to perfection; the beef was medium rare, good job to the chef! I'm not a fish person but it got me eating second piece, it was delicious and fresh. Our daughter just loves the chips and tomato. Service was attentive and well explained. Good job to Chris and team! Looking forward to visit again!

It was my anniversary celebration. We had
lunch, and it was a carnivore's dream come true. The buffet-style service, with servers continuously offering a variety of meats until you signal them to stop, was a delightful experience.

The meat selection was impressive, and I must say the Picanha, Prime Part of Top beef stole my heart.
Despite that Picanha that stole my heart, there were some others that I think otherwise. Maybe this is personal preference.

Overall, I found their concept of unlimited, high-quality meat servings are truly enjoyable.

Notes: the bottle provided on the table are chargeable. One is sparkling water, the other is mineral water.

No complaints whatsoever. It's worth the steap price, from the sides (pictured) to the array of various meats, all cooked to perfection, to the attentive and courteous wait staff.

My only reccomendarion is to come hungry.

The only positive thing I can say about this place is the decent interior. The food is otherwise pretty terrible. Their picanha is tough, dry and sinewy while their supposed wagyu sirloin is almost certainly not wagyu given that it lacks the signature tenderness you expect from high quality beef and also carried a weird, almost gamey taste. Service was also lacklustre, with the waitress having an attitude that suggested she would rather be anywhere else than at the restaurant.
Brazilian restaurants in Holland Village.name: Casa Brazilia

Brazilian restaurants in Holland Village.reviews:
The açai is nice!! The waiter and waitress are nice too! There provide some seats inside where you can do your work or have a small chat with your friend while having açai!
There provide some power socket too! If you need to charge your laptop also can!
Overall it was a good experience!

You can choose your cup in different sizes, ordering Lean & Green. I will say the staff isn’t friendly and welcoming, but my order is being done perfectly. Big space for you to dine in.

Relaxing ambience to supercharge bonding time with this healthy Superfood! Overall I enjoyed the environment and both the berry & mango taste superb. Looking forward to try out the other range.

I’m a frequent patron, and would usually order the medium Triple A.

This time my order was served lesser than
usual. When I had went to get it checked, I was given the rudest reply by their staff Xin Hui, whom insisted it’s their SOP and was reluctant to change.

When I stood my ground about the serving standard being lesser, I was shouted at by her, my order was also snatched from my hands.

I’ve written in to their management about this encounter, it’s been about 6 months and I’ve not heard a single word back.

Came here twice, and both times, tables weren't clean. Their acai were great though pricey.

Brazilian restaurants in Holland Village.reviews:
Came here second time. Ordered the watcha chicken Crepe. It taste really good with the chicken nicely grille.

I have ordered the sweet crepe of banana and Nutella. love it when it is gluten free. it is hard for the crepe but after the first bite it kinda of melt in your mouth. it is not too sweet. the spinach drink is very refreshing and is well blended. the portion of the. crepe is alright for me as it is quite filling. but maybe little for people with bigger appetite. packaging is well protected delivered by grab. looking forward to try their other crepe.

Before visiting, I read the reviews and was wondering how good can acai be. After trying it I must say it's really very appetizing with the chocolate sauce and peanut butter. One thing that can be improved would be the packaging for the acai, the bottom of it was already wet within 10mins.

The grilled tapioca wrap was also good with generous amount of fillings. Although the skin looked crispy it was quite chewy but in a good way.

Love their acai bowl! Portion was generous and they purely used acai - no fillers like chia seeds taking up half the bowl unlike at certain other places. My favourite is their keto goddess bowl - it has everything that I like: blueberries, strawberries, cacao nibs and coconut flakes! The owner is really friendly too. And price was very good at $12.90 for a large bowl which was enough for two of us to share.

Favourite acai place by far.

Beiju Express have the best açai bowl in town and I‘ve tried many. Fresh, delicious range of ingrediants, served at the perfect temperature and amazingly arranged.
And must try the Brazilian Tapioca Crepes. I had the Watcha Chicken. It was delicious!

Tried the Keto Goddess, and it was really nice. Portion size is very generous as well. The staff is also very friendly and helpful.

Brazilian restaurants in Holland Village.name: Beiju Express - Brazilian superfoods (tapioca crepes, acai bowls, chia pudding, smoothies)

Brazilian restaurants in Holland Village.reviews:
The premise looks very clean, which is absolutely assuring. Acai bowl never fails, not too sweet and filled with fresh ingredients. I especially love their nut butters but wished that they could give slightly more as it’s always not enough to go around with the acai. 😅

Always had the Acai Flower bowl at other outlets, decided to try Coconut Yoghurt Acai bowl instead. Fresh fruits used, mixed with cruchy toasted coconut flakes, granola, and goji berries. The coconut yoghurt taste not very prominent and serving kind of little, hope to get a bigger scoped.

A promotion is ongoing in Woodleigh mall with 2 bowls for $16. Ordered a Original Flower Bowl and a Nuts for Açaí bowl with 2 butters namely peanut and cookie. The staff were very helpful to help me change my order. Overall experience was good 👍

The staff were so unfriendly with an unpleasant face that make you feel guilty for ordering, my appetite for eating açaí was gone instantly. I said hi with a smile no reply, thank you no reply, looking upset and kind of scary. The açaí is good though but never coming back here again for the service.

Came to support them for their new opening at the Woodleigh Mall! Got the promotion which was 1 for 1 acai bowls and the staff were super nice and acai was super yummy!

Spanish cuisine in Sentosa Cove.reviews:
Great food! Although the squid ink pasta took 40mins to prepare, you can be sure it is cooked the authentic way cause the flavour is thoroughly infused into all the rice. The tapas were so flavourful, went very well with the bread drizzled with olive oil. Only thing was this menacing crow that was eyeing our food from the tree outside.

Went for dinner on a Saturday - wasn’t too crowded.
Service was great! Really appreciate the staff checking in with us - and when we wanted to look at the menu for desserts, the lady recited the whole list and recommended the lava cake (which we thoroughly enjoyed). When I asked for additional ice for my drink, they gave me a cup with a pair of small tongs!
Food was okay - nothing to shout about, in my opinion. I enjoyed the White Anchovies Salad but my partner didn’t really like it much. He enjoyed the squid ink paella and the Pan Con Tomate. The Huevos Con Todos was pretty good too. Dessert was amazing - I don’t have a sweet tooth so it was cloying towards the end but my boyfriend who loves sweets had a field day. Very flavourful!
But I guess you pay for the ambience.
Not sure I’d make a trip down specifically for it again, but a nice place to try for a date night.

Came to celebrate a dear friend’s birthday and we caught the tapas promotion - 9 tapas for $109.90++. Just nice for 4 of us to share. Each of the dishes carry their own richness - yummy! We polished them off clean! 😁 the staff were also helpful and great in servicing us! Love the high ceilings and spaciousness of the premise that overlooks to the yachts dock. Will definitely recommend this place!

A good place to dine by the sea.

Service requires more attentive staff.
Spoon was not provided when the dish requires such.

The grilled octopus leg was good. Recommended to order.

Paella Pescado seafood rice is average. Depends on whether u like the spice taste, some of us feels the dish tasted sweet.

Gambas Al Pil Pil was also nice. If they can provide bread to go it would be excellent.

Pan Con Tomate was a normal bread with tomatoes topping. Nothing to shout about.

Overall price is not cheap.

This place is pet friendly dog cats etc, hangover brunch was awesome. Been here several times already so food is legit and consistent they’ve change furnitures recently looks more Mediterranean. All you can eat menu within 2 hours also for drinks if you fancy to add 39 unlimited sangria and pava

Spanish cuisine in Sentosa Cove.reviews:
Two chefs bar was an impromptu decision we’ve made. It was the best decision ever. Food was 10/10 in my opinion. Every dish wowed us.

For 2, we ordered chili lime wings, Italian pork sausage pizza, pan seared barramundi, linguine meatball pasta, and tiramisu gone wild. My favorite was the meatball pasta, something in the meatball was so addictive, felt like there were exploding flavors of several herbs and nuts in this dish but weren’t overpowering. Everything was tied together perfectly with the sauce and most importantly, pasta was Al Dante. On a side note, the dessert, tiramisu was actually huge and made perfectly. Good to share!

And with such good food quality, it was worth every dollar spent. We managed to try a few dishes in one sitting and was a little over being just full. The service was prompt and pleasant so as the environment. Will be returning here for sure!!

Food really nice +, environment is great+, staffs are friendly. Foods are so good to taste. Love the tiramisu.

Food here was AMAZING! Every dish that was recommended to us was so delightful to taste. Highly recommend the mushroom ravioli for starters, the crab pasta, and the pizza (crust was so nicely done) ⭐️⭐️⭐️

Service was great too, they provided 4 wraps for our fajitas instead of the usual 3 as we came as a family of 4. He also shared these amazing recommendations, thank you very much! 🙏🏼☺️ will be back!

Nice ambience for Mexican & Italian food. Love the beef fajitas and Burrata. Sadly line many establishments these days, they do not serve tap water and only served still water at $7 a bottle.

Excellent thin crust pizza! One Of the better ones I had tasted. Service was good and food came out quickly. Prices are reasonable too.

Spanish cuisine in Sentosa Cove.reviews:
Love this place and the fact that after so many years, the quality of the food remains high!

Undeniably on the higher price range so it’s a bit of a treat whenever we visit FOC. The food and service does not disappoint. Staff tried to accommodate every request we had, which does really make the whole night more enjoyable.

This place serves up one of the best Paellas in Singapore! My go to place for squid ink paella! The black paella came with perfectly grilled tender prawns and scallops!

Ordered the grilled prawns which was served on small sizzling skillet filled with soft tender prawns swimming in a pool of fragrant garlic oil. Hmmmm.. I could cut the all the seafood here with my spoon!

Our favourite appetiser was still the sautéed cauliflower! It looked like a simple dish until we bite into it! There were so many layers of flavours in this dish! One bite into the crunchy cauliflower, paired with the smoked aubergine purée, spiced mayo, pickled onions and a speck of herbs was just divine.

If i can give 10 starz i will gladly give them. Their seafood paella was honestly one of the best we ever tasted in SG. The flavour is bursting with every bite and the texture is legit aldente. Their fish n chips and char grilled portobello was also great tasting.

I would like to commend on their service because they had went the extra mile to provide my partner with a complimentary birthday dessert when i casually mentioned to the staff. Really appreciated that gesture which made our day. Thank you

We celebrated my daughter's birthday yesterday and we had a great time! The staff was accommodating and we felt really well taken care of. The kids enjoyed having a pool to splash in before and after dinner.
Food was good, we had the mushroom croquetas - this tastes like breaded mushroom soup; crystal bread - which was a hit with the kids, its basically toasted bread with tomato paste; potato churros - another hit with the kids; octopus tentacle - super yummy; beef steak - tender and juicy; red snapper; highlight was the squid ink paella! We also had the iberico paella - that was OK only.
The white sangria was a little too watered down. Tasty, but abit like fruit juice.

Nice beach atmosphere. Great pool. Good food. Pate and ham Croquettes were great! Fried Peppers too! Bread was so so. Had their cocktails. Not fantastic though.

A beach club which does dinner service in an air conditioned restaurant section. Spanish styled tapas and mains dominate the menu. Extensive range of drinks including cocktails and wine. Food quality really good as well as service.

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
Stumbled across this place today and decided to eat here with my mum. Very no frills and simple place.

She had a falafel moussaka, and I had the mexican beef bowl. The moussaka was delicious but I feel like 5 pieces of nacho chips wasn’t enough and mind you this cost $13…..

The beef bowl was a little dry, could do with some kind of sauce but it was good and we finished both dishes. The churros came freshly fried and was good too, but would have preferred actual choc sauce vs the hershey choc syrup.

Only gripes; the overly sugary lemongrass drink that was served premade with no ice. Had to ask for ice twice but given few pieces…..  also very weird that we dined in but were served with plastic cutlery when we clearly saw metal cutlery, it was a little strange. It was practically only 2 tables and the lady served my food to the other table…. Could tell she wanted to take it back to serve me but they already started eating it.

I think its a quaint little place but some things need to be improved. At $30 for 2 expected just a little more.

Excellent service. The beef Mexican rice bowl was not bad. With the homemade drink, I spent less than $10. I was there alone at 5 ish and I had the entire place to myself. I don't remember music playing but it sure would be nice to listen to some tunes.

Small quaint shop located near Tai Seng Mrt, they had a $10 set meal that had a wrap, small hash brown and a lemongrass tea. There was a small side of nacho chips with salsa.

Nothing amazing but I guess it was better than nothing coz there wasn’t anything there open before 11am

Dropped-off my 10-months old laptop at LENOVO Service Centre at 3 Irving Rd, #01-17 Tai Seng Centre. BITC, Singapore 369522 on Tuesday 18 April 2023,

Thus decide to settle my late lunch within the area too.

One will be spoiled with choices as there are so many small eateries and cafes. I was drawn to  Olive Mediterranean & Middle East which was located across the street at 11 Irving Place #01-14/15, Tai Seng Point, Singapore 369551.

Ordered for myself a Mexican Rice (Celantro & Spinach With Beef) Bowl at S$7.50.

If you are a small eater, the serving portion is just right. However, definitely a "No. No." for someone who has a heavy duty digestive system, I would recommend that you order some nachos or Quesadillas too.

In my opinion, the rice is mildy aromatic (I was expecting a more pungent aroma of Celantro and spinach).

I will rate the minced beef topping as "healthy choice".  It is relatively quite nice BUT will not leave one any special impression.  It will definitely taste alot better if there is a little more fat (this will enhance the juiciness) and more spices are added.

However, if you working in this area, it is a great place to meet up with your colleagues and friends after work.  You can sufficient outdoor sittings surrounded with plants.

Stumbled on this place as i happened to be browsing around. Been awhile since i had my tacos and wraps, decided to try this as i noticed they had very high reviews.

Had the beef Quesadilla - loved it as it was simply nice
Chicken Saffron Stew - Soooo tender and nice but soup wasnt as thick as i wanted but thats purely due to my own taste
Hashbrowns - Thumbsup as we all loved it. Hearsay its even better than M's hashbrown but i leave it for u to judge.

Service wise was top, very homely feel given by the lady boss and staff. She took her time to guide me through the menu and shared with me what we should order.
I must say the food takes a pretty long time to come for a quiet Monday Afternoon but i guess Good Food - Time to prepare so no complaints from me on this.

Overall i recommend this place based on the food served + prices. Very nice and they deserves better businesses. should be pretty quiet when its after office hours.

Will be back again :)

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
Opening in March 2022, Zuzu Kebab is a Muslim-owned hawker stall specialising in Turkish kebabs. The chef at the helm of Zuzu Kebab formerly hailed from the Turkish Kebab House, a pop-up stall often seen in Pasar Malams / Night Bazaars around Singapore. Zuzu Kebab tends to attract long hungry queues of diners, thanks to their delicious dishes served in large hearty portions, at wallet-friendly prices.
.
Ambience at Zuzu Kebab is shared with the rest of the Serangoon Garden Market & Food Centre hawker stalls. There's ample common seating, with bright lights, and an open, airy, bustling atmosphere. The large and attractive signage of Zuzu Kebab is easy to spot, with people patiently waiting their turn to order.
.
Service at Zuzu Kebab is friendly but structured. Chef takes a few orders at a time, then makes each order one at a time. This results in fresh, made-to-order, piping hot meals each time, though it also leads to a short queue of up to 15 minutes in waiting time. It's usually a 1 or 2 man show here, and while they demonstrate great product knowledge on the menu, they can be rather brusque during peak periods.
.
Food at Zuzu Kebab is Turkish cuisine, with a focus on kebabs. There's a good range of options here, though most folks order the staples. I like that their dishes and meals are healthy and wholesome, not too greasy, and served with plenty of fresh vegetables. Quality is consistently above average, and portions are large for individuals.
.
Prices are wallet-friendly but higher than other hawkers, budget about SGD $9 per person.

Enjoyed the burrito & butter rice with chicken. The pita bread with hummus was yummy. Be prepared to queue/wait for your food during peak meal time.

Zuzu Kebab serves food fresh and you can’t go wrong with any orders. Just try whichever you feel like to eat today. My all day comfort food and also healthier choice :)

Good quality and value !!! Just need to prepare for long queue and waiting time.
Kunefe is the best I had so far!! Freshly made, rich but not sweet! Must try!!
The pita bread are freshly made, for garlic and cheese option, they will bake it upon ordering, it is so good just out from the oven , but be prepared for some waiting time, if you are in a rush, take the salad ,kebabs , original pita.

ZUZU IS BACK!! Absolutely tasty and worth the wait. Just look at the char on the chicken. Definitely value for money w the huge portion size. I always come prepared to pack some back for my lunch at work tmr 😍

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
Been to Plonk many times over a few years and the consistency of the food, good service staff and quality (& quantity) never fail to impress. Still keeping up the standards. Fish & chips are served in a good proportion. Pizza (thin n nicely done as well) n pork ribs (big portion hor) Crispy wings with a special dipping sauce - not too bad but I thought the wings can be further marinated for people who don't go for the dipping sauce. Fries costs only $5 on Fridays n you get ALOOOT of fries too. Ordered Bolognese n Carbonara (finished before I remember to take photo). The kids absolutely loved it. We loved how much clams we had in the vongole - power la. The staff were also very friendly n kind to hand us spoon n plates for our cake.

Been awhile since I had a beer at Serangoon Gardens! Plonk serves Little Creatures Pale Ale on tap. It was an enjoyable pint and the St Kinda fish and chips was a great pairing. Great attentive service crew and will be back!

Been to Plonk many times, usually for their express brunch. The fish and chips was fantastic, crispy and freshly fried fish with a nice thin batter coating. A whole heap of fries absolutely fried to perfection. Paired very nicely with the Little Creatures IPA they have on tap. Very pleasant ambience as well, open air but cool inside. The tart was more on the chocolate side, fudgy and delicious and paired with vanilla ice cream. On other visits i’ve also had their truffle mushroom risotto which is cheesy goodness.

I was around the serangoon area and looking for something new to try. Stumbled upon Plonk with loads of people having a beer in the front and decided to try this place out. The food was great, the place wasn't too crowded, music volume was just nice, but inside was just too dark.

The food was great and you should not skip on the pizza. Ordered the mushroom truffle, mushrooms are big and chunky, dough was nice and crispy.

Kitchen whipped meals are 💪 strong. Very flavourful pizzas. Eggs and burgers are juicy and crisp to lock in the flavours 🍔

Unfortunately they’re so popular the kitchen is short handed. You’re gonna have to wait 40mins plus for service. You can tell the waiter and managers are harried from the load too. Kudos on their efforts to still be friendly and nice 😃

Check the waiting times if you’re in a hurry to avoid being hangry

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
My favourite Greek restaurant in Singapore of all time.  I have been here 10 TIMES. The food is always so consistently good. They serve the best salad, octopus, sea bream, lamb chop and even chicken. Their dips and pita bread are also to die for. Service isn't as good as it used to be anymore but oh well.

Celebrated a friend birthday here and the staff was quite helpful. We were introduced to a good spread. Wasn’t expecting the food to be good in this type of cafe but was pleasantly surprised of the meat quality and portion. Slightly on the salty side but acceptable. Overall, would come back again.

Loved having dinner here. Food, service, atmosphere all fantastic. Wayne was a great server who recommended some signature dishes - codfish roe was my fav. Octopus was well cooked and kebab was also unique but perfectly cooked.

Came here multiple times including the one at the old location. Also recommended and brought my friends, colleagues here many times! Loved the food, ambience and service! Just so good! This time my friends and I came here to celebrate birthday and the bar manager treated us to complimentary alcohol and gave a small bottle of olive oil (we also purchased a big one!). Their olive oil tastes so gooooooood! The dessert was complimentary as well. I love the fish, octopus and vegetables the best!

Food is fantastic. Price is reasonable as well, total damage is about $50/pax. (We ordered like 7-8 dishes).
Service is pretty prompt. The ambience is good & cozy for gathering & chit-chatting.

Greek food in Serangoon.name: BAKALAKI Greek Taverna

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
Came here on the recommendation of my daughter for a lunch birthday celebration.
Knowing I am a fan of Japanese food and hearing this place is rated quite highly so decide to give it a try with my family.
We try the ebi and tonkatsu and also the chashu. The food did not disappoint and everything was really delicious ans savoury. The chef and waiters service was friendly and attentive. And there was also a free flow of cabbage for us as well.
Overall a five star recommendation for this place so do come and try!

Service is great.
Place remains same for a Monday before 6pm .

Miso ramen is still well flavoured and appetising. Helps chase away Monday blues.
Prices have increased for adding noodles so I opt for a add on of rice instead.

Cheers.

We were very happy with the taste of our food and the service level provided! Big eaters like me rejoice with free flow rice and cabbage!

Family’s go to dinner place for tonkatsu sets. Love that the rice and cabbage is free flow!

The tonkatsu is well breaded and fried. Not greasy and still juicy.

Rice is properly cooked, always nicely done. Loving the soup that comes as a side with the meal itself. Cabbage is shredded nice and thin, and the dressing is tart and delicious!

Overall a really good experience!

If you are keen on noodles, the ramen is pretty good as well. Extra serves of noodle and soup can be purchased to top up the meal itself.

Overall, really yummy! Get there early for a table!

One of my favourite Oyakodons(and store, too!) in Singapore, while I often visit for their Katsus, if I ever crave Oyakodons I often find myself back here. Affordable Authentic Japanese Comfort Food.

The Oyakodon has half-cooked eggs which lends an extremely smooth texture to the dish. The Mirin is rich but not overbearing. Chicken chunks are tender, eaten with rice, it’s truly something I come back to again and again.

That said, most dishes here are tasty, so if it’s not your bowl of rice, you can’t really go wrong with the Miso Katsu either(not pictured).
Greek food in Serangoon.name: Hajime Tonkatsu & Ramen (myVillage @ Serangoon Garden)

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
The best Greek restaurants we’ve ever been in Singapore. The ingredients are so fresh and every dish is very delicious.
The desert is also the highlight.

Will come back to try more dishes.

Came here for a work lunch as the food was supposed to be good! Apparently my friend said that the standards have dropped and the food used to be better prior to their renovation…

Also, the restaurant has a strict 2 hours rule in place and we had to vacate the place by 2pm for their closing.. not a good experience for sure.

One of the best Greek food I’ve ever had! The dips are yummy, pitas are warm and tasty, the grilled octopus is one of the best I’ve ever had!!!! The tacos giros are yummy and the beef is of great quality! One more thing to mention is that they even serve Greek beer!!! The service is good, decoration/interior design is top! A must go place!!!!
