The best Greek food in Singapore!

Slightly pricey but the food taste amazing, simple yet flavorful!

The highlight for me was the octopus and eggplant spread 💯

Beautiful interior decor but the place was a little cramped and noisy due to the proximity of the tables. Food was great, esp the grilled octopus, but prices are on the higher end. Worth a try :)
Greek food in Serangoon.name: Alati Divine Greek Cuisine

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
An affordable pet and dog cafe in the neighbourhood. We came here several times and this time was a special day for us and our precious Stitch who turned 5 years old this year. You could pre order a dog friendly cake few days before your appointment. Our cake is made of pumpkin and fruits so humans could eat it too

Food is not bad for the affordable pricing and we enjoyed it! Service was great and speed of serving the food is considered fast. We enjoyed ourselves a lot and recommend you bring your dog there :)

Better than average human food for a pet cafe! Prices are very reasonable. The floor is a bit gross though because it's vinyl and some owners don't clean up after their dogs immediately. Not wheelchair-friendly as there are steps at the entrance.

A Paradise for Pet Lovers!

This is another hidden gem for all pet lovers and foodies alike. From the moment we walked in, we were welcomed with open arms and so was our furball.

The highlight of our visit was the pet menu, a thoughtful touch that truly sets this place apart. Our pup had a ball choosing from a variety of delicious options and the complimentary water served in bowls was a fantastic gesture to keep him hydrated and happy.

For the humans, the Chilli Crab Shakshuka and Salmon Hae Bee Hiam Spaghetti were nothing short of amazing. Bursting with flavors, these dishes were a treat for the taste buds. The Chilli Crab Shakshuka had the perfect balance of spiciness and richness, while the Salmon Hae Bee Hiam Spaghetti offered as much punch, if not more.

The presence of pee pads made our visit stress-free and convenient, ensuring our pets' comfort. The entire atmosphere exuded warmth and welcome for animals, making our experience very lovely.

We will be back!

Went there twice.
First, the food was really affordable and really good, ordered beef burger, their fish and chip and salmon rice bowl. Quality food!
Second, it’s really dog friendly, the mop water etc is readily available, even leash as well. We
Can leash our dog to the hooks on the wall which allowed us to eat peacefully
Third, the dog food portions were really great and affordable as well☺️ our baby girl really enjoyed it without us spending a bomb on it (picture Was attached can be seen, how big the portion was)
Last, the staff were really friendly, service were good ☺️

Like the Pet Friendly inside the restaurant. Wanted to pay with cash or credit card but was told only paynow or paylah.
Order:
Using QR code need my credit card details
Duck comfit - salty & very dry meet.
Big breakfast -  Good
Carrot cake-  hard & dry. Suspect frozen & reheated.
Hot beverages - Good
Reasonable prices

Review quality of food from feedback & I  am confident business will grow.

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
One of the few times you go to a restaurant and feel that the amount you paid for the service charge is worth it. The floor staff attend to you immediately and ensure the food served are hot. Unfortunately, there were some mishaps with the food served. When informed, it was immediately rectified and a new dish was served. I am very impressed with the service and the quality of food. Kudos.

Yummy food but I think they need more staff for the weekends. Hard to get their attention especially for water refill. Can’t blame them as there’s only two of them managing everything. Might want to consider self-service for the water though.

UPDATE:
Went back again and now they don’t even serve tap water but charge for bottled water at $6? Not sure if I will revisit.

We were there on a weekend for a late lunch. The place was very empty. We were ushered in quite quickly, but when we wanted to place an order, we waited quite a while to be able to get someone's attention.
3 out 4 items we wanted to order were not available, but we were not informed when we sat down, hence very disappointed. They also have a pasta menu that is not available for weekends too..
Food came quite fast, but the plates have very disgusting dirty and wet cotton string wrapped handles. I cannot imagine anyone's hand touching that and then touching the fries or wrap. Mocktail was a glass of diabetes, 15% to 20% syrup, coloring and milk. The orange cake was a miss too. It tasted like tapioca kueh.

We had a comfortable good time on a rainy Sunday evening, eve of PH, at Ela (Bukit Batok)! Our favourite dish was actually 'Keto' with Pulled Beef - the cauliflower rice was very well done with a generous portion of pulled beef! #mustry
We would like to do a special shout out to the one and only floor staff that night, Yani! She was like a wonderwoman, running the floor service alone, serving at least 5-6 tables of guests professionally - from bringing guests to tables, to taking orders, clearing tables, making drinks, serving the dishes etc.! Mad respect! Thank you for being so attentive and patient with your warm services! Will be back at the new outlet to try other items soon too! 🥳

It was so cozy and absolutely loved the vibes. The food was exceptional and the service was great.

The smell of the pita was sooo good and the pita on my lamb was soaked with flavor. Tho you may want to note that lamb generally has a strong smell/taste. My suggestion is to maybe elevate their dessert as the cake tasted like any ordinary lemon pound cake with an ice cream scoop on top. Wish there were smtg more special.
honestly would come here again.

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
Nice respectable Korean restaurant in the Serangoon Gardens area. Comes with a variety of ban chan dishes - ten to be exact. I was personally expecting the meat to be grilled on the table but it was done in the kitchen instead. Pork collar was overcooked and tough to chew. The beef on the hand was done alright. The other main dishes that we ordered were slightly better than the BBQ option than we had.

I reached 630pm and had to queue outside for a while for 25mins. The server was passionate and shared with us what’s the highly recommended dish to go for. Order an oxtail soup and a recommended BBQ. Oxtail soup was okay and lags of umami. The pork belly is overcooked and served on a hot plate that’s not hot. Then I would recommend serving on the plate instead if there isn’t any sizzling effect, why bother? Food for thought. I think probably we picked the wrong dishes? I don’t know… but I’m sure paying for that price I can get better BBQ meat for sure. Head down and try for yourself, review is base on my personal preference. You might have a different experience than I have.

Food:
pork bokkeum $30
serving size was generous and it was filled with lots of veg, onions and mushrooms. slight spice gave it a nice kick but doesn’t come with rice. quite a challenge to finish it even if we weren’t full because it got quite jelak
dolsot bibimbap $20
can’t go wrong, really nice and we polished it off
haemul pajeon $17
there was seafood with every bite of the pancake, they certainly don’t scrimp on the ingredients. personally not a fan of how soft the pancake was though ):
additional items:
sikhye $4
really nice and smooth drink, but serving size was a tad small, moreover no complimentary water which is usually a norm in korean joints
hite beer $17, rice $2

10 side dishes came complimentary but nothing really stood out. some were quite salty as well 😅
overall not too bad, but nothing that stood out as being really delicious

Superb Korean food. Great, authentic taste.

Love the japchae - nice texture, flavourful. Oxtail stew is good too. The BBQ platter is fantastic.

This place reminds me of a joint in Seoul that I used to frequent, esp their bokkeum octopus, which has such a generous amount of octopus compared to other places where there's more veg in the dish.. their side dishes are also good and a hit for my toddlers.

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
They have a selection of kebab, burrito, quesdadilla etc. Taste is ok, about slightly average in my opinion.  The shop is small, not much seating available. Overall a place you can come for kebab, burrito etc, but only if you are in the vicinity.

The service crew @AMK recommended me Karana (young jackfruit) kebab as I am vegetarian. The taste was interesting and yummy! I will recommend it to anyone wants to try something  not soy or mushroom.

I am first time try....
The chicken taste very yummy with vegetables so great. I buy one was Pita pocket for my son and I have kebab wrap so full. Now they have Ramadan combo set person only $8.90 come drink also fries 🍟.
I am so full with combo meals.They all very friendly. Next time I will be dine in... See you again.

Great service by the server. Well done. She was friendly and asked about our satisfaction with the food.

My 3rd visit tonight.
Tastes good and fresh because they make it after you ordered.

Very happy to see you guys having more and more customers!
If the owner can see this comment, maybe can assess if you can allocate one more staff in the peak hour to shorten the waiting time.
Staff is hard working to prepare food orders but one man band is having its capacity.
Greek food in Serangoon.address: 61 Ang Mo Kio Ave 8, #01-05 Jubilee Square, Singapore 569814
Greek food in Serangoon.name: Kebabs Faktory (Ang Mo Kio)

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
Mentai chicken is quite normal, but their buta don is very delicious.  We love the buta don and buy 1 free 1 asahi draft beer.

High quality food as always...aburi en never fail to provide good food with fresh ingredients. Grilled Pork Jawl and Ikura Rolls were my favourite

They specialise in aburi meat. Their donburi is a must try. There is quite a variety of side dishes and sake.

Lunch set is value for money. Comes with salad, miso soup with clams and a mini dessert.
Pork is tender and tasty.

Delicious buta don with truffle toppings, and got a free scoop of ice cream by filling up their survey.

Greek food in Serangoon.name: Aburi-EN (Nex)

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
We specifically chose this Chong Qing for its location and crowd. We reserved well in advance as this place requires reservation during the peak hours.
Ordered Grilled Tilapia in spicy fragrant sauce and few veggies like potato, lettuce, tofu. The flavours were amazing and fish tasted really fresh and there was no fishy smell as you usually feel while eating any seafood. We got a plate of home made buns and rice to go along with it. Cooled ourselves with cucumber salad. For drink we got sour plum four seasons tea and local craft beer. Everything we ate or drank were worth it.
Staff was friendly and accomodated our request of getting rice later and also getting some of those buns take away. Definitely will visit again, Cheers :)

Got the mushroom seabass, medium spicy and added Chinese cabbage. Portioning is quite little, can only find a few pieces of veg and that's about it.

Service was also slow. Our noodles was not served as we were almost finishing our food. We checked twice with one stuff who told us that he will check for us. Then we checked a third time with another staff and staff told us they forgot our noodles. She asked if we would like to cancel this item since we are almost finishing our food. We said ok. Our noodles came shortly.

Seasoning and food is quite nice and flavourful.

We brought our friends to experience mala cusine and were told that the Classic set meal for 4 pax offers whole seabass so we accepted their recommendation. The medium seabass was slightly small in our perspective because we were expecting a larger fish since fish is the main item in this set. Each one of us got a little portion and it tasted fishy and unfresh, we didnt enjoy the fish at all. Nonetheless, we thought the presentation of this dish was beautiful and the side dishes in the fish tasted yummy. We were wowed by all other side dishes like Spinach, Lala, Sweet&Sour Pork, Watering Chicken, etc.  We feedbacked to the Server on our experience and glad that they will inform their kitchen. In general, their service level is friendly and helpful.  It is the fish dish that ruined the overall eating experience.

Saturday lunch at 12pm, only customer in the restaurant for a while. We ordered the set with the grilled fish and several side dishes. Fish was fragrant and flavorful, but the portion was a little small for 4 pax. Generally on the saltier side as expected of Chinese cuisine. We had a good lunch together.

Excellent food and customer service. My food was in a mess when the grab driver delivered to me and was irresponsible to reply or answer my call. When I call in the restaurant to ask for a solution, immediately after seeing the photos that I send them. Without second they arrange to send me those damage food to be replace and resolved my issue. Would like to thanks chong Qing grilled fish serangoon for your fast reply and your efficiency. Especially to Jia Zhe for your help.

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
We went there for our eldest's birthday dinner. The food was amazing. From the grilled Octopus tentacle, to the seafood platter to the meat platter and the best of all, the pork skewers.. we almost didn't order the pork skewers but am glad we did because it was out of this world and not like anything we (or I) have tasted before.

Be prepared for a budget of 80 to 100 per pax without drinks or alcohol.

Easy parking at Craig Place (walking distance). May need to maneuver a bit if you have guests on wheelchairs.

Had an extremely enjoyable dining experience here with my work colleagues. Although I've not been a huge fan of Greek food all along, our lunch was actually quite yummy. Got ourselves a mixed platter combo to share, some moussaka, spanakopita (make sure you get this), and some pita bread with dips. Make sure to call and reserve ahead of time, as they do get quite crowded during meal times.

This place is just outstanding: exceptional raw material used to create fresh, delicious, authentic dishes. Great wines offered, relaxed atmosphere, cozy decoration. All pieces are put together nicely for a fantastic experience! The cooks and managers are really putting their heart into Fotia and it shows!

We will be back for sure!

Greek food in a nice setting. Been here a few times and the food always stands out, definitely one of the best Greek restaurants in town. Salads are delicious, uses good fresh ingredients and seasoning was good. Meat platter was big enough for 4 of us with a good selection of grilled meat, flavourful and had good taste.

Beautiful venue that really makes you feel like you’re in Greece. Wide variety of seafood, meat and vegetarian dishes - the platters are definitely plentiful and good for big groups. Service is friendly and prompt which is appreciated.

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
Enjoyed the food here! Unique taste very garlicky 🫶 love the chewy noodles too. The chicken feet & pancake with brown sugar is good too! #authentickorean food 👍

Food was awesome! Loved the soup broth. We took out 2/3 of the garlic from the soup, as we were scared it was too spicy. The taste was perfect to me. We ordered small, but couldn't finish it between 2 people. I think it's highly possible to have 3 people share a Small pot. Service was great, waiter refilled our soup automatically when he saw it was finishing, and allowed us to take away the remaining dishes which we couldn't finish. Location is extremely convenient as well. We came during lunch without reservation, so we got seats immediately. Not sure how it's like for dinner. Would definitely come here again, with a bigger group to try again 👍👍👍

First experience with Dakdoritang and it was wonderful! Love the spicy soup and big bunch of garlic! The steam egg is also wonderful!

The interior design also makes you feel like you are transported to Korean. Really like the vibe and the staff were super friendly and helpful with suggestions.

The taste of eating in Korea! People who like garlic will like it! There's a lot of garlic, but after taste is very clean!

There are a lot of side dishes, so you can enjoy the drink!
There's only one restaurant specializing in chicken stew in Singapore !!
Weekend waiting is long. Join us on weekdays
I recommend it :)

First time trying Dakdoritang and Kelim’s version was great as they added in a good amount of garlic for an enhanced taste of the stew and the chicken meat was very tender. The knife cut noodles and fried rice made with the stew were very tasty too!
Greek food in Serangoon.opening_hours:

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
Food was amazing and prepared fantastically - delicious and hearty Greek/Mediterranean fare. All the restaurant staff were exceptionally warm, friendly, and kind, and it felt like we were having a sit down dinner at a family home. For the birthday celebration, everyone sang happy birthday as well and we were so well taken care of. The ambience was amazing. Definitely must try and we will definitely come back.

We went to Mykonos by the bay on 1st July to celebrate my daughter’s birthday. I must say that the service staff was quite friendly but the  quantity of the food actually disappointed us. The food was nice but portions were extremely small so we have to order more food. Specially the platter, which was priced at $29 was totally not worth as the dips portions were too small.

Very nice view of the marina of docked boats, al fresco dining.
Well trained staff, skillful and knowledgeable.
Food is equally fantastic.

Food is excellent, especially the fish, perfect with the creamy garlic source. Not too crowded on a Monday night, it was windy and comfortable with the outdoor seats. Staffs are attentive. Overall very pleasant experience.

Great Greek Food

Had dinner with a bunch of friends. We ordered to share. The meat sharing platter was of high quality and cooked to perfection despite it being a dish with many different types of meat. The breads and dips were also great.

Service was excellent. We had them arrange tables and then changed tables. They accommodated us each step of the way without any fuss. Service came promptly with a smile.

The place certainly lived up to its Mykonos name - blue and white furniture graced the place. Outdoor sitting was comfortable with ceiling ELV fans constantly cooling the place next to the water.
Greek food in Serangoon.address: 31 Ocean Way, #01-10 Quayside Isle, Sentosa Cove, 098375
Greek food in Serangoon.name: Mykonos On The Bay

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
We had our dinner here on Good Friday night with the last minute reservation from google.
We ordered a starter, a pizza, a grilled meat platter and a Lebanon dessert. The food worth 2 stars. The meat was pretty hard, the starter was too sour. The dessert was really not able to match our taste. The house wines was tasteless, but the red wine taste better when it pair with the meat. I will strongly recommend you only order the red if you want to have their one for one house wine promo.
Our bill was $128, you can get a much more better grilled meat platter and better food at other restaurants. :)

Le Rida has a rustic ambience somewhat akin to an old time eating house in a small town. Quaint and homely
Freshly baked pita bread with lemon chick pea hummus was delicious and filling
Mains of Lebanese lamb kafta kebab had the right balance of flavour and crunchiness.
Wash it all down with 1 for 1 Heineken draft at $17.90

Manager Sanjiv was both friendly and helpful in his recommendations and unlike in some establishments, he did not push you to over order.
Definitely worth a return visit!

A quaint no frills dining place with excellent food and good service. The staff are simple people but are very hospitable, often checking in on the food quality and our experience. If you are looking for a good meal away from hustle and bustle, this is the place to go. Oh.. U can definitely have a conversation with your company and hear them loud and clear

Didn't think the food was thaaaat amazing. Nor was the service. But at least they let us drink outside drinks.
HOWEVER, i requested for no garnishing on my hummus. When the guy brought it over, there WAS parsley on it. And all he said was "just pluck it out". --.--
So if i was allergic to that, i should just pluck it out.... nice. The hummus wasn't good either. I've tasted better. Like a friend who went with me commented... it isn't creamy enough. Also, comments about the baklava was that it was too hard... and wasn't good.

Absolutely loved the food, I am heavily into Mediterranean food. I have tried most of the places around Bugis as well. The food here was so fresh, with perfect taste and presentation. It was completely worth it travelling from East.
The service was quick, the portion size was generous . We ordered mezze plateer and tabalu salad. They were scrumptious loved the customised heart shaped Pita bread. Hummus, was so creamy and so were all other dips.

Would strongly recommend.. It has become one of my favourite place..

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
Came earlier for better chance of parking at the landed estate. Thoroughly enjoyed the food here! Had the Fig Time pizza, rock melon with parma ham and angel hair pasta w/ king crab meat. Will come back and try other dishes on the menu (:

Another find in Serangoon gardens and Another Italian favourite of mine. Quite hidden. We had to park car and walk a while to get here. The ambience was cosy and the service was prompt. I loved their pizza! All dishes we ordered were lovely. The pastas were fresh. Truffle pasta was decadent.

Baci Baci, nestled in a cozy corner of Serangoon, proved to be the ideal spot for our early celebrations of my son's birthday. When asked what he wanted for his special day, he excitedly exclaimed "pasta," so we ventured to this charming restaurant.

The moment we stepped inside, the neat and inviting decor set the tone for a pleasant dining experience. The service staff were friendly, exhibiting warmth and genuine hospitality.

We embarked on a culinary journey, starting with the Crema di Porcini. Unlike other commercially-made versions, this soup had a distinct homemade taste that was truly delightful.

The Cacciucco, with its perfectly balanced acidity, whetted our appetites and prepared us for the feast ahead. The Soute do Cozze was heartwarming, and the choice of white wine in the soup was spot-on.

The Tagliatelle impressed us with its impeccable texture and rich truffle aroma, while the Capellini al Grancho, although tasty, could benefit from a touch of cream to enhance its flavors.

A surprising hit among the children was the Frutti de Mare, their first encounter with squid ink. Initially skeptical due to its color, they couldn't resist requesting seconds after tasting its unique and delicious flavor.

In conclusion, Baci Baci surpassed our expectations for a memorable early birthday celebration. With its cozy ambiance, friendly service, and delectable pasta offerings, it proved to be a delightful culinary haven.

Had expectations but after some cold plain bread then bland ordinary 'homely' pasta, things got incredibly boring and disappointing. One thing good was the pizza dough. Might be worth giving the pizza another shot... Maybe.

Best service ever, waitress and owner went above and beyond to take care of us. authentic pizza was so good I ate it before taking the picture!
Greek food in Serangoon.name: Baci Baci Restaurant

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
Did a takeaway of their sliced fish soup. Pretty flavorful soup, but not much in terms of ingredients. Perfectly decent bowl of soup for a coffee shop, definitely will get it again if in the area.

Was a little apprehensive about ordering from this stall cause of the reviews but like another reviewer mentioned, people seem to have issues with their fried fish soup, whereas the sliced version is alright.

one of the best fish soups around the neighbourhood! the staffs are friendly, especially the lady from malaysia. she always remembers that i want fish roe in my soup 🤣 not too sure about the bad reviews on their fried fish because i prefer sliced fish, but i can say that the sliced fish is fresh and portions are generous too. the soup is tasty because of the dried tee-poh fish in it. highly recommended!!

Ordered mix fish soup, add fish egg and fish sliced. When I open it up at home, fish egg is hard like rock and not fresh. Fried fish is missing too.

Soup & thick beehoon taste ok. Ordered fried fish soup but was given fried flour soup, 5% meat.

Fried fish soup eat only flour..meat 5% only or even lesser..just like eating fried flour soup! 147 Serangoon Nth Ave 1. Totally disappointed!

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
Good selection of delicious BBQ meats and cooked dishes, but I was very disappointed with the service (or lack of) provided. I had made an online reservation a week ahead, and even physically went down to confirm my reservation with the manager. She gave us assurance that we would be accommodated for our Sunday lunch. Somehow the staff forgot to reserve seats for my family on the actual day, and we were told to wait outside the restaurant for 20 minutes past the agreed time. No sincere apology or even any seats or water provided for our kids and elderly while we were waiting! We definitely won't be patronizing this outlet again!

A seamless dining experience here especially with friendly & effective crew. Food are fresh & tasty. Peter helps to cook & pack our food as we couldn’t finish it. I didn’t manage to name all the crew but they are all fantastic!! I highly recommend this place!!

Had a great experience with the food and service.  Exceptional positive service with Peter who waited on our table.  All of us had a many good laughs with his stories and the evening is so enjoyable.

We had excellent service from Joey and Peter. They came to help us cook our meats. The food is excellent. Only concern was a 90 minute time frame to enjoy our dinner.

Went to check out this Korean BBQ restaurant at Nex, they marinated all the meats with the yummy and tasty sauce! They offered free flow of vegetables, garlic, onions, kimchi and cucumbers. The environment is cozy and you no need to worry about the smell of the barbecue. This place is really a great spot for family and friends gatherings.

Greek food in Serangoon.reviews:
Lovely hidden gem. Honestly one of the better places for authentic Mexican food I had in Singapore. Compared to overpriced places, this is reasonably priced and was really delicious. I had the Birria taco and I loved it. Definitely will be back.

Awesome food.. a tad bit over priced in my opinion.. but not a deterrent.
We ordered a couple of stuff and everything was fresh, hot and yummmy !!! Their lemongrass drink was pretty refreshing!

Very welcoming staff recommended us food and was very friendly. Ordered the Mexican rice bowl and Burrito, which was really tasty and flavourful. Will come back again.

Stumbled onto this eatery and we decided to give it a try.
Aceituna Mexicana serves some Mexican inspired dishes, as well as some Middle Eastern inspired dishes. The reason I say it's inspired is because I feel that it's more like it's been tweaked to cater to the local taste buds.
The menu isn't extensive, but what they do serve is pretty decent. My enchilada is more like a lasagna, with less fillings.
It's probably a place that caters to the people living and working nearby, as I don't really see myself making a trip specially for the food. But if you're around the area, it makes a nice change from the usual fare.

Had the set lunch - chicken rice bowl set. Taste like Briyani for me. Food taste not so bad, with salad on top, it is a plus! The set come with crunchy hash browns make it even better! Still worth to try if you are nearby.

Peranakan restaurants in Katong.reviews:
Went in at around 2pm on a Saturday afternoon. It was fairly empty (only 1 table occupied). Asked for a table for 2 and sat down. Wanted to order a chendol and a chin chow drink. The server told us we have to order main food. I asked exactly this “we cant just order a dessert and a drink?” The person replied yes and that he cant take our order if we not ordering food. We got up and left.
Cant believe they turned down customers just because we only wanted dessert and a drink? Horrible service.

I brought 5 Australian friends there and we were late because the flight arrived 1.5 hours late. The restaurant was very accommodating. Everything was delicious. Everybody was very happy and had only nice things to say. The favourite was the curry fishhead. The staff really followed my request to introduce the dishes to my friends. I really appreciate the attention to detail, speedy service and accommodations. I highly recommend this place and have only gratitude to them. Sorry I didn't take any photos because we wee busy eating! :)

The place is small and tight. Portions are small - even the medium is enough maybe for 2 to 3 people at most, and cost a pretty penny. For 8 persons, total cost came up to S$241.50.
Taste wise it was ok overall, nothing to shout about.
Hae cho was ok, but tiny.
Ayam buah keluak, at medium size, had only one nut cut into two. The taste was ok. Chicken was tender.
Chap chae was good, but portion was really small and alot of cabbage more than anything else.
Itek was really sour, bit strange but ok. Tender.
Babi pongteh was really soupy. I'm more used to those that are less watery. But the meat was good.
Fish was not fresh. At 38 bucks, not quite worth it, I felt.
Otah was small for the ten bucks it cost. Thought it was way overpriced.
Dessert portions were small for the price tag of 7 bucks. So-so only.

Overall, I felt not worth the price tag. Unlikely to go back again.

wow. House of Peranakan has been the highlight of my week! Great food and service, not many Peranakan food in Singapore, and as a Peranakan myself, it brings me back to my childhood days when grandma would cook. Highly recommended!!!! The staff is really helpful esp. this waiter named Duane

Unique, one-of-a-kind environment.  Food depends on taste, but for me was unique, top class, and tastes home made.  I'm honestly a bit puzzled as to why the restaurant isn't rated higher.  Peranakan cuisine is under-rated.
Peranakan restaurants in Katong.name: Peranakan Inn & Lounge

Peranakan restaurants in Katong.reviews:
I had a wonderful dining experience with my family at Old Bibik's Peranakan Kitchen. The staff was incredibly helpful, polite, and friendly, which added to the overall enjoyment of the meal. The ambiance of the restaurant was cosy and welcoming, creating a perfect setting for a pleasant meal.

The highlight, of course, was the food, which had a homely and authentic taste that truly captured the essence of Peranakan cuisine. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a genuine Peranakan dining experience.

Dinner @ Old Bibik Peranakan Kitchen.

Love the Barramundi Assam Pedas! Just right on point!

Here are the dishes i ordered:
1. Crispy Chinchalok Omelette 7/10 (portion is huge! Suited for 4-5pax)
2. Barramundi Assam Pedas (9/10)
3. Kepiting Soup (8/10)
4. Ayam Buah Keluak (8/10)
5. Nyonya Chap Chye (7/10)

P/S: Old Bibik’s cooking suits local palate, hence if you’re looking for authentic peranakan food, move on 🤭

Fabulous food. Super tasty with chilli on the side to adjust to your own taste. Good sized serves, well priced with good old fashioned service (efficient and attentive). Keen to go back as there was much on the menu we'd like to try but couldn't fit it in.  Loved the open setting with fans to keep you cool.

Some of the best Peranakan food we've had in Singapore! Everything tasted great and had a lovely home cooked feel. The sayur lodeh especially was spectacular -best I've had in Singapore. The Nyonya Ikan Assam Padas was something new to us and was very good too. Portions were generous and quality of ingredients felt high -well worth the price. A cosy ambience and warm and friendly service completed the excellent dining experience here. We will be back again with our friends!

Chance by this place when the original venue we wanted to go was close on a sunday. Tasty perankan dishes with wide offering of dishes with friendly service

Peranakan restaurants in Katong.reviews:
Not familiar with the Peranakan foods or favours. They are good but flavours are very subtle not as flavoursome. General all the dishes were delicious , flavours were towards the mild side. Fresh ingredients and we enjoyed the service and ambience !

Came here after watching Ghib Ojisan eating here on his YouTube channel. Ordered ayam buah keluak, beef rendang, assam sotong, otak otak, nyonya chap chye, blue pea rice, chendol and bo bo cha cha. Rendang was very tender, probably my favourite in this list.

Overall, food was decent but so-so. Can find better peranakan food elsewhere for this price range. Restaurant has a nice ambience though, and wasn’t crowded on a Sunday night for dinner around 6.30pm.

I decided to explore the Joo Chiat area and took a bus there and walked around. It's a Monday so it's quiet and relaxing. Just felt a bit hungry and wondered what I could find and this restaurant just popped up!  Very quiet on a Monday and i had the whole place to myself for lunch. I must say prices are high for the food, but I decided to treat myself. Service was good and the food was good. I really like the very special Ayam buah keluak and ngoh hiang. I love the decor and traditional objects all around the restaurant. It's a great authentic dining experience.

We came here while scouring for Nonya food in this area.  There were several restaurants in the area,  and I decided this based on Google reviews.

Reservations needed and recommended too.

The food is well balanced in both taste and scent,  unlike other places whereby the spices can be very overwhelming. The Sambal KangKong has that homely style cooking,  similar to mom's. Another item worth a mention is the curry chicken,  with that hint of sour in it,  bringing out the life.

Finally,  never leave this place without trying the Chendol,  always leave room for dessert. It's not too sweet,  though heavy on the coconut.

Overall,  service is fast,  speedy in fact.  I guess this is also due to the crowd that never seems to stop coming in,  we came on a Sat evening.

Worth a return visit or as when one craves for Nonya food.

staff were v friendly and the food was gd 👍🏽

the best dish we ordered was SAMBAL KANGKONG ! the chilli paste used was very fresh and tastes different from sambal kangkong from other places.

we also ordered: nogh hiang, ayam buah keluak and hainanese pork chop.

they also gave a complementary acha dish.

wanted to try their fish but was a bit expensive (about $48).

total was abt $25 per person !
Peranakan restaurants in Katong.name: Guan Hoe Soon Restaurant

Peranakan restaurants in Katong.reviews:
Here are my recommendations from the variety of food available.

Ayam Buah Keluak - where chicken meets the rich, earthy flavor of buah keluak nuts, creating an irresistibly complex dish!

Loved the DIY Yong Tau Foo and Rojak. Get to choose your favorite ingredients. My Yong Tau Foo paired perfectly with their rich and flavorful laksa soup.

Don't miss the creamy, custard-like Durian Pengat! A divine treat with that bold durian kick.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at “Nyonyas”and I must say, it was an exceptional experience. The standout feature of this establishment is undoubtedly the impeccable staff and their genuine hospitality. From the moment I stepped in, their attentiveness and spontaneous understanding of my needs was evident.

The menu at “Nyonyas”is a testament to their commitment to catering to a diverse clientele. It flawlessly balances an array of international flavors, ensuring there's something to satisfy every palate. Whether you're craving traditional fare or seeking a culinary adventure, this restaurant delivers.

Kudos to the team for their dedication to creating an inclusive dining environment that transcends borders. I'm thoroughly impressed and can't wait to return. Keep up the fantastic work, Nyunyas Team! 👍

what a pleasant find in the east (Katong)! Good buffet spread of Nyonya Peranakan food at only S$38.90++, and is daily lunch. I recommend to try their laksa, kueh pie tee , achar & durian pengat - really good. Kuddos to their Chef David, who runs the kitchen & live station (fried carrot cake is good too!) Service staff is good.

Peranakan buffet spread at Katong Village Hotel. Spread is rather huge for the price, but the food taste is so-so. Curry chicken and ponteh chicken rather bland. Salt duck soup very saltish. Nyonya laksa is is still manageable. The only 2 outstanding are the appetiser, which consists of kimchi, achar etc and durian penget.

There’s a wide variety of food to choose from with a mix of Peranakan food and other cuisines too! There are live stations and diy stations along with their buffet spread which made the experience more fun. I particularly liked the laksa which was very flavourful and the appetising achar too! The staff provided prompt and good service which made the dining experience very enjoyable :)

Disclaimer: Was here for a tasting but I saw how the staff treated other guests similarly as well ☺️

Peranakan restaurants in Katong.reviews:
Overall food was abit disappointing, more on the salty side.  But some people may like it. Environment was good as it was just renovated. Nice and cozy. Service was also fast. Opposite was an open air parking, so no concern.

Great peranakan cuisine by far in the East side! 👍👍 love their assam fish & itik sio dishes, portions were generous too for a small serving. I have to say their dishes served there alludes warm & comforting home cooked food.

The food was excellent - well executed, good ingredients, served piping hot and fresh. Quick too.

We came as a family of four and ordered 7 dishes + 2 desserts. That was entirely too much food as the portions are generous, we could probably do with 1-2 dishes less.

Order consisted of:
- Sambal squid
- Laksa Goreng
- Honey Pork Ribs
- Fried chicken wings
- Meatball soup
- Egg & shrimp fried rice
- Jackfruit curry

Desserts were delicious also, and were portioned for individual consumption.

Overall dining environment is pleasant - clean & comfortable. Service was quick, though staff could be slightly more attentive.

I’m already looking forward to our next visit ♥️

I find their Nyonya food is nice overall, but a bit pricey. Portion is pretty small given the price, maybe due to inflation..

We were here on a Sunday for late lunch around 2pm. We were seated promptly.

The beef rendang was superb. Not too spicy as my girl who cannot eat spicy food also enjoyed the dish. Ayam bulak is good. The salted veg duck soup is normal. The duck meat is very soft. As usual, the chap chumye is very nice.

Prawn egg omelette is a bit too oily, but still delicious. We tried the honey pork for thr first time. It's sweet, and nice. Only thing is there's corn, carrots and peas, not sure if everyone would like it.
Peranakan restaurants in Katong.name: Chilli Padi Nonya Restaurant

Peranakan restaurants in Katong.reviews:
Emmanuel Stall at Marine Parade Food Centre is an absolute gem! They sell normal rice and dishes but what I always come back for is the nonya blue pea nasi lemak. The chilli packs a punch too.

I normally order fish and vetables with the blue pea nasi lemak.Price is decent for the taste as well. Actually the other dishes go together with white rice is good too. Been a patron of this stall since this is my home ground.

Not only is the food exceptional, but the service is also top-notch. They take great pride in their food, and it truly shows in every dish.

The ambiance of the food center is bustling, adding to the overall dining experience. It's a great place to enjoy authentic Singaporean cuisine.

Emmanuel Stall at Marine Parade Food Centre is a culinary delight. If you're in the area, don't miss the opportunity to savor their delicious offerings.

Do take note they are off on Tue to Thurs.Also blue pea nasi lemak only avail on Fri to Sun.

I’ve always wanted to try the Nonya Nasi Lemak at Emmanuel Peranakan, which is one of the more popular stalls at 84 Marine Parade Central Hawker Centre.

No luck this time either, so I went with their regular Nasi lemak. Took fish fillet, chicken, begedel, tofu and fried egg.

Rice is very ok, not flavourful. I liked the begedel and the chicken. Fish is well cooked. The egg and tofu weren’t good - quite bland and didn’t seem fresh.

For $8.5, it’s on the more expensive side too.

LOVE their sayur lodeh!! This dish of theirs hasn’t been getting the attention it deserves - it’s creamy and strong on the coconut milk - probably one of the best I’ve eaten!

Their blue pea coconut rice is pretty interesting too: it kinda has the texture/flavour of the glutinous rice you find at the bottom of kueh salat haha and so it’s stickier then usual and has a mild sweet fragrance to it.

Would definitely dabao my lunches from here if I stay around the area. It’s somewhat pricey but well, it does taste better than the other mixed veg rice options out there!

My perennial favorite hawker stall. The menu is wide. My favorites will be fried chicken wings, cod fish batter, bombs, fish otah. The curry gravy is heavenly. This is a place whereby you can have a decent meal at a decent price. My only grouse is that they should open more during the week.

Friendly shop owner and reasonably priced. The Nyonya nasi lemak is a nice twist of the usual one with excellent chicken rendang. However, the sambal chilli isn’t super spicy.

Peranakan restaurants in Katong.reviews:
If you have in mind the usual traditional Peranakan food, this is not the place for you. The dishes are more fusion-modern and bar-like. Food is generally appealing to taste buds, staff comes across as friendly, what I really love is the interior aesthetics and vibes.

Certainly interesting for an experience, but perhaps not a return visit, and the prices tend to be a little high.

Service excellence goes to Marivel and Aeron. We had a great dining experience because of them.

Food was great too! Kudos to the Chef!!!

I couldn't say anything bad for the ambience of the restaurant as it bring more effect to the experience.

Here for the four-hands collaboration and got to try dishes of very different cuisines. Very friendly staff and delicious food! Weekend lunch seems slightly crowded do make a booking if you can! There's a beautiful outdoor area that is pet-friendly!

Nice cosy Asian fusion restaurant in the heart of Katong with stunning casual interiors. We came on a weekday evening, and only 3-4 tables were occupied.

We had red wine and decided to have it along with the following :

1) Chilli Crab Cake - Nice crispy croquettes that pairs well with the chilli crab sauce.

2) Rendang Lasagna - Nice rendang sauce, that is not too fiery. Mix it well with the cheesy lasagna and you have a winner.

3) Salmon main served on a bed of mash potato, some noodles and veggies.

As a guest of Hotel Indigo, we enjoyed their breakfast buffet and room service. The breakfast was included with our room rate so we took advantage and the staff was helpful to point out the vegan options and made us a veggie currie and roti to go with the buffet, we were full and taken care of. The fruit was a bit bland and the cappuccino was a bit bitter, but overall good variety for breakfast and we were full for hours.

The room service came in clutch after being exhausted after a long day of walking and shopping. We ordered the Assam Curry Seabass, the Chap Chae, Sauteed veggies, and jasmine rice - we didn’t venture into the fusion dishes and kept it simple. Everything was flavorful, especially the Sea Bass, and it arrived quickly and piping hot, totally satisfying!
Peranakan restaurants in Katong.opening_hours:
Monday: 6:30 AM – 10:30 PM

Peranakan restaurants in Katong.address: 86 E Coast Rd, Katong Square, Singapore 428788
Peranakan restaurants in Katong.name: Baba Chews

Peranakan restaurants in Katong.reviews:
A must buy whenever I’m around that area. The shop is very peranakan-ly done up. They sell a wide variety of traditional Nyonya Kuehs, Nyonya bak zhang(Dumplings), cookies and biscuits. They have mini Nyonya bak zhang too. I love the Nyonya and Salty ones!! Mini ones at $1.50, regular ones at $4.50. Fillings gao gao. Support local, you can even use Kris+, by Singapore airlines to make payment 😂

Craving for Nonya Kueh, this is one of stalls is recommended online. But the taste was not up to my expectations.

During Covid, I ordered the Bak Zhang via delivery. The glutinous rice was undercooked, so the dumpling were unpalatable. I do not have this issue when I buy the Bak Zhang from the shop. I like to eat Kim Choo Bak Zhang.

Was gifted this by a friend and when I know it’s from Kim Choo, you enjoy every moment because you know there’s a bit of heritage, history, heirloom you are experiencing.

The glutinous rice layer breaks apart softly to reveal the filling with anticipation. One mouthful and you experience an alternating taste of sweet and savoury of the chinese five spice powder and lean pork.

There will be newer flavours; more exotic proteins; colours - and yes that should be the way.

But I take comfort that there is a homely version we can all return to.

‘Kim’ me the zhang cos I ‘Choo’ the original anytime.

Having bought from KCKC for years, it’s generally has been ok to good but never quite hitting the 5 stars mark. Perhaps it’s because they spread their products to include obvious 3rd party suppliers. So today we decide to try 1 items. fish cracker  has more flour than fish having eaten this snacks from across Indonesia, Malaysia and Singapore. it’s also over fried.   Lastly they only accept purchases over $15 if you wish to pay cashless or card or swipe.

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
Wanted eat Penang fried kway teow but sold out at 730pm . Went for the clay pot rice which was ok. My wife went for ban mian as mee hoon kway also sold out..Shouldn't such places cater for enough items if they want to do business... A go to place if you want a quick and fuss free meal.

My personal review, Malaysia Chiak stall at Singpost generally offers Penang fried kuey teow, a popular Malaysian dish. The overall experience at the stall may vary, but based on customer feedback, the taste and quality of their Penang fried kuey teow is usually average. It's always best to try it for yourself and form your own opinion based on your personal taste preferences.

Overall I feel it’s extremely value for money at $5.50. You get claypot chicken rice with a decent amount of chicken. The rice has a good char and there are tiny bits of salted fish. I think many people give flak about the minimal service but the price reflects the service. It’s one of the cheapest full meals you get in the mall anyways. Not the best claypot rice in SG but definitely above average.

Chilli is definitely very good tho. It’s like chicken rice chili but spicier.

Used to be good when it first started. Food quality and service have deteriorated over time. Recently did take away and the queue system was horrible, its disorganised and staffs are angsty with the need to order and cook... Ended up they did not separate the noodle and it was all soggy...there goes my lunch

We’ve always liked this place - primarily the Penang fried kway Teow; carrot cake (which I think they have stopped); and the prawn noodles.
The fried kway Teow is about just nice - dry fried, not overly oily;
Next to try is the claypot- looks good and reasonable price.

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
Large variety of halal food. Great choices with authentic Muslim cuisine. Out of curiosity, tried the dry lontong which is quite good, something different. Reasonably priced.

Iconic market in the East... has 2 levels comprising the market and sundry stalls on the Ground level  offering a myriad  of grocery and  market items,  and Hawker dining and retail stalls offering apparel and household items on the Second level. Very crowded especially on weekends. Time for a major renovation to the market area and hawker dining area as it's very congested. A few hawker stalls on the 2nd level are "Legacy Hawkers" having existed in the old Geylang Serai Market 50 years ago or more.

Yesterday at Geylang Serai, saw charming  44 to 60 Changi Road, mixed commercial and residential shophouse enclave with a post-World War charm. Time seems to stand still here, offering a serene escape from the bustling cityscape. The slow pace of life allows visitors to immerse themselves in the traditional Malay culture and food that permeates the area. From the tantalizing aromas of Malay cuisine to the enchanting sounds of traditional music, Geylang Serai offers a nostalgic retreat, capturing the essence of a bygone era.

At Geylang Market, you can get almost everything down here. Now under this one stop roof, you can get food, marketing groceries, apparel, fruits & authentic traditional jamu also. Do spent time to wonder around this market be it at level 1 & 2.

Clean, spacious and airy (thanks to the high ceiling) hawker centre with many food stalls. Good for locals and tourists alike.

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
Ridiculous attitude. We requested to sit outside and she raised her voice at us “ORDER FIRST HERE!”. We proceed to order and took our seats. We wanted to add tau kee in our soup so we went back to the counter and it was $6.50?! Then we asked if we added in initially how much will it be? She said $1.50 and she can’t sell it at $1.50 anymore. Okay fine. We asked to add soup, she gave us extra soup in a small bowl and literally just slammed it on our table! Goodness. And there were SO MANY cockroaches around it was super disgusting! Small ones big ones EVERYWHERE! NEVER AGAIN will I ever come back here. First and last time. Food is so-so, just edible. Soup taste has super strong star anise taste and that’s about it. Nothing else. Not tasty.

This malaysia styled bkt is the kind that I prefer, rather than Singapore's peppery kind. Ordered the mix soup which was not overpowering with herbs. Mixed intestines and parts were generous enough, and I like that the ribs are of smaller sizes that just falls off the bone and easy to eat. Despite eating at peak lunch hours, I hardly perspired. Price is reasonable and they accept visa which is a plus. Will try the dry version in the next visit

One of the best bkt!!! Love the soup and the chilli with garlic, so malaysia style. They allow refill of soup only once! The green vegetables so sweet and crunchy.
They have other food like frog porridge, small side dishes if you don’t like the ribs.

nice Bak Kut teh with herbal flavour.
The mutton soup is also good, mutton meet is very tender.
crispy intestine is very unique with the spring onion inside. good texture.
Friendly staff.

Herbal style Bah Ku Teh (pork ribs and organ soup). Youtiao are soggy. We tried signature bah ku teh soup and dry versions and they are nice. We didn’t enjoy the organs. You can also have frog dishes with porridge. A bit pricier in my view. The shop can be improved in many ways.

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
Went the the outlet at Geylang Serai. We were a bit confused initially as there were 2 entrances/exits. Recommended to split up such that some look for seats and some queue to order as the queue was rather long. Food wise, it is definitely worth the trip down. It was affordable, delicious and the service was great despite the crowd. There were 2 staff at the cashier who will help you to bring the food to your seats. We will definitely return to try other dishes on the menu!

Often crowded. Today I went first thing in morning oh mine the nasi is 5 stars. I know breakfast i heavy… they have the best beef rendang,  Teh Tarik is not too sweet and polite staffs. I will definitely visit again soon!!

Snaking long queues for the food with a little madness for weekend ordering, ample seating on 2nd floor. Had the tauhu telur, sotong, Ayam baker, sambal goreng. Hits all the right spots for comfort food for Singaporeans. Efficient service.

Probably one of the best legendary Nasi Padang Restaurant in Singapore! Visited during lunchtime put me in a long queue. There are many options of Indonesian and Malaysian food. Delicious and big portion.

One of the best Nasi Padang restaurants in Singapore. A plethora of dishes on offer, so best to come in a bigger group so that you can share more. Personal favourites include the ayam rendang, sambal sotong and tahu telor. Only downside is the cost as it’s slightly pricier compared to other establishments.

ILunch Malay Fusion Food

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
This is one of my frequently visited food centre and I have never really noticed this stall until today. Being a nasi lemak lover, the nasi lemak appealed to me immediately. Not only that it looks good, it taste even better - warm and fragrant coconut infused rice, fluffy fried egg, very crispy ikan bilis, and fried chicken wings that is aromatic and crispy. The chilli is perfect which is both sweet and spicy. It’s so satisfying.

Sedap! One of the few authentic Malay cuisine stalls in this market selling Malay Kueh & traditional menu, like Mee Soto, Mee Siam, Lotong & etc. Serving breakfast & early lunch only. Irregular off day. Unpredictable mood. Occasionally "angin", but most of the time friendly. Highly recommended!

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
Food was served promptly despite us ordering quite a variety of food. There is a crab promotion that is going on. However,
It’s kind of obvious that the crabs are not really that fresh, hence the pricing. Other dishes were quite tasty and value of money. The Kai lan vegetables were very tasty, a must order dish in my opinion. Barley tasted too sweet.

It is ideally situated close to the Aljunied MRT. You can choose between outdoor and air-conditioned sitting.

On various days, there are special promotions. They had $15 soon hock fish and $45 volcano chicken on Monday and Tuesday, respectively. For specials, give the restaurant a call before you visit.

It's a manual reservation, and you should ask the restaurant to text you a confirmation in case they accidentally forget your booking

A good location for gatherings of friends and family.

Food was generally good. The salted egg squid was excellent -- squid cooked to perfection and we actually tasted the salted egg! The pork belly was also very good -- flavorful and crispy-tender. Wasn't a fan of the crispy noodles, though. If you order that, ask if you can have the sauce separate so the noodles stay crispy. Also, one of the waiters threw a tantrum while we were there.

I brought my wife for a good meal in Singapore and notice this simple restaurant along the street when I drive . Penang Seafood ...and we drop by for the seafood ..to our suprise that there had been a promotion to the crab . Price so worth for it. At $68 for 2 crabs.  Simply look at the size of the crab.....and it just so delicious 🤤

All the dishes we picked were really good. Especially the spicy bee Hoon and baby squid garlic. They only take reservations for 6 pax and above. For small group walk-ins, come earlier at 6pm. Wait staff are friendly. Open-air Carpark opposite MRT and walk over. Spent sg$107 for 2 carbs, 3 dishes and 4 drinks, great pricing!

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
Makcik was super friendly. Tried their Gandos Kelapa & Gandos Ubi, as well as Agar-Agar. Surely will come again.

One of the better Gado Gado around.
Tasty, with a generous serving of peanut gravy. Definitely a must try.

Tried this agar agar gudil. So niceeeee! Raw sugar coconut jelly.

They have good gado gado

yummy

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
Ordered all their different variations : belly pork $1.40. Pork, chicken and mutton 70 cents each and rice cakes (ketupat) 70 cents. Do note Chinese satay doesn't have beef skewers. All skewers were grilled to perfect tenderness. Marinade was a good balance or sweet & savory complimented by the peanut dipping sauce. 👍

Maybe it’s just my luck that my order of delivered satay tasted like overnight food because I certainly won’t recommend it. I know my photos made them look pretty good but both the mutton and pork texture were dry and absolutely does not represent what good satay is suppose to be. And the Banana Leaf Otah is unusually small for a “Banana Leaf” type otah. It’s not the usual size you and I are familiar with. It’s so small it’s the size of a normal otah or perhaps even smaller. Moreover it did not taste good at all. It tasted flat and like overnight food as well. The chicken wings, although damn skinny, was their saving grace. At least the wings and chilli sauce tasted quite nice. Satay sauce also not bad. But this will be my first and my last time. This place is not for me.

Order the Pork Belly satay and don’t bother about the rest.
Simply because the pork belly was so good that the usually pork and chicken pale in comparison 😊

I will let the photo speak for itself.

We ordered 10 sticks of chicken satay and all 10 were puny pieces of skewered meat. Behold, each stick actually costs 70 cents!

Satay was well marinated and cuts of meat good sized. The pork belly satay was good! every thou the price is double of the normal pork satay, you do get double the portion as well, so it works out to be the same price. Their prices are really reasonable considering the most satay sellers are asking $0.70 to $0.80 per stick now they are still at $0.60.

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
It’s very disappointed as I bring my friend from Malaysia just to came here taste this beef halal Bak Kut Teh. Open half shutter and i ask other hawker they also say not sure open or not. I arrive at 11:30am and google say open at 12pm-7pm.  Waited almost 2 hour. Decided to eat briyani at other hawker and wow! its amazing

Love it! A different twist to Malaysian’s halal wantan mee. The beef kut teh is delish! Just be careful of the mala pepper in the soup or you’ll numb your tongue biting it.

The halal bakuteh was quite different from the usual. This was more on the peppery side. Lots of Big black pepper was inside so be careful when eating.

The beef was tender and flavourful but also loaded with fats on many of the chunks. If that is a concern to you.. flavour wise it’s wholesome almost identical to mutton soup.

Overall can eat again if you have the feels. Customer service very good. I was carrying a baby and the staff brought the dish to my table.

It’s my first time trying Bak Kut Teh (don’t worry it’s Halal version). To be honest as a muslim I don’t have the comparison with the real Bak Kut Teh but this one taste good and can smell the spice so nice. Worth to try😄

Came down on Monday at 5pm plus to try their halal Bak Kut Teh but no longer serving food. Google map state that its open from 10am to 7pm. Should’ve change the timing. Disappointed and waste of time.

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
Had the sarawak laksa, kolo mee, lu rou, and mani cai with egg. All definitely have authentic flavors but might be a tiny bit different. The soup for the sarawak laksa is a bit thick. Overall a great option if you are missing the food back in East malaysia!

I had:
1. Kolo mee
2. Sarawak laksa
3. Tomato crispy noodle
4. Money cai longevity noodles
5. Kacangma chicken

Personally I will recommend to try the kolo mee and sarawak laksa. I do have friends recommend the tomato noodles.

#2nd review# (a year later)
The Sarawak laksa is still very good. The broth, the sliced omelette, and even the prawn paste on the side - I highly recommend it.

I also had stir-fried money cai with egg, which is off-menu. It's decent too.

Rare find of Sarawak food place that is selling other than kolo mee and the laksa. Decided to try tomato crispy noodle and it was really good! The tomato gravy is quite tangy and it came with 2 decently sized prawns and some fishcake. The good thing is that they serve free flow pork lard. Friendly staff too.
On other occasion, tried the mei cai longevity noodle and kolo mee. The mei cai noodle came with crispy bits of fried prawn, stir fried egg and veggie. Taste is quite mild and comfortable with good portion. Kolo mee noodle is quite QQ and came with quite generous portion too but unfortunately the char siew was finished. Enjoyed the food here!

The mee suah wz vege is too dry and no taste at all. The noodles also not near to
original taste n served wz green chilli instead of red .

Very interesting East Malaysian food and I enjoyed every meal. There were 6 of us and owner suggested a good variety of the local delicacy.

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews: The lontong is good, it is above average in Singapore. The portion and price is okay too.

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.name: AlRahman Kitchen

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
Food was okay, not too bad. Price was actually okay for buffet style for 2 hours. Quite a few variety of food and drinks, even have ice cream, chips and alcohol sold separately. Service was good just that the place was a bit warm and when you leave you will definitely have BBQ smell on you. Overall not too bad.

Newly renovated! Is so much nicer now and the owner is really friendly. As usual the satay sauce is really good with the lok lok.
You can have best of 3 worlds here. Boil, fry and deep fry and I feel is worth the money!

Friendly staff. Great food. Free snacks while waiting for my food. The next table bak kut the smells delicious 😋

Good quality is actually quite decent considering the price you pay. Had the buffet which have 3 types of cooking style. You can choose to have it grilled, boiled (lok lok, many soup base to choose from) or fried. You do the boiling and grilling yourself, the kitchen will do the frying for you.

Free flow of soft drinks and ice cream is included.

Staff are friendly.

Tried the KL Hokkien mee and Penang Char kuey teow. They charge a 10% service charge but service can be a little slow.

CKT is not bad, but no wok hey.

Hokkien mee has a lot of pork lard, but it’s too sweet, not fragrant and no wok hey.

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
Long q but moved fast. Many food on menu. We ordered the lontong and bee hoon soto at $3.50 each. Portion is big and delicious

Joined one of the longest queue at the geylang serai. Tried the malay staple, mee rubus and mee soto. Good but nothing spectacular.

Ordered the laksa Johor. Gravy was authentic, delicious & thick. Though there were no fishcake slices, julienned laksa leaves & slithers of cucumber served on top of the laksa. Basically, it's SGD3.50 for a plate of laksa gravy poured over white, fat & cylindrical rice noodles (which stuck together & made eating them quite unpleasant & inconvenient), with no added protein or vegetable values. For that price, I think it's quite expensive for a serving plate of "just carbohydrates".

One of the best breakfast to go stall here.

This place serves amazing bowls of laksa. Thick rice noodles swimming in savoury and mildly spicy coconut gravy. There are so many layers of flavours in this dish that to describe it in words is not justified. It is heaven in a bowl. Highly highly recommended!
Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.opening_hours:

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.name: Warong Solo

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
Nice texture. Very delicious with a balanced blend of gravy and noodles. Not too thick and not too watery.

This stall is operated by a husband and wife team (William and Mei Ling)

It serves a very good lontong, full of vegetables (cabbage and long bean), come with one hard boiled egg and a fried tau kwa (half slice). The soup is rich with coconut milk and lots of dried shrimps, really delicious. The Chilli Paste is spicy and very flavorful. Price is reasonable at $4.00 per serving.

As I was sitting right in front of the stall today, I overheard that the lontong was sold out - that was 9:35am!

The stall serves very nice mee rebus as well. Stall lady (Mei Ling - Indonesian Chinese from Medan) told me she would recommend me to add her special Perkedel if I was ordering the Mee Rebus or Mee Siam.

Delicious Indo style mee rebus, lotong & mee siam run by an Indonesian family.

Love the broth and the fried potato. Pardon my photo and do not be fooled by the plain looking bowl of noodles as i asked for no tau ghey and no spring onion.
Chilli is spicy though.

Their curry/ sardines puffs is worth waking up early in the morning to get. Mee Soto and Mee rebus is also one of the best I have eaten in SG!

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.name: Indonesian Food House

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
There is a fantastic ayam penyet here, probably one of the best I've ever had. The chicken is moist and crunchy, and the sambal is extremely flavorful.

There is also a putu piring stall that is very much worth queuing for!

I have no issue with the food choices here but the chairs are not good for big sized people. Too soft that the moment I sit, I can feel the legs start to spread. Sometimes I have to put an extra chair to make it sturdy. Can the management change the chairs, please?

One of the best Malay snacks around. Their epok epok are damn shiok. Jack fruit fritters also shiok. Same quality but cheaper than their T3 branch.

Whenever I am within the Geylang Serai area, Mr. Teh Tarik is one of my favorite places to go.

We went there to get our Hokkien mee and fried Kway Teow for lunch. It is near the entrance just beside the pisang goreng stall.

As always, the 2 dishes we ordered are Hokkien mee and fried kway teow. Ironically, although the menu is Chinese but the cook is of Indian heritage and he cooks it perfectly and fast too. You don't have to wait long to get your food.

The Hokkien mee was flavourful and not too soggy. Fresh prawns and ingredients. The Fried Kway Teow with clams is spot on too. The "char" taste is present with the right amount of sweet dark sauce.

Then coupled with teh tarik to end your meal is so blissfully satisfying. Give it a try if you are nearby.

Warung Syuhadah nasi lemak and nasi rawon taste wasn't nice. All 4 of my family agreed. Chicken was so dry and hard. Begedil was very very oily too.
Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.opening_hours:
Monday: Open 24 hours
Tuesday: Open 24 hours
Wednesday: Open 24 hours
Thursday: Open 24 hours
Friday: Open 24 hours
Saturday: Open 24 hours
Sunday: Open 24 hours
Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.name: Mr Teh Tarik Eating House

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
Highly recommend this Indian Rojak stall, sauce is rich and tasty. Tastes even better after a short while in the oven!

This was our favorite dish at Geylang Serai after trying many stalls. What a wonderful combination of unique flavors. I will dream about this! And the people working were so kind to explain everything to us. Can’t wait to go back!

First time here, not sure is it good
Had craving for indian rojak...
And this is the only store selling that.
Picked my food, they chop it up then done...
I was shocked... never re-fry?
Then how to be crispy...
But it was soooooo goood.
Its flavourful and crispy for some items..
Sauce is very old school taste...
I love it!
Will be back...

Saw a long queue during lunch and decided to join. The rojak is ok, many choices to pick, I like that they have tempeh and fried tau kwa, which are my favourites. The deep fried stuff does not taste oily. The dipping sauce was light, on the sweet side and complements the rojak well. Overall it was a nice first try for me and I may patronise the stall again if I dream of eating indian rojak.

An interesting experience. Lots of locals come for authentic rojak. Love some of the stuff (fried fish cakes etc) while some might be just too salty for my taste (animal liver)The secret sauce is flavorful- makes all the difference.
Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.opening_hours:
Monday: Closed

Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM

Sunday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM
Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.name: Rojak & Mee Siam

Malaysian cuisine in Geylang.reviews:
Very competitive stall in Geylang Serai Hawker Centre.

Many stall selling Nasi Padang in this malay based hawker centre. Most of them are doing well, good flavor and charging was high too.

For this stall, the quality of Malay dishes was good, full of flavor with variety of choices.

I brought a take away Nasi Padang which consists of 2 vegetables and 1 chicken thighs meat. Cost me $7. Which is usually $5.50 to $6 before covid.

Very understand that the food cost nowadays is increasing tremendously. But I still feel the increase is way too high, perhaps $6.50 is more reasonable.

Beside that, I must say that their service attitude was good, polite and patient when selecting your dishes from many they had offered.

Overall, I  pleased by their great taste of food they offered, definitely I will come back again but probably not so often due to the high cost of food.

Had Nasi Rawon for takeaway and I must say that the rawon is lacking of the real gravy of buah keluak. Tasted more on turmeric. Begedil & paru are coated with batter which frankly there's no need to. Sambal belacan is 💯

I've had better rawon elsewhere just that this stall have to give a miss.

Best. Sedap. But like most place all food price went up.

Great food! The nangka vege and kupang is outstanding. Better value than Sinar Pagi. Thoroughly enjoyed both the rendang and ayam lemak as well.

I usually not like this,but it is too much.Bought nasi padang at this shop this morning (21 October 2022). Rending is abit chewy. Telur Burung tasted sweet. Sambal is bland.no taste .it's like having a covid symptoms. Best part is,the WHOLE FOOD BASI(STALE). my mum is the type of person whom doesn't like to waste food even though it is going to be fatal. Price was charged $7.80. I hope my mum won't have stomach problem. Wanna do business,do it professionally.  Don't start later on by saying, "melayu gini,suka dengki sama melayu..please do the right way..  1/100.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
There are hardly any Nasi Padang options in Novena. Hence, I’m glad to discover this stall in the cafeteria of Revenue House. Food quality is surprisingly good - I had the beef rendang, fried tempeh, otah, asam pedas gravy on the rice. Don’t expect ambience or service quality here, it’s a very busy lunchtime crowd and Makcik prefers transactions to be quick and quiet. If you want to know any item prices, just refer to the display board which is fairly accurate.

Tasty Nasi Padang and Malay food

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Delighted to dine here today.  Authentic Indonesian food by three young Indonesian sisters who learnt the cuisine from their mom.  Their focus is on delivering quality creative and flavourful Indonesian dishes.  Portion is quite good.  Nice simple cosy cafe in the heartland with limited seating capacity.  Good to make reservations during peak time.  Hope to try more dishes next time!

Very authentic Indonesian food.

I ordered the oxtail soup and the grilled chicken.

The oxtail was so fall off the bone tender and bustling with amazing flavours.

The grilled chicken was very well grilled with a nice caramelized finish.

Loved the chilli paste that came with the dishes. Rustic that comes with a punch.

Will definitely be back for my Indonesian food fix!

Keep up the good work!

This is my first time trying fried oxtail, I liked the juiciness of meat with a hint of salt. The traditional oxtail soup feels healthy without the overwhelming strong flavour compared to the others that I tried.
A must-try is their signature ginger drink! Not spicy and smells so fragrant!!!

I enjoyed the quiet ambience and the pleasant service. Gonna bring my whole family here the next time!

Great location with a multi storey carpark just beside the restaurant. Staff are very friendly and great with recommendations. Food comes freshly prepared and the sauce on the chicken was very flavorful and the soups they gave with each dish are also worthy as dishes themselves. They have quite a few oxtail options and those are definitely worth a try also.

Went here on a Monday afternoon. Restaurant was very quiet. We ordered fried oxtail with rice, fried chicken with rice, corn fritters, ginger drink and rose drink (bandung). Oxtail was well-cooked but tasted a bit salty. Fried chicken was nicely cooked. I liked their new item, the corn fritters. Ginger drink was nice but could have been more flavourful. We liked the ambience but would have liked items to be more affordable. Place was also very stylish and posh looking but our cutlery kept making loud noises as we ate. Nice place to go once in a while.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Quite a wide range of dishes on the menu. Rendang was lean, and hence tougher than expected  though the taste was great. Gado Gado and tahu telur were pleasant, though the peanuts used in Gado Gado wasn't the most fresh tasting. Chicken satay was tender and not overgrilled, peanut sauce was good. Ikan pepes was nicely done. The yellow rice was fluffy, with long grains separating nicely. Overall, they seemed a bit short of staff. Sambal was good.

Jay and Chris,

I wanted to express our sincere gratitude for the delightful meal we enjoyed as a family from Tambuah Mas. The flavors were exceptional, and every dish surpassed our expectations, making it a truly memorable dining experience.

Your dedication to providing outstanding service shines through, even in a takeaway setting. It's evident that Tambuah Mas takes pride in ensuring that each customer, whether dining in or enjoying a meal at home, receives a culinary delight.

Our family thoroughly enjoyed every bite, and I can assure you that we'll be singing Tambuah Mas's praises to family and friends

Thank you both  and team  for consistently delivering excellence and for making our family meal so enjoyable.

Best Regards,

Mohd Hanafiah

Food was moderate. The food wasn’t serve hot and the taste was okay. Felt really bloated after eating, immediately I knew food was prepared way earlier and not freshly cooked and serve. I have very sensitive gastric. To go back or not? Nah.

This is not the first time we dine at Tambuah Mas.  The food is good, quite authentic.  Service is not the best, probably due to shortage of staff and poor training.

The experience from making reservation to dining was excellent. They were accommodating to our big group and the service during the dining pleasant. Food was good as usual. Highlight is the deep fried fish which was fresh and crispy. The beef rendang was a bit dry compared to what I had at the Tanglin Shopping Centre branch. But overall the food and service did not disappoint and we all enjoyed our dinner.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Been here twice so far.

Expect to pay at least $8.50 for 2 veggies and 1 meat (at the time of review).

Food is decent taste-wise.

But whether it is worth the above-average cost, I will leave it to the reader.

Personally for me, I rate it as 4/5 overall.

Centrally located, Warung M Nasir is within walking distance from Somerset MRT. Food turned out DELICIOUS and surprisingly even the teh bing is yummy. Highly recommend this place to everyone! I only have two points for improvement to raise. The tahu telor was super salty. Skip this dish please. Also, unsure why the lighting was crazy dim. I could barely see what I was eating. Please turn up the lights! It didnt help the ambience, trust me. But overall, a wonderful meal.

Tasted wee bit on the sweet side otherwise ok.  Quality if rice bit too broken.  Lopez not bad teh tarik too dilute.  Pricing ok.

Love the chicken rendang and sambal brinjal. The chicken rendang is rich in flavour and will give you the mmmmm factor!!  Beef rendang is also a favourite here though, I didn't order it.  For drinks, just order the teh botol.

The perks of eating here are no queues to wait in, and a fairly comfortable seating atmosphere, however, the food isn’t as good as the ones on north bridge rd. The gravies and dishes fall short of a real oomph and flavor. Ok for a quick meal if in the area but I’d rather opt for the real deal elsewhere.
