Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
A gem that located at 2nd floor of Lucky Plaza. It's Indonesian kind of stall (depot makan). Couple times we tried their food and we found that their ayam geprek with sambal bali / matah is the must have item when you're here. The price was justify the taste and amount of the food.

Their fried boneless chicken was nice, the fragant rice and everything was in generous portion. We tried their other sambal but nothing can beat their sambal bali, the rice vermicelli toward hot & strong white pepper-y smell and taste.

One of the same staffs couple times looked so unfriendly, maybe too tired after working long hour but wore a mask still couldn't hide the look. Since the person's working in service industry he needs to spread the joy, welcoming spirit and friendliness.

Since their sweet martabak is really sought after, it's better for you to order the sweet martabak in advance as they have a limited slot in a day.

They have launched a new menu in their new outlet and boy it was so good!

I tried the Soto Betawi, which is a hearty beef soup simmered in a coconut milk based broth. Its light on the palate, not thick and the umami, they nailed it!

One of my new favorite Indonesian food eatery! I was so glad when I found out that I could order via whatsapp and arranged my own courier because I stay in the east and rarely got the chance to go Orchard. Tried almost everything in their menu and none was ever disappointing.

My favorites are soto betawi, ayam geprek, batagor and tempe bacem. My hubby and I are tempeh (soybean cake) lovers, so we love to try tempeh dishes every chance we got, and we never find tempeh bacem (seasoned tempeh) anymore in Singapore after the last eatery that had it closed down long ago. We were elated that Gading have it, and it was very very delicious! Sadly it was unavailable this time around, but it definitely become our must order dish. The ayam geprek is tender, generous portion and great with any kind of sambal, have tried the sambal mercon, kemangi and bali - all were amazingly good with different levels of spiciness. The soto betawi soup is so rich I always finish it till the last drop. And the batagor taste authentic and very nice, just that the portion is a bit small for its price.

Tried the martabak in two separate occasions, black charcoal (chocolate and cheese with charcoal dough) and classic (chocolate, cheese, peanuts). Had the classic one with add-on wijsman dutch butter at additional $4 and no peanuts. Both were amazing! Adding wijsman butter just made it even more delicious, the extra cost was a tad pricey though, maybe I’d say it’s worth it if it were $3 price point.

Overall, Gading offers great Indonesian food that I will definitely love to order again and again.

I was walking around 313@somerset when I saw this little shop at the basement. I was quite excited to see they are selling martabak (basically Indonesian version of pancake/min Jiang kueh that is more decadent and unhealthy). My normal go-to for martabak is pancake boss at Bugis so decided to give this one a try.

I ordered the original and top up $4 for wijsman butter. Total damage is $19.90. A bit on the pricy side when compared to pancake boss. The martabak can easily feed 2-3 people (better to share due to high calories).

The martabak is delicious, sweet and a little salty from the cheese. They use good quality chocolate rice (much better than the one used by pancake boss).

Nice to see more martabak shops in SG (there is another martabak shop in ION Orchard but I have not tried it).

Overall, I highly recommend this shop for your martabak fix.

Give it 5 stars as the main course were so delicious. The ikan Bakar is nicely done with the kicap manis sauce. Ayam penyet is soft and tasty. Thank for serving us diff sambal as requested. We also ordered original martabak in advanced but the filling still abit bland.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
I like Bumbu restaurant’s interior design, is unique and Peranakan decorating. Foods are nice and mouthwatering. I would recommend chili prawns, the gravy is flavourful. I will definitely come back to try other dishes! This place is suitable for company, family and friends gathering, why not?? There have set up the beautiful partition so it gives us privacy when dining.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Bumbu Restaurant in the Arab/Muslim neighborhood of Singapore, and it was a unique experience. The restaurant’s decor is a refreshing blend of Thai and Indonesian antiques, which added a distinctive touch to the ambiance.

The food at Bumbu is a fusion of Thai and Indonesian flavors, which made for an interesting culinary journey. I ordered the Tom Kha soup, which was incredibly flavorful and packed with chicken. I also tried the Thai-style chili basil, although it was a bit on the salty side. The olive fried rice was a delightful addition to the meal.

One of the standout aspects of Bumbu was their excellent service. The staff was friendly and attentive, which enhanced the overall dining experience.

In conclusion, Bumbu Restaurant is definitely worth a visit if you’re looking for a unique blend of Thai and Indonesian flavors in a beautifully decorated setting. I had a great time, and I believe you will too!

Love the ambience and the decoration.

Beef rendang is good, very tender and flavourful. Fried kangkong is interesting, paired well with the sauce that is slightly spicy and tangy. Telur tahu is nice. Must try the sambal (caution, 🔥).

I found the durian chendol too thick (coconut cream) for my liking.

Had a great experience here this evening! First time here and was impressed with the service and food quality. While the portions seemed a bit small, it allowed for us to order more variety! We tried the chicken buah keluak (love the spoons that came with the dish to help with the nut!), signature rendang, chap Chye, prawn egg, fish maw soup, and ended off with chendol! Everything tasted very authentic! We really enjoyed the sambal belachan too, which was complimentary! Will be back again to try more dishes in future! Service was excellent, and the interior was beautiful!

Not much food pictures because too tasty and hungry to eat immediately. 😂
Jokes aside I appreciate their innovation and effort to making their dishes as they planned to taste as possible. I would say their dishes has many influences from Chinese, Malaysia, Indonesia, even Thailand. Very innovative. Their interior aesthetics were so picture worthy.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Sambal Petai King is to die for, it's so good you can just eat with plain white rice. Char Kway Teow is a chef's kiss, I'm not exaggerating, try it for yourself. Sambal fish is so-so,abit sweet ,not to my liking . Nasi Padang also not bad, consist of what I think is vegetarian chicken rendang,soy tofu,vege lemak lodeh and sambal egg belado.Orh luak with oyster mushroom is also good, not oily at all , taste on point , actually better than the real thing.Bak mie is tasty,noodle springy,mock shredded chicken is unnecessary,the fried wonton is good though,I settle with level 1 spiciness which to me is pretty hot. Satay is so-so,don't really taste like the real thing, tasted like regular deep fried mock meat, satay sauce can't mask save it either.
Service is super fast, 5 different person served us, all are very warm, friendly and are always smiling. Even though we came just 30 mins before their break time which is at 3pm.We feel welcomed!

My first on an Indonesian take of vegetarian fare, as strongly insisted by the friend as a counter-proposal to my initial spot for vegetarian food. Small and cozy restaurant along the ground floor close to the entrance. Great spread of Indonesian food in vegetarian version if you are game for it.

Place is cooling, sheltered, and very accessible from the MRT.

I had a wonderful experience at Warong Ijo!

This new outlet is located conveniently near the MRT making it more accessible.

The vegetarian dishes they offer are simply amazing – full of flavor and beautifully presented. The friendly staff made my visit even more enjoyable. It's not often you find a place that caters so well to vegetarians while providing top-notch service. I highly recommend trying their delicious dishes and soaking in the welcoming atmosphere.

We have never tasted Indonesian vegetarian, find the dishes not bad but nothing special. We ordered the Rendang fried rice, sanbal sweet potato leaves, otahs and gardo gardo. Find it pricey n felt the portion were not justified, especially the gardo gardo.

Very happy to come across this vegetarian restaurant!

All the dishes we had were full of flavors yet not too salty. I particularly like Orh Luak (oyster mushroom omelette), Lumpiah Goreng (spring rolls), and stir fried spinach.

Rendang lion mane mushroom was quite spicy and oily.

Saturday dinner was very busy. A very lively place.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Must try the specialty chicken and fried tofu here, damn good. Pig liver kailan was tasty too, cook to perfection and the sauce is just so savoury that it’s perfect with the rice. Lastly we had the chicken feet with a Thai spicy sauce. Apparently this is a new appetiser and not every time has this dish. Very 开胃, sweet and sour. The chicken feet is deboned so very chewy and easy to eat. Staffs was nice too, very friendly and attentive to our needs. We ordered all this with 4 rice, 4 drinks and even takeaway 2 more packs of chicken rice, total with gst about $120. Quite worth it for the quality of food. Their specialty always never disappoints me. Highly recommended if u wanna try Chinese cuisine

Frequented this place for the past 10 years. Taste deteriorate compare to years ago. The fried hor fun no longer have the wok hey. Steam chicken still good as per usual apart from more oily. The pork belly have more fats than meat. One thing good is the service have improved compare to the past. Avoid lunch hour as place is crowded. But too little people then the aircon is not on for all. Need to request for them to on.

Very nice chicken rice, better than the opposite Loy Kee. The price is more to a high price but they use kampong chicken.

A must visit for tourist

Great Chicken Rice with the "olden day taste" and the other dishes such as the Lotus Root Soup, Fried Beancurd, Stuffed Meat Beancurd and the Eggs Fried Prawns.

Oh ya Boon Tong Kee i left my powerbank yesterday! Please help me keep leh. Thank you 😅😅😅

Very good white chicken, we ordered chicken for 2 pax portion with a sambal kangkong.

It is quite crowded during peak hours but we didn't have to wait too long before our seats.

Chicken is perfect with their soy sauce, and goes well with their fragrant rice. Honestly 1 bowl isn't enough due to how tasty it is but the price point is abit of the higher end.

Sambal kangkong was delicious which I suspect was cooked with abit of the chicken broth or essence on top of the usual sambal - an unique taste if you want something new but tasty!

Overall a decent 5 star for the price.
P.s. please ask the staff to debone your chicken otherwise you get more bones than meat..
Indonesian dining options in Balestier.name: Boon Tong Kee Restaurant

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Finally dared to try this Penyet place as 1)it's usually quite empty, and 2)we haven't really felt up to eating a boatload of fried stuff in one sitting. Turns out, it's surprisingly good!

The Tahu Telor is a must-try for all! It's so difficult to get this dish nowadays at your neighbourhood hawker as it's quite labour intensive to make. Soft tofu cubes are deliciously coated in a big mound of egg, the tastiest parts being the flossy burnt ends. Add in a generous heaping of beansprouts, julienned cucumbers and carrots in tangy kicap Manis sauce. The peanut gravy was served separately, so that you can control the amount of sauce/ sweetness you want in your dish. We usually cannot finish a Tauhu Telor but as this didn't feel as oily and heavy, finishing it was a breeze. There wasn't a lot of oil leftover on the plate either.

The Sour Vegetable Soup is good as an appetizer or palate cleanser between heavy dishes. Cabbages, long beans, turnips and peanuts were simmered in a sweet-sour broth with flavours of tamarind, galangal, turmeric and shallots. It was refreshing but I found the peanuts undercooked and rather crunchy. Not sure whether I love or hate nuts done as such.

The Fried Pomfret was quite basic, it was lightly battered in some turmeric cornstarch and served with Spice Level 5 Fiery Chili. This dark coloured Chili gives quite a good punch unblocking my blocked nose but it was not strong enough to mask the fishiness of the fish. I felt that the pomfret was not super fresh as I could taste some staleness near its belly portion.

Lastly, we had the Mozzarella Smashed Chicken cutlet. The chicken meat was really tender and not dry at all, the bits of flour coating hanging on it was flavourfully soaked with mozzarella cheese, which was thrown atop the chicken and lightly torched before serving. We chose a Level 1 Sweet Chili to be served with it. This Chili is great for beginning spice eaters as it's super smooth and sweet with an oniony taste.

The smashed fried duck really came off easily when poked with a fork, we tried the Level 3 Shrimp Paste chili with it and the pairing turned out heavenly. I found the Level 3 chili a little sweeter than expected but it was well received by the others.

The Honey Marinated Beef Ribs were also thoroughly pre-simmered to achieve tenderness, although meat grain was slightly stringy and tough, the sweet kicap manis marinade made the dish whets up a good appetite and made it easier to swallow. The Level 2 Green Chili was one of the least sweet chili, with aromatic notes of coriander and green pepper.

The Teh Tarik Kosong Ice is really rich and good. It was full bodied with vanilla notes with a rich, milky mouthfeel.
It's a nice place to overindulge and grab a deep fried dinner. Cleanliness of the place could be improved. There were strands of hair and bits of batter on the benches we chose.

Will revisit to try more dishes!

Total damage: $37-42 for 3 pax

Yummy Indonesian food.  Surprisingly good.  The chilli has up to 7 levels to be selected.

We ordered Ayam Bakar Taliwang Kampung (S$14.50), Iga Bakar (beef) (S$14.50), and Tahu Telor (S$8.50).  We opted for level 3 chilli which was spicy and good enough for our liking.

Will definitely return for other food.

Update as of 28 Oct 2022:
Tried the fried chicken, gado gado and my favourite tahu telor.  The chicken was nice.  As for the gado gado, it was just ok as it had the same gravy/sauce as tahu telor.

Portion abit small but the taste is cook. Chicken are nicely fried and tender. Chilli Aso shiok but quite spicy

Recommend to try!

There's a good spread of Indonesian dishes. The food was good. The asam rebus soup tasted good but could be better if they also use belinjau nuts and leaves (but I know it's not easy to find in Singapore). The tahu telor was also good but could be improved by having more tahu to attain a good balance between the tahu & telor. The grilled chicken was okay although the meat was a little dry; could be a bit more juicy and moist and tasted better if fresh chicken was used instead of frozen chicken. The fish (tilapia and pomfret) dishes were my favourite. The fish meat was juicy and tender whilst the exterior was crispy and well prepared. I will visit again and will want to try their equivalent of beef bakso and other dishes also. Well done guys!

A little too pricey. $10.30 for 1 ayam penyet (takeaway). Rice was also charged. Taste of the food was not great. I will stick to the good old ayam penyet ria or president in the future.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Came all the way from KL for a work trip and stopped by this resto for a good lunch.

The food is tasty, we took a few lauk lauk with rice. The tauhu goreng was good, and it deserves another repetition the next time I stop by Singapore.

Food portion is good. Could be a lot if you’re not a big eater. But still worth it and your tummy will thank you 🤣

They have outdoor seatings as well as air conditioned area upstairs. You have to order at the counter first. It could be quite busy during lunch hour, but worth the wait for the food !

Spoiled by choices, vast selection of mains and side dishes on display. Tried a handful of dishes and most of them are fragrant and tasty. Their vegetable side dishes were also well executed. Kind of slightly salty for me.

However, prices here are at a premium, especially with the limiting portion served. Good authentic nasi padang with their main customers observed as tourist during my visit. Not a meal to be enjoyed daily at this price point. And especially during lunch time, the hot weather is a push away factor for me to revisit.

Rumah Makan Minang Pte Ltd is one of the best Malay food restaurants I have ever been to. This hidden gem located on Kandahar Street serves authentic nasi Padang that is so tasty, you will be dreaming about it for days after. The menu offers a lot of selection, but be prepared to wait in line as the dishes can run out quickly.

The restaurant's atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, and the staff members are friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend trying their Rendang and Soto Ayam, which are so flavorful and cooked to perfection. The dishes are served fresh and hot, and the portions are generous.

The only downside is that the restaurant is quite popular and sometimes can be crowded, so I suggest getting there early or being prepared to wait in line. Overall, if you're looking for authentic Malay food that is both delicious and affordable, Rumah Makan Minang Pte Ltd is the place for you.

I came here a few times and the queue really speaks for how popular this place is. The fun starts with queuing and ordering the food. It’s also good to come here in a bigger group, so you get to savour the various dishes. My favourite is the tender beef rendang and the tauhu telur. Their best part is that there is an air-conditioned seating area on level 2 that is accessible by a staircase at the side.

I've eaten malay cooking for aeons; the taste and flavours of each kind of dish are ingrained in my DNA. Sadly, for such a popular name as Minang, the food is poor in taste and very pricy. For the lunch I had, it cost me $45 sgd.
There are many small stalls in foodcourt that can rival this restaurant.
The taste is just not up to standard, lack of salt, flavour and richness of Malay cooking. If its about healthy living, there are alternatives that they can add to maintain the standard. Like KFC, McD, they remain consistent throughout the eras... if these big names can do it, so can they.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
l I must say, this place is one of the best spots to savor a delicious plate of Ayam Penyet. I tend to opt for their BBQ chicken over the fried version, simply due to personal preference. While their service might come across as blunt, it's undeniably efficient. And let me tell you, their fried tofu is a must-try; it's a personal favorite of mine. The self-serving free flow of soup is a major plus. Price-wise, it's a bit on the higher side, typically exceeding $15. All in all, if you're in the area, it's definitely a great choice to relish some Ayam Penyet!

came by for dinner before catching the Singapore vs Thailand match. impressed with how fast their food was served to speed up turnover. loved the crisp of their fried chicken, as well as the spiciness of their sambal chilli. remember to help yourselves to the complimentary chicken soup too near the drinks counter, it's really tasty! 🍲

Surprise, surprise, we didn't expect much at all, thinking it was just another average restaurants, we were so delighted we had one of our most memorable dining experiences.
The grilled chicken, satays, beef rendang, were cooked to perfection! This was the closest thing to eating in Jakarta. The price is reasonable too, this will be our favorite to eat when we crave Indonesian food.

Good food. Self serve soup. Good variety of options to choose from. Fairly good portion side. The grill beef feels quite dry for me but the rest was good. 🤷‍♂️ good serve fairly quickly.
Have good seatings for group. Maybe just me but it’s was a bit warm inside the restaurant. Not a bad feed but I expected better? Reasonable price for the location.

Yummy Ayam Penyet and other Is Indonesian dishes at affordable prices.

The chicken was succulent and crispy without being greasy. The accompanying tofu and tempeh were very good too. Tofu was soft on the inside and tempeh was crispy. The catfish was very generously sized. Overall, I would say the portions were generous.

Only dish that was a a bit of a letdown was the kangkong which was a little soggy. Still, we will return for other dishes.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Walked in for Sunday lunch. Ordered first at counter and pay later before you leave. Attentive boss at the cashier. Note that ayam penyet is without rice. Sambal wasn't spicy enough but chicken portion was good. Iced lime drink was refreshing. Fried rice was on point.

The food was okie. Pricing wise it is slightly cheaper than a few other popular brands.  Overall service is ok too. Attentive service and friendly boss. The only unpleasant experience was the smelly menu. Guess the material was made in PU leather. Spoilt my mood.  They should change their menu….  Very unpleasant.

The nasi kuning was above average - quite fragrant.   The soup ayam noodles was really good. The satay sauce was good but the chicken lacks of marination.  Overall I give 4 stars for food but the smelly menu worths only 1 star.

[updated: i visited agn for lunch and was happi. ordered P2 dis time rd]

their rendang beef was really good. i ordered the rendang jawa timur which came in 3 big cubes. for a small eater like me, i could only finished 2.5 cubes with white rice. the lady at the counter was really nice to offer me a glass of warm water when i told her im not ordering any drinks. would return agn next time to try other dishes.

Take away gado gado $9.90 and so small portion with 2 cubes rice cake 4 cubes potato abit of tofu and no tempeh. The portion take out vs dine in is huge difference. This is not
How you do business

Post lunch time was easier to get a table for 2 on weekend. Staff took our orders within minutes of deciding. Food came in acceptable time and was piping hot. Delightful service and overall had a wonderful lunch.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Great authentic indo food! Flavourful but not too oily or salty. Taste was just right 👍👍 service was prompt and attentive but they kept on offering to clear when we were not done and the place was not crowded. Will definitely come again

Bad service especially the man with white hair. Can’t remember his name. Worst attitude ever. Don’t allow my gf and myself in even when my mum was in the toilet. But not sure why some was allowed to go in when their friends took more than 20-30 min to reach. Food standard drop. Tauhu telur felt like I was eating telur only. Gado gado peanut sauce over cooked. Smelled of burnt peanuts. Seems like there is only half egg and vege with little potato. Horrible standard. Enping also not crispy anymore. Definately not coming back again. I am giving only 2 stars instead of one because one of the Chinese guy was friendly.

Date of Visit: 6 July 2023

Delicious authentic Indonesian cuisine.
Both professional and family setting.
Expect crowds during peak hours.
Highly recommended.

We ordered quite a lot of dishes today (more than the pics I could share) for Mom's birthday but the table was filled up so quickly we had to start eating and we had no time to continue with photo taking 😅 Overall the food was nice. Tahu telor is very nice. A pity the beef rendang had a mixture of meat that was quite tough. The restaurant gave us a complimentary chendol for my mom's birthday. They also allowed us to bring our own cake for cutting and provided paper plates! Overall, it was a good experience.

Went there for dinner, as it was on Friday night it was packed with people.
We do have to queue for a while to get a table. So if anyone had a plan to go on weekends you might need to be patient as the waiting time could be longer. Food wise was ok.Dining experience, maybe the waitress could jot down or pay more attention when customers order as I have to regularly check on them for the item that I order which end up was not be key in. Understandable that the staff are tired for the long working hours. But something could do better in serving wise. Price wise seem ok for me as it in town area. Overall 5/10

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Overated abd expensive Malay food in toa payoh. Different price for malay. Very unreasonable. Avoid at all cost. Portion pathetic . $13 for this food !!

Nice nasi padang. The beef rendang is good and traditional. Rempah of the rendang is great and fresh. Ask for extra gravy for rendang as it is more traditional dry style. Other dishes is good too. They are generous with the gravies so that added complexity to the dish. I think firstly the dishes are traditional and what dish we choose to balance with each other is important. It is almost the same for all nasi padang too. Overall it is a great gem for authentic nasi padang. Well done!

One of the best nasi Padang in Toa Payoh. The beef rendang is stew till very soft n tender.

Authentic Indonesian style nasi Padang done very well at good prices. Very popular with a queue during lunch time. Can tell many are regulars.

The gravy is flavourful and not overpowering spicy which is great for me. Also lotsa variety to choose from. The beef looks really tender even though I chose the Sotong, which is fresh and tender.

It is a true local treasure that brings the authentic flavors of Malay cuisine to our neighborhood. If you're in search of a memorable dining experience that celebrates the heart and soul of Malay culture, look no further. This eatery is a must-visit, whether you're a local or just passing through.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Ordered maggie goreng with fried chicken and egg.
The chicken was crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside. The egg has a good toast at the bottom while maintaining a runny yolk. Only gripe is that the maggie goreng was undercooked, so it lessened the enjoyment. Still a good spot for a meal.

The dalca is very nice - thick and spicy. There are ceiling fans so it’s not hot. Staff are friendly. Prata could be a bit better though - more fluffy or crispy. Feels a bit doughy.

Plain prata was good 3.5/5
Egg prata - don't try - 2/5
Maggie Goreng -3.5/5 I liked it . Tasty and juicy .
Teh Halia - 4/5 . Loved it .
Service is okay and atmosphere is good .

Second time here. Masala thosai is one of the most flavorful I had. Uncles & servers are always attentive & welcoming

Very good food and drinks here, and they open till late. It is thus sn extremely popular place for supper.

Most of their drinks are good, hot or cold. Today, I had their

1. Iced Milk Tea, less sweet
- the tea taste was strong, not sweet, and cold enough

2. Cheese Egg Prata
- I usually don't order the plain ones, as it may be served from their ready pile.  So this came piping hot from the stove!

3. Maggie Goreng, normal
- which meant plain with just egg, to savour its original taste. You could pay and add meat like chicken and beef.

The boss and staff are very friendly, and most willing to help with photo-taking.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.name: Fayidha Restaurant

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Thanks for the tasty food and professional service. One staff called Doreen was friendly in providing food recommendation and their front counter staff, restaurant staff are also friendly.

It’s my second visit here and the food is still as tasty. Hope to visit again next time 🙏thanks a lot !

Food/dessert was delicious and prepared to perfection. Enjoyed the service by staff who were friendly and jovial. The ambience was nice. Very happy with our experience, will definitely recommend to others :)

I recently dined at IndoChili restaurant in Singapore, and it was a truly positive experience. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warm hospitality that set the tone for the entire meal. The highlight of my visit was undoubtedly the authentic taste of Indonesian cuisine that I savored. Each dish was a delightful journey through the rich and diverse flavors of Indonesia.

The menu offered a wide range of options, allowing me to explore various regional specialties. The rendang was particularly outstanding, with its tender, slow-cooked beef infused with a symphony of spices. The satay skewers were a flavorful delight, and the sambal had just the right level of heat to awaken my taste buds.

The ambiance of IndoChili restaurant was also a significant factor in my enjoyment. The cozy interior design, adorned with Indonesian decor, created an immersive atmosphere. The staff were attentive and knowledgeable, making recommendations that enhanced my culinary adventure.

Overall, IndoChili restaurant in Singapore is a must-visit for anyone seeking an authentic taste of Indonesian cuisine. The combination of delicious food, warm service, and a charming atmosphere left me with a memorable and highly positive dining experience. I can't wait to return and explore more of their tantalizing offerings.

Coming there in almost evening for dinner. I ordered nasi goreng sate (fried rice with chicken satay), nasi goreng seafood (fried rice with seafood), and lemontea.
Nasi gorengs's taste is actually good, authentic, it taste same like i ate when I still in Indonesia, approved. Satay's also quiet good and tender, but the gravy is 4/5 because its too smooth and dont have cutted peanut texture but okay lah, still acceptable. Lemontea also okay.
Tip: if you like nasi goreng spicier you need to tell the waitress/cashier to give you more chili because mine is not too spicy.
Great services comes from the manager and waitress aunty who treat us equally with another visitors. They also helpful.
Another plus point: atmksphere was very cozy and they played Indonesian traditional sonha so it will take you too your old day and makes you relax&nostalgic.
Probably will come back again to explore another foods.

Great experience, had a variety of dishes with some groupmates. Service at the restaurant was very attentive and made us feel at ease. When our food went cold while waiting for one member, server Doreen even placed our soto ayam over a heater so that it would remain warm. Dishes are all traditional fare and delicious, nasi goreng sate especially is quite a decent portion for the price. The drinks were a good surprise, the strawberry tea genuinely shocked me at how fast i finished it 😂 if you're willing to take the price this restaurant is definitely worth the time

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Ayam Penyet President's ayam penyet is always a delight! The chicken is incredibly tender and generously flavored, especially with the extra spicy chili if you're a spice enthusiast. For those leaning towards sweetness, the ayam bakar or griller chicken is an excellent choice, accompanied by delectable tempe and tahu.

The service is commendable, and there are no hassles with payment via PayWave. Highly recommended for a satisfying and flavorful Indonesian food dining experience.

Good quality, tasty Ayam Penyet served in a fast food manner.

Chicken is moist on the inside and crispy on the outside without being oily. Tempeh is crispy. Tofu is nice and soft on the inside. The portions are fairly generous too.

Great place for a quick meal.

I must say that I’m very surprised by the portion of the food. Just take the fish for example - it cost me SGD13++ via GrabFood and the portion is huge (and it arrived crispy and hot too!).

The taste is good too - I like the sweet black sauce with a touch of onions and the chilli sauce that isn’t too spicy.

Flavorful fall off the bone tender crispy fried chicken leg and awesome sambal chilli. Perfect combi. The chicken satay is very chunky, tender and moist. Gado gado was nice too. Lots of crispy belinjau crackers topping. Very generous portions for low prices. Friendly staff. Shiok.

Back again for penyet, tahu telur and mangoes. Shiok.

I previously ordered delivery from this restaurant and enjoyed the food, so I decided to dine in today. However, I found that the quality of the food for dine-in and delivery was about the same. I ordered the oxtail soup and fried chicken, and while they tasted okay, they were only warm.

When I entered the restaurant, the waitress did not serve me and I had to find a table myself. I figured I need to order via a QR code and had the option to pay on our phone or at the counter before our food arrived.

Unfortunately, the staff's attitude left something to be desired. This restaurant is popular for its food delivery service, and there were several delivery drivers coming in to collect food. One of the orders was not checked and ended up being picked up by the wrong driver. When the correct driver arrived, the staff refused to take responsibility for the mistake and make up for it, despite having plenty of food in the kitchen and not being busy with other orders.

After witnessing the incident, I've decided that I will no longer order delivery from this restaurant. My decision is not only based on the impact it has on the delivery person, but also on the hungry customer who's waiting for their food.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.name: Ayam Penyet President - i12 Katong

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
The food are nice, close to authentic indonesian food but not quite. However, food are tasty so it’s worth to try. Have gone to the place few times and the place delivers nice consistent flavour.
It’s nice they allow walk in also and give the timing , not put all into reservation only

Sweat worthy dishes, it's been a while since i didn't get to enjoy nasi padang at this level. The dishes are packed with umanis and flavours. Worth to orders are beef rendang, fried egg, sambal (on its own) and ikan asam pedas. I had 2 and a half packs of rice. Oh, forget to mention that the rice is the unsung hero of the meal, steam to perfection and the chef is care enough to add in some butterfly pea juices to make it slightly blueish.

Bravo! Definitely will bring friends and family here again

I think my favourite of all will be Ikan Goreng Balado because it was fried till crispy on the outside and not too dry on the inside, along with their Chilli Sauce, it was match make from heaven. Next will be their Emping Belinjo which dipping with belachan lime mixture was a whole new experience at least for me. Tahu Telor was okay with the sweet, nutty sauce drizzled over. Kangkong Belachan wasn't spicy enough in my expectation for this dish. The portion of their steamed rice wrapped in banana leaves was just right for me. Chendol was okay. Will come again.

Speedy service. Seated, Ordered, Served at break neck speed and efficiency.

Food was great, an absolute joy. Would prefer a thicker rojak sauce for my tahu telor. The ikan Assam pedas was a little spicy. But otherwise, everything else was marvelous!

This was one of my favourite Indonesian restaurants. I have been a customer for more than 20 years, since when they were operating from a shop house on the other side of Upper Cross Street.
I seldom go there nowadays as my favourite dish, the otak fish was always not available due to one reason or another. Now I heard that that they stop wrapping their rice in banana leaves. This is something special for this restaurant, the leaves gives the rice a great fragrance.
Although cost have increased, restaurants should not cut corners especially with items that makes a difference. Old photos attached.
Indonesian dining options in Balestier.name: Pagi Sore

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Ordered Nasi Lemak Set A. Price is affordable ($5.50) and portion is reasonable. Blue pea rice texture is on softer side and smell fragrant. Chicken wing is normal. Chilli has spicy kick to eat. Nothing to complain, nothing to rave. A decent Singaporean meal.

Very nice nasi lemak place with yummy side dishes. Tried the ayam lemak which is spiced chicken cooked in coconut milk, very warm to savour on a cold day. Not to miss, the coconut rice felt rich and aromatic. All these for below $10 while dining in an air conditioned place.

Loved the otah. Bought set E to get a variety of ingredients but not sure if it’s worth that price. You can choose the type of chicken you want. Food was good nonetheless! Seating can get a bit cramped as tables are seats are close to one another.

This place has a home cooked feel about it. The staff are friendly and understanding but not overly stiff.

I ordered classic basic nasi lemak and chose my own sides.  I feel that it may have been more economical to just purchase one of their sets. The beef rendang was soft and the sauce was nice. What I do appreciate is that it had less salt in all of their food.  They make their own Chile which was not too spicy.

I take one star off because 1 plate of food plus 1 drink set me back $10. I won't be able to afford to eat here that regularly.

Interesting Nasi Lemak! Good choices available. I like the flavour of the rice and it's chicken. The combinations is interesting. I do find it a bit pricey but they make up with taste. Will try again when possible.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.reviews:
Am pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food there. The grilled chicken drumstick was tender and moist… but it’s not much bigger than the drumstick from a spring chicken. The veggies were fresh. The soup was flavorful and had lots of beef in it. The crisps were nice and crunchy but not enough of it. Hahaha.

Overall a nice experience but the cramped sitting area and the fact that it’s right by an undivided walkway kinda spoils the experience a little.

A Halal Muslim shop, managed by experienced muslim ladies.
Shop serves Indonesian Muslim fare ... which were delicious and average-priced.
My friend from Indonesia enjoyed the soup best.
He mentioned that the rest of the dishes taste different from those in Java ... but still delicious.
I guess the shop owner adapted some local flavourings to our local tastes.
No alcohol is served here ... just soft beverages.
Service can be improved ... but I understand they may be short-handed.
Ambience ... no choice ... as the shop is already small, with only a few tables and space.
Overall ... a nice experience in a cosy shop ..

Third time eating from this restaurant. We ordered the Bumbu Kemangi (chicken) and Soto Ayam Kuning, and both are very nice and flavourful. The rice in Bumbu Kemangi came wrapped in pandan leaves and was very fragrant. The stir fried chicken was well marinated with aromatic spices. The chicken soup was hearty and homely. The only con was the glass noodles in the soup was quite little. But overall a very satisfying indonesian meal!

Totally impressed with the food here! Love everything on the plate. The rice is very fragrant and tasted like chicken rice. Chili was great! Highly recommended for a flavourful meal! Only downside is it can be quite hectic to find a seat during lunch time, but the food is worth the wait.

The food was great! Tried the ayam bakar bara, gado gado and bakwan jagung (corn fritters). The flavoured rice was very tasty and the chicken was delicious. The chilli is quite spicy for me. A bit pricey for the portion served. It is always very crowded during lunchtime on weekdays so it is best to go before 12pm.

Indonesian dining options in Balestier.name: Bara Food Tanjong Pagar

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
We have been coming here on days when my mum requested for vegetarian meals, always enjoyed eating here. Food available suits even my picky nephews 😅

We always order the curries and toufu, and pastas for kids. 😋

Shiok!!!! Impressive food place. As an Indian vegetarian, I enjoyed every bit of it. The food order can be altered even to suit vegans. Don’t miss this place must try place for everyone locals as well as tourist, don’t forget to try Singapore delight food Laksa.

The restaurant is located just opposite the Beauty World MRT station. We had lunch (3pax) on a Saturday and it wasn't too crowded. Service was prompt and polite, prices were reasonable. We loved all the dishes (bitter gourd in black bean sauce, fried egg & tomatoes, steamed tofu) except for the deep-fried sweet and sour mushroom, which wasn't exceptional (more chewy than crispy). They have a good selection of infused rice and serve different hot and cold beverages (including BBT). Recommended!

was there at 9.15pm, we know your last order 9.30pm and the cafe has no crowd.

Hmmm perhaps your boss earn enough for today and you suggested us to take away instead?

Quite disappointed and decided to travel else where to fill our hungry tummy instead.

I will reconsider whether will want to visit your place again if given the choice.

Nice vegetarian food! The Nasi Lemak has a nice flavour on the rice, though not overly done, chilli goes with this dish in my opinion. The ngoh hiang is a bit hard but the taste make up for it. If you don't like too hard stuff, maybe you want to skip this dish. Toufu has a great mixed of sauces. Claypot rice looks better than the taste though, so I'll skip this next time, as I'm one with heavy taste. Cereal "prawn" is very well done, such that I can just go with cereal and rice if need to. Overall, this place has enough dishes and set meal to cater to most, so I'll not take any stars off, especially the ambience and service is well above average.

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Love the location, the ambience and music is great and the fact the it’s so near the mrt ❤️ the tiramisu was nice but it doesn’t live up to the “tiramisu” there was no coffee taste, all I tasted was coconut. It tasted okay but maybe “coconut chocolate” would be a more realistic name? The burger tasted great but the sweet potato portion was very very little:( and was a tad bit dry wish it came with sauce or something. I probably would come back again even though it’s a bit expensive but normal cafe price haha. Probably will wanna try other raw cakes but the tiramisu just didn’t cut it..

Great place if you need to do some work.  Wifi is available, and it's not very noisy.  Only 2 tables have a power point nearby that I can see though.

We went on a Sunday morning, foodwise there's many vegan options. Not very familiar with vegan and gluten free but I felt the food were very gentle to the palate unlike ur usual hawker fare.

Atmosphere were great, staff services is great an not too crowded. I would think its a great experience and food combination is well thought out.

Lacks generosity!! I’ve been 4 times to the living cafe & each time I came back feeling dissatisfied & hungry. Not because I can’t order another main dish but it doesn’t make sense - what’s the point? The menu is great but the portions are restricted. We ordered for 2 people, vegan wrap, veggie delight pizza (barely any vegetables) & some deserts. Ask for the sauce & you are asked to pay $3 on top. I prefer to be charged on the dish & I’m happy to pay $25 instead of $20 but serve me a well thought wholesome plate please.
I think there’s a misconception that Vegan people don’t need much food despite paying more for their dishes.
Most of the deserts contain honey, so they are out of bounds for vegans.
Hopefully some heart is put in to this great place to make it feel more warm 🍀🙏🏻

Food was pretty good but the cappuccino with soy milk and beer root latte with oat milk were terrible. Prices were OK for the high quality ingredients but service was almost nonexistent other than putting food on my table (ordering and payment was done online and no drinking water was provided). Cafe was rather cosy but not good for gathering as customers have to leave after just 1h 15 min (despite it being half full on a Sunday during brunch time). Also, you HAVE TO provide both mobile number and email address for ordering, which is an involuntary release of private data just for a meal. 😅

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Order Claypot Yi Mee $4.50. Is yummy as cooked upon ordered. Located in the front row. Will tried others food in next visit

Rice was basic. Tasty and delicious.

Located in the Beauty World Food Centre.

Food is so good, variety of quality n quantity of ingredients put in a dish. If want to try a vegetarain food this is the place. Hawker price extremely affordable too ($4  for my Hor Fun) But not open for dinner n close on Sunday n PH.

Value for money vegetarian zi char. Taste is good and cooked well. Popular n busy during lunch. As there is only one cook some items may not be available to help cope with the orders.

Superb vegetarian food. Had the claypot e-mian. Good mixture of different beancurd type ingredients, flavorful stock, green vegetables. All for just $4.50. Served piping hot in a claypot.

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Great food, since many years ago. Vegetarian but meat eaters will enjoy this place too.

Mezze platter was quite big even for 2 pax.

Really enjoyed the moussaka and the Spanakopita.

If you pay by cash there is some free ice cream.

First time visiting due to friend’s recommendation. Did not disappoint. Lots of options that don’t make you feel you’re eating vegetarian. Drink menu is extensive but on pricey side. Service was good.

Ambience - The restaurant has this very European, relaxed vibe. Good for families but I don‘t see why you can’t go for a date either 😁

Food - my friend and I ordered the halloumi salad and lasagna. We really enjoyed the meal, the ingredients were good quality and food was prepared with care. However, did feel the halloumi was a bit too salty. They have a variety of Mediterranean and Italian options and can make it vegan too. Didn’t really enjoy the rose though.

Service - prompt service and the staff were polite and friendly

Would definitely return again.

You won't believe how rare it is to have a Mediterranean vegetarian place that has so many allium free options, including the Pizzas. Glad to see original sin survive the pandemic when many didn't.

The Moussaka and Mediterranean pizza were good, though a little too salty but that's probably just me. Nice ambience for a date with friends or the significant other, especially over a good conversation. You pay for the quality. Enjoy!

Wonderful and classy vegetarian restaurant. Had dinner here with the wife on a weekday evening. Food was wholesome, good service and atmosphere. Recommended!
Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.address: 01-62 Jln Merah Saga, Chip Bee Gardens, Blk 43, Singapore 278115
Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.name: Original Sin Restaurant

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Located at Bukit Timah Market & Food Centre, stall number #02-188.

Price: $7.00 (Lei Cha Brown Rice)

The ingredients of the Lei Cha (Thunder Tea Rice) includes fried bean curd, sweet chye poh (preserved radish bits), long beans, stir fried cabbage, mani cai (sweet leaf), black eyed pea, toasted peanuts and sesame. Tea soup is basil based and kind of resembles Thai green curry in taste minus the coconut milk.

All the ingredients they used are very fresh and tasted delicious as a whole. The tea soup might seem little at first but the amount given is just right.

Looking forward to trying the Bee Hoon set next time!

Do come support the lesser known dishes in Singapore!

First time trying leicha, was curious about how the tea would taste. Opted for kosong set and was amazed how FULL i was 60% into my bowl. I enjoyed all the crunch factors from celery (i think), beans, peanuts (the best imo). The tofu was soft and yummy.  The portion is really generous.

The tea...is not what i was expecting. It's like an acquired taste for me, i cant say i like it when i first tried. It's more of getting used to that taste. Would continue trying leicha elsewhere to compare how different/similar it can be.

Overall the whole bowl has a light taste, not too heavy nor salty. Enjoyed my meal!

Usually takeaway, but the thunder tea will be better if thicker and more cencentrated. Can't even ask for me to go with the rice, the amount is not enough to complement the rice and veg.

Very good taste amongst the rest I have tried. Good find if you want something healthy from this hawker centre. Something nutty yet Asian in flavour.

So yummy and wholesome. A bit pricey but worth it. Balanced flavours with generous portions of veggie and taukwa, complete with beans (more protein!) and crunchy peanuts~ requested for thunder tea paste since this was a takeaway, and I added my own water to it. On the saltier side, though I guess this is common, so I added more water to balance out the taste a bit. Still very tasty though. Will be back to try the beehoon :-D

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Food was yummy, we ordered the mala fried rice, spicy chicken and creamy butter lotus root. Slightly too salty n oily but overall taste is great. Will go back n try other dishes again

They serve very good vegetarian cuisines with wide varieties of vegetarian dishes to choose from. The restaurant is clean and cozy, but the only downside is the limited parking lots. We tried their Mala Xiang Guo, Oatmeal Mushrooms and Butter Cream Lotus Roots and we love them all as they were flavourful and tasty! Will definitely visit again to try other dishes :)

The dishes were delicious, will definitely visit again. Spent about $20/pax including drinks.

Comfortable setting, good legit mala, vegetarian hokkien mee is delish. There's quality in the food. Spent abt $15 per pax. Will be back again.

Love everything that we ordered, especially their Fragrant Spicy Grilled Fish! Can't get enough of it, best eaten hot! 🌶

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Quirky small cafe that appears to be well renovated, but comes with practical downsides - afternoon sun was blasting into most of the available seats/tables, table was shaky, blasting Korean music which destroyed the ambience, etc. Ordered iced coffee which was more than $10 and served in a very small glass. Service staff were friendly which made the experience feel a little better. Not a place I will visit again.

The waffles here are fantastic and their dessert here they do not use normal sugar. It's hard to find nice crispy waffles nowadays. Hidden gem in bukit Timah area.

Outstanding service and food. We enjoyed every sip of our coffee with the music. I love the place and surely will come back more often. Staffs are very accommodating.

Ordered their pizza. Said it will take 10mins. No problem. After 15mins, needed another 6mins. Fine.
Pizza was sparse. Too crusty, over baked, pizza base was soo salty. With only 3 ingredients:- cheese, 3 capcisum and a few mushrooms. Don't waste yr money. 30april@5ish pm.

Given your ‘earthly pretence’, disappointing that you choose to serve dine in food in plastic bowls with plastic cutlery.
Your reason ‘we use plastic because we are very busy’ didn’t quite wash I’m afraid.
So come on - please get your act together.  Currently there is little to distinguish yourselves from Mac Donald’s.

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.name: Haven on Earth

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Sunny ☀️ Choice at Bt Batok. Their Assam “Fish” Rice set one of the best I tried, not too spicy soupy texture not thicken sauce. I ❤️ the raw fresh radish beetroot salad. Been here many times. #vegetarian #brownrice #assamsoup

Eight treasures rice (八宝饭) - 5 stars
Loved this!

+++

Leppet - 3 stars
Haven't tried the actual dish. The toppings seemed like they could've come prepackaged.

Yam abacus - 4 stars
On the soft side. Tasty.

Assam fish noodles - 4.5 stars
Even better than the Assam fish rice because you get a whole noodle bowl full of the sauce!

Very tasty, delicious and makes me feels like home. The ingredients are 真材实料！Very nice lady boss as well. Highly recommend and I will be back!

The food here is delicious and value for money; this was my first visit, and impressed with the variety of food offered here. You can also purchase packed vegetarian/vegan snacks. In any place where no harm is caused to animals or humans, you can expect good vibes from such places. So do visit this place. I highly recommend it.

Delicious Lei Cha. Rich hot soup served in a thick walled bowl to retain heat.

Barley Gingko is thick and nice too.

Lion mane curry is rich and spicy!

Repeat visit.
Ba Bao Rice is surprising good

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
We had our dinner here on Good Friday night with the last minute reservation from google.
We ordered a starter, a pizza, a grilled meat platter and a Lebanon dessert. The food worth 2 stars. The meat was pretty hard, the starter was too sour. The dessert was really not able to match our taste. The house wines was tasteless, but the red wine taste better when it pair with the meat. I will strongly recommend you only order the red if you want to have their one for one house wine promo.
Our bill was $128, you can get a much more better grilled meat platter and better food at other restaurants. :)

Le Rida has a rustic ambience somewhat akin to an old time eating house in a small town. Quaint and homely
Freshly baked pita bread with lemon chick pea hummus was delicious and filling
Mains of Lebanese lamb kafta kebab had the right balance of flavour and crunchiness.
Wash it all down with 1 for 1 Heineken draft at $17.90

Manager Sanjiv was both friendly and helpful in his recommendations and unlike in some establishments, he did not push you to over order.
Definitely worth a return visit!

A quaint no frills dining place with excellent food and good service. The staff are simple people but are very hospitable, often checking in on the food quality and our experience. If you are looking for a good meal away from hustle and bustle, this is the place to go. Oh.. U can definitely have a conversation with your company and hear them loud and clear

Didn't think the food was thaaaat amazing. Nor was the service. But at least they let us drink outside drinks.
HOWEVER, i requested for no garnishing on my hummus. When the guy brought it over, there WAS parsley on it. And all he said was "just pluck it out". --.--
So if i was allergic to that, i should just pluck it out.... nice. The hummus wasn't good either. I've tasted better. Like a friend who went with me commented... it isn't creamy enough. Also, comments about the baklava was that it was too hard... and wasn't good.

Absolutely loved the food, I am heavily into Mediterranean food. I have tried most of the places around Bugis as well. The food here was so fresh, with perfect taste and presentation. It was completely worth it travelling from East.
The service was quick, the portion size was generous . We ordered mezze plateer and tabalu salad. They were scrumptious loved the customised heart shaped Pita bread. Hummus, was so creamy and so were all other dips.

Would strongly recommend.. It has become one of my favourite place..

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.name: Le Rida (Mediterranean. French. North Indian)

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Briyani is full of flavor, also tried Chicken tikka masala , the fish dish- Dum Methi Machli, both very nice and Nan, Roti are good too.
I also recommend the Masala tea, Mild and milky rich tea.

Boy, oh boy, hands down the best Indian Food that I have ever had. And this, is even by Indian standards.

And the best part, you get a hearty and warm welcome and such wonderful conversation and stories about Bangkok and Thailand from the owner. Uncle was kind enough to sit with us the whole time and talk about how art, culture, and the current situation in Thailand.

The food is prepared by the family and they don't have a cook. Its quite wholesome. Really a "Ghar ka Khaana".

Recommendations would be to go for the Mutton Rogan Josh, Pulao, Lassi, Chicken Butter Masala, Naan.

And the waitresses are very nice and had patience the entire time we struggled to order 😜. She also gave some nice recommendations for food.

A must visit whenever, you are near. I have found my food place in Bangkok and will always return to "The Stay" anytime I am in Bangkok.

Best Indian curry in Singapore! Highly recommended!! I always have this every Deepavali festival, or any day when I crave for Indian cuisine.. the curry is rich and thick; fish head is huge and can savor it to the last bone at home.
Here’s an advice from a seasoned customer: please plan for a longer waiting time during peak hours, and do not expect much from the service, just go for the food!!

The curry tastes very authentic and nice. We ordered the chicken butter curry, fish curry, prawn curry etc, all items are good and go very well with the garlic and butter naans. Price is good as well. Overall great dinning experience here.

Best indian vegetarian I've ever had. Very fresh dal makahni and saffron rice.
Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.address: 805 Bukit Timah Rd, #01-03 Sixth Avenue Center, Singapore 279883
Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.name: Indian Curry House - Bukit Timah

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Small shop front with limited seats. Mainly for take-out or delivery.

Measly portions and super slow service

The foods here are very delicious
Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.opening_hours:

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.name: Shy Signature Vegetarian Cafe

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
I have been having meals from Omar Shariff quite frequently through delivery for a few months now and they had been good. I love spicy food and their vindaloo fit the bill.

The vindaloo, chicken samosa, garlic onion kulcha, naans and tandoori chicken were ok.

The above has been edited post my recent order: They gave a reduced amount of potatoes in the vindaloo, the taste was not as good as previous orders and they did not give any pappadums with my order for the first time. This inconsistency is a negative experience for me.

Highly recommend with the reasonable price. Their fried cauliflower, Tandoori chicken and cheese with spinach are very nice. Nann is normal but very good with prawn masala. Im not Indian and sometimes I can’t really imagine their dishes but staff is very kind, explained me one by one.

Nice food with friendly staff and they care for their delivery riders. Five stars! Will be back for more briyani!

Authentic Indian food, nice ambience and seating.
I have tried Aloo Paratha and Egg burning - both of them were absolutely delicious.
I understand that all the breads will be wrapped in a nice cloth, served in a small basket. I could feel the smell of ghee while I unwrap the bread.
Staffs were friendly and they do have a nice clean toilet facility.
I’m sure I will visit again to explore other food options.

Absolutely delicious Mango Lassi, Garlic Naan, Palak Paneer and Chicken Tikka Masala. Before our dishes arrived, we were served with delicious papadom and Mint Chutney. That itself was high quality so we knew the food would be good.

The Garlic Naan was wrapped in a maroon cloth, served in a basket. When we unveiled the Naan, the fragrance of the butter and garlic felt like a warm hug. It was crispy and tender, the perfect combination for the Chicken Tikka Masala and Palak Paneer.

The Chicken Tikka Masala was served with fresh tomatoes and they were delicious with the Tandoori chicken. After eating the spicy food, we washed it all down with the perfect Mango Lassi.

The staff was friendly and accommodating to our requests for ice water. Definitely returning to try the other dishes!
Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.opening_hours:

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.name: Omar Shariff Authentic Indian Cuisine

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
It’s been a while since I came here and the increase in price is really steep; I no longer find it value for money. We got Plain Prata x1, Egg Prata x1, Butter Chicken x1, Garlic Naan x1, Dum Briyani x1 and Iced Teh Tarik x2 which added up to $38.80 for 2.

Prata is average but their fish curry is really diluted. Butter chicken is not bad. Garlic naan is what you would expect it to taste. The only thing worth the price is probably the Dum Briyani. Although it looked like a small portion, there was a lot of mutton buried in the rice and was really filling. The mutton was also tender with really nice gravy. Personally will not be back again.

Good place to have your Indian breakfast. Service is good during the morning.

Last I had supper here at night on weekend, they clean your table as soon as you finish your food to make way for the next diner which is understandable. So, decide if you want a place for good food or a place to hang out.

I've been using this restaurant as a JC peeps meeting base for years. Glad to see that it, together with its competition down the road, has survived the building of the MRT line. When I last went, they didn't have date milkshake. Not sure if its temporary or for good. Date milkshake is good 👍

Incredibly extensive menu with plenty of seating. Service is really quick and you order through a QR code so it’s convenient. There’s parallel parking along the road and parking at the malls opposite. The food was good, there’s choice between dum briyani and just briyani and this was the plain briyani, rice was flavourful and the chicken was good. Can even choose what piece of chicken you want. Overall quite nice, i would return and would want to try the other stuff on the menu.

This is one of those few eateries I often wonder how they managed to attract the crowds. The place isn't cozy, the food are generally pricey, there are mostly misses than hits in their extensive menu, even the tasty ones are achieve by being too greasy & over saucy like the Maggi Goreng Pattaya I had today.

Also their QR code ordering system is a pain to use, there's no embedded payment system to any of the many existing digital payment we have here, you simply have to enter ur credit card manually. If you choose to pay at the counter, your cart orders would be gone and you have to re-order everything at the counter.

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.name: Al-Azhar Restaurant

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Hidden jem inside lovefresh food court at bt timah plaza. This stall has been around very long and remains the same quality and worth the price!!! No stall name seen but only 1 duck yam rice and wonton mee stall inside the food court. Super friendly owner too! Give it a try when you nearby. 😉

Amazingly good!!! Just ordered the combo as I need to have a quick meal before my shopping trip, but the quality of food surprised me!!! Service is good as well and I guess, I'm gonna go back to try other food in the menu as well. Had a beef sumiyaki & salmon & chicken sumiyaki and impressed with the combination of ingredients used! Keep up the good work, and I guess I'll be back soon!

Tea was too diluted, even after pouring half away and mixing with the stronger cup of coffee couldn't save it.

The Chee chong fun was too oily (refer to picture attached) and surprisingly tasteless even with the black sauce.

The toast were soaking in melted butter aka soggy.

The redeeming factor were the half boiled eggs that were perfect.

Perhaps the breakfast menu isn't your forte, or more training could be done for the front end staff if you intend to continue targeting the morning demographics.

Definitely not a good way to start the weekend morning with an underwhelming breakfast with the family.

I think this place is a hidden gem. It deserves far far more than the 3 stars it has which is why I’m posting this review.

The beer garlic fried rice is one of the best I’ve had and the taste is like from an upmarket Japanese restaurant.

The sushi was also really tasty, and yet different from other restaurants.

Highly recommend!!

Finally the place reopened at B1, replacing the coffeeshop at the corner (the chicken rice is still there). Prices are just slightly above average and the food quality is good for the price point. Their chicken curry seems to be using the roti prata curry instead of Japanese curry.
Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.opening_hours:

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.name: LoveFresh - Bukit Timah Plaza

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Quite a number of tables available during lunch period and indoor seating. Service was quick and friendly. Dishes are good and acceptable, with a big range of dishes available. Average price per person for ala carte and drink is about $10 per person. Fuss free meal! Parking available at the road or outdoor carpark nearby Beauty World Mrt station.

The food was delicious. Served quite fast. You don't need to wait long.

Tried the nasi campur. You need to try the curry chicken, which was fantastic. Tried the butter chicken with plain naan, which was great, too. We also had bryani prawn and Chinese style fried rice.

Staff are very attentive, friendly, and helpful.

Easy to travel here via bus 67 from CCK Bus Interchange or Downtown Line Beauty World.

Will come down to try other food next time.

Been coming here for years. You get what you pay for, never had complaints about their food.

Looks like they upgraded their curry bowls 😂

Lots of comfort food at its best here. They've range from Western food to indian dishes.

The dishes we ordered are served warm and taste acceptable.

With all the price rising, we are surprised that their price is still reasonable.
You'll find fried rice with a side dish from $5+ only.
Portion is generous too

It was a weekday when we visited the restaurant, and it was busy with customers, but their staff were incredibly fast.

Reasonable rate + Great service.
It's definitely a great supper place to lepakz with friends

And the cheese naan & butter chicken is a must try! Highly recommend!

The butter chicken was the best I've tasted all over singapore.  As I've tried alot of it elsewhere... nothing is compared to Ameen's butter chicken. And damn the cheese naan is solid I tell you. Crispy on the outside and soft and gooey from the cheese on the inside. Totally recommending this place to anyone who loves a good solid butter chicken and pair it with their naan. Will be coming back very soon and many more times over the years!!!!
Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.opening_hours:

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.name: Ameen Makan House

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
One of satay bee hoon I used to get when I had a project around there decade ago. Chef is younger generation but taste is not all lost! Cheap and good old traditional food is always good. Food Quality A+ Quantity A+

Came here for a late lunch with my colleagues as a new stall from 石年 pork trotter just recently open.

We also order many of the local favourites like satay, chendol, chicken wings oyster omelette and carrot cake.

This place is not only popular with their food with many stalls and also have a huge crowd during peak hours.

The passage of time has brought about many changes to this hawker centre but one thing for sure, you will always have a memorable meal at the end of the day.

I attribute my visits to trips to the nearby supper places, hiring a domestic worker or eating at Beauty World Food Centre. The Korean food along the slope or the cafes along Lor Kilat are part of that too.

The carrot cake is nice, I remembered there was a stall that allows you to add meat like pork. Peter's Pan was a good western.

The vibe is different during lunch and in the evenings when the BBQ stalls open. A sunny day will make you want to grab chendol while a rainy day will entice you for fish soup.

There is no bad food here, only good memories.

the food compared to other hawkers centres is one step above, having a really savoury and delicious wanton mee, crispy and hot fried carrot cake and good chicken.

Tried kopi C kosong from Hup Cheong (3 stars) and Hainan coffee (3.25 stars)- both were so-so. The Hainan coffee was slightly milkier so we preferred that.

Nonya Zhang was good (4 stars). Wanton mee close to the entrance (3.5 stars) - char siu was too sweet, wanton pretty good.

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Without any doubt, it is the best Italian restaurant in Singapore. You can enjoy southern Italiano taste here. There's reason why this restaurant survived during the pandemic. Leonardo, the boss of Caruso, always treat his guests with his best.

The perfect Italian restaurant at Western Central. With every pride and passion possible, each dish is carefully prepared with excellent taste. The service is exceptionally pleasant with an original Italian taking you through their signature dishes.

2 recommendations here. Reserve your table way in advance. Parking is ample at Guthrie House behind.

The Italian food here is very authentic. They use fresh ingredients. The ingredients look simple but the aroma and taste of the dishes are very flavourful.
It was super busy and packed during mother's day, but the Italian owner was very approachable and friendly, and tried his best to get us our reserved table as soon as possible as the previous seating was late.
Love their pistachio gelato with bailey shot. It's really 👍.
Will definitely visit again!

Very pleasant Italian cuisine! The food is the attraction here, wouldn't rate the ambience and the service as 5 because it's just not there. However the food served was really scrumptious. Highly recommend the lamb steak. Would come back for the food again.

It was a pleasant visit, although I expected more as this is an authentic Italian restaurant. It was for a girlfriend’s birthday treat and we were served 2 slices of plain bread after ordering. It came with olive oil and balsamic vinegar but no side nor small plates were provided. So we ended up pouring the dips onto our main dining plate. No butter was served either.
The $58 mixed grilled meat platter was delectable. The lamb and pork belly were enjoyable. The salad was served was limp and there was no crunch nor freshness

We asked for mint sauce and the server wasn’t sure and said would check if available. Few minutes later, she served us brown sauce instead. We didn’t want to trouble the crew and decided to stick with the brown sauce. The meat was already tasty and we wanted the mint sauce to balance the taste. Nonetheless, I wonder if mint sauce was available as this is an Italian restaurant. I totally respect the original taste of the meats and used the brown sauce only sparingly. Service was friendly. Paid $123 for 2 mains (a pasta and mixed grill) and a bottle of sparkling water.
Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.name: Caruso

Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
I recently had the pleasure of indulging in Rubato's lunch buffet, and it was truly a memorable experience. The restaurant provided impeccable service, and the buffet itself offered a delightful selection of Italian dishes.

From the moment I walked in, the staff at Rubato made me feel welcome and ensured that I had everything I needed throughout the meal. Their attention to detail and dedication to guest satisfaction were evident.

The lunch buffet at Rubato featured a wide variety of Italian classics, from fresh salads and antipasti to hearty pasta dishes and delectable desserts. The flavors were outstanding, and the buffet's diverse offerings catered to a range of tastes. It's a fantastic option for those looking to explore a variety of Italian flavors in one sitting.

The only area where Rubato could improve was in the presentation of the main courses on the buffet. The plating of the meats and sauces at the start could be refined to make it easier for diners to identify and enjoy each dish.

In summary, Rubato's lunch buffet offers an exceptional culinary journey through Italian cuisine, with outstanding service to match. It's a fantastic option for those seeking a wide array of flavors in a warm and welcoming atmosphere. With a little attention to plating, Rubato's lunch buffet could become an undisputed five-star gem in the world of Italian dining.

We had a blast celebrating at Rubato with their fancy Vegetarian Italian Omakase! We told them we don't eat meat or seafood, and they whipped up a 6-course masterpiece just for us. All we had to do was sit back, relax, and enjoy the delicious Italian dishes they served up!

Scallop, Uni angel hair pasta was 10/10, worth the price. Octopus was 10/10 too, charred taste and sauce goes well together. Crab leg pasta was alright 7/10. Big and juicy oyster 8/10.

We just had the best dinner date at @rubatosg ❤️!

They are one of the oldest & most prestigious Italian restaurants in Singapore founded in 2009. Do you know they are available till 2am daily for deliveries via @grabfoodsg & for dine-in during weekends, eve of PH & PH?

Among the dishes that we've tried in our 6 course Japanese-Italian Omakase, here's our top 3 picks! See till the end to salivate over what we enjoyed 😝.

🌟 "A Gift from the Angels"
You literally 🤯 when you take a mouth, it consist of Chilled Angel Hair Pasta, Hokkaido Scallops Sashimi, Exotic Japanese Seaweed, Premium White Truffle Oil And Freshly-caught Hokkaido Bafun Uni, the combination matches so well and they are really fresh!

🌟 Lobster Cappuccino & Mushroom Soup with Truffle
The soups are so flavourful & rich but not cloying, we just slurp down the soup till the last drop, it's definitely one of the best we've ever tried.

🌟 Cod Fish
The cod fish literally melts in the mouth, there wasn't much seasoning or sauce but you can taste the freshness of the fish in every bite!

You can enjoy a Japanese-Italian Omakase between 6 - 9 courses starting from $128++. The chef will decide on the menu, you can inform them of your dietary preferences & they will customize the menu accordingly for you! They also have regular menu if you prefer to choose your own dishes.

This restaurant is a perfect place for dates, gathering or celebrations. Recommended to make a reservation and enjoy the amazing dining experiences!

Celebrated my birthday with my girls at Greenwood! Mr Daniel was attentive and provided a great experience for us! The Tomahawk Steak & Seafood Platter is a MUST TRY! Ended the lovely night with amazing desserts, one of every kind! Thank you Daniel for the arrangement! Will be back!
