Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Food is not bad. Hummus and avocado tomato antipasto were tasty. Ordered the large pizzas. Taste was nice but rather thin. Fairly pricey menu. Desserts were nice. Waiting staff friendly and helpful. Lady staff was cheerful and welcoming.

Food was good, really enjoyed the mushroom soup. The pizza will really thin and light ( I'll let you decide whether its a good thing or bad thing ) and my favourite was the truffle fries. The menu was a little confusing as we were given 2 menus, but one of the labels for the kids menu was different than the others. The atmosphere is good if you want to eat peacefully. Ambience is nice and calm with a sort of vintage-y theme to it. The music is nice too. I will recommend this place and all the other places around it.

Ordered via Deliveroo but couldn’t add photos to the review. 12” Paper thin pizza as thin as a tortilla wrap that cost $30 each for the margherita and the pepperoni pizza. And this was the Large size already.

The box weighed more than the pizza itself. I don’t know how they actually allowed this to be sent out. Will definitely not be ordering from them again.

lovely place with great options. love the truffle pizza! atmosphere was relaxing and nice, we sat next to the kitchen so we could see the chefs make the pizzas :) the staff was nice enough to give us a free DIY pizza kit because of children's day too!

Attentive, friendly service staff, nice food, and good atmosphere. Easy parking space when we got there.
Vegetarian restaurants in Bukit Timah.name: Peperoni Pizzeria @ Greenwood

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
Celebrated younger sister birthday at Long Beach VIP room which has a minimum spending of $1000. Overall the food is awesome but somehow we don’t seem to enjoy the Canada crab.. the service is also top class as they are friendly and serve us well. Keep it up!

Came here because there’s a queue for Jumbo beside this restaurant. Decided to give it a try as this place’s quite busy too. We were ushered to a table but then it’s hard to get the servers’ attention when we were about to make orders.

We ordered the Canadian chili crab as recommended by the server and it didn’t disappoint. The crab was huge and fleshy where I craved for more of it as the chili sauce was so good. We even ordered mantou buns to dip in the sauce and it’s delicious.

The steamed fish was delicious as the flesh was soft and flavorsome. The razor clams with minced meats and vermicelli were fresh and flavorful. I liked the noodles with oysters too especially the crispy bits of the topping.

I had a fantastic experience at this restaurant! The food was absolutely superb, and the service was top-notch. During my visit for lunch, I had the pleasure of trying both the chili and pepper crab dishes. The crab meat was incredibly fresh, and the dark pepper sauce was a standout—it paired perfectly with the crab. To end on a sweet note, I indulged in the mango coconut dessert, which was not only beautifully presented but also impressively layered. I highly recommend this place for an unforgettable dining experience!

I've been here twice, and both times are good. Food is tasty, especially love the Irish duck and white pepper crab. The staff are friendly but not attentive as it seems like they are very short-handed. Overall, the experience is enjoyable, and I will be back.

No matter how tight is your schedule in your Singapore visit, you have to try the crab plate in Long Beach UDMC. UDMC is rightfully famous for its delicious black pepper crab, the plate that I ordered there. The crab is cooked tender, and the sauce is incredible. This was my first time eating a crab and I am definitely not disappointed.

I should warn my European friends that the price rates are quite high in this restaurant, the prices are excluding tax (US style) and no service in the restaurant is free (even tissues).

I recommend Long Beach UDMC for visiting once but only once
Seafood in East Coast Park.address: 1202 ECP, #01-04 East Coast Seafood Centre, Singapore 449881
Seafood in East Coast Park.name: Long Beach UDMC

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
Grub 🍛🍛🍛🍛
Dricka 🍻 🍻 🍻
Price 🔪 🔪
Vibes 🏮 🏮 🏮
Service 🙇 🙇 🙇 🙇 🙇
Parking 🅿 🅿 🅿 🅿
Overall 🏆 🏆 🏆 🏆

Sze-Char with highball 🥃, beer or stout from tap. Fried rice, horfun and stingrays cooked in two - butter and sambal. Curry rice sets with sunny side up 🍳 is awesome too. Not your usual coffeeshop but booze with your locals

Went to order Fish head steamboat. it is good! the soup broth is nice and not overly salty. i dont feel thirsty compared to other place i patron.
The fish portions is good enough for 3 adults who just order the soup without other dish. We waited for 30 mins on a sunday evening as they are shorthanded.

We know this coffeeshop to be famous for the Fried Hokkien Mee.  Tonight, at 8pm, we arrived, relieved to know that this coffeeshop can host  a party of 5pax  (some coffeeshops turn us away because they only have the capacity to monitor 2pax in this pandemic).

Alas, the Fried Hokkien Mee was sold out. We stumbled upon Lagoon BBQ Seafood. We ordered:

1. Yangzhou Fried Rice (Excellent. The best YZ fried rice i ever tasted in SG. Got wok hei and each grain of rice is gorgeously evident)
2. Salted Egg Yolk Sotong (Excellent, Tasty and Crispy)
3. Sambal Kang Kong (Good, could be spicier with more sambal)
4. Sour Plum Pork Chop (Excellent. Umami)

I have lived in the east forever and I never knew of this Tze Char place. Well, I'd be back. This will be my go-to place in future. Move over, Hokkien Mee.

The best charcoal fish head steam boat in the east!!
Remember to try the Har Cheong Gai, hot plate beef cubes, clay pot roast pork taofu also 👍👍👍

Ordered hot plate tofu but the tofu was sour, thinking it’s us, we went on to try the sauce and even prawns are indeed sour. The $12 stingray was also a very meagre portion that probably look like $7.

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
Definitely one of the top 3 chili crabs in town, if not the best. The food dishes were excellent and at the right price point. Vast variety of seafood and other meats and veggies dishes to choose from. Thoroughly enjoyed the dinner here. Staff were friendly and efficient and the atmosphere of the East Coast branch is very nice, comfortable with plenty of seats for all. Can get packed during peak hours, if not, I highly recommend the outdoor seats that’s closest to the beach / foot paths. Highly recommended!

Service was fine but not outstanding, with the staff forgetting my request for ice water until i finished my meal. Nice ambience next to the beach with comfortable sea breeze. As for the food, black pepper crab was fine. Fried yam with scallop didn't taste freshly fried which was disappointing compared to what i tasted previously at the Ion outlet. Hor fun was decent. Mocha pork rib was the highlight here with the pork rib crisp on the outside and the meat tender plus a strong coffee flavour. May return for the ambience.

We were treated to an exemplary dining experience thanks to Julia. Her attention to detail and thoughtful arrangements for our lunch gathering went above and beyond! She anticipated our needs with professionalism and added special touch to our meal.

Lobsters, chili crab and black pepper crabs were amazing.

Thank you for the great seafood and hospitality 😊

Jumbo East Coast never failed to impress me for the past 20+ years. I’ve also met the most amazing person, Julia, since I patronised Jumbo East Coast. She is so amazing and always making sure that whoever I bring over for meals are always given the best service.
Thank you Julia and her amazing team for always making our experience at Jumbo an amazing and memorable dining experience. Kudos to you and your amazing team! ❤️

Wonderful food, helpful staff and great location by the beach. The place was crowded for a drizzly weeknight but the energy was awesome. The chilli crab could be a tad spicier. I hope they didn’t tone down the spice level for the many tourists who dine there. Their mocha pork ribs was super delish and tender. Everything was tasty!

Seafood in East Coast Park.name: JUMBO Seafood - East Coast

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
I had an incredible dining experience at here. From start to finish, everything was exceptional. The ambiance is inviting and elegant, setting the perfect mood for a memorable meal. The staff is knowledgeable, attentive, and went above and beyond to ensure our comfort. Their passion for hospitality shines through, making us feel truly valued.

Recently dined at this lovely restaurant and was blown away by the amazing food and service. The dishes were absolutely delicious, prepared with fresh ingredients and bursting with flavour. The staff was friendly, attentive and make sure aspect of our dining experience was perfect. Highly recommend! They provide a free delicious handmade abalone dumpling during the day!

Lux Cove offers a fantastic seafood experience. The ambiance is charming but can get crowded. The service is friendly and knowledgeable.

Alaska King Crab with the promo , the waitress suggest me the 3 eat , its very surprising me.

Prices are on the higher side, but the quality justifies it. Overall, a memorable seafood dinner.

Wonderful experience on first time home delivery . Great services from the professional chef and service crew on site . Exactly same taste and service when you at the restaurant. My family and friends are very delighted and satisfied with this home delivery experience . Will definitely engage their service again

Today's family reunion my family and I having dinner at Lux cove restaurant. The decoration of this restaurant is very sophisticated.
What surprised me was the food and the way it was served. Especially the seafood decoration, not only exquisite but also very fresh. If you have the opportunity to bring your family and friends to try the food in this restaurant.  I highly recommend Sashimi here, not only words can describe its freshness.

Seafood in East Coast Park.name: Lux Cove Seafood 富景

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
Yummy food and the price is not too expensive. Love the deep fried fish with sambal chilli, super crispy! Hor fun has good wok hei too.

Had lunch - boss mee sua, coffee ribs, prawn rolls, fish maw soup, crispy sotong, cai Po tofu. Pretty standard zhi char food. Good quality and tasty. Best dish would be the crispy sotong. Boss mee sua below average.

$50 for grouper hotpot with 8 slices of fish filet and lots of fish parts in the soup. Really nice. When I was there, I think every table ordered this so a must have. $12 for the prawn paste chicken. Nice with the soup if you like meat. Best thing is no corkage charge for wine lovers with dinner. Bad thing is 10% service charge on bill. You need to tell the helpers 2-3 times to do something. Like..can i have a soup-base refill. Can I order now? So the service charge is really not for service but to pay the staff, which is fine but when it is added automatically onto your bill for ok service, you feel somewhat disappointed. Nevertheless, the food is good and people/staff is quite nice. Overall, I will be a repeat customer.

We were taken to this restaurant by our Singaporean friend on a weekend trip. The food and atmosphere were great, and the price was reasonable. The signature chilli fish tasted amazing. The service was outstanding - friendly waiters. The restaurant is about 20 minutes drive from the city centre.

Loved the red grouper fish steamboat. Tasty broth with deep fried yam, spinach and cabbage with fresh slices of grouper fish.  Sambal kangkong was good, balanced flavour of spiciness, and saltiness from the haebee.
Seafood in East Coast Park.name: Lai Huat Signatures

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
Old school kind of restaurant. Supposedly creator of chili crab. Tried both kind of chili crab with and without eggs, it was different and nice not so ketchup taste n less starchy. We had the fried fish with Thai mango sauce, good! Crispy US duck was good, tender n skin was crispy.

Superb dinner and seafood experience with the work team. Everything was done excellently. Deep fried baby squid, duck, Cereal prawns, fish and crabs. Amazing. Will want to come back again with family.

16 Jul 2023: back here to celebrate mum BD. Nice food, firm meaty crabs and excellent service. Tried the curry fish head as it was birthday girl's favourite.

I love the old school vibes here! Traditional Chinese restaurant set in the 80s! This place has been around since 1956, and the food is great! Service is also good! Love the chilli crab here and they are apparently the creators of this iconic dish! We had Buddha jump over the wall soup, baby kailan, chilli crab with mantou, and a fried mee sua. What a memorable and amazing experience! Will definitely be back again soon! We also got to say hi and bye to the friendly founder and owner on our way out!

Nice food n great service. The boss is always friendly n welcoming. My gal loves the Chili Crab n it’s always a must have dish on the table for her when she goes to Roland Restaurant.

One of the old school Chinese restaurants that the entire extended family goes to over the years during special occasions. Has nice Tim sum and Chinese cuisine. 5 stars for sentimental value and nostalgia. Good to know that the restaurant is still around after all these years.

Family had a 10 course meal to celebrate a few birthdays.

Cold dish was so so. Would prefer sliced lobster with mayonnaise to lobster balls among other things.
Lotus paste bun was ok, but it is always fun to have it styled as longevity peaches which are linked to Chinese mythical stories.
Buddha jumps over the wall was nice, but every individual soup pot ingredients are non-uniform. You never know what your going to get till you open the lid. 😂
Suckling pig was awesome! Crispy! 😋
Razor/Bamboo clams were delicious.
Asparagus was decent.
Drunken prawns were ok.
Chilli crab is the signature dish with fried Mantou buns which are a childhood favourite. 🤩
Steamed pomfret was good.
US duck was yummy.
Seafood in East Coast Park.name: Roland Restaurant
Indo Banana Leaf BBQ Seafood

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
Excellent choice for family dinners. The food is 10/10, every dish is perfect - it's very difficult to reach that level of consistency across a big menu. The prawns are super fresh and super sweet. The bamboo clams are very big and flavourful. The food also came very fast even when all tables are full. The price is very reasonable. There's an outdoor seating area - good for kids to run around. Parking lots right in front of the restaurant. The only downside is the noise when the restaurant is full due to the relatively small space. Overall very highly recommended place.

Great Food at reasonable price, lobster porridge and white pepper crab definitely a must have, the white pepper is quite different from the usual ones I had, it’s flavorful and spicy. Highly recommend 👍👍👍

The restaurant serves fresh and live seafood which tasted delicious. I would recommend you to visit this place with your family and friends!

It’s been our 3rd visit here since their opening. The food is amazing! Fresh seafoods and portions are good! Love their white pepper crab! It’s our favourite place to go for crab! Their current promotion is 50% off Alaska crab.
Friendly boss and staff! Thank you for the great food and great service!

All the food was very fresh and delicious, very affordable pricing! Went to eat on their opening week, although restaurant was very packed but the staff are still very friendly & efficient! Must try their Chili Crab! Will go back again! 🙏🏿🙏🏿🙏🏿
Seafood in East Coast Park.name: 城记海鲜 Cheng Ji Seafood Restaurant

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
Food was just okie but not the price paying for.

Chicken Chop - Salty.

Satay - Not bad.

Stingray - Chilli and Sauce okie, stingray meat was very blend.

Chilli crab - so so ok.

Food presentation - can be much better.

Staff n service - courteous and friendly.

Overall - Personally I reckon there is better option out there.

Chilli kangkong - okie.

Always busy on weekends but if the ground floor dining area is full, then they will try to accomodate the walk-in crowd by opening up the top floor if no prior reservation is occupying it and we were 1 of those group that came in. The 2nd floor dining area can fit about 50pax. The food is ok2 only...
We had Hong Kong Steam Fish which was ok, sambal kang kong is good, Seafood Tom Yum Soup was veey good, Hotplate Beancurd was ok, Sweet & Sour chicken was nice so is the omelette prawn was good too. Who doesn't like eggs?...  😅😅😅

Great place to go to if you are stressed and want a taste of comfort food that is not complicated and hits the spot. The taupok and youtiao rojak is the best I had in a while. My kuaytiao mee goreng was yummy with sambal and tomato.

It's the time eating at this outlet..they have a musolla for Muslim to pray..2nd floor .the food were good and tasty .. varieties of drinks and the atmosphere,scenery  was awesome because you are facing the seaside!
Will come again to try their noodles dishes .

Made a reservation for our group of people and they accepted. We ordered our foods already and almost 1 hour later then they came and informed us that some of the foods will take very long to cook and request us to change our orders.

For some of our pax , food took a total of 2 hours before they arrive on our table.

2.5 hours later, some food still did not arrive.

It would be understandable if the restaurant was packed with dinner crowd. Unfortunately there were only us in the restaurant during lunch time with no crowd.

A little hard to swallow the fact that you sit in an empty restaurant and not having your food served after 2 and a half hours.

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
I think they have changed ownership. Didn't see the usual uncle and auntie at the stall anymore. The quality of food had dropped, compared to the previous owners. Serving was fast. Price was affordable. Staffs were friendly and helpful.

A bit disappointed with the flower clam beehoon from this stall. The clams are tasteless as though they have been boiled in water for a long time before adding to the beehoon

Try the

salted egg squid sotong 3/5 - average.. definitely not the best I ever had in ECP food Village.. credits to the portion.. looked creamy but the butter is too much until cover the salted egg...

Salted fish egg fry rice 3/5 - below average.. can't taste the  salted fish although got salted fish in cube size.. a good salted egg fry rice must use the original oil (fry salted fish) to fry the rice.. the rice not enough wok.. overall taste plain.. the prawn are fresh but they did not remove the vein..

Chili Clamp 3/5 - taste so so only.. not the best I ever had in food Village..  the sauce aren't great...

Average I would say.

The worst attitude as hawker owner I have experienced so far. They treat you like nobody, scow you, forget about your order…

Extremely disappointing.

Mediocre food at best. Tried once, didn't like it. Also noticed that staff enjoys giving out menu a lot.

Seafood in East Coast Park.address: 1220 ECP, #5&6, East Coast Lagoon Food Village, 468960
Seafood in East Coast Park.name: Xin Long Xing Seafood BBQ (新龍興海鲜烧烤)

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
Recommended to order their fried baby squid. It was really very good, firm to chew, crispy and delicious. Very addictive. Sambal stingray was fresh, meat was tender. Sambal was spicy enough too. Definitely worth a try!

We used to love the BBQ stingray from this stall. This time round, we ordered the stingray $20 and blood cockles $8. The cockles didn’t taste fresh. The stingray also didn’t taste as good and fresh as before. My friend and I who ate the cockles had  diarrhea the next day. I don’t recommend this stall anymore.

First time trying the food from this stall, usually we have a specific stall that we always go to but decided to give other stall a try this time round.  Quite surprised that they are Halal certified, so its Muslim friendly. Menu is pretty extensive, can cater to different tastebud. Like most stalls over here, they have bbq seafood as well.

Ordered 3 dishes, sambal stingray, Kailan in oyster sauce and an onion Omelette. Food took about 15mins to 20mins to be ready. Taste wise, not bad but there is room for improvement. One thing I didn't really like was that the food was already cold when served. My guess, was due to waiting for all the dishes to ready and served together and as a result the food turn cold.

Overall, food was acceptable. Not really sure if i would return though.

Cockles stank of mud. Inedible. Will not recommend. Hoping we will not fall sick tonight!!

Super yummy mee goreng and loaded with flavour! Perfect spot to stop off while cycling the PCN to refuel.

Seafood in East Coast Park.address: 1220 ECP, #01-11 East Coast Lagoon Food Village, Singapore 468960
Seafood in East Coast Park.name: High Kee BBQ Seafood

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
I won’t say much.. photo said a thousand words!! Crab is around 800+gram cost me $86 but it’s REALLY WORTH IT! The meat is so meaty and fresh! Oh My GOD! Im surprise to find this standard in hawker rather then in Famous crab restaurant.. Seeing is beliving!! Come down try yourself.. 👍🏻👍🏻 oh yah. The aunty wearing Rolex is very friendly too. 👍🏻👍🏻

Loved the sambal stingray and the BBQ prawn. Had the order as take away so the family can dine at the sea side area. The lady is so thoughtful and ensure that all the utensils and the needful are properly assorted for us. We had a fabulous sunset meal at the seaside.

Outstanding!  The stingray was tender, and the sambal had just enough heat.  The satay was delicious. The calamari was crisp and tender.  Combined with the outdoor setting on a beautiful evening, it was amazing!

A beautiful and thick slab of stingray, nicely grilled with a smooth texture. Sambal packs a punch too and surely not for the faint of heart!

Loved the BBQ crab that I ordered for a mini celebration today. The meat was thick, solid and chunky, crab weighed 900g. Everything they cook here tastes great. Usual favourite items I order are Tua Tao, BBQ Spicy Stingray, Salted Egg Prawn and Deep Fried Baby Sotong!  Loved it!

Seafood in East Coast Park.name: Stingray Forever BBQ Seafood

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
2 for $45++ crab promotion but there wasn’t any advertisements for it except on their facebook page, no posters or anything in store so you’d have to ask for it. Crab was very small, was told 500-600g but we felt like it was a lot lesser as the crabs do not contain much meat in them. Sauce was alright, towards the spicier spectrum.
Mantou buns were $1 each which was quite pricey.
We also ordered the champagne pork ribs ($16) that was good, lean pork with slight champagne taste. Rice ($1.50) was a small portion.
Wet wipes are $0.50 each.
Overall wouldn’t come back again even with the promo as we felt the price wasn’t justified, service was also alright. Parking is in the condominium, quite a walk from the restaurant as you can only park at the visitors lot. The security doesn’t really care about where you’re going so you don’t have to deal with them.

Found in a condo. Cosy and  homely place for dinner. Food is nice canto style.

2 pax meal was bit pricy but to be fair we had steam clams.

Worth a try. Good for family meals.

Had to pay for parking at the condo though. Hdb rates.

Went for dinner on a Friday night after reading the good reviews on google map. Ordered their signature dishes, BeeHoon, pork, veg, prawn and crab.

The pork is average, done-ness is just nice, not too sweet but a bit of starchy after taste.

The BeeHoon is below average for me. they put too much ginger and cover the taste of the clam and BeeHoon. The sauce is too starchy which is not what I expected. Good thing is it is not salty.

the veg is average, the taste is good and the veg is young. but there are too little century egg and salted egg. the sauce is also too starchy.

the prawn is good, full of wine taste. the doneness is ok. but it is suppose to be in a wooden pot with stone but they say they run out of that so only normal steam for us.

the crab is above average, the sauce is good, one of the better one that I have tasted. but the crab is a little over cook, the meat is a bit tough. they do not have big crab, only those 500g +- kind. the crab meat is not sweet and do not have any crab taste.

Very cozy place with good food that is reasonably priced.

Standard of food and service was maintained reasonably well even after the CB period, there were fewer people patronising this outlet on a Saturday night but it deserved better attendance. Chilli crab sauce was a bit disappointing- dropped quite a bit from our first patronage. I liked the dessert - being lemon grass jelly. Overall, not bad, a satisfying dinner.
Seafood in East Coast Park.address: 5000F Marine Parade Rd, #01-22/23 Laguna Park Condominum, Singapore 449289
Seafood in East Coast Park.name: Diamond Kitchen

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
Food was good. Enjoyed the steak, they had some fanciful cocktails which I enjoyed too. The East Coast branch has a different concept, they serve seafood too. Would encourage anyone who has not been to try!

great food at affordable prices. Enjoyed the atmosphere and especially the cocktails! Tiramisu was also interesting with the lava topping.

Had a beautiful dinner last night. Very good atmosphere, music and decoration. In term of food my favourites were: the steak and the seafood bowl.
The service was attentive and no waiting time despite the restaurant being full.
Prices are very reasonable for the quality of the food & beverage! Will be definitely come back!

Went down on the 23rd of Nov 2023. Ordered the feather blade steak, scallops, coffee martini and tiramisu. Food was fresh, nicely plated and delicious. Prices were fair. Ambience was great. The staff were friendly and Nicholas particularly gave good recommendations and constantly checked in if the food was good. 10/10 would go again.

Great Food, Affordable pricing. Great Drinks. Superb Atmosphere
Seafood in East Coast Park.name: The Feather Blade | Steak, Sando & Seafood Bar

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
Decent experience if you are looking for some halal seafood restaurant around the Kembangan area.

1. Salted egg chicken is always a hit, portions are a little small. So do note when ordering for a bigger group.
2. Salted egg prawns were well fried such that we were able to bite through the shells
3. Beef with veges was really average and don't think you should be ordering this
4. Chili crab was honestly pretty decent but sure packs a punch!

Overall, the quality of the food was decent however felt that the food could have came a little hotter as it was freshly prepared.

Easy to find @ near Changi Road roadside. Seat no problem. But, the food cook not (  sorry ) nice. Especially the fried chicken lemon.

Went for my birthday - food was good and staff were helpful and friendly. I love the crispy baby squid and theirs did not disappoint. Highly recommended!

Had a company dinner here. Food was good but not great. The fried noodles were unexpectedly delicious. Chili crab was normal tasting but the there was a lot of gravy. The sweet sour spicy fish was mostly spicy, didn’t have the sour savoury taste. But the fish wasn’t fresh out of the water. There were many tables. Enough to fit 10 people each. Toilet was relatively clean. Parking was quite easy to find nearby.

The food quality at this place has gone from bad to worse. The eggs in the hot blade ate burnt. The chicken used are frozen and not well cooked.  Only the drinks seemed normal. Would definitely fire the chef at this place!
Seafood in East Coast Park.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM
Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM

Seafood in East Coast Park.name: Chai Chee Seafood Restaurant

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
First time here for a family dinner. The set menu prices are very reasonable. I ordered a set for 8 pax and 3 additional dishes and my family of 12 pax ended up packing some of the food home because  the portions were really generous and we couldn’t finish. The staff were also kind enough to serve all of us dessert even though the dessert that comes with the set was only for 8 pax. Also received some vouchers for our next visit :)

Not as appealing as other famous Seafood restaurants but the food was pretty good! Generous in portion and still delicious! Just ambience seems sad and deserted!

They are very accomodating in terms of service and the food is taste Good.The staffs also is very friendly . They serve on time . ❣️HOME OF SEAFOOD/SUSHI

First time here. All food we ordered exceeds our expectation. Especially the butter prawns and chili crab. But chili crab is slightly too spicy. Super large sized crabs. Very meaty. The meat is full and intact. Expensive but worth it. Will surely come again next time.

We came here to celebrate a birthday! I feel you can get better halal seafood elsewhere bt the service here is just impeccable! For 10 pax, it’s about 51 per person inclusive of gst. And we were stuffed! It was so good. Highly recommend this place for huge family lunch.

Seafood in East Coast Park.name: Home of Seafood

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
Didn’t expect much but everything turned our VERY GOOD. The crab was $50 but it was huge and fresh. 10/10 would recommend ✨

Impressed with the food here! Sotong, stingray, Lala and even the kailan tasted great!! Salted egg Sotong is crispy and nicely flavoured! Would come back to try other dishes.

Tasty pepper crab. Live fresh crab and good size. Reasonable price with very good service. Highly recommended to seafood lovers.

The only place I go to for seafood, it’s always consistent and reasonably priced. Would recommend their cereal prawn, black pepper crab and steamed fish. No regrets, only regret over ordering and not being able to finish all the good food.

My go to stall when I am at east coast and have craving for some seafood. One of my favorite dish from there is the bbq stingray. The sambal chilli is very good - spicy and have a good aroma. Stingray is fresh and generous! The okra goes very well with the sambal also! Recommended to try if you are in the area

Seafood in East Coast Park.name: Eastern Red Seafood

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
Came here for Stingray, Kangkong, and Black Pepper Crayfish. Stingray and Kangkong got a good kick in their chilli taste! 👍

Crayfish wise, the crayfish was a bit small and correspondingly the meat was rather small too but the black pepper paste was pretty good! Can give it a try. 😋

Came 3rd.time (March 2023).. the squid portion remain same. Yummy yummy

Stingray - $20sgd... I like the sambal and freshness.. tender... portion ok... sambal taste good.. 5persons sufficient..

Baby kailan $10sgd.. enough for 4persons.. not enough fragrance in my dictionary

Salted Egg sotong $20sgd.. the best of the best... omg.. the cuts / the umami / the flour used to fry with the squid.. WALALA... melt in my mouth.. I like it..  yum yum..

16 BBQ Seafood calls this "seafood fried rice" for 6 dollars (half a prawn cut in half and that's it). When asked where's the seafood they started shouting to not come back if don't like. Stay away

If you are heading to Eastcoast Park lagoon for dinner and not sure which stall to choose, look for Meiqi Cuttlefish Kangkong and Bbq seafood ! (HIGHLY) Affordable and (EXTREMELY) fresh ! 😉 yummy tummy

Ordered a bbq sambal stingray, portion was smaller compared to other stalls, the fish doesn't taste fresh and it wasn't even hot when served.

Seafood in East Coast Park.name: Mei Qi Cuttlefish Kangkong BBQ Seafood

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
Ming’s kitchen has a chain of zhichar stalls island wide. I have already seen a few of their stalls in various coffeeshop. Happen to be in Marine Terrace area and decided to give this place a try. We were there around 7pm and there were many people having takeaway.

Ordered three dishes and the food didn’t take long to arrive although the staff did inform us that there is at least 30mins waiting time. We order the 3 cups chicken, stir fry Hongkong Kailan with garlic and fuyong omelette.

Food was not bad, got nothing much to complain about. 3 cups chicken was quite good, unlike most place where they chicken piece with bone, they use chicken thigh here, much convenient to eat.

Overall, worth coming back again to try other dishes.

Very bad experience at this stall. Ordered 2 portions of Sing Chow Beehoon, but got kids size, containers were not even half full for $9.40!! Also beehoon wasn't fully cooked!! Very disappointing! Seems like cook only made one portion by mistake and then split it into 2 portions, didn't border to make a 2nd one! Not serious to run a business like that!

Avoid this place at all costs, if you can. Food quality and quantity is not good. Think about paying 30 bucks for a dish that is made up of ingredients costing $3 or $4, either they are extremely super stingy or just plainly outrageously trying to rob you in daylight (without even blinking an eyelid),

Service is very bad. Very unfriendly people. They say open but then say to me come back at 4pm when it was 2.50pm. What is this huh? I can literally see your stall open and if there's staff there, why don't just make the food? Price is ok and food taste good but only wished that the service was better than this.

Food is average, portion is small but pricey. Only advantage is I can call in advance to order and collect later.

Seafood in East Coast Park.reviews:
No frills. Just good, satisfying dim sum. You order, you eat, you leave content. Yang zhou was surprisingly tasty than expected. Distinct wok hei. Dumplings were fresh and chewy. Generous fillings of prawns. Service was quick, efficient, no nonsense.

Dim sum is good and very fresh. Seems like older people tend to visit and may not leave reviews which could be the reason why the not-so-high rating is as such. Personally don't think the rating is reflective of the food! Maybe it's a bit pricey but would definitely recommend this place. Har Gao has really fresh and big prawns, Fan Choy is also delicious. Liu Sha Pao has sweet, watery custard. Carrot Cake is very flavourful and has additional ingredients inside too. Didn't try the porridge but will do so next time. Zi Char also seems quite popular here, a lot of people ordered fried rice. Very sad thing is the parking here is horrendous :'( But really worth a visit!

Enjoyed the har Gao and xiao long Bao here, delicious and well-made! Recommend the pan-fried carrot cake (not in picture) as well, super fragrant, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

Tried out this newer location of Mongkok Dimsum in East Coast and the food was consistently good like other branches. This place is smacked in the great Joo Chiat area so you can also have a pleasant walk around the neighborhood after your meal to digest the food 😁💯👌

pleasant experience dining at mongkok dimsum, with a large variety of meat & carb dishes as well as dim sum. beef hor fun was good, veg dishes were fresh and well cooked. dimsum was pretty okay - not the best but good and satisfying enough.

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
went for dinner as we really wanted to try beef wellington. taste of the food is good. but serving size is quite small for the price.
place is a bit busy but there’s only a few servers so they’re hands are full. so a bit of wait time. but they are very nice people.

Exceptional service - a well oiled friendly machine. Genuinely impressed at how smooth everything was. Food (chicken wings and steak) were spot on too. It's got a bar vibe overall with a combo of tables and chairs + tables and bar stools.

I liked it very much. Very good ribs and chowder. Excellent service. Nice ambiance. Happy Hour 4pm-6pm. Large food menu for dinner (starting at 4pm). Large drink menu too with many options for tap and bottle beer, wine, cocktails.

Food was delicious, well priced with decent size portions. Scallops and Beef Wellington were my top picks however If I'd gone again a steak was next on the hit list. Looking for a warm and cosy venue on a cold night? Look no further than Brazz, no booking no worries. Visited twice on our 11 day Queenstown holiday and thoroughly enjoyed both visits.

Awesome food. Staff kept leving door open with horrible wind blowing on me

Updated, two years on. The food was really good. However they got my order wrong twice. Forgot a condiment and j had To ask a third time before they brought it over. The staff were really nice though.
Western cuisine in Queenstown.opening_hours:

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
We stumbled upon this restaurant by pure chance, and what luck it was! The food was incredibly delicious, and the atmosphere was very inviting. However, the service left much to be desired; they weren't particularly friendly or attentive. Don't miss out on their amazing bread!

This was really disappointing! First, the owner asked if we want sparkling water. We asked for tap water. We were given bottled water and charged $5. We thought it was law that drinkable water is free, or at least cheap. Second, we were given a small table next to the door which had freezing air flowing in. I politely checked if we could change a table as there were three free ones. The owner almost yelled “no” and walked away. The other tables would have been good. Third, the seafood pasta I ordered was awful! It tasted no flavor, the white sauce was just cream, no garlic or wine or oil, and I found heaps of celery in it. It’s just weird. The pizza had lots of fresh toppings but needed seasoning. We paid $105 for a beer, a juice, a water, a pasta and a small pizza and we opted not to tip.

Yeah that famous garlic bread is famous for a reason, so delicious! They have half portion options for their food which is so great! Also fun to add to the chalk walls in the bathrooms

Good hearty food in a rustic old style farmhouse. We had the portofino pizza (highly recommended), spaghetti bolognese (a classic done well) and the spaghetti with chicken livers (delicious). Portions were decent sized and good enough to share. Prices are on the high end but that's pretty much what to expect when in Queenstown.

They don't take reservations, so just show up early and put your name down for a table. Service is efficient and food is out pretty quickly.

They “surprised” us by adding celery to our Her Majesty’s Pleasure pizza?? It was disgusting and not anywhere on the menu or list of ingredients. They need to tell customers before adding random ingredients to their order — especially with pizza that has specific listed toppings so you can customize.

The bolognese sauce on our second pizza still had whole bay leaves still in it, which are inedible.

Also, this is the only restaurant we’ve visited in Queenstown that makes you to pay $12 for water instead of offering free boiled tap water.

Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM

Western cuisine in Queenstown.address: Cow Lane, Queenstown, Otago 9300, New Zealand
Western cuisine in Queenstown.name: The Cow

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
Came here about 2 times.

Absolutely loved our dining experience here. Food, service, and atmosphere were amazing. Sherie (hope I got your name right) was the friendliest/warmest host and actually explained to us the menu and followed up with thoughtful wine suggestions.

I highly highly recommend eating here. Everything from their steaks to seafood were top drawer. Will be back for sure.

Couldn't be happier after dining here at Botswana Butchery. My partner & I are visiting celebrating our engagement and we were not disappointed! The food was delightful. The waitress we had was friendly and so attentive! We even got a complimentary dessert which made our day! Was seeking a quality steak all week long and I finally found it! This is the place to go to for sure!!!

Beautiful atmosphere, amazing food and really great service, it’s an experience coming to Botswana Butchery.
The menu has an abundant selection of delicious food to choose from, there is something for everyone and especially so if you are a meat eater.
For starters we had the bone marrow and the tuna tataki….my husband was very impressed with the bone marrow and the quality of the tuna in the tataki was very high.
For mains we had the half duck and the wagyu eye fillet. The half duck was so delicious and cooked to perfection. The eye fillet also was cooked beautifully.
The only small thing which I didn’t like are the prices of the wine. They have an amazing selection yes, but prices were insane. I know how much I can buy these for and a 300% mark up is crazy.
Other than that, we had a great experience- just be prepared that it will be pricey.

Highly recommend Botswana. Service was great and the food was amazing. We had the crispy squid, lamb loin, t-bone steak and eye fillet with sides and they were superb and the pudding for dessert was delish.

Great dining experience on a cold, snowy day. Beautifully cooked whole NZ lamb shoulder served with absolutely perfect duck fat potatoes - crispy on the outside, soft in the middle and hot. We ordered the seasonal vegetables which was asparagus with hollandaise sauce; again, very tasty. The slow cooked lamb was served on a warmed plate accompanied by a nice jus and mint jelly on the side. Able to carve it with a spoon - cooked to perfection. Staff were great, the experience exceeded our expectations.

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
We recently dined at Lombardi in Queenstown and had a truly delightful experience. The variety of dishes we tried left us thoroughly satisfied. We savored the mouthwatering medium rare beef, the succulent confit duck, and the flavorful salt and pepper calamari. The catch of the day was unfortunately not up to par, but the attentive staff promptly resolved the issue when we had to send it back.

To accompany our main courses, we indulged in the delectable polenta fries, which, while a bit lackluster in taste for our liking, were still enjoyable. The Caesar salad provided a refreshing and tangy addition to our meal.

For dessert, we were treated to the heavenly trio sorbet and the classic crème brûlée. Both desserts were prepared with finesse and left us longing for more. What made our dining experience truly memorable was the personalized dessert arranged for my dad by the kind and attentive staff. It truly showed their commitment to providing exceptional service.

Over the years, Lombardi has received numerous awards for its outstanding culinary offerings and impeccable service. The restaurant has consistently been recognized for its commitment to quality, earning accolades that showcase their dedication to excellence.

In conclusion, Lombardi in Queenstown is a must-visit for anyone seeking a memorable dining experience. From the mouthwatering beef and amazing duck to the flavorful calamari, the restaurant's menu boasts a range of delightful options. Though a couple of dishes fell short of expectations, the exceptional service and attention to detail more than made up for it. Lombardi's well-deserved accolades reflect their commitment to providing a remarkable dining experience.

Celebrate my birthday here last march. Nice food and service plus great view from restaurant.

Great service, amazing fresh food and very quality. Very nice view as well.

Food  large  portions delicious.
Could do with some extra staff training.

Was fortunate enough to try out this restaurant after a day on the slopes as it was part of the hotel & was too tired to venture out to the city.

This place definitely did not disappoint! The breakfast options are nice but dinner was even better! It also had a nice cosy & fancy restaurant feel to it during the dinner service.

The service by Kyle was fantastic, friendly & attentive.

We ordered:
- the soup of the day (pumpkin) 👌🏼👌🏼
- seared scallops with octopus 👌🏼👌🏼
- fish of the day 👌🏼👌🏼
- bakes lasagne 👌🏼👌🏼👌🏼

Standout dish was the baked lasagne for me & would fly back here just for that (& the views)! Having said that all the dishes were fantastic & well flavoured.

They also had daily specials & happy hour. The mulled wine was tasty as well!

Keep up the good work!

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
We love Lone Star Queenstown, great atmosphere and absolutely the best food in town.   A huge shout out to Eva, what a great host ... very personable and she adds so much to the way things are done at what is honestly our favourite restaurant anywhere.   Congrats Eva, we'll see you again Friday night at Table 14, we can't stay away!!
John & Lynda, Australia 🌏

Nice experience….after 11 years!

Our last visit to Lone Star, Queenstown was in 2011. The most recent visit was in December 2022 - during Christmas/ New Year holidays.

We were a group of 8, including 5 vegetarians. All the dishes we had were well prepared, and the wait time was reasonable. The service was friendly and efficient.

If my memory serves me right, the number of vegetarian options in 2022 is more than in 2011, which is great.

It was quite a nice experience dining at Lone Star, after the long drive from Christchurch. My only small complaint would be that there was no guacamole/ avocado in the nachos dish. The dish was tasty nevertheless, hence we didn’t mention it to the staff there.

I will be happy to dine here again.

Very disappointing experience.
The wait staff were friendly but quite slow and inconsistent with their level of service.
They had to change our drinks selection multiple times due to them not having ingredients or drinks available.
The food was not great my wife ordered salt and pepper squid and it was not edible, it was so salty it was like eating salt directly from a salt shaker.
The fish and chips tasted like crusty fat vat. None  of us finished our meals.
When we told the staff about the food quality they weren’t surprised and didn’t seem to care.
Let’s just say I will never go back to lone star Queenstown again.

Our server Basil was amazing, he was friendly and entertaining, thank you Basil. The food was worth the price you paid and absolutely delicious. Went there for my nieces 18th birthday, Basil sang her happy birthday and she was given a free desert.

Most enjoyable dinner we have had during our weeks stay in Queenstown.
Quesadillas to start were awesome. The ribs were great and I loved the coleslaw no the usual stuff. Then not having any more room we shared a white chocolate pudding that was super yummy and a great size to share. My daughter loved the frozen margarita and espresso martini.
The safe to drink still water was way better than other restaurants keg water

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
It’s a nice place to have a meal. Decent view of the wharf through the windows. Free clean filtered water (some venues don’t have this). The steak and ribs were nice (ribs especially were good value). The lamb was nice but slightly over cooked. I recommend this place and would try it again.

We love this place so much we went twice! Lovely views here too. Order the steak. Medium rare.  Lamb skewer. The yummy flavoured chips! And the tiramisu brownie! I’d love to return here one day…

Went for dinner on a Monday night. Service was excellent although we always are early eaters.

Great selection of meats and meals (vegetarians need not attend). We had a meat share platter. The ribs were delicious,  the chicken was moist and cooked so well, the sausage had a nice kick and steak was tasty.

I was also impressed at the drinks options, I do enjoy a bourbon and there was a great selection.  Also similar section for Whiskys.

Couldn't fit in dessert (even with the nice selection they had) but thought finish it off with an Espresso Martini.

Highly recommend Flame if you are in Queenstown.

Had a late lunch here after getting off the old steam boat. Loved the atmosphere, staff were super friendly, good local beer, restrooms were clean. Food was alright, maybe 3.5 stars. Our ribs were decent, maybe needs a little spicier smokier bbq sauce for more oomph (we asked for hot sauce and at least they had that), the coleslaw was lacking sauce and flavor, very bland, chips were good. The rump steak was good, but the burger was not, dry and kinda sad. Generous portions though. We would probably go back to try some different dishes next time at dinner time as they have more options, and for the friendly staff and atmosphere.

Didn't have reservation but was seated within 10 mins. This was on a Monday, around 9:30PM. Place was still packed. Somebody took my order right away. Had my starter and waited for almost 20mins for my main. They were busy so I guess it was understandable. Food was great in general.I would say they have one of the best ribs I have ever tasted here in NZ. Chicken was moist and flavourful but the Mozambique Prawn was a bit mediocre and underwhelming. And their chips! I am not a fan of chips but theirs were delicious. I actually finished a serving of chips for once. Serving was huge. Don't worry if you can't finish your meal. You can ask for a takeaway container so you can just bring home your leftover. Lunch sorted! I would still recommend this place to people wanting a decent meal while in Queenstown. They also open til late so if you are arriving late in Queenstown and you want to have a good meal before heading to your accommodation, head to this place.
Western cuisine in Queenstown.name: Flame Bar & Grill

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
Was hosted very well by our server Joseph! He was friendly and well spoken. Atmosphere was great. Ordered the market fish alongside a scotch fillet and both was excellent. Not to mention their scotched carrot which was so amazing. Overall highly recommended to try their steaks!

We had fabolous night dine in here, atmosphere is decent. They have good table service and acknowledge us so well for the menu, it's worth to have a wonderful night here. The food is unique and well-served.
The first floor you can have bar drinking with friends. Second floor are the restaurant part. Also they have nice dessert menu after having steak feasting.

No doubt about it, this place is seriously amazing! Just let the chef work their magic and enjoy the deliciousness. The staff here are super friendly. It's hands down the best spot for steak in Queenstown, my favorite restaurant in town.

Thanks so much for our wonderful experience and divine food.
Both our maitre D, and fabulous French waiter Charles were so professional and they ensured we had all we needed constantly, to make the night be a smooth seamless banquet of courses,
along with the other staff.  Sincere thanks to the chefs we didn't meet.  Food we wont forget!
Beautiful surroundings, best wines and lovely comfortable décor.

Absolutely the best steak I’ve ever had. Just trust the chef to cook the meat how it’s best done and enjoy. The staff are super friendly and knowledgeable of all the different cuts of steak. This is definitely the best steak place in Queenstown and probably my favorite restaurant in the town. For a side, get the truffle Mac n cheese too 👌🏻

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
Great atmosphere. Awesome interior.

Service was solid.

Food was good. Mussels in crème sauce were good but nothing to write home about.

Same for the eggs Benedict

The tabbouleh salad was really unexpectedly delicious.

We stopped here for breakfast before a big day of hiking. The service was very quick and the staff were very nice. The rosti was fantastic, a very generous serving. I’d definitely return as everything was delicious.

We made a booking for lunch but had to cancel as our day trip plans to Milford sound took longer than expected. But we decided to try our luck without reservation at dinner and boy are we glad for that decision! The food and service is impeccable and I truly enjoyed the crispy duck bun, along with the pork duo and polenta fries. Highly recommended visit !!

Absolutely amazing food. This was our first restaurant after arriving in Queenstown, and it had set such high benchmark standards for the rest of the trip.

The chowder is a must order as it was creamy and buttery. Perfect with the bread that came along. The beef rib sandwich was good as well. The fried pickle offered a tangy contrast to the sandwich.

Loved our dinner here - mussels were fabulous and staff were really attentive and friendly. We ordered the 2 hour slow cooked rib eye steak, fries, peaking duck and mussels with garlic toast. We sat outside and enjoyed the view of the lake.

Western cuisine in Queenstown.name: Ivy & Lola's - Kitchen & Bar

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
One of the best restaurants I have been to! Could not fault the food, service or ambience. Beautiful decor and very attentive and personable staff. Daniel was fantastic! A must visit when in Queenstown.

Wow, what an amazing restaurant! The food was of exceptionally high quality, and the service was outstandingly friendly and helpful. Our waiter went above and beyond to assist us in choosing dishes and even took a beautiful sunset photo of us outside the restaurant. The meal itself was simply superb; we had the steak and ordered a dessert of cake and crème brûlée.

This restaurant is amazing! The food is top-notch, and the service is super friendly. Our waiter helped us choose dishes and even took a great photo of us. The fish was absolutely delish!!!!

French onion soup - This was a good onion soup. The soup base was intense like the French ones but the French were too salty. This one was just right. One thing it can improve, more cheese.

Legendary seafood chowder - The name itself was a gimmick. I've had way better chowder from many many places. This was probably one of the more average one. Not saying it's not tasty, but the amount of cream, the thickness, and from all the seafood ingredients, you want to have a balanced but also strong enough to taste the presence of them.  Not impressed.

Beef bourguignon - Average.  The beef were fine but the sauce overwhelmed by red wine, you want to have red wine to compliment the flavor of the beef not the other way around. This one I couldn't taste the flavor of the beef but just wine.  The pasta was Al dente👍🏼.

Sirloin steak - Great quality. The beef is tender, tasty. The thickness of the steak actually became an issue.  The grill steak I had in America is not big by volume but thick as texture.  I also preferred stronger grill taste.  Normally, you need a very strong grill to char it, locked in the juice and then it'll crisp up on the outside then lower it to grill it to medium rare. Or you can sous vide it to perfect temperature and charred it with strong flame grill.  This steak was not grill to crisp, in fact, it was warm when it was served.  The peppercorn sauce also underwhelmed.  I had to add fresh ground pepper to spike up the flavor.

This is a fine dine restaurant, I expected more from it. Otherwise, it's still quality cooking and it's not fair to compare to Michelin stars restaurants.

My partner and I celebrated our engagement here last night and the service was absolutely amazing! The food was delicious and the atmosphere was amazing too, a big Thank-you for making our night so special 💗

We will most definitely be returning the next time we’re in Queenstown!

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
Some vegan options available - that's a great plus.
Red wines and white wines are all from Italy. Understandable although New Zealand has excellent wines in its own right. BUT wines - be red or white - are served at room temperature. Sorry, I couldn't drink my white wine. My wife ordered ice cubes... to improve the situation somewhat. I will never ever order wine in a restaurant in New Zealand - this restaurant killed it completely by serving white wine at this temperature...
Food was okay.

Exemplary authentic italian food with delicious handmade pasta, love the angus beef ravioli! Staff very attentive too, prices reasonable too around $24 for a pasta. Garlic bread will be better if there is more garlic, but bread is handmade and still good

Great service and atmosphere, awesome pizza. The only issue is the carbonara, the egg was added when the dish was too hot, so in turn i ended up with scrambled egg through the dish. Easy mistake for a novice. But overall a good experience.

Was super excited to try this place!
After a long day out adventuring Queenstown, we decided to order in. I was hyped for some authentic Italian as advertised but what we ordered was not that.

The gnocchi sauce tasted like it had been poured out of a tin from the supermarket and was topped with tasty cheese. The margarita pizza tasted like domino’s. Both meals were cold when they arrived and the delivery took 45 minutes longer than it said on the app.

For the price I paid ($62) I was expecting authentic Italian. Would not recommend if that is what you’re expecting.

OH EMM GEE.......HANDS DOWN - BEST ITALIAN FOOD IVE TASTED in a long time!!  The flavours were absolutely delicious as was my Aperol Spritz!  Amazing service just made this whole experience FANTASTIC!!  A MUST TO VISIT in QUEENSTOWN if you love ITALIAN CUISINE 🧡

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
Edit
The service was appalling, especially one of the shorter male staff, none stop rolling his eyes and no manners at all. Management should look into having more training with him.

My visit to Nest Kitchen and Bar in Queenstown left me with a delightful culinary memory. I had the pleasure of savoring their smoked salmon bagel, and it was a true culinary gem.

The bagel was perfectly toasted, providing just the right amount of crunch to complement the luscious ingredients within. The generous serving of smoked salmon was of the highest quality, offering a delicate balance of smokiness and freshness. The capers, red onions, and cream cheese added layers of flavor that harmonized beautifully with the star of the dish.

What truly stood out was the attention to detail in the presentation. The bagel was a work of art, as visually appealing as it was delicious. The service was friendly and efficient, adding to the overall enjoyable experience.

Nest Kitchen and Bar's inviting atmosphere and picturesque views of Queenstown's surroundings provided the perfect backdrop for this culinary experience.

In conclusion, the smoked salmon bagel at Nest Kitchen and Bar is a must-try for those seeking a memorable breakfast or brunch in Queenstown. It's a testament to the art of flavor and presentation, leaving a lasting impression on your taste buds and culinary senses.

One of the best dining experiences of our lives!

We went for the degustation menu and the food was simply excellent.

We would like to compliment the staff - every one of them were attentive, helpful, friendly and engaging.

The view was simply gorgeous!

Overall 10/10 experience. We would highly recommend this place for special occasions!

The view was amazing! I'd recommend coming during the day time instead of night time as you get the whole lake view. Food wise was good, but not amazing in terms of international fine dining standards. It just feels like something is missing. My cod was slightly salty, but the lamb rump was done beautifully. The service could be a bit more attentive but it was friendly. Probably come back for breakfast next time!

Our anniversary dinner at The Nest was one of the single best culinary and custom service experiences that we’ve ever had. From the moment we walked in the wait staff interacted at a professionalism that we’ve only experienced in 5 star resorts in Italy, and the food was a culinary experience that was second to none.

While I don’t enjoy dramatic or hyperbolic reviews, it’s safe to say this was easily within our top 3 dining experiences and we will come back any time we are in Queenstown.

It was a memorable experience, the location and the restaurant itself were outstanding.

Vanessa and the staff looked after us, introducing the chef's dishes with great savoir faire.

We opted for the tasting menu and all the dishes were meticulously prepared, with international flavours blended with local ingredients.

There was a prevalence of seafood options Although also pork, wagyu and lamb were available.

In terms of fine dining experience I was satisfied, and the price for me was perfectly in line with their offerings.

Surely this is a place you want to keep it in mind when you visit Queenstown.
Western cuisine in Queenstown.address: 139 Fernhill Road, Fernhill, Queenstown 9300, New Zealand
Western cuisine in Queenstown.name: Nest Kitchen + Bar

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
Tried to come on the Monday long weekend, but they weren't open.
Went Tuesday, and was definitely worth coming here.

Staff are incredibly friendly, wonderful atmosphere.  Food is really fresh. We were parked next to the kitchen, and could see everything being made.

Had a pizza which was made by the head chef. Was fluffy and delicious.  Would definitely come back next time I visit Queenstown.

I really enjoyed the cuisine at Bella cucina! We had a pizza and two pasta dishes.
The ingredient tasted fresh (including the parsley in the pasta) and the staff were friendly. Especially we were all impressed by your freshly made pasta which well cooked and went well with a sauce. Definitely would like to go back when we go to QT. Thanks!

Top notch food! Fresh, natural, and just so nicely cooked. The clam spaghetti was just natural and right on the spot. Will definitely go there next time we visit Queenstown. Have recommended to a few friends already.

This is one of best eateries in Queenstown. Small and intimate it does not move away from its authenticity. The food was amazing and delicious. Try the dough balls ( small bread buns) with their infused olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Vongoli pasta and chicken roulade. Don't be surprised however if you don't find these on the menu. Their dishes change according to the season and availability of produce.

We had an amazing dinner here. The pasta, seafood & risotto are super delicious. The restaurant atmosphere is chill and relax but a bit crowded cuz the seating area is quite small. Overall, highly recommended and early reservation is needed.

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
Really enjoyed it here. We came twice over the weekend. Super busy because of the marathon, our food did come out a bit warm but we choose to still eat it despite offers to rectify. We only give the feedback to save further customers complaining. We appreciated the offers to change but were happy to eat it. (Appreciated the complimentary soft drinks) The next time we had a wee cheeky Chappy serving us he was funny and cool and read the room of his customers. Well done sir. A real cool groovy place. Will recommend and return.

We visited on Easter Monday, when the weather was gorgeous and every single outdoor table was occupied. We took a high table inside with a nice view of the bar. The beer selection was great, and we ordered pints of Panhead Sandman Hazy IPA (yum!!) and the Loaded Nachos with Chili and Guacamole. The nachos, served in a hot cast iron pan, were among the best I have ever tasted!

The service was as friendly, the beers came quickly, and the food came very shortly thereafter.

We loved our meal and would be here often if we lived in QT!

Food was delicious, as had fish and chips, bbq cheeseburger and fish tacos. Cocktail dangerous daiquiri was really good as well.
The ladies served us so well and made us feel welcome. Thank you 😊

Great location with happy hour 3pm-5pm $8 house pints

Options available for all dietary requirements

Visited from the US and immediately felt like a local. The beer selection was fantastic, service was quick, and food was top notch. We had the cauliflower starter, and chicken burger, and “world burger” for our main. Overall the vibes were immaculate in this place, and we’ll definitely be coming again during our short time in New Zealand

Western cuisine in Queenstown.name: The World Bar & Restaurant

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
The only 6/5 I've ever wanted to give on a google review. We had an amazing dining experience doing the 8 course tasting menu. Everything was perfect from the atmosphere to the food & paired wines, and Grant's service was impeccable and incredibly knowledgeable (along with the others).

It's definitely the place to be if you want an unforgettable culinary experience in Queenstown.

We happened to stumble across this little cocktail bar after dinner somewhere else. Awesome cocktail menu, there is definitely something for everyone tastes and the barmen/ women are more than happy to make the classics too. They are beautiful presented with garish. It seemed to be quite a trendy spot for the tourists who were entertaining.

What an experience! We had an awesome night enjoying the 8 course tasting menu. Everything was perfect from the vibe to the food and wines I’d rate the experience 20/10. If you are looking for a nice meal perfectly paired with wines this is the place to go. The last dessert was the best with the late harvest Pinot gris wine.

Really wonderful food and service. Our party had the eight course tasting menu. Staff explained each course and wine pairing wonderfully. The wines were paired really well. Portions were large for tastings.
We were worried about dress codes, but the restaurant was lenient and we saw many parties with pretty casual clothes even though the atmosphere would indicate more formal attire.
There was no issue accommodating the nut allergy my friend had.
The only point of improvement would be the quality of cherries used in my aviation and other cocktails. It would have been preferable to get a luxardo or equivalent rather than a red maraschino.

I have had the pleasure of coming to The Bunker over the last ten years - it was exciting to come back after the renovations and see they’ve made more space to ensure more people can get bookings! Still feels like a wonderful almost speak east style atmosphere with great appointments a now larger restaurant bar but still kept the low heat fireplaces, leather, black table clothes and green “bookie” lights with the historical Queenstown photos to dine amongst.

The food is always spectacularly prepared and is of portion sizes which mean you can do three courses or a tasting menu without feeling like you have to roll yourself back to your accomodation.

The staff are incredibly inviting and knowledgeable about the local area, produce, flavours and dishes. Love a good chat with staff that are engaging and attentive.

Cocktails are great to enjoy - the Casino Royale Vesper is still a favourite - smooth and delicious with all courses but the wine list is wonderful without being confusingly large featuring many of those that make this province shine for their wine making talents.

For me it’s one not to be missed every visit on the near annual trips. Book early to get a preferred time with perhaps only 30-34 people able to fit in each half of the new renovations.

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
Such a fun place for breakfast! Awesome vibes throughout. Great food menu, with so many dietary options, and good service. It’s super busy though so definitely get there early.
We had the pancakes and the French toast. Both were delicious but our favourite has to be the French toast.

This place is hella popular and it's easy to see why. The main draw for me was plenty of options for dietary issues, and I had the eggplant dish which was a huge serving size and absolutely delicious. The staff had such a good vibe about them, and the almond mocha I ordered was probably the best I've ever had. If you can get a table, this place is definitely worth the hype!

Edit to add: I went back twice after my initial review and every single time the food and drinks were top notch. Can't recommend it enough!!

Food was tasty, and sharable. We got the beef brisket and an appetizer. We were able to share this between 3 girls. If you are hungry though, getting two apps and the brisket would probably suffice!

A standout health food place in my opinion, and my favorite meal in Queenstown. Ordered the Turkish eggs and the raspberry and pistachio French toast, which were both incredibly tasty and had creative flavoring—definitely not as basic as they sound. Combined with outdoor seating, it was a great brunch experience!

Yum! And very accomodating for our little one with food allergies. French toast was absolutely delicious, pancakes were yummy but did get a tad trifle-like-soggy under all the berries, might be better on the side? All around though a delicious breakfast and buzzing little place.

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
Wow! Very likely the BEST food I’ve eaten out all year! Couldn’t fault anything & as a Qtwn local we are intending this to be our regular dining experience! Was utterly superb!

Had steak somewhere in Queenstown, that meal make me think "Queenstown never compare to my CHCH" until I had Angus Steak here. That is what steak should taste like!!!
Everyone! MUST! COME!

The restaurant’s view is the only high thing I can talk about as it overlooks the mountains from the window. However the service attitude of staff is missing. We ordered dinner with soup,  entrée and main course and they served us main course first. When I asked about the soup, the rude reply came that I have only two hands to serve. Basic etiquette of serving a dinner are missing , looks like no training given to staff and how to speak to guests. Next day I order a simple Omlette and what I got was the most hopeless Omlette I ever had in my lifetime. The cook didn’t even know how to stuff the Omlette with simple fillings and the dish was just thrown on my table as if a great favour was done to me. Menu of breakfast was same for all the three days we stayed. The rooms are average and the bathing tub is risky as no anti skid mat. I felt so unsafe while taking bath. Overall I didn’t find it worth the price I paid for three nights

Had the most delicious dinner. The Ribye was amazing and Apparently the Salmon too. Dessert pavlova a good size and delicious. Highly recommend. 🤩😊

Very few vegetarian options, entrées were good but the mains were rather plain and unenjoyable. It is quite expensive for what you get even though the portion sizes were decent. The view and restaurant were beautiful and well kept, also the staff were friendly and polite. However, the food is the main reason to go to a restaurant and our meals simply weren't very good.

I would have a hard time recommending this restaurant for the price and quality.
Western cuisine in Queenstown.opening_hours:

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
My companion and I chose Mackenzies for our first dinner in Queenstown as we’re staying at the Heritage. We noticed that it’s been a while since a review so here is an update.

The menu is simple and provides enough of a range to suit anyone’s pallet. There’s a dedicated vegetarian and vegan menu and, they can cater to dietary requirements although best to speak with the Maître De / Restaurant Manager about what can be accommodated.

We had the Baked Feta and Crispy Chicken options from the Entrée menu, alongside sides of mash potatoes and roast vegetables. This was a great amount of food for 2 people. We also had room for desert and the lava cake is recommended. I was able to obtain a cream-free option as I am lactose-intolerant.

I can’t rate the staff service enough. A special appreciation goes to Yuka whose service and standards are fantastic. The chef was also great - which goes to show that it’s not always about it going perfect but the people who can help out when something doesn’t go quite right. All in all, would recommend dining here for dinner!

Every dish we ordered was absolutely exceptional and our waiter was so friendly and hospitable. We ordered the seafood chowder, Mackenzie's salad for entre, porkbelly and zucchini risotto for mains followed by the most magnificent peanut butter ice cream cake.

Great atmosphere, great service, delicious food - would 10/10 recommend dining in if staying at the gorgeous Hertiage Hotel in Queenstown. Well worth it!

Very tasty (especially salmon and steak), friendly staff, I strongly reccomend :)

Service was good but portions were way over priced. For $19 I got what would be a starter in most places. The buffet looked decent but don't order the avocado smash its so not worth it.

Beautiful diner tonight, pork belly and the pasta of the day and the lovely choc lava was the best

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
Cute little Latin American joint in the middle of Queenstown. Not many seats (and mostly outdoor seating) but very good ambience and service!

The vegetarian tacos and arepas were good, the nachos were okay (strange mix of veggies) and the cheese sticks were winners for our group. Ordered another round, 😋

Not sure I would return for the veggie versions but maybe the meat dishes are better!

best latin american food i’ve ever had. just beautiful.
all the flavours are spot on. very tender pork on that cubano. burrito is not mushy unlike some other mexican restaurants. pictures don’t do justice how amazing they are.

the coxinhas are so good, definitely a must try.
horchata is very refreshing, perfect balance to the spiciness of the food. their sauces are equally great.

highly recommended.

A cosy, little Latin American eatery with a wide range of meals. We loved its ambienece and the friendliess of staff members was also praiseworthy! We went for the vegetarian nachos and  we requested it extra spicy. It turned out to be a great choice. We also had a horchata. I found it a bit too sweet, but the cinnamon flavour in it was very enjoyable.

good value for money; has a cool vibe.
we've ordered beef burrito (good), chicken arepas (good, but needs sauce to be yum) and beef nachos (very good).

Awesome little eatery with (what seems like) authentic arepas and other Latin American food.

We had the arepas and tacos, plus a horchata to drink. The arepas were the highlight - a Colombian dish of delicious warm corn flatbread cut in half and with rich fillings like pulled pork or chicken and avocado. This seems like their signature dish. I haven't been to Colombia but it tasted right, like it was they way it is meant to be.

The tacos were not as good and didn't seem as authentic - maybe the chef is Colombian? They came on blue corn tortillas but they had too many beans in them. Horchata was sweet but very yum.

The downside was the service. The person at the till was super distracted, and I had to remind her twice to make my horchata.

There is very little room to sit inside, so you'll be outside in the cold if you're more than a 2-3 person party. However the vibe is pretty good with contemporary Spanish-language pop and rock music blasting and colourful decorations.

Western cuisine in Queenstown.reviews:
Congratulations to  the owners and their great team 👏. Impressive establishment with outstanding team.  A special thanks to server Jasmine. Great service and  friendly  attitude 👏 👍  Recommending!

Had dinner here for our last night in Queenstown. Food was amazing & our waiter was super on to it! We went with the Trust the Chef option and i was surprised, almost everything that came to the table was something I wouldn’t have ordered but I enjoyed it so much especially the vegetarian options. They had live music playing when we arrived and it really just added to the great vibes of the place. Would definitely be back next time im in Queenstown.

Awesome location with great scenery, seating right on the water, can get a little chilly at night but the staff can supply you with a blanket… the service and the staff were positive, easygoing, informative and cheerful.
We had the Head Chef’s Choice and the food was amazing, succulent, full of flavours.
The wines from surrounding Queenstown regions was spot on and the cocktails specials didn’t disappoint.
Highly recommended if dining-in or just enjoying a few beverages.

Food was promptly prepared, well presented and tasty, which is amazing considering they were really busy. Bread was a generous amount. Staff were attentive.

Public Kitchen and Bar is the best restaurant I ate at in New Zealand. Food was incredible! We ordered the “Trust the Chef” option which I highly recommend. I loved every dish. The grilled squid with pineapple salsa was incredible and fork tender. I’ve never had better. The pork belly had the most amazing flavor and was cooked perfectly. For dessert was a delicious traditional pavlova and a coconut crème brûlée which were both incredible. Great location, ambiance and staff! They even played some of my favorite songs!

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
Went to visit this establishment with my family. Used the voucher found on Chope where we got a main and a drink for $8.99. It was absolute value-for-money!

The main dishes were generally okay, with quite small portions. However, they were nothing much to write home about. The drinks and sides were the stars of the show, and I would definitely be back especially for the fried chicken.

However… the desserts here were really expensive, costing as much as a main dish. If you are craving Taiwanese desserts, you’re better off going to another place like Nine Fresh.

Very nice Taiwanese food bistro if you miss Taiwan food! The braised pork belly rice is very flavorful, oyster egg omelette is differently made compare to sg style, and the egg crepe roll is also very crispy.

Very satisfying meal indeed. I had a very joyous dining experience! My family and I enjoyed the food very much 😄

This time I ordered something new like Fried Chicken with Cheese, and all my family members love it so much!
Love their meesua too, but I ran out of it yesterday. So I ordered their pork belly rice and udon, scallion oil chicken rice and as usual, the food at 8 Degree always satisfies my craving for Taiwanese food!

Their Bubble tea also spoil me with their choices.. all yummyy!

Try them out! Super recommended!

Food was pretty good! Reasonably priced too. Shop is simple but service was good and Aircon always nice in Singapore. Recommend you try their eggroll with floss. Somewhat like a crepe/fresh popiah roll.

Also recommend trying the sesame cold noodles paired with a fried chicken with cheese.

Pork rice was also nice, not too sweet, hardboiled egg was also very good quality and with their spicy chili dip. Very good!

Oh I also really liked their bubble tea. Even at zero percent sugar it was good. The pearls here are really chewy soft and can tell it's made fresh.

Will be back to try other dishes when I'm in the area again.

Came here for Taiwanese food and really enjoyed our meal!

To drink, we tried the milk tea with pearl, jasmine green tea with pearl and the grass jelly milk tea (all large size)! The portion was really generous, they gave loads of Pearls, and the tea taste was rich and strong

We tried the chitterling and oyster meesua, the pork belly rice and the cold sesame noodles (pictured below) which we all enjoyed.

A yummy meal, would like to come back one day and try more dishes!
