Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
Overall, yummy food at a cosy eatery at wallet-friendly prices. My partner and I ordered scallion chicken rice, veg, pork floss egg roll with cheese, milk tea, honey butter toast.

I don’t usually eat rice bowls but I thoroughly enjoyed the scallion chicken rice which was flavourful and fragrant! Would definitely recommend this dish.

Loved the hot milk tea at 50% sweetness too. I don’t really eat pearls but this one was nice!

Would have preferred the egg roll to be more cheesy with the usual crispy kind as it turned out to be more of a soft chewy dough - still rather interesting and some may like that.

Honey butter toast was a nice dessert to end our meal!

Had a nice dinner at this Taiwanese restaurant. The staff is really friendly and the cafe itself is cosy. Loved their scallion oil chicken rice. It was very flavourful. We ordered 2 mains, 2 side dishes along with their signature pearl milk tea. The price is reasonable and definitely worth the visit.

Our favorite to go when we craving for Taiwanese food. The Pork Belly Rice is a mix of fatty and lean braised pork, pickled veggies, all on fluffy white pearl rice. 🤤 The Scallion Oil Chicken Rice has this killer fragrant sauce and perfectly shredded chicken. Worth the try

Service was impeccable and food was served promptly. Their chilli is really good. Mixed it with the 卤肉饭&大肠面线and it gave both dishes more flavour.

Milk tea is really fragrant, I had ordered 0% sugar.

Aiyu Bing was nice, but could have been colder and it would be even better. Portion is huge. Worth it.

Had a great dinner at 8degrees with my family, we really enjoyed the signature pork belly rice as well as the other dishes! The prices are affordable and it’s a hidden gem in Kovan. Definitely worth a visit if you enjoy authentic Taiwanese cuisine. Highly recommend the milk tea with pearl 👍 and scallion pancakes!

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
We ordered oriental wanton in black vinegar & chili oil, egg friend rice, pork chop fried rice. The servings are hefty and they tasted so good! Especially their egg fried rice, it's really authentic and you can tell how it was skillfully wok-fried. The restaurant though is more suited for families and groups of people, so it's a bit noisy and not suitable for couple dine-ins. The dish per order is quite pricey but it could be shared for two. Overall, we enjoyed the food here!

The location is great, though other branches like the one in Nex are brighter and nicer. The food is good as always, we loved the hot and sour soup, soup dumplings, egg fried rice etc. Dessert-wise it would have been great if they serve the taro sago in coconut milk like the branches in Shanghai.

Date of visit : Tue 15 Aug 2023
Time : 11.30 am

This time we arrived early. No queue.
We basically ordered the same dishes. Thru the QR code and self-ordering.
Food is alright quality remains the same.

Date of visit : 17 Jan 2023
Time : 12.15 pm

Not much queue. Food came quickly. Service and tea is good.

Everything was ok, except maybe the noodles.

Classic taiwanese cuisine. The dumplings are out of this world!!! Prices might be a bit high for traditional Chinese cuisine, but worth it considering the Michelin star, AND they make it for you on the spot, fully transparent for anyone to see. Seasonal additions are good too.

Ding Tai Fung always delivers a delightful experience! I ordered their fantastic egg fried rice, which was as delicious as ever. The xiao long bao were freshly made and bursting with flavor. The mi sua with chicken soup was a winner, packed with rich taste. Dining here is a surefire way to enjoy a flawless meal.

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
Authentic Chinese food stall recommended by my colleague from China for lunch!

The best dumplings I have ever had in my life! Please try the both the steam and pan fried versions! Order with hot sour soup and scallion pancakes to share and it’s settled!

Try their steamed dumplings 🥟❤️. The skin has a lovely bite to it and the filling is seasoned perfectly. When you take a bite, the flavourful juice from the filling flows out making it a more enjoyable experience!

Really love this simple and comforting food.. if you love 葱油饼 (Spring onion pancake)，饺子 (boiled dumplings)，锅贴(pan-fried dumplings)，豆沙饼(red bean pancake)。。 Go and try it. Very affordable and accessible.. nearest train station - Lavender

After over a year in Singapore this is still the best taste for value fried rice I've had, and that's not even the store's specialty. Pass over the long queue at Tai Hwa Pork Noodle and give the scallion & egg pancake, dumplings, and fried noodle here a try

This is my go to place if I want to eat China dumplings and hot and sour soup. As many have highlighted, the scallion pancake is to die for. They are all so good, much better than what many restaurants can produce. It's in a coffee shop so the ambiance is not high class but the food is really authentic and very high quality. Don't miss this.

Approved by a fellow Shenyang-native. Highly recommend the chive and egg stuffed pancake 韭菜盒子 - better than my mum’s.
Also worth trying the fried noodle: addictively garlicky and slightly spicy. Very different from fried noodles commonly seen in Singapore.

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
There's a home cooked taste to the food. I ordered the 卤肉饭便当 (pork bento). It was light on oil and salt, which I like and is healthier. Serving size is just about right for an adult male. It seems to be managed by Taiwanese so the food should be authentic. The place is small but cozy and decorated with old school nostalgic household items. It's a good place for a quiet lunch. Overall a thumbs up and would visit again.

Has the lu rou fan set which taste good on it's only, the mushroom tempura is well seasoned too. Egg is old school hard boil though, so nothing too exciting there. Oh ya chili is really good and goes well.

The salt crispy chicken is very underwhelming, feels like very poor chicken quality. Milk tea is ok, the pearl feels a bit dry.

Honestly price point is steep for comfort food.

We ordered the braised pork belly rice set, intestine mee sua, and egg pancake with cheese and pork floss. The taste was very homely and generally good, though I wished that the flavours were stronger. Perhaps it's just my personal preference, but I would have loved a bit more of the oiliness that those at a street stall in the night market would have, which makes it a little more authentic.

We still enjoyed our time there, and the decor was also very nostalgic, with typewriters and cassette tapes!

A good place to have some Taiwanese food! We ordered braised pork rice, mee sua with braised intestines & oysters, fried chicken and fried king mushroom! All rice and mee sua were good. The fried chicken was succulent and the fried mushroom was really moist and juicy inside! Overall a really pleasant dining experience!

Salty crispy chicken rice and Crispy Cheese & Pork Floss Egg Pancake is nice 👍 . Lu ru fan(mince meat bowl has more fats then meat though.
Black tea kosong with pearl bubble tea ($4) was good

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
Ordered Braised Pork rice. The taste is good but the portions are super small. $5.40 is definitely not enough, can easily down 3 bowls.

Would prefer there is more meat given. What to do?

Attendance saw me standing there, rather than attending my order they were chatting. Probably wanted to form a queue to take the order all at a time.

Pretty solid Taiwan food at Paya Lebar. Food was great but customer service could be better. Aunty at the cashiers gave me the feels that she is rushing off to the loo and needs your order & payment ASAP.

Well executed Taiwanese street food. Fried chicken and honey grilled chicken were crispy on the outside , juicy on the inside. Good selection on the menu and the crispy mushroom was a little too hard and chunky for my liking… I was hoping for some plum powder to go with. The 卤肉饭 was just okay for me.. too little sauce, rice was not soft enough and overall I think I have had better. Seats are limited, so be prepared to share table :)

A good place to go to if you have a craving for some Taiwanese street food! The prices and portions given were reasonable! ($5 for a bowl of braised pork rice) And the taste was quite similar to the original version! Overall a pleasant dining experience!

Tried the braised pork bento and Taichung Braised pork rice. Rice is cooked just right and moist and the gravy is quite flavorful especially the braised pork with the bento. The braised pork was cooked soft and flavorful and easy to go with the rice. It is a good meal  especially the price is very reasonable!
Well recommended !

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
Cosy place for a good Taiwanese dinner. Can easily park directly in front of the restaurant. Great for bikers to hang out. Very hospitable lady boss Fiona. Really enjoyed the flavourful beef noodles and dumplings which were handmade and actually Fiona’s family recipe. Boss is also a fellow rider and made us feel at home. His dogs are so cute!

Authentic Taiwanese food.
Recommended:
1. Kala chicken leg rice
2. Braised Beef Shanks
3. Century egg tofu

Overall:
Good food with a neighbourhood cafe vibes. Really value for money!

Food (GST and service charge applicable. Prices before):
1) braise pork rice set - comes with preserved vege , half a braised egg, and braised pork with sufficient braised sauce. Tastes very balanced! Not too oily but really flavourful with the sour notes from the preserved vege accompanying.
2) beef noodle soup - strong flavoured beef soup, with thick cut noodles and thinly sliced beef pieces. Favourite of the day
3) gyoza - comes in 10 large pieces. It's lightly panfried and comes in either cabbage/酒菜 + pork. We opted for the 酒菜one and it was decent. Worth the price
4) crispy pork big intestine - this is pretty tasty and nicely seasoned after deep-fried, however it's a little smaller than what we expected for the price.

Service:
Orders are placed via web-app thru QR code, and pay at counter after you're done eating. as at 01-Sep-23, paywave is acceptable.

There was only one lady in charge of serving everyone for the full dinner service, so don't expect servers to come to you greeting you and asking for your orders and recommending you things to eat. It's pretty no-frills in this regard. Nevertheless, food are served to you and not self-collect with beeper.

Dog owners do take note! Place states it's dog-friendly yet the seating that's truly dog-friendly is only a small strip of area outside of the "outdoor" seating. Seating that only accommodates 2pax per seat. We had to tie our dogs by the railing as our group's 5-pax.

Decent food tho. Try the railway bento and salt-pepper chicken ✌️

A rustic place offering Taiwanese signatures like braised pork rice, beef noodles and dumplings, etc.

A place to patronise when you have cravings for food from Formosa.  Serving portion is just about right for 1 person. That gives you the chance to order more dishes to share with dining companions.

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
I recently had the pleasure of savoring the exquisite flavors of Taiwanese cuisine at Abundance, and I must say it was an absolute delight for my taste buds. The attention to authenticity in every dish is commendable, transporting me straight to the vibrant streets of Taiwan.

From the first bite to the last, the dishes showcased a perfect balance of savory and aromatic spices. The culinary expertise is evident in every detail, from the impeccable presentation to the rich, complex flavors that left me craving more.

The menu at Abundance reflects a true passion for Taiwanese food, offering a diverse array of options that cater to every palate. The friendly and attentive staff added to the overall enjoyable dining experience, making me feel welcomed and ensuring that each dish was a memorable journey.

If you're a fan of Taiwanese cuisine or just eager to embark on a flavorful adventure, Abundance is a must-visit. My taste buds thank me, and yours will too!

Food:
Food was really great with creative choice from the restaurant. Taste was really good. Dessert (ice cream roll) is a must-try for me. Interesting cocktails, craft beers, and drinks.

Service:
The reservation was at 7pm but the seat was not ready within 15 mins (understandable as it was a large group but could be improved).
Brought a cake for celebration. When I asked for the cake, I was expecting the cake to be served by the staff but I was given the cake and served it myself instead. (Service charge was in the bill, so customer would expect better service)

Atmosphere:
Ambience was great but could get noisy in peak hours. I could not hear clearly what my friend was saying who sit two seat away from me (maybe could improve on sound absorption?)

Lovely place for some novelty Taiwanese cuisine! We had the chicken and the prawn buns. O thought the dressing that came with the chicken bun was too wet for my liking, but the chicken was well fried and crispy. The prawn patty was quite nice too! Truffle fries is a pass. The sauce for the dumplings was a touch too heavy for my liking, though the addition of lard is a nice plus. Finally, the dessert is really good in my opinion, because I'm a bit of a weirdo and I like coriander ad peanut with ice cream. It makes sense to me, but I get it's not everyone's thing. Shout out to the staff who checked how many pieces I wanted the ice cream cut into. She had considered that I was there in a family of three, and that I might not have wanted the default sliced in two. Will definitely recommend, and also come back!

A well-hidden gem in the Redhill HDB estate. The Taiwanese cuisine at Abundance was a pleasure experience for us. The authenticity in each dish transported me to the lively streets of Taiwan, with a good combination of savoury, acidity, spices and texture evident from the first bite to the last. Their culinary expertise left us wanting for more.

The friendly and attentive staff enhanced the overall dining experience, making us feel welcomed and ensuring each dish was prepared with effort.

If you're a foodie person, Abundance is a must-visit dining location.

The atmosphere was rather cramped and basic, but the food made up for it. Nestled at the block near the MSCP, this place is a treat. The balsamic fries were an interesting find. The gua bao was a hit. Kids also loved the beef noodles. The salted egg prawn gua bao was nicely done. One dish I didn't like the fish paste chicken... a bit overpowered by the fish paste. Lack of kids' utensils and plates make this place slightly kid unfriendly, although high chairs are available. It's a simple fix that the management should look into. The meal was rounded off with their black sesame ice cream popiah and the peanut with coriander ice cream popiah. The latter is a definite must try!! It was so good we forgot to take a photo of it. Price wise, the food is not cheap, but the innovative menu is a treat! Was crowded on a Sunday evening, and I recommend booking ahead.

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
I recently dined at Enjoy Xia Hokkien Mee. Our experience during lunch hour was somewhat disappointing. Surprisingly, there was no lunch crowd, but that didn't necessarily translate into a great dining experience.

The food was just average, lacking the depth of flavor we expected, and it leaned towards the pricier side, making it hard to justify the cost.

We attempted to use deals via Burpple, but unfortunately, the staff's unfriendly response left us quite disappointed with their attitude and service.

On a positive note, the restaurant had an alright atmosphere with a nice design, but it didn't make up for the underwhelming food and staff interaction.

My friend and I ordered the Hokkien mee, crispy hor fun and prawn cakes. The Hokkien mee was flavourful and satisfying, and the crispy hor fun was surprisingly good but might be a bit jelak. The prawns were a bit powdery and tough though. I didnt enjoy the prawn cakes as it tasted a bit weird.

When we were checking out, they offered a 10% discount in exchange for a Google Review. They didn’t specify if it had to be a 5 star review tho, so take it as you will.

Hokkien prawn noodles tastes really good in my opinion but really too oily from the roasted pork & lard added I believe. I’m certain that the amount of oil can be halved at least. Other than that, prawns are fresh & huge. Place is IG friendly. Service is ok.

Mai hiam buay pai.  I love their man tou, Hokkien mee slightly above average for me but lots of ingredients which justify their price. Pork cheek also not bad. Second time patronised this restaurant because we wanna try their Hokkien mee. I will not return again for their Hokkien mee but other dishes, why not?

Pretty average food. Nothing much to wow about. Need to reserve early for seats, walk in will be taking a risk. Maybe is the hype from influencer that’s causes everyone to come. Prawn noodle above average but for selling price not much worth it because of the big prawn that’s all. Stingray was kind of disappointed due to was deep fried first, kind of wasted to execute this way. Overall not worth the price paying for.

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
Braised Pork Belly rice was good but the complimentary milk tea meh!

We tried:
- Signature Honey Chicken Chop Bento ($6.80)
- Braised Pork Belly Rice ($5.80)
- Oyster Mianxian ($5.50)
- Chicken Bites sides in sesame & honey ($5.50/set)
- Summer Peach (peach oolong, strawberry boba & aloe vera) ($5)
- Toffee Milk Tea (caramel milk tea, brown sugar pearls, agar balls) ($5)

All bentos also comes with half a braised egg & pickled vegetables that go so well with the meats & QQ fluffy rice! Honey Chicken (as with our sides) was so well marinated & crispy even though it was packed up. The fragrant pork belly rice has a good ratio of meat-sauce-rice that makes it delectable! At least 5 plump oysters swimming in my mianxian, & I'm so gleeful downing it! I highly recommend the sesame chicken bites too - a must-order side to accompany your meal, or just pair it with a bbt for a quick snack! Bbt here are the large 700ml cups & $5 a cup with toppings already included is such a steal! Ours are their bestsellers, the first a refresher, & the latter oh-so-smooth we need another cuppa! 😋

Ordered salt and pepper mee sua. Super good and flavourful. But need to wait 15 mins for the food  to be ready. The staff will inform you the waiting time before ordering.

Not bad la. But the rice was too mushy. And when they said bento, I sort of expected a bento. This is more like a bowl. Price a bit high for the size.

Mango tea was ok. But the agar ball was weird. It was more of a popping ball.

Nice mixed of chicken with sides, flavourful and satisfying. Nice taiwanese flavoured.
Only shortcoming might be the preparation time.

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
Really not sure how this place has such good reviews. When I came here with my friends, we all left sorely disappointed.

The beef noodles wasn’t great. It’s hard to explain but it just wasn’t good. Lacking in flavour and basically just salty. The chicken wings that came with the set although well fried, the meat wasn’t moist and you could tell that it’s a cheap frozen wing.

The indoor portion of the restaurant also had a rather bad smell, but at least we could choose to sit outside.

Will definitely not be back here or to even try other branches.

Blanco Court Beef Noodle is a beloved establishment in Singapore, renowned for its delectable bowls of beef noodles. As you step inside the unassuming eatery, you are immediately greeted by the rich aroma of simmering spices and savory broth, setting the stage for a culinary experience that is nothing short of extraordinary.

The star of the show at Blanco Court Beef Noodle is, of course, the beef noodle soup. The broth is the heart and soul of this dish, and Blanco Court does not disappoint.

Really a delicious bowl of beef noodles, with tender beef slice, smooth noodles that mixed very well with the gravy, spicy tangy chilli sauce to mix with the noodles, beef, gravy. Soup is delicious too. Only thing is that the portion slightly small at $9.90...but as we know..inflation...inflation.

Greedy me bought the Large Superior Bowl cause I wanted it all!

The portion was huge and the ingredients were all clean & fresh.

Slightly Salty for the dry sauce, I used the like and chilli paste to reduce it.

The soup was flavorful. I asked for a refill & they gave me a bowl.

Comfort food especially on a rainy day. Dinner Queue was reasonable as Thai Food was crowded.

The best beef noodle I've tasted. Ordered the superior beef noodles and the beef slices, tendon, and balls are all superb. The sauce was initially starchy but turned more fluid as I ate.

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
Passed by this stall whenever I am in Queensway shopping centre. This stall sells Taiwan food in particular Taiwanese bento. Apart from the bento, they also have other stuff like noodles and soup. The food looks not bad and have always wanted to dine here. I happen to run some errands nearby and decided to drop by for lunch one day.

With much anticipation, ordered their fried chicken bento which was SGD$7.50 for the big portion. When the food came, I was quite disappointed because the fried chicken was very small piece. The rice bowl came with 2 different kind of veg and half a braised egg. First thing, my food was served cold. Fried Chicken felt like it have been prepared for quite sometime back. Chicken was not crispy and it lack seasoning.

Utterly disappointed with the food. Would not recommend. With that being said, Owner was Friendly, contrast to what other review have said.

In a corner of Queensway, this tiny eatery serves reliably yummy lu rou fan (braised pork rice)! Used to eat here fairly often when I was working nearby, and it most defnitely qualifies as good comfort food. ♡

𝐃𝐚𝐢𝐥𝐲 𝐒𝐨𝐮𝐩 & 𝐁𝐫𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐞𝐝 𝐏𝐨𝐫𝐤 𝐑𝐢𝐜𝐞 𝐒𝐞𝐭 ($𝟔)
A smaller bowl of braised pork rice with their homemade soup. Braised pork was flavourful, juicy and soft as always, and today's white fungus pork rib soup had lots of ingredients inside, and tasted really smooth and not oily!

𝐂𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐤𝐞𝐧 𝐒𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐍𝐨𝐨𝐝𝐥𝐞𝐬 ($𝟓.𝟓𝟎)
Distinct scallion oil taste which was great! Chicken slices were tender and juicy, but could have been a bit more well marinated!

It is a super cozy eatery that is a great place to rest your legs after shopping at Queensway, at an amazing price point with generous ingredients and great tasting food. 🥰 Recommend visiting here if you are around Alexandra!

Came here a few years ago and remembered the food was decent..but it seems the standards have dropped now :( there are other better Taiwanese food around now

Ordered a small Signature Braised Pork Bento ($5) and this was an amazing find. Really lovely home cooked taste. Apparently the large (+$1) will have more rice and more meat, but even the small was hearty enough. I want to try the soup and other dishes next! Will definitely be back again :)

Update: I’ve been back multiple times since my first review and each time it’s SO GOOD. Seems like they change up the soup every so often. It’s definitely of my favorite places to eat in this area.

It’s been awhile since I visited. Happy to know that the homely taste I love has not changed! Definitely worth a visit. ❤️ this is located inside Queensway Shopping Centre, nothing fancy about the ambience, but a simple but definitely good budget-friendly meal with lots of options

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
Very generous size burger for amount paid! Juicy meat patty is hand made and not one of those frozen patties you get from the supermarket. Excellent value for money! Have purchased the burgers a few times, will definitely order more in future.

Friendly and generous owner. Good service. Favourite so far is the Taiwan Honey Chicken Chop rice ($6). Personally prefer it with more sauce and owner is happy to oblige. He topped my order today with complimentary crispy chicken. Thanks!

I am a hamburger lover and I have to say TakeawaySpecialist's burger is the best!
I love their unique and creative flavours ! Very  juicy and tasty . The portion is so big u cant find any other like that!
omg have to try it again!

Food is great. I really love the chicken herb skewer, so flavory! I will definitely order again.

One of a kind experience! I’m someone who don’t really enjoy eating prawns as I hate to de-shell, but this place proves me wrong! Ordered prawns as they were very fragrant when grilling, the shell came off really easily and the meat was so fresh!

Have never enjoyed eating Prawns until I discovered this hidden gem!

Owner is humorous and kind, servings are in big portions and all the seafoods are always very fresh.
The food is always fantastic and no matter what I order I am always delighted with my meal!

There’s not once I left here feeling unsatisfied!

Truly recommend!

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
Undoubtedly the best Taiwanese restaurant in Singapore! It's an authentic Taiwanese Zi Char place serving all the classic local Taiwanese stir fry dishes!! We felt like we were taken back to Taiwan as soon as we walked in. Super popular amongst the Taiwanese expats in town and always full at night even on weekdays - better to make reservations in advance!

Really loved the 卤肉饭, felt that it was really authentic and affordable. As for the other dishes they weren't particularly spectacular except the deep fried oysters but it was not bad to say the least. I enjoyed the varying types of tea they offered.

The food was generally served quickly, and the place itself was quite vibey. Felt a little like stepping into Taiwan.

Wide variety of food to choose from that we ordered too much. All tasted quite authentic Taiwanese. Place a bit so small so can get full house real quick

A Taiwanese friend recommended this restaurant and it was the best Taiwanese food I have had in Singapore. The 盐酥鸡 (golden fried chicken), fried rice, yam balls, bitter gourd with salted egg were exceptionally good. The meatball soup was mediocre. Stir fried sweet potato leaves with Sakura ebi was simple yet flavourful. We will come back to try other dishes.

Braised Pork rice 卤肉饭 ($3)- 8/10 very tender braised pork belly in such a savoury sauce. Excellent

Braised Pork intestine 卤肥肠 ($3)- 7/10 Also tender braised pork intestine. However had abit of smell

Braised Pork intestine 卤肥肠 ($3)- 6.5/10 Also tender braised pork intestine. However had abit of smell

XO Carrot Cake蘿蔔糕 ($15) - 8/10  fantastic battered carrot cake with XO that was savoury. The batter was not overly thick and not oily. After biting into the crisp batter, the carrot cake inside was soft.

Crispy fried oyster 蚵仔酥 ($18) - 9/10 love this dish. Oyster was meaty and not fishy, just like the carrot cake the batter was just right. Love the salt and pepper seasoning.

Stir fried sweet potato leaf 炒蕃薯葉 ($10) 8/10 - there is 4 style of cooking: garlic, chili, XO(+$2) and sakura ebi (+$2) - chose the one cooked with XO. Really simple yet flavourful dish

Squid 中卷 $18 - 8/10 - 5 flavours to choose: three cups, white boiled, salted crispy, salad egg (+$2), five flavours - chose the one with 3 cups, basil taste abit strong but I am ok with it. Squid was cut in thick slices and was really fresh

Stir fry clams 海瓜子 ($18) - 8/10 three flavours green onion, basil, chili - lala was cooked just nice, flavour was excellent

Tried the grape beer and mango beer for $5 each. Very good. They do have a lot of non alcoholic beverage selection as well

Overall 8.5/10. The menu was so extensive and dishes were great generally. Will def return to try more dishes

Instagram: @melvineateat

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
Sweet potato porridge was really nice, traditional taste. Oysters omelette, braised pork belly are two dishes that go very well with the porridge. The restaurant is next to Toa Payoh Town park so some tables has great view of the park. The dining environment is a bit rundown but they will shift to a new location soon.

Stewed pork - Fine but could have been a little more tender.
Braised pig’s large intestines - Too soft.
3 types of eggs with Chinese spinach - Fine.
Fresh cockles - Fresh and plump. Better with chilli sauce.
Frog with spring onion - Not bad.

Came here specifically to eat before they move to macpherson. This place is bustling and full house when we reached around 6pm. Recommend you reserve in advance.

Porridge is pretty plan and simple but thats the charm and they give you a full bucket of it which u will be sure to finish. There is sweet potato inside.

Food is awesome and right up the alley of my chinese taste buds. My favourite dish was the shredded pork and the prawn paste chicken. Packed with flavour and right on que with the crispiness for the chicken.

Had the fish maw  but you can do without it as the price is pretty steep for $30, but it is a HUGE bowl for at least 5 pax so its worth it.

The minced meat with salted egg is pretty much a must when eating porridge. You  need somethinv salty.

The omellete is soft, nice and fluffy with fresh oysters that soak up the juices of the porridge or anyother dish sauce.

Kang kong is 'crispy' and spicy.

I seldom talk about the free side dish but the braised penut and sour vegetables are damn good appetisers with your porridge.

The atmosphere is your noisy chinese restaurant in front of a park with a nice view as its glass all around.

The place is a 7 mins walk from Toa payoh mrt and there is no reason for you to not come and try. Highly recommended.

OASIS TAIWAN PORRIDGE 🍚🥢🥣🏡⛲️🪴

BEST PORRIDGE VIBES EVER! ❤️

Thanks to a friend’s posting, got reacquainted with Oasis Taiwan Porridge. It didn’t struck me but this was the iconic porridge place that was once situated at Kallang but they had to move to make way for the stadium. 🙏🏻🙏🏻🙏🏻

They are presently at Toa Payoh garden where they still have a large restaurant facing the gardens, not quite as iconic as Kallang, but a very good alternative. Sadly, due to move again - last day 14 Jan and they resume business at a new location near Grantrall Mall 1 Feb 2024. 🥹🥲😟

A 52 years legacy and 38 years in the biz - fans of Oasis would no doubt reminisce the good old days when the food at Oasis was top notch. Nonetheless, still a comfy place to savour piping hot porridge with family or hosting friends. Overlooking the serene greens and tranquil pond - it’s still quite a vibe. 💚💚💚

So, head down to eat before they move, because I don’t think we will be experience this kinda nice mood with Taiwan porridge and a scenery hand-in-hand. Best thing yet? - unlimited porridge, they open till 11 pm (great for supper option) and parking is so easily available. 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼

Recommendations: Chai Po Omelette, Braised Duck, Salted Fish Steamed Pork, Pomfret in Black Bean Sauce, Oasis Beancurd, Bean Sprouts with Salted Fish. 🏆🏆🏆
.
.
.
📍OASIS TAIWAN PORRIDGE
303 Lorong 6 Toa Payoh
Singapore 319 393

Oasis Taiwan Porridge 海京楼台湾粥

Food is 3.5 stars, the pomfret with black beans and leek is good, so is the salted squids that is cooked right and chewy. The highly rated salted egg minced meat is so so. Worth return to try their other dishes.

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
Probably the only place in Singapore that I know of that has Mee Sua. Sausages were great, beef rice was also great, haven't tried the drinks yet but will do so next time.

A lot of my Taiwanese friends recommend here as well, so I guess that's a good sign.

The braised pork rice is good though portion kinda small. The cheese foam tea is excellent while the fried mushroom a bit oily and not very seasoned.
Service okay, staff quite relaxed and atmosphere good.
Overall, a good restaurant. And it will permanently close soon.

Braised pork rice has a nice taste but very small bowl.  Oyster mee sua was quite nice. Shredded chicken is available at top up.

We also had the garlic beef $26 after tax.. Had multiple pieces too chewy.. Personally find it overcooked and not much taste for me.

2 pax : mee sua x 1, braised pork rice x 1, garlic beef x 1, aiyu jelly x 1, 1 plain rice total paid  $23 pax after svc charge & Gst.. 吃不包 😂

Nearest public car park is J0100 very walkable.

Lovely corner shop along Pasir Panjang Road with quaint, yet homely decor. Being in an industrial area, it was relatively quiet during a weekday dinner.

Food was very tasty and the flavours were reminiscent of Taipei street food.

One inconvenience is the ordering system as you are unable to see the available variations (e.g. hot/cold drinks selection) unless you order one and check if the variation is available. Could use some improvement if you need to cut on waiting staff.

My favourite place for Taiwanese lu rou fan, it's the best in SG. Do order the onsen eggs as well, perfectly done with marinated and soft yolk. The Mee Sua is not bad too but the vegetable dish is overcooked and too soft for me. Best of all, prices are very reasonable. Take note that portions are small hence the name for big eaters.
It's a small restaurant so go early to avoid queues. Service is fast though.
It is the only restaurant I know where you not only order using your phone but pay also.

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
The cashier lady is a gem in the food service industry. We need more people who take orders to be like her. When people are ordering, please tell them they're ordering too much or too little.

Dynasty fried porridge lady does this, and it helped us with deciding the appropriate portion size.

Food at this place is really nice. Malaysian style. My family really liked it, and we'll be back 🙏

Best fried porridge ever I eaten in Spore. The claypot bee Tai Bak is super sedaplicious. Can really match those in Msia. Ask for less salt as their food tend to be on the salty side.

Came on a Mon around 6.30pm, coffeeshop had quite a bit of tables available. Ordered their signatures like Fried porridge, KL Tai Lok Mee, San Lou Beehoon and Claypot Bi Tai Mak.

Personally feel that their Claypot Bi Tai Mak was the best out the 4, followed by KL Tai Lok Mee, Fried Porridge then San Lou Beehoon. However, of the 4 dishes I would probably only recommend the Claypot Bi Tai Mak.

Claypot Bi Tai Mak was flavourful and hits the right spot. Albeit a little on the saltier side, it’s pretty good. Tai Lok Mee was alright, nothing special. Fried porridge was a little disappointing; no wokhei, every bite seemed to have some cuttlefish(?) while others had pork lard. Nothing special, didn’t have the distinct fried porridge taste. San Lou Beehoon was just… chaota. Legit burnt taste, not wokhei kind of burnt.

Probably wouldn’t come back again.

Was here on 15th May 2023.

Ordered the claypot meetaimak/laoshufen which I found pretty tasty albeit salty. Enjoyed the generous serving of pork lard and meat in the dish.
Had the KL Hokkien mee, the noodles were good. Thick and authentic. However, it was missing the wok hei taste. The lard however, managed to add a lot of flavour to it.

Overall, for $15, I find the food pretty good.

Really good fried porridge! Umami from dried seafood and great texture from yam. Sweet potato leaves were young and well fried.

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
We had a delightful evening of local China taste . Its put trotterz chicken and stomach is top with its hours of broth boiled. Keep you steamed up with
Red dates and some Chinese herb. Not overly powerful but good to your throat
And nice in your tummy. The cumin based shewers of mutton and pork slice
Taste so good. The grilled squid is a must try, so chewy good. My wife just love the squid grilled to its chew chew
Shiokness. Don't miss this place if you
Care for a not overly spiced powdered
Mala flavour. Must karry on makan.

Came to this place during mid June this year. Overall the food quality is much better than other Chinese restaurants especially their 辣子鸡 (diced chicken with chilli) - those diced chicken are well-seasoned and the taste is authentic. Do try their dumpling too, the skin is thinner as compared to other Chinese dumpling we usually had in other places. Mushroom skewer is a must-try item as well. The only item we don’t appreciate it is their beancurd skewer which we find it tough to consume..

In sum, the food quality with such an affordable price will definitely make us visit here again.

Happened to be walking around and found this Chinese restaurant that serves authentic Chinese food. Affordable, and not as oily. Skewers are priced pretty decently. Ordered a few skewers, potato slices, scallop with vermicelli. Thought the scallops were alittle tough. So I may not order it again. My friends enjoyed the potato slices. Surprisingly tasty. Good customer service as well. Compared to many other Chinese restaurants, I honestly feel their menu is one of the more comprehensive one. They even included pictures of the dishes, so if you don’t know what to order, or how to read the Chinese characters, fret not, there’s pictures!

In my next visit, I’ll probably take more photos! Will be back again if I’m nearby. 👍🏼

Try their skewers and diced chicken chilli !
Menu comes with pictures for better illustration.
There are 4 outdoor seating but serving Robot can't can't climb stairs.
This Lady waitress has bad customer attitude, unfriendly and no patience in recommending the menu.

This place serves Chinese food that were as authentic as you were having a meal in China. Extensive food menu for you to choose from. Food was very tasty and served quickly. Their 辣子鸡 (Chongqing Fried Chicken) is a must-try. Right balance of spicyness and flavour, not too oily and sufficiently crispy. If you like clams, then this is a dish you shouldn't miss, 香炒花啦 (Stir Fried Clams). Their clams were clean and fresh, no sand, very flavorful. They also served (烧烤) BBQ skewers here too. Overall, this is a perfect place for friends gathering or celebratory meals at affordable prices.

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
IMPORTANT, READ HERE

If you plan on having food at this store. Please take note that this is not the standard you will be expecting N Years ago.

The taste and quality have change. Same story after COVID.

But the service is much better than last time.

Will one star first for the food and improve if they got better.

If you like some simple authentic Chinese food, this is the place to go for. The soya bean is original, you can taste the bean. There are no sugar added so you may adjust the rate accordingly

The drop in standard of yong he food is terrible! Not only is expensive, a small packet of soya bean drink cost $2. The 烧饼 used to be crispy and fluffy, I bought 2 I can’t even bite and cut using my home scissors! One look you can tell the 烧饼 is made and stored for long time before it is sold. I am so disappointed with the standard, not sure if it will survive!

Went to try their 豆浆 soya bean drink and 油条 fried fritter and also ordered a 萝卜丝蛋饼 carrot cake which is their probably signature dishes.  The fried fritter dipped into soya drink was pretty nice and not overly oily but the carrot cake (which reminded me of fried UFO) was a tad too oily for us. What was interesting was that they have a layer of egg omelette on top of fried skin and the whole setup is like that of a huge 煎饼 aka UFO.
Din try the savoury soya beans which comes with vinegar. The ambience is old school and prices are reasonable though if you are looking at a cool place to have soya milk then it is a no no. Parking is limited and we were fortunate to get a slot along the many side lanes! Still I do think it is worth a visit for nostalgia and Taiwanese food if you have some craving! Geylang many fantastic food places and is a foodie paradise. If you can look beyond the heat and also limited parking it is a piece of Singapore that is not so frequently seen!!

Standard dropped big time. Used to be a favourite supper place for many, but now...

The only consolation is the much smaller you tiao is not as oily as other stalls

Taiwanese food in Lavender.reviews:
This Legendary Bak Kut Teh is delicious.
Peppery and herbs style, the soup is free flow, we had 4 times of soup added, very satisfied!

The pork trotter is a highly recommend item to order. The meat and the skin were so flavourful, the spices of the braise sauce were truly filled in the meat, the texture of the meat braised till soft but not mash, the meat is still in its shape yet easy to eat. Nice!

2nd visit here. Soup is nice. Staff is very automatic in adding your soup. Portion is just nice. However the vinegar pork trotter is alittle hard/over cooked.

Everything else taste good.

Order dou miao, upon served we thinking this doesn look/taste like dou miao, upon asking staff then know this is hong kong dou miao. Staff are easily available to add on orders, no need to wait for long time. Maybe due to friday raining weather thus the shop wasnt crowded.

Lean meat soup, they probably patted some corn starch on the meat making it smooth, but dont like. Peppery soup, but taste abit heavy than the earlier one at rong hua.

Nice place to bring your foreigner friends too! One of the best Bak Kut Teh, the pork leg (throttled) is very tender.

Another little hidden gem....off the beaten path.  The food is freshly prepared and delicious.  The atmosphere is inviting with comfort food to make a relaxing day.

Like and follow for more amazing places to see and visit around the World

Russian cuisine in Novena.reviews:
A meal starts with a soft warm bread with butter. Lamb shashlik and cherry jubilee are still good as ever!
Unfortunately not so much on the borscht soup. Although tasting good as before, the Borscht soup was lacking in ingredients, very little cabbage and 1 piece of beef inside. Not worth the price.

Food was excellent! Loved the onion soup, borscht soup. The steak on iron pan was really delicious and super well seasoned! Didn’t expect it to taste that good. The tomato fish was sadly a miss for me! But the Irish coffee was delicious!!! Even my partner who is a super non-alcoholic person loved it and love the cream the whole presentation. What a gem of a place! Lovely!

the interior really brings you to a whole new place after walking up escalators of a seemingly abandoned and pretty run down building.
we had borshch soup which was really hearty and good we both loved it - must try when you’re here! 👍🏻
the upside down crab was also really good (tip: add salted butter onto the toast before adding the crab meat on top - the slight saltiness does a huge difference). We loved it though should have finished it while hot/warm because once cold, got a bit too jelat.
I had the fish en papillotte which was not bad (not much special) and the fish was SUPER SOFT but probably better for sharing; got a little boring after a while. He had oxtail stew which had a little too much fats, it got too jelat after a while too so better for sharing too.
We ended off with the waitress recommended cherry jubilee but we both found it very underwhelming so we had say no harm passing!
Overall a nice dining experience as the staff were really nice and attentive ☺️

Set above Far East Shopping Centre on the 6th floor, Shashlik Restaurant is one of those establishments that blends fond memories with consistently pleasing meals. The journey through the aisle of shops from way back yonder, with its varied mix of some newer ones, together with that single-file escalator, makes a sweet start to a culinary venture that feels like a warm embrace of the past.

The ambience while plain is rather pleasant, with wooden furnishing making a calm statement where food takes the lead. The wait staff were a mix of the young and elderly, who infused our experience with a lovely blend of professionalism and genuine warmth. Adding to that, their friendly banter invites diners into a space that feels both upscale and homely.

The Borshch soup, a creamy treat made even better with sour cream is always a personal favourite. The Tenderloin Shashlik while looking rather plain on a sizzling plate, gave bursts of exceptional flavours, complemented with a simple side salad. My companion opted for the Impossible Meat Balls with Pesto Pappardelle Pasta, while the other ordered the Chicken Thigh Shashlik. The obligatory order of fries was, as always, a welcome addition. The rice ball was not what we expected with its crispy texture, but pleasant nonetheless.

The pricing is slightly above average, but it does find some justification in the consistent quality of food and service.

Shashlik Restaurant positions itself with its intriguing blend of Russian and Hainanese cuisine, stemming from an even more interesting history. The cuisine, varied yet harmoniously blended, is not merely a meal but an essential culinary adventure, offering a unique and memorable palette of flavours.

Over the decades, Shashlik Restaurant is a testament of time-tested culinary delight. It stands as a resounding recommendation for those seeking a culinary journey that offers both unique flavours and a dash of nostalgia.

Always satisfied at the restaurant.

Location,  it's not really within the Orchard belt so it's great not to be in the traffic! There's an open air car park nearby.  Taxi drop off is next to the building.

Food is really yummy and of good quality.  The bun served is super good! Hot,  soft and tasty!

Ambience is good.  Keep a very cosy,  yet comfortable and exclusive feel.

Very welcoming staff.  All are friendly,  approachable and polite,  and with a good sense of humour.  And they all prepare you for your photography or video time knowing one would like to do some picture or video taking.

Price wise,  generally it's good reasonable for the venue,  Ambience,  quality and service.

Enjoy the time there for celebrations!

Russian cuisine in Novena.reviews:
Fun place to dine. Dumplings and cocktails are ace and service is awesome. Some food misses the mark. Will be back to try their extensive and interesting menu! More details below:

Food:
- Assorted dumplings are worth the try! Had lots of fun with the flavours and having them with the salsa and the sour cream
- Cocktails came with fried dumplings, I loved how they were salted, super great bar snack.
- Enjoyed the unique cold summer soup too!
- Some of the mains were a tad salty (chicken patty and mash) but really homey and warming and all came with veggies
- All food arrived in order so we had a cohesive meal

Service:
- The staff came to give recommendations and talked to us about the dumplings, very attentive.

Atmosphere:
- Quiet, peaceful, a great place to go for a date!
- Decor also very interesting and rustic

we made a reservation and were promptly served upon arrival.

food took a bit of time to arrive, noting they were all served hot and fresh.

food was nice and interesting, dumplings is their hit menu item here. I find the skin a bit thicker than the Asian dumplings, nevertheless they are flavourful. They have a variety of flavours for their dumplings.

good service and easy to order system.

I always wondered what Eastern European cuisine will taste like and I finally had the chance.
Definitely come try the dumplings as the flavors are so comforting and homely. It's made with a slightly thicker skin and has a nice texture and bite.

Service was great as staff introduced the menu personally and poured the Kvass for us. Me and my partner was pleased with the experience!
I will come back for another Kvass!

First time trying Russian food, I must say that the food, particularly the dumplings are very delicious, they are very filling. This is one of the foods I highly recommend, the service are excellent too, the staff would give recommendations and explain the food when it’s being served, thirdly, the restaurant is decorated with many Soviet era items such as Soviet newspapers, posters with Cyrillic text and even a Soviet Army ceremonial trumpet. Overall, good experience, food and service. 10/10.

I actually visited here a few years ago to try their ‘angmoh’ dumplings before they rebranded and found them rather interesting as compared to the usual Chinese dumplings. Glad that I’m able to try more dishes this round

What we had
🥟 Angmoh Dumplings Combo, $17.90
8 flavours in total. Salmon, minty ram, black bull, wild hog, golden hen, siberian (beef & pork), paneer and potato. The dumpling skin is thicker than the Chinese style. Fillings-wise, I enjoyed the potato and chicken

🍄 Cheburek, $22.90
Fried pastry with a choice of fillings. We picked cheese & white mushrooms. The pastry is crispy and filled with cheesy and juicy shroomy goodness

🐟 Draniki (Rosti), $24.90
Fried rosti served with smoked salmon. The rosti here is more similar to hashbrowns in terms of texture and not the usual crispy grated potatoes texture that I’m used to but it’s definitely more flavourful and well seasoned imo

🍰 Medovik, $12.90
Multi layered Slavic honey cake that is great for those with sweet tooth 😜

🥃 Shots, $10/shot (inhouse infused vodka)
🌶️ Ukrainian Red Chilli Pepper
Sounds scary but it’s actually not that bad.. I think? It does have that spicy and peppery kick tho, give it a try if you dare 🤪
🍊 Mandarin - slightly fruity
🍇 White Grape - for those who like it sweet

For more food reviews, follow me on
IG: @dtfoodaffair :)

Russian cuisine in Novena.reviews:
Old school feels where your orders are scribbled manually on paper.
Chatted with the owner abit and found out they have been at this location for 25yrs. Food is msotly freshly prepared except for rendang which is so good.

Prices are good and hard to beat..Give this a try if you are near this area.

Food is really good. This place has been around for 25 years. They have a fixed number of meals per day so nothing here is mass produced. Stay nearby but have never been to this gem. Will definitely come back again.

Food is really good. This place has been around for 25 years. They have a fixed number of meals per day so nothing here is mass produced. Stay nearby but have never been to this gem. Will definitely come back again.

True-blue authentic old-fashioned Peranakan home cooking at old-fashioned prices. Try everything, the flavours and portions will be more than satisfying. The owner serves you rice from a traditional bakul. Decor is outdated, but that's part of the charm. Sadly, it is hidden behind extensive construction at Novena and custom is definitely affected.

On 28.8.22 ,7.30pm, we reserved a table of 10 for my eldest son birthday.This is the first time we went to this cuisine to eat.All the dishes we ordered are very delicious to eat .The lemon tea & chendol are very nice. The boss jeffery is a very humble man which my father praise him for his work talent & the way he served customers warmly. Thank you jeffery & your workmate for your excellent service & we will recommend friends to eat at your cuisine.

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
A very beautiful and clean restaurant to try out. I have never been to a Moldovan restaurant before and decided to check it out. The menu is small with a variety of options. The food was very good but certain dishes can be pricey. I will potentially come back and try something else.

The food is very good! I would consider it home style. I had the braised lamb and the pan fried potato pie. Both very flavorful and authentic. Good service, good atmosphere. I would recommend it.

Great food, good atmosphere, good service, good beer and wine selection.

I started with the chicken and mushroom crepe appetizer, which was delicious. Then I got Tyask grape beer, which was unique. I tried the cabbage salad with sausages. Both were great, but the sausages were amazing. I also got the stuffed grape leaves, which I loved. I can’t wait to come back and try more!

We went for dinner with live music.

The food is just delicious. I don’t normally eat lamb, but they recommended it, so we ordered it.

Order the polenta.

The service needs improvement. It took 30 min to get our food. The waitress never came back to ask “do you like the food?”, “can I get you another glass of wine?”, “can I get you more water?”. We could have ordered more wine, so that was a missed opportunity for the restaurant.

If you can scan and pay, why wouldn’t you let me place my order using Toast? It would have been much faster.

Go for the food, but be patient because the service is not the best.

Thw food here was ABSOLUTLEY AMAZING. The sour cherry desert was delicious, the Chicken and Mushroom crepe was so good, the chicken and mushrooms was minced together. The potatoe dumplings were very good and the Braised Beef was MOUTH WATERING.. the chef had to have cooked the braised beef for hours to make it that tender, the red wine sauce and seasoning on this meal is unexplainable good. This is a must try place.

Great food.  The fried pickles and peppers were unique and delicious.  The chicken sandwich was outstanding.  Great bar menu and amazing service.   5/5.

Nice neighborhood bar and grill. Food was very good The service was excellent and the atmosphere of the restaurant was very nice and quaint. The prices were reasonable and although I didn't hang out at the bar I could imagine this being a decent neighborhood spot

I had the pleasure of enjoying drag brunch here on Saturday. Breakfast tacos were great. My server was delightful. Fun atmosphere. The drag queens, kings, and things were exceptional. Highly recommend the venue and attending an upcoming drag brunch. So fun!

Pub with TVs, a fairly large separate dining room, and some outdoor seating on a covered patio. Aspiring to be upscale, evidenced by the food prices - not quite there yet but still a great experience. Excellent beer selection with good variety.

Went tonight for the first time and although I saw multiple staff (including someone behind the bar) they all refused to look over at the hostess area for a good 5 minutes then we finally got seat on the patio. While seated, we waited a while, finally a server came out but didn’t even acknowledge our table (they passed our table to go to another table) and went to another table. Came back our way with still no acknowledgment and went back inside. Waited a few more minutes and asked another customer if we needed to go inside to order and they said normally servers do come out but they have been really slow at that moment. Finally walked out and went to another restaurant down the street.

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
I went here in the middle of the day with my husband for a late lunch. I really enjoyed the meal. We ordered a borscht which comes with a pirozhok, which is like a savory puff pastry with meat inside (although they have a vegetable option as well). Both were really well flavored and the pastry was very crispy and fluffy, a rare find in the pastry world. We also ordered the smoked salmon blinis, which were very good. Blinis are not your typical crepes, they are slightly heavier and chewier, which is very satisfying with the sour cream and salmon. It’s always a pleasant experience to go to a restaurant that isn’t run of the mill, but has good food.

A Delightful Journey Back in Time

Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Review:

I recently had the pleasure of visiting this hidden gem tucked away in the heart of the city, and I must say, it was an experience that left me utterly captivated. From the moment I stepped through the doors, I was transported to a bygone era, a time of elegance, sophistication, and culinary delights. Allow me to share my delightful journey at this charming establishment.

The first thing that caught my attention was the enchanting kitchen atmosphere. It exuded a nostalgic aura, taking me back to the days of grand dining halls and lavish banquets. The attention to detail was impeccable, with vintage decor, elegant chandeliers casting a soft glow, and beautifully set tables that evoked a sense of timeless elegance. The lady owner's touch was evident in every corner, creating a warm and inviting ambiance that was both cozy and refined.

The menu, oh, the menu! It was a culinary masterpiece, offering a selection of Russian fare that was truly a feast for the senses. Each dish was meticulously crafted, showcasing the rich flavors and traditional techniques of Russian cuisine. From the hearty borscht and tender beef stroganoff to the delicate pelmeni and indulgent caviar, every bite was a revelation. The infusion of vodka with various flavors added a unique twist to the dining experience, providing a perfect complement to the sumptuous dishes.

To further elevate the atmosphere, a talented pianist graced the establishment with their melodic tunes. The classical music filled the air, intertwining with the clinking of glasses and the laughter of delighted patrons, creating an atmosphere of enchantment and refinement. It was a true symphony of culinary delights and soul-stirring melodies.

But what truly sets this establishment apart is the personal touch of the lady owner. Her passion for hospitality and her commitment to creating an unforgettable experience for her guests shone through in every aspect of the evening. She effortlessly made everyone feel like a welcomed guest in her own home, ensuring that every need was met with grace and warmth.

In conclusion, my visit to this establishment was nothing short of magical. The kitchen atmosphere, with its nostalgic charm and elegant setting, took me on a journey back in time. The Russian fare, infused vodkas, and live piano music added layers of delight to an already exceptional experience. To the lady owner, I extend my heartfelt gratitude for creating such a haven of beauty, taste, and hospitality.

If you're seeking a dining experience that transports you to a world of elegance and grace, I wholeheartedly recommend paying a visit to this extraordinary establishment. Prepare to be enchanted, indulge in exquisite cuisine, and let the melodies of the pianist sweep you away. You won't be disappointed.

Once again, my sincere thanks to the lady owner for curating such a memorable and beautiful experience.

Visited: July 2023

Authentic Eastern European cuisines served in a rustic vibe.

My friend and I came here a while ago to try authentic Russian fares. As expected, we were the only English-speaking group at the restaurant, but our server was very welcoming and accommodating. It seemed like there were several groups coming in to celebrate special occasions, and we were fortunate to enjoy live piano throughout the evening.

We shared a couple of apps and a soup, and I had the sturgeon tzar with Russian kasha for the entrée. Served with a side of sour cream, both the blintze and the pirozhok were good, but the latter pulled ahead as a winner. Wrapped in a crispy baked pastry, the meat pirozhok was very flavorful, and I especially liked pairing it with the traditional beet-based soup - borscht. Sturgeon was also a nice surprise, and I liked that its texture was a bit similar to that of cod.

Overall, our experience at Cafe St.Petersburg was definitely far from typical dining experience in Boston. Nevertheless, we really liked the feeling of being transported to a local restaurant in a small Eastern European country, and I would highly recommend giving them a try.

Very yummy soups they have , pretty nice and polite waitress , adequate prices . Soups were around 8-10$ . They serve it with bread . Thank you for your warm welcome!

if you want home cooked food. on a friendly environment.. with great prices.. this is the place for russian. Georgian. Ukrainian foods.. it is a large place to have parties.. staff is great.. not a fancy place but that is why you go.. prices are very reasonable.. food is fresh.. it is like grandma is cooking for you..  come home and enjoy here.. they open they are open.. if not they are not.. but if they are there they will cook for you. be nice and they are the best

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
We visited BRONWYN (I have no idea why they capitalize their whole name.) Friday because October calls for German food. I love German food and there aren’t a lot of German restaurants around. I’ve been there before, but this was a wonderful visit. We started with the pretzel, big soft and covered with course salt. It comes with a very nice horseradish mustard, spicy but not overwhelming. For an up charge you can also get beer cheese, but I greatly prefer the mustard.

They were celebrating Oktoberfest, but I’m not much of a beer drinker, so I started with a cocktail. They have a variation on a Negroni called Czech Yourself, made with Czech fernet, gin, and Campari. Although I’m mostly Irish-German, I do have some Czech ancestry and as you well know I’m a gin guy, so I had to try it. Very nice, I actually preferred it it to the traditional Negroni. After that I had a couple glasses of Austrian Grüner Veltliner. I’m not Austrian.

For dinner we split the Spätzle and the Schnitzel. The spätzle is larger than I’m used to but nicely browned and served with spinach and onions. You can add a sausage to it if you like. We added a bratwurst. This dish is delicious but huge. I took some home, and it heats up nicely in a frying pan the next day.The schnitzel was also excellent. It is topped with a mushroom cream sauce and served with warm, bacony potato salad. I would get both of these dishes again with no hesitation. I’d even get the spätzle to go because it reheats so well.

For dessert, we had the Apflestrudel, apples and golden raisins stuffed into a pastry and topped with buttermilk whipped cream. With it, I had a shot of Jäegermeister, which I didn’t shoot, I sipped.

The staff was dressed in traditional German attire and the small space was decorated for Oktoberfest. There aren’t many seats and it’s crowded, but definitely charming. The service was very friendly and the atmosphere was casual.  It was a relaxing feast. Union Square is about the worst place to park, but once you find a spot everything is great! I’m excited to go back to try the sauerbraten and of course more of their haus sausages.

Always a blast during Oktoberfest! Don't forget it's there the rest of the year. Perfect to stop by and satiate your want for a soft pretzel.

Very classy and authentic German gastropub in Summerville. Plenty of parking spaces, friendly and warm ambience! Food was amazing and priced reasonably!

Fun German pub with welcoming vibe. The burgers and wurst got high marks from our crew. The wait staff was flexible and fun.

Don’t skip the pretzel! Food is awesomely German (duh!) and so is the beer. Be brave and get the Liter.

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
The laid-back vibe, surprisingly decent food, and great beer selection makes up for the dingy basement feel. They did a great job of making full use of the outdoor space, so that should definitely be your first option if the weather is good. The restaurant should check that all the table umbrellas are fastened - ours was missing the tightening knob and it almost hit us when a big gust of wind blew. I love how they have a truly unique brew shop right next to the dining area.
The staff was very accommodating and as sweet as can be.
The food was very good. Salads were fresh, the pretzels were soft and warm, and the deviled eggs were top notch. The chicken curry chicken salad was a massive bowl of just chicken, and it was definitely tasty, but all the chicken we had was a little rubbery.
This is truly a unique spot and is a great place to chill, grab a bite and drink a few brews.

There is something nice and family about this place. My 7 and 10 year old grandkids love it, hot dogs and root beer, interesting German type food for grown ups and great big beer selection. It's in a basement, lots of benches and picnic tables. We keep going back.

It’s always great to come here, drink great beers - both local and international, enjoy tasty food, and enjoy the company of others - everyone is just so thoughtful here, from the staff to other guests.
100% a worthwhile stop if you’re looking for a tasty brew (three different ounce serving options), food, and/or a family-friendly spot.

Great beer selection, nice outdoor tables (with view of parking lot...), decent German food. A good option in Belmont Centre [sic].
Schnitzel was decent. Knockwurst and sweet mustard were good. Warm potato salad was a bit too vinegary for my taste, and didn't have enough bacon grease (but others will like that!).
Friendly and efficient service.

Stopped by for dinner when visiting family in town, we must've stayed 3 hours and ordered the whole damn menu... Outstanding & unique dishes, everything was tasty. Plenty of perfect pairings with beer & sausages.

Staff was knowledgeable and very helpful. Can't recommend this place enough. We'll definitely be back the next time we're in town!

Loved the contactless menu & ordering as well. Such an efficient system that I wish more places used.

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
If you want a juicy flavorful steak I suggest going elsewhere. Came here for my birthday the other day. Service was great and I was so excited about the food until I actually tried my dish. I ordered the seared tenderloin with butter poached lobster. It was the most flavorless steak and lobster I've ever had. Literally, every other steakhouse I've tried was better than this, and this is the 4th stop. The only downside to my birthday was the steak. The fries and dessert were good but for it being a fine dining steakhouse... highly disappointed.

We recently dined at The Capital Grille to mark a birthday, and our experience was truly wonderful. The waiter was friendly and knowledgeable. The food was superb, although the drinks could have been a bit improved. Nevertheless, we all had an immensely enjoyable time. The ambiance contributed to a fantastic birthday celebration, and the special birthday plate they presented added to the overall experience.

We celebrated my birthday last night in Chedtut Hill, MA and it was outstanding. My dirty martini was just right! The tuna tartare was delicious! And my filet mignon was perfect. Miranda took great care of us and made sure it was a special night. Can’t wait to go back soon!

Chestnut Hill location. Fabulous restaurant for a special event. Just celebrated a birthday there. The cocktails are great. Try the Double Oaked and Rye Manhattan. One of the best Manhattans I have ever had. The tuna tartare appetizer was great. Beautiful presentation and great flavor. The bone in rib-eye was delicious. And the service is superb. Ask for Miranda-she is terrific!

First time visiting TCG and I must admit, it was FABULOUS. First, the manager Jeff runs a smooth ship.  His staff are just an amazing group of people.  Feel free to ask for him, he is the real deal.  Had a minor hiccup and Jeff made it right without us even saying a single word. That…is truly superior customer service at its best.

My waiter Patrick and his co-worker Jose were simply nothing short of remarkable.  I mean, you want a great dining experience, ask for one of these guys, I mean…they WOWED me.  The food was absolutely amazing and the passion fruit mojito was excellent.  The bone-in ribeye…..just O.M.G! The place felt like you were in a law firm.  They do offer valet parking at the front door and the bathrooms were very nice and clean.  Plenty of parking and dress appropriately. Don’t wear t-shirts and your grandfather’s overalls, dress nice, it’s a nice and classy place that your significant other will truly enjoy.

So, amazing dining experience and would I return? That would be an emphatic HECK YEAH I WOULD.

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
Go to place for soups and salads. The Greek salad is always delicious and fresh especially with the grilled chicken breast on top. The pita on the side is always freshly made and delicious. The Greek lemon chicken soup and homemade gazpacho are also favorites.

A deli with huge salads and sandwiches. They did not have table service, but lots of booths and tables were available. Most of the items on the menu are big enough to serve for two. I took home half of my Cobb salad. Wife took home half of her corned beef sandwich. Onion rings were enough for two, and were very good. We did not try any of the dinner items on the menu.

Ordered a “lamb” gyro and I’m almost positive it was actually just beef chunk…. The gyro tasted okay but it was tough to believe anything about the meat was actually lamb. Walked in and it was empty (given, it was a Monday at 6:30pm), the lighting was dark, could barely see into the display shelves at the counter. Just a lot of work that needs to be done here before I’d consider going back.

Everything turned out perfect! I worked with Sean to cater my party. He gave me great suggestions for the menu and the amount. Everything was ready for pick up  at the time we agreed with clear instructions for reheating. The food was delicious, and we all enjoyed without stress. We especially loved the hummus, pita, tzatziki, the pie, kebab and the beet salad. Thank you Sean and Putterham Grille!

A nice selection of sandwiches, salads and deserts. I went there for Lunch and it wasn't crowded, there quite a few tables were taken. We had the Mezza platter which was enough for several people to share. The decor is pleasant so are the wait staff. The food was very good, and the portions are ample. Prices are reasonable. Parking is really available.

I’ve been a regular at Devlin’s for over 2 years and this review is long overdue! My family threw a surprise bday here for me which was also a blast. The food is amazing, lots of comfort food items and also fun desserts, drinks, and apps. The patio is an absolute gem, one of the best in greater Boston. Can’t say enough good things and highly recommend giving Devlin’s a try!

It's one of my favorite spots. The food is always consistent. I got the plantain tacos. They weren't bad! The steak ones were better though. The sticky toffee pudding dessert was amazing. The service is always great. Don't miss trying this place out.

Great pun food and salads. Bloody Mary was just average but good none the less. Private outdoor patio area (well away from the street) with it's own bar is a perfect place to get together after work. They have a varied brunch menu as well. Worth the trip?

Steak tips the right size for medium-rare were perfect, as was the grilled brussel sprouts and lobster casserole...in a comfy classic atmosphere backed by attentive wait and generous barkeep services. Made our multi-cultural trio feel relaxed and focused on each other's conversations. ✅✅🎉

I went here with some friends, and we had an interesting experience. The food was great, but it took us 10 minutes to get access to a menu because the online link didn’t work and they didn’t have any printed out. Its pretty inside, a little hard to find because the building isn’t labeled, but there was quick service since there were less than 4 other tables full in the restaurant.

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
My favorite bar in town. Always feel welcome there and it's nice to know the crowd when you go in to have a few drinks. Great prices for the drinks, great bar tenders. Beautiful bar on the inside. Also has a great deck to enjoy some drinks on during the summer months

Our first visit to the German Club on Tuesday, September 7, 2021 was after a bicycle trip down the Youghiogheny trail.  The Club stands majestic amongst a small quite town of residents.  Inside was just as jaw dropping.  Beautiful woodwork and so spacious with a large bar, dining area, stage for what appears to be live entertainment, massive pull-down screen for sports games and several pool tables.  Stopped in for a few drinks only so unsure of any food items besides the standard chip-bag stand.  Visitors and staff were all so friendly.  We actually became members and look very forward to visiting again!!!

The best place to hang out and have some drinks. Everyone there is friendly and the bartenders are fantastic .

Great time, great prices, great atmosphere! I love that it’s a private club so it’s not a typical bar scene!

Beautiful bar and dance floor,, Nice and congenial barmaids, pretty too. Good food and fun prices for any beverage.

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
I really enjoyed this neighborhood dive. Somehow I never made my way over here and now I wish I had gone sooner! With so few neighborhood bars in the area, I'm so glad that I not only found one, but a great one. It looks like there is. Trivia night on Tues which I will def check out!
The atmosphere is bright and cheery despite a little sticky menu grime. While you wait they give you the most buttery salty movie theater popcorn to munch on. The food was very good. I recommend the surprisingly good clam strip roll and the burgers are juicy and delish. Gluten free rolls are available too.
The service here is stand out. The wait staff is genuinely friendly and they truly offer great service.
I wouldn't come here to impress visiting in town family, but for those more frequent times where you want a comfortable friendly neighborhood spot where you can watch the game, enjoy a cold beer, and eat some comfort food, this is your place.

Everything is great at this place food is amazing can't go wrong with anything here to eat. But a must try is the wings they are so big and juicy. I couldn't pick a sauce or flavor so I got plain bone-in and got sauces on the side. It is a home feeling kinda place not so updated but worth eating here. Don't miss out on a wonderful experience people. I been there two times already bringing more people each time I go.

Interesting rustic pub feel.  The wait staff was on target. The menu consists of sandwiches, apps and a couple of entrees. The food was pretty good.  Basic food with reasonable costs.

i have to say that this place has the best onion rings! i have had many dishes here but almost always get onion rings. this visit i got the smoke house burger and my partner had the ultimate chicken sandwich which i have had before. everything had a great flavor and was cooked to order. the staff was attentive and very polite. will definitely be going back.

We go there all the time! Love this place! Great food, great atmosphere. Great bartenders and servers. NEVER a problem. Unfortunately..  last 2 visits we got chicken wings which are usually perfect. Got Teriyaki a  thin sauce so we could see the freezer burn on our wings. It was disgusting. At home if you grab something out of the freezer and see freezer burn you throw it out as to not serve it to your family and friends. Disappointed in the cooks, as how would the owners know? They rely on there cooks to serve to their Guests quality food.  Cooks if you won’t eat it throw it away! Owners talk to the kitchen! Are  you aware of it what’s going on? We will NOT stop going just letting you know.

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
Stopped in on my way to work to try them out. They had just opened and I was kindly greeted. Ordered the breakfast sandwich on a biscuit with sausage. It was so good! The biscuit was soft and flaky, the eggs were freshly cooked up and the sausage and cheese were perfect. I also ordered a cold brew which was really tasty. Not bitter at all and perfectly done. I wish I could have stayed because the atmosphere was super cozy. I will be back!

The tacos are delicious-light but filling and very tasty.
The blueberry scones are just wonderful.
Can't wait to try some other of their breakfasts and lunches!

Bettina’s is the hidden gem of Newton. I’ve been coming back frequently to try new items on the menu and have not once been disappointed. My “usual” has become the delicious brioche egg sandwich along with a cold brew. Absolutely worth stopping in!

Best breakfast and lunch around. Nice hand-made breakfast sandwiches. Their muffins tend to still be warm when they first open.

Bettina's Bakery is great. Their Honduran Baleadas are delicous.  i recommend add avacado.  They can even make it gluten free.  Everything is freshly made, but still very quick and friendly service.  Interesting Coffee ans Tea choices.  You can go for breakfast, lunch, or to just bring baked goods home for the family.

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
A really lovely place to celebrate the holiday. Excellent food and signature cocktails! Warm staff.

So good. Crystal, our server, was awesome. Will come back soon. Best to reserve a table if you come with a party of more than 4 people

Food is excellent. Very comfortable old world atmosphere. Service is great. Only downer... pay with plastic and 5% is added to the bill.

It'd be respectful if this were told to a patron before bill presentation.

Not my most favorite meal. Also a bit confused by what they were offering since the meal I got, mushroom ravioli, was $10 on the specials pricing and I was charged $27. I didn’t say anything because I didn’t wanna be rude, plus the place was really cute and I really liked the environment I was in. Still, confusion on all, I don’t think it was my style of food. It is mainly German food, still a great experience.

Very nice to find you guys. I never expected. beautiful place good service and great food i come back definitely 👍🏼

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
This is a popular restaurant in Coolidge corner so I was very excited to try. However, I am disappointed by the food.

Although I really appreciate the big servings, this is not gen z vibe or flavor that we love. Starting off, there was NO salt in all of the food we got. Unseasoned, and really just tasted the flavor of the ingredients. The plate looks not aesthetically pleasing. Food stacked on top of each other and no special color or plating. I think the chefs know how to cook food cuz it looks nice to the eye, but they just forgot to add salt or any herbs or seasoning 🧂!!!!

Overall, the deli captured the essence of tradition, flavor, and community, making it a must-visit for anyone looking to savory cuisine. I left with a happy heart and a full belly, already counting down the days until I can return for another memorable meal.

The knish's simplicity is its charm, yet it manages to pack a punch of flavor that always leaves me wanting more.

Be prepared to be overwhelmed with the flavor from their sandwiches, complemented with a new dill pickle. The deli mustard is explosive with flavor.
Make room for some matzo ball soup and bagel chips with your meal, it's good for you.

We were in Boston for our anniversary and heard we should try Zaftigs. We rode the green line and hiked over. What a wonderful experience. The food was terrific. Service extremely good. Atmosphere perfect. Highly recommend the visit.

I had the challah French toast, it was great!  The fruit plate is big, could easily be split by two or three people. Syrup was really
Good too.

We went here for lunch and it was absolutely delicious! I would highly recommend the Reuben, the Monte Cristo, the Pastrami and Swiss, and the French Fries. There was about a ten minute wait when we went on a Saturday morning, but they kept tables moving through quickly. Once we were seated, the service was prompt and friendly.
