German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
This place has atmosphere! The food was okay. The chicken fingers where frozen which is always sad and I definitely had regrets when I saw the Mac and cheese and burgers come out. We got two entrées a side order of onion rings and appetizer and it came out to about 60 bucks. There was this strange surge of excitement in the air and it’s hard to explain but it seemed like everyone was just really happy from the service people to other guests. 100%will go back.

Great experience … I live in the neighborhood … will definitely be back. Good food and good vibes. My wife loved the fish tacos and the drinks were good. Wish they had a few more local draft beer options but still a great little spot with good service/atmosphere.

After reading about the post-pandemic debt problems, my husband and I decided to support the restaurant last night. Went in for a quick dinner and did not disappoint. Mindy at the bar was kind and efficient. Recommended great cocktails. Had delicious fish tacos and fish and chips with wonderful service. Vibe was friendly and relaxed.  Definitely a neighborhood place that needs to stay around. I

I was a first time customer at Ritcey tonight, and I’ll definitely recommend it as a spot to check out! The atmosphere is so friendly and welcoming: we were immediately greeted by two different employees and offered a choice as to where we would like to sit.

My husband and I ordered a burger and the fish tacos, respectively, and my pro-tip is to absolutely order the onion rings. Those were devoured instantly! My one tip on the fish tacos would be to add more seasoning to the fry batter for more depth of flavor. Otherwise, the portions were generous and we can’t wait to try other items on the menu.

P.S. We were thrilled to see that this restaurant is a queer friendly space. Just another reason to love and support this local gem!

A favorite local spot! We love the burgers and fish tacos, and I usually enjoy a fun specialty cocktail. The staff are super friendly too!

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
We sat outside, it felt like home, a backyard at home.
No complaints at all about wind, dust, mosquitoes or flies. The place is clean and we got very good service.
They don't have a big menu but it has a fair variety and diversity
We had a great time.

Phenomenal burgers, and the salmon was really delicious

Porter Cafe is my happy place. Absolutely amazing vibe, the food is SPECTACULAR, everyone I bring here has enjoyed it and the man behind the bar always has a story to tell. The staff here are incredible and really make me want to come back every single time.

Had a very delicious meal that was well prepared, tasty and used fresh ingredients. Service was good and Sever was attentive to needs. Good sized portions. One thing you need to be prepared for is the tables are close together. I had one party on one side that was having a quiet conversation and then unfortunately had a party of four on the other side that was to loud. Overall a very good experience and looking forward to going again

A very nice little neighborhood cafe. I loved the food and the environment. Had poke and watermelon cocktail and do recommend them both. Will visit again.

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
Great hot food and dishes perfect for the working man or college student. Jim is there most of the time super great guy lovely energy he helps get you excited while you wait and the chefs cook the burgers, salmon dinners and other things upon order, you can see what they’re doing and there are professional and attentive. Just a little pricey but it’s always been worth it each time I go 🥳

Best sandwich/breakfast/dinner plates around. If you go to BC you need to check out Jim’s Deli. Order Uber eats if you don’t have a car. I have lived all over the country, Jim’s is up there as the best of the best

So great! Great fresh food that tastes like home! The atmosphere is very cozy, and staff are so nice. Would absolutely come back! I had the Italian sub and it’s one of the best I’ve ever had! Great fries too!

This place is always in business! Great setup to order and receive what you requested. Lots of menu options AND you can edit your order to your liking! The staff is VERY friendly, accommodating and rapid with their work! Don't worry if there is a line because they operate rather quickly. NOTHING IS MICROWAVED! Everything is made fresh, right on site* Street parking is available and prices are beyond reasonable. After you visit Jim's Deli, What more would one need to know or want?!

Authentic place & amazing burgers.
Worth a visit if you’re nearby!

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
A good spot with great sauces. Very very casual. Cafe style. Ready quickly. Clean restroom. Street parking isn’t bad in this area. There is no alcohol served here.
The Kofte is flatter than I’m used to; was pressed more like a hamburger but was still good.

I visited this restaurant on the recommendation of a Turkish friend. We are from Cambridge and our first visit to Needham. We ordered 4 dishes. Among them, the beef kofte was especially delicious. Normally I don't like meat, but it was well cooked. The salads and hummus were fresh and the food was cooked quickly. But the stuffed grapeleaves are cold to eat so we asked them to warm up. The staff was willing to do that. They are very kind. Thanks to this restaurant, I have a good impression of Needham. Oh! I also had coconut and pistachio baklava for dessert, but I forgot to take a picture. It was so good I ordered more and brought it home.

In the western suburbs, this is the best gyro/kebab restaurant I have been to. Solid value.  Fresh pita. Very fresh lettuce/tomato. Gyro meat is juicy and flavorful, as is the chicken Kebob.   Food is served hot and is prepared quickly.  The place is clean.  I’ll be back soon!

I had gyros from here a couple of weeks back since I had been craving them for a while. I felt a little less attentiveness from the staff. The place is not great for dine-in. The food was good though, so I might order take-out or delivery the next time.

I love Gyro and Kebab house. Always fresh and delicious food. My family regularly goes for a dinner in Norwood. My favorite plate is Adana kebab, baklava is always delicious. We love this place.

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
This was a great place to grab a laid back dinner with family or friends. I ordered the NYS Strip with frites and did enjoy it but nothing extrodinary, I give 4/5⭐️. My friend got the summer salad with chicken and thought it was just okay-there definitely could have been more chicken or could have came mixed in a bowl. The service was very quick with our server Brian and he made sure we had everything we needed!

Even it was a little bit crowded I found a very kind service. The food was delicious, I got a hamburger with very well made fries. Highly recommend the place for taking a beer a having a good time with friends.

I'll start off with the good; service and atmosphere was fantastic!

The bad.... Food was not worth the prices. A hamburger was $18 then in you wanted cheese it was $2, want sauce $2, maybe bacon $3. All in you're at $25 for a burger that looks like a bubba burger....

Go here for the beer or the mac and cheese (just don't look at the up charges). If you want another food go to bartaco.

Good place to hang out.  Good variety of beer, especially if you like German or Belgian beers.  Their lobster nachos are amazing!

Well crafted cocktails and more! Food, cooked to order, is fresh and tasty with great portions. Servers were extremely attentive to what we may have needed and went above and beyond with making our dinner feel special. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a new place to try out!!!

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
Drunken noodle was bad. Super sweet and not much noodle. Waiter was inattentive. Had no water in my cup, he never noticed. I had to get my own water in the front. Then he realized and walked around to fill ppl’s drinks. He didn’t ask what spice level we wanted either. I am not coming back.

The absolute best Tom Yum soup. Order the one with noodles and you will not be disappointed. Every time there are 5 enormous shrimp that take 2-3 bites to finish one and these bad boys are the reason this is the best soup in the neighborhood. Huge portion and the broth is to die for. I salivate just writing about it. If you order it to go it’s even better. All the ingredients are so fresh and packed separate so you can add more or less to taste. Last week I had it three days in a row and I never eat anything three times in a row without getting bored. The prices are very reasonable and other dishes are just as good.

I have been coming here for 2 years now on a consistent basis. Today, I was made to feel extremely uncomfortable by the male server who serves during the day. It started with once I sat down which was 11:30 when they opened. I mentioned it was a bit hot and asked if their air was working (simple question) non-accusatory, the waiter then alludes to the fact that I walked right in once they opened and maybe the restaurant would’ve been colder had I not come in when they opened. After letting him know multiple times I was fine with where I sat, he moved my menu anyways to an area I did not want to be in. The water cup I was given was broken and making pools of water on my table- he did not change it although noticing I was wiping water the table the entire time. Last but not least— after paying my bill in exact change he has the nerve to ask me where the tip is. After seeing my face absolutely mortified by that question, he tried to joke around and say “wasn’t the food made with love?” My food wasn’t packed up, and I was nowhere near ready to leave. Usually I leave the cash tip on the table as I head out. I responded by letting him know I wasn’t leaving yet and I had planned on putting it on the table. I felt so uncomfortable by this exchange I wanted to let him know for future reference. After coming up to the counter and giving him his tip in hand, I told him he really should not assume someone is not giving him a tip and him asking me that way made me uncomfortable. He says “okay have a nice day goodbye” over and over again and I repeated- no you made me very uncomfortable and an apology would’ve been nice. He laughed at me as I walked out. This was somewhere I went once a week easily and I really enjoyed all the workers I’ve had thus far but this experience really made me uncomfortable to ever come back. Please don’t allow your servers to do this again, this ruined my dining experience

Friendly staff and nice atmosphere! First time trying this place and we ordered pho. Was pleasantly surprised how big the bowls were. The noodles and broth were delicious!

Very good eats at extremely fair prices. Their Vietnamese food is certainly the best of their offerings, but it's nicecthat they have some Thai and Japanese options as well. The service at this location is quite slow (but very friendly) so don't expect a quick meal.

German restaurants in Newton.reviews:
Absolutely loved the wood-fired pizzas here! Tried the margherita and the fennel and sausage varieties, and both were awesome. The wood oven half chicken was incredibly flavorful and just as impressive. The overall dining experience was fantastic, and I highly recommend trying Prairie Fire

Loved their fire pizza. It has a nice ambience and the servers were great. I was immediately seated next to the kitchen door while all the window spaces where available. I thought at the beginning that maybe because our chosen table was for two but then several pairs were seated at these tables which made us question if we were placed there by pure bias. I think customers should be asked where they prefer sitting if the place has empty tables.

My coworkers and I had our office celebration here. We were the first group there. The employees were all extremely attentive and consistent throughout the entire time (we had to have been there for two hours +). Our waitress Carmella was so sweet and had great energy.

My team and I were all so hungry, we had ordered the rolls and 1 of each pizza.

Wow. Wow. Wow. My manager Steve had asked “What’s your guys favorite style of pizza”. I had answered “This” and a few others on my team did as well. Being so serious.

Everything was genuinely incredible. So fresh, temperature was perfect. Drinks were also really really good. Everything came out so quick too.

The squash, margarita, classic cheese and pepperoni pizzas were my favorites. But the others were not far off.

Seriously all so so good and the rolls omg. A perfect appetizer, with the perfect cool down garlic herb butter to accompany the roll. Loved it.

The perfect place to unwind with your family/ friends/ coworkers, while still feeling good about yourself (I ate like 10 pieces of pizza and could’ve kept going lololol)

Rise Realty thanks everyone at Prairie Fire for their incredible service and incredible cuisine. As for myself, well you guys will definitely be seeing me more of me 🔥✨

Ordered the squid ink Campanelle. It was delicious. Sat at the bar. Friendly server. Friendly host. Nice ambiance. They have casual outside seating with picnic tables. Like a beer tent minus the tent. Need to be redecorated. Maybe nice for families w small kids?
Def recommend this place

Great food, atmosphere and service…the mushroom toast to start and lamb pasta were excellent

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
Went to the Timbre+ outlet in expo and it was a decent plate of lechon. The skin was crispy but a bit too hard. As for the meat some parts were juicy but some were too dry and hard. The accompanying vege also seemed a bit sad..

Eaten here twice - once in the evening and this time during lunch. The grilled pork belly is very juicy and slightly crispy on the outside, and has that awesome bbq aroma. I would love to eat that chilli but I did not as I would definitely break out in sweat. It’s so satisfying just eating the pork belly and rice.

We had a Lechon dish ( roasted pork with rice) quite nice, but another time we try the a potion without rice, it was too many fat inside. We always eat in the timbre near expo. I guess should tell the staff give us the less fat one 😁. Their sauce is yummy with the meat

Disgusting attitude from the large Chinese woman serving. I have bought Filipino food from here several times yet have never encountered the type of attitude I just received from this so-called server. I approached the counter and in my friendliest voice I asked "Hello, do you have lechon?" The woman totally ignored me and refused to answer me even though I asked three times. Eventually she snapped and shouted "Yeah, I know you want lechon." I asked her if they had it (they often sell out) and again she refused to answer me. I will not give my money to support someone with such a disgusting and hostile attitude so I spent my $40 at the Thai stall next door where I received friendly service. Will not go back to this stall while this disgusting woman who doesn't understand customer service works there.

I believe that this is the Filipino version of roasted pork rice. The meat is tender and skin is crispy. Soup that came with it was a tad salty but it blended well with the set.
The restaurant is located in Timbre+, a cool looking conversion from the typical JTC factory canteen.

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
5-star service with average dishes.  This may be the first restaurant that my eldest specifically asked if I was going to provide feedback because he loved the service so much.  I have to concur, the staff at Gerry’s certainly made us feel right at home.  The dishes however were average at best, reminiscent of what I’ve had elsewhere, but definitely on the pricey side and seemingly confused as to what customer palates they are catering for.  The sisig and grilled squid are worth a try.  We’ll be back given it’s family friendly and a convenient option when we have a craving for Filipino food.

Never had Filipino food before, and was pleasantly surprised by the fare at Gerry's Grill. The restaurant has a friendly family restaurant vibe, and the service is good.

Recommended dishes include the mackerel with grilled pork, and the Halo Halo dessert.

Be careful of over ordering as portions tend to be very generous as well. Will come back again.

Standard dropped :( I last ate this in 2019 and it was so so good. But in my recent visit in Oct 2023, it didnt taste as good as before.

Pork sisig was a total let down. I remember this place has my fav sisig but this time, it just tasted off. Very charred and lacking in flavour.

Adobo was okay but veryyy salty.

Lumpia used to be very good too. Now, just average.

Perfect place to go to in Singapore if you want quality Filipino food to satisfy your cravings! Service is quite fast. Place is clean and cool. Staff are friendly. Food is delicious. Very much happy and will visit again 😊

Tried this Filipino restaurant as a reco from a Filipino friend. Food was ok, a bit pricy and quality is mediocre. We tried a bunch of dishes because it was out first time. Each dish is about $17 (nice portions tho). The grilled and roasted pork were the best. The yellow noodle dish (can’t remember the name) was really weird but strangely addictive. Everything is a bit oily so be prepared. The place is very quiet (we went for a late lunch) so no issues to get a table. Overall a so so experience…it felt like being in the Philippines which was the objective.

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
Paid $48 for this at LECHON PINOY. Not coming back.

Ordered Lechon Sisig which WASN'T SIZZLING, it was warm but NOT HOT. Flavour was more towards (shredded) Lechon than a sisig fusion, lacked basic sisig ingredients like onion, soy sauce and egg.

Ordered Laing and Bopis too. While I couldn't complain on the flavours, they were ala carte portions and of course priced as one dish. I asked if there's a side dish option so I could order more, but was told they don't. In the end, me and my company had too much leftovers.

This is a crook place. Twice I ate there, they charged crazy prices. I thought I wanted to try filipino food but never at this place again. A small bowl of beef lungs, he charged $7.50 & it stank and tasted bad. the same for a bowl of vegetables takeaway..$7.50 too!! What a rip off! 🤬🤬🤬

AVOID AT ALL COST!!! robbery at broad daylight. pretty expensive for a filipino food. which is not that extra ordinary when it comes to taste. $25 for lunch.

I had the Lechon in Lechon Pinoy (i believe they are the same owner with Lutong Pinoy). The Lechon was perfect - moist interior and crispy exterior

The beef soup is very nice. Broth is very tasty and the meat so tender. $14 for 2 bowls of rice and soup with big chunks of meat.

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
Located on the 4th level of The Clementi Mall, head to green MRT line and alight at Clementi station and take the exit towards the mall. Head up to the 4th floor and they are located beside Wing Stop.

The concept of this restaurant is interesting as they are not halal and serves premium pork, chicken and beef, even Wagyu for a personalized BBQ. Restaurant occupancy is about 40 to 60 pax and dining is allowed for 60 minutes. A QR code will be provided by the staff when they show you to your seat which will be used to browse their menu and order food. Staff are friendly and trying their best to serve you as fast as they can.

The meat they serve is acceptable and with the price of their value meals, it's really value for money. I would recommend paying a little more for the extra portion. Each value meal comes with a small bowl of kimchi and a variety of sauces on your table. Beef lovers might just love it here as you can grill your meat to your liking. Chicken would not be as easy as they use the thigh meat and when sliced, there are many small pieces which could drop into the grill. I have the say the pork is great and with the option to add on pork jowl, you have to come try it for yourself.

Overall a must try for Yakiniku lovers that aren't looking for a buffet setup but just for a quick BBQ fix at an affordable price. I have snapped their QR code for you to take a queue number while you're heading down as the queue is longer during peak hours thus won't need to waste too much time.

Food is as usual nice. However I still feel they should extend the eating time to more than 50 min.

My daughter and I were on the way to JEM for Yakiniku-GO, when this place popped up searching through Google maps. Attracted by the Taiyaki Mochi, we decided to try. It’s almost, but not as good - sauces, smaller heating bbq area, less spacious. The one plus is the Taiyaki Mochi - was a real treat, but possible to buy frozen options online to do at home. So bottom line, still prefer our original place for Yakiniku.

Overall a pleasant dining experience! Second time visiting this outlet. Restaurant environment is clean and the design of the grill makes it non-smoky and greasy when grilling meat. Restaurant staff are friendly and helpful too, they were quick and sincere in rectifying the mistake when one of the staff sent me the wrong kind of meat. And I think the quality of the meat cuts is pretty good for the price point! Nice kimchi side dish too.

Atmosphere wise, your standard noisy yakiniku place.

Service wise, not exactly how they claimed on restaurant deco that they deliver food on table in 5 minutes, but still within 10 minutes.

Food wise, I find them rather affordable and tasty. Many options of different cuts, completed with sauces. Visited twice and will visit again.

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
I'm glad to visited there ! Filipino cuisine is known for its variety of flavors, textures and colors. From the flavorful adobo to the soup. there's something for everyone. I'm sure you found plenty of delicious dishes to enjoy.

I had an incredibly disappointing experience at this restaurant. Not only was the food served to me raw, but the owner's aggressive and confrontational attitude towards my complaint was truly unacceptable. As a customer, I expected to be treated with respect and professionalism. I strongly advise others to be cautious when considering dining here, as my encounter left me feeling both unsafe and unsatisfied

Great Comfort foods here!!!
Shout out to Mamita's Kitchen
:) Mapa meat or veggie ulam, panalo

Helped my Filipino colleagues to buy their lunch from here and they were nothing but utterly RUDE! requested for vinegar, patis with chili padi and they commented "so many requests a!" When I reach our ofc and open the orders, they ended up not giving the requested vinegar. The service was ridiculously BAD. I have helped my colleagues from other Filipino stores in Lucky Plaza many time and they were never like this.

For all places I've tried, their bulalo is the best in Singapore.

The other food I ordered (longganisa & bicol express) is the same or better than other places but not the best.

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
Food was ok. Hit and miss on some dishes. Snacks (rice cakes) and desserts are good. Service was  lacking the usual Filipino friendliness and happiness, imo. Place is spacious and clean.

🚇 Orchard

Visited the restaurant on a Tuesday afternoon. It's a rustic Pinoy place serving the familiar Philippines fair. If you really like strong tasting food, then this is the place to visit. Bulalo soup is SGD20 per bowl, and it's large enough for 2 pax. They serve desserts herr as well if you are game for it.

Tosilog is actually a combination of the different components of the meal - Tocino (cured pork), Sinangang (garlic fried rice), and Itlog (egg). The cured pork was so thick and flavourful, almost like a version of charsiu with sweetness to it, but might be somewhat tough for some. The Sinangang was the star of the show though, so fragrant and aromatic and paired so well with the meat and egg. The soup was sour (in a good way) and helped to cut through the oiliness. Overall, enjoyed this Tosilog Set ($7.50).

Had the Maja Blanca ($2.30 per pc) too. Also called Coconut Pudding, this is made from coconut milk, cornstarch, and sugar. Corn kernels are also added to give added sweetness and crunch. Thick and creamy, this was similar to the Nyonya kueh of my childhood. The toasted coconut flakes at the side also paired so well with the pudding. Delicious!

Filipino caifan with a large variety of dishes to choose from. Saw many filipinos choosing the fried bangus fish and took it. Was disappointed as it was cold and tasted like mackerel with a slight sour taste not worth the price of 9.50. The kare kare fared better. It was thick and rich in peanut flavour and came with soft stewed vegetables and chunky pork belly

Feels very homely! I love coming to this place once in a while to try out the different dishes. Yesterday I had some sisig and other side dishes, it was delicious!

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
First time in this place and it's quite interesting as the first thing that hits you are all the Filipino breads, fried snacks and desserts and the front. Enter from the right through a small corridor to reach the restaurant. Self service so you order can get you food order disc and sit and wait.
Items like pan de sal, kutschinta and flan are showcased at front with wafts of freshly baked bread enticing you to buy buy buy.
In the restaurant a simple menu awaits but a very tempting one as the grilled chicken and pork belly were excellent.
The presentation was simple with just one bowl of rice. You would need to order vegetables separately if you wanted a balanced meal.

This is just a regular butter cheese bread which is selling in a Philippines Bakery & Restaurant in Lucky Plaza, Singapore. Though it’s fluffy and buttery, no other things stands out for these. Probably can give other items a try next time.

Overpriced And Disappointing.  This restaurant serves classic Filipino dishes and priced a bit higher than other Filipino restaurants in Lucky Plaza so I thought its going to have at least good quality.  Boy was I wrong.. I ordered pork kare kare and its tasteless and is not as creamy as its suppose to be.  The meat is also very bland.  The bagoong saved the whole dish.  Order also took a bit longer than usual and its not crowded at all.  The dining area is poorly lit and looks like an abandoned warehouse.  Service also not great.  Never coming back.

Ordered lechon kawali because it was recommended by my my friends. It was ok, but i think lechon in the food court b1 would probably be the better choice. It’s slightly harder and quite pricier compared to the option mentioned. The good thing about inasal is that it also offers desserts and breads from the philippines which taste really good, will probably go back for those and maybe try some other dishes also. Another thing to add is that it’s not as busy as other restaurants during the weekends when others are fully packed.

Delightful Filipino restaurant no shrinkflation here beef bone soup is rich with taste of marrow and more meat than we can chew. Dont miss out their Liempo, nicely marinated and reminiscent of street side grilled meat.

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
Always curious about Filipino food and their famous Lechon so gave this restaurant a try.

The Lechon has crispy skin and quite juicy. Overall flavor of the various dishes is more muted and tend towards a more thicker starchy type of sauce. Not so to my taste buds. If you like more subdued flavor and thick sauce then I think this restaurant is for you :).

The dishes that we enjoy the most are Lechon Sisig Meal ($12.8 comes with 1 drink) (grilled pieces of Lechon that is quite fragrant and has nice crunchy pieces) and Chopped Lechon Meal ($12.8 comes with 1 drink).

Their signature roasted chopped Lechon is a must-try. Crispy skin, soft tender juicy meat paired with the house made sauce. Next to try is the Mango salad and Sisig.

The Lechon $12.50 set is good. Very crispy skin. Goes very well with the sauce. On the other hand, the sizzling hot plate (Lechon sisig) $12.50 set is too salty. Just get the normal Lechon.

The Lechon skin was really crispy, and the best part is the tender and juicy meat under the skin!! Will definitely be back to order a half kilo slab of that. The lunch queue starts around 12:30p on a Sunday, so need to get there early.

Probably the best Lumpia you can find in Singapore! The Lechon have some crispy skin that can hear the sound even when you are sitting opposite! The chicharon has a very unique taste as well! The soup sinigang taste very similar to what you get in Philippines. Highly recommended

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
This place has gst charge but not service charge. 👍🏻.

Food I would say is edible.

Fish is slightly over cooked. Iime sauce on it with soup is really refreshing for the stomach. This is the best dish here though.

The rest of the dishes is meh. Prices not high. Very reasonable. $86.40 for all these, including one coke, and 2 rice.

Saw the new opening few months ago and went there for dinner. Food is slightly below average like the chicken in the curry was dry, nothing impressive don’t know why it has such high rating

Food is nice

But they dont clear the plates after we are done to make room… and very hot also

Sign up as a member first on getz

Come early to escape waiting for long time! Food is really good! The steam sea bass with lemon sauce was the bomb! Fried egg and tomyum mama too.

Food is nice, but a little cramp as the space is really small. Recommend pineapple rice, olive rice. Seafood egg, ruby dessert.
Filipino dining options in Clementi.name: Soi 47 Thai Food

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
Not crowded with people during Sat lunchtime, no flies, even thought outdoors, not hot. Food is Halal for Mala! Taste good, my Muslim friend enjoyed together with me. They also have other dishes such as fried rice, chicken rice available. Chicken meat is tender. Overall, happy experience with my friends there to catch up and eat slowly together.

I have tried the chicken rice set, niang doufu and mala hotpot.
But the most delicious is the mala soup hotpot, while the other foods taste normal. Spicy levels are available from L1-L3.
The place is comfortable because there are fans and half of the place is an open space with a roof.

Always come here for their mala and it never disappoints!!! I love having it with their seaweed soup on the side as well. I bring everyone i know to eat mala here at least once haha. Pricing wise, it’s well worth it in my opinion. Staff are super friendly and helpful too! Always a pleasant experience here.

One of the best halal mala ever!!!!! Love that it has a wide variety of ingredients! Very affordable as well. Service is quick and friendly!

We enjoyed eating in this place. Our favorite is the hakka Yong tau fu.

Recently we tried the kampong fried rice. It was also nice and tasty.

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
A good prata place serving good prata and a lot of other food too. Today, I decided to try something new other than the usual prata order. Ordered Briyani, and it came with a huge "mountain" of rice, and instead of chicken on the rice,  the chicken was served in a separate bowl and was soaked with curry to the brim of the bowl. It is heavenly for curry lovers. Recommended.

Nice place to have lunch, dinner or even supper. The food is rather good and the beverages like teh tarik and masala tea are delicious and not overly sweet.
The staff are a mixed bag. Not really good with customer service except for a young chap (either Malay or Filipino, not too sure) who is really pleasant.
Ambience is reasonable for the category and price it charges.
The range of food is wide though it does not have the some of the offerings from Evans Road. They are nice enough to put the papadam in a basket for us.

Kosong prata was crispy and good. Chicken murtabak had bones bits so that's quite bad even though overall taste was decent. Tea drinks were alright. Burger was ok. Service was decent.

Would still prefer springleaf overall but can't deny that this is more affordable

Scoody Dooby Doo Hotdog was very good. However 2nd order was incorrect (wrong dish came) and undercooked. 5 stars for the Hotdog, would eat again.

Stop eating from here a few years back. Back then, the food was not as good as before and the cost went up. Heard there was a change of boss. Decided to give it a try again. Cost consider ok. Luckily the food standard is good again. Love the fish curry n chicken marsala.

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
A Culinary Gem! We recently had the pleasure of dining at Kubo that left us utterly enchanted. From start to finish, every aspect of my dining experience was nothing short of exceptional.

We were warmly greeted by the attentive crew and immediately immersed in the inviting and vibrant ambiance. We sat right in front of the open kitchen, perfect backdrop for an unforgettable culinary adventure. Seats at the counter, highly recommended!

The menu are masterfully crafted with authentic flavors and innovative twists. Each dish resulting in a symphony of taste that danced on my palate, my all time favourite are the pork trotter and house aged ducks! Definitely coming back for these again! Love the Halo Halo presentation and it tastes amazing too!

Big shout out to Chef Kurt and team for their impeccable attention to detail and warm hospitality. The best part was getting a sneak peak inside the open kitchen! Thank you!
Definitely a culinary gem that deserves every bit of its five-star rating.

Thoroughly enjoyable! If you like the natural, almost earthy flavours of cooking aromatics, you’ll love this place! We sat at the kitchen counter which was a bit warm from their wood oven but worth the slight discomfort for the chance to see the passionate crew at work.
The dishes that stood out to me were the sisig, the mid-joint wings, the dry aged duck and the turmeric rice, which was refreshingly different. The octopus is worth a mention too.
Some of the dishes can be a bit rich but that’s not necessarily a bad thing as those would go well with a beer or glass of wine.
I really admire that they let the natural flavours of their ingredients shine.
It makes this place just that little bit more special in my mind.

The foods are extremely delicate and authentic, I can feel the dedication of chefs giving different layers of taste and texture of the food. The environment is really comfortable, an gourmet experience without lossing the natural and traditional theme. The staffs are super friendly too.

I’m not an expert of Filipino cuisine, still Kubo does not seem to be most authentic. Although not deal-breaking, since they market themselves as modern fusion dining. Hopefully it helps for those expecting otherwise and also sets expectations straight for this review. We really liked most of the dishes, especially anything to do with pork, they cooked them well. Random but i loved how the sweet potato leaves were paired with the barramundi. Turon with coconut butterscotch was a beautiful end to the evening. Staff was friendly and helpful. For cocktails, I wouldn’t order again.

Have been eyeing this place for a long time and wanted to try their elevated filipino cuisine, so my partner brought me here for my birthday dinner.

First of all the service staff were really friendly and helpful in recommending dishes to try. The ambience of the place was also immaculate - warm hues and cosy vibes, perfect for date nights or gathering with friends.

For the food, we had:
1) Chicharon ($12) - Great way to start off the meal. Loved the crunch and fattiness of the pork cheek slivers. The smoked plum ketchup tasted so similar to macdonald's curry sauce though, and that threw me off a little.

2) Pork Longanissa ($20) - Like an open-faced sandwich with a perfectly grilled patty complete with crispy edges, pickled cucumber for the tang and crunch, cheddar cheese and mustard sauce to give depth of flavour, atop a fluffy toasted potato bread with briney ikura and gooey cured egg on top. This was a flavour bomb. Full stop. This was my fave dish of the night.

3) Crab Fat Risotto ($22) - This was quite a disappoint as it was highly raved online but I could only taste sourness from the entire dish. Not sure if it was the fermented crab or the calamansi, but the sourness was overpowering in this plate.

4) Duck Fat BBQ Corn ($12) - Simply corn grilled with duck fat and smoked paprika sprinkled on top. Flavors were nice with the sweetness of the corn and savouriness of the paprika coming through, but $12 for what I think is half a corn? Wouldn't order this again.

5) Halo Halo ($14) - A scoop of purple yam ice cream with coconut jam and coconut corn custard. That's all. Thought I could eat the flesh of the coconut this was served in too, but it was too hard to scrape off. Overall, felt that this dessert leaned too heavily on theatrics instead of the food itself.

6) Barbie Potion ($20) - A gin-based aperitivo with raspberry, balsamic and egg white. Felt this was pretty diluted and tasted more like raspberry soda instead. Absolutely not worth the price.

Overall, had a nice meal but personally there were more misses than hits for the food. But I would say service is good; my partner told the staff that this was a birthday celebration and they took away the Halo-Halo (that they already served) while I went to the loo and when I returned they came back to serve it with a candle on top. Enjoyable experience, but would try the rest of the menu.

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
As I have seen in the Philippines during my visit, “it’s the house that Fried Chicken Built”. They are after all famous for the more traditional Fried chicken that’s unlike most of today’s fast food places where chicken relies on batter to get it to be crispy. Here the chicken is friend simply, has crispiness outside and really juicy tasty inside. I like this option because it relies on quality meat, good marinate and precise cooking to get it this way. We also tried the BBQ belly, their soup sinigang (sour and yummy with pork ribs and lots of veggies) ant the new Tina’s fried rice (smoke fish) to wrap it up. 4 dishes with good portions (2 guys with good appetite) we were full and still had a good leftovers for at least 1.5 meals. So if you are looking for a decent Pinoy cuisine, come here.

Only complaint I had was service was really understaff.

Great place if you are craving for Filipino cuisine. Ordered beef bulalo, signature fried chicken, pansit and lumpia. They had my favorite lumpiang ubod on the menu but it was sold out.
Food were seasoned well, wished they use pansit canton for the noodles instead of the yellow mee. The serving portion was good for the price, and their service crew were very friendly and attentive. We went there around 5pm which was not yet crowded so we were able to settle in easily.

Tl:dr not bad! Quite nice. Spicy chicken is nice. I like the tofu too

Theres also the lunch set, affordable and nice. Chicken is fried and is spicy.
Really enjoy the food here.

This is our first time trying Philippine food and the experience was not so great…everything taste amazing at the start, but near the end of the meal you will feel so gelat due to the extreme oiliness of all the dishes…we had to go for a ice kacang after the meal.
I also didn’t expect Philippine food being so expensive, $55 for two pax (we had some leftovers)

Chicken is soft even though its fried tastes like it was boiled, then deep-fried.
Lechon sisig : good .
Adobo rice : I was expecting fried rice in adobo sauce, but not its just plain rice mix in adobo sauce.
Sinigang milk fish belly : It's okay
Pancit:  Some parts of it are not fully cooked, but it's good.
Halo halo: was the best if you like sweet 😋

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
We're impressed by Froy and Camille's outstanding and tangible customer service. They were both attentive. Thanks to Head Chef Sam's food presentation, quality, and tasty food we receive. It was a Great dine-in experience with a breathtaking place to chill.

We will differently recommend it to others and be back again.

Me and my brother had a great time eating delicious food at Kubo sa boundary☺️ Ms.Camille were committed to great service and very friendly. The atmosphere was awesome:
I would highly recommend and definitely comeback 👍

It’s a great experience, the place is great as well as the staff, they are so friendly and welcoming. I enjoyed the food specially the bulalord and halo-halo, taste of authentic filipino food.👌 highly recommended

Awesome food, great friendly atmosphere and top notch service! Thank you Camille & Froy for the great hospitality.
Will definitely be back.
Fareed & Aileen 👍🏻

New fave filipino food restaurant.
Food was superb..we ordered bulalo and pork knuckles - krispy Pata.
I especially liked the Bulalo, soup was flavourful and not greasy.
The location is near SGH along the shop houses in kampong bahru road.

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
Authentic Filipino roast pork! Highly recommended the Lechon Laing set meal...mouth watering roast pork...this is Filipino style roast pork, so don't expect the pork skin to be thin...the sour soup goes well to cut through the fats..and the coconut potato leaves just adds a different layer of flavours..served with steamy hot rice along with the pickle onion vinegar...at the point of writing, only 12.50 for this well worth it wholesome meal...5 stars for taste portions and value for money, 5 stars for service the ates/aunties are very friendly and accommodating..the atmosphere rightly takes you to Philippines..

Rating this solely on the plate of Lechon w rice ($9.50). Don't scoff at the price; this is nothing like your run-of-the-mill $5 Roast Pork Rice from the local foodcourt. The Lechon is so much more meaty, crispy, aromatic, and fatty, and I guarantee you that you'll think that roast pork tastes so average after. Pair this with the sweet sauce and you're good to go. They also give a bowl of tangy soup to cut through the fattiness every few bites.

This is a hidden gem if you do not mind the super crowded food court. The Philippines style roasted pork taste very close to those Chinese’s style (without heavy spices). This is the first time I’m having Philippines cruises, so excited they served pork. The meat is tender and juicy, the skin is crispy and crunchy. It’s roasted in house in the oven slowly and evenly turn rotating. This is not spicy as it’s peanut sauce with veg as side. Although it’s slightly pricier than the food selling at some other stall in the same location, but this is something that you may try as they are actually roasted the whole big piece of pork not by smaller pieces. This way can lock the moist from being dry out. It taste more on the original meat taste rather than overly spiced up, can appreciate the true taste of pork (the meat is clean and do not have those porky taste from frozen meat). This might not be great for those really preferred heavily flavored food.

Paid $48 for this. Not coming back.

Ordered Lechon Sisig which WASN'T SIZZLING, it was warm but NOT HOT. Flavour was more towards (shredded) Lechon than a sisig fusion, lacked basic sisig ingredients like onion, soy sauce and egg.

Ordered Laing and Bopis too. While I couldn't complain on the flavours, they were ala carte portions and of course priced as one dish. I asked if there's a side dish option so I could order more, but was told they don't. In the end, me and my company had too much leftovers.

Tried bbq pork with rice, crispy skin but a bit oily, meal okay but a bit soften, must eat with the sauce, overall is good

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
One of my fave coffee shops to visit. Clean, airy. Good food choices.

My faves are: Mee Bangus, Khaki Yong Tau Foo and the Pisang Goreng 😋

IG @sporkandbeanz

🚇Clementi

Had the pleasure of indulging in a culinary adventure across different eateries, and here's my take on the experience:

Khali Yong Tau Fu: A Flavorful Delight

The flavors were rich and satisfying, leaving me craving for more. The expertly crafted dishes showcased a perfect blend of ingredients, making it a delightful culinary experience. I wholeheartedly recommend this place to anyone in search of a delectable meal.

Mee Bagus: Volcano Ayam - A Decent Choice

Tried Volcano Ayam from Mee Bagus and it was decent, it didn't quite live up to the hype. The flavors were good, but it lacked that special touch that sets extraordinary dishes apart from the ordinary. It's a suitable option for a quick meal, but don't expect anything out of the ordinary.

Makan Melaka: Cendol - A Missed Opportunity

Unfortunately, my experience at Makan Melaka was rather disappointing. I ordered their Cendol with high hopes, but it fell short of expectations. The ice wasn't cold enough, resulting in a watery consistency that left much to be desired. However, I appreciated the effort in using fresh coconut santan, but it couldn't salvage the overall experience.

Happy dining!

Food choices varies. I ordered the asam pedas melaka and it was shiok. Drinks wise a bit let down. Menu stated as 'Limau' but it was the thick sour syrup lime. No choice cannot cancelled because the indian guy give me weird look and he already served the drink. My husband say the decorations was a bit too much though.

Food place is clean and airy, according to my preference Clementi outlet is by far the best one, not too crowded and the food served not bad.

Mee Bagus is good but preferred the regular staffs to prepare the Volcano set as this time the taste a lil’ slackened due to lesser paste/ taste. Liked it with rich flavours and noodles still “springy”. Don’t scold that guy, give him a chance to master it, I’ll be back again..

A halal coffee shop located in the heartlands. It's a 15 minutes walk from green Clementi MRT station or you can take a bus from Clementi interchange to get here.

All of their food served here are halal and tastes great. You wouldn't taste much difference compared to the non-halal versions. The drinks stall has unique specialty drinks that is hardly found anywhere else. The Zi Char stall here is by a recent popular franchise of Buey Tahan Seafood. Other than the usual Zi Char dishes, they do have Crab in a Bag or Seafood in a Bag.

The stall I would have to recommend is the BBQ store called Joy Satay(you have to try the mutton), they also have otahs and BBQ prawns which are sweet, fresh and amazingly tasty!

There is a halal version of HawkerMan here which serves Char Kway Teow and Hokkien Prawn Mee. Although they taste different from the non-halal version, they still try their best to make it as deliciously good.

Overall this a good place to chill and gather with everyone of your friends. Since this is a halal coffee shop, everyone can dine without any fuss and food selections. Hope they have more outlets around Singapore.

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
We are so glad to find this restaurant; they serve authentic and very good Filipino dishes. Everything we had was very, very delicious.👌

It was nice to have a taste of home. Only negatives were that the food was a little bit too oily and potatoes were undercooked in the bulalo and beef stew, lechon kawali was a bit stale (maybe from sitting for a while).
I loved the chicharon bulaklak and will be back for this

Not bad Filipino food. Good central location though!

Our go to place for Filipino food in the city area. Good food and service!
IG @sporkandbeanz

An extremely cozy place to dine in. We ordered a Fiesta Platter and Sisig for 4 of us and the portion was just right!

I feel that it is an absolute go-to place for meat lovers - meat was juicy and flavourful, their sisig was just ... pure amazement to me 🤩

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
Epitome of comfort food 😋 Closed its indoor space due to rent prices, but the outdoor area was great for the breezy dinner weather. First time trying their bangus (milkfish) sinigang, and it was a favourite even among the non-Filipinos. Lechon kawali hit the right sweet-savoury note, too.

Sinigang was a good accompaniment to the rest of the spread, which was characteristically salty. Vegetable kare kare was alright, a bit bland compared to the rest.

Don’t get me wrong this place definitely deserves a 5 star for its food and service. The pork was chunky, crispy and delicious. It is the kind of food that you miss. However, we were unlucky enough to pay a visit on a rainy + windy weather, only to realise that the restaurant didn’t have any indoor seat and the outdoor shelters & umbrellas were not really rain proof. The table was wet and seats were literally flooded. Still good food though, just check the weather forecast before you head there.

3.5 stars for food. 1st time trying filo food. We came on a Wednesday before 8pm. Was served a plate of cold 1/2 kilo roast pork and rice. The pork skin was semi crispy, slightly thick and hard. Meat was very tender. The sauce seems to be missing a sour punch. Perhaps some lime chilli will liven up the greasy meat dish. As we didn't have any veg or soup, having roast pork alone felt quite greasy. Sat at the alfresco area. Found our own table, went counter to order, not much of a friendly service here.

I think the bicol express and kare kare were really tasty and the Lechon was great.  Although the sisig dish was not bad, as in, if I came over for dinner, you served it up, that would be A-OK, I’ll have to say it doesn’t measure up to the pig jowl/cheek sisig of Eg Manila’s Gerry’s Grill…it lacked the fattiness/cartilaginous and smokiness I associate with a good sizzling sisig dish.

The Grandlink mall outlet for Don Lechon is outside under some umbrellas next to the river. The kitchen is in the store, inside. Dress in shorts and tees. No frills and there’s no shame in that. My husband and I were quite happy!
Cold drinks from the fridge include Pepsi and 7Up, lemon tea and coconut juice in a can, and bottled water. Ice is available.  They have also leche flan, ube and cheese puto, among others as dessert options.  They charge a nominal extra per dish for takeaway. 30c per dish, if I recall correctly.
Simple and tasty Pinoy fare.

Love their lechon! They used to have a air-conditioned dining area, unfortunately for this time we can only sit outside when having our lunch.

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
Very expensive for basic street food. Filipino food is not amazing Drink's prices are high.
Minimum of 80SGD for a bottle of wine (55€).
Fried fish (half)+spring rolls+porc sisig+sparkling water+ginger ale => 85 SGD => 58€

The place is nice and the food is delicious too. You need a reservation to get into this place because it is mostly crowded on Fridays and weekends. Majority of the staff was helpful and supportive but there are few who were being rude. As also the glasses they gave us for drinks were not properly cleaned and when we asked the waitress to clean it she was being a bit rude and giving us looks. The prices are bit high but I think it is acceptable because of the location of the restaurant.

Went to the Cuppage area, ordered Sisig, Kansi and garlic rice for 2 at 12:37. Food still not served at 1:25. Staff wasn’t communicating when asked if food is being prepared and how long would it take. Sisig tasted like sprinkled with MSG. Kansi was ok. Hopefully they will improve their service.

Not the most comfortable place to eat and the drinks were expensive, but the food are top notch. All the dishes tasted amazing, well seasoned!

Had a great time last night. Haven’t eaten a real filipino food for some time especially Isaw, Chicharon bulaklak and tuna panga. All the food we have ordered tasted really good. A great value for your money. On top of that Sir Angie really made our experience memorable. Kudos to Sir Angie. We will definitely eat here again.

Filipino dining options in Clementi.reviews:
Food was good, especially the Sizzling Sisig. Not overly seasoned 👍🏼, meat & fat ratio was good, tasted fresh and close to authentic.

Bangus was fried crispy and not overly seasoned 👍🏼, however fish portion seem smaller than typical size.

Halo halo was not overly sweet 👍🏼, loaded with ingredients but maybe I prefer less of "sago". I think mango was substituted with sweet potato which was cute but pleasantly went well.

Paid total $61 for these 3 dishes, 2 rice, 2 iced lemon tea.
For the price point, I had to hold back -1 🌟.

Will come back only for the Sisig and maybe to try the Lomi.

Great place. Amazing servers and super helpful as well as friendly.
They have a good wine selection!

Of course I do wish they had more vegetarian options but all the vegetarian food I had was good!

The live music adds on as a great experience :)

Good stuff!

Ps: this is how it looks in Christmas!

08 Jan 2023
This is the 2nd time here.
1st time experience is good, The hotplate pork sisiq came out piping hot. Fish also the same thing.
But not this visit. Pork sisiq came out and the egg was over cooked. Can't mix with the pork. The fish too, not really hot.
Probably the kitchen was ready with the food but didn't serve it right away, maybe  short of staff cause only 1 guy is serving.

Pork spring roll : skin not crunchy
Chicken Wing :  standard
Pork with taukwa : don't like it
Fish, pork sisiq : love those
Vegetable : so so

An interesting place to visit with affordable range of wines, beer, food and live band that performs from Monday to Saturday starting from 730pm.

They serve good range of Western and Philipino dishes (hotplate pork sisig $15).  They also serve late night menu (fries, spring rolls) after the kitchen is closed while you enjoy the live music.

While we appreciate the live performance, please consider tuning down the volume of the speaker.

Service is good and worth the visit.
Please make a reservation to avoid disappointment 😞.

One of my favourite places to eat Filo food. The people are quite nice, accommodating and friendly. Really like their food especially my all time fave, sisig! We ate during lunch thus did not experience the bar and band at night but I feel it is good! Will come back again! Highly recommended!

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
1. They serve u in kids plate. So imagine how small the serving is

2. Stingy portion. Everywhere else when u order Turkish food, they give you some salad as side.

3. Expensive for its poor quality and small serving.

4. Tasteless. I ordered 2 times and all 2 times been disappointing.

I've eaten here four times, and the latest visit will unfortunately be my last.

Trip #1: Pleasant surprise to find a new store selling kebabs in the food court so we tried it. It was alright. Not nearly special enough that one would visit just to eat it, but I like an exotic food option so we decided we would visit again and support them.

Trip #2: Take out this time. Ordered the same thing, two kebabs, but added one more dish to try more of the menu: falafel. The falafel ended up being delayed by about 20 minutes because the owner said they kept breaking up as he prepared them but there was some service recovery; he offered lentil soup for free which I thought was a nice gesture.

Trip #3: This was just a few days ago. I brought more of my family members along to try the food. This time, the food tasted so much better than the first time two times (the chef dipped his head out of the kitchen occasionally, and I noted he actually looked like he's from Turkmenistan). The kebabs were juicy and crispy, and the rice was tasty. Slight hiccup, however, in that I ordered falafel (again, this seems to be a problematic food) and it was delayed by about 15 minutes. When I went back to check on the falafel, the owner handed me a plate of four pieces of grilled haloumi, saying that there were issues with the falafel and that the haloumi was of equal value. I didn't order grilled haloumi, and it wasn't what I wanted, so I just opted for a refund. The owner then said the haloumi would be free, and he would give me the refund. I didn't want to do that since he's running a business, so I reluctantly accepted the haloumi as replacement for the falafel. The saving grace, however, was that the haloumi turned out to be very good.

Trip #4: This was just this evening. The order was put in at 18:36: two kebabs and a grilled haloumi. The first kebab came quickly enough, but was very dry and bland. We then went to retrieve the second kebab some 10 minutes afterwards, and was told the haloumi would take some time. Though the portion was a good size, this second kebab was just as dry and bland. Now by 19:00, we had finished our kebabs and were still waiting on the grilled haloumi. So, I walk to the store for the third time, and the kebab guy with the long hair tells me "one minute". 19:06 rolls around, and so I tell him again: "Bro, it's been half an hour. Can I ask where my grilled haloumi is?" Kebab guy with the long hair is clearly upset, he drops his chicken shavings and goes into the kitchen and yells inside to someone something along the lines of "half an hour already", echoing what I just asked him. Long hair guy comes out and raises his voice at me and tells me something about "only one person bro". I reply: "I know you're only one person, but if the grilled haloumi was going to take 30 minutes you should have said so."

I'd like to think that I was fair and mentioned the good and bad parts of this stall in this review. I like supporting local businesses but I won't tolerate being given attitude for something that's not my fault. There seems to be an preparation issue items like falafel and grilled haloumi on the menu, so it would be good if the owner could look into that. Not for me though, but for future customers. I have no more reason to return. There's Stuff'd downstairs at a better price point, faster service times, much better food quality and best of all — no bad attitude.

Pretty decent Turkish food for takeaway. Won't say it's the best I've had, but it does the job.
Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.name: Bereket Kebab

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
Best hummus in Singapore! Not only it was tasty....it was so smooth on the palate too! Everything else was good but the hummus was the star for us. So glad we found a gem in our neighbourhood. Will definitely come back to try other dishes.

Really impressed with the food and service. Place is air conditioned and comfortable. Highly recommend.

I ordered Iskander kebab, moussaka and a platter entre. I think the food is really delicious. Not so salty and can taste the good blend of spices and well marinated meat. Really good. Portions are large. About $40 per pax

Authentic Turkish food prepared by the best Turkish chef in Sg. Good place to visit with colleagues or family

Great food and service! Decent range of vegetarian options too including the pide and starters
Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.name: Chef Ahmet Deli Turk

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
The menu offers a wonderful variety of authentic Turkish dishes, each bursting with flavors that transported me to the heart of Istanbul. The quality of the ingredients was evident in every bite, and the presentation was a feast for the eyes.

The staff at Derwish are not only knowledgeable about the menu but also passionate about ensuring a memorable dining experience. Their attentiveness and friendly demeanor added to the overall positive atmosphere.

Had a delightful dining experience at Derwish Turkish! The mixed kebab platter was outstanding; I was trying to control my carbs but I couldn't get enough of the fragrant rice. The hummus was good, although the bread was a bit tough for my liking. However, what truly stood out was the exceptional service. The staff was incredibly friendly and always had a smile on their faces, which added to the overall splendid experience. Looking forward to visiting again!

Everytime I have a loved one visiting Singapore, I always take them here. I always come back here for the food and service. The food is great - big serving and authentic and I love their Bunefe!! ♥️ The service is top notch, leaving us satisfied every single time. Will surely be back with other loved ones who are about to visit. 🥰

Great food and service. Food is definitely wayyy more expensive than the usual, but the taste makes it not such a bad deal. Apple tea is really nice before eating the food, very refreshing and fragrant but after eating any food it doesn't taste as nice.

Peter, the staff here, was exceptionally polite and gave us a warm welcome. When I needed to store my dessert in the fridge, he was incredibly helpful. Peter also recommended their signature dishes, and we decided to try them.

The Tajin lamb shank was a delightful surprise, with tender, succulent meat that practically fell off the bone. The flavors were rich and aromatic, making it a standout dish.

The Meze tabagi was a delightful assortment of Mediterranean appetizers, a true explosion of flavors and textures. It included a variety of dips, fresh vegetables, and savory bites, providing a wonderful contrast of tastes.

For a refreshing beverage, we ordered the Mango Ayran. It was a perfect balance of sweet and tangy, making it a great complement to our meal.

Unfortunately, as there were only two of us, we couldn't order the traditional dessert Peter recommended. Nevertheless, we thoroughly enjoyed the atmospheric environment, delicious food, and excellent service provided by the staff.

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
Honestly, wasn’t the most impressed with the service here at first, asked for order and the person simply said yes can continued doing his own stuff for 5minutes.

However, when the food came, i didn’t think too much about it afterwards. Starting from the hummus, absolutely generous and delicious portions. Perfect appetizer.

The butter rice with kebab was crazy delicious, we literally scraped the plate clean from the rice and the greek yogurt like substance in the centre.

Pizza was crispy and fragrant at the same time, the tomato sauce parts was absolutely amazing.

Strawberry drink was okay!!! Not super special but nice!

In the middle of Arab street you find this restaurant. We were welcomed by a real Turkish guy. Very friendly and he could advise us what was the best to order. We sat outside, along the street. Within 15 min the table was full with all kinds of grilled meat. Real Turkish flavors and a nice apple tea were enough to make my day complete. Eating here, and watching the people pass by is a big joy.

Parking in this area is very hard, as you can understand.

Had a great dinner here today. My friend saw this online with high rating stars so we just stopped by after work.  And yes, the food is delicious, the atmosphere is awesome, love the music too.
So if your family or friends are outgoing and friendly, this is the right place for you to gather together and laugh together and dance together !

Cuisine is new to me as a traveller. Trying the dish with my arab friends and the chef being a wonderful host in telling us about the different food added to the stellar experience of dining here. Service was awesome. Food was a good blend of flavors.

Just returning home from an amazing service and hospitality from Cappadocia.
Chef Ahmed Hagras went out of his way to arrange a very sweet surprise for my husband's birthday at my request.
The whole staff sang happy birthday for him with a special kunafe.

The food itself is finger licking good, no doubt. But the experience was way better.

Thank you everyone at Cappadocia for helping make this day special for him.

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
I had the pleasure of trying Turkish cuisine for the first time, and it was truly a delightful experience! The standout dish for me was the lamb; it had absolutely no odor and tasted fantastic. The grilled items were a highlight as well, bursting with delicious flavors. The restaurant’s ambiance was beautifully decorated, and the staff was both charming and incredibly helpful, taking the time to explain the dishes to us. While it’s not the cheapest option, the prices are fair for the quality you receive.

One thing to note, though, is that the platter we ordered was described as “for two,” but for Asians, it’s considered a generous portion. So, if there are four of you and you’ve already ordered other dishes, I recommend going for the platter for two only; it’s quite substantial. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great dining experience!

First time having Turkish food and was really
pleasantly surprised. Their dips and bread was really exceptional. The bread was steaming when it came out it was both crispy and fluffy at the same time. The platter for 2 was also great all the grilled meats was tender and flavourful. Portion was also huge.

Everything from the service to food were impeccable. Staff were polite and always made sure we were well taken care of. I ordered before my friend came and they asked when the food should be prepared and how it should be served. Food was perfectly done too. It is the little things that make a difference and win them a return customer.

Very impressive food & service displayed by the dedicated front staffs and chefs. It’s nice walking in the street after a wine & dine session in the area. The staffs were very attentive, price is reasonable.

Went here for a birthday celebration and the attention to detail from their service staff is amazing, didn’t mention to the staff that it was for a birthday celebration, only had a note in the reservation. But they went above and beyond, having candles in the dessert and even giving us props to take pictures with and proceeded to then print out the photo of us to keep!

The food also matches the service, authentic Turkish cuisine done perfectly, the Hummus was so good we had to order a second portion! I’m not usually a fan of chicken but the chicken that came with the platter blew my mind, so juicy and tender. Then comes dessert, my first time having Kunefe and the only thing I have to say is that I wish I didn’t share it, wanted it all to myself 🤣

Definitely coming back here again!

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
We ordered mixed grills with chicken and beef. This comes with rice. It was very good.

We also ordered Chicken Mandi. Overall, being a Turkish restaurant, the spices used are different from what we thought was Mediterranean. The chicken Mandi was only ok.

Overall, it was a very well laid out restaurant in line with the vibe on the street.

The latte and Turkish coffee were good. My son loved it.

The ambiance is great. The staff are very helpful and very courteous.

Really enjoyed our meal here. Food was fantastic, serving was amazing and the service was excellent. The severs were very polite and courteous especially Kiran! Thank you so much! Definitely coming back.

It’s my first time being here and i love it!
The food are nice, the service are good too, especially Sahi.
The food portion is generous and large, and fulfills our request as well.
Will definitely come back here

This was my first time here and we arrived just before closing.  I was pleasantly surprised that the full menu was still available!  Istanbul Grill’s served up an delightful meal, with great humus, and  top notch Turkish coffee.  Our server even hand-made our delectable balaclava!

Highly recommended!

Great food, great atmosphere. Not sure why there aren’t more people. Do note the 20% offer!

Hummus was delicious, platter for two is a lot. Two guys and one of me girl… so stuffed. Great meal!

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
This is the most awesome place in all of Singapore! Huge veranda overlooking the park, delicious Turkish food! Super hospitable staff! Everything is always delicious, fresh, you can only enjoy food and views with such pleasure here! I would never have thought that there were such wonderful places in this city!

I ordered the baked cheese rice with chicken and it was pretty good, adequate cream sauce with the rice, the chicken was tasty & the melted cheese made it all better overall. Although I would say that the portion is slightly small, but perfect for one person. The other dish was kebab chicken rice - the shredded chicken was really good and the rice had a delicious buttery taste too. It came with some salad on the side, although without salad sauce, when paired with the chicken and rice it was a good meal :) The drinks prices were too high though, does not seem worth it.

Awesome food - awesome people - great location!
True Turkish hospitality!
Our favourites are
-the Turkish tea
- Adana kebab
- Lahmacun (bread with Lamb meat )
- Ekmek (Bread)
- Lavash (Turkish Bread)

Pricing is a bargain compared to other Turkish Restaurants in Arab Street.
For us it’s our everyday go to!

Food is a little towards dry but fragrant and taste is acceptable. Service is not so fantastic, 2 people sharing but no side plates and only given 2 thin pcs of serviette which we used to  hold the pizza. Venue is still considered good and outdoot sitting is pet friendly.

Overall, it's something can consider to try. Still grateful for making their outdoor sitting pet friendly.

Unassuming on the outside with minimal decor on the inside, I thought that there’s no way this place could be selling authentic middle eastern food!

But of course I was wrong. Meat dishes are decently priced and delicious, baked goods are fresh, and the Kunafe is deeelightful.

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
I had a great time eating delicious food at your restaurant. The staff were committed to great service and were very friendly. The atmosphere was awesome and I definitely liked that you have a very modern style. Most importantly, every food and drink on your menu tasted great

I've had lunch there. The waiters were friendly. They gave me a complementary Apple Tea 🍵 since it's lunch time. The food is pretty good. The Turkish taste is there. They have plenty options. Unfortunately most of the beef items were unavailable. Had to choose the lamb ones. It's really tasty nonetheless. They also have good chicken and vegetarian options.

We used the Eatigo discount and its definitely worth it.. the foods are great, taste just fantastic to our liking! The waiter is friendly to recommend us their signature foods too..

Service by the Chinese guy was good, but the food was really so so and would have been very expensive (avg $25/main) if not for the entertainer app we used. We tried their most popular mains and switched the rice to pita bread. But the bread was very stale and tough, the meat was so so and we ordered hummus which tasted rather diluted. The only good dish was the kunefe, although somehow it's really oily. I'm not sure if that's normal cos this is only the second time I'd eaten kunefe and the last time I had it elsewhere, it wasn't swimming in oil. We literally poured the oil out on a separate dish and it was a lott of oil...

Setting was pretty although it was mostly empty on a Sunday lunch time, not surprised 😅

Love the food from this place. It is slightly expensive but the food is always cooked to perfection. The meats is always so tender. The server was also very attentive and welcoming. Will definitely come back.

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.name: Mavi Turkish Restaurant & Grill

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
Celebrated my birthday here with my hubby on 16 Nov 2023 and it was a pleasant dinner for us. We are satisfied with the ambience, food, drinks, service and the atmosphere.

The staff are polite and helpful. We ordered the Mixed Jumbo Kebab Platter for us to share and followed by Kunefe with ice cream for dessert. They even sang birthday song to me when they presented the dessert with a candle on it. It is very nice and I appreciate their thoughtfulness.

We are impressed with the jumbo platter as all the meat and veggies are well prepared, well marinated and well cooked. We finished everything off the plate. It is simply delicious. We also enjoyed the Turkish Tea and dessert.

We will definitely return to try out other food from here again.

If you follow my Google reviews, you'll know I'm very critical. Yet, this is a restaurant that I'm giving a full five-star rating. That is because it's really perfection!

This was my third visit, and this time was with a group of friends. I was not kidding when I shared that I liked the food here more than what I had when I was in Istanbul! Was it because they catered well to the local Singaporeans? I'm unsure, but I really liked the Turkish food here! Most importantly, the service quality here had been great thus far! Please maintain!

Such a gem! The food was so I’m very impressed!! Some meats are dry but overall the food is so good! I love the hummus dips! Our table was nxt to the glass so the view was amazing!!! The food does get cold fast because the place is cold!

I love love love the desserts they are super sweet as expected of Turkish desserts but with their tea or coffee it is perfection! Will come back for the desserts!!

My partner and I had a wonderful anniversary lunch at Sofra Turkish restaurant. We were impressed by the authentic and delicious Turkish food, the friendly and attentive service, and the cozy and relaxing ambience. We ordered the mix platter salad, the chicken Adana kebab, the baklava, and the Turkish coffee, and we enjoyed every bite and sip. The salad was fresh and flavorful, the kebab was tender and juicy, the baklava was sweet and crunchy, and the coffee was strong and aromatic. The portions were generous and satisfying. The staff were very kind and helpful, and they even gave us an extra dessert to celebrate our special occasion. We felt very welcomed and appreciated. The restaurant has a nice view of the CBD and esplanade, which added to the romantic atmosphere. We had a great time at Sofra Turkish restaurant, and we highly recommend it to anyone who loves Turkish cuisine. It is one of the best Turkish restaurants we have ever been to.

Amazing food. Would recommend! Good options but most of it are variation of similar items. Service is friendly and prompt. Prices are slightly above average but portions are good for sharing, so its good for groups. Great outdoor views (minus the heat). Would be good if there are those  mist-fans or coolers outdoor.

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
Good experience, wrap was decent, not worth to spent there, best dishes were Mixed Mezze and Mixed Grill, but if you are not a big eater choose only 1 of this dishes. The tea was good, lasted us the whole meal, decent amount. They also gave us a complimentary baklava. Nice touch. 200+ for 3 person.

We have visited this restaurant many times before. The staff are always very warm and friendly, and service is great. Food is consistently very tasty. Dishes are best for sharing. Our favourites were the pottery lamb kebab and the chicken musakka. A lovely, unique place for Turkish cuisine that we highly recommend.

Incredible Turkish food - despite being at a touristy location, the quality was excellent and of good value.

This was a popular spot on a Saturday night, given our last minute reservation, they only had slots 8pm and later.

Needless to say the slight wait was worthwhile - the various breads were so fresh and done in house. Meats were succulent and well seasoned, all around excellent, there wasn’t a dish we didn’t like.

Portions are generous, given the choice of would be nice to go with a group of 3+ but we won’t complain about leftovers!

had an amazing dinner here! brought my family to try turkish food for the first time and they enjoyed themselves :) the owner was extremely hospitable and gave us a complimentary kunefe as well as some tea. the food was amazing! solved my middle eastern cravings ~

My first authentic Turkish food experience highly recommended by my friend. And it totally blew my mind - how hearty and flavourful the food was and how warm the staffs were. The biggest take away was the hummus & bread and baklava!!

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
Friendly staff
Foods were delicious and well cooked
Free complementary
Price was okay and worth to eat.

If you are coming Singapore don’t hesitate to visit this restaurant.

Food was really really good, it improved my mood to be even better. Condiments were a bonus. Staffs are friendly and approachable too. Definitely will come back again 😉

My second time to come here and service never disappoints. The food is tasty and the ambiance is great😊 highly recommended😊

Nice location and good tea, cool weather with Islamic vibes that place is too good to spend quality time with f&f nice to explore and good Turkish cuisine👍🏻

Delicious authentic Turkish cuisine, great atmosphere and excellent service ❤️

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
Clean tables, excellent service and most importantly delicious food! Portions are amazing and you really get what you pay for 👍🏼 If it is your birthday, let them know and prepare for a surprise 😉

Service and food were excellent. Was served by Sivan and his helpful crew! This was our 3rd visit and they never disappoint us 🥰🙏 Thank you! Highly recommended, Lahmacun, Beyti Kebab, Tavuk kanat ( Grilled chicken wings) Grilled meatball with cheese, Çoban salad and of course Kunefe with ice cream.

I read good reviews about this restaurant and decided to dine in last night with cousins from Malaysia and an aunt. Firstly, I'm disappointed with their service, food came not as we requested, instead of Pita bread, we were served rice. Secondly, had to ask from 3 servers before our drinks were served. Food are not as delicious as we expected it to be, compared to other neighbouring Turkish restaurants there. Not attentive service. Tables are dirty, chairs not cleaned before sitting customers. Will not come again.
2. After replying this review, I don't think the Owner is genuine with his reply. I'm not expecting for a refund neither a free meal but i am sharing my experience in the restaurant. I guess you should be sincere with your offer of apology or service recovery and not offer and giving an invalid number. Such a dishonesty!

Sivan was very approachable and friendly! Top tier service from the guys here and the manager as well. Food was good too! Highly recommend the meat platter and kunafe with goat’s milk ice cream!

Great Turkish fare, with the best kunefe. Order the mixed grill if you're here, and the kunefe with goat milk ice cream.

Just gets a little warm for outdoors seats.

The restaurant is located in Haji Lane neighborhood, next to the Grand Mosque.. The service was very excellent and the workers were very kind and generous.. They gave us a free sweet as a hospitality for us.. They played Arabic songs and Gulf songs for us. ..I enjoyed the atmosphere very much.. I advise everyone to eat in the restaurant when they visit the historic neighborhood 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
