Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
Turkish kebab BBQ, hummus, and bread was a delicious and satisfying meal. The kebab was perfectly cooked, with a juicy and flavorful interior. The hummus was creamy and smooth, with a rich and nutty flavor. The bread was warm and soft, and the perfect accompaniment to the kebab and hummus. We loved the service very very hospitable. We were very comfortable stayed there for more than 1.5 hours had a really good time they didn’t rush us. Place is a little congested but overall I was very impressed with the Turkish kebab BBQ, hummus, and bread. It was a delicious and satisfying meal that I would definitely recommend to others.

Food was pretty good and authentic. Beyti Lamb Kebab was the star of the night. Usually lamb dishes have strong taste and restaurants tend to use very strong sauces to mask it, but the lamb didn't have such a strong taste and the sauce was mild. A perfect balance. Hummus was good as well, although the pita was on the harder to chew side.

However, service was a little off, hence 4 stars. Would, however, come back. Got 30% off dine in via foodpanda and ended up to about 30 per pax, so pretty good deal.

The food was served so fast. Everything was delicious and the priced were good too. Servings were more than adequate! JB still was sweet to serve us even though we came half an hour before they closed. Try the meat grill  platter! Love it!!!!!!!!

Food are fantastic. The butter rice is very tasty.
With the herbs on Lamb and chicken. It really tastes good. Price abit pricy but it will not deter people from going back.

Very good !!! We ordered the eggplant kebab, hummus and dolmads and it was so tasty!!!! Very good meal, perfect service. They were so nice to us and made us feel at home. Thank you! We will come back for sure ❤️

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.name: Pasha Mezza and Grill

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
I haven't really eaten much Turkish crusine in Singapore and I must say that I'm in for a pleasant surprise..!!

The gentle looking chef who goes by the name of Mr Oktay animatedly gestured me to give his signature dish - Number 5, Kebab and Butter Rice a try and the rest was history.

Not too spicy and refreshingly savory; To which I had even asked for lesser amount of butter rice after I looked at him prepare a generous amount of kebabs and fresh vegetables to the dish.

He even gave me a little souvenir at the end of my first Turkish delight experience when I asked if I could take a picture of his stall.

Opening hours are from 10am to +/- 9pm and you can even hire him for catering services etc (details are in the pictures).

What are you guys waiting for?

Try it to believe it!!

PS: Its Halal certified so don't put the plates and utensils in the non halal return section :D

We had a sumptuous Eid family lunch thanks to the Bosphorus Turkish Kebap Chef & Team . The food was beautifully prepared. Everything was spiced nicely,  flavourful & balanced.

I especially loved the chicken. It's really something special. 💯recommended.
Even the pasta had a unique taste we enjoyed.

We had DIY wraps & the bread was really soft!

The Baklava was light, nutty & not so sweet. You wouldn't want to share it 😅

You can tell all the dishes & sauces are made from scratch, made with love.

I'd recommend it for family gathering. Enjoy!

Saw this place from a news article, and decided to try it. Got this for SGD$12 and it's great value for money. The long grain rice is fluffy and airy, it soaked up the sauces and oil from the meat nicely. Surprisingly the meat is juicy and not dry. It has the right amount of spices that is not so overpowering like the other Middle Eastern food. The portion of meat is generous. The butter rice just has a hint of butter, which is very nice. Good balance of flavours, meat and salad. The mild sourness from the preserved olives adds a nice touch of tardiness to cut through the oil (don't get me wrong, the oil was kept at a light touch). The sweet was sweet which is a given so I suggest having an unsweetened tea to end the meal and sweets.

Overall a balanced and healthy meal at a great cost. The portion is just nice for me but might be a bit more for a lady. Like the brand said, hotel quality at hawker center price. The boss is friendly and I got a free coin purse from him. Very likely I will be back for more.

Friendly bros serving authentic Turkish kebabs, generous portions and high quality ingredients. Requested for the more charred bits for my kebab and theh were very gracious to comply.

Chicken kebap roll ($6) - Average. Strong paprika taste in the sauce. A decent portion for the price.
Baklava ($5 for 2) -  Tasted ok. Rather small pieces for the price.

Chicken was the only meat that they had.

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
We ordered salami pide and pita falafel. Very good and freshly cooked. Nice music and they gave us food at 11pm when others rejected us due to closed kitchen

For me to be honest, the price is too expensive for the portion of the food. The taste is fine though I feel it is not as authentic as what I was expecting. This all for 19 sgd.

Visited this newly opened Turkish stall on a Sunday afternoon.

We got their Masala Tea, Lamb Shawarma with Rice, Pita Chicken and Kunafa.

Lamb with rice was good. They gave us a mix of lamb and chicken as the lamb wasn't enough. The lamb was tender and did not have a strong lamb taste. The rice reminded me of biryani rice which I like. The Mandi sauce was really good. Very spicy, herb-y and tomato-y which added a nice refreshing heat to the dish.

Pita chicken was not bad. The chicken was tender, vegetables were fresh and crunchy and the pita was crispy yet chewy.

Kunafa was delicious. First time trying this popular Middle Eastern dessert. The warm Kunafa went well with the cold cream and I like that it was crispy and sweet. But do order this early as it takes a long time to prepare.

Overall a place you can consider if you're having a Turkish food craving. The people here are also friendly!

One of the best tasting sharwma and Turkish kebab I've ate around in town. Been here multiple times and the food has been consistent in quality and taste. Head down for a no frills Turkish foodie experience. Outdoor seating only

I do not know that they are selling with the Baklava, and 3 pieces for 12 SGD at the first time I buy. I am shocked, but hopefully there is 6 inside. I can't acceptable. How about you? Might be the food is expensive, or
Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.name: Restaurant

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
Stumbled across this place today and decided to eat here with my mum. Very no frills and simple place.

She had a falafel moussaka, and I had the mexican beef bowl. The moussaka was delicious but I feel like 5 pieces of nacho chips wasn’t enough and mind you this cost $13…..

The beef bowl was a little dry, could do with some kind of sauce but it was good and we finished both dishes. The churros came freshly fried and was good too, but would have preferred actual choc sauce vs the hershey choc syrup.

Only gripes; the overly sugary lemongrass drink that was served premade with no ice. Had to ask for ice twice but given few pieces…..  also very weird that we dined in but were served with plastic cutlery when we clearly saw metal cutlery, it was a little strange. It was practically only 2 tables and the lady served my food to the other table…. Could tell she wanted to take it back to serve me but they already started eating it.

I think its a quaint little place but some things need to be improved. At $30 for 2 expected just a little more.

Excellent service. The beef Mexican rice bowl was not bad. With the homemade drink, I spent less than $10. I was there alone at 5 ish and I had the entire place to myself. I don't remember music playing but it sure would be nice to listen to some tunes.

Small quaint shop located near Tai Seng Mrt, they had a $10 set meal that had a wrap, small hash brown and a lemongrass tea. There was a small side of nacho chips with salsa.

Nothing amazing but I guess it was better than nothing coz there wasn’t anything there open before 11am

Dropped-off my 10-months old laptop at LENOVO Service Centre at 3 Irving Rd, #01-17 Tai Seng Centre. BITC, Singapore 369522 on Tuesday 18 April 2023,

Thus decide to settle my late lunch within the area too.

One will be spoiled with choices as there are so many small eateries and cafes. I was drawn to  Olive Mediterranean & Middle East which was located across the street at 11 Irving Place #01-14/15, Tai Seng Point, Singapore 369551.

Ordered for myself a Mexican Rice (Celantro & Spinach With Beef) Bowl at S$7.50.

If you are a small eater, the serving portion is just right. However, definitely a "No. No." for someone who has a heavy duty digestive system, I would recommend that you order some nachos or Quesadillas too.

In my opinion, the rice is mildy aromatic (I was expecting a more pungent aroma of Celantro and spinach).

I will rate the minced beef topping as "healthy choice".  It is relatively quite nice BUT will not leave one any special impression.  It will definitely taste alot better if there is a little more fat (this will enhance the juiciness) and more spices are added.

However, if you working in this area, it is a great place to meet up with your colleagues and friends after work.  You can sufficient outdoor sittings surrounded with plants.

Stumbled on this place as i happened to be browsing around. Been awhile since i had my tacos and wraps, decided to try this as i noticed they had very high reviews.

Had the beef Quesadilla - loved it as it was simply nice
Chicken Saffron Stew - Soooo tender and nice but soup wasnt as thick as i wanted but thats purely due to my own taste
Hashbrowns - Thumbsup as we all loved it. Hearsay its even better than M's hashbrown but i leave it for u to judge.

Service wise was top, very homely feel given by the lady boss and staff. She took her time to guide me through the menu and shared with me what we should order.
I must say the food takes a pretty long time to come for a quiet Monday Afternoon but i guess Good Food - Time to prepare so no complaints from me on this.

Overall i recommend this place based on the food served + prices. Very nice and they deserves better businesses. should be pretty quiet when its after office hours.

Will be back again :)

Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar.reviews:
Tasteless shawarma with bland mayo and sweet and sour tasting sauce. It’s like the chef never even heard of the dish let alone know how to make it. I was hungry but even like this I chose to wait for takeaway and threw this away after two bites. For 12$ this was an all round bad experience.

Awful falafel wrap, honestly one of the worst I’ve ever eaten. Covered in horrible sauce, presumably to disguise the dry, packet falafels. Couldn’t finish it

Grilled beef skewers are quite tasty and tender
Highly recommended 👍

Swiss food in Outram.reviews:
Was recommended this nice little Swiss restaurant by a friend.
The food was overall good. The malakoff and coucou salad was very good with us feeling of wanting more. The crescendo of the evening would definitely be the venison striploin from their seasonal menu. Really nice texture and went perfectly with the cranberry sauce accompanying it. Wanted to have the chocolate fondue for dessert but we were so stuffed that we just opted for the seasonal dessert of vanilla ice cream with Chantilly cream.
Service staff was excellent and attentive. Always checking in on us to make sure everything was to our liking.
Thank you to Chef Yves and the staff of Coucou for the wonderful evening.

Nice place with interesting food. Cheese fondue is slightly expensive but unfortunately had a slightly bitter taste. Would not recommend this dish.
Rosti and steak is good. Desserts are ok too.
Service is great with many attentive servers, there was almost no wait for any requests. Atmosphere is good too, just slightly cramped but not to much inconvenience.
Overall a good experience and nice place.

My second visit to Coucou: first time with a group of 6, the next with 2. Better to dine with a bigger group as you can try more dishes (the cheese fondue might get a too rich after a while). The meringue dessert was not too sweet and was paired well with fresh berries.

The service staff was very friendly and patient with us. As we were leaving the restaurant it started raining heavily , so we decided to head back in for some desserts. As it was getting quite cold inside, we requested for a table outside and the waiter was very accommodating where he took the extra effort to find us another table.

Thank you for a great dinner and will return again!

we called in to make a reservation instead of online and they were nice to arrange an indoor seating for us nevertheless ☺️
we ordered the original cheese fondue (comes with free flow bread) - amazing though gets a little salty after a while!
we also had cordon bleu which was crispy but quite lacking in taste (likely because of the saltiness from the cheese fondue which ruined our taste buds haha) and spatzli (very disappointing in taste).
total damage was $150~
note: for the cheese fondue min order is 2 pax which is $70++ so can just order for 2 pax then whole table (more than 2 pax) share also OK 👍🏻

Would rate this place 4.5/5!! We ordered the Cordon Bleu, Rosti Zermatt and the Ovomaltine Mousse. Cordon Bleu was nice - the breaded crust was well done, the chicken was yummy but could be a little more moist. Rosti Zermatt was slightly underwhelming for us - the cheese and ham were good, but rosti was a little too thick and hard. Ovomaltine Mousse was amazing - the ginger bread was yummy even on its own and the mousse was really light. We spent $97 for three dishes. Staff was extremely attentive - filling up our cups many times without having to ask for a refill. They also cleaned our table before serving the dessert. Had an enjoyable time here!
Swiss food in Outram.name: Coucou Authentic Swiss Restaurant and Bar

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
First time here for the Mexican food and it is surprising good. Enjoyed the food! I do not know remember the exact name of the food my friend ordered but here are the pictures! I like the red wine with fruits. Tasted sweet so good for ladies. The meat in the pan is the chicken.

It was a packed evening with a good crowd.
We ordered 3 dishes. I would recommend a party of 4 to really go enjoy the food as they are made for sharing.

After a while, you start to see similarities in the ingredients and basically dipping into the same sauce and same protein spread across different wraps. I thought there would be more varieties.

On the whole, service was 5 stars.
Attentive and warm.

There’s nothing much you can do with the sewer smell when you sit outside and smokers from the neighbouring drinking joints.

Came by for an afternoon lunch over a weekend. Found the food a bit underwhelming and under-seasoned. Had the fish tacos and quesadillas. Would have been nice if the taco shells were handmade. Anyway, the salsas and dips saved the under seasoned quesadillas for me. We were the only guests at the restaurant at that time.

Vivian was very welcoming and sincere in recommending us the dishes for the night. Dishes were cooked to perfection and we really enjoyed every dish. Pearlyn and Uncle Ben’s service was also top notch. We were there to celebrate my sister’s 18th birthday and she had a blast! Will definitely recommend to anyone who’s looking to try Mexican dish, it’s one of the best out there!

Grub 🌮🌮🌮🌮🌮
Dricka 🍸🍸🍸🍸
Price 🔪 🔪 🔪
Service 🙇 🙇 🙇 🙇 🙇
Parking 🅿 🅿 🅿 🅿
Overall 🏆 🏆 🏆 🏆 🏆

According to owner, Best Mexican 🇲🇽 restaurant in SG - awarded. The tequila and the tortillas. Great deco and effort in making the restaurant arribas friendly. Service is excellent - the staff do take pride in their work. Excellent gaff here
South American restaurants in Siglap.opening_hours:

Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM

South American restaurants in Siglap.name: Comida Mexicana Singapore

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
Glad to discover this Spanish dining gem. Firstly the place has a very welcoming vibe with its laid back countryside style and soothing lighting. The tapas here somewhat more authentic than some other places. What really wowed me is the Paella which is so delicious. Definitely will come back when I have crave for Spanish fare.

Lovely food, great vibes and the service was excellent. The paella is the best we’ve had in SG, really! The flies at the alfresco tables were a bit annoying, so might opt for the indoor sitting in the future. We’ll be back!

The food here is good. We over ordered but still managed to  finished everything.

My only gripe is that
1. I wished the anchovies (which were really great) came with bread to balance out the saltiness
2. The Pedro Ximenez was abit pricey for 100ml

Had lunch here on a Friday afternoon. Friendly staff, food tastes amazing and very authentic! I’ve been to Spain twice and glad to enjoy the same authentic taste here. I love the vibes and will definitely come back here again!

the food is absolutely divine!!! (especially the brussels sprouts & patatas bravas). short ribs were really tender so that was great. paella was alright for me personally. really liked that the tapas came really fast.

the cafe is really quaint and cute, love the design but because its size is rather small, the noise depending on the crowd can get quite deafening, inevitably affecting the atmosphere.

South American restaurants in Siglap.name: Next Door Spanish Cafe

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
Absolutely loved my dining experience at this Greek restaurant! The flavors were authentic, and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. The staff was incredibly friendly, making it a delightful meal from start to finish. Can't wait to go back and savor more of their delicious dishes!

The meat platters and lamb rack at this Greek gem are culinary masterpieces! Each bite is a flavor explosion, and the tenderness of the meats is truly impressive. The dips, a perfect accompaniment, add an extra layer of deliciousness to every dish. A must-try for anyone who appreciates top-notch Greek cuisine!

Visited for the first time after hearing good reviews from friends. Awesome ambience and child-friendly. Helpful staff who helped us with food orders and wine recommendation. Dips were great, octopus tender and flavourful. Desserts were also delightful. The standout dish was the lamb chops!

Had dinner some time last week and the food was pretty good but it was quite pricey. The waiter asked if we would like sparkling or still water and we thought still meant free tap water, but it turned out to be $10 bottled water. Don’t make the same mistake as we did if you don’t want to splurge on water!

Unfortunately, we found a piece of stainless steel dish sponge in our food which is quite unhygienic and dangerous. The staff were kind enough to take it off our bill but this was a very eventful first experience dining here.

We had an excellent dinner here at Blu Kouzina. The food was delicious, staff very friendly and helpful, and the restaurant designed beautifully.

We shared the meat platter, kebab platter, 4 dip platter (tzatziki, hummus, red pepper, harissa), and kanafe. Everything we ordered was cooked to perfection and tasted amazing. Stand outs include the lamb chop and the red pepper dip.

The restaurant even served us a few drinks on the house!

Overall a great dining experience and easy recommendation.

Went to celebrate birthday with a few friends. The food and service were good. Only disappointment is that when we were leaving the place, the wine was actually not finished.  The staff could do better to confirm if we still want it before throwing the bottle away.
South American restaurants in Siglap.name: Blu Kouzina Siglap

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
Tasty mexican food at decent prices. Very good service and staff are nice and friendly. Love the ambience here too. They have alfresco style dining and often screen sports matches etc.

A very welcoming restaurant serving flavorful Mexican delicacies. The staff there were extremely approachable and helpful in recommending dishes and constantly checking in on us. A must visit if you are craving Mexican cuisine and I recommend the Pork Carnitas. Worth the travel to go back again 😊

Just passed by this place and decided to give it a try! Unexpectedly good! Flavorful and interesting taste you won’t get with other typical chain burrito stalls.

Daily rice bowl available at approx $8.90 with proteins, available on public holidays too. Give it a try!

Portions may be small for big eaters though.

Went there for a couple of refreshing beers to end my day and it was great. It was almost closing but the kind staff still served us. We finish our other pint at the chilly outdoor area. Good management!

Absolutely fantastic! Went here for lunch with a friend. Really friendly service and totally fresh and flavourful food. We will be back!
South American restaurants in Siglap.opening_hours:

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
Really good selection of Italian food. Reasonable prices and nice vibes to the place.

Good for a family meal or with friends over drinks and small bites as well.

I will reconnect the pizza and pasta for sharing. Do order their cold or hot sides to start off with.

Outdoor seatings are good during evenings.

Will be back again very soon.

Great pasta but a little on the pricey side! Portions are very generous and good quality as well so you get what you pay for! Heads up, do not sit outside unless you want to be a buffet for the mosquitoes like us😭

Staff was very friendly, food came on time, not too crowded on a late weekday evening.

Pizza was as expected, thin crusts are my favourite and the sauce spread was in appropriate amounts. Ordered the marinara pizza.

Regretted the aglio olio, noodles were too thick, rather tough and garlic was overpowering everything else. Ravioli was right on point with the amount of sauce as well, generous serving.

Desserts were nice

Back in Singapore for a quick trip. Caught up with an old friend and we decided on one of Singapore's OG Italian restaurants.

Soup and pasta were okay. Competent. Tasty enough... although my Carbonara was a tad salty and the sauce was just a bit too thick for my palette.

Was looking forward to the Tiramisu... which was like the go-to hip dessert there during my youth long long time ago 😉 ... I was disappointed. The fingers were not well soaked... it was dry. The chocolate powder was overdone... that was an overdose. My memories were slightly tainted 🤨

Was there for dinner on a Sat evening with my family of 8 person. We took the inside table with aircon. The ambience is cosy and nice. The taste and quality of the pasta is generally good. The cream sauced pastas are really thick and rich and can be a little to jelak to finish. My Carbonaro is too salty for my liking, it could be due to to bacon in it. If I am not wrong, I think their they used fresh pasta. Price is of mid-high range. Overall we had a great time and enjoyed the dinner.
South American restaurants in Siglap.opening_hours:

South American restaurants in Siglap.name: Pasta Fresca Da Salvatore (Siglap)

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
It was pouring when we arrived. The restaurant should do an extension shelter to help patrons exit the car. Even the lady at the reception did not help to offer an umbrella and just stood at her station. First experience entering the restaurant is spoilt by the lack of the service.
Once we were seated, the service staff were attentive. The food was delicious. The sourdough with smoked butter was really good. The bread was crispy on the outside and soft and warm inside. The butter was smooth and smoked well. The rest of the dishes were good too. The jamon was flavorful.
The staff offered us to move to their bar for drinks and we moved there once we settled the bill. The bar was cosy and comfortable. Love the vibe.

A beautiful restaurant with excellent and attentive service from everyone. Nothing much to complain about the food, as bread lovers we the warm sourdough and smoked butter did stand out for us, that we ordered another half way into the service. Meat were all well cooked. We were hoping for a chocolate based dessert. The alternative of the interpretation of cafe con leche works well too.

I had a fantastic end-to-end booking experience at this restaurant. The hostess was not only friendly but also very accommodating. The food was delightful and, as a pleasant touch, "muy rico" as they'd say in Spanish. Although I was initially suprised to find a limited cocktail menu. It didn't detract from the overall experience. Based on my visit, I've already recommended this establishment to a friend. I'm also looking forward to visiting another restaurant of theirs - Next Door Spanish Cafe, in the near future.

This is one of those in my todo visit place for a while. The food and service surpassed all our expectations. The sourdough bread may look normal but it is so crusty outside but soft inside. What is more amazing is the house smoked butter which is unlike anything we had before. We were recommended the charred cabbage which is so refreshing before the main dish which is the dry-aged beef rib. It is enough for 3-4 pax comfortably to have room for other dishes. We ended with Pina Colada and a scope of lemon sorbet. It’s a memorable experience I must say.

The foods are alright but pricing is on the steep side. There is a speakeasy bar in the restaurant itself called 60ml. They make great cocktail and ambience there is much better:)
South American restaurants in Siglap.opening_hours:
Monday: 5:30 PM – 12:00 AM

South American restaurants in Siglap.name: Asador Singapore

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
If you have in mind the usual traditional Peranakan food, this is not the place for you. The dishes are more fusion-modern and bar-like. Food is generally appealing to taste buds, staff comes across as friendly, what I really love is the interior aesthetics and vibes.

Certainly interesting for an experience, but perhaps not a return visit, and the prices tend to be a little high.

Service excellence goes to Marivel and Aeron. We had a great dining experience because of them.

Food was great too! Kudos to the Chef!!!

I couldn't say anything bad for the ambience of the restaurant as it bring more effect to the experience.

Here for the four-hands collaboration and got to try dishes of very different cuisines. Very friendly staff and delicious food! Weekend lunch seems slightly crowded do make a booking if you can! There's a beautiful outdoor area that is pet-friendly!

Nice cosy Asian fusion restaurant in the heart of Katong with stunning casual interiors. We came on a weekday evening, and only 3-4 tables were occupied.

We had red wine and decided to have it along with the following :

1) Chilli Crab Cake - Nice crispy croquettes that pairs well with the chilli crab sauce.

2) Rendang Lasagna - Nice rendang sauce, that is not too fiery. Mix it well with the cheesy lasagna and you have a winner.

3) Salmon main served on a bed of mash potato, some noodles and veggies.

As a guest of Hotel Indigo, we enjoyed their breakfast buffet and room service. The breakfast was included with our room rate so we took advantage and the staff was helpful to point out the vegan options and made us a veggie currie and roti to go with the buffet, we were full and taken care of. The fruit was a bit bland and the cappuccino was a bit bitter, but overall good variety for breakfast and we were full for hours.

The room service came in clutch after being exhausted after a long day of walking and shopping. We ordered the Assam Curry Seabass, the Chap Chae, Sauteed veggies, and jasmine rice - we didn’t venture into the fusion dishes and kept it simple. Everything was flavorful, especially the Sea Bass, and it arrived quickly and piping hot, totally satisfying!

South American restaurants in Siglap.name: Baba Chews

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
A lovely location by the beach on the East cost. They serve Mexican, Indian, Italian dishes. Beer available on the tap. Food quality OK. Beer pricy at S$14+
Overall OK for one off visit, especially watching cricket, soccer matches in groups since they have multiple large screens.

Food was ok, service was acceptable. At the beginning, I took a spoon of the butter chicken and found a food wrapper inside. Still, ate and didn't complain. Towards the end of the meal, at the last pc of my naan, I discovered a strand of hair stuck inside. I must be unlucky to see 2 inedible items in 1 meal. Still finished our meal, but not gonna return here again.

Happened upon this great spot for lunch right next to the beach , we had the mexican fare and it didn’t disappoint - tacos , nachos, pasta and pizza - all good. They have a huge menu for both mexican and indian cuisine , next time we will try the indian menu. Service was good and staff friendly. Will be back.

Service is really bad. The staff seem to ignore you and you have to call them multiple times to get your order/ food.

Location is superb. Food is ok. Price is quite high.

Being on the East Coast Park and one side facing the beach is an added value for this restaurant. Good ambience and if we sit out, view of the water will be clear. Food was average, okie okie taste. We ordered a mix of Mexican and Indian dishes, all turned out to ve average. Prices are maintained as per the location. Staff is very friendly and during weekends orders will be served with a delay due to good crowd and many orders. Overall it was a good experience.
South American restaurants in Siglap.name: Patro's Sports Bar & Restaurant

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
It was a bit cramp but was clean. It was my first time to Singapore so I didn't know that the servers are oldies and it was already midnight so I didn't expect to be served by a lolo, but he is really accommodating and friendly

Even now I'm not really like fast food products but when I came back here after 26 years ago, they still give excellent service to the customers..

Very slow and bad service. Accepted voucher of a greater value than my meal and did not tell, only to lock it and inform that it was locked into the system already and cannot be refunded. Whoever the manager was on 20th Sep, 8.34pm.

Standard McDonalds ... crew usually polite and service is above average.

3 stars because no shaker fries as advertised. Only regular fries. And cannot accommodate to simple request to add tomatoes & lettuce to order of angus cheeseburger only can remove cheese & ketchup but no add ons. Geez so calculative. I given up the 2 cheese slices. C’mon lol

And so many items not available besides the shaker fries. If it gonna be 24 hours kn a Friday night ... stock up.

Manager don't have any idea about how to make payment with PayPal or pay now ...infact he was confused with ez link payment. Finally I make the payment with Ez Link..

South American restaurants in Siglap.name: McDonald's Siglap

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
We came here for our wedding anniversary and were absolutely impressed! Husband is Spanish so there were high expectations. Absolutely liked every dish, however the squid ink paella and croquetas were a hit for us. Service went above and beyond, would absolutely come back again :)

We were greeted by friendly staff when entering.
Ordered some paella 🥘 . Delicious.
Food was amazing not pricey for restaurant. Spanish delights well served.
Desert was cheesecake with whiskey ice cream.
The staff recommended food which were incredible.
Overall experience 100/10

I like the Beetroot with smoked olive oil sorbet. Stunning dishes. Paella is super nice as well. Good experiences. Very happening places. Price meet the service and dishes.

I think this should be the best place to have Spanish food in Singapore - very delectable and original dishes. Loved the beetroot and strawberry salad in olive oil ice cream. Paella was also very flavourful. No regrets for a Tuesday weeknight dinner.

Lively atmosphere.   It’s a bit noisy so if one will need to speak louder to your companions.  Been here for a few times and experienced seated on a table and counter.   I personally prefer the counter just because I can see what’s happening at the kitchen and it was fun to watch.   Food were all yummy and their Sangria was one of the best we have tasted in Singapore.
South American restaurants in Siglap.opening_hours:

South American restaurants in Siglap.name: FOC Restaurant

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
Previously came before renovation and the food was decent overall for their price. However, after the renovation, the food standard dropped drastically during my recent visit. Although, the food place is relatively clean and pleasant since it’s newly renovated.

The truffle cream chicken chop was overly cooked hence it was tougher, drier and chewier compared to most food stalls out there. In addition, the mushroom was of low quality similar to a processed can food in my opinion.
However, their food portion is decent. The garlic bread is nicely toasted with a rich taste of garlic for garlic bread lovers.

Comparing the quality of food in the stall with the same pricing out there in the market, their  quality of food is substandard. As for the loaded mac and cheese, the macaroni tasted burnt and without much cheese taste.. moreover, the chicken taste was off. However, the pulled beef quality is normal and their portion is decent.

Overall, I am disappointed with my recent visit back to the stall. I hope they can improve their standard of food quality where they can match up the quality of food with their pricing, and their cooking method can improve such as less burnt macaroni taste and the meat can be more tender.

Thank you.

Had our dinner here.. Ordered the Chitpole Fried Chicken Burger and Aglio Olio Chicken Chop.. Burger is good but for the aglio olio, the garlic was burnt and the spaghetti had the burnt taste.. Unable to finished up the spaghetti due to the burnt taste..

Being one of only a handful of halal gourmet burger joints, as well as the owner being an ex- co-founder of Burgs by Project Warung, comparisons would be inevitable.

I think the Smoky Pulled Brisket burger is slightly juicier & succulent as compared to Burgs’ Pulled Beef burger. The beef strands feels a bit more charred also. The charcoal bun is soft and fluffy, which I personally prefer a more toasted/firmer grilled bun. On the overall, it’s a pretty good burger.

The beef patty on the Ashes Smash Cheeseburger also seems tastier than Burg’s Classic Cheeseburger.

The straight cut fries are crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

Well done Ashes Burnnit crew!

Above average for a kopitiam western food. Ordered it's truffle chicken chop, serving is more than average too. Worth to try. Worth to return.

Been seeing the review but yet to be able to drop by and test.
We couldn't avoid comparing their burgers vs burgs so we ordered crispy mushroom and pulled beef and ribs.

Their burger is bigger than burgs.
Their fries is coated fries like kfc , and thicker cuts.
Mushroom was good but their pulled beef is better than burgs.

Service was prompt and friendly. Order was ready within 5min of waiting.

The only drawback is that they are located in a small,  packed kopitiam which could be difficult to secure a table.
South American restaurants in Siglap.address: 69 Bedok South Ave 3, Springleaf Eating House by Coffee Buddy, Singapore 460069
South American restaurants in Siglap.name: Ashes Burnnit

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
Great place to chill and catch up with friends, colleagues, or family. Tried the Mee Siam again after so long. Still as good as before. The Royals burger (take out) was nice too. Will come back for more good food.

Always liked coming to Royals Cafe cos of how homely and warm the service and atmosphere is. Not a great place if you want a romantic meal with your date 😂 but definitely a great place to take a boisterous crowd to.

Food is always homey and warms not just my stomach but my soul ❤️

If you come here, the mee siam is a must try and don’t forget to pack away some home made cakes and cookies!

The portions are pretty hearty so come with a hungry stomach to enjoy the meal.

Came here for the mee siam that is described as “best mee siam in Singapore” on a signage at the door - IMO it’s good but not outstanding - I would have given 4 stars if not for the fact that the two prawns were frozen and quite tasteless.

However, my colleague and I were quite impressed with the crab cakes which we are really glad we ordered.

Am not a mee siam person, but this place serves the best Nyonya Mee Siam 😍, and now it’s my regular fix. They also have assorted pastries & cakes. My favorite is still none other than the ‘ondeh-ondeh swiss roll’ (not to be confused with the sliced cake). They also have many finger food options for take-aways and great for parties - best to pre-order to avoid disappointment. Staff is also very pleasant and helpful!

Awesome food! Awesome staff! Awesome service! This cafe have never failed to impress me for the last 10 years I have been here. Thumbs up for ticking all the correct boxes in F&B.
South American restaurants in Siglap.opening_hours:
Monday: 9:30 AM – 9:00 PM
Tuesday: 9:30 AM – 9:00 PM
Wednesday: 9:30 AM – 9:00 PM
Thursday: 9:30 AM – 9:00 PM

Saturday: 9:30 AM – 9:00 PM
Sunday: 9:30 AM – 9:00 PM
South American restaurants in Siglap.name: The Royals Cafe (Siglap)

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
Good service and tasty food. Good music from the 70s and 80s. Suitable middle age and older crowd. Wide range of liquor to choose from.

It's one of the best bars I've been too. The vibe js just amazing with an amazing service !
Try the sotomein(fish ball) it's to die for ..their chicken wings crispy on the outside succulent on the inside ! Their stir beef fry with wagyu beef is just so mouth wateringly juicy !
Definite visit if you are looking for a good drink and good food with a great atmosphere..
Oh almost forgot, you can get a bottle and come back later and use it ! Worth every penny spent...don't miss going here if you're in Singapore.

The Pork Ribs was tender and tasty. The Chicken Tikka Pizza was crispy and had generous amount of topping. This is probably one of the best pizzas I have ever tasted in Singapore (I do like the crust thin and crispy). Definitely a place to come back to.

Excellent place to hang out. Got outdoor & indoor. Indoor no cigarettes smell at all. Lots of beers & liquor options. Their small bite snacks order come hot and freshly cooked. My boss favourite place to hang out. He had been coming to this place for years. The staff basically knows him!

Yesterday went for second round for his farewell party.

It was a full house but took some time to figure out why? Impossible burger -must try!

It was my first time over there.  I sow a lot of good reviews and etc.
So we decided to   check it out.
It was a full house so it took a moment. But of course,  that how most of the people are going to choose the place. Nobody likes  empty  pubs and etc.  So far so good.
We got a small standing table for two. And we got a menu in 2 min. I was a good start.
Now its getting a bit more complicated.
Service.   The staff were friendly enough.
The first lady gave the menu and another lady took the order.  Her hands were occupied with a dirty plates so she didn’t write the order. Maybe it wasn’t the case, but nobody cares as long as the result will be satisfying .  But it usually goes with the order mess up as we were predicting.
So we ordered 4 glasses of wine,  onion rings, impossible burger and pasta to share.  It was a different waiter every time so I was actually wondering about the result.
And yeah, it was some mistakes like a missing onion rings and 4 glasses became 6. But I do aware about quantity doesn’t mean quality. So even if 10 people will take the order it will take some time to get the job done.  So just be ready to wait and etc. I was prepared.
Food. Food was tasty. I did like the impossible burger  the most.  It reminded me the time when I wasn’t a vegetarian yet  . Good job.
Drinks. The house pour wine was a good one as well.
This place has some drink promotions and happy hours till 8.00 pm so you can check it out!

Over all> well

South American restaurants in Siglap.name: Georges MADBar & Grill

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
I quite like their pizza and their bar snacks are better than those at many other places. Reasonably priced for that area and most of their full time wait staff are quite attentive and friendly.
On weekends, when it gets busy, service standards might drop a bit.
They also serve Thai and North Indian cuisine.

Tiffin serves great value North Indian cuisines. Al Fresca dining at sunset, perfect for casual chill out dining.

Fun place in Katong, super vibrant and happening.

Recommend: Thai Green Curry, Butter Chicken and Fries

The food is decent, service is very slow and drinks are okay. It’s a casual dive bar experience. I would not recommend this place if you’re going for an all out dining experience.

Pros
Ambience - Super chill
Price - Reasonable
Food - Asian/Contintental/Indian/American

The number of options to choose from is an advantage. However, nothing is extraordinary.

Nice place for casual dining. This is a combination of 4 places. They have pizzas and burgers, Indian, Thai.

Good decor, open air and indoor seating. Great staff, friendly and sweet

We orders veg biryani and chicken pad see ew. Loved both, decent priced for the portion size

Visited this place twice during my stay. Nice food, although the service was very slow.

Pros,
Good prices
Good Food
Causal dining

I would recommend the pizzas and the butter chicken set which came with rice and a naan and was very good value.

Lots of menus which means plenty of choice available, however the service was a bit of a let down as on one occasion, I ordered two pizzas which came 35 minutes apart.

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
Staff are very helpful and friendly. Made the dining experience so much more enjoyable. Food is also very good. The fried squid with salt and pepper is really good. Huge menu and would definitely come back again with a bigger group to try other items on the menu.

Good place for lunch in Siglap. Only 2 of us so didn’t get to try the different dishes yet … so may have to come back. Noodles were quite good. Satay was OK … I prefer the Singaporean/Malaysian style more.

Food quality was good with each dish well executed and reasonably generous portions. Service was friendly and prompt. Restaurant had a retro feel but a bit spartan. Pricing was reasonable - $100 (inclusive of service and GST) for 5 dishes which was very adequate for 5 diners. The reasonable pricing contributed to the 5 rating

It is a very nice place for dining with family and friends. Food were slightly on the saltier side, probably the dishes were catered to pair with white rice. We highly recommend the gong bao frog legs. The meat is substantial and comes with a lot of cashews. I am not a fan of pork but do give the satay a try! The meat is tender and marinated well.

The drinks were a little pricey (a real coconut juice cost $8.88 and the passionfruit soda comes with passionfruit syrup and not the real passionfruit seeds >_

Noodle dishes like mie keriting were well executed, with springy noodles of good texture.  The roasts - roast pork belly, char siew were ok. Nasi campur was ok, not overly impressed as the roasts were similar to that of the noodles. Ngo hiang texture and taste left the impression that it was very processed, the texture more like that of fish cake rather than regular ngoh hiang. Fu yong hai was average. Service was friendly and responsive and ambience was nice.
South American restaurants in Siglap.name: Kota88 Restaurant

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
Chanced upon this quaint looking Peranakan eatery at Siglap and was blown away by their dishes! Simple yet heartwarming. Prices are also very reasonable as compared to other Peranakan restaurants you may find elsewhere.

The place is a little hard to find but please do not let that deprive your family and yourself of the chance to enjoy delightful tasting Nonya food! 👍🏻

Just randomly chanced upon it and tried the curry chicken. I walloped it super fast … cos it was so darn tasty! Friendly lady boss and she was introducing me to her other dishes. For sure I’ll be back to try them !!

Charming place. We hardly get to see such a shop setup these days. Everything else is modernised and highly commercialised. But this shop still retains an old world charm… just like chilling out !

A hidden gem for delicious peranakan food in Siglap. The nice owner gentleman was crooning away live at the oldies he recorded many years ago, right at our table while also chatting with us. Not crowded but not many seats available. I finished all the chicken curry sauce, to 2 bowls of rice. Katong Delights is a delight for a natural windy afternoon lunch.

At first glance you'd think it's someone's home and then when you walk in you'll realise it's setup half a restaurant and half a home. That's because the main business is actually catering and the owners had this setup to accommodate customers who wanted to dine in. Great taste and great variety, serves fast too. Not too spicy or salty. Homely feel. Hidden Peranakan Gem of Singapore. Would come again.

A very nice peranakan eatery. Wanted to try their food many times but always not possible. Finally got an opportunity today as it was quiet in the afternoon. The setup is very home like so if you want a grand setup than you need to go somewhere else. The food is very tasty but you need to wait for a while as each dishes are prepared individually. When the food is served you will noticed that the long wait is all worth it. I will surely return for more from this eatery.

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
Mushroom fettuccine was delightful. Yummy and generous mushroom portion (please don’t change this!)

Pizza no.3 (smoked salmon one) would probably match a white sauce base better but it tasted good nonetheless.

Cappuccino was not amazing but very decent. Gluten free lavender and citrus cake was very sweet but pretty nice after scraping off the syrup layer above.

The ambience takes the hat.

Overall an enjoyable experience. :) I’ll definitely return.

Overall service and food were good. My Americano was a little flat, and they forgot to put in my scrambled eggs order with the cook, but the friendly service and good taste and quality well made up for it.

We're all human, and sometimes, mistakes happen. It's how does a particular establishment handle their mistakes, and this particular establishment handled it in a friendly and professional manner instead of blaming the customer due to a bruised ego, which is a common thing in the USA. It's nice to see an establishment own their mistake and offer a solution to rectify it.

A quaint cafe in the spirit of halloween. The staff were dressed as pirates and it was swarmed with families with children after trick or treat. Despite that, service was fast. Was amazed the food was ready so quickly.  The food was alright. Nothing for me to say it was awesome. Plating was good. The sourdough pizza was soft and warm. I was actually amazed that it remained soft despite cooling down. The prawn. aglio olio was made with black pepper, garlic and some crushed pepper. Prawns were fresh. It wasn't dry. That was definitely a plus. Truffle fries were ok..I will definitely visit the place again

Absolutely enchanted by the beauty and serenity of Swan Lake, nestled perfectly amidst the vibrant East Coast suburb of Singapore. A stone's throw away, Opera Estate stands as an epitome of a delightful neighborhood. The store managed by the dynamic duo, Franklyn and Felix, is a testament to excellence and passion. Their wonderful team ensures every visit is memorable. Highly recommended!

The Pain au Levain here is one the best sourdough in Singapore up there with TBB and Providore, so are their croissants, tarts and cakes. I use air fryer to lightly toast breads for a minute and it’s the perfect balance of crisp and chewiness. I have to declare that the Multigrain Croissant is the best Croissant I have ever had. It’s my fav now. Ultimate shiok.

Back again for the Spelt Sourdough loaf. It’s too dense and hard. Not for me.

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
My husband and I love Social Outcast's burgers and pizzas before. So when we heard they have this new Experiential Dining we cant wait to try. We tried their 7 course Woodfire Experiential Dining to celebrate our wedding anniversary and we had an enjoyable, sensory and mouth-watering experience. Ella and Noelle were great hosts with good knowledge and made us feel comfortable. The food was well thought of, tasty and we could feel the creative passion of Chef Mint. We also appreciate their thoughtful gifts. Thank you.

Ella (our host) was super friendly & helpful! Noelle, Tian and her team were all very welcoming too
Omakase 7-course meal was superb! Service was really fast and Ella was super helpful in explaining the dishes & ingredients!
Atmosphere was chill & mysterious, even the toilet (red room) is really interesting 👀

Furthermore, they ensure that you leave their place full! Chef Wan prepared an additional dish (for you to find out) and it was amazing!!

I have more videos of the dishes (but can’t upload to Google 😭)

Had the pleasure to try the omakase last night. It was such an amazing and fun experience! Delicious 7 course meal with a great selection of ingredients. Would like to give my thanks to Ella, Noelle and Chef Mint for the wonderful evening.

Will be seeing you guys again soon! 🫡

Chanced upon some word of mouth recommendation of this rather elusive private dining! I’m glad The Lover and I followed our gut and made reservations!

We were enjoying every course of this Omakase and the surprising menu kept us guessing! The only thing we knew? It was gonna be good!

I’m not gonna spoil the surprises, but will let the pictures do the talking. It was absolutely lovely paired with some chilled, delicious palette cleansing teas. Every dish was lovingly prepared with attention to details— I’m feeling the SOUL man!

Premium produce at not so premium prices. Affordable enough to come whenever they update the menu (which I suspect will be quite often as they are creative 😛)!

I have not included photos of the entrance as it is part of the experience for others 😜

We had Omakase experiential dining experience and it’s 10/10! Service was impeccable, food is beyond our expectations! Hey, if my 80 yr old grandma love their food and the people behind it, it shows a lot of how much she truly enjoyed the experience. My photos don’t do justice to the creations they made. You’ve got to experience it to know what we mean when we say we love every dish and moment of it.

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
The dining experience had its highs and lows. The beef was passable, and the pork leaned towards dryness. However, the standout was the fish taco, boasting an excellent taste. On the downside, the seafood rice carried a strong, fishy scent, which might not appeal to those less inclined towards seafood. Overall, a mixed bag with moments of delight and areas for improvement.

Cherished and had a great experience.
So far, their dishes are quite good, and appetizing just we're came here for a shot.
Well, as their service is acceptable and their prices are quite extravagant but it's fine that we're first time visited here. We're all as never before.
The atmosphere here is pleasing and tremendous.

Nice ambience with 2 drinks @ $23 depending on what you choose. We choose a beer and a wine.

For food, it all tasted awesome and we love the food. The only downside is the price which is a little steep for the portion of food presented.

If you ask me whether I will come again, I am sure I can find the same quality food with a lower price range.

It is a restaurant where the service is fast and the food is fantastic. It was a good experience having my dinner here.

Throwback August 2023. As we had reserved our seats, we had the best view in the restaurant. Food was fresh and yummy. Very authentic Mexican cuisine and staffs were great with their service and even gave us a free ice cream churros with candle for my daughter’s birthday. So memorable and beautiful place. We will be back soon

Enjoyed our meal at Tonito@Jewel. Beautiful ambience with wonderful view of the Rain Vortex. Excellent service from the crew and especially Pei Min who took the time to chat and introduce each dish in detail.

South American restaurants in Siglap.reviews:
Amazing place with great food and cold beer.
I definitely recommend going on a Friday night, Melissa and the usual suspects keeps the energy alive with amazing music, very beautiful space with amazing people!

Pleasantly surprised by this sleepy bar-bistro. Largely pub-grub fare but everything was well prepared especially the prawn tacos & calamari. Food portions were sizeable too.
Only slight down side perhaps was the choice of music. But definitely worth another trip for food & ambience.

Chilled out place, took a ride out and stopped off for refreshment. Nice location. Chilled out hippy style bar/cafe. The rustic look with barrels and pallets as table base fits the mood but desperately impractical for any visitors with legs!

Despite not being too busy, I thought I was eating my invisibility cloak and ended up going to get some service. I guess it’s a chill-out mood setting and if you are in a hurry - wrong move! Not sure why my salad took so long. Was ok though in someways basic. The Caesar dressing seemed very ‘supermarketty’ but ok. Prices were tasty though and as always must take everything into context. A look at neighbouring tables and it doesn’t look too bad at all - and don’t get me wrong, mine was fine, could just have been spruced up with a better dressing and perhaps a few pine nuts - but now I’m being picky. All in all - will be back if I get the chance, quite ok.

Amazing place for food, drinks and music. Live band sang really well. Food was good, and not too expensive. Taste was great! Beer could be colder, but perhaps the heat was just too high this period. Good chilling place. Come in the evening, best!

Great place to eat after some wakeboarding or if you're in the area. Wagyu burger (medium rare) is to die for here and live music (I think nightly) makes it all even better. Would definitely recommend!

Caribbean dining in Kallang.reviews:
We’ve ordered fish tacos, spiced wings, oxtail gnocchi, habanero prawn plantain tart & curry goat stew. All the dishes were so flavourful & delicious!
Special shout-out to Martin, the manager, and his team for the attentive & great dining service provided. We really had an enjoyable time at the restaurant.
This is our first visit and it will definitely not our last! (:

Came here with my husband and in laws for his birthday. We started off with the doubles and plantain nachos, then had the spiced lamb, jerk chicken and fisherman stew, all of which were excellent! All of us had cocktails to go with our meal, and the house lime punch was so yum. We have to commend the manager for his wonderful service.  while we did not inform the restaurant that it was my husband's birthday, he made it extra special by giving us a cocktail on the house and also made our desserts complimentary. Thank you very much for the lovely experience and we will be back for sure.

The fisherman’s stew which came with rice and beans was the star of the night - the sauce was filled with seafood-y flavour and goodness. Will come back again just for this dish, and try other appetisers like the Mac and cheese balls. The other dishes we tried were quite decent too, like the BBQ pork ribs.

First time trying jerk chicken after seeing it countless times online. Fair warning, it packs a punch! 🥵 I ordered the Jerk Chicken Skewers and Fish Taco. The taco was drenched in a delicious sauce and I highly recommend ordering this even though it is slightly on the pricier side.

Would love to return with friends and family since none of us have tried Caribbean cuisine before!

Excellent selection of food! We had the nachos, curry goat with rice and spiced lamb. Every one of them was well-seasoned, leaving our stomachs feeling happy.

An area of improvement would definitely be the space- lighting was terrible for good photos. It looked a bit rundown, unless that was the effect they were going for.

Caribbean dining in Kallang.reviews:
The first thing I liked about this place is the lighting. It was perfect with no glare to eyes. Menu item names were funny. haha.. triggering to try it out. Would suggest this place for both couple dining and team dining. For desserts, expect for vanilla ice cream nothing else was available. Little disappointed that I could not try out the creme brulee :-(
Nachos was too good. Must try. Food was served hot and we all loved it.

The Troublemaker

Al Capone's Sports Bar + Dining
📍Kallang Wave Mall, 1 Stadium Pl, #01-15, 397628

🍜 Food wise: For bar food, this was surprisingly good! Better than good actually. Each item on this dish was made perfectly, although it was saucy but it wasn’t too greasy.

There was this lamb masala, thought to be an oily dish, but it wasn’t! It was fragrant, well balanced flavour of spices and it came with soft and tender lamb! The meat also had the nice aroma of the spices, they were generous about it too! They came with crispy hot bread that one can dip into the sauce of the masala, delicious!

Then there was nachos, so good! Nice and crispy, the nachos were well layered with the guacamole, cheese, and salsa, so refreshing!

There were also a variety of sausages, 4 different sausages, firm, soft, and tender, some more juicy and the other. Taste wise, they were not very salty, not very sure what was the difference in them though.

The salad was also tasty and refreshing, fresh, sweet, and appetizing!

✨ Ambience wise: Great bar! Very cozy and serves delicious beers!

🤵🏻 Service wise: Great!

💵 Price wise: $45.90

🫵🏼Where else will you recommend?

Share with me in the comments below👇🏼!

🤗Remember to follow me to see what can make you hungry!

I hardly complain about stuff but i think the establishment needs to improve.

We waited quite a while for your meal to be served, while the others who came after us were served first

The lamb shank is such a disappointment! Unfortunately, it didnt make its mark. For the many lamb shanks i have eaten, this one had ONE slice of carrot and ONE slice of garlic bread. The whole dish tasted like it was bought from the wholesaler and heated up over the stove.  Sticking some rosemary and a chilli padi will not add any flavours. Huge disappointment 🙄

The sea bass came much later and by the time it did, the lamb shank turned lukewarm. We requested for roasted vegetables instead of mash potatoes and were told that they can't do so. At least the bass was fresh, but nothing to scream about.

When we aaked for more warm water, we were told they already gave us a complimentary glass and had to pay $1 if we wanted more. Hmmm I would imagine that the establishment had already factored these costs into its pricing... Anywayzzz

I doubt we will be back again. We only went in because there werr seata and the other places we wanted to go had really long queues.

We came here with a big group after a great CrossFit workout at CrossFit Unit in the same building. I only took one for which is my Bangers and Mash but the group ordered all kings of food. The portions are very generous and worthy the price and can be for sharing. We also tried the wings, fish and chips and pasta. All were good.

Food is goods and so are the beer taps. Have Guinness on the tap and have the rest of the team having beers and 1 bottle of whiskey. Food selections are a lot, and the same goes for alcohol selections. The only issue is short-handed and take some time for things to come.  Highly recommend on the platters and the fried chicken in the bucket.

Caribbean dining in Kallang.reviews:
Good food and quick serving time. The staff was very helpful and attentive during our visit.

Had the steamed barramundi and it was delicious. I still prefer the sanbei claypot chicken I had at another branch, but the fish was also good.

Update: Decided to drop to 4 Stars after my 2nd visit.

2nd visit:
Went with my gfs to this outlet yesterday. Most of us ordered their set dinner menu which comes with main course & tea set - $15.90. Or, you can change your drink with an add-on of $3.80.

The consensus among my gfs and I is that although the price for the dinner sets are good, the quality of their mains needs improvement. My Mee Sua was way too salty. The fried salted chicken that came with my Mee Sua was quite tasty. The hot tea & drinks were also really good.

Although the restaurant wasn’t too crowded, the senior staff attending to us was quite impatient. I was trying to pay for the bill through my phone, and realised that the only way we can get the $5 discount is by signing up as a member.

The way the senior staff attended to my queries wasn’t too professional. After I signed up as a member, our mobile order disappeared from my phone. She then came over to take our orders manually, and seemed impatient when doing so.

I was very mindful that we keep to their opening hours, and asked the staff politely what time they close.

When the same senior staff replied, she emphasised that it’s 9.45pm quite loudly. I think the way she replied is quite uncalled for. She could have just given a neutral reply.

Although I love their desserts, I am not sure whether I’ll return to this outlet after the unpleasant experience.

1st visit:
My lucky day! 😂😂 I had the restaurant all to myself for about 2 hours on a weekday late afternoon.

First time at this eatery. Frankly, what caught my eye was the pretty interior with the huge Turquoise (my fav colour) Ceiling Centrepiece.

I needed a comfy place to have some happy food (aka desserts 😂) & do some work. I asked the staff if I could sit at the big table at the back of the restaurant.

The staff told me that it’s meant for big groups, but kindly obliged me with my request. That made me happy!

What made me even happier was that the dessert that I ordered - Souffle Stackers with Honeycomb Ice Cream - was super yummy! I also ordered a decaf lemongrass tea as I was feeling a bit guilty eating the huge portion of dessert ☺️

I had a good time at this eatery, and I managed to get my work done. It would have been great if the restaurant has wifi. I had to use my personal hotspot to do work on my laptop.

I’ll definitely be back at this outlet or their other outlets to try their other foods.

Ordered a $6.90 small pot of tea and I was told the refill can only be once. I wonder how much does it cost for the tea leaves!?
The soufflé pancakes are not bad, but the rest are not worth the $.

Staffs are very friendly, very attentive on every table. Food are well-prepared, season and tasteful. Environment was also very nice.

We wanted to try the food typhoon cafe for quite some time and we are happy we finally tried the food here. The items we ordered were close to the taste we had in Taiwan! Dessert looks and tastes awesome! Staff service was excellent! We are sure to come back again!

Caribbean dining in Kallang.reviews:
Great Indian food here. Serving portions are quite good. tastes authentic. We went for lunch,  so it was not that crowded. Likely to get crowded at night.

It’s my first time in Singapore and this restaurant did not disappoint. The food is so tasty, the staffs are friendly. We met the owner and he’s so accommodating. There is also a live band at night. CANT WAIT TO GO BACK!

Food was ordinary. Ordered something but something else came. The staff was too busy and it was too loud so we ate it anyway. The staffs were disrespectful and not very accommodating. We told them that the booking was for 2 but they wrote it as 3 and gave us a table and kept on telling us to move to allow walk in customers and last minute booking customers. However, the atmosphere was fun and the singers made our night. Not sure if I’d go back again though.

Was a wonderful experience on Wednesday at Rocking Rickshaw! Amazed that as busy as it was, the waiter still had a smile on his face and tried his best to get our food and drinks to us fast! Food was very good and of course prices are more than competitive. Definitely a highly recommended place for a night of food and drinks plus the live band was great!

We won’t be frequenting your establishment any longer. The absence of a bouncer or security became a significant concern for us, as we, a group of ladies, had to fend off numerous intoxicated individuals, disrupting our right to enjoy our time. The limited space also seems to attract unwarranted attention, and when we sought assistance from a waiter, he appeared preoccupied with dancing rather than addressing our concerns. Unfortunately, this experience has led us to the decision of not returning.

Caribbean dining in Kallang.reviews:
Upon entering, the seafood display sets the tone for a true seafood experience at this restaurant. While also offering limited Dim Sum options, the dishes are surprisingly tasty and won't break the bank.

The fried noodles outshine the fried rice, both enjoyable nonetheless. Fresh seafood is a highlight, with reasonable prices compared to other seafood establishments. Service may be a bit stretched thin at times, but the quality compensates.

The Bamboom Clams at $9.90 each are a standout – huge, fresh, and impeccably cooked with garlic and rice noodles.

The Hairy Crab, deshelled upon request, offers a convenient and tasty experience, although the $68 price tag might be steep for some.

The Boston Lobster, originally baked with cheese, transforms with my request to be cooked with minced garlic and vermicelli – a must-try modification.

While it may not be perfect, this spot is an excellent choice for a satisfying lunch or special occasions in the area. The fresh seafood and surprising twists make it a memorable dining experience.

I was in a dilemma... should I gate keep this place or write this review. Decide not to be selfish. Lol! I visited this place 3 times. Twice for dinner and once for lunch. The seafood and dim sum are so fresh and value for money. My family used to patronise a seafood restaurant in the west but the prices have been increasing. Yet, the quality of seafood we had on the last 2 occasions there was disappointing. So, when we found Ji Xian, we decided this will be our go-to place for seafood! However, do not expect much from the service nor the ambience. Enjoy!

Seats a bit squeeze. Food taste is good Cantonese style. Serving seem to have shrunk. Service wise is still good. Helps if you know Cantonese.atmosphere old school type of restaurant. But highly recommended for Cantonese food.  Good and nice dim sum too.

First time eating in this resturant. Started with some dim sum, love the chicken feet cos its so peppery 😋 Actually not a bad place to eat dim sum! Had the Geoduck sashimi, haven’t had this for so long since hong kong. Slight crunchy texture, really individual preference but I quite like it. Bamboo clams, braised lobster noodles, veg with pork lard, fresh steamed fish etc all so good! Will definitely be back to try more of other dishes!

Came over for dim sum lunch on a Saturday. Ordered their signature dishes, mainly dim sum. Firstly, quite impressed by the variety especially live seafood and the affordable prices. Ambience is like a friendly neighborhood restaurant with a cozy atmosphere. Foodwise is OK, pretty average, slightly better than those foodcourt standards. Portions and pricing are good so making it value for money. Service was prompt and efficient. Really wanted to try their live seafood next time. Anyway, really enjoyed the dining experience.

Caribbean dining in Kallang.name: 极鲜 Ji Xian Seafood & Hong Kong Dim Sum Express

African cuisine in Jurong.reviews:
This was an amazing find.  We meant to go to the restaurant next door but they were closed. We came in here on a whim. The food is amazing. My friend had the goat curry. I had the fish curry. Both were spicy but flavorful. The plantain chips are hot and crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. The coffee was amazing, presentation and taste.

We had a wonderful dining experience at this restaurant. The standout feature was their incredibly welcoming, friendly, and attentive service. The staff patiently recommended dishes and even showed photos of them when we needed assistance.

We ordered the peanut chicken stew and goat curry, both of which were absolutely delightful. The flavors were well-balanced with just the right amount of spice and heat, and there was no gamy taste from the goat meat.

The cocktails were also a hit, and the evening was rounded off with delicious desserts. The overall ambiance was cozy and inviting, making it a perfect setting for a memorable evening.

We'll definitely be returning, and I can wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to friends. It's a gem worth visiting again and again.

Went there for dinner and I had cauliflower and buttermilk fried chicken for starters and the portion is pretty generous. Absolutely love both of it. Got the fish curry too and it was amazing tho pretty spicy. However we didn't enjoy the Malindi Halwa dessert so much with it's jelly-like texture. Service is really top notch as they were always attentive.

It’s my first time trying Africa’s cuisine, and I’m pleasantly impressed with the food.

We ordered a variety of curry based dishes, with different level of spiciness - and we enjoyed all of them.

Highly recommended the Goat Curry, where in our opinion is the best one there.

Great ambience and fantastic customer service from the staff. Our waiter spent time to recommend us the dishes. The food is definitely on the pricier side and it felt that it might have been adjusted so much to suit the local palate that the food does not feel uniquely african. When the food tastes very similar to local dishes, it does not really justify the high price.
African cuisine in Jurong.opening_hours:

African cuisine in Jurong.name: Kafe Utu

African cuisine in Jurong.reviews:
The crab Pao fan here is good. Other recommended dishes are Ipoh Hor fun & their signature dish, red wine Por ribs.  The La Zi chicken was however a let down. I think the quality of the food has come down recently.

Ordered flower crab paofan ($38) and prawn paste chicken ($12). Good tasting broth for paofan and generous amount of chicken for chicken.

Some downside is the seafood ingredients are not fresh, prawn is so rubbery. Also very costly at $38. Good to try but don’t think I’ll be back soon as I think they’re many paofan that are cheaper with better ingredients in the food scene now.

Despite the good reviews, unfortunately, not for me. The Ginseng Chicken Claypot taste more of wine than ginseng. The Pork Ribs is total disaster, the waiter pour white spirit and lights up before serving. He doesn’t check if the fire burned off the spirit. Imagine you could taste the heavily liquor pork. Vegetables & Tou Fu are normal.
Service is below average.
Price is not cheap as the area is not consider a prime area.

Taste: 8/10 Chicken breast is slightly dry but otherwise the flavour is pretty alright. Mild ginseng taste. Love the variety of mushrooms in it!

Cost: $38 (3-4 pax)

Waiting time: 10 mins on Saturday 1230pm

Overall: Will come back to try the flower crab paofan

Tried the Ginseng Chicken Pao Fan. Love the combination of egg rice and broth. Portion was huge with lots of ingredients. Chicken was very well done and fall-off-the-bone tender. Would definitely come back again to try the other dishes.
African cuisine in Jurong.name: Paofan Paradise 泡饭天-T.K Kitchen

African cuisine in Jurong.reviews:
One of the few times you go to a restaurant and feel that the amount you paid for the service charge is worth it. The floor staff attend to you immediately and ensure the food served are hot. Unfortunately, there were some mishaps with the food served. When informed, it was immediately rectified and a new dish was served. I am very impressed with the service and the quality of food. Kudos.

Yummy food but I think they need more staff for the weekends. Hard to get their attention especially for water refill. Can’t blame them as there’s only two of them managing everything. Might want to consider self-service for the water though.

UPDATE:
Went back again and now they don’t even serve tap water but charge for bottled water at $6? Not sure if I will revisit.

We were there on a weekend for a late lunch. The place was very empty. We were ushered in quite quickly, but when we wanted to place an order, we waited quite a while to be able to get someone's attention.
3 out 4 items we wanted to order were not available, but we were not informed when we sat down, hence very disappointed. They also have a pasta menu that is not available for weekends too..
Food came quite fast, but the plates have very disgusting dirty and wet cotton string wrapped handles. I cannot imagine anyone's hand touching that and then touching the fries or wrap. Mocktail was a glass of diabetes, 15% to 20% syrup, coloring and milk. The orange cake was a miss too. It tasted like tapioca kueh.

We had a comfortable good time on a rainy Sunday evening, eve of PH, at Ela (Bukit Batok)! Our favourite dish was actually 'Keto' with Pulled Beef - the cauliflower rice was very well done with a generous portion of pulled beef! #mustry
We would like to do a special shout out to the one and only floor staff that night, Yani! She was like a wonderwoman, running the floor service alone, serving at least 5-6 tables of guests professionally - from bringing guests to tables, to taking orders, clearing tables, making drinks, serving the dishes etc.! Mad respect! Thank you for being so attentive and patient with your warm services! Will be back at the new outlet to try other items soon too! 🥳

It was so cozy and absolutely loved the vibes. The food was exceptional and the service was great.

The smell of the pita was sooo good and the pita on my lamb was soaked with flavor. Tho you may want to note that lamb generally has a strong smell/taste. My suggestion is to maybe elevate their dessert as the cake tasted like any ordinary lemon pound cake with an ice cream scoop on top. Wish there were smtg more special.
honestly would come here again.
African cuisine in Jurong.opening_hours:

African cuisine in Jurong.reviews:
It’s sad that the best tasting item was the wedges. Although the chicken was well cooked, the chili sauce, the spice level was ultimately disappointing. Not tasty, too salty, the ketchup sauce tastes so much better.

As much as I enjoy the staffs mingling and enjoying their work, but the chefs were talking a tad too loudly.

Yummy food, big portion. A variety of sauces like ketchup, garlic, herb and those with different level of spiciness.

Had the Tuesday deal which is Chicken Pita bread (buy 1 and get another for 50% discount) including 2 sides each. Added a pineapple ring for additional $1.

Recommends also the quarter chicken. Free flow water provided! However the water tasted weird so 1 star less.

my experience there was amazing. i love the food and how nice the people are over there. personally, although it is a little pricy, the wild herb sauce there made me love the food but the amazing service there made my experience even better. you should definitely go down and experience it for yourself!

One of the better Nandos outlet in Singapore. Service is fast and friendly despite it being a peak hour lunch. Food came hot and relatively fast. Get up to 25% off if you’re an NSF with 11B. Good atmosphere. Nandos, pls open up an outlet in the North!!

Nando’s is well known for their peri peri chicken, we had boneless thigh and chicken breast, they are both cooked very well and tender. Love the sides too. Quality of food is fantastic, just the quantity has reduced quite a lot. The restaurant is very beautifully decorated as you can see from the pictures. Service was also great. However we feel a bit warm in the restaurant, seems the aircon is not too strong. Got to order and pay for the food online before the order is placed. Cutlery and sauces and side plates are all self service at a corner counter. Will be great if they operate like a normal restaurant instead of having to order and pay online and take cutleries on our own.
