Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Still good value for money. Everything is self service but easily navigable.
Limited menu but yummy and fresh
Food was served colder than usual which used to be piping hot. A not fancy but good for a simple non fussy meal

Good food at good price. There is always a queue here during meal hours. Popular place for the young & elderly, even for people who ate not here to shop for furnitures. The all time favourites are the Swedish meatball, fried chicken wings. They offer special items from time to time like Mala crayfish, baked chicken with curry sauce, black pepper pork chop etc.

Great, tasty food for sharing at affordable prices, though it can get very crowded and queues can be long. Recommended to go during weekdays or non-peak dining hours to secure seats and have a less bustling environment.

Needless to say much more about this iconic eatery. Visited again after a long while to buy furniture and have lunch there. The chicken wings and meatball are still tasty like I rmb. Tried their salmon dishes which are decently priced given the ingredients inflation. Cheese cake is super smooth. Very value for money. Minus point is the crowds

Classic meatballs are delicious as usual. Pork ribs were also juicy and tender at affordable prices. However, they were clearly under staffed as each staff has to manage a food section on their own. They also looked frustrated and overworked, which led to them snapping at some customers. The ordering was also slightly confusing as peole could order differently but the price for some meals were not stated upfront.
Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.opening_hours:
Monday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Thursday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Friday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Saturday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Sunday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.name: IKEA Alexandra Restaurant

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Really enjoyed our brunch at this cozy restaurant. Highly recommended for those that are looking for brunch menus that are not generic (like your eggs benedict, pancakes, etc). Also their plating was on point and the ingredients were super fresh & well prepped. I will definitely come back again.

Small cosy joint that serves excellent Scandinavian food. Though menu is limited yet the curated specialities are made with such excellent culinary standards. Enjoyed the shrimp toast and fish stew so much, we practically wanted to wipe the utensils dry. Love the simplistic clean look of the place and inviting ambience. Will surely return to try the other things on the menu.

Cosy, relaxed little cafe serving Nordic style toast with some amazing toppings. Just the one vegetarian toast option which was the mushroom so tried that with the bean side salad. Both really fresh and tasty. Also had a delicious herbal tea. The staff were very friendly and took a lot of pride in the venue and food. My friend had the seafood stew which looked generous and she really enjoyed it. Worth a try

Delicious open faced sandwiches in a beautiful, unpretentious and welcoming space staffed with warm family vibes! The potatoes were great as well and the tomato with fennel seed soup is a winner. The level of detail in the tableware and decor is admirable too. 10/10 will come back!

This is a cool little spot for having simple but delicious Scandinavian food! I especially loved the bread that came with the fish stew. The meatballs, too, are certainly not your run-of-the-mill IKEA meatballs!

It would be nice, however, if there could be stricter rules against people bumming a 4-person table by themselves, with a laptop, during lunch hour, with nothing but a glass of water.
Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.name: OVERBRØD

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
It's a market that is quite busy and crowded for all 3 meals, due to the number of above average stalls there.  However there isn't good ventilation and it does become stuffy.

One of my top three hawker centers for the food and ambiance. Wide range of food options from leicha and caifan to Penang and SG-style laksa. Also parata options, chicken and duck rice, soba, and more. It’s also spread out so the breeze gets through. there’s ample seating at 11-1230pm on a Sunday. It’s well lit so you don’t feel like you’re eating in a dungeon. Extra points for being close to ikea

ABC BRICKWORKS, a heartland hawker center. Open all day - Chinese India Malay food. Have a reasonable good food to try. Today manage to try THE MEEPORK - the minced soba was great (see photo) and JASON PENANG - the char kway teow ( the light ) was excellent, Penang laksa was good too. There are still plenty to try on my next visit.

The claypot chicken rice ( Yuan Yuan ) was so satisfying ! Rice was soft, drizzled with black sauce brought to mix round with all the ingredients. Chinese sausage not hard, chicken tender and not overly dry, and bits of salted fish just nice for the portion and not an overkill. Veg can be a little bit more but it’s not a deal breaker :) love it when it is served piping hot and warm all the way to the end digging the burnt rice crusts out from the sides of the pot. Maybe I don’t eat claypot rice for a long time so the experience may sound a bit exaggerated.   The or jian ( oyster omelette) just a few doors away on same row was nice and crispy that put a smile to my face when I crunched the omelette bits in my mouth combined with the oysters oozing. Oysters were of good size - not too big. It too small.  Ended with iced Ching Tng  with generous ingredients! Impressed ! Uncle has a cheerful demeanour too ;) .

A place with good and tasty food from Chinese, Malay and Indian hawkers.
Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.opening_hours:

Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.name: ABC Brickworks Market & Food Centre

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Value for money chicken chop set meal at a promotional price of $7.80. The smoky, tender and juicy chicken was great on its own even without the gravy (though it would have been nice if the sauce was slightly saltier). Fries was crisp and piping hot, while the tanginess of the coleslaw was perfect.

My only gripe was there was too many tendons in the chicken chop, disrupting the overall eating experience. It would also be good if customers are given the flexibility to select their own side dishes, instead of sticking to the usual fries and coleslaw.

I ordered a sirloin steak, medium rare.

The cut was a bit dry and less seasoned to my liking.

I have yet to try the rest of the dishes. I hope my dining experience can be better refined the next round.

For the price of $13.50, there was definitely some expectations plus i actually tried since I seen xiaxue raving about it. I reached around 6pm and there was only 1 staff. He was busy frying stuff for the western food options and took my order for noodles while informing that I had to wait for a while. I was damn annoyed when he took my order as he kept frowning. The best part is he frowned again when I requested for no meatball and guess what? Check the photo 😂 he was the same guy who made my noodles but I think he may not be supposed to be the one, maybe he just took over cos his colleague was not there... Anyway, scallop is not fresh, fishball is standard factory made type, soup is a weird diluted msg taste, soft shell crab was hot but batter is very thick, and noodle texture is poor. I would say if you really like bak chor mee (No. 25), go to next block 161 stall during day time the young couple makes amazing bcm you won't regret.

Went over on Saturday night, no queue. Had Aglio Olio Meepok with grilled chicken and Carbonara with grilled chicken. First mouthful Aglio was better but the Carbonara grew on me. Aglio Olio looks like Indomie but doesnt taste like it. Chicken was tender but like that lor. The star for the hubby was the Mashed Potato, apparently inspired by Joel Robuchon? Place also sells mee pok hahaha

Wow. Honestly did not expect finding this gem in this coffee shop. Best combo is to get the crab tobiko pasta and add on the chicken chop. If you’re going with friends, get the seaweed fries to share. I didn’t like the mentaiko fries as much cos I felt there was more mayonnaise than usual, but my companions liked it. Truffle mushroom soup was not as viscous as I would like it but overall still tasted better than most mushroom soups out there. Overall a really good place to try! Will definitely be back
Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM
Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.address: 165 Bukit Merah Central, Man Lin F&B Coffeeshop, Singapore 150165
Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.name: JOFA GRILL

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Interesting food court with unique food stalls. The chairs are special and hippy, with a touch of heritage. Nice hangout place if you wanna have yakinuku and beer at night. In the day, wanton mee and liver bak chor mee are good choices.

Rong Fa Bak Chor mee: If you love pork liver, or just lots of ingredients in yummy soup accompanied by al dente noodles, this is the place! The liver served is in HUGE chunks, and lightly blanched, so it is tender and melts in your mouth. So much ingredients in the soup too... 2 meatballs, 1 fishball, fishcake slices, sliced taupok, chunks of minced meat... The noodles are well-cooked and seasoned too. If you order the double balls soup, you get a range of fish balls and meatballs with fillings.

Only downside is the wait. We went at about 1.30 and waited for about half hour. Fortunately, it was worth the wait and we were not in a rush.

Worth the price we paid, which was a total of $13.

Tasted the wanton mee and minced pork noodles, waiting time for for mee pok was 45 min for a non busy day. Wanton mee char siew is nice!

Bunch of variety of food stalls hiding inside this industrial canteen slash beer garden. There is thai, vietnamese, western, bachormee, japanese don, chicken rice. Quite varied options to try, however location is a bit obscure. Food was generally good and tasted above averahe for it's price point.

Nice place for beer. They have draft and bottles beer. Only 4 stalls are open on weekday nights.
Tried the thai food. Ordered the egg, fried rice and noodles. All was good except fried rice was salty.
Western food was nice , tasty and priced reasonable.

Excellent selection of affordable beer on tap served in chilled glasses. Only $8.80-10 a pint. Happy Hour from as early as 7.30am (yes, morning!) till closing, every day. Even credit card payment was available.

Food stalls seem to have a rather high turnover rate. Currently, there are stalls selling Thai, Japanese, Vietnamese, Ipoh cuisine, Grilled lamb, Western and Bak Chor Mee. However, there is nothing much left to eat after 8pm except for mookata.
Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.opening_hours:

Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.name: Maddox Canteen Bar

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Kaya butter toast is a huge let down at the "star coffee" stall. You a big slap of NOT butter, but margarine! Coffee is not your usual kind of coffee but more to western taste so some might like it.

It's overpriced at 4.30 for a set (because no butter), but maybe because of the coffee.

Came here for lunch during weekday on several consecutive days. They have a good variety of rice, noodles, vegetarian food available. Tried their vegetarian store, chicken rice store and Yong Tau foo store. Prices are affordable and food tasty. Can get quite crowded during lunchtime due to nearby office crowd. Please continue the great work. 🙏

1) 2 fried kway teow stalls, both equally good.
2) The cheong fun stall has vegetable fillings or 3 other fillings (e.g. char siew). Good.
3) The dessert stalls has a variety of hot / cold desserts. The bubor cha cha & chendol are highly recommended. 👍
4) The chinese pancakes stall has the usual peanut filling, red bean, coconut & peanut jelly ones.
Usually sold out by 2 pm.

Nice Food  Center with numerous stalls at affordable price. A bit warm.

02-26 Yong-tau-foo stall (see pic). Lady seller is super friendly and serve with a smile. Very Hygiene way of keeping the yong-tau-foo items in enclosed cabinet for selection! Price is super good in the midst of today's high food inflation (display on stall signboard). Variety of items good enough for most patrons. Laksa & Tom Yam soup is good. If you are in the area, do support her for the low pricing to sell more quantity to sustain her operations. Closed on Sundays.
Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.opening_hours:
Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.name: Bukit Merah Central Food Centre

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Char Sew is quite thick & quite a lot. Though roasted pork is not that much. Roasted pork skin is crispy and not too salty. Rice portion is quite satisfying. Black sauce is quite tasty without meaty smell. Chili sauce is slight salty. $5 for char Siew & roasted pork rice is ok value to $$.
Taste ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
$$ to portion ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Service ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

A favourite place for my Dad as he would come to ABC market to only eat this Roasted Pork Char Siew Rice.

I really like the burnt caramelised ends of the char siew strip. Especially when it is hot. The marinade is savoury and fragrant. If you like fattier cuts, I recommended to request for "fatty char siew (肥叉烧)" The thick and warm gravy rehydrates the grainy white rice and coats, each spoonful with meaty goodness.

Like all chefs who place their heart into their cooking, emotions play a huge part in our daily life. A few times, the quality of the portion and cuts are not very consistent when the staff are in a bad mood 🫣 The lean meat portions are slightly tough at times, and the marinade is not very infused. But those are like.. 15% of the chances out of all the times ordered.

If you need to find a plate of good char siew rice to satisfy your craving, this is the place to be. The lightly charred surface with the tender meat is much desired. Even the rice quality is good, which I think is very important as it compliments the char siew with every bite I take. Do try.

They have one of the best char siew around. The food is generally very good and I like their sausage.

The secret is also in their unique sauce.

Would have given a 5 star but my current visit when ordering a plate of rice with 3 meat cost close to SGD10. I have ordered such combi before and it was never this expensive.

It’s been quite a few years since I last had the wanton mee here and was glad to have it for lunch today as I was in the area. At $4 a plate, it’s very reasonably priced given the portion size. The charsiew is as good as I remember it to be and the noodles were also of a really next texture
Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:30 AM – 8:30 PM
Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 8:30 PM
Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 8:30 PM
Thursday: Closed
Friday: 11:30 AM – 8:30 PM
Saturday: 11:30 AM – 8:30 PM
Sunday: Closed
Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.name: Fatty Cheong

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Large range of food available here. Spacious with generally clean tables and chairs.

Some recommendations:
1. Love Lian Kee minced meat noodles (soup and dry!).
2. There is a popular Chinese stall selling dumplings and noodles - always snaking queues.
3. Chinatown beef noodles (soup and dry)
4. Soy sauce chicken
5. Balonglong juice and avocado shake
6. Prawn mee
7. Muffins

There has been a general revamp and change in stalls. But overall, still a good place to find affordable and tasty food.

There are lots of great hawker stalls here, including dumplings, prawn noodles, claypot laksa, roasted pork rice, muffins, the iconic Mr Avocado, among many more! Always spoilt for choice when I come here. It gets crowded and bloody hot during lunch hour, though.

Very good food court...great choice and great taste with all dishes Asia can offer, at reasonable prices...go where the locals would go

Patronized this 古早味Big Prawn Noodle Stall in Alexandra Village Food Centre. It was 3pm, hence no crowd in the Hawker Centre.
I was second in queue. Ordered a Pig’s Tail Prawn Noodle and another Pork Ribs Prawn Noodle. Our orders were served within 5 minutes, self collect.
I was a little disappointed when the orders were collected - the two bowls of Prawn Noodles did not appear like those in their photo displays.

In the Pork Rib Prawn Noodle, the prawn were pretty small - 4 halves small prawns deshelled without prawn heads but with the tails attached. Two pieces of pork bone chunks instead of pork ribs and four slices of lean pork. One miserable strand of vegetable.

For the Pig’s Tail Prawn Noodle, the prawn serving, lean pork and vegetable servings were similar. There were 4 pieces of pig’s tail.

However, we must say the prawn soup was really good. The pork bone chunks were well seasoned and texture were nice. The lean pork slices were quite tender. And oh…the pig’s tails were really soft and the skin and meat slide off the bones easily.

Besides “feeling deceived” by the photo displays and the small sizes of prawn, the servings were reasonably sized and the meals tasted good overall. $6 for each bowl of noodle was reasonable.

Relatively cheap place to eat with lots of options. Went here around 10am and it wasn't crowded. The place is clean and food was served quickly.
Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.opening_hours:
Monday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM

Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Sunday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.name: Alexandra Village Food Centre

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Many good food options like mutton soup, fried carrot cake, duck rice, wanton noodles and Nana curry. The hawker centre us a little run down and could definitely do with some upgrades. It is also not easy to find parking especially during peak hours and weekends

Great old school hawker centre. Enjoyed the NaNa Curry. Spicy but tasted good. Hokkien mee was also tasty with bits of fried pork crackers on top and mixed with into the noodles. It was hot in the afternoon but will go there again.

Now this is the real deal. With a plethora of options, I stumbled upon fantastic selections at incredibly reasonable prices. Situated in a bustling location, it exudes a wealth of character that makes the visit absolutely worthwhile.

This hawker center (recently renovated in Nov 2022) caters mostly to the breakfast and lunch crowd and come dinner time, many stalls are closed or their food sold out by 7.30pm+.

One notable and nondescript exception is the Vietnamese Cooked Food stall located at the corner of the hawker center (next to the Modern Old School coffee stall) and facing the carpark.

This is a one-lady operation helmed by a hardworking Vietnamese lady, Ann who speaks Mandarin, English and some dialects. For carbo eaters, check out the Ribs with Rice (Com Suon) (generous rice portion!) and Bahn Mi (bread). They are both delectable and very filling even for those who feel Vietnamese food are light. Many customers, especially the ladies, are seen ordering the Pho with Beef and Noodle Soup.

The stall operates from 10.30am-10pm. Something to consider if you are coming here for a late dinner, or wish to skip the lunchtime crowd at the other popular stalls. At 9pm+, most stalls, except the drinks stalls,  at the hawker center would be closed. Paynow and Paylah are available.

A Huge hawker center with many stalls some a few with Michelin Bib.  Nice airy and clean environment with ample parking around the hawker.

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Hidden Gem Unearthed - Redhill Food Centre Singapore! 🍲✨

Amidst the bustling city, I stumbled upon a culinary oasis at Redhill Food Centre. This unassuming hawker centre revealed a hidden gem - a delightful $1.5 chicken rice with a mouthwatering taste of soup. The flavors danced on my palate, leaving me pleasantly surprised by the incredible value and authentic taste.

Redhill Food Centre is a treasure trove of local delights, where passionate hawkers craft affordable and delicious dishes that satisfy both the stomach and the soul. A true haven for foodies seeking a taste of Singapore's gastronomic delights without breaking the bank.

•Bak Kee Satay BeeHun

I recently had the pleasure of trying "Bak Kee Satay BeeHun", and I must say, it left me thoroughly satisfied. The star of the dish was undoubtedly the satay sauce, which perfectly complemented the noodles. The rich and creamy satay sauce had just the right balance of sweetness and spiciness, creating a harmonious flavor explosion, which I find it very creative.

The noodles, accompanied by tender squid, succulent pork liver, and thinly sliced pork meat, were a delightful addition. The variety of textures and flavors added depth to each bite, making it a truly memorable experience.

One word of advice to fellow food enthusiasts: devour this dish quickly! The noodles have a tendency to soak up the flavors, and while that might sound tempting, it's best enjoyed when the noodles are still slightly firm.

•Fried Oyster

Out of so many dishes the stall offered, I would recommend their Fried Oyster, non-greasy, and the oyster was just cooked right. Not too raw or not too cooked.

Char Kuey Teow was just so.. so only in my opinion, and nothing to shout for.

Little do you know:
The difference between fried carrot cake black or white are not only the colour of the sauce itself, but also the taste. To all tourist, remember to choose the white instead as that's what local Singaporean will choose. If you are curious with the black sauce, it tends to be sweeter if you like it.

One of my go to Hawker for breakfast, lunch probably not recommended for dinner.
Prata, duck noodles, Chee Cheong Fun, Nasi Briayani, chicken rice, curry rice, bread and toast, soya beans, soft boiled eggs. What you name it, will definitely full-fill your 90% of your choice.
Prices might not be as economical as you thoughts, but it won’t be rocket high. Saturday & Sunday are packed, avoid peak hours.
Enjoy!

Good variety of food stalls here. Been here thrice but so far all the stalls I have tried are good. Only tried the pancake this time which I personally like for the crunchiness as well as softness and non-dryness (if this is the right way to describe it).
Would update next time upon visiting

Here to mention that this dessert stall’s chendol is weird. Taste more like ice kacang. Forgot to snap photo of my tau suan, but they are good 👍 at tau suan.

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Been here twice. Unexpected find in an industrial building.

Coffee is good! Not the acidic kind. The mocha seems stronger than the white coffee even though it's the same type of beans.

Very cool vibes and comfortable seating area available. Conducive place for working! They don't play loud music either.

Will try their pastries next time!

Parking is within the building, though the lots are strangely laid out.

Easily accessible by car, parking places available downstairs.

Pastries selection limited when we were there. ( left with one choice)

Truffle brie mushroom pastry was not bad. Mocha was not bad. Comfy seats. Nice vibes. Water served by friendly staff.

A hidden gem in an industrial building. Love the decor and ambiance. Great place to chill out over great coffee. Love the coffee so much that we purchased some beans to enjoy at home.

A proper coffee haven in an area you least expect it. But once you enter the cafe, you know it takes its coffee seriously with all the pro gear, experienced barista and beans/gear available on retail as well. The menu offerings are all about the coffee with some pastries to snack on. Quality stuff all round in a nice, gothic-themed atmosphere.

Coffee - 3 stars, ambience and aircond 5 stars. Lovely cosy cafe at an industrial place. A little disappointing as coffee was quite milky. The iced one seems strong than the hot one. Maybe I will stick to iced next time but since the environment is quite comfortable, I will probably be back whenever I’m in that area.

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Ordered apple crumble with a huge scoop of ice cream. Delicious, could be a little more seasoned. Fisherman pasta was filled with plenty seafood. Prawns were especially fresh. Pasta was Al dente. Sauce was delicious although a little salty. Great service and environment (indoors)

Service can be warmer. It really doesn’t cost much to wear a smile when introducing your patrons to their table. Had a steak with warm potato salad, received almost well done instead of medium rare.  We asked for more water once, and it didn’t come. Water comes with a small charge. Our group was seated upstairs, and one of us had to make our way down every time if we wanted to ask the service staff for assistance.

It’s been a while since my last visit to Fika. Was rather disappointed by the quality of the food and service rendered this time round.

I recalled the server used to take order but now we have to self-order at the counter.  As we were seated at the second level, it was rather a hassle to go up and down a few time just to order and ask for water. If they want to have self-service ordering, at least allow customers to scan and order via QR code.

The meatball was rather dry and the grilled chicken was slightly salty too. We requested for candles and they did not offer too. Could feel a huge difference in the overall experience this visit, and would likely not return again.

Never fell in love this easy with food before and yes i said it. I love how tasty the meatballs are and the beef stew are made with almost perfection. Definitely come again next time to try some new dishes next time.

Although the food was alright, the seat I was at was vibrating throughout the whole meal and it was really annoying. We later realised that we were seated directly above a ceiling fan installed on level 1 which is likely the cause of the vibration. Our table was next to a window and I found it rather glaring but was sternly told by one of the servers that the curtains must be kept open. While I respect that the restaurant might have a good reason for such a rule, the message could have been more politely communicated.

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
The servings of the pork is huge and rather generous.  However, the taste of the noodles were a bit hard and at parts clamped together.  Would have recommended if not for the long wait (30min on a Friday lunch)

I'm on a ketogenic diet. Happened to see that there are many google reviews on this shop selling pork liver (without noodles), dry style.

The pork liver is cooked to perfection - Tender and bloodless. Not flaky like some of those served elsewhere. There's also some minced meat inside. I requested more pork lard. The chilli and vinegar mix was done properly.

Service was great. I was told to sit and the food was served to me.

Would definitely be back again!

Wow! If you love pork liver, or just lots of ingredients in yummy soup accompanied by al dente noodles, this is the place! The liver served is in HUGE chunks, and lightly blanched, so it is tender and melts in your mouth. So much ingredients in the soup too... 2 meatballs, 1 fishball, fishcake slices, sliced taupok, chunks of minced meat... The noodles are well-cooked and seasoned too. If you order the double balls soup, you get a range of fish balls and meatballs with fillings.

Only downside is the wait. We went at about 1.30 and waited for about half hour. Fortunately, it was worth the wait and we were not in a rush.

Worth the price we paid, which was a total of $13.

Price : $$
Taste : 8/10
Value for money : 9/10

# Specializes in the freshness of pork.

If you are a BCM lover , you will find that the liver is fresh with no powdery texture.

Each slice varies about  0.5 cm thick and its tender when u bite it across.

Noodles were normal and the sauce were good.

Soup needless to say , plenty of ingredients and the freshness of mince pork and slices.

Worth the make the trip and their customer service is good. 👍

There’s so much good reviews about the BCM of this stall so have to try it out myself.
Came on a Sat morning and be warned of the long waiting time, 30-45 min is a norm.
The highlight of the BCM is the thick and chunky pork liver, you may req for the liver to be cooked medium well else it may turn out to be slightly bloody.
There’s option to add side dishes which is assortment of fried tofu, fish cake & etc.

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Marko has been extremely patient and knowledgeable to walk us through the different furniture and ensuring that we pick the best suitable piece for our home. Thanks again!

The products speak for themselves. Sure you can import them yourself but you have to deal with customs, taxes, shipping and provenance. Marko is very upfront with what he does and the products he sells. He is approachable and not pushy. It is telling when in the two times that I’ve visited, you see customers who he greets by name: and I doubt these people would return if they didn’t have a good experience. I highly recommend Noden if you’re looking for quality furniture that will elevate your living space.

We had a wonderful experience at Noden. Noden's furniture collection consists of specially selected & curated vintage Danish furniture.

We enjoyed our time interacting with Marko. Marko is very knowledgeable and passionate about sharing his collection with us.

We will absolutely recommend Noden to those interested in Designer's/Vintage Danish furniture!

Absolutely thrilled with my experience at Noden! Marko was incredibly knowledgeable and helpful in guiding us with our furnishing needs. We found the perfect pieces for our living space. Will definitely be returning for more.

Absolute pleasure and amazing experience shopping at Noden. Marco is very knowledgeable and passionate to share about Danish furniture. He readily share his knowledge even way after the closing time as we visited the store closer to the closing time. Left the store feeling very inspired and eager to come back to the store to find more gems!

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Went on a Saturday afternoon and surprisingly there were seats. Ordered our food and it took half an hour for our food to arrive. The mentai aka ebi capellini was ok, would be better if the pasta was al dente. The salmon avocado toast was disappointing. It was not stated in the menu that the salmon steak is not fully cooked. Due to personal reasons I was not able to eat raw food. After 5-10 mins, they brought it back and said the salmon steak is actually meant to be “sashimi style” as quoted by the staff. But they cooked it further as per my request, which I was thankful. However, to my dismay, it was still raw. The photo uploaded is AFTER they brought it back out. Luckily I ordered another chicken katsu curry don while they were preparing my salmon steak further as it really came back still raw. But the chicken katsu was so tough and dry. So disappointing. The curry was tasty though. After such a slow and disappointing lunch, we decided to go elsewhere for dessert. In total, for the 3 dishes, the bill came up to $70+.

This is a nice Japanese themed cafe in Tanjong Pagar. We came here after a badminton session, and it was a nice place to cool down.

Casual place for a conversation or to catch up on work with comfortable seating. Service is ok, but quick.

We ordered the following -

1) Kombu Truffle Fries - Fries sprinkled with kombu (seaweed) and cooked in truffle oil. Liked how crunchy and well spread out the flavours were.

2) Pork katsu sando - Liked this sando, crunchy and well toasted. Pork flavours were good and the pork was soft and not too chewy. Good dip of curry leaf mayo to go with it.

3) Beef fat short ribs sando - Another sando with crispy toast. This one was a bit heavier compared to the pork katsu, but likeable. Comes with sliced tomatoes.

Cosy cafe with minimalist interiors. Food are mainly inspired by or fused with Japanese food. What I really appreciate here is the warm and friendly service. Coffee here is nice too, not the acidic kind, which I like.

We were given a room for our dine-in as we had 7 people.

Service, ambience and vibe were solid. Appreciated the check ins from the owner, ensuring everything was good. We ordered 2 servings of truffle fries to share. Recommended to get that to share!

As for mains, all the dishes that we tried (shown in the images) were really yummy.. although i had a bit of difficulties finishing my curry don because the portion was slightly big. But my guy friend finished his, so i guess it varies from individual to individual!

We also got the grape ricotta toast as dessert, i liked it! Something new and unique in taste :) Also appreciated the owner prepping cakes for a birthday celebration, despite sharing that there weren’t available cakes ready then!

Will i come back again- defo! 😊😊

Great Chicken Curry Rice for a good price with a bottle of free water. Loved that the (kind) waiter was also the cook. Will definitely eat here again if I'm in Singapore

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Came here around 10pm.. almost sold out. No more fish balls. Noodles well cooked. Dry version is good, with their chillis sauce, old school type. Meat ball is good too, although it is factory make. $3.50 is very affordable.

VFM meals at $3.50/$4 for all dishes except for satay bee Hoon $4/$4.50. Laksa is good too.

Nice bowl of fishball bcm.  Noodle mix is nice and soup is delicious.  Meatball forgettable as taste like supermarket type.  Fishball and fish cake is ok.  One of the better bcm around.  Enjoy the noodle much.  Friendly owner and affordable price of $3.50 only.

Mee pok dry was too dry, the noodles lacked fragrance and disjointed with the ingredients in the same bowl. Meatballs tasted like those from supermarkets. Fishballs were soft and the soup was pretty tasty. Overall, not too bad for $3.50. Seller was polite and e-payment was available.

Friendly uncle and auntie. Bfast and lunch. Closed from 18-Jan to 2-Feb-23. Reopen 3-Feb. Closed on Wed and Thu. Personal favourites: tasty Mushroom Minced Pork noodle meepok 4$ in picture, Fuzhou fishball noodle. Guo Tiao option available.

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
I am a soupy wanton Mee person. And this hits all the right spots. Al dente noodles and tasty soup. Char Siew is generally lean, wantons are juicy. I like mine with added shredded chicken - their shredded chicken is not the dry breast slices so again, really juicy and tender!

Stall is run by 2 elderly aunties and an elderly uncle. They are really nice people!

Everytime I come, I think I must try the laksa, but I still have not managed to do it. I could eat this everyday. (For info my portion isn't 3.50 as I added chicken. Pls don't expect this from auntie.)

Super full sia, nearly can't finish my food! I kei kiang (Act smart) go and order a large portion of wanton mee at Swee Kee Wanton Noodles in ABC Brickworks Food Centre. Good and affordable!

I dug into their wanton noodle, and I love the traditional type of wanton noodle and char siew the best! The noodles were springy, and the wantons were stuffed with flavor.

Their wanton soup was especially sweet and savory and I wanted to ask for one more bowl, but paiseh to ask lah.

Came by during lunch hour, there was a short queue but got my Laksa bowl pretty quick. Ordered my Laksa with yellow noodles with cockles and chilli. The bowl also came with fish cakes and toufu puffs. The Laksa broth is not as oily as you might find from other stalls, it is flavourful and it tasted a little on the sweet side. I like the texture of the noodles, toufu puffs are well cooked and they gave a good servings of cockles.

A good and traditional wanton noodle store manned by an old couple.

Braised chicken feet can be added as a side to your wanton noodles at additional cost. The braised chicken feet is flavourful, soft and tender. Highly recommended as an add-on!

A decent plate of noodles $3.50. not much more u can ask for. Friendly auntie duo at the helm.

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Still our favourite place for a leisurely meal. The fried chicken wings have regained their former taste and standard. Weekday crowd is not too bad. Come before 11am and you should be able to get a seat of your choice. The sundaes are still selling at 50 cents per serving.

Convenient here instead of the long queue at lvl 3 upstairs. The self service kiosks doesn’t seem to function though, the staff is slightly rude serve the hotdog bun upside down while I pop open the box  But the hotdog bun and mango ice cream is good.

Love that they have the full menu up so it's easy to see instead of those flashing menu that keeps changing.
There's 3 self order kiosks but only one was working.
No crowd on a weekday late afternoon. We went once on a weekend and it was really crowded.
Kudos to the staff for their speedy service! I remembered being impressed by how fast the queue moves even with the crowd. And today only one staff was serving and she's faster than McDonald's fast food service!
Good that they serve different types of food from the one at level three so that there's more variety. Delicious food at affordable prices! Ice cream is a must have! Get the twist!

Ordered a gourmet hot dog with nacho cheese, tastes much better than the hot dog from Level 3.
The self-order kiosks were not working and some dishes were not available as well.

Excellent concept IKEA Tampines should have rolled out years ago. This snack bar has some menu items not present in the upstairs outlets. Quality control has to be improved however; food is haphazardly cooked and packed.

Gourmet hotdog with nacho cheese isn’t properly laid out and centred in the bun — although it tastes better than the usual IKEA hotdog.

Fries are borderline edible: most are soggy with occasional hard (and not crispy) bits — evident lack of oil temperature control.

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Famous SG vegetarian ready fry noodles. Queuing mandatory so avoid weekends/1-15. Non greasy fried and fresh daily. One of best tasting dry / wet style hence queue. Many regular followers, greens include cabbage / french beans. Also sells spring rolls, mini potato puffs & ‘goose’ cracker toppings. Friendly folks with new hires (ah ma sometimes here) & chain store Vista & Pagar. Special mention here as their Hor fun & Mee hoon great wok hei here On weekends there is curry too, but queue longer too

For $5, its a hearty meal with a lot of ingredients ☺️ A solid value breakfast; pretty good although the bee hoon noodles are a little bland but mixing it the green chili definitely makes it tangy and more flavorful! Definitely kid-friendly too! 😆

I would revisit and eat it when it’s convenient but wont queue up / wait for a long time for this!

Read a lot of positive review about this stall hence tried it on a Saturday mid morning.

The queue was acceptable and moving quite fast. This stall has an interesting concept where there's 2 queue - one is to order and after that, you will have to join the other queue to collect your food.  For 1st timer like me, it does get a bit confusing and luckily it was pointed out to me by another customer.

Ordered 2 plates of bee hoon with all the ingredients mixed together. The portion given is rather generous and reasonably priced at S$4.00 per plate. This by far one of the store that I feel gives the best bang for bucks in terms of quantity.

In terms of taste, I would say its slightly above average. The white bee hoon has relatively nice flavour, char siew is soft and the zai er (fried bean curd skin) is crispy. But I find the rest of the bean curd items doesn't have that much of a flavour and overall all the items are rather oily.

In my opinion, this is a store that serves a very decent plate of vegetarian bee hoon at a reasonable price.

I have been trying this branch located in a coffeeshop next to the Redhill Food Center. Usually spotted with a long queue, the price for a plate of vegetarian noodle has risen to S$4.00. However, the  ingredients are fresh and noodle is tasty. Worth a try!

Ordered Kway Teow with bee hoon. $3.50 per pack.
Queue: 15-20 mins
Taste: Full of flavour (salty and peppery) but quite oily (grease coated my lips), bee hoon is tasteless, kway teow not much taste
Portion: Typical portion for lunch.
Price: not worth $3.50, there are better ones that cost lesser.

Scandinavian food in Bukit Merah.reviews:
Desmond and May have curated an excellent and expansive collection of mid century modern treasures. There are many pieces of intruige throughout the store, and I typically find new pieces everytime I go. Walking into the store is like entering a museum of Scandinavian and Danish furniture design. It's an excellent source for well-made and thoughtfully selected vintage pieces. I almost have to stop myself from visiting too often as I always find something to fall in love with when in the store.

They are highly knowledgeable in not only the provenance their select pieces, but also the design history. I will most certainly be back to add to my ever-growing collection, and highly recommend for you to pay a visit to Copan too.

It is always a welcoming experience visiting the showroom, Desmond and May are friendly and patient in sharing with us about the products and how to care for it. We are now happy owners of a beautiful Danish dining table and sideboard :)

May was knowledgeable and also extremely accommodative and patient in answering my queries. Their showroom have a wide range of rare vintage pieces at competitive price range compared to similar players within the vintage furniture business. Will definitely deal with Copan again in the future. Keep up the good work guys.

May was very helpful from the moment I asked questions, she also gave me enough privacy to explore all the beautiful furnitures by myself and when I stumbled upon something that speaks to me, she kindly shared the story of where it came from and how they got the piece all the way to Singapore. They also did some touch up to fix up the piece and sent me pictures and even opened up the store early (as I had a plane to catch) for me to view it before they arranged the delivery to my apartment.

Overall the experience is great and I am saving up for the next piece for my home.

Bought an exquisite looking glass cabinet and am very happy with how it sits beautifully in my residence. Desmond was very cordial and helpful with the information and knowledge he had to offer  generously about the products.

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
Absolutely disappointing. Pathetic amount of filling. This peanut pancake is extremely dry and the dough is honestly just bad and too thick to the point that I felt like I was just eating dough with bits and pieces of peanut. It's a far cry from what was advertised and a huge drop in quality from when it first opened. Definitely not patronising this place ever again.

Quite a unique experience and twist of the traditional mee chiam kuey. Ordered 3x mini munchies set which allowed 2 flavours each set.

Personal favourites are the Biscoff, Earl Grey and Black Sesame.

Belgian chocolate itself is nice and rich but doesn't go well with the pancake.
Cream cheese filling is very generous as well.
Thai milk tea was a little bit sweet for my liking.

3.5 stars. Prefer the traditional ‘mee chiam queh’. During peak period, prepare to wait 30,60min for next batch of orders. The crust is fluffy and we prefer coconut over chocolate.

can try but i think wont keep craving. maybe once in awhile if i happen to be here will get it… the thai milk tea munchi was so cold like from the fridge 🥺 i don’t know if it was supposed to be like that but i ate only the skin in the end 🥲

Have always loved the items on their menu. Very generous fillings & the guy at the cashier, Jvan was friendly too! Will travel from west to the north for this!😀

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
A family friendly place for parent to kids along. Bring my teenage boys to play pool and darts. Affordable and super yummy western food and finger food for the kids!! Highly recommend! We had lots of fun, and my boys want to go again another day!

Give it a try during birthday . The environment spacious and staff are friendly.
The chicken cutlet are juicy and crispy,portion is big, the grilled fish pasta and chicken satay is nice too !
But mochi ice cream was not suit my taste bud.
Overall is highly recommend

Sadly the place has closed down. Visited this gem multiple times in 6 months. Love the place, food, drinks and friendly waiter/waitress. If the owners have intention to open up another one in the area, please do update. Thank you for operating for the past 5 years.

Edit: been to the new place and its pretty much similar, some food taken of the menu and some added in. All good, I am happy now. Haha

Overall food and service was not bad. Just wished that the food could be served faster...

Surged the web for a Fusion Restaurant to take the family for dinner earlier and the search came up with this place. The Internet is always so full of surprises and this one was a pleasant one. The waitresses were really nice and knew their menu very well. A few recommendations and we were digging into a very palatable and sumptuous meal! I’m Glad I found this place. It’s another great go to place for the family.

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
Very good bowl of laksa with thick and fragrant gravy soup . You will ask for more after one bowl😄 Wish to have more gravy soup .
Don’t seem to Har much more cockles even though I added extra cockles for my order😅

1st time trying. Its very value wise for a bowl of laksa. However, perhaps long queue and they cook very fast, the noodles were not throughly well cooked. Laksa broth wise was okay but not too thick and lemak. about 10 to 15 ppl in the queue but was moving very fast. Perhaps dabao would be better than eating here.

Flavourful laksa, filled with many curry leafs. Always to go place for a bowl of heart filling warming bowl of noodle. Takeaway this time, 4 star given due to less gravy compared to dining at the shop itself. Gravy filled only to half.

Amazing laksa with soupy flavourful broth. Noodles are al dente with nice mouthfeel. Lots of ingredients with self service for laksa leaves and chili.

Good value. Less than $4 for delicious laksa. Gravy is not those thick coconut flavour. Long queue 30min+ but serving is fast.
Limited seating space. Take note mscp car park only 1.8m height limit.

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
海南仔 in the Chong Pang Hawker food center cooks and sells fried carrot cake, fried Chao Kuay Tiao (fried noodles), Fried Oysters and many common local food. We understand the humidity, the heat in Singapore and the hawkers needing to stand for a really long time (if the business is good). However, my recent experience with the service staff was bad tempered and unable to convey what further information he needs to take my order. The food was mediocre. People only queue for this stall because the good stall (selling the same thing) was closed.

Pretty average. But the serving size though. At $4.50 the hokkien Mee is really one of the larger serving size I have encountered. This is the thick bee hon variety which I don't prefer. Should have asked more chili for the taste.

Edit (Jan 2023): doing my dd to review their fkt. Small plate cost only $4.

It was better than their hokkien Mee. Generally more savory (salty) [my preference] than sweet, Chinese sausage is a contribution to that as well. Cockles was very small and few in between.

Noodles is just slightly on the softer side for me but i am sure many will find it enjoyable.

Added: White carrot cake $3

The bigger chunk variety, it is pretty average. Chill has a kick and the preserve radishes add a more savory profile to carrot cake. Otherwise if u like scramble egg this might be up your alley. The egg isn't crispy at all but large chunk of scramble egg so is like 50% scramble egg 50% average carrot cake

Not sure how this place was even awarded the Michelin bib gourmand award because the food tasted pretty ordinary. Ordered 4 dishes from the stall and NONE stood out at all. In fact there was no queue at all for it in that forever bustling Chong Pang Market. Ironically, it was a stall selling similar stuffs just diagonally behind it that had a queue of over 20 persons.

We saw a long queue for this stall. I can say it is very popular and many locals really like their cooking. We ordered the white carrot cake and it was pretty good. The chilli goes very well with it and the egg was perfectly fried. So nice. We like the fact that we can ask them to put more onion chives on top 'coz it adds more flavour to it.

Despite the long queue, it moves fast and they also cook and serve the food very quick. The uncle is also very nice and cheerful.

Char kway teow not bad, the wet kind. Feels abit like mee goreng in fact only sweet sauce instead of tomato sauce...
Quite big cockles and not stingy with the numbers.

Carrot cake ok only, maybe should try the other stall next time

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
Ordered from the S  Bistari Famous at Yishun....definitely a  let down. Fried kway teow seafood, missing the seafood? Unless you are desparate to eat else stay away as there are lots of eateries around the area.

And the 101 Rojak....sigh....

Bought a $5 rojak to go as Nine Five Rojak was not open. Ate at home after a 10min walk. The rojak was mediocre - sauce was watery and not flavourful at all (no lime zest or rojak flower or anything like that, although anyway they wouldn’t have been able to lift the prawn paste sauce which just didnt taste good), the pineapple was soggy and not the least bit sweet, not generous with the ingredients either, taupok and youtiao were also not freshly toasted. The only plus point was that service was fast at 1pm.

My favourite black pepper lamb chop... better than any restaurant. Black pepper sauce was fully originally created by them. The one and only sauce. Totally different from outside.  Worth trying. Almost 300gm lamb chop sold only $11.00.

One of the favorite coffee shop which I will visit whenever I am around this area.
They have stalls that offers delicious, cheap and affordable bee hoon noodles and wide variety of food to go along with.
Also there is a Muslim stall that sell cheap and delicious nasi lemak that used to be popular in town area.

Terrible tea. Plain like water. Very small cup. Indian rojak is terrible. Prawns not fresh and starchy pieces. Cucumber not fresh.

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
Ordered the carbonara with fish and cheese fries, and my partner had the aglio oglio. Food was painfully average, although the portions were more than enough : ) Prices are average as well.
Overall.... decent place. Not worth going out of your way for this place

Ordered Run Down burger，Firebird burger, Carbonara spaghetti with chicken, Spagetti with Steak. Serving is very generous. Steak is overcooked and hard although we ask for medium rare. Spagetti was just nice. Firebird burger was not to my liking because it is fried chicken and oily. My stomach did not feel too well after that.

Disappointed with my order of rib eye. It didn't look or taste like rib eye. Very rubbery & I didn't finish it. Waitress was kind enough to serve me a serving of chicken chop but I Was still charge the full price for rib eye. Chicken chop was OK. Pasta so so. Mushroom soup was not bad. Unfortunately, it'll be my first and last time coming here...

Great service and ambience. Portion was big and affordable pricing. Taste wise, can be better! Fish and chips was too oily for my liking and steak was a little tough.

The food here is priced competitively and the quality is good. We had a great time catching up with friends and the food is so good. I think it has good value and recommend people to give it a try.

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
few seats but quite empty 👍 the staff was nice and I saw she allowed this lady to taste test some flavours (hygienically, with a new spoon per flavour). I wouldn't personally say that the waffles were more extraodinary than other places I've been but they're pretty good! some cool flavours too :D

Immediate 5/5! Great service, food and variety at an affordable price! What is there not to like?

Personally I loved the Vietnamese coffee ice cream (Little Saigon) when paired with the soft and chewy waffles 🧇 which went swimmingly well!

Perhaps what can be done better is that the cappuccino could be serviced in a ceramic cup for a better tasting experience. Flavour wise it is good 👍🏻

Overall this is the kind of place you would happily want to return to. Kudos!

Cozy ice cream place at Yishun and there's constant crowd during the time I'm here. Decided to try the Blue Hawaii (bluepea flower with choc chip & a hint of sea salt) that seems to be their popular item but don't have much of the choc chip and the sea salt is not hint though. Am pretty disappointed and won't recommend for me but the Pistachio is smooth and flavourful. Waffles is crispy on the outside and soft inside.

Nice ice cream, cool ambience, affordable prices. Had the mint chocolate. Inside can seat 25pax max, but turnover quite fast since ice cream melt fast and it’s so sweet. They serve waffles too! Overall it’s nice place to have a hangout and chill.

Been a loyal customer for a long time, but I was let down by the service I received today. The lady named Eugene who assisted us was impatient and came across as rude when we wanted to try some new flavors. It would be great if the staff's attitude could be improved to enhance the overall ice cream experience. Fortunately, the delicious ice cream and waffles helped make up for the disappointing service.

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
First time here to coba (try) the food. Very delicious and generous amount. Price slightly on the high side but once you take a few mouth of the food, you forget about how much you paid.
The beef rendang is tender and I will recommend as first meat dish if this is your first visit.

Nicely located corner makan place so you get some good wind circulation... Essential when eating spicy food.  😂 Staff are friendly and chill.

Good Nasi Padang dishes and Nasi Ambeng set! 2 meat and 1 veg with 1 drink costs $13.50. Spicy and great taste, easy to eat and not too heavy. Friendly service.

Great muslim food. Great taste.👍 Custer services  is good👍. Like sambal alot. Plenty  of carpark lot nearby. Down side is abit warm during hot day if sit inside. Price wise seem reasonable to me.

I like the laid back ambience and good service but the food looks better than they taste…both chicken and esp beef rendang was dry and the latter made worst by serving without gravy.

The serving shown is $16, fair for the nice comfortable ambience plus good service. I’ll return if in the area but will try different dishes

Very delicious nasi padang. Every dish looks so appetizing but my stomach cannot fit all. Not cheap, this plate is about $9, but very good. Sambal chilli is too spicy for me.

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
Delicious ayam penyet with reasonable price, big chicken thigh & tasty chilli paste from S.Bistari Changi Village @101A,Yishun AVE (5)

This the best Ayam Penyet
They usually packed their Ayam Penyet look very appetizing .
🤔
Their chili super nice 💯  must buy extra 😍

Food is well presented on a wooden round plate.  Portion is good to fill an adult stomach. The rice taste bland, and there is some blood stain inside the chicken drumstick.

worst service among all! one of worker is the most terrible malay worker very rude !

Nasi penyet the chicken is burn! Taste horrible.. Will not support anymore!
Lousy food lousy worker

The nasi ayam penyet was super delicious! The sambal was just so shiok ! Loving it 🫶🏻

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
Walked past this coffeeshop frequently but never tried the Zi Char before, finally decided to try it and the food was fantastic! Ordered the Salted Egg Chicken and wow, it's really good! If you like the dry version for salted egg, this is a must try! 😋 Ordered the Yang Zhou Fried Rice which was tasty with the wok taste and Moonlight Hor Fun which was on the sweeter side! Nevertheless, a delicious meal here! ☺️

I am pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food at this neighbourhood's Zi Char food stall.  Business is brisk with takeaway orders as I sat at the table waiting for my order.

I only took one picture of the star dish from my set dinner, the assam fish head.

The fish is very fresh and the assam sauce is very generous, very satisfying meal!

Service staff is very friendly and helpful.

The tables at the coffeeshop are also very clean, thanks to the regular cleaning by coffee shop assistant.

Counter lady doesn't have the patience to understand your questions about the menu.

Food was horrendous possibly because the counter lady doesn't care about your stated preferences and simply keyed in food order as how she deems it to be.

Operating hours mention till 10.45pm ... Reach there then wait the cashier ask the kitchen staffs then tell me they are close ... I ask the cashier about closing time then she look at another place (i guess she look for time) and tell me last order at 10.15pm ... I directly look at my watch and it 10.16pm ... So the time i reach your counter and wait for you to ask your kitchen staffs not counted ? Dont want to make noise as you never know what they will do to your food if they are not happy.

Lazy staffs ... Super Duper bad service !

Dropped by for quick dinner. Food was so so. Price reasonable.

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
Just managed to sap few photos of this place.
I think the hawker centre is amazing!

Good selections of food for all races and wallet friendly too!

Highly recommended you to come here if you are just nearby!

I will definitely come back for more of the food here! 😘

You got to know what you’re here for. That’s one thing I’ve learned on visiting local hawker centres. And one man’s meat is another man’s poison. Service, being next to none in a self-service hawker environment, I gave a 5 to fill in the blanks.

A lot of local foods, mostly crowded. Recommend to try the 石年pork rice, its super delicious!

Hot and cold desserts are available (~$2). Always nice to have after meals or even on its own. Queues in Chong Pang hawker centre are generally good signs that the food from that stall(s) are appealing and appetising. The noodle stall facing the fruit stall (or market) opens from morning and till evening. So far so good!

This place is not the best hawker centre I Singapore. It is just ok. Many stalls here repeat the same type of dishes. For example, I think there are at least 5 stalls selling fish all noodles and 4 stalls selling prawn noodles, none of which are particularly outstanding and nice. Price wise: most stalls are very reasonable.

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
This Yishun Mos outlet serves quality burgers and fries. Love the fish 🐟 burger 🍔 because I think is the fillets that a difference for Mac fish. The hamburgers though uses onions which Mac burger uses  pickles as the favour enhancement.
Only drawback is the size of the outlet, small area so gets quite crowded at times.
The burgers are now pack in boxes, use different tapes to differentiate the contents.

Just wanted to share my favourite order of fish burger, milk tea and fried chicken! Just $10 for this set :) Their milk tea is light and refreshing, while their fish burger is the best! Japanese Mayo and mustard with crispy fish patty, onions, cheese, all between two soft buns.

The buzzer rang twice when my food wasn’t ready though... hope that the technology improves here

V disappointed, 2nd time I order this burger but the standard at Northpoint is so lousy. When I approach ur staff, he asked me I want more guacamole is it? I mean do I look like a beggar? Ur ala carte burger is $9.

The fries were hot but hard and stale and tasted like they have been fried a few times and left to sit there for some time... the staff was nice to change a new one for me however the second portion was still the same as the first... Northpoint outlet needs to look into how they fry their fries to ensure it’s fresh and good tasting when served to customers.

I know this can’t be right because I’ve tasted better at other Mos Burger outlets. Come on Northpoint team you can do better. This is not the standard of your fries.

One of my go to fast food joint. My personal favourites are yakiniku rice burger and ebi rice burger. The French fries are also better tasting then other fast food restaurant. The reason why I gave it a 3 star? Their lemon tea drink is always very diluted. Feels like drinking sugar water doesn't taste like tea at all. As for service, the staff is always on the ball and serve with a smile. Will still patronize from this outlet. Please give a 'Like' if you enjoy this honest review.

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.name: MOS Burger

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
Food served very fast. Servers responsive when called. Meat is well marinated. Pork belly very thick though. It would taste and cook better if sliced thinly. Buffet price is cheap at $20.90 per person. Would be good if they increased the price by a few dollars more and make it drink free flow. The sweet soy fried chicken the best and so yummy. So sweet and flavourful and skin so crunchy and meat so tender.

The price is reasonable for the quality of food. I've tried both buffet and ala carte before and both types are equally good.  The meats and vegetables and noodles served taste good and authentic. Service is also very good and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The only downside is the barbeque smell that is left on your clothes and hair and skin after you leave the place but I suppose this is unavoidable even when you are seated and dining outside the airconditioned area.

Overall it's a pocket friendly restaurant. Good for group dining but ventilation wise can be a bit stuffy. Buffet variety is limited but sufficient for those who are meat eaters. Their friend chicken is good. We are not so in favour of the seasoned meat as it tend to be on the sweet side. Dining time is 90mins and will have penalty charges for unfinished cooked food.

One of the Korean BBQ which I always visit. Value for money depsite the increase in price recently. Barely tea used to free, but now chargeable. Fried chicken still as good and servicing portion quite okay, since is buffet, you can always order as long as you can finish it. Dinner more worth it as just $3 extra, you get more variety of the ingredients as well as ice cream. Owner may want to look into serving ice cream during lunch too. It doesn't cost you much as not everyone likes, but it do helps in your business. For those who drive, is not easy to get parking lot, but you can always park at the opposite HDB carpark.

Finally had the chance to try this place despite knowing it exists for years 😂 tried the cold spicy noodles and soy sauce fried chicken. Noodles were close to lukewarm 🥹 but flavour was decent so maybe next time I'll bring my own ice cubes to add haha but the chicken was very good! Crispy and juicy and the sauce was on point without being too overpowering. Not mind-blowing but it checked off all my boxes for good fried chicken - no complaints. Sides wise I think the Mac and cheese tasted gross and sad and cheap - especially the cheap mayo used but the kimchi was good. Tastes exactly like the one from wonderful bapsang.
Belgian cuisine in Yishun.opening_hours:

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
I could eat at a reasonable price with the Father's Day promotion. If you like beer and mayonnaise flavor, or if you are a big eater, please visit there. Very satisfied!

This is my 2nd time here.
Very very disappointed!
The platter didn’t serve hot, said exchange but end up even worse:
Medium rare become medium well and smelly
The chicken wing went back kitchen for reheat then serve again.
Do u think the customer can be cheated easily?
Sigh…. Won’t come again. Sucks

Once in a while you find a restaurant that greatly exceeds your expectations and Kingdom of Belgians (KoB) is one of them.  I've now eaten here twice; two nights in a row. Each night I tried completely different things. All of it was outstanding. Highlights are the beef stew, Flemish asparagus, Belgian wings and the two desserts I had. Belgian waffle with ice cream and the spiced apple tart. To die for. They had a special on a bottle of wine in my photos too and for the price was great also. Staff, while busy, are great and friendly. If you are in Singapore don't miss a dinner here with family or a date. The prices are very reasonable for SG and the food really is outstanding. Kila approved!! 💓 PS:  I didn't even try the mussels yet haha! 😀

3.3/5 (3/5 food; 5/5 service; 2/5 atmosphere)
It's ok. Honestly, we came because of the mussels and belgian beer. The mussels were alright. Decent portion, however i felt that the seasoning was off, and the flavours over powered the mussels. We also had the cauliflower and asparagus, the seasoning was off also there (lack of salt). Asparagus under cooked. Unfortunately my partner got sick afterwards (we had to go straight home - we don't think it was the mussels as i was fine, but something was definitely off. Things can happen the vote is not influenced by that. I was a little dissapointed on the beer selection. It's your commercial trappist or lindeman. Was hoping for some lambic/geuze or other artisinal beers. We didnt stick around for desert  (as partner was unwell). The atmosphere was also very strange - we stayed indoors, and the decor, lighting, seats all make it feel a little fast foodish. Maybe that's the point, but it did feel a little weird. There is an outside though which looked very nice and may have a totally different atmosphere.

It's my third visit here. KoB is a riverside spot which specialises, as you may suspect from the name, in Belgian beer and food. Waffles, fries with mayo, Blue Moon Belgian witbeer (actually not a Belgian beer; it's American, but let's not quibble 😃), Leffe etc.

The restaurant has a pretty amazing deal where you get two beers for the price of one during happy hour, which is 1100-1900. Most people come for the beer and sit outside under the umbrellas to enjoy them but the food is surprisingly good. Pesto pasta with parmesan and croutons at just $13 (lunchtime special) is terrific, the fries with mayo can be variable (twice they've been well cooked and crispy, just how I like them, once they were a bit soft and floury inside), and the jalapeño poppers are die die must try!

Solid ice-cold beers at a great price, great food, ideal location by the leafy riverside in Robertson Quay...definitely going to be visiting this place a lot!

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
A unique restaurant with some strange decoration that added to its charm. The chill vibe and cooling environment with fans made it a pleasant spot, but be warned about the mosquitoes. Luckily, we arrived early, as the place filled up quickly. Although the food took a while to be served, the quality and generous portions made up for it. It might be a bit pricey, but the overall vibe is worth it. We will visit again with friends next time.

Discovered this hidden gem after driving by and the atmosphere was alluring. Looked like a full house, but staff made space for us. I was already expecting a bit of a slow wait, so bearing that in mind, food was definitely worth the wait. Drinks (root beer and Heineken bottle) came within 5 minutes of sitting down, first dish (fried rice) came around 30+ min after, and everything else came quite quickly after that.
Highly recommend the onion rings, satay and fish and chips. Serving sizes were generous and tasted great.
Not sure what’s with the recent low reviews - this place definitely is a charm for what it is. If you’re expecting super fast, quick, and “high class” restaurant vibes, then this isn’t the spot for you. If you’re looking to chill, have a hearty meal, enjoy the atmosphere without rush, then this little gem of a cafe does the job.

Our experience at woody’s cafe was okay . Food was overpriced, my wife and i ordered the bua keluak burger, pork ribs, onion rings and satay . We only enjoyed the satay and onion rings. The burger’s sauce was too salty for our liking, and the pork ribs was not that meaty and tasted bleh. We liked the unique atmosphere though.

A lovely place to chill. As I was driving so didn't drink. They have a good selection of food and drinks. Must try if you're ard the area or at least Tey to make yr way there. Secluded and quiet. Go on a weekday as I heard it is usually very packed on the weekend.

Good satay. Avoid the chicken salad if you want less calories n vegetables, it’s loaded with chicken and sauce. Rustic and great place to hang out for a drink at night. The next time I will try their peranakan dishes. There is no ac, so it can get hot in the day.

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
Somehow despite living just a stone's throw away we have never tried this place until now, its a hidden gem! Friendly service and food portions are huge, we visited at 9pm and had a really nice dinner. Fried mushrooms were juicy and spaghetti was so creamy and good. Honey bourbon pork was slightly dry/hard for me but overall a really nice meal.

The food is delicious and generous, the waiters are friendly, the prices are fair, and the beer is on sale!！ Great for dining with family and friends!

Didn't know this place exist, totally tucked away in a landed residential area. Nice quiet ambience on a weekday afternoon. Very classic Western/Italian style fare with good portioning. Taste is average/good.

My favorite go to place for western food in my neighborhood.
Food is above average and portion is huge There is wide spread of food and cocktail on the menu as well.
The auntie waitress is cheerful and chatty. We love to talk to her.

I wanted to give 5 stars. But less one star because it is not a non-smokers friendly.

Is really suffering for non-smokers and we have to inhale second hand smokes. :/ While enjoying our meals.

Really hope the owner(s) can do something to this issue.
------------

This place is decent size, a very nice place to chill. But really dislike the fact that is smokers friendly :(

Food is awesome

Best pork ribs can be found here. Super soft and tender.

Recommend pork ribs and their aglio aglio a must try.

Staffs are friendly and approachable.

We ordered fish and chips to try today but very salty. Hence won't be ordering again.

Here sell beers and wines too.
( Please drink and not drive!)
Be responsible ☺️

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
Coming for my favorite key lime chia seed tart. -7.20
Complete with a large hot latte at 6.80
Situated in the midst of shops inside northpoint mall.
They serve good breakfast menu but I haven’t tried it yet.

I was given a NY cheesecake instead of Carrot cake which I specifically ordered in grab.. I should have checked but I was in a hurry. Not the first time they didn’t give me carrot cake

I recently visited here and had the pleasure of trying out their latte, mocha, and cheesecake.

The latte was expertly crafted with a smooth and velvety texture. The coffee was strong and bold, but not overpowering, and perfectly balanced with the steamed milk. The latte had a good foam and the taste was well balanced.

The mocha was also delicious, with a rich and chocolatey flavor that was well balanced. The chocolate was not too sweet and not too bitter, and the drink was expertly crafted with a rabbit and a leaf latte design.

The cheesecake was heavenly. It was creamy, rich and the texture was perfect. The crust was buttery and crumbly and the topping was fresh and sweet.

Overall, I highly recommend this café for their delicious coffee and cheesecake. Their staff was also friendly and attentive. A great spot for a morning coffee or a dessert break.

Always my favourite place for morning breakfast as there are only few opened in the morning before 10am. However, the area is a bit hot and seems like no air con in the morning

Highly recommend
1. All day breakfast fry up - chicken bratwurst, scrambled eggs, mushrooms, baked beans, salad mix, and 2 pieces of soft whole grain toast.
2. Skillet sous vide eggs with chicken bratwurst, melted cheese and cherry tomatoes. This is so yummy!
3. Mushroom melt on a ultra soft brioche bun

For cakes, we love the lychee rose and key lime. So delicious. So fragrant. Not too sweet. My friend and I typically can’t finish an entire slice of cake but we polished both slices up in no time!

Service is good and attentive. We asked for hot water refill for our rose Earl Grey (very fragrant) and it was done immediately, no questions asked.

Prices are reasonable too - especially if you buy their stored value card (for drinks)

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
Came here to try the buttermilk waffle with 2 scoops of ice cream. The pistachio ice cream is quite nice, but Oat Milk dark choc is a disappointment- not dark choc at all, more like super sweet white choc. Waffle is average, can be better.

Environment wise it’s a really small shop with a few small round table and small stools. Not comfortable

If you're in the mood for a tasty treat and don't want to break the bank, then look no further than this amazing spot that serves up some of the best waffles and ice cream in town. The pandan gula melaka waffles are perfectly crisp on the outside and fluffy on the inside, making every bite simply heavenly. And let's not forget about their incredible selection of ice cream flavors that perfectly complement the warm waffles. Whether you're a fan of classics like chocolate and vanilla or more adventurous flavors like salted caramel or cafe mocha crunch, this place has got you covered. The ambiance is laid-back and friendly, making it an ideal spot to catch up with friends over a delicious dessert.The staff service (Chloe) is exceptional as well – friendly, efficient, and always ready with a smile. They make you feel welcome from the moment you step through the door until your last bite of waffle. So do yourself a favor and head over to this hidden gem – your taste buds will thank you! And me and my girl friend come here almost every night.

1st and last time. Came to the shop & sign was ‘ toilet break 20 mins ‘ the staff was outside using phone , not sure is lady boss or what . After finish ordering the staff said ‘ eh it’s done already ‘ , apparently it’s self service . We were the only customer there as the place was empty , there was no music or anything in the background so it was completely silent and it make the experience very awkward . This place really doesn’t have any customer care or service , I agree with the other 1 star reviews . Waffles was also so so only , ice cream give so little . 11.50$ paid , totally not worth the experience & price . (7$ for waffle , 4.5$ for 1 pathetic size scoop of ice cream) Refer to photo for the portion of the scoop given

The waffles and gelato at No Horse Run Yishun is exceptional! Very tasty and well prepared and you can chose among many menu options. I love the service at the place and the crew(Chesca) is so friendly with the guests and always takes care to offer the best quality! I highly recommend this place. You must visit right now!

Lovely place. Felt super cosy when i first entered even though it's small. Me and my partner decided to drive down to takeaway 2 scoops of ice cream and waffles. Even after we arrived back home the waffles was still crispy. One of the better heartland cafes around the north area! Ice cream portion was super generous too!

Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
First time here, waited quite long for our food due to large crowd in the restaurant.

Upon sampling the food, it was a wait worth it, food was so delicious. Daughter enjoyed the pretzels very much and she gave a thumb up 👍🏻 for the sausage platter.

Pork Schnitzel was nicely done and goulash was so amazingly good!

Best of all the pork knuckle is so crispy, goes so well with the accompanying sauce.

Definitely will come again to try their signature fried beehoon.

Tonight we thought we would try something a little different, European style food with the opportunity to sample a nice cold beer.

Brauhaus with its old charm and quiet setting seemed a great place to start our evening.  Upon arriving the bar/pub you can  view a large selection of glassware and beer bottles from Germany and other countries around the world which was rather exciting.
But sadly that's where the excitement ended, having ordered the sausage platter x 2 and roast potato's we thought we were in for a special treat. The sauerkraut was from a jar, served slightly warm, and tasting of vinegar, the sausage platter was supposed to be four different kinds of sausage where only two types of sausage were served.
The roast potatoes were boiled, tossed in oil with onions, mushrooms and a few slithers of bacon, topped with cheese and grilled in the oven, hardly roasted and tasting rather bland due to the lack of seasoning.
It was a far cry from the Brauhaus in Sydney Australia which truly is representative of German cuisine.

Brauhaus may have been back in the day (2013) a bar to be reckoned with something different, but today in 2023 it falls well short of what it actually boasts about. A place I would not recommend, or frequent again!

Weirdly enough, the dish I enjoyed most was their pig's trotter bee hoon. Meatloaf and oxtail were pretty alright as well.

Staffers were friendly and made sure all our glasses were always filled. That ensured a most enjoyable evening out.

Love the bee hoon. Sausage platter not bad. The knuckles were delicious too.

The beer selection is more than normal.

Nice place to chill and eat and beer!

Wide variety of beer and very homely. Been here for years and they stayed consistent. However, not all beers on the menu are available and you should check with the staff before ordering. Always order the sausage platter here as you can’t go wrong with sausages. However, the table beside us was having beehoon which looked and smelled super good. Will try next time.
