Belgian cuisine in Yishun.reviews:
Has a warm welcome into the restaurant. However service staff were kind of slow when taking orders and preparing food orders. We had a long wait for our food to be served. Food portion was huge and was tasty. Price is also on the higher side. But ambience was good. Especially if you wanna chill with friends and family over food.

The food taste average. The only nice thing is the hot chocolate which serves with the Turkish tin. Not so satisfied with the service. We finished the food and decided to stay for a while longer. Without asking for the bills, the waiter passed us the bill. Would appreciate if they don’t do this to customers 😅 it made us feel like we are supposed to leave right after eating without the peace to stay a bit longer and we were there from 4.10pm to 4.50pm and it wasn’t even crowded. Very disappointing for such quality and service at such a venue.

Very nice brunch option. Great atmosphere. You should be mindful you should book a reservation to avoid eating at the bar and that there is a time restriction after which the next batch comes in.
The menu is pretty good but it was surprising to see some classics missing like veg scrambled eggs or eggs benedict.
Dishes are pretty big and high quality. We will definitely come back.

First time having wild honey.
Nice food.
We had quite a “surprise” on the first time ever at wild honey. It ended well.
I hope to see improvements over the check in the supply of bagels.

I had a wonderful birthday dinner here 🥰. The space is cozy and spacious, the food is delicious and healthy (not too sweet, or too salty). Staff are enthusiastic and friendly. The restaurant also gave me a surprise when giving me a slice of birthday cake beautifully decorated with candle. 🫶🏻 Thanks

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
Saw some good reviews on google and decided to try out the white beehoon here.

However, taste wise it was really a little lacking. The white beehoon was like a sticky gooey version with lots of egg. Came with 2 small prawns and 2 scallop which was honestly quite little at this price point.

The XO fried rice was also just average- quite spicy, nothing really outstanding.

Service was very good and friendly. Ambience was quite warm during a hot afternoon. Overall really quite average food for this price- I will probably not try again.

I had previously tasted their white bee Hoon at Jewel, and it was delicious. However, last night's dish lacked the wok hey flavor. Additionally, their yam ring was small and missing key ingredients like cashew nuts and other vegetables. Just to also note, there was no air conditioning.

Main seller white bee hoon is still nice as always.
Beancurd quite typical, not much tofu fragrance.
Ngor hiong also quite normal, gave chillie sauce not black sauce.
Claypot chicken gravy is nice, but chicken meat abit dry.
Peach gum dessert hardly find the peach gum inside.
Overall food is decent, only the white bee hoon has a reason for return. Quantity of food is very little even though price is on high side.

I went there on a Saturday Night around 6pm. There is a slight queue but the wait is not too long. It's is my first time trying Singapore white beehoon, and yesh I'm honestly grateful that I have my first dish here. It's sooo good, the lime makes it so much better. Asides from white beehoon, the Signature Meat and Seafood Roll is nice too!

Disappointing experience! Broccoli and naibai were sold out before 7.30pm (normal dinner time hours). Ordered "Homemade Tofu with Dried Scallop and Mushroom", naibai got changed to 5 snow peas without informing us and toppings were pathetic (See comparison photo of the same dish at the Vivocity outlet).

Had high expectations of the original outlet after relatively good experiences at both Vivocity and Waterway Point. Not coming back again.

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
Service staffs are friendly. Steam chicken is tender and rice is flavourful, however the Chicken Feet with Thai Sauce too cold.

They serve not only chicken rice but also other foods.
Chicken rice set was nice. I will try other Chinese foods.

It is a four star ⭐️ for me as such Hainanese chicken rice with the “coffee shop” ambience and feel are hard to come by in Singapore. Chicken rice is good. Other dishes and zi char options are available for those whom don’t fancy the chicken rice but want to immerse in the ambiance. Give the mutton dish a try. You may love it.

Staff V Friendly N Approchable. But Food Was Served Relatively Slow, Been Informed That Only One Chef Cooking?? Staffs Apologised Few Times For The Late Food Served Which I Felt Was Not Their Fault Actually. For The Chestnut In The Tofu, Taste Slight Sour. Other Than That, Still An Economical Meal After All.

Tender chicken with side dishes, veg & bean curd, meat dish, seafood, egg, rice, noodles and drinks.

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
Menu is extensive, that's not necessarily a good thing. Didn't know where to start so we went for the tim sum (since most had some on their table).

Tim sum was below average in my opinion (won't go to details).

The pao fan was quite bland (didn't like it), fried HK kailan was normal, and the sweet and sour pork was disappointing (a tad too sweet too sour).

Not coming back in a hurry.

place was very warm although indoors, seems like aircon is all broken.

Fish bait was fried beyond recognition, absolutely hard and crackling.

San Lou horfun was black, tasted like normal horfun, when clarified if it was san lou, staff didn’t even reply, just nodded and said didn’t we ordered that?

plenty of fish scales in the fish slices in the horfun though, almost wanted to ask if it’s part of the dish.

Chicken feet was sweet, period, no savoury taste.

Lor mai gai was borderline edible.

the dim sums are still edible but not recommended.

Drinks had a charred taste, but it’s still acceptable i guess?

not sure why it is rated 4 stars? i wouldn’t give it above 1 star, a random kimly dimsum would have tasted better, so i am doubting the ratings here

Outlet was quiet in a Saturday evening so it was a nice dining experience. Not crowded. Food was okay. The best is indeed their prawn pao fan. The pao fan was soooo flavourful. Just this dish is enough to feel happy and full. Ee fu mee not bad, oily enough. Get the luffa fish ball soup. Soup was yummy and fish ball was full fish paste.

Good for family gathering.

Have been here a few times with friends and family. Will often order a variety of Dim Sum here. The Mango Pomelo Sago is my favourite too esp when it comes with full load of good stuffs!
For Dim Sum and Pao Fan lover, this will be a good place for you!

A place to enjoy the old school vibe. It has a good selection of dishes and dim sum, from the typical Zi char items to Hong Kong style quick bites. Their pao fan (rice is rich broth) is a must order. Thoroughly enjoyed that.

Place is generally not overly crowded. Parking can be an issue if you go at lunch time. Expect parallel parking lots.

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
Saw the 5 stars reviews so thought we would check it out as we were close by.

The food was decent, but wasn't amazing. I wouldn't classify this place as having authentic Hong Kong Dim Sum, maybe more local style.

What I was not happy about was the service. We were still eating, and there was one staff who kept trying to clear our table or asking if we wanted to take away the rest.

I get that there are people waiting outside, but you should let your existing customers eat in peace!

When were trying to pay they kept asking us for our order form, which we never got back.

So all in all when it came to service, this place did not impress. I only gave it 2 stars for service because there was one really sweet waitress there.

Safe to say, we will not to racing to go back any time soon.

Dim sum acceptable. Roast duck is great. Curry fish head is the best dish ...

Omg very nice. Was looking for late dinner place in the north and chanced upon here when my train ended its service at springleaf and wa rly damn nice

Roast pork and char siu rice is good (roast pork nicer than charsiu) and the chilli and the sauce is damnnnnn good

Dimsum also very nice (carrot cake and cheong fun)

My friend’s HK noodle also not bad

Service is good, they will even warn u if the saman auntie coming. Girl math, if you come here to eat u save $$ on saman money

V nice will be back for more suppers 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Like this + 1 Coke Zero only $21.50, SUPER WORTH!

Here again June 2023:-
Down to 2 stars. Not so nice today both service and food. Had porridge, crispy noodles, crispy rolls, Siew Mai. Size of Siew mai very small compared to last we had. Wont be gog there again.

Went there for dinner few times. Up to 4 stars from 3. Hor fun was good.

Decent food for late night supper.  Parking is abit challenging as there isn’t any parking lots nearby.

The tim sum is excellent. Ordered the Carrot cake, chicken feet, liu sha bao and seafood roll are flavorful with right texture and serve piping hot. the fish head steamboat soup is well brewed, tasty and fish head is very fresh with yam, corn, cabbage, seawood and beancurd. Highly recommend.

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
Parking not that easy to get one nearby, mostly park by motorcycle, some occupying more space for themselves.
The Nan and Satay are satisfying.
Tried their white fried Maggie noodle good too.

I will come here to get my biryani or prata whenever I am around the area as both are good in my opinion. Their tandoori corner starts from 5pm onwards. Price wise expect to spend around 10 dollars per person. Their drinks are consistently good.

The Mee Siam has depth and is full of flavors.
Great selection of food and drinks with good service.
Long established brand with large loyal customers.

Everyone knows this is the place for decent Indian-Muslim food at any time of the day or night. The daily cooked Indian Mutton soup is a must-try, but they are ready only around 4pm. Actually, best after 7pm.

Have been coming here since I moved to Yishun in 1986. Nothing much has changed except they now have an air-conditioned area next door and have some digitalisation. They now gives out receipts. See photo

One of the best Roti prata shops in my opinion. The curry puffs are great also. Will only eat when free parking is available along the row of shops.

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
My regular choice, Best HK Roast Duck, Steam Fish, Cantonese Soup…

The roast duck is very good.  The cantonese style zhi char is very good also especially the steam salted fish minced pork.

Has to be my favourite Chinese restaurant! Serve the best roasted duck!

Food is good especially roast duck. But service by the old aunty was horrible. Went as a couple and waited for 15 minutes for a designated table for 2, even though there were available tables but only meant for 3 pax and above

Best duck, best food. Sweet Aunty with home-cooked vibes to the food. Taste like moms cooking. Had the best meal there. Deserves all the stars fr. Dont miss out, give it a try.

Had the ducks, sweet and sour pork and threeway egg with spinach. Fantastic meal for sure.
Czech restaurants in Sembawang.name: Sum's Kitchen 深記飯店燒鴨

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
Not salty & this is good. Healthy cooking.    Not crowded, so the staff keeps coming to our table. Food is good but business is not attracting big crowd. Maybe they can do more promo.

Decent teochow Chinese food here at chin Lee
Quite a hidden gem as it’s tucked all the way in a corner on the second floor
We ordered set menu. Dishes we quite liked include the chicken, fish and prawn
Service is good and They were very accommodating with larger table as we came with children . Overall pretty good food and service

It’s a hidden gem that only got to know this place now whereby they have been here for almost 2 years (open during covid time). Its actually sister restaurant from its main restaurant at Bedok. It’s family friendly with mostly all round table setting. Easily good for 6-12 pax. This place can be very crowded so be there early to avoid disappointment. It’s very spacious, nice ambience and comfortable to dine in. It’s a Teochew restaurant, hence must try their signature dishes. Chilled Teochew Pork Trotter Jelly, Homemade Teochew Prawn Ball, Teochew Kway Teow are some of the must try. There is currently promotion on extra value set on weekdays dinner only which is really value for money. You can have choice of fish/prawn, chicken/duck/meat & veg/tofu/omelette on top rice, soup & tea/water. All good taste great and portion is decent for 4 adults. Especially the coffee pork ribs, it’s tender juicy and yet flavorful. Kway Teow also got wok hey. The only disappointment we have got is we did not manage to get our oyster omelette 蠔煎 order on our table during our 45 minutes dining time (6:45pm-7:30pm). Not sure if they missed our order but they claim that its still on order queue even we finished all our extra value meal. We just have to give up with disappointment. You can’t expect customer to wait oyster omelette for another 30 minutes whereby you have already finished your dinner. Probably they just couldn’t cope with the order and do not mind missing one or two customers along the queue in any case they will still sell it to a later customer (probably a shorter time).  That’s a 2 star rating for Service. Hopefully can try it when my next visit (with reasonable waiting time).

Had an assortment of dim sum for lunch. Overall pretty average. I reckon the cooked food might be better? It was quite crowded during lunch hour. The charsiew pau was probably the best of them all.

Authentic Teochew Cuisine.
Sat Dinner, luckily we have made a reservation as the place is almost full .
Being first timers we ordered a fair bit from the recommended list.
Food is served very fast and they asked if we want to slow down the pace... and then last 3 dishes did not come till they activate again😅
I would say the food is within our expectations of a good teochew cuisine and portions are good.
Only exception is the teochew kway teow, L portion but hardly enough for 8 of us.
Czech restaurants in Sembawang.name: Chin Lee Tea & Dine 深利喫茶添味

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
Enjoyed the promotion of $2 Signature Meat & Seafood Roll or the Fiery Popcorn Chicken with any medium Rice / Noodle order! Pretty worth it and only till 31 Aug 2023!

One of the earliest specialize in White Bee Hoon. Which always have long queue at night. The white bee hoon like very ordinary plain type, one you put it in your mouth,   the noodles are full of nice  flavour! The broth is thick and the nice smell linger on   which makes you wanting to have more. The plate have ingredients like prawns, squid, egg, vegetables that  all soaked up and blend nicely. Hmm I wonder why nobody review this place but other outlets in Jewel and Sun Plaza. 🤭
The coconut drinks abit expensive at $5 each. The other dishes like the Salted Cutter Fish , the Sambal Dry Prawn and the Five Spice Spring Rolls are tasty and nice too. Must try . 👍👏🍸

White beehoon is the signature. You don't eat the signature, is the same as you have not been there. Sides are good!Die die must try!

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
This outlet has better service than others I have visited on the island. The gentleman at the orders and cashier desk is efficient and the chef and plating staff work with a smile. The seating is abundant and the restaurant is clean and neat. All of this just adds to the actual taste of the food. Thumbs up to this branch of this franchise!

Eat this fried chicken from many outlet across Singapore, but this one still serve the best food. Not sure what different from others but the pieces cut in consistent every time and the flour batter is evenly spread on the chicken.  All the side dishes are good and fried to crispy when serve. It’s come back if I crave for this fried chicken.

Chicken was a little bit pepperish. Seems a bit too much black pepper on it for my preference. The skin was crispy, didn't taste any spicy even though ordered spicy one. Overall ok only. Not that fantastic.

Usually have a lot of people on queue that I never order this but today was less queue and I tried the chicken at last.

This place was quite busy around dinner time. Manage to visit before the crowd. It was quite sunny though around 4 to 5pm. We have to queue and the cashier will assign table for us after order over the counter. The fried chicken is quite nice, the sides can be chosen from various options. I took the onion rings and twisted fries but ended too much, should have gone with salad instead. This is a must try if you guys have not try it before to exercise your taste buds and find your preferences.

Nice fried chicken with various choice of side dishes. Alot of seatings as well, just avoid peak hours as they conviniently opened till 10pm. The staffs were friendly and nice ambience with not so loud music as well. Overall, nice fast food experience.

Waited a little for the charcoal pot to arrive but understandable as they had lots of customers, very spacious too so didn’t felt near other customers. Staff was moving really quick, food portion was huge, meat was delicious, price was reasonable too. Loved the sauce

Good food. Good service. Easy parking. Nice atmosphere to enjoy Thai food or Mookata. Boss will come take your order if he is free

Was served very fast, their customer service is great too. I love it that its outdoor, close to the greens and nature.

There's alot other types of food served too in case your children don't take mookata. But their marinated pork is really good. So was the mini sotongs!

Overall was really good🥰

We ordered their Thai steam fish, which was fantastic and fresh! There's also other types of Thai dishes too!

Nice alfresco seating restaurant. Like that they use charcoal instead of the usual portable gas stove. The smell is more authentic. Big portion for two at only $39.90. Food was served fast and seats also filled up fast despite us being there at 6pm.

The mookata is so good in terms of food quality, quantity and freshness. The environment also nice, open air and nice music. We really enjoy having mookata here. And, the staff is friendly too.
Thumbs up :)

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
Great place for dining with family members.  I was there for lunch during the weekday, and my overall experience was pleasant. Service is prompt, and the taste of the food is delicious. Recommend.

The pork cutlet is expertly prepared, boasting tenderness on the inside and a delightful crispiness on the outside, complemented by a flavorful sauce. However, it's worth noting that the prices lean towards the higher side; my meal, along with a drink, totaled $30. Nevertheless, the restaurant's charming ambiance, infused with a touch of history, makes it a great choice for special occasions or an occasional treat. With both indoor air-conditioned seating and non-ACed options available, and the beach just a stone's throw away, it caters to various preferences. Moreover, their diverse menu spans Chinese, Western, and local cuisines. For those looking for a budget-friendly option, they offer a more affordable brunch set before 12pm on weekends.

Great place to escape the crowds. Nice and quiet most weekdays, especially at lunch. Fusion menu, think British Hainan food. Pork chops and satay are great. Wash it down with beer or a Long Island Iced Tea. Best part is the ambiance. Throw back in time. No wonder the black and whites are so popular. On cool day try sitting in the non aircon areas under the fans. From an era a long time ago!

Was here for a Saturday lunch. Service was fast and the staff were very attentive. The portions were generous (ordered all small except for fried rice) and was sufficient for 6 + 2 pax!

Celebrated our Mother’s Day here.
We make an advanced booking during this special day.

The restaurant is in the heart of Sembawang park, ppls who stay near by should know the restaurant but due to location not near to town so this many be their weakness point to attract crowd.

Restaurant very vintage , n colony style, it’s quite spacious & quiet, there have aircon n open area.
Very good for taking nice picture

We ordered quite some foods , portion was just nice but all taste was good, reasonable price and aft food can just slow walk around the park. definitely will come back again

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
The seafood got worse than before. Don't waste your time and money.

I have visited Nur Fah Muslim Corner.
Outside of the Blue Heaven was quite lovely.
There is plenty of parking lot.

Time seems have slowed or freezed up for Blue Heaven.
Haven't been to here for a long long while. Didn't try makan, so comment on that. Place is now clean and less mosquitoes I. the late morning to after noon. Hope they stay that way.

Nice seafood served. There is a dart room too. Importantly the price is reasonable and the carpark is just beside it.

Standard has drop since I first ate there some years back.

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
A unique restaurant with some strange decoration that added to its charm. The chill vibe and cooling environment with fans made it a pleasant spot, but be warned about the mosquitoes. Luckily, we arrived early, as the place filled up quickly. Although the food took a while to be served, the quality and generous portions made up for it. It might be a bit pricey, but the overall vibe is worth it. We will visit again with friends next time.

Discovered this hidden gem after driving by and the atmosphere was alluring. Looked like a full house, but staff made space for us. I was already expecting a bit of a slow wait, so bearing that in mind, food was definitely worth the wait. Drinks (root beer and Heineken bottle) came within 5 minutes of sitting down, first dish (fried rice) came around 30+ min after, and everything else came quite quickly after that.
Highly recommend the onion rings, satay and fish and chips. Serving sizes were generous and tasted great.
Not sure what’s with the recent low reviews - this place definitely is a charm for what it is. If you’re expecting super fast, quick, and “high class” restaurant vibes, then this isn’t the spot for you. If you’re looking to chill, have a hearty meal, enjoy the atmosphere without rush, then this little gem of a cafe does the job.

Our experience at woody’s cafe was okay . Food was overpriced, my wife and i ordered the bua keluak burger, pork ribs, onion rings and satay . We only enjoyed the satay and onion rings. The burger’s sauce was too salty for our liking, and the pork ribs was not that meaty and tasted bleh. We liked the unique atmosphere though.

A lovely place to chill. As I was driving so didn't drink. They have a good selection of food and drinks. Must try if you're ard the area or at least Tey to make yr way there. Secluded and quiet. Go on a weekday as I heard it is usually very packed on the weekend.

Good satay. Avoid the chicken salad if you want less calories n vegetables, it’s loaded with chicken and sauce. Rustic and great place to hang out for a drink at night. The next time I will try their peranakan dishes. There is no ac, so it can get hot in the day.

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
We love coming to this outlet. It's nice and big. Not as crowded as the Andes outlet at Woods Square. The service is a bit slow, but they are good. My girl couldn't finish her food and she was so pleased because the food was packed nicely w napkins and a small tub of sauce that she had initially already finished.

Came first time for a quick lunch without expecting too much, but the steak was surprisingly good especially for the price! Ordered coleslaw and baked potato for sides and they were fresh and delicious too. Overall affordable and good quality food!

Updated
Ordered herb grilled fish. Chosen mac and cheese and potato salad. Cost $12.50.

First of all it took like 30min. Second the fish was terrible. Very tough. Taste wise the cream sauce pulled it through.

Mac and cheese was undercooked..

Potato salad was good but need smaller potato.

Overall just get the chicken instead.

~~~~~~~~~~~

Order black pepper chicken chop for $11.90. Side I choose pasta salad and mash potato.

Godly
Chicken. Damn tender and juicy. Maybe char can be better or it can be more chicken taste but black pepper covered the taste. Luckily black pepper sauce was awesome as well. This is really better than their steak, it should be legendary chicken.

Pro
Black pepper sauce. Tasty! Only down side is it over shadows taste of original food.

U can choose your slides

Meh
Pasta salad. Still better than coleslaws I guess.

Mash potato. Not very good, not buttery or as smooth as some hawker mash potato.

I've been here countless times.
One word of advice: don't be there at opening as the grill items may not be cooked to perfection.

This round I went at lunch time on a weekday and no crowd so was great.
No need to order and pay at the counter. You will be directed to your table, to scan qr code to view menu and payment to be done through the link. I love this, finally!!
We ordered 2 meals:
1. hickory bbq grill chicken with 2 sides -mac and cheese & potato wedges
2. Black pepper grill chicken with same sides as the above.

The mac and cheese is different from the ones you get from other shops. You can taste artificial cheese in it but the taste just grows on you, haha. I love it. The potato wedges goes so well with the cheese sauce too.

Prompt and efficient service too. Will come back for more.

order beef steak Medium cooked and it came rare so spoke to waiter and told him it is medium but came rare so he made kitchen to recook and came as a new steak but still slightly rare but abit better so the end we had it instead as not to waste food.wrote to aston and they said will notify the outlet thats all..not sincere about the experience we face and they cant cook medium at all very poor service nowadays..

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
Best American bar in Singapore. Amazing pool table and the best people you'll meet in your life. Only 4 stars because I don't remember half the night.

Enjoy the moment  in nelson bar yesterday, Love the vintage atmosphere and with friendly bartender zila and shine was amazing thank you for your wonderful hospitality will come by and visit you guys again.

You can literally meet Mariners from every seafaring county on earth, good cold Tiger & you can stumble back to the ship if need be.

Media Invite~

Started in the 50s, Nelson Bar used to be frequented by sailors and captains who docked at the Sembawang naval shipyard, making it one of the oldest bars in Singapore.

The bar’s history is still retained through pieces left by sailors – old pictures, life buoys and scribbles on walls – and a pool table that’s made out of decommissioned ships.

You must visit Nelson Bar to experience this nostalgic spot and perhaps learn a thing or two about this bar’s past over some drinks and a game of pool with friends. Pool table is not available due to COVID-19 restrictions these days.

For vegetarians and non alcoholic people like me,they do serve a range of mocktails and plant based dishes etc.

It is a place to rest,relax,listen to music and mingle with nice people.

Zila served me well.

Thank you Mashel for inviting me to such a historical place.

#media #influencer #sponsored #sgcafefood #restaurantreview #Singapore #Marketing #singaporeinsiders #historicalbuilding #historyfacts

Sailors & ex-sailors. A go-to. Hospitality top notch.

Been here many times, just a good nice venue to chill without much noise… will continue being here👍

What impressed me the most was the attention to detail. The pizza was cooked to perfection, and each ingredient stood out with its distinct flavors, harmoniously combining to create a taste sensation. It was evident that the chef used high-quality ingredients and put great care into crafting this culinary masterpiece.

Good atmosphere and nice food. Recommended.

If you need to chill out, this is the place. Good drinks and northern Indian food is there for you...🍻🥂🥃🍾

Somehow despite living just a stone's throw away we have never tried this place until now, its a hidden gem! Friendly service and food portions are huge, we visited at 9pm and had a really nice dinner. Fried mushrooms were juicy and spaghetti was so creamy and good. Honey bourbon pork was slightly dry/hard for me but overall a really nice meal.

The food is delicious and generous, the waiters are friendly, the prices are fair, and the beer is on sale!！ Great for dining with family and friends!

Didn't know this place exist, totally tucked away in a landed residential area. Nice quiet ambience on a weekday afternoon. Very classic Western/Italian style fare with good portioning. Taste is average/good.

My favorite go to place for western food in my neighborhood.
Food is above average and portion is huge There is wide spread of food and cocktail on the menu as well.
The auntie waitress is cheerful and chatty. We love to talk to her.

I wanted to give 5 stars. But less one star because it is not a non-smokers friendly.

Is really suffering for non-smokers and we have to inhale second hand smokes. :/ While enjoying our meals.

Really hope the owner(s) can do something to this issue.
------------

This place is decent size, a very nice place to chill. But really dislike the fact that is smokers friendly :(

Food is awesome

Best pork ribs can be found here. Super soft and tender.

Recommend pork ribs and their aglio aglio a must try.

Staffs are friendly and approachable.

We ordered fish and chips to try today but very salty. Hence won't be ordering again.

Here sell beers and wines too.
( Please drink and not drive!)
Be responsible ☺️

The food was really good, especially the crispy omelette with chili sauce and oysters, chicken and fish. All were fresh and tasty. The dishes were different from usual Chinese restaurants and I really enjoyed the meal there. Service was prompt and place was clean, great for family meals.

Love the peikin duck, skin is so Cripsy together with the sauce. It taste so good. The meat used in the noodle was also great. Will definitely recommend anyone to come and try

1/10/2023
Back here again, food and service still as amazing!!

2022
Great restaurant. Great service, food was great and their portion is big. Would definitely recommend to all! Celebrated my uncles birthday here! Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! Staff was accommodating as well! :)

Nice Hokkien restaurant serving traditional dishes. Try their version of UFO which is the deep fried bun with oyster. Love the traditional Hokkien Mee also with thick gravy and that flavour that only comes with pork lard, love it! Must try!

Nice tasty dishes and very affordable. No svc charge! Generous servings and attentive service. The roast peking duck looks v crispy,  shall try next time. Will revisit again with more friends after our next walking trip nearby windsor/thomson nature park/lower pierce/bishan park.
Czech restaurants in Sembawang.name: Bee Heong Palace Restaurant

Czech restaurants in Sembawang.reviews:
It's worth the wait. Had to queue about half an hour due to safe distancing measures. Had to split seating 3 at 1 table and 1 more at another 😒 What to do. Anyway, other than the slight inconvenience, it was still a wonderful dining experience. The promotional meal set was worth it. Came with 1 main, 2 sides and drink. Gyu Don was tasty. Other sushi dishes were ok.

Food was average until the soft shell came. The dish was a disaster,  horrendous ! The 1st bite of it my husband spit out! The meat inside was actually still raw. He was so uncomfortable and told the staff. Guess the staff is a part time, without apologizing she just took the whole plate behind. Moments later she came back with the food , same plate cos it's the same portion. Hubby gave it another try. Then again , he spit out ! It's beyong savage ! The crab was really smells! It's so bad! The taste lingered in my hubby's mouth tat he wanted to puke !
Then after we spoke to the incharge Miss Laura. A very pleasant incharge whereby she expressed her apologies over the incident.
Just would like to nudge the management please look into the quality of your food as this is F&B industry which who knows may result in food poisoning.

The food quality is above average. But too pricey for its quality.
The only selling point I can think up is that this restaurant is halal.

Decent meal at one of the pioneer Halal sushi joints in Singapore. Slightly on the pricey side, requires a bit of experience in choosing food items that are value for money.

Salmon sashimi is thick and fresh, however without the 1-for-1 promotion it’s rather expensive. The rest of the food items are average, special shoutout for the Spicy Salmon Gunkan which is a must for me everytime I come! :)

Overall, with more and more Halal Japanese joints on the rise, I’d come visit again if it’s convenient.

Honestly the foods here aren’t fresh. Wasn’t my first time eating at Hei Sushi but the one at Woodlands Civic Centre is much more fresh then the ones at Sembawang Shopping Centre. Took a bite of the sushi and the rice was super rock hard and didn’t taste nice at all. The fish portion was smaller then the ones at Woodlands. The fishy smell was even there too. Its like the fishes has been kept for a few days before it was served. Not to forget even their edamame too, some of it taste sour already. Half portion couldn’t be eaten after i take a bite of it. Service was also quite disappointing. When i mentioned that i came alone, the server looks like shock and just pointed to the sit without saying anything. They were seen like they were just talking more then actual working. But i am really disappointed with the foods there. For such an expensive menu, your foods should be served fresh just like how Woodlands outlet does. Wouldn’t recommend anyone to come to Sembawang outlet. For a total bill of $68 for 1 pax, its a major disappointment. The only item that’s not disappointing is only their dessert.

Here at BLK 693 woodlands Ave 6, they are serving it for everyone.

Awesome serving, taste and affordable pricing!
Best in Woodlands,for current. 👍👍👍

Nasi goreng mamak + sunny side-up egg : $5.20
Enjoy the meal✔️

Ordered through Food Panda their Kuay Teow Goreng, Mee Kuah and Mee Goreng. Very nice overall and leaves you with a paus feeling :) Only suggestion is to add a couple of Chili Padis for some heat. Will defo order again!

Finally found the best indian rojak here. the gravy was fantastic!

I always do alot of Roti prata grabfood delivery for this shop

Iranian dining options in Woodlands.reviews:
After 15 years, this restaurant sadly shows its age, lacking the charm and care it once might have had. Claiming to offer authentic Persian cuisine, the reality is a disappointing mix of flavors that lean more towards Indian than Persian. The kebabs, dry and tasteless, are a stark contrast to the rich flavors expected from Persian cooking. Equally disheartening is the rice – cold, undercooked, and lacking the basic essence of Persian culinary art. This establishment, once perhaps a bastion of authentic cuisine, now serves as a reminder of how far it has strayed from its original glory.

Flavourful middle-eastern cuisine, the dips were delicious.
Nice al fresco dinning areas.
Thank you, Ronny for the great host that makes our dinner wonderful. We appreciate your service.

Came back to this lovely Persian restaurant after 3-4 years to celebrate the Wife’s birthday. Last time here was for dinner, with the belly dancer floating around!

This time we were seated indoors due to the afternoon heat! Last few times were seated outside by the river which is lovely in the evening.

It was quite busy on a Sunday afternoon ! The food was as good as we remembered it to be.

Look forward to coming back here… sooner this time :-)

flavourful and appetising Persian food! had an enjoyable alfresco dinner by the river with a very accommodating food attendant. the dessert was delicious but the faludeh shirazi was a tad too sweet for us. maybe next time will just stick with the saffron ice cream on top of the faludeh, sooo good. will go back to try more food on the menu!

We enjoy a spread of 3-Course Middle-eastern set lunch for $48++ per person. 🍷And we add on 2 hours of Toi Toi Sara’s Rose free flow for $40++ per person. Here what we ordered:
❤️ Kash-E-Bademjan
❤️ Borani Esfanaj
❤️ Fish Kebab
-Well marinated with special saffron sauce, it is very fresh and flavourful
❤️ Chicken Masti
-Marinated with yogurt and herbs, the chicken is tender and slightly charred given it’s fragrance
❤️ Dessert
-We love the ice-cream with spice and the Pistachios
The wine is good, with tinge of sweetness and hinge of dryness.
We really enjoy our meal in a restaurant with such a serene environment right beside Singapore River.

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
Grew up eating their orh lua, however I was there last week for supper and ordered the big serving. The flour/starch was super hard and all in small bits like fried crumps. There were only 5-6 pieces of oyster and they were over cooked and felt mushy.
Only the chilli is good, but it is the same chilli you get everywhere, nothing special

Date of visit: Wed 4 Oct 2023
Time : 9.50 pm

Tried the fried oyster omelet flour 耗煎for the first time. Priced at $5.

Egg was over fried. The flour was too oily. See what remains on my plate.

Carrot Cake / Chye Tow Kueh (SGD $5) @ Bedok North 85 Fried Oyster Carrot Cake.
.
This remains a popular stall in an equally popular hawker centre, though allegations that quality varies by the mood of the chefs has some truth.
.
Generally above average and decent value for money, the plates borders the edge of smoky goodness, with soft moist texture to the carrot cake, and a good spread of egg over.
.
The black is better, as the dark sweet soy sauce with the egg creates a tasty sweet eggy savoury salty flavour. The white loses slightly as it lacks crispness, and the savoury sweet eggy salty flavour is mild.
.
.
.
Fried Oyster Omelette (SGD $5) @ 85 Bedok North Fried Oyster.
.
This popular supper spot has decent quality of dishes.
.
Their version has more distinct chunks of fluffy egg and soft crisp potato starch, making it great for those who don't like it mixed.
.
The oysters are medium sized and juicy. Lends briny salty sweet flavour to the smoky eggy savoury notes of the base. Chili has a nice spicy sour kick that builds on the palate.

The oyster egg portion is big for 8 dollars. The best part is actually the sauce that comes with it.

Despite the 2.8 goggle review, still decide to give this bedok north oyster omelette stall a try. The S$5 hokkien mee is decent, and I like their chilli so I asked for more 😋.

Review as posted on my IG: Yummymich

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
Date of visit: Wed 4 Oct 2023
Time : 10 pm

Tried this stall for the first time. Ordered a small meatball noodle soup priced at $3.50.

Quite many people ordered. Got the beeper to inform you when it’s ready.

Soup is alright but salty. Noodles are springy maybe tough for old folks. Portion quite small.

Overall taste is good.

More than 10years apart, the taste and flavour are well maintained!
Comfort food.
Soup is simple yet comforting.
Noodle texture is done just right. Minced meat blends well with the hot soup and tastes really great with the noodle.

Relatively clean and very organised in terms of ordering system and buzzer.
Speed is quick as there is a system within the store.

I love the broth so much as even though it is very greasy and oily, the soup has a sweetness from the minced meat, and the alkalinity of the thick mee kia noodles is not too heavy. The noodles are so chewy and quick thick. I love it!! Minced meat is soft and generous as well. The addition of the dumplings is a must! It has sa fragrant sole fish flavour in it.

Using the old school style of ceramic bowl, it feels like I'm eating my grandma's food ❤️

First time trying a soup version of Bak Chor Mee! Maybe because I was never a fan of bak chor mee, this soup version tasted underwhelming for me. The soup felt under seasoned and the noodles were quite average. The only thing I like about this dish is that they gave a lot of pork balls at only $4.50! Overall a underwhelming experience for me....

This is a nice bowl of soupy bak chor mee. They do one item and do it well, and no wonder it has a big following and long queues.

Tried the $4.5 Bak chor Mee on a Sunday morning. Luckily, no line and was served in 2 minutes.

One thing that is distinctly clear is the number of meat balls, which are really soft and nice to chew.

The soup is nice and not like water. Good flavour. Asked for extra chilli, and that adds some much needed spice. Good amount of minced meat as well. Noodles are soft.

This is a feel-good meal.

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
Lovely place to chill. Enjoyed and finished all the food served.
All food is prepared with fresh ingredients and it's  absolutely yummy😋. Furthermore, the mains and dessert looks so pretty.

Friendly staff and boss. Would definitely visit this place again.

Had dinner with my friends and the service is so good and staff are very friendly especially Marie. The chef makes the food fresh and tasty  and we all love it. Will come back again next week.

An impromptu visit gave rise to this 5-star rating, mainly because of good coffee, good hot chocolate, and the very deliciously freshly baked chocolate lava cake with ice-cream.

Service was good, but it was a tad too overwhelming when staff members take turn one after another to check how we felt about their food. It would have been nice to give customers some space after all. Shoving a printout of QR codes to get customers to do reviews may not be that appropriate. I suggest you just let your good food and friendly service elicit proactive reviews, ya?

Amazing food and friendly service. Will definitely come back esp for a freshly baked croissant 🥐

Lovely homely French food in a cosy restaurant! Loved the setting and variety of food. Excellent service from the service staff and the owners! Kudos to the whole team! Keep it up and we will definitely be back more!

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
Few years ago, my first time tasting their curry chicken noodle was not a pleasure experience. It was too salty too oily too expensive.

Today, after probably 5 years later, I pay my 2nd visit, very hopeful to enjoy a different and improve tasting experience.

Yes. They has improved a lots. The curry flavour was well balance, not too salty, spiciness just nice, not too oily and portion was decent and price is reasonable.

As compared to the famous and popular curry chicken noodle at Hong Lim food centre, they are not as good as that top standard, but their flavour and taste was already very close. In fact, their portion is bigger than the popular one.

Glad to see their great improvements and no wonder always long queue. Highly recommended if you like curry chicken noodle.

💥 Welcome to my food sharing Instagram: jkgourmets. 欢迎游览我的美食IG: jkgourmets

A simple above average curry noodles.
Pro tip, adding too much chilli yourself will alter the taste. You will not taste the curry aroma and instead you will only taste peanut flavour kinda gravy.
There may gut be a long queue during peak hours.

Remember to put extra sambal into your curry chicken noodles for the spiciness and fragrant. Always ordered the medium size, as small size was never enough for my craving of it. A single bowl of CCN served with a generous portion of Hainanese Steamed Chicken and tau pok, the meat was juicy and tender. Overall it taste good and delicious.

Long queue for a reason, and will queue for it again!

There's always a long queue. It's my second time (gave it a second chance), but i can't quite fathom why still. The soup is the most distinct part of the dish here imo; it's more milky than most others and perhaps this is its draw, but my friend and i couldn't get into it. Everything else is rather on par with the average curry chicken noodles, and you might get better cuts of chicken if you're lucky. As a bonus, the chicken portion is rather generous.

So not worth it! Just 2 pcs of chicken meat and so many tau pok and 1 pc potato.  I'd rather get the curry noodle at golden mile market. So much tastier.

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
Pretty sure this hawker centre has the most stores that sell affordable meal in the price starting from $3.50. The price and taste of the food are 5 stars but the atmosphere is 3 star because it can be a bit dark if u are dining at the inside of the hawker centre.

One advice I give is to avoid stores that always have no queue during lunch and dinner hours. There is a reason why they have no queue think about. I would not name stores but u will notice it yourself

Lots of nice local food here. Many long established food stalls are here too. Seating areas quite spaced out and with big ceiling fans. Shouldn’t miss irbid hawker centre I f you are looking for good and affordable local foods. It’s next to Bedok Mall, Bedok Bus Interchange and of course Bedok MRT Station. There’s a Djitsun Mall nearby too.

These is a huge hawker centre with Many delicious and famous food here! These hawkers have been running their stalls here for years!

This is one of the best place that you can get almost all the best tastes of Singapore food at the affordable price!

Look for those with long queues and let the patrons guide you to find the best!

My Recommendation:
Bedok Chwee Kueh
Nasi Lemak
Tiong Bahru Pau
Mee Goreng
Nasi Briyani Mutton
Mee Rebus
Stewed soup
Vegetarian
Satay Bee Hoon
Steamed Chicken Rice
Fish Soup Porridge
Fried Carrot Cake
Prawn Noodle
Fried Hokkien Mee
Desserts
Herbal Mutton Soup
Mala Hotpot
Spinach Soup
Satay
Sugarcane
Kway Chap
Fishball Noodle

Food variety ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Wallet friendly ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Cleanliness ⭐️⭐️⭐️

Few things to improve for this place that I can see are the hygiene issue and the birds…

I grew up eating at this hawker center for nearly 20 years. First visit after they renovated.

A lot of the old stores were gone. But there are some new ones.

Still one of the cheapest place to get some real food in Singapore.

The fish put into Set B of nasi lemak at the Minhad malay stall is too hard. Not sure if its over fried or re-fried from yesterday. Not recommended

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
The best thing is the noodles and broth. Noodles were cooked just right, chewy and tasty. The soup was packed with flavors and I loved that it had a garlicky note. Overall always a good place to slurp down a good bowl of mee.

Really inconsistent. Sometimes good, sometimes bad. These days they do not close past midnight. The queue is much more forgiving these days hence ok to pop by for a quick meal. Always order the large one.

Meatballs are good and the noodles are quite al dente.

There are a few bak chok noodle stalls in this hawker centre.  This stall served not only soup noodle but also dry noodle.

This is my preferred stall as the meat balls and minced meat were tastier for my liking.  I also prefer their ordering system.

You will be given a caller after your order.  You do not have to wait there.  While waiting for the food, you could queue for other stalls.

Soup was thick and rich filled with minced meat, noodle springy. Pair with generous amount of fishballs and meatballs.
A bit tough to find seats and parking lot during weekend peak hour.

Ordered the small portion. Was quite satisfying. Love the overall taste. Bring back many memories of those late night supper at Bedok 85 back then. Will definitely come back again.

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
18/11/23
had cravings for pork knuckle.
2 dishes that contained pork knuckles did not disappoint. the skin was evenly crispy, and meat was soft and tender. they taste quite similar to the ones you get in germany.
the mac and cheese was great, too.
you can skip the soup, was good, but save your tummy for another sausage platter😉
only 2 of us, so we couldn't order much to try. We will be back to try new dishes~

waiter and waitress(chinese) was very hospitable.

One of many outlets in Singapore serving hearty German fare and beer. Akin to a German beer hall in atmosphere with friendly staff serving the delicious food. Visiting during Oktoberfest presents more food and drink options and that makes it very popular, requiring advance booking. Value for money considering the amount of meat that’s served.

I am a Germann living in the US and visiting Singapore. This place is absolutely amazing. The food is authentic and delicious. They even import the breadcrumbs for the Schnitzel from Austria. The Erdinger Helles was one of the best I have had. Five stars all around! (and yes, I went 3 times here in 4 days)

Had a great time at this place. As much as I love Asian cuisine, after about 13 days it is always nice to go back to some western comforts and you can’t go wrong with a chicken schnitzel and a beer. The staff were all great and always made sure to serve your beer with the obligatory “Prōst!” which is generally used to say “Cheers!” The deserts were nice and the ambience at this location was quite calm which is a welcome change to the busy street markets, food courts and hawker centres. Really glad I visited!

This is a nice German beerhouse in Katong and has a few branches around the island. A reservation is recommended as it's quite popular and fills up fast.

Service is friendly and quick. Beer are strong and taste great in the sweltering Singapore heat. We tried the following -

1) Schweinshaxn (Signature Pork knuckle) - So so good. Crispy but meaty, this is a good rendition of pork knuckle. It was so much that we had to pack some of it. Served with bacon sauerkraut and potato salad.

2) Brezn (4x Pretzel) - Liked how this was presented, but the taste is okay.

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
Great cooling and refreshing dessert, highly recommended on a hot day. Service was extremely fast and no waiting time required. The Cheng Tng was made on the spot and customization would be allowed, ingredients inside are tau suan, dried longan, sweet potato, white fungus, barley, ginkgo nuts and more. Overall a tasty treat able to satisfy your dessert cravings and at low price of 3 dollars per bowl. No take away fee.

This is the best Cheng Tng in SG! A refreshing dessert featuring the natural sweetness of sweet potato, the chewy richness of dried persimmon, and the subtle crunch of winter melon strips.  It's thirst-quenching and perfectly balances flavors and textures. With each bite, you'll experience a symphony of tastes that rejuvenate your palate on a hot day. Do note it's with ice chips, not shaved ice.

Used to come here for the Cheng Tng in the past. However, standard has dropped over the years and it is not as good as before.

Overall, still a decent bowl of Cheng Tng, although price has also increased due to inflation: $3 per bowl.

Very generous with the variety of ingredients they used!

Surprised to find strips of dried permission and even sweet potato chunks in it! Portion was huge and it’s was such a delight to have this on a hot day.

Only wishing for it the be less sweet and served in shaved ice.

For cyclist, this is a great stop for a break!

A nice bowl of cheng teng. On the sweet side. Ice chips instead of shaved ice. Pricey at $3.

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
Wow! The food here is really amazing. Each plate is lovingly cook to perfection for each customer. From the beginning to end, I can see that the chef is very passionate about his food and want to share it with his customers.

Definitely 5 stars.

We tried the top 3 items on the menu - Signature Mee Tai Mak, Dry Laksa and Dry Mee Siam. The Mee Tai Mak is fried with century egg! It is a very unusual ingredient for fried noodles but it blends in so beautifully! It is also full of wok hey! Excellent. The mee siam is so full of flavor! Dry laksa is also amazing.

All is nice but really recommend the signature mee tai mak!

Omy the mtm is really good! so much textures & flavours...can't really pinpoint everything but it is defo a pleasureable one!

Laska was lemak fragrant & really special!

Mee siam was OK, but I think cos I was wowed by the earlier 2 dishes more! But still a lovely dish though I wished it more tangy in its flavours!

Prawn paste chicken wings and prawn rolls are very nice. Dry meesiam is great after adding lime! Dry laksa is pretty good too. Mee tai Mak is not bad.

Tried the dry laksa small portion and the prawn roll. Was blown away by the taste. Also bought a calamamsi spread home to try. Will be back to try the mee tai bak and har cheong kai next round. Love that everything on their menu is tasty yet fairly priced. Will recommend that one order the medium size portion. Small portion is just not enough.

Ordered the dried laksa and mee siam. Both are bad. Dried laksa lacks the usual laksa aromatics eg. haebi, laksa leaf. Can only taste coconut milk. Dried mee siam is sweet and too wet a consistency. Overall just badly executed.

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
Another great all time favourite hawker centre that offers lots of local favourites in the evening from Bak Chor Mee, Seng Kee Kidney Mee Sua, Bbq chicken wings, Bbq sting ray, satay, fried carrot cake, fried hokkien mee and many more. Quite a small hawker centre with limited tables so it is best advised to be early to get your seats. Some of the stalls like the famous bak chor mee can be busy during peak periods and waiting time can be up to 45mins. Most of the stalls are self service. Not so much service there as we order and pay first, when the beeper beeps then you go collect. Tables are quite clean at times as most of us clear up after we eat. Prices of food are quite reasonable depending on what you order. Nice place for gathering with friends. Will definitely come back again from time to time. 😋👍⭐️

Tried 2 malay food stalls. One was good, the other passable

Found a quaint little stall selling kitchenware in the dry market section and picked up a nice little enamel mug that has the amazing ability of super-cooling hot water in the shortest time (shy of adding ice cubes)
Very rare to find such thick quality too
Rare find

The fish soup stall at one corner abutting walkway - Asked for one small bowl fish soup one big seafood soup with 2 white rice. Kept pestering me to try the yam rice. Must be unsold a lot. Told stall assistant (a chinese woman) no longer keen and walk away. Teruk!

First time here. Arrived at 3pm. Very quite. Only few stalls are opened. Tried foods as per photo. Amazing delicious!!

Pig organ soup with mee sua- vey thick herbal soup, pork kidney and pork liver are very clean without smell. The pork slices are very think and smooth.

Nasi lemak- OMG! It looks so ordinary but ho… I tell you, the chicken wing is a MUST to try! Marinated with spices and very juicy!!!! Lemak rice taste good as well.

Teow Chew fish ball noodle- the soup was long boiled with soybean and ikan bilis. Very clear soup based. I saw the soybean and ikan bilis still boiling in the soup. I couldn’t resist and asked a small portion to taste. OMG!!! Indeed very fresh ingredients! Fish ball also very chewy without fishy smell.

I also tried the Teow Chew laksa- their sambal got dried shrimp and shallot. Very fragrance and can eat bowls of rice just with it! Laksa gravy is very thick and fragrance. Beside si ham, they also served lala with the laksa.

My sons told me food here are even better than Bedok 85 food market! Hahaha..

We will definitely come back again from Kallang for our next visit! :)

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
The only stall opened in the evening so we had a nice quiet space to dine. The prawn paste chicken was seasoned very well. My husband liked the fish soup. Dishes were not too salty. Can’t ask a lot on the service as it is a hawker stall. We spent $30 for 2 of us. Might come back and try other dishes as stall owner seemed passionate and diligent with his craft.

Decided to do a dinner take-away at  this zi char stall at Blk.16 Bedok South. Wait time was slightly shorter than 20 minutes even though there were a bit of a queue. Pretty fast I must say. Ordered the following dishes and my taste bud's verdict: 1) Sweet sour fish; It tasted ok. Nothing to shout about. 2) Black soy sauce pork with ginger; The pork slices were tender with a nice gingery taste. The bits of fried pork lard gave an additional porky flavour. 3) Fried sambal kangkong; Sambal flavour was nicer than most places. 4) Fried rice; The rice was lumpy and soggy. There wasn't any wok-hei flavour in it. Disappointment. 5) Fried prawn paste chicken (Har cheong gai); Perhaps the best dish. The chicken wings were crispy on the outside and tender and juicy inside. My favourite dish here. 6) Fried tofu with vegetables; Tasted just like any other zi char stall. It's saving grace was the bits of fried pork lard which added an extra texture to the dish. Overall verdict: It's about the same as the average hawker centre/coffee shop zi char stalls.

We (3 covers) had Har Cheong Gai, crayfish soup, bitter gourd pork ribs, prawn omelette, and mixed vegetables with one rice for $48.

It’s a busy stall so it’s best to arrive and order before 7pm. Make your payment at the point of order and make sure you know your table number. Har Cheong Gai was amazingly juicy and crisply fried! The meat inside was tender but not very flavorful.

Overall it’s a great value, and delicious to boot!

Gem of a zhi char store at the hawker centre of Blk 216 Bedok North street 1. The food is generally delicious and cooked with good wok hei.

The prawn paste chick is crispy on the outside with good prawn paste flavour, and juicy on the inside. The braised red garoupa fish head with bitter gourd is very well seasoned, and for us the star of this meal. The Kang kong is properly cooked.

Prices are not quite Hawker centre level, but for the  food you get it’s well worth the money in my view.

One slight drawback: if you’re going for dinner, there are few other stalls open except for Sin Ho, so you’ll have to buy your own drinks.

Highly recommended.

They served a delicious seafood soup with a awesome broth. And the prawn paste chicken was equally tasty. It was nicely fried and had a fragrant prawn paste taste.

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
It was heartening to see young hawkers running this stall.

For $7, the prawns were bigger and fresh, and the soup was suitably umami. The little more heat with its chilli sauce would be great!

Expect to queue for 20 minutes 😉

Excellent comfort food, especially on a rainy day! Totally worth braving the rains for.

Consistently delicious ever since they opened years ago. They have the most tender and flavourful pork ribs I’ve ever tried from a prawn noodle stall, and they have such great balance of fat and meat. Decent bite sized pieces for ease of eating and they literally fall off the bones.

The prawns are so fresh, succulent and sweet! The bright orange hue on these prawns are the most vibrant I’ve seen at a prawn mee stall. The shells are peeled too, but fret not they meticulously leave the heads on for extra flavour boost! The soup has a well balanced richness without being too sweet or heavy (generous amount of soup too).

The chilli sauce really hits the spot of savory and heat. The fried garlic and shallots atop add great aroma and I especially love that they don’t scrimp on the vegetables! I’m in awe watching the team at work. Dining here is really always a treat.

Wanted to order $5 prawn bee hoon soup but the guy serving the customers asked me if I wanted to top up to $7 for more prawns. Since I waited for 20min, might as well. Regretted it though cos although the prawns were very fresh, I didn't think it was worth $7. There were 4 prawns, some bean sprouts and kang kong, fried pork lard and bee hoon. Soup was not flavourful enough. An OK bowl of prawn noodles but not worth queuing 20min for it. Not sure why there is a queue for this.

Saw many people eating it so I tried too. Prawns are big and fresh, not like the wrinkled ones some stalls serve. Noodles are nice. Soup is really good. Tried the $5, was good portion but I think I will get the $7 next time.

Operated by 2 young guys keep it up!

Amazing prawn mee with pork ribs. Pork ribs are very soft and you even can chew and eat the soft bone. Prawn soup is also very good. Love it when the prawns are not in halves and are de-shelled. Heartening to see young hawkers whipping up really good prawn mee. There are always long queue, even with aunties and uncles.

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
One of the great tasting Kway Chap aound. Even though the q was a bit long due to some not knowing what to order, the food was worth it. Had ordered for 2 person and added additional pork trotter and additional pork belly. Meat was so tender with the right amount of fats. Kway was smooth to the taste. Chilli was great addition to bring it up a notch. Worth every kilo, I m putting on. Hahahaha. Keep it up.

Very very long queue and expect to wait up to 30mins time. The kway chap is peppery and different from the usual. I believe they used many ingredients to boil the soup.

It is worth a try, if you are ok to wait in the queue!

Been wanting to try for quite some time but always didn't manage because of the long queue. Decided that I should at least try once.

Waited in queue for about half hour or so. They served standard set at $6 for 1 pax. You can state what you want or add more ingredients if you like.

Overall, the kway chap was delicious and certainly lived up to the long queue everyday!

Ordered 3 pax worth of kway chap for 2 pax. No awful/stinky smell, intestines are cleaned thoroughly, hair on pig skin is also removed (bought from this store multiple times, didn’t recall any purchase having observable hair follicle on the pig skin). Kway is silky and light. Overall, a hearty meal.
Only downside, definitely be prepared to q if you come on weekends. Waiting time is at least 15-30mins, depending on the time you come by.

So-so only. Very soft but ok nothing to shout about. The queue is long but the speed of serving is even worse. Which I think is why the queue is kept long always. I ordered one more egg and chicken feet so that set me back by $10.

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
Although I have been to his food centre umpteen times. Fortunately or unfortunately this is the first time I am having this. I am so glad that I did, or else I wouldn’t have known what I have missed out all along. This is definitely quality nasi lemak. For $4.40 for the ingredients shown, it is really value for money and delicious till the last bits - big and juicy chicken wing, authentic otah, thick-cut luncheon meat and crispy ikan bilis, and top notch rice and chilli. Because of the constant queue and quick turnover, the food is hot which adds to the pure enjoyment.

Value for money nasi lemak! You can expect a continuous long queue (as seen in the picture) in the early morning or lunch time. Fried chicken wings are well done, crispy and tasty.

Long queue but it’s move fast because there’s 2-3 staff at the counter helping with the ordering and packing of foods. Their fried anchovies very nice and crispy. Fried chicken was soft and nice too. Sambal chilli not too spicy. Overall is not bad and will definitely come back again.

Been eating the nasi lemak from this particular stall at bedok 216 hawker centre for at least the last 20 years. Used to takeaway their food on the weekend in the past. Happen to be running some errands near to 216 market decided to pop by for breakfast. I was quite surprised there wasnt a queue when i reached the stall. There were only 3 people ahead of me.

Ordered the stir fried long bean, fried boneless chicken thigh and sunny side up egg. Paid SGD$3 for my meal. Food was still nice after so many years. Room for improvement for the stir fried long bean as it tasted a little undercooked. Chili is on the sweeter side.

Shortly after purchasing my food, the long queue started.Overall, still enjoy the food. They only do takeaway over here.

One of the best Nasi lemak in the East, Otah & boneless chicken is the highlight! Otah is spicy yet savoury and boneless chicken is crispy and juicy, waiting time varies from 10-30 minutes! If you are driving, there is a carpark just right beside the hawker center, if it’s full, alternative there is a linked multi-story carpark.

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
Porridge, served in Cantonese style, ought to be like how it's sold here!

Customer service quality aside, this is where one must come for quality porridge. It will be perfect if the stall owners are friendlier and more customer-oriented...

Chai Chee pork porridge S$4.50 at fengshan foodcentre. the pork and minced pork is tender and fresh. Porridge is of a thick texture that do not go watery after stirring it. They also added a little preserved veg to it.
There are two stall having the same name, the one in morning and afternoon only $3.50, but at evening supper one is $4.50 got the same thing

A Delightful Return to Chai Chee Pork Porridge

Having the opportunity to return to Chai Chee Pork Porridge at Bedok 85 Market after all these years was nothing short of nostalgic bliss. Undoubtedly, this humble hawker stall remains an unbeatable classic, continually serving what I consider to be some of the best porridge in Singapore. The porridge remains as mesmerizingly smooth as I remembered, capturing the essence of this beloved local staple. A testament to consistency, quality, and an unwavering commitment to the art of porridge making. So, if you find yourself at Bedok 85 Market, Chai Chee Pork Porridge is a culinary pit stop you simply can't afford to miss.

A long wait of 45 minutes for a Sat dinner meal. Compare to the two famous mincemeat noodles, our beeper finally sounded.
The porridge is silky with an alluring fragrant.
The pork mincemeat is out of this world and make us wonder why we did try this before.

The porridge is like glue. Also quite saltish. I ordered a fish porridge. Other than fish, spring onion and glue-like porridge, nothing else. Waiting time is quite long due to many takeaways. A disappointment.

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
Depending on what kinda atmosphere you are looking for, the ratings here will vary for you 🤭 if u r looking for a local feel, this market nails it. Come in the evening for a great buzzing ambience, with great food to boot. From staples to carbs to sides to desserts to drinks… this place has it all. A one-stop-have-it-all, & great pricing to top it all off. A fav come-back-to spot for me

Sufficient seating space and tables spaced out & sufficient. Many options for seafood-related tze char. People often order stingray & it’s indeed quite decent though can expect the usual greasiness of hawkers.
Healthier options might be their spinach soup / herbal soups?

Seafood lovers might find it better than East Coast lagoon 😅pretty accessible if you stay in the neighbourhood.

Quite quiet in the afternoon. But gets busy from 5+pm onwards

There’s dessert such as chendol or ahballing or muffins.

Sufficient bike parking space around

Ah B Fried Prawn Noodle stall located at 85 Bedok, and it was an experience worth raving about. What sets them apart is their choice to fry the noodles with a combination of normal bee hoon and yellow noodles, resulting in a delightful medley of textures and flavors. The star of the show, undoubtedly, was the generously sized prawn that adorned the dish – it was incredibly. If you’re looking for a satisfying and flavorsome plate of fried prawn noodles, this stall is an absolute gem that you shouldn’t miss!👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

We've found our new favorite spot for Ngoh Hiang thanks to "Er Jie Ngoh Hiang Prawn Fritter". The atmosphere in the food centre was bustling and lively, which made for a fun dining experience. My friends and I thoroughly enjoyed every single dish we ordered.

The bee hoon was outstanding - perfectly soft, chewy and non-greasy. All the items were fried to absolute perfection. You can tell the stall puts in effort to use only the freshest, highest quality ingredients. But the standout for me was their homemade chili sauce. It had a uniquely rich and complex flavor that packed just the right amount of heat. The sauce alone is worth a return visit for.

Service was quick and friendly without being overbearing. There's a reason people were lining up even on a weekday - the food here is truly that delicious. I'm obsessive about finding the best hawker fare, and this little gem easily blew all my previous favorites out of the water.

This will definitely be my first recommendation anytime someone asks about must-try hawker stalls in the area!

First time at bedok 85. Worth travelling the distance for, the food here were pretty good not disappointed. Favourite was the porridge with a raw egg dropped in 🫦
Austrian cuisine in Bedok.opening_hours:

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
14.05.23 Lunch $7 / ordered just Sliced Fish Soup,  Large size.  Generous with the lettuce n reasonable slices of fish n some tofu. Nice soup with the salted tang chai (mustard leaves) n friendly uncle who took orders. Edible but not necessarily will want to join if Q is long.

Not sure if they are affiliated to the famous Han Kee fish soup at Amoy since both share the same stall name.

Average waiting time: 10-15 mins

Teochew style, the sliced fish is fresh and it’s interesting that they sells braised pig skin & tau pok.

Love their chewy pig skin - $1.50 per serving.

If the fish slices are thicker that will be perfect.
How much I paid for it. Answer is $4.
Value for money, I don't think so. 2/5
Taste of it is definitely good. Meaning same as the rest. It is oily for fish Soup see photo here 3/5
Service is 5/5.
Can be better? Definitely YES!
Coming back? Perhaps when I see more better review that they have improved.  (Of genuine reviews)

The taste is alright. Won't say really out of the world.

Price is considered not cheap for their standards. Maybe cos of inflation.

Pretty decent sliced fish soup. Broth is clear amd light but packs with ton of flavours.generous portion of fish. Good alternative to the milk base fish soup that i usually been eating

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.name: Han Kee Fish Soup

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
Superb, now I understand the lines that form even before their official opening hours. For a basic $4 order of fish ball mee pok, you get a fish dumpling, 2 meatballs, and about 3 or 4 yellow-tail fish balls with the noodles. You can also get 10 meatballs or fish balls for $3, or 20 fish dumplings for $6.

Every component is done really well, especially the yellow-tail fish balls and chili for the noodles. The fish balls are a good balance between springy and tender, and are flavorful. The chili is fragrant and leaves you wanting more with each bite. No frills, seemingly no secrets, just a fantastic and humble bowl of fish ball mee pok.

This stall is located within the popular Bedok 216 hawker center. Been patronizing this stall for more than 20years and the standard is the same till date , the only thing that stop me from eating it often is the waiting time and long queue. So if you wanna try, do be prepared to queue more than 30mins. Noodles was nicely cooked and springy, soup was excellent, light and tasty. The highlights is actually their handmade fishball, smaller size compared to those we usually eat but the freshness and texture make up from it. Personally I find the seasoning is alittle too salty to my liking else this will be one of the perfect fishball noodles around.

A long queue snakes a corner unit of Blk 216 Bedok Food Centre and Market on a typical Thursday lunchtime. Queue moved quite fast and was informed there has to be mix of Fishballs and Meatballs as they were running out of Fishballs.

Service wise, the lady taking the order will help you take the tray, chopsticks and spoon, a rare occurrence amongst hawkers.

Fishballs tasted good, meatballs tasted generic but I have no complains. For the $5 portion shown, it provides exceptional value amid rising costs.

payment options: cash and cashless

Opening hours:
630am - 130pm
Rest day: Wednesdays

If you are a fishball noodle lover, it is very likely you have eaten here (as well as the one at 538 Bedok North) many times. Somehow I like the presentation here better, and it seems the portion is more generous. The fishball is very soft and I particularly like the soup here which tastes sweet it is boiled with soy beans. There is some queue so expect some waiting especially if you go at peak hours.

This stall always has a long queue.  today I wanted to give it a try, which required a queue of more than half an hour.  curious about the taste, the fish ball is not too salty and I like the texture which is soft and not too chewy, not too fishy either.  the noodles are not that much different from other stalls.  the soup is fresher and not too salty.

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
Food was good and cheap! Sold out by 6pm :o love the herbal soup :))

538 kitchen stall foods are nice, and prices are reasonable.

Lotz of food variety here at very reasonable prices. Can come and try. I had 1 bowl of Laksa plus 1 ice coffee, cost me $5.10.

I saw a few trays of eggs being sun outside at the temp of 35-37c.. that's a risk of breeding bacteria in the raw eggs and can subject to food poisoning esp in the elderly who has weaker immunity. I cannot confirm which stall does that, but it is sun together with some dried fish. And only 1 stall facing the tray of eggs uses dried fish and plenty of eggs in their noodles. Go figure out. NEA should do an investigation in this.

There’s this small unique shop in between the hawker Center and the wet market #01-14 that sells attractive and value-4-$ stuff; check it out!

Austrian cuisine in Bedok.reviews:
Been here many times in the past. Today I try this Prawn 🦐 noodles stall. Quite a good portion for $4 bowl.  Broth is just nice. Good value meal!

It been years since i last came here, since my mom wish to visit this hawker after watching some youtubbers video, so came see see and find some nice food. I start my day with a bowl of pretty nice soy chicken noodles, noodles was springy and chicken was tender. Kwap chap not bad also, forgot to take pictures of it.🤭 since we sitting right in front of fried kwap teow so we decide join in the crowd🤦‍♂️. 45 mins of wait, char kwap teow was okok but the wait is way too long. The kopi o from jia ping coffee stall was nice and fragrant. 👍

A market that comprises of both the wet and dry market. Good variety of food here for the locals to consume and fill their tummies. Very convenient place situated beside a Junior College! Friendly bird also that sometimes visit your table to check up on you and want to share your food

This has always been one of my favourite hawker centres since young. After renovation, it is now clean, spacious and airy. There are lots of good food here for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Famous stalls include the fishball noodles, rojak, nasi briyani etc. My favourite drink stall is Farah’s cafe. The owners are super friendly 😊. Cheers.

My friend from Temasek JC (right opposite this hawker centre) claimed that this place has the best mala in town. So I came here and chose a bunch of veggies to make a vegetarian mala bowl for my friend and I, and oh my god, it was so delicious, the peanuts gave such a good crunch, the spice was just right, the lotus stem and bean curd were so yum and the overall meal was so flavourful and filling. Definitely a must try!!! And I must say, the lady who made our mala was also so sweet :)
The opposite stall had Teh Peng which was amazing too but just a note, they only accept cash and CDC vouchers, so do bring cash/vouchers along with you!

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
Ordered the $39 set menu for 2 which came in fairly small portions. Their signature sweet sour pork with lychee is good, not overly sweet nor sour. The bean curd vegetable dish was on the bland side. Our fried rice had some wok hei but the portion is more for a person instead of 2. The herbal prawns (6 of them) soup was not over powering of herbs if one is not fond of angelica. The free dessert was white fungus with red dates. Although sweet, it was cold and a nice way of ending my meal. Good thing abt this place is no GST or service charge and actually the service personnel is attentive and polite. Food was served fast as well.

Putian style food place. Neat and nice location. Ordered the set meal for 2 pax. Food is tasty enough but portion is more for small eaters. In fact the portion can be finished by 1 person with big appetite. Drinks like tea and coffee can be ordered from the coffee shop next door and consumed.

1. They have worms in their broccoli. I found 2 worms so i minus 2 stars
2. They served me one of the hardest and toughest chicken i’ve eaten so i minus 1 star
The rest of the food served tastes fine, not too bad lor.
But if you have a fear of worms I don’t recommend you to come (:

Fast turn around, fast serving, attentive staff, friendly and great food.

Highly recommended the xin hua thin noodle if you like stir fried bee hoon. If you like soupy kind, you can op for fujian noodle.

If you can take raw seafood, you can try the garlic raw cockles.

A very popular small eatery in Lorong Ah Soo. About 4 tables inside and 4 outside the restaurant. Can get crowded at peak hours for lunch and dinner. Ample parking available.

Tried the Putian Lor Mee and fried sweet potato noodles. Flavour is mild but delicious. At $6 for 1 pax it is reasonable price for restaurant setting.

Can order dishes when dining with more pax. There is enough variety for a yummy lunch or dinner.
