Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
The portion is big and it only cost $7 !!! But I think their usp is the sauce of the chicken chop, so the fish and chips just soso lah and they even didn’t give tartar sauce just a normal mayonnaise. Recommended for all their chops except fish and chips.

Tried this stall many years ago and ventured to try out again with my son and daughter. There's a pretty long queue but it is moving fast with efficiency. We ordered mixed grill ($12), Pork Chop ($7) and Chicken Chop ($7). The friendly service crew processed the orders very quickly and deliver the food to our table within 15 minutes.

Portion wise, they are huge! Taste wise, I would say there's some room for fine tuning and improvement. But its already pretty decent and tasty.

I noticed that the several tables around me, all ordered mixed grill too. So its a very popular choice here. Your have Chicken, Pork and lamp meat on the same hot plate. Very satisfying experience, dining here.

The legendary Hougang Ah Beng western.. The food is excellent.. But at the price point don't expect very good service.. Want service, go restaurants and pay service charge. Atmosphere, coffee shop, don't expect air con.. Want air con, go restaurants and pay service fee..
Nothing to complain, just simple western food..

Patronised this store more than 20yrs ago, i rem manned by a few ah bengs at that time, very popular stall with a messy q system. Fast forward 20yrs later, still popular, seemed to be manned by same guys and chicken chop is still good. Pork chop can skip though, too hard. Portion of the sides quite generous.

One of the best western food hawker stalls I've ever tried. Seriously don't know why it has such a low rating, portions are good, meat is well cooked and tender, and prices are very reasonable. Will be able to enjoy it more since I'm moving across the road very soon!
Polish food in Hougang.opening_hours:

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
One of the best Ayam Penyet I’ve had given the kick of the sambal & flavoursome of the rice! The chicken itself was crispy, and huge. I’m always ordering it via GrabFood, and given the 10-15mins delivery time, food was always served at its best quality. Never fails to disappoint. Other dishes like the Briyani and satay as well were delicious! Definitely something you should try given the price 🫶🏻

Their food is ok, butter rice is nice. Chicken cutlet reminds me of my secondary school fried chicken snack. The price increases a few times. I order online but they gave me wrong/missing order. If order at their stalls, the preparation could take sometimes, then sometimes they will closed their stalls to go smoking at the carpark.

Generous portions, delicious food, friendly staff! Western Ambeng idea was definitely a hit with the family as usually everyone is so fickle for iftar choices and they love the variety of sauces as well!

Underrated western food that happens to be halal. Warm and friendly staff that greets with a smile. Food portion is very very generous. The aglio olio is especially superb. Worthy of #cleanplateclub

Decided to check out the long queue that is consistent during peak hours. While cooking time may varies depending on what you order. There is a buzzer system and I will say it is worth the wait. Taste wise I got what I paid for. If there is one small niggle, the price is considered on the mid tier side considering it is inside ci yuan cc.
Polish food in Hougang.opening_hours:

Polish food in Hougang.address: 51 Hougang Ave 9, #01-39 & #01-41 Ci Yuan Hawker Centre, Singapore 538776
Polish food in Hougang.name: Brostern

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
Very patient staff and you can tell they’re trying their best to cater to every needs. There was a customer complaining of bad smells and I saw them shuffling around just to please that guy despite a rather busy weekend. (To begin with, I wonder why that guy chose a table near the toilet)

Anyway, the food is unique here. Expect your Benedict’s with salted egg sauce, chicken with Milo and ice cream served in tempura style.

Ambience is a little warm for me despite Aircon running at full blast.

Made a reservation but was late but staff were super friendly and understanding. Ordered Egg Benedict and Salted Egg Chicken Burger, upgraded to the set with Cappuccino and Mushroom Soup. Food came super fast, like within 5-10 minutes of ordering! The cappuccino and mushroom soup were great, loved the latte art 🥰 Also the eggs Benedict was on point, compared to other eggs Benedict dishes I’ve had at other cafes. Servings were generous and left feeling very satisfied.

Reasonable prices, good service and atmosphere, waiting times can be a bit long. Coffee was fragrant and not acidic. Unfortunately I found the raclette to be too pungent, even more so than blue cheese. Otherwise this is a nice small Cafe to hang out at.

Had dinner here. Found this place by accident. The food was delicious. Certain portion was a tad salty but not a deal breaker. Definitely need to make a reservation the next time I'm coming here.

We came here at 2pm on a Sunday, not crowded but the service was damn slow and bad. We ordered at 2:11pm, 1 steak with 5 dollars top up for the cheese and 1 salmon. Half an hour later at 2:41pm, the food were still not here so we went to ask the staff, they said 6 more minutes. Waited for about another 8 minutes still no food so went to ask again and they replied rudely "now, now, now!" Ended up our food were still not here. Finally my salmon arrived, only the fish was hot, the sides were all cold, terrible! Steak arrived around 2:52pm and we had to wait another 5 minutes for the cheese that we paid $5 for. Of course the steak turned cold! Ordered medium rare, what came was medium well to well done. Come on... you all can do better, waited more than 50 minutes for trash food. My hubby ate 1 mouthful and asked for refund. Within 1 minute, the female cook came to clear the food angrily making quick and noisy moves. Wow, serve so slow clear so fast, worst service I've experienced.

Polish food in Hougang.name: Flavour Flings

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
Have a sudden craving for chicken and visited Arnold’s. Fried Chicken was tasty, however the chicken parts were relatively small given their price point. The coleslaw is refreshing and the other sides were acceptable.

For a price of $13, including a soft drink. It’s really on the high side.

Fried Chicken: 4/5
Coleslaw: 5/5
Fries: 4/5
Fried Bun: 5/5
Price: 3/5

Fried chickens were not too oily. Fries were good - crispy on the outside and mushy potatoes insides. Overall, a decently good meal albeit higher price. Restaurant environment can be improved - didn't feel very clean.

I always love Arnold Chicken one of the best in SG
The way they fry the chicken is tasty
Great chicken

The chicken is crispy and not too oily. Waited a short while after ordering despite been a PH today but the mashed potato is lose out to kfc.

Just because it's almost always non crowded, one of my favorite branch.

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
1 of the best porridge I've tried . The serving is quite a lot. Big chunks of liver in the porridge with fried shallots and spring onions. The porridge is tasty and smooth. Don't mind coming back again to try the other options . It's crowded during lunch time but the shop assistant will help you find seats

the congee is well seasoned and the ingredients inside are soft and flavorful too. the you tiao is crispy and not too oily, the century egg has a very distinguishable ginger and vinegary taste, plus being served cold helps to cool down the porridge and giving you a much better experience. in addition, the kaya toast is well toasted and crunchy and the soft boiled egg is perfect.

How can a porridge restaurant garner such a high number of reviews and such a high rating? The answer is the porridge is really that good and very affordable.

There weren't much seats in the restaurant so most people would opt to takeaway. The queue was quite long and I had to wait about 30minutes for my porridge. Even though I ate it about an hour later, it was still piping hot.

The porridge had a slightly smoky aroma with a gooey consistency like typical Cantonese porridge. Initially I was afraid that I wouldn't be full so I added on some sliced pork to my pork ball and century egg porridge, and a youtiao but I kinda regretted it as they were so generous with the ingredients that I felt like I just came back from a buffet after finishing the porridge.

I would recommend getting the minced pork ball and century egg as the combination works the best.

Best porridge in town! Be prepared to queue for at least 15 mins and then wait about 30 minutes for your piping hot bowl of creamy goodness chockful of ingredients! Go for the signature porridge. My parents frequently travel accross the island just to eat here. Ingredients are generous and great quality, squid thick and tender, liver so velvety and just ooh la la. It can be confusing to secure a table, approach the lady manning the delivery station. Price? Cheap! For the quality you pay!

This is one of the best porridge in Singapore. A must try. Their porridge, by default, is already salty. Remember to taste before adding any more soy sauce.

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
A gem in Hougang serving a good variety of western food from fresh oyster to the typical chicken and pork chop. Pork chop was tender though we wish there’s options to choose the sides. Mushroom soup was decent and fried was well fried. The cheesy escargot was unique. We dipped the Fried with the cheese! Generous portion for spaghetti. Staff were friendly too. Cashless option via QR code payment available.

1st time there. Their grilled pork chops (bestseller) was really tender and especially flavourful (eat with their mustard). The portobello was nicely breaded and fried under their Portobello with grilled chicken. Good deal to add soup with drink for extra 5.90. Place coikd do with some background music to liven up thd restaurant. Will be back tk try others in menu.

The staff was coughing badly and didn't wear a mask! I am irked by this behaviour after the COVID pandemic. The prawn and grilled chicken pasta was not bad, but the "aglio olio" lacked parsley flavour. It tasted like garlic and chilli pasta. The mushroom soup was also not flavourful and lacked texture. I prefer to have some bigger bits of mushrooms for texture and bite.

We were there to hold an event on behalf of Make-a-Wish Foundation for one of our wish child. Very impress with the food and services.

Just bought oysters for takeaway, and I'm impressed how well packed they are. Even more impressive are the plump and fresh oysters! They are really juicy and super tasty!

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
A convenient place to get yummy similar to home cooked food, plenty of dish choices for you to choose from. Some could be a little bit salty though, but generally we enjoy the food. It’s almost a monthly must have. Price could be on the high side when you choose a lot of dishes.

Their sides are really fragrant and delicious! Just wish it wasn't so pricey and had bigger portions. We spent about $10 for 3 pax since we got 4 bowls of porridge and 5 sides.

Their duck is so chewy and delicious! Paired with their crunchy taogeh and just a strip of parsley :)

I like their braised tofu which had a LARGE pirtion of minced pork on top. Dip a cube into their braised sauce and its so tender to tear into the tofu skin!

Their sweet and sour pork is nothing special, just a little cold.

Overall its good but just too pricey and a little expensive. But good quality and fast!

Long standing Teochew Muay of this area, famous for customer fighting and smashing the stall some years ago. Overall the food is good and service is not bad if not busy hours. Authentic old school dishes that comfort the stomach. Pricing is on the very expensive side, good to bring foreigners here to get sticker shock on how expensive road side food can be in Singapore. Parking is as bad as forever. The best dish is the salted veg chilli stingray, the sauce pour into the porridge wah like shiok and feeling old school childhood. Overall it’s good.

Really love the food here 😋😋

They have large variety of dishes to choose from.😁

Particularly I really like their sweet & sour pork, egg tofu dish and their mince (pork) meat w/ salted egg.😋👍

Their prices are very reasonable too 👍

And they are strategically located along the Upper Serangoon Room and within walking distance to Kovan MRT Station.

Will definitely comeback here again for dinner or supper 😁

Wide variety of selection. Decent porridge. But not fantastic. Reasonable pricing. Best thing is stall open 24hours. Expect to queue during peak hours. Parked at carpark blk373.

Polish food in Hougang.name: Heng Long Teochew Porridge @ Upper Serangoon

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
Used to love their pistachio eclairs from the main outlet at Beo Cres and bought some from this outlet. Price remained unchanged but size has shrunk w fewer pistachio bits. Dry inside too :(
The cendol cake is less sweet and not cloying altho coconut fragrance is very light so probably friendlier for those watching calories.

I went down to buy mini cakes, trying them to decide if I want to get them for my baby's full month.

I like the apple tarts - crunchy and nice.
The chendol cakes and mango pomelo cakes are on par - both taste interesting and refreshing.
Ondeh ondeh cake is also not bad.
Chocolate mousse is a boring choice but my kid loves it.
Pistachio eclair looks nice, but was disappointing as it tastes too sweet.

Review is for their online purchase, got the 25 pieces corporate gift box. Most of the cakes are variations on the swiss roll theme, with "traditional" flavours and fillings. So onde onde is pandan swiss roll with a coconut/gula melaka filling (our favourite), while chendol was pandan swiss roll with gula melaka as the "jam". The mango cake was more ordinary, while the choux pastry was good. Prices are very reasonable, the cakes look really attractive, and it feeds 25 people, or 12 very greedy people.

Bought 2 boxes of 25 pieces for my family gathering. The cakes in the premium box are perfect, just open and can serve my guest. I love the apple crumble, very nice and crunchy. Love the ondeh ondeh cake, resemblance of the real ondeh. I ordered online because they sold out really early some times, so in order not to be disappointed, I ordered online and collect at their shop. Lady at counter was really nice, swift and easy collection as it was ready when I arrived at their shop. Recommended and definitely will order again!

Bought 4 different cakes to try. All are nice. Personally I  prefer the onde. Will come back again!

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
No prices are displayed. Roast duck drumstick is $10.80 at a kopitiam, can get better quality at lower price elsewhere.
Char siew, roast pork are above average and priced more reasonably priced at $5.50

Don’t you love surprises? Like finding money in your pockets you didn’t know you had, I mean like a $2 note, ain’t nobody happy to find coins. Or having a smiling competition with a random child in public. Or having random past thoughts that bring a smile to your face every once in a while. That bit of surprise mix with joy are the little funny things makes this life fun.

I was on my way to play some sports around this area and I haven’t eaten anything all day. Wanted to fast all day and grab a big feast after my game. So while walking over to the court I had to walk by this coffee shop and food stalls. My big behind couldn’t hold it anymore so I gave in and broke fast.

Saw this roast place and decided to give it a try. Hard to go wrong with chinese roast. Lady greeted me, I put my order she told me to sit down and she brought the order to me. Got some noods, char siew and roast pork. The meat was really good, flavorful, succulent, juicy and roast to perfection.

I haven’t had the chance to visit my favorite roast place in a while. But not gonna lie this one is freaking good might be number #1 for me as of now due to recency bias. But with this new found location, why does every good roast that I like most be so far away.

Had roast duck, roast pork and char siew with rice. Roast pork skin is crispy, the other 2 meat so so nia... same standard as the stall at the market

Decent n pretty QQ wanton noodles at S$4 but eventhough I have asked for extra chilli 🌶 but it was still not spicy. Don't see any lards bits or chunks accompanying the noodles. I have had better wanton noodles elsewhere.

Had char siew roast pork rice ($5.50) for lunch, was ok.

Polish food in Hougang.name: Guan Chee Hong Kong Roasted Duck

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
A very small stall which might go unnoticeable if you don't walk close to it, am impressed with the number of flavours it offers. Of course am not going to try the usual stuff so I got the green tea and the yam. Price is pretty reasonable and the size of each is quite big. The filling is really quite thick so the mee jiang kueh is almost bursting.

Value for money and definitely a good snack for the sweet tooth people.

Chunky and generous paste fillings with very thick pancake (mee jiang kueh) skin and crust. Sold out by early to mid lunch time.

Very popular Min Jiang Kueh! It was a bit on the sweet side for me, and each serving is quite filling.

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
21/11/23
Teochew cuisine. Visit during weekday lunch hour and it is not crowded. Egg fried oysters, fried Chye Poh kway tiao, prawn ball and Lor duck are very nice. Kong Ba Bao looks good but the meat is about tough to chew and also prefer more five spice flavour. Fish maw and noodles are average.

Visited on 24 Sep 2023 for birthday meal. Ordered 10 dishes.. food generally good like the claypot tofu, fried oyster came instead of oyster omelette.. fried horfun with cai po, and lor duck.. but the rest not so tasty and was told its not teochew enough, though I am Cantonese.. Still the service is not too good when it's busy. Asked waiter 3 times to order food, but nobody entertained us.. the food here is pricey.. our bill comes to $218.60 for 9 pax..

This is my first time here, and I came because my Teochew cousin invited me. Personally, I feel that the food doesn't quite taste like traditional Teochew dishes, such as Or Nee. Most of the dishes seemed tailored to suit the customers preferences. They were also quite salty, and we provided this feedback.

(P.S. I’m Teochew grew up eating traditional Teochew dishes)

Food is good but generally expensive. Situated in a old shopping centre with narrow car park.  Timing of food served can be inconsistent. Some dishes were served very late

1st time trying. We ordered 6 items + 1 dessert, and total cost $300. Good is generally good, with outdoor (aircon) seating inside the mall. Easily accessible and parking is available just below the building. The Teo Chew fried Hor fun is very tasty and have Wok Hei. The fish soup cost about $100, and fresh fish and can top up the soup. Overall is good and recommended.
Polish food in Hougang.name: Fragrant Garden

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
Different from the usual japanese ramen. However, food was served hot and noodle was well done. Volcano sauce is 👍 and spicy.
Lifetime membership for cashback discount  next visit.

The place is rather neglected. But customer service is number one . The staff are mostly older aged and I really respect them working despite the difficulty they may face . Came during off peak and really enjoyed the company . But the place was neglected in a sense that the lights were dusty and the walls painting are rusty and browned.
The food was alright , I got the tomyum chicken ramen and the tomyum was actually rather good . Got the fish cakes too but not really to my liking . It's like those Thai fish cakes that are super thick and hard to chew .

Service is good. Aunty very kind to refill drinks.however gyoza is meh ..do not order it.. Total failure. Ramen cmi. And the miso soup taste so weird i did not want to take second scoop. I tot it was some new ramen restaurant . Only found out it is ajisen..........

Very rude staff. Especially the middle aged woman with a bun. As a vegetarian, I sincerely hoped that the restaurant could accommodate to my dietary requests and help me modify the broth for the Veg Ramen.  My friend and I had dined here previously so I called her up to explain my dietary request more explicitly and clearly in Chinese to the staff (since I don’t speak the language). However the lady was SO stuck up and kept making snarky remarks “Excuse me, we speak English” and also told my friend “Your friend doesn’t understand how to order you should clarify to her” - which was SO unnecessary and uncalled for especially if the customer is confused about the dish. Upon clarification, I placed my order. Then she served the incorrect topping (spice). When I inquired, she dismissed my request altogether and just spoke to my partner saying “I don’t think she understands so let me explain it to you instead” - first of all, they are making me pay extra for a VEG set with no protein (I was basically paying $2 just for the spice) and ON TOP OF this daylight robbery she has the audacity to be plain rude. To anyone reading this, save yourself the trouble and go to a better Ramen place :) The 1 STAR is literally just for the gyoza cause it was yum.

Food was served promptly and noodle is Q and just right. Just that their Vocano ramen isn’t spicy. Staffs are polite and especially an auntie who is very friendly and helpful.

Sad to say, today’s f&b in most restaurants out there, most staffs only do what they need to do and doesn’t bother to even show you a smile. Appreciate the auntie who chatted with our toddler and did not gave black face when he made a mess on the dining table and floor. While we tried to clear up, she stopped us and told her not to worry (seriously we had seen many others just kept quiet - we parents clean up, they can do lesser work, ain’t?) and chat with our toddler.

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
This is a HDB coffeeshop selling the usual food - Mixed vegetable rice, Zhi char, roast meat, noodle, prata, coffee/tea, noodle, dim sum etc. Good place for breakfast in a clean, nice, and peaceful environment.

The usual neighborhood Coffee Shop.....gets really hot in the afternoon esp at this time of the year. There's a very nice and patient auntie selling Punngol Mee Goreng and Char Kway Teow.  I was surprised that she'd still deliver each order to her customer's table even though it's lunch-time and she was the only one operating the stall......she'd even collect money later just to start with the next order.  The Hokkien Mee is only available from Fri to Sunday unfortunately for us.....we'll be back soon we hope.

Please patronise her stall when you next visit this coffee shop.

Renovated 3 mths ago, the kopitiam is very nice and clean. The food stall are majority new with the old stall holders moved out.
Food choices are average but prices of drinks have risen fairly since the renovation.

Coffee stall staff ability to make cofee and tea is so so and they are slow and with strange attitude. 118 coffee shop has such a better standard. It is more expensive than 118. Staff never smiles and seems highly unhappy to work at this place. The boss must question if he is doing things right.

i ate at the western stall and THE CARBONARA WAS AMAZING, pasta soft, nice cream🤤🤤 Chicken cutlet WAS AMAZING, THAT CRUST BRUH I LOVE IT PLUS DAMN SILKY AND JUICY
CHICKEN WING WAS SOOOOO JUICY AND CRISPY ON GOD BRUH SO GOOD
THE FRIES WERE SEASONED PERFECTLY TOO (shown in picture)
9/10 reccomend
Polish food in Hougang.name: BGAIN 121 Eating House

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
Like to eat onion prata but find the price $2.30($1 over plain prata )unreasonable as onions is very cheap.
So got the Prata kosong which is pretty fragrance and quite crispy but Egg's Benedict is disappointing, very salty with the ham and fried cheese gives a weird taste & texture.... soften and spoilt the prata. Dal curry is plain salty w/o fragrance nor texture.
The Mutton Mysore is soso and the fish Assam curry is surprisingly good despite some reviewed that it's sour and watery🤔, hello it's Assam curry!
Can come eat the prata kosong 👍

Ordered bull’s eye and Egg Benedict Prata. Bull’s eye nicely done. But sadly Egg Benedict’s yolk was broken during the process. Staff apologised to me and I said it’s okay. Good service. But the Prata still taste good 👍

Tried the kosong, the thosai and the paper thosai. The prata was fluffy and crunchy on the outside. The thosai and paper thosai texture is nice.

As for the fish curry, find that it is lacking in flavor. Mainly can taste sourness. I feel that a dash of salt will bring up the flavor. Possible that the chef wants to create a healthier version and reduced the salt. Anyway, I am giving feedback more based on the taste :).

Tried this Prata stall run by young enterprising owners. Their food is made to order. We ordered the cheese Prata and Egg Benedict. The cheese they used is mozzarella cheese, not the normal square ones. The Egg Benedict Prata is very creative and it elevates the prata dish to next level. Love how the egg benedict was done and it goes well with the prata and turkey ham and cheese. The mutton gravy was thick and full of flavour. Very shiok. What impresses us is the cleanliness of their stall. Will definitely frequent this stall. A must go to for Prata craving.

Briyani and the chicken was very dry and so little curry provided. Somehow was not provided curry for the bull's eye but it was still nice but my expectations is certainly dropped

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
Conveniently located within the heartland of Hougang Avenue 8 where it’s surrounded by hdb flats, this supermarket is definitely strategically located to serve the residents staying in that area. It is pretty well stocked up even though it isn’t a huge place but most of the products are relatively cheaply priced, including my favourite fish essences and other daily necessities and also taoist prayer products such as prayer paper products for ancestral worshipping. Rice packs also come in interestingly small bags meant for occasional cooking or product sampling.  Staff are also observed to be jovial towards one another. Highly recommended to patronise this outlet! (Photos pending...)

A variety of spices & cleaning detergents that are value for money.
I love buying the owl kopi o without sugar. But the prices of this product has gone up fast exorbitantly...from $4/50 to $5/50 n now $6/95...wondering why the sudden spike for this product.
Overall, a convenient store with helpful staff.

Very helpful for everyone to buy daily food

Very convenient just 2 blocks away. Nice service staffs. But only accept cash and nets.

Relatively very low in prices of most items.

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
Kindly know there is a staff working there name Tan Er Fu make a girl pregnant outside and don't want be responsible . Working as a prime supermarket supervisor u der fruits and vegetables.

Good place to get all your supermarket items for the home. Some of the prices are even cheaper than at Seng Siong.

Small store, but organized and you get everything. Has a separate cutting section for fish/chicken (halal) and pork stall. If you are in hurry and grab few fruits or snack on the go, you can pay by cash at counter outside /around fruit section.

A pretty small supermkt but you are able to get most of the daily essential necessities here. A bit cramp, making walking a little difficult at times when crowded. Prices are reasonable.

It is a 24 hr supermarket within hdb area, so it is very convenient to shop. Bus stops are within very short distances.

Unfortunately this wins by being the only supermarket in this vicinity. Don’t have much choice of items (soya sauce: only a few brands, margarine: only 3 types). Personally I don’t like to feel forced to make a decision based on limited options but that’s what it is for the convenience of location and 24 hours.
My go-to choices are the Tampines Giant or NTUC at Hougang 1

Polish food in Hougang.name: Prime Supermarket

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
Decent selection of fresh products. Usually crowded on the weekends.
I'll normally choose weekday afternoon to drop by as it is quiet, yet fresh products are still available, as I can shop in peace.

+ There's a 4D outlet here too.
++ Apply for a Prime membership to enjoy 1% rebate

Its really nice that there is a supermarket with everything you will need right next to our house. Very good supermarket. Friendly Staff. Safety rules are followed. Prices are very reasonable.

Terrible attitude from one of the shelf-stackers who barged me out the way as he was 'first' to go down the aisle.

No apology, no regard for others let alone customers & really not worth conversing with the ignorant employee.

Suffice to say I did not buy anything from this pokey little so called supermarket & will never return. Overpriced as well, jst use a proper supermarket

Most of the cashiers including lady boss attitude problem. Deaf or mute to question asked. Hope to have alternative supermarkets within nearby walking distance.

Well stocked with daily foodstuff. Some good bargains. Friendly staff and very helpful, especially with older people.

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
Good place to buy some groceries such as magnolia omega low fat fresh milk,  oxtails, multi grains bread, butter, brown rice, potatoes, onions etc., shop or just stroll after having a delicious lunch and beverages at the kovan hawker centre.

Nice cosy place to get groceries. Nice ambience especially at the entrance area. Lots of variety to choose from. Many plant based meat to look out for too! Some are hidden near the canned ham/luncheon meat area or canned tuna area. Some are at the frozen meat fridges. Lots of ice cream selection. Lots of drinks selection. Lots of roast meat selection! Many marinated meat cuts for ready cooking at home! Unity is part of this NTUC. Even has a toilet for patrons to use if you really need to go. Staffs are very friendly and they have many self paying kiosk for use to skip the queue! Best of all it is open 24 hours!

Ready to eat Bentos at affordable prices & its fresh though the price drops after 2pm which is even better. Love their Korran snacks & biscuits too.

I am truly disappointed with this Ntuc outlet. It is supposed to be Fairprice FINEST but i just bought the boxes of blueberries and there is one box that has blueberries with mould on them. The grapes are not fresh as well. I really hope they will review their products again.

A quiet 24hours supermarket located in an isolated corner of kovan. It may not be a exhaustive supermarket with most item. However many household item and grocery could be found here.  I find their fresh meat selection a little lacking . Fresh pork selection are quite miserable at times. Management here are quite lacking as I experience all manned counter closing at once when they change shift. Overall most staff here are quite friendly and helpful.

Polish food in Hougang.name: FairPrice Finest Hougang St 21

Polish food in Hougang.reviews:
Neighborhood mall (non air-conditioned) with a variety of shops. Predominantly maid agencies and tuition centers. Nevertheless it has 3 coffee shops that serve pretty good food, and several reasonably good eateries/restaurants.

Pretty convenient heartland mall with a couple of amenities and f&b outlets catering to the masses. It’s an open air area, without air-conditioning. Many carpark options nearby amongst the HDB blocks. The food options are surprisingly good - many good finds and famous brands from all cuisines. Arnold’s friend chicken is here too. Sitting at the heart of the building is a massive food court with a unique alfresco dining for the zi char stall. Seems pretty confusing to navigate initially  with the lack of signages but overall a decent area to visit for the neighboring residents.

Spanish style mall with our fave vegetarian restaurant Green by choice. It has also 7/11, pet supplies store, food court with Al fresco seating under the stars and a large supermarket.

But beware! if you ever venture into the rickety basement carpark, do park at your own risk. There are broken rusty pipes sticking out awkwardly in car park lots waiting to scratch your car. The management tried to warn drivers by tying some feeble ribbons around these pipes. Alas I only saw them when I had to investigate what I had backed into. Sigh.

Update in Jun 2023- there is now a cordon on the offending lot. Must be many offended parkers…

A good place to go for eateries and hawker food.

Looks like promising but disappointed. Not much choice for halal food. I wonder, muslims community staying in hougang, how do they survive with less choice of halal food? Especially morning breakfast with only 1 malay stall, taste wise, so so

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
The food was really amazing. I really enjoyed everything on the all-inclusive menu that we had. Every dish was delicious. It was a shame the only dish recommended to us was not available.  I can't score the atmosphere as high as we were the only table all dinner. So you feel a little looked upon by everyone working there. I also think price wise for the all you can eat and drink package I think it's expensive, really the same as a hotel price, the portion sizes maybe could be a little small and reduce the price a little, we didnt have room for dessert, but they were already included on the menu, we did ask for another drink but was refused. We had a good time and probably would come back in the future

New Moroccon restaurant run by a very friendly Moroccan owner who's super helpful and has built a great varied menu that we thoroughly enjoyed.

Going as a group to this restaurant is probably a good choice so you can order a few different dishes and try as they are all good for sharing.

The specia slow cookedl lamb shoulder dish was our favourite, the lamb was so tender and juicy and meat falling off the bone, cooked perfectly with rice and the combination was wonderful.

We tried Tajine and few other dishes which were all good and made it for a wonderful Moroccon feast.

Glad we have Tajine joining latest scene of diversity in culinary works. The salty sourdough mini buns gave quite an interesting pairing compared to usual pita bread. I love the light intensifying broth that comes with braised monkfish. Lentils dip surprised with almond flakes, while the hummus and grilled eggplant are lighter than the norm Indian and Middle East buds. Tasteful decor within small space, friendly and attentive staff to brighten vibes. Would hope to see more well maintained restroom, for it's the only one for all.

Visited this TRADITIONAL restaurant yesterday, so it claims. I thought the meat was well cooked and all. Unfortunately the flavours were underwhelming and portion was small. Please note this is a 2 persons portion. The lamb stock was very light in colour too seems like watered down. One is suppose to pour the lamb stock over the Royal couscous dish. I expected a more robust flavour and looking forward to more spices. We are in Singapore and very exposed to différent foods with lots of spices like briyani, and all the dishes available in a Nasi Padang joint. So I was surprised to learn from this restaurant that North African food seems “very clean”.

I love thé cocktails though, they were really yummy. We would have come back to try the starters and some other dishes but we won’t be coming back. So why two stars? It was very odd that the Israeli floor manager asked for our feedback and when we provided our truths that we love food just that the spices were underwhelming. She seemed defensive but most importantly she said that the Chef is just interpreting Moroccan food in his way and has tone down the spices for Singaporean taste buds. I was surprised to hear. Aren’t you marketing Tajine as a traditional Moroccan restaurant so I expect that? Not a watered down or modern interpretation. Just traditional please.

Oh and food prices were really expensive.
100 plus per person for Royal Couscous, corne de gazelles (dessert) , 2 cocktails and one mint tea each.

Wanted to try something different and chance upon this restaurant at Mohd Sultan. The dishes cooked from the tajine are awesome. We had both chicken and veal. Both are savoury and flavourful. The batbout which is a round, firm and chewy dough goes extremely well with the tajine dishes.

Do notes you must order two portion for the tajine dish which will cost you almost $70 per dish.
Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.name: TAJINE Moroccan Tapas & Cocktail Bar

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
Overated abd expensive Malay food in toa payoh. Different price for malay. Very unreasonable. Avoid at all cost. Portion pathetic . $13 for this food !!

Nice nasi padang. The beef rendang is good and traditional. Rempah of the rendang is great and fresh. Ask for extra gravy for rendang as it is more traditional dry style. Other dishes is good too. They are generous with the gravies so that added complexity to the dish. I think firstly the dishes are traditional and what dish we choose to balance with each other is important. It is almost the same for all nasi padang too. Overall it is a great gem for authentic nasi padang. Well done!

One of the best nasi Padang in Toa Payoh. The beef rendang is stew till very soft n tender.

Authentic Indonesian style nasi Padang done very well at good prices. Very popular with a queue during lunch time. Can tell many are regulars.

The gravy is flavourful and not overpowering spicy which is great for me. Also lotsa variety to choose from. The beef looks really tender even though I chose the Sotong, which is fresh and tender.

It is a true local treasure that brings the authentic flavors of Malay cuisine to our neighborhood. If you're in search of a memorable dining experience that celebrates the heart and soul of Malay culture, look no further. This eatery is a must-visit, whether you're a local or just passing through.

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
First time having lunch here today. I ordered from their Weekday Brunch Special Menu which is available from 11am to 3pm.

I ordered Pan Fried Dory Fillet in Cilantro sauce with some greens and fries ($12.90++) plus $4.80++ for the Meal Upgrade to include the soup of the day and a drink.

Rating for the main course: 4/5 (the fish portion is just nice it is well cooked but the fries are slightly salty.

Rating for the spinach soup and bread:
4/5 (the soup is delicious and the bread is nice)

Overall, this place is ideal for lunch and dinner with family or friends but it does not impress me enough to give a 5-star rating.

The Larder cafe has never fail to make my day. Standard of the food is still there. Ambience good. Enjoyed the Truffle fries & Salmon thoroughly.

Hidden treasure of Toa Payoh! There are not many cafes in TPY that offers, coffee, food, all day breakfast, beer, ice cream in a cosy setting.

Scan QR code and self order but the servers are friendly and easy going. The layout inside lean toward a bit of Retro settings, nice pics with warm lights.

Food was good! Every dish was a 4-5 stars but hands down it’s the desserts that’s gonna kill! Ice cream, Crème Brûlée, waffles! If I had more space, I will try the rainbow cake.

The Waffles and Ice Cream is really very good.  The other food I would say so-so and can be missed. So I'd only be back for Waffles.

The place is really noisy when running full house. We can't wait to leave right our meal. It's so stressful to eat in such noisy environment.

Cafe is on 2nd level. Not wheelchair friendly.

The food was good! Got the brunch set meal of the chicken skewer and pasta, with soup and drinks. Go if you would like to have a cafe feel at a reasonable 'cafe' price (for the set).

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
Delicious and inexpensive. A surprising and delightful find. If you crave for something different from the usual hawker fare, you should try this. The portion size is generous and the stall owner is friendly too! I am coming back again.

THE biggest meat portions in the whole market. Awesome flavours, different from the usual Muslim food store.

Mandhi rice with Mutton was amazing. The owner of the shop really nice and friendly. Mutton was really tender, rice balance and with good flavour, not very overpowering. Big portion. I ate half way, decided to take photo 🤣😂

Absolutely delicious and savory kebabs at such a reasonable price!

The other food here like the Lamb and the BBQ Kofta are flavorful and soulful. The store owner is also a friendly Moroccan man who is bubbly and very clearly very happy to serve his customers.

Give the nasi lemak a break on your next visit and give this place a try!

Recommend:

1. Kebab
2. Lamb

Kebabs big portion. Fast

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
Highly recommend their fried chicken and begedil! Begedil is served hot and soft. Very tasty! However, the lady at the cashier wasn’t friendly at all.

Our go-to nasi padang stall! We come here weekly, and the standard is consistently great! There is a huge variety of dishes to choose from, and the spread is delightful! The dishes are neatly arranged.

We have tried and recommend their ikan pedas, curry fish, fried fish, sayuh lodeh, fried chilli potato, fried tempeh (our favourite!), omelet, Paru, beef liver, etc. We have tried their fried chicken wing, curry chicken, beef rendang, ayam Penyet, but still overall perfer the ikan dishes. You have to ask for any of their curries to be added to your rice! Sometimes they have desserts like banana ball (?) and lopez... Order them! They are yummy!

Their drinks are also strong and tasty. We usually order teh and Kopi tarik kurang manis.

There is usually a queue but it moves pretty fast because the servers are efficient.

I have brought my mother here, and she claims that this is the BEST nasi padang stall in Singapore! We also dabao some dishes every time we visit. Do come and support!

Been coming here frequently during lunch.
Place is packed and well organised.

They have daily specials and I tried the nasi lemak and follow up with the mixed rice meals.
Both were below $10.

The fried chicken is awesome, tempeh is delicious, beef rendang fantastic. Prefer when the fried chicken is hot out of the fryer but still awesome.

Will return again and again.

Hari Raya Haji package :
I am really impressed by the Raya Haji packaging! 😍  This is really very smart! The food is really delicious, not greasy and has a balance in taste!

I subscribed to the Lunch tingkat for my Mom too.  She sends me photos when she receives her food.  She always compliment that the food and dessert is always delicious and the generousity in its servings.  The menu is balanced with good protein (array of meat, seafood) never repeats and I can sense that is always thoughtfully crafted.

Had Nasi Padang ($7) for lunch on 2/8/23, was good.

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
so damn worth it!!! beef udon was $6.50 and the portion is damn big bro. california maki mini was $4??!! Oishii chicken don was $6 and the chicken came in damn big pieces!! the people were so nice and efficient :D

Great food, cheap and really huge portion. We went out of the way to come to this place. Will definitely come again. Really nice ppl serving, clean and they take pride in what they serve. Forgot to take pictures though...but though it's in a hawker centre setting, it definitely taste better than some restaurants I hv been to.

Ordered the teriyaki salmon don at $5.50. Love that they top the salmon with lots of stir-fries onions and also generous amount of lettuce. Comes with miso soup too. Portion is good too. Gave it 3 star as it didn’t taste Japanese even though it was a good meal that I enjoyed.

I hv bought their food many times and this is my review. Food is good, good price and at times generous portion. Good place for me to buy Japanese halal food at a cheaper price. If they have a lot of orders, u need to have the patience to wait yeah. But the wait is worth it.

Cheap and value for money! It can be hard to find something different to eat that is halal in Toa Payoh and this was not bad! A bit far to walk from MRT though and service was a bit slow though there was no crowd. But food was good for the price!

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
I came to Singapore few weeks ago and was looking for Mediterranean restaurants. I stumbled upon this gorgeous place 5 minutes away from my hotel. I tried Kebabs on day one and man it was delicious. Atmosphere is great and all servers are friendly, specially three girls Urmi, Wendy and Fina are super nice, they make sure to get you a table quickly, take the order in timely manner and also make valuable suggestions on the menu. They always keep checking if everything is fine and customers are enjoying food. I loved the desert suggestion after eating my dinner. After first day I have been to this place 7-6 times and was always greeted with same service. I highly recommend this restaurant and will go again before I leave Singapore for USA.

We had the sultan's delight and mussels with garlic cream and cheese toast. The sultan's delight is really enjoyable. We could taste the smokiness from the eggplant puree and the lamb stew is really tender with tomato based sauce. It's tangy and smoky with some crunchiness from the pine nuts. Really enjoyable. But the mussel is pretty standard. It didn't taste really fresh but they're quite generous with the amount. The garlic cheese sauce is ok only.
Service was good and attentive.

Visited for my birthday meal with my family as I was craving some Mediterranean food and this place had great reviews. However, the whole experience ended up kinda disappointing - as I had high expectations too on my first visit.

Service:
- It’s a restaurant but I felt like there was not much service per say.
- It’s a pretty high price point but they don’t serve complimentary water (charged at $3 a pot of hot water, or $11 for Evian water only)
- Ordering isn’t as fuss free as they try to make it. Online ordering only from mobile app, with just one physical menu at the door. Asked for any extra copies for easier viewing but none available. You also have to pay upfront in mobile order.
- Feels like I visited a restaurant but received fast food style service.

Atmosphere:
- Overall atmosphere is okay. Like a typical restaurant

Food:
- Average, I’ve had much better at other places for a similar price point.
- Pita bread, spreads and kebab grills were okay.
- Saffron rice & Briyani rice were disappointing. They use basmati rice which gave a nice texture. However, flavour is so subtle that I could barely taste the difference between the 2.

Summary:
Would I return? Definitely not! For the price point, the food and service didn’t live up to expectations for a highly rated restaurant. Will continue on my hunt for yummy Mediterranean food!

Visited on a Thu night, it's superb crowded and busy in the restaurant. 3 dishes for 2 people, very filling. Overall the food is pretty decent and the price point is on the higher side.

Excellent experience with vibrant dining experience. Food has great range of taste to excite the palate. Service is welcoming and top notch, they also gave a complimentary cake.
Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.name: Pistachio Middle Eastern & Mediterranean Grill

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
Didn’t know if the reviews before I bought them, but granted they were one of the only coffee stalls opened on a Sunday afternoon, there’s not much choices around..

💰 At $3.20 for the 2 drinks, it’s at least a full dollar more pricey versus the other two I tried

☕️ taste wise, we both found it to be super bland, really not worth the money at all..

Unfortunately it’s deserving of a 2 star, would have given it a 1 star if the service was poor - not a stall I would consider returning.

Lovely elderly lady selling snacks and drinks. I come here regularly when it's too hot for the sugarcane. It's $2.50 which I think is a bit pricey but I suppose she needs to stay in business. The sugarcane is refreshing.

29/3/22

Stall run by an elderly lady who sell Vegetarian for 30 years.
I tried the Siew Mai and I like it.
The sugarcane drink was freshly made too 😍

Will be back to try other items.

Date of visit: 23 Jan 23
Time of visit: 1050am
Name of store: Mahaprajna Snack Cafe
Location: Inside Toa Payoh Lorong 7 Food Centre
Items ordered: 1x teh, 1x hot milo
Total damaged: $SG3.00 (Day 02 of CNY)
How: You find your own seat, you queue, you order, you pay, they make, you take, you drink, you clear and go.
Taste: CMI, no toast somemore
Will drink again: NEVER

This stall is selling very unreasonable price drink and snack. Rojak at $3 very small like small kid portion. Plain water at 40cts food court price. Anyhow sell drink price. Sometimes $1 sometimes $1.30 . They used to sell popiah but hv stop due to unhygienic. 👎👎👎
Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.name: Mahaprajna Snack Cafe

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
Standard drop drastically . Last time it was a ah Tiong chef cooking . Now change to Malaysia chef . The mala spicy don’t have enough mala pepper . Not nice anymore and the sauce adds 豆辨酱. Distasteful and min need spent 7 dollars . My last time here . I used to crave and like so much . Cust cost maybe . Dried chilli yes but the mala factor not that anymore

Super spicy and salty even on lowest setting. Avoid!

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
Made the effort to come here after numerous recommendations from different parties.

10 minute wait. Decent portion size for $6.

Looked good. The flavour tells that very good quality shrimp paste is used. So it was such a pity that the fried fritter was limp and cold. The same goes for the tau pok.

Tried this Soon Heng Rojak due to good reviews and highly recommendation from a colleague.
The gravy is thick with much peanuts and the sauce was favourably nice.
The rojak was very tasty in the mouth, the you tiao was not tough to chew.
Waiting time was longer as the orders kept coming and queuing took some time.
Overall experience was good and highly recommended.

A really famous rojak served by a masterfully efficient chef 👨🏼‍🍳

At $4-7 a plate, they are churning these out really fast compared to the other rojak stalls - and at a good quality too.

Having tried it for the first time, I could understand why there’s a demand for it - though I didn’t love it enough to give it a perfect score.

That said, definitely a choice for desserts for a lovely generous plate of peanut goodness 👍🏻

Soon Heng Rojak was founded in 1988 and is supposedly made the very same way to this very day.

Since rojak isn't generally eaten as a meal on its own, this stall seems to rack up a short queue no matter the time of day.

$4 gets you the smallest plate, and if you want to add a preserved egg on top of that it'll cost an extra dollar. The portion seems regular, or perhaps I don't eat enough rojak to know the current market 'standards' of size and portions, but I do know that there wasn't any cured garlic slices and that the egg looked like it had an abusive parent. To note, I also ordered it less sweet, for I remember it to be unbearably briney and sweet the last time round.

Generally if you order the default plate, you would get a wetter rojak that is wading in 'hei ko' sauce. Personally, the brininess and sweetness of the default plate is too much for me as it gets to a point where it feels like I'm eating rojak in 'seafood jus'. Even with my less sweet order it was still too much for me. The pineapples were sliced thinly which meant they were coated more but could also mean you get less of it. The you tiao was slightly dense, but the sauce rehydrated it enough to still be enjoyable. The best thing for me was the preserved egg. It tasted good and had no unbearable pungent or ammonic taste and smell.

All in all I just feel something is lacking with this rojak though I can't quite put my finger on it. Maybe it's the lack of garlic that throws it off balance, as well as the excessive hei ko sauce.. or maybe it's just a very traditional taste I'm not used to. You be the verdict of this one.

@goodfoodwrite - instagram & YouTube

Relatively short wait as it was off peak hours . Generous amount of peanut . Tasted well balanced , can see why its very popular

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
Second time here. Love the variety of hawker food! Usually quite crowded and difficult to get a seat during peak hours. Some food there sell out fast too, and the famous ones have long queues. Overall, worth visiting multiple times to try different food. Tried the kway chup today! Was good! 👍🏻

Along Toa Payoh Lorong 1, this is a food heaven for local food lovers but it gets crowded during weekend and meal times! Go for their fried carrot cake, fish porridge, fried hokkien noodles, muffins, etc. The wet markets is at level one while the food stalls is at second floor. A lift is available for elderly folks.

Fun hawker centre with a big selection of food. Many stalls and many different types of food, such as carrot cake, fish soup, chicken rice, ban mian, soya bean drink and pudding, fried you tiao, and even satay (in the morning!!)

Asked for mixed fishball, fish dumpling and shredded chicken noodle soup. Was told $6..After having it, rest of ingredients are okay, except the fish dumpling is over rated..imagine you need pay $1.20 each, I would go for Song Kee.

Clean & airy place. Food is good. Must try the hokien mee. Yummy.
Also the Chee Cheong Fun, though done with a slight different look, but really delicious.

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
Chanced upon this $1 Nasi lemak stall and decided to try the Mee rebus first considering we are time constrained today.

Mee rebus was decent at $3, they have a lot of those crispy stuff on the top of it and it adds to the texture of it - not much of other ingredients but definitely will return based on the quality (will probably add some stuff in future too).

Update Aug’23: Tried the Nasi Lemak and it was good! Skip the chicken wing and get the begedil instead 👍🏻 chilli was more on the sweet side, but good nonetheless! Definitely will be back for more in future.

I give 5 ⭐️ because of the heart of the owner!

I think it is very nice to have these people in our community - they try to give back to others!!

A $1 meal is like almost impossible to find lah, ya maybe can with plain economic beehoon.

But this one — nasi lemak + ikan bilis + a piece of egg + sambal + cucumber

Taste ok! Can also help us doing charity if we pay forward 😊😊😊

Perhaps the only place where you can get $1 Nasi Lemak. Although it's just a small packet with thin slices of eggs, one slice of cucumber, some ikan bilis and peanuts with samba chilli, it's good enough for a light breakfast. Thank you for keeping the price down when most stalls are raising the price. I went there at noon and there was no queue.

Bought the $1 nasi lemak and added a chicken wing. The rice and the chilli is 5 stars but the chicken wing is 3 stars and hence the 4 stars rating.
There was a queue but it move quite quickly. Next time will have only the nasi lemak and will try out the mee rebus and lontong.

Delicious Nasi Lemak! Portion is good and the rice is extremely fragrant. Will definately be back.

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
20231012 First visit to this hawker center because of a new assignment in the vicinity which will recur on a weekly basis.

Unbelievable variety at unbelievable prices !
One of the few hawker centers I can find non-carbs dishes easily: from steamed fish, lady’s fingers, gourd soup (from Yong Tau Foo stall), oyster egg and finishing off with the amazing desserts from Dove Desserts.

Glad my assignment is recurring !

I just had this basil pork rice with eggs. Marvellous!! $5 per plate. Yummy! They are open Sun to Friday.

#01-47. Qing xiang ting, 清香庭 desserts. Bobo cha-cha hot for only $1.80. Tasty n rare in desserts stall. Must try.

When you visit Kim Keat Palm Market and Food Centre for lunch, I recommend trying the signature Lor Mee from Jia Wei Xia Mian Lu Mian (家味虾面滷面). They use high quality vinegar that complement the dish without overpowering it. A satisfying meal! Portion is generous.
To note the stall rests on Fridays.

the popular Toa payoh west food centre. Another beloved option among the area’s residents is Kim Keat Palm Food Centre, which boasts a plethora of stalls selling the likes of noodle, velvety chee cheong fun and various refreshing desserts.

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
The food was not too bad. First time having Lebanese food. The chicken was cooked nicely and the basmati rice was seasoned well. The lamb chops were on the drier side. Overall interesting meal. Recommended for group dinners.

First time trying Lebanese food and it was really nice with a very good vibe. the ambiance was all set and whole arab street experince was lit. Hummus with bread and apple teas is a myst try dish over here. The price is on the higher side and I would say going in a group pf 5-6 people will be good as we get to try lot of new dishes.

Sanobar Lebanese Restaurant in Singapore is a hidden culinary gem that whisks diners away to the flavors of Lebanon. The restaurant offers a delectable and authentic Lebanese dining experience, from succulent shawarmas to flavorful falafels and tantalizing baklava desserts.

The ambiance is warm and inviting, and the friendly staff ensures a delightful dining experience. The menu caters to various dietary preferences and offers a true taste of Middle Eastern cuisine. Staff is so welcoming and friendly! Whether you're a fan of Lebanese food or new to it, Sanobar is a must-visit, I enjoyed the place so much when I visited Singapore in January!

Visited 13 July 2023 humid summer evening. The following sharing are based on our unbiased personal opinion and experience.

Multiple visit to this restaurant serving Turkish delicacy. Located at Kampong glam, Bussorah street. We had a great and delicious dinner for the night.

The food was filling and delicious dessert 🎂 and Turkish coffee was fantastic. And the dining atmosphere vibes was good with outdoor sitting.

Food 4 ⭐
Services 4 ⭐
Atmosphere 4 ⭐
Return to try again definitely 😁

Drop by the next time when you visit Kampong Glam I'm pretty sure you will like it here. Cheers

Nice food. Requested for some cherry tomatoes on the side and was spot on. Chicken was cook perfectly and tender. Good service staff. Was given a mint tea after meal. 5 star for the chefs and service crew.

A must go to restaurant. ;)

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
The most delicious Mediterranean food in Singapore. Very friendly staff,- quick service and very nice Singapore Sling. Super clean environment, good ambiance and price worthy. 5/5 will come back for sure.

If you like Hummus, this restaurant/pub has the best Hummus in Singapore 🇸🇬 .
Just order the big portion! You won't regret it.

For a person who doesn't like lamb, I'd like to share that this restaurant is the only one where I would not hesitate to order their lamb shanks!

The atmosphere is good for catching up with friends over a beer and a good Turkish meal.  A change from the usual type of dining places we locals normally go to. The friends I brought there thoroughly enjoyed the evening.

The staff are friendly and humorous.  It can get crowded Friday nights.  So go early!

They are open 6 days a week, closed on Sunday.

Super juicy and delicious kebab and loved the hummus and babaganoush too. The lunch special is good value for the quality and portion. Service was quick and helpful. Will definitely be back to try more.

Kazbar's cold mezze platter is a delightful mix of flavors with hummus, baba ghanoush, tabbouleh, falafel, stuffed grape leaves, olives, and pickled veggies. The lychee mint crush mocktail is a must-try, and the lively atmosphere adds to the overall experience. 🌟

Unique experience eating middle eastern food. The food was great and there was quite a bit of variety. Also the staff were very friendly! It is a bit on the pricey side but it is still worth the experience.

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
1. Food was good

2. Prata is big piece

3. Butter chicken doesn't taste creamy. Abit too dry for a butter chicken

4. Fair share, more than enough to eat.

5. Price a little expensive, 2.70 for an egg prate. 7.50 for butter chicken.

6. Well affordable and worth a try!

I love this place and come frequently. I do think that they have the best prata in Singapore - they are crispy, not too oily and has the right thickness giving it a little chew. The curry dipping is flavorful and also very generous portion.

The place has indoor and outdoor area. It’s air conditioned so it’s comfortable to dine in with group as well, not just get and go. The menu is also diverse from prata, thosai, naan, fish head curry, chicken briyani and mutton briyani to please the different preferences in larger group!

Its a very nice experience. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. However, I had the butter chicken but the butter chicken was quite spicy. Dont know if its suppose to be spicy. The milo and teh was awsome. Burst of flavors. Would reccomend totaly!

Mr Vasanth and his team were excellent help in planning and delivering a “live-prata” party. The catered food was very delicious, the curries good especially the mutton was super soft. The kids enjoyed the special pratas the Chef recommended them.

After 2 years in India, it feels really good to find an Indian place with the taste of india for a correct price. Order and within 5min your food is on the table ! We love it and highly recommend!

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
Friendly staff
Foods were delicious and well cooked
Free complementary
Price was okay and worth to eat.

If you are coming Singapore don’t hesitate to visit this restaurant.

Food was really really good, it improved my mood to be even better. Condiments were a bonus. Staffs are friendly and approachable too. Definitely will come back again 😉

My second time to come here and service never disappoints. The food is tasty and the ambiance is great😊 highly recommended😊

Nice location and good tea, cool weather with Islamic vibes that place is too good to spend quality time with f&f nice to explore and good Turkish cuisine👍🏻

Delicious authentic Turkish cuisine, great atmosphere and excellent service ❤️

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
I ordered Egg Shakshuka (tomato source base with egg, cheese, 鹰嘴豆) together with pancakes, the tasting style like the Greek restaurant I tried last time.
Also, I tried the Moroccan Mint tea. Very special, the water is not that hot, with mint leaves inside. Something sweet.
Pink pink color inside, pretended on holiday!

In general, it’s good and a new experience for Moroccan food.

Celebrated a friend's birthday and everything was BEAUTIFUL. The reservation was a breeze, super responsive on whatsapp! The place and ambiance brought me to Morocco! Love love the food we had the dips and platter. Serving is huge, perfect for sharing! They gave us 2 complimentary cakes as well for the birthday girls. Will surely come back!!

Visited La Fez restaurant for dinner, wanting to try Moroccan cuisine, but was left quite disappointed.

The decor and the interiors are nice, and the service is friendly enough.

The food, though, is quite disappointing. Ordered the marrakesh dip platters which comes with 8 pieces of pita bread and 4 dips (hummus, baba ganoush, zalouk and Muhammara). Tasted quite average and nothing to shout about considering it is priced at $23.

Asked for the chicken and vegetarian tagine but were told they didn’t have the vegetarian option. This is supposed to be the main, so seems weird that they didn’t have it.

The chicken tagine seemed quite bland and devoid of character. Nothing remarkable. It was served with pita bread too, and you can also opt for Mandi rice as sides.

The only saver of the evening was the Turkish apple cinnamon tea - was nice, warm and soothing.

Nice idea - there aren’t many similar options in Singapore - but average execution at best. Dips platter, tagine, harissa were all somewhat bland. That’s despite the fact that the harissa is already meant to be the spicy tastier option for the lamb. Tagine and Harissa dishes don’t come with rice or couscous, only pita - maybe a grain would be nice.

There are some “comfort food” options - maybe for kids - we had the fish & chips which was simply awful. The fish is fried hard like a rock and barely edible. Fries were bland.

The hot baklava cheesecake was tasty but tiny for the price.

I don’t think I’ll be back.

We dine in here for a family dinner.
Cozy, pleasant & lovely ambience.
Staffs were friendly.
Serving was quite fast.
We were lost of what to order at first & the waiter there recommended Mandi Platter which was in fact a sumptious one. The Strawberry Dome for our dessert was yummy.
Fully recommended & would come back to try other menus.
Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.name: La Fez Restaurant

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
Excellent meal, service was great and the recommendations were all spot on. The food was so yummy & tender! Hummus & tea on the house as well.

A little on the pricey side but expected for the popular location. Wld return👍

4th time here. Food was good with big portions. Love how tender the lamb is. Staff here are friendly as well!

Boss and staff are polite, friendly and helpful. Very attentive as well. Would say it's definitely better service than you would get in general in Singapore.

Food-wise I enjoyed the dishes. Boss Jamal was really nice to offer me vegan options for the hummus as well as the moussaka vegetables. Was my first time trying this style of hummus. It was served hot and when the boss saw that it looked dry, he automatically brought out olive oil for me to pour to my liking. Hummus was tasty for me although would have preferred it wetter. I'm guessing it's because usually it contains a bit of yoghurt but I had to have the yoghurt removed. Bread was OK. Moussaka was amazing! I would definitely be back for it. The signature mint tea is a nice-to-have after so much oil... 😂

Price-wise it is quite expensive for the portions, but it's very comparable to the other restaurants in this area. Probably because it's a tourist area. Good news is that price is nett. So no additional charges.

Decoration of the restaurant is done well! The Moroccan tiles on the table is Instagram-worthy!

Nice place to eat. The staffs are friendly.
Foods are affordable and yummy :)

Had dinner on 19-Dec-20. It was a mixed bag of experience.
Location: great. Right in front of the Sultan Masjid
Reception: v cordial & helpful (but so are all the other restaurants around it)
Seating: comfortable since a gentle breeze was blowing
Covid Safety: v poor. If we had known this, we wouldn’t have eaten here. No Safe Checkin, no safe distance between tables, and some of the people serving weren’t wearing the mask properly. Scary.
Service: poor. We were promised our lemonade would b without sugar or ice, but they didn’t care. The people serving were mixing up dishes for the tables multiple times.
Food: tasty, but not the authentic type. Having eaten in Turkey we didn’t find the eggplant kebab the way it should have been.
Presentation: Good
Price: Fairly ok
I am not planning to go there again
Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.name: Delimoroccan

Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.reviews:
This is our first time trying Moroccan food. The dishes are exotic and we like how fruits are introduced to most of their main dishes. The beef (with prunes) is tender and flavorsome. I particularly like the chicken with a hint of lemon, it's delicious and goes very well with bread. The lamb however was quite disappointing, there was very little meat and the dish mainly consists of veg and cous cous.
Prices are on the high side but it's worth trying. We love the ambience of the restaurant too, peaceful and quaint. We had a chance to chat a little with the friendly owner, overall a great experience.
Feedback - please consider rice in the menu, it goes well with beef and chicken. Singapore locals are generally fond of rice :)

Nice atmosphere. Great place to dine Moroccan cuisine. Although the price is on the high side but worth for its value.
I has chicken with preserved lemon and stewed beef with prunes. Both are served in traditional tagine. Mint tea was excellent.

Great spot for Moroccan cuisine. The lamb and veg couscous was delicious, and we really enjoyed the chicken and preserved lemon tagine. Bonus for serving wine and beer! Definitely recommend this spot!

The food is really yummy! I expected to be spicy and super flavorful but it’s not spicy & I like it this way 👍🏻 The food still has lots of flavour but not the overwhelming kind. Love their bread with all the dishes.

Their pancake dessert is a must to order & Moroccan tea is jus super nice 👍🏻

Great to go with friends and share the different dishes as it’s super filling to the tummy !

Came here for a birthday occasion. Recommend the bread and dips. Warm bread was comforting and the dips a flavourful compliment. The chicken pastilla was also authentic and on par with what I tasted in Morocco previously. The chicken tagine was fairly good.
Moroccan restaurants in Toa Payoh.name: Zarabi

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
They offer a captivating feature where customers can conveniently place their orders using a table-mounted kiosk. Each table is equipped with one, allowing you to make the most of your waiting time by browsing the web, shopping online, or enjoying a game. Additionally, they provide wireless chargers, so don't forget to charge your phone while savoring your meal. The staff is exceptionally friendly and accommodating.

To be fair, this rating is based solely on their signature chendol. Was graving for dessert and chanced upon their chendol advert outside their shop. Looked so good so proceeded to order their signature chendol as take away. My work place is only a few shops away and not that far. Almost immediately I opened the tub and was disappointed that the 'shaved ice' was all melted. The ingredients were also very pathetic plus the coconut milk was very lumpy as seen from the photo. I think they use ready-made coconut milk as I could see boxes of them at the counter. Very heart pain that I paid $5.09 for this lousy 'signature' chendol.

Omg~ so nice! I love the texture of the noodles, the small little container of chilli yet potent enough, the fried wanton that has filling and not just fried wanton skin and the overall portion of the meal! The soup is strong in flavour, slightly to the the salty side. Bakso is good. My complete set cost about 10.50 with a drink (lime juice or lemon tea) (i prefer lemon tea), 2 wanton and 2 bakso. I thought quite reasonable! Please don't change ur taste or standard for this particular Jakarta chicken noodles~~~ I always love indo chicken noodles! The sulawesi noodles is just as good too, just that the chicken feels lesser but chilli spicier. No matter how, am coming back again and again! Note: Service may need to slightly speed up when there's more customers but I'll definitely wait for good food! Also, this particular section of shop has always been small so seatings very limited and slightly feels more cramped with people eating and queueing.

Friendly Staff and very attentive to customer.
Love the springy noodle texture that is authentically indonesian! Must try is the Bakmie Rica Rica and Bakmie Yamin Bandung.

Complete the set with a cup of Cendol, its the real indonesian cendol and you could choose jackfruit or durian topping.

👍🏻

Good option if you are looking for authentic bakmi and cendol. The cendol is great, choosing the less sugar option has the right amount of sweetness for me. The pangsit goreng is also good. The bakmi however is just average, but with not much option in Singapore, this is a good option.

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
Been frequenting Wine Connection at Downtown East. Coco is always friendly and she’s very attentive to guests needs and provides excellent service. The food is great here; especially love their pesto fettuccine .Always served fresh with lots of shaven cheese. Great place to hangout with family and friends. Good choice of vegetarian options

Truffle mushroom fettuccine was heavenly. Hawaiian pizza was awesome. Both dishes around sgd20. Ribeye sgd35 was a disappointment (3/5 stars at most). Dessert medley sgd19 was alright but hits and misses (4/5 stars at most). Giving this place 5 stars coz they serve complimentary water and service was attentive yet not obtrusive. Great ambience too, chairs were comfy tables were large. Serviettes were thick and luscious. Place was dimly lit, quite romantic, yet so many diners were large groups of family, still able to enjoy. Plenty of baby chairs available and children's cutlery also provided. We will definitely be back for the fettuccine and the pizza. Give the ribeye a miss.

The staff, Kati, Apple and Coco were very helpful, providing assistance whenever required. The food was served was promptly, with high quality. Every dish served surpassed expectations. Keep up the good work!

Good food and plenty selection of wine ,
Specially thanks to Kati who served me thru out the whole dining experience,
Soft spoken person and pleasant.

Kati's service is excellent. He is very sincere. Understand customer's need. He recommended a very good wine to me and my wife. Definitely look for Kati again next time I'm here.

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
Attended a Barista Basics coffee workshop on 26th Dec in this lovely cosy Dutch Mountain coffee lab. Got a good understanding of expresso as well as palatte development in this two hour coffee course. Put my hands on the grinder machine as well and got some basic ideas of how to recognize and appreciate good expresso. This course is truly helpful if you wanna learn everything about coffee bean's history, global logistic and how to make your own decision to get the best suitable type for yourself. Looking forward to the upcoming course about Coffee Cocktail Mixology in 2021.

A fantastic workshop that taught me more than I could have hoped for about coffee and its making! The barista course was very informative, well explained and fun at the same time. We got a lot of information from history, over beans to coffee quality and equipment. I can highly recommend this workshop held by our lovely host Serge.

Had the original greek recipe Cafe Frappé prepared by the amazingly friendly Serge😊 it is always a pleasure to enjoy a great coffee and company! Looking forward to my next visit👍🏻

Great coaching from Serge! Learning and enjoying new coffe ideas, what else does one need?

A very unique and creative drink shop. The boss is funny and easy-going. You can talk to him about any interesting topic and chat about everything. He can catch any joke you throw out.
The coffee looks good and tastes good;
The drinks are healthy and look great;
The wines are carefully prepared and are full of innovation compared to traditional bartending.
Don't miss it

Coffee cocktail is a new feature of our store and is rare in Singapore. Don’t miss it...
Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.name: Dutch Mountain Coffee Lab

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
Typical coffee shop. So nothing wow on atmosphere.

I like the breakfast selections. Look simple but really taste good. The porridge is real good, ticks my box.

One of my fav spot for my morning fried bee hoon. The noodles are well flavoured and the chilli goes very well with the bee hoon/noodles.
There’s often a long queue and waiting time can be up to 10 mins.
The chee chiong fan here is good too.
Service is generally ok, except this particular uncle serving bee hoon who is literally always grumpy.

Love the wanton mee and chicken rice here. Expect a queue during peak hours. Gotta try the wanton mee with extra chilli... be careful. Super spicy

Like the porridge, bee hoon and chee cheong fun. Very often go there for breakfast on weekends morning. Very often long queue. Use to like the meat dumplings but they seem to stopmselling them.
Service wise, a few are very nice and polite while some are grumpy and speak in an impatient and impolite manner.

Good and reasonably priced meals. Porridge, chee cheong, jwee kueh & fried bee hong all good. Patronise this stall for more than 30 years 👍👍👍

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
Cold, dry chicken but the seasoning was nice. The variety of sambal was also great. Service was very quick and efficient. Interior was pretty warm compared to the mall.

Overall will not come back as there are much better alternatives in Singapore at better prices, even when factoring their lunch set discount.

Nice and flavourful food .Chicken is warm .Chilli is spicy(thats good)Rice perfectly cooked and egg you can request for half boiled or normal.If it opened in the east,would I eat it every single day?
No,but I would still eat it every single week.Price is affordable(depends on what you buy)

Pretty authentic ayam geprek though would’ve preferred it to be more flavourful. Chili is very spicy and what you’d expect from indo food.

Terrible gado gado, the tau gua s cold, the sauce is cold, the egg is cold(overcooked, and kept for long time) the vegetable is cold and soggy.  How can such restaurant sustain…disgrace to this dish..

Their ayam penyet is not even smashed. Should just rename it to ayam goreng lah.🤦🏻‍♂️

Response to admin: I made a grab order from the downtown east branch. So it seems your downtown east branch doesn't ALWAYS smash the chicken.
