Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
I don't care what anyone says. THIS IS HANDS DOWN THE BEST AND MOST DELICIOUS AND TASTY nasi Ayam penyet. the curry + crumbs mixed with the rice is AMAZING 😭😭 and the chicken is well cooked and tender. Thank you.

Hi managers, could you please tell your staff (Chinese woman) in Pasir Ris Hawker centre beside the Sports Centre to PLEASE be aware of how she speaks to her customers? She is very crude and raises her voices to old folks who buy from her 90% of whom are Malay elderly people. Tell her to improve her behaviour or will escalate this matter to the town council

I had steam chicken with brown rice , service wise is good from the workers . They are friendly but not the boss, the boss is a Chinese owner non Muslim employed Muslim workers, unfortunately she only speaks mandarin when I tried to communicate with her, she not that friendly and had a stuck up face .

The business about 5years .

Ok back to the food, no standard at all.
Brown rice so smashy, steam chicken tasteless no marination at all even they have a big part of the chicken but tasteless, really tasteless, their chillies no match at all with the steam chicken.

My conclusions go and buy steam chicken rice from the Chinese stall way much better than eating steam chicken from this stall.

For ayam penyek I dare not try after I alreday tasted the steam chicken with no taste at all in the meat, marination is very important to have a good chicken flavours.

This is my own opinion ya, so for this , I only give 1 star ⭐

One of best Ayam Penyet I have ever had. The chicken is crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. Pair with rice and curry sauce which makes the whole dish very satisfying. The sambal belacan is spicy which makes the chicken tasted even better.

The staff are friendly and helpful.

Worth to queue/travel to eat: Yes

The food here is surprisingly good. What stood out the most is the portion of the chicken; They are generous with the size of the chicken, hope it remains this way. The size of the chicken is bigger as compared to most Ayam Penyet places. The set comes with rice as mentioned on the menu below. Service is just as fast despite having to serve orders collected by delivery riders waiting to collect. Also kudos for treating them nicely, reminding the riders to double-check their orders.

I like that they provided sauce and chilli in smaller separate containers for takeaways, easier to make hot if I choose to eat it at a later time. I also like that they provided curry gravy such that the rice is not dry.

One star missing for charging the extra chilli (at 50 cents each tub) and not separating the chicken from the rice for takeaway.

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
Went for lunch and didn’t know the breakfast menu had a timing. Ordered the sambal hor fun and stir fry beehoon with a plate of kangkong too. I like how the food were served really hot and portion was decent too. Kangkong was a little too salty. Very nice deco in the shop, service was prompt too. Might drop by again to try the breakfast.

Great breakfast !  Quiet and cozy environment
Truffle egg mayo croissant with Milo  $5.90 , great taste and generous portion ..
Prawn Sando breakfast $6.90 with 5 big prawns , and drink ..
really good value for money , will definitely come back again :)
But have to wait for awhile for the food to be serve

Oct 2023.
Visited this awfully happy place for late dinner. Omg, had an awfully yummilicious meal. The highlight is the sambal sweet potato leaves. Not many eateries serve this dish. Its a must have. Thanks Ms Ai and team. What a way to wrap the hectic day. Am happy.
≈===========================

Have not visited this eatery for awhile. The service and meal served are still awsome. Highly recommended, especially for family get together. Thank you Ms Ai and team!

Nice fun cheery place tucked in a corner. Food was a total let down sorry to say. Far far cry from established eating houses with zi char style. Food had zero wok hey and rather tasteless and almost bland. I looked around and I am pretty sure I wasn't alone given the handful of half eaten food. Quantity is reasonable and menu had good variety which was probably its saving grace. Hyper fast serving time as well if you need a quick fix.

Delicious food that we had here on a Saturday, 22nd October.. we went for the $28 set meal for 2 with Hotplate Stingray, Sambal Kangkong, Tom Yam Soup complete with two plates of white rice . The servings were generous too. Food was served very fast as well

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.name: Buey Tahan See-Food Restaurant @ DTE

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
Unexpected visit to the east, this is a must go, seriously the food is so good here and the best part is, the place is so cooling and clean!
Definitely 💯 worth the visit here, food variety is huge and the stalls are so neat and tidy, can we like have all of the hawkers built this way??

This is quite a nice hawker far out to the west!
There are quite a few nice good food stalls here!
Used to go for the catfish Western food.
Latest favourite is the fusion nasi bryani - stingray!!
The flying noodle is also my kid's favourite now.
Only bad thing is no air con!!

2 floor hawker center. Second floor is more modern.

It's spacious. The place has ample seating relative to number of stalls.
Lots of good food options. We tried 4 places and all were 4+ stars.

Level 2 of the hawker centre you can find 2 worthy stalls 1) Collagen Pao Fan & Ramen - the Double Sliced Fish Ramen was very good!!  2) e Food Fun uses fresh ingredients for their kueh Tutu - 5pcs for $3.50 (able to choose filling: Coconut / Peanuts) - eat them while its warm, will be nicer. They also serve kueh pie tee & popiah - for that price point - its good too.

Update … MUST TRY > also at Level 2 > LATTE  from “Le Pantry” was so good.
Enjoy !

23 October 2023 - A bright and airy hawker centre with high ceilings. Passenger lifts serves both floors of the hawker centre as well as the multi-storey carpark. Has a well known hawker stall by the name of Wild Olives located inside it.

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
came here to try their nasi lemak set A (+ luncheon meat, sausage, fish) and a teh o bing. Dish came up to about $10.20; but the best thing about this dish is the flavourful sambal!! the sambal did the dish justice, spice is just right and all the different ingredients to the dish are made hot and fresh on order!

chicken wing is well seasoned and crispy, fish filet was a tad over-fried though.. and the rice is decently hot and importantly flavourful too! Definitely coming back again for the sambal and the rice - the rest are supporting ingredients😅

as for reviews about the staff being rude or what not, i dont ever see them being like that..even when there is a long queue and they’re busy. they have character but so long as you’re not out of the line, i doubt they would too. in fact, they’re friendly and helpful!

Very nice cozy food corner in HDB void deck along Pasir Ris Drive 6.

Dropped by for breakfast while on an early morning cycling trip in the area because it was the only place to open that early (7am). Auntie is brash in character and blunt but it makes the place more endearing as a heartland food corner IMO (as long as you haven't been an annoying customer to get on the receiving end).

Ordered the set A nasi lemak with otah, yuan yang and bean curd with longan. The main food was alright. Nothing outstanding about it, though it's nice that it's light on oil and freshly cooked, and the "otah" was basically flavoured sponge rather than actual otah, which was disappointing.

I like their (seemingly handmade?) dessert offerings, and the cold bean curd, sweetened by the longan, hit the right spot to bookend the meal. It helped that there was a seat with a view of the road outside and some nice greenery.

Can't really comment on comparative pricing for the area (or the recent price hikes) since I don't live in Pasir Ris, but as someone who's used to the higher prices in the North-East, it definitely remains on the affordable end of the spectrum.

tl;dr nice cozy heartland breakfast spot. Don't mind the auntie, try the dessert.

Ended up ordering food here over two days and it was a mixed experience. The service was friendly and quick.

The morning  kway teow noodles were tasty but there was too much tofu in the ngoh hiang and fishcake.  The mee goreng was enjoyable, if a little sweet, and I liked the chicken chop with rice. The ayam goreng with fries was disappointing though. It did not look like the menu photo at all, and was in fact over fried till black and the meat was super dry. It seemed as if it was someone else’ order that was cancelled and then refried. It was inedible.

I have been patronizing this place for more than 7 years. The food is decent and the price is reasonable. This eatery has its character. I have no problem with the operator. It's either you love it or you hate it.

Tried beehoon mee 1st time, expensive & taste ordinary like any beehoon mee stall. Serve cabbage in a separate bowl. Portion for beehoon mee little, over fried fish fillet, wings nothing to shout about. Halal certified thats why ex maybe! 1st & last time .

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
Nice place to relax and afternoon tea

Very nice and friendly owner Rusz who demonstrates great Customer Service! He will even bring your drinks to you if not too busy.

Putra Delicacies used to operate in Kranji Gallops Stables. Newly opened here about 2 months ago, Jan'22.

Nice cosy Atmosphere with Alfresco seating available if you don't mind some Sun😜

For Breakfast, the home made Kuehs like Kueh Ko Swee and Kueh Lopes are SEDAP,😋 yummylicious and reasonably priced!! Worth a mention too is the Nasi Lemak👍

Will definitely come back for more and even for Lunch and Dinner, can't wait to taste the Burgers and Satays!

Minor works in progress to expand seating too and I can just see this Little gem getting crowded soon.

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
Dishes were decent - could taste the wok hey in the vegetable dishes. Cereal prawns were tasty. But the fish head steamboat could be more flavorful.

Reasonable price point is bonus.

Quiet place to enjoy dinner since most of the stall of the coffeeshop serve the surrounding workplace during day time.

Recommended: Coffee pork rib and "Cui Po" tofu.

Beware of the Ice Lemon tea: Look at the Ice Lemon tea in the jar not fully cover and not store in the fridge.

It is a standard zichar stall we visit occasionally. Food is generally above average, which translates to 4 stars. The other 1 star is for the ample seating and the speed which they serve the food. Unlike some other zichar stalls where the first and last dish served can be more than 30min apart, this zichar stall is usually able to serve the first dish within 10min and the last dish less than 10min later.

Recommended by my friend who been here before.

Indeed, one of the good zichar out there.

The fish (curry fish head) & prawns (cereal prawns) is super fresh!

And the fish head steamboat soup base is light (not as salty) and flavorful.

Will be back again with my family!

Honestly, the food is not bad.
The goodness turned into a lousy environment when you order your food with the lady at the counter. One of them is very friendly n chat a lot. The other one, her face is darker than 包青天。包青天lady seriously spoiled the atmosphere when you ordered your food from her. She even decides for you to dine in or dine out without asking.

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
This western food stall is located on 2nd floor of Loyang Point, in the food court near to Singapore Pools outlet.

I love their chicken chop & pork chop as the meat is very tender and is easy to cut…. Also, the salad & mashed potatoes that come with it are very well prepared 😋

Try to avoid 6.30pm to 7.30pm as it is the busiest time so we normally go around 7.45pm.

Delicious and affordable food! Highly recommend!

Edit: was great but quality slowly getting worse.

Pork chop - overcooked, dry and tough
Chicken chop - undercooked
Nuggets - feels reheated as tough and hard

Nice and affordable western food in Loyang point , would like to recommend anyone to try their chicken chop pasta
You can see how much effort they put in even the price is only 7 bucks
Thumbs up to the friendly boss

Rude attitude stall owners and lousy food. Dont bother wasting your time.
Go else where for better food

wonderful place for family meals

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
Great place nearby to get scrambled eggs. My long black was bitter as hawl. I should have gotten the latte instead.

The English breakfast style platter is actually one of the best I've tried in Tampines and other areas, even the more astute parts of town.

I'm a westerner and sometimes get tired of eating soft boiled runny eggs, so the scambled eggs fit a nice niche for my sensibilities.

The Tampines location is tiny to dine-in. I could see a scenario of not being able to get a table during peak time quite easily, so plan accordingly.

I wished they served Kopi C Kassong, but of course, it's Singapore, so not very hard to find nearby.

great ambience and delicious food but also pricey (average cafe prices but still expensive) the cafe itself is a bit small and can be cramped if ur more than 2 people visiting, but there's a bit of outdoor seating. the desserts were genuinely so good! the bottled drinks not worth getting tho - too sweet.

Not too bad, just a pity the Angus beef burger sold out by the time I reached. Drinks were okay food was quite nice. Paid about $55.

Stopped in here for a quick coffee and dessert. You order and pay via a QR code.

The flat white was okay, but was a tad expensive for what you get.  I wanted the ondeh ondeh cake or the double baked cheese cake, which we had before at the Frankel store, but the missus had a hankering for the carrot cake.  It was nice, creamy and full of fresh chopped hazelnuts.

Polite staff, who is very transparent and make sure to keep us in the loop despite the long line

Food is yummy! I really liked everything, except maybe the sausage that is a little too Herby for my taste.

The coffee was great! The staff recommended the Brazil bean and I liked it. :)

Dining limit is 90mins

Tbh it can be a little pricey, but the food and ambience is great! Using the thub passion card gives you additional 10% if you order at the counter :)

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
I have past by this stretch of road umpteen times and decided to pay this Dutch Colony branch a visit on a Saturday morning. The coffee is great  - the Piccolo latte is rich and creamy, and the long black is elegant and fruity. My favourite is sourdough toast, sunny-side-up eggs and some bacon - and they have exactly that and I wouldn’t mind eating that every day. The other big plus is the soothing ambience of the place, which makes it a perfect place for a laid back morning.

Food was not bad and the ambience was nice! Great place for a gathering!
We ordered:
- Honey lemon mint tea (refreshing!)

- bottled water

- strawberry shake

- choc shake

- matcha latte (choice of hot or cold)

- turmeric oat latte

- Caffè latte

- vanilla shake

- herb crusted salmon

- seafood marinara linguine

- soup of the day (mushroom soup and comes with 2 slices of sourdough bread)

- Angus beef burger

- Hearty breakfast

- PBA toast

Coffee is good and been to this cafe for sometime. But! Today ordered a chicken pie and it came cold inside ask for a reheat and in the end the food served is what shown on the pictures. Left the pie it is and left the place. Now I dk if this place is worth or not….

Is a very pretty place to have lunch. The salmon was well cooked, just the crust was too salty for my taste. Matcha had soya option, very nice indeed.

Haven’t tried the food yet but will definitely come back for the food. Coffee was good

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
Ordered: Creamy Garlic Chicken Lunch, and a Pineapple Bacon Pizza

I initially got a Cheese Chicken Baked Rice, which I then tried to get the attention of the staff which didnt attend to me, I then went to the kitchen to talk to the staff they then went to my table, picked up the wrong food, went to another table to place that food there, and took it from that other table to me. They said they didn’t touch it, but I’m not taking his word for it, plus there are 3 people at that table talking and laughing, so not that very most sanitary in my eyes.
10 minutes later I got my food again, new? Or not I don’t know, however it was not creamy, and I as very bland, oily water base, spaghetti, and meat that tasted like pork and not chicken. Really unappealing

Pizza was ok, just remember you’re not eating a actual pizza even though they mention they have ingredients imported from Italy, it’s a plain wheat tortilla with toppings. The topping were ok, but the rest wasn’t, I would give food 0 stars if i could. As well as service as some had masks serving food, and some weren’t.

Last but not least, I few flies flying around, so I suspect the restaurant is sanitary unclean, probably violating a few health codes, I would r come back here, however great vibe and place for teenagers to come to. Comfortable seats as well.

Ordered the Garlic Brocolli Salad, Crispy Chicken Strips, a Chicken Pasta, Mussels and a beverage (Free Flow)

Total bill was 

I have been patronising Saizeriya at their various locations. White Sands is the best outlet so far in terms of food and the customer service. I ordered Black Pepper Pasta Chicken the other day and requested for chicken to be replaced with mushrooms as I am a vegetarian. The young and very petite staff named Shu Hui (or Shi Hui?) obliged and I got what I requested. Very courteous and professional. Think the company should implement Crew of the Month as incentive. Each staff should wear a name tag so that we diners can give the due compliments.
Would suggest that the online ordering portal to build in the edit function for special request. Overall, Saizeriya is my favourite cafe to go to. I love ❤️ the Oreo Cheesecake especially. The Semifreddo is too sweet for my liking.

Portions are reduced. Does not taste as good as before. This could be the last time i patronize Saizeriya. This could be why there is no more lunch time crowd or long line.

Our favorite family restaurant. Great selection of food. Value for money.  But all their outlets always seem shorthanded. Hope they can hire more servers!

We ordered seafood stew from the seasonal menu today. It's comforting to eat this on a cold day. Wish it is a little bit more spicy though.

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
We had taken the tents for celebration but they were all quite aged with stains all around and not so clean and hygienic.

I have rated 4 just for the location. Go through the photos I have posted and you will realise why I rated so high for the location.

They also  have an open to sky arrangement for family to bring their food and prepare barbeque,just by the bay

Friend booked a glamping staycation here and it was horrendous. Inside the tent was very humid and the air cooler is so small that it literally does nothing. We originally booked a dome for the night but all of it was so dirty and in the end they downgraded us to a smaller tent. The dome tent has a fridge that is mouldy and a fan. But when they move us to a smaller tent, all we have is an air cooler and our mattress downgraded to an air mattress that is very uncomfortable to sleep in. Our tent has fairy lights that keeps flashing on and off and it caused everyone a headache and there is no proper lighting inside the tent. Overall it was a very unpleasant stay and we won’t be coming here again.

Mouldy ceilings. Dirty and sticky tables, chairs and floor. We had to ask the management for a mop and cleaned everything by ourselves. Some chairs were very unstable, seem like they were gonna break easily. Air conditioners were useless. Some didn't even function properly. External light for the bbq pit didn't work so it was very dark. The bbq pit wasn't cleaned when we arrived, there were still old charcoals. Refrigerator didn't work on the 1st day. Bathrooms were extremely dirty. The washing machine leaked water and made a pool in the kitchen.

Chalet is huge and good for young groups to party. However , you have to limit your noise due to the distance between the glamping sites. Management will keep calling you to lower your volume. All doors closed , yet management ask u to reduce volume. Chalets are old , no televisions , olden days facilities , not well upgraded. If u do not drive , it will be very far. No food nearby. U have to only rely on grab. Bedroom beds are very hard , stiff pillows , stale smelling toilets. Not for family or ladies.

The tents are equipped with airbeds even though proper beds were promised to us. The rooms were to be air conditioned, but there is only one pathetic air cooler which doesn't even really work. It was very very warm. It was an uncomfortable stay. The toilets are dirty and it wasn't the most ideal. The kids couldn't sleep well as every movement made sounds. The service is not up to standard because the place is run by foreign workers and they can't make the decision when the boss is not around.

The only plus point here is the location. It is near the beach and the playground. The bbq was also alright.

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
No major complaints, generally the buffet is great and the seasonings are amazing! The mookata grills were relatively new and staff were attentive to us most of the time.

Great place to eat and relax and chitchat with friends! The atmosphere is very laid back thus very relaxing. Great variety of food! Great variety of chilli sauce to go with the food! The Thai Ice Milk Tea is great! Comes in a tower for family sharing too! Their beef is great! So is their chicken and fish glue!

Ordered the ala carte mookata for 3 pax which costed around $55 inclusive of service charge.

Price-wise is very affordable! The prices of the ala carte dishes range between $1.80 and $4+ and the portion per set is generous too (definitely enough to be shared).

Food-wise was just average; wouldn’t say it’s exceptionally delicious because the meat quality is just so-so. However, they do offer free serving of ice cream per ala carte mookata order; the ice creams were great though and appetising!

Overall, really affordable and suitable for group meals (although I am unlikely to patronise again unless I am really craving for it).

The food was excellent, especially the chili sauces. I'd recommend getting the Thai fish sausage, prawn paste, and fish noodles in particular. The prices were reasonable too. The service crew got the job done, though they could be friendlier.

Had dinner yesterday. I usually enjoyed the food from other outlets but this one it was horrible.

The meats was bland and beef was off taste, I'm guessing the preparation was badly done. Only to be saved by their special chilli sauce. Prawns were also not as fresh.

Rice was of either bad quality or undercooked as they were quite hard.

Would not come back here anytime soon. Maybe will go other outlets.

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
4.5 stars

(bonus star for being pet friendly!)

lovely place to hang out with (fur)iends with a live band when we visited and a relaxing, soft lit atmosphere. the cafe closes late as well, so we had a lot more time to chill and chat. the food was pricey but for once, I thought it was relatively worth it (except the grilled fish, that was a little dry). portions are small though. well-seasoned duck and creamy risotto, served with great mashed potatoes.

cocktails were pretty amazing, and honestly the highlight of our night. a little expensive, but large serving size made up for it. thank god, they weren’t stingy with the alcohol portion either. they were classic, tasty and in our opinion, great value. on top of all that, we found a fly in one of our glasses and the staff immediately replaced our glass with a new one, no questions asked.

great service, ambience and cocktails, will be back!

- a broke college kid

One of my favorite place to chill. Decent good food with great service! By the way, it’s a pet friendly restaurant with live band on certain days.

Frequent this cafe cause it's next door and how their chicken wings are just amaze-balls. Jumbo wings with a solid prawn paste flavor and fried ti perfection.

The location is pretty ulu and far flung but it's quite nice to eat there! Out door seating and pet friendly as well. Really like their mee goreng

My first visit at Bark Cafe was excellent and surely will visit more times! It is not so easily accessible and u will need a car or cab to get here conveniently. The food quality is super high and we loved every dish ordered. Well done chefs! However, the food variety HAS to be improved. So many of the dishes contain pork. Arent there more types of food to be offered? Please review and improve your menu.  You dont need to put pork in everything! About the place.. The ambience is fantastic! Love the open air seating and the pet friendly atmosphere. Service staff are very warm and friendly as well. Wonderful human beings! One girl made an error into an intrusion to my privacy but I took that as innocent ignorance and Im sure she will learn from it. Overall, a fantadtic place to have a meal and chill out.

Great place for dine in and food was good. Will be back again next round. Thanks for the great service experience.

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
The fried chicken wing is delicious, with crispy batter 😋. Fried noodles taste normal

The fried chicken and sambal are damn good.But
the rice Hard and Crusty!The rice Always undercooked !

Great nasi lamak and fried noddles

The bee hoon and noodles are very tasty.  The sunny side up is cooked to perfection. Highly recommended to anyone who likes bee hoon, fried Maggie mee, fried Kway tiao.  Support local family business!  This taste better than Tampines mall Fei siong.

It's closed today 22 October 2023. In case anyone still head down today.

Dutch dining in Pasir Ris.reviews:
This place serves really nice, aromatic coffee! Love how easy it is to order from your table using scanning the QR code to view their menu online. Their food is delicious and reasonably priced. Their service was fast too. Great place to have breakfast as it opens as early as 8am.

Shop does not entertain reservations.

***

Visited without reservations anyway. Food was not all that great. Orders were delivered wrongly. (No word of apologies).
Not worth time and effort though Lorong Chuan is a cool enclave. Give it a miss.

There wasn't cold so I liked it. Best of all, the coffee's tasted so good!!! It wasn't sour and I loved that I could taste two different types of espresso. I think the price is reasonable, too.

Decent brunch place. I love that tax & GST r inclusive in the menu price

My go to is the chicken burger set. Really filling and tasty, esp the generous sweet potatoes

Croissant egg was decent. The croissant should be more chewy and buttery.
The added chicken was very generous, but quite dry and boring

They will serve free water if u ask. In a small glass, but won't refill

The seats r limited. I always prefer coming in solo for some quiet brunch time

Sourdough with avocado and coffee were really good. Chocolate croissant not as great but not bad neither. Service staff was so friendly and welcoming. Place was clean and tidy. Not crowded during a Sunday afternoon which I like it too.

Vietnamese cuisine in Ang Mo Kio.reviews:
Read many good reviews and it's my first time coming here to try.

The Banh Mi sandwiches are all nice tasting n their own way.

Roasted pork - still slightly crispy and flavourful. I added pate for $2 which is creamy and complements the sauces and meats.
Grilled BBQ pork - the meats is well marinated and kinda like a savory sausage. Not bad.
Slat baked roast chicken - children like this cos the meat flavour is milder than the pork I guess
Spring rolls - quite large pieces, suggest to buy and share esp is also buying the banh mi.

Overall must eat! I believe the rat saga is well over and I wish the staff and business all the best to continue providing great Vietnamese fare!

I am not a fan of Banh Mi but this changed my mind about this humble sandwich. The bun was crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside while the generous fillings were flavourful but yet not too salty. The coffees were good too and were huge enough to be shared. Glad that dine-in is available again as the ambience was very quirky and authentic. Friendly service too. The menu is diverse and includes pho, spring rolls and flan. Those who stay nearby to this gem are really lucky.

Came here cause I was recommended by a friend, wasn’t a fan of Vietnamese food in Singapore and bahn mi but this stall changed my mind about it.
Utilizing a super crispy and crunchy baguette for their bahn mi, I would say their bread is the star of the show. Not forgetting their generous toppings, given that it’s about $9 making it priced fairly in my opinion.

The other “plated” stuff like their rice noodles and rice meals are also great, I had the grilled bbq pork rice noodles for $10. It’s a little pricey given that it’s not exactly a cafe , however the taste is great and you should try it for yourself.

The stools provided are a little uncomfortable for adults but they bring a certain cute atmosphere to the place hence I gave it 4 stars here for atmosphere.

Ordered number 4, with the roasted pork, and all the fixings (cucumber, coriander, spring onions, pate). They’re super generous with the servings, and there’s lots of ingredients stuffed in the lightly toasted baguette; the whole thing was the length of my forearm!!

The takeaway corner also has friendly staff, especially the cashier who patiently asks every customer how they’d like their order, and helps make recommendations when the extensive menu makes choosing just 1 thing too difficult.

10/10 would love to come again!

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Banh My Saigon in Singapore, and I must say, it was an absolute delight. This unassuming gem of a restaurant offers a culinary experience that is nothing short of exceptional.

The first thing that struck me about Banh My Saigon was its cozy and inviting ambiance. The warm and welcoming decor creates a comfortable setting for a memorable dining experience. The staff, too, were incredibly friendly and attentive, adding a personal touch to the entire visit.

Now, let's talk about the food. Banh My Saigon specializes in Vietnamese cuisine, and they do it with an authenticity that's hard to come by. I started with the traditional pho, and it was a flavorful bowl of comfort. The broth was rich, the noodles perfectly cooked, and the meat tender and full of flavor. It truly transported me to the streets of Vietnam.

The real star of the show, however, was their banh mi. The crispy baguette, fresh vegetables, and a choice of mouthwatering fillings make for a sandwich that is an explosion of flavors and textures. Whether you're a fan of classic options like the grilled pork or daring enough to try their unique creations, you won't be disappointed.

One thing that stood out for me at Banh My Saigon was the attention to detail in their dishes. It's clear that the chefs take great pride in their craft. The presentation was as impressive as the taste, making every meal a feast for both the eyes and the palate.

What also impressed me was the affordability of the food. You get high-quality Vietnamese cuisine at reasonable prices, making it an excellent option for both casual dining and special occasions.

In conclusion, Banh My Saigon in Singapore is a true culinary gem. With its warm ambiance, friendly staff, and delicious, authentic Vietnamese dishes, it's a must-visit for anyone looking to embark on a culinary journey to Vietnam without leaving Singapore. I can't recommend this place enough, and I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

Vietnamese cuisine in Ang Mo Kio.reviews:
Beware: no price list. Owner charges whatever amount she deems fit.

Bought pork noodles once or twice. Always faced with very bad attitude from both the younger and older female vietnamese ladies. Only the Chinese guy working there is polite. No choice as this is the only vietnamese place in the area to satisfy cravings.

Today was the last straw. Faced with the usual bad attitude and was charged $10 for the above meal which was prepared in 30secs.

Most vietnamese people I've met have been so friendly and warm. Quite sad that these people come to Singapore for a better life and instead start to cheat and abuse Singaporeans.

Will stop patronizing this stall from now on.

Nice Vietnamese noodles at reasonably price. A hearty portion and flavorful soup. Can try.

Chanced upon this when craving for Vietnamese rice rolls and it is such a great find! Although $7 for 4 rolls for a stall at coffee shop, the fat rolls are worth it! The prawn and beef noodles soup (although there were pork ribs inside) was nice too. Glad this can be found at AMK

Not common to get hu tieu namvang so I decided to try.

Taste wise is quite nice though I think too salty w msg taste. For $7 they do giv quite abit of meat n prawn is fresh

Will look forward to try other dishes.

Super delicious Vietnamese food.
I rarely give good comment for Vietnamese food in Singapore as not much good tasted as my country. But this one is good.
Recommended for Singaporean who want to try Vnese food with reasonable price and nice food 🍲

would give 1 more star for food if the pho came with a side of raw veggies typically served with pho. also the beefball was too undercooked that i had to spit it out. but i understsnd it could be a one off accident.

the soup was good and flavourful and i liked the noodle texture, not too soft, quite chewy.

not sure why the spicy one is $2 more then the original. is the extra chilli paste added really worth $2?

had the spicy one with the chili seperate. i prefer the original soup, dont think adding the chilli makes it better.

service was good, guy manning the stall is friendly and helpful

Sorry. But really no standard. Ordered lemongrass chicken rice. But the whole thing taste like garlic and black pepper. No lemongrass taste. And the chicken was heat up in microwave. Not my kind of food.
I dont know what gravy they use also.

Flavourful hearty bowl of Pho, noodles were springy and light along with tender beef slices.

The soup is nice. It is just nice. Not f-ing shiok, not taste bad. Just "meh". Fragrant but blend. Its has a strong flavourful smell but when you drink the soup, it didnt live up to the expectations. Noodles and beef slices were fresh. Soup disappointed.

Food tastes so so. Service is normal, you pay and get a buzzer then collect upon notification. Coffeshop setting with lots of seats on weekend evening.

Vietnamese cuisine in Ang Mo Kio.reviews:
This is an interesting place. It sells combination of laksa and Vietnamese dishes. There must be an interesting story behind their decision to sell these 2 unrelated type of food :).

Anyway, decided to try their banh mi. The bread was soft inside and crispy outside. Nice sauce and well marinated meat.

Very rare to find Vietnamese cuisine in food centre. Laksa seems to be the popular for most residences. But decided to try the original Vietnamese pho. No regrets. Tasted very nice nd generous with the shredded chicken $3.50. The broth is so flavourful. Another must eat is their spring roll ×2pcs $2.50. Usually you need to travel downtown to Vietnamese restaurant. So this is the place if you want to enjoy simple Vietnamese food. My next visit will try the Laksa and rice item. For tourist, come and experience this and other local food stalls. No regrets.

One of my go to lunch places at Mayflower Market. From Mayflower MRT station (TEL) take exit 2 or 3.

Authentic taste and really value for money. The stall serve Laksa that is equally delicious too.

Spring roll noodle and special pork chop rice are my favourite but you can also try their fresh vietnamese spring roll, banh mi, and chicken phó🤤🤤🤤yum!

This is the laksa i been having since i was a kid, which is also my late father favourite laksa. Elderly uncle no longer cook the laksa now. maybe that reason the laksa taste abit off but still not bad.  Elderly uncle will still come to stall and see see look look. The stall now focus more on vietnamese food.

Laksa sauce was thick and flavorful. Quite typical ingredients like cockles, sliced fish cake, tau pok and bean sprouts.

Vietnamese cuisine in Ang Mo Kio.reviews:
Was planning on visiting FIC for a very long time already, and we managed to drop by this sunday afternoon! Owners were very friendly and heartwarming, and the food were delicious!

We ordered FIC Fried Spring Roll Vermicelli Bowl, Fresh Spring Rolls, Paper Pizza (Lemongrass Chicken + Mentaiko Crabmeat), Phin Viet Coffee (Iced, White) and Fried Ice Cream (Coconutti).

Vermicelli Bowl was full of herbs and flavours, and it was not too spicy (good for people who can't take too much spice).

Fresh Spring Rolls were packed full of ingredients, and the dipping sauce elevated the whole dish.

Paper Pizzas were true to their names - they were really crispy rice paper(?) topped with generous amounts of ingredients and 1 pizza can fit 1 pax perfectly (the owners mentioned that it was actually a side dish).

Viet Coffee had a very unique aftertaste, and I really enjoyed it even though I'm not much of a coffee person. The sweetness level has been adjusted to suit the local tastebuds, so it wasn't too sweet/bitter.

We ended our scrumptious meal with a serving of their famous Fried Ice Cream (FIC), topped with a nice amount of coconut shavings and nuts! The ice cream was vanilla-flavoured, and the outer crust layer was fried to a nice crisp.

Overall, we enjoyed ourselves and will definitely return to check out other items on their menu! Thank you for having us :) Highly recommended!

Yummy experience at FIC at a local neighbourhood area. Owner created her own dishes to suit local Singaporean with her unique twist of viet cuisine. Super yummy! Definitely worth the try, our favourite was the Cold white coffee, spring rolls and paper pizza. Do come down and support!

Great little cafe with affordable food with food that easily out match the pricing by a mile!

The coffee and vermicelli bowl were the highlight dishes for me! The Viet rolls and pizza came in a close second. Despite not being the top rated in my book, every single dish that came out of the kitchen was beautifully presented and satisfying to eat. No complaints in the food department!

The service was excellent as well!! The owner gladly and proudly introduced dishes to us and took her time to let us know what to expect from the dishes. She was absolutely easy to talk to, more than happy to answer any questions that you may have. Note: There are items that aren't on the menu. Strike a conversation with her, and she'll gladly tell you about the items that weren't shown on the menu.

The coffee took a while before their ready, but absolutely worth the wait. My advice is to order another drink together with the coffee to sip while you wait.

The vermicelli bowl is bee hoon based, soaked, and marinated with beautiful flavours of Vietnam! If this is your first time eating Vietnam cuisine, this would be a great introduction, something familiar to welcome you into a new cuisine. The only thing people might not be accustomed to is that the vermicelli bowl is served cold.

Overall, it's a must try! Even if you're new to Vietnamese cuisine, this would be a great place to start.

Loved the fried spring rolls, super crispy and tasty. The fresh rolls were also super generously stuffed with prawn and pork. Overall really yummy & will be back. The owner is super sweet too :)
Only downside for me was the ventilation (the place was abit smoky)

Fried Ice Cream sounded like a very interesting proposition so we thought to give this restaurant a try. First impressions is that the food was carefully prepared and looks good. We liked the chicken wings and vermicelli more than the rice plates. The pizza was by far the best dishes but not filling as it’s super thin. I think this restaurant is still new as orders still gets mixed up (serving later customers earlier). The Fried Ice Cream was very beautifully prepared but all of us felt it was kinda watery inside probably due to the heat from deep frying. Very friendly service from the cashier. Ambience was a bit hot for lunch and the additional spotlights made it even warmer.

Vietnamese cuisine in Ang Mo Kio.reviews:
3pcs fresh spring roll ($5.50)
Fresh ingredients, large amount of pork belly and fresh prawns. 3 pcs for that price is worthy and considerate esp at neighbourhood area. Will takeaway again if im around Marymount.

Cold milk coffee ($2.80)
Nice thick viet milk coffee, even the ice has melt I felt the drink was still great. It doesnt cut on the amount. As compared to coffeeshop price it may be pricey, but the thickness of it is worth the try.

Downside of the place is more for takeaways, nonetheless the food are prepared esp for rolls are done upon request. 👍🏻

I ordered the black pepper beef banh mi. They were really generous with the beef, every bite I had was full of it. The bread was also very fragrant and delicious. I would say it wasn’t as crispy as other banh mi places I’ve visited, but again that could be due to condensation from having to take away the food (no seating).

Also, if you’re a student, you get 10% off every set meal (banh mi + drink). So it usually works out to be around $7, which is extremely affordable. :)

All in all I would absolutely visit this place again.

If I could give 3.5 stars I would.
TL:DR new stall finding their footing, wait time too long, food nothing special.

**But I do think they will continue to grow and change since the stall is pretty new.
--------------
Our usual Vietnamese stall at the nearby market is closed and on one grocery trip we walked past this and thought to give it a try.

We got the Signature Pork Banh Mi ($6.50), Chicken Banh Mi ($5.50) and Beef Rice Vermicelli ($6.50). It seems you can request for no spicy / less spicy / more spicy for the Banh Mi.

It's a takeaway-only stall with no seats at the bottom of a HDB block. There was one lady assembling the Banh Mi, another at the back whom I assumed was preparing ingredients, a man manning the cashier. I do hope they are refining their processes because I waited 20-25 mins for my order. There were 2 people who had ordered ahead of me. It didn't help I needed to rush off to work, but I did feel the wait was a bit too long.

Signature Pork Banh Mi looked like it was made from sliced ham - to be fair the slices were tasty, we were just expecting actual meat. It was also unexpected that other ingredients (veggie and condiments) weren't very tasty / present. Perhaps we have been spoiled by Banh Mis that cannot be closed due to overflowing veggie and meat for a slightly lower price....

Flavours-wise, the rice vermicelli wasn't very exciting - that is, compared to the usual market stall or even the one I have at work. I'm not sure if the sauce is diluted or if it's their recipe, but it's somewhat flat and mild. I was concerned it would be spicy but had zero issues. The amount of meat given was pretty good for the price. I did feel there could have been more veggies though!

We're not in a hurry to purchase again, but never say never :)

I was walking around and saw this newly open place selling banh my and coffee. It looks authentic so I decided to try and loved it. The person who was making banh my was actually a Vietnamese and the taste was great. It was crispy and delicious.

I also ordered a coconut milk coffee and it was very good as well. It was strong but refreshing at the same time.

The Bánh Mì was assembled by herself infront of your eyes with fresh ingredient and toasted after. The crispy loaf had its unique taste from pâté, french word for paste that’s usually made from some meat.

Bánh Mì & Coffee by Phan have 4 different Bánh Mì you can choose from.
- Signature Pork Bánh Mì $6.5
- Black Pepper Beef Bánh Mì $6.5
- Shredded Chicken Bánh Mì $5.5
- Golden Egg Bánh Mì $5

They also served other authentic Vietnamese cuisine like Spring roll(3pcs $5.50), Shredded Chicken with rice vermicelli($5.50) and Black pepper beef with rice vermicelli($6.50) which are really affordable to the hood.

There’s a distinct fragrance from the Milk Coffee ($2.50 Hot) that I couldn’t really describe what it is. I also recommend trying their Ice Coconut Milk Coffee ($3) here.

Vietnamese cuisine in Ang Mo Kio.reviews:
Fantastic food at reasonable price!!! I liked everything i ordered and this considers the price point and value you get from the meal as well. Chicken pho costs only $6 but you get a ton of food, light/refreshing/authentic broth. $9.80 Grilled lemon grass chicken with egg and rice, acceptable price, grilled chicken was tender and comes with appetizing sauce. Fried chicken $7, a bit on the dry side but i think the flavor's good. Though there's room for improvement on the food, but i do think we should support new F&B establishments in north east area that adds to the vibrancy in the food scene!

Having the chicken cutlet with garlic fried rice, still eating halfway but already felt the need to share! Surprisingly good; fried rice with wok hei, cutlet with right crispiness and flavour, spicy but shiok chili. More veg would be nice though. Will be back to try the other items on the menu. Owner/staff also said Banh Mi will be added soon

Ate here because I happened to be in the area. The stall doesn't look like much but the food is on point! Had the cutlet and fried rice, fresh and well fried. The cutlet was legit and the rice was surprisingly solid with good wok hei. Better than your average zi char for sure.

Ordered chicken pho for my daughter and char kway teow (spicy) for myself.  Both were very tasty, and they were quite generous in terms of ingredients!  Good value!

Had the Taiwanese chicken cutlet and fried kway teow. Nice!

When I took first sip of ice coffee, I’m impressed. It does taste abit like Vietnamese coffee but less strong and more suited for local taste but yet still strong enough for my taste

Try the hot coffee but abit strong for my taste so I recommend ice one which is slightly diluted but still strong

I like the Ice Milo. Its very good. ;)

Vietnamese cuisine in Ang Mo Kio.reviews:
As a regular customer at Lang Nướng Vietnam, I cannot express enough how fantastic this place is. It has, hands down, the best Vietnamese barbecue in Singapore. The staff are always so friendly and accommodating, and the owner never fails to make you feel at home by personally greeting each guest. And let’s talk about the food - absolutely delicious every single time! The raw prawn dish, in particular, is to die for. It’s obvious that a lot of care goes into every aspect of this restaurant, from the carefully crafted menu to the overall atmosphere. I always look forward to my visits to Lang Nướng Vietnam and highly recommend it to anyone looking for authentic flavors and top-notch service. It’s always a treat to dine here!

Food very nice. I like their cockles in tamraind sauxe as well as the prawns steamed in herbs. Service staff very approachable and friendly. Very attentive to your needs. Ambience very nice, feels like you are transported to a local eatery in Vietnam with the low tables and chairs. Vietnamese music in the play too .

Stumbled into this restaurant on a Sunday and it was empty compared to the rest of its neighbours.

We ordered the BBQ meat dishes as recommended and asked for them to help us with the BBQ in the kitchen.

Pork was the best of the lot.
The premium beef was out of stock and we opted for the VN beef. It tasted like protein just not beef. It was coated with alot of sweet sauce and we could quite make out what meat it was.

The coke we ordered was flat and there wasn’t and fizz left.

We packed some more food home.
The usual, Pho, spring rolls to continue out dinner as it was really stuffy and hot in the restaurant.

Staff was friendly except a little forgetful.
We waited half an hour only to be informed they ran out of the dish we ordered.

Self proclaimed first Vietnamese BBQ in Singapore that transports you to Vietnam with its low tables and chairs, making you believe you're eating on the streets of Saigon.
Meat never tasted this refreshing with their generous serving of herbs and tangy sauces.

29 May 2023:
the most authentic Vietnamese food I’ve tasted in Singapore so far. grilled pork & vermicelli was really good!!! fried spring rolls made us gasp a bit so definitely must try. the shaky beef was not good, too tough- lesson learnt, don’t order a dish just cause the name is funny. their coffee is nice but wished it was stronger (Vietnamese coffee has to knock you off your chair to be of standard right?)

3rd July 2023:
Decided to try their broken rice. It’s as good as the vermicelli! really loved the meatloaf too (it has tiny noodles inside) overall great, clean & fills you up.

Vietnamese cuisine in Ang Mo Kio.reviews:
This unassuming joint in Kovan has a small but tasty menu of Vietnamese salad bowls and banh mi. It is a quick-serve concept that caters to healthy eaters with less sugar and salt, and virtually no MSG or oil. Special mention goes to the avocado mousse ice cream — a rare find in Singapore.

[What it’s good for]
The banh mi classic (S$9.50) is stacked full of pate and butter spread, Vietnamese pork ham (cha lua), pork floss, pickled carrots and daikon, and enough chilli to make you sweat. The ham is the standout star, thanks to its meaty juiciness. The banh mi beef ribeye (S$13) features premium beef ribeye that's sliced fairly thinly and roasted perfectly with a flavourful tenderness and a touch of five spice. The sandwich is stuffed with a heap of coriander and fresh chilli. The pork belly bowl (S$10.80) comes with a generous portion of chunky and fatty pork belly, which is tender and nice to chew on. There’s also a certain smokiness from the marinade that melds harmoniously with the other ingredients. For the more health-conscious, try the regular pork bowl (S$10.80) that is less fatty than the pork belly version and vibrates with a more savoury umami flavour.

Vietnamese coffee (S$4.60) is the only drink served here. It's rich and has a dark flavour profile, with strong chocolate and caramel notes. The avocado mousse ice cream (S$6.80) — dark green avocado mousse at the bottom of the bowl, with coconut ice cream, desiccated coconut, almond flakes, and chopped peanuts on top — is a beautiful dance between the decadently creamy mousse and denser, milky ice cream.

[What it could improve on]
There was a lack of sauce (think sriracha) and oil — perhaps olive or sesame — that could take the banh mi here to another level.

[Our quick takes]
Is it conducive to conversation? -—Yes, but I can’t imagine it’s the kind of place you’d want to stay at for long.
Is a reservation necessary? — No reservation needed!
How to get there? — A 13-minute walk from Serangoon MRT station should get your appetite started. Otherwise, there are several buses from both Serangoon and Kovan MRT stops.

[Things to note]
If you like the salad sauce, you can add 50 cents for another container — totally worth it.
Do note that this place is hardly suitable for groups — there are just eight stools and three wooden tables. I’d consider it more of a delivery and takeaway spot.

Read more at HungryGoWhere for the full review

A hidden gem around upset Serangoon, nested among the boutique cafes. Well toasted bahn mi with generous ingredients, could be stronger in taste with more sauces but still great overall!
Ordered the grilled pork bowl filled with lots of well charred grilled pork balanced out with crunchy vegs and rice vermicelli, will try the other bowls next time!

Located deep within a commercial space in between Kovan and Serangoon is this humble Vietnamese restaurant.

Dishes ordered were the chicken bowl and pork banh mi. Personally I would give the banh mi a miss mainly due to the tough pork meat used. On the other side, the chicken bowl was such a great deal, ingredients were generously given, mints and greens were so refreshing and crunchy while the nuts within gives a good crunch in texture.

Little downside would be its price and location.
Also please take note that there are very limited tables (3) for dine-in as this place mainly serves takeaway.

We tried the Pork Bowl, Chicken Bowl and also the Tofu Bowl. I like the char-ness with the roasted pork and chicken in both the meat bowl. I like that there is the option of tofu bowl which is vegetarian, as you know, we have all got one of such friend.

They are filled with greens including romaine lettuce, japanese cucumbers, big cherry tomatoes, mint, basil, pickles carrots and daikon. The mint gave a refreshing taste. There’s also chopped roast peanut for that addition crunch and taste.

The Chilled Vietnamese Coffee is really bold and strong with added sweetness from condensed milk. A little sweet and could do with some melted ice for that perfect taste.

Delicious Vietnamese food! We had the pork belly and chicken bowl which was very flavourful. The chilled Vietnamese coffee tasted bold and refreshing. Will come back again!
Vietnamese cuisine in Ang Mo Kio.name: Qwang - Vietnamese Food You Love
Vietnamese cuisine in Ang Mo Kio.query: Vietnamese cuisine in Ang Mo Kio

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
Stumbled across this place today and decided to eat here with my mum. Very no frills and simple place.

She had a falafel moussaka, and I had the mexican beef bowl. The moussaka was delicious but I feel like 5 pieces of nacho chips wasn’t enough and mind you this cost $13…..

The beef bowl was a little dry, could do with some kind of sauce but it was good and we finished both dishes. The churros came freshly fried and was good too, but would have preferred actual choc sauce vs the hershey choc syrup.

Only gripes; the overly sugary lemongrass drink that was served premade with no ice. Had to ask for ice twice but given few pieces…..  also very weird that we dined in but were served with plastic cutlery when we clearly saw metal cutlery, it was a little strange. It was practically only 2 tables and the lady served my food to the other table…. Could tell she wanted to take it back to serve me but they already started eating it.

I think its a quaint little place but some things need to be improved. At $30 for 2 expected just a little more.

Excellent service. The beef Mexican rice bowl was not bad. With the homemade drink, I spent less than $10. I was there alone at 5 ish and I had the entire place to myself. I don't remember music playing but it sure would be nice to listen to some tunes.

Small quaint shop located near Tai Seng Mrt, they had a $10 set meal that had a wrap, small hash brown and a lemongrass tea. There was a small side of nacho chips with salsa.

Nothing amazing but I guess it was better than nothing coz there wasn’t anything there open before 11am

Dropped-off my 10-months old laptop at LENOVO Service Centre at 3 Irving Rd, #01-17 Tai Seng Centre. BITC, Singapore 369522 on Tuesday 18 April 2023,

Thus decide to settle my late lunch within the area too.

One will be spoiled with choices as there are so many small eateries and cafes. I was drawn to  Olive Mediterranean & Middle East which was located across the street at 11 Irving Place #01-14/15, Tai Seng Point, Singapore 369551.

Ordered for myself a Mexican Rice (Celantro & Spinach With Beef) Bowl at S$7.50.

If you are a small eater, the serving portion is just right. However, definitely a "No. No." for someone who has a heavy duty digestive system, I would recommend that you order some nachos or Quesadillas too.

In my opinion, the rice is mildy aromatic (I was expecting a more pungent aroma of Celantro and spinach).

I will rate the minced beef topping as "healthy choice".  It is relatively quite nice BUT will not leave one any special impression.  It will definitely taste alot better if there is a little more fat (this will enhance the juiciness) and more spices are added.

However, if you working in this area, it is a great place to meet up with your colleagues and friends after work.  You can sufficient outdoor sittings surrounded with plants.

Stumbled on this place as i happened to be browsing around. Been awhile since i had my tacos and wraps, decided to try this as i noticed they had very high reviews.

Had the beef Quesadilla - loved it as it was simply nice
Chicken Saffron Stew - Soooo tender and nice but soup wasnt as thick as i wanted but thats purely due to my own taste
Hashbrowns - Thumbsup as we all loved it. Hearsay its even better than M's hashbrown but i leave it for u to judge.

Service wise was top, very homely feel given by the lady boss and staff. She took her time to guide me through the menu and shared with me what we should order.
I must say the food takes a pretty long time to come for a quiet Monday Afternoon but i guess Good Food - Time to prepare so no complaints from me on this.

Overall i recommend this place based on the food served + prices. Very nice and they deserves better businesses. should be pretty quiet when its after office hours.

Will be back again :)

Streamed Gourmet (Koufu@Oasis Terraces)

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
Been there a couple of times and have seen the turnover of staffs. Barman with earrings is not so attentive. The rest of the staffs are so so. They need to learn how to walk while looking around rather than looking at the floor. Myanmar, India, Philippines staff good! The rest better wake up. Nonetheless Vibe wise band is good. Service can be better on a slow Monday Night. Good draught promo but bottle wise still expensive. Food was decent! Overall I”m just truthful.

There's live performance on Friday. I enjoyed the performance and the setting of the bistro. The place has a big seating, so during peek hours, you need to be patient. Food are always good. Their lamb chops were nicely done. Seafood marianna and chicken wings were nice too.

It's an ok bar to chill out with friends. its annoying with their Chinese live band, no international vibes. Was ok at first with English songs from the stereo till the live band started. Price was ok for a bar standard. Had a calamari and soju with coke for about 40 bucks

Highly do not recommend. UNHYGIENIC PLACE, FULL OF INSECTS with bad service recovery.

Lizard on their counter. Black bug in my cocktail. My drink was still a full glass as I only had tiny sips. The staff (lady with short hair) tried to return me the same drink sans the bug. Told me to speak to her supervisor instead.

Her supervisor was apologetic but insincere. He gave me a replacement drink that was extremely diluted with water. Based on the other reviews on here, this is their standard SOP.

Avoid at all cost unless you are willing to put your stomach at risk. There are much better bar options elsewhere.

Great place to enjoy a drink or two with family or friends. Live music entertainment helps liven up the atmosphere. It's getting crowded over the years compared to when it first started.

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.name: Frienzie Bar & Bistro

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
Went on a Monday evening, not my first time here. Always love their baby back ribs, juicy soft and tender moist from outside to inside, their mussels are also very good. Friendly staffs and serene surroundings, serves very good beer, will definitely come back again.

Nice area at Punggol settlement. By the seaside on the 2nd level, you can feel the sea breeze and occasionally sighting of climbing monkeys on the trees. Enjoy the sun set and enjoying the beer.

Service staff was excellent and attentive. Great service I must say, kudos to the team.

Despite been a bar, there’s kids menu for my kido so the adult can drink at ease without worrying what to order for the kids.

The beef burger was superb, as the veg were fresh as it can be and the patty is as juicy as it should be. No wet buns or whatsoever.

Mussel was well prepared, and my family enjoys it.

I regularly bring family and friends as this place has a great atmosphere, excellent food and perfect service. It's an enjoyable moment every time we go.
It's very cozy. The sea is litterally 10 meters away. There's a huge fish tank to make your kids busy. And the staff especially Melanie and Ken are very friendly and always go the extra mile to wow our visit giving us not choice to come back regularly.
Thank you.
Gregory

Made reservations for a simple dinner with a friend here. The location itself, which is at Punggol Settlement, is really inaccessible if you aren't driving a car. The nearest LRT station is Punggol Point, after which you would have to walk 1.2km. Not too sure about the bus, but I am pretty sure it's not too frequent as well.

However, this restaurant was worth the long journey. First of all, we were really lucky to be able to sit indoors because it had started to drizzle slightly. We were also seated directly in front of the TV, which was coincidentally showing the Women's World Cup between Colombia and England. Although we don't usually watch soccer, the atmosphere and the hype made the experience all the more worthwhile and we found ourselves watching it intensely too. For the food, we ordered spaghetti aglio olio, truffle fries, mojitoh and peach coolers. The aglio olio was delicious, although the portion could have been slightly more. The peach coolers was perfect to cool me down during a hot day, after which I ordered one more glass of it. The staff was also really professional in ensuring that our orders were swiftly prepared and that the food came out fast. Overall, if you are willing to travel a bit further, we recommend coming here for a chill night with friends or family. You can even walk along the coast after dinner, which was really relaxing.

We had a last minute family gathering (25 adults) for dinner at George's by the Bay.  The atmosphere was great.  The service was slightly slow but understandable given our large group and other guests at the restaurant (it was also a public holiday).  Kudos to staff for being accommodating - we had reserved tables for 16 but had to accommodate an additional 9.  All the dishes ( chicken satay, chicken wings, fries, chops, fish and chips, mushroom soup, garlic bread, and more) were delicious.   Will highly recommend and return!

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.name: Georges by the Bay

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
It is a good place to chill with family and friends. A decent variety of cuisines to choose from.
Do bring insect repellent if you are someone who attracts mozzies very well.

Wide variety of food choices, ranging from Malay Zi char (D'Rubinah), Lok Lok, Western (Whisk and Paddle), Eastern (near the container area), as well as activities to try on, e.g. prawning, billiard, strolling around the nearby park connectors or simply sit and chill.

It was simply too crowded even on weekdays! Food was quite average in taste.

Went here to past time till my friends came. Bought the Mee Thai Goreng and a delish Bandung , just enogh milkiness which I don't always get and sweetness.

The meal was sweet, mild spicy and savoury. The mee is on the wet side akin to Those mildy wet hokkien mee. Not the dry fried kind of mee Goreng I'm used to. The texture since it is more wet , compliments well with the flavours.

Good selection of food options with a good variety of preferences.  Mostly outdoor dining but not too hot.  Staff are generally friendly but atmosphere can be quite noisey depending on who are the other patrons.

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
Great place to head over to in the evening /night to watch the sky getting darker / the brilliant sunset when the skies are  clear. There is a picturesque spot to watch the sunset and take pictures.

The pond fronting the settlement has several turtles in it, who seem to swim over to the edges of the pond at the signs of human activity.

Several restaurants dot the settlement, offering patrons a choice of food and drinks.  Makes for a great place to chill out with friends/family. Can get loud and noisy at times. The cycling and walking trail from Sengkang goes through the settlement.

The public toilet though can be pretty disgusting  especially during public hoildays and weekends.

This place was delightful to eat at, the seafood was very fresh and portions were very large, staff also were very friendly. The yam meal was one of the most tastiest things I ate in Singapore. I will eat here again!

Came here because of good reviews. Indeed, it didn't disappoint us.

If you want to enjoy the happy hour beers, the best hour is come before 7pm to enjoy the special price.

Live band only available after 8pm.

It's next to the sea. Brilliant. Good food and beer of course!

Dishes ordered are tasteful 😋😋😋
Generous portion w reasonable price. Staff are approachable.
Beautiful view facing sea n harbor, breezy, spacious n clean environment.
Recommended whose driving there as family gathering, cycling, fishing n watching tortoises pond 🐢🐢🐢 its friendly n adorable 🤓🤓

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.name: The Punggol Settlement

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
Spacious dining area good atmosphere. Feels great with high ceiling. Enough staff running around.

My wife love the pizza very thin crust. I personally like the cream sauce with the Macaroni. Very rich in taste. The nachos beef  was great, crispy thin tortilla. Food portion were great with lots of filling on the pizza.

Keep it up! Thumbs up

Nice spot for a relaxing day! Outdoor or glass window seats are preferable as we can enjoy the greenery scene outside while having a meal. The staff is helpful. The food is not outstanding but not bad at all. Will definitely go back!

Had their seafood pan. I must say the bread they served was amazing. It’s crispy on the outside, soft and moist on the inside, more importantly, the bread was warm when served. A perfect combination to dip into the seafood pan.

Visited before and tried the Lamb and Prawn Rose this time around. The Lamb was super soft but a little bland, while the Prawn Rose was nice.

There is a playpen for kids at the outdoor tables, hence we weren't able to enjoy much of the nature ambience. However, those with kids would enjoy it.

Food will always be subjective but for us, it's good! Especially the shrimp aglio olio, calamari and the mini burger. Their breakfast is not bad as well, love the sandwich. Their milk shakes are tasty, must try the baileys espresso shake.

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.name: Whisk & Paddle

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
Honestly, wasn’t the most impressed with the service here at first, asked for order and the person simply said yes can continued doing his own stuff for 5minutes.

However, when the food came, i didn’t think too much about it afterwards. Starting from the hummus, absolutely generous and delicious portions. Perfect appetizer.

The butter rice with kebab was crazy delicious, we literally scraped the plate clean from the rice and the greek yogurt like substance in the centre.

Pizza was crispy and fragrant at the same time, the tomato sauce parts was absolutely amazing.

Strawberry drink was okay!!! Not super special but nice!

In the middle of Arab street you find this restaurant. We were welcomed by a real Turkish guy. Very friendly and he could advise us what was the best to order. We sat outside, along the street. Within 15 min the table was full with all kinds of grilled meat. Real Turkish flavors and a nice apple tea were enough to make my day complete. Eating here, and watching the people pass by is a big joy.

Parking in this area is very hard, as you can understand.

Had a great dinner here today. My friend saw this online with high rating stars so we just stopped by after work.  And yes, the food is delicious, the atmosphere is awesome, love the music too.
So if your family or friends are outgoing and friendly, this is the right place for you to gather together and laugh together and dance together !

Cuisine is new to me as a traveller. Trying the dish with my arab friends and the chef being a wonderful host in telling us about the different food added to the stellar experience of dining here. Service was awesome. Food was a good blend of flavors.

Just returning home from an amazing service and hospitality from Cappadocia.
Chef Ahmed Hagras went out of his way to arrange a very sweet surprise for my husband's birthday at my request.
The whole staff sang happy birthday for him with a special kunafe.

The food itself is finger licking good, no doubt. But the experience was way better.

Thank you everyone at Cappadocia for helping make this day special for him.

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.name: Cappadocia Turkish & Mediterranean Restaurant

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
I had the pleasure of trying Turkish cuisine for the first time, and it was truly a delightful experience! The standout dish for me was the lamb; it had absolutely no odor and tasted fantastic. The grilled items were a highlight as well, bursting with delicious flavors. The restaurant’s ambiance was beautifully decorated, and the staff was both charming and incredibly helpful, taking the time to explain the dishes to us. While it’s not the cheapest option, the prices are fair for the quality you receive.

One thing to note, though, is that the platter we ordered was described as “for two,” but for Asians, it’s considered a generous portion. So, if there are four of you and you’ve already ordered other dishes, I recommend going for the platter for two only; it’s quite substantial. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great dining experience!

First time having Turkish food and was really
pleasantly surprised. Their dips and bread was really exceptional. The bread was steaming when it came out it was both crispy and fluffy at the same time. The platter for 2 was also great all the grilled meats was tender and flavourful. Portion was also huge.

Everything from the service to food were impeccable. Staff were polite and always made sure we were well taken care of. I ordered before my friend came and they asked when the food should be prepared and how it should be served. Food was perfectly done too. It is the little things that make a difference and win them a return customer.

Very impressive food & service displayed by the dedicated front staffs and chefs. It’s nice walking in the street after a wine & dine session in the area. The staffs were very attentive, price is reasonable.

Went here for a birthday celebration and the attention to detail from their service staff is amazing, didn’t mention to the staff that it was for a birthday celebration, only had a note in the reservation. But they went above and beyond, having candles in the dessert and even giving us props to take pictures with and proceeded to then print out the photo of us to keep!

The food also matches the service, authentic Turkish cuisine done perfectly, the Hummus was so good we had to order a second portion! I’m not usually a fan of chicken but the chicken that came with the platter blew my mind, so juicy and tender. Then comes dessert, my first time having Kunefe and the only thing I have to say is that I wish I didn’t share it, wanted it all to myself 🤣

Definitely coming back here again!

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
The perfect place chosen for a birthday celebration!!

From great service, to amazing ambience, to tasty food... everything was simply perfect!

Awesome selection for both veg & non-veg menu!!

2 thumbs up!

Thank you Byblos for making our evening beautiful!

Quality food, ambience and excellent service from staff made the dinner special. Thanks to receptionist Mahiti for always giving a great smile to all guest. It definitely makes a difference.

We celebrated my brother's birthday here and had a great time. The restaurant is beautifully decorated with classic Turkish designs and really put us in the mood for their cuisine.

We ordered the mixed grilled platter to share and they portioned it for to the seven people in our party. The salads were fresh and the dessert was delicious. I highly recommend their kunfa as it's authentic, made fresh and absolutely scrumptious.

My only drawback was the warmth. There could have been better distribution of air-conditioning, other than that we had a swell time. I know there are many other restaurants in the area offering a similar experience but Byblos stands apart with class and authenticity.

LOVE the food!!! Hot, freshly baked lavash bread, delectable and well seasoned kebabs, even the salads appealed to my picky 11 year old. Ambience was lovely, only downside was the music is a wee bit loud (I was sitting indoors), but the staff brought down the volume. Our plates were all cleaned out, clearly we enjoyed dinner at Byblos. Highly recommended!

There are many Turkish food restaurants along Arab Street but this is the best one I've had here. In fact, I daresay it's the best Turkish food I've ever had. The Chef and waiters were all very welcoming!

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
Wonderful experience at the Med last weekend. First time trying Mediterranean Food and it blew my mind. Nat took the time to show us around the house and it was beautiful.
We were led to the roof top during sunset and the view was stunning.
We had some snacks at the roof top while they were preparing the dinner.
After sunset, we head down to have dinner.
Strongly recommend!
Love ALL the dishes presented.

Celebrated our engagement at Med@59JCT and had such a wonderful and charming experience! Al and Natalie were the best hosts you could ask for, from start to end. They were so generous, kind, and charming as they shared the intentions and origins behind each dish and design choice. I loved hearing about how they chose to emphasise some of the Peranakan and Chinese design elements of the house whilst infusing it with their own identity and culture!

The house was as beautiful as the food was delicious - we came here for a meal, but left with so much more!

GREAT dining experience at Med@59JCT. We had enjoyed the delicious Mediterranean food prepared by AI. AI explained the food and story about the food. Love it all.
Not only the delicious Mediterranean food, a good chat with AI make the dining experience even better.
Will be back again.

Had the best private dining experience with my closest friends at Med@59jct. Al and Nat were the most friendly and welcoming host, Nat brought us on their house tour and explain patiently to our questions.. we were very intrigued by the many interesting displays in their place. Al, is like a master chef! The dishes were amazing one after another, with each dish explained by Al carefully. We were belly full!!!
Special mention to the moroccan spiced carrots and tomato zucchini bake. Al mentioned that food doesn’t have to be complicated… We can feel all the love that Al and Nat has put in for the private dining experience.. My friends and I enjoyed ourselves throughout the dinner and will definitely be back for more.
Bonus tip, just add on the wine pairing.. You won’t be disappointed! 😉🍷

Went in a group of 4 in early 2023.
Food - delicious, varied, made with a lot of care and accommodated 2 vegetarians in our group. Portions were very large so go hungry.
Hospitality - Al and Nat were very warm and answered all our questions patiently and in a lot of detail.
Shophouse - really tastefully renovated and love that all the pieces have a story.

Highly recommended and hope to return. Thank you Al and Nat for the lovely dinner.

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.name: Med@59JCT

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
Third time back at this restaurant and certainly will be back for more. Authentic Turkish cuisine and we especially love the creamy hummus, chickpea stew and delightful kunefe. Great service as well. Will recommend to visit in a group to try a variety of sides and mains!

Everything is delicious here! Staffs are friendly, the Kunefe is one of the best, and the Karavan kebabs, both beef and lamb, are amazing! 😅 The hot pita bread is also great. In the last 4-5 months, we've visited this place many times, and our friends love it too. Whenever we want to enjoy a meal without worrying about quality and taste, we head straight to this restaurant. 😋 You won't regret giving it a try!

Hummus! Good! The lunch set is value for money - comes with a main + drink + soup + bread + dessert all for $20!
The pita bread is baked to perfection and the submarine bread looks so amazing! However the price for the submarine bread is a little high. Will probably not order this again the next time.
The soup of the day was lentil soup (vegetable soup) its really rich and herby. Very different from what i usually have.
The chicken dish is the highlight of the meal. The chicken meat is sooooo soft and tender. The seasoning is on point. Goes really well with the breads. The rice that comes with the dish is really fragrant as well.
Lots of vegetarian options.
Overall a positive experience and will recommend 👍🏻

Total bill is about $85++

Ordered quite abit for 2 person.  Love the cauliflower salad. Hummus, eggplant dips. As we were celebrating our birthday, the restaurant gave us complimentary tea and a kind of Turkish delight. The staff were attentive and friendly. Will definitely go back for the cauliflower salad and hummus.

This was my second visit today and my colleagues and I absolutely loved the food! I am usually not a fan of Turkish or Mediterranean food but this place is an exception. After trying the food a few months ago for the first time, I have been wanting to visit them again.

Every dish was delicious and tasted fresh and   wholesome. The Mezeplate is a good option if you are not sure what to order as it has a bit of everything and you can to try the different dips and appetisers. I enjoyed the hummus, cauliflower salad and eggplant dip very much. Their lentil soup was very good too - comforting and tasty.

For the mains, we tried two of their lunch set meals -  two rice dishes with the different chicken kebabs which were served with tea, soup and a rice pudding dessert. We also ordered their salmon which was so tender and flavourful. Several colleagues commented that it was the best salmon they had ever tasted!

The highlight of the meal was their dessert - Kunefe which was absolutely delicious! The taste and texture was so complex and had so much depth! The crispy stringy pastry with the creamy sauce, nuts and ice cream was indeed like what the menu described it to be - “a slice of heaven”!

This is seriously an underrated restaurant which serves amazing food and I would highly recommend it :)
Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.opening_hours:
