Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.name: The Mediterranean Deli Turk

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
I came to Singapore few weeks ago and was looking for Mediterranean restaurants. I stumbled upon this gorgeous place 5 minutes away from my hotel. I tried Kebabs on day one and man it was delicious. Atmosphere is great and all servers are friendly, specially three girls Urmi, Wendy and Fina are super nice, they make sure to get you a table quickly, take the order in timely manner and also make valuable suggestions on the menu. They always keep checking if everything is fine and customers are enjoying food. I loved the desert suggestion after eating my dinner. After first day I have been to this place 7-6 times and was always greeted with same service. I highly recommend this restaurant and will go again before I leave Singapore for USA.

We had the sultan's delight and mussels with garlic cream and cheese toast. The sultan's delight is really enjoyable. We could taste the smokiness from the eggplant puree and the lamb stew is really tender with tomato based sauce. It's tangy and smoky with some crunchiness from the pine nuts. Really enjoyable. But the mussel is pretty standard. It didn't taste really fresh but they're quite generous with the amount. The garlic cheese sauce is ok only.
Service was good and attentive.

Visited for my birthday meal with my family as I was craving some Mediterranean food and this place had great reviews. However, the whole experience ended up kinda disappointing - as I had high expectations too on my first visit.

Service:
- It’s a restaurant but I felt like there was not much service per say.
- It’s a pretty high price point but they don’t serve complimentary water (charged at $3 a pot of hot water, or $11 for Evian water only)
- Ordering isn’t as fuss free as they try to make it. Online ordering only from mobile app, with just one physical menu at the door. Asked for any extra copies for easier viewing but none available. You also have to pay upfront in mobile order.
- Feels like I visited a restaurant but received fast food style service.

Atmosphere:
- Overall atmosphere is okay. Like a typical restaurant

Food:
- Average, I’ve had much better at other places for a similar price point.
- Pita bread, spreads and kebab grills were okay.
- Saffron rice & Briyani rice were disappointing. They use basmati rice which gave a nice texture. However, flavour is so subtle that I could barely taste the difference between the 2.

Summary:
Would I return? Definitely not! For the price point, the food and service didn’t live up to expectations for a highly rated restaurant. Will continue on my hunt for yummy Mediterranean food!

Visited on a Thu night, it's superb crowded and busy in the restaurant. 3 dishes for 2 people, very filling. Overall the food is pretty decent and the price point is on the higher side.

Excellent experience with vibrant dining experience. Food has great range of taste to excite the palate. Service is welcoming and top notch, they also gave a complimentary cake.
Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.name: Pistachio Middle Eastern & Mediterranean Grill

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
A very welcoming atmosphere and service was top notch. The concept and food was unique and good but like what others have mentioned, the portion can be rather small for its price tag. The wagyu beef was the highlight.

Definitely a unique place to visit if you’d want to try Mediterranean food and the service is really good. It’d be a place to consider revisiting if the portion matches its price tag.

The kind of place we had absolutely nothing to complain about.

Great food quality, amazing service, awesome atmosphere and inanely good cocktails.

We’ll be back

Food is great but the portion is too little, this should be improved.  Drinks are great, they have their own signature cocktail  The restaurant has great music and vibes.  Great for pre-dinner drinks.  Interior is beautiful and cleverly designed.

Best cheese cake I’d ever tried!!

It’s a new & cozy restaurant with passionate staff, one of the best restaurant in my SG trip, especially their cheese cake and the bikini… miss them so much!

First time into this nice Mediterranean Restaurant, ambience is good. Food is superb with Chef Marcus recommendations. The grilled salmon n lamb kofta were good! Love their desserts grapefruit tart n ice cream sandwich. The service is great n staff are friendly..

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
Never thought i would give a bad review.
Chicken Tikka Burrito was subpar. But not as bad as the salmon grain bowl.
One of the worest salmon grain bowl. The sauce was watery, diluted. But the "cardboard like" salmon is just unforgivable... first and probably last time ever gonna try this again.
Not worth it at all for $11.90.
Would also like to highlight that I had this for dinner afew blocks away from the outlet. (10mins Walking distance). So you can rule out this as a reason.
Check out the video to see the toughness of the salmon.
No one should suffer this. Really.

It was a terrible experience. The chicken was all black and burnt and he told me I do not know what is kebab. I've bought it many times before and it's never been this charred. And the shop assistant was very rude and discriminated against women, and scolded me very loudly. Pointing his finger at me the whole time and telling me not to talk to me because I'm a woman.Very angry, very angry！！！！as a consumer to be pointed at by a man is very angry. And no apology at all！！！！

Food was a bit pricey compared to stuff d. Options were not as many as well. But on the upside it tasted healthy and delicious overall

Staff is friendly and efficient. 👍🏼

First time trying the lamb salad box. Quite a variety of choices although food could do better if kept warm.

Personally I feel the meat griller shld be placed at front of shop instead of the back. The smell and sight wld definately bring in more crowds. Almost missed the stall if i was not purposely looking for a halal stall.

Price is abit high but understandably since its lamb.

Nothing was warm. Food was alright. Service was great. But for the price i paid for a basic bowl ($10), i would rather get stuffd

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
The food nice and very tasty, but the service zero very delayed to service the customer the staff looking supersized if ask them for things really disappointed from service ( but food amazing)

I recently tried out  this restaurant and it was absolutely amazing!

The food was incredibly flavorful, with a wide variety of delicious dishes to choose from.
The ambience was cozy and inviting, making it the perfect place to enjoy a meal with friends or family. I highly recommend giving it a try! 🍽️✨

Great food, welcoming ambiance.. you could say one of the best restaurants in Singapore to have dinner.

We’ve ordered Grand Konak for our team’s Party and the whole team have enjoyed the food! Grand Konak team is even so nice to accommodate our request as it’s their staff party too. They made sure that the food we are gonna have will be warm by the start of our party. I highly recommend Grand Konak for parties and gatherings, everything is just so delicious plus the service is really fantastic! We will for sure have them again for our next event ❤️

Nice Ambiance and Authentic Turkish and Mediterranean Cuisine.
We had mezza platter, Lavash and kunafee all were amazing

Ambrosia Mediterranean Lounge
Casa Mediterranea Restaurant

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
The waitress had a moody face but after a few orders in, her service became better. The food was well cooked and the seafood was quite fresh. Quite a chill place to have a few drinks and some skewers with friends. Very long walk from the nearest LRT station though. Better to drive or cycle there.

Staff was friendly and helpful, food was good, the grilled oyster is no more which was very good, but the current fresh oyster is also very big, juicy and fresh. The grilled lamb and pork was superb. Very nice to be back again.

The food and ambience is great, I had a late night snack that became a whole meal instead but well worth the calories. (You can always walk it off later at the park nearby.)
Food was well seasoned and grilled, particularly enjoyed the squid and fried rice.
They offer a wide range of alcohol as well and offered to extend our menu from the shop next door which was selling Thai food.
Overall a great experience and would recommend to visit if you are in the area to support their family business :)

Vibe and feel is great. Staff are really friendly and food is generally good. Loved the garlic rice especially, didn't manage to take a pic as it was the first to serve and I gobbled it up in no time. Beer is cheap IMO - $26 for a jug, skewers' price is on the high side though. Nice place to chill nonetheless.

Great place to chill! Service is great. Food is alright. Pets are allowed

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.name: Izakaya 95

Mediterranean restaurants in Punggol.reviews:
We had our dinner here on Good Friday night with the last minute reservation from google.
We ordered a starter, a pizza, a grilled meat platter and a Lebanon dessert. The food worth 2 stars. The meat was pretty hard, the starter was too sour. The dessert was really not able to match our taste. The house wines was tasteless, but the red wine taste better when it pair with the meat. I will strongly recommend you only order the red if you want to have their one for one house wine promo.
Our bill was $128, you can get a much more better grilled meat platter and better food at other restaurants. :)

Le Rida has a rustic ambience somewhat akin to an old time eating house in a small town. Quaint and homely
Freshly baked pita bread with lemon chick pea hummus was delicious and filling
Mains of Lebanese lamb kafta kebab had the right balance of flavour and crunchiness.
Wash it all down with 1 for 1 Heineken draft at $17.90

Manager Sanjiv was both friendly and helpful in his recommendations and unlike in some establishments, he did not push you to over order.
Definitely worth a return visit!

A quaint no frills dining place with excellent food and good service. The staff are simple people but are very hospitable, often checking in on the food quality and our experience. If you are looking for a good meal away from hustle and bustle, this is the place to go. Oh.. U can definitely have a conversation with your company and hear them loud and clear

Didn't think the food was thaaaat amazing. Nor was the service. But at least they let us drink outside drinks.
HOWEVER, i requested for no garnishing on my hummus. When the guy brought it over, there WAS parsley on it. And all he said was "just pluck it out". --.--
So if i was allergic to that, i should just pluck it out.... nice. The hummus wasn't good either. I've tasted better. Like a friend who went with me commented... it isn't creamy enough. Also, comments about the baklava was that it was too hard... and wasn't good.

Absolutely loved the food, I am heavily into Mediterranean food. I have tried most of the places around Bugis as well. The food here was so fresh, with perfect taste and presentation. It was completely worth it travelling from East.
The service was quick, the portion size was generous . We ordered mezze plateer and tabalu salad. They were scrumptious loved the customised heart shaped Pita bread. Hummus, was so creamy and so were all other dips.

Would strongly recommend.. It has become one of my favourite place..

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.reviews:
First time eating at Garden grill based inside the SGCC club, the nice little restaurant upstairs is cozy, though a bit old.  Promotion pricing for meals was quite affordable.  $30 for 3 course, $40 for 4.  Definitely worth the price. Wine was also not marked up too high.  Food was good.  Shoes required.

A cosy place for family and small group of friends to gather. The service staff all did a great job from welcome to preparing and serving the food. An old English setting but filled with warmth. The food is all great and will definitely be back again next month.

My family regularly dines here for special occasions as we're members of SGCC. We're never disappointed with the food or the service. Do look out for monthly promotions as they'll focus on different cuisines, and they normally have a weekend semi-buffet (choose a main, while the appetizers and desserts are buffet).

Amazing steak! Cooked medium rare :)

Have been coming here with my parents since I was a kid, and it's always been good. The food is great and the service is always top notch.
Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.name: Garden Grill

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.reviews:
Love the pan fried carrot cake & milk tea. Porridge. (Century egg and mincemeat) was too plain can only tasted the salty taste. Siew Maii was quite good but personally don’t like the mushroom flavour.  Braised chicken feet was abit too sweet for me but overall was good.  Bo Lu Bao char Siew filling was really good, but the bun dough have a very good yeast smell.

We love Chinese cuisine, we avoid eating at high end Chinese restaurants, we prefer hardworking independent chefs who have small eateries with authenticity in their cooking, this place is the cherry on top. As usual we ordered dishes we are familiar with, their dim-sum selections for dinner is a mini menu so we choose 2 , and 3 main dishes, quite enough for us as we are small bites people, more on quality of the food than quantity, I must admit Chef Wong have skills. And we will be back soon for lunch. Service was great too, happy we came !

I can vouch that it’s the best and most underrated dim sum in Singapore - in terms of its taste and presentation 👍🏻

If you’re skeptical like us to think that the signatures beautiful dim sum are probably just gimmicky, think again! so glad we tried them, they are so delicious 🤤 芋角 skin was so flaky yet not oily, taste of yam filling is so well balanced and not overly sweet like the average ones. 虾饺 skin is very delightful and thin. Everything is done to their perfection *chef kiss*

Highly recommend and would definitely visit again!

P/s: Room for improvement- we can smell waft of cigarettes 🚬 coming from the outside as we’re seated near the entrance.

This is the best dim sum place in the area. Food is affordable and so much better than many other dim sum places in the same price range. I really enjoyed everything that we ordered. Service is also very good. Will definitely be back again, and also try more dishes! Highly recommended! Safer to make a reservation as it can be crowded at certain times and the place is quite small.

This is one of the must go restaurant for Dim Sum and Chinese dishes 👍 All their handmade dim sum are delicious and tasty.  The ambiance and services are good too.  Will go back for more!

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.name: JU Signatures

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.reviews:
We specifically chose this Chong Qing for its location and crowd. We reserved well in advance as this place requires reservation during the peak hours.
Ordered Grilled Tilapia in spicy fragrant sauce and few veggies like potato, lettuce, tofu. The flavours were amazing and fish tasted really fresh and there was no fishy smell as you usually feel while eating any seafood. We got a plate of home made buns and rice to go along with it. Cooled ourselves with cucumber salad. For drink we got sour plum four seasons tea and local craft beer. Everything we ate or drank were worth it.
Staff was friendly and accomodated our request of getting rice later and also getting some of those buns take away. Definitely will visit again, Cheers :)

Got the mushroom seabass, medium spicy and added Chinese cabbage. Portioning is quite little, can only find a few pieces of veg and that's about it.

Service was also slow. Our noodles was not served as we were almost finishing our food. We checked twice with one stuff who told us that he will check for us. Then we checked a third time with another staff and staff told us they forgot our noodles. She asked if we would like to cancel this item since we are almost finishing our food. We said ok. Our noodles came shortly.

Seasoning and food is quite nice and flavourful.

We brought our friends to experience mala cusine and were told that the Classic set meal for 4 pax offers whole seabass so we accepted their recommendation. The medium seabass was slightly small in our perspective because we were expecting a larger fish since fish is the main item in this set. Each one of us got a little portion and it tasted fishy and unfresh, we didnt enjoy the fish at all. Nonetheless, we thought the presentation of this dish was beautiful and the side dishes in the fish tasted yummy. We were wowed by all other side dishes like Spinach, Lala, Sweet&Sour Pork, Watering Chicken, etc.  We feedbacked to the Server on our experience and glad that they will inform their kitchen. In general, their service level is friendly and helpful.  It is the fish dish that ruined the overall eating experience.

Saturday lunch at 12pm, only customer in the restaurant for a while. We ordered the set with the grilled fish and several side dishes. Fish was fragrant and flavorful, but the portion was a little small for 4 pax. Generally on the saltier side as expected of Chinese cuisine. We had a good lunch together.

Excellent food and customer service. My food was in a mess when the grab driver delivered to me and was irresponsible to reply or answer my call. When I call in the restaurant to ask for a solution, immediately after seeing the photos that I send them. Without second they arrange to send me those damage food to be replace and resolved my issue. Would like to thanks chong Qing grilled fish serangoon for your fast reply and your efficiency. Especially to Jia Zhe for your help.

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.reviews:
Came here on the recommendation of my daughter for a lunch birthday celebration.
Knowing I am a fan of Japanese food and hearing this place is rated quite highly so decide to give it a try with my family.
We try the ebi and tonkatsu and also the chashu. The food did not disappoint and everything was really delicious ans savoury. The chef and waiters service was friendly and attentive. And there was also a free flow of cabbage for us as well.
Overall a five star recommendation for this place so do come and try!

Service is great.
Place remains same for a Monday before 6pm .

Miso ramen is still well flavoured and appetising. Helps chase away Monday blues.
Prices have increased for adding noodles so I opt for a add on of rice instead.

Cheers.

We were very happy with the taste of our food and the service level provided! Big eaters like me rejoice with free flow rice and cabbage!

Family’s go to dinner place for tonkatsu sets. Love that the rice and cabbage is free flow!

The tonkatsu is well breaded and fried. Not greasy and still juicy.

Rice is properly cooked, always nicely done. Loving the soup that comes as a side with the meal itself. Cabbage is shredded nice and thin, and the dressing is tart and delicious!

Overall a really good experience!

If you are keen on noodles, the ramen is pretty good as well. Extra serves of noodle and soup can be purchased to top up the meal itself.

Overall, really yummy! Get there early for a table!

One of my favourite Oyakodons(and store, too!) in Singapore, while I often visit for their Katsus, if I ever crave Oyakodons I often find myself back here. Affordable Authentic Japanese Comfort Food.

The Oyakodon has half-cooked eggs which lends an extremely smooth texture to the dish. The Mirin is rich but not overbearing. Chicken chunks are tender, eaten with rice, it’s truly something I come back to again and again.

That said, most dishes here are tasty, so if it’s not your bowl of rice, you can’t really go wrong with the Miso Katsu either(not pictured).
Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.name: Hajime Tonkatsu & Ramen (myVillage @ Serangoon Garden)

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.reviews:
Quaint cafe in the heartland area. Thumbs up for dog friendly.
Had Shakupan and Steak & Eggs, both dishes executed well. Love the sourdough and coffee are good too.

Love the environment. Love the chicken over beef. Love their service where they given a piece of cake for my husband’s birthday and sang him a birthday song! So warm! The cake was nice too and I think Ram had choose wisely.. Will definitely go back! Thanks Ram & Shafeeq for your great service!

Another good option at serangoon garden village. Liked the outdoor seating (if it is not too warm). Food is decent. It has a little farm's market next to it if you need to grab some groceries. Quite popular on a weekday afternoon. Most of the outdoor seating were filled. Good place to explore.

Very nice and cosy environment. Feels like we are in Austrialia already. The food was good, awesome crews service and the seating area outside the restaurant good too.
Ordered the Croque Monsieur $22, Aussie $28 and cappuccino.

Really like the ambience here. Cool, windy night, nice music and good service. Fried chicken thigh meat is really nice. The grilled cauliflower was huge. The mushroom pasta is good. Carrot cake is normal.

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.name: Little Farms Bar+Grill, Serangoon Garden

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.reviews:
A very well hidden treasure.

Pretty, yummy food prepared by very talented chefs in a nice comfortable atmosphere. A wonderful culinary experience that captures the essence of our local food and gave me a different perspective of what the dishes could be. A lot of attention was given to the details of each dish and you can tell a lot of “heart” was put into it.

Really appreciated the energy and sincerity of the chefs too. The sake pairing was amazing.

Menu changes every two months, will definitely be back to try their new menu!!

A delightful culinary experience. Local Omakase with a touch of Japanese. I loved the tsukune with black chicken garlic soup, squid rojak and crab chawanmushi. The dessert was outstanding - banana fritters with home made macadamia ice cream. The restaurant is in a small shophouse in Serangoon Gardens and only seats 14. Reservations open on the first of every alternate month. The next window is 1 Feb for March and April 2023. Set your alarms. You won’t regret it.

I’ve had the privilege of dining here a couple of times including once this month. It’s pretty difficult to get reservations if your fingers aren’t nimble enough. Out of the few times they were, every meal was a memorable hit.

Their cuisine borrows influences from Singapore, Malaysia and sometimes Japan and I can’t really find another place serving anything similar which makes this place really special. Every bite is an explosion of flavours, yet delicate enough to not de-sensitise the palate. I would always come back if ever presented the opportunity.

Managed to snag a reservation at this hard to book restaurant. It can sit around 15 for each dinner service and there is only 1 service per day, hence the difficulty in getting a reservation.

I was very impressed by the standard of the food here. It is one of my top 5 meals in 2022 at this price point. Each dish was unique and leaves you anticipating for the next dish.

Do note that payment is only via cash or paynow. If you do get a chance to dine here, please cherish the opportunity.

Been fortunate enough to eat here several times, and I will definitely keep coming back. I would give Mustard Seed 11 stars out of 5 if I could - from the first meal at Chef Ming's home private dining a few years ago, every meal has been exceptional. I'm constantly astounded by not only the constantly creative dishes that Ming and Shin churn out, but also by their execution. Seems impossible for every dish to be delicious, but they have really been.

Service is impeccable and warm, like eating at a friend's place (if your friend is insanely talented). For me, hands down best restaurant in Singapore.

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.reviews:
Their sauce is really yummy but noodle texture not the best, i feel that it could be chewier but thats my personal preference. I really liked the soup and it came with good serving of veggies too. The portion seems smaller as I had ask for lesser, the normal portion is pretty good👍🏻

Not bad. Noodle portion quite okay, not much liao. Soup is sweet tasting and I believe they use mani Cai. Ikan bills is crispy, chilli is special (green chilli, with a sour note)

If you love "QQ" kind of noodles, this might be the place for you. Whenever I come to Serangoon Gardens, I somehow gravitate towards this stall if the queue isn't too long. My friend tried this but he didn't like it, so pretty subjective here.

Bossi banmian is SUPERB. Extremely flavourful and unlike any other banmian out there. I’ll get to the flavours but first the noodles are cooked on point - if you like al dante / QQ noodles, bossi is for you. We had both the banmian and u-Mian. Guess what the u Mian was chewy too! Normally stalls will screw up the umian cause of how thin it is. Next their soup is truly one-of-a-kind, it’s sweet, it’s salty and super comforting. I think they added preserved veggie in the soup and it elevates the whole dish. We finished the soup... lastly their chilli is unique too! Reminds me of the Indonesian sambal ijo with an added spicy kick. And it’s really different from all the sour orange chilli usual banmian stalls use. A must try! DONT be fooled by their weird sign board.

Soup was excellent, chilli was unique and appetising, noodles and ingredients were on point and fresh. Love this ban mian!

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.reviews:
Cosy mall with all the shops u need for groceries and food

Really love this Sarawak food, especially the manicai series!!!! Hard to find good manicai in Singapore, this is probably the best one. Their Kolomee and Laksa is also very authentic! The tomato fried crispy noodle brings me the memories when I am in Sarawak too haha. Enjoy!!

A tiny yet charming mall right in the heart of Serangoon Gardens. Well it certainly serves the immediate needs of the residents in the neighbourhood.

The anchor tenant here is Fairprice Finest and rightfully so considering the upmarket neighbourhood.

A couple of restaurants like iSteaks adorn the mall.

Is the mall worth a visit ? I would not make my way here if only to visit this mall. Like i said earlier it serves the immediate needs of the neighbourhood and it is a nice mall.

A very peaceful shopping mall that is clean and lovely. Please maintain this way forever.

Nice smell and peaceful.

Best shopping mall in Singapore.

My Village is a small boutique kind of mall in Serangoon Gardens. There is a FairPrice Finest, gifting shops, apparel boutiques and nail salons. There is food court with decent options as well.

It’s situated on Maju Ave opposite Tiong Bahru Bakery. I like to go here for casual shopping when I’m around this area.

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.reviews:
21/11/23
Teochew cuisine. Visit during weekday lunch hour and it is not crowded. Egg fried oysters, fried Chye Poh kway tiao, prawn ball and Lor duck are very nice. Kong Ba Bao looks good but the meat is about tough to chew and also prefer more five spice flavour. Fish maw and noodles are average.

Visited on 24 Sep 2023 for birthday meal. Ordered 10 dishes.. food generally good like the claypot tofu, fried oyster came instead of oyster omelette.. fried horfun with cai po, and lor duck.. but the rest not so tasty and was told its not teochew enough, though I am Cantonese.. Still the service is not too good when it's busy. Asked waiter 3 times to order food, but nobody entertained us.. the food here is pricey.. our bill comes to $218.60 for 9 pax..

This is my first time here, and I came because my Teochew cousin invited me. Personally, I feel that the food doesn't quite taste like traditional Teochew dishes, such as Or Nee. Most of the dishes seemed tailored to suit the customers preferences. They were also quite salty, and we provided this feedback.

(P.S. I’m Teochew grew up eating traditional Teochew dishes)

Food is good but generally expensive. Situated in a old shopping centre with narrow car park.  Timing of food served can be inconsistent. Some dishes were served very late

1st time trying. We ordered 6 items + 1 dessert, and total cost $300. Good is generally good, with outdoor (aircon) seating inside the mall. Easily accessible and parking is available just below the building. The Teo Chew fried Hor fun is very tasty and have Wok Hei. The fish soup cost about $100, and fresh fish and can top up the soup. Overall is good and recommended.
Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.name: Fragrant Garden

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.reviews:
Overall, yummy food at a cosy eatery at wallet-friendly prices. My partner and I ordered scallion chicken rice, veg, pork floss egg roll with cheese, milk tea, honey butter toast.

I don’t usually eat rice bowls but I thoroughly enjoyed the scallion chicken rice which was flavourful and fragrant! Would definitely recommend this dish.

Loved the hot milk tea at 50% sweetness too. I don’t really eat pearls but this one was nice!

Would have preferred the egg roll to be more cheesy with the usual crispy kind as it turned out to be more of a soft chewy dough - still rather interesting and some may like that.

Honey butter toast was a nice dessert to end our meal!

Had a nice dinner at this Taiwanese restaurant. The staff is really friendly and the cafe itself is cosy. Loved their scallion oil chicken rice. It was very flavourful. We ordered 2 mains, 2 side dishes along with their signature pearl milk tea. The price is reasonable and definitely worth the visit.

Our favorite to go when we craving for Taiwanese food. The Pork Belly Rice is a mix of fatty and lean braised pork, pickled veggies, all on fluffy white pearl rice. 🤤 The Scallion Oil Chicken Rice has this killer fragrant sauce and perfectly shredded chicken. Worth the try

Service was impeccable and food was served promptly. Their chilli is really good. Mixed it with the 卤肉饭&大肠面线and it gave both dishes more flavour.

Milk tea is really fragrant, I had ordered 0% sugar.

Aiyu Bing was nice, but could have been colder and it would be even better. Portion is huge. Worth it.

Had a great dinner at 8degrees with my family, we really enjoyed the signature pork belly rice as well as the other dishes! The prices are affordable and it’s a hidden gem in Kovan. Definitely worth a visit if you enjoy authentic Taiwanese cuisine. Highly recommend the milk tea with pearl 👍 and scallion pancakes!

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.reviews:
Our food tasted a bit too salty and bland.
I was disappointed that the braised tofu was egg tofu rather than real tofu.
Comfortable seating and clean.

Was there and we (three of us) wanted to try their dimsum only to be told that it would only be served on weekends only. Nevertheless, we tried four items in small portion - roasted duck, prawn vermicelli, sliced fish and tofu, and the bill came up to about $105. After our meal, we all came to the same conclusion. The roasted duck was the best being crispy on the skin and tender and fragrant for the meat. Sadly, we didn't enjoy the other three items at all.

The dishes were served promptly and it was delicious! Service staff was also friendly and attentive. Price is also reasonable. 👍

We enjoyed the food! Thumbs up especially for Curry fish head and frog leg. Service is swift too!

Dim sum were piping hot when served n prawns were fresh n crunchy. Many mains to choose from. Love the garlic n black pepper prawns. Service a bit slow though the staff were trying their best to serve the packed restaurant. Guess they are short handed. Worthwhile when they have promotions such as 40% off dim sum n 15% off mains.
Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.name: Clan 7

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.reviews:
I came here with my family on a Saturday afternoon around 3pm and it was not crowded.

A small vegetarian cafe located in the Serangoon heartlands, it serves mainly local and fusion Japanese food.

We ordered the Hotplate Unagi Rice, Chicken Rice as well as the Hokkien Noodles.

Overall the prices are affordable and reasonable. Well worth the visit!

I ordered a Sweet and Sour Pork Chop King Rice and a Teppanyaki Chicken Cutlet Rice. Both meals included an egg and a bowl of miso soup. Even though my husband is not a vegetarian, he found them delicious. The flavors were just right, not too salty or greasy. The environment was clean, and the owner was very friendly. The food was made to order. Highly recommended.

Located within the heartlands and at a hdb block, it was probably our most surprising discovery. Tried the vegetarian chicken rice and salted egg chicken rice. The chicken was fine but the chicken rice was delicious and surpassed some regular chicken rice stalls outside and the chili sauce was a nice complement. The salted egg sauce was full of flavour too and i finished up my plate of rice in a flash 😂 Will return again 🙂

I came on Sunday and reach the place minutes before 6pm. Waited for food for more than an hour. Counter staff very blur and couldn't cope with the orders. Staff bring my order to every table who arrive later than me. She was going to serve the dish to someone who ordered the same dish and arrived later than me. Restaurant also does not issue receipt so if there is anything wrong with your order, she will be in denial.  Even though she apologise for the delay but it is not sincere.

Food is fine but definitely not worth the wait. First time visiting and also my last. 👎🏻

Environment was quiet and homely.

They had air cooler installed and lots of fan around which made the place very cooling and comfortable. Fans were not too much to blow your hair all over the place either.
Food prices were mostly reasonable to the taste and portion
Ordered 2 main dish to try, the hot plate cod fish rice which was dissapointing as it costs $7.90 but only with 1 serving of fish and normal rice portion that would barely be sufficient for a average grown adult. 2 slice would be more acceptable for the price. Taste would be a 6 to 7/10, sauce of the hot place cod fish goes nice with the rice but again not a filling meal and too small portion for the price.

On the other hand, the chicken cullet rice was a 8 to 9/10. Rice was the legit chicken rice kind of rice instead of plain rice. Did not expect that until I took a bite. The chicken cullet was fried nicely, not oily or greasy, and came with a very touch of sauce on top of it. Sides of broccoli was cooked nicely, tasted fresh  and came with a decent portion of fries at the side.
It did not come with chicken rice Chilli but I checked and you can ask for Chilli to go with the rice if you're a Chilli lover.
Drink price was reasonable and portion was acceptable. Drinks like tea, red date teas were available.

Parking was decent and easy to find a slot.
Went on a Saturday dinner and wasn't over crowded  food was served within 10 to 12 mins which was ok waiting time for us.
Lady wearing glasses at the shop was really nice and friendly .
Ordered some take away before leaving as well for the family.

Overall feels like a very healthy meal.
Would rate overall as 6 - 7 /10

Fusion cuisine in Serangoon Gardens.reviews:
The hotplate tofu set with rice and soup was my go-to comfort food for many years. But in recent years the quality has dropped. The portion has been reduced. The sauce was one of the better parts of the dish, and the new edition just barely gave any sauce in it. I would rather pay more and have it still be as delicious and have the same portion as to have it be reduced and taste worse.

But on the bright side, maybe it's finally time to try other food options they have.

Ordered their vegetarian nasi lemak. Huge serving of rice that is very fragrant. Generous serving of ingredients too.
$4.00 only.
Very friendly owners and helpers.

Mee rebus must try. Shiok. A lot of ingredients. The queue gets crazy during lunch.

Visited a little after 5pm today.  There were around 5 staff at the stall.  Some of the staff seemed a little confused with orders through food delivery platforms.  I waited almost 30min for my food.  I paid $7 for luohan toufu hotplate but was given something which looked like baoluo wanxiang that costs $6.  Upon my enquiry, 2 of the staff still insisted that it's what I had ordered.  The dish didn't even contain a single piece of toufu.

Ordered Xiao wan mian and ba kut teh.

Xiao wan mian soup were tasteless, just salty.
It is mostly veg which were good because I don't like mock meat. The noodles were good though!

Ba kut teh soup taste better than the other one.
Both rice and noodles portion were too much!
Please ask for less if you don't eat a lot.

They have a wide range of menu though, would try it again if I'm around the vicinity.

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
Went for the weekday set lunch and was very impressed. Best chocolate fondant I ever had (but wish there was a scoop of vanilla ice cream).

I've to caveat this by saying that perhaps Argentinian food isn't for me. So please view this review with a (huge) pinch of salt, especially in view of the other glowing reviews here.

To me, the food just doesn't hit the spot. I'm left feeling confused - and cold inside. Ordered the Chapa for appetiser - it tastes like normal bread with cheese fondue - nothing to comment about. For my mains, I ordered the grilled zucchini stuffed with risotto - and it's fairly disappointing. It was served with white sauce that has a subtle milky flavour but no risotto to be found. It may be hidden. I stopped eating after the first piece because there's nothing exciting about the dish. I was left stagnant and not looking forward to my next bite. We also ordered the vegetable platter - the vegetables tastes raw and bland, and the potatoes taste a bit coarse inside.

Overall, I don't find the food value for the money. It didn't even attempt to take flight. Apologetically, I've to say that it was a fairly sad dinner for me and my company.

Though the staff was very friendly and attentive. I've to credit that.

Since I am a vege lover, I selected this restaurant because I saw good options of vegetables dishes in their menu. My first time tried Argentinian grilled food and we love so much of their potato rescoldo in grilled vegetables platter. Grilled potatoes are crispy outside and soft inside, saltiness is just nice. I love the smoked asparagus with fried garlic too. Steak is ok and lamb is good too. My hubby likes the Empanadas. Dessert - Dulce De Leche Cookies, Love it!!. I should have ordered more cos the size is a bit small. Service is great, attentive and know customer needs without a need to ask. View is great. Can see the fireworks at Marina bay for NDP rehearsal.

Food was really delectable and I would return for a second round! Loved the black cod. Beef was really flavourful and savoury. Their dessert chocolate hazelnut cake was one of my favourites! Wished the table service could be better in terms of knowledge of their menu. Overall a pleasant experience in a warm and welcoming environment.

Beef was really flavourful and savory. A little overcook for me on medium. Their dessert chocolate cake was very good.

Prime location at Ion and your can reach Fire by dedicated elevator from 4th to 55th fl.
Argentinian food in Sengkang.name: FIRE | Argentinian Restaurant

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
Bad experience. Ordered a steak and chicken chop. First, waited for 30min. Next, mention twice no sauce, ended up heaps of sauce added. Thirdly i ordered chicken chop but fish and chips packed to me. Conclusion, dont ever try to take away for western food. They are more interested to fulfil grab order then walk in.
Mookata is ok but not the western food or zi char.

Had the hot plate tofu, unfortunately the taste was just 1 layer which is savoury!

Tried out the Halal Mookata. Service is satisfactory. Item served quite fast. Price is reasonably cheap with about 6 items costing us $25. What lacked is the variety of food items available.

Note: I can't comment on Buey Tahan See-Food x Halal Mookata as I didn't patronise this stall for its food or service. This review is for the coffeeshop experience.

1st time visit this so-called 7 stars signboard coffee shop but the experience was an awful one. The drink stall uncle wearing spec was sitting biting his thumb on his lips. Then we ordered homemade herbal tea as indicated in the posted menu. He said don't have and stared at me with face "very long and black". See how rude that was. I told him if off the menu already should take down that menu poster. After taking the drinks to our table, he keep staring at us for few mins with the same expression. I came all the way from Bedok to this sengkang coffeeshop only to get badly treated. This coffeeshop should change their name to 1 star coffeeshop instead. The service rating here is for the drink stall. My experience here was really "buey tahan" See-Uncle.

We tried the japanese food stall, the food portion is good for its price. The tray quite heavy to carry when ordered for 3 pax. The outer area of this coffeeshop is quite spacious with natural ventilation and high ceiling.

my 9yo son loves the Brown sauce chicken chop + baked bean + coleslaw. the chicken and mushroom sauce was bubbling when served. Do take note that the western food takes sometime to be served.

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
Had an amazing dinner with my friend on a Friday night. Reservations required. Service was great. Food was fantastic. Especially love the tenderloin, it’s so tender and yummy. Also love the bread we had, it’s well worth the price of $16.

Fantastic steak & food & service! You’d probably also be able to get a decent steak here for 

It was our first time visiting Bochinche. The restaurant has a lovely ambiance and the staff are polite and helpful. The manager kindly explained to us the differences between each cut of meat.

For starters, we had the SD bread basket and ox tongue carpaccio. The bread slices were delish with butter. The ox tongue carpaccio was an interesting blend of flavours that worked well together.

For the main, we ordered the Heavenly Meat Board with 4 different kinds of steaks. They were perfectly cooked medium rare, served with a bit of smoked salt, garlic confit and padron peppers, which elevated the flavour immensely. Sides were chips, broccolini and wild mushrooms. Kiddo had the cheeseburger and finished the entire thing off!

To finish off, we shared the nectarine tart and espresso creme brulee while kiddo had a scoop of vanilla ice-cream. The creme brulee was delicious. Creamy with the wonderful fragrance of espresso. We enjoyed that immensely. Were not too crazy about the tart though. The nectarine slices were not ripe and still hard after cooking. The sharp tang wasn't to our liking.

All in all a wonderful dining experience. We'll be back for more!

Great place with great food.

The staff were amazing as I celebrated my wife’s birthday. The steak was beautifully done and all the food recommendations were good.

Kudos to the people for making this place awesome.

Edit -

Forgot to mention that we also ordered the hand cut beef empanadas. Sad to say my nenek can make better epok epok.

Ordered the “Robbins Island” Wagyu Bone In Striploin (MS7) along with the creamy Mac-cheese pangrattato, broccolini pomegranate (without bacon bits) and Chips Provencal.

The wagyu striploin was cooked well but lacked the juiciness that wagyu steaks typically have. The steak was also under seasoned but was accompanied by smoked Maldon sea salt and roasted peppers.

Chips was fried well and had a nice crisp bite to it and was salted just right.

Broccolini was grilled perfectly and had a nice charred smoky taste to it but was overly salted. Portion was a tad too stingy in my opinion for the price. Served on a medium sized plate it looked like a few broccolini might’ve escaped during plating.

Surprisingly the creamy M&C was the best of the lot! Very creamy with gooey cheese and a nice layer of bread crumbs on top to give it a welcoming different mouth feel and texture.

Over all I think Bochinche is worth a visit due to its lovely homey interior but do be prepared to spend a few dollars here. 3.6/5.
Argentinian food in Sengkang.name: Bochinche

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
Thohirah Restaurant is a great place to have a tasty and economical meal. I loved the fish head curry, paratha, and biriyani that I ordered. They were all well-spiced and flavorful. The prices were also very reasonable for the quality and quantity of the food. The only downside was the customer service, which was not very attentive or friendly. However, I did not mind it too much, as the food was so good. I would definitely visit this restaurant again and suggest it to anyone who likes fish heady curry and prata type food.

Plain prata is recooked it is hard as rock. First time having tissue prata without any sugar coating inside. Asked the staff abt it, he pass me a bottle of sugar. The standard has dropped tremendously. During payment the staff/ owner just talking on the phone without interaction with the customer/ telling how much and all.

Great mutton briyani! Meat is tender, non gamey at all! Paired with it's flavourful briyani and thick curry, each mouthful is a match in heaven!
Portion is huge@$9.50, would come back to try other dishes.

Food coma kicking in while writing this review😅

the Worst cheese prata i ever taste. The cheese taste like plastic.and the Masala thosai too much cinnamon stick till i ate like afew and throw back.

Pretty disappointed with the food here. No longer serving yummy food. Many places serve better Prata than here, plus the food is not hot! You can give the Nasi Lemak a miss too! Served Cold and rice has no coconut taste and fragrance.

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
This is probably my favourite Indian restaurant. Food is excellent and everything is mostly very good.
We've tried many dishes and most would not disappoint except for the squid. The biryanis and pratas are of huge portions and the sides are generous and tasty.
Some signature items tend to sell out early on weekends so you may wish to go early or try them on weekdays instead.
The staff are friendly too and they also give good recommendations and advice. The seating arrangement may not be the best but it still offers relatively comfortable seating and acceptable views.
There are vegetarian choices too so those with vegetarian members amongst friends or family can eat happily together.
We will certainly continue to visit. Car parking is of no issue as it is within the neighbourhood shopping mall.

Fantastic dining experience at Banana Leaf Rivervale mall! Prem, the manager, was gracious enough to set up a table for 10 people for us! The food tasted fantastic! Very good customer service! Prem checks to see if everyone at the table is satisfied by asking if we need anything or if there is enough food. He goes above and above in his service! He will always beam while he serves us, without fail! Definitely returning here! ♥️

Tasty food & great service! Serving was generous and definitely filling for sure

Kudos to Premnath who helped us changed our vegetable dish that was way too spicy for us.

Will be back for more!

I had a rather heavy day at work, and whenever this happens, I love to imbibe in one of my favourite foods, Indian.
There’s something about the spice, the smell and the flavours that give me that ‘kick’ I need to continue with my workday!
So I drove to the Mall and walked into this place. I always (well, almost always) have my Garlic, butter naans with mutton keema. Minced mutton cooked with a spicy thick broth, with peas to pop, and something magical happens with I top my naans with this dish.
Alas! They don’t make keema here, but the nice gentleman who attended to me offered me an alternative. Keema naan!
I thought about it awhile, and reluctantly said yes!

Certainly a great recommendation from him! What I had was a paper-thin, buttery, garlicky, naan, sprinkled with seasoned minced mutton on the insides. It’s amazing how they do this! The whole concoction still looks like it’s half the thickness of an average plain prata! Don’t be fooled ok? Bite into it, and all that buttery, garlicky goodness pops in your mouth, and the insides render flavours reminiscent of a mutton murtabak, but only ever so slight, and not as overwhelming. What can I say? It was a delight to eat! I savoured every bite, as I downed this delectable dish with an equally spicy but delicious rasam soup and some fish curry for a sip.
The naan was so good, that after a few bites, I realise the fish curry had become redundant, and remained untouched until I finished all of my Keema Naan!

Great service, good food, and I love the quiescence of this place amidst a crowded noisy mall! I’m happy, and will surely be back:)

One of the best fish head curry ever in Singapore.  Fish head was meaty and FRESH..curry is superbly tasty and tangy.A MUST TRY!!  Masala chicken is fantasic , a good portion meat , soft and juicy. Staff Gulshan from Rivervale Mall is commendable..attentive and polite . Will definitely  come again and recommend  to all my friends! Hats off to the chef!!

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
Very long waiting time, I waited  for 36minutes for my teh o limau drink despite not much crowd there. Only three dine in tables ordering and waiting. Food have to wait for 50minutes, like seriously?. Restaurants’s floor is super oily and slippery. The quality of the food dropped alot compared to last time.  Curry is water with what I don’t know what is that? The cucumber is spoilt. My teh o Limau straw comes with another drink stain on top? Waste of time and waste of effort to be here.

Crispy prata and filling biryani. Loved the place after a nice workout in the gym. Better than Thohirah for sure!

Very delicious prata. Especially I like they provide a crispy prata (It’s not oily)

Tea also very nice.

Very nice mutabatk, you can get everything you want here plus it opens 24h. Got Zi char also. Malay food, Indian food, Chinese food all in one Come here when hungry & nowhere to go in the middle of the night. Parking very easy, big big carpark. Just rmbr don’t act smart & park road side or private housing entrance. LTA cows’ breeding spot, they love to come here to hit their quota 😂

So disappointing, meal was unacceptable, prata was so thick and the curry was equally bad, the biryani came with some strange pickles, the curry and prata was something that I can’t swallow.

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
Recently, I had the chance to visit  this restaurant. It was crowded with people, and we had to wait a short while to be seated. The restaurant service was not up to the mark as the server was inexperienced and didn't seem to know what to do. The service was slow, and it took us more than half an hour to get our food served, even though we arrived early.

The black pepper crab, which was supposed to be the restaurant's signature dish, was overcooked and not very fresh. The taste was average, and it didn't live up to its hype. The best dish we ordered was the vegetable dish, which was delicious.

The fish maw soup disappointed us, and the prawns were not very fresh. It was the least worth ordering.

The restaurant had an upmarket and elegant setup, but the food quality and service standards didn't match up. It could be a concern for those who are short on time due to the slow service.

On the bright side, the restaurant had a clean toilet, which was a good experience. Overall, the restaurant wasn't a great dining experience, but it was worth it if you're in the mood for good veggies or a clean restroom

Simple dinner, just ordered steamboat Ang Go Li and chrysanthemum tea. The food was delicious and fragrant. My husband doesn’t like fish but he was enjoying. Just nice for 2.

The Mala grilled fish is our must-order dish every time we visit. The portion is enough for 2-3 pax. It's the best-grilled fish I have in Singapore. It comes together with some potato thin slices, black fungus, peanuts, and cabbage. The fish is fresh, so the meat is very tender! Please try it out, everyone!

We ordered the 回锅肉, but it is a bit oily for us.

We have come back to visit serial times. The food quality maintains good, and the service is excellent!

Nice little 煮炒, air-conditioned, neat and clean. We had deep fried squid, tofu and broccoli. The prices may be steeped compared to coffee-shop prices but I think it is worthwhile as it is after all air-conditioned. I like it that the food isn't salty or taste like msg. The tofu was soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. As I don't eat pork, I simply scrapped the pork toppings from the tofu. I appreciate that the waitress is service-oriented. She was attentive and the food were served very promptly. Oh yes, their barley was homemade without the canned drink type of taste. We'll definitely be back!

This is a Chinese style stir fry dishes with BBQ spicy while fish as it's signature dish! the fish was large and fresh, fragrant and spicy(non spicy sauce available as well) and only costs $35! other dishes we ordere includes sambal paste long brand, sweet sour pork cubes, hotplate seafood beancurd, hotplate beef slices all were flavourfully executed too. We were surprised even drinks offered was wide range: Pu er flower tea, coconut sugared milk tea was fragrant yet not too sweet and smooth to have. Overall highly recommended to come and savour if in this part of SG!
Argentinian food in Sengkang.name: Lao Hero Kitchen

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
Our first visit since its makeover. It's now so much more crowded than its predecessor Legends. I love the buffalo wings! I can take spicy food well, but level 3 was already quite spicy. Recommend to pair with some beers for even better taste. The live band was a plus esp if sitting indoors. The music can also be enjoyed outdoors as the sound system was pretty decent.

Went on a Thursday night, rather crowded but managed to find a seat for 1 pax.
The drinks selection is pretty good but do ask the price before ordering as the menu price is before ++

Food wise it is ok, edible and nothing to shout about. The impressive bit was the live band. They were good and made up for the avg food.

Ordered the grilled chicken, seafood marinara and take out pizzas (Pepperoni, Hawaiian).
Grilled chicken was slightly tough and too salty with sides(mushroom+potato and some greens)
Seafood marinara with spicy tomato sauce was nice and not that spicy actually.
Pizzas topping were slightly salty and well done.
We were seated outdoor and there were bug flying around and one went for a swim.

Second try: Ordered burger, fish n chips, buffalo wings and ice cream. Burger was ok, salad was black at the tip. Fish and chips was well done. Buffalo wings - sauce was not nice, spicy level 2. Ranch was not cold while celery stick was too thin and soft, no crunch.
Ice cream was creamy with tiny marshmallow and nuts.

First visited to this place and did not expected it to be crowded. They have indoor and outdoor seating. Only limited seats in the restaurant which have air-cond. Outdoor can be breezy too as it’s near the river. They offered limited but general choices of Thai/Viet food, Pasta/Pizza and Western grills. Not wide selection, but it’s good variety to choose from. Thai prawn cake abit salty, probably it’s from vendor, not house made. But glass noodle seafod is good, quite refreshing and appetizing. Carbonara cooked to al dente and we like the creamy sauce with well smoked bacon. Pizza is a missed as we think taste like from frozen food. They have beer promotion at Happy Hour (

Couple of good selection of beer choices. Food varieties are good too. Really like their luncheon fries, given very generous portion.  Their prosciutto pizza are just average. And had jug of beer and a bucket of mixed beers.

The ambience is great both outside and inside seating for chilling.

The live band was nice but inside seating will be harder to chat with ur company.  Outside seating will be preferable for chatting. Inside seating sound system are better.

Do take note: if it rains, the cantilever shelter only able to extended to first 3 rows. The rest are not covered.

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
Went right after they open to reserve for 2.30pm timing. Food wise uncooked food like meat is like what usually you would get in a normal hotpot buffet and not beauty in the pot standard but cooked food wise is probably more like beauty in the pot standard.

During lunch or tea time, is worth to get the premium set which has better product at a reasonable price. Dinner maybe not.

Overall, not bad but with hard to book reservation online, the queue system and chances not getting seats even if arrived, probably would be worth the trip if live nearby.

The front desk is really a minus, unprofessional in the way that she didn’t guide us on how to order and proceed with the electronic menu, and do not have the heart to genuinely serve the customers. She was in a random and long conversation with one customer instead of serving customers who are in real need and there is no one who is doing the cashier duty coz she is busily talking :”( . Really wish to replace the front desk person who is the in the first contact with customers. Might not be coming back if she stays in this working attitude

My wife and I came here for lunch. $29.9 premium + $3 peak surcharge. Total $78.17

About 1135 am then we entered due to long queue. Our reservation was at 1130 am. Timer in tablet also start from 1130.
1150 am. Pot with soup base served.
1200 pm. Ingredients are not served yet. The manager came to every table to add time to the tablet, and told us that if still not enough time, to let him know. He said system got issues. The timer added about 20 mins.
1210 pm then start serving us. But only got the prawn paste.
Waited till 1227 pm then served us again with meat.
3rd serving is 1255 pm. Prawn paste, crab sticks.
1257 pm gave us prawn. Kelp.
1.10 pm then final stuff.
1.30 pm finished eating. Still left about 7 mins in the tablet (we asked the manager to add more time halfway through)

Not much selections at the sauce station. Even shi li fang has more to choose from.

Sliced US beef is indicated as sold out in tablet. It was enabled only after we notified the manager.

Cheaper than Shi li fang if choosing the same premium food. But enjoyed better dining experience in Shi li fang. But perhaps this isn't an accurate review due to them having issues with their system.

Paradise Hotpot disappoints on multiple fronts. The poorly trained staff at the entrance add to the initial negative impression. The narrow interior feels cramped, especially around the self-service sauce area, which is invariably overcrowded. Continuous need for fuel replacements disrupts the dining experience. Moreover, the ingredients are very average . Overall, this hotpot restaurant is highly unrecommended due to its inadequate service, cramped space, and mediocre food quality.

I love that you get an individual hotpot here which is perfect when eating alone. I love their pork bone soup, mala soup and the tomato soup. Ingredients here are always fresh and service is always helpful and polite. They have various discounts available and you can use Kris+ to earn miles here too.

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
a chill place in the neighbourhood for drinks been here for many years

Just went there today! Great customer service and awesome food! Very nice and comfortable place for a chill session. Price is reasonable given that the portion are not very small.

The staffs treat you with with great courtesy and service, when my family just ordered plain water only. The staffs even help to refill without prompt. Thumbs up! Definitely a recommended place to go. Will definitely suggest to my friends for a chill out there again.

Went for a drink over there. Just a simple place for drinking with a few friends

Been here way before they have a new look.
A "feel at home" environment to have a drink.
Want to sort out some thoughts over a drink, or have a chat with staff to laugh off a lousy day, it's the place I will go.

Super chill bar for a night out catch up with friends.
Beverages are at an affordable pricing.

One down point is the air-conditioning, not cooling.
I guess I will go for the outdoor alfresco option next time ;)

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
Had a great time having my dinner with my friends and chatting away while we are enjoying our meal. Especially loving the mango prawn fritters, love the taste and sweetness is just nice as well. Not forgetting the duck, 红油抄手, XO Carrot cake and char siew. Just everything was so great and my friends enjoyed the time we have spent there as well. Will definitely return for another round of gatherings!!🤤🤤

Portion is much smaller compare with last time, look at the salted egg prawn. It’s not cheap leh, but the portion is really too little. Ordered duck noodle and char Siew noodle also, noodle is a lot but meat is very little. Standard drop, not worth the price at all. Wont go back again.
Only good thing is staff attitude is good.

Had a great time with family. Love the duck, roasted pork, carrot cake and cha shiu bun. Always order these dishes without fail.

We arrived at Canton Paradise Compass One at around 12:30pm on a Saturday and there was a modest queue waiting outside the restaurant. Took around 15 mins of waiting before we were seated.

There are two varieties of food to choose from here: Dim sum selections and also cooked dishes (noodles, rice and variety of stir-frys). Unfortunately a number of dim sum dishes were already sold out when we were seated. We still ordered a couple of available dim sums to share, but shout-out to the unique appetizer, cold braised mushrooms which was a great hit. I usually refuse appetizers, but this one is amazing. Definitely try it if you are a mushroom lover!

Everything else is pretty much Canton standards. No surprises.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at your establishment and felt compelled to share my exceptional experience.

From the moment I entered Canton Paradise, I was greeted by a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The cleanliness and inviting ambiance immediately set the tone for a delightful dining experience.

What truly stood out, however, was the remarkable service provided by your staff. I had the pleasure of interacting with two outstanding individuals who made my visit truly memorable.

Firstly, I’d like to extend my sincere appreciation to Ms. Tham Mei Ling. Her attentiveness and knowledge of the menu were impressive. She promptly answered all of my questions, provided recommendations that perfectly matched my preferences, and made sure my dining experience was nothing short of exceptional.

Secondly, I would like to commend Mr. Kai Wen for his exceptional customer service. His patience and dedication in assisting me with my membership and ensuring that I could benefit from a discount code made my visit even more enjoyable. Mr. Kai Wen’s commitment to ensuring customer satisfaction was evident throughout our interaction.

The combination of delicious food, a clean and welcoming environment, and the exemplary service provided by Ms. Tham Mei Ling and Mr. Kai Wen has left a lasting positive impression on me. It’s not every day that one encounters such a remarkable dining experience.

I believe that exceptional service should be acknowledged and celebrated. Ms. Tham Mei Ling and Mr. Kai Wen are true assets to your team, and their dedication to ensuring customer satisfaction deserves recognition.

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
Came in at 5.30pm with a reservation to celebrate an anniversary and saw that almost every other table indoors was reserved as well. Best to book at least a day in advance before coming down to make sure you get indoor seating!

The food was pleasant, ordered the two different ribeye platter to share and we even received a complimentary cake to help us celebrate the occasion ❤️

Staff also packaged the last drink included in our platter to bring home as we only had 2 out of the 3 drinks included in the platter we ordered. Uncle was dutifully going around taking orders as well :)

Fantastic service and I can’t praise them enough 🙏🏻 Do come down and give them a try!

We went for lunch, so there is only lunch set. Limited choice. Their lunch set come with fries, coleslaw and lemon tea, fix, can’t change. Portion is quite small, my 8 years old son can finish the set by my own, so we adult don’t even feel full when we walk out from the restaurant 🥲 air con is not cooling, maybe too crowded so we felt warm while we were in the restaurant.
Mushroom soup is good, highly recommend for pulled pork burger! Ribeye was fine too.

Had the Cajun Chicken Chop, it was very well done, though the skin was not as crispy as when I had it all that time ago but the chicken was juicy and the sauce rich. Unique to this place is the Potato Gratin side, it has this odd herby flavor I’m not used to but is otherwise creamy.

They have an extensive list of meats from different places if you were feeling up for beef, but sadly I wasn’t that day, but given the quality of beef they were serving, I doubt it could go wrong. They’re cheaper than what you would get in restaurants too.

The potato came in chunks instead of slices, which I would have preferred. Be careful though as the dish is VERY hot. The coleslaw was alright. Overall, I’d say it’s worth the price, it’s also located in a relatively quiet area in the Serangoon-Ang Mo Kio stretch. I would definitely visit again. If you’re visiting with a group, making a reservation is highly recommended as their seating area is pretty small.

A premium steak restaurant hidden among HDB flats. From the outside, its rather inconspicuous, yet it serves some premium cuts of steak from various countries. The steak we had was done just nice and taste good. Even the other type of meats were good too. Price wise they are definitely on the much pricier side, but at least you get some premium meat and taste. Put aside the location, come for the food.

Delighted and Glad to find this place. Well hidden n i guess only those who stay here/or nearby will know about them.
Heard good reviews from a friend previously but didnt come till now.

Its a superb place for a steak and you will be seeing me very often for sure.
We had a great dinner, my kids loves the Mac n Cheese and Cheese Sticks.
Cajun Chicken was done nicely and tender.
Pork Quesadillas...oooo shiok la....so nice. If only u are so near my hse, i would actually dabao this item weekly as we r a fan of this item.

For the 2 Ribeyes we had - Argentina Pampas and Usa Holt Rib, juices leaked out the thick slabs and was also done nicely.
Superb piece of work and all at a very affordable attractive pricing.

Even the chef (indian gentleman, didnt get his name) came to ask how was things, very good service indeed. Small action but speaks volume.

Nice cosy place and i will be back again for my next steak for sure.
Already looking forward to next trip so do keep up the good work guys 👍👍👍
Argentinian food in Sengkang.name: Steakgrill Steak House

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
A wonderful experience from every single point of view! You start by entering to this great Durian farm, the temperature is perfect (not as hot as in the city), the food is delicious, the drinks are great and the people working there they are just lovely. They take care of every little detail, getting everything you need, so you have the best time ever.

Just have in mind that you need to book in advance. So it is great for getting a group of people together to celebrate a special occasion.

I recommend this place!!

Ordered some of these delicious meats for a birthday event. Everything was so delicious, especially the Vacio and Entrana. And the sauces were amazing! Belen was very helpful in recommending the right combination and quantity of mains and sides. Great customer service and on time delivery! We would like to thank Belen and her team for helping to put together this amazing menu for a memorable birthday celebration. Muchas Gracias!

My friend celebrated her birthday there and it was an amazing night!!! Such an original and new way to go out here in JB! The food was sooooo delicious and the beef was of an incredible good quality!  Real Argentinian asado and experience! The place is a Durian plantation and we were eating surrounded by this beautiful trees, that was an extra plus! The entire place was only for us.... We ate, we danced and we had the best time!

Very authentic Argentinian Asado BBQ experience. Kudos to the chef for the specially curated Argentinian flairs featuring different  cuts of meat. The Chimicurri sauce pairing with the BBQ meat is to die for. 😋

I had the best Argentinian asado experience at Chimichurri! Amazing food, vibe and companies. I won’t want to celebrate my birthday any other than spending quality time with mi gente and the crews made it extra special xx Thank you so much for a night to remember!

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
Came earlier for better chance of parking at the landed estate. Thoroughly enjoyed the food here! Had the Fig Time pizza, rock melon with parma ham and angel hair pasta w/ king crab meat. Will come back and try other dishes on the menu (:

Another find in Serangoon gardens and Another Italian favourite of mine. Quite hidden. We had to park car and walk a while to get here. The ambience was cosy and the service was prompt. I loved their pizza! All dishes we ordered were lovely. The pastas were fresh. Truffle pasta was decadent.

Baci Baci, nestled in a cozy corner of Serangoon, proved to be the ideal spot for our early celebrations of my son's birthday. When asked what he wanted for his special day, he excitedly exclaimed "pasta," so we ventured to this charming restaurant.

The moment we stepped inside, the neat and inviting decor set the tone for a pleasant dining experience. The service staff were friendly, exhibiting warmth and genuine hospitality.

We embarked on a culinary journey, starting with the Crema di Porcini. Unlike other commercially-made versions, this soup had a distinct homemade taste that was truly delightful.

The Cacciucco, with its perfectly balanced acidity, whetted our appetites and prepared us for the feast ahead. The Soute do Cozze was heartwarming, and the choice of white wine in the soup was spot-on.

The Tagliatelle impressed us with its impeccable texture and rich truffle aroma, while the Capellini al Grancho, although tasty, could benefit from a touch of cream to enhance its flavors.

A surprising hit among the children was the Frutti de Mare, their first encounter with squid ink. Initially skeptical due to its color, they couldn't resist requesting seconds after tasting its unique and delicious flavor.

In conclusion, Baci Baci surpassed our expectations for a memorable early birthday celebration. With its cozy ambiance, friendly service, and delectable pasta offerings, it proved to be a delightful culinary haven.

Had expectations but after some cold plain bread then bland ordinary 'homely' pasta, things got incredibly boring and disappointing. One thing good was the pizza dough. Might be worth giving the pizza another shot... Maybe.

Best service ever, waitress and owner went above and beyond to take care of us. authentic pizza was so good I ate it before taking the picture!
Argentinian food in Sengkang.name: Baci Baci Restaurant

Argentinian food in Sengkang.reviews:
Ordered the rib eye (2 to share) and tenderloin (2 to share). Both beef are deliciously done (medium rare).  One of the best i had.   The mashed potato and spinach is a good choice of sides to have a change of taste. On a tuesday night, its quite a good crowd. Place can be a bit noisy when crowded. Of the 3 desserts, loved the brownie most

This place exceeded my expectations. I had such a lovely, medium rare, buttery, peppery crusted ribeye! (Maybe could have been rested a tiny bit longer but I think most customers prefer warm rather than rested)
They also have some interesting premixed cocktails that aren’t stiff but go very well with food.
Service was a casual, friendly style, yet prompt and efficient.
I hope they keep it up, because their accessibility/value/quality as a steakhouse are rare in my opinion.

Menu change with no sides need to purchase additional add on for sides. Friday night they do not have lobster bisque soup which is the only soup they carry in their menu.
Sides were good and not bad.
Order sirloin steak and i regretted as it was very tough despite it was cook medium rare. I will order ribeye next time. No staff ask how was the food even though it was my first time eating here.

We saw it had a good review, so we decided to try it. Ordered USDA Prime Ribeye, it comes w 2 sides, we chose fries and spinach and ordered a bottle of wine and dessert. Overall, we are satisfied. It's in a mid-range level.

Recommended if you're looking for a quality yet not on a high-range or super expensive level.

Total bill paid $200++

The ambience and service was really nice and personal. Small restaurant hence the gaps between each table is rather narrow.

Shout out to the Starters - Crab cake, Octopus and Truffle fries.

Ordered a ribeye and the cook was good. However, the sauce wasn't impressive. Just alright.

Salmon was beautifully cooked.

Chicken thigh was strangely tough and hard and the crispy skin was a little over salted.

Again, the servers did the most amazing job.

A table next to us ordered the mother's day special and we were almost done before their food arrived. They probably waited an hour - they arrived before us!

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
Price: $2.50 (Plain Thosai)

Plain Thosai: 3.5/5
Some crispy surfaces, savoury and good sour taste.

Sambar: 4/5
Savoury, slightly sweet and starchy.

Chutney: 4/5
Orange chutney was spicy, tangy and gingery. White chutney was savoury, coconuty but a little watery and slightly salty.

Total score: 11.5/15

Was not too crowded on weekday dinner time. Ordered mutton murtabak and tandoori chicken Briyani. Wait was about 15 minutes very normal. Place was clean and neat. Mutton murtabak was average. Tandoori chicken was flavorful. Size was slightly small. Rice serving was large.

A restaurant just near the Bukit Batok MRT. The food is delicious and the service is quite good. We visit them regularly and they have never disappointed us so far. There is a big variety of food and the prices are reasonable. There is a story upstairs with Aircon and a larger seating area.. the downstairs story may seemed cramped up and noisy. So if you need to relax and have a better experience, always opt to dine at the upper floor. Afternoon hours are less busy and the staff attends to you quite soon. But we have been there during evenings and found the place busy and the food orders take time to come.

The lychee and milo dinosaur is lovely. And the thosai are really soft and nice. Chicken biriyani, Rice and Curry, Tom yum sea food rice and chicken fried rice are must try’s in this restaurant. They are open passed 12 midnight as well. We will surely return again for a meal here.

I love mee goreng yet I hardly came across a good one. Even when you occasionally had a good plate of mee goreng and came back again, the 2nd time may disappoint because it may not be cook by the same person, the simply fact that most Indian eatery are not manage by 1 person but by a team.

The mee goreng here was moist enough and flavourful but by no means fantastic, and probably because I hadn't had one for a long time where marginal utility play a part.

Used to be good  and a frequent at this stall but now
1. Price increase
2. Tastes drop tremendously
3. Got an upset stomach and diaahrea
4. Unhygienic environment
