Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
The first time we had our meals here. The place is quite crowded. It's a sign of good food. We ordered Beef Claypot rice, Seafood Hong Kong Bee Hoon noodles, and the Tarik.

We would say the foods are flavourful and the portions are quite generous. The Teh Tarik is delicious.

We ordered Nasi Goreng Salted Fish for takeaway.

Overall is satisfactory 👍👍... Will surely come back.

This restaurant is the 1st Halal establishment that I know that introduces the Beef Kut Teh to the muslim community in Singapore. Over the years the flavours have not changed a bit and the soup is so refreshing and not with a overpowering of herbal fragrant & taste. Not too salty either but just nice for me. Though, the soup is good and beef is tender, the amount of meat, to some maybe, too little and soup is too much. Serve with sambal, I think, belacan and white rice.

We also ordered Beef Claypot Rice and its is also 1 of my favourite here. The portion is a lot for the rice, sauce & beef but a bit too salty because it also have salted fish in the sauce and the burnt bits the bottom of the claypot is the best part and to not get too burnt you must scrap and mix the rice with sauce etc,  as soon as it is served.

Sambal Kangkong is a must as side dish and the portion for small is generous and delicious. Well balanced flavours.

Situated at Bukit Gombak and jammed between a few other restaurants, Habib has made a name for themselves.

Wanted to makan dishes and so we decided on Habib. My sis loves this place for their butter naan and normally when I'm here, I would just almost always have individual dishes. However today was different decided to try individual dishes and boy it was a smart choice.

Sambal Petai, Black Pepper Beef, Sambal Sotong and Beancurds were all super sedap lah! Delicious!!!! Simple mouth watering. I can't gush enough on how good it was. And the portion size was absolutely fair. I don't care if I sound bias but it really was that good. And service timing was also on point. Maybe it was off peak but we had our drinks in less then 10 minutes and another 10 minutes all our orders were served.

My only grouse would be that a clearer instructions about the ordering process and the clearing if tables be put in place.

All in all, I would definately be here again and hopefully they keep up to their standards! Pls do not falter or regress cause that would be absolutely disappointing.

Food : 4 / 5
Staff : 3 / 5
Ambience : 3 / 5

Must try halal beef bak kut teh at this muslim family restaurant located at Bukit Gombak

The claypot style bak kut teh is very herbal and is better than most chinese versions.

They also give big chunks of beef

You can opt for bee hoon option
Around $8 for a big portion

Also must order their sambal stingray. For $15 comes quite big and very meaty. Loved the spice as well!

Habib Family Restaurant
374 Bukit Batok Street 31, HDB, Singapore 650374

Tiktok: unconventionalpassionss

If you're looking for a delicious and filling meal, then Habib Family Restaurant is the place for you. This family-owned establishment is known for its delicious Bak Kut Teh made of beef and mutton, which every foodie in the area should try. The menu is full of tempting options, but the Bak Kut Teh is the real star of the show. The broth is rich and flavourful, with a perfect balance of spices and herbs. The beef is tender and juicy, while the mutton adds depth and complexity to the dish. All in all, Habib Family Restaurant is a must-visit if you're a fan of Bak Kut Teh or just want to enjoy a delicious meal.

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
I takeaway four prices of prata kosong at $1.30 each. The size of the prata is probably the largest I have ever eaten!

I was given two large packets of gravy. One is fish curry, the other was Dahl.

The fish curry was sour and a little too salty.

The Dahl was thick and not watery. This is the first time I ever like Dahl curry!

Tried the mutton briyani. Rice is good, mutton is tender and comes with an egg.

Price is on the high side at $9.00.

I order this chicken briyani, the taste is good, you can taste the spices.. but the staff is not friendly to customers, it’s a bit rude

Went here for breakfast. The prata, nasi lemak was substandard. Food standard has dropped. The makcik serving the nasi lemak and the brother serving the drinks have very very very bad attitude. If you don't want to work during breakfast hours then don't work. No reason to be rude

Love the Indian rojak here. Tried their mee goreng and nasi briyani as well and they were good too. The price is similar to other neighborhood cofeeshop. The boss and the staff are very friendly and even gave us discounts when we do not have small change. One of our must go to places for Indian rojak!

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
Food taste okay. Reasonably priced. Almost full house when we reached at 10.45pm. Noted that a couple of tables ordered western food.

We ordered red Tom yum - average, Pad Thai - beef is over cooked, but there is wok hei. Fried baby squid - got to eat while it’s hot, otherwise wouldn’t be crispy.

Quite good place to go for supper since it opens until 2/3am.

It's our first time dining here. We came on Sunday lunch hrs, not much crowd. We were served approximately 15 mins after ordering.
There's a variety of dishes for Thai food lovers. All look super appetizing .
Love  their initiative of customising the table to display all the menu with the prices stated clearly on it. So convenience for customers to choose from.
We ordered  fried kuey teow & Singapore fried Beehoon.
Both suit our taste bud..thou we felt that the portion could be more :)
I love the teh o longan which definitely quench my thirst in this hot weather. A must try!

What i like is the wide range of variety of food available.
Order chicken fried rice, it was fine, but just.
Came out within minutes of ordering, chicken wasn’t that fresh, hard.

Finally the west side has decent food. I have to admit, their food is really nice. I tried their seafood tomyam spaghetti, it was spicy and delicious! I was a bit skeptical at first cause usually it is hard to get a perfect spicy sour taste for tomyam spaghetti but this one is simple and hits just nicely.

Their beehoon goreng was great too!! At first my hubby was upset cause the beehoon came not only super late.. it looked soggy and wet..He likes dry kind of fried beehoon... But the moment he tasted it..he was like wow... I tried it too...it was really delicious! It has the spicy chilli padi taste with a touch of tomato sauce as well ...

Their red spider drink remind you of childhood pink cough syrup! Maybe it the combination of strawberry ice cream and their red gassy drink..

Ambience is nice too...if you come at night, it feels cosy...
But parking is weird as the nearest parking in front of the shop it is only meant for season parking holders only.. therefore need to have to drive all the way at the back of HDB and park inside.

It was our first time dining here. Service was quite fast. The only thing the runner who send the food is not sure of what he is sending us. It was nasi goreng kampung, but he told us it is nasi goreng seafood. So i rejected the food at first, another server came and say it is nasi grg kampong. Alhamdulilah it is delicious. Only that dissappoint us is the nuggets set that cost $6.50. The fries is dark, some is hard and some soggy and oily. It looks like it was being refried again. Hopefully they can do something about it.

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
Came here 2-3 times. Friends mentioned that their food standard fluctuates. Apparently when there’s lesser crowds, the food is good. It’s probably only a 70% pack on a sat evening.

So this time round every thing was on point.
Also they offer free flow of icecream though there was only 3 flavors.

Tried during lunch time, the area was pretty hot despite the kind gesture of the staff to bring cooler. Tried few food, they are nice but not leaving much impression. If you stranded there with no much choice, can try their Salted egg chicken, seafood bee hoon and Roasted pork. Not recommended: Fried Rice, stir fry vegie and yam Ring.

Though the food is tasty, unfortunately it is alittle too oily for my liking. I really enjoyed the fried pork dish intially but after the 3 to 4 slices it was really sickening. We ordered the chill crab dish where the meat was already extracted (since we were lazy to deshell it ourselves) and while the crab meat portion was pretty generous, the sauce was too watery to my liking. It felt like an oily soup dish with crab meat in it. The four heavenly king dish was good since I didn't taste much of the raw veggie taste and the salted egg yolk chicken was good too just that it was pretty heavy towards the end.
Overall I will still visit this place for it's other dishes such as the hokkien noodles or fried rice which seems promising

First time eating here arrange by my sis for my mum birthday. None of the foods order taste nice. Hei zou are dry n hard...... Worse are the 2 small crabs price at $88. Totally not fresh the meat inside the crabs basically shrink until like no meat at all. Dont keep for how many days leow. Eat crabs dont even provide water to wash hands n the crabs cracker tools. Business do seem good..... Try leow let me know how the foods.

Always liked coming to this bustling joint that's fast gaining popularity. They even started engaging a magician to entertain patrons while waiting for our food to arrive. The Hokkien Mee and White Seafood Bee Hoon are must try items but portion is slightly small. We liked the prawn paste chicken and coffee ribs too. Kiddos welcomed the free ice cream for dessert. Will keep coming back!

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
I really like eating here compared to the nearby coffee shops. It’s clean and airy which makes it more comfortable. Staff are friendly and efficient!

The chicken rice is pretty good, to me the amount of chicken is slightly more than usual stalls 😅

I always get the Ampang sauce for yong tau foo. The fried items are always nicely done and they will cook the veggies separately. Yet to try the other bases but there is also Hakka sauce, Tom Yum, laksa and soup!

Overall, worth to stop by this place for a satisfying meal if you’re nearby. It’s just across the street from the MRT anyway. They sell kopi/teh, canned beverages and also accept various cashless payments too

The very first time I tried yong tau foo that was fried and filled with delicious meat sauce was from Dajie Bukit Gombak! I instantly fell in love with it! I got hooked onto their Hakka sauce! I loveeeee how oily, crispy and delicious the yong tau foo were when paired with this sauce!
Remember to eat it there and then as it can get soggy! Y.u.m.m.y!

The only thing I think they can improve is on their soup though.

The food at Da Jie Niang Dou Fu (Dajie Makan Place) never disappoint! Used to frequent the Clementi outlet when I was a student at Ngee Ann. Nowadays, we venture out a little further to the Bukit Gombak outlet. We really like the food here! Spoilt for choices!

Food is very good but service by the staff AWESOME. They are pleasant and freindly even during their busy period

This place is a monthly visit requirement even pre pandemic 😊

Enjoyed the chicken rice (good portions), the Yong Tau Foo was good (more variety would be nice) and price was reasonable for sure.

Biggest issue with me since day 1 I visited here was the tiny tiny tables. 2 person to a tiny table is just super crowded and uncomfortable. 2 tables seating 2 people (as per the required regulations) would not breach the space and distance requirements. So hopefully they can look into this.

The food can be nice, the staff can be wonderful but when the set up is uncomfortable, the whole experienced is compromised. Again, hope they will look into this.

Food : 4 / 5
Staff : 4 / 5
Ambience: 2 / 5

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
Personally, this Srisun Express branch makes the best Maggie Goreng I've ever had in Singapore. I rate their Maggie Goreng 10/10, but what brings down the quality of this branch is the rowdy customers and noisy kids from time to time. Also, they should replace their menus which are so old and torn apart

Neighbourhood prata place that's on the steeper side price wise but decent food, wide variety. 5pcs indian rojak for $9 and prata kosong $1.40 each. Service staff attitude and face as Black as they come

Price: $2.70 (Plain Thosai)

Plain Thosai: 3.5/5
Crispy centre, savoury and slightly sour.

Sambar: 4/5
Savoury, slightly sweet and starchy.

Chutney: 5/5
Orange chutney was savoury, slightly spicy and garlicky. Green chutney was minty and garlicky. White chutney was coconuty and garlicky. The taste kind of  resembles garlic bread spread.

Total score: 12.5/15

I have paid 2$ extra to add more chicken pieces in fried rice, but still less. I can find only 5 or 6 small chicken pieces. Not worth for 10.40$. I Never go to this hotel again.

Ordered roti John chicken w cheese and in the comments I wrote add onion under the comments section but it came without onion. Ordered ice milo and wrote more sweet in the comments but it came and tasted like there was no sugar at all. Don't know what happened to this place but it was good last time

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
Went at 1130am, 1 staff outside,  1 staff inside making drinks and 1 staff for packing and taking calls.
Full House by 1145am and still just 1 guy outside to take orders from all tables.
Manager needs to rethink the staff planning. Food and drink might be prepared fast but it's pointless without people to serve to the customers.
Been coming here for years and food is still up to standard though, good job on that 👍

Today we celebrated Mother’s Day at Jiak. I have been wanting to try this eastern after recommendations from my colleagues. As reservations were full, we went early to try our luck. Blessing that the timing we went was perfect and we are a seat on arrival. There were only 5 of us so we did not order too much. We ordered the Signature Seafood Black Beehoon; Prawn paste chicken; Sweet & Sour Seabass; Ladyfingers and a Seafood fried rice as the girls are too sceptical to try the black beehoon. I must say all the dishes are cooked to perfectly suit my palate😋 I was initially worried if the black beehoon would come with an over empowering flavor but no, it didn’t! In fact it contains the freshness of the seafood in the dish and overall a 👍. The fish is another one worth recommending. Personally I love sweet & sour dishes and this one is done right on the spot. Fish is fried till it’s crispy to every bite and the sauce nailed it all. Chicken comes covered with loose crumbs which my daughter finished to the last bit! The 2 desserts which they have, the chendol and mango ice were sweet and serve as the icing to the cake for the evening. Great place with tasty food. One minus point is, the food took a bit long to be served and there was one staff giving our free snacks to appease the diners but I am not sure why our table was left out when we are the second table to be seated🤨 Not a fair gesture on his part. I would have rated 5 stars if not for this.....

the ambience is nice! we ordered kopi o chicken, mee soto, and curry fish head.  looks exactly like in the menu. i would have ordered veggies too but my dad doesn’t eat them. Will come here again to try more dishes!

Prawn paste chicken was good! Decent dinner, had the set for two and added prawn paste chicken, also topped up $5 for dessert, total bill came out to ~$60.

Generous portions of food.
Floor was still from mobbing when we went in at 11.30am

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
Very generous and kind people, always give me the feeling of Itaewon class(Korean TV show), whenever you go there staff will treat you in very good manner, either you are doing dining or take away, service wise they are awesome.

Below are the breakdown of features,

Pros:
- very kind staff
- tasty food, must try chicken curry rice and Mee Goreng.
- environment and staff will give positive vibes
- spacious dining area

Cons:
- I found nothing.

If you wanted to eat good food and want some positive vibes, just there and speak with any staff member.

23rd July…its open guys…since 21st July…a day after Eid Adha…check it out…
Latest as of Jun 2021 for those whom has not known yet…they r under reno LAH …n maybe somewhere in July is ready…i did saw more seats will b available…Yahoo!
The only problem is...Insufficient seatings but the rest is quite good...
Second last shop away from the drink stall...only open half day bug the lontong goreng...its sambal goreng its much much better than Allif🤫...sambal sotong...superb
1st shop after the drink stall has good variety of food and delicious...if u r early u can try their mempedal..grizzard
Nasi ayam is not too bad...they have their own style...

Friendly service, comfortable well ventilated dining venue. But skip that, let’s talk about the FOOD 🤤 I had sambal beef fried rice and this dish has CHARACTER! Most sambal fried rice I have had are just good because they’re spicy, but the fried rice here has an umami flavor that complements the spice! The chili is also awesome and a must eat condiment pairing with any of their dishes! For the beef itself, don’t expect too much from it. It’s pretty lean, but at $6 a plate, this is a very value for money meal! One happy and satisfied customer here!

This place is not $, it deserves $$$ or $$$$. 1 hotdog, 1 mini sotong a size of my thumb will cost you $4. As a customer, I find it hard to eat $4 dish with the portion I get. Felt like a food scam.

Singapore is a good country and helpful government.

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
Good taste of dosa with good chutney taste. The onion pakoda was nice too. Reasonably priced and good service staff. The vegetable biryani, North Indian naan set were also was nice when tried on other occasion.

This is my favourite Indian restaurant aside from Sam's curry. The taste is always constant. Please eat in the restaurant and dont order delivery. By the time the food reached you, the taste would be different. I will recommend the below following:

- gobi 65
- Palak paneer
- butter chicken
- garlic and cheese naan

If you would like to have your meal on time, never ever order this restaurant food via any delivery platform! Their waiting time is always at least 1 hour and above. Unless you don’t mind that your lunch become tea time or your dinner become supper.

I’m a regular here. our Saturday lunch at home is usually vegetable biriyani, Palak Paneer or Kadai Paneer, rotis from here. The biriyani and Paneer dishes are cooked extremely well. But their Tandoori roti preparation is below average.

For dinner, we have the Kal Dosai or Paneer Dosai or Parotta kurma from here and they are amazing!

1st time ordering from here.Ordered thru Food Panda.Arrived within 40mins of ordering.Rice was spicy.Each container came with an egg.Meat portions seemed less in each container.Fish biryani had abt 4 pieces of fish.But fish is soft.Chicken meat seemed abit tough thou.For price,don't seem like much of a deal breaker. Taste ok-ok only...

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
Roasted Chicken noodle. Simply awesome. Noodles was well done- not soggy and not too tough. Perfect. Chicken was tender and flavourful. One of the few 5 stars I think. Must come back again to test others like Char Siew.

Not too bad. Decent for coffee shop standard. Good variety of meats, roasted chicken, char siew, sausage, crispy pork, roast duck.

The roasted pork is slightly above average, towards hard crispy and tasty, but the roasted duck is below average, towards salty and not tasty. $4.50

Generous portion, affordable price.

Roast pork is crispyand nice, char siew has the right meat to fat ratio.
Noodle is springy, as of an expected standard of a roasted delight stall.

Went before the lunch crowd, ard 11:30am on a weekday, easily found a seat, no queue.

-------------------

Price increase is minimal despite recent food supply issues. 👍👍

Food is not bad but the female staff attitude can be better, ask a question and her face and tone wasn’t friendly at all. As if i am not suppose to ask or clarify. Have a good day.

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
Spacious food centre that offers variety of food choices. Tried the chang chen chicken rice and they were very generous with their portion. The chicken rice was affordable as well, and comes with a free bowl of soup. Halal food options are available here as well!  Would highly recommend the chicken rice stall

Best food ever
The western food, mini wok noodle are really amazing
Behind it is my favourite prawn noodles and popiah. Love to enjoy all at one go . Best recommended to hang out with friends or family cos can share all at the same time

A large coffee shop with many food stores. Several of them are supposedly famous, where you will see people queueing to buy or place order. Examples are the Fried Hokkien Mee store and the Lor Mee store. Spacious, breezy and clean. One of the better coffee shops I had visited.

A rather large kopitiam sitting side by side with another large coffeeshop - Broadway.

The noteworthy stalls are: Tiong Bahru lor mee and nasi lemak stalls that has super long queues, black and white fried carrot cake, teochew kuehs.

1st time ate her with colleagues.  We ordered Tiong Bahru Lor Mee. Didn't expect it to taste much better than the stalls at Tiong Bahru Market/Food court.  The Q was never ending. Gravy was thick,  ingredients was generous. To find the stall named as TBLM n hidden in far away market in Bt Batok surprised me. Highly recommended.  To go early and not during meal break period as Q is long  or if you don't mind 10mins waiting time!  13:01

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
I came here for lunch the other day. It was surprisingly bustling even having come a little late. The atmosphere feels a little dark, run down, and cramped but we managed to get a spot. The table staff are friendly and helpful. The food is pretty good, too. Definitely above average. However, I am compelled to give a low rating for a few reasons. First, they need to work on their kitchen hygiene. Second, it’s quite pricey. The pita sandwiches are tasty but should be at least 25% cheaper. What really got me, however, is gouging $11 for a small bottle of lemonade. That’s obscene. If they lowered their prices (and maybe the music volume while they’re at it) and cleaned the place up, it would be an easy four stars. As things stand today, I can’t really recommend it despite the food being good.

the pita is so delicious! the calamari is a must try. very worth it for its price :) the beef was a bit dry and the tiramisu is more of a cake than a tiramisu - was v creamy.

Spent $50/person but we were stuffed. Couldn’t finish our food

The bread is super duper soft!
We love what we ordered only the mushroom hummus is a little bit too salty.
The music is a little too loud. So is quite hard to make a conversation .
The service is good.

I came here for the falafel the first time and absolutely love it. Back again to try something else. This time got the baby cauliflower and fish schnitzel. Love the refreshing slaw that comes with the fish. Baby cauliflower maybe a little too torched but its ok for me. Have really love the food here so definitely will be back just that parking around the area can be a little challenging.

Delicious, with generous portions. Hearty flavors, casual atmosphere, pricing reasonable for the size, location and quality.
Cauliflower nice but a smidge expensive. Pitas are large and decent value, very tasty meat and combinations.
Hummus is good.
The bread itself is just awesome.
It’s a casual-ish joint. Service is ok not great.
Sometimes there is smoking next door if you’re outdoors.
Will be back for the food.

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
My 2nd visit after a long while. It is a corner shop below HDB blocks with parking spaces in front of the shop. A cosy restaurant that serves Teochew food. The Teochew Cai Poh fried Kueh Teow is tasty, the chicken is nice, the Hey Chor Is just ok-ok. Overall, food is generally nice.

The food are all overpriced even though I knew teochew cuisine is meant to be expensive. The crab was so small and 2 pcs for the price of $100, salted egg squid was $50, prawn was $60 and worst of all, a plate of tofu cost us $24. The waitress however at the 2nd floor did render good  service as she kept changing our plate but that don’t justify for the total amount we had paid for ($475.90) for a simple dinner.  We would rather go to Jumbo restaurant or any zichar stall which serve better good quality food than them and cheaper in fact.  Last but not least, I do not understand why the review here is commenting on another food (Kway chap) and the sign board is different. Anyway the address is the same. For us, it will definitely be the 1st time and the last time to dine here. We would strongly don’t recommend any patronage to the so called ‘Teochew Restaurant’

Comfort food near home. Would always come for their fish soup and kueh chap. Flavourful fish soup, usually I would add bitter gourd for the crunch and vegetable source. Flavourful tender braised innards (love that skin is included). Would usually add on braised duck meat in my kway chap for additional protein. Their nai bai vegetable dish was cooked with broth (上汤) and with whole fried garlic. Flavourful, vegetable not overcook; has a crunch. Also love that they processed the garlic beforehand hence the garlic was not spicy. Attention to details.

Standards has improved, less salty and more flavourful than before, probably change of chef. Prices are reasonable. Love the convenience that they are open 24 hours.

The fish porridge is good, must try. The service is nice too. Some staff's service approach is not the polished polite style, and at times is very direct, so to some customer this may appear as rude, but it's just their down-to-earth direct approach.

Fish soup is fresh, and portions are just nice. Service is good but sometimes can't understand their mandarin. Accent bit too strong 😅

This place never sleeps. They open 24/7

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
Best to make a reservation as they can get quite busy on Friday and Saturday evenings. Service is very good and the staff are attentive and gave good recommendations. The hummus with prawns is one of the best thing on the menu. The octopus is also worth a try and the kebab is very decent too. The only thing we won’t bother try again is the artichoke.

The food here was amazing. Very inventive menu and everything was delicious. Highly recommend the prawn hummus.

The place is nicely styled with a very high energy atmosphere created by the staff. The staff are attentive and helpful.

Portions can be quite big. Would definitely come here again.

Pasta has changed since the last I had. Used to be spaghetti which I really enjoyed. The new pasta didn’t excite me this time. Other than that, the buttered spinach and the grilled octopus, ZEE BEST!! Salivating just thinking about it :D Needless to say, the service well deserving of 5 stars!

Enjoyed the food. Pasta was amazing. Lamb is average, can give it a miss. Overall slightly pricey though. And sound reverberation is horrible. Not a good place for a first date... you will be shouting at each other.

4.8/5 (5/5 food; 4/5 service; 5/5 atmosphere). Great night out! I tried to objectively evaluate this restaurant. We came as a couple for a date night, but this restaurant is clearly best experienced as a group. The atmosphere is super lively, loud and charming. But if you're looking for an intimate night out, this probably isnt the place. Nonetheless, we could really appreciate the ambience in the room! The food was fantastic, we had a bit of everything and honestly each plate was better than the other. Great wine and drink list. The only drawback is slow/less attentive staff. The place is packed and bustling not sure if it's because there is a shortage of staff but they are clearly going at 150%, but not sustainable. The end of the night holds a nice little surprise! Will definitely be going back (with a group)

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
went over earlier at around 4plus in the afternoon with my mum... welcoming staffs with warm ambience and friendly service!

i had their 7" hawaiian pizza, seafood tom yum pasta & mushroom soup set 😍 all the dishes were cooked and made beautifully and delicious 🤤

PIZZA was baked perfectly. toppings were generous & the pizza base was not too soft not too crispy not too thick not too thin. LOVE IT! 🍕
PASTA was delicious not too overwhelming with all that cream sauce, the tanginess from the sourness of tom yum flavour balances the dish out. seafood were also cooked nicely. tender squid rings! 🦐🦑
SOUP & GARLIC BREAD much love! baguette of garlic bread were baked to a nice crisp yet not burnt and still remains soft in the center. 🥖🧄

THANK YOU STAFFS INVOLVED! surely i will come back again 🤍

Simple neighbourhood place for a fairly quick meal of pasta and pizza. Staff was very friendly, food was nice. They have indoor and outdoor sitting. Would visit again.

Friendly and respectful staff, great pasta all the time, my top choice to go for pasta cravings 😘

We were sitting in the restaurant for 30 minutes scrolling the menu and decided to place our order at 2132 hours (2 minutes after 'last order' 2130 hours)

They asked us to move to the outside seating area, which was fine.

The SG$3 garlic bread had to be the most underwhelming and overpriced item. Never, ever order it.

Pasta was so and so. Ordered three dishes, all different types, nothing out of the ordinary that would make me want to come back. Although, upsize portion was good.

Around 2157 hours we had received all items for our order barring the baked rice. We decided to ask about the rice and were shocked to see that the baked rice was left in the microwave for the entire time, and was not served to us.

The baked rice was given in a plastic container (even though we were eating-in) with exceedingly low portion size for the price.

When asked for water, the cup had a black particle in it. Nothing major.

The atmosphere was nonexistent, the music choice was straight out of hell.

Only positive was the extremely kind and helpful service.

Simply put, extremely disappointed. Nothing close to what my friends and I paid for. Will think twice before ever coming back.

Pasta and Pizza ...

Couldn't decide what we wanted for lunch as we were in Westmall. Walked around and saw Pasta Mania.

Quick decisions and there we were. Approached one of the staff and swiftly, she explained to us accordingly the menu etc. Checked in and got our seats. Commendable that the seats were spaced nicely apart.

Our food came rather quick. Heres the plus point. 2 staff came to help us on different times and both times they were super accomodating, polite and always smiley.

The food is above average. It was nicely seasoned and the portioning was rather generous. Just that the pizza was slightly underwhelming. Also, it's funny enough that I do enjoy the garlic bread. Look at the calamari, it's nice lah!  Price wise, it's OK I suppose with the portion.

What makes the meal pleasant really was the attentive staff, period. An average food but served with a delightful atmosphere makes the whole experience really pleasant. So will surely visit them yet again and hopefully the standard remains.

Food : 3 / 5
Staff : 4 / 5
Ambience : 3.5 / 5

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
As another reviewer mentioned, security is tight before being allowed to enter this place. At first, you can't tell that there's a restaurant in this address, but after you clear security you learn that the place is actually on the 6th floor of the building.

The food was very good and at a reasonable price. I loved the Mezze Platter (appetizer). Service was also very pleasant and fast, which was nice. They accept American Express, which not all places do in Singapore.

It's very hard to find a Kosher place in this little country, so I'm glad that this place turned out to be a good option!

The hummus, pitas and falafel platter was simply delicious, serving 4-5 persons! The waiter made good recommendations on how much we order as the portions are big! Schnitzel (fried chicken)with fries/fried rice plus salad is good for 2 persons per plate! You can literally taste the potatoes in the Fries ~ very yummy! Reasonable prices too and good service!

Very good kosher food, was lovely and soft, would go back anytime. Nice friendly staff.

Level of security is high before one could enter the premise. Kosher food is served here. At the time our visit, there was a limited list of food the kitchen could serve.

Best hummus in Singapore.. better than many Turkish restaurants
Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.name: Awafi Kosher Restaurant

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
So happy these people made a come back! Context: I first tasted the Chai family’s delicious food at Thunder Tree Lei Cha previously located in Raffles Hospital food court and Vivo City food court, now permanently closed due to closure of their organic farm.

In my opinion, they are serving the best vegetarian kolomee in Singapore. The noodles are cooked al dente/very springy. My usual order is the mushroom kolomee with a dollop of their spicy homemade chilli on the side. Portion runs small. I would order it with extra noodles and extra mushrooms! My husband’s favourite is the chilli kolomee - if you can’t handle spicy/chilli hot food, don’t order this. Their carrot cake is also tasty, best if you arrive right when they just finish frying them, hehe.

Stall gets busy during lunch time and table/seats may be challenging to find. Suggest to arrive early.

To note: food from this stall are all vegetarian without allium (no onion, no garlic).

Happen to past by this stall, order an dry noodle and yam cake . The kolo noodles are yummy and tasty. But not recomme the yam cake, the taste are average and cold. Good choice on 初一& 十五.

Would have given 1 star if I hadn't actually enjoyed their Lei Cha.

Kind of like selling "dog meat with a goat sign", the sign was clearly indicating their Lei Cha uses brown rice and even if they do have the white rice option, they shd confirm it with us before proceeding serving us with white rice. The noodle menu was even ridiculous, the BIG SIGN above their stalls with their menu items numbered was no longer valid, replaced by an new & different menu in a A4 size sign right in front of their stall which you will only notice it when you are 1st in the queue. The staff didn't bother to inform abt the differences but I did realized the no.4 item I wanted to order was a different dish in the new menu and I specifically told him I wanted the no.4 from the Big Sign above and even pointed my finger to it, the staff acknowledge but proceed to cook the no.4 from the new menu after which he just told me the "no.4" I wanted was out of stock. I would have replace it with Lei Cha also if he had bothered to inform ahead. This is hawker etiquette at its worst.

Ordered signature chili kolo mee the shop told me to be careful of the spiciness. Indeed it was very spicy but still torelable to me.
Soup was good, sweet from radish and not oily.

Maybe next time can try the lei cha if i’m around😀

This leicha is vegan, no egg. The soup has no oil and is smooth and rich. The kolo mee is vegan too as the noodle is egg-free.
Everything was tasty and only two main dishes were available at 2pm and there was a queue the whole time we were there on Saturday.
About a 10-min walk from Bukit Batok train station, cutting across the park.
Definitely will come often.

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
I wouldn't its very bad or very good, its just ok.
We were the only customer that day.
We ordered the family meal which includes 3 seafood buckets, free flow plain white rice and fruit punch. Seafood wasn't very fresh, gong gong wasn't cleaned properly there were still algae on them.
Sauces we got was chilli crab, percik and creamy onion, it was good.

P. S. This place will be a one time thing.

Ordered Family Bucket, which comes with 3 servings of Seafood Tub, Free flow fruit punch, and rice. Each serving of Seafood Tub allows a choice of sauce. Went with Creamy Garlic Sauce, Chilli Crab Sauce, Percik Sauce. Seafood is not too fresh, crab meat is visibly flaky/crumbly, mussels look shrivelled up.

Was a bit doubtful seeing the mixed reviews. Went there in a Saturday evening, place was ~70% full but service was still good. We got the 5 pax (3 seafood bucket w/ 3 sauces, lobster, fried fish, free flow rice +fruit punch) for $155. Flavours were not too intense and spicy, so everyone including kids enjoyed the food. No GST and service charge. Family enjoyed it, will def come again!

Seafood not very fresh. Not cleaned properly and overcooked. Staff was not attentive and have attitude problem. Does not even tell you in advance for out of stock but simply give anything following their choice. Portion quite small only 3 crabs. Corn was overcooked and smells weird. Gong gong has greenish shells. Mussels have sand in it and overcooked. Sauces not that amazing. Shellout worth of 100 dollars came with clams, mussels, gong gong, 10 prawns, 3 crabs, 2 corn sliced in smaller knobs plus rice. Rice also not up to standard. No improvement in food standard.

Wasn't planning to dine here at first, but I'm glad we gave this place a try! Food was really good and affordable. The seafood aglio olio was delicious. My girl really loved the lamb chops too. It's somewhat like dining at Aston but tastes better.

Definitely our go to place for lunch/dinner after swimming at the csc pool the next time!

Israeli restaurants in Bukit Batok.reviews:
Quite a number of tables available during lunch period and indoor seating. Service was quick and friendly. Dishes are good and acceptable, with a big range of dishes available. Average price per person for ala carte and drink is about $10 per person. Fuss free meal! Parking available at the road or outdoor carpark nearby Beauty World Mrt station.

The food was delicious. Served quite fast. You don't need to wait long.

Tried the nasi campur. You need to try the curry chicken, which was fantastic. Tried the butter chicken with plain naan, which was great, too. We also had bryani prawn and Chinese style fried rice.

Staff are very attentive, friendly, and helpful.

Easy to travel here via bus 67 from CCK Bus Interchange or Downtown Line Beauty World.

Will come down to try other food next time.

Been coming here for years. You get what you pay for, never had complaints about their food.

Looks like they upgraded their curry bowls 😂

Lots of comfort food at its best here. They've range from Western food to indian dishes.

The dishes we ordered are served warm and taste acceptable.

With all the price rising, we are surprised that their price is still reasonable.
You'll find fried rice with a side dish from $5+ only.
Portion is generous too

It was a weekday when we visited the restaurant, and it was busy with customers, but their staff were incredibly fast.

Reasonable rate + Great service.
It's definitely a great supper place to lepakz with friends

And the cheese naan & butter chicken is a must try! Highly recommend!

The butter chicken was the best I've tasted all over singapore.  As I've tried alot of it elsewhere... nothing is compared to Ameen's butter chicken. And damn the cheese naan is solid I tell you. Crispy on the outside and soft and gooey from the cheese on the inside. Totally recommending this place to anyone who loves a good solid butter chicken and pair it with their naan. Will be coming back very soon and many more times over the years!!!!

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
The food is tasty and the portioning is just nice!

Not many halal seafood casual dining restaurants with nice comfort seating seats around Jurong. Especially outside the shopping malls!

Find SAFRA Jurong, and find Rasa Istimewa.
Overall seafood is nice and at affordable prices. A recommended place for family.

Salted egg chicken is a must try. Hot plate bean curd with seafood is delicious, spinach with mushroom is soft and delectable, and the sliced fried fish with sweet and sour sauce is an awesome complement as well. Drinks are refreshing too, and the variety is amazing compared to your typical Chinese restaurant. Being halal, this place is welcoming to all rave and religion! A go-to choice for delicious homely Zhi char if you’re in the Boon Lay heartlands. Comfortable ambience with soothing decor, lighting and music makes this an ideal location for a relaxing dinner over which to catch up with friends or family.
Worth coming back again, value for money 👍🏻

I would like to thank all the staff serving us as quickly as possible for our iftar.

The food was not delivered early before breaking of fast which is appreciated. I know that with this type of system will be bound to encounter delay on 1 or 2 dishes (which for us is the ala carte dish, Mee Hon Kong.) Nevertheless, rest of meal was nice except the Tom Yum Soup (tasted bland). Apart from it, we have a wonderful experience there.

Would recommend others to iftar there. Slightly pricey but for the service and ambience, it is well deserve.

Got the family combo. Yu Sheng was different yet felt premium. Food is generally excellent and well prepared. Only complaint is the fried noodles were too salty during our visit. Developed sore throat the next day. But flavor and texture is still there.

Staff are generally friendly, and ambience is good, only because it wasn't too crowded a little before peak dinner time. Will recommend to my friends around my area.

Food was great. My mother in law wife and daughter enjoyed the food. No complaints!

The food came fast and was piping hot for the hot plates. Taste was great for the beef and tofu and was cleared very quickly.

Stingray taste was good and non rubbery. The youtiao was very crispy and there was sufficient fish paste inside!
Kai lan was tasty with wok hei

Thanks for a sumptuous lunch!
Ps the usual waiters are quite ok. The tall, young man wearing the green polo was very friendly:)

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
Ma Lor mee is quite good especially with the fried fish option. Ample garlic and chilli for self add on.
Whampoa Soya Bean gave a generous serving of gingko nuts with the bean curd. But be alert to inform them to have less sugar as mine was too sweet for me.

Wide array of selections to choose from prawn noodle, chicken rice, fritters, Nasi lemak, fish soup, soya drinks, duck rice, and more recently newly opened pork trotter rice. Day 1 launched at Boon Lay Place Market. Some of the hawker stalls open as early as 6am, and the Kuay Chap stall even open 24hours. Evening stalls included satay, fried chicken wings, Zi Char and even grilled string ray etc. Always crowded with throngs of patrons visiting different stall throughout the day. Attached is pork trotter rice from Bai Nian!

Variety of food choices.. lor mee is not bad :)

I wanted to have something light and ate carrot cake. It's very tasty and not oily like the rest. The only set back at Boon lay are the sitting arrangements. Time for a TOTAL REVAMP... 🙏🙏🙏🙏

There’s a famous Nasi Lemak stall at a corner and another chinese version which is equally nice. My favourite Chong Pang satay stall that sells nice satay and bbq chicken wings. If you like Hokkein mee, there’s a stall diagonal opposite to the satay stall, which is very nice. And there’s a stall selling nice Ngoh Hiang, aka deep fried stuff seasoned with five spices, facing Boon Lay place.

As for dessert, other than the typical bamboo cane drinks and the many different hawker drinks, there’s an auntie selling assorted soya bean drinks and dessert.

In short, it’s a hawker flair paradise!

IG: sgfood13
Tiktok: gohht13

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
my first time to prata wala, i ordered a new menu item - wrap salad series butter chicken. there is also wrap briyani series. took quite a long while waiting for it to be ready. i could see the staff figuring out how to wrap it behind the clear glass counter. maybe cause it's a new item, i'll give them the benefit of doubt. i thought it would be subway's wrap's size but it's significantly smaller. butter chicken and its accompanying gravy/sauce is definitely sufficient. taste is on the spot, matches the wrap, not too spicy, not too strong. however, the salad (veggies) is meager. i only remember seeing one piece of lettuce and several countable strips of onion and carrot (i presume carrot? cause something orange). surely lose out to subway and/or stuff'd since the price range is about the same. hope they can improve on that, otherwise this wrap idea is a good menu add on. i also ordered hot teh tarik which is on point 👏🏽. restaurant is set up for fast food setting, i don't remember seeing any high chairs for kids though. their tray return is also all the way inside with minimum shelvings, they were already fully stacked with returns when i put my tray there. i thought it kind of discourages people to return their trays, especially when it gets crazy busy and crowded. on a good note, i spotted a really petite albeit thoughtful/useful hand wash basin at another corner of the restaurant.

I tried the deepavali special Dahi puri and chilli chicken briyani. I could say this is so far the best briyani I had. Chilli sauce is not too overpowering, and the curry goes well together with it. Pair it with a crispy pappadum, and acar, the taste is heavenly. I would also like to say thank you to the friendly staff, Naveed, for the service and  recommendation of Mango Lassi. It helps to lower the heat from the food and is very delicious too. First time trying out Dahi puri, quite an interesting taste experience for me. Sweet, salty, and a mixture of spicy makes it a well snack for anytime.

Price: $6.30

Masala Thosai: 5/5
Thosai had extremely crispy edges, the potato of the curry was more like a mash, there were carrot, peas and lentils which added a nice crunch.

Sambar: 4.5/5
A hearty and moreish sambar containing lentils with some heat from the chillies.

Chutney: 4.5/5
Red chutney is flavourful, tangy and tasted tomatoey. White chutney has A LOT of coconut with tiny bits of ginger. Very refreshing.

Total score: 14/15

Butter chicken biryani, add egg ($1) and masala chai came up to $15.40 which is very reasonable given the portion. See how small the fork and spoon is in comparison to the plate lol. Sauce is addictive, chicken is tender, egg is delicious. I like everything about this ☺️ The service was also very good and friendly. One small thing is that the place is very cold, so the food gets cold fast. Other than that, everything is awesome. I like that they have a small sink so you can wash your hands and they have napkins as well.

We ordered the butter chicken briyani (pictured; $11.90) and curry chicken briyani ($10.90) and the portion size was so huge that each dish could be shared by 2 persons. The curries were pretty good, though the curry chicken was slightly tough. It was busy on a Sun afternoon but there were still a few seats available. Service was friendly.

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
Came for supper and it was fairly quiet so not much of a wait, but they only had chicken satays left so we got pork ones from another stall. I enjoyed the satays (70c each) and liked that the peanut sauce was a bit chunky with the bits of crushed peanut clearly visible.

Also tried some of their bbq chicken wings ($1.40, minimum 2pc) which looked a bit small but they were packing flavour. The wings went nicely with the chilli sauce which seemed to contain a bit of tanginess.

I also appreciated the food being served on reusable crockery.

Still as good Satay, popular with locals. Taste as good even when pack back to consume. Gravy not spicy, strong hint of peanut.

The best satay that we have eaten so far. The pork satay is juicy and flavour full. The ketutput is wrapped in coconut leaves unlike of others in plastic paper. The lady who attended to us is pleasant and courteous  despite the hot environment & many orders. The digital queue system gives you an informed waiting, no worrying if your order had been missed. This make the waiting easy. Overall eating experience 5 stars. Will definitely return for more. Highly recommended.

This satay stall is my favourite. Meat well grilled; add 50 or 80 cts more for cucumbers /onions rounding up to nearest dollar.

Best satay I have tasted so far. Always call to order before reaching the hawker centre to reduce waiting time of 30 minutes or more. Now they offer chicken wings too.

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
Standard drop way to low compared to when Ayam penyet is newly launched. Super disappointing. Can u see how pale the dory is?! Really waste of money, its not cheap mind u! And as usual alot of things in the menu are not available during order.

The tofu was good. The yellow sauce tasted amazing. But the chicken in ayam penyet was so dry without any sauces. The only moisture in it was the chili which is super spicy…

I like the gado-gado so much.
The ayam bakar also quite good.

Bad experience with their service team. My toddler spill the drinks on the table and floor, the service crew just ignore us thou the shop was 50% empty. They were just being blinded that the spillage on the floor. Initially tght some of the crew would help to bring out the mop, NOBODY bothered. Food there also felt normal compared to intiallu when they opened. Bad expereince that i would not even think of having any meals there. If there is no star rating on their service, i would change to 0 star.

most of the items we wanted to order were not available.

The standard last time was better compared.

Disappointing!

HOPE NEXT ONE BETTER.

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
Food was good, however, there was a fly which kept flying around and landed on a few people’s drinks.

The food is flooded with oil. Terrible! The waiter just ignore our feedback, and the qrcode for feedback keep requesting for personal info only, but not allow to upload any photo.

Ordered the trio meat set meal with a mac and cheese. It’s what’s you expect from pepper lunch meal, exciting to stir fry everything in front of you. Queue was slightly long due to SDM but the server was friendly and prompt in explaining how to order and the SDM in place. Made the whole dining experience quite enjoyable and smooth.

Ordered 2 salmon pepper rice (one without corn) and a seafood aglio olio for takeout. The aglio olio and normal salmon pepper rice arrived in 15 minutes. Counter staff kept saying it takes time and that it was a special order, but more than 20 orders including multiple salmon rices were served in the meantime. Kitchen staff kept forgetting (or refused to make) the order even after being reminded by senior staff three times. It took an additional 30 minutes for the remaining salmon pepper rice to arrive.

Standard remains consistently good even after many years. Clean and excellent customer svc. The cashiers, be it part timers or regular staffs are very helpful. Was checking if they recently changed their menu. She explained to us what are some of changes.

Maybe this is the only time I’ll finish all the rice! 😆 be it beef, salmon, or chicken, scallops, it’s always good. Be sure to quickly “cook” it with their special butter once the food arrived!

But if u re seated inside the restaurant area, where the cashier is located, rmb to spray the fabric mist on your way out. Cos you may smell alittle oily if you don’t.

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
So so only nothing fantastic. There is no fragrance in the rice. The fried chicken wing has a refried oil taste. With such a long queue, I thought it must be delicious.

One of best nasi lemak. Fragrant rice and delicious chilli.  Fried chicken is normal. Waiting time could be long, would not go for it if q is too long.

POWER! The nasi lemak is fresh and tasty. Good selection and choices. Nice flavorful rice and sambal. Friendly and quick service. POWER!

Ordered the Chicken Set ($4) for takeaway and only managed to eat it almost half a day later. The rice and chilli is amazing, I finally understand why this place is so popular! Chicken is alright, and the egg yolk was cooked to a nice jammy consistency. 10/10 will come back!

Power Nasi Lemak.. powerful punch of sambal and powerful crunchiness chicken wing that is flavoursome too. Despite the current unpredictable weather, customers who are craving for this powerful nasi lemak remain undeterred and patiently queue for their turn. Wide selection for customers to mix it, try it & love it!

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
The dish impresses with its meticulous presentation, featuring a perfectly grilled and seasoned hamburger patty served alongside a bed of fluffy rice. The taste is a delightful blend of savory and umami flavors, complemented by a rich demi-glace sauce. Overall, a visually appealing and delicious culinary experience.

Walk in on a Sunday early evening at around 5.45pm and there was only one group ahead of us so waiting time is around 2-3 minutes.

Ordered the truffle omelette set at $18.80++ and avocado pork hamburg set at $16.80++.

Each set come with a side dish, a salad, a tamago soup and a rice.

Service staff are very attentive and excellent customer service.

Will definately return to dine in again.

Walked in on Sunday 530pm for early dinner and could get seats readily. What attracted us into the restaurant was the smell, likely from the sizzling hot plates that the steaks are presented on. Had Bacon & Kinoko Hamburg Steak Teishoku. The food is good but not excellent probably due to my personal preference of not so greasy food to begin with.

I was quite hungry, but unfortunately, the food here left me with a sense of normalcy, which in itself speaks volumes.

Here's what I ordered:

1. Tsukimi Pork Hamburg Don - The hamburg was rather tasteless, but fortunately, they provided soy sauce on the side. I must say the egg yolk was a highlight. In fact, I ordered an extra egg to mix with the remaining rice, elevating the dish.

2. Tamago Egg Soup - Surprisingly, this simple soup stood out amongst all the dishes.

3. Thick-Cut Bacon - A decent choice if you're hankering for bacon.

This was my first experience tasting hamburg steak in Singapore! We conveniently placed our order through a QR code, and the food arrived promptly after we ordered. We opted for the Bacon Hamburg Steak Set Meal and Tsukimi Hamburg Don, and both dishes were incredibly delicious! The Japanese ingredients were impressively fresh, leaving a delightful taste in our mouths. We're already looking forward to returning to try other items on the menu!

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
I recently visited this Bak Kut Teh place, and it was delicious! The meat was tender and juicy, and the soup was nice and peppery. The tenderloin soup was also tasty. It is worth a try. The location is far from the center of town, but it is worth the trip.

The meat was fall-off-the-bone tender. Soup was not overwhelmingly garlicky or peppery and there's a taste of sweetness of the pork in it. Pig trotters was fabulous too.

A Bak Kut Teh stall that is the main anchor stall in a coffee shop. Order at the counter, and food will be served to the table. Soup refill is self-service.

Reasonable price and above average taste. One of the better BKT in Singapore thou there was no wow feel.

Food not as good as before. Prices increased but quality of food gone down alot. Soup is over salty now, side dishes too oily, mei cai contains too much hard unchewable parts which I need to spit out constantly.
It took away my pleasure of enjoying this popular bak koot teh. We're quite the regulars here by the way. Disappointed.

Love the BKT.  The meat is tender and soup, which is pepperish and flavourful.   The pork trotter is very well done,  soft and juicy, which just melts in your mouth.

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
Use to come to this stall in Yu Hua at least once a week while I was working in Jurong area. It’s been 20 years since my last visit. Must say I am happy they have survived all these years.

Back then, I would have rated this as one of the top BKT places in Singapore. Today, with the rise of Ng Ah Sio, Song Fa and others, Hwa Xing is still good but not as spectacular as before.

Same peppery taste that I remembered. Same slightly bloody kidney. Same salty vegetables. Same long wait for your food to be served. If you like steamed fish, go for the steamed garouper.

One of the best Bak Kut Teh experience I ever had. Ordered pork rib (there is option to select how many piece you want), mix veg, fermented veg, pig trotter, and steam fish (half) was pleasantly surprised the prices were so reasonable. Strongly recommend anyone in the area to give it a try. You won’t regret it yummy.

The bak kuh teh is decent but not WOW.  The queue is rather long with a 45min wait at peak hours.  The service attitude is good and they bring the order to the table.  Their steam fish seems popular too.

While the meat was soft and tender, the soup was insanely peppery that you can't really taste any other flavours from the soup. We much prefer the pig trotters as compared to the bak kut teh.

The pork trotter was mainly the lean parts. Having said that, it was surprisingly tender. The sauce was of a good balance.

Accompanying soup was peppery but lacked depth. Mainly flavored with soy sauce.

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
This was a busy place during our family patron. The table was big enough to accomodate 4 persons. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Food wise, I think they are slightly better than expected, but still have room to be perfect as we had salmon teriyaki, udon, sushi etc. I would be back due to the service.

Waited for more than 30min, then my bro decided to ask the waiter. They realised that they served my bro’s food to the wrong table, we know this becuz they discussed in front of us, but they nvr explain to us, nvr say sry. Unacceptable, very bad

Our usual spot for a family meal! Put mentai sauce on anything, & I’ll have it, such as this Aburi mentai caterpillar sushi! Good variety of dishes & most made upon order. Tori karaage is always a kids’ favourite.

IG @pingguo301

Is peak hours when we get there for dinner so i can't really feel the environment. Service is very good, up to expectations. Foods wise is ok but the season menu is for illusion purpose i guess, i feel like it is two different kind of foods. Ha.

Location specially was the eel rice, it was quite flavourful and fresh. Also had the fish and all quite good? I was pleasantly surprised and walled out happy and full. Service and everything was quite good for a busy time as well. Keep it up !

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
Many stalls here… unfortunately more than 2/3 were closed at 6:30pm on a Sunday.   The carrot cake stall, fish bee hoon stalls were closed. The Japanese bento stall at #01-47 was open though.  Good value servings. Glad to have tried that stall.  They have a wide menu to choose from.  Chicken teriyaki and fish cutlet Bento for $5.50. The rojak stall nearby was still open. A big plate of rojak starts from $4.

Recommend to try out this stall which is famed with its Crispy Yong Tau Foo coated with the right blend of chilli and sweet sauce, alternatively you can try the soup type ( add on: noodle etc) or even with Laksa gravy spreading over the Chee Cheong Fun. Excellent combo of crispy & crunchy stuffed Yong Tau Foo with moist & smooth Chee Cheong Fun, a must try for those who love Yong Tau Foo, as breakfast!

Don’t get mixed up with another Yuhua market, this one is Yuhua Village. There are variety of eatery especially morning, Xiang Ji Porridge is a 2nd generation - - try them when here will never regret. There r two wanton noodle facing the road - very good. There roast meat & duck, chicken rice, Mee Pok, Malay food - very good. And a whole lot of eatery, the famous Zai Shun is here next to the market. Tiong Bahru boa is also here. Plus after breakfast walk around medical hall, barber, spa, hardware shop, bread shop & many.

Could not find a parking space in the morning on the weekend, luckily we stay nearby, so even if its take away food, the 炒粿条is still good, should have added 3 dollars cockles to make it substantial. Chwee kueh is also good! Fried carrot cake is not as good as yu hua place hawker center nearby but they offer black+white mixed, so it is a +point. If u can't park, then forget about those long queue Michelin stuff...
Hdb should add a multi storey car park here, then it will be much better.

Delicious local food at reasonable prices.    My favourites : chicken rice, peanut pan cakes, fried carrot cake black flavour, roti prata, mee rebus, mee siam, nasi lemak, soya bean drinks, fried black colour kl hokkien mee, economy bee hoon, mixed rice, pork porridge, zhi char at night,  economy rice,  vegetarian wan tan mee, laksa,  fried you tiao,  fish soup noodles......  😀😀

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
This hawker center is located in Jurong East area, selling local cooked food and fresh products (wet market). Prices for cooked foods are reasonable, ranging from $4 onwards. I bought a packet of fried prawn noodle for $5. The Tiong Bahru tim sum coffeeshop is near the hawker, selling all kind of tim sum, they operate from morning til around 2.30pm daily except Monday (close)

A lively hawker for breakfast and lunch.   Bak Kut Teh,  Teochew Kueh,  Pancake, Laksa and Chicken Rice are some of the popular ones.  There are usually a queue at these stalls but they move fast.

Variety of food at affordable price.

-Prawn mee was oily and expensive, with few prawns.
-Fried hokkien mee from 晶晶 and kway chup from Good Duck were good.
-The gu chye kueh super good!
-Coffee was average.
-Thunder tea was good.

Had Fried Carrot Cake ($3.00), Chicken Rice ($4.00), Lor Mee ($3.50) & Gu Cai Kueh + Soon Kueh ($1.10 x3), were good.

Carrot cake 5 🌟 - Really good carrot cake that is proven with a long queue each time , well worth the wait for the plate of goodness!
Note: The white and black version comes at $5!

Dimsum 3.5 ⭐️ - Dimsum is also decent, though they tend to leave it to cool if you are late on your collection, quite a wet blanket on that part - pun intended.

Wanton noodle 4 ⭐️- springy noodles, decent portion and comforting bowl of noodles

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
I’m a repeat customer for many years, especially for the Chives Kueh. The line can get pretty long especially on weekends but it moves quickly. Fried ones are the best in my opinion with the skin at the right thickness, not too thin or thick. Turnip ones were okay. I usually buy 20-30 pieces in one go, waited 5-10 mins for the order to be done.

Recommend to try this if you’re in the area!

If you wonder how good can Teochew kueh be, you have to suspend any judgement and head here. This has been on my to-revisit place for a while and the last time I came (from the eastern part of Singapore) was probably before Covid. Given how good it is, a 30 minutes wait is worth it. What is amazing is that the kueh here is made, steamed and fried right before your eyes. Personally I like fried version which is my choice always. The skin is so perfect - thin and delicate and slightly chewy. It’s definitely Michelin Bib Gourmand worthy.

Visited 16 July 2023 Sunny Sunday morning. The following sharing are based on our unbiased personal opinion and experience

This stall need no further introduction if your stay in the neighborhood. And there were a few interviews about this authentic teochew Kueh stall on some social media platform.

The owner are a pair of middle aged couple with 4 - 5 stall helper to handmade the Kueh daily. The male stall owner is very friendly and we will greet each other morning everytime I visit his stall.

Handmade Kueh truly hits a spot on me. There have a option of steam or pan fry Kueh. I will order for 2 days portion for take away and leave some for next day to pan fried.

Overall a 4 ⭐ for me. Come on down and give it a try I'm sure you will love it as well

One of the few places where teochew kuehs can be pan fried upon request (add 10 cents each). Both soon kueh and png kueh were good. Everything served in disposables even for dine-in. E-payment available.

Michelin-rated local food. Price is reasonable. Had two kuehs and it was warm as it was heated over a big pan.

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
Drumstick with chicken wing combo at $6.80.

Superb long Q and I join in wanting to find out why...

Very tender and juicy chicken. Rice is fragrant too..

The only downside is the chilli still need improvement compare to my must go store in Gek Poh Shopping Center kopishop. That's why minus  stars.

Overall, can eat and will come back again if around the area.

Long queue. But can’t say it was worth the wait. Maybe the chicken quality went down after the shortage…. Skin felt really oily, and the breast meat a bit dry. Rice was nice. Chili nice. Ginger sauce nice. Maybe come back after the chicken supply comes back to normal.

Great and deliciously good Chicken Rice The prices are reasonable. For half a Chicken with 4 plate of rice, it costs you less than $15. They friendly family business. Worth to eat! Very fragrant rice too

This boneless chicken rice stall attracts a crowd. They are usually sold out around lunch time. So it is advisable to come slightly earlier, before noon if possible. Taste is great and the chilli is fantastic. Price is reasonable and the hawkers are friendly.

By 1pm you are probably stretching your luck, as most days they could be sold out by then or favourite parts of the chicken are no longer available.

Chicken is awesome. Price is good.
Half chicken is $15. Love their skin. The sauce pairing is good. Traditional taste.
Rice on the other hand a bit hard but the taste is moderate. Can be stronger tho.
Soup was clear and savoury. It so damn worth it lah.

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
The vibrant atmosphere and diverse array of food stalls offered a tantalizing selection of local and international dishes. The variety of stalls caters to every craving, from traditional local favorites like Hainanese chicken rice to international delights. The affordable prices and efficient service make it a top choice for a quick and satisfying meal. It's a bustling hub where the rich flavors of Singaporean cuisine come to life, and the perfect place to experience the city's diverse culinary heritage.

Was here to have lunch with my mum, and she mentioned that the Mala was not bad located at the Kopitiam Food Hall (old Jurong Point building Level 3). After renovation, the new Food Hall has comes alive with many interesting new stalls. However, the prices are a bit higher. Therefore, it is recommend to use the Fairprice/Kopitiam App to get 10% discount.

The stall was seated at the far end inside, there are a good wide spread of ingredients to choose from. I picked quite a few items and my plate weighed heavy. Noodle cost $1 each, compared to other Mala selling at $2 each.

Requested for medium spicy, less salt and less oil, waited for a while for our order. It smell so good, the pork belly was so tender and fresh. I love the fried beancurd skin and all types of mushrooms. Personally feel that medium spicy is not that spicy after all, just a bit mild and not that oily after all after requested. But still a little bit salty at the bottom.

Total cost me less than $20 for 2 pax after 10% discount. And I think it is really worth it!

Weekend crowd as always  you will see long queues formed in most of the food stall. Luckily we managed to secure the dining seat easily. Ambience was overall similar to food hall. Food was reasonably priced though some maybe pricey. I ordered the chicken bimbimpap, it was ok in general.

Good selection of food here.. use kopitiam app can get 10% discount.. clean environment. Most of the food was delicious.  Korean cuisine was below expectation.  Not nice

I like dinning this foodcourt cause it has a wide range of asian food. And one of my new favorite is the newly opened Lechon Pinoy. They have the tastiest lechon I had tried by far here in Sg.👍👍👍I highly recommend!

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
Great atmosphere and options in menu.
The alcohol selections are good too.
Staffs are helpful and nice.
Missing 1 star is just because the portion of the food is a bit little for the price.
Good to come for a few drinks with 1-2 sides.

Very good and very authentic german & austrian cuisine!!
I can recommend the Schweinsbraten, Käsespätzle, Rösti and Sauerkraut. For Dessert the Apfelstrudel was amazing.
As an Austrian myself I can recommend this place in singapore to any expat who misses the taste of home or anyone who would like to try authentic german and austrian food.
I already came here twice, can't wait to go again :)

Everything from the start till the end was amazing. Found this place by chance on Chope, managed to booked a table for 4 on a Friday evening. Ambience and decoration is very nice. All of the staff were very friendly and attentive, service was good also. My friends and 1 loved all of the food and devoured everything. Would recommend 👌 👍 👏

Went here twice while in Singapore, drinks were great and so was service first time.
Went back second time due to enjoying the beer, ordered a pint and got the same great service, however ordered a second and got served a original instead of a wiessbier, asked for it changed and watched the server top up the wrong pint instead of replacing...this is absolutely unacceptable when paying so much for a pint in the first place

Had some really great German gastropub favourites here. The pretzels and cheese were fabulous, and the goulash was hearty and tasty. The special was also I is, and they make some really good drinks too!

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
Food and service were good! Looks like they have revamped the bistro and looking better. Went there for lunch with wifey as we wanted to grab some fresh meat at butchery. Ordered 2 soup to go along with our main. She ordered potato soup and onion soup for me. Before the soup arrived, we were served with their in house baguette and butter. It was so so good especially the butter. Main were served hot from kitchen, portions were good for the price and we left the bistro with our happy stomach. Wish they can offer ribeye in time to come. They were having Oktoberfest menu too. Do drop by! Will definitely return. Thank you

Had an outdoor seating which was sooo hot. They gave a time limit of 1 hour but was happy to let us hang around if there wasn’t too busy. Food wise was ok but nothing spectacular. Has a children’s playground at the side so lots of family groups were there. would recommend the onion soup and creme brûlée but sirloin was underwhelming. Great that it had lots of vegetables at the side.

Had fresh onion soup that warmed us up . Thereafter we shared the mains of short rib and pork cordon blue .

The short rib served tender w mixed flavour between savoury meat and sweet caramelised onion, and tinge of horseradish . And pork cordon blue toughen up texture in breaded form and broaden the palate w some greens .

Enjoy the meals as much as the shopping later .

This place have very good beer and western foods. I highly recommend as service are good and foods are excellent. Only downside are the outdoor seating only got small wall fans and the downlight are too strong and sharp make me felt warmer on a sunny day dinner. Last to mention that the portion are quite big.

Nice food!
Revisited, food n service are great 👍👍
Plants in the garden were healthy, nice to have plant labels.
Also playground for kids while waiting for seats.
Supermarket offers wide selection of meat, snacks, fresh vegetables etc!

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
Tried the braised pork cheek set (recommended by the chef), and it was delicious. If you like lean meat, this is it.

The sauce of the braised meat is darker than usual, and it's perfect with rice! It was served in a metal bowl. And the empty bowl says it all...

Arrived at 1140 at Golden Mile Food Centre and decided to try this stall. I was quite lucky I was the 2nd customer it seems and there was no queue and didn't even need to take a number. The moment I sat down and started eating and queues started forming and there were like at least 10 people waiting.
A little confused initially not sure what to order, wanted to order the pork cheek but was already sold out, not sure if it was really sold out or not prepared for the day.
Was confused about the set and ala carte. Didn't really knew how it works but was told if I were to order the set it would have the rice and pork and a piece of everything of the sides. The ala carte is the additional sides that you want to add on to the meal.
I had the pork shank set and was so surprised it was only 4.50! And the portion was quite generous that they gave quite a lot of rice which I couldn't finish. It was also a good tasting bowl to try the different sides. What I loved most about the dish was the thick gluey sauce which was so tasty.
All in all it was cheap and good and I seriously have no complaints except for a slight disappointment. I expected the Ajitsuke egg to have slightly runny yolk but this yolk was almost completely cooked.

I was a little hesitant to join the long line, but I'm glad I did. The store was only staffed by two people, but the line moved fast. I tried the braised pork belly bowl and it was great. The meat was tender and flavorful. With fungus, egg, and mushroom, it's a delicious combination.

I had the braised pork cheek bowl (S$8.50) which was really good. The meat was tender, the portion generous and the greens were fresh and crunchy.

Hidden gem serving Taiwanese style braised pork rice. Personal favorite being the braised pork cheek rice set with tender melt-in-your-mouth pork accompanied by soft boiled egg, braised toufu and vegetables. The sweet /sour not too spicy chili sauce balances the thick braise gravy accentuating the tender pork. Go early as the popular pork cheek set may sell out.

Hungarian dining options in Boon Lay.reviews:
Headed here for lunch, and we tried out a new stall this time.

Checkout the Golden Mile Curry Rice 👍 located at level 2. Taste really good, with the think and generous amount of gravy.

Ordered our favourite coffee as well to end our meal feeling satisfied.

Golden Mile Food Centre is one of the oldest hawker centre in Singapore that first opened in 1975 to house all the street hawkers from Jalan Sultan to improve sanitation and it is a 2 storey hawker centre with a 3rd storey selling army paraphernalia which is also known as the Army Market !!! This hawker centre is almost 50 years old in 2 years time and the ventilation in most of the older hawker centres is pretty bad as the ceilings are low, only those built in the last 10 years are much cooler with higher ceilings so that gigantic, power fans can be fixed to cool down the place in hot and humid Singapore. It is not a place to eat and chill but rather a place to eat and run immediately !!! 🤣🤣🤣 It is one of Singapore's most popular hawker centres in a gastronomically diverse food landscape in a melting pot of cultures and cuisines across the different dialects groups and internationally, offering a smorgasbord of food flavours. It was inscribed on UNESCO representative list of The Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity in 2020 that serves as a testament to Singapore's hawker culture. Singapore is as cosmopolitan as it can be like New York, the Big Apple 🍎 of Asia and the Switzerland of Asia in the financial arena !!! Singapore has to be the cosmopolitan metropolis that it is because of its small size, a red dot on the world map reference by the many and with no natural resources for its survival !!!

My first visit yesterday and I’m in love with the middle eastern food there especially the Turkish Food Stall. I ordered Chicken Kebab Roll ($6) and Chicken Kebab with Butter Rice ($8) and their homemade Baklava (8pcs for $20). My hubby ordered Biryani with Lamb Shank ($10) from Nasi Arab. My youngest girl ordered Fried Kway Teow with Chye Sim ($4.50) from stall #01-91.

We ordered some vadai and Nyonya kueh to share after lunch. We also ordered Iced Lemon Tea and Iced Milo.

Rating for food and drinks: 5/5

We will definitely return to eat other food like the fried Hokkien prawn noodles, Braised pork rice, boneless chicken rice, steamed pork dumplings, western food and Muslim food.

I am currently enjoying my 10th visit to Singapore and this place may be my favourite Hawker Centre.  I discovered it on my 3rd visit and have been coming here since.  I have a double lunch when I’m here; a $5 bowl of beef noodles and a $3.50 Hainanese Chicken Rice set - $3.50!!!  Plus I always grab myself 2 pineapple & orange juices, 1 when I arrive and 1 when I leave.  $15.50 for all of that.

Very popular local food center with a wide variety of Asian and Western cuisine. The queues can be long, but definitely worth it. The top level is a bunch of reasonably priced military surplus and sew shops. Try the Lor Mee at 02-86!
