Cambodian cuisine in Admiralty.reviews:
Rice was completely bland. Zero taste. Chicken cutlet are those off the shelf nothing special.

Would come again! Convenient for those who stay around the area. Clean restaurant with ample of seats.

We got the cereal fried rice and kway teow goreng (spicy). Price range is about $6.60 for the usual goreng dishes whereas anything abit special would be $1 extra. Honestly, a fair deal for a place with aircon and in a mall establishment. Generous portions

Would come and get more dishes next time!

I'm not for wet mee goreng and what I ordered came wet.  Unpeeled cooked prawns are a no no for an al carte restaurant. Not taking the extra effort.

Extreme disappointment with the quality of the food. Unsatisfied by the tasteless dishes and overly salty omelette that I received.

We ordered seven dishes from your restaurant, which came to a total cost of $96.12. However, upon receiving my food, I was immediately struck by how bland and unappetising everything looked. Each one was seriously lacking in flavour, and I found myself struggling to finish even a single serving.

To make matters worse, the omelette that I ordered was incredibly salty, to the point where it was almost inedible. The fried fritters turns out to be frozen fish and tempura with fried chicken instead calamari. The fried rice is dry, bland and has zero fragrance. The tanghoon is awfully bland as though there isn’t pinch of salt in it. Furthermore, we ordered this as a form of  Hari Raya celebration but the food turns out to be terrible.

As a paying customer, I expect a certain level of quality and care when it comes to the food that I receive. Unfortunately, this was not the case. I was deeply disappointed by the lack of attention to detail and the overall poor quality of the dishes I received.

I hope that you take this feedback seriously and work to improve the quality of your food and the overall dining experience that you offer.

Terrible. Came afew times and service is really bad. Came early all the time, but with sufficient staffs and no other customers at that timing, their food still take forever to serve because they do not check their orders, we had to remind them every single time. The food was not bad the first few times. However, it just got worst time over time. Today the chicken chop turn out to be  breast meat, really dry and tough to bite. They add alot of garlic butter in the mushroom soup and its very disgusting as there are so much oil in every scoop and when it turn cold the amount of oil harden at the top. Took afew pictures from today's meal at Yassin Kampung, to share in some review.

Cambodian cuisine in Admiralty.reviews:
You can go around and probably get a meal below $3.00!

Wide variety of food ranging from porridge to soup to roti prata! A place where you’ll be spoilt for choices. Do get ready for a huge crowd when you are there during lunch or dinner time, but it’s just how a hawker Center is after all.

Enjoy the food here!

There are plenty of food options in Admiralty kampung. When I went there today to purchase dim sum, the queue was extremely long and the staff were using mental calculations instead of a calculator. As a result, they ended up miscounting the money, resulting in me paying extra to the stall. The service was unsatisfactory.

The food wasn’t fully cooked too.

Love ❤️ the food variety and the vibrancy here!
Non stop traffic and the price of food here is 👍👍👍

Too bad I was in a rush to grab my coffee, else I m going to try all the food from here!

Many stalls having long queues, drinks stall especially!

Heard that the stallholders here have not been changed much since it’s opening. Guess the businesses here must be good and all hawkers here earning big bulk 💰💰💰!

After renovation, the hawker Center is now more spacious, windy and with more seats. Just next to Admiralty MRT.

Variety of foods and drinks. From Chinese, Malay, Indian, Thai and many more. There are Bakery , fruit stalls, fried banana, vegetarian and etc.

The yong tofu we ordered are made to order. Fried or soup. We ordered fried with mixed of Vegi and tofu.

Ordered the mala and green pepper grilled fish from 三义軒

Payment could be cashless too, convenient

Nearby here have wet and dry market and also Prime supermarket

WORST HAWKER CENTRE IN SINGAPORE! Auntie cleaner is crazy and rude!!!!! She pushed her cleaning cart into a narrow space between my son's chair and another chair. She didn't even politely asked if he could move his chair in. She just pushed her cart till it touched my son's chair and expected him to move his chair in! Which he did! But unfortunately her cart was too near his chair which in turn made her cups on her cart fall down. But the design of the chair was terrible! It can even be moved properly and the legs of the chair bents out! And why must she stack her cups so high! In the end the crazy auntie cleaner scolded him in Chinese she said: Can't you move your chair inner!!!!!! She was so rude and dared to scold him when she was the one at fault for pushing her cart so near my son's chair! Can't she just ask politely! She deserves to be fired! How can NTUC Foodfare, a government organisation be so lousy at hiring staff!!! Insane! NTUC CAN'T YOU DO YOUR JOB PROPERLY! Auntie, doesn't mean you're a senior you can treat others badly! Treat others with respect! Don't think you're the top of the world!

Cambodian cuisine in Admiralty.reviews:
Tried the fried kway teow. The smallest portion is $4. The food taste wise is quite good. There is some wok hey and a twinge of sweetness and savory. The portion is the smaller side.

This stall been there since the hawker centre started. At first the CTK still decent but standard drop not long and it become one of the worst CTK I ever eaten, give it a try recently but it still sucks.  Highly not recommend.

$3 fried kuay tiao portion so less. Few mouth and gone. Might as well sell $4 and remove $3. Requested no cockles but still put. Not buying here again. Not recommended.

Ordering is pretty fuss-free here and there are multiple options by paying through digital wallet. The receipt has your queue number and you wait for the number to be shown on their display. I had a mix of both white and black carrot cake ($4). I thought that their black carrot cake had a lot more taste and flavour of the wok. The white carrot cake on the other hand was average, and the only good thing about it was that it was crispy.

Get the yuan yang. The white one is eggy and the black one is sweet and savoury. Stand nearby if you da bao, the auntie will call out your number

Cambodian cuisine in Admiralty.reviews:
Accidentally found another branch here, the  Mee Sua is as good as the one at Bukit Panjang hawker that I missed it so much.
This is inside a new, clean and spacious food court. Not too crowd in the morning to have Mee sua as breakfast.

Hearty portion of mee sua at 5$
Light and clean soup so suitable for piping hot soup for breakfast or lunch
Soup flows in my blood so this bowl speaks to my soul

Mee Sua comes with pig liver but I slways change it to lean pork slices but its great taste is not altered. Its taste reminds me of Mee Sua in soup cooked for me by my mum, her mum or her sister as a comfort food when I had had measles or fever or they cooked it on weekends to take a break from the rice staple. To me, a taste that reminds me if my loved ones and their love each time i patronised the stall. Thumbs up!

Totally worth the price. $5 for soup mee sua and the soup is power much! Love the handmade meatballs and the lean meat is marinated too! I believe they added huadiaojiu to the soup and the fried ginger level up the soup.

Will be back to try more of their other noodles.

HERE: 3x

再来阿嫲面线. Chye Lye Ah Ma Mee sua, S$4. Wanted to eat the famous J99 ban mian in this coffeeshop after my swim. It is opposite Toa Payoh swimming complex. Unfortunately my favorite ban mian stall is not open on Sunday. Hence I tried this Chye Lye Ah Ma Mee Sua it is pretty good, especially when I feel hungry and cold after swimming. I think food tastes extra good after having a swim. 😋
,.
The ah ma meesua is yummy, they drizzle hua tiao wine into it, with fried ginger and chives this makes a hearty warm meal. 😋👍 I asked for extra fried ginger. The minced Pork ball is tastily marinated. The stew mushroom is also flavorful and quite soft. I will be back again for this yummy and healthy meesua. 👍
,.
Review posted on my IG: Yummymich

Cambodian cuisine in Admiralty.reviews:
First time here to coba (try) the food. Very delicious and generous amount. Price slightly on the high side but once you take a few mouth of the food, you forget about how much you paid.
The beef rendang is tender and I will recommend as first meat dish if this is your first visit.

Nicely located corner makan place so you get some good wind circulation... Essential when eating spicy food.  😂 Staff are friendly and chill.

Good Nasi Padang dishes and Nasi Ambeng set! 2 meat and 1 veg with 1 drink costs $13.50. Spicy and great taste, easy to eat and not too heavy. Friendly service.

Great muslim food. Great taste.👍 Custer services  is good👍. Like sambal alot. Plenty  of carpark lot nearby. Down side is abit warm during hot day if sit inside. Price wise seem reasonable to me.

I like the laid back ambience and good service but the food looks better than they taste…both chicken and esp beef rendang was dry and the latter made worst by serving without gravy.

The serving shown is $16, fair for the nice comfortable ambience plus good service. I’ll return if in the area but will try different dishes

Very delicious nasi padang. Every dish looks so appetizing but my stomach cannot fit all. Not cheap, this plate is about $9, but very good. Sambal chilli is too spicy for me.

The Korean stall's spicy cuttlefish hotplate was a generous portion, undeniably spicy, but lacked a stronger taste. Overall, still enjoyable.

Worst kim chi fried rice ever. Very few kimchi, used a lot of onion as substitute. Dry and bland, doesn't taste Korean at all. Soup is bland like water. Not recommended.

Friendly service & affortable price.

Cambodian cuisine in Admiralty.reviews:
Food was quite alright - I ordered the Nasi Lemak Set B and it tasted just fine, but coffee was a little lacklustre.

The staff was quite friendly but it's mostly the decor and atmosphere that hooked me up.

Nestled in a shophouse opposite SINDA, the view of the trees and street brings me back to my childhood in the 80s, something which vintage decor alone cannot provide.

I'd also appreciate the ample parking spaces available and quiet neighborhood. It wouldn't be the same if they weren't nestled here.

A charming nasi padang place in an equally charming neighborhood, complete with a handsome silkie chook freely roaming the premises. I chanced upon this place while exploring the area seeking breakfast and it felt like i was transported back to old kampung days.

A good thing about coming early is that the curries and padang dishes are all piping hot. The food was all right, not very spicy (might not appease hardcore sambal lovers) - was happy to find sayur manis lemak here.

What i loved best was the laid back vibe, and the friendly staff who served up the warm nosh with warm smiles. Refreshingly un-Singaporeanesque.

Servers are really friendly and food is amazing. Love the choice of 3 types of chilli sauces. Price is reasonable as well. Premise is well ventilated and clean.

The coffee shop, decor, location, car park and even a resident chicken makes this place a great idea.. but it's more than a great idea now that I've tried it (maybe I was hungry and enjoyed the food a tad more).

I think their dishes are not very spicy which is a nice change (from all the mala).. they were nicely executed, taste, texture and all. And by today's standard, $12.50 for this is not exorbitant (compared to some nasi padang at Geylang Serai).

Great place for Nasi Padang , easy to find parking. Came after lunch so I guess most of the items were sold out. Would definitely come again

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
Nested in a food court within an industrial estate. This humble corner store offers one of the best Appams in Singapore. We had the egg, plain, Ondeh-Ondeh and Kaya with a side dip of Ikan bilis sambal. Very nice!

They have other food too: thosai, bryani, etc. Worth a try if you are in the area!

Went there because of the good review. But I really don't know what's so special about this stall.
1. Dirty utensils, have to dig and find those slightly better ones.
2. Dirty dining area. Prolly school holiday, u have to tahan sitting on dusty seats. Wet tables due to rain.
3. Because the whole place is empty and this stall is the only one that's open. U could clearly hear what's going on in the kitchen. All I'm hearing is the microwave sound every other min.
4. I thought only if u take away, it would not be crispy. But I was wrong. Even if u eat there, it's the same.
5. Had the ondeh ondeh, the palm sugar tasted sour.
6. Worst of all, the price shown on the signboard is student rate. And when I told the lady that I'm a student. The reply that I get is. Sorry, key in already, cannot change. Win liao loh. $4.50 for a so-so appam only.

I ordered the nasi lemak appam and ondeh ondeh appam. To be honest, u should just go have the real nasi lemak instead.

My overall review. Not deserving a second visit.

Appam is quite ok. To be fair, we didn’t try the special ones. Just did the plain. The appam is lacking in flavour but the texture is good (nice springy taste). Price is on the high side ($2.50 for one plain).
The foodcourt is clean and airy.

Need to be patient once order, because each and every appam is made upon order (including those in food delivery order). But it’s worth the wait. Had the egg appam & plain appam. It’s so fluffy in the center and it’s amazingly well cook in the center. It’s not oily nor greasy. Next time can try other modern combinations.
Take note: They only have takeaway after 6:30pm to close 7:30pm.

Is really nice if you eat at the shop.  They should improvise their packaging. This is definitely a good packaging but is doesn't help to maintain the crispiness. Should try using paper container. That would help slightly.  Just like those waffle shop.

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
I order the $8.50 Seafood Soup, 3 big prawns with fish meat & lots of minced meat. Soup is yummy as it has the prawn sweetness, prawns consider fresh & fish meat is soft. You may need to wait quite awhile if it’s during lunch or dinner time.

This place has variety of food. Prices are reasonable $4-5. Tried the dry chilli pan mian and was good. Uncle would knead the dough and Aunty roll the dough on d spot to make individual bowl of ban mian. The dry ban mian cost $4 was good. The mkt  has soya bean stall selling refreshing soya bean. A bit stuffy if seated inside but the good food comprises the environment, charge for use of toilet. Toilet could be improved-wet floor.

Lots of good food but also lots of stalls closed by afternoon. I frequently go Kitchen carrot cake and Lai Hua Fishball noodles.

Sunday is a good day see the buzz of the lively food centre and stores.  It's a good place to buy fresh fruits among the stores and makeshift stalls selling durians. I bought $50 worth of fruits, excluding durains. Queues were long among several popular hawker stalls.  There's also the well known bah kuteh stall at the coffeeshop.

Some of the hawkers like to put their stuff on the table near their stall especially under the fans and chope place there. This makes it difficult for customers patronizing other stalls to find seats or to be sitted under cooler table as the place is deem stuffy especially in the day time.

Can still get $3 per plate of nice 😋 chicken rice at Yong Seng chicken & duck rice stall. Uncle (though he isn't the stall owner) despite having to pay rent, said that there's alot of elderlies in this area hence he was selling at $2 per plate of chicken rice. Price went up to $3 about just a year ago, probably due to high rental bah. Other places you may probably get $3.50 per plate or higher amount.

Coffee at Jing Loong 金龙 is great , so used to drinking their Kopi  O Gao which is $1 per glass, 👍 but have to be make by the boss ie atthe stall facing the shops.

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
Ordered the cheapest available item at $7.5. Small portion with chunky n but not much flavour minced pork. The 2 prawns are fine . Fish is also. The soup is simply prawny soup. Trying first time but dun think will be a repeat customer

Tried other seafood soup but i must say Yan Ji Seafood soup is the best.

Ordered the $9.50 seafood soup and it was filling enough for me. But if you’re a big eater you should definitely go for the $11.50 one.

Would come back to try the crayfish and red grouper the next time.

The quality and portion has dropped tremendously. Look at the portion size, especially the soup given for the $9.50 basic portion! Soup is also just salty now. Best to boycott such black shops who constantly raise prices, shrink portions and compromise on quality.

Confronted the stall owner about portion size and he mumbled some nonsense about his soup being about "taste" which is total nonsense! He reluctantly gave a few more spoonfuls of soup - never ever again.

A honest and personal review on this.

Ordered Clayfish Seafood Soup, $13.50, because of the price (I think), the portion is generous, it got clayfish, minced meats, dory fish, prawn and some sliced tomatoes.

Maybe because of the minced meats given, a huge portion, almost filled whole the bowl, there is not much of the “seafood” taste in the soup. The food tastes more than mixed pork soup, 猪杂汤. The sweetness came from the pork instead of seafood.

If you are looking for a food portion that worth for the price, this is the right place.

Paying $9.50 for a pathetic medium size if seafood soup, charging me additional 50 cents for a takesway bowl that pack almost nothing in that bowl! Feedback on the spot but worker say that more soup will ruin the taste, what a “splendid” excuse. Not patronising it ever again!

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
Tried their laksa and prawn noodles. Prawn noodles forgettable, soup was on the sweet side. Laksa acceptable but overrated. Ingredients for the large $5 version was miserable, 2 prawns, some fishcake slices, half hard boil egg, few pcs of taupok and hum. Lots of noodles given though. EAT laksa taste better in my opinion.

Stall is inside marsiling mall hawker at level 1. So far tried the lor mee and laska. Both are good and hearty. Ingredients are generous compared to current market now. Regular dinner staple. Certain weekdays are very crowded.

had laksa. like the taste. good price.

expect long queue at lunch hour n possibly run out of some choices early on busy days. so go early.

A better than average bowl of laksa , gravy was not boiling enough to bring out the aroma

Probably the best laksa in the whole of woodlands. Conveniently located at the sprawling hawker centre of Marsiling Mall, this stall is kind of hidden deep near the back entrance of the shopping mall and hawker centre. There will always be a queue at breakfast , lunch and dinner time so just be patient.

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
During our dinner gathering with three of us, we decided to try out this restaurant that offers a variety of cuisines, including North Indian, Muslim, Western, and Thai food. However, we were a bit disappointed when the service person provided us with a menu that seemed incomplete. Drinks like coconut and canned drinks were not listed on the menu, which left us wondering about the full range of beverage options available.

Despite the initial confusion with the menu, we were pleased to discover that the restaurant accepted both e-payment and cash payment methods, making it convenient for all of us to settle the bill.

As for the food, we ordered a selection of dishes from different cuisines. To our delight, the taste of the dishes was quite decent, and we found the overall spiciness level to be manageable, as it was not overly spicy. The variety of flavors from the different cuisines added an exciting twist to our dining experience, and we appreciated the diverse range of dishes available.

Overall, while the incomplete menu and missing drink options were a minor setback, the positive dining experience, delicious dishes, and the option for various cuisines made the dinner gathering enjoyable. We would consider visiting again in the future to explore more of the restaurant's offerings and perhaps inquire about their full drink menu.

Chance upon this eating house on the way back from JB. Amazing food! Nothing is not nice about this place! Opens till 2am, best place for indian muslim supper. Their mee goreng mamak is one of the best eaten so far, hard to get a place that serve mee goreng merah the correct way and taste. Beef soup was flavourful too and peppery, chicken rice is nice too. Will come again to try their kambing soup!

Quite amazed on their cooking speed too, the place was rather full yet all the food came within 15mins. Staff are also friendly, only downside is the parking.

Lots of varieties here, choices of food will make u drool 🤤, servers and waiters all are good and prompt, price wise is ok but not your regular typical coffee shop. Place is big and can cater combined tables to supply for a larger quantity of customers for dinner gatherings. Parking is also not a problem for not cars and bike, toilet and washing available too. 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼

Wow. Absolutely blown away by the hearty and delicious food. Not to mdntion the realllly affordable prices! Would definitely come here again because oh my god beats al amaan and other places by a MILE!

Butter chicken is ridiculously creamy and buttery for just $7! Thick chunks of chicken coated in gooey curry. SSo yummy! The garlic naan wasn't as garlicky as I liked but still a good complement!

We also got their palak paneer which is more... unconventional. Thick green spinach curry which is less creamy and has cottage cheese curds! Interesting taste, though I prefer their classic butter chicken.

Their roti prata is on the softer side, not crunchy you you won't get sick of chewing. It was soft and fluffy, a little floury. Tasty!

One of the best Mamak food in the North.

Tom Yam very tasty and spicy
Chz naan very soft
Beef Kwey Teow also very tasty.

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
Decent neighbourhood hawker centre. Supermarket, shops and a Burger King located on 2nd floor. Multi-story carpark for drivers out there.

Food wise my opinion is that Marsiling Mall is average. There are some stalls here that deserve a look at if you’re in the area but I wouldn’t go out of my way just to eat here.

The wanton mee stall always has a long queue. People mainly order the wanton mee or the lor mee but it also sells fried chicken noodles. Got the wanton mee at $4.50. The portion of noodles is not a lot , good amount of char siew (not fatty or chewy) and a small piece of fried wanton. It also comes with a bowl of soup with 2 small dumplings.
The coffee stall sells not too bad coffee and soft boiled eggs which are nicely cracked into a bowl for you. The Kaya toast could have been crispier (in comparison with Ya Kun).
Not easy to find a cool table on a Sunday morning. Quite a crowd here. There are quite a variety of foods here. The giant fans help to circulate the air in the hawker centre.

📍 𝐅𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐡 𝐒𝐮𝐠𝐚𝐫 𝐂𝐚𝐧𝐞 • 𝐂𝐨𝐟𝐟𝐞𝐞 • 𝐓𝐞𝐚 (𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐬𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐌𝐚𝐥𝐥 𝐇𝐚𝐰𝐤𝐞𝐫 𝐂𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐫𝐞, 𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐬𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠)

Starting our morning right with 𝙎𝙚𝙩 𝘼 ($3.50) that came with 4 kaya toast pieces, 2 eggs and a kopi ‘o’, and 𝙎𝙚𝙩 𝘽 ($2.70) which was similar but without the drink ☀️

Kaya butter toast: Very crispy thin! Just the right thickness of butter, kaya leaned on the less sweet spectrum but could be more fragrant. I liked how they used the traditional brown bread though number of butter slices was inconsistent.

Eggs: Yolks were soft and creamy 🍳

Overall, my dad preferred this to Ya Kun due to its affordability and decent quality!! There’s always a queue at this stall despite a few other stalls selling kaya toasts in the same hawker centre, and I can now see why after trying 😋

Follow @iloafbready Instagram for more food reviews! :)

Good variety of food choices, I like the 'Bukit Panjang Dessert's ching teng and bobochacha.

Good Lao huo tang as well.

Some of the hawkers like to put their stuff on the table near their stall especially under the fans and chope place there. This makes it difficult for customers patronizing other stalls to find seats or to be sitted under cooler table as the place is deem stuffy especially in the day time.

The pig organ soup, pig liver, pig stomach soup are fresh and taste sourish nice 😋 at Fu Qiang pig organ soup stall. Coffee O is strong enough at Yinle hot & cold beverages. The hot & cold desserts 😋 at the stall operate by an old uncle & auntie near to the escalator nearer to woodlands stadium.

Attach photo shows the hawker stall owner's stuff on the table under 2 wall fans ):  Seemingly people think that someone has choped the seat, but it's the stall owner 's stuff when we inquired about it being there for more than an hour. We went to Sheng Siong supermarket after our meal and back in about an hour's time yet the stuff are still there ): this no good especially that these are the 2 walls fans in that row of stalls and there's no other cooler place for customers to sit and have their meals.

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
Perhaps the only place in the north to get your dose of authentic satay! 👍🏼😋

This place has the best chappatti I ever eaten. They originated from old woodlands interchange which has been demolished. Looked for them for years and found him at Marsiling Mall. You should try this chappatti and kheema before you die. I never give 5 star rating unless as nobody's perfect. The chappatti bread is also soft and has the powdery floor which makes its taste unique. Not oily and healthy. Kheema is quite oily but you don't eat it everyday!! Lol.

Visited this place multiple times. One of the best chapati and kheema in the north! Don’t need to travel down to CENTRAL just to have Azmi (Norris Rd) cause this place have awesome chapati as well.

Tried more than 7 and this is by far the best mutton briyani in woodlands.
Rice is well cooked and fragrant, mutton so falls off the bone tender, curry just the right consistency and spiciness.

Bhai's rice has singular grains that is both fragrant and well spiced. The keema w/ chapati is second only to Norris road's. Full piece of chicken thigh and drumstick for a flat fee. This guy is the Briyani king 👑 of woodlands.

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
Cuttlefish and century egg rojak ($8.50) - Average. The flavour of the sauce could have been stronger and thicker. The portion was small. Even the cucumbers. The cuttlefish was not bad. The century egg was fine.

Decided to check out the hawker centre at Marsiling mall as I was in the area and chanced upon this absolute gem of a stall.

The owner was friendly and extremely professional, and even though it was peak hour, the food came quite quickly.

I really enjoyed the satay, with its smokey aroma and succulent meat which was delicious especially when paired with the peanut sauce. Definitely recommend the the crispy taupok and rojak as well.

I learnt that they are a third generation hawker in Singapore from the owner too! Definitely check them out - and support local hawker talents while enjoying a great satay experience in the north.

Observed the satay meat shrished this time as we ordered regularly when we are there. Fruit rojak are fresh and portion small.

Our all time favourite satay and rojak in the whole of singapore, consistent and always a pleasure ordering for our lunch. ❤️ ❤️ ❤️ love the friendly and efficient service especially Godon and godon wife are truly a charm.

Went there recently and tried their cuttlefish rojak + their satay! The staff there were friendly. Even though we went during dinner, they gave us a beeper so we didn’t need to stand and wait at the store. (Especially thankful for that so I didn’t need to stand around and wait or keep checking whether the food is ready)

The food was really good and my favourite was the cuttlefish rojak!

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
Hidden gem here in Woodlands. Great tasting middle eastern food at less than half the price of those restaurants at Arab street. Everything was flavourful, juicy, and with just the right texture. We had the Lamb Mandi, Chicken Quesadillas, and Kunafe - all were amazing. Portion sizes were HUGE too. Highly recommended.

This is an amazing kebab place. Everything is delicious and real deal. They just opened Arabica Grill just behind this outlet and it's equally amazing. If you are in mood of good Arabic food, no better place in Woodlands than this.

Ordered via grab food and its so goood. My lamb mandi was still warm when it arrived.  The lamb shank was super tender and juicyyyy!!! First time to try knafeh and its was so yummy too, crispy outside but soft cheese inside 💯 Will try the quesadillas next time as I’ve been reading a lot of positive reviews on it. 🤤

Ordered the Kofta Mutton. Very juicy and tender. Even better than well know restaurants. They might be located in a coffee shop but the food is great.

Ate the mixed kebab and i must say that it is the best kebab i have ever eaten in my life. Had this quite a while back (~3 months ago), and i think about eating this every now and then! The meats are so juicy and tender, moisture is locked into the meats unlike some other kebabs sold by other stalls that have dry, stringy meat. Seasoning is so good as well. Will definitely come back here again to try their other dishes

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
One of the best Mee Kuah & Mee goreng served over here😋. Their yummy portion on plateful be sure to delight your appetite. Next door teh Tarik stall able to complete your great beverage to go along. Simply best ever comfort food served it here. They also have Indian rojak for you to choose from.

Portion of nasi goreng ikan bilis was big and it tastes spicy and delicious. Ordered roti prata as well. Overall was worth it and will order from here again.

The fried rice is full filled with wok hee and taste so good. Every weekend noon, the stall is full of food panda guys and let you wait ur dishes more than 20-30mins. Whole stall dishes are very nice but sinful. So weird no comment in google map review so far. So surprised I am the first to write the first review and picture.

Service's good, food prep is fast, and importantly the Nasi Goreng Ikan Bilis is fantastic, one of the best I tried so far 👍🏼👍🏼

You sure this is five star. Most of its food aren't really fantastic. Not gonna lie. Western food there is just okay.

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
Trying them for first time at Fernvale Hawker Centre (somehow I ser reviews for other outlets too?). Roast pork’s got the coveted crispy brittle skin (wish there was more!) but char siew is just average. Food wise 3/5. Extra star for friendly service.

Visited this popular roast meat joint in the west, they are in a hawker centre inside Marsiling mall. They occupied 2 stalls inside the hawker centre. Each stall is selling rice and noodles respectively, therefore need to join the correct queue. If you are facing the stall, the left stall is for noodle.

Noodle starts from SGD$3.50 onwards. Other than the wanton noodle, they also serve chicken feet, braised mushroom noodles. First impression, portion was quite small. Noodle was nicely cooked, but the sauce tasted a little too salty for my liking. The star of the dish must be their charsiew, which was really good in my opinion.

Do expect some waiting as the queue was pretty long when I was there.

Highly recommended Hong Kong styled roast meat. They have the usual char siew, roast pork, roast duck. You can either order it with noodles or nice. Note that there is two different queues for noodles and rice. I would recommend to order the wonton noodles ($3.50) and you can add additional types of meat to it. The char siew is a juicy and has a nice BBQ smokiness mixwd with sweetness  to it. Note have a fixed days of the week for closing.

Maybe that day my luck is down. Got only little portion of Char Siew. Well they only have White rice and No oil rice. Taste is AVERAGE.

Update 2021 January
Stars increase to 4 Stars :-)
Well i order 1 Char Siew Noodle and by the time i reach home it was still delicious...

The crispy pork is very good. Every time I came must order. The char siew is ok for me. A little bit too sweet for me. Still quite ok. Duck drum stick is also delicious. However my preference is still crispy pork in fu shi. This plate duck and 2 kind of pork should be 14 SGD around. The other 2 pictures for crispy pork , each plate is 10SGD

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
One bowl of prawn mee from this store cost just $3.50 for 4 prawns, countless fish cake and meat with noodles and supreme soup covered with fried oil onions. It’s no wonder that we queue for close to half an hour for it’s wonderful prawn noodles!

Was recommended to try this prawn noodles stall.
Noodles are well cooked. Soup definitely tasty and aromatic. Generous amount of ingredients at a reasonable price. They give pork belly meat instead of the usual lean meat. They also provide red chilli powder and pork lard too.
Be prepared to queue for it. I waited at least 20 plus minutes. Try go early, heard they can sold out in 3hrs.
Highly recommended.

The stall opens at 7:30am., but the line begins earlier and always sold out around 10:30am. Don't expect the same flavor as Malaysia's Penang Prawn Noodle, but it's still tasty. The small packet costs S$3.50, while the large one costs S$4.00.

10 years ago this stall offers dried prawn noodle version. Can’t describe to you how delicious the dried version was. The scallion oil and the abalone sauce such great combination and freshness of the prawn. The soup version is good but definitely can’t beat the dried version. The stall doesn’t offer the dried version anymore which is such a shame. The taste is just going to disappear like that. Maybe abalone sauce cost is too pricey to make a profit? The quene is still long for the die hard followers who loves the soup version. The soup I bet has a lot of MSG because it taste good and sweet too. They do use pork in their soup base. The noodle usually sell out fast on weekends and usually by noon they will close up. The other amazing thing about this stall is they will place a box of tissue and I notice customers who don’t have the habit of bringing their tissue or handky will usually help themselves to it after their meal. Marsiling court is located near the elderly estate and more elderly people frequent there. There is a multi carpark which is only 5 mins walk to the hawker center and wet market the other open carpark is usually full most of the time.

Wonder why there's a long queue.  Wait 30mins for a MSG soup prawn noodles. The prawns served are not fresh at all. Anyone keen on MSG this is the place to be.

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
Mee robus very nice.

Few places in singapore which does laksa siglap. Bedegil is worth a try too.

Rice a lot but dishes like vegs & asam pedas gravy to little, not enough, end up eat plain rice.

Sitting in front of the store for 30mins, notice that both madams serve without masks on.

Great Malay food!

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
It is a 10 to 15 minutes walk away from the MRT (both Marsiling and Woodlands). Decent variety of food. Many of the stalls that were from the Woodlands Checkpoint area moved here after that place closed down. Tried the Yan Ji Seafood Stall seafood soup and the sesame chicken + yam rice from the bak kut teh stall beside.

Seafood soup was decent but had higher expectations because of the hype. It's also available on grabfood. The sesame chicken was so-so and the yam rice was unfortunately not as fragrant as I hoped it would be. Also had the bubble milk tea from Long Hua Cafe (first row of stalls, nearer to the mrt tracks). The white pearl was good.

Overall, good experience. Nice place to try local food. While the place was hot, there were many huge fans around and the heat was bearable even on a hot day.

PS: Return your tray for a 50 cents refund. Remember not to mix halal and non-halal food and take out the glass/porcelain items from your tray before you drop it off at the tray return stations situated around the hawker centre.

it has good food served here! recommended chee cheong fun! cheng tng! lei cha! and the seafood soup!

Hawker shifted from old Woodlands Interchange.1st day of business 15/12/17. Soup is nice. Waiting for my favourite herbal soup stall (front row), which I came all e way from South, to start business in a week's time.

It is also known as Marsiling Mall Hawker Centre. Unexpectedly crowded during lunch & dinner hours. With patrons of all walks of lives, may it be working personnel, families or students, who flock there for their favourite ethnic dishes. Pretty good variety of food of affordable prices. Also a breezy, cool & relaxing environment to dine. Even just having a cup of afternoon tea with friends can make you feel great!

Newly opened food centre. Huge with high ceiling.  Plenty of delicious food options here.  Must try!

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
20/8/23
Amazing food experience here! Came here to celebrate my girlfriend birthday and the staff here was so accommodating and nice! Really appreciate the staff! The food was really amazing too —> by authentic Thai chef! Thank you once again! Will be back again :)

Came back after 2 years and still very satisfied with their food and services. Their menu is wide and have many choices like pasta, western and waffles and also have some Thai food like Thai green curry, basil rice and basil pasta and still many others. Food is served fast and portion is big. Overall worth the visit

Citrus by the Pool made my girlfriend's birthday celebration truly unforgettable! The staff was friendly and attentive, creating a warm and cozy ambiance. The food was delicious, bursting with flavors that delighted our taste buds. Their drinks were also fantastic! The exceptional service ensured we had a fantastic night. A big thank you to Citrus by the Pool for a wonderful experience! We'll definitely be returning for more special occasions! 🎉🍽️🍹

Came here for a birthday dinner! The interior is very pretty and aesthetic. Good music, not so loud. Food was good and portions were good too. Requested to them to write the Happy Birthday on the cake and they also played birthday song as requested hehe. Good experience in overall!

Enjoyed the atmosphere, 2nd time here! 🙂 Staff was very attentive and provided excellent service throughout our meal. The Passionfruit sparking americano was a much needed refresher after a long morning. Come here for the chicken and waffles too! The food we had were all really good as well :)

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
Order $9.50 beef, tendon and tripe which is stomach of cow with thick bee hoon.

Pros
Beef was thick but brittle. Is a tough cut but it was cooked to the extent that they just break apart. Reasonably flavorful.

Tendon is gluey, soaking up the gravity gives it it's taste.

Sauce. Optional sauce both are great but not needed imo. Chili is definitely spicy.

Soup. Sweet gaming and I think full of msg. Is nice lah but makes u thirsty.

Meh
Tripe. While expected to be chewy, the cut is too thick causing it to be rubbery. Taste is still go but could have been better if slice is slimmer.

Order beef ball and beef soup, the beefball and the beef taste good but the soup taste was bellow expectation. Overall it’s an ok experience.

I ordered the beef, tendon with thick bee hoon soup. The noodles was smooth, beef very tender and the soup was delicious, not too saltish. See my photo, you will know what I mean.

Mala beef noodle 5 stars for u!Nvr scrimp on ingredients and super flavourful.Recommended

Had both the soup and dried version of beef noodles.The beef and tendon is on the tough and chewy side.The chilli sauce is just like chicken rice I prefer the other sauce that is sour and spicy.The beef soup is rich but dk why taste abit like kambing

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
We waited our order for about 20 mins even though 2 tables only to serve and we didn’t get stainless steel fork . I used stainless steel spoon and plastic fork to have my pasta (can see below photo). When I requested to get fork she said still washing and need to take time. I am very disappointing at the customer service.

Quite disappointed with the food this round at causeway point. I'm a person with strong taste buds hence I find the garlic bread was too salty to my liking. And the pasta seems to be overcooked with wok hei taste. Please review the food and I hope u can improve the quality of the food.

This is halal restaurant. Not recommended to a heavy taste person. The price is cheap compared to nearby restaurants.

Tableware is very dirty. Verrrrrrry dirty. Verrrrrrrrrrry dirty. Important thing need to say three times. Need to improve your tableware.

Cheddar cheese sticks and Mushrooms soup so so only.

You can try Cheesy crumble chicken bacon spaghetti. It's very Cheesy.

Spicy chicken spaghetti tastes like water spaghetti. I do not recommend you order this.

No service charge because almost all is self-service. The price is below average compared to others. Paid after you order from the website.

We’re a frequent diner here with my husband, always feel disappointed with the service if not the service it’s the food quality, today early  afternoon we ordered the bacon cheesy crumble the crumble was very chao ta it tasted burn and dark color the sauce was very little it alrdy requested to add more sauce but upon serving still the same very dry, the bacon was not really crisp cook, I ordered a calzone pizza but when the staff served is the same like normal pizza not calzone and the crust is burn also the taste was very bland

Are you kidding me on the portion?
Was ordered this on GRAB, left is the regular size and the right is the upsize. I am a regular customer for about 5 years and so I know that this is not the right portion it should be.

Years ago the regular size was the upsize now, and the upsize can even filled up the container. This is not the first time that the portion is being lesser, but it’s still acceptable. This time round, it’s really so less until clearly not enough for my stomach…

I paid more than years ago, and got lesser. What a disappointment.

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
Fantastically and fanatical food here! Where else do you get a mega bowl of noodles dish at only $4.5! Try Chin Heng Noodle House, Yap Kee Hainanese Chicken Rice and Lai Xing Prawn Mee! The good old golden hawkers only selling so much for just a small price! And you get the mega sugarcane 700ml not including ice for just $2.20 at Lim Chun Heng Hot & Cold Drink!

Inside market very narrow.. making walking difficult with things in hand. Fish reasonable priced. Mutton very expensive. Limited halal meat stalls. Beef reasonable. many vegetables stalls so can pick variety of veggies. Cautious, wear non slippery foot wear. Floor very slippery and wet, especially around fish stalls

Not as crowded as before. Typically HDB heartland environment. Nice food though. Can buy almost any ingredients for cooking back at home.
No need to wear masks now. But most people still wearing. This is probably the most comprehensive wet market in the north of Singapore. You have to wake up early and go there to get fresh foods before they got sold out by the never ending morning crowds.

No change so far.

My go to place every week for buying chicken, fish, shrimps and fruits as they come at quite a good rate compared to other markets like Sheng Siong. It also has all sorts of veggies and fruit stalls alongside the whole market place for your all needs.
It also has various stalls serving cooked food items, but have not tried any yet as the place is usually crowded.

Wet Market wonders! Go native and break out the slippers or rain boots. Nothing like a bargain hunt in this place. And when you get hungry, load up on some local delights.

Sri Lankan food in Marsiling.reviews:
Cleaner when collect  utensils from return rack and throw into collection trolley innot gently put it in, she just throw very hard and last for at least few minutes into the collection trolley and we just sit beside her. I don't know today she is no mood or is her work altitude?

I tried this Lele chicken wing fried rice and the fried rice is my ideal type. The chicken wing flour taste quite good and the chicken bigger than i expected and probably if they maintain this standard i will be back often. The only thing might expect waiting time as they deliver fresh one.

Wonderful place. Went to the new Superpets store on 2nd floor for some pet food. Visited shengsiong supermarket to get some groceries. The prices of many essential items have gone up. For example the price of two broccoli used to be $1.88, but now is going for $2.68. Similarly, the price of a pack of nuts containing a mix of cashew nuts and almonds nuts is now going for $5.45 when it used to be only $4.50. Inflation is real. As crowded as ever.

😊😋😄 Many choice of old traditional food stalls. The hawker stalls surrounding breezy and well ventilated.  The Super Big Fan make the place less hot and warms. Especially noon time, you enjoy the food more comfortable .😉😊🤩

Great selection of food and quality of food is generally consistent. However it is on the pricier side with a full meal at least $4.50 or $5. Hopefully can implement budget meal like I have seen in Tampines Hub Hawker

Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.reviews:
One of the best place to enjoy with friends and good food. Service is very fast, staff and owner is very friendly. Always first choice to go for drinks with friends and Best part is Momos. In singapore no other restaurent serve this tasty momos.

The food was hearty and delicious, service was very good as well!
Ordered masala tea, mango lassi, mutton briyani, steamed veg momo, fried chilli chicken momo, butter chicken, fish korma, gurkhali mutton (spelling might be wrong), garlic naan, cheese naan. Very filling for 4 pax. Every dish was good. Special mention to the fish korma and chilli momo.

Lovely little place in Little India away from the bustling street. The food is good especially love their grill lamb special. I would skip the butter chicken as it’s a little on the sweet side. The dumplings are good although it do taste like Chinese dumplings. The lamb biryani is so flavourful! Will definitely come back

It was lunch time and today we decided to check out Gurkha Palace.
Ordered Lassi, Chili momo,  Naan, Chicken tikka masala ,  mutton and chicken Biriyani.
Good Service, Ambience is great.
Staff is helpful, attentive and kind to offer suggestions.
Food was served in reasonable time. First came the Mango Lassi. taste and flavour was a bit different. Not the flavour and smoothness as I would expect.
Chili Momo came the next and it was just super delicious. Well cooked, rich in flavour and slightly spicy. The texture was perfect. We loved this dish the most.
Next the Naan and Chicken Tikka masala, Naan was thin and soft. It had good flavour. Chicken Tikka masala gravy was nice but a bit salty.
Lastly, the much awaited Biryani..  the rice had a good flavour but rice in  both mutton and chicken Biriyani tasted the same. The meat was well cooked but lacked the freshness. Seemed like the meat was cooked separate and added to Biryani Rice. Overall It's a different taste. Something different from the  usual Indian style Biryani.
Portions were generous. Overall  it was not bad experience.

Food was very good!
I am surprised!

It is not pricey, very well cooked and clean.

Toilets should improve in cleaning but the people from the restaurant were very kind.

I recommend to try out

Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.reviews:
Ordered Nasi sambal goreng and mee soto via grabfood apps order number gf-633.. When arrived, discovered they missed out to give the mee soto gravy. End up i throw away my mee soto as how the hell i gonna eat my mee soto w/o the gravy. Really messed up this guyss at harum manis…

Ordered via foodpanda. 4.6 rating on the app, but reality is as per google review. 2 stars or less.
Nasi lemak was almost like porridge texture, so soft, no taste of nasi lemak.
Sambal goreng is just like fried tahu with long beans, no tempe in sight. Its rendang, no meat. Food used to be nice. Not sure what's going on.

Always bought this from Harummanis. Food was delivered super fast and their Mee soto is nice and good.

MeeSoto: Soup was good with also generous about of shredded chicken. It was light and nice!

Lontong: Lontong was good as well!

Nasi Lemak Chicken Wing: it was good! The chicken is slight marinated if I’m not wrong

Will definitely purchase again!

I bought lontong in my order from foodpanda and other food too but funny part, no lontong gravy... Expect me to cook my own lontong gravy is it? Expensive nevermind, charge more for extras or separate chilli nevermind, then forgot my gravy.. Then for what i pay so expensive if my order incomplete? All foodpanda can do is to refund. Im not blaming foodpanda or the rider, they only take order and deliver.. The one to blame is the one preparing... And this is not first time simple mistake happen... Omg.. People want to eat good food also become no appetite to eat..

The foods gravies are diluted..its either too sweet or no taste at all..the lontong rice are hard..not to the standard (tasteless)as i expected ..

Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.reviews:
No queue and place was relatively empty when visited on 26 October 2023, Thursday morning. Ordered via the counter, payment was by cash as debit/credit cards aren't accepted (other cashless payment methods are accepted though). Order came quickly after. Pratas were served piping hot and crispy. Sauce trays for the prata gravy could be a bit cleaner though. Overall a pleasant experience.

Finally back here after a long while for a feast! 🍽️ Used to order their crispy masala thosai & red bean prata regularly when I was still in school~

🍳 ThosaiMiyaki (*for meat-eaters only; $7.90)

Launched on 5 Aug, this creation continues Springleaf’s tradition of launching one super innovative new dish every year — as part of their Ultimate Series💡

Inspired by the Japanese okonomiyaki, this crispy thosai base was topped with shredded cabbage, sliced turkey ham & bonito flakes. The omni dad & mom enjoyed this!

🍋 Yuzu Gula Soda

Top up $2 to get this as a set with the ThosaiMiyaki. A nice balance of sweet, tangy & fizzy — feels like multiple worlds colliding into one 💥

🪄 Magic Meatless Murtabak ($7.90)

Includes a medley of lentils, mushrooms, curry leaves, vegan mayo and mildly spicy korean sauce. Didn’t really taste the curry leaves but appreciated the protein-rich pulses, juicy and umami mushrooms and creamy sauces! 😋

🍔 Vegan Impossible Murtaburger ($11.20)

Very hearty burger-like creation, with two thick & chewy pieces of prata sandwiching lots of stretchy vegan cheese, impossible burger patties & sauce 🧀🫕

🥞 Hi-Fibre Plain Prata ($1.70)

Interestingly doesn’t taste like it’s high-fibre. Seems like margarine or something was added to make it look really chewy and yellow.

❤️ Red Bean Prata ($4.40)

This brings back memories of post-hike / after-school days 💭 Very sweet & super super crispy, just like what I remembered! ✨

We enjoyed the foods at Springleaf Prata Place. The Prata sugar is crispy, my girl loves it. I like the masala chicken and nasi biryani. The staff there is very friendly too.

We found a cockroach in our food!

We raised the complaint to the service crew and they offered to give us a replacement. But we're already grossed out about this as we are unable to eat anything here. The service crew suggested that it might have fallen from the ceiling. But it is dead already and one of its legs is chopped off as well. I cannot imagine it being from the ceiling as the leg would fall far away or it would be alive and walk off normally.

I don't think I can eat outside for a while now

One of their smallest outlet with limited seats.
So there’s a rule that you have to order first and they will assign table for you at the counter. However some idiots will just chop seat and then q to order. Previously they do have a sign saying the above rule. But now they took it down. Thus there’s this constant confusion. I am happy for this rule but I hope that the staff can be consistent to tell the people off.

Today they are kind of lack of staff as the plates were short and the orders took longer than usual.

maggie goreng which is overly salty.

My fav here is mozzarella cheese prata. 10/10
Plain Prata is crunchy and nice.

Milo dinasaur is in a small cup which I think they do not have enough cup. Kind of sad when it cost more than other drinks.

Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.reviews:
Had dinner at the restaurant a couple weeks ago.  Ordered Roganjosh, chicken biryani, chicken tikka masala and garlic naan.

The taste of all the dishes was truly authentic and flavourful with all the aroma from the spices, but not overwhelming.  Love that the gravy was thick and the portions of chicken and lamb is also pretty good.  My favourite was the garlic naan, crispy and garlicky, it really went well with all that gravy.

The servers were polite,  helpful and prompt. The restaurant itself was also nice and cosy. Thoroughly enjoyed the dinner.  Only thing is that there is very limited (parallel) parking along the road. There is a small public carpark nearby, a short walk from the restaurant but it is pretty difficult to get a parking lot too during dinner hours. Parking aside, the food and ambience is really good, give it a try if in the vicinity.

The garlic naan was great. The paneer butter masala could be less sweet and have more Indian spices. The noodles could be cooked in a bigger fire. The mutton set was very nice.

The portion is reasonable for sharing. I enjoyed the Basmati rice which is perfectly steamed to bring out the nice fragrance and texture. The sauces are great to go with the rice and naan.

My friend takes me here to taste Nepalese foods. Wow ! It’s super delicious and very tasty. Tea is the best ever I have tried in Singapore . Pretty similar to Burmese Tea . Will go back again definitely.

Will nvr be coming this restaurant again. Had to remind them to provide the mint chutney which is typically served with the papad, $14.50 for chicken thali and you will only get 3 tiny pieces of meat which wasn't worth it. Bad incident of one waitress serving the thali in an abrupt way, can't even place the plate straight it was served slammed on the table slanted sideways. Gave feedback to the male manager, he asked me if I am from the industry also which I assumed he meant if I'm a waitress too? I think its rude to ask customers that type of question. Very unpleasant experience overall.
Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.name: Himalaya Kitchen, Macpherson
Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.query: Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang

Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.reviews:
Had Fried Momos (Chicken) - very affordable and DELISH. The owner was interesting and kind. Will definitely visit again!

We ordered the gobi manchurian (cauliflower), fried momo, joul momo and a roti paratha. The food was all superb! The momos were really savoury! There was only one staff there so we had to wait a while for the food, but it's worth it 🙂 Food was affordable - each main dish is about $10 inclusive of GST. Portions were generally substantial.

The ambience at the second floor was pretty nice with the flag decorations and music, but the restaurant and the mall itself is pretty rundown haha. The restaurant staircase has damaged tiles so need to be careful while using it. Staff was really friendly and helpful in explaining the menu 😊 Overall a pleasant experience and we will definitely come back again!

Bad experience with food. Veg Momos were served cold and had zero filling!

Worst service ever
May be good for locals
But literally waited 2 hrs for takeaway food nd one Nepalese guy he ruins the malingo as not good for genuine people

Best Nepali bistro and bar in singapore✌️
Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.name: Malingo
Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.query: Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang

Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.reviews:
I don't think reviews matter that much. This place has lots of bad ones but it was packed during my Sunday evening visit.

Anyway, here's mine.
Staff were friendly enough. Prices MUCH better than the two places nearby that are popular with expats. Especially for beer. And the Sunday specials are hard to beat for price. $9+for Thali. And the portion was very hefty. I think this place is popular for prices more than food.

My mutton tasted very familiarly western Chinese. I've lived in China for the past 4 years and there was definitely a Chinese spice going on. It wasn't bad at all. Just didn't taste northern Indian to me.

One of the thali side dishes was black beans and they were hardish like briefly boiled peanuts. Maybe that's the way they should be?

Visited this place randomly for dinner and drinks. Happened to see as Nepal Cuisine, so wanted to give a try. Beer offers are good, food prices are fine, however, the taste of the food is below average. Staff is very friendly and courteous, Manager Jessie is taking care of the place very well. Food lags taste in terms of spice, chili and freshness.

Food was delicious! The meat platter was a great choice, allowing us to try all the different flavors in one platter, though the green meat looked a little too "radioactive"! 😂 The ambience was just so-so.

When we first entered, the waiter attended to us mentioned that waiting time for the food is about 30 minutes to 45 minutes.

The food came within 15 minutes, and is really delicious. They provided papadum and room temperature water. The service is alright and the food is amazing. Per person, average damage about $25+.

I enjoyed their naan and one of the chicken dishes. Tasty, will return!

Absolutely wonderful Northern Indian and Nepal cuisine. Having spent many months in Northern India, I can say that this food is about as authentic as it gets. Service was great! The atmosphere is very generic. But the food is wonderful. I will be going back

Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.reviews:
Order their national day 2 crab for $58. The gong is big. And some other dish. Very good. Still have free fish skin snack.
HAPPY NATIONAL DAY!!!!

Halal Chinese zichar at good prices, decent for a neighbourhood seafood stall. Portion they give is also quite big. Relatively fast service. There’s a few seats available at the coffeeshop for you to dine in. Friendly and helpful service by the female cashier. Meal for two cost $20++ with two mains and 1 side.

Nice food, reasonable price,I love the oyster omelette very nice ,friendly staff .However sambal stingray gravy to little ,thank you.

My wife dapao a fried rice for me late at night. When I looked at the price I was a little stunned as it was rather expensive for fried rice, but I requested my wife to order it anyway as there's not much makan option left at that time. Certainly the right decision, the portion was very big and tasted great, certainly justifying the higher price tag. Highly recommended.

Thai Style Chicken and Kangkung are OK but the San Lou Bee Hoon and Hotplate Tofu that I ordered are just disappointing. The taste of San Lou Bee Hoon was million miles away from JB standard and the Hotplate was not even sizzling when served.Overrated.

Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.reviews:
Ordered the mid size claypot rice, small claypot pig organ soap & large portion vegetables.

1) claypot rice is filled with reasonable portion of chicken, lup cheong & salted fish. The claypot rice fragrant is released after mixing well with black sauce and oil. Portion wise not enough for 3 pax hence we have to order another small claypot rice.

2) Pig organ soup ingredients portion not enough to justify the price of $7. The soup is not well cooked with the pig organ, resulting very artificial taste. Recommended to order the fish soup in the same coffee shop instead.

3) vegetables overcooked.

4) friendly onsite staff who helped us to look for a empty table outside coffee shop dining area

5) able to accept CDC vouchers for payment

The taste of this Bak Kut Teh is far from some of the mediocre ones I've ever tasted. I won't try again.

serves hokkien/ klang style bak kut teh, which is dark and herbally. pork ribs were tender. soup was flavourful. with options to add enoki mushrooms and meatball.

had the claypot chicken rice. loaded with lupchong/ wax sausages, salted fish and chicken.

chilli is good. provides a nice umami kick, but not spicy.

staff is very friendly and welcoming.

very pleased. will return.

Not recommending to visit this place any more. Seems to have a change in owner after the renovation. Firstly the portion of bkt has dropped to pathetic level and price has went up. Secondly, the soup is very bland and taste more like soya sauce/salty water, no longer taste as the previously proclaimed herbal soup bkt. Thirdly the service is also very bad, with the server just rushing for you to make order. Lastly the cutlery were also quite dirty. Sad to see this place has dropped its standard.

Always the best Bak Kut Teh (Herbal) option in Choa Chu Kang! Recently the coffee shop got renovated so ambience is slightly better than last time!

Really thick and herbally soup, that is very flavourful. Standard has not dropped since my days in PJC (2013-2014). Food still as tasty!

Options to add enoki mushroom or meat balls available as well. For people who only eat pork ribs for their bak kut teh, do let the stall owners know. For organ lovers, their intestines are cleaned relatively qell and liver is nice as well!

Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.reviews:
Good indian food, quick service and great hospitality by the staff. We had dal tadka, paneer kadhai, roti and rice, the food was tasty, good quality and portion size. Paneer unexpectedly was quite soft and creamy. A meal for 4 would cost anywhere between 65-80 SGD.

The 'Shish Mahal' Indian restaurant was just across the road from the Ibis hotel we were staying at, and we visited it three times, having some delicious curries there and cool beers.

Very inexpensive for Singapore, with excellent staff who made us feel really at home, and kept offering us additional titbits.  It's a great place to eat, and the area around it - 'Albert Court' is very interesting.

Came here for a late night snack and some beer. While they were kind enough to accommodate my order despite the kitchen being closed, the cheese balls were still cold at the core. Beers are fresh and cheap tho. Would come again for that.

Was given complimentary papadam which was really nice! The chicken briyani was fragrant and flavourful and was nice to have together with the palak paneer and garlic naan!

The staff was also very friendly and helpful!

Good place to  eat indian and nepali food.
Price is reasonable .Staff are receptive on your request. Atmosphere is amicable . You have choice for both indoor and outdoor. cheers

Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.reviews:
all dishes were good, tasted home made and very healthy. every bite had a warm, comforting feel to it.

We ordered:
chili chicken momo (nepalese style dumplings)
jimbu butter chicken set
vegetarian momo thukpa (noodle soup)
chyau mushroom set
tea

we came before rush hour so it was not busy yet and the chef had time and was kind enough to recommend dishes, also since it was our first time in her bistro.

Delicious, flavourful and home-made. Tried the Thupka, the Jimbu butter chicken and the green tea. The owners take a lot of pride in the quality of their ingredients (I was told the Jimbu and green tea were imported from Nepal, and that the chef does not use any MSG, preservatives or artificial flavourings) and the care put into making the food fresh, and you can really taste the difference. They hence recommend eating in the restaurant vs takeaway.

Great experience to try out a different cuisine. Very friendly owner(?) who explained each dish to us when they knew we were first timers trying out mew things. Both variations of momo was delicious, so was the panner. Sad that bitter chicken was sold out by the time we got there for dinner. Definitely will come back again to try the butter chicken and thupka.

We came right as they opened to be able to get a seat but the place filled up fast. The owners tell you it takes up to 20 minutes for food to be prepared so take note. Momos are definitely what to go for, as well as the mushroom fry. The butter chicken is good but nothing too unique!

Sooo good! Small restaurant serving authentic Nepalese food. Highly recommend booking (or even ordering online) to avoid any disappointment, as it is an absolute gem. The crew is really nice and the food is delicious and perfectly priced.
We had both the veggie steamed momos and fried chicken momo with chili (SO good) and the mushroom set. Everything is cooked fresh and to perfection. Really enjoyed the massala tea too. Overall, amazing experience, only wished they had more space cause this is definitely a spot I’d like to show to my friends.
Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.name: LOMBA The Gurkha Bistro
Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang.query: Nepalese restaurants in Choa Chu Kang

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
Price is definitely not on the low end, but still, rather affordable for a Turkish meal as compared to some stores.

Waiting time can be rather long due to cooking duration and online delivery orders.

I love how generous they are with the meat.

The Beef Kebab was delicious, a good portion, and the price was reasonable..The staffs are friendly

Pleasant and friendly crew serving generous tender grill.

Generous amount of chicken given in the kebab. Yummy. Recommend!

Big portion and so delicious. I tried the mixed kebab. Amazing.

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
The place feels small and crowded. Furnitures quite old and needs to renovate. Food are expensive. They even have a promotion but actually not really a promotion price. They just added their current meal bundle price just to look like a ($58) promotion. I walk out the restaurant not satisfied with what I paid. We ordered Ultra and Mega burger. The Ultra burger looks small in actual compared to their posters and in this photo. Don't be fooled by it.

Visited swensens on a Saturday night in a group of 3. Went around 6+pm, managed to get a seat after waiting about 5min.

Our waiter was patient and professional, took time to explain the perks of the swensens memberships and the vouchers we could use (nowadays the swensens memberships is quite rewarding but also quite complicated - requires the use of telegram). There was another waiter subsequently who was a bit rude when we asked for our banana split - literally didn't acknowledge us and just waved his hand at the kitchen and walked away.

Ordered one pizza, one battered fish and chips and one meatballs to share. Came with 3 free drinks (topped up 1 dollar each to get special drinks), and a free banana split because of all our membership perks.

Total bill of 60 for quite a filling and value for money dinner. Thank you

I remembered my first visit to this Swensen’s outlet. As a kid, it was nothing short of an excellent experience. Staff was nice, my fish and chips classic was delicious, and my ice cream was nicely presented. That was in 1998.

25 years on I still walk out from this branch a happy diner but no longer a kid. And I would absolutely change nothing about this restaurant.

Overall, the food is ok. I have ordered a combo "steak & chicken", the steak somehow well prepared as per my order "midium rare", as some restaurant could still see bloody in the middle.
Fish & chip is ok, too. No special vs. others.
Swensen's should be famous in their ice cream, but I'm not able to find the special of it. The milky cream is not as strong and a bit watery. Just hope could improve further.

The fish and chip is not up to standard. Batter too thick for my liking. Fish too bland.

Worst of the worst is chicken in basket. The chicken is not fully cook. Is cold inside. Apparently the waitress just took it back to the kitchen, fry it and bring it back to me without any explanation or any apology.

Thats about it for my experience.

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
Fast service , QR order. Tried the Hokkien Mee. The portion is quite generous and flavour is ok. Compared with some hawkers lacks the seasoning and intense wok hey taste but it’s acceptable and decent for the price. With Svc charge and gst outside of promo days is about 10SGD. Worth it if you’re around , but i would still rather train to Bukit Timah Hawker Center for the Hokkien Mee there.

We tried the hokkien mee and we find it flavourful with slurpy texture! There were intense wok-hey taste too! Besides the food, ordering process was easy too!

Decent Hokkien Noodle. Feels like the noodles are freshly cooked upon order instead of warming up from precooked one like many stalls do.

this place won't survive for long, I've eaten better standards in coffee shops and hawker places. staff was not attentive at all, stood for a good 5mins before someone came to take our order. pig organ soup too much pepper and pork slices were paper thin ($15++), hokkien mee tasted so so only and the pork lard not crispy, don't think the prawn were fresh. sadly this place does not meet the standards, hawker centre cheaper and taste better, everything just overpriced here. ain't coming back.

Not bad, but quite salty. Price is quite ok for the promo…. Otherwise it’s quite expensive for full price. Noodles are not piping hot despite being served on the spot, not sure why? Or wok fire not big enough

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
Some dishes were good, others not so much.

The fried chicken with tteokbokki was particularly bad. There seemed to be more fried batter than chicken, and only a tiny amount of sauce was given.

Water costs $0.50.

fast service...nice food especially their stew..fried chicken and rice cake crispy..i usually dun eat rice cake but i like this..but the sauce is bit too salty.

Wanted to try Ajumma after seeing multiple franchise opening up in Singapore and people queueing for it. Ordered the jjajjangmyun, kimchi fried rice and galbi. Not sure if we ordered the right food warranting of the long queues. But the food did not stand out much. Although the galbi is nice and tender, the jjajungmyun and kimchi fried rice tasted rather flat and bland. There are certainly many better versions of jjajangmyun and kimchi fried rice than Ajumma’s.

Comfort Korean food! Quite authentic. Egg soufflé was light and fluffy. I had the beef noodles - pork bone broth was delicious! Free flow sides are great as well. Reasonably priced. Will definitely be back

Had a pleasant experience from one of the staff, Richele. We ordered one of the dishes with extra Noodles but didn't realise it doesn't come with extra soup. She was kind to help us with our request. Thank you so much!

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
Date of visit: 13 August 2023. The restaurant had empty tables when visited just after noon. However they all filled up pretty quickly a short while after. Ordering was via scanning the QR code found on the table. Food and drinks came shortly after e-payment. Service was also quick and efficient, with staff members quick to clear empty plates. Only gripe was the tomato ketchup packets, which were quite oily and thus hard to peel open.

Always pack during dinner time, food serving is abit slow, would recommend their fiery chicken it’s my fav order every time I dine in. Would not recommend to go for the all day breakfast which I did, scramble egg tasted sad. However their fiery chicken always make up for it, fries and wedges are given decent portion and crispy. Would recommend to dine in instead of takeaway.

Kind of slow in cooking the food. They do QR Code order n payment. No service charge👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
Food is decent, not expensive. Double chicken can be share between Two.

Do not eat here if you are used to a western quality steakhouse.

Burger had absolutely zero seasoning or flavor.

Salmon ad bland as can be.

They brought out my burger and almost 12 minutes later the salmon came out.

I would avoid if here again and eat ramen next door.

Usually a queue outside but for good reason... this place has killer steaks!

Ordered a black pepper chicken and the Prime Ribeye (tip: Ask for black pepper sauce, really awesome flavour). Nice and chewy, juicy steak with the tender chicken. 2 sides per meal, with good variety so customize as you like. They have takeaways too.

Cosy ambience too, feels homely and warm👌🏻

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
Rendang chicken set: a good meal.
Ayam Gulai set: also good
Achar: too small serving

Kopi: Thick with aroma, do go with default option, as milk is machine dispensed.

not a full cup? siew dai and is still too sweet. after they automated, the staff seems busy with meddling machines than actual orders.

I have been patronising the store for many years. Ever since they had done the renovation and started using the machine to make their drinks, the quality of their drinks have dropped. I have ordered ice kopi and ice teh in the past week, and both drinks tasted more like sugary milk. I really do hope they improve their standards, before customers start heading over to Yakun.

The aunty at the cashier super rude. Show attitude. Bang the atm device and slam the receipt on the counter. Not the first time we encountered with her. Previous aunty was so much better, patience and helpful. Food and drinks are still good.. Have to face her first though.. 🙄

Average place.
Food is ok, served quickly. Eggs are not warm. They provide a plastic bowl for the eggs, instead of a traditional ceramic bowl. It's kind of weird for the eggs.
Place is slightly messy, a lot of boxes and cartons on the benches and chairs. Then you get these old folks blasting music or videos from their phones.

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
Streats Cafe needs no introduction.

I used to find the food on the average but at a recent visit, I change my mind a little. The food is still on the salty (flavourful) side but I do enjoy the Claypot Rice Porridge with Seafood and Minced Chicken Ball.

The soup dishes which my friends order also taste overly flavourful, to me. I hope they don’t have to drink lots of water after the meal. 😆 Oh, but I like the HK Carrot Cake with XO sauce. That scores another thumbs up from me. 👍
#tiramisooojiaks #jiakjiakjiak #sgfoodie #streatscafe #friedcarrotcake #claypotriceporridge #kimchisoup #halalfood #halalsg

It's a nice place but the food is not nice.
Food is dry and tasteless. Even the sauces didn't add much taste.
The place is nice with high ceilings and nice decor. Service is average.

This "hybrid" cafe serves HK style dishes as well as local fare. They have a small selection of dim sum (I like their siew mai), small selection of "Nasi Lemak", small selection of local tze char dishes...you get the drift. When put together, however, it becomes quite a smorgasbord of choices.
The Nissin Soup Noodle is one of their more popular choices. It's like a more glamorous Maggie Mee, with 'liao' inside. The soup is tasty and overall it's yummy. And who doesn't love the oversized soup spoon that it's served in?
The Nasi Lemak - hmm. The Nasi is not Lemak, and the Acar serving is quite pitiful (nowhere near as shown in the menu picture). However, the fried chicken was great, and the prawns were fresh. And the sambal, while not the best I've had, was good enough.
The star of this cafe, to me, is it's ambience. Tucked away at the corner of the mall, it's 2 storey ceiling with glass windows one one side makes for a cosy and warm casual dining experience. Worth a visit. Or two.

Consider A Moderate Halal Restaurant For Fusions I Would Say, Not Very Fantastic, But Can Be Consider Above Average Comparing w Some Few Other Fusion Cuisine Restaurants Out There... 😊

order the food on 1930, food delivery takes 30 mins. Message from Streats set to aim to deliver the food by 8pm yet it is 8.23pm now and the food is not delivered yet.

Very slow service, not going to order again.
Will advise my friends and relatives not to order from this outlet in Bukit Panjang Plaza

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
The thai fried rice has no thai influence at all but taste good as a fried rice. The fried rice texture is dry, fluffy and every grain well fried. The chilli padi adds the extra heat and drizzled with lime to give the spicy tangy taste (maybe that’s the thai part) and fried chicken is a good side that makes the meal more hearty. The place is quite messy, service is normal. Eat and go place.

Tried this dish (Aroi Royale) as its different from their zhi char dishes.

Not bad. Tom Yum soup based with seafood varieties and noodles. Serving was huge for 4 pax.

Ordered via online from the table QR code. Hassle free.

The staffs were polite and courteous.

Overall, nice experience. Thank you.

Set meal was really worth it. About 28++ for assam fish, veggie, sichuan soup, 2 rice. It was marketed to be for 2 pax but would think 3 pax is good for it too (maybe order 1 additional side). Would revisit to try their fish head / other seafood options.

Good old Halal Zhi Char . We tried some normal or usual selections. I must say , I love the mee goreng and prawn paste chicken wing . Overall food tastes qreat but as the place have no sound proof,  it get noisy at time especially when it crowded.

Weekend and it's time for lunch and buddy picked West Coz. I'm up for it for sure.

We arrived around 2pm thereabouts and the place was not that crowded. We were seated and given our menu by a lady. She seem rather uptight, not rude just the tone I guess. Nothing to be bothered much by. In fact she was nice enough to inform us to call when we were ready to order.

The choices! Oh my, that was the biggest issue albeit a good issue to have really. So we decided on Assam Fish, Sambal Kangkong, Oyster Omelette, Black Pepper Beef and rice of cause. The male server came and took our orders and in about 15mins all our items arrived. That's a nice thing. Probably because it wasn't that crowded.

The pictures speaks for itself. The portions were generous, the veggies seems fresh however I would assume the assam fish to be different, you know the red soupy type rather than what I believe to be coconut based gravy. And half a fish head? Hhmmmm ... Nevertheless it was still delish. For the price point, was it worth it, definately. Would I be back here again, sure.

Oh, and after we ate and went out to catch a breather, saw the lady leaving on her bicycle. Thank her and she smiled and went on her merry way.

All in all, enjoyed it.

Food : 4 / 5
Staff : 4 / 5
Ambience : 3 / 5
