Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
Located on level 2 - Celsius Vegetarian素
The stall offers an impressive variety of vegetarian frozen food that caters to different tastes. The lady who manages the stall not only exhibits friendliness but also possesses a commendable depth of knowledge about the products.

Have Teochew noodle, op for the Kway Teow minced meat (good)add 2 Taiwan meat ball (average) and a Five spice roll (fair only ) . Average - Kway Teow soft and tender.

So far not so good, first level hawker food was fine but 2nd level is inconvenient n pricely.. the LHH staff is very rude, no receipt given and there is no return and refund policy.
No wonder business was so bad.. staff is very rude a fat aunty and a newly staff... all the stall closed down as nobody want to frequent upstair.

The boss of LHH better improved your staff attitude , sooner or later no business and customer soon.

I would not recomended .

Didn't feel comfortable eating at this hawker centre that comes with some unsound design ideas. For example, half the walkway around it is not covered and gets wet when it rains.

Coffee and food are reasonable priced. Fishball  noodles are good but stall operate from about 10.15am instead of 9.30am as stated on their stall.

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
This is really ridiculous. Ordered my food at 6.08pm and was told waiting time of 20-30 minutes based on the time chart. The number wouldn’t move even after 50 minutes. Collected my food at 7.02pm for two packets of fried rice. Mind you there’s 3 chefs cooking and the grab food orders kept coming in. Please tell your crew to off the grab machine if you can’t even handle ground orders. If I can give zero stars i will. And one of your malay chef was talking to a regular instead of cooking during peak hours.

Ordered at the store there.
Was standing there waiting and saw some boxes ready and put on the table but no number was called so thought is for delivery or online self-collect.
Waited 10mins, number still did not jump so go up to ask, in the end the foods that are placed on the table are mine.
Not sure what the number system are for if do not use, inside got 7 peoples working some more.

Ordered many times from this outlet. But first time reviewing cos really cannot tahan anymore.  Always pay for extra vegetable but only realised missing ingredient when we were about to eat! Happened to me three times! Can the Wok Hey staff please be more careful while scooping in the ingredients?

Tried the egg fried rice with seasoned prawns. Surprisingly it was good, and tasty. The eggs and rice blend together nicely, and the short grain gives it a nice texture. The prawns are fresh and the overall experience was good. Will be back to try other options!

Hey! It’s my first time trying wok hey. I found the rice a bit soggy. Yes it’s tasty but could it be because of the MSG that they add?

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
5.60 for spicy kekou noodles. Noodles are springy and firm. Pork balls are well marinated. The broth is decent. They are super generous with fried shallots which is amazing.

Overall a good bowl of noodles if you live in the area. However, nothing in particular that stood out or made me want to go down specially for it.

Otherwise known as Uncle KKM. We got the standard bowl and being greedy, we opted for large size. Hahaha shouldn’t have done so since the noodles were too much oops. I think the normal size is just nice.

A nice bowl of noodles, shallot was v fragrant, they charge extra if you want more and I can see why 🍜

Had also tried their spicy version before, it’s good but really packs a punch. The queue is shorter when nearer to its closing time.

Used to frequent this store in the past, if uncle cook the bowl would be more flavorful, aunty cook tends to be less tasty.
A simple bowl of comfort koka noodle, price has increase and ingredient portion getting lesser, seldom visit the store nowadays due to mostly aunty cooking and pricer with less ingredient.

Used to frequent this store during the weekend. Quite disappointed with the taste and the amount of indgredient in a bowl of KKM. I think there is a significant differences between the KKM prepared by Uncle KKM and the Auntie.The one cook by Auntie is less flavorful and the ingredient(meat) is much lesser. Hope Auntie can make improvement and serve us the best KKM in bukit panjang.

Travelled across SG to explore no-mans-land known as Bukit Panjang.

Stumbled across this by pure chance and saw extremely long queue, in typical Singaporean fashion see queue just follow.

Spicy Ke Kou mian was quite excellent, with healthy portions and a savoury broth,  5/5 for food. Paid $11.2 for a large Spicy + large Seafood bowl, so value price wise is middling. Self service, self clearing. Would eat again, but only if queue doesn't take 30 mins

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
15 Nov 23’

Today breakfast set ($3.80) the bun look ugly.

The signature breakfast set promo price at $3.00 only apply to union membership, normal price is $3.50. It make the worker keep & repeated explained to lot of senior customers who doesn’t have union membership.

If Kopitiam willing to offer 50 cents breakfast set, why can’t they just make $3 breakfast offer from morning to 7am~ 11 am?!

Promotion at special price for co-operative is to help lower the price, for the benefit to customer, No for the aim to increase of revenue..

Visited on 20 July 2023 mid afternoon. Place was relatively quiet. Ordered the Bubur Cha Cha at the dessert stall. Tasted exactly the same as what you will find at other Kopitiam outlets.

The tea c made by staff 👎🏻, tea is too diluted. My experience with kopitiam for tea/coffee taste is inconsistent 😏

It is getting pricey yet you are not assure of consistent taste, unlike some branded brand like Toast Box; pricey too but you are assured of the taste.

I wanted to rate 1 star but staff at coffee n fruits counter are friendly, so I rate 2 stars for my experience here today.

The cai png is good and economical. Kopi taste OK and hot desserts were reasonable.

Teriyaki chicken and saba bento was below average as the teriyaki sauce was more like sugary syrup. The rice was also not well cooked.

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
Mookata can be ordered at this coffee shop. Tried the meat platter and did not disappoint. Came with a variety of meats like beef chicken. There was also scallops, prawns and clams. Recommended for large groups.  Delicious dipping sauces to accompany the meats.

Service: ⭐⭐⭐⭐
Waiting Time: ⭐⭐
Food Varieties: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Food Quality: ⭐
Food Taste: ⭐

Food Ordered:
Seafood Fried Rice
Salted Egg Fried Rice

Utterly disappointed by the quality & taste of food received after a long wait. Was super excited as has their meals from the other outlets & it was definitely tasty & fulfilling.
Seafood Fried Rice has undercooked seafood, bland, no spring onions or anything else just undercooked rice with eggs & seafood.

The establishment might want to standardize the standard & food taste.

Singapore style Chilli Crab was decent and saucy to go with rice. Stir Fried Kailan was done well too. Apparently this restaurant is halal friendly. EDIT: returned for Mookata - they offer a platter of mixed meat for 4-6pax (Ultimate Meat Bomb Platter) which was pretty fresh and value for dollar! Some weaknesses: The smell of Lamb meat easily overwhelms everything else, the soup refill is *very* salty may want to consider refill with plain water instead.

Well ventilated mookata area. Food was good especially the meat platter. Not too good for larger groups as they only have smaller tables (up to 4). The online ordering system kept hanging and staff was q grumpy when clearing and setting up the grill but overall decent experience.

The food are delicious, affordable price ,come back for Mother's Day celebration , friendly staff ,very recommended.Thank you 🌹♥️🙏

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
Had a quick lunch here, pleasantly surprised by the seafood kim chi soup. It’s one of the best I’ve tasted. There’s crab meat in it which makes the soup authentically ‘seafood’ in flavour. Everything tasted v good. A surprise find this one!

Always a quiet and chill place where you’ll almost be guaranteed a seat even on Friday nights. Food options are decent but some dishes are a hit or miss. The fried chicken had lots of batter and the flavour didn’t feel like Korean fried chicken (somehow it reminds me for sweetened dark soy sauce). Will return mainly because it’s quiet.

The hotplate beef is served on a cold plate. The banchan is not worth a repeat. You get better fried chicken at a fast food place. The tofu kimchi soup is ok. The chive pajeon is thick and uncook at the center and doesn't taste Korean.

Not much of ambience but a good place for some quiet moments and good , reasonable price k food. Although I am not a fan of k stuff, the pancake is really good and the various fried chicken. Do go for the sets as they are more worth it.

Homely and very customizable which is a plus for vegans/vegetarians! Naengmyeon is a must at Gayageum whenever I finish trekking nearby especially during hot weather. The jeons are tasty and in good servings - there's banchan too but not all side dishes are vegan.

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.address: 170 Upper Bukit Timah Road B2, #14 Shopping Centre, 588179
Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.name: Gayageum Korean Family Restaurant

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
Visit here for lunch on 15/Oct Sat at 12pm. Place was cosy for a quick lunch. There were 3 staff managing  the outlet.
There are several authentic Indonesia food & tasted very good. I love the Ox tail soup, very meaty & the broth was power & beefy! Wife had Gado with Noodle, love the peanut sauce.
Overall very good...Well done👏👏👏

A few months ago, I would have rated 4 stars for the review of this place. I love indomie and I think the Satay Gado Mie was the best thing ever, it used to have this chonky satay chicken with the indomie (You can see it from a review from 6 months ago). This year the meat was reduced severely by half to 2 sticks of regular satay 🥲 was there a change in ownership? Is this from the GST increase? I have no idea but I don't think I can patronize this store as regularly as I once did. Major downer.

Used to always buy chunky satay here, was nice and came with some veg on the side.  Now there is nothing chunky about it, just processed chicken.  And hardly any veg on the side.

Ayam penyet on the slight pricey side ($6-$7 on average). Limited seating. Enjoyed the gadomie the most, flavourful noodles and tender boneless chicken with satay sauce. And keropok! Chilli packs a punch. Fried chicken has very subtle tumeric taste, overall abit bland. Also they can have more gravy on the white rice.

DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!! UNCLEAN FOOD!!!

I ordered their NasiGo on 10 Oct 2022 through deliveroo and had such a nasty food poisoning afterwards. Vomiting for 2 days, stomach unwell for 3 days. Even had high fever on the first day of food poisoning lol. Spent $100+ on visiting the doctor. Terrible experience. I don’t know if you’re serving food from previous days or your kitchen is unhygienic. But something is definitely wrong. Please check because you’re playing with people’s lives. This is unethical. Will NEVER eat here ever again and strongly suggest people DO NOT EAT FROM THIS PLACE!!

UNCLEAN FOOD DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!!!!!!

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
Good food, quick service but there's always a crowd (wait wasn't long). Understandable why they're so popular. I'll be back.

Love that you order online from the table. Food comes pretty quickly and service is slightly above avg I'd say.

Food was good and decent price for value. The items with a chili spice have a bit of spiciness. Not too spicy for most and not too mild.

Super fast service and good food! Food came 5 minutes after order. My friends and I selected the set menu for 4. We chose fish head curry, long beans, mapo tofu, claypot chicken, salted egg sotong. All for the price of $98.35 (inclusive of GST & service charge). Food was pretty good! Their fish head curry is very good. Will come again :)

One of the better curry fish head I’ve tried. For the amount we ordered it’s about 35 dollars per pax. Ate with another friend on a weekday night, packed as hell, barely found a human friendly seat for two person situated at the the causeway of the cashier and the kitchen. The atmosphere was definitely impacted. Table was small as hell and we had to cramp all our plates in one table. They lighted the curry fish head infront of us and it had an amazing smell. To be honest if u r gonna order curry fish head. Just Match it with white rice and not Thai seafood rice which btw was terrible and salty. A vegetable drink was discounted for us at 2.50 dollar per cup where the usual price was 3.50. Once again, the vegetable drink felt like an unhealthy sweetened drink that was green in colour filled with a lot of ice. These days restaurants charge you premium price for drinks where at least 70% of the drink is filled with ice so u expect me to sit at your restaurant and wait for your ice to melt while my drink is kept cool. Atmosphere was trash and loud market, u had to literally shout to talk to your friend across the table. Not ur usual candle light express dinner. Good thing they didn’t chase us away from this inhumane table and we left anyway cos it was getting really hot. Yes the temperature in that area is kinda like open air as the aircon is central air cooling of the overall mall. People who love curry fish head should come but just order white rice and bring your own bottle of water to save money

Curry fish head is great! We ordered the set meal for 6 people $82.80. Plus Gst near to $98.
Service was fast and place was clean. The oyster egg was delicious,  and oysters given was fresh and generous. We will come back again.

Ordered the asam fish head, egg, kangkong, salted egg sotong and chicken.

Overall a very delicious meal, especially the fish and sotong.

Comfortable dinning with aircon.

Would recommend for a comfortable meal with family or friends.

Uzbek dining in Bukit Panjang.reviews:
One of the best KBBQ in the west.
Service is good. You don’t need to cut the meat or cook the meat by yourself. Staff will cut and cook for you.
Love the rice ball 🍙.

Always very crowded. Best to avoid peak hours. And get a queue number when you arrive by scanning the QR code or simply use the tablet to get queue number.

Ordered the pork & beef set which comes with soup and steamed egg. They also serve side dishes. The service is amazing, they will refill your side dishes regularly. They will also help to cook your meat. All of the food is very good. One of the best Korean BBQ in Singapore

Located along Cheong Chin Nam Road of restaurants, take the downtown line and exit at Beauty World MRT station. They are located at the further end of stretch.

This brand of Korean BBQ feels like an authentic restaurant right out of Korea. Their staff were helpful, friendly and accomodating. Their menu of meat is amazing and tastes really good. All of their cuts are one of the better ones I've tried but these come at a price.

Definitely drop by to have your Korean BBQ cravings satisfied.

Foods nice. There’s a long queue to enter but it’s justified as the food is great, the atmosphere is lively, and the staff members are extremely friendly. Ordered the Beef BBQ Set and they’ll cook for you while ensuring nothing is burnt and everything is as crispy and tasty as it can get. 10/10 would return again.

Very delicious. Daebak 👍🏻
Recommended here by colleague.
I came during my leave with family, and had a great lunch. They use charcoal!!!
There’s free ice cream on the way out too.
Great service.

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Went here for lunch during weekends. There wasn't much of a queue and they were relatively fast in preparing your order. I have waited approximately ten minutes before they serve you the food. The price is reasonable, the food is great and it is definitely worth the price.

It is quite hot here so I recommend you to sit somewhere exposed to the outside air so that there would be an occasional cooling breeze that would circulate the air so that you wouldn't feel that hot.

It's best to eat here in groups so that you would be able to enjoy the different varieties of food together. Recommend this to your friends too!

Google reviews is pretty accurate, very very average Korean food here.
Served up by very authentic Korean ladies but the food(I tried) were not close to authentic tasting at all. The kimchi stew and ginseng chicken soup tasted like premix or just stock, with lots of msg and not made with fresh ingredients. I was super thirsty after eating. The soup was watery and not tasty.

Price I feel is ok, not too expensive for the portion which is rather generous, 1 stew and rice will be very very full.

However with the number of other Korean options in this building, I won’t be back for this Korean food.

I have to blame myself for not reading other reviews before ordering.

Seafood stew with rice $13.90 at a hawker centre. Taste bland and the ingredients (prawns and mussels) are not fresh.

The only thing authentic about this place is probably the store owner who is a Korean.

Overall about 3.5 stars for this popular Korean food stall.

The ginseng porridge $10 was pretty good. Tasty, comforting food and the portion was a huge ball. The ginseng was cut into thin stripes so it doesn’t come across as super bitter when I bit into it.

However, the seafood soup was lacklustre. The main complaint would be that the prawns and mussels were not fresh at all. I was struggling to peel the prawns so much it simply disintegrated. I just gave up eating it.

Peak hour wait could be from 30 mins onwards so be prepared to wait during dinner time!

Rooftop dining and great place to chill at night. Serves Korean food and beer. Love the oiginal fried chicken wings, crispy on the outside, tender inside. Located in the hawker centre decorated with assortment of plants which adds a botanic side yo the place.
Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.address: 144 Upper Bukit Timah Rd #04-60 Beauty World Centre, Singapore 588177
Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.name: Pink Candy Korean Restaurant

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Had a quick lunch here, pleasantly surprised by the seafood kim chi soup. It’s one of the best I’ve tasted. There’s crab meat in it which makes the soup authentically ‘seafood’ in flavour. Everything tasted v good. A surprise find this one!

Always a quiet and chill place where you’ll almost be guaranteed a seat even on Friday nights. Food options are decent but some dishes are a hit or miss. The fried chicken had lots of batter and the flavour didn’t feel like Korean fried chicken (somehow it reminds me for sweetened dark soy sauce). Will return mainly because it’s quiet.

The hotplate beef is served on a cold plate. The banchan is not worth a repeat. You get better fried chicken at a fast food place. The tofu kimchi soup is ok. The chive pajeon is thick and uncook at the center and doesn't taste Korean.

Not much of ambience but a good place for some quiet moments and good , reasonable price k food. Although I am not a fan of k stuff, the pancake is really good and the various fried chicken. Do go for the sets as they are more worth it.

Homely and very customizable which is a plus for vegans/vegetarians! Naengmyeon is a must at Gayageum whenever I finish trekking nearby especially during hot weather. The jeons are tasty and in good servings - there's banchan too but not all side dishes are vegan.
Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.opening_hours:

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
We had cold noodle, kimchi stew and fried dumpling! Their price point is considered steep for typical Korean dishes . The kimchi stew is average, not too spicy nor flavourful. However it is a good meal to wind down after a long day! The cold noodle texture is great and refreshing. We enjoyed it.
Their fried dumpling is a great snack to go along with the main dish.
They serve complimentary side dishes and barley tea.  I’m unsure if the side dishes are refillable as I did not request for refill.
The ambience of the restaurant is acceptable!

I’m neither Korean nor have I been to Korea, but I definitely believe this is what Korean food is supposed to be.

I loved every minute in the restaurant. Its ambiance is very warming- almost like you’re hosted by a warm lady.

Hearty and rustic dishes that really hits the spot.

Visited for dinner a couple of times. The food is delicious, and the portions are big.

It is a small restaurant with a low ceiling, and isn't acoustically treated, so it feels too noisy to have a conversation without raising your voice (which then makes the problem worse).

Another odd thing we felt was that either the tables  are shorter than usual, or the chairs taller than usual. We could be wrong, but our backs felt a little sore halfway through the meal.

Owner is extremely Cheerful and is full of smiles. The food is absolutely stunning, making me crave for more everytime. Will definitely recommend this restaurant to all Korean food lovers! Food is also authentic and fresh 😋

Awesomely good Korean food worth a try!! The spicy chewy noodle (jjolmyeon) was excellent with the right noodle chewiness and taste. We love the spicy Braised chicken and grilled mackerel as well. The grilled mackerel was crispy on the outside and so tender within 😋.  Will definitely be back!! The banchan are so good to eat with rice.

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.name: Yogiyo Korean restaurant

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Decided to do this review when I saw my old photos of this place. Came here because my regular Korean BBQ place next door was too packed.
Remembered that the marinated meats were good. Overall a good experience although you have to do the meat grilling yourself unlike at....

It’s a long time since we had Korean bbq & decided to give it a try since the ratings are good. The side dishes are really good ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️, better than most Korean restaurants. We ordered beef & pork set. It came with the soybean soup that was quite tasty ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ and the steam egg which we didn’t really like it as much ⭐️⭐️⭐️ since it is harder than the usual steam egg. The meats : iberico pork collar, pork belly & beef striploin were good ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ except the beef ribs as it was quite chewy ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️. We were given free beer due to our spending amount. Overall it was a great experience.

Have always wanted to try the wood fired meats ever since I heard about them and today I got a chance. We ordered a set meal for pork with three different types of pork, steamed egg and also kimchi beef soup. The set is pork omma set meant for 2-3 pax.

Meat were generous and really more than enough for two pax. They recommended 2-3 pax but it should be more like 4 pax as both of us were not big meat eaters.

We ordered a wood flavour charcoal that is suitable for pork - hickory wood which tbh we both cannot smell it and cannot even taste the difference!! The steam egg could be better as it was chao tar at the sides:) the marinating of meats were left to us and the variety of salt and pepper to me were one of the more unique features of restaurant:)

The set comes with ban chan and they were delicious. There were free flow of ban chan until they ran out!

I like the kimchi and the ikan bilis banchan:) my friend like the ikan bilis banchan and ordered 2nds for both. By the end of the meal both kimchi and ikan bilis have ran out!!!

There were drinks on special offer but since I drove we did not get the offer.

Was surprised they don't do the cooking for us and also the young girl who first approached us seem new. There was also a housefly landing on the wood panels after we finished eating!!

The meat set was still a little frozen when served. The fried chicken was pretty average while the beef soup lacked ingredients and it doesn't come with rice. The seafood pancake was floury and non crispy. Food was alright, nothing surprising.

One of the staff doesn't know the differences between a receipt and a ticket and was augmentative about it. He said because we add on orders and not order at the start (which we totaled over $300 for the bill) doesn't count for the free flow beer for the table. While it was written on the poster outside the restaurant that "with minimum spend of $250 in a single receipt per table" he feels he had the need to go outside take a photo and show us to prove us wrong. At that point it just made us feel that the restaurant was kinda scammy. In the end he said only for this time he let us have the free beer. But kudos to the rest of the staff that were friendly, attentive and filled our drink fast.

Overall the food was mediocre and the service should be quite good but there's always a bad apple that spoiled the experience. Or maybe it was the management policy, who knows. I won't recommend this place instead just try the next door O.bba Jjajang for better Korean food.

Its my second time coming back here and they notice me directly!! Excellent service friendly &  accommodating staff !They welcomed me with their best smiles, assist me well especially in ordering ❤️ Hemah, Venissa and Sylvester 🫶🏻 were the best as they always check up on me for top-ups ! with my beer & etc.🤩

Excellent Customer Service! Ill keep on coming back here! thats for sure !

Best Regards as well to Kitchen Staffs who prepared all the food ! It is very well prepared the meat and my favorite seafood soup😍!❤️  thumbs up  and keep up the Good Work Everyone👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Excellent curry rice. Piping hot and crispy pork cutlet matched with silky smooth Japanese curry and steaming rice.

One of the best curry rice I have had.

The curry packs some spice is not the all-sweet curry sauce. Cutlet is flavourful; the crunch and temperature of the meat is excellent!

One of the star outlets of this hawker centre. Atmosphere is what you would expect of a hawker centre. The pigeons are a problem for this hawker centre but shouldn't distract you from the good food.

Look at what you can get for $10. Definitely 5 stars for someone who value quantity over quality yet quality is decent for a hawker fare Japanese curry rice. Pork katsu was the best out of the 3 meats on the plate while the other 2 were forgettable. Very extensive menu for such a small stall which makes ordering decision quite a headache.

Update Jul 2023:
Had their Char Siew Don which is definitely value for money at $5.50 though it's quite lacking in the taste department. Their char siew was succulent and the rice has the right texture but the sauce just doesn't felt right. I guessed the lack of mayonnaise was the difference, there's a reason why most Japanese outlets would add them in their CSD, something that the owner shd consider including.

Update Aug 2023:
Had their Poached Rice which is so far my favourite dish at this stall though it's recipe essentially derived from their ramen by changing the noodle to rice.

Update Aug 2023:
Finally got to try their ramen again which I had it long ago but didn't left an impression. Totally enjoyed it this time eventhough the tonkotsu broth lacked some depth(as expected for a hawker fare) but this can be gloss over by avoiding the original flavour and order either the spicy or black garlic flavour. A 80% restaurant's quality at less than half their price.

Update Aug 2023:
The Miso Rice w Mentaiko Pork Cutlet is my least favorite by far. The miso rice was too mushy and tasted like kimchi rice which I happened not to like. Pork cutlet was ok but the Mentaiko doesn't seems to compliment the meat as well as it did to salmon.

I purposedly went to Beauty World Food Centre just to try this ramen stall. I read that this stall is one of the 'must try' in the list. I went through the menu and saw that the ramen called BLACK KING (GARLIC) has 3 thumbs up sign. I ordered a bowl costing $9.90. It did not disappoint me. The broth is tasty with rich umami flavor while the noodles are al dente. The thing that I liked most is the barbecue slices of pork with nice  charred flavor while maintaining the tenderness of the meat. It also comes with cabbage, japanese style soft boiled egg, and generous topping of bonito flakes. I would definitely recommend this stall. An affordable ramen that is only a fraction of cost than a normal ramen would be.

My favourite ramen place of all time!!!! Even better than typical ramen restaurants who claim to be “michelin star’. I always order their signature ramen bowl ($8.00), comes with the ingredients as shown. The pork slices are SO THICK and crispy on one side! Absolutely savoury! Also gives a generous amount of black fungus & the noodles are not overdone with texture in-place. Broth was flavourful yet not too overwhelming.

Even when their food is excellent, their service is impeccable as well. Due to the layout of the food centre, rain splashes quite heavily beside the stall (causing some flooding water as well). The owner came to deliver the ramen to me personally & even wrapped the ramen bowl with a layer of cling wrap + put seaweed in a plastic bag to prevent water from going in, even though I was dining in. Was blown by the effort & it showed how much pride they put in ensuring their ramen quality tasted the best! Kudos! Recommend anyone to go try!!!!!

Atmosphere is not that great - sg weather hahaha & area is not clean, but I’m not going to shortchange this stall of 5 stars as it’s the foodcourt’s issue xD

Buta Kin must be a favourite at Beauty World Food Centre. There is a waiting time of 15 minutes for the Ramen.

To me, good ramen is one with great-tasting broth, and the noodles must be cooked to my liking (a tad on the hard side). This ramen store ticked all the right boxes (almost). The broth was lovely, but it bordered on the lighter side on the taste. The noodles were perfect. The Char Siew or Charred Pork Slices were delicious and with a little charred flavour. The umami was perfect.

For extra ingredients, like one boiled egg and extra Char Siew, the cost turned out to be $11. Cheap for the food court? Not exactly, but compared with the ramen restaurants, it is very reasonable.

Verdict, I would certainly come again. I like it.

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Very delicious food prepared by passionate chefs. Risotto, angel hair pasta, spicy pork ham pizza and wagyu beef steak were all cooked to perfection. The whole experience was brought to another level by extremely warm service by genuinely friendly staff. We would be back again.

Came to celebrate Father’s Day lunch on a lazy Sunday.  Place is not crowded and quite a nice homely atmosphere.  Ordered pizza, lamb chop, burrata cheese plater and bruschetta bread. All tasted delicious and pizza is really good.  Finished with nice coffee and tiramisu dessert.  Service is fast and prompt.  Overall a pleasant experience and the bill came up to $126 which is reasonable for the quality of food served.  Will certainly be back.

A nice cosy Italian restaurant nestled inside a private apartment. You will be spoilt for choices as they have a great authentic Italian menu and everything is tasty. Interior decor is also nicely done with a homey touch. Very friendly staff and chef as well.

I used to order often from them 4-5 years back as I was living next door and I returned for a dinner (last visit was probably 2019). The atmosphere is still great (old school italian place), the food is still amazing. Had the burrata, the 4 cheese pizza (I always order this wherever I go and Al Borgo is top 3 in Singapore for me) and pasta (angel hair with prawns). Nice Super Tuscan red wine at 90$ a bottle. Had deserts too (tiramisu and affogato with whisky instead of coffee). Total damage approx 230$. I left happy in spirit and tummy

It's definitely a great restaurant for who wanna taste real Italian food!! Thanks so much for giving us a lovely and unforgettable evening :)
Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.name: Al Borgo Italian Restaurant

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Plenty of delicious food here to be spoilt for!

I particularly enjoy the Hong Kong soya sauce chicken rice because of the tender chicken and the warm tasty soup. Their chili is fire if you put a lot.

Then the wanton noodle stall that is along the mutton soup stall side, the noodles always cooked perfectly al dente, their chili sauce is quite unique.

Then chendol at the corner is a hidden gem, the sweetness is just right that won’t make you feel getting diabetes after that.

Total damage as seen in picture is only $10. Yes i am very hungry so i ate a bit more. This was on a Sunday evening period.

We had a feast here today after our hike at Bukit Timah and rifle range nature parks. All the food was so good! There also was beer and a nice beer garden outdoor seating area (too bad it was raining and we couldn’t sit outdoors). Fried chicken was yummy, and the economical
Bee Hoon was pretty good too! It was very crowded and it took awhile to get seating. Lots of people were waiting around too. The beef noodles and carrot cake were decent too. Will be back to try more food next time

EDIT: went back for the 3rd time! The stall is called Mom’s food!
*however the kimchi soup I ordered this time was alil too spicy.. I guess the spice level is not very consistent, but I’ll forgive auntie maybe she accidentally poured too many chilli.. the previous 2 time was great!
It’s NOT pink candy ok… it’s located at the opposite end of pink candy!! Pls check it out~ it’s manned by a Korean auntie and I’ve only tried their kimchi soup~ trust me~~ it’s super flavourful and delicious very heartful😋 loads of kimchi but the meat inside is meh, abit tough and dry.. but the soup compensates all!!! It’s $7.90 with a bowl of rice whereas pink candy is charging twice the amt.. 😅 pls give it a try~

food was really mediocre at best. i cant speak for all the stores but the xiao long bao tasted like plastic. just little balls of “freezer” taste

the western had a lot of good reviews but for its price and taste, it wasn’t good at all.

bak chor mee was really watery and bland.

there isn’t any upkeep of this place and it was super dirty. what happened to the beauty world food center i knew and loved 😞

There are so many good hawker fare at this location, you'll be spoilt for choice.

On this visit, I had the Chicken & Cream Mushroom Pasta. The noodle is cooked just right with a flavorful creamy sauce at the right consistency; not too watery or too thick. The grilled chicken is savory with the right amount of crunchy skin; a wonderful pairing. This item is from BIG BOYS Western at #04-25.

And of course, don't forget to end your meal with YE TANG Chendol, which is door to Big Boys. If you are fan of the famous thorny fruit, order the one with a scoop of durian ice cream. The pairing is heavenly.

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.name: Beauty World Food Centre

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Very delicious and refined cooking . Was impressed! Perfect food portion control and great timing between each course. Do try the tasting menu, everything from appetizers to dessert was unique and sumptuous. A great place to celebrate birthday , instead of the usual cake/desserts, they served something special :) ( Not going to spoil the fun by saying)

It’s a fairy tale experience for me!

The food is fabulous. Their specialty flower-like bread is one of the best bread I have ever tried. Many of their dishes have incorporated authentic Columbia’s cuisine elements and also included some Asian ingredients. For example, one dish has salted egg in the source. All the international ingredients are harmoniously combined in this taste menu experience!

The chef and staff are very friendly and they will passionately tell you stories behind the food instead of just listing all the ingredients and the source countries. One of my favorite is that they show me how Columbian local people open a passion fruit (just by hitting their heads! 🤣)

The interior design is mysterious and exotic for me, because I’ve never been to Latin America.  The staff showed me how the beautiful vases are handmade by local Colombian people.

I will definitely recommend this restaurant to people:

1) who want to celebrate an important anniversary with some memorable experiences and delightful dishes.

Or
2) who want to have some interesting cultural exposure and travel to Columbia mentally without being physically there.

Or simply
3) who love food!

If you are interested in their cuisine/culture, don’t be shy to ask! The staff will give you a trip to Latin America with their kind words, for all the customers from the world.

Went there end of August and I just say that everything was just perfect !
Food was amazing and when you know Colombian cuisine you can definitely find the influences in every single dish !
Cocktails were also all very good.
Service was great and the chef is lovely !

Deserving of a lot more attention and love. I had the BEST BREAD EVER here. This restaurant, recommended by a friend, was a great find for me. The menu, food and decor of the place have all been meticulously thought-out. I didn’t get a good photo of the interior but the restaurant has a clean, sleek and modern look while retaining some vibes to remind you of its Colombian roots. I was here for lunch and had its Arborio rice cooked with Sea Urchin and Smoked Eel and Iberico Pork Chop. To be honest, I don’t think their dishes are essentially what I would think to be columbian cuisine but I love good food regardless. Each dish was light, flavourful, well-seasoned and the ingredients all complemented each other very well. Love the plantains with the pork chop. I would love to be back soon again. It’s a shame that they’re located in an office tower which I think is the reason behind the slow traffic. Support them if you can, you will get nothing but a great meal and experience out from it.

Had our anniversary dinner there and we had a wonderful time. The dishes were delicious and cocktails yummy. We never had columbian food and we are so glad we did. Chef does seafood especially well, cuttlefish and Boston lobster were cooked to perfection. We had iberico pork for mains and it was so tender and tasty.

Shout out to the service staff too. I like that the service was warm and friendly and not stuffy and overly formal like other high end restaurants.

Already made another two business lunch bookings.

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Finally tried the Colombian chicken ($5.50) for lunch. There’s option to add steamed vegetables (which I didn’t).
Tender meat, with lots of gravy, and nice salsa to accompany. The rice is flavored too which is a great addition. Not bad a meal! Portion would be small for a guy.

I have no idea what authentic Colombian food is but this stuff was delicious, inexpensive, and reminded me of my mom’s cooking. Owners were super friendly too! I ordered a second plate immediately after finishing the first. Also the chili is among the hottest I’ve had in SG! Which is a good thing.

Succulent chicken meat coupled together with aromatic rice and perfectly seasoned chopped tomatoes 👍🏻
Be sure to add on more vegetables for a nutritious meal
I tried coming a few times specifically for this shop, but they were closed.
Today I finally get to try their delicious food 👍🏻😀

Gobbled up all the rice before taking a photo because I was too hungry.
But hey, at least I've tried and tested it 😁

Ordered Colombian chicken rice. It came with two huge chicken thigh and drumstick. The Colombian flavour had an sweet and savory taste which was really nice. Owners were friendly too.

Found this unique hawker stall @teekitchenofficial selling 𝗖𝗼𝗹𝗼𝗺𝗯𝗶𝗮𝗻 𝗖𝗵𝗶𝗰𝗸𝗲𝗻 (honestly my first time hearing about this) at Golden Mile Hawker Center, and BB was pleasantly by how good this was! Can tell long hours of simmering had gone into this slow-cooked chicken stew - the meat was relatively fork-tender and absorbed the flavours from the moreish gravy. BB pretty much polished off their entire plate with their fragrant olive oil rice & tangy salsa! BB was wondering why they gave such a small dollop of chilli but understood why after taking a small mouthful - it packs a super spicy punch! 🥵🔥 For an additional dollar, you can get a bowl of vegetables (broccoli, carrots, cauliflower) to complete your meal. Quite enjoyed that the veggies were lightly salted and cooked just right! 👌🏻⁣
⁣
If you are looking for a dessert, don’t forget to try their Apple Crumble to end off on a sweet note!⁣
.⁣
📍Address: 505 Beach Road, Golden Mile Food Centre, #01-78, Singapore 199583⁣

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
my first time to try marinated raw crabs. it was surprisingly delicious, juicy and meaty. the one with the sinfully sweet orange fat was better. the meat selection was overshadowed by the crab but they were very good, too - melts in your mouth level good.

staff was warm, friendly and attentive.

My first time here. Great service! Meats are good and cooked as requested. Generous with side dishes as well.
The whole restaurant is clean and spacious. Great atmosphere!
Will come again next time with my friends.

Yesterday, we had a blast celebrating my sister's birthday at Nami Korean Grill House. The food was amazing, and while the cost was on the higher side, it was absolutely worth it! The service was fantastic, especially thanks to Kaijie, who took care of us most of the time. He definitely deserves a shout-out for his excellent service.

Great service and ambience nicely located within a quaint neighborhood. Really liked everything we ordered and glad we tried the marinated crabs which were fresh and tasty. Will definitely be back to try out other dishes.

Well-marinated Korean Bbq food and nice side dishes. High quality meat, and beef was super good.  Fried chicken & glass noodles were delicious, steamed egg was fluffy and pancake was excellent too.  Service was impeccable as well.
Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.name: Nami Korean Grill House by Hanjip

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Came here for lunch and there was already a long queue. Tried their sliced fish mee sua and added fish maw. Apparently all their noodles are handmade. Really tastes similar to home cooked food. There is a good balance of ingredients, just the right amount of everything - greens, fish slices, meat, mushroom etc. They were quite generous with the fish maw. The chilli and black sauce complemented really well with my dry mee sua. Comes with a bowl of soup as well. Would pop to eat again next time. Definitely recommended, especially when queue is short!

Worthy of the name Top 1, the noodles are decently priced and delicious.

We had the Tom Yum You Mia , Abalone Clam Mee Sua and Ban Mian. All 3 were distinct in their own flavors.
The Tom Yum soup was more of a thick gravy with a nice kick. The default soup was flavorful.
Lots of ingredients in all made us pretty full.

The 30 cents chilli is skippable if you are a chilli fiend, otherwise it is acceptable to normies.

We paid $16.80 for 3 bowls of soupy goodness. The only downside is the 30 mins plus queue time but I would say it's worth it.

Long Queue, ordered $5 dry ban mian. Although a small table spoon of chilli paste, it's very potent. Enjoyable experience when eating.

Meats and condiments are comforting.

Next time I will order a larger portion the next time.

Waited about 15 mins in line and another 10 mins after ordering for a dry ban mian. Very tasty ban mian and soup. Portion is a bit small compared to other ban mian places but I think this is very good quality. If you don’t mind waiting time then this is nice.

Top 1 Home Made Noodle holds a special place in my heart as my ultimate go-to stall for exquisite noodle delights. Despite the inevitable queue, the wait is undoubtedly worthwhile. Offering selection up to 8 distinct noodle varieties, from thin strands to thicker cuts, this multi-generational establishment has consistently delivered impeccable quality.

One of their standout dishes, Dry Noodle aka (Gan Lao Mian) stands as my personal favorite. Its chewy noodles bathed in a tantalizing combination of rich dark sauce and spicy chili create an explosion of flavors on the palate. The addition of premium toppings prawns, fish, and abalone elevates the experience to an unparalleled level of indulgence.

While the queue might seem daunting, the freshness of the soup speaks volumes about their commitment to quality. For anyone yet to savor the delights of this noodle haven, it's a must-visit destination. Top 1 Home Made Noodle is not just a stall, it's an experience that seamlessly blends tradition with culinary excellence. Prepare to be captivated by the harmonious marriage of chewy noodles, exquisite flavors, and premium toppings

Anyone have not tried it go for it you will love it for sure!

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Visited 18/09/23.

It's a small space.
But not there to soak the environment.
Here to eat good food and we weren't disappointed.

We had good Mee Siam and also Mee Rebus.
Both were fantastic.
The chilli - da best. 👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾
Taste were spot on. Portion was HUGE too!

No complaints from our side as we stuffed our mouths with deliciousness.

Will come again also for sure.

Arrived at 11.15am before the lunch crowd. Boss was a really friendly chap and recommended his specialties Nasi Kunyit and Mee Siam but I ordered Prawn Noodles and I was not disappointed.

This has got to be the best prawn noodles I had this year. The soup has solid taste of prawns. The yellow noodles were springy in terms of bite with crunchy bean sprouts. Loved their sliced red chilli sauce when you dip the two shells off prawns into. Brings back memories of how grandma would cook prawns noodles traditional way when I was young.

If the prawn noodles was already so good, must come back soon to try their specialties.

my parents & i visit this place pretty often & their standard is very consistent! all their dishes taste good. howeverrrr, i think you can give the drinks a pass 😵‍💫.

the owner is a very friendly guy who greets everyone by ‘sister’ & ‘brother’. the place & the dishes are very homely. their kueh’s and traditional nonya desserts are also v tasty!! i’d say give it a try if you’re in the area as it is also very value for money. portions are also filling enough!

The cakes are soooo delicious, especially the chocolate tart and the coconut. The coffee/tea and food prices are cheap and everything is good quality! Less sugar used in cakes and kueh too but tastes immense!

Food here is great, I had the Nasi Kunyit, Teh Peng and the Nonya Chendol. My friend ordered the Laksa Lemak, and made me regret not buying that even though the Nasi Kunyit was good. The Laksa just had a very thick and gao soup / sauce.

The Teh peng is different from most shops in that it's not too sweet, rather a thinner feel to it, and the flavour is more subtle. Something different that I enjoyed!

Oh, the seats aren't too comfortable for longer meals, and the payment is a little confusing, I don't know exactly when to pay (especially if you're ordering desserts or having a friend join a little later. But otherwise, I'll definitely recommend this place, especially the Laksa.

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Bought the $4.50 Satay Beehoon. The satay beehoon contains taupok, kangkong, beansprouts, cuttlefish, pig liver, sliced lean meat, blood cockles and a prawn. Every component was fresh and tasty, with the satay sauce bringing everything together. The satay sauce for satay beehoon is slightly on the savoury side while still having some of the sweetness that we are familiar with. The satay sauce is very tasty, boasting a depth of flavour.

There will almost always be a queue as the stall is very popular but the line moves very quickly and service is fast.

Not a commonly seen dish found in hawker centres so definitely give this dish a try if you are around the area.

There was always a long queue, and I am curious if it was worth queuing 15 minutes for the satay bee hoon. The queue moved fast because there was a well executed process in the stall to minimise waiting time. And the service was friendly.

As for the satay bee hoon, the satay sauce was not thick and lacked that wow feel on first taste. Good but not exceptional.

Opens only 4 days a week. They serve satay bee hoon as well. You can also choose to add bee hoon in the cuttlefish kang kong. This dish is no longer as easily available as before. The serving came with generous portion of cuttlefish, jellyfish, kang kong, bean sprouts and achar (!). The blend of sweet and sour sauce and chilli, crunchy cuttlefish, spicy and sweet achar made their version so unique. Their satay bee hoon was also good but not as spectacular.

5⭐️star for great taste and best satay gravy sauce ever. Very old school and now looks like the second generation youngster are taking over. Sister S and bro team whips out plate of super savoury satay bee hoon quickly and very efficient . Only downside is hawker center is really hot and the que always long😅

Been patronising this stall since I was a kid.
Taste been consistent all these years even after the 2nd Gen took over 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
Has to be one of the better Satay bee hoon around!

Highly recommend If you have not tried it!

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Went to their drive thru to grab a quick bite with the kids. Ordered 2 happy meals, and some extra nuggets. They forgot to include the toy and book in the bag, the nugget was not even warm. The fries were not fresh either. My kids were super disappointed. Will never come to this branch anymore.

This is most definitely the best restaurant in the entire country. People who disagree are tweaking out of their mind. It was my friends birthday and a staff member gave him a free ice-cream. Excellent service and customer service is phenomenal. Very nice to go with friends. Food is warm and excellent. 10 out of 10 would recommend.

Screw hidden in my egg McMuffin.

Edit: customer care have reached out to me. Editing this review to neutral as the response I received from the team shows that they are committed to food safety.

I have spent at least 200 dollars here. I have celebrated 4 birthdays here. I have cried here. I have laughed here. I have felt every emotion I can feel in the world here. I would say this place is my second home but it is not. It is my first home. Staff treat me better than my parents. The food here has brought me from suicidal to the happiest man alive. I love this place.

Had to try the limited time coconut soft serve cone, this is a location near me and with drive-thru, quick and easy .

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Been patronising this stall since I was a kid. Definitely one of the best chicken rice stall in the hawker center and around this area.
The rice has an unique and subtle flavour to it. Chicken is tender and chilli is nice. Very consistent taste as well. Always a queue during lunch. Highly recommended ! 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Possibly the best chicken rice in town . Affordable and absolutely delicious . They stop operating when Malaysia stopped exporting chicken but the good news is that they are now back !!! Store usually sell out by 1/2pm and there’s always a long line during lunch time . Chicken is succulent, fragrant and the rice is superbly cooked, separated grains .. you can’t go wrong with this

I really, really hate queuing for food, but every time this stall is open I just can't help it! Waiting time always exceeds 25 minutes, but there's a reason why everyone likes this stall.

Owner and his son are friendly, and portions are good. Rice here is very special, as it's fragrant and 'liap' (一粒一粒), yet not oily at all. No idea how they do it, but it's very unique.

So glad that they’ve reopened after taking a break due to the Malaysia chicken export ban. I’m happy to report that the standards have not dropped.

The chicken remains succulent; the rice fragrant, tasty but not too oily; the chilli punchy as ever. I’ve been eating this chicken rice for years and they have upheld the quality consistently. To me, this is the best chicken rice in Singapore.

Lots of reviews griping about the long waiting times due to phone orders. Give them a call in advance if you’d like to takeaway a bulk order. If not, please be prepared to wait in line for longer than expected.

Who doesn’t love chicken rice? There’re a few stalls in this Hawker Center, very much depend on guys taste buds. Ordered 2 drums, gizzards and hearts. Have to request for free soup. Rice is very fragrant. Chickens are very tender and sauce that drizzled over is tasty. The chillis are spicy and garlicky, not very well blended to my liking. The black sauce is very salty. $11.20 for the serving is consider average.

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Food quality was top notch and every dish was amazingly yummy and delicious! Definitely one of the top Spanish restaurants in Singapore!

Only 3 areas of improvement:
- to have more cocktail options, they had way too many wine options.
- it was relatively noisy at the courtyard, might be the infrastructure or design of the restaurant where the noise keeps bouncing back.
- should have cleared the plates on the table before serving the new dish, and not get customers to help hold the plates while they are serving.

It's a 4.5 stars for me personally.

My 7 y/o daughter and I enjoyed our dinner with TINTO. The service was impeccable - our server was attentive and patient with us, explaining the dishes as they were served.

The Gambas (prawn) starter was excellent and our favorite! The Grilled Asparagus was great, and we appreciated that it wasn't too salty. The Grilled Squid and Chorizo Paella didn't disappoint, albeit the serving was smaller than I expected.

All in all, a lovely experience and a small notch above Tapas Club.

Really liked this place: Elegant, but still relaxed atmosphere, attentive service. The person who seems to be the restaurant manager is indeed checking that everything is taken care of. I also appreciate that, at the beginning, they ask what type of water you like, including warm and ice water. This is a lovely attention to detail.
They have a full vegetarian menu with creative and interesting dishes - I want to come back to try more of these. Also very good Spanish wine options.
This would be a definite 5 stars if not for the below:
1) At our table, we had one starter and two mains. One of the mains was paella, which takes time to prepare (it's called out in the menu). They brought the other main so early, that one person at the table was pretty much done with the food when the paella arrived.
2) the vegetarian dish of the grilled gem lettuce was really nice, especially the chimichurri. Great use of herbs and flavours. Unfortunately, it was quite oily, which made it very heavy. A less oily preparation would have been great.

PS: The restaurant was full when we were there. For privacy reasons, I edited the other diners - but it certainly wasn't empty.

Party of 4...we came here for a birthday celebration. First impressions upon entering the restaurant exuded positive vibes - ambience, decor, welcoming crew. We were led to the inner section which was very cosy and inviting... I knew a great night was in store. Great menu and price points. We were attended to by the inimitable Ara who made the evening very enjoyable. The recommendations were on point. Food was fabulous. Overall a lovely lovely place for authentic Spanish fare. Highly recommended. Well done guys!!

Tapas were very unique and tasty. I believe we had the grilled octopus and some anchovy + burrata cracker. Paella was nothing exceptional. Desserts (rice pudding and orange cake) were alright. If I were to go again, I would order just the tapas.
Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.name: TINTO Spanish Restaurant Sg

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
The chicken wings are not as crispy and fragrant now as before but more saltish. I prefer my egg yolk for my sunny-side-up egg to be liquid oozing out to show its freshness with the bee hoon. The chilli sauce is not the hot oil paste but ngoh hiang type that goes well with the bee hoon.

One of the best Char Bee Hoon and Char Kway Teow Mee.

Chicken wings is a must try.
It was Crispy, tasty, fragrant, nice color. The meat was juicy and tender.

Price are reasonable.

Long Q, but it was cleared quite fast.

4 stars mainly for the chicken wing, which was juicy, tender and very tasty (but not as crispy as I would’ve liked)! Otah is quite good as well. Personally prefer the beehoon over noodles/kway teow.

The chilli is quite interesting, tasted like a blend of sweet sauce and chilli!

Food (chicken wings, fish fillet and bee hoon) is great, old school hawker centre super hot.

Having past experiences with their chicken wings, the ones were disappointing.
Chicken Wings ($1.30 each) were not as seasoned and the chili was slightly different, less fiery and more sweet.
A pity the brand seemed to be suffering in quality.

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Comfort food done well! Will pop by if i am in the area, but definitely wont travel just for this.
Overall, all the food is made decent well, for sure a classic!

Visited on a weekday night and the restaurant was fairly crowded during peak hours. One of the few places that serves really nice frog porridge. Prices were rather reasonable and food was served pretty fast.

The ginger onion frog leg claypot is the star dish. Topping it off with the fried intestine, cereal prawn, fried chicken wing, egg and dongpo meat, you will be feasting like a king.

Shiok ah!

Nice and many food choices. Just that the space for 2nd floor is a bit small and can be quite noisy if everyone is talking..overall very good.

There’s a dearth of good frog porridge out west, so the family is happy that NO.5 is alive and thriving. The claypot frogs are tasty enough (probably top 5 island-wide for us), with the standout dish here their signature fried tofu (a must-try).

I only wish that their servings were more consistent - depending on chance, you may end up with little or no sauce, resulting in strict rationing.  That and the slightly too starchy porridge result in the 4 star rating.
Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.opening_hours:

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.name: NO.5 Bukit Timah Live Bull Frog Claypot Porridge

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
This was my third or fourth time here. My last visit was quite awhile back. The food, ambience, and service here are very good! Parking is free! Place tends to get crowded and there’s sometimes a queue, so it’s wise to make a reservation before heading down. Had the dips and bread, octopus, sea bass, spinach pastries, and finally, baklava for dessert! Everything was great! Octopus was nice and tasty + tender, sea bass was fresh, all the pastries were warm and the Greek coffee we had to end the meal was pretty good too! Will be back here again to try more food! Hopefully sooner than later! Highly recommended for authentic Greek Mediterranean food! Fantastic experience every visit!

A lovely place for those looking for non pork meals. They don’t qualify as a halal place  as they serve alcohol. But good for Muslim friends. It was my first time here and it’s been a while since I had Greek food. I love the dips option from spicy to mild tasting dips. The fried calamari was great too followed by the medium rare lamb which was tender. Ensure you make a reservation to avoid disappointment. Good place to bring friends.

Always crowded on weekends such that even booking a table on same day is sometimes not possible.
I really enjoyed the medium meat platter. grilling was on point  meat was juicy and not dry.
moussaka went down way too easily. Greek dip platter was on point flavour wise and the taramasalata was flavourful without tasting too fishy.
sadly the pita bread is pretty small portioned, I'm not sure how you're expected to finish the dip given with the portions served
Grilled octopus was also delicious.

Service was friendly and efficient.
Decor isn't very Greek but honestly ambience is great (albeit a bit noisy)

It's harder to get a table here than the at its closest competitor, and for  good reason.

Good food. Although the beef can be on the dry side, everything else was delicious.

Highly recommend the grilled octopus. It is not chewy at all. For those who don’t like squid or octopus, try to have a bite.

Restaurant is packed on a Friday night and the food arrives pretty quick. Staff are quite alright. Some could use a little refining in politeness.

There’s complimentary licorice candy. Absolutely love it.

Will visit this place again. But recommend to come here in a bigger group to order a larger variety of dishes.

First visit. Reservation was smooth via seven rooms. We chose an outdoor table as the weather was pleasant. The food was delicious. We had the whole oven chicken and chicken yiro wrap with fries. Pesto pasta was good as well. Desserts were amazing too. Overall highly satisfied.
Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.name: Blu Kouzina Dempsey

Colombian cuisine in Bukit Timah.reviews:
Great laksa! Thick broth and relatively filling portion for me. Also ordered the shepherds pie and i love it! The meat was well cooked and juicy, the mashed potato on top was also good.

The mango sago was yummy too with lots of sago but looks like they put quite a bit of colouring too as it was staining the plastic container it came in.

Service is prompt and quite friendly..
Their chicken curry rice, Mee siam, laksa and curry Mee all tasted really decent. Especially their ondeh cake ($8.90) not very cheap, it’s special as there is sauce to top on the cake. But it’s nice.
Will recommend if you are nearby and if the queue is reasonable.

Around for 40 years and now spearing the nonya spread by 02nd & 03rd generation.

Laksa was out of the world! Bringing back of my grandma taste…. Humble stall but big favours!

A must to try for lunch or if u r around here, do consider packing their laksa or chendol.

Is it over rated?

It was as as early as 11am when I stumble upon  this eateries. Usually, it was crowded and I have never patronize it. But today it was empty so I thought they weren't open but out curiosity i probe and they said they will open at 11:30 so I decided to wait. Which gave me some time to read some of the reviews on the wall and I am really impressed. Not before long, I saw a few customers come to collect orders they had placed, seems really popular and I'm glad.

Since the review on Mee Rubus and Laksa sounds good, so, I ordered both... hehehe.

While I'm queuing to wait to pay for my food, a lady budge and she explained, she ordered before me... I was really puzzled, how can that be? And she add on, "don't worry, I'm a Singaporean and I don't cut queue..." that statement make by her seems offensives. Then she threw $50, to the lady that was serving me and she took her money. She begins to justified herself by saying seems I am still taking out my cash, she is oblige to take the other customer's... and she said it was company policy?!

I couldn't believe what I hear and I ask, "policy?" Then she make the most offensive remarks by saying, "I don't have time for such people..." I was stunt and then in the kitchen, a man told me to "chill"

I was furious with that remark and I believe I was by far being composed but for the sake of trying out the food, I walked back to my seat and then to find my seat taken by another person. What a day!

Anyway, my food came, and it looks good. By the way, I also ordered Chendol and water to rinse out my mouth so I can have an objective opinion.

I go for the Mee Rubus first and I like the thickness of the gravy as I stir and mixed it well. The noodles was well cooked and when I got very noodles mixed and soaked up with the very nutty gravy, I took the first bite. Slurping some more to firm up my decision. Unfortunately, it did not meet up with my expectation. Maybe it's a little too sourish to my liking but in fairness, I like the thickness of the gravy. But, it did not won my 5 star ratings and the comment on the wall seems incredulous. Anyway,  it is really a difference in opinion and I have my Laksa to taste.

After rinsing my mouth,  I begin to devour one of my favourite dishes, Laksa. I do not claim to be a food connoisseur but I believe I have enough Laksa in my lifetime to determine what is good, better or best.

The first impression was good. The looks of the Laksa was acceptable but when I eat it I felt that something was missing. To me, the true essence of a great Laksa is in its broth. Besides, the spices and ingredients, the slight pungent sense of dried shrimp must be prominent and of course the Lemak should be thick. Plus, the chilli offered could be much better.

Despite of this, I ate more of the Laksa than the Mee Rubus and again, in my opinion, the food can be better but not to the extend of warranting a long queue. Plus, I never waste food.

But I am not convince with my own assessment as I read other good reviews and awards on the wall therefore I investigated further and these were some of the comments from other patrons and neighbours. Most of the remarks were: it was better when his mom is selling it.

That was a revelation to me, and hopefully, this long review can challenge the owner of Nonya Delicatessen to continue the legacy build by the mother.

Came here on weekend later afternoon. No crowds. Ordered mee siam and laksa. Saw food being microwaved, it is a no go for this reputable outlet. The mee siam is sour enough and laksa is flavourful. But after one hour, drink plenty of water...yuks msg laden food. Did not expect msg from a famed nonya food outlet.

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.reviews:
This cozy restaurant has left the best impressions! Lynn is very friendly & she recommended us delicious dishes. The presentation of food is beautiful & there’s a wonderful selection of desserts to end with! I would wlike to come back here again and again.

Came here for a birthday celebration and we were served by the pleasant and friendly Kai, who gave us excellent recommendations and advised us on the portions. Service was great and our food came super fast to the point that we got full a bit early. Kai noticed this and helped slow down the subsequent dishes. We had the octopus and truffle egg mash for starters. The dishes were all superb and up to standard but the portions were pretty big too so be warned not to overorder. The highlight for us was the seafood paella and the iberico pork, each spoonful of the paella was bursting with flavour and fresh seafood, we felt like we were one with the ocean itself. Our table for two was also very spacious. They served a light Basque baked cheesecake on the house for our birthday celebration. Will definitely be back again!

This restaurant really has it all! The service, the food and atmosphere. We were also served by an amazing waiter, Kai. One of the best genuine services! His recommendations for food and drinks were top notch =) He even insisted to take away the leftovers. And he was right, still so good the next day! Don’t miss taking photos outside the mansion. It’s too pretty to miss!

We celebrated my wife birthday at Una on a Friday. Only set lunch option available unless we pre ordered tapas. Service crew is very friendly here, keep checking our water is filled. The food is delicious! The server also surprised my wife with a slice of cake for her birthday! What a great place to celebrate birthdays.

Overall it was a great dining experience. The staffs are friendly.
The foods are delicious. The Ibérico pork was great however it could’ve been better if it was cooked medium rare. As in the picture the right side was alright while the left side was kinda dry, about medium well to well done.

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.reviews:
Nearest hawker centre to mount faber. Good pit-stop for breakfast /brunch … lotsa variety of food options. Many popular stalls with a long queue. Queued for the “Ban Mian / Fish Soup” … ordered Ban Mian (handmade noodles) & couldn’t resist to add a few pieces of golden fried batang fish. I enjoyed it 🤓

Simple tasty meal @3.50 . Portion given is ok.
Nice gravy with fresh garlic , celery , chillies.
Always sold out fast before 1pm

Kopi O $1.80 x2 cup. 90 cent each. Food here are reasonable price and mainly good for most stores here

I think this is one of the best food courts in Singapore. In particular, there is excellent Malay and Indian food! A lot to explore.

Great place with variety of food choices for everyone. Always go this particular stall called NM Hussain Mee Goreng to try their Mutton Soup and fried rice. Best taste and opposite is a parata shop too named Al Amin.

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.reviews:
Good hearty bowl of mixed beef dry noodles.

Sesame oil is added by default.

If you like the taste of beef in all it's glory, I would recommend to skip the sesame oil altogether.

The sesame oil is good but it is also overpowering the main star of the dish...the beef!

I have eaten quite a few dry beef noodles but most don't add sesame oil.

I love the generous amount of dark brown gravy accompanying the bowl of noodles. The soup was flavourful and great.

Quite hard to find this coffeeshop/food court as it is on the 2nd floor and only easily accessible by staircase that leads to the main road.

Highly recommended!

👍👍

Ordered mixed beef noodle with gravy. Food is so so only. Gravy is thick enough but too salty. Not much ingredients. Stall owner is very unfriendly and unhelpful. Shouted at me for ‘not able to understand and order’ in a way he understood. Also almost knocked off the tray with the food in front of me and never apologized. Will never order anymore.

Had no 2 which is w tendon.
Excellent bowl of beef kway tiao soup, tendon is nice & gelatinous which takes time to do.
Extra points for having 3 types of chilli👍🏻.
Will try the dry version next time.
Only downside is the coffeeshop is pretty warm despite so many fans.
Try to sit near this stall as it’s cooler on this side then the side w the economical rice.

Still one of e better dried beef horfun I have eaten.
$5 for a sliced beef bowl. Add $2 extra meat. Omg.... love it.
Soup s beefy n umami. 😋
Worth it. Must try.

Was attracted by their variety of beef noodle options, beef balls, mixed entrails and many more. Decided to go for my all time favourite dry beef sliced rice noodle.

Impressed by their choice to use porcelain bowls and it is the rooster printed type, gave me a traditional olden days feel especially with the piping hot soup and noodles. Many vendors have abandoned forsaken such practice to save cost and for ease of handling. This bagged their first star!

Generous portion of noodles and beef slices, the portion of meat is definitely enough to last with the noodles which is so rare to find nowadays. Many foodcourts’ renowned beef noodle stalls in only give 4-5 tiny thinly sliced beef with few mouthful portion of noodles.

The gravy is thick & tasty towards sweet but still acceptable for me who usually prefers more savoury food. The sliced beef is tender and chewable. The soup is flavourful but can be improved as it lacks the wow factor of simmered soup base. The effort to top the soup & noodle with generous amounts of garnish is applaudable.

Not the best that I have tasted but it beats many foodcourt ones. It is value for money at $5 with good presentation and taste. Thumb up, will be back to try the other variety.

Side note: Help yourself to the type of chilli sauce and cincalok.

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.reviews:
Was there for after lunch dessert, didn’t try their main. Unfortunately we didn’t like the kueh and desserts. The bobo chacha has too much sweet potatoes and a little too sweet. Chendo, as you can see, not lemak enough. Not much fragrance to the rice kueh selection and some rice weren’t well cooked. The sugee cake has a little nutty feel but overall not to my liking. But the ambience is quite good, with choice to sit in aircon inside, a little cramp though. You can sit outside, sufficient fans and air cooler fan around. Tables and chairs looking clean.

The food is nice and serving is good for 2 people. Like that it is dog friendly at the outside dining area. Can slightly before lunch time on a PH and it was almost full during lunch. 👍🏼 glad I found this place

White rice is different. Was using Indian rice. It good. Foods nothing special, it just a normal peranakan dish. Can go and try it out. One of the quiet place and environment I like.

This place is good. We spent $76 today. The kueh pie tee is so good - Met my expectation. The ingredients of the food here are fresh and good. The only disappointing item is the Bobo chacha - too little soup but they give lots of yam and sweet potatoes. The yam is not soft enough。it will be nicer if the texture is the 粉 粉 type.  Service is ok. They accept cash or PayLah only. No credit card payment.

Authentic and delicious Peranakan food. They also serve Peranakan snacks and kueh.

Family run. The food is home cook quality what you would like to eat every night.

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.reviews:
Blk 11 Telok Blangah Cres Food Centre #01-113

Not knowing what to eat..... I just follow the Q for this stall !

Looking at the Menu, I like it....
Simple ! Nothing much to choose from.😂😂
Will be no 选择障碍...

If u wana patron them, u must be extra patience ya.
Need to be more understanding after u see how uncle serve every order with his pride. U see how Uncle did his plating !!!

Gravy available  - Lor or Curry.
Warning ! Your Bee Hoon will be super Drench🤣🤣 (like eating zichar Hor Fun kind)

Close on - MON/THUR/SUN

Portion - 3.50/4.50. Take away add 20c for box

One of the BEST VEG Bee Hoon I ever had. 😂😂

#素缘 Vegetarian

Enjoyed the vegetarian bee hoon ($3) - the mock char siew had a barbecued flavour, the bee hoon was warm and wet and not fried. The lunchtime queue was 30 mins long even though it wasn’t a very long line.

Tried their vegetarian bee hoon and liked it. Please come with patience (not if you are in a hurry) if you plan to try this stall. Uncle serves slowly but calmly and politely with a smile and thanking customers for their purchase. One of the vegetarian stall I will patronise again in future. Keep up the standard of food and sincere service :-)

The bee hoon is good, that's all I can say about this stall, most times on the weekend, it takes about 25mins to 30 mins to get to your turn, mainly because. The service is slow, if that is just the sole reason, I would still queue for it, but the auntie manning the fort have been consistantly rude and has zero service attitude. The attitude alone is not worth anyone time.

Extremely S. L. O. W. seller. The queue is forming not due to it being nice or popular but the serving is really really slow. Average 4 mins to serve a person. The uncle will use his tongs to slowly take ingredients, then come the cutting part.... was sitting there and watching it could not help shaking my head. Best part is the lady assistant can still play with a distracting baby from another stall. Really hope another vegetarian stall will spring up! There's actually another 2 stalls here selling same stuff but most of the times closed, people are queuing here thinking it's good not knowing how slow the uncle is.. Still shaking my head cos still serving same lady by time I finished this review.
