Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.reviews:
The location is really interesting. Gives me the feeling of a Taiwanese restaurant that is outside of the city, when I travel to Taiwan.
The restaurant spreads the table giving good space to enhance the dining experience.
Food is generally good, although I find some dishes a little saltier than what I would prefer. But 真的不错吃！😊
If you have got been here before, give it a try! Quite a unique place.

Awesome food. Was so good and ate a lot. Portion is reasonable. Ordered approximately 11 dish of varying sizes for $250++. No regrets.

A classic Chinese Tze char eatery for the nostalgia. Food was decent and not too salty. I really liked the pumpkin tofu as the tofu was very silky. Coffee ribs were a bit of a misrepresentation as it was pork slices (easy to eat coz it’s boneless I guess?) Am still on the search for a good Yam ring which wasn’t fulfilled here although still ok but  unfortunately the Yam felt like it was cooked in overused oil. Fried mee sua was underwhelming.

Aunt picked this place for her 84th birthday treat & was disappointed. The place kind of messy maintained outside & ordered dishes are not the best. The chilli crab doesn't look & taste as said. Management proposed to wash the sauce off to re-cooked into pepper crab, which still tastes average. The sauce for the fish head had so much starch that turned into paste when cold. The black pepper beef is overcooked, rough & tough like John Wayne. Although the desserts are thrown in by Management & I'd the yam paste which many highlighted... my verdict ... disappointed.

We'll 04 agreed that this'll be our 1st & last.

We had a team lunch at Sum Kee, was pretty disappointed with the taste and the price being charged especially the crab meat tofu, which is very little crab meat and the tofu portion is very small and bland, medium for $33.
The only great dish was salted egg chicken.
Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.name: Sum Kee Food

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.reviews:
It’s good mutton briyani for $6.50 with tender meat. It’s not gamey like most I have tried. Usually I dnt take mutton. But this is real light in taste but with strong herbs.

Simply one of best mutton briyani you can find. Rem to ask for extra curry which fused with fragrant mutton flavor.

The usual stall that we have always patronised was not open on the day and thus we were given a good reason to try out the other popular stall in Telok Blangah Food Center. We remembered many of the diners enjoying their plate of Briyani from one of the Muslim stalls and guess it's our time to try it out now.

At one glance at the stall signboard, they are offering biryani and roti prata only. For Briyani, there is a choice of chicken or Mutton.

Who needs a good presentation of the food when it tasted good? For both Chicken & Mutton Briyani, do expect the eye-pleasing serving that has a delicious drum or meat topping up the plate of Basmati Rice, papadum and colourful pickles to entice you. Instead, I would say what they prepared was a bare minimum, cut cucumbers, meat and rice with a plate of curry.

The first mouthful of the rice had landed me an understanding of why people are patronising them. No doubt that the food was simple and straightforward, I must say that their rice is very fluffy and non-greasy at all. There is no gamey taste from the mutton. The meat was tender and the meat literally fell off the bone with the slightest effort. I drenched my plate of Briyani with the curry gravy given and had enjoyed every grain of it.

Mutton Briyani - $6.50

The chicken Briyani too, was tender and delicious with meat falling apart easily. Curry was thick and satisfying.

Chicken Briyani - $6

Overall, food is of the right amount of spice and not overpowering in any aspect of taste. I will be back again!

I would have given them 5 stars if the biryani comes with papadum.

Very thick and flavorful curry (both chicken and mutton). Both meat was cooked to almost perfection.

Very fluffy basmati bryani rice. Not oily and delicious. Mutton was soft and tender.. curry have just the right touch of spices. Popular stall

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.reviews:
Wanted to eat mee goreng at the food center but it's closed.

Came over to the coffeeshop and noticed a new Indian food stall, so I ordered mee goreng from them.

It looks, not the usual red Indian mee goreng, just an unusual color.

The shock was, $7 for a plate.  Everywhere else is selling at $4.50 or at most, $5.  $7!  It's really expensive!  I was really unpleasantly and uncomfortably surprised!

Back to the mee goreng.  It doesn't taste the familiar mee goreng taste.  The sauce, was it chilli or tomato sauce? It taste a bit stale so I didn't want to take it.

Noticed there were a lot more Mutton than the usual, so that's why it's $7.  BUT who pays $7 for a plate of fried mee goreng at the coffeeshop or food center?

I wouldn't want to try anything else again, for I'll likely get another shock I'm not prepared for.

Good luck guys. I wonder if the business can last.

A nice coffee shop w a variety of food and all were pretty good!

We tried the stall selling ipoh food and their curry mee was really nice, especially the soup version. Beef noodles from Horiginal was really nice and not too gamey. The portion is really huge! Oyster omelette was not bad too.

1 star for the drink stall. Ordered teh c and it tasted horribly diluted. Just a sip and I am done with it.

3 stars as there are really quite a number of interesting food stalls here including the famous char kway teow supposedly with generous serving of cockles with a super long queue. Tried the prata stall and it was pretty good.

Very good char kway teow and beef noodles
Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.name: 78A Telok Blangah L2 Coffee Shop

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.reviews:
A pretty okay and decent food centre which is not too heaty - the ventilation was actually quite okay.

The prawn noodle here is pretty good. You got to go queue early (11.30am or earlier) for lunch. Well priced and filling.

Good food but not for morning bird, if you are too early there is nothing there.

Smallish place but houses some great local food

Nice porridge and chicken served at Tiong Bahru Wah Yuen Porridge. Only open on weekends, please note

The tea at 七时年代 was good

Try the Hong Kong Soy Sauce Chicken hor fun

As usual the prawn noodles is a crowd favourite 👍.... they’ve been around >20 years!

You can find one of the best fried carrot cake here!

Hong Ji wanton mee is popular. I would prefer my noodles to be less over cooked though. It’s still nice and value for money

LABRADOR Malay food stall’s lontong was good although the tau kwa was hard

Delicious bryani rice at Sabeen Sara! Mutton was soft and basmati rice was light and fluffy. The prata dough was freshly handmade at the stall!

Yanan ban mian was surprisingly nice especially with the fresh fried fish.

The black carrot cake is kind of sweet for me. The white one tastes good thuo. Other stalls like the Prawn noodle, Char siew noodle and seafood Hor fun worth trying too. After 3pm all shop will be closed...

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.reviews:
When opened, char kway teow and carrot cake are awesome stalls. Only downside to the place is that there aren't alot of choices but they mostly cater to the residents nearby.

The taste is nice, simple yet refreshing. Cost $5.00 for the noodle while coffee from stall #01-50 cost $1.00.

Here got lot of good food, clean and a quiet environment.

Stopped there after a long walk on the hill. Was a great place to discover the real local neighbourhood live away from the tourist areas. Super friendly service by the hawker stall staff and excellent food at good value.

Not so crowded usually. Several good stalls for lunch. Duck rice, CKT, noodles and Bah Chor Mee.

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.reviews:
Enjoyed dinner with the family. We ordered the Sea Food Pizza and the truffles pasta as well as spicy crab pasta. There was even a fantastic live band. Only grouse...somewhat secluded and the elderly would find it difficult to climb up the stairs leading to Alkaff Mansion where the restaurant is located.

Beautiful location, tasteful greenhouse, food is not bad (we stopped today just for coffee), but I wanted to make a point about their cooling devices... about 6-10 of these things on full blast for about 10 customers, on an overcast day at 8am. Also blasting loud pop.

One can be in paradise but still feel like you're in a city centre. Pity. The park offers a natural advantage, and people's expectations after a long sweaty walk will not be the same as in the middle of town.

Zero points for sustainability.

My dining experience at Wildseed Café at The Alkaff Mansion was thoroughly impressed by both the exquisite cuisine and the impeccable service from Ms Valencia that serve our table with utmost sincerity and earnestness to let us feel welcome. Ambience and style of restaurant excellent and the food was amazing. I can’t recommend Wildseed Café enough for a fantastic dining experience.

Came for breakfast after my walk. Made reservations to ensure I have a seat.
Ordered the Big Platter to share but portions weren’t that big. Ordered add-ons too. Loved the sourdough bread.
Ordered long black and a pot of Earl Grey which was served in half a pot only.
Wished they have more options for cakes.

Had a wonderful lunch here although parking maybe a problem. The ambience was great. We ordered chicken katsu waffle, prawn and scallop pizza and soft shell chilli crab linguine. The food was sumptuous and delectable.
Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.opening_hours:

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.name: Wildseed Café at The Alkaff Mansion

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.reviews:
Great old school cantonese style porridge. The boneless wings are also really good but the steam chicken is a must try. Soft, tender and really well marinated so you don’t even need any sauce. Just eat it on its own and it is delicious.

My old neighbourhood. Have not been back since I shift out to Yishun 20 years ago. If not wrong they have been there since 1997-ish or earlier . Glad still found this stall around. Dad and son team dished out yummy dishes. Best chicken wing ever. They de-boned the chicken wing before frying. Eat with their fried bee hoon damn shiok! 白暂鸡also can eat.

Surprise find in an old neighbourhood when we are looking for places that sell porridge near Vivocity area. Took away 1 bee hoon, 2 porridges (fish and chicken), 4 fried chicken wings & 1 cuttlefish cabbage. Taste super 古早味 and even my children who are 7 & 10 years old enjoyed the food. Very affordable comfort food. Will be back again though we live quite far away.

Great tasting congee and bee hoon. Easily the top ten in sg. Nostalgia old school taste that I misses a lot. The wings are Boneless and made upon order. A little oily though. Ps: I think one of the two uncles has some listening issues... Some customer may think he is being rude.

Affordable and tasty food. Love their porridge that is silky smooth and their boneless chicken wings. Only available in the PM. Operated by a father and son who work on the orders separately and do not do small chats. Just make your orders and wait patiently because they are definitely introverts hahhaah

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.reviews:
First off, this uncle is such a pleasant, polite and friendly man! Not an ounce of arrogance despite being so popular. Truly admirable!
As for his char kway teow, it’s one of the classic renditions still available.
More on the moist side, slightly sweet, a good amount of tasty crispy pork lard but not too much of the lard oil, which is good because it doesn’t feel so sinful.
Really good for cockle fans!
Best eaten there.

Uncle is so sweet! He opened the stall a little early at around 4pm because there was already a "sitting" queue on a Saturday. Usually, he says it's around 5pm.

It's totally worth the craze- wok hey Kway Teow with crispy lard and delicious cockles. Only 1 size portion - $5 and max 10 per order.

If you are done, you can return the empty plate to the grey bin and the chopsticks to the smaller green bin.

Uncle also does his stall preparation is secret with the binds down. 😂

Prepare for 1.5h queue. Uncle cooks plate by plate so each person about 10mins on average. One of the best CKTs I ever had in sg and is on the wet side. Pork lard very crispy and fragrant, stock used is sufficient. 1 size only at $5. The queue is too long for me to eat this again tho

Hand down one if not the best Char Kway Teow in Singapore! Came in $5 portion only. Plenty of fresh cockles and crispy pork lard in the noodle. Sometime you have to wait a hour or more if people in front order a lot of packets but it is definitely worth the wait! Uncle is soft spoken and friendly too!

Long wait time as he fries each plate at a time. But puts in a lot of effort for each plate. No lap cheong but loaded with lots of cockles and bean sprouts. Five dollars per plate no more no less and so filling.

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.name: Hai Kee Teochew Cha Kuay Teow

Venezuelan food in Telok Blangah.reviews:
Recommended by friend to this ckt. First time in this food centre. Very quiet and not many stalls open. Longest queue is here at this stall.

Waited about 20mins with 8pax infront of me. Uncle fries 1 plate at a time but he is quite fast in my opinion.

Ordered a $4 medium portion ckt and added an egg for 70cents.

I was lucky to get an order with 2 egg yolks in my fried egg. Loved how strong the wok hei is in the noodles and the bits of pork lard mixed in it. Everyone ahead of me ordered with the extra fried egg and I can understand why. The gooey egg yolk mixed with noodles was heaven. Not to be missed.

Will definitely be back to eat again.

Queued close to one hour for this fire Char Kway Teow stall ran by two elderly folks. I saw this stall on Youtube which is recommended by a popular local food eater.

This kway teow noodle suits my taste bud perfectly because it is not too dry, the black soy sauce is not overpowering sweet. I suggest order $4 for a slightly bigger portion as $3 portion is really small serving. Sunny side up egg add on another 70 cents, but is runny egg yolk and also added with some soy sauce on top (see video). Too bad I didn’t got the double egg yolk! Take note this stall doesn’t include cockles which is perfect for me.

The food centre here is relatively spacious and airy. Queuing here is certainly not the most humid experience for sure. Plenty of seatings so no need chop table with tissue packet. Am surprise the people here are friendly for a chit chat about the food. They mentioned usually got no long queue for this stall.

Taste is subjective!!! Hope your enjoy it. Do take note of their operation days.

Went on a Sun morning at 11.30am and there was no queue - just one customer in front. The queue started forming from 11.50am ;-)

The CKT doesn’t have much wok hey but, thankfully, was not oily. The $4 portion was a little small too for my liking. To me, not the best CKT for sure in SG. What’s nice though is listening to the loud tunes of the song birds at the nearby pet bird shop while having the CKT!

Above average plate of CKT, it’s definitely less sweet than usual but still flavorful especially with crispy pork lard and lap cheong! Just need to note that the sunny side up is an add-on to the price of the CKT (70cents) - honestly I feel the CKT could do without the additional egg!

There is no cockles in the dish but it is packed with decent amount of lup cheong and fried pork lard. Super shiok if you like them. I would feel it's well compensated for the absense of cockles and the taste isn't compromised. But if cockles is a must have for you in CKT then this place is probably not for you!
Add 70cents to have a sunny side up egg on your CKT. Super lucky to have double yolk for my first visit! Uncle cooks the dish plate by plate so do expect a small wait but the waiting time is ok for me.

But the "golden clay pot" was alright, should have gone for the more mainstream clay pot rice or 麻油鸡 for example. Might try again if I'm back here.

Laotian restaurants in Jurong West.reviews:
Would recommend the basil pork rice (tasty & value for money $7.90) and the fried pork neck (tender and juicy meat, lightly fried).

Would not recommend the pineapple rice (too dry and lack of pineapple) and red Tom yum soup (too thick and salty even after we requested for less salty)

Service from staff is very good. Place can get crowded during meal times.

Standing itself at the wild west of jurong. A rare find if you are alone.

Lonely looking for some vibes before going home.

Try this place. Still people from all walks are here. So you won't feel lonely. Drinking talking,

Trying the bbq pork neck and of course goes with Chang beer.

Peace.

Overall dishes are tasty. Their pad Thai, Tom yam and deep fried garlic pork is a must try!

PS: Just take note that there will be queue during dinner time. So do make your way there earlier to avoid the crowd.

A place to go to when I have Thai Food craving. We always get a table as we visit on weekdays. Service staff are pleasant and friendly. Tasty Thai food which are reasonably priced with huge portion. Will be good for 4 pax or more if you would like to try more dishes.

Our all time favorite is their fried pork cheeks which is only $12.

Their pricing on the menu is nett price, so i personally it cheap for such authentic Thai food adapted to local taste buds.

The crispy  pork cheek very nice. Go with Tom yum clear soup and mango salad. The yellow curry seafood smell fragrance and tasteful. Price affordable rate. Highly recommended as it really authentic Thai food.

Laotian restaurants in Jurong West.reviews:
Delicious white pepper bak kut teh with refillable soup! It's worth it for $10.80 as there are 4 pieces of pork ribs which are quite tender. The waitress also took initiative to refill our Pu er tea and soup. Food was served promptly after ordering. Clean and spacious environment. A hidden gem in Taman Jurong!

Pretty nice BKT with 2 types of base soup for your preference. Impressed that they also have some tze char dishes for those who are not into BKT. Recommend that you get premium ribs since its easier to eat with tender meat. Soup are refillable - hurray! Prices quite reasonable but rice at $1. Finally being your own tissues because they charge for wet wipes.
Parking available since its at Taman Jurong Bowl. Will return for BKT craves.

One of my favourite place to host client, family and friend!

Nice food, environment and friendly staff!

Love their herbal and white pepper bah ku teh, with unlimited (I guess?) soup refill!

Have tried their other dishes, mostly ok for me, and their price are reasonable, for me is restaurant standard, coffee shop price, worth to try 😁

Yummy soup with free refill of soup only. We had nice peanuts and hard boiled eggs, fried chicken, bitter gourds with salted eggs… staffs are friendly and crowds are moderate at peak hours…

Comfortable and spacious interior, suitable for families with kids. I personally prefer the white peppery Bah Kut Teh soup over the herbal one. There is a huge variety of options for diners. The chicken rice set was pretty good too. Reasonable price.
Laotian restaurants in Jurong West.name: 老2肉骨茶(Lao Er Bak Kut Teh)

Laotian restaurants in Jurong West.reviews:
This place is good for a soupy meal. I like the soups they make and their Seafood Hor fun.

The only issue is that there are plenty of flies. For years they are having this problem and they can’t seem to sort it out.

Service is a hit or miss. But for me it’s generally good.

Healthy and tasty food. Nice and clean environment, though now the seats are a bit too close to each other. Free top up of the soup once. Flavourful! Tried different dishes and so far very tasty.

IG: sgfood13
Tiktok: gohht13

Service could be better. Food taste average. Used to have dimsum menu but sadly they removed it. You get a refill of the soup though( once ), which isn't allowed at other branch.

Update Nov ‘22: Soup isn’t as flavourful anymore, and a lot of the dishes were undercooked - chicken was red, pork rib was red, bitter gourd too tough.. dropping to 2 stars ⭐️

Can’t find any fault with the quality and taste of the food here, it’s all wonderfully done.

There is also a 1 x free refill on all soups, which pretty much fills 60-70% of the bowl. Also, it’s a good idea to takeaway the refill portion of the soup if you can’t finish both bowls in one setting 😉

However, the service level and price is a little off imo. (Or maybe we just weren’t used to the GST and service charge after 4 months at home - $116 for 4 pax, you be the judge)

Delicious and nurturing Chinese home dishes. Preferred the lotus root soup with more herbal taste than the chicken herbal soup which is too sweet. The homemade tofu is very good. Just soup and tofu with rice for 2 is very filling. Ordered 1 soup and 1 dish and get another soup free. Great bargain for a satisfying meal! 👍🏼

Laotian restaurants in Jurong West.reviews:
Normally chicken rice shop will come with cucumbers but this shop provide olive leaf and slice tomato, it is quite refreshing as well.

Their Chili is the best. For sure you will go back again next.time.

Delicious plate of chicken rice !  Delicious toufu too

I am shocked that simple observation of this stall did not suggest how fantastic or tasty this chicken rice stall is. At 11.30, only 2 whole roasted chicken and 1 steamed whole chicken is seen. The workers at the stall look sleepy and unmotivated. I dare NOT buy cos I don't trust the reviews here.

So I first tried their chicken rice back in 2011 when a friend recommended it to me. I have been going back to this stall regularly to eat their chicken rice, the chilli is really good which compliments the chicken and the stall owner is really friendly as well, do give them a try you will not regret it.

Laotian restaurants in Jurong West.name: Lao Er Herbal Soup 老2煲靓汤 (Ah Er Soup 阿2老火汤)

Laotian restaurants in Jurong West.reviews:
Pork trotter vinegar with mee sua.

Mee sua was average as it soaked some of the braising vinegar.

Pork trotter was very good. Braised till tender and flavorsome. The vinegar was balanced with acidity, sweetness and fat. They are generous with their portion.

The combination did not work for me as it made the dish heavy tasting. Probably better with plain rice.

Tried their lor mee, gravy texture just nice, not too thick not too watery.
I ordered bee hoon, and bee hoon are well cooked, generous amount of ingredients.
They also got sell braised pork rice.
Worth a try.

The lor mee nice, portion big, a lot ingredients. Frequent come. But close when I came sometimes just double check today that they Close Tues wed n chu yi shi wu...

Tasty homely food..

06 Feb 22’
It's the first time to patronize this stall's braised noodles, the taste is good. $4 a bowl.
Recommended.

A hidden gem located at a corner in the Tahoe Garden coffeeshop, with just the owner aunty as the chef. Delicious and affordable Thai food with very generous portions. Ridiculously long queue on weekend nights.

Location is wrong. Blk474 Jurong West  st 41 dont have any kopitiam. Should be at Tahoe Garden 大和園 Kopitiam at Blk493 instead.

Best Phad Thai in Jurong!

Best Thai Food in Jurong West

Good and nice Thai food

Laotian restaurants in Jurong West.reviews:
- they do not allow reservations and
- the open area of the restaurant is quite warm.

We went for lunch and there were 15 of us. Food was good but the service was slightly slow as it was peak hour.
We spend a total of SGD 414 for 13pax which we thought was ok for the place.

Left with full stomachs and smiles on our faces!

Although there are several outlets of Sanook Kitchen in Singapore, we feel that this outlet is better compared to the others in terms of the taste of the food and the attitude of the service staff. Complimentary popcorn was served before our meal. The food was served within minutes of ordering and every item was worth the price we paid. Great place to go for a casual lunch or dinner!

Not the best Thai food I have tried, chicken pad Thai kinda tasteless but the texture of the noodle is still fine. Lemon tea less sugar taste better. Free pop corn is provided which is surprised for me. Staffs are friendly and helpful.

There are good selections of vegetarian options here! Price is pocket friendly and we love their stir-fries!! Spicy food here are super shiok too, great for people who love spicy food. And kids will be delighted with the free popcorns!

Is my first time here after seeing the overall positive review. I am so sorry to say it doesn’t taste anything like Thai food. We order the big fish but is too dry. Price range is affordable, but the fish is not cheap plus poor culinary skill, not worth ordering it. I don’t need the popcorn honestly but kind gesture. Tried and done with it. Never going back.

The lady cashier at this Korean Stall is ridiculous, she just like to scold every customer for a small matter. If I can give negative 5 stars I will do that. Pls sack this lady if you want to improve your business. The customer all nearby residents I don't think I will come back to this stall whenever I saw her there. 😡

Sucks to max. Order wrong, not according to q, tasteless korean food. Simply everything is wrong, dont eat at this korean stall, try other nice food in koufu

Not sure if this is the current korean food place, stomachache and diarrhoea after eating kimchi fried rice and sabah fish. Me and my wife both.

Laotian restaurants in Jurong West.reviews:
Kway teow and carrot cakes were nice. Oyster omelette not so much.

Good packaging delivery via foodpanda.

Stall is located within kopitiam food court at IMM. It's pretty popular and has a queue from time to time.

Decided to do a takeaway for their fried hokkien mee. The noodles are the wet type, personally I prefer it this way as the noodles are coated with the gravy evenly. The noodles doesn't have a strong prawn taste, perhaps due to the lack of prawn stock. That said, the dish is well cooked with hints of wok hey charring some bits of the noodles. The dish is also generously topped with fried garlic bits that not only gives a great crunch but also accentuates the wok hey notes too. Interestingly, my order came with chilli sauce that has the real bits instead of sambal that's common elsewhere. But mind you, they pack a serious punch and complement the noodles well without flattening the noodles into a one dimensional dish.

The portion for the noodles are satisfying, but don't expect generous servings of prawns. My order came with just 2.

Owner seems like a nice chap and do stop to chat when it isn't too busy.

Food seems to hold up well as a takeaway!

Visited in March 2021.
Laotian restaurants in Jurong West.address: #03-55, 2 Jurong East Street 21, Level 3 Imm Building
Laotian restaurants in Jurong West.name: Lao He Ji

Laotian restaurants in Jurong West.reviews:
Friendly and attentive service from a Tze Char stall underneath HDB block. Every dish was really yummy, especially the Seabass fish which was fresh. The Chilli Crab sauce was spicy but had a very smooth texture. Definitely visit and support :)

Food is flavourful and tasty. Staff is very nice to recommend another veg dish, based on our preference. Good portion and decent price. Food is quite oily and a bit salty. But traditional zhi char taste. 😋

IG: sgfood13
Tiktok: gohht13

I am extremely furious that this restaurant can even exist. There is an employee from Vietnam who has a tattoo on his left arm and operates the chicken rice stall in the morning too. He is so rude. He always pressurises the customers to order more and always overcharge when I don't even want to order anymore. Bad employee who try to gaslight his customers. This place belongs in the grave.
